excerpts: We had the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread at the bar.
I had a delicious (and very tall) fruity drink (the Alcatraz Escape) and they were running some bottled beer specials for my husband.
For entrees, I had the fried shrimp and hubby had an entree that contained shrimp, fish, and calamari.
Portions were very large; you won't go hungry here!
The dining area overlooked the water.
Service was prompt throughout the meal.
I highly recommend this restaurant!
It does lose points for the cost, but it was at Pier 39 and super touristy, so what can you do?
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Christy M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: After our excursion to Muir Woods this morning we decided this would be our lunch. The restaurant was CROWDED. So crowded we decided to sit at the bar and wait (wait time: 45 minutes to an hour). However, the food was delicious! We had the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread at the bar. I had a delicious (and very tall) fruity drink (the Alcatraz Escape) and they were running some bottled beer specials for my husband. For entrees, I had the fried shrimp and hubby had an entree that contained shrimp, fish, and calamari. Portions were very large; you won't go hungry here! The dining area overlooked the water. Service was prompt throughout the meal. I highly recommend this restaurant! It does lose points for the cost, but it was at Pier 39 and super touristy, so what can you do?

excerpts: This was perfect with blue cheese garlic bread.
But please order this with a cup or a regular bowl(not the bread bowl) and eat it with blue cheese garlic bread.
I mean, unless you want to eat lots of breads

...

- blue cheese garlic bread :
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Kim P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
My family and I were looking for a place to have lunch, and I insisted that we should come here based on yelp reviews and I was right. hip hip! Everything was good except that there was this not so little fly trying to kiss on my cheek!

- strawberry basil nojito(non alcohol) : very sweet and fresh. I forgot to ask for little ice. It was literally full of ice that my drink was gone after two sips....:( 

- res chili garlic shrimp : our server warned us that it is very spicy......are you kidding me!? Not spicy at all! Booo but it was good. The plate itself was small but there were many shrimps and vegetables to share with. This was perfect with blue cheese garlic bread. 

- clam chowder : AWARD WINNING! No wonder! One of the best clam chowder I've ever had. But please order this with a cup or a regular bowl(not the bread bowl) and eat it with blue cheese garlic bread. I mean, unless you want to eat lots of breads...

- blue cheese garlic bread : the BEST dish I had here. I love love cheese and garlic and how can you go wrong when you have them with a bread!? And if you add clam chowder here...? Heavenly! But the bread is really big, big enough to share with 3people.

- lobster tail : chewy and fresh, but mashed potato and broccoli was meh :/ i ended up leaving all of them. It tasted like they didn't add any seasoning. 

- cioppino : I didn't get to try this but looked amazing. My husband said it's good but not amazing. I recommend you to order "lazy" one though...so that you don't need to deal with crab shells haha

Overall, it was great!

excerpts: Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto.
TO DIE FOR!
I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again!
All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant!
You will not be disappointed!
I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either!
LOL - my intuition was correct once again!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Laura G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: OMG, We found Nirvana! On a cold frozen night, we stumbled into This restaurant, sat at the bar have some drinks while waiting for our table. Then we realized how wonderful it was sitting at the bar and decided to have dinner at the bar. Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto. TO DIE FOR! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again! All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant! You will not be disappointed! I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either! LOL - my intuition was correct once again!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch on the menu however the taste doesn't really match the concept of this place.
Overall the service was decent, the food was amazing and the view was awesome.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jatin K.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: I had read many reviews before I got here and decided to give it a whirl. This was our first stop when we arrived to fisherman's wharf, we had a party of 9 about 230 pm on a Friday afternoon and were seated right away on the window side. We all sat down ordered a bunch of drinks and appetizers, at first I feel like the waitress was a little annoyed and wanted to rush us out of there but then later she did end her shift while we were still there so I'll give her the benefit of the doubt on that one. This was hands down some of the best seafood I've had. The calamari was delicious and perfectly cooked. The oysters were the most fresh delicious oysters I've ever had. The whole table tried an oyster even the people who aren't oyster lovers. We ordered the sliders which had such a delicious sauce on them which made them absolutely amazing. The blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch on the menu however the taste doesn't really match the concept of this place. Overall the service was decent, the food was amazing and the view was awesome.

excerpts: Also blue cheese garlic bread is great (but too much for single.
Maybe I should've asked for a half plate)!
But definitely expensive.
The disadvantage.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Rosalind G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: It is absolutely delicious! Scallop and crab risotto is amazing! The feeling of chewing the large scallop is great, and the taste of tomato perfectly neutralize the cheese. Also blue cheese garlic bread is great (but too much for single. Maybe I should've asked for a half plate)! But definitely expensive. The disadvantage.

excerpts: Also get the blue cheese garlic bread
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Joshua B.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: The dinner I had there on my vacation to the area is the best meal I have ever had. The location along the pier provides a perfect backdrop for the meal. Service was impeccable, never feeling rushed or hovered over but never going long without a check in to ensure we received everything we need. The food was perfectly cooked, from the scallops and crab risotto to the crab meat covering the filet, and all of the sides. I couldn't ask for anything more than I received from my meal, and would suggest this as a must stop for any tourists. Also get the blue cheese garlic bread

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread we shared
[bc we're on vacay and don't care about being fatties] was yummy.
Without the blue cheese atop the bread, it was like any other garlic bread--smothered in butter.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Andrea M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Such a pricey spot ($20 avg), but, that's what you get for eating right on the pier. 

The blue cheese garlic bread we shared [bc we're on vacay and don't care about being fatties] was yummy. Without the blue cheese atop the bread, it was like any other garlic bread--smothered in butter. And man was it expensive at $8.

The bf's crab roll, under the sandwich section, was really delicious. The poor roll was packed full of yumminess. It was flavorful and sort of oily. The accompanying fries were slightly crispy and yummy.

My choice of the seafood penne was great. There was a good mixture of various seafood goodies: mussels, clams, and some type of fish. There was a good ratio of meats to pasta.

excerpts: Upon sitting down we immediately decided on the Blue Cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and a few beers to start.
The bread was perfectly crispy
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jen R.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Our very first night in one of my favorite cities, after the day of traveling (albeit, it was a short flight) and upon hitting the touristy Pier 39, we realized we were famished. We actually went online and the only available reservation was for 
10pm that evening which was so not 
happening so, we took a chance at just walking up and surprisingly only had a 20 minute wait.

Upon sitting down we immediately decided on the Blue Cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and a few beers to start. The bread was perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised to find that they did not skimp on the delicious Point Reyes blue cheese. 

I settled on Linguine with Clams and my husband went for the Flat Iron Steak. The latter of which, I must admit, I was hesitant about given the location and abundance of wonderful seafood options. However, I was extremely happy to be wrong; the hubs claimed this to be the best steak he's ever tasted and I do believe, my dish may have been as well. Not only were the clams obviously fresh, the seasoning was perfect and the sauce, nice and light to showcase the delicious seafood. 

The service was absolutely phenomenal and the views of both Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge from our table absolutely could not be beat. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone either visiting or, living in San Francisco.

excerpts: Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.
As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Cliff W.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack.
The appetizer was huge!
It tasted alright.
But our entrees did not fair well.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Mandy T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Tourist trap, as expected. On the 2nd level of Pier 39 complex, hubby was getting hangry and refused to walk anywhere else for food. We settled in here as they had good reviews, has a view over the sea lions beaching at the pier, the interior looked clean and well put together, and they offered crayons and coloring sheets to entertain the little one. 

Started off promising. The waitstaff were all professional. We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack. The appetizer was huge!  It tasted alright.  But our entrees did not fair well. We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood. It wasn't. The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.  For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.  I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow. Taste-wise, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring. A very basic burger for $15. 

So overall, overpriced and unmemorable food serving mostly tourists, but does provide a view, comfortable seating and good service.

excerpts: We had the blue cheese garlic bread and the Mixed Grilled seafood, which were really good.
The place itself and the view are nothing much.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Larissa A.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Very friendly staff. We had the blue cheese garlic bread and the Mixed Grilled seafood, which were really good. The place itself and the view are nothing much.

excerpts: We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread which had the perfect combo of cheese and garlic but was a little too burnt at the ends for our liking.
Nothing too special about the NY strip I had; it was cooked as requested, medium rare, and had a strange unknown glaze which didn't do the dish much good.
The dessert menu here is great and they have a live sample display if you ask to see it.
All in all, very pricey but offered a great view of the bay and servers
are very attentive!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Victor G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: This place is a great place to "treat yo self" as there is a big menu with a great wine selection. For lunch after Alcatraz, my girlfriend and I were ready to chow down and this place had us seated quickly with service soon to follow. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread which had the perfect combo of cheese and garlic but was a little too burnt at the ends for our liking. Nothing too special about the NY strip I had; it was cooked as requested, medium rare, and had a strange unknown glaze which didn't do the dish much good. The dessert menu here is great and they have a live sample display if you ask to see it. All in all, very pricey but offered a great view of the bay and servers are very attentive!

excerpts: Try the blue cheese garlic bread.
Try the scallops.
Try the surf and turf.
Everything was good.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Brian L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great atmosphere.  Solid food.  We really enjoyed this place.  Try the Oysters with spinach, cheese, and bacon.  Try the blue cheese garlic bread.  Try the scallops.  Try the surf and turf. Everything was good.

excerpts: I recommend the calamari and the blue cheese garlic bread appetizers.
The staff was friendly, but the wait can be quite long.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jeremy N.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We had dinner hear on New Year Eve. The food came out in a timely and amazingly quick fashion despite them being so busy for the holiday. I recommend the calamari and the blue cheese garlic bread appetizers. The staff was friendly, but the wait can be quite long.

excerpts: In addition we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread because checking in on Pier 39 comes with an awesome yelp special for a coupon book!
I must confess to being satisfied but not overwhelmed
, the bread rocked, the chowder was thick and warm but needed something else to make it pop, what I am not sure.
The crab roll on toasted sourdough was also well garnished and stuffed with crab meat but just didn't wow us!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Joshua R.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Having never spent any time in the San Francisco Bay area I found myself in a bewilderment, I dislike looking like a tourist and overpaying for things, however I wanted to see Alcatraz, Fisherman's Warf, and the SEA LIONS!  This place had good reviews and we actually planned to have dinner there, but since it was a work trip and since its my only free day, we decided to have lunch. 

We were seated at a table for two, within ten minutes of arriving, with a stunning view of San Francisco Bay, the rock and even the Golden Gate.  I was super pleased with the table! Our waitress came over very quickly with fresh warm sourdough bread and butter and water.  After perusing the reviews and noticing the bread flying around, we ordered two cups of the chowder without the bread bowl, and split the crab roll.  In addition we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread because checking in on Pier 39 comes with an awesome yelp special for a coupon book!  I must confess to being satisfied but not overwhelmed, the bread rocked, the chowder was thick and warm but needed something else to make it pop, what I am not sure.  The crab roll on toasted sourdough was also well garnished and stuffed with crab meat but just didn't wow us!  Also, I am a coke guy and they only have pepsi, but I digress.

The place was really enjoyable and I would recommend it over the chains like Rainforest, Hard Rock,  Bubba Gump and others found down at the warf. The staff is awesome, the restaurant is beautiful and has an amazing view, the food is good just not phenomenal!

excerpts: (NY steak and grilled chicken with the blue cheese garlic bread) washed it all down with a great Pinot Noir.
Would come back and spend more money
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Ricardo D.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great atmosphere and food is well prepared.  On a Saturday evening, my wife and I waited less than 30 minutes to be seated.  Wait staff was not bad but not exceptional either. The food, however was great (NY steak and grilled chicken with the blue cheese garlic bread) washed it all down with a great Pinot Noir. Would come back and spend more money

excerpts:
I ordered:

Blue Cheese Garlic Bread ($8):
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Irene Z.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
This place will definitely live up to your expectations. Trust the yelp reviews! The restaurant is on pier 39, towards the front and up the stairs! It is a very big restaurant with a very nice view, towards the sea lions. I ordered:

Blue Cheese Garlic Bread ($8): I got this dish for free because it wad in my coupon book that I got from the welcome center. If I had to pay for this dish, I would probably not get it again. The bread was a bit too oily and tasted really strange.

Seafood Penne ($20): The seafood was definitely very fresh and worth the price. The portion was huge. Would highly suggest this if you like pastas.

Filet Mignon ($39): This is worth every penny!! I usually am not a big fan of meat, but this steak melted in my mouth!! The flavoring was on point. Mashed potato was flavored and creamy with chunks of potato.

I gave it a four star because of the server. He was really bad. He seem confused half the time and it took forever to get his attention. Other than that everything else was pretty good.

excerpts: I highly recommend the clam chowder and the blue cheese garlic bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Kathia S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Delicious food, great service and great prices. Great view too! I highly recommend the clam chowder and the blue cheese garlic bread.

excerpts: Food was very salty,  blue cheese garlic bread was clumpy,  salty,  hard and soaked in oil.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Wai Y.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Food was average,  wait time was 40 minutes,  menu offered some interesting new items but it did not pan out.... I preferred Blue Mermaid when it comes to flavor. 

Got a quick inquiry from management which is appreciated.

 So here's more details... Hostess was not friendly  or helpful. The lines of crowd coming in for dinner is understandable but her generic response of "20 more minutes" was off putting.

 Food was very salty,  blue cheese garlic bread was clumpy,  salty,  hard and soaked in oil. Pumpkin Plum Salmon was salty and ingredient flavors were indiscernible.

excerpts: We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and loved it!
The fish and chips was enough for 2 people easily and
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Apryl E.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: The view can't be beat!  The food was delicious and they bring you a lot of it!  We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and loved it!  The fish and chips was enough for 2 people easily and the plate with salmon, swordfish and shrimp was huge and delicious as well.  We enjoyed it.

excerpts:
We got: 
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - free if you stop at the tourism center first and look through some of the maps for coupons!
I wouldn't actually pay for this - but then again, I don't really like cheese.
Clam Chowder - I was craving clam chowder and that's pretty much the reason we wound up here.
This hit the spot - flavorful, creamy and generally delicious with the bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Sharon C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
I had lunch here with a couple friends - the wait wasn't too long, we were seated promptly and our server was amazing. 

We got: 
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - free if you stop at the tourism center first and look through some of the maps for coupons! I wouldn't actually pay for this - but then again, I don't really like cheese. 
Clam Chowder - I was craving clam chowder and that's pretty much the reason we wound up here. This hit the spot - flavorful, creamy and generally delicious with the bread. 
Ahi Tuna Poke - best thing we got by far. Absolutely delicious, so fresh and light. 
Fish & Chips - unexceptional. I like fish & chips, but I found these a little floury. I wouldn't get this again. 

I would go back here despite it being a complete tourist trap. The service was great - and the ahi tuna poke and clam chowder were both delicious!

excerpts: We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, crab cakes and fish-n-chips.
Hardly any flavor, avoid crab cakes at all cost.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Scott S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, crab cakes and fish-n-chips.  Hardly any flavor, avoid crab cakes at all cost.

excerpts: oysters and the blue cheese garlic bread.
We really liked the view of Alcatraz and the bay.
The oysters were great and the bread was good.
The place was crowded but it was a Saturday
so I expect the wait would have been pretty long had we been waiting on a table.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Eddie N' Hailee S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We sat at the bar and just had drinks, oysters and the blue cheese garlic bread. We really liked the view of Alcatraz and the bay. The oysters were great and the bread was good. The place was crowded but it was a Saturday so I expect the wait would have been pretty long had we been waiting on a table.

excerpts: We started off with some clam chowder, blue cheese garlic bread, and calamari all of which were excellent.
Our mains consisted of lobster, steak, and grilled/fried shrimp.
Everyone in my party who ordered the seafood dishes was very happy with their choice.
I, on the other hand, didn't find the steak to be too tasteful which is why I docked a star off my review.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Noha G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
We came to Fog Harbor Fish House on Christmas eve and were very pleased with the overall service and quality of food, not to mention the phenomenal views!

The four of us were seated very quickly despite the restaurant being almost at full capacity, and we were immediately greeted by our server who was very energetic and friendly. We started off with some clam chowder, blue cheese garlic bread, and calamari all of which were excellent. Our mains consisted of lobster, steak, and grilled/fried shrimp. Everyone in my party who ordered the seafood dishes was very happy with their choice. I, on the other hand, didn't find the steak to be too tasteful which is why I docked a star off my review. I realize that this is a seafood place but a little flavor on the steak (even only salt and pepper) would have been appreciated!

This being said however, I would definitely recommend this restaurant! Make sure you stick to the seafood dishes and you'll be a very happy camper :)

excerpts:
(1 star off)
- check in at Pier 39 on yelp and receive a FREE coupon book at their information center (next to the restaurant) you can get 2 hours of FREE parking (structure) instead of 1 from the restaurant (saved $18) and a coupon for FREE blue cheese garlic bread (saved $8)
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Christine A.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Whenever my family and I are in town (we're from SoCal) we always come here to eat!

- Ask for a window seat. You might have to wait a little, but the view is too pretty!
- Food is pricey, but delicious! I had the clam chowder bowl with crab ($16) It's the best!!
- FREE sourdough bread with butter while you wait till your food comes
- The hostesses in the front were nice, but our waiter was kind of rude! (1 star off)
- check in at Pier 39 on yelp and receive a FREE coupon book at their information center (next to the restaurant) you can get 2 hours of FREE parking (structure) instead of 1 from the restaurant (saved $18) and a coupon for FREE blue cheese garlic bread (saved $8)

excerpts: For appetizers, I had the blue cheese garlic bread.
This dish is best shared with at least three or four people as you get a half loaf of garlic bread smothered with melted blue cheese.
Fog Harbor doesn't hold back on the cheese either, as each bite was an explosion of flavor.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Nadav P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Treat yourself right to amazing seafood with a spectacular view.

Fog Harbor has the longest wait times out of all the establishments in Pier 39 and for good cause.  The food and service are top notch with a large variety of seafood dishes. 

For appetizers, I had the blue cheese garlic bread.  This dish is best shared with at least three or four people as you get a half loaf of garlic bread smothered with melted blue cheese.  Fog Harbor doesn't hold back on the cheese either, as each bite was an explosion of flavor.  For my main dish, I had the Cioppino, a bowl of tomato sauce filled with a variety of seafood from fish to crab to mussels.  One thing I appreciate was the option to order the Cioppino "lazy style" meaning all the shell fish was de-shelled before serving.  The dish itself had bold flavors, a good amount of spice, and was so filling that I had to take half of it home.

Fog Harbor is pricey, so it's more of a place to treat yourself and your date or celebrate a special event, but if you have money to spend and want food from the sea, by the sea, then look no further then the Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: I had the scallops and crab risotto with calamari and blue cheese garlic bread!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Nate V.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: First time here and I don't have any complaints.  Delicious food and great wait staff! I had the scallops and crab risotto with calamari and blue cheese garlic bread!

excerpts: We also had the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and to drink I had the Alcatraz; both were very good.
For dessert we had the Chocolate Bread Pudding which was lovely!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Nicole S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Very touristy as it is right on the water at Pier 39 but the atmosphere nonetheless is still very nice and the food is great! Definitely can see their Clam Chowder being "Award Winning;" its delicious! We also had the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and to drink I had the Alcatraz; both were very good. For dessert we had the Chocolate Bread Pudding which was lovely!

excerpts: The Yelp check-in gets you blue cheese garlic bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Isabella B.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
On the No1DP's last visit to see me, he made a request: he wanted to try SF's clam chowder. What the No1DP asks he gets, I just happen to be the lucky woman to tag along. I had another restaurant in mind that was a little less touristy but after some research and consideration we ended up eating here instead.

VENUE: We went on a Sunday night, just as the sun was about to set. The host put us in a table right next to the window. The No1DP and I were able to watch the people walking around Pier 39 and people just getting off the ferries. While the No1DP and I weren't able to secure a window that overlooked Fisherman's Wharf we weren't too far from those windows and we could look at the massive amount of tourists walking the wharf. 

SERVICE: Service was excellent, as expected from a fine seafood establishment. 

WINE: Both of us had white wines. Although I don't remember specifics on the grape varietal, I remember my wine was a little sweet and went well with my dish.

FOOD
The Yelp check-in gets you blue cheese garlic bread. The blue cheese was a bit strong, but it's good for anyone that really likes blue cheese.

We got bowls of their famous clam chowder. One of the better clam chowders I've tasted, and the No1DP agrees. It may look watery when you're served the bowl but don't let that fool you. Instead we were treated to a quite creamy (and not starchy!) soup with good amounts of CLAM. They were quite generous with the clam but they better be considering how much you pay for a bowl!

No1DP got one of their special dishes lobster mac and cheese. As a New Englander, he has a right to be picky about his seafood, especially his lobster. His dish was "quite comparable to an equivalent dish I'd be served back home". Lucky him. I tried it and it's quite the rich dish - the cheese is RICH and one big bite can make you significantly fuller than before... No1DP ate less than half of his dish. The lobster was to his liking.

I got another special dish: 0.5 lbs lobster stuffed with dungeness crab. I thought this would be an excellent dish as this would combine two of my great seafood loves - lobster and dungeness crab. When I was served this dish the tail part was the lobster while the head was stuffed with the crab. The crab was quite sweet, I'm not sure if this is supposed to be how the crab naturally tastes, but the sweetness took away from the crab. Lobster was excellent, soft and buttery yet I could taste the lobster. Spinach and mashed potatoes were good sides yet were not too rich to overpower the seafood. 

Dessert consisted of creme brûlée. The sugar was hard enough that I can crack it open with one swift tap of the spoon. Custard was creamy yet not too rich. The speculoos cookie they put on top was a nice touch and gave the dessert a subtle ginger taste if you eat it. 

Though Fog Harbor can be considered a touristy restaurant to some, the food was still excellent. Thanks to the No1DP for another excellent eating adventure!

excerpts: Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.
The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.
The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Frances G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Sure, this is along the touristy Wharf, but when it's 9:00p on a Friday night and you haven't eaten since late morning (plus crackers and sh*t in between to tie you over), you'd be desperate to go anywhere, right?

Well, it's good to know that this place was rated pretty good, and I can't say I went to SF without eating some kind of seafood so here I was with 4 others (note: "cooked" seafood...I don't like anything raw).

My friend actually called them around 8:15ish to see if we can make a reservation, but at that time, they were booked and walk-in would be about a 30-minute wait.  By the time we got there around 9:00, the restaurant was maybe a 1/3 empty so we were able to sit down right away (thank goodness, I would've had to chew my arm off).

Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.  The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.  The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.  But I did.

For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).  I still ate some of it.  The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).  The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.  Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!

excerpts: We shared the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and the Fish and Chips.
The garlic bread was delicious.
They were not cheap with the blue cheese.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Allison G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
My husband and I had lunch here. We shared the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and the Fish and Chips. The garlic bread was delicious. They were not cheap with the blue cheese. There was a generous amount of blue cheese and it was seasoned well. 

The service and atmosphere were great. Beautiful view of the bay. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the fish and chips was lacking flavor. The size was fantastic and the quality of the fish was great I just felt like there was something missing.

excerpts: They have blue cheese garlic bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Ami T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Beautiful view, got a nice window table that overlooks the water.  This is supposed to be one of the oldest or maybe even the first to open restaurant on the pier.  It's very good food here.  The salad is really nice.  We got a window table by making a reservation so make sure to add it ahead of time.  Some of the tables are too close together so you can hear everything other people are saying.  The lighting could be a little better but overall a great experience, felt happy here.  They have blue cheese garlic bread.

excerpts: The first menu item I ordered was the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt.
Reyes blue cheese and herbs which was fine but 'fine' is my 4-letter word to describe it.
There just wasn't anything special about it.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jessie E.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
I chose this location based on yelp reviews and I feel rather betrayed from my fellow Yelpers, I was counting on you to not lead me astray. 

The atmosphere of this location would be perfect for a tourist family who wants a mass produced menu of deep fried blah. One of the bartenders was more interested in the basketball game on TV than tending the bar; however, I can't completely blame her because I wouldn't have pride in my work tending bar here either yet we all choose where we work.

The first menu item I ordered was the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt. Reyes blue cheese and herbs which was fine but 'fine' is my 4-letter word to describe it. There just wasn't anything special about it. When I think of San Francisco food I think of innovative and fresh and the menu stated 'fresh sourdough' but if they had served me a loaf from the grocery store nearby I wouldn't have been able to tell you the difference. 

The second menu item I ordered sounded amazing so I was hoping it would redeem the fact that the bread was just so sad. Crispy Bay Scallops - Panko breaded and fried served with a roasted jalapeno aioli

What I had imagined were these beautiful scallops that you were able to taste the freshness of the sea with a slight crisp and a pop of this gorgeous aioli, what I tasted however were these knuckle-sized deep fried greasy bites served with an equally greasy jalapeno mayonnaise rather than a bright aioli. The restaurant had so much potential to have their food set them apart but I felt I was eating out of necessity, not enjoyment so I wound up taking my food in a doggy bag and giving it to a local homeless man who would hopefully enjoy it far more than I would.

Overall, I enjoyed my glass of wine, a 2013 Argentinean Malbec, as well as the view when it wasn't filled with tacky office groups asking for the fruitiest drink on the menu.

excerpts: We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder.
Each meal was so good.
I had the swordfish with a yummy chimichurri/pesto sauce.
The boys loved their fish&chips and shrimp&chips.
The winner of the night was the linguini and clams that my mother in law had.
So good, we all had a bite!
Walk around and come back to this spot.
Clean, friendly and if you're lucky you get an amazing view of the bay.
Enjoy
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Emilia P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: The touristy part of Frisco has a hidden gem! Followed a fellow yelp review and took our chances on the hour wait. The wait was totally worth it, they'll text you when the table is ready or you can make a reservation online! Went with the family and everyone enjoyed their choices. We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder. Each meal was so good. I had the swordfish with a yummy chimichurri/pesto sauce. The boys loved their fish&chips and shrimp&chips. The winner of the night was the linguini and clams that my mother in law had. So good, we all had a bite! Walk around and come back to this spot. Clean, friendly and if you're lucky you get an amazing view of the bay. Enjoy

excerpts: We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and scallop appetizer.
Of the two, I preferred the scallops, which was a very good portion for sharing.
The jalapeño aioli dipping sauce paired well with scallops also!
As a Caesar salad lover, I ordered the crab and avocado Caesar salad, which also had tortilla strips.
Not the traditional Caesar salad
but I loved it!
My friend ordered chicken pasta and substituted the penne pasta for linguini.
She wasn't thrilled, more so content.
She expected the pasta sauce to be creamy and it was not.
Both of us were too stuffed for dessert, but the waiter presented all the desserts on one tray, a great way to present the desserts they have to offer
but I couldn't indulge.
Maybe next time.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Camille C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
After reading reviews, I secured a reservation, which was definitely a good idea for a Saturday night as there were plenty of people there and a wait. With the reservation, my friend and I were quickly seated with no problem. Our reservation was for 630 PM, so we caught the sunset! We could see only the peak of the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance, but there was a really good view of Alcatraz. 

We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and scallop appetizer. Of the two, I preferred the scallops, which was a very good portion for sharing. The jalapeño aioli dipping sauce paired well with scallops also! As a Caesar salad lover, I ordered the crab and avocado Caesar salad, which also had tortilla strips. Not the traditional Caesar salad but I loved it! My friend ordered chicken pasta and substituted the penne pasta for linguini. She wasn't thrilled, more so content. She expected the pasta sauce to be creamy and it was not. Both of us were too stuffed for dessert, but the waiter presented all the desserts on one tray, a great way to present the desserts they have to offer but I couldn't indulge. Maybe next time.

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread is the best garlic bread I have ever had, Tastes like a combination between artichoke dip/blue cheese on garlic bread...
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jaime C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
My first and only restaurant for seafood in SF! I don't get to eat seafood very often living in the central valley. So on a weekend trip to SF we decided to try this restaurant because of the positive reviews. Was not disappointed AT ALL.

The blue cheese garlic bread is the best garlic bread I have ever had, Tastes like a combination between artichoke dip/blue cheese on garlic bread...SO GOOD!

Secondly, I got half a Dungeness crab on ice which was amazingly fresh and delicious for a first time crab eater. Ate every little bit. I also ordered the Dungeness crab burger, which was also VERY good. A regular burger topped with lots of crab meat. 

Wife ordered the chicken penne and the seasonings were spot on and was packed full of flavor. 

Service was excellent from wait time(they text you when your table is ready) and the waitress was able to answer all my questions about the food!

excerpts: We also ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.
I tell you, I don't think I could replicate this at home lol.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Erica P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Such a great restaurant! We were referred to check out this place because of the views. We were taking a trip to SF and booked out reservation a week in advance, just in case. We loved it!!

My and I both had the clam chowder in the bread bowl. And for $6.00 more you can add fresh crab inside. DEFINITELY SPEND THE 6 bucks! So worth it! They gave us a huge mound of crab. 

We also ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. I tell you, I don't think I could replicate this at home lol. It was so good! 

My friend had the Seafood Cioppino which she let me taste. absolutely amazing. I had the Seafood Penne. Also amazing. 

For dessert we shared the Vanilla Bean Crème Brulee. I wanted to order a 2nd one, it was that good. 

Overall, very good food! Friendly wait staff, and beautiful views of the pier. I would definitely go back again!

excerpts: We were talking with the manager about the blue cheese garlic bread deal on Yelp, as another member did a check in, and we ordered an extra - score!
He comped us with a free one.
Drink were good, all the meals were presented very nicely.
We were completely happy with the food, service - and the prices are pretty respectable!
Thank you again for a great time.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Liz T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: What an excellent dining experience, on par with the experience from last year.   Funny, we were seated in the same table as before, like they were saviing it for just us!   Late lunch again, and just as good as the meal from last year.  We were talking with the manager about the blue cheese garlic bread deal on Yelp, as another member did a check in, and we ordered an extra - score!  He comped us with a free one.  Drink were good, all the meals were presented very nicely.  We were completely happy with the food, service - and the prices are pretty respectable!  Thank you again for a great time.

excerpts: We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.
I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jason F.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
I stopped by here earlier this year with my wife and her parents for dinner.  To be honest with you I wasn't too happy about heading here as I thought it was going to be a touristy place with a ton of tchatche due to its location on the pier.   However, by the end of the visit they had me and I truly enjoyed eating here.  We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.  I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.  As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.

The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future if I was in the San Francisco area.  I really enjoyed the food, especially the bread.

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was also tasty.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Nadine B.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Came for dinner with friends during a conference. Location was very nice...we were all from PA so my review may sound touristy. I liked that it was right near the water and there were a bunch of places near it to walk around and explore. Service was nice. Our waitress was very accomodating for our large party. Price was decent for the area....we looked at a bunch of other places that were nearly double the price. We caught happy hour so the wines were on special! Definitely recommend the calamari. So deliscious and tasted fresh. The blue cheese garlic bread was also tasty.

excerpts: We also used a coupon from that book to get a free blue cheese garlic bread at the restaurant (and it was hella good).
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Agnes C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
"Mmmmm"-peccable service and delicious fish! I had the special of the day - Pacific Cod. Best tasting fillet I've had in years. I don't usually like eating seafood over red meats, but I wouldn't mind eating at Fog Harbor Fish House. 

Be sure to go to the front desk to ask for the coupon booklet and get 2 free hours of parking at the structure. We also used a coupon from that book to get a free blue cheese garlic bread at the restaurant (and it was hella good).

excerpts: I ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder salad combo, and chili shrimp appetizer.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Step H.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
This was actually an amazing restaurant considering it's in probably the MOST touristy part of all of the city! I've been living in San Francisco for almost 4 years, and I usually avoid pier 39 like the plague. However, today my yearning for sourdough bread drew me to Fog Harbor. 

When I entered, I was pleasantly surprised by the cozy entranceway with the cascading waterfall. I especially liked that the water was running super fast, much faster than normal... But anyway, my name was called within 20 minutes (845 pm on a Wednesday night), and I was seated by the extremely cute host. I sat and was helped by my server, Meron, right away. I have to say, even within the first 5 minutes, I knew that she was the best server I have ever had. She asked if we wanted bread, and brought it out extremely quickly. I ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder salad combo, and chili shrimp appetizer. This was all we ordered for me and my friend and she did not make me feel pressured at all to order more, which I appreciated.

We ate the bread in 5 seconds flat , and asked for more. Meron was a mind reader and knew right off the bat that we NEEDED two extra loaves. When I commended her for her foresight, she simply stated "well, it's amazing to dip into your shrimp sauce." UHHHH HOLY CRAP. ITS LIKE SHE HAS LOOKED THROUGH MY EYES AND INTO MY SOUL AND LEARNED ALL THAT ANYONE COULD EVER LEARN ABOUT ME IN 2 MINUTES OF TALKING TO ME. I love her. 

Aside from the amazing service, the food was way more phenomenal than I would have ever thought for the area. That chili shrimp has perfectly cooked onions, the bread was warm and fluffy and delicious. The clam chowder was good, but I wouldn't say it was my favorite. It was extremely creamy and buttery. I'm sure that it would taste amazing to most, but just didn't fit my preference that well. 

Overall, amazing restaurant. 10/10 would come back. Thanks for the yummy night!!

excerpts: We had the seafood platter, calamari, blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder.
Everything was great but the bread and the chowder were just tiny bit below average.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Alex S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: This is a solid 4 star restaurant at the Pier 39. We had the seafood platter, calamari, blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder.  Everything was great but the bread and the chowder were just tiny bit below average.

excerpts:
What we ordered:
- Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good!
It's a must-order starter.
Definitely could of gotten full from this alone.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Angela L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.

The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too. 

What we ordered:
- Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone. 
- Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge. 
- Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either. 

The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed. 

All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!

excerpts: Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer.
I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!)
since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night.
We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away.
Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Amy D.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
This is your typical touristy restaurant in the Pier 39 area, which decent tasting food and a nice view, but inflated prices. Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer. I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!) since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night. We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away. Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room. However, it worked out fine, and I got to try:

-Blue Cheese Garlic Bread (Fresh Sourdough, Topped w/Garlic, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Herbs, $8): Just ok. The blue cheese overpowered all the other flavors, and you couldn't taste the garlic. The bread was also too crunchy for my liking. Skip!
-Oysters (Served w/Cocktail Sauce, Dozen $26, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw): The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok. I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters. Skip!
-Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon, Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#3lMGE6tFW3afyze8HNomkA): Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy. This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe. Skip!
-Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16): Ok. The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli. However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland. Skip!
-Crab Louis ($22, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#_pzD387ZKQjuxDPLN0KIFA): They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great. However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland. I wouldn't order this again.
-Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#FyzyT_3ZvIESH5I0qp6APg): Pretty good if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely. The sweet potato fries were also really good. Recommended!
-Fish & Chips (Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#EuuXw-pZ356IX--lG1jksA): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok. I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter- it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy. The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland. However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious.
-Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#s7bQ8LaMVBCTTvrlIYQd4Q): This was a pretty good version of clam chowder! It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder. Recommended!
-Apple Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Ok. I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard. I wouldn't order this again.
-Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Just ok, nothing special. I wouldn't order this again.

The best dishes from here were the Crab Roll and Clam Chowder, and the fries from the fish and chips. Although I don't think I'd come back for those dishes again, I would recommend ordering them if you are dining here. The service was good up until the end- it took them a long time to bring the dessert and our check. Make sure you ask them to validate your parking ticket if you parked in the structure across the street.  

Overall, there are so many better restaurants to eat at in SF, and it's not worth coming here unless you can expense your meal, or if you really want a view of the pier area.

excerpts: We had the blue cheese garlic bread - yummmmmm.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Colleen C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We had the blue cheese garlic bread - yummmmmm. The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw. The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty! Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.

excerpts: blue cheese garlic bread and crab salad.
Everything was to die for.
Really really enjoyed it and planning to bring my whole family back.
Give it a try.
You won't regret it.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Sabrina R.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Had appetizers today for late lunch early dinner and it was spectacular.  Calamari was great, crab cocktail  blue cheese garlic bread and crab salad.  Everything was to die for.  Really really enjoyed it and planning to bring my whole family back.  Give it a try. You won't regret it.

excerpts: Also try the blue cheese garlic bread if you're into that, it was good as well.
For entrees we ordered the Crab Legs which were large and juicy, a huge plate of crab legs (enough for 2 people if you're splitting a meal).
The fried fish n chips were great too.
3 large chunks of fried fish and French fries too.
The fish was nice and fresh (just what you'd expect from a place in the wharf) and was fried perfectly.
We also ordered the Pacific Cod (special of the day) which was grilled to perfection.
Not dry and hard, it was just great.
All in all a great meal.
And the server was super nice as well, couldn't have asked for more.
Highly recommend for lunch.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jorge G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Came here for lunch after visiting Alcatraz. Awesome view of the bay, The Golden Gate Bridge and The Rock. Food was awesome, beer was nice and cold and the cocktails were great too. 

We started off with Mussel Fries - nice broth at the bottom of the bowl, mussels and delicious French fries with a nice sauce drizzled on top. The broth was awesome for dipping bread in (there wasn't much left). 
The Ahi Poke Tuna appetizer was outstanding. Tasted super fresh and came with nice chips. Full of fresh avocado and mango. Highly recommend it. 
Also try the blue cheese garlic bread if you're into that, it was good as well. 
For entrees we ordered the Crab Legs which were large and juicy, a huge plate of crab legs (enough for 2 people if you're splitting a meal). 
The fried fish n chips were great too. 3 large chunks of fried fish and French fries too. The fish was nice and fresh (just what you'd expect from a place in the wharf) and was fried perfectly. 
We also ordered the Pacific Cod (special of the day) which was grilled to perfection. Not dry and hard, it was just great. 
All in all a great meal. And the server was super nice as well, couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend for lunch.

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread!!
Great place for someone who doesn't eat seafood ,you have options.
The view is amazing !!
Have to have the chocolate cake !!
Wow !!!
We will be back for sure !!!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: melissa a.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Service awesome !! Great dirty martini!! Must try the clam chowder w/ the Dungeness​ crab!! Blue cheese garlic bread!! Great place for someone who doesn't eat seafood ,you have options. The view is amazing !! Have to have the chocolate cake !! Wow !!! We will be back for sure !!!

excerpts: We ordered the linguine, the blue cheese garlic bread and the clam chowder in the bread bowl with crab.
The linguine wasn't cooked well on top of being cold with an interesting taste.
The soup was cold so we had to send it back.
However the garlic bread was delicious.
It was also kind of busy so don't expect quick service.
I gave it 3 stars due to the wait and the great view of the bay.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jae L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: I came here on a Saturday before the 49ers game and boy was I disappointed. After reading all of these wonderful yelp reviews, I was so excited. The wait was a decent time (20-30 mins) and I love that they text you so you can wander around until you're called.  That's where things went south.We ordered the linguine, the blue cheese garlic bread and the clam chowder in the bread bowl with crab. The linguine wasn't cooked well on top of being cold with an interesting taste. The soup was cold so we had to send it back. However the garlic bread was delicious. It was also kind of busy so don't expect quick service. I gave it 3 stars due to the wait and the great view of the bay.

excerpts:
uber'd home before we placed our order and all was fine again and we were able to order drinks after talking to the manager 

ordered:
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Raquel T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
after a going on a birthday booze cruise, we were all hungry and the birthday boy picked this place bc it was close to where the boat docked

one of the guys in our party was so messed up that the server had to inform us no alcohol was to be served to our group. never had that happen to us before..the guy then uber'd home before we placed our order and all was fine again and we were able to order drinks after talking to the manager 

ordered:
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt. Reyes blue cheese and herbs

Crispy Calamari: Fried jalapenos and onions, served with lemon aioli

Crispy Bay Scallops: Panko breaded and fried served with a roasted jalapeño aioli

Crab Cake: One large cake, citrus beurre blanc, mango relish

Clam chowder: in a House Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl

Fish & Chips: "Anchor Steam" beer battered fish with french fries and cole slaw

Tiramisu

tourist trap for sure since it's in pier 39 but everything was a-ok.. halfway through the meal all the fried food was starting to get to me that nothing tasted good anymore.. that was remedied with some dessert

i have never been to a dinner where a bunch of people were so drunk.. it was quite entertaining for us sober people..one of the girls was popping the scallops in her mouth like grapes then ate the lettuce with a glob of aioli that came with the calamari like a taco.. i was pretty digested she was able to swallow that much without flinching.. she had some aoili on the side of her mouth so our friend that was sitting next to her wiped it off with his index finger, licked his finger, then said tasty.. hahahah

excerpts: We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Lea L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!

We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.

The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese". 

Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.

Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!

excerpts: I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD!
that
and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Paul S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!

it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.  

this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!

bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.  

after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!  

we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.

and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

excerpts: We shared the blue cheese garlic bread starter, and it may have been because we were so hungry but the both of us were stopped in our tracks by the deliciousness (at this point I remarked "Don't come here on a date"...
Bad breath for DAYS but totally worth it).
I ordered the sustainably harvested swordfish and mom had the grilled chicken.
I'd never tried swordfish before
but I am certainly a convert.
Grilled to perfection atop a bed of roasted potatoes and vegetables, I didn't want it to end.
But I also didn't want to miss out on dessert.
Christian brought the tray around and we were quickly swayed to the creme brûlée and molten chocolate cake duo.
DEFINITELY THE RIGHT DECISION.
Wait staff was all friendly without being overly chatty, and it was some of the best seafood I've had in a very long time.
Can't wait to go back again!!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Sara S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: The atmosphere is sort of a relaxed-classy environment. Christian took our drink order promptly (Cucumber-basil gimlet for me, Lombard Lemonade for mom) and quickly came back for our food order. It was a bit a wait for food, but it was also Easter Sunday at lunch time, and the wait really wasn't an issue when there was such a nice view to look at. We shared the blue cheese garlic bread starter, and it may have been because we were so hungry but the both of us were stopped in our tracks by the deliciousness (at this point I remarked "Don't come here on a date"... Bad breath for DAYS but totally worth it). I ordered the sustainably harvested swordfish and mom had the grilled chicken. I'd never tried swordfish before but I am certainly a convert. Grilled to perfection atop a bed of roasted potatoes and vegetables, I didn't want it to end. But I also didn't want to miss out on dessert. Christian brought the tray around and we were quickly swayed to the creme brûlée and molten chocolate cake duo. DEFINITELY THE RIGHT DECISION. Wait staff was all friendly without being overly chatty, and it was some of the best seafood I've had in a very long time. Can't wait to go back again!!

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread is an instant favorite and the flat iron steak was cooked perfectly.
Khaiman was awesome, and made an excellent dessert recommendation...
The blondie is killer!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Tracy S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: This place is great, even if you don't like fish like me! Blue cheese garlic bread is an instant favorite and the flat iron steak was cooked perfectly. Khaiman was awesome, and made an excellent dessert recommendation... The blondie is killer!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Gene C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.  

All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

excerpts: And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked.
There was so much on the menu
it was hard to decide LOL.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Vol T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner. 

The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas. 

Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead. 

And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!

excerpts: Sourdough bread is excellent, and we bought the blue cheese garlic bread as well....so awesome, but better to have if you have a group larger than 2.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Dustin C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Place gets 2 stars because they get 1 star in a lot of areas but 5 in others.  Took my wife here for our anniversary, she loved her part of the meal so I guess the night was a success.

First they charge 4.5% for "SF emp Ord", so it's a political statement, I get that, but as a political statement I can choose not to eat at your restaurant - so heads up on this before you go there.  These places should have to have a sign calling this out or something obvious on the menu... 1 star

View was outstanding, and I'm willing to pay for that view. 5 stars

Barrel aged Manhattan that used four roses bourbon and made a huge square ice cube infused with an Orange peel...$13 but still worth it. 5 stars.

Sourdough bread is excellent, and we bought the blue cheese garlic bread as well....so awesome, but better to have if you have a group larger than 2. 4 stars

Cod special with chorizo and white beans. Ugh so bad, completely lacking flavor even though all the ingredients typically have a ton of flavor.  Tasted like cruise ship food, so bland my great-grandparents might have loved it.  At least the cod was flakey and cooked well.  1 star, mainly because everything on the menu looked good and I ended up stuck with that...

Curry mussels.  These were awesome too, full of flavor, melts in your mouth, incredible dipping the sourdough in the sauce.  One mussel hadn't opened, wish they would have gave us another one instead. 4 stars

Service was a solid 3.  He was attentive and friendly but seemed annoyed that we ordered coffee to start the meal (cold night) and that
He'd have to bring refills.

excerpts: Excellent blue cheese garlic bread as a starter.
While it's a high tourist area and spectacular views, food was incredible.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Brittany N.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: The ambience was incredible. While we had to wait, we sat at the bar and had great service. When we were seated, server was efficient with good recommendations and attentive. The red chili crab was beyond this world. It was perfectly flavored. My husband had the swordfish and it was moist, flaky and well seasoned. Excellent blue cheese garlic bread as a starter. While it's a high tourist area and spectacular views, food was incredible.

excerpts: We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Anu S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Great food, great atmosphere.  I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.  Both were delicious.      We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.  The garlic mashed potatoes were good too.

The service was a little disorganized - food that wasn't ours was brought to our table, I got rice instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered, and we were asked twice if we wanted dessert instead of bringing us the bill which we asked for.

But all in all, a great experience.

excerpts: Oysters - both fresh and baked, were great, as well as the blue cheese garlic bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Sara D.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Awesome view, awesome service, awesome food, what's not to love?  Oysters - both fresh and baked, were great, as well as the blue cheese garlic bread.

excerpts: We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Calvin T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.

We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.

Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.

excerpts: Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: R M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Pretty solid dinner tonight- came with two other couples. Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid. Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)

The prices were reasonable, the food was fresh, and the restaurant was nice, airy, and classy while not feeling ultra touristy. Will be back to visit again for sure!

excerpts: Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Matthew H.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Best meal I've had in years. Seafood cioppino was amazing. The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly. Bread was great. Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic. Crab meat
Melted in my mouth, fantastic . Bloody Mary's we're outstanding. Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts. Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world. Great management and great food. Highly recommend this place.  

Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread was awesome, as was the clam chowder and fried shrimp.
We had a great wait or and really enjoyed the experience.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Kyle T.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great view and we were lucky enough to get seated at the best table for the sunset with view of bay, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Blue cheese garlic bread was awesome, as was the clam chowder and fried shrimp. We had a great wait or and really enjoyed the experience.

excerpts:
Super tasty clam chowder, calamari, and blue cheese garlic bread. 
Very reasonable price for Pier 39. 
Highly recommended!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Eric L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Excellent service. 
Super tasty clam chowder, calamari, and blue cheese garlic bread. 
Very reasonable price for Pier 39. 
Highly recommended!

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread is yummy.
Fish and chips
I'm not crazy about the batter.
Crab is delicious and generous portions.
I just had the pumpkin martini and love it!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Glenn S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: I love coming here and I love the view. Blue cheese garlic bread is yummy. Fish and chips I'm not crazy about the batter. Crab is delicious and generous portions. I just had the pumpkin martini and love it!

excerpts: We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill.
Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate.
Don't waste your time and money going here.
The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it.
If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Sammie B.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews, the menu and the proximity to our hotel. I never would have expected such poor service from a restaurant like this, especially one in a prime tourist location. A little background, we had reservations for Sunday at 4:00 PM. Here's a summary of our experience here after being seated:

-No one acknowledged us, no one as in any other waitstaff
-Another server had to take our order 10 min after being seated. He tells us out waiter didn't know he had the section we were in.
-Our waiter served a table that was seated after us and still don't stop by our table which was four feet directly across from their table
-We didn't get water after 20 minutes and that's after asking multiple times 
-Our waiter didn't acknowledge us for over 15 min, didn't say hello or apologize for the wait
-We had to ask for bread
-It took 50 min to get our food
-We had to flag down our waiter to get boxes and the check
-The general manager didn't even ask how everything was even though it was obvious we weren't happy and were looking all over the place for our waiter throughout our entire time there

I cannot stress how bad this dining experience was. How could a tourist restaurant be so poor in customer service? It should be the exact opposite in my opinion. I will not be returning here and will tell others to not go here. The food was mediocre. We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill. Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate. Don't waste your time and money going here. The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it.
