If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.

excerpts: We ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic bread, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails and Chowder for appetizers.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Alana L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: There was a 45 min wait so decided to sit at the bar. The service was great! Jason bartender/server was very attentive and quick! We ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic bread, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails and Chowder for appetizers. For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu. My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu. The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery. It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT! Shrimp cocktail was simply great! And the Tiramisu is amazing!!! The Ahi Tuna was good. I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant. I was hoping for something different. The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite. It was way too garlicky for my taste and it was overflowing with potatoes. My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you! This is a great restaurant! Highly recommended!!!

excerpts: We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder, both made with their own sourdough.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Holly M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Wow... The view here is no joke. Our sever was excellent and the food was fresh and delicately prepared. We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder, both made with their own sourdough. Excellent drinks and the wild salmon entree is a great recommendation. Can't wait to come back

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was really good.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Bradley G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great seafood. I had the fried fish combo and the calamari was great. The blue cheese garlic bread was really good.

excerpts: Excellent: sourdough bread, blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Leslie E.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Love Love Love !!!

Excellent: sourdough bread, blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder!

Highly recommend!!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread, calamari, and scallops apps were all REALLY good!
Their sourdough bread is awesome, and the chowder bread bowl was some of the best around.
Fantastic views of the water and GG Bridge, with reasonably priced good seafood and fantastic drinks .....
we recommend it!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Ann H.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: This place was surprisingly good! It's located in probably THE most touristy spot in town, so we were skeptical. We didn't have reservations, but were seated right away. They have a great selection of drinks to choose from. The blue cheese garlic bread, calamari, and scallops apps were all REALLY good! Their sourdough bread is awesome, and the chowder bread bowl was some of the best around. Fantastic views of the water and GG Bridge, with reasonably priced good seafood and fantastic drinks ..... we recommend it!

excerpts: id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon.
It was AMAZING!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Danielle F.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Came here around 2pm with no reservation. The wait was only about 15mins. 

I'll start by saying I am not a fan of blue cheese AT ALL but figured id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon. It was AMAZING! Exceeded expectations. 

Tried some oysters from here and they were great! I definitely recommend. Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!! Loved it 

I ordered the entree with the crab cakes, big mistake!!! I love crab cakes but I tasted everything EXCEPT the crab so that's obviously not something I would order here again. 

My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips which were exceptional! Wish I had ordered that instead. It's cooked to perfection! 

I ordered a Long Island, which was sub par. It's a pretty strong drink but the purpose of the Long Island is to not taste how strong it is. I'd try something different.

excerpts: First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Ford S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT. 

The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jonathan G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Agreed tourist trap. Acclaimed clam chowder does not have much flavor and clams are lacking. Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering. Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread). Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through. Plusses: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great. Servers were also attentive and courteous.

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread was a great app.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Angela L.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great meal..... Blue cheese garlic bread was a great app. My hubby enjoyed the cioppino and my crab sandwich was delicious.

excerpts: The Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and Spicy Shrimp appetizers didn't disapoint.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Mairead D.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: A great meal and wonderful, attentive server Curtis made for a delightful evening at Pier 39 in San Francisco. The house Cabernet was full bodied and just right. The Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and Spicy Shrimp appetizers didn't disapoint.  Wedge salad and Dungeness Crab cocktail were delicious and the fabulous creme brulee/dark chocolate cake combo dessert was perfectly balanced and out of this world.

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was awesome.
We got the fish and chips and penne with chicken, both were very good.
The service was excellent.
It was pricey though.
2 people, 2 plates, and 2 sodas ran about 70 bucks.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Joel S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: This place looks like a typical fish food shack from the outside.  But it is quite nice on the inside and definitely on the higher end of sea food.  Excellent view of the water.  The blue cheese garlic bread was awesome.  We got the fish and chips and penne with chicken, both were very good.  The service was excellent.  It was pricey though.  2 people, 2 plates, and 2 sodas ran about 70 bucks.

excerpts: - try the blue cheese garlic bread, its quite good... and the wine selection is decent as well, I like the 1.5 glass option for a few dollars more
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Beth P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
Of the restaurants on the Wharf, I think this is a good choice... 
- great views
- decent food (5-6 out of 10... but it is on the wharf, where most food is a 2-3 out of 10)
- good friendly service
- good for large parties or children
- events room in back for large parties
- convenient to parking garage (we took my grandpa here, he didn't have to walk far to go to dinner!)

- try the blue cheese garlic bread, its quite good... and the wine selection is decent as well, I like the 1.5 glass option for a few dollars more

excerpts: Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jordan S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: For Fisherman's Wharf this place is good.  I had the clam chowder, which was good, not great.  But then I had the Ahi Tuna - this was fantastic and cheap.  For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.  Tasted great!  Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)

excerpts: We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Cristina M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
WOW this place is AMAZING! You HAVE to get the baked oysters! We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.

The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. They didn't seem to be bothered that we showed up with four people more than our reservation! They told us to come by again right at sunset; apparently the view is incredible. 

I got half a garlic crab which was super fresh, delicious, and economical. Also, in order to not single me out, they put bibs on our whole table - we had a blast taking pictures!

Go here, bring friends!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was nice.
Heavy, but great.
I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo.
Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl.
We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item.
Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Rita S.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Clams in the chowder (one or two in every spoonful) were meaty and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was nice. Heavy, but great. I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo. Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl. We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item. Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.  Lastly, the oysters were great! Cold, fresh, and big!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was yummy.
Would order it especially if you like blue cheese!
We also had the apple cranberry crisp.
That was the best!!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Linda H.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Had fish & chips.  It was delicious!  The blue cheese garlic bread was yummy.  Would order it especially if you like blue cheese!  We also had the apple cranberry crisp.  That was the best!!

excerpts: BUT...and this is what really made me love this place....the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread!!!
SOOOOO GOOOOOD!
I could have eaten this for my meal by itself!
No pressure, but you HAVE to get the Blue cheese garlic bread....just sayin'
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jay H.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
After our Alcatraz tour ended, we went exploring around Fisherman's Wharf for a late dinner spot and we stumbled upon Fog Harbor. 

The atmosphere = Awesome! We got a table for 2 right at the window. The view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance was unforgettable. The whole atmosphere was perfect.

BUT...and this is what really made me love this place....the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread!!! SOOOOO GOOOOOD! I could have eaten this for my meal by itself!
I got the seared ahi tuna, it didn't disappoint either! It turned out to be a very good choice!
  
Great spot for dinner if you are out on Pier 39.

PS: No pressure, but you HAVE to get the Blue cheese garlic bread....just sayin'

excerpts: We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.
We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus.
A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot.
The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly.
Definitely worth a try!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Laura B.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was very rich and flavorful.
Fish and chips for the main course - also perfect!
Our waitress was super nice and the manager was very friendly and took time to tell us about how they only use sustainable fish suppliers.
So, they don't overfish the areas and wipe out populations.
They have closely inspected all their suppliers and it shows in the quality of the food.
Great experience!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Jenn E.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Hands down the best calamari I've had, not over-breaded and cooked just enough and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was very rich and flavorful. Fish and chips for the main course - also perfect! Our waitress was super nice and the manager was very friendly and took time to tell us about how they only use sustainable fish suppliers. So, they don't overfish the areas and wipe out populations. They have closely inspected all their suppliers and it shows in the quality of the food. Great experience!

excerpts: I had blue cheese garlic bread from the check-in, some calamari, fried scallops, and the clam chowder for my appetizers.
For the main course I had the garlic whole crab...
it ROCKS.
If you happen to eat here be sure to get your parking ticket validated for a parking garage nearby - we didn't notice the garage until AFTER we finished our meal and explored the area.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Timothy C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Absolutely delicious!  I had blue cheese garlic bread from the check-in, some calamari, fried scallops, and the clam chowder for my appetizers.  For the main course I had the garlic whole crab...it ROCKS.  If you happen to eat here be sure to get your parking ticket validated for a parking garage nearby - we didn't notice the garage until AFTER we finished our meal and explored the area.

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread was just like we make it at home...but bigger.
Cannot say I'm mad about that.
The swordfish and sole we had were both fresh and well prepared to flaky goodness.
Though service was a little slow it was worth it.
Our waiter understood what we wanted and directed us accordingly.
The place was packed on a Sunday night with tourists so definitely make reservations if you're headed this way.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Stevie C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We usually have very, very bad luck on Fisherman's Wharf when it comes to food but we finally found a winner! Large portions, great sauces, sustainable seafood and well educated service. The blue cheese garlic bread was just like we make it at home...but bigger. Cannot say I'm mad about that. The swordfish and sole we had were both fresh and well prepared to flaky goodness. Though service was a little slow it was worth it. Our waiter understood what we wanted and directed us accordingly. The place was packed on a Sunday night with tourists so definitely make reservations if you're headed this way.

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread, Fried Scallops, Crab Cake & fries.
Special shout out to the fries!
Just the right amount of crunch and softness that I like in my fries.
CRAB CAKE was the bomb, LOVED IT!
Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty.
The fried scallops did not do anything for us and we left that plate almost untouched.
The dips we got with each of the dishes was awesome!
Unfortunately, after the above dishes we felt stuffed and did not actually try the sea food platters/ entrees that we set out to originally have.
Well, then again, there is always a next time!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Shruti D.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: A friend was visiting from India so wanted to show off with the food available in SF. I had an option of Boudine or this place, and i selected FHFH because I had never visited here before and thought, well, two birds with one store. We started off with drinks: Alcatraz Escape and the Blueberry Ginger beer drink (don't remember the name). AE was OK, I liked my blueberry ginger beer concoction. We then moved to the starters: Blue cheese garlic bread, Fried Scallops, Crab Cake & fries. Special shout out to the fries! Just the right amount of crunch and softness that I like in my fries. CRAB CAKE was the bomb, LOVED IT! Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty. The fried scallops did not do anything for us and we left that plate almost untouched. The dips we got with each of the dishes was awesome! Unfortunately, after the above dishes we felt stuffed and did not actually try the sea food platters/ entrees that we set out to originally have. Well, then again, there is always a next time!

excerpts: he offered the best appetizer they have which was the blue cheese garlic bread
and it was one of the best if not the best garlic bread I have ever had, but also
the most expensive.
We both ordered the crab cake burger and at first it tasted really good
and then I felt like it was missing something
and I just couldn't even finish it all.
I did not think their food was a good as I expected considering the prices but the view and the garlic bread made me feel better...
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Cindy M.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We randomly found this restaurant and it looked amazing so we walked in. The place is beautiful and it has a great view. I was able to see Alcatraz for our entire lunch it was pretty cool. Our waiter was really nice and we were starving so he offered the best appetizer they have which was the blue cheese garlic bread and it was one of the best if not the best garlic bread I have ever had, but also the most expensive. We both ordered the crab cake burger and at first it tasted really good and then I felt like it was missing something and I just couldn't even finish it all. I did not think their food was a good as I expected considering the prices but the view and the garlic bread made me feel better...

excerpts: The blue cheese garlic bread is a must.
The popcorn shrimp was excellent as was the fillet Mignon and crab cakes.
The prices were right on target for being in a high traffic tourist area.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Joel G.
blue cheese garlic bread.review:
The most remarkable thing about this place was the cohesive team attending to their guests. We sat near a high traffic employee intersection and I was blown away by observing the level of efficiency, professionalism and camaraderie demonstrated by these hard working folks. It was like watching a finely tuned symphony. As for the manager on duty, if he was in charge of the Gulf oil spill debacle, I suspect he would of had the leak plugged in half the time it took BP to do the job. He was spot on keeping the symphony on track during busy season on a Saturday night.

Now for the food. The blue cheese garlic bread is a must. The popcorn shrimp was excellent as was the fillet Mignon and crab cakes. The prices were right on target for being in a high traffic tourist area. There were many high and low priced items to find a comfort level with.

Being on the second floor made for a beautiful view and even though the place was humming, there was a little less traffic than below.

Of the dozens of restaurants to choose from in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we were fortunate to find Fog Harbor.

excerpts: Don't miss the Blue Cheese Garlic bread.
Their fish is sustainable!
I had the swordfish, it was excellent.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Roxanne C.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: We expected Pier 39 to have high prices and bad food.  We were very pleasantly surprised by Fog Harbor Fish House.  The food, prices, services, views and atmosphere were all excellent.  Don't miss the Blue Cheese Garlic bread.  Their fish is sustainable!  I had the swordfish, it was excellent.

excerpts: Good swordfish dish and blue cheese garlic bread starter.
The music was at an average volume so it didn't bother.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Victoria J.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Excellent food and service! Good swordfish dish and blue cheese garlic bread starter. The music was at an average volume so it didn't bother.

excerpts: We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.
Tasted awesome!
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Kristine W.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Great food!  After a long day of tourist attractions we referred to yelp and thought we would give this place a chance based on the reviews.  Great ambiance and waterfront!  Reasonably priced for waterfront restaurant.  We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.  Tasted awesome!  Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.  Very good!  Would recommend.

excerpts: We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Meera V.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!

excerpts: We got a scallop appetizer and the blue cheese garlic bread.
Both were decent.
My boyfriend ordered the crab cake dinner and I got linguine with clams.
My boyfriend's crab cakes were burnt and cold when they came out.
The menu description for my linguine should have said "small portion of linguine and a couple clams.
For $18 it was way overpriced for pasta and literally like three clams.
Not to mention they didn't even clean the clams and the whole bottom of my plate was covered in gritty sand.

Since we already had to send my boyfriends food back and his family seemed horrified that he did, I didn't complain about my sandy pasta, but when the waiter picked up the dish, I am surprised he didn't notice the thick layer of grit left on my plate.
We won't be back.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Dayna P.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: Came here with a large party of 14. The service was actually really good and I was impressed with our waiter. The entrees my boyfriend and I ordered on the other hand was terrible. We got a scallop appetizer and the blue cheese garlic bread. Both were decent. My boyfriend ordered the crab cake dinner and I got linguine with clams. My boyfriend's crab cakes were burnt and cold when they came out. The menu description for my linguine should have said "small portion of linguine and a couple clams." For $18 it was way overpriced for pasta and literally like three clams. Not to mention they didn't even clean the clams and the whole bottom of my plate was covered in gritty sand. Since we already had to send my boyfriends food back and his family seemed horrified that he did, I didn't complain about my sandy pasta, but when the waiter picked up the dish, I am surprised he didn't notice the thick layer of grit left on my plate. We won't be back.

excerpts: After some great appetizers ( the red chili prawns and blue cheese garlic bread), we ordered dinner.
The entrees were outstanding, and the service even better.
I was in the mood for steak
so I tried the Cajun Rib Eye.
My friends shared the crab linguini and a plate of calamari with fries.
Everything was delicious, well prepared and promptly served.
Add the spectacular view, and it was a great experience.
Well worth visiting.
blue cheese garlic bread.author: Paul V.
blue cheese garlic bread.review: I was in town recently, and visited this restaurant with a couple of friends. After some great appetizers ( the red chili prawns and blue cheese garlic bread), we ordered dinner. The entrees were outstanding, and the service even better. I was in the mood for steak so I tried the Cajun Rib Eye. My friends shared the crab linguini and a plate of calamari with fries. Everything was delicious, well prepared and promptly served. Add the spectacular view, and it was a great experience. Well worth visiting.

excerpts: *Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ($16)
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Elena N.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
So I decided to do a touristy day. Since a friend and I were going to be at Fisherman's Wharf, I suggested doing a seafood dinner at Pier 39. I made a reservation through Yelp for a party of two about a week prior for Thursday, September 27th at 7pm. We showed up a few mins early and had to wait for a little bit. We were seated about 10 mins after our reservation at a table by the window, so we had a nice view.

*Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ($16)
*AWARD WINNING CLAM CHOWDER ($9 Bowl)
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
*Duckhorn: Napa Valley, California '17 ($50)

I wanted the crab and clam chowder. Since my friend and I always over order, we added the shrimp. The clam chowder was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. A little thicker than I prefer, but still a good bowl. The crab was a little disappointing. There wasn't enough garlic flavor. Plus, the best part of the crab, the head, was missing. It was just an empty shell for decoration. If a restaurant states a whole crab, I think that should include the head. The shrimp were okay. Had a nice heat, but I didn't really like the sauce. A little too sweet for me. Dinner came with complimentary Bread & Butter, which was good for soup dipping.

Service here was nice and friendly. They were busy cuz there was a convention in town, so there were times when we had to flag down our server. The wine was good and paired well with our food. Both cocktails were okay. A little light for my tastes, but at least the pricing wasn't too bad.

A nice dinner for a touristy spot, but the food was a little underwhelming. 3 stars.

excerpts: We proceeded to order a variety of dishes Blue Cheese Garlic breads, Crab cakes , ahi tuna poke, Red Chili Garlic Shrimp and the Crab .
The Crab cakes were  so soft and succulent
, I wished they would never end !
Our server recommended the Hibiscus Margarita , which I think wasn't that liked by either of us , it was way too sugary .
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Rashi T.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Every time I have been to SFO , this is one place we always visited because someone in our party always ends up picking it based on the great reviews . Honestly it doesn't disappoint either. The seafood is good , the service is fast and the views .. ahh the views , well that's the first thing that catches your fancy. We had a nice spot near the window , especially with the sunlight filtering in . I would highly recommend the Clam Chowder , its pretty darn good . We proceeded to order a variety of dishes Blue Cheese Garlic breads, Crab cakes , ahi tuna poke, Red Chili Garlic Shrimp and the Crab . The Crab cakes were  so soft and succulent , I wished they would never end ! Our server recommended the Hibiscus Margarita , which I think wasn't that liked by either of us , it was way too sugary .

excerpts: We started off our seafood feast by sharing the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp appetizer ($16).
It contained just six large shrimp, tossed with thin slices of onions and bell peppers in an intense chili sauce.
Although I enjoyed the spicy flavors and tingling heat, I didn't find that it was the best value.
I also couldn't help but try a cup of their award-winning clam chowder ($7), which was so creamy and had large meaty clam pieces.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Courtney L.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
During my family's trip to San Francisco, our mission was to find a restaurant that showcased the Bay's fresh seafood at fairly reasonable prices, and Fog Harbor delivered!

Located on the second floor of Pier 39, this restaurant has a classy ambiance and a scenic view of the water where you can spot the sea lions in the distance. We were greeted by our waiter who took great care of us throughout dinner. He was personable, attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. 

We started off our seafood feast by sharing the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp appetizer ($16). It contained just six large shrimp, tossed with thin slices of onions and bell peppers in an intense chili sauce. Although I enjoyed the spicy flavors and tingling heat, I didn't find that it was the best value.  I also couldn't help but try a cup of their award-winning clam chowder ($7), which was so creamy and had large meaty clam pieces. Yum, this is a must!  

For my entree, I went with a lighter plate, being the Seared Pacific Cod ($28). The fish was seared perfectly with a golden brown, slightly crisp top. It was served with white beans, chorizo butter, tomatoes and spinach, then finished with a dab of garlic shallot aioli. The aioli added an extra layer of flavor to an already savory plate and I loved the white beans as an alternative for a starch. With the Cod placed on top of it all, it was truly the highlight of the dish. Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. They enjoyed their entrees as well.

This was easily one of the best seafood meals my family had in years. 
Thank you to Fog Harbor for such a memorable dinner to start off our visit to San Francisco on the right foot!

4.5 stars.

excerpts: The red chili garlic shrimp is a starter and I definitely recommend it
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Angie A.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
This is probably the best restaurants here on pier 39!!  The service was fantastic. Our waitress was Ashley G was incredibly sweet and gave us many recommendations!
The entrées are absolutely amazing and the drinks are strong, all with an amazing view !! 
The red chili garlic shrimp is a starter and I definitely recommend it

excerpts: For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries.
All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp.
That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Jennie N.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill.
The clam chowder was delicious!
I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy.
The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy.
The cioppino was sooooo delicious.
For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops.
This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that.
The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes.
I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it!
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Joanne Y.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)

excerpts: My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino.
Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it.
Service was good.
Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked.
They were not as spicy as I thought they would be.
Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food.
Both the dishes tasted great.
Next time, I will try other items off menu.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Ruchi S.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
Pier 39 is synonymous to San Francisco. It is full of restaurants and shops. I have very fond memories of pier 39. Having clam chowder and enjoying the endless beauty of sea.. Divine. During my last visit, I got a chance to try out this restaurant. All the seats with sea view were taken, so we were escorted to the dining area in between. The menu had loads of seafood options to choose from. My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino. Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it. 
Service was good. Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked. They were not as spicy as I thought they would be. Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food. 
Both the dishes tasted great. Next time, I will try other items off menu.

excerpts: Had the red chili garlic shrimp (the sauce that this is in you can put on EVERYTHING!!), clam chowder and the garlic Dungeness crab.
All were amazing!!
You should make reservations as the place filled up pretty quickly right after they opened.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: LuLu L.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Super yummy!! A great atmosphere and staff that was helpful with recommendations and attentive to our needs. Had the red chili garlic shrimp (the sauce that this is in you can put on EVERYTHING!!), clam chowder and the garlic Dungeness crab. All were amazing!! You should make reservations as the place filled up pretty quickly right after they opened.

excerpts: I ended up getting the red chili garlic shrimp with pasta (very tasty, got some heat to it and tons of garlic which I loved!).
They give you bread and butter before you eat your meal which was also good.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Magz K.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: This place was amazing! The food was incredible and the service was excellent. I ended up getting the red chili garlic shrimp with pasta (very tasty, got some heat to it and tons of garlic which I loved!). They give you bread and butter before you eat your meal which was also good.

excerpts: For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail.
We also had two Moscow Mules.
All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area.
By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area).
The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Ralph M.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
I would give the Fog Harbor Fish House 3 1/2 stars because it's a little better than just OK. We had a good experience and the service was impeccable, the restaurant was clean, and the view was perfect. For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail. We also had two Moscow Mules. All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area. By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area). The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty. And the Mules were well-mixed.

Our biggest complaint here was the overall lack of zest in the sauces. In a word, they were mostly boring. Serviceable, but boring. For example, I think serving run-of-the-mill cocktail sauce with that delectable crab meat is a mistake. I would go with something much more subtle but enhancing, such as a delicate lemon-saffron sauce or even a lightly spiced creme fraiche. Sure, offer the cocktail sauce for those who may want it, but this app screams for something more daring to help it stand above. So offer a selection of sauces. With the mussels, I didn't taste any garlic in the garlic aioli and sadly there was not enough of the cream sauce to truly enjoy it. And the sauce that accompanied the shrimp was ... eh. Could have been a lot more spicy.

As I said, our experience was good and maybe if we had gone with full-on meals rather than a sampling of apps, I might have rated it higher. I will add that for what we got, we left with satisfied appetites - I even left with some of the crab meat. If I get to the area again, I would return to Fog Harbor.

excerpts: but I felt that a real miss with the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp with its red chili paste, onions, red peppers and garlic, it featured only a handful of shrimp but plenty of an oily red sauce that enveloped the entire dish.
With one toasted piece of baguette bread for "dipping" the meal left me wanting something more filling, Thankfully, Fog Harbor offered complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter without asking.

Another benefit to sitting at the bar is that Fog Harbor also offers complimentary usage of their portable cell phone battery chargers for those who need a charge but forgot their cords or can't find an outlet.
A place that provides an affordable meal and an iPhone charge?
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Jason F.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
What is it about Fog Harbor Fish House that I love so much that every time I am in the Pier 39 or North Beach area whether with tourists or friends this is the one place I take them to? Maybe its because of their amazing clam chowders and tasty crab cakes, or for the fact for as long I always known about this place the wait is never long, as there seems to always be plenty of room to get a table or a place at the bar even during the prized Happy Hour.

And that's the best part of Fog Harbor Fish House, the food is fresh and nicely prepared and, for the most part, is an affordable option in the tourist mecca that is Pier 39. They represent the perfect kinds of seafood dishes that San Francisco has to offer. For the most part they are always filled at Fog Harbor, thanks to their stable of dishes from seafood to meats. 

My friend and I were hungry, so I knew for this trip the Happy Hour menu would be perfect for us as we had another place to get to after our early meal. So when in doubt after perusing the Happy Hour menu, which is very short for a Happy Hour menu, as it only has four dishes total, we simply went with everything on it: fried calamari, red chili shrimp, chicken wings, and garlic fries. Their cocktail menu is actually really thorough, especially for Happy Hour and for some reason I always go with the tried and true, the Lombard Lemonade with its SVEDKA Raspberry vodka, black raspberry liqueur, and fresh squeezed lemonade, it went down like juice, smooth with a hint of sourness. And at 6 dollars for the drink for their Happy Hour price, it wasn't exactly a 50 percent off discount, but it was a reasonably enough priced drink that made me want to drink some more!

As for our dishes, the garlic fries, as always are solid, the perfect Bay Area treat if one could call it that, the crispy lemon calamari served with lemon aioli was nice and crunchy and tasted better than most. The chicken wings were tart and tasty but I felt that a real miss with the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp with its red chili paste, onions, red peppers and garlic, it featured only a handful of shrimp but plenty of an oily red sauce that enveloped the entire dish. With one toasted piece of baguette bread for "dipping" the meal left me wanting something more filling, Thankfully, Fog Harbor offered complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter without asking. Another benefit to sitting at the bar is that Fog Harbor also offers complimentary usage of their portable cell phone battery chargers for those who need a charge but forgot their cords or can't find an outlet. A place that provides an affordable meal and an iPhone charge? We really are in the 21st century aren't we?  

I really do like Fog Harbor, it's really the only place I regularly go to in that touristy area. But be forewarned it,,like many other places in the area, can get pricier the further you look down their menu. Besides going for Happy Hour my best recommendations would be the crab cakes in the appetizer menu, which always taste hearty and fresh and are under twenty dollars as well as the award-winning clam chowder which in a sourdough bowl clocks in at 10 dollars which is quite reasonable. I've been to Fog Harbor when they're slammed and when things are slow, it's the overall quality of food and service that always makes me come back for more each and every time.

excerpts:
Starters: 
Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Tangy, sweet and sour, really loved it.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Sebin K.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
We hit the Fog Harbor Fish house on Pier 39,Fishermans wharf for lunch. All the tables to the far end of the restaurant were full but we were lucky enough to get a table right beside the windows overlooking the sea.They definitely offer the best views of the Golden Gate bridge(as long as the skies are clear with no fog), the alcatraz island and the blue ocean.

Impeccable service, the server helped us decide between items on the menu for starters as well as the main course. For example, my friends and I didn't want the crab with the bones so they got us the Cioppino with just the crab meat.

Starters: 
Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Tangy, sweet and sour, really loved it.
Crab Cake: The meat was perfectly cooked and it was upto the reviews you'd already see on Yelp.

Main Course:
Swordfish: Impressed!
Cioppino: We ordered the usual Cioppino but when the check arrived, it said the 'Lazy Cioppino'. I wasnt so impressed because all i could taste was tomato sauce. The scallops, the mussels and the salmon were cooked however there weren't any flavors to it from the curry/sauce.

excerpts: and then I tried the red chili garlic shrimp.
My shrimp was so good, honestly, if I had more money I would have ordered a second one.
There were several kids in our party but
the crayons and coloring sheets the hostess gave them were enough to keep them happy until they got their food.
Can't ask for much more.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Michelle O.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: As a native of the city, I enjoy taking visitors to Fog Harbor Fish House. The wharf is a real tourist trap and Alito's is a welcome step away from that. Classic fish dishes well done, very good service, a willingness to work with kid's preferences, and great views of the bay. Last time I was there I had a cup of clam chowder and then I tried the red chili garlic shrimp. My shrimp was so good, honestly, if I had more money I would have ordered a second one. There were several kids in our party but the crayons and coloring sheets the hostess gave them were enough to keep them happy until they got their food. Can't ask for much more.

excerpts: (so good), red chili garlic shrimp!
(take caution, it's really spicy), and cioppono (large tasty portion)!
red chili garlic shrimp.author: M K.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
I come back here because they serve one item with Zabihah Creekstone Steak - the NY Strip.  It tastes delicious! :D

Remember to ask for a price adjustment on your parking slip if you parked in the Pier 39 garage.  

Other things on their menu that were fantastic: clam chowder! (so good), red chili garlic shrimp! (take caution, it's really spicy), and cioppono (large tasty portion)!

excerpts: The red chili garlic shrimp and crab cake were awesome!
Highly recommend this place.
Also conveniently located on pier 39.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Wafi M.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Excellent service. Great food. The red chili garlic shrimp and crab cake were awesome! Highly recommend this place. Also conveniently located on pier 39.

excerpts: Our server Ash recommended the red chili garlic shrimp for an app as well as hibiscus margaritatas that were bomb!
Really loved her smile and recommendations.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Phil G.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Went to fog harbor for lunch with a friend and had a blast. Our server Ash recommended the red chili garlic shrimp for an app as well as hibiscus margaritatas that were bomb! Really loved her smile and recommendations.

excerpts: This last visit I started with clam chowder and the red chili garlic shrimp.
The clam chowder is really good.
The sauce for the shrimp is tasty with a nice kick.
I had a half order of the roasted garlic crab.
That was good too, but not as good as I expected.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Angela D.
red chili garlic shrimp.review:
I've been here a couple of times and both times I've been satisfied. The food is good, although I haven't had anything amazing. 

This last visit I started with clam chowder and the red chili garlic shrimp. The clam chowder is really good. The sauce for the shrimp is tasty with a nice kick. I had a half order of the roasted garlic crab. That was good too, but not as good as I expected. Also had a couple of Moscow mules from the bar that were good.

Service is pretty good however out waitress seemed a little flustered. She was pleasant but probably just overwhelmed since it was s busy night.

Overall my experience both times were good. It's in a great location (Pier 39) if you want to walk off your food after, grab dessert or just check out the view.

excerpts: I had a red chili garlic shrimp.
The sauce was great.
Sour taste.
The bread was spicy, delicious.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Mao Y.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: I had a red chili garlic shrimp. The sauce was great. Sour taste. The bread was spicy, delicious.

excerpts: Red Chili Garlic Shrimp was amazing!
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Sarah N.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Great service, good food and good view for a nice leisurely lunch!  Red Chili Garlic Shrimp was amazing!

excerpts: The red chili garlic shrimp is amazing!!!
It's very sour and hot.
Though we did wait for the wait to order our food, the food didn't take that long.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Grace L.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: The seafood here is definitely among the best I have ever had!! The red chili garlic shrimp is amazing!!! It's very sour and hot. Though we did wait for the wait to order our food, the food didn't take that long.

excerpts: I didn't order a dinner, but got the red chili garlic shrimp appetizer and a salad.
I think the waiter was a bit confused, but didn't make too much of a fuss over it.
Hubby ordered the ciopppino and said it was good, but not what he had hoped it would be.
Overall, I would probably look for other places to eat before I headed back here.
red chili garlic shrimp.author: Michelle D.
red chili garlic shrimp.review: Food was good, atmosphere was a touristy (no surprise there) and VERY loud.  We were seated rather quickly on a Friday night but our table was awkwardly positioned under a beam of some sort, right next to the waiter area (where the waiters gather, put their orders in, etc).  It was VERY warm, so much so that I almost left midway to cool off outside.   I ordered the clam chowder, which I usually DON'T order, as I am not a fan of cream soups, but I actually enjoyed it a lot.  I didn't order a dinner, but got the red chili garlic shrimp appetizer and a salad.  I think the waiter was a bit confused, but didn't make too much of a fuss over it.  Hubby ordered the ciopppino and said it was good, but not what he had hoped it would be.   Overall, I would probably look for other places to eat before I headed back here.

excerpts:
so

I ordered the steamed clams to start and to me although tasty, it was overly salted and smothered in corn- to me not successful

I also had their famous Cioppino which seemed to lack flavor- disappointed
steamed clams.author: Gregg B.
steamed clams.review:
I was really looking forward to eat at Fog Harbor

The reviews and photos on yelp made this place seem great

I walked over from my hotel and sat at the bar to watch the NBA playoffs with the SF Bay in the background- not a bad setting

Ordered a beer and a Prisoner wine

So far all was good- but the food to me was so so

I ordered the steamed clams to start and to me although tasty, it was overly salted and smothered in corn- to me not successful

I also had their famous Cioppino which seemed to lack flavor- disappointed

I don't know if I will come back- next time I go to Sotto Mare to try that

excerpts: My son has been asking for some steamed clams and I've been craving for some chowder; then hubby just wanted to tag-along.
He ordered the steamed clams with linguini.
Lastly, don't forget their non-alcoholic drinks.
I enjoyed the strawberry nojito!
steamed clams.author: KK M.
steamed clams.review:
Our server's name was Curtis the Courteous! He was a wonderful server right from the beginning. He was pleasant, detailed and spoke with class. He definitely made our trip to Fog Harbor Fish House a five star.

My son has been asking for some steamed clams and I've been craving for some chowder; then hubby just wanted to tag-along. I suggested the cioppino to him but he was skeptic at first because he didn't want to be let down. Luckily, I checked a yelper's tip first and a yelped suggested a linguini added. My Hubby loved it! 
We had calamari and steamed mussels for appetizer; it was delicious!!! My chowder was excellent! Our son, well he finished everything on his plate! He ordered the steamed clams with linguini. Lastly, don't forget their non-alcoholic drinks. I enjoyed the strawberry nojito! They even served fresh squeezed orange juice and lemonade.

We will definitely return.

excerpts:
The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn.
steamed clams.author: Shannen R.
steamed clams.review:
Two words: Tourist Trap.

Located in Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House sits on the 2nd Floor amongst many restaurants. It's outdoor waiting area is relaxing, spacious, and modern. It felt like I was sitting on a daybed in Hawaii and my parents can second that. 

Fancy? Yes. Pricey? Sure. Food content? As Yelp suggests, it is A-Ok.

I took my parents and siblings out to eat and only waited for 10 minutes to get seated. For a Monday afternoon, this place was already busy. Our host led us to our booth overlooking the pier and boy was that a treat. 

The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn. It was a little salty for my taste but my parents loved it!

Clam Chowder - Cup vs. Bowl - What should you get? Well, my sister and I ordered the cup size, which really is a size of an espresso cup. It was good enough to fill that clam chowder craving. My mom had the bowl. We all concurred that the chowder tasted pretty bland. Our waiter even forgot to give us crackers - whomp! 

Salmon - Yes, you've read that right. The plate is called Salmon. My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it. He gives it 4 stars.

Cioppino - Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food. So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth. It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out. 3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!: Mom and sister had to share this one out. They barely finished the whole plate. This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino. The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time. 5 stars.

Surf and Turf: Brother wanted some meat so he settled for this. He demolished his steak and lobster but says his veggies and mash potatoes were gross. 4 stars.

Drinks:

The  "Perfect Hibiscus Margarita" was really perfect. It was beautifully decorated and STRONG. My dad even tried it and got tipsy with this look deceiving drink. 5 stars. All that for $13.50? What a steal.

My dad's Lombard Lemonade was a refreshing drink. Again beautifully decorated and well worth the price.

Large portions, beautiful plates, and bomb drinks. And would you take a look at that seafront view?!

So why three stars?

Well, the food was A-Ok. It sure wasn't bad but it definitely didn't blow me away either. Solid 3 stars.

excerpts: Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto.
TO DIE FOR!
I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again!
All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant!
You will not be disappointed!
I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either!
LOL - my intuition was correct once again!
steamed clams.author: Laura G.
steamed clams.review: OMG, We found Nirvana! On a cold frozen night, we stumbled into This restaurant, sat at the bar have some drinks while waiting for our table. Then we realized how wonderful it was sitting at the bar and decided to have dinner at the bar. Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto. TO DIE FOR! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again! All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant! You will not be disappointed! I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either! LOL - my intuition was correct once again!

excerpts: The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand.
steamed clams.author: Cliff W.
steamed clams.review:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: Steamed clams, Caesar salad as appetizers.
All dishes were amazing along with a wonderful wine list.
We sat next to a clean large window with beautiful views of the bay.
Customer Service was on point and we got seated quickly since we had reservations.
We will definitely return for many more trips.
steamed clams.author: Jay R.
steamed clams.review: This place  was amazing. From the fresh bread & butter to our appetizers and main dishes. We chose to have their award winning clam chowder and we understand exactly why it was award winning. Steamed clams, Caesar salad as appetizers. All dishes were amazing along with a wonderful wine list. We sat next to a clean large window with beautiful views of the bay. Customer Service was on point and we got seated quickly since we had reservations. We will definitely return for many more trips.

excerpts: Delicious steamed clams!
Highly recommend!
steamed clams.author: Carolyn B.
steamed clams.review: Phenomenal clam chowder! Lots of clam in it! Delicious steamed clams! Highly recommend!

excerpts: the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers.
All were very good
(I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty).
Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10.
steamed clams.author: Matt K.
steamed clams.review: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.

excerpts: We tried the fresh oysters, steamed clams, clam chowder, calamari, poke, fish and chips, and linguini.
They were all excellent!
We will definitely come back!
steamed clams.author: Meghan B.
steamed clams.review: We were hesitant to come here because we thought it would be too touristy, but the experience, the ambiance, the views, and the food are all incredible. Our server Eddy was phenomenal. He was fun-loving and made our dinner one we will never forget! We tried the fresh oysters, steamed clams, clam chowder, calamari, poke, fish and chips, and linguini. They were all excellent! We will definitely come back!

excerpts: The oysters were small af and the steamed clams tasted so bad.
The waitress I got was so rude.
She intentionally made some noises while she was moving my plates and her attitude was terrible.
steamed clams.author: Mason Y.
steamed clams.review: This was one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. The oysters were small af and the steamed clams tasted so bad. The waitress I got was so rude. She intentionally made some noises while she was moving my plates and her attitude was terrible.

excerpts: Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.
The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth.
steamed clams.author: Ameenah M.
steamed clams.review:
First time, I really wanted to try this place because it has  4 stars of 1000 reviews. Plus the other place I wanted to try was packed. I mean it is a Saturday and today is the giants vs. LA dodgers game.

This place is upscale, fine dining type of place. I like that they offer places like these in an attraction base environment. Cause sometimes you want to enjoy a nice dinner with a fantastic view. Like this place I'm at right now. 

Our server is nice, but when we asked for water she said it's coming, and made it seem like someone else was bringing it but she brought it to us instead. Sometimes she'd walk by just to walk by and see that my water is almost empty and doesn't fill it up, you're just walking back and forth, what are you doing? 

Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.

What it tasted like: everything looked amazing. The clam chowder was the best thing we ordered, it was hot and very good. The seafood ciopponi was ok, there was some type of flavor I probably won't remember. The noodles were hard. The seafood in the ciopponi were good, I like the variety. There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs. The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth. This chorizo with tomatoes, I didn't really care for.

Would I come back? Maybe I'll try somewhere else first before I give this one another shot.

excerpts: I hate to bash a spot, but the oysters taste like crap, the steamed clams have corn in them (who does that) how can you screw up a bleu cheese wedge salad.
steamed clams.author: Frank C.
steamed clams.review:
Simply just not Good. I hate to bash a spot, but the oysters taste like crap, the steamed clams have corn in them (who does that) how can you screw up a bleu cheese wedge salad. On the bright side The coors light was good if this helps. 

Simply disappointed, dinner time ruined. I didn't complain and still tipped,  it's not the servers fault this places blows donkey nuts. 

I really don't know how all you yelpers gave this place 4 stars and over 2800 reviews, what the hell is wrong with all of you. Unreal. I'm done listening and taking a chance with the hype, this keeps happening more and more.

I'm just visiting SF but if anyone comes out to L.A. Please try the Santa Monica Seafood Market. Trust me!!!!

excerpts: Pork in steamed clams?????
Come better than that.
Who does that?
steamed clams.author: Lester E F.
steamed clams.review: Great location, pretty fast service, friendly staff, excellent bread, but pork in clam Chowder???? Pork in steamed clams????? Come better than that. Who does that?

excerpts: I tried the blue cheese rolls (a yelp favorite) and as an entree me and my other half got the shellfish platter for 2 which contained steamed clams, mussels, garlic shrimp, garlic Dungeness crab drenched in buttery olive oil garlic sauce.
Delicious just like going fishing and eating the prey.
steamed clams.author: Ellaine C.
steamed clams.review:
The second we walked by this place the hostess greeted us and was really friendly! Out of all the places to eat seafood near the bay we chose this place because of its 4.5 reviews. 

1. Appearance 10/10- the outside looked like a ship or a boat and I liked the different color toned wood floors, the comfortable seating as well as the windows overlooking the harbor and ocean. Everything looked clean as well.

2. Customer Service 10/10- besides the hostess who promptly seated us after 10 min of waiting on a lobby coach (great because my legs hurt from all the walking), the waiter quickly came to greet us and get our drink orders.

3. Food 10/10- the food was incredible. I tried the blue cheese rolls (a yelp favorite) and as an entree me and my other half got the shellfish platter for 2 which contained steamed clams, mussels, garlic shrimp, garlic Dungeness crab drenched in buttery olive oil garlic sauce. Delicious just like going fishing and eating the prey. The only bad thing is we smelt like sea water after lol.

I'm definitely bringing my family back here.

excerpts: Had steamed clams and i got about 4 sandy ones.
That I can somewhat overlook
but the worst was the seafood tower.
It came with 5 shrimp cocktails
but like 4 out of the 5 shrimp had been deveined improperly.
You can see brownish residue along where they deveined them.
This is the first time I've come across that
steamed clams.author: Heejin L.
steamed clams.review:
Horrible tourist trap with horrible service and poorly cleaned seafood.
Had steamed clams and i got about 4 sandy ones. 
That I can somewhat overlook but the worst was the seafood tower. It came with 5 shrimp cocktails but like 4 out of the 5 shrimp had been deveined improperly. You can see brownish residue along where they deveined them. This is the first time I've come across that and I have eaten quite a bit of seafood.

The server barely checked up on us. The managers that came by would take forever to give us to-go boxes and no one would bring us the check until we asked, although we were clearly done. 

The food was not that great. The clam chowder wasnt bad and i liked that you can add crab to it.  The seafood tower was just ok. The seafood didn't seem that fresh and they cleaned the inside of the crab (where the tomalley is) really well [unlike the shrimp veins]. I personally love crab tomalley so I felt gipped. They didn't explain which oysters were which. And the tower only comes with half a lobster tail and a claw which I thought was rubbery and overcooked. 

The cioppino was not good. It seemed more like a watery pasta sauce. I actually took it home to add pasta to it and it was better that way.

excerpts: We had the steamed clams for a starter.
Some interesting taste selections for the broth.
I would have liked a small bowl rather than a plate to serve my clams on.
steamed clams.author: David M.
steamed clams.review:
They tried really hard, and I very much enjoyed the food.  It was a Wednesday July sunset with lots of tourists (including myself, but I was brought by a local).  Some of the tourists should probably be supervised while out in public, or away from their tiny villages for the first time.

We had the steamed clams for a starter.  Some interesting taste selections for the broth.  I would have liked a small bowl rather than a plate to serve my clams on.  The broth sloshes all over the plate, and then you have the serving bowl left with some really edible broth/brine that is taken away uneaten.

My friend had the blackened Cod.  He raved about it constantly.  He'd probably eat it daily if he lived closer.  It was a weird experience to witness for sure.

I had the cioppino, and paid extra to have the crab removed from the shell (I wish everyone did that).  I'm not sure that crab made it back into the dish, but some of the shell did.  I found one scallop in the whole dish, and I don't know what the fish was.  It wasn't the best cioppino I've ever had, but I'll place it 2 or 3 because I could pay to have the crab removed from the shell even though I couldn't find it.

I'd go back again, insist on better seating, and be pickier about my plate.  I'd go back again.

excerpts: We started with the steamed clams, I would bathe in the broth if I could.
The crab was delicious and fun to crack open and eat, bib and all.
And no review of the Fog Harbor would be complete with out mentioning the clam chowder: it really was the best I've eaten here.
Not too thick, clams so tender
steamed clams.author: Kate S.
steamed clams.review:
Fog Harbor was a lovely stop on our spring trip to SF. We were seated right away(arrived around 6 on a Friday evening) and had a wonderful view of the harbor, sea lions, and sunset. The view is undeniably spectacular. 

I would have given Fog House five stars if our waiter had been a bit better, but I realize everyone has off days. Our service was less than prompt and our waiter seemed like he didn't have too much interest on our table. He seemed annoyed that we only ordered appetizer portions of whole crab. 

It was a shame our waiter was such a goof because the food was delicious and simple (how I feel seafood is best).

We started with the steamed clams, I would bathe in the broth if I could. The crab was delicious and fun to crack open and eat, bib and all.  And no review of the Fog Harbor would be complete with out mentioning the clam chowder: it really was the best I've eaten here. Not too thick, clams so tender I almost couldn't believe they were clams. 

All together, a great stop. For a bottle of Chardonnay, clam appetizer, three appetizer clams and three cups of clam chowder our bill was around $200, as a heads up.

excerpts: For appetizer, we ordered the the steamed clams, also very good.
We could drink the sauce, it was that flavorful.
The crab topped clam chowder is also very highly recommended.
For entrees, we each got the crab special, it is huge but so good.
I would recommend sharing it with another person.
steamed clams.author: Jezelle P.
steamed clams.review: This place was excellent. We went right before sunset so we had a fantastic view and enjoyed it with a good bottle of wine. Our timing was perfect because the crab was in season and had a whole menu dedicated to it. I would definitely recommend people ordering from that menu. For appetizer, we ordered the the steamed clams, also very good. We could drink the sauce, it was that flavorful. The crab topped clam chowder is also very highly recommended. For entrees, we each got the crab special, it is huge but so good. I would recommend sharing it with another person.

excerpts: We then split the crab louis and the steamed clams.
We got brought out the steamed clams with chorizo...which is not what we ordered
but
oh well.
steamed clams.author: H D.
steamed clams.review:
I was extremely excited to try this place out for lunch. The view alone is what intrigued me to come to this spot. And to be honest, that was the best part of dining at Fog Harbor.  

In my opinion, the view should just be a compliment to the food, not the only thing that is great about the experience.  

Our server didn't say more then 5 words to us. 

We ordered the fried calamari which was my favorite out of all the dishes we ordered.  The deep fried jalepeno was a nice touch. 

We then split the crab louis and the steamed clams.

We got brought out the steamed clams with chorizo...which is not what we ordered but oh well. It was mehh, I was looking forward to the buttery white wine sauce.

However, the crab louis is what I take an issue with. The salad was straight up bagged.....I have no doubt in my mind. When you are paying more then $20.00 for a salad it should NOT be bagged salad are you kidding?!? It was just not good. My boyfriend and I left disappointed. 

Remember what I mentioned about our server only saying 5 words to us? Yeah it was to ask if we had yelp? And I said yes. He then circled his name and said "write me a good review!" 

.....What???!? This guy barely spoke to us the whole entire lunch and now he was asking for a good yelp review? I DON'T THINK SO. 

We will be going to Scoma's next time....they have yet to fail us!

excerpts: From the overflowing amount of crab in the San Francisco favorite Crab Louie salad, to the crispy and fresh calamari appetizer to truly, one of the best bowls of steamed clams you may ever have, it was a perfect lunch at Fisherman's Wharf.
steamed clams.author: Jennifer O.
steamed clams.review:
My parent's hotel, The Argonaut, recommended them and I'd previously read on SFGate this restaurant is notable.

I have to tell you - and it might be a surprise to you as well since it's at PIER 39 - it is.

From the food to the service and certainly the views, Fog Harbor Fish House is about as perfect as you'll get for a San Francisco seafood restaurant.

Specializing in sustainable seafood and with a luxe, Malibu-style gorgeous outdoor space by the entry complete with roaring fireplace, Fog Harbor Fish House is a perfect choice for out-of-town friends and family you're hosting to a romantic date. 

It's such a surprise to find a "view" restaurant not resting on its laurels or looking a little dated and frumpy (you know who you are).

From the overflowing amount of crab in the San Francisco favorite Crab Louie salad, to the crispy and fresh calamari appetizer to truly, one of the best bowls of steamed clams you may ever have, it was a perfect lunch at Fisherman's Wharf.

Sleek, modern yet comfortable, the ambiance strikes the perfect chord as does its food.

It's just a bit pricey (you will, after all, pay for the pluperfect view) however the quality and postcard perfect location equate to Fog Harbor Fish House being well-priced.

I would go there again in a heartbeat, all on my "local own"   -without out-of-town family and friends.

If you're thinking, "Wow, that's pretty high praise"... it is.

And Fog Harbor Fish House surely deserves it.

excerpts: I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious.
steamed clams.author: Lauren M.
steamed clams.review:
My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced. 

The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome! 

Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!! 

One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.

excerpts: Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino.
Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams.
Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious.
Service was excellent.
Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola.
And don't forget to get your parking validated.
steamed clams.author: Veronica C.
steamed clams.review: Bff and I got very greedy coming here. We were one of the few patrons, as it was 11am on a Thursday morning. I started off with a refreshing blueberry press and we shared a daily special ceviche. Not the best ceviche, but it was decent. Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino. Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams. Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious. Service was excellent. Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola. And don't forget to get your parking validated.

excerpts: We had the Steamed Clams as our appetizer and that was definitely the best dish of the night--most likely because of the amazing chorizo butter sauce.
For our main courses, we had Swordfish and the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese.
steamed clams.author: KC G.
steamed clams.review:
The location of the restaurant and the views over the Bay greatly help the rating for Fog Harbor Fish House. We made reservations for two on a Friday night and were seated within minutes of arriving--make sure to request for a table with a window view as the view is breathtaking. 

As for the menus, both the food and wine lists were extensive with multiple options and lots of specials. The sourdough bread that they serve is absolutely delicious and probably one of the best breads that I have tasted. We had the Steamed Clams as our appetizer and that was definitely the best dish of the night--most likely because of the amazing chorizo butter sauce. For our main courses, we had Swordfish and the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese. Although both were good, they were not anything special which was very disappointing (especially considering the price).

In the end, I would recommend this restaurant simply for its location and views but I don't think I would go back again for the food other than appetizers.

excerpts: The swordfish dish, mussel fries and steamed clams were outstanding.
Usually swordfish is grilled too long and becomes a task to eat--not at this place.
They grilled it perfectly and served it warm.
Very pleased.
Also, the cream and fennel sauce that was used for the muscle fries was a delicious way to serve a nontraditional combination of fries and chips.
As a plus, the wait staff was very willing to accommodate our two-year-old who is often a dining challenge for most eateries.
I will go back!
steamed clams.author: Sarkit S.
