steamed clams.review: Great food! Went here on a quick visit to family and was looking for yummy seafood. This place got great reviews, so we decided to try it. The swordfish dish, mussel fries and steamed clams were outstanding. Usually swordfish is grilled too long and becomes a task to eat--not at this place. They grilled it perfectly and served it warm. Very pleased. Also, the cream and fennel sauce that was used for the muscle fries was a delicious way to serve a nontraditional combination of fries and chips. As a plus, the wait staff was very willing to accommodate our two-year-old who is often a dining challenge for most eateries. I will go back!

excerpts: Got very upset when ordered steamed clams only to find out that out of about 20 clams 10 were empty :(
steamed clams.author: Vadim K.
steamed clams.review: Got very upset when ordered steamed clams only to find out that out of about 20 clams 10 were empty :(

excerpts: The red chili prawns are flavorful, and pack a decent zing, but the steamed clams lacked flavor.
steamed clams.author: Maria S.
steamed clams.review:
First, I need to give a shout-out to Faycal and Oscar. Their service was five star quality. Be sure to ask for them the next time you're dining at Fog Harbor.

Ours was a big party - two full tables - and we were seated in the back of the restaurant, which had lovely views, but no air circulation. As the sun went down, the room became entirely too stuffy for comfort. I had to get up to walk outside several times just to clear my head. The bar and main restaurant areas were a good 10-15 degrees cooler. That said, it was really nice outside; the wharf is a beautiful place to have dinner.

The fried calamari is an excellent way to start a meal at Fog Harbor. Crispy and expertly cooked, they were absolutely delicious.

If you like sourdough bread, then you'll love the stuff here. People at our tables also raved about the clam chowder, the tuna and the garlic-roasted crab. 

The red chili prawns are flavorful, and pack a decent zing, but the steamed clams lacked flavor. Stick with the more highly spiced dishes and you'll be fine.

Desserts were A-OK as well. Nothing too fancy. Our table had just about every dish offered, and I tried most of them. My favorites were the blondie, the apple crisp, and the cheesecake.

excerpts: Steamed clams were by far the best I have ever had
steamed clams.author: Courtney M.
steamed clams.review: We only sat at the bar and split some appetizers, but the service and food was amazing! Steamed clams were by far the best I have ever had

excerpts: The broth for the steamed clams was dull, and the panko encrusted scallops served with jalapeño aioli were a deep fried mess.
The cocktails, @$13 per were tasty and along with the fresh sourdough bread were the highlights of the meal.
Not likely to recommend this place to foodie tourist.
steamed clams.author: Drew P.
steamed clams.review: Pass. This is a hard review to write after just one visit, but as it is located at Pier 39/fisherman's wharf, most folks will have a very similar experience. Lots of tourist crass, as expected in the general area, we chose this restaurant because it had the best yelp rating. As walk-ups on a slowish Tuesday night we were seated way in the back far from the scenic window view. Ok, fair enough. We liked but didn't love the lobster Mac and cheese. We liked the creamy clam chowder. The broth for the steamed clams was dull, and the panko encrusted scallops served with jalapeño aioli were a deep fried mess. The cocktails, @$13 per were tasty and along with the fresh sourdough bread were the highlights of the meal. Not likely to recommend this place to foodie tourist.

excerpts: We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.
We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus.
A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot.
The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly.
Definitely worth a try!
steamed clams.author: Laura B.
steamed clams.review: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!

excerpts: We had the steamed clams for an appetizer.
They were delicious and melted in your mouth.
steamed clams.author: Katrina M.
steamed clams.review:
I had the Whole Dungessness Crab & My boyfriend had the Surf & Turf. Next time I'd like to get the Whole Lobster. The Crab was cooked perfectly in garlic! It came with mashed potatoes & steamed vegetables. It was perfect! I was pretty full afterwards. I had a drink called Alcatraz Escape, it was good, but a little too sweet, perhaps the margarita next time? Or maybe, just a beer.. 
We had the steamed clams for an appetizer. They were delicious and melted in your mouth. The leftover sauce was great for our bread! 

Our server was very nice, & we didn't get bothered much! :) 

We made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait, (it was 645 on a Wed, a small crowd)

excerpts: My daughter ordered the steamed clams  &  they were cooked to perfection, my son-in-law had the curried steamed mussles - even more amazing than the clams- he let me taste one.
I had the clam chowder...and it was perfect!
I have had many a bowl of chowder in SF and I am a tough critic.
Hubby had a cup of clam chowder & a crab cocktail-
he gave those the thumbs up too.
The bread basket was filled with hot, sour dough & I swear no matter how much we consumed the waiter managed to keep fresh, hot breat on our table.

The little one had the grilled cheese & fries...as with most little ones he ate the fries & some of the grilled cheese...it was a beautiful sandwich...toasted a little too much for a toddler...but perfect for a child, a little older.
In fact the grilled cheese looked so go, I would have been happy to have had it for lunch with my soup.
Best of all since it was my daughter's birthday they brought us the most AMAZING butterscotch soaked bread pudding with a side of ice cream....
the dessert was so yummy...
I am not a big bread pudding fan...but next time we are here
I am ordering one JUST for me!
steamed clams.author: Debbie M.
steamed clams.review: Wow oh wow...great & I do mean Great service...we stopped in for lunch 4  adults & one over active toddler.  We were seated by the window....our waiter was top notch. My daughter ordered the steamed clams  &  they were cooked to perfection, my son-in-law had the curried steamed mussles - even more amazing than the clams- he let me taste one.  I had the clam chowder...and it was perfect!  I have had many a bowl of chowder in SF and I am a tough critic.  Hubby had a cup of clam chowder & a crab cocktail- he gave those the thumbs up too.  The bread basket was filled with hot, sour dough & I swear no matter how much we consumed the waiter managed to keep fresh, hot breat on our table.  The little one had the grilled cheese & fries...as with most little ones he ate the fries & some of the grilled cheese...it was a beautiful sandwich...toasted a little too much for a toddler...but perfect for a child, a little older.  In fact the grilled cheese looked so go, I would have been happy to have had it for lunch with my soup.  Best of all since it was my daughter's birthday they brought us the most AMAZING butterscotch soaked bread pudding with a side of ice cream....the dessert was so yummy...I am not a big bread pudding fan...but next time we are here I am ordering one JUST for me!

excerpts: I love French fries as well, so I decided to try the Mussel Fries starter
and I think the most tasty thing of it wasn't the mussels and fries alone, it was the creamy white sauce they used with it.
Very different
mussel fries.author: Teda R.
mussel fries.review:
From the food, to the view, and to the staffs, it's all marvelous! I've been here so many times with my family because we really do enjoy eating here. It's our to go restaurant whenever we are adventuring around the Pier or craving clam chowder. I'm from Stockton and yes, we really do drive to SF sometimes just to eat here lol!

I've tried countless of restaurants in SF that serves clam chowder, and I think Fog Habor have the best ones! + adding crab meat makes it extra delicious! Is definitely worth it to get the shellfish platter or tower if you're into seafood! A great variety and nice portion. The salsa dipping sauce that came with the Shellfish Tower was to die for. It's mixed very well with the touch of crab meat too. I love crab meat as you can tell lol! I love French fries as well, so I decided to try the Mussel Fries starter and I think the most tasty thing of it wasn't the mussels and fries alone, it was the creamy white sauce they used with it. Very different but I like. 

The servers here are sooo sweet and friendly. They're the ones to lit up the atmosphere of the restaurant. I never once experienced bad service here. 

I think the only con here is the waiting. It's usually very busy on weekends and especially during dinner hours, which is when I'm usually here lol. You can either reserve ahead of time or put yourself onto the waitlist on Yelp before arriving. It really does help the waiting time to be lessen.

I definitely recommend this restaurant!

excerpts: Mussel Fries (5/5) -
um yes please.
what is in that sauce?
mussel fries.author: Paul L.
mussel fries.review:
Dear Foggy,

I am glad I found you. My good friend yelp let me know I should check you out, so I did.

I was looking for a place to take my in-laws, somewhere nice, somewhere where the food is distinctly San-Francisco-like, and of course the food has got to be good. You hit the mark.

I don't dish out 5-stars lightly, but I'll give it to you. If the prices were like $5 cheaper and the seats a little farther apart you would be perfect, but hey I understand. If I was running a business at such a prime location and brimming in the seams, I would have done exactly the same so I can't hold that against you.

To keep it simple, your service good, your people are nice, and the food is fantastic. The highest compliment is that despite your prices, I've returned yet again, with my own parents some months later. We even got seated right next to the window and when that happens it's like magic. Also the wait was never as long as it seems for a place so busy. I would have expected to wait 45minutes to an hour but somehow it ends up being way short of that each time.

As for the food.

Mussel Fries (5/5) - um yes please. what is in that sauce? yum.

Seafood Penne (4/5) - very good. I don't order pasta much because I am not a big fan of pasta so this is a high compliment. pasta lovers would have a field day.

Clam Chowder (5/5) - yeah people might have different opinions but I am firmly in the camp of ... this is really good clam chowder. flavorful, little chunks of meat. Usually I leave clam chowder places wondering if they just opened a can of campbell soup. This ain't one of those.

Seared Scallop Risotto (5/5) - oh yes. yes. very delicious. expensive but delicious. wish there were more scallops, but those scallops that were there... delicious. 

You have become our go-to place to bring people we want to take out to the city to see pier 39. great job.

until then...

excerpts: Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards.
We basically lick our plates clean.
mussel fries.author: danielle a.
mussel fries.review:
This is one of our favorite local spots. It's great for a sit down dinner with friends but they also have bar seating that's first come first serve. I will say the service is MUCH better if you sit at a table. Great views & for as touristy as it is the food is killer!

One of my favorite dishes is the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon. There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood. Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards. We basically lick our plates clean. Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.

The fog house lager is really good! Try their beers

excerpts: We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty.
The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough.
I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top.
We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first.
mussel fries.author: Sarina J.
mussel fries.review:
Food is pretty good, but is HEAVY. Like I still feel the clam chowder in my stomach, writing this days later. Had to knock down a star for some service issues.

Due to traffic, we barely made the 10-minute cutoff for being late to our reservation. However, we sat for a good 10-15 minutes ignored by at least 3-4 staff members, including who we would find out to be our actual waitress. Just a little after opening, it was busy but not chaotic, and we got one of the last booths in the middle facing the water. However, no one stopped by to offer water or anything for these 10-15 minutes. When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away. Ooookay? However, her attitude adjusted quickly when she came back, and was extremely accommodating and polite afterwards.

As for the food, like I said, it was heavy. We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty. The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough. I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top. We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first. But everything was cooked well.

For my entree, I got the clam chowder and Caesar salad combo, but could barely finish half of the clam chowder. My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne. I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite! The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it. The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free! The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF. Pretty good! When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.

excerpts: The mussel fries were surprisingly my favorite thing there.
The sauce it came on top of was so good!
Then I also got the capriccio, which was just ok.
I didn't eat too much because I had filled up on the appetizer.
mussel fries.author: Linda C.
mussel fries.review:
This place was a great spot to eat at. 
The views were nice & it was easy to get a table. 
We were seated in 2 mins. 
Service was good and they even validated parking, however when we tried to leave the parking structure said we were given one that was already expired ? So that's why I knocked off one star. 

I didn't like the complimentary bread. 
The mussel fries were surprisingly my favorite thing there. The sauce it came on top of was so good! 
Then I also got the capriccio, which was just ok. I didn't eat too much because I had filled up on the appetizer. 
The creme brûlée was pretty good as well. 

All in all, the seafood was fresh and I would come again.

excerpts: We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto.
Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice.
All of the dishes were packed with flavor!
We were too full for dessert
so we omitted from ordering
but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée!
We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House.
I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends
and I hope you have Lulu as your server!
mussel fries.author: Cheryle L.
mussel fries.review: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the long Labor Day weekend from San Diego and decided to make the Fog Harbor Fish House the first spot we ate at. The wait for our table took around 45 minutes which I think is pretty fair considering the restaurant's busy location. There are plenty of benches and chairs to sit and wait at which is awesome for my tired feet. My boyfriend and I were seated on the right side of the restaurant with a nice view of Alcatraz and the water. Lulu was our server who was very helpful in guiding us on what her recommendations were on the menu. We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto. Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice. All of the dishes were packed with flavor! We were too full for dessert so we omitted from ordering but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée! We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House. I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends and I hope you have Lulu as your server!

excerpts: We started off with the Mussel Fries ($16), which I HIGHLY recommend just because I'm a fry person.
But also because it's actually delicious with the sauce and mussels.
My boyfriend and I also split a clam chowder bread bowl ($11), but I recommend getting a regular bowl and using the complimentary sourdough bread to dip since you don't want to get full off of bread.
mussel fries.author: Jenny N.
mussel fries.review:
Amazing dinner place for date nights - classy yet casual. Located on Pier 39, which has a lot of shops to check out while waiting for your name to be called for dinner. Wait for dinner wasn't long at all - maybe 15 minutes in total without a reservation on a Saturday night at 8pm.

We started off with the Mussel Fries ($16), which I HIGHLY recommend just because I'm a fry person. But also because it's actually delicious with the sauce and mussels. My boyfriend and I also split a clam chowder bread bowl ($11), but I recommend getting a regular bowl and using the complimentary sourdough bread to dip since you don't want to get full off of bread. For the main course, we ordered the lazy cioppino ($41), and our server split the dish between my boyfriend and I without us asking. It's too much if you eat alone. We also ended up sharing a dessert plate with chocolate cake and creme brûlée, very light & delicious even when you're full. 

Parking isn't bad... there's a parking garage that's located right across the street from pier 39 which is super convenient because we didn't want to waste time looking for street parking. Again, it's not a bad price...IF YOU DON'T LOSE YOUR PARKING TICKET. I cannot stress this enough. The parking ticket is your GOLDEN TICKET. Each hour is $10, with a max at 5 hours. You can get your ticket validated and get the first hour free. Our ticket would've have cost $10 since we only stayed for 2 1/2 hours, and we wouldve gotten the ticket validated. HOWEVER, we lost it and had to pay the max fee ($50), WHICH IS OUTRAGEOUS (I was very sad). Other than this, Fog Harbor would have gotten a 5 star review but parking wasn't an amazing experience :(

excerpts: The drinks were really really good and the mussel fries are delicious but the chef needs to cut back on the pepper.
Everything we had seemed to have way too much pepper in it.
I had to send something back because all I tasted was pepper.
The staff was really nice about it though and got me another dish ... which also had too much pepper on it but was more edible than the previous dish.
mussel fries.author: Chris R.
mussel fries.review: The drinks were really really good and the mussel fries are delicious but the chef needs to cut back on the pepper. Everything we had seemed to have way too much pepper in it. I had to send something back because all I tasted was pepper. The staff was really nice about it though and got me another dish ... which also had too much pepper on it but was more edible than the previous dish.

excerpts: The mussel fries were still ah-freakin-mazing(!) and the clam chowder was really good.
It was my boyfriend's first time and he was in heaven.
They sat us next to the windows where the Blue Angels were putting on a spectacular show.
Everything was perfect and it was a lunch to remember.
Thank you Fog Harbor!
mussel fries.author: Hoyan L.
mussel fries.review: Came back again for Fleet Week and this place is still as amazing as I remembered. The mussel fries were still ah-freakin-mazing(!) and the clam chowder was really good. It was my boyfriend's first time and he was in heaven. They sat us next to the windows where the Blue Angels were putting on a spectacular show. Everything was perfect and it was a lunch to remember. Thank you Fog Harbor!

excerpts: This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries.
The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch
but they are, and
the cream sauce was delicious.
The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here.
I generally prefer for my cod to have

that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table).
Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab.
Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options.
Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth
a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway.
We will be coming back!
mussel fries.author: Joanne S.
mussel fries.review:
Every time my mom comes to SF I take her to get seafood at Fog Harbor Fish House. Great view of the bay and Alcatraz, located at Pier 39 so lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. Of course, with the tourist location comes tourist prices but it's not that bad. In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5. We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good! This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later. Service is usually quite good and you can get seated usually within an hour even if there is a wait - no problem there's lots to do while you wait!

This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries. The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch but they are, and the cream sauce was delicious. The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here. I generally prefer for my cod to have that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table). However our waiter was fabulous at everything else, including getting our check to us early as we had lost track of time and had an upcoming appointment.

My brother usually comes with us and always gets the burger because he doesn't like seafood. It's alright, but really why come to a seafood house for a burger? It does comes with those delicious fries.

Tl;dr: great views, great service, great area, generally great food. Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab. Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options. Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway. We will be coming back!

excerpts: Recently, the staff recommended their mussel fries.
mussel fries.author: Eri N.
mussel fries.review:
This is our favorite. The staff is excellent and the food is divine. Fog Harbor came highly recommended. 

Our standard order is the clam chowder with crab. It is the best! Recently, the staff recommended their mussel fries. It sounded strange, but was a table favorite. 

Fog Harbor is a must in Fog City.

excerpts: Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!
mussel fries.author: Christine A.
mussel fries.review:
wow!  I love this place.

we managed to get a window-view table; an awesome water/land and Alcatraz picture opportunity before or after your meal.

we had a wonderful server named Kayla.  She is very nice and very helpful with Appetizer and Meal recommendations.
Very, very attentive!   

food and service; ON POINT!

Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!

Will definitely be back here!!!

excerpts: For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries.
All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp.
That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick.
mussel fries.author: Jennie N.
mussel fries.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: the real star is the mussel fries.
forget everything else in pier 39.
Come here and get the mussel fries, it was absolutely worth it.
It's a big plate with a nice seafood cream broth/sauce, a ton of mussels (~15+) and some crispy fries.
The mussels were the best I ever had.
mussel fries.author: Olive X.
mussel fries.review:
Pier 39 has a bunch of pricey tourist trap restaurants, but this is not one of them.

Had a really nice cozy date by the waterfront! The service was really fast, and the food was delicious. We got the clam chowder bread bowl which was claimed to be SF's best. it was delicious!


the real star is the mussel fries. forget everything else in pier 39. Come here and get the mussel fries, it was absolutely worth it. It's a big plate with a nice seafood cream broth/sauce, a ton of mussels (~15+) and some crispy fries. The mussels were the best I ever had. They were just the right amount of cooked where it was still bouncy, fluffy, and rich.

Def come here if you're touring the pier!

excerpts: We ordered the mussel fries as a starter and clam chower bowls with crab meat.
I am not a fan of mussels usually because I feel they are more on the dry side as oppose to clams, but THESE mussels were so moist and tender
I've never had mussels like these before.
The aioli sauce drizzled over the french fries were absolutely delicious!
Sounds like a weird combo, but trust me, it is soooo good!
mussel fries.author: Katrina Y.
mussel fries.review:
Out of all the restaurants they offer on pier 39, I am so happy I chose Fog Harbor Fish House on my recent trip to SF! Number one of course was the spectacular view on that perfect sunny Saturday. It was just perfect! Service was also phenomenal!


We ordered the mussel fries as a starter and clam chower bowls with crab meat. I am not a fan of mussels usually because I feel they are more on the dry side as oppose to clams, but THESE mussels were so moist and tender I've never had mussels like these before. The aioli sauce drizzled over the french fries were absolutely delicious! Sounds like a weird combo, but trust me, it is soooo good! The clam chowder I felt was a bit too thick, but it was still nonetheless delicious especially with the crab meat!

Main entrees we had the half garlic roasted crab, and penne seafood pasta. The roasted garlic crab came out perfect. Everything just broke apart perfectly, no need for any utensils to open up the crab legs. It was almost like a soft shell crab in a way. The tomato cream sauce in the Penne seafood pasta was perfect! I am not really a fan of tomato sauce pasta, and cream only sauce is a bit too heavy for me, so this was a perfect combo for it was not too tangy nor heavy. 

Our drinks were filled constantly and our waitress checked on us very often to make sure everything was good.

PLEASE give this place a try! WILL BE BACK!

excerpts: Clam chowder,  mussel fries and an Alcatraz cocktail...
Great food, ambience, service and views!
Love this restaurant, will definitely return on my next visit to SF.
mussel fries.author: Arlene R.
mussel fries.review: Clam chowder,  mussel fries and an Alcatraz cocktail... Great food, ambience, service and views! Love this restaurant, will definitely return on my next visit to SF.

excerpts: Then we had the jumbo shrimp cocktail and mussel fries.
Both were fantastic.
Ended with the crab Cesar salad which was also awesome.
Our server, Jeremy, was polite, courteous and prompt giving us great recommendations.
A bit pricey but worth it being in SF and the great view.
mussel fries.author: Brittney G.
mussel fries.review: Great scenery for starters. Nice bar and comfy seating. Good house cocktail list that is very "San Francisco" along with a long wine list. We started with the chowder topped with crab and it was awesome. Then we had the jumbo shrimp cocktail and mussel fries. Both were fantastic. Ended with the crab Cesar salad which was also awesome. Our server, Jeremy, was polite, courteous and prompt giving us great recommendations. A bit pricey but worth it being in SF and the great view.

excerpts: Mussel fries were just fries on mussels, but the sauce on them were so good!
Came here with my husband and serving sizes of dinner were just enough.
View was decent and lucked out seeing the sunset.
Glad we came, but it wasn't outstanding & probably won't come back next time.
mussel fries.author: Janet Z.
mussel fries.review: Busy, noisy location at Pier 39. Waiter was friendly & did great job. Was disappointed that one of the specials was "sold out" by only 7:00. Food was pricey but pretty good. Mussel fries were just fries on mussels, but the sauce on them were so good! Came here with my husband and serving sizes of dinner were just enough. View was decent and lucked out seeing the sunset.  Glad we came, but it wasn't outstanding & probably won't come back next time.

excerpts: I loved their mussel fries!
It didn't sound appealing at first, but there's something about the sauce they cook the mussels in that
mussel fries.author: Melissa R.
mussel fries.review:
The service here was great, very quick to respond to a need! 

I loved their mussel fries! It didn't sound appealing at first, but there's something about the sauce they cook the mussels in that was DELICIOUS! 

I don't know if I would get the 1/2 garlic crab again, seemed small for the price. But it was still tasty.

I ordered the linguini with clams and it was light! Very nicely done!

excerpts: The mussel fries were interesting but none the less delicious.
I enjoyed the seafood pasta and my grandmother really enjoyed the sole fish.
The wait to eat was extremely long, however the service was well.
Overall I recommend to eat here once during your stay in SF
mussel fries.author: Alexis R.
mussel fries.review: Really good food, enjoyed everything we ate. The mussel fries were interesting but none the less delicious. I enjoyed the seafood pasta and my grandmother really enjoyed the sole fish. The wait to eat was extremely long, however the service was well. Overall I recommend to eat here once during your stay in SF

excerpts: We tried the Mussel Fries and Crispy Lemon Calamari for appetizers; both done really well, especially the mussels.
mussel fries.author: Afshin A.
mussel fries.review:
Touristy location, but awesome food!

Fog Harbor Fish House is located in one of the most touristy locations in San Francisco. In most cases that would be a warning sign, but they break the norm. The quality of the food and the service is very good, and their prices are very reasonable! Imagine that!

Although I live only a few blocks away, this was my first time eating here and I was very disappointed ....... in me for not having come here sooner! We tried the Mussel Fries and Crispy Lemon Calamari for appetizers; both done really well, especially the mussels.  then had the Grilled salmon for main course. It was served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula,
red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter. Excellent! 

The desserts looked very inviting, but it was late and we were all full, so that we left for another day!

excerpts: Tyler our server suggested some really good dishes - the mussel fries were to die for.
Mussel fries!!!
mussel fries.author: MayMay C.
mussel fries.review:
You'd think places by the pier are overpriced for mediocre food, but this place is worth it. the food was superb and the service was excellent. Tyler our server suggested some really good dishes - the mussel fries were to die for. Tyler did not judge me for wanting to take the very last bit of to go, so I did. 

Mussel fries!!!

excerpts: This review is for their bar and the mussel fries.
With my weekend guest dying of thirst from exploring the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf, we ended up going here to grab drinks.
Of all things at the bar, we ended up with two non-alcoholic drinks.
However, they were probably two of the best non-alcoholic drinks I've had.
The strawberry nojito (clever right?!) is legitimate.
What I really want to talk about are the mussel fries.
I normally like mussels but these made me fall in love all over again.
The mussels were plump and fresh, which is expected because the restaurant is literally sitting on top of water.
But geez they were delicious floating in the rich white sauce with cream and onions.
I took sourdough and soaked all that flavor up before the wait staff decided there wasn't any left and took my dish away.
Get this!
mussel fries.author: Quoc N.
mussel fries.review:
This review is for their bar and the mussel fries. With my weekend guest dying of thirst from exploring the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf, we ended up going here to grab drinks. Of all things at the bar, we ended up with two non-alcoholic drinks. However, they were probably two of the best non-alcoholic drinks I've had. The strawberry nojito (clever right?!) is legitimate.  The bartender even made us a complimentary ginger lemonade. 

What I really want to talk about are the mussel fries. I normally like mussels but these made me fall in love all over again. The mussels were plump and fresh, which is expected because the restaurant is literally sitting on top of water. But geez they were delicious floating in the rich white sauce with cream and onions. I took sourdough and soaked all that flavor up before the wait staff decided there wasn't any left and took my dish away. Get this!

excerpts: the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers.
All were very good
(I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty).
Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10.
mussel fries.author: Matt K.
mussel fries.review: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.

excerpts: Ordered the mussel fries (the sauce they have with this is so delicious), calamari (always a fave), and clam chowder in a bread bowl!
Everything was so good.
Restrooms are clean.
Would definitely come back!
mussel fries.author: Kathryn C.
mussel fries.review: There was so many places to eat and I randomly chose this one. The hostess was friendly and seated us near the window to where we had an amazing view of the pier/water. Our waitress was very informative and really friendly. Ordered the mussel fries (the sauce they have with this is so delicious), calamari (always a fave), and clam chowder in a bread bowl! Everything was so good. Restrooms are clean. Would definitely come back!

excerpts: For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail.
We also had two Moscow Mules.
All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area.
By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area).
The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty.
mussel fries.author: Ralph M.
mussel fries.review:
I would give the Fog Harbor Fish House 3 1/2 stars because it's a little better than just OK. We had a good experience and the service was impeccable, the restaurant was clean, and the view was perfect. For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail. We also had two Moscow Mules. All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area. By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area). The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty. And the Mules were well-mixed.

Our biggest complaint here was the overall lack of zest in the sauces. In a word, they were mostly boring. Serviceable, but boring. For example, I think serving run-of-the-mill cocktail sauce with that delectable crab meat is a mistake. I would go with something much more subtle but enhancing, such as a delicate lemon-saffron sauce or even a lightly spiced creme fraiche. Sure, offer the cocktail sauce for those who may want it, but this app screams for something more daring to help it stand above. So offer a selection of sauces. With the mussels, I didn't taste any garlic in the garlic aioli and sadly there was not enough of the cream sauce to truly enjoy it. And the sauce that accompanied the shrimp was ... eh. Could have been a lot more spicy.

As I said, our experience was good and maybe if we had gone with full-on meals rather than a sampling of apps, I might have rated it higher. I will add that for what we got, we left with satisfied appetites - I even left with some of the crab meat. If I get to the area again, I would return to Fog Harbor.

excerpts: I got the mussel fries since it was one of the only handful of items on the menu under $20, and thought the fries were great
, the mussels were terrible.
Of the bowl I had, FIVE of the shells were empty and one of the was still very sealed shut.
When it came down to it, more than a 3rd of my mussels were duds and the ones that were actually in their shells were pretty awful.
mussel fries.author: Candice G.
mussel fries.review:
Came here a few weeks ago for lunch...
I'm still full. 

That food is heeeavy.

It's in a tourist area so for that it's pretty decent but it's also hella pricey and they don't have a weekday lunch menu so you're still stuck paying those dinner prices mid day, but if you neeeed food and can't fathom walking another half block to catch a cab, well, this isn't a terrible. 

It's a one and done type of deal here for me. A lot of the food seems to have super heavy creams involved the way banquet dinner meals are. That kind of thing is fine at first but after 6 bites it's just too much. 

I got the mussel fries since it was one of the only handful of items on the menu under $20, and thought the fries were great, the mussels were terrible. Of the bowl I had, FIVE of the shells were empty and one of the was still very sealed shut. When it came down to it, more than a 3rd of my mussels were duds and the ones that were actually in their shells were pretty awful. They had this strange taste to them that was a tinge foul and paired with the sauces, wasn't good. 

If you go and you're on a budget, I think the soup in a bread bowl and salad combo is the way to go. It's enough food for 2 people given the heaviness and the bread (sourdough, of course) was darn delicious. 

I could see where it'd be a cute date spot for an older couple who's touristing, but I don't think I'll see myself back again.

excerpts: My friend was a little disappointed in her mussel fries which basically consisted of some mussels - most empty and closed and fries in a white creamy sauce.
Again at $14, not so bad, but not the best bargain around.
Most of the entrees start at about $30+ and sandwiches at about $15+.
mussel fries.author: Stephanie Y.
mussel fries.review:
For a tourist spot, this place isn't so bad. With that, I probably won't ever come again, unless invited. Mainly because the prices; everything is expensive. I get it: San Francisco, seafood, Fisherman's Wharf. 

I'd say the caesar salad and chowder in the bread bowl combo is the best deal. At about $14 you get a small salad with a huge bowl of chowder in the most delicious sour dough bread bowl. I dare you to try and finish any of it. Have I had better chowda? Puhlease, I'm from New England. I've had better chowda. This was the generic cream based New England chowder. Plenty of potatoes and clams, but it could have used some pancetta or some renegade ingredient to spice things up a bit. Have I had better salads in my day? Yes. This was some romaine lightly dressed. I opted for the $6 crab add on (shredded crab) and I highly suggest you do not follow my lead. Not worth it and did nothing to the flavor of the salad.

My friend was a little disappointed in her mussel fries which basically consisted of some mussels - most empty and closed and fries in a white creamy sauce. Again at $14, not so bad, but not the best bargain around. Most of the entrees start at about $30+ and sandwiches at about $15+. * The complimentary sour dough to start was delicious and a great way to fill up a little if you decide to go light.

Great views of the pier, friendly service albeit a bit too friendly, sometimes a gal likes to be left alone to eat, solid food makes this a pricy power lunch that filled me up throughout the day (no dinner needed). I didn't try the seafood entree's as they were just too pricy for lunch, but hey if you're on vacation or money ain't a thing, maybe your experience will be better than mine!

* Have ya heard of a lunch menu?

excerpts: Mongo eat Mussel Fries.
Yummy!
Mongo eat Shrimp Louis.
Yummy!
mussel fries.author: Mongo I.
mussel fries.review:
Mongo like this rest-or-rant soooo much. And so close to Mongo's hotel - Mongo eat here five times so far. Mongo eat Sourdough Bread Bowl Clam Chowder. Yummy! Mongo eat Crab Cakes. Yummy! Mongo eat Mussel Fries. Yummy! Mongo eat Shrimp Louis. Yummy! Mongo eat Fried Combo. Yummy! Mongo drink many, many Jack and Cokes. And everybody nice to Mongo. 

Mongo say pretty views from Mongo's table. 
But Mongo no see no fog...

excerpts: We ordered...a crab roll, garlic roasted crab, mussel fries, clam chowder, seared tuna app, grilled seafood plate with a lobster tail (my entree) and cippino (my friends entree).
Did I mention we were really hungry?
Our waiter probably thought we had lost our minds especially bc
we are very tiny girls lol
The mussel fries are prepared really crispy with this shallot cream sauce that you simply want to drink.
The garlic roasted crab was cooked to perfection and is served with just the right amount of garlic.
I loved my grilled swordfish!
My friend could not stop eating her cippino lol we had to squirt hand sanitizer on it
mussel fries.author: Star J.
mussel fries.review:
Let me start by saying this: we waited an hour and 15 mins and it was worth every second! My friend and I were visiting from Vegas and saw the promo on instagram. I didn't have much faith in this choice seeing as how they were advertising on Instagram but she really wanted to give it a try. So glad she didn't listen to me! We are both originally from the East coast and miss a great deal the fresh seafood. It tasted just like home. 

We ordered...a crab roll, garlic roasted crab, mussel fries, clam chowder, seared tuna app, grilled seafood plate with a lobster tail (my entree) and cippino (my friends entree). Did I mention we were really hungry? Our waiter probably thought we had lost our minds especially bc we are very tiny girls lol but we were commited!

Everything was amazing. The mussel fries are prepared really crispy with this shallot cream sauce that you simply want to drink.  The garlic roasted crab was cooked to perfection and is served with just the right amount of garlic. I loved my grilled swordfish! My friend could not stop eating her cippino lol we had to squirt hand sanitizer on it so she would stop. 

Overall this was a great lunch and our server was really good with recommending wines and menu items.  This will definitely be a regular stop on our visits. Our bill was reasonable for what we ordered. We were very pleased

excerpts: The lazy chiopino and the mussel fries were amazing.
Paired with some local brew (805) and a view of Alcatraz, helped make my first visit to San Fran (and California)
an experience I won't soon forget.
mussel fries.author: Bryan D.
mussel fries.review: The lazy chiopino and the mussel fries were amazing. Paired with some local brew (805) and a view of Alcatraz, helped make my first visit to San Fran (and California) an experience I won't soon forget.

excerpts: The food (overall) was great, we ordered the seafood platter for 2, lobster clam chowder, mussel fries, caprese salad, and shrimp cocktail.
Everything was fresh, decadent and delicious...
but I have 2 complaints.
mussel fries.author: Grace C.
mussel fries.review:
3.5 stars overall 

My girlfriends and I decided to come here for a last minute lunch on a Sunday. The wait was about 10 minutes, not bad at all.

The food (overall) was great, we ordered the seafood platter for 2, lobster clam chowder, mussel fries, caprese salad, and shrimp cocktail. Everything was fresh, decadent and delicious...but I have 2 complaints.  The chowder was a little too salty, and there was long, GROSS hair cooked inside it :( 

Now for the service... 
Our first waiter was awesome, he was quick, friendly, and funny.  But when he went on break, the waitress that took over... Not so much... 

She was impatient, and unintentionally, but constantly rude.  Most of us felt that she needs to be retrained.  

Still, I feel like this place deserved 3.5-4 stars.. because stuff happens (hair falling in food/hiring a not so great server), the chowder was taken off the bill, the view is beautiful, and most importantly, the food (almost everything) was delicious.

excerpts: The mussel fries I would not order again.
They provided mussels that were the most plump and large mussels I have ever had.
I fantasized whether they were given growth hormones because they were so large HAHA.
It seemed like a gourmet dish over freshly baked french fries.
I was not a big fan of the mussel and french fries combo.
It was a good appetizer, but personally I just did not like the combo.
I ordered the surf and turf which is a lobster tail and 10 oz NY steak.
I'd definitely say this is a great deal if you want both the lobster tail and steak ($15 difference if ordering the 2 items separately).
It's hard to go wrong with the lobster tail, but they removed all the meat from the lobster perfectly, leaving nothing behind in the shell.
The NY steak was cooked as asked (medium rare) topped with capers.
mussel fries.author: Andrew S.
mussel fries.review:
Looked like a small restaurant from outside, but turned out to be pretty large and roomy once we got inside. The ambiance was great, dimly lit room, large windows overseeing the harbor and boat. The servers were very nice, but could have been a bit more attentive. Seems like they could have a few more servers for the amount of tables in the restaurant. 

Now lets get to the good part! I'd give the food overall a 4 out of 5. The clam chowder is supposidly world famous so I gave it a whirl. It was definitely great, but nothing amazing. Wish it had more flavor to it in general. The mussel fries I would not order again. They provided mussels that were the most plump and large mussels I have ever had. I fantasized whether they were given growth hormones because they were so large HAHA. It seemed like a gourmet dish over freshly baked french fries. I was not a big fan of the mussel and french fries combo. It was a good appetizer, but personally I just did not like the combo. I ordered the surf and turf which is a lobster tail and 10 oz NY steak. I'd definitely say this is a great deal if you want both the lobster tail and steak ($15 difference if ordering the 2 items separately). It's hard to go wrong with the lobster tail, but they removed all the meat from the lobster perfectly, leaving nothing behind in the shell. The NY steak was cooked as asked (medium rare) topped with capers. The broccoli side was rather bland, but the mashed potatoes where great. 

The sparkling ginger lemonade was tasty, had actual slices of ginger infused, but was way too sweet for me. 

Would I come here again? YES definitely!

excerpts: We definitely recommend the Mussel Fries!!!
mussel fries.author: Thuy P.
mussel fries.review: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The food was amazing and the customer service was great. Plus, you can't beat the view of the docs! We definitely recommend the Mussel Fries!!!

excerpts: Had the mussel fries, mixed grill, clam chowder, and half garlic crab.
Mixed grill was savory and in good portion.
Mussel
fries-
I was very surprised with this one because it blew me out of my mind.
It was so good!!!
I loved the combination of fries and mussel!
Clam chowder- was rich and amazing!
mussel fries.author: Michelle K.
mussel fries.review:
Had the mussel fries, mixed grill, clam chowder, and half garlic crab. 

All I can say is everything was SO GOOD. PERFECT!!! 

Garlic crab was cooked perfectly so that my bf didn't have a hard time going through the crab. 
Mixed grill was savory and in good portion. 
Mussel fries- I was very surprised with this one because it blew me out of my mind. It was so good!!! I loved the combination of fries and mussel! 
Clam chowder- was rich and amazing! Best clam chowder in fisherman's wharf imo. 

Would come back here again! Service was nice and attentive!

excerpts: I wish I had tried the mussel fries, as they sounded really good!
The clam chowder was delicious, and I enjoyed the option to add crab.
The lobster tail looked huge and scrumptious.
Prices are reasonable.
This is a spot with a great view that would make for a great date.
mussel fries.author: Natasha K.
mussel fries.review: Tasty drinks and food. I wish I had tried the mussel fries, as they sounded really good! The clam chowder was delicious, and I enjoyed the option to add crab. The lobster tail looked huge and scrumptious. Prices are reasonable. This is a spot with a great view that would make for a great date.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers.
The mussel fries was really good.
Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny.
The Cesar salad was also good
but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce.
Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad.
Here's the bad...
I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size..
But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!!
And they only gave us 5.
We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one
but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy!
mussel fries.author: Fiona T.
mussel fries.review:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it. 

I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot

excerpts: Got the mussel fries and the calamari.
The garlic sauce that came with the fries was awesome along with the sweet sauce underneath.
The entree I got was the red chili grab, which had a delicious sauce, but only an average tasting crab.
The service was relatively slow, however it got very busy around the time our food was ordered, so it's understandable.
Overall excellent experience, and a beautiful view!
mussel fries.author: Yangyang J.
mussel fries.review: The selection of beer was pretty decent for a restaurant. Starters were excellent. Got the mussel fries and the calamari. The garlic sauce that came with the fries was awesome along with the sweet sauce underneath. The entree I got was the red chili grab, which had a delicious sauce, but only an average tasting crab. The service was relatively slow, however it got very busy around the time our food was ordered, so it's understandable. Overall excellent experience, and a beautiful view!

excerpts: We got the mussel fries and the actual fries weren't that good
but the mussels and sauce were amazing!
And I usually don't like mussels.
The clam chowder was good, but the bread bowl was a bit small for $10.
The table next to us got a crab sandwich that looked amazing.
Absolutely beautiful view.
Great, clean place to get your wharf seafood kick.
mussel fries.author: Vicky S.
mussel fries.review:
A little pricey, but everything was tasty! Get any dish with crab.
We got the mussel fries and the actual fries weren't that good but the mussels and sauce were amazing! And I usually don't like mussels. The clam chowder was good, but the bread bowl was a bit small for $10.
The table next to us got a crab sandwich that looked amazing.
Absolutely beautiful view.
Great, clean place to get your wharf seafood kick.

excerpts: Mussel fries - sounds funnier in English than in French.
And rather than come with fries alongside
, these mussels have fries chucked right on top, ready for dipping in the creamy, shalloty, fennelly sauce.
And there's garlic aioli drizzled on top.
And warm baguette alongside if you need more carbs to dip.
Yaaaaas.
Delicious!
mussel fries.author: Meredith A.
mussel fries.review:
Why wait ages for a table, when you can sit at the bar on a Saturday night with no wait?  Same food, and same view, although you're slightly further from the window.  Who cares!  Close enough!

Apparently this place is very touristy.  I believe you, but I also do not care, because their seafood is delicious.

Mussel fries - sounds funnier in English than in French.  And rather than come with fries alongside, these mussels have fries chucked right on top, ready for dipping in the creamy, shalloty, fennelly sauce.  And there's garlic aioli drizzled on top.  And warm baguette alongside if you need more carbs to dip.  Yaaaaas.  Delicious!  Great for sharing, and expect big fat mussels and lots o' fries.

Mixed Grill - they split this onto two plates for us, which was very nice.  Wonderfully prepared salmon, swordfish, and shrimp in a citrus butter.  Simply prepared and served with the usual host of rice and vegetables.  Absolutely fresh seafood, a little expensive for the portion size, but overall great stuff.

We were in, ate, paid, and out in fairly short time, so we could explore Pier 39 and get back to the baaaaaars, because it was Saturday night and that's what we were about.  Anyway if you don't mind being seen at a touristy spot, you will get good quality food here, great views, and a secret way to eat without a long wait first on a weekend night.  You're welcome!

excerpts: Definitely try the mussel fries and Moscow mule, those two are my favorite!
mussel fries.author: Thanh N.
mussel fries.review: I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant. The service, the ambiance, the drinks, and the food (I'm drooling thinking about it!) is so deserving of a good rating. Definitely try the mussel fries and Moscow mule, those two are my favorite!

excerpts:
Mussel Fries
2)
Clam Chowder
mussel fries.author: Bread S.
mussel fries.review:
Very nice place to have a daytime lunch or even an evening dinner.  Either way, the food here was great.  I ordered the Cioppino and it was excellent!!  It had an assortment of shrimp, Bay scallops, fish, mussels, clams and topped with (lazy style) crab meat- Lazy style as in they crack the crab shell for you and sprinkle the crab meat on top.  Others prefer to break-open the goodness, but I decided against a messy meal.

My wife had the mixed grilled seafood consisting of grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables and wild rice.  My daughters went with the crab cakes and pan-seared chicken breast.  All plates completely cleaned-out.  

The most notable 2 dishes that stood-out from the rest that you ABSOLUTELY must try have to be the following:

1) Mussel Fries
2) Clam Chowder (Best I've tasted in San Francisco)

Our waiter was Scottie- He was the most knowledgeable, funny and down to earth server.  Very attentive and made great recommendations.  Well-deserved tip for this guy.

       *****Read below when reserving a seat with the hostess outside the entrance:*****

(Knocked-off 1 star for this)

If you happen to go here during lunch on a weekend, the hostess will take your cell phone number down and send you a text if the wait should be horrendously long.  You can tell if many people are lounging around the outdoor seating area.    

Keep an eye out on your phone because the text message is a confirmation whether or not you still want your reserved table.  The text is NOT, I repeat, NOT a message telling you your table is ready.  I learned this the hard way by reading my message 10 min. late and then responding 10 minutes later.  The hostess had thought we no longer needed our seats and gave them up to the next party on the list.  When it told her that I read the text message late, we had to wait an additional 20 min.  Our entire wait ended up being over 40 min.  She apologized and said there were too many people even after I told her that my wife was sitting at the couch next to her the whole time.  I was away at the sports store across the way during that entire time.  Anything you send back to them as a text they can read back as a normal message.  

You've been warned- Now go out there and eat!!

excerpts: The calamari here and the mussel fries are to die for !!!
mussel fries.author: Reca A.
mussel fries.review:
For starters the food here is great!! Thanks to Oscar, our wonderful waiter for the great suggestions made. He really made this restaurant shine by his work. He went above and beyond and he works happily. The food came really quickly and he didn't fail to check on us. 

Great food and great customer service!!!! THANK YOU OSCAR FOR MAKING OUR NIGHT !!! 

Ps. The calamari here and the mussel fries are to die for !!!

excerpts: The mussel fries were excellent!
mussel fries.author: Mara S.
mussel fries.review: Yes the wait is long if you don't have a reservation, but the wait was worth it! The mussel fries were excellent! We also enjoyed the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh. Our service was great as well. Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.

excerpts: Mussel fries were literally mussels topped with French fries, no wow-factor favors.
mussel fries.author: Tammi T.
mussel fries.review:
Sadly disappointed given all the previous great reviews which could only be explained by tourists who have never had delicious chowder. 

Service: Our waitress wasn't any help at all. I asked, as I always do at every restaurant, what are their popular items. She responded with the most dull and detached manner. I get it, it's annoying to get asked that question a million times a day, but hey guess what...it's your job. 

Food: I came here just for their "award-winning" chowder and it was far from award-winning in my opinion. The bread was a little too chewy for my taste. I prefer it to have more of a crispy exterior. The chowder was just chowder. My child's pasta had no flavor. It was like eating just cooked penne. Mussel fries were literally mussels topped with French fries, no wow-factor favors. Chili shrimp was good, but tasted like the one from Panda Express.

Overall it was an expensive, unenjoyable experience. One star for validating my parking and a great view of the pier.

excerpts: We started off with Mussel Fries - nice broth at the bottom of the bowl, mussels and delicious French fries with a nice sauce drizzled on top.
The broth was awesome for dipping bread in (there wasn't much left).
mussel fries.author: Jorge G.
mussel fries.review:
Came here for lunch after visiting Alcatraz. Awesome view of the bay, The Golden Gate Bridge and The Rock. Food was awesome, beer was nice and cold and the cocktails were great too. 

We started off with Mussel Fries - nice broth at the bottom of the bowl, mussels and delicious French fries with a nice sauce drizzled on top. The broth was awesome for dipping bread in (there wasn't much left). 
The Ahi Poke Tuna appetizer was outstanding. Tasted super fresh and came with nice chips. Full of fresh avocado and mango. Highly recommend it. 
Also try the blue cheese garlic bread if you're into that, it was good as well. 
For entrees we ordered the Crab Legs which were large and juicy, a huge plate of crab legs (enough for 2 people if you're splitting a meal). 
The fried fish n chips were great too. 3 large chunks of fried fish and French fries too. The fish was nice and fresh (just what you'd expect from a place in the wharf) and was fried perfectly. 
We also ordered the Pacific Cod (special of the day) which was grilled to perfection. Not dry and hard, it was just great. 
All in all a great meal. And the server was super nice as well, couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend for lunch.

excerpts: We had the mussel fries which were absolutely delicious and crab roll which my husband loved!!!
Great atmosphere and would definitely return!
mussel fries.author: Morgan W.
mussel fries.review: Amazing experience!!!! Our waiter was Brenda, who had a great personality and took great care of us!!! We had a 30 minute wait but just walked around the pier and they texted us when our table was ready! Worked out perfectly!! Great view of the bay with excellent food. We had the mussel fries which were absolutely delicious and crab roll which my husband loved!!! Great atmosphere and would definitely return!

excerpts: We started with the mussel fries  and calamari, both of which were superb.
mussel fries.author: Harry L.
mussel fries.review: We had dinner the evening of October 22nd. We started with the mussel fries  and calamari, both of which were superb. We followed with main courses of scallops, mixed grill, and fish and chips. All were superbly prepared and delicious. Our server, Tyler, was top notch. He was always available when we had any requests, and served with good humor. We will definitely return any time we visit SF in the future.

excerpts: The mussel fries are as good as it gets!
All the rest of their seafood seems fresh and local and was very tasty.
They also have a great view of the bay.
Highly recommend trying this place.
mussel fries.author: Oscar P.
mussel fries.review: Great spot on the harbor. The mussel fries are as good as it gets! All the rest of their seafood seems fresh and local and was very tasty. They also have a great view of the bay. Highly recommend trying this place.

excerpts: And the mussel fries were evil.
mussel fries.author: Jesse M.
mussel fries.review: I wasn't expecting anything great in such a touristy area, but everything was great.  Food, service, view.  Brought kids, and we all had a great dinner.  Chowder, mixed grill were both great.  And the mussel fries were evil.

excerpts: The swordfish dish, mussel fries and steamed clams were outstanding.
Usually swordfish is grilled too long and becomes a task to eat--not at this place.
They grilled it perfectly and served it warm.
Very pleased.
Also, the cream and fennel sauce that was used for the muscle fries was a delicious way to serve a nontraditional combination of fries and chips.
As a plus, the wait staff was very willing to accommodate our two-year-old who is often a dining challenge for most eateries.
I will go back!
mussel fries.author: Sarkit S.
mussel fries.review: Great food! Went here on a quick visit to family and was looking for yummy seafood. This place got great reviews, so we decided to try it. The swordfish dish, mussel fries and steamed clams were outstanding. Usually swordfish is grilled too long and becomes a task to eat--not at this place. They grilled it perfectly and served it warm. Very pleased. Also, the cream and fennel sauce that was used for the muscle fries was a delicious way to serve a nontraditional combination of fries and chips. As a plus, the wait staff was very willing to accommodate our two-year-old who is often a dining challenge for most eateries. I will go back!

excerpts: Had to wait but really enjoyed the mussel fries and clam chowder.
Had a hearty taste!
mussel fries.author: Steph R.
mussel fries.review: Tasty little spot with good service. Had to wait but really enjoyed the mussel fries and clam chowder. Had a hearty taste!

excerpts: We had the mussel fries, clam chowder, fried calamari, linguine and clams and cioppino all of which were to die for.
Wonderful ambiance, table overlooked the bay and docks where the ferry would come in.
Wait wasn't as bad as expected considering it was fleet week.
Will only dine here for all future trips to San Francisco!
mussel fries.author: L K.
mussel fries.review: Words can't express how delicious and fresh the food is at this restaurant. The waitress we had could improve but the quality and tastiness of the food is why we were here this past weekend! We had the mussel fries, clam chowder, fried calamari, linguine and clams and cioppino all of which were to die for. Wonderful ambiance, table overlooked the bay and docks where the ferry would come in. Wait wasn't as bad as expected considering it was fleet week. Will only dine here for all future trips to San Francisco!

excerpts: We had the mussel fries in garlic aioli.
Fries were perfectly crunchy and the mussels were perfectly done.
I ordered the crab roll sandwich for my main dish.
Lots of crab meat.
Great view of Alcatraz and the water.
Attentive service.
mussel fries.author: Virginia N.
mussel fries.review: We had the mussel fries in garlic aioli. Fries were perfectly crunchy and the mussels were perfectly done.I ordered the crab roll sandwich for my main dish.  Lots of crab meat.  Great view of Alcatraz and the water. Attentive service.

excerpts: Fog Harbor had the most amazing Mussel Fries & Surf and Turf i have ever tried!!
Yum Yum...
mussel fries.author: Esperanza M.
mussel fries.review: I've lived in the bay area all my life and I can never imagine getting tired of coming to the Pier and trying a new restaurant each time I go. Fog Harbor had the most amazing Mussel Fries & Surf and Turf i have ever tried!! Yum Yum...

excerpts: We had clam chowder topped with crab, seafood tower, mussels fries, and ahi poke.
Not one complaint about any of it.
Highly recommend place at pier 39
ahi poke.author: Ruben A.
ahi poke.review:
Very nice experience and great food. We had a very attentive and personable server Samir. 
We had clam chowder topped with crab, seafood tower, mussels fries, and ahi poke. Not one complaint about any of it.
Highly recommend place at pier 39

excerpts: We also loved the fried calamari, Ahi Poke & crab cake(s)!
The ambiance was great also.
As we dined , we had a good view of the harbor & ocean near Pier 39.
The service was great!
Our waiter brought everything to the table fresh , hot or cold and he was always smiling!
Despite a 20min.  wait to be seated, we both had a great experience dining @
Fog Harbor Fish House!
Highly recommend!!!
ahi poke.author: B H.
ahi poke.review: My wife and I visited this restaurant during our July 4th get-away. She has really been craving raw oysters on the half shell and I decided to treat her. Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint! Between us, we ate at least 48 oysters! She loved it! I was impressed with the freshness and the quickness of of oysters delivered to our table. We also loved the fried calamari, Ahi Poke & crab cake(s)! The ambiance was great also. As we dined , we had a good view of the harbor & ocean near Pier 39. The service was great! Our waiter brought everything to the table fresh , hot or cold and he was always smiling! Despite a 20min.  wait to be seated, we both had a great experience dining @ Fog Harbor Fish House! Highly recommend!!!

excerpts:
My favorites:

- Ahi Poke
- Dungeness Crab
- New York Steak (medium rare)
- Wild Salmon
ahi poke.author: Owie N.
ahi poke.review:
I try to steer away from Pier 39 since my first initial visit back in high school. YES, it was that long ago. 

I must admit, I miss the street performers, sea lions, live music and especially waterfront dining at Fog Harbor Fish House. 

They do offer excellent seafood and shellfish. Strikingly, their steak is quite legit.

My favorites:

- Ahi Poke
- Dungeness Crab
- New York Steak (medium rare)
- Wild Salmon

Too many delicious offerings have me at an instant food coma. Oh, no worry; I always have second stomach for dessert. 

Whether you are playing touristy or not. Pier 39 is a must on your list of things to do in SF. Better yet, Fog Harbor is where you want to be be be...

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!

excerpts: The ahi poke was light and spicy in flavor at just the right temp.
ahi poke.author: Jason B.
ahi poke.review: Great seats and presentation of the food. Coming in the late afternoon during winter makes the ambiance incredible. The ahi poke was light and spicy in flavor at just the right temp. The shellfish platter was amazing with the saffron butter garlic sauce. If you are a fish lover. Go for the swordfish

excerpts: We also split the large shrimp, the crab bread bowl soup, and the ahi poke.
Wow, everything was incredible and fresh!
ahi poke.author: Melissa L.
ahi poke.review: Excellent food and cocktail with a gorgeous wine. We had a few glasses of wine and a few mules and they were some of the best drinks we've had in awhile. We also split the large shrimp, the crab bread bowl soup, and the ahi poke. Wow, everything was incredible and fresh!

excerpts: Appetizer - Ahi Poke was fresh and delicious.
ahi poke.author: Andrew J.
ahi poke.review:
Me and my girl walking around Pier 39 / Fishermans Wharf trying to find out which place has the best Clam Chowder.  I'm really glad I chose this place but NOT for the Clam Chowder. 

Appetizer - Ahi Poke was fresh and delicious.

The Ciopinno - This was the best part of my meal, a wonderful mixture of all kinds of seafood in like a tomato sauce with pasta... Definetely a must get.  I'll be back when im in SF!

excerpts: For my three courses I had their Ahi Poke, King Salmon & their Vanilla Bean Caramel Brulee with a glass of their Pinot Noir.
My friend had order their Crabs, 10 oz NY Steak, and their Warm Chocolate Cake with a glass of their Zinfindel.
Every single dish was well articulated and presented.
And the service was great, we were constantly checked on by 5 different employees to ensure our needs were well met.
It was a great atmosphere, with a great view of the ocean.
ahi poke.author: Karen C.
ahi poke.review:
Definitely worth coming to check out for San Francisco Restaurant Week. Appetizer, Entree and Dessert for $40 with three choices each to choose from.

For my three courses I had their Ahi Poke, King Salmon & their Vanilla Bean Caramel Brulee with a glass of their Pinot Noir. My friend had order their Crabs, 10 oz NY Steak, and their Warm Chocolate Cake with a glass of their Zinfindel. Every single dish was well articulated and presented. And the service was great, we were constantly checked on by 5 different employees to ensure our needs were well met. It was a great atmosphere, with a great view of the ocean.

excerpts: We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.
ahi poke.author: Darien R.
ahi poke.review:
We had a very good experience here.  Every dish and drink that came to the table was enjoyed. We had a table by the window.  This restaurant, to me, is a great place for a special occasion celebration.  Large open space, white table cloths. GOOD FOOD!

If I'm remembering correctly, the CLAM CHOWDER was spot on. The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.

We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.

The Garlic Crab was good, but The Crab House next door has them beat when it comes to this dish.  I love it when Yelpers drop hints like this in their reviews, so here is a good tip for you.  Go to The Crab House literally next door and get the Garlic Crab.  Best I've had.

I like this place a lot.  It's between a 4 and a 5 for me. This is exactly what you would expect from a classy version of a fish house.

excerpts:
Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF 
and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.
ahi poke.author: Mike R.
ahi poke.review:
Staff was nice, food was...standard fare...which surprised me since it was pricey. Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.

excerpts: The Ahi Poke Tuna appetizer was outstanding.
Tasted super fresh and came with nice chips.
Full of fresh avocado and mango.
Highly recommend it.
ahi poke.author: Jorge G.
ahi poke.review:
Came here for lunch after visiting Alcatraz. Awesome view of the bay, The Golden Gate Bridge and The Rock. Food was awesome, beer was nice and cold and the cocktails were great too. 

We started off with Mussel Fries - nice broth at the bottom of the bowl, mussels and delicious French fries with a nice sauce drizzled on top. The broth was awesome for dipping bread in (there wasn't much left). 
The Ahi Poke Tuna appetizer was outstanding. Tasted super fresh and came with nice chips. Full of fresh avocado and mango. Highly recommend it.
