Also try the blue cheese garlic bread if you're into that, it was good as well. 
For entrees we ordered the Crab Legs which were large and juicy, a huge plate of crab legs (enough for 2 people if you're splitting a meal). 
The fried fish n chips were great too. 3 large chunks of fried fish and French fries too. The fish was nice and fresh (just what you'd expect from a place in the wharf) and was fried perfectly. 
We also ordered the Pacific Cod (special of the day) which was grilled to perfection. Not dry and hard, it was just great. 
All in all a great meal. And the server was super nice as well, couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend for lunch.

excerpts: The ahi poke is really really fresh.
The last time I had tuna that fresh was in Costa Rica!
The wines were amazing and the service was good.
Will Definitely come here again & recommend to friends.
ahi poke.author: Jazmin C.
ahi poke.review: In town from San Diego and really wanted fresh seafood...this place definitely delivered! The ahi poke is really really fresh. The last time I had tuna that fresh was in Costa Rica! The wines were amazing and the service was good. Will Definitely come here again & recommend to friends.

excerpts: I had the calm chowder soup and the Ahi Poke Tuna
both were amazing !!!!
Beautiful views of the bay !!!!
ahi poke.author: Tony L.
ahi poke.review: Great service and clean environment.  I had the calm chowder soup and the Ahi Poke Tuna both were amazing !!!! Beautiful views of the bay !!!!

excerpts: We tried the Ahi Poke and literally, we love sushi
but this tasted like the fish was still swimming.
It was almost too fresh lol!
Then I really wanted to have crab legs but the only way that they serve crab is by bring you a full crab - body, head and all... not my thing.
I would pass on this place next time.
ahi poke.author: DMarie M.
ahi poke.review: The view is one of the best parts of this restaurant. Besides that, the food is ok. Ok, the clam chowder in the bread bowl was good but otherwise, we just did appetizers because nothing else on the menu was to-die for. We tried the Ahi Poke and literally, we love sushi but this tasted like the fish was still swimming. It was almost too fresh lol! Then I really wanted to have crab legs but the only way that they serve crab is by bring you a full crab - body, head and all... not my thing. I would pass on this place next time.

excerpts: Excellent service, great food, Our server suggested the ahi poke and baked oyster for starters,we gave it a try and OMG,best ahi poke ever!!!
ahi poke.author: Pau S.
ahi poke.review: Excellent service, great food, Our server suggested the ahi poke and baked oyster for starters,we gave it a try and OMG,best ahi poke ever!!! Oysters were ok,"am not a oyster lover anyway" we also had the chili crab, lobster tail and the cioppino to share and we ended up with the dessert combo, we would definitely come back to this place because the food and the excellent service our waiter Oscar provided us.

excerpts: For three people, we each got the clam chowder bread bowl, a salad, the tuna ahi poke, calamari and two cocktails.
Total before tip comes to about $95 dollars.
ahi poke.author: Christine N.
ahi poke.review:
First time in SF so I wanted to have the best clam chowder bread bowl experience. This IS a tourist trap! 

For three people, we each got the clam chowder bread bowl, a salad, the tuna ahi poke, calamari and two cocktails. Total before tip comes to about $95 dollars. Not worth it for appetizer meals. 

Although the chowder was good, nothing about it was outstanding from the rest of the chowders. I wish it contained more or cost less. What makes up for the price is the view of the bay; but depending on where you were seated it wasn't much of a view.

excerpts: Get the Ahi Poke, it literally melts in your mouth.
For an appetizer we had the fried scallops with jalapeño dipping sauce..
wow seriously incredible  the clam chowder was also to die for...
Pretty much everything we ordered was the best we've ever had.
Also for 15% off go to the welcome area next door
ahi poke.author: Rebecca C.
ahi poke.review: We have used yelp for several restaurants on this trip and this one BY FAR IS THE BEST! Get the Ahi Poke, it literally melts in your mouth. For an appetizer we had the fried scallops with jalapeño dipping sauce..wow seriously incredible  the clam chowder was also to die for... Pretty much everything we ordered was the best we've ever had. Also for 15% off go to the welcome area next door

excerpts: We also ordered the ahi poke appetizer (decent) and the crab ceviche (no flavor).
Service was slow-
we waited 10 minutes before they were ready to take our order.
ahi poke.author: Alex B.
ahi poke.review:
Our clam chowder came fully loaded with PLASTIC SARAN WRAP in it.  Yummy.  We also ordered the ahi poke appetizer (decent) and the crab ceviche (no flavor).   Service was slow- we waited 10 minutes before they were ready to take our order.  The room was crowded - they packet everyone into one room like sardines even though there were other empty rooms, which made it tough to have a conversation and tough for the servers to move around to the different tables.

After the discovery of plastic in our clam chowder, the waiter apologized and also had the manager come over to apologize (and make excuses for why there was plastic in the chowder).  They took the chowder off the bill, which was the least they could do since we only ate a couple spoonfuls of it anyway.  They really should have offered us another appetizer or more $$ off the bill... but they didn't.

2 stars (instead of 1) for the view and location on Pier 39.

excerpts: The Ahi Poke was pretty good.
Service and views were amazing.
The sourdough was delicious and made us forget the trip to Boudin Bakery we were going to take.
This is a must revisit!
ahi poke.author: LAURA F.
ahi poke.review: Unusual for me, we just walked in without knowing anything about this place. AMAZING. Hands down the best Ceasar salad and Clam Chowder I have ever had. The Ahi Poke was pretty good. Service and views were amazing. The sourdough was delicious and made us forget the trip to Boudin Bakery we were going to take. This is a must revisit!

excerpts: We had mussels and fries, fried seafood platter and the ahi poke ...
Everything was exceptional.
All of the fried seafood was AWESOME.
We come from an east coast coastal (read: seafood) town.
So we get fresh seafood all of the time.
The food at this restaurant was exceptional.
We hear that there are a lot of tourist traps on the piers.
At Fog Harbor-- you get what you pay for...
And it is exceptional!
Highly recommend it!
ahi poke.author: K. H.
ahi poke.review:
LOVED this place. We rolled in, in t-shirts and sweats b/c we just got off a plane from the east coast and were whiling away a few hours before we could check in to  our hotel. 
They treated us like royalty... 
ASK FOR AMELIA- greatest, nicest, awesomest server-- EVER. 

We had mussels and fries, fried seafood platter and the ahi poke ... Everything was exceptional. All of the fried seafood was AWESOME. We come from an east coast coastal (read: seafood) town. So we get fresh seafood all of the time.  
The food at this restaurant was exceptional. We hear that there are a lot of tourist traps on the piers. 
At Fog Harbor-- you get what you pay for... And it is exceptional! 
Highly recommend it!

excerpts: We started with the Ahi Poke, I fell in love!
The taste and the mango sauce was mouth watering.
My husband had the steak and he loved it.
I had the Clam Chowder and it is the best I have ever had.
Especially in the Sourdough bowl.
Our server Khaiman was wonderful, excellent with tour information and service.
I recommend it for anyone going to San Francisco and I will go again!!
ahi poke.author: Kristen M.
ahi poke.review: We love this place.  We came from Southern California for a little vacation and found Fog Harbor after touring Alcatraz.  We looked at the other restaurants and decided to eat here.  Amazing!  We started with the Ahi Poke, I fell in love!  The taste and the mango sauce was mouth watering.  My husband had the steak and he loved it.  I had the Clam Chowder and it is the best I have ever had.  Especially in the Sourdough bowl.  Our server Khaiman was wonderful, excellent with tour information and service.  I recommend it for anyone going to San Francisco and I will go again!!

excerpts: I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette.
Both of them were very good!
The service was okay but not overly impressive.
The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross).
The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.
ahi poke.author: Lori C.
ahi poke.review: We were at the wharf for the afternoon and decided to grab a late lunch here based on the yelp reviews. I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. Both of them were very good! The service was okay but not overly impressive. The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross). The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.

excerpts: *AWARD WINNING CLAM CHOWDER ($9 Bowl)
award winning clam chowder.author: Elena N.
award winning clam chowder.review:
So I decided to do a touristy day. Since a friend and I were going to be at Fisherman's Wharf, I suggested doing a seafood dinner at Pier 39. I made a reservation through Yelp for a party of two about a week prior for Thursday, September 27th at 7pm. We showed up a few mins early and had to wait for a little bit. We were seated about 10 mins after our reservation at a table by the window, so we had a nice view.

*Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ($16)
*AWARD WINNING CLAM CHOWDER ($9 Bowl)
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
*Duckhorn: Napa Valley, California '17 ($50)

I wanted the crab and clam chowder. Since my friend and I always over order, we added the shrimp. The clam chowder was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. A little thicker than I prefer, but still a good bowl. The crab was a little disappointing. There wasn't enough garlic flavor. Plus, the best part of the crab, the head, was missing. It was just an empty shell for decoration. If a restaurant states a whole crab, I think that should include the head. The shrimp were okay. Had a nice heat, but I didn't really like the sauce. A little too sweet for me. Dinner came with complimentary Bread & Butter, which was good for soup dipping.

Service here was nice and friendly. They were busy cuz there was a convention in town, so there were times when we had to flag down our server. The wine was good and paired well with our food. Both cocktails were okay. A little light for my tastes, but at least the pricing wasn't too bad.

A nice dinner for a touristy spot, but the food was a little underwhelming. 3 stars.

excerpts: My absolute favorites on the menu would have to be the award winning clam chowder.
The calamari is one of the best I've tried, and I'm a huge sea food lover.
It's paired with fried onions and jalapeños.
The dipping is a creamy aioli sauce that truly brings out the flavor of the calamari.
For the entree, I usually order the linguini and clams.
The amount of clams that's served is unbelievable!
If you aren't in the mood for something super heavy, I would go with this dish to satisfy any seafood cravings.
It also comes with a slice of garlic bread that pairs really well with the sauce.
award winning clam chowder.author: Yixuan L.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Food: 
This is a great place to go for special occasions! I've celebrated many birthdays, anniversaries, and valentine's days here. I've always sat near the windows for a beautiful view of the water. My absolute favorites on the menu would have to be the award winning clam chowder.  The calamari is one of the best I've tried, and I'm a huge sea food lover. It's paired with fried onions and jalapeños. The dipping is a creamy aioli sauce that truly brings out the flavor of the calamari. For the entree, I usually order the linguini and clams. The amount of clams that's served is unbelievable! If you aren't in the mood for something super heavy, I would go with this dish to satisfy any seafood cravings. It also comes with a slice of garlic bread that pairs really well with the sauce. My family is a huge fan of the shellfish platter. Although it's a bit on the pricier end, it encompasses all the seafood favorites that anyone can ever wish for in a meal! Mussels, clams, shrimp, and half a Dungeness crab. 

Price & Portions:
Clam chowder: I usually go with a cup, but for an additional $2 you can get a large bowl to share between 2-3 people!
Calamari: I would say for a $15 plate, it can comfortably serve 3-4 people as a starter dish! 
Linguini and clams: Not a lot of pasta, but still quite filling. $20
Shellfish platter: ~$50 for a sizable amount of seafood

Overall opinion: 
If you're ever on Pier 39, this is a must-try, not only is the food delicious  but the ambiance is one of a kind. Service here is wonderful, the waiters really make an effort to ensure your time there is well-taken care of!

excerpts: We started with the award winning clam chowder and I could certainly see why it won the award.
It was delicious.
award winning clam chowder.author: Ralph R.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Went for lunch while in San Francisco. It's a large Restaurant on Pier 39 on the upper level. The window seats overlook the harbor and the "Sea Lion Resting Area". 
We started with the award winning clam chowder and I could certainly see why it won the award. It was delicious. So was the Dungeness Crab cocktail. 
Of course we had to have the Cioppino which was fantastic. The steamed whole Dungeness Crab was well received. And the Crab Ceviche was outstanding. 
Not only was the food very good, so was the service.

excerpts: We ended up ordering the mussels and their award winning clam chowder bowl.
award winning clam chowder.author: Anthony N.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Have you ever wish you could enjoy a delightful meal with a breathtaking view of the ocean. There's just something soothing about listening to the waves crashing upon the shore. For many, it can be very therapeutic and a comforting experience to indulge in. Add a glass of wine and your significant other to the picture and you'll never want to leave that moment of euphoria. So if you're ever around, Fog Harbor would be the perfect getaway for this kind of occasion. 

F.H.F.H wasn't apart of my friend's and I agenda. We had initially stop by to check out the pier but ended up giving this place a try.

We had walked in during one of their slow nights of a while back ago and got immediately seated at the bar. We had a couple of luggages on us so we didn't opt for any tables. The bartender who was working behind the bar was also our server as well. 

He initially greeted himself and took our beverage orders. As my friend and I were glancing through their array of seafood selections, we both wanted to get two appetizer to share. We weren't as hungry but we were willing to see what this place has to offer. 

We ended up ordering the mussels and their award winning clam chowder bowl. They provided complimentary bread to us which was great to dip with the mussels. 

Several minutes later, our meals had came out and we both started digging in. The mussels were perfectly cooked and marinated in the white wine broth. There was a subtle taste coming from the roasted garlic and a sweet tang from the tomatoes. A beautifully well executed dish I must say. 

As for the clam chowder bowl, the sourdough bread felt as it was freshly baked from the oven. The exterior of the bread was still nice and crunchy and the inside was soft like marshmallows. The clam chowder had chunks of potatoes, bits of chopped clam and also had a rich tasting cream broth. The juices from clams and cream were in perfect harmony which provided that sweet and savory component to the dish. I very much enjoyed since I am a huge sourdough fanatic. I highly recommend this to others!

My overall experience was a superb one. Their customer service was right on the dime and the quality of seafood was worth every penny. The panoramic window scenery was definitely a experience to remember...

excerpts: I ordered the award winning clam chowder and indeed they are correct.
award winning clam chowder.author: Lisa E.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Came here with a friend for the first time. Great service from our server -Beautiful views even though we sat in the back 40 room...
Ordered a delicious Malbec through the urging of our server - yummy.
I ordered the award winning clam chowder and indeed they are correct. Followed it with the mixed grill, all was cooked to perfection. 
Would come here again in a heartbeat.

excerpts: We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna.
The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff.
The crab cakes were good as well.
I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well.
But the service here, was just terrible.
Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink.
We had to ask for everything, straws, etc .
Our table was never cleared at anytime either.
All of our plates were just sitting on the table.
I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space.
Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything.
The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table.
award winning clam chowder.author: Mike N.
award winning clam chowder.review:
The restaurant has great ambience while still in the prime location of Pier 39. However today I was deeply disappointed with their service. We had a few things to try and it was all pretty good. We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna. The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff. The crab cakes were good as well. I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well. But the service here, was just terrible. Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink. We had to ask for everything, straws, etc . Our table was never cleared at anytime either. All of our plates were just sitting on the table. I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space. Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything. The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table. The ice turned into water and the oyster shells were floating around in the dish. 

After paying $170+ dollars is this what I should expect? By all means I have no issue spending money on food. But it really just hits a nerve when I get crappy service and I'm paying for it.....

I would go else where if your thinking about The Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: Came in for the 2017 award winning clam chowder.
I had it topped with crab and Caesar salad.
The soup was creamy delicious.
The iceberg lettuce was fresh and crisped.
Sliced cheese on top.
On the side was warm fresh sliced French roll.
Altogether was delicious and filling.
Great customer service.
He was friendly and attentive.
award winning clam chowder.author: Miriam T.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Came in for the 2017 award winning clam chowder. I had it topped with crab and Caesar salad. The soup was creamy delicious. The iceberg lettuce was fresh and crisped. Sliced cheese on top. On the side was warm fresh sliced French roll. Altogether was delicious and filling. Great customer service. He was friendly and attentive. The day was warm and sunny to enjoy over lunch.

Restaurant was on the 2nd floor of pier 39 overlooking the pier water. If you're looking for great clam chowder, this is the place to be.

excerpts: I started with their award winning clam chowder.
award winning clam chowder.author: Cindy G.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Waited 45 minutes to 1 hour for dinner as no reservations were available. Enjoyed wandering around Fisherman's Wharf and the time passed rather painlessly. 

Given the review and crowds, I was looking forward to a tasty dinner.  

I started with their award winning clam chowder.  The temperature of my chowder was tepid, otherwise the soup was creamy and full of clams.  

My dinner choice was the crab roll. I really wanted to try their crab but was lazy and didn't want to get messy (work dinner).   I think a little celery salt and a lot less mayo would have helped.  The fries were hot, crispy and nicely salted. 

The complementary hot sourdough roll was the best thing I ate.

excerpts: We ordered a seafood tower and their award winning clam chowder.
Everything came out quick and was well prepared.
Service was good and we were seated right away at opening.
We had a reservation via Open Table although we didn't need it
but it's always good to reserve just in case with popular places like this.
The view of the bay overlooks the GG Bridge and Alcatraz Island.
I would recommend this place if you like good seafood.
award winning clam chowder.author: Andrew P.
award winning clam chowder.review: Had a great brunch here yesterday. We ordered a seafood tower and their award winning clam chowder.  Everything came out quick and was well prepared.  Service was good and we were seated right away at opening.  We had a reservation via Open Table although we didn't need it but it's always good to reserve just in case with popular places like this. The view of the bay overlooks the GG Bridge and Alcatraz Island.  I would recommend this place if you like good seafood.

excerpts: Their award winning clam chowder also lives up to its reputation.
I left there VERY satisfied.
award winning clam chowder.author: Jasmine P.
award winning clam chowder.review:
The Fog Harbor Fish House was a magnificent venue to celebrate my birthday.  Our seating couldn't have been more perfect with a view of the SF Bay and to Sausalito, the food was flavorful & all deliciousness and the staff was pleasant, attentive & friendly.

I was craving for a whole crab along with a side of pasta & veggies.  Their award winning clam chowder also lives up to its reputation.  I left there VERY satisfied.  We'll be back soon on our next visit.  

Thank you for a splendid dining experience.  It was a beautiful afternoon/evening to be in SF.

excerpts: I also tried the award winning clam chowder which was really good.
My family and I were seated in a nice spot with view of Alcatraz and enjoyed some nice cocktails.
award winning clam chowder.author: Surf City M.
award winning clam chowder.review: The crab roll was legit!  Full of crab, celery and a light sauce on toasted sourdough.  I also tried the award winning clam chowder which was really good.  My family and I were seated in a nice spot with view of Alcatraz and enjoyed some nice cocktails.

excerpts: I ordered Seafood Penne accompanied with a cup of their award winning clam chowder.
I have to repeat myself
award winning clam chowder.author: Wildary C.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Definitely one of the finest and best restaurants I've been to.
Had the pleasure to come here for lunch-early dinner a couple of summers ago and I've been dying to come back to this city and this restaurant since then.

We shared appetizers first, sliders, crab cake and crispy calamari. They all were on point!!

I ordered Seafood Penne accompanied with a cup of their award winning clam chowder. I have to repeat myself, i've been wishing i could come back. 

Everything was perfect, from the food to the service. I said it was one of the finest restaurants i've been to because the way they take care of the customers' need is something else. Waiters and waitresses are on another level. 
At some point my phone died, since I was on vacation I was carrying my charger everywhere, I asked one of the waitresses to take my phone somewhere safe so it could charge a little and she brought me a portable charger so I wouldn't have to worry about it, she made my day. Of course, that's one of the things this restaurant has to offer to the clients but to me it was a kindness act and great way to take care of the clients' needs.

If you happen to be in San Francisco, don't leave without paying a visit to this place. Almost forgot to mention, if you happen to be lucky like we were, you'll be seated near the huge windows that offer a view to the bay, in the evening it's BEAUTIFUL here. Come by and rate

excerpts: Great way to start off our trip with a bowl of award winning clam chowder!
When you receive the bill they give you coffee crackers instead of mints to end your meal.
award winning clam chowder.author: Karen H.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Our first official meal in SF! Authentic good clam chowder is what he wanted in a sourdough bread bowl. This place had us sold when we read award winning chowder!

It was a tough choice since Fishermans Wharf is basically filled with a ton of great chowder places but this spot still won us over. You walk into a beautiful entrance with a seating area and fireplace. Past the bar and into the dining room. We got lucky and we were seated next to the window. It was on overcast chilly day but the view still looked spectacular. The chowder defiantly helped us to warm up before our bike ride to the bridge. The chowder was warm, thick and flavorful. It was not salty which is my main issues with clam chowders. They didn't skimp on any of the ingredients you see the huge chunks of clams. It wasn't watered down or runny. The spices really did come through nicely. We added extra crab meat for $7. I wish the crab meat was warmed before placing it on top of the chowder. I had to mix it into the chowder to warm it up. Then we ripped off pieces of the sourdough bread bowl to dip into the chowder. It was delicious just what we needed. We also had their complimentary sourdough bread and butter before our meal came out. Can't get enough carbs! Especially good sourdough! Calamari is another tricky dish that can go wrong. But not here! The hot plate of freshly fried calamari was so good! Lemon aioli was served instead of tarter sauce. The lemon aioli really made a huge difference especially with a freshly squeezed lemon over the calamari. The surprise kicker was the deep fried slices of jalapeños to give you a surprise kick of fire. I didn't even notice it until my BF pointed them out. I tried some of the smaller pieces of jalapeño and calamari dipped into the aioli ohhhh it was the best combo. 

Service was wonderful, server was on top of everything. Refilling waters and checking up on us. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. Great way to start off our trip with a bowl of award winning clam chowder! When you receive the bill they give you coffee crackers instead of mints to end your meal.

excerpts: Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.
The oysters were very fresh and delicious.
The clam chowder was delicious.
It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect.
The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..
yummy.
The roll just meats in your mouth and they
they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.
The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good.
award winning clam chowder.author: Ashley L.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Came here to have my Bday dinner with the Beau because we were in the area and I was craving seafood.  Didn't know this place is located in Pier 39 until we got there.  **Note** This place only validate parking in the garage for an hour and it will take you more than an hour to eat at this place.

We waited about 15 mins before we got seated.  Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.  The oysters were very fresh and delicious.  The clam chowder was delicious.  It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect. The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..yummy.  The roll just meats in your mouth and they they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.  The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good. 

Recommend this place if you are looking for a seafood place to eat in the area.  The view was also very nice as we were seated by the window looking out over the water.

excerpts: In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5.
We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good!
This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later.
award winning clam chowder.author: Joanne S.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Every time my mom comes to SF I take her to get seafood at Fog Harbor Fish House. Great view of the bay and Alcatraz, located at Pier 39 so lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. Of course, with the tourist location comes tourist prices but it's not that bad. In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5. We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good! This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later. Service is usually quite good and you can get seated usually within an hour even if there is a wait - no problem there's lots to do while you wait!

This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries. The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch but they are, and the cream sauce was delicious. The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here. I generally prefer for my cod to have that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table). However our waiter was fabulous at everything else, including getting our check to us early as we had lost track of time and had an upcoming appointment.

My brother usually comes with us and always gets the burger because he doesn't like seafood. It's alright, but really why come to a seafood house for a burger? It does comes with those delicious fries.

Tl;dr: great views, great service, great area, generally great food. Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab. Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options. Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway. We will be coming back!

excerpts: I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl!
This was amazing as well.
award winning clam chowder.author: Hai L.
award winning clam chowder.review: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

excerpts: We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks.
Just YUMS!
award winning clam chowder.author: Jennie N.
award winning clam chowder.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: Award winning clam chowder is amazing!
Service was quick and convenient.
By far my favorite place on the pier.
award winning clam chowder.author: M C.
award winning clam chowder.review: This is a great place to visit on the pier if you're looking for a delicious family dinner or lunch. The view of Alcatraz was breathtaking. The steak with whiskey sauce is very good. Award winning clam chowder is amazing!  Service was quick and convenient.  By far my favorite place on the pier.

excerpts:
For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.
award winning clam chowder.author: Racheal D.
award winning clam chowder.review:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!

excerpts: Award winning Clam chowder was no need to say.
I recommend a bread bowl one rather than regular ones.
award winning clam chowder.author: HeeYoung Y.
award winning clam chowder.review: Super kind services and great foods and drink! Award winning Clam chowder was no need to say. I recommend a bread bowl one rather than regular ones. Garlic roasted crab was fantastic. It serves for two perfectly.

excerpts: We chose to have their award winning clam chowder and we understand exactly why it was award winning.
award winning clam chowder.author: Jay R.
award winning clam chowder.review: This place  was amazing. From the fresh bread & butter to our appetizers and main dishes. We chose to have their award winning clam chowder and we understand exactly why it was award winning. Steamed clams, Caesar salad as appetizers. All dishes were amazing along with a wonderful wine list. We sat next to a clean large window with beautiful views of the bay. Customer Service was on point and we got seated quickly since we had reservations. We will definitely return for many more trips.

excerpts: But, I was satisfied when my award winning clam chowder was served.
It was piping hot and the clams tasted so fresh and the chowder was rich, creamy, and very flavorful.
I had it with the sour dough bread that was given at our table.
What helped with the long wait was watching the beautiful sunset turning from orange to pink and the sun finally setting.
award winning clam chowder.author: Diana S.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Our group got here on a busy Monday evening without a reservation and waited for 15-minutes and that wasn't so bad.  

We ordered our meals and waited extremely long for our orders to come, maybe about a half an hour.  But, I was satisfied when my award winning clam chowder was served.  It was piping hot and the clams tasted so fresh and the chowder was rich, creamy, and very flavorful.  I had it with the sour dough bread that was given at our table.  What helped with the long wait was watching the beautiful sunset turning from orange to pink and the sun finally setting.  My group of 5 all stood up to get some pictures.  

We eventually all got our entrees another half an hour later.  My Salmon "Club" Salad was very good.  The portion of salmon was prepared just right.  It was moist and flaky.  The lemon vinaigrette mixed in the salad was nice and tart and the lemon ranch dressing on top of the salmon enhanced the already freshness of the fish.  I enjoyed the onions, cherry tomatoes and bacon bits throughout the dish.  This dish was pricey for a salad, $20, but well worth it.

Next we were waiting for our check to come.  It was a long wait.  Our waitress apologized for our wait and her Manager decided to give us complimentary desserts for our time.  He also came to apologize for our wait.  We all ordered blondies to go.  I actually wanted to get the creme brûlé but that wouldn't be practical to take out.  

So, I gave our experience a 4 since we had great service recovery, and the meal and scenic view was fine.  If you don't mind waiting, this place is very good.

excerpts: Last but not the least is their Award winning Clam Chowder....
award winning clam chowder.author: Jonathan C.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Ive been Traveling to the United States for Couple of years. Yelp in the philippine is not that popular. But when I came to visit my Friend in San Francisco. Told me about yelp? I tried it out for the best Seafood at Pier 39? A popular tourist destination in San Francisco. I stumbled at Fog Harbor Fish House. My Host Friend confirmed about the Sustainability of the Restaurant. Sustainability... A first to my ear Let me realized how environmental friendly this restaurant was.

Its on the second level of Pier 39. They had a Majestic View of Golden Gate. Huge Windows to enjoy the best view while you enjoy your Dinning experience.....

Our Server Shawna was sooo welcoming.. Explained what sustainable Seafood they offer.  She suggested the Mix Grill with salmon, shrimp and swordfish with mash potato and broccoli. Loved her suggestion as this trio compliment with each other....

My Friend Got the Salmon. Its was moist and Loved it ...I had to steal half of his salmon too...

Last but not the least is their Award winning Clam Chowder....True Its must try..

For a first time Yelper..Im glad my friend informed me about this application...


Thanks to Shawna and Fog Harbor for a wonderful experience..

excerpts: Ordered the crab roasted with garlic, their award winning clam chowder and clam with linguine.
award winning clam chowder.author: Mai B.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Went here with my family and was honestly expecting a lot out of the seafood. The wait was pretty long, but Fisherman's wharf was right there, so was able to keep myself and fam occupy. Ordered the crab roasted with garlic, their award winning clam chowder and clam with linguine. 

The crab and linguine was delicious!  I did not like their clam chowder because it was too heavy for my liking, but the bread bowl was yum. 

Overall a good experience and worth a try.

excerpts: You must try the award winning clam chowder with crab meat.
We had not one but 2 bowls.
Ordered entree's were the sea food mix and linguine with shrimp.
The portions are just right.
award winning clam chowder.author: Racquel S.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Sit down to great ambiance. Magnificent view of the water and a feeling that you could just reach out and touch Alcatraz from your seat. 
The food is fresh and decadent. You must try the award winning clam chowder with crab meat. We had not one but 2 bowls. Ordered entree's were the sea food mix and linguine with shrimp. The portions are just right.
Its been days already and we still think and talk about this food.

The wait time was approximately 30 mins for seating without prior reservation but it was so worth it

excerpts: Award winning Clam chowder in bread bowl was rich and clamy
We ordered the Dungeness Crab cakes - they just melt in your mouth - exquisite flavors.
Must recommended.
Lobster tail - Presentation of this dish was very creative and it tasted soft and succulent.
Fish and chips was not so great.
Desserts was Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée.
Its freaking awesome...must try.
award winning clam chowder.author: Sudesna M.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Ambience : Romantic and scenic. We went around 7:00pm in summer and caught the Alcatraz islands view in the sun, during sunset and after sunset. It was breathtaking. You can just stare at the bay forever. Hubby tried Merlot 2012 and it was good.
The complimentary sourdough bread provided was perfect - just the right taste.  Award winning Clam chowder in bread bowl was rich and clamy :)
We ordered the Dungeness Crab cakes - they just melt in your mouth - exquisite flavors. Must recommended. Lobster tail - Presentation of this dish was very creative and it tasted soft and succulent. Fish and chips was not so great. Desserts was Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée. Its freaking awesome...must try.

excerpts: Crab cake and cup of award winning clam chowder.
Having crab cooked with garlic brought out the flavor of the crab!
Crab cake was perfectly cooked while the clan chowder had biteful pieces with every spoonful.
award winning clam chowder.author: Robert M.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Excellent food overlooking the pier and bay.  Entree ordered was Garlic whole dungeness crab. Crab cake and cup of award winning clam chowder. 
Having crab cooked with garlic brought out the flavor of the crab!  Crab cake was perfectly cooked while the clan chowder had biteful pieces with every spoonful.

excerpts: The creaminess of the clam chowder made me believe why this cup of goodness was crowned Award Winning Clam Chowder.
award winning clam chowder.author: Andrew L.
award winning clam chowder.review:
If you love fresh seafood, this is the place for you!

My girlfriend and I ordered the Shellfish platter for one, crispy scallops, and a cup of their famous clam chowder.

First glance at the shellfish platter as soon as it arrived at our table made my mouth water with excitement! The aroma from the fresh herbs and spices enhanced the experience!

The creaminess of the clam chowder made me believe why this cup of goodness was crowned Award Winning Clam Chowder.

The crispy scallops was an "okay" for me since I'm not really fond of scallops but my girlfriend thought otherwise.

Overall this lovely restaurant lived up to its name and the great reviews is what got me here!

excerpts: We tried their award winning clam chowder and it was pretty good, the best part was the service though!
Mel was our server and on top of everything, made the night!
Also made us want to spend more!!
I'd go back definitely, if I had out of towners visiting to get the Pier 39 experience right!
award winning clam chowder.author: Lily S.
award winning clam chowder.review: The view was right at sunset overlooking the pier and bay, so perfect! And the food was delicious. We tried their award winning clam chowder and it was pretty good, the best part was the service though! Mel was our server and on top of everything, made the night! Also made us want to spend more!! I'd go back definitely, if I had out of towners visiting to get the Pier 39 experience right!

excerpts: so I stuck to the award winning clam chowder, which was delicious.
Server had a great sense of humor and even brought me a couple complementary cookies to taken home for after I was fuller recovered and able to eat solid food.
Will definitely be coming back for more !
award winning clam chowder.author: Daniella R.
award winning clam chowder.review: First time having dinner at Fog Harbor. Service was amazing! Food was outstanding, props to the chefs.  Ahí tuna appetizer was to die for! Not mention the clam chowder and the dessert. Our server was very attentive! I had just gotten my wisdom teeth taken out a few days prior so I stuck to the award winning clam chowder, which was delicious. Server had a great sense of humor and even brought me a couple complementary cookies to taken home for after I was fuller recovered and able to eat solid food. Will definitely be coming back for more !

excerpts: In my opinion, the scallops appetizer and the award winning clam chowder is a must.
award winning clam chowder.author: Austin R.
award winning clam chowder.review: First time here and it was a great experience. Food was good and fresh, they have boudin sourdough that you don't have to line up for. Amy was our server and she did a really good job making sure we were having a good time. Another server Martin came up and offered to give us more of the sauce that came with our appetizer. He also offered us more to drink,.They were both polite and friendly. The restaurant has a lively environment with a great view of the dock too. In my opinion, the scallops appetizer and the award winning clam chowder is a must.

excerpts: Award winning clam chowder is exactly that!
award winning clam chowder.author: Crystal E.
award winning clam chowder.review: Beautiful view of the bay in this place if you get a window seat. The food was on point with the expectations. Loved the friendly staff & the ambiance. Award winning clam chowder is exactly that!

excerpts: The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name:
Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes.
award winning clam chowder.author: Calvin S.
award winning clam chowder.review:
3.5/5, +.5 for service

Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.

We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.

Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.

Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.

excerpts: I made a reservation for this place for the boyfriends birthday, based on their award winning clam chowder bowl.
Well, due to unforeseen conditions, we were late.
VERY LATE.
award winning clam chowder.author: Julie P.
award winning clam chowder.review:
OH MY GOODNESS!!!!  I made a reservation for this place for the boyfriends birthday, based on their award winning clam chowder bowl.  Well, due to unforeseen conditions, we were late.  VERY LATE.  But they were wonderful and very understanding... and sat us immediately at a window table for two.

Now, I was expecting the food to be eh... okay for touristy san francisco.  I was WRONG.  WAY WRONG.  The calamari.... OMG.... probably the best we've had.  SOOOOOO GOOOD.
Their clam chowder breadbowls?  Oh Yeah... I get why they are award winning.  Please do yourself a favour and try it (though we both opted to pass on the crab meat on top... WHY would you have CLAM AND CRAB meat?).  The long island ice tea i ordered... probably the best I've EVER had (thank you mark).

Our waitress... shoot... I can't remember her name, but she had a pink flower headband in her hair.  She was the sweetest thing ever.  THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU.  You really need a raise.  Seriously.  You made our lunch there PERFECT.  A million thank yous.

We were so full and well taken care of, that this was our only meal of the day, and ALL we needed.  We were too busy for breakfast, and too full for dinner... but our lunch was so AMAZING.... we didn't need anything else.

I promise you.... we WILL be back.  Soon!!!!!

excerpts: I normally get the award winning clam chowder and the Caesar salad with crab.
Also, the have the best crab cakes which you would expect being that it is a seafood restaurant.
However I have been to some places that had horrible crab cakes and called themselves a seafood restaurant.
The restaurant is right on the water so it the scenery is so beautiful.
They have vey good dessert options.
I have only had the chocolate cake which was good but a little too rich for my taste.
But for anyone that is a chocolate lover I would still recommend getting it.
award winning clam chowder.author: Dominique H.
award winning clam chowder.review: The best seafood place I have been to! I love crab and it's always fresh there when I go.  I normally get the award winning clam chowder and the Caesar salad with crab.  Also, the have the best crab cakes which you would expect being that it is a seafood restaurant. However I have been to some places that had horrible crab cakes and called themselves a seafood restaurant.  The restaurant is right on the water so it the scenery is so beautiful.  They have vey good dessert options. I have only had the chocolate cake which was good but a little too rich for my taste. But for anyone that is a chocolate lover I would still recommend getting it.

excerpts: The award winning clam chowder, I couldn't tell the difference between it and the one sold at street corner.
award winning clam chowder.author: Amber X.
award winning clam chowder.review: Another travelers' must go place but locals will not choose. To be honest, food is really average. I don't think it worth the price neither ($90 for 2 including tips). I ordered oysters, fried calamari, clam chowder, and Ani tuna. The fried calamari was WARM...not crispy at all... Ani tuna was good, although the soy sauce was not spread evenly which made some of the rice too salty. There was only one kind of oyster. But they were really juicy. The award winning clam chowder, I couldn't tell the difference between it and the one sold at street corner.

excerpts: The food was enjoyable as it gets, from the award winning Clam Chowder Sup in a bread bowl, that I had, to the veggie pasta, had by our daughters' room mate...
All in all, an experience I will repeat anytime... Give it a try!!
award winning clam chowder.author: Rolando R.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Yesterday we went to celebrate my daughter's is going to college in this amazing city. Previous to that, and because I've used successfully YELP in the past, I did my reservation by email.
Bob (actual CEO was kind enough to answer me), and 5 of us sat down in this "cozy" place (as my daughter will called it).... A truly first class experience. Scotty our waiter was a truly friendly and caring person, so were the ladies at the entrance. 
The food was enjoyable as it gets, from the award winning Clam Chowder Sup in a bread bowl, that I had, to the veggie pasta, had by our daughters' room mate... All in all, an experience I will repeat anytime... Give it a try!!

excerpts: Scott started with the Award Winning Clam Chowder.
He rated the soup a three star and he is quite the clam chowder aficionado.
We split the Beet & Blue Cheese Salad - red and golden beets, organic mixed greens tossed with blue cheese dressing topped with walnuts - which was utterly delicious.
The server had the kitchen split the salad which is a detail often missed.
The hot from the oven sour dough bread was very tasty that came with our appetizers.
award winning clam chowder.author: Wendi G.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Service is definitely a standout at this tourist location at Fisherman's Wharf. Our server was top notch and paid attention to detail and incredibly helpful and friendly. We made our reservation via Open Table and that made it easy to get a table but they also gave us a nice amuse bouche to start our dinner. The atmosphere is loud - lots of noise and clanging - so don't plan on an intimate dinner here. 

Scott started with the Award Winning Clam Chowder. He rated the soup a three star and he is quite the clam chowder aficionado. We split the Beet & Blue Cheese Salad - red and golden beets, organic mixed greens tossed with blue cheese dressing topped with walnuts - which was utterly delicious.  The server had the kitchen split the salad which is a detail often missed. The hot from the oven sour dough bread was very tasty that came with our appetizers. As a side note, I wanted the grilled artichoke but the server said the item was not available. 

The food fell to a low point with my entree the Salmon special. It was very dry and served on their mashed potatoes which appeared to be instant or potato pearls. It was not very tasty and I mostly just ate the vegetable on my plate. Scott had the Whole Dungeness Crab with a spicy Thai sauce. He loved this meal. The crab was cooked perfectly and the sauce, although messy, was really good. Had my seafood been as good as the crab I would have bumped them to a four star.

A fun place to try if you are in the mood for a Pier 39 restaurant.

excerpts: When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table.
award winning clam chowder.author: Sonia Y.
award winning clam chowder.review:
Let's just say that walking all the way from the Powell Bart Station to here... was worth the sore feet.

My friend and I had our mind set on clam chowder in a bread bowl on the pier. When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table. 

The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari. Everything was delicious but I think the clam chowder took the cake. It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency. I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much. Bread bowl was amazing. My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl. Crispy, just a little tart, and warm. Hrmm. 

Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was awesome. Would definitely come here again.

excerpts: Their "Award Winning Clam Chowder" is just that!
Simply Amazing!!!!
We also ordered the calamari, which was okay, my fiancé really liked it, but I would rate it a 6.5.
I live in the Central Valley and I take weekend trips to San Francisco every so often and
this place I will definitely return too ;)
award winning clam chowder.author: Jose R.
award winning clam chowder.review: Really nice restaurant on Pier 39 with great views of the harbor. Their "Award Winning Clam Chowder" is just that! Simply Amazing!!!! We also ordered the calamari, which was okay, my fiancé really liked it, but I would rate it a 6.5. I live in the Central Valley and I take weekend trips to San Francisco every so often and this place I will definitely return too ;)

excerpts: They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try!
Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl!
Everything else was also great.
award winning clam chowder.author: Alina K.
award winning clam chowder.review: First time trying this place as recommended by our group. They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try! Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl! Everything else was also great. Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried! Our server went above and beyond to make us happy. We were very pleased. The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking. Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.

excerpts: I started with a bowl of their award winning clam chowder, which I must say was excellent.
From there, though, the meal was downhill.
Our server was not very happy at all, and it was took about 25 minutes before we ordered our food.
We both got fish & chips, which we agreed was very plain.
The restaurant itself is very nice and it has great views, I just wish the food was a little better.
award winning clam chowder.author: Brian L.
award winning clam chowder.review: Fog Harbor is just average. Was excited to finally eat here after reading all of the rave reviews, and chose it over "Fog City" on my most recent trip to San Francisco. I started with a bowl of their award winning clam chowder, which I must say was excellent. From there, though, the meal was downhill. Our server was not very happy at all, and it was took about 25 minutes before we ordered our food. We both got fish & chips, which we agreed was very plain. The restaurant itself is very nice and it has great views, I just wish the food was a little better.

excerpts: For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.
award winning clam chowder.author: Racquel E.
award winning clam chowder.review: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.

excerpts: Award winning clam chowder was perfect in a sour dough bread bowl.
Fresh bread and butter as an appetizer was excellent.
Friendly waiters, fast service, and just a great atmosphere!
If your around Pier 39 this is a good place for amazing sea food.
award winning clam chowder.author: Kristi P.
award winning clam chowder.review: Award winning clam chowder was perfect in a sour dough bread bowl. Fresh bread and butter as an appetizer was excellent. Friendly waiters, fast service, and just a great atmosphere! If your around Pier 39 this is a good place for amazing sea food.

excerpts: For lunch, one of us enjoyed the award winning Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl ($9) and the other had the Soup and Salad Combo ($14) with a Caesar side salad.
The soup was served in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl.
award winning clam chowder.author: Meghan L.
award winning clam chowder.review:
If you're looking for a nice sit down seafood restaurant at Pier 39, the Fog Harbor Fish House is a great restaurant! We came here in the afternoon and enjoyed sitting by the fireplace outside and listening to the waterfall while we waited for our table. The restaurant has beautiful bay windows with panoramic views of the wharf. It's worth asking for a table next to the window where you can actually see the seals below! 

Being in SF I really wanted fresh baked bread so I was delighted when a bread basket of warm, freshly baked sourdough bread arrived. To kick things off, we enjoyed the Crispy Lemon Calamari ($12), which was delicious! The calamari was seasoned with lemon zest and delicious on it's own even without the lemon aioli. For lunch, one of us enjoyed the award winning Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl ($9) and the other had the Soup and Salad Combo ($14) with a Caesar side salad. The soup was served in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl. We enjoyed the complimentary Biscoff cookie that arrived at the end of the meal.

Visit Fog Harbor Fish House, you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: I had the their award winning clam chowder to start and it was excellent.
award winning clam chowder.author: Dennis B.
award winning clam chowder.review: Waiter was friendly and very responsive.  I had the their award winning clam chowder to start and it was excellent.  For my entree, I had the Ahi Tuna which said it was served rare as I like it.  When it came out it was more like medium.  The flavor was great but it could have been cooked better.  The restaurant has a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge also which is nice to enjoy.

excerpts: We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl.
That's more than enough food for my mom and me.
The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful.
Great experience!
award winning chowder in a fresh baked s.author: Yang L.
award winning chowder in a fresh baked s.review: Went there on a Thursday lunch time. Didn't have to wait and we even got a window table with fantastic pier view. We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl. That's more than enough food for my mom and me. The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful. Great experience!

excerpts: We got the crispy calamari to start along with the jumbo shrimp cocktail and clam chowder.
The crispy calamari had good flavor, but the fried batter came off the calamari very easily and was a little difficult to pick up.
The batter was also a little too thick and hard, not quite airy and crispy.
The shrimps seemed pretty fresh and it was tasty with the sauce, but I noticed that a couple shrimps weren't deveined very cleanly and had bits of black left.
The chowder was decent.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Annie L.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
I came here with a friend who was visiting since it looked like a nicer restaurant. We came for dinner and the wait was about 20 minutes on a Saturday.

The service was good, but the food was quite disappointing. We got the crispy calamari to start along with the jumbo shrimp cocktail and clam chowder. The crispy calamari had good flavor, but the fried batter came off the calamari very easily and was a little difficult to pick up. The batter was also a little too thick and hard, not quite airy and crispy. The shrimps seemed pretty fresh and it was tasty with the sauce, but I noticed that a couple shrimps weren't deveined very cleanly and had bits of black left. The chowder was decent. It had a lot of ingredients, but it was a bit too salty and thick for me. 

The most disappointing dish, however, was the main. I got the scallops and crab risotto that was on the seasonal menu. I love all of those so I was very excited about it. However, I'm not sure if the scallops weren't fresh, if it was the type of scallop used, or if it wasn't prepared properly, but it had a very strong fishy taste that was very off putting. The scallops also looked like it had been seared so I was looking forward to that texture, but they were just wet and soft. The risotto was very average and not quite al dente. 

My favorite part of the meal was the blackberry press soda. It's quite a big cup and was very refreshing. 

Next time I'll be taking visiting friends to another restaurant.

excerpts: We ordered: clam chowder, calamari, fish and chips, and jumbo shrimp cocktail.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Jovi D.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Um, hello? Clam chowder topped with a generous amount of crab meat? Count me ALL THE WAY in!

Fog Harbor Fish House is conveniently located right in the front of Pier 39 on the second floor above a souvenir shop. The place itself is very upscale looking on the inside and I know I felt a bit underdressed walking in. But who cares, it's located in the heart of a touristy area.

We were seated for a party of 4 right away. We had an awesome view of the water. Our waiter was a gentleman name Tyler who went above and beyond his job description. Very cool dude.

We ordered: clam chowder, calamari, fish and chips, and jumbo shrimp cocktail.

Everything we had was exceptional. There was not one thing that we ordered that my friends and I didn't enjoy. I wish we had room for dessert! 

Best believe I am definitely coming back to Fog Harbor! I can't get enough of their clam chowder! I want to try so many other things!

excerpts: We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail".
For myself I ordered the
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Christal C.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Wow! Amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.  My boyfriend and I wanted to taste a little bit of everything without spending a lot, so we decided to share. We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail". For myself I ordered the  "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter". Overall we spent $130 not including tip. Quite an expensive meal but definitely worth it. 

CHOWDER: 10/10 cup size was perfect to share. Get a little taste without getting full. 
SHRIMP COCKTAIL: 10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB: 10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli. The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering. Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert. 
SHELLFISH PLATTER: 8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry. He liked the meaty mussels though. 
CREME BRÛLÉE: 10/10 perfect sweetness

excerpts: Then we had the jumbo shrimp cocktail and mussel fries.
Both were fantastic.
Ended with the crab Cesar salad which was also awesome.
Our server, Jeremy, was polite, courteous and prompt giving us great recommendations.
A bit pricey but worth it being in SF and the great view.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Brittney G.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Great scenery for starters. Nice bar and comfy seating. Good house cocktail list that is very "San Francisco" along with a long wine list. We started with the chowder topped with crab and it was awesome. Then we had the jumbo shrimp cocktail and mussel fries. Both were fantastic. Ended with the crab Cesar salad which was also awesome. Our server, Jeremy, was polite, courteous and prompt giving us great recommendations. A bit pricey but worth it being in SF and the great view.

excerpts: Jumbo shrimp cocktail.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Nicole L.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: OMG phenomenal. Warm sourdough bread. Jumbo shrimp cocktail. Dinner plate of grilled salmon, cod, shrimp complimented with mashed potatoes and fresh crisp green beans. Everything was mouth-watering delicious I would totally eat here again.

excerpts: I had the calamari and the jumbo shrimp cocktail.
The waitress at the next table and the manager were super nice; I added a star for their great service.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Lon G.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Food was good, but very expensive for what you get. Then again, it is a prime location. I had the calamari and the jumbo shrimp cocktail. The waitress at the next table and the manager were super nice; I added a star for their great service.

excerpts: the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers.
All were very good
(I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty).
Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Matt K.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.

excerpts: We got the clam chowder, jumbo shrimp cocktail and linguine with clams.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Thomas D.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Wife and I made it a point to stop here for dinner based on the yelp rating.  Food and venue didn't disappoint.  Place gets packed for dinner, we were estimated at 1.5-2 hours on a Saturday night.  We were able to grab a couple seats at the bar within about 20 minutes and you can order the full menu. Drinks and food were great, would highly recommend coming here. We got the clam chowder, jumbo shrimp cocktail and linguine with clams.

excerpts:
And the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail was Subpar. 
The cocktail sauce just had a weird taste to it, no flavor. 
I actually ended up adding the shrimp from that to my meal. 
I would recommend this to family and friends because they have many other really nice looking dishes
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Greg F.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
The Sourdough Clam Chowder Bowl was yummy, and the bread was very good. 
The Crab Cakes appetizer was the best crab cakes I have ever eaten!! 
I also ordered a Moscow Mule and that is a real nice drink when you have a hot date like I did 
On the other hand my Mixed Grill dish was small for the price in my opinion.. 
And the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail was Subpar. 
The cocktail sauce just had a weird taste to it, no flavor. 
I actually ended up adding the shrimp from that to my meal. 
I would recommend this to family and friends because they have many other really nice looking dishes

excerpts: The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was indeed "jumbo" AND delicious.
The chowder was excellent but, be warned, my vegetarian wife couldn't have any because it has bacon in it.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: S And J T.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Our first visit here and they actually got us in for dinner on Valentine's Day without a reservation. Amazing! Not the best table, but, with their superb location and all those windows, we still had a beautiful view of the bay at sunset. The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was indeed "jumbo" AND delicious. The chowder was excellent but, be warned, my vegetarian wife couldn't have any because it has bacon in it. The Ahi Tuna was perfectly/lightly cooked and a very substantial portion. Fresh and delicious. Wife got the mixed grill and couldn't stop oozing over the swordfish. It was the best either us of us has ever had. Full disclosure, we live in the desert.

excerpts: I ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail and the sourdough bowl chowder.
The shrimp (which I think was expensive for 6 large shrimps) tasted very fresh, the cocktail sauce had an unexpected kick as well.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Janice C.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Located in the famous (or imfamous, depending on who you ask) pier 39, the restaurant was higher end then I expected. I expected something more shack like and when I first saw the restaurant I was afraid it was gonna be a tourist trap, but the food was amazing! 

I ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail and the sourdough bowl chowder. The shrimp (which I think was expensive for 6 large shrimps) tasted very fresh, the cocktail sauce had an unexpected kick as well. While I would order it again, I think $16 for 6 pieces of shrimp is very pricy. 

The clam chowder was excellent as well. The soup came in a hot toasted bread bowl and was piping hot as well. Very well seasoned with lots of pieces of clams. The clams were no overcooked (which can be a problem when mass producing clan chowder) and it was very filling. It was also a good price as well,  I would have no problems ordering the bowl of soup again since it was about 2 cups of soup for $10. 

The service was meh, they were obviously busy but I didn't think they were packed and yet our waitress who was very nice and polite never really came by. We had to our our drinks from someone we flagged down and we did so for the rest of the meal. 

Both the high price point on the shrimp and the service contributed to the 4 stars instead of 5 stars but I would highly recommend this restaurant to those visiting the pier.

excerpts: Jumbo shrimp cocktail, Moscow Mule and warm Sourdough Bread started our dinner off with a bang!!
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Joan S.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
We hit the mark again!! All our plates were so delicious ...might have over indulged
Nice ambiance right by the water and views amazing even with a little rain. 
Jumbo shrimp cocktail, Moscow Mule and warm Sourdough Bread started our dinner off with a bang!!

excerpts: We also ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail, which was yummy.
The service was nice and ambiance was pleasant.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Katie C.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: My husband and I went here yesterday, April 23, 2015 for dinner. We were seated near the window which was perfect because I was cold. Having the sun come through the window warmed me up. The bread was very hard to cut through; however and luckily, the manager noticed this after I was done and brought us warm and softer pre-cut bread. My husband had the Shellfish Platter and thought it was good. I had the sourdough bread bowl clam chowder and thought it was okay. I personally do not like spices and a lot of herbs in my clam chowder and thought this soup had a little too much of both. We also ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail, which was yummy. The service was nice and ambiance was pleasant.

excerpts: Jumbo shrimp cocktail, no so jumbo.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Kevin L.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Food just okay.  Quite expensive for a small crab.  They also cleaned all the tamale out of most of their crabs.  Not good if you like the tamale like I do.  Same price as PPQ and was only half as good.

Also had a crab melt that had too much mayo and a little too runny.  Popcorn rock shrimp was the best.  Perfect seasoning and had a good kick of spiciness.  Clam chowder too thick.  Jumbo shrimp cocktail, no so jumbo.  Ahi tuna with wild rice was well portioned.  SF sourdough bread awesome.

Server was funny and happy even on a super busy night.  But he didn't check on us often.

Hey its pier 39, tourist central.  What can I expect?

excerpts: Clam chowder was fantastic and jumbo shrimp cocktail was very fresh but sorely disappointed at our server Amy.
She just handed us the 2 menus, didn't inform us of the specials.
