We had to hear it from the other table's server.
She also didn't check back with us while eating.
It took her a long time to process our payment.
Great views and food , bad service .
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: M L.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Clam chowder was fantastic and jumbo shrimp cocktail was very fresh but sorely disappointed at our server Amy. She just handed us the 2 menus, didn't inform us of the specials. We had to hear it from the other table's server. She also didn't check back with us while eating. It took her a long time to process our payment. Great views and food , bad service .

excerpts: Shared, jumbo shrimp cocktail and Ahi and Crab Cakes..
I think I expected the Ahi to blow me away and whileit was  good-
it didn't blow me away.. crab cakes had lots of nice crab and the shrimp were just fine though.
Our waiter was nice enough.
However, he did reach across our table from the opposite side and pick up empty glasses by the rims.
I notice these things because I used to be in service and these are just simple things that clearly the mgmt doesn't watch for.
Otherwise,  their staff wouldn't be dong these things..
we had a very nice evening and enjoyed the views and the food
but we'd probably try some other places next time.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Sopla R.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Your in SF and you want seafood and a water view right?!! You'll get all of these here..but  I'd say all in all, we were a bit underwhelmed for the price point..
Did we clean our plates? Of course!  Shared, jumbo shrimp cocktail and Ahi and Crab Cakes.. I think I expected the Ahi to blow me away and whileit was  good- it didn't blow me away.. crab cakes had lots of nice crab and the shrimp were just fine though.  Our waiter was nice enough. However, he did reach across our table from the opposite side and pick up empty glasses by the rims. I notice these things because I used to be in service and these are just simple things that clearly the mgmt doesn't watch for.  Otherwise,  their staff wouldn't be dong these things.. we had a very nice evening and enjoyed the views and the food but we'd probably try some other places next time.

excerpts: My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners.
The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce.
Presentation was awful.
The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Anastasios V.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Definitely not a destination place. Very touristy spot. My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners. The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce. Presentation was awful. The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks. We have yet to receive our lobster tails but I am sure that they are definitely less than stellar. I will definitely update you all on the lobster tails. That is if my wife and I make it out of this place without food poisoning.

excerpts: The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.
They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Doug K.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Great food.  The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.  They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.

excerpts: We had the jumbo shrimp cocktail, mussels cooked the way they make the clams (per my cousins request), clam chowder, and crab cakes.
Everything was fresh, reasonably priced (even the drinks), and service was excellent.
We made several recommendations when people asked us where to eat at Pier 39.
I will definitely be going back.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Victoria R.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Just got back from a vacation to San Francisco and we could not have been happier with the food and service here. We went here after a hop on hop off tour and really wanted a nice sit down meal. We had the jumbo shrimp cocktail, mussels cooked the way they make the clams (per my cousins request), clam chowder, and crab cakes. Everything was fresh, reasonably priced (even the drinks), and service was excellent. We made several recommendations when people asked us where to eat at Pier 39. I will definitely be going back.

excerpts: The best jumbo shrimp cocktail on the pier!
All for under 15.
Great service and environment.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Stacy A.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: The best jumbo shrimp cocktail on the pier! All for under 15. Great service and environment.

excerpts: Our final appetizer was the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and it was actually our favorite.
The shrimp was fresh and large.
It was served in a martini glass filled with cocktail sauce and the cocktail sauce was perfect!
It had just the right blend of horseradish in it
and it was delicious.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Jo B.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review:
Appetizer:
The clam chowder was just average.  It arrived in a plain white bowl garnished with some parsley that did not seem very fresh.  On the menu it said that the chowder was award winning but my guest and I did not feel that it was great.  The soup was not hot enough when it came out so I felt that it was slightly older.  My guest commented that he had a couple pieces of clam where that was sand.  I however did not come across any sand.

The second appetizer was the crab cakes.  I felt that the crab cakes were well made and had a good flavor.  I felt that the crab was fresh which is very important, especially for a restaurant located on the pier.  With that said, I'm not sure about the salad that accompanies the crab cake.  The salad had a good dressing that was somewhat tart and a little spicy.  It was very good but overpowered the natural flavors of the crab.  By itself, the crab cake is good but I would suggest pairing it with a salad that has a lighter dressing that can enhance the flavors of the crab more rather than over power it.

Our final appetizer was the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and it was actually our favorite.  The shrimp was fresh and large.  It was served in a martini glass filled with cocktail sauce and the cocktail sauce was perfect!  It had just the right blend of horseradish in it and it was delicious.  I would definitely order this dish again.

Entrees:
My husband ordered the whole lobster and it was served with two sides - mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.  He said the corn on the cob was very good.  The mash potatoes were good also but compared to the corn, it wasn't as memorable.  The lobster was fresh and "sweet".  It was a little on the smaller side but adequate since we had a few appetizers. 

I got the shrimp scampi.  The shrimp was in an oval dish filled with oil, garlic, and parsley with tons of shrimp.  The rest of the plate was filled with wild rice and fresh vegetables.  Instead of the mash potatoes and I requested wild rice.  

I was extremely pleased with the wild rice because I felt that it went very well with the shrimp.  The vegetables were abundant and I was only able to eat about one third of it.  Now onto the shrimp - it was delicious and nicely flavored.  The shrimp was cooked just right and was very crisp.  I was happy with the portioning, often times restaurants will skimp on the shrimp but I felt that Fog Harbor was more than generous with their portioning.

Service:
A bit on the slow side

excerpts: Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail for starts and a clam chowder bread bowl for me.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.author: Mowdukes H.
jumbo shrimp cocktail.review: Came here last night after a day trip to the SF Zoo and it was really nice. We were sat right away in a booth near the great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The server was nice and friendly until the end of our visit. I ordered the Napa Landing Chardonnay which was divine and my husband ordered a glass of Anchor Steam which helped each of us unwind. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail for starts and a clam chowder bread bowl for me. My husband ordered the Seafood Cioppino with added pasta and we both got  added deshelled crab to top our dishes off and there is nothing better than crab out of the shell! YUM! I tried catching our server for another glass of wine but he seemed really busy and didn't look my way. I ended up leaning over to catch his attention and noticed that the table across from us was trying to catch him too but he didn't noticed that they had a question about their check....we enjoyed each of our meals very much and the warm bread in the basket was delicious! If the server stayed engaged the whole time we might have given this 5 stars.

excerpts: So was the Dungeness Crab cocktail.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Ralph R.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
Went for lunch while in San Francisco. It's a large Restaurant on Pier 39 on the upper level. The window seats overlook the harbor and the "Sea Lion Resting Area". 
We started with the award winning clam chowder and I could certainly see why it won the award. It was delicious. So was the Dungeness Crab cocktail. 
Of course we had to have the Cioppino which was fantastic. The steamed whole Dungeness Crab was well received. And the Crab Ceviche was outstanding. 
Not only was the food very good, so was the service.

excerpts: Since they ran out of shrimp cocktail, we opted for the Dungeness crab cocktail.
Fresh and great compliment to the other salty dishes we had.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Helen C.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
This place is filled with tourists, given that it's located at the Wharf. However, Fog Harbor is a great restaurant for those visiting SF and want a taste of Bay Area seafood. They have local dishes such as Dungeness crabs, clam chowder, and mussels. The interior is a little "formal" looking and there's a cozy outdoor patio area to wait at. There's a lot of windows at the dining room to see the views of the waters. Unfortunately, we went at night, so we couldn't get to see much.

Since they ran out of shrimp cocktail, we opted for the Dungeness crab cocktail. Fresh and great compliment to the other salty dishes we had. We also ordered oysters and crispy calamari. The calamari was crispy and an easy dish to share with the table.

The cioppino was really good. The dish has a strong tomato base and there was a good amount of seafood. Pro tip: dip the sour dough bread with your leftover soup. 

The only downside was that the dishes were very salty. I was pretty thirsty afterwards.

Highly recommend checking out the seals at Pier 39 while you're here!

excerpts: For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail.
We also had two Moscow Mules.
All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area.
By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area).
The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Ralph M.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
I would give the Fog Harbor Fish House 3 1/2 stars because it's a little better than just OK. We had a good experience and the service was impeccable, the restaurant was clean, and the view was perfect. For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail. We also had two Moscow Mules. All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area. By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area). The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty. And the Mules were well-mixed.

Our biggest complaint here was the overall lack of zest in the sauces. In a word, they were mostly boring. Serviceable, but boring. For example, I think serving run-of-the-mill cocktail sauce with that delectable crab meat is a mistake. I would go with something much more subtle but enhancing, such as a delicate lemon-saffron sauce or even a lightly spiced creme fraiche. Sure, offer the cocktail sauce for those who may want it, but this app screams for something more daring to help it stand above. So offer a selection of sauces. With the mussels, I didn't taste any garlic in the garlic aioli and sadly there was not enough of the cream sauce to truly enjoy it. And the sauce that accompanied the shrimp was ... eh. Could have been a lot more spicy.

As I said, our experience was good and maybe if we had gone with full-on meals rather than a sampling of apps, I might have rated it higher. I will add that for what we got, we left with satisfied appetites - I even left with some of the crab meat. If I get to the area again, I would return to Fog Harbor.

excerpts: I ordered dungeness crab cocktail for $15.
It was small.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Dixie L.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
This is a really fancy establishment located on Pier 39. They have a waiting room right outside their establishment which definitely resembles an actual living room with an actual fireplace! 

 Service was pretty attentive aside from the fact theirbwater is practically lukewarm.. I ordered dungeness crab cocktail for $15. It was small. it was not good. 

on the other hand its a is very beautiful date place because it overlooks the waters. Unfortunately for me I'm not a big fan of American seafood. 
 And fortunately for this place they had a very sweet independent singer sing just right below them. It was definitely very romantic, specifically because of that singer.

excerpts: Try the Trio Grill and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail.
The desserts were nothing short of amazing.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Liz Y.
dungeness crab cocktail.review: Samir was so on point. He was very efficient and charming. The food was excellent. Try the Trio Grill and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail. The desserts were nothing short of amazing.

excerpts: We tried the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer - very fresh!
The clam chowder soup was outstanding.
So creamy and delicious.
I had the special lobster roll for my main dish and it was great.
Good pieces of lobster.
Stuffed when we left!
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Emily C.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
Very upscale restaurant!  More so than I was expecting.  We tried the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer - very fresh!  The clam chowder soup was outstanding.  So creamy and delicious.  I had the special lobster roll for my main dish and it was great.  Good pieces of lobster.  Stuffed when we left!  Service was only ok, but food was great!

312/365

excerpts: Wedge salad and Dungeness Crab cocktail were delicious and the fabulous creme brulee/dark chocolate cake combo dessert was perfectly balanced and out of this world.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Mairead D.
dungeness crab cocktail.review: A great meal and wonderful, attentive server Curtis made for a delightful evening at Pier 39 in San Francisco. The house Cabernet was full bodied and just right. The Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and Spicy Shrimp appetizers didn't disapoint.  Wedge salad and Dungeness Crab cocktail were delicious and the fabulous creme brulee/dark chocolate cake combo dessert was perfectly balanced and out of this world.

excerpts: I started with the dungeness crab cocktail.
It was shredded crab dresses with a touch of cocktail sauce and some lemon wedges.
It was fresh and chilled perfectly.
The main course was fish and chips; something I haven't had in a while since it's usually so greasy.
This fish on the other hand was beer battered perfection using the locally made Anchor Steam beer.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Jeff P.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
My family and I went for lunch on a Saturday.  The service was top notch and the food was excellent.

I started with the dungeness crab cocktail.  It was shredded crab dresses with a touch of cocktail sauce and some lemon wedges.  It was fresh and chilled perfectly.
The main course was fish and chips; something I haven't had in a while since it's usually so greasy.  This fish on the other hand was beer battered perfection using the locally made Anchor Steam beer.  It was crispy and the fish was tender and moist.

The view was also great, looking right out into the bay.  I would definitely return.

excerpts: We also got a sampling of their seasonal dungeness crab menu by trying the mango and avocado dungeness crab cocktail.

The portion could feed one person as a meal it was so huge, and between the two of us we were concerned we wouldn't have enough room for our meals (but not in a bad way, we were loving every minute of it!).
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Nicole D.
dungeness crab cocktail.review:
Went to this place with a friend during a visit to San Fran. After seeing a lot of local fare on tv a few weeks prior and with my boyfriend not being much of a fish person thus meaning I get to eat it so infrequently, I figured I'd seek out one of the better restaurants on pier 39 to have a delicious fish dinner.

We sat by the window and had a gorgeous view of Alcatraz and the harbor, and most of the restaurant has this view even if you're not sitting at the window, so this is an excellent spot if you're a tourist and want the whole experience while you dine.

I had the swordfish with chimichurri sauce. I'm seeing some photos here of that dish served with mixed greens in addition to the wild rice, but my vegetable was broccoli mixed with pearl onions and that was it. I love broccoli, but for such a delicious fish it seemed really lackluster in comparison, and the pearl onions didn't really do much to help. I would have much preferred asparagus, or at least for the broccoli to be anything other than steamed. I dipped it in the garlic sauce from my friends meal, big improvement, sad it wasn't better. 

The swordfish steak, however, was perfectly tender and seasoned. I haven't had swordfish in years and after having read that their menu is sustainably caught I had to try it. It didn't disappoint!

We also got a sampling of their seasonal dungeness crab menu by trying the mango and avocado dungeness crab cocktail. The portion could feed one person as a meal it was so huge, and between the two of us we were concerned we wouldn't have enough room for our meals (but not in a bad way, we were loving every minute of it!). This appetizer was packed with crab and really showcased the ingredient in a deliciously fresh way.

My friend ordered the seafood platter which had clams, mussels and crab legs and claws in a garlic butter sauce. I'm not much of a shellfish person, but thanks to Fog Harbor, I now know it was simply because I hadn't had them done well, and these were so delicious I'm seriously wondering where garlic mussels have been all my life. If I were to return I would order this item in a heartbeat, and if you're a garlic lover, you'll absolutely love this!

I look forward to returning and trying more from their menu, but given that their seasonal dungeness crab menu is for a limited time, I'd say definitely try something from that list if you go in the next few weeks, it all looks good!

excerpts: Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino.
We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Lauren W.
dungeness crab cocktail.review: Great tourist spot for the seafood lover if you're strolling around Pier 39. Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino. We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.

excerpts: For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Mark J.
dungeness crab cocktail.review: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!

excerpts: Very good service, lovely view and the dungeness crab cocktail and ahi lomi lomi appetizers we had were excellent.
The halibut on the special that night, however, wasn't.
It was perfectly cooked, moist but rather tasteless.
Halibut is a fish that can soak up sauces and be flavored as the chef determines.
This was just cooked with a few tomatoes on top and some quinoa underneath neither of which added any taste.
When we told the waitress that we had had better halibut she was quite nice about it and a minute or two
later the matre de was at our table asking what we didn't like about the halibut.
We told him, he thanked us for our feedback, adding that usually the halibut is the most praised item on the menu, and comped us a dessert of our choice.
The service, the setting, the experience were all fine and would have been perfect if not for the main dish.
We would go back and try a different item except there are so many other seafood restaurants we want to try first.
dungeness crab cocktail.author: Bill P.
dungeness crab cocktail.review: It was my birthday so when I made the reservation I asked for a window table and when we arrived at 6:30 we got the window table. Very good service, lovely view and the dungeness crab cocktail and ahi lomi lomi appetizers we had were excellent. The halibut on the special that night, however, wasn't. It was perfectly cooked, moist but rather tasteless. Halibut is a fish that can soak up sauces and be flavored as the chef determines. This was just cooked with a few tomatoes on top and some quinoa underneath neither of which added any taste. When we told the waitress that we had had better halibut she was quite nice about it and a minute or two later the matre de was at our table asking what we didn't like about the halibut. We told him, he thanked us for our feedback, adding that usually the halibut is the most praised item on the menu, and comped us a dessert of our choice. The service, the setting, the experience were all fine and would have been perfect if not for the main dish. We would go back and try a different item except there are so many other seafood restaurants we want to try first.

excerpts: Stopped in here for some chowder, and literally that was the only thing, although we ended up trying the oysters, too, which were small and
not really that good (dry and sticky).
Next time will have to ask to see what they have as the half dozen was not worth it.
Front had plenty of seats though we still waited for a table.
oysters.author: Hank C.
oysters.review:
Stopped in here for some chowder, and literally that was the only thing, although we ended up trying the oysters, too, which were small and not really that good (dry and sticky). Next time will have to ask to see what they have as the half dozen was not worth it. Front had plenty of seats though we still waited for a table.  Crayons and paper for the little one to draw on as we waited and ate.

The server was gracious and didn't complain when we only ordered a few chowders, though they came for seating, order, and drop off food and check. Not much else. I can see why they won their awards, for the sourdough bread bowl was fantastic (even my father-in-law loved it), and the chowder was excellent and well-balanced, rich with flavor and clam and just enough other potato and other veggies to keep it from being simply soup. The sourdough bread was a great starter, too. Will have to try the other seafood meals here later!

And the view of the pier and water was great. Right near the front foot of the pier adjoining the mainland, not too far to walk. There's a bar upfront which looked always open. The seats in the restaurant definitely filled up after 1pm.

excerpts: Oysters - these were pretty fresh and local according to our server.
No clue what they were though
but they were tiny.
oysters.author: Rainie L.
oysters.review:
I had high expectations of this place and had bookmarked it for awhile so was excited to try it tonight while I was in town. 
First off, this is a charming restaurant with great vibes and great service in Pier 39. No doughs about that. Our server was amazing and super awesome. I forgot her name but she was so attentive despite it being a full house. 
The food itself was a letdown. We ordered the clam chowder, half dozen orders and the seafood platter with add on lobster tail in herbs and butter. The entire meal was pretty much a miss for me. Let me explain fish by dish:

Chowder - they added bacon to it. I love bacon and yet bacon couldn't save this dish for me. It just tasted weird like they added lemon to it or something. It had a sour undertone for a cream soup but it didn't taste spoiled.

Oysters - these were pretty fresh and local according to our server. No clue what they were though but they were tiny. Decent though and my fave for the night.

The seafood platter was huge and came with dungeoness crabs, mussels, clams, jumbo shrimp, and fingerling potatoes, plus one lobster tail add on. 

The lobster was pretty bad. The texture was obviously over cooked and very dry. The crabs while a lot (and usually I'd be jumping with joy) was pretty dry and overdone. So we're the clams. Only the mussels and shrimps were cooked just right. Maybe it's because they baked this dish and over did it but I think steaming it would have preserved the sweetness and juiciness of the dish. 

Tax and tip came out to be $170 USD. Really not worth it in my opinion. Not because of portion because we were full but because it just wasn't very tasty. We wanted fresh juicy seafood in SF and instead got over cooked dry seafood that could have been previously frozen for all we know. 

This might have been a one off experience but being out of town, this was our first and def our last experience there. Again, great vibes and service just not IT for the seafood experience.

excerpts: For appetizer, I tried the Clam Chowder in the bread bowl which was really creamy and tasty, fresh oysters - freakin' delicious, and even the baked oysters were noteworthy, and the crab cakes were to die for!
oysters.author: Cynthia D.
oysters.review:
Amazing spot for great food with view of Alcatraz and the pier.

My party of four enjoyed our seafood dinner here and the sunset view was gorgeous. For appetizer, I tried the Clam Chowder in the bread bowl which was really creamy and tasty, fresh oysters - freakin' delicious, and even the baked oysters were noteworthy, and the crab cakes were to die for! For entrees, we got the seasonal Jumbo Scallop and Crab Meat Risotto and the Seafood Penne. Both were solid dishes! I loved the crab flavor in the risotto. 

Infamous restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf whereas the wait can be for hours. Luckily for us, Yelp Waitlist was the MVP! I wish more restaurants implement this in NYC. I simply opened my handy Yelp app and tapped to join the waitlist (must be within 40 miles) while I was commuting from my hotel in Lower Haight. It would give me an estimated time to check in with the hostess and approximately how many parties are ahead of us. My friends and I were exploring Fisherman's Wharf the entire time until time got closer. Ta Da!

excerpts: I also had half a dozen oysters that were local.
Very different flavor form our blue points.
It was delicious and they were small.
However, the scallops and crab meat risotto was out of this world.
It was hands down a show stopper.
I could eat this everyday!
We finished out meal with a banana bread pudding.
It came with a sweet milk to pour in top of it with some whip cream.
The dessert was delicious but could have been better with a scoop of ice cream since it was a warm bread pudding- whip cream didn't cut it.
oysters.author: Jay O.
oysters.review:
Okay, this place is all that and a bag of chips.  It is on the upper level at the pier.   The view is amazing and you can see the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz in the distance.  The service is comparable to s high end steak house.  One thing that tip them over the edge for me is that they had little battery pack chargers for glue cellphones- they have the connector for both iOS and micro usb.  The table bread is delicious and fresh.  The menu is simple and the ingredients is very high quality.  At first glance, you might think it's a tourist trap, but it's ex

We had s Caesar salad, clam chowder and scallops with crab meat risotto.  Salad was good, clam chowder was unique- I really liked it, Cary R didn't think it was that special.  I also had half a dozen oysters that were local.  Very different flavor form our blue points.  It was delicious and they were small.  However, the scallops and crab meat risotto was out of this world.  It was hands down a show stopper.  I could eat this everyday!   We finished out meal with a banana bread pudding.  It came with a sweet milk to pour in top of it with some whip cream.  The dessert was delicious but could have been better with a scoop of ice cream since it was a warm bread pudding- whip cream didn't cut it.

excerpts:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay.
oysters.author: Phi N.
oysters.review:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. I was pretty disappointed that they remove the shell from the crab and clean all the yellow poop; that stuff is delicious 

Went with the flan and tiramisu for desserts. Both were delightful and delicious. 

Service was just average. Our server was training and it showed, lol. But even the guy training him wasn't that great.

excerpts: We started with some oysters and a Caesar salad.
Oysters were nice and fresh according to Jay O.
And salad was great too just slightly overdressed to my liking.
When asked about a charger for our phones Adam came right over with two portable chargers and plugged it in for us.
We went with their special crabmeat risotto and scallops.
Man this dish was delicious!
We also went with Adams favorite dessert the bread pudding also very delicious and not overly sweet.
This place is a winner!
I look forward to next time!
oysters.author: Cary R.
oysters.review:
Amazing restaurant!! So many restaurants to choose from in fisherman's wharf, we decided to dine here. While pricey than most the food is top notch! Adam was our waiter and he was fantastic! 

We started with some oysters and a Caesar salad. Oysters were nice and fresh according to Jay O. And salad was great too just slightly overdressed to my liking. When asked about a charger for our phones Adam came right over with two portable chargers and plugged it in for us. We went with their special crabmeat risotto and scallops. Man this dish was delicious! We also went with Adams favorite dessert the bread pudding also very delicious and not overly sweet. This place is a winner! I look forward to next time!

excerpts: We started off with half a dozen oysters for $18 which was a total disappointment!
They were half the size than what I have tried back home in Texas.
My sisters and I we're dumbfounded at the size of them.
The crispy calamari was delicious and the lemon aioli sauce elevated the dish!
I wouldn't come back here for the oysters but the menu was limitless and the food very fresh!
oysters.author: Blair V.
oysters.review:
My sisters and I chose this place over Hog because of the variety of options on the menu. We started off with half a dozen oysters for $18 which was a total disappointment! They were half the size than what I have tried back home in Texas. My sisters and I we're dumbfounded at the size of them. The crispy calamari was delicious and the lemon aioli sauce elevated the dish! The clams and linguini was excellent and a must try!

They brought out their delicious and warm lava cake with a scoop of ice cream for my birthday. It was heavenly and the perfect ending to the meal! 
I wouldn't come back here for the oysters but the menu was limitless and the food very fresh!

excerpts: Although I didn't order this due to the limitation of available space in my stomach (you can only loosen your belt so much) I have ordered their Signature Shellfish Tower which is served cold but includes lobster, dungeness crab, shrimp, and oysters.
oysters.author: Tomas R.
oysters.review:
I'm not a fan dining in tourist heavy sights but damnit I will make an exception for Fog Harbor Fish House. I've had the opportunity to dine formally and at the bar at different locations. FHFH is on the second floor and you'll see it from the central location of The Wharf. When you walk up the stairs you'll see an outdoor waiting area with a fireplace where you can wait for your table. You'll be able to check-in with the main host there as well.

If you're looking to skip the line and simply want to grab a bite to eat, as well as, drinks then walk on in to the bar. The bar area is open seating and it's first come first serve. You can enjoy the full menu of FHFH at the bar so that's always a win! No need to worry about a dedicated bar menu.

When you're deciding what to eat make sure to take a look at their seasonal menu.

I have to tell y'all though...
If you don't grab a bowl of their clam chowder, then you're doing yourself an injustice. Their clam chowder is so good you'll be licking the plate clean. You have to add crab meat to the chowder which takes it to the next level. You get such huge chunks of clam and the crab meat for $7 is A STEAL. Pretty sure you're getting way more for your buck without the messiness of opening crab legs yourself.

Although I didn't order this due to the limitation of available space in my stomach (you can only loosen your belt so much) I have ordered their Signature Shellfish Tower which is served cold but includes lobster, dungeness crab, shrimp, and oysters. A great appetizer to order for a party of 4 alongside some of their other apps.

The few dishes I've had there have all been great, but the service is what keeps me coming back for more. Although you may be situated within a highly trafficked tourist area, they don't take advantage of you. They treat each table with pride and they take the time to make sure you have a great dining experience.

Sadly every time I've gone I've yet to learn my lesson to make room for dessert when they bring around the dessert presentation. ONE DAY, ONE DAY....

excerpts: He asked what I wanted for dinner and being from the Midwest - I told him I had been craving raw oysters.
He laughed and said he would take me to a good place -- little did I know, he took me to his workplace on his day off.
He ordered me some oysters and we went at it.
Everything was delicious and clean.
The oysters were so yummy and fresh.
oysters.author: Cathy V.
oysters.review:
A disclaimer that my review is biased because my cousin worked as a chef here so we got really good treatment... other than that, the food def lived up to the expectations. I came to SF for work and my cousin met up with me. He asked what I wanted for dinner and being from the Midwest - I told him I had been craving raw oysters. He laughed and said he would take me to a good place -- little did I know, he took me to his workplace on his day off. So sweet of him.

He ordered me some oysters and we went at it. Everything was delicious and clean. The oysters were so yummy and fresh.

excerpts: I started with the west coast style oysters which were chucked and chilled perfectly.
Next, came the Caesar which was way larger
then I was expecting, I'd definitely split this if you come with a guest.
I was really craving some clam chowder and I'm glad I was because theirs was stuffed with fresh clams..so good.
For desert I went with the apple crumble special with ice cream on top.
oysters.author: Brian J.
oysters.review:
Fog harbor hit the mark for me. I was really in the market to get a sampling of everything when I was visiting San Fran.  The shell fish platter cooked in garlic butter was definitely off the chains and gave me everything I was searching for.

This place isn't cheap especially the wine but hey when you're on vacation why not.  I started with the west coast style oysters which were chucked and chilled perfectly. Next, came the Caesar which was way larger then I was expecting, I'd definitely split this if you come with a guest.  I was really craving some clam chowder and I'm glad I was because theirs was stuffed with fresh clams..so good.  For desert I went with the apple crumble special with ice cream on top. I didn't come anywhere close to finishing but it was totally worth it.

This was a marquis order and experience.  They placed me at a table looking over at Alcatraz. I will be back!

excerpts:
It was ok

Food:
-1/2 Baked Oysters (5/5): I am such a huge connoisseur for baked oysters and these were so delicious.
oysters.author: Trinh V.
oysters.review:
We came here on a Friday night and we were lucky that we got a reservation that day! When we walked in there was already a crowd of people waiting to be sat and now I can see why. Most places on the water are tourist traps and the prices are usually high but we were on vacation and also wanted to see the sunset so here goes it. 

We requested a table next to the window where we could see the sunset. Our waitress was kind and we had no issues here with service.

Drinks:
-Hibiscus Marg (4.5/5): Delicious! A sweet but not too sweet drink. 
-Lipstick Lemondrop (3.5/5): Not my fav lemondrop. It was ok

Food:
-1/2 Baked Oysters (5/5): I am such a huge connoisseur for baked oysters and these were so delicious. It's hot so be careful. I requested no bacon. 

-Shellfish Platter (4/5): It comes with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and potatoes. The whole platter is doused in butter and it lays on a puddle of butter and garlic. The minced garlic tasted amazing. The butter was a little overwhelming but it was decent and filling. It's pretty messy so they have a bib for you. 

-Fried Combo: I did not try this so I can't rate this dish.

-Creme Brûlée (4/5): Omg I'm not a huge creme brûlée fan but they have the best creme brûlée I have ever tasted!

-Blondie (4/5): So nutty and delicious!

The sunset was covered by the clouds so we couldn't see much but from what we could see it was beautiful! Delicious food and great service.

excerpts: I also had half a dozen oysters that were local.
Very different flavor form our blue points.
It was delicious and they were small.
However, the scallops and crab meat risotto was out of this world.
It was hands down a show stopper.
I could eat this everyday!
We finished out meal with a banana bread pudding.
It came with a sweet milk to pour in top of it with some whip cream.
The dessert was delicious but could have been better with a scoop of ice cream since it was a warm bread pudding- whip cream didn't cut it.
oysters.author: Ryan R.
oysters.review:
One thing that surprised me is that they had little battery pack chargers for glue cellphones- they have the connector for both iOS and micro usb. The table bread was yummy and fresh. The menu is simple and the ingredients is very high quality. At first glance, you might think it's a tourist trap,lol

We had s Caesar salad, clam chowder and scallops with crab meat risotto. Salad was delicious, clam chowder was unique- I really liked it, larry didn't think it was that special. I also had half a dozen oysters that were local. Very different flavor form our blue points. It was delicious and they were small. However, the scallops and crab meat risotto was out of this world. It was hands down a show stopper. I could eat this everyday! We finished out meal with a banana bread pudding. It came with a sweet milk to pour in top of it with some whip cream. The dessert was delicious but could have been better with a scoop of ice cream since it was a warm bread pudding- whip cream didn't cut it.

excerpts: We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters.
Everything was so good I don't have any complaints.
We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset.
On top of that, service was impeccable.
Would definitely come back in the future.
oysters.author: Jessica T.
oysters.review: Used yelp to reserve our table and were seated right away so it was already off to a great start.  We tried not to order too much as we wanted to try a different restaurant (we're from Orange County so we wanted to make our way around the city), but ended up ordering too much because there was so much we wanted to try! Nonetheless, the food was great! We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters. Everything was so good I don't have any complaints. We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset. On top of that, service was impeccable. Would definitely come back in the future.

excerpts: OYSTERS (6): So fresh and sweet!
Not sandy at all.
oysters.author: Emmeline W.
oysters.review:
A pleasant conclusion to our SF trip! We headed to Pier 39 for a seafood dinner-- I was worried that restaurants here would skimp on quality to cash in on oblivious tourists, but this couldn't have been a better spot to end our day. Having a few drinks + watching the sunset was divine.

Walking in at 5PM, our party of 2 was seated within 10 mins. The windows had a gorgeous view of the pier. Our server, Miguel, was cordial and made fantastic conversation between dishes.

Yooooooo I was over carbs for a min but their bread was like the holy grail of restaurant bread-- crisp outside, buttery/fluffy inside, moist & soft when cool. I wanna live in this bread forever.

LINGUINE WITH CLAMS: The restaurant was PACKED, but we were served within 15 minutes. I already love linguine, I love clams, I love white wine sauce-- of course I was a fan of this hearty dish ^_^ The portions are pretty generous; my friend and I could barely finish.

OYSTERS (6): So fresh and sweet! Not sandy at all. Just some lemon was enough to season them, no sauces needed for me.

WILD BERRY BRAMBLE: I had this and thought, "Ok, that's DEFINITELY 99% mixer/ice and 1% alcohol"-- it tasted like a lil fruit cooler! 30 minutes later, I was drunk. HAHA WOOPS. Deceptively strong.

Also, huge props to their overall quality of service. I really hate children, and we happened to be next to two loud af toddlers who decided their paper mats were good for makeshift confetti. Idk why the moms thought it was ok to chat away instead of disciplining their kids, but their server patiently picked up the paper with a brush, took the remaining paper away, and soothed the kids' tantrums.

excerpts: Then their oysters were the right amount of sweet and briny which I loved.
The main course which was seared cod with a side of white beans, roasted tomatoes and spinach was delicious.
A tad salty
but it did the job for me.
They had a great selection of cocktails as well.
I opted for fresh pisco sour which I thought was perfect for the sweet and salty flavors I was getting from both oysters and cod.
The service was great too.
My server was attentive and everyone there seem happy to answer any questions.
Given that it was also Fleet week, I thought the place wasn't so crazy that day.
It was Wednesday around noon, yet everyone was seated pretty quickly.
I'm glad I decided to come here even on a whim!
oysters.author: Diana M.
oysters.review:
I was surprised that I enjoyed this restaurant! I rarely visit Fisherman's wharf or Pier 39. I always thought good here is mediocre. I happened to come here during one of my " let's-be-tourist-for-the-day" days. I had just come off from a visit to Alcatraz and was hungry after a morning full of sightseeing. It was Wednesday and the closest seafood restaurant with no lines was Fog Harbor. I was seated right away and was pleased that they didn't put me at the bar (seeing as I was by myself). 

The view was fantastic but I was there for the food. Seafood. They did pretty well. Mind you, I went to Swan Oyster Depot the previous day, which has mind blowing, freshest seafood you could ever find in SF. I didn't have high hopes for FH. I was just hungry, really. 

I ordered their shrimp cocktail which were quite good. They were large shrimps, simple and straight to the point. No BS there. Then their oysters were the right amount of sweet and briny which I loved. The main course which was seared cod with a side of white beans, roasted tomatoes and spinach was delicious. A tad salty but it did the job for me. They had a great selection of cocktails as well. I opted for fresh pisco sour which I thought was perfect for the sweet and salty flavors I was getting from both oysters and cod. The service was great too. My server was attentive and everyone there seem happy to answer any questions. Given that it was also Fleet week, I thought the place wasn't so crazy that day. It was Wednesday around noon, yet everyone was seated pretty quickly. I'm glad I decided to come here even on a whim!

excerpts: We also had the half dozen oysters which were okay.
I wished they had options of other types of oysters instead of one type.
oysters.author: Felisha L.
oysters.review:
What a view when dining here at Fog Harbor!  We have visited Pier 39 many times but have not dine here.

Atmosphere:  What a view!  If you are seated by the windows, you will get the ocean and pier view.  If you come after sunset, viewing may be limited to city lights and stilettos of the pier.  Lightly dim wotj a relaxing atmosphere.  

Food: Even with full tummies, we still had several dishes.  First and foremost, you must get their famous clam chowder.  It was on point and one of the best!  To top ot off, they served fresh baked complimentary sourdough rolls!  We also enjoyed the fried halibut served with couscous tossed with fresh veggies in vinaigrette.  The halibut is on the rotation menu.  It was perfectly grilled and the meat was flaky and flavorful.  We also had the half dozen oysters which were okay.  I wished they had options of other types of oysters instead of one type.  

For the kids menu, we had the fish and chips.  The fish was perfectly battered and fried.  We also had the penne pasta and chicken tenders.  

We would definitely come back for the view and clam chowder!

excerpts: The oysters were very creamy and delicious.
The "award winning" clam chowder lived up to its name.
There is a richness to it
and I love how it comes with full sized clams that are also very fresh.
The seafood pasta came with mussels, clams, mixed fish and a tomato sauce.
Pasta is cooked very well
, everything was seasoned to my liking.
Hands down, best seafood I've had in a while!
I will be back the next time i am back in San Fran.
I would highly recommend the Lombard Lemonade as well!!
oysters.author: Tammy L.
oysters.review: The freshest seafood I have ever had in my life without a doubt! The oysters were very creamy and delicious. The "award winning" clam chowder lived up to its name. There is a richness to it and I love how it comes with full sized clams that are also very fresh. The seafood pasta came with mussels, clams, mixed fish and a tomato sauce. Pasta is cooked very well, everything was seasoned to my liking. Hands down, best seafood I've had in a while! I will be back the next time i am back in San Fran. I would highly recommend the Lombard Lemonade as well!!

excerpts: Fresh oysters, nice portion of crab cocktail and good chowder.
Check out their convenient online reservation service if you have a large group.
oysters.author: Ron S.
oysters.review: Being in the heart of a very touristy area my expectations were not high.  I was pleasantly surprised with a decent meal.   Fresh oysters, nice portion of crab cocktail and good chowder.  Check out their convenient online reservation service if you have a large group.

excerpts: Next, we got half a dozen of raw oysters and it was not worth the price.
It was really really small oysters
and I have definitely gotten bigger and better tasting oysters for a cheaper price.
oysters.author: Dorothy L.
oysters.review:
This place is great for a date or a nice dinner! The view is spectacular and the ambience of the restaurant is very nice and dim.

For starters, we got the crab cakes. It was very soft and yummy. I think it had a really good texture and the overall taste was pleasant. 8/10

Next, we got half a dozen of raw oysters and it was not worth the price. It was really really small oysters and I have definitely gotten bigger and better tasting oysters for a cheaper price. 2/10

I had the lobster tail and it was good but not spectacular. I felt that it was over priced because it didn't taste any different than other lobsters I have eaten before. The mash potatoes were really buttery and the beans were also really crunchy and tasty. Overall, it was delicious but not worth the price. 7/10

I also tried a little of the cioppino and it was really good. The tomato sauce was very tasty but they gave very little crab in my opinion. 

In terms of quantity, I think this restaurant is on the pricier side since it is located in a very touristy area. Also, at the beginning of the meal, they only served two small pieces of bread which I thought was strange since most restaurants give a large bread basket. However, I would come back here for a special occasion and try their crab.

excerpts: The food is fantastic, we got 1/2 dozen oysters to start and then the linguini & clams as well as the salmon which were both delicious.
Finished off with apple crumble dessert!
Best food we have had in USA
and we have been to NY, DC, Orlando and Vegas.
oysters.author: Sam L.
oysters.review:
Just finished a tour on Alcatraz and saw the reviews on here were good. It did not lie, the service was great and got a seat for two straight away. Sitting near the window can see Alcatraz and also sea lions! The food is fantastic, we got 1/2 dozen oysters to start and then the linguini & clams as well as the salmon which were both delicious. Finished off with apple crumble dessert!
Best food we have had in USA and we have been to NY, DC, Orlando and Vegas.

excerpts: We also ordered oysters and crispy calamari.
oysters.author: Helen C.
oysters.review:
This place is filled with tourists, given that it's located at the Wharf. However, Fog Harbor is a great restaurant for those visiting SF and want a taste of Bay Area seafood. They have local dishes such as Dungeness crabs, clam chowder, and mussels. The interior is a little "formal" looking and there's a cozy outdoor patio area to wait at. There's a lot of windows at the dining room to see the views of the waters. Unfortunately, we went at night, so we couldn't get to see much.

Since they ran out of shrimp cocktail, we opted for the Dungeness crab cocktail. Fresh and great compliment to the other salty dishes we had. We also ordered oysters and crispy calamari. The calamari was crispy and an easy dish to share with the table.

The cioppino was really good. The dish has a strong tomato base and there was a good amount of seafood. Pro tip: dip the sour dough bread with your leftover soup. 

The only downside was that the dishes were very salty. I was pretty thirsty afterwards.

Highly recommend checking out the seals at Pier 39 while you're here!

excerpts: so I was trying to slurp the oysters with a butter knife.
oysters.author: S D.
oysters.review:
I'm from Southern California and we have great seafood restaurants, so I was disappointed by this place. Service was weak, it took 10 minutes to get our waters. They ran out of oyster forks so I was trying to slurp the oysters with a butter knife. It's a tourist spot, so I'd just avoid if you can....


Update based on the restaurant's response:  We visited on August 16th around dinner time. We sat in the near the window, straight off the path the leads to the restrooms.

excerpts: We ordered the seafood tower that had 1/2 a live main lobster, 1/2 crab, 6 large shrimp, mussels and fresh local oysters.
All of the seafood was fresh, sweet and delectable.
Our waiter Adam was a great host and attended to our every need.
Thank you Fog Harbor!
oysters.author: GG J.
oysters.review: Birthday lunch.  We were greeted with a smile and sat with a great view of the bay and Alcatraz Island.  Our server gave us some great recommendations on the menu and even gave us a complementary piece of delicious chocolate banana bread pudding with vanilla cream dessert.  We ordered the seafood tower that had 1/2 a live main lobster, 1/2 crab, 6 large shrimp, mussels and fresh local oysters.  All of the seafood was fresh, sweet and delectable.  Our waiter Adam was a great host and attended to our every need.  Thank you Fog Harbor!

excerpts: We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna.
The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff.
The crab cakes were good as well.
I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well.
But the service here, was just terrible.
Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink.
We had to ask for everything, straws, etc .
Our table was never cleared at anytime either.
All of our plates were just sitting on the table.
I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space.
Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything.
The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table.
oysters.author: Mike N.
oysters.review:
The restaurant has great ambience while still in the prime location of Pier 39. However today I was deeply disappointed with their service. We had a few things to try and it was all pretty good. We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna. The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff. The crab cakes were good as well. I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well. But the service here, was just terrible. Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink. We had to ask for everything, straws, etc . Our table was never cleared at anytime either. All of our plates were just sitting on the table. I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space. Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything. The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table. The ice turned into water and the oyster shells were floating around in the dish. 

After paying $170+ dollars is this what I should expect? By all means I have no issue spending money on food. But it really just hits a nerve when I get crappy service and I'm paying for it.....

I would go else where if your thinking about The Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: The crab cakes and baked oysters were delicious and packed with good flavor.
Being on a special diet, they were able to modify the dish as per my restrictions.
My dish arrived with an allergy tag.
oysters.author: Tejashree M.
oysters.review:
We were able to put our name down, see the pier and come in time for dinner for our turn. The place was pretty packed on a Saturday night. We got a table in the corner where it felt little crowded/claustrophobic. However, it was much better when neighboring table emptied. I would have loved to have a window-side table, perhaps next time.
The crab cakes and baked oysters were delicious and packed with good flavor. Being on a special diet, they were able to modify the dish as per my restrictions. My dish arrived with an allergy tag. The salmon was great and went well with arugula and the smoky taste of peppers. I wondered if it tasted so good with the exceptions, how well it would taste with all its original ingredients. Their desserts were presented well and I was very tempted but found the courage to pass.. The service was good and we were taken care of/ checked on without anybody being persistent/annoying.

excerpts: The calamari and oysters were great!
Crab cakes were good
but I've had better.
THE CLAM CHOWDER WAS FANTASTIC!!
I had to get it in the bread bowl to get the full effect
and it was totally worth the carbs.
My friend's salad was ginormous and my sister bought us a bottle of the finest champagne.
The whole experience was memorable and the service was great.
I would recommend making reservations because the place gets packed and for good reason.
oysters.author: Thoa B.
oysters.review:
What can I possibly say about this place that hasn't been said! This restaurant will always have a place in my heart because this is where my fiance and I went with our family and friends right after we got engaged. They made us feel special and gave us a complimentary congratulations dessert which I didn't really expect but appreciated. There was a big group of us so we got to try a lot of different things.

The calamari and oysters were great!  Crab cakes were good but I've had better. THE CLAM CHOWDER WAS FANTASTIC!! I had to get it in the bread bowl to get the full effect and it was totally worth the carbs. My friend's salad was ginormous and my sister bought us a bottle of the finest champagne. The whole experience was memorable and the service was great. I would recommend making reservations because the place gets packed and for good reason.

excerpts: Fresh oysters.
However, the food left us underwhelmed.
oysters.author: Frasier J.
oysters.review: Delicious clam chowder soup. Great service. Fresh oysters. However, the food left us underwhelmed. I had the filet mignon topped with crab with sautéed spinach and "mashed potatoes" the potatoes had more lumps than mash and were not cooked well. The crab was topped a very thick sauce that tasted like the smokiness you get when you bite into a Burger King burger. Very strange. My friend chose the shrimp and steak chow mein. Her noodles were too rubbery to eat. All in all try their chowder and appetizers.

excerpts: We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.
Everything was delicious.
The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.
Will totally come back.
oysters.author: Eleonor T.
oysters.review: Came here for my mother's 75th Birthday.  The food was absolutely fabulous. We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.  Everything was delicious.  The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.  Will totally come back.

excerpts:
5/5

Never been a fan of oysters but their oysters are out of this world amazing!
oysters.author: Carmel A.
oysters.review:
Food: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5

Never been a fan of oysters but their oysters are out of this world amazing! Came here for my boyfriend's birthday and was not disappointed. We arrive one hr before our actual reservation and they still accommodated our request to be seated. I have no complaints. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

excerpts: Our waiter was sassy, but professional, and honestly the only complaint I have was the fact that the oysters were extremely small and had a rather dull taste.
I'd definitely recommend for seafood lovers, but just a tip don't get the oysters...
they are rather unappealing.
oysters.author: Jackie Q.
oysters.review:
Loved my experience here! Everything was fantastic, the restaurant has an upscale feel, and the wait wasn't too bad (cuz good luck trying to get a same-day reservation). 
Our waiter was sassy, but professional, and honestly the only complaint I have was the fact that the oysters were extremely small and had a rather dull taste. I had the lobster tails and if I ever had the heart to spend $49 on one meal again, I'd definitely reorder. Had the apple crumble for dessert, it was on point! Came with my family and we ended up spending a bit more than $300 total, but it was $300 well spent. I'd definitely recommend for seafood lovers, but just a tip don't get the oysters... they are rather unappealing.

excerpts: Lovely salads but oysters and scallops was good yet not spectacular.
I still would come back for family dinner but not super special occasion kind of restaurant.
oysters.author: Chrsitina L.
oysters.review: Thank god there is a function on yelp to get in the waitlist ahead. Overall cusotmer service was good, and was very accommodating. Food was good for its price, fresh seafood and was done nice. Portion was smaller than my anticipation. Lovely salads but oysters and scallops was good yet not spectacular. I still would come back for family dinner but not super special occasion kind of restaurant.

excerpts: There was a bold flavor from the clam chowder and you could taste the sea from the oysters and mussels.
This place is a great casual place for some good seafood!
oysters.author: Eric T.
oysters.review: The view here was great, sitting right next to the pier. The server this time around was a little inexperienced but he was very friendly. The food had some which were expensive and some which were not but overall, the flavor of everything was great! There was a bold flavor from the clam chowder and you could taste the sea from the oysters and mussels. This place is a great casual place for some good seafood!

excerpts: Try the seafood sampler to have a taste of their sweet lobster, crab, shrimp, and oysters.
My favorite entreé was the jumbo scallop and crab risotto.
Their libations are also quite good ;)
Skip the chicken penne - bland and over cooked chicken, watery sauce.
Also skip the beef skewers, weird glaze with a sour taste and too salty.
Customer service did not stand out.
Luckily their seafood was spectacular and we had great seats by the windows, but they barely made the 4 star cut for me.
oysters.author: DH P.
oysters.review:
At its price point - go all out on the seafood, it's high quality! Try the seafood sampler to have a taste of their sweet lobster, crab, shrimp, and oysters. My favorite entreé was the jumbo scallop and crab risotto. Their libations are also quite good ;)
Skip the chicken penne - bland and over cooked chicken, watery sauce. Also skip the beef skewers, weird glaze with a sour taste and too salty.
Customer service did not stand out. Luckily their seafood was spectacular and we had great seats by the windows, but they barely made the 4 star cut for me.

excerpts: But I can tell you this much, get the clam chowder and stick with the baked oysters.
They're so good!
My friend got the seared scallop risotto special and it was so tasty!
Wouldn't mind coming back during the day to see the bridge views this place brags about
oysters.author: Noel B.
oysters.review: After a long flight into the city this place was very good. Nice and tranquil vibe with excellent service. The atmosphere is nice but not uppity, but I wouldn't come in to dine in my yoga pants here. The seafood menu all sounded ohh so good but my appetite this evening wanted smaller bits. But I can tell you this much, get the clam chowder and stick with the baked oysters. They're so good! My friend got the seared scallop risotto special and it was so tasty! Wouldn't mind coming back during the day to see the bridge views this place brags about

excerpts: The oysters were phenomenal as was the sourdough bread.
If I would have been able to order a different drink, it would have been 5 stars.
oysters.author: Devin V.
oysters.review: Dropped in for a quick bite at 8 on Friday. We got lucky with two seats at the bar, and it took a bit to get a bartender's attention. Once we did, they were extremely friendly and accommodating. We both got margaritas, I got the hibiscus version which mentioned having egg whites in it, which I typically love. The drink itself was extremely sour, and I can't believe it had egg whites in it bc it typically cuts any sour flavor.  No one ever checked to see how the drinks were, so I finished it begrudgingly. Not the best $15 I've ever spent. The oysters were phenomenal as was the sourdough bread. If I would have been able to order a different drink, it would have been 5 stars.

excerpts: We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again.
We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.
It was good also.
oysters.author: Asia V.
oysters.review: Good food,atmosphere, service and view. This restaurant has it all. We went here for lunch on our Anniversary after reading the reviews.  I can tell you that this is a good place to go for a date or if you just want to have delicious seafood. We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again. We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.  It was good also. We then shared the combo fried seafood plate and the shellfish platter. We had so much food it was for dinner as well. I give them 5 stars and looking forward to our next trip. Yummy!

excerpts: Beautiful restaurant with wonderful baked oysters.
Clam chowder was creamy and yummy.
Beautiful place to go for a special occasion or date.
oysters.author: Judi H.
oysters.review:
Beautiful restaurant with wonderful baked oysters. Clam chowder was creamy and yummy. Beautiful place to go for a special occasion or date. Sunset views were spectacular. 

Margarita was yummy so was the shrimps Brochette

excerpts:
1) Got here with a reservation, ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes which is the least of my complaints 

2) Asked the waiter if the oysters were good on that night, he said they were "very good".
To keep it short and simple, the oysters we're not prepared well.
Salty like it was never rinsed or cleaned out.
Oysters were TINY.
No flavor other than sea water.
Not good to the pallet.
oysters.author: Kelvin L.
oysters.review:
Wish I could give this place a zero star.

1) Got here with a reservation, ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes which is the least of my complaints 

2) Asked the waiter if the oysters were good on that night, he said they were "very good". To keep it short and simple, the oysters we're not prepared well. Salty like it was never rinsed or cleaned out. Oysters were TINY. No flavor other than sea water. Not good to the pallet. Had small shell bits inside. 

3) Ordered a $7.50 non alcoholic berry drink. You would think they would put a little more effort for that price point. Basically a flat Sprite with some dried blackberries. I'd much rather drink a can of sprite had I known any better.

4) Asked the waiter for parking validation. He said be right back with it and came back with the bill - no validation. I ended up having to ask another and he got for me just before I got up to leave. My original waiter comes back and drops a second validation on my table and walks off as he probably saw my 12% tip ( which I felt thoroughly justified for the lack of presence and honesty about the food).

5) Here's the kicker. CHECK YOUR BANK STATEMENTS. I clearly wrote $130 on the $117 tab, giving them a $13 tip which I was even reluctant to give in the first place. What do they do? Charge me $140. This is theft. I clearly, in big and clear numbers wrote $130. And no, this is not about $10. It's about the integrity of this restaurant. So naturally, I called in, and the host said he would check and call me back right away. No call. I called in 6 hours later, same host picked up. Explained to him the situation once again, he put me on hold, and then hung up on me. Never called me back again. This place is a sham. Check your bank statements. Especially if you tip them less that the 18%, they will pull a fast one. I'm sure I'm not the first and definitely won't be the last. Contacted my bank and will file a dispute.

excerpts: That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too.
When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates.
I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me.
The presentation lost its "WOW" factor
oysters.author: Alan L.
oysters.review:
Smacked in the middle of Pier 39, I was excited to try this place out because of the amount of reviews it has and the amazing look food. 

The restaurant looks super fantastic. Very high class restaurant except you don't have to be all dressed for it. 

There was only 3 dishes I wanted to try. That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab. 

The baked oysters was such an awesome starter. That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious. I wish I had 3 dozens of those. 

The famous clam chowder in a bread bowl. Probably the best clam chowder I have ever had. The consistency, the flavor, and the chuck of clams were great. The sour dough bread really compliments well with the clam chowder. 

The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too. When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates. I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me. The presentation lost its "WOW" factor and I was super disappointed in that. 

Otherwise the crab was very good. Great garlic flavor. Good chunks of crab meat. 

Should really give this place a shot. Great seafood dishes. Except if you get a whole crab, make sure they serve it whole and not split between two plates.

excerpts: Enjoyed crabs and oysters.
Also it has Napa beer.
Named after the restaurant's name.
Nice view, must b good the clear blue sky.
oysters.author: Saori Y.
oysters.review:
Enjoyed crabs and oysters.
Also it has Napa beer. Named after the restaurant's name. 
Nice view, must b good the clear blue sky.

excerpts: I went all out and ordered a bunch of dishes including oysters, crab cake, whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder, etc. for a couple of hundred dollars.
Food was very fresh and tasty.
Our waiter was friendly and attentive.
oysters.author: Angela F. W.
oysters.review:
I don't care it's a touristy spot. It's a decent restaurant with an awesome view. Plus it's my dad approved. 

Came here with my dad when we visited SF a few years ago. I was living in Texas back then and wanted to take my dad for a good seafood meal when we were doing our tourist thing at Pier 39. 

After looking at nearby restaurants, we decided to eat here for lunch. I went all out and ordered a bunch of dishes including oysters, crab cake, whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder, etc. for a couple of hundred dollars. Food was very fresh and tasty. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. And the view was amazing. 

My dad was super happy with the food and whole experience. I was so glad he liked it. This place deff brings back memories. Fast forward a few years, I now live in the Bay Area. I'll take my whole family back here when they visit me in the city!

excerpts: We also got half dozen of oysters and that was delicious!
It was also $17 for half dozen... which In my opinion is expensive.
The views were lovely.
Would I come back to this place?
I'm not sure
but it was definitely worth a try and to check it off my list.
It is mostly a tourist attraction.
oysters.author: Jean K.
oysters.review:
Fancy restaurant on the Fisherman's Wharf. It's located on the second floor and they have their own restroom! I came to Fog Harbor for their claim to have the best clam chowder. Yes, it was good but I don't think it lived up to the hype. A local told us a placed called Chowders will have the best clam chowder.

We also got half dozen of oysters and that was delicious! It was also $17 for half dozen... which In my opinion is expensive. The views were lovely. Would I come back to this place? I'm not sure but it was definitely worth a try and to check it off my list. It is mostly a tourist attraction.

excerpts: We loved the oysters!!!!!!
me and my girlfriend went by after doing hair for a wedding on a Saturday.
We ordered some waters and started with 3 appetizers, we're big eaters.
The server never came back and asked if we wanted anything else.
Maybe he assumed we were not going to eat more
and we were just snackers which we are.
But we were there for the big plates!!!
oysters.author: Coryann E.
oysters.review: The food, well appetizers were good I love calamari. I didn't care for the sauce but that's my preference. I didn't like the mussels fries not sure if it was the onions but something threw it off for me. Again that's just me. We loved the oysters!!!!!! me and my girlfriend went by after doing hair for a wedding on a Saturday. We ordered some waters and started with 3 appetizers, we're big eaters. The server never came back and asked if we wanted anything else. Maybe he assumed we were not going to eat more and we were just snackers which we are. But we were there for the big plates!!! We wanted the seafood trio with the salmon and all and the steak plate... we will have to try again. Only reason for three stars is we were never asked anything we pretty much walked him through the service of serving.

excerpts: They half good oysters but everything else is over priced, like the crab and fried shrimp we got.
Definitely not a place for a craft cocktail, unless it has cheap shrimp in it.
Skip it and find a true SF sea food spot.
oysters.author: Colton S.
oysters.review: Such a tourist spot. Idk why we chose it because we normally like the smaller, more creative dinner experiences. They half good oysters but everything else is over priced, like the crab and fried shrimp we got. Definitely not a place for a craft cocktail, unless it has cheap shrimp in it. Skip it and find a true SF sea food spot.

excerpts: Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.
The oysters were very fresh and delicious.
The clam chowder was delicious.
It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect.
The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..
yummy.
The roll just meats in your mouth and they
they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.
The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good.
oysters.author: Ashley L.
oysters.review:
Came here to have my Bday dinner with the Beau because we were in the area and I was craving seafood.  Didn't know this place is located in Pier 39 until we got there.  **Note** This place only validate parking in the garage for an hour and it will take you more than an hour to eat at this place.

We waited about 15 mins before we got seated.  Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.  The oysters were very fresh and delicious.  The clam chowder was delicious.  It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect. The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..yummy.  The roll just meats in your mouth and they they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.  The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good. 

Recommend this place if you are looking for a seafood place to eat in the area.  The view was also very nice as we were seated by the window looking out over the water.

excerpts: Stared with local Oysters, as stated they were smaller then we are used to but so sweet it made up for it.
I had the crab risotto with scallops and the added shrimp.
Te scallops were perfect, the risotto buttery smooth with plenty of crabmeat.
The grilled shrimp added another dimension to an already outstanding meal.
My wife had the mixed grilled seafood again superb.
Our experience here was great, the staff treated us well customer service is a real thing here.
Curtiss was an outstanding guide leading us the right way.
Believe the hype this place is a winner.
oysters.author: John M.
oysters.review: Just had a wonderful dinner here on our last night in San Francisco. Our server Curtiss was professional, friendly and guided us to a memorable dinner.  At his suggestion we each added grilled shrimp to our meals and it was a great addition. Stared with local Oysters, as stated they were smaller then we are used to but so sweet it made up for it. I had the crab risotto with scallops and the added shrimp. Te scallops were perfect, the risotto buttery smooth with plenty of crabmeat. The grilled shrimp added another dimension to an already outstanding meal. My wife had the mixed grilled seafood again superb. Our experience here was great, the staff treated us well customer service is a real thing here. Curtiss was an outstanding guide leading us the right way. Believe the hype this place is a winner.

excerpts: I asked for the waitress' opinion for a starter - half a dozen oysters or the 2017 prize winning clam chowder highlighted on the menu.
She recommended the oysters and they did not disappoint
I ended up ordering a cup of the clam chowder TOO (adding crab to it) - YUM!
The complimentary sourdough bread
oysters.author: Shawn O.
oysters.review:
The Fog House was a great dinner spot to end a beautiful day out in the Bay Area. With a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz, the setting is beautiful to start. The restaurant's ambiance is very nice even though it is clearly very busy!

The hardest part was trying to figure out what to choose with the tasty menu options available!

I asked for the waitress' opinion for a starter - half a dozen oysters or the 2017 prize winning clam chowder highlighted on the menu. She recommended the oysters and they did not disappoint but......I ended up ordering a cup of the clam chowder TOO (adding crab to it) - YUM! The complimentary sourdough bread combo'd perfectly with the chowder.

For the main course the choice was the trio of the salmon, swordfish & shrimp that came with mashed potatoes & grilled asparagus. DOUBLE YUM! It was tough to pick a favorite but I'd give the swordfish a slight lead over the other two; the asparagus was grilled & seasoned perfectly too! The potatoes were not bad but didn't stand out.
