Soooooo.....this was already plenty of food and most people wouldn't bother considering dessert .....until the options were presented! So many choices that looked delicious but my choice was the blondie and it was really good!

In case I wasn't clear enough, I'd highly recommend this Pier 39 restaurant option. Enjoy!

excerpts: We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.
All dishes were excellent.
Would recommend the baked oysters especially.
The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.
But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.
Would recommend the baked oysters especially.
The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.
But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.
oysters.author: Scott S.
oysters.review: This was my wife and I's first taste of San Francisco seafood.  There are countless options in and around the San Fran area.  We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.  All dishes were excellent.  Would recommend the baked oysters especially.  The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.  But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.

excerpts: Calamari was somewhat okay nothing special, oysters as well, I tried better oysters at other location.
Service was good and overall good restaurant to visit if you are at Pier39.
oysters.author: Sophie L.
oysters.review: Our first time eating at Fog Harbor Fish House. Whenever we visited San Francisco, we always ate at the Crab House. However this time we tried Fog Harbor and food was good. We ordered several entrees to tryout and I would say clam chowder was the best. Calamari was somewhat okay nothing special, oysters as well, I tried better oysters at other location. Service was good and overall good restaurant to visit if you are at Pier39.

excerpts: The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.
oysters.author: Brady B.
oysters.review: Brady Bunte - I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39.  It truly was an amazing place. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.  Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.

excerpts: Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty.
Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams.
Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked.
The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT.
I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent.
We were not checked upon by our waiter.
Not once did he ask if everything was okay.
oysters.author: Anjelica N.
oysters.review:
The food was pretty good. Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty. Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams. Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked. The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT. I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent. We were not checked upon by our waiter. Not once did he ask if everything was okay. After our dinner was finished, 30 minutes went past and I had to grab the waiter's attention for the check.

Side Note: I made the waiter aware that I was there celebrating my birthday. I guess they don't celebrate birthdays here and give a dessert as other places do, because nothing came after dinner.

excerpts: We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish.
It was basically your typical raw oysters -
it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were.
$34 for 12 oysters.
oysters.author: Kathy N.
oysters.review:
Disclaimer: Despite the fact that this restaurant has $$$, high stars and looks nice, you can totally get away with dressing casually!! 

The pricing of the dishes here were definitely a bit steep. 

We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish. It was basically your typical raw oysters - it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were. $34 for 12 oysters. 

Ahi Tuna Poke $18 - Loved the flavors in this! It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes. I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors. Great appetizer to start out our meal with.

Clam Chowder w/ Crab - got the cup size to try ($7), to add crab was an additional $7, but well worth it! Had to really get that seafood experience, right? The chowder was good on its own, but the crab added an extra umph and texture. I enjoyed it. Their chowder was also rewarded best in SF! 

Seafood Penne $23 - The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me. The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish. However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate! For a small girl, i found that this dish was just enough for me. 

Alaskan Halibut $34 - This was part of their seafood menu. A bit of a disappointment. Although the fish was very soft and fresh, it lacked flavor. We are more so people who enjoy more flavor in our dishes. Had to use sauce from the pasta so the fish wouldnt be so bland. 

Apple Crisp $8.50 - We came here for our anniversary, so they gave us a complimentary dessert. So nice of them! At the end of your meal, the server will come out with a tray of desserts to choose from - you select the one you want and they will prepare you a new one from the back. I was silly and was about to grab it right off the tray. The Apple Crisp was delicious. Not too sweet and served with vanilla ice cream. Unfortunately, i was too full from the dinner that i couldnt finish the dessert - which never happens.

For being a high rating restaurant with steep prices, I would have taken this place to be a more upscale restaurant, but its a great spot to come for any occasion at any time of the day.

excerpts: We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake.
Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.
oysters.author: Harshini R.
oysters.review: Loved absolutely everything here! The service was great. The food was amazing and the dessert was pretty good too. We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake. Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.

excerpts: We started out with the raw oysters and garlic bread with blue cheese.
The oysters were perfection.
The garlic bread was delicious.
We had the cod fish and seafood platter for 2.
There was 3 of us.
The portions were great.
The food was just delicious.
The service was great.
All around amazing experience and would definitely visit again when we're back in town.
oysters.author: Krystal N.
oysters.review: All I can say is wow. We were greeted by the friendly hostess and sat right away. Our server Justin was amazing. He was friendly and very helpful when it came to ordering, he recommended the seafood platter. We started out with the raw oysters and garlic bread with blue cheese. The oysters were perfection. The garlic bread was delicious. We had the cod fish and seafood platter for 2. There was 3 of us. The portions were great. The food was just delicious. The service was great. All around amazing experience and would definitely visit again when we're back in town.

excerpts: Tried and loved; tuna poke, crab cakes, oysters & sautéed veggies!
Would totally come back & recommend!
oysters.author: Courtney C.
oysters.review: This was a great find!!! Fabulous views of the Bay and seals. We were seated right away, Had a great server, Justin H. Who helped us choose a great variety rather than just two entrees. Tried and loved; tuna poke, crab cakes, oysters & sautéed veggies! Would totally come back & recommend!

excerpts: I love this place, especially love the oysters here!
That paired with a view over the water and it's a great place to relax on a nice day.
Bit on the costlier side, to be expected from a touristy street.
oysters.author: Maansi D.
oysters.review: I love this place, especially love the oysters here! That paired with a view over the water and it's a great place to relax on a nice day. Bit on the costlier side, to be expected from a touristy street.

excerpts: The oysters were the most fresh delicious oysters I've ever had.
The whole table tried an oyster even the people who aren't oyster lovers.
We ordered the sliders which had such a delicious sauce on them which made them absolutely amazing.
oysters.author: Jatin K.
oysters.review: I had read many reviews before I got here and decided to give it a whirl. This was our first stop when we arrived to fisherman's wharf, we had a party of 9 about 230 pm on a Friday afternoon and were seated right away on the window side. We all sat down ordered a bunch of drinks and appetizers, at first I feel like the waitress was a little annoyed and wanted to rush us out of there but then later she did end her shift while we were still there so I'll give her the benefit of the doubt on that one. This was hands down some of the best seafood I've had. The calamari was delicious and perfectly cooked. The oysters were the most fresh delicious oysters I've ever had. The whole table tried an oyster even the people who aren't oyster lovers. We ordered the sliders which had such a delicious sauce on them which made them absolutely amazing. The blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch on the menu however the taste doesn't really match the concept of this place. Overall the service was decent, the food was amazing and the view was awesome.

excerpts: The oysters were amazing, enough said.
Let's not forget the view of Alcatraz you have while enjoying drinks and food.
oysters.author: Dennise M.
oysters.review: Quick bite at the bar : calamari, YUM! It was lightly crispy to perfection.  Crap out of shell cocktail was nice and refreshing with nice portion.  The oysters were amazing, enough said. Let's not forget the view of Alcatraz you have while enjoying drinks and food.

excerpts: We ordered the special -- which was a combination of lobster tail and steak -- plus the linguini & clams pasta, a dozen fresh oysters, and clam chowder.
To go along with all the seafood, white wine was a must.
The oysters were fair in proportion, yet not large enough to "wow" you.
The clam chowder was delicious in particular.
It had enough ingredients for the three of us.
My personal favorites would be the clam chowder and lobster tail + steak special.
The steak was cooked medium rare, and it was quite a unique experience switching off tender, moist beef with tougher, lobster meat...
We devoured it.
oysters.author: Sarah R.
oysters.review:
This restaurant is THE eatery to visit when you're at Pier 39 in San Francisco! Although the 40 minutes wait was quite long, it was totally worth it. The food, service and view were superb.

We were seated by the window, which we like, and could see the pier and ocean. We ordered the special -- which was a combination of lobster tail and steak -- plus the linguini & clams pasta, a dozen fresh oysters, and clam chowder. To go along with all the seafood, white wine was a must. The oysters were fair in proportion, yet not large enough to "wow" you. The clam chowder was delicious in particular. It had enough ingredients for the three of us. My personal favorites would be the clam chowder and lobster tail + steak special. The steak was cooked medium rare, and it was quite a unique experience switching off tender, moist beef with tougher, lobster meat... We devoured it. The linguini & clams pasta was decent, but not the best.

Our server was kind and very attentive. He was clearly busy running around, yet addressed our needs and always wore a smile. The restaurant was packed, without a single empty table. I'm unsure whether they take reservations or not, but this is a worthwhile place to check out.

Last but not least: don't forget to validate your parking when leaving!

excerpts: Oysters were a disappointment - small and flavorless.
The sourdough bread  is fantastic!
Calamari was a Bret variety with delicious jalapeños and onion straws mixed in.
Muscle fries were unique and much better than the oysters but I wouldn't get them again.
The chowder however was fantastic and worth the visit.
Adding crab meat to the salad was clutch and easily enough to top the salad and toss in the soup.
Overall, could be improved.
It's disappointing
it wasn't a better experience
but they have plenty of redeeming aspects to make it a decent option if you're in the area.
oysters.author: Katie R.
oysters.review:
This place could easily be great - location, ambiance, and food for the most are on point. Unfortunately we had a group of six with a space cadet server. Though the bartender, bread/water service and a check in from the manager seemed alert, the bulk of our dining experience fell short. 
Oysters were a disappointment - small and flavorless. The sourdough bread  is fantastic! Calamari was a Bret variety with delicious jalapeños and onion straws mixed in. Muscle fries were unique and much better than the oysters but I wouldn't get them again. The chowder however was fantastic and worth the visit. Adding crab meat to the salad was clutch and easily enough to top the salad and toss in the soup. 
Overall, could be improved. It's disappointing it wasn't a better experience but they have plenty of redeeming aspects to make it a decent option if you're in the area.

excerpts: The oysters are awesome, but a little pricey.
We had the oyster sampler, clam chowder, a sandwich  and a couple of drinks.
If you like oysters and a great view this is the place to go.
oysters.author: Wilson W.
oysters.review:
Awesome atmosphere. Great view by the bay.
The oysters are awesome, but a little pricey. We had the oyster sampler, clam chowder, a sandwich  and a couple of drinks. 
If you like oysters and a great view this is the place to go.

excerpts: To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce.
These oysters were incredible.
It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor.
oysters.author: Hai L.
oysters.review: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

excerpts: My mom and I shared: cracked dungeness crab, crab cake, a dozen fresh oysters, and a bread bowl of clam chowder with 2 iced teas with a total of 102 dollars
so it's not cheap, but
oysters.author: Lauren K.
oysters.review:
This is THE place to eat crab. The view is gorgeous, the service impeccable and the best crab cakes I've ever eaten. My mom and I shared: cracked dungeness crab, crab cake, a dozen fresh oysters, and a bread bowl of clam chowder with 2 iced teas with a total of 102 dollars so it's not cheap, but by far one of the most special meals I've ever had. 

I highly recommend this place!

excerpts: The oysters looked good, the crab sounded good, but for me it's always about the sourdough clam chowder bowl when in San Fran.
And this place does it amazing!
Definitely a must have in my book.
Best place to eat on Pier 39 for me
oysters.author: Jake T.
oysters.review:
Going to the Piers and not eating at Fog Harbor is a mistake. This place is great. And if you're a solo traveler like I was, don't let the 2 hour wait scare you off. You can hover the bar and grab a seat to eat at.

I didn't catch her name, but my bartender was so great. She took care of me and I'm sure several others that evening without an issue at all. Food came out fast, the virgin drinks were tasty- especially the nojito, and all at a pretty decent price.

The oysters looked good, the crab sounded good, but for me it's always about the sourdough clam chowder bowl when in San Fran. And this place does it amazing! Definitely a must have in my book. Best place to eat on Pier 39 for me

excerpts: I ordered a chowder bread bowl, oysters, and some gumbo, and they were all pretty good.
The oysters were fresh and delicious, and the gumbo was thick and savory.
The server we had was very friendly as well and took nice photos for us.
They also saw us without reservations and it was an overall good and convenient last minute find.
oysters.author: Dan N.
oysters.review: Definitely one of the touristy restaurants on the Pier and Fishermans Wharf but still a good restaurant experience. I ordered a chowder bread bowl, oysters, and some gumbo, and they were all pretty good. The oysters were fresh and delicious, and the gumbo was thick and savory. The server we had was very friendly as well and took nice photos for us. They also saw us without reservations and it was an overall good and convenient last minute find.

excerpts: Oysters were by far the BEST!
Our server, JD, took care of us with our 3 month old.
He was so understanding and thoughtful!
Thanks, JD, you're the bomb!!
The bread was fantastic!
oysters.author: Jeanette G.
oysters.review:
Best clam chowder ever! Lots of clams, thick, hearty... satisfying!
Oysters were by far the BEST! Our server, JD, took care of us with our 3 month old. He was so understanding and thoughtful! Thanks, JD, you're the bomb!!
The bread was fantastic!

excerpts: Local oysters & garlic blue cheese bread are to die for!
Susan was our server
and she did an incredible job, so sweet & friendly.
She is very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu & the area as well.
We will make sure to return next time we are in the area !!!
oysters.author: Ali S.
oysters.review: We just had a great lunch!!! Local oysters & garlic blue cheese bread are to die for! Susan was our server and she did an incredible job, so sweet & friendly. She is very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu & the area as well. We will make sure to return next time we are in the area !!!

excerpts: Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder.
The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet.
Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it
and it's absolutely to die for.
The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal.
They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens!
I can also see why their clam chowder is famous.
It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato.
I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again.
oysters.author: Cliff W.
oysters.review:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!
oysters.author: Christine A.
oysters.review:
wow!  I love this place.

we managed to get a window-view table; an awesome water/land and Alcatraz picture opportunity before or after your meal.

we had a wonderful server named Kayla.  She is very nice and very helpful with Appetizer and Meal recommendations.
Very, very attentive!   

food and service; ON POINT!

Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!

Will definitely be back here!!!

excerpts: Love the fresh seafood, and the view is great, we celebrated my husband birthday here and he love the lobster, shrimp,crabs, mussels,clams and oysters!
Staffs are very nice too!
oysters.author: MG B.
oysters.review: Love the fresh seafood, and the view is great, we celebrated my husband birthday here and he love the lobster, shrimp,crabs, mussels,clams and oysters! Staffs are very nice too!

excerpts: We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you.
The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes.
The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch.
I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving.
I'm not a big drinker
We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile.
oysters.author: David R.
oysters.review:
My wife and I were in SF during Christmas weekend having just finished a late afternoon bay tour and needed something to warm us back up. The crowds were decent and we expected long waits regardless of where we decided to dine so we settled on splurging a little. We put our names on the wait list and after hearing the party before us (party of 4) get a 45 minute wait time we were estatic that our names were called within five minutes of putting our name on the waiting list!

The hostess seated us adjacent to the window overlooking the bay! SCORE!!! It did take about seven minutes for our waiter to come take our orders but we used the opportunity to review the menu and decide our options. We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you. The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes. The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch. I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving. I'm not a big drinker but I ended up having two more...suffice to say I enjoyed them.

Our main course was delicious. There was plenty to fill the bowl, large chunks of fish, mussels, a couple clams, and a set of large crab legs reaching out! My bowl had a large 'knuckle' that was packed with meat. As I deshelled the crab legs I observed I had amassed significantly more meat through my labor than what my wife had been provided in her 'lazy style' bowl...in other words 'don't be lazy'. The broth was equally delicious although I would have preferred a little more broth...regardless I was still able to splash some on my coat.

We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile. Very happy that we were able to enjoy a very nice dinner with an incredible view and hardly any wait.

Until the next meal,

David

excerpts: I ordered an old fashion, half a dozen raw oysters, and the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl with a side salad.
My old fashion came in a glass that was only half filled and full of pulp.
Three of my six oysters were gritty as hell, and a couple had bits of broken shell.
oysters.author: Vee V.
oysters.review:
The hostesses could use some customer service lessons. Smiling to start would be amazing. 

I strolled in at 5:30pm on a Monday and asked to be by the window so I could have a nice view. The host took me to the furthest seat from the window. I was practically next to the host stand at the front of the restaurant. Umm...no thanks. I asked to wait to be seated at a window instead. A guy, I assume a manager, although friendly, asked if I absolutely needed to be at a window. Umm...yes. 

25 minutes later I'm back, and I'm at a window seat. The view was worth the wait, and especially being a solo diner. 

I ordered an old fashion, half a dozen raw oysters, and the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl with a side salad. My old fashion came in a glass that was only half filled and full of pulp. Three of my six oysters were gritty as hell, and a couple had bits of broken shell. Not impressed. 

The clam chowder was decent, but not something I'd come back for. 

The server was nice, and the view was spectacular, but the prices and food were not worth it. I recommend maybe a drink and app, but go elsewhere for entrees.

excerpts: My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder.
oysters.author: Cruz C.
oysters.review: We came to celebrate my wife's birthday here. My wife had the halibut. My oldest child had the pan seared chicken. My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder. I had the Shellfish platter. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Worth every penny! We will be coming again.

excerpts: This decent local restaurant serves the customers from local to travelers to taste and experience the finest seafood caught cuisines from fish, crabs, oysters, clams, mussels and many more!
As I entered their front door, the atmosphere was very remarkable and elegant as I welcomed there.

The concept is much like visiting to a first class seafood restaurant with a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean especially the Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge not too far away from the restaurant.
oysters.author: William L.
oysters.review:
My 3rd flashback review.

On 7/20/2016 when I was in San Francisco on a fine, sunny afternoon, I was heading to the San Francisco Piers until I discovered for this incredible seafood restaurant located at Pier 39 called, "Fog Harbor Fish House." This decent local restaurant serves the customers from local to travelers to taste and experience the finest seafood caught cuisines from fish, crabs, oysters, clams, mussels and many more! As I entered their front door, the atmosphere was very remarkable and elegant as I welcomed there. The concept is much like visiting to a first class seafood restaurant with a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean especially the Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge not too far away from the restaurant. The interior is very clean and fancy both inside and out.

The employees from servers, hosts and cookers especially chefs and bartenders are doing a fantastic job for accommodating the customers like me a sensational service despite the busiest summer environment. This server named, Samir was such a great male server. He gave me some good recommendations and suggestions especially asking a request for water refills too! No cons at all.

Now onto the food! Since I was in the middle of my budget visit, I ordered their signature soup of: the Fog Harbor's Clam Chowder. As I ate that chowder (in a small bowl), that soup was tasty and outstanding. Much bolder and flavorful than my homemade clam chowder! The ingredients were fresh and new as I did feel the taste of potatoes, clam bites and the smoothness thicker broth of the soup. Such a great soup at all!

Parking at Fog Harbor Fish House can be difficult to park. You can park at the nearest surface street parking nor the parking garage if it's available. Otherwise, you can also ride a bike, walk, carpool, public transportation, valet parking or ride sharing transportation easier without the hassles and headaches.

To conclude, Fog Harbor Fish House is the most absolute extraordinary local seafood restaurant that I've ever visited right here in San Francisco! Perfect for date nights, anniversaries or friends and family gatherings all year long! A well received visit! My rating: 4 1/2 stars.

excerpts: My wife and I started w/ their baked oysters (oysters Rockefeller,) which were spectacular.
Was hard to hide my southern roots as I wanted to pick up the shell and shoot i down, but I refrained and used a fork.
For my entree I had the crab roll.
I'm a sucker for a New England Lobster Roll, and this was similar.
Crab was shredded so it was closer to crab salad, than the lump meat of a lobster roll.
It was amazing though.
Sweeter meat than a lobster.
Delicious.
My wife had the fresh local caught halibut fish and chips.
As good as I've had across the pond.
Pay a little extra for the view, but worth it.
You can see the sea lions on Pier 39 from your table.
oysters.author: Adam B. J.
oysters.review: I'm a sucker for a view.  Fog Harbor has a great one.  This was our first meal and stop in SF, and it didn't disappoint.  Our server was helpful, polite, and attentive.  My wife and I started w/ their baked oysters (oysters Rockefeller,) which were spectacular.   Was hard to hide my southern roots as I wanted to pick up the shell and shoot i down, but I refrained and used a fork.  For my entree I had the crab roll.  I'm a sucker for a New England Lobster Roll, and this was similar.  Crab was shredded so it was closer to crab salad, than the lump meat of a lobster roll.  It was amazing though.  Sweeter meat than a lobster.  Delicious.  My wife had the fresh local caught halibut fish and chips.  As good as I've had across the pond.  Pay a little extra for the view, but worth it.  You can see the sea lions on Pier 39 from your table.

excerpts: Dinginess crab was over cooked, raw oysters decent, but not sweet.
Final blow was
some one kipped my new ball cap from my chair.
Staff blew it off.
Not impressed!
oysters.author: George C.
oysters.review: Over rated for quality of meal. Dinginess crab was over cooked, raw oysters decent, but not sweet. Final blow was some one kipped my new ball cap from my chair. Staff blew it off. Not impressed!

excerpts: For food we generally had shrimp cocktail, calamari and oysters.
All good.
oysters.author: Justin R.
oysters.review:
If you're looking for a great mixed drink in Fisherman's Wharf, go here and ask for Nelson. This guy made the best Belvedere martini I found anywhere in Fisherman's Wharf.  Once we found Nelson, my wife and I had happy hour here everyday during our vacation. I even had another bartender at Fog Harbor make the same drink when Nelson was on break, and it wasn't nearly as good. A great bartender makes all the difference. They should actually put that drink on the menu and call it The Nelson. Really nice, personable guy too. Always made us feel welcome. For food we generally had shrimp cocktail, calamari and oysters. All good.  Worth a visit if you're in Pier 39.

Forgot to add - if you want The Nelson, it's Belvedere martini, up, touch dirty, blue cheese olives.

excerpts: We sat at the bar and my husband ate oysters until he couldn't stand.
Though I am not into oysters, I did enjoy the broiled options.
It's just that good.
The fish was fresh and the beer was ice cold.
Loved it!
oysters.author: Edie C.
oysters.review: Wonderful food and atmosphere.  We sat at the bar and my husband ate oysters until he couldn't stand.  Though I am not into oysters, I did enjoy the broiled options.  It's just that good.  The fish was fresh and the beer was ice cold.  Loved it!

excerpts: I wanted clam chowder, crab and oysters.
I didn't know I was in for a treat.
The hostess was very accommodating and quoted us a reasonable waiting time.
My party was seated partially (great, because I was starving!)
I was delighted when I found out they were serving my favorite oysters that day, Miyagi's from British Columbia (plump, briny, deep cup, meaty, perfection!)
an immediate dozen to begin please.
Clams linguine with a generous portion of fresh clams.
Garlic herb roasted dungeness crab comes pre-cracked with a side of veggies and potatoes.
The fried platter came with a delicious lemon aioli sauce but the fried seafood was a miss though.
Our server and the wait staff was awesome, attentive and nice.
For desserts, there's no menu.
They will bring you a whole tray of "display" desserts for you to select from.
Love this idea.
oysters.author: Carrie C.
oysters.review:
Walking around Pier 39 being the tourist I was, I decided to have a nice lunch with a nice view. I wanted clam chowder, crab and oysters. I didn't know I was in for a treat. The hostess was very accommodating and quoted us a reasonable waiting time. My party was seated partially (great, because I was starving!) I skimmed through the menu and told myself to try not to order everything on the menu. 

Views of the Alcatraz, Sf Bay, Golden Gate Bridge, so request a table by the window. 

Clam chowder with a side of their fresh house-made sourdough bread. I was delighted when I found out they were serving my favorite oysters that day, Miyagi's from British Columbia (plump, briny, deep cup, meaty, perfection!) an immediate dozen to begin please. Clams linguine with a generous portion of fresh clams. Garlic herb roasted dungeness crab comes pre-cracked with a side of veggies and potatoes. The fried platter came with a delicious lemon aioli sauce but the fried seafood was a miss though. Our server and the wait staff was awesome, attentive and nice. For desserts, there's no menu. They will bring you a whole tray of "display" desserts for you to select from. Love this idea. I went with the dessert duo of house-made vanilla bean creme brulee and warm chocolate fudge cake. 

Take your receipt with you for 30% off Biscoff downstairs

5 stars for great food quality and great service!

excerpts: The fresh oysters were delicious though - can't go wrong with freshly shucked oysters with marinara, vinegar and horseradish!
The tuna poke was also very good and had good flavor.
They also give you fresh sour dough bread - I'm not a fan of sour dough but everyone was killing it!
The calamari was decent as well, nothing special but not bad either.
Ok place on the Wharf - definitely caters to tourists.
oysters.author: Ivy L.
oysters.review:
Decided to come here based on yelp reviews for lunch while visiting Pier 39 and the Wharf! The hostess was a little snooty because she was not happy to seat an extra person.. I believe I said 6 and then corrected myself with 7 and she must not have heard but the attitude was definitely not called for.  Oh well.. our server was nice for the large party we had.  I feel like we sat there for a long time though for just a meal and didn't end up having enough time to explore the Wharf.  

The food.. I had the mussels and they were a bit sandy and salty.  My friend said her linguine and clams were also a bit salty.  The fresh oysters were delicious though - can't go wrong with freshly shucked oysters with marinara, vinegar and horseradish!  The tuna poke was also very good and had good flavor.  They also give you fresh sour dough bread - I'm not a fan of sour dough but everyone was killing it! The calamari was decent as well, nothing special but not bad either.  Ok place on the Wharf - definitely caters to tourists.

excerpts: I really liked their backed oysters and clam chowder.
Not a bad choice when you are in the area.
oysters.author: Melany C.
oysters.review:
The average rating for Fog Harbor is correct! Nice views, good food, pleasant atmosphere, but super touristy. 
I really liked their backed oysters and clam chowder. Not a bad choice when you are in the area.

excerpts: We also had their famous Clam Chowder soup as well as half a dozen oysters.
oysters.author: Patrick L.
oysters.review:
We didn't expect to find this gem of a seafood place at Pier 39 and we were pleasantly surprised when we decided to give this place a try. The Cioppino is a MUST and we enjoyed it tremendously. And the butter and garlic crab as well. We also had their famous Clam Chowder soup as well as half a dozen oysters. While all were good, our two favourites are the Cioppino and the garlic crab. 
To top the great food experience, our server, Lidia was just outstanding ... she attended to our needs always with a smile and her food recommendations were spot-on for us. 
Would highly recommend this seafood restaurant to all who visit pier 39.

excerpts: 1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!
oysters.author: Racheal D.
oysters.review:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!

excerpts: We added extra oysters too.
Hats off to you Fog Harbor!!
I'll be seeing you through the upcoming Christmas holidays!!
See below what a gorgeous night it was....
oysters.author: Corlyn D.
oysters.review: This was my first time here! Our waiter Justin, was very personable from greeting us to going through the menu thoroughly! He was very prompt and kept my water full! We had their famous clam chowder, which was so creamy and a crab salad was to die for!! Then went for the Seafood tower!! (omg the CRAB?!!!) We added extra oysters too. Hats off to you Fog Harbor!! I'll be seeing you through the upcoming Christmas holidays!! See below what a gorgeous night it was....

excerpts: We ordered oysters, seafood tower, Caesar salad, clam chowder with crab on top and a separate bread bowl of clam chowder.
We had window seats with an amazing view of the sunset.
Christian was our waiter.
If you don't treat yourself to this place you are not treating yourself like you should.
We ended the night with the desert duo, Omg perfect ending to a great meal.
oysters.author: Jason Z.
oysters.review: 5 solid stars.. This place is amazing, they told us a 20-30 minute wait was actually maybe 15. We ordered oysters, seafood tower, Caesar salad, clam chowder with crab on top and a separate bread bowl of clam chowder. We had window seats with an amazing view of the sunset. Christian was our waiter. If you don't treat yourself to this place you are not treating yourself like you should. We ended the night with the desert duo, Omg perfect ending to a great meal.

excerpts: We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh).
Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.
oysters.author: Kate H.
oysters.review: My husband and I dined here tonight and we have no faults! We chose the restaurant because we wanted to try a chowder bread bowl and Fog Harbour's didn't disappoint - it was incredible. Highly recommend paying the $7 extra to get crab pieces included. We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh). Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.

excerpts: I don't like mussels, scallops or oysters.
oysters.author: Nicole H.
oysters.review:
This is my favorite place to eat in San Francisco!  Pier 39 is a great location, with lots of things to do.  The food here is off the hook every time I go and last night was no exception.  The service is excellent and the patrons are friendly, often striking conversations about area activities and of course the great food!  

Last night the chef made me sooo happy!! I don't like mussels, scallops or oysters.  So when I wanted to try their cioppino, I asked if I can have it with crab and shrimp..."No problem" is what I was told and I was blown away with the flavor of the sauce, the tenderness of the crab and shrimp!  This dish was large enough for 2 to share.  The warm bread they serve is great for dipping in this sauce as well as their soups (we had the amazing clam chowder).  The drinks, strawberry patron maguerita and a tequila sunrise was on point!  Then for desert we trued the duo of creme brûlée and chocolate mousse cake.  The balance of creamy, sweet, and bitterness made the desert one to remember.  I love this place and will always return.

excerpts: My husband and I got the fried calamari, oysters, and clam chowder in a bread bowl topped with crab.
It was a very pleasant dining experience!
oysters.author: Madelaine M.
oysters.review: This place has got waiting down to a science. As my husband and I walked down the pier we put our names on the waitlist right from Yelp (they also have a place you can join the waitlist on an iPad by the host station). We grabbed a beer at a bar and received updates via text when we had about 5 minutes before we needed to check in.  The hostess that sat us was very nice and our waiter was welcoming. My husband and I never can make decisions and the waiter did a great job helping us decide. The table, seating and dishes were clean. The food came out fast and was so delicious. My husband and I got the fried calamari, oysters, and clam chowder in a bread bowl topped with crab. It was a very pleasant dining experience!

excerpts: And I also got the half dozen oysters.
A little pricey.
I don't think the oyster were worth it.
My boyfriend got the steamers.
I loveddd those.
The sauce they were cooked in was delicious.
oysters.author: Uyen N.
oysters.review: I think what caught my eye about this place was the huge windows that gave you a view of the water. It was gorgeous. Our server was nothing short of amazing. He went through the menu w us and suggested a few dishes. I got the salmon which was awesomeee. And I also got the half dozen oysters. A little pricey. $18. I don't think the oyster were worth it. My boyfriend got the steamers. I loveddd those. The sauce they were cooked in was delicious.

excerpts: We received only half a dozen oysters when we had asked for a dozen.. and were given our clam chowder in a bowl when I had asked for a bread bowl.
All fixable mistakes, however, so no real harm done.
The ambiance indoors is rather nice though, for anywhere else to dine at in the area.
It's not too "touristy" seeming, and there's a lovely view if you are lucky enough to dine by the window.
oysters.author: Chelsea W.
oysters.review: The food here is pretty decently priced; however, the service can be rather slow, as well as the speed your food comes out. Our orders seemed to come out wrong a couple times -- or our server was just jotting down the wrong order. We received only half a dozen oysters when we had asked for a dozen.. and were given our clam chowder in a bowl when I had asked for a bread bowl. All fixable mistakes, however, so no real harm done. The ambiance indoors is rather nice though, for anywhere else to dine at in the area. It's not too "touristy" seeming, and there's a lovely view if you are lucky enough to dine by the window.

excerpts: Try the Oysters with spinach, cheese, and bacon.
oysters.author: Brian L.
oysters.review: Great atmosphere.  Solid food.  We really enjoyed this place.  Try the Oysters with spinach, cheese, and bacon.  Try the blue cheese garlic bread.  Try the scallops.  Try the surf and turf. Everything was good.

excerpts: Their oysters are incredible.
oysters.author: Deidre H.
oysters.review:
My husband and I made reservations here for our 5 year anniversary when visiting SF! This place made us feel so special and when I asked for a window seat they made it happen. Their oysters are incredible. The dipping sauce is hands down the best! 

I ordered the tuna and it was great but not a fan of the rice side. My husband had surf n turf and it was delish! Everyone must go!

excerpts: The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters
oysters.author: Daniele T.
oysters.review: Great food, will definitely go back again. The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters

excerpts: Especially the oysters!
Linguine and clams was to die for.
Jim/jimmy was our server.
He did an fantastic job!
He constantly checked up on us and made sure we had all we needed.
He explained the menu really well.
Great experience.
I will definitely come back when I visit again.
Thanks Jim
oysters.author: Thanh L.
oysters.review: Came here for a Saturday brunch. I'm from Orange County so I'm pretty new to the area. The food was amazing!!! Especially the oysters! Linguine and clams was to die for. Jim/jimmy was our server. He did an fantastic job! He constantly checked up on us and made sure we had all we needed. He explained the menu really well. Great experience. I will definitely come back when I visit again. Thanks Jim :)

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the crab salad sandwich and half a dozen oysters.
The oysters were fresh but the typical common variety so nothing special.
The clam chowder actually had bits of clam in it and went really well with the bread.
But next time I would just order the clam chowder without the bread bowl and save $2.
They serve fresh sourdough for free which I found out after ordering.
The filling in the crab salad was good as well but the fries left much to be desired.
She was rushed, unfriendly and unable to answer my question when I asked her what variety of oysters were being served.
oysters.author: Jenny C.
oysters.review:
We were enjoying the day at Pier 39 and wanted a nice lunch spot away that was a little quieter. First off, this place really does have the best view of the water. We were seated at a table right in front of the window and we could enjoy watching the hustle and bustle down below. The view is what is bumping up the rating of this place from a 3 star to a 4 star place because the service and food is average. Warm sourdough bread is complementary! I love restaurants that still offer bread service. This is a surprise these days with most places making you pay for bread and butter. 

We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the crab salad sandwich and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh but the typical common variety so nothing special. The clam chowder actually had bits of clam in it and went really well with the bread. But next time I would just order the clam chowder without the bread bowl and save $2. They serve fresh sourdough for free which I found out after ordering. The filling in the crab salad was good as well but the fries left much to be desired. I wish they had the option of a salad or veggies with the sandwich because there's already a lot of bread so its certainly not a balanced meal.

Service was subpar. She was rushed, unfriendly and unable to answer my question when I asked her what variety of oysters were being served.

excerpts: The oysters are fresh, also the clam chowder is light but creamy.
Overall did not have a bad dish
oysters.author: Jasmine E.
oysters.review: This place was a really good place to eat. The oysters are fresh, also the clam chowder is light but creamy. Overall did not have a bad dish

excerpts:
As for the food, we got the :

seafood platter- for $68 you get a lobster tail and claw, half of a Dungeness crab, 6 jumbo shrimp and 6 oysters.
oysters.author: Kevin N.
oysters.review:
Whoa, I'm on a seafood binge in sf! First off, the view of the bay and Alcatraz is awesome! We came on a Friday night and the wait was only 30 minutes. Luckily they have a lot of seats for you to sit on.

As for the food, we got the :

seafood platter- for $68 you get a lobster tail and claw, half of a Dungeness crab, 6 jumbo shrimp and 6 oysters. Man, the lobster was so tender and the dungess crab was so sweet and fresh. Everything was super fresh and not fishy at all. So good!

Clam chowder bread bowl- $11- yummy! The clam chowder is seasoned to perfection and the sour dough was delicious. The best bread bowl I've ever had.

Fish and chips- $19. The batter was very flaky and crispy. It was excellent and portion size was great.

Overall, this place is top notch! Everything was very fresh and not fishy at all. The staff is very attentive and the decor and view is gorgeous.

excerpts: The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again.
Clam chowder was solid.
oysters.author: Joe O.
oysters.review:
We were STARVING  from a drive from Napa and needed a place to eat. Some friends were eating there so we joined. It's full of tourists as expected and the food isn't bad at all. The cioppino was not good, at all. Seafood in it was good but it was a super thick sauce. The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again. Clam chowder was solid. The scallops were really good.

The line was crazy outside and it's really loud.

excerpts: Baked Oysters (5/5)
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time !
That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy.
I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used
but I'm guessing it's ricotta .
I didn't read the menu for it lol.
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time !
That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy.
I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used
but I'm guessing it's ricotta .
I didn't read the menu for it lol.
I just saw baked oysters
and I had to try It.
I just saw baked oysters
and I had to try It.
They're small oysters, so it's super yummy
hehe.
oysters.author: Jenny N.
oysters.review:
I came here a little before noon and it wasn't too crowded considering it was a Monday after all. 

S E R V I C E 
We were immediately sat down when we walked up to the podium. I can't recall if my server had mentioned her name or not. The service was pretty good I have to say. They were really attentive and patient with me when I couldn't decide what I want to eat yet. 

They validate parking garage tickets for an hour :) that's $9 !! Hehe. 


F O O D ! ! 

Clam chowder (5/5) 
I have read some of the reviews and people say the clam chowder is the best. It was Good but I can't say it's the best I ever had. I honestly haven't tasted THE best yet. So I'm still looking. However, this one IS pretty good. Some places are very stingy with their clams. Not here though. They gave a pretty decent amount of clams in their soup. I'd still give it a 5/5 :) cause it was good. Not too salty , which is great.

Baked Oysters (5/5) 
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time ! That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy. I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used but I'm guessing it's ricotta . I didn't read the menu for it lol. I just saw baked oysters and I had to try It. They're small oysters, so it's super yummy hehe. I recommend trying it. 

Seared Tuna- 2/5 
This entre was too salty. Not the tuna, but the veggies and the sauce it was cooked in was too salty and very overwhelminThe garlic mash potato was pretty average. The fish was okay too. I wasn't a really big fan of this dish, so I was kinda disappointed.

excerpts: Baked oysters
: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked.
Even the cheese on top was cold.
But this is where the service shined.
Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well.
When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.
oysters.author: Jack R.
oysters.review:
I feel rich. Like lottery winning rich.

I won a $100 gift certificate here, and I went all out when it came to ordering food.

But don't worry, I'm not that selfish. I like to share the wealth, so I invited my friends and paid the difference.

Here's what we had and our thoughts.

Clam chowder: Great, creamy, clam-y. Everyone loved their clam chowder. The ones with the bread bowl loved the bread too.

Caesar salad: Huge portion, good dressing, not overly great, just okay.

Baked oysters: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked. Even the cheese on top was cold. But this is where the service shined. Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well. When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.

Large Shrimp Cocktail: Delicious, and lived up to it's name. They were large. So good we couldn't stop ordering and eating these. 

Crab cakes: Excellent flavor. More crab meat than breading, great texture. We ordered several of them because we liked them so much.

Chippino: Huge,and filled with things you would find under the sea. Clams, crab, salmon, I mean this thing was a cauldron of goodness.

I want to say that our waiter was exceptional and was always there to fill up water, and even bagged up fresh sourdough for one of my friends who wanted to take some bread home.

Being that this is a tourist spot, I highly recommend it for tourists who may be overwhelmed with all the choices on the Pier.

Even as a local, I can say, I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: The shellfish putter comes with half a dozen of oysters, 0.5lb of crab, half a pound of lobsters, and shrimp.
Average quality.
My one complaint is they didn't offer sauce that wasn't spicy.
Oysters were a bit small.
oysters.author: Danae L.
oysters.review:
Bf and I came around 7pm and were seated towards the entrance right away. It was really windy so asked to be seated towards the inside. The host immediately told us there's a wait to sit inside. Well shouldn't you have given us the option of waiting to sit inside? The estimated waiting time for the Inside was 10 minutes, but we were seated in less than 2.

We shared the shellfish platter, chicken penne, and calamari.

I really enjoyed the calamari! It wasn't oily compared to other restaurants and had a nice crunch.

The chicken from the pasta was slightly plain and dry.

The shellfish putter comes with half a dozen of oysters, 0.5lb of crab, half a pound of lobsters, and shrimp. Average quality. My one complaint is they didn't offer sauce that wasn't spicy. Oysters were a bit small.

Overall they exceed my expectations given that I wasn't preparing myself for a five-star treatment. What I come again? Maybe next year.

excerpts: The oysters here are not worth getting.
So don't get them and you won't be disappointed!
Other than that, they have awesome cocktails and great food in general.
oysters.author: Michael K.
oysters.review:
Excellent service!

My linguine was awesome! The oysters here are not worth getting. So don't get them and you won't be disappointed! Other than that, they have awesome cocktails and great food in general.

excerpts: We had half a dozen oysters probably the best oysters I've ever had soo fresh and no fishy after taste.
I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl it was delicious!
My boyfriend has the seafood platter that included crab, mussels, clams , and potatoes.
It was a bit to garlicky for me but the seafood was fresh!
As well we had a great view of the water from our seats.
oysters.author: Linda N.
oysters.review: On vacation out in the Bay area, waiting for our ferry ride to Alcatraz Island me and my boyfriend were hungry and decided to stop here for some lunch. We had half a dozen oysters probably the best oysters I've ever had soo fresh and no fishy after taste. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl it was delicious! My boyfriend has the seafood platter that included crab, mussels, clams , and potatoes. It was a bit to garlicky for me but the seafood was fresh! As well we had a great view of the water from our seats.

excerpts: The oysters were great, hard to screw those up if you have a good purveyor.
oysters.author: Mandy B.
oysters.review:
Underwhelmed. Clam chowder was tasty- but not tasty enough to warrant $7/cup price tag. No crackers even offered? The oysters were great, hard to screw those up if you have a good purveyor.  I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed. There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor. Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some. My water glass was empty more often than it was full. I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations. I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!

excerpts: The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome.
oysters.author: Kritpong S.
oysters.review:
Great food, awesome view, good waiter, horrible hostess.

Took my wife there for a fancy dinner with a view today for our last dinner in San Francisco. The dinner started off great with prompt seating and we ordered our food. 

The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome. 

So after dinner my wife and I took turn to go to the restroom after we ordered dessert. While my wife walk away the waiter came and took our dishes and drop off 2 dessert spoons. Not a minute after that I over heard 2 hostess talking no more than 5 feet away from our table about how we have been sitting at the table for a long time not ordering anything and why are we not leaving. I was shocked and pissed off at them. 

I looked over at them and they gave me a look like oh you heard that? Then took a couple step back and kept talking about us and other table. WTF? 

Totally ruin the experience for me. I understand that it's a busy friday night but we were not just lounging around not ordering any food. Even if we were to lounge around enjoy the view after our meal we should be able too in peace! We end up spending over $100 for the meal and I was totally disappointed with the experience.

excerpts: My boys had the fried shrimp, we had oysters, clam chowder, and shrimp linguine.
Boys gave the food 5 stars and so did we.
Along with a Cali Double IPA and Hibiscus Margarita with egg white frost means we had a great time here!!
I'm
oysters.author: Daniel T.
oysters.review: Ono food and service! Looking to get out of the cold, we decided on this place. My boys had the fried shrimp, we had oysters, clam chowder, and shrimp linguine. Boys gave the food 5 stars and so did we. Along with a Cali Double IPA and Hibiscus Margarita with egg white frost means we had a great time here!! I'm

excerpts: The oysters were terrific!
oysters.author: D Joseph P.
oysters.review: Wonderful! Excellent seafood in a great atmosphere. The oysters were terrific! I had the crab and my husband had the salmon and both agree that this was one of the best tasting stuff we've ever had! Michael was our server and he was awesome!

excerpts: Our menu: my wife started out with the fabulous baked oysters, with a cocktail of a Hibiscus Margarita.
The clam chowder cup was perfect but I added a pinch of salt to bring in the true sea flavor.
I had a really good Prosecco which cleansed the pallet for each new flavor.
We split a Cal crab Caesar for $30.00 and this is why this rating is NOT a 5 star.
The lettuce was really "off color", seemed bagged and had a strange if not bland taste.
We separated the lettuce from the wonderful crab, bacon and croutons which made it perfect.
The main course of Scallops was perfect with crab and just a touch of cheese in the Risotto.
The Scallops were "crisp" on the outside, perfectly grilled, the inside was tender, moist and most flavorable.
A really good restaurant, except for the lettuce and
we will tell friends and family of our dining experience.
oysters.author: John94521 H.
oysters.review: Had a lunch date with my wife because we Love to come to the city and find new restaurants that satisfy our tastes and palates. Pier 39 can be a busy and busselling place during the summer but we decided to take a chance on this restaurant. I made reservations for 11:30 am on a Friday, and it worked out perfectly. The open door policy and greeting at the door was very inviting. The hostess was friendly and showed us to a table for two by the window. My wife faced the bay and I faced the tourists walking the Embarcadero, perfect. The bird droppings on the window didn't detour us from ordering a wonderful lunch. Edgar, our waiter, did a fine job of serving us. The restaurant was almost empty when we entered but became packed by noon. Our menu: my wife started out with the fabulous baked oysters, with a cocktail of a Hibiscus Margarita. The clam chowder cup was perfect but I added a pinch of salt to bring in the true sea flavor. I had a really good Prosecco which cleansed the pallet for each new flavor. We split a Cal crab Caesar for $30.00 and this is why this rating is NOT a 5 star. The lettuce was really "off color", seemed bagged and had a strange if not bland taste. We separated the lettuce from the wonderful crab, bacon and croutons which made it perfect. The main course of Scallops was perfect with crab and just a touch of cheese in the Risotto. The Scallops were "crisp" on the outside, perfectly grilled, the inside was tender, moist and most flavorable. A really good restaurant, except for the lettuce and we will tell friends and family of our dining experience.

excerpts: I tried oysters for the first time ever and it was SOOOOOOOOOO bomb like I can't explain to you the amount of love I have for the oysters in the world.
Also...I am such a big clam chowder critic and might I add that this was 10/10!
Great service.
Loved Andy (I think that was his name) our waiter was impeccable and gave us great suggestions on what to eat.
Also we ordered the Fog Harbor Lager and it was so good.
Very repetitive yelp review because I'm drunk from that beer
LMAO love this place
oysters.author: Tanya M.
oysters.review: Omggggg this place was soooo good. I tried oysters for the first time ever and it was SOOOOOOOOOO bomb like I can't explain to you the amount of love I have for the oysters in the world. Also...I am such a big clam chowder critic and might I add that this was 10/10! Great service. Loved Andy (I think that was his name) our waiter was impeccable and gave us great suggestions on what to eat. Also we ordered the Fog Harbor Lager and it was so good. Very repetitive yelp review because I'm drunk from that beer LMAO love this place

excerpts: Seafood tower was delicious, oysters were briney and delicious, not too creamy for our taste.
FANTASTIC dirty martini (see photo below), ice crystals and all!
oysters.author: Amy F.
oysters.review: Wonderful attentive service!  Seafood tower was delicious, oysters were briney and delicious, not too creamy for our taste.  FANTASTIC dirty martini (see photo below), ice crystals and all!

excerpts: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer.
oysters.author: Victor A.
oysters.review: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer. For our main course we had the Filet mignon

excerpts: We had cioppino, half shell of oysters, and linguini with clams.
And Yes!
we love seafood..
Everything came out very delicious!
My fav. is cioppino (my server reccommended)
the seafood is very fresh and the flavors are just right!
Overall, I love everything about this place.
Price is resonable for what you get...
Also the service from our server was phenomenonal...his name is Arrif?
(apologize on my spelling) he can read our mind, just provided everything that we needed!
oysters.author: Ryan Y.
oysters.review:
Went there with my girlfriend on Friday for dinner...We absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
The food and service are amazing. We had cioppino, half shell of oysters, and linguini with clams. And Yes! we love seafood..Everything came out very delicious! My fav. is cioppino (my server reccommended) the seafood is very fresh and the flavors are just right! Overall, I love everything about this place. Price is resonable for what you get...Also the service from our server was phenomenonal...his name is Arrif? (apologize on my spelling) he can read our mind, just provided everything that we needed!

excerpts: We feasted on fresh oysters, grilled oysters, the clam chowder, and a plate of pickles...
oysters.author: Serena H.
oysters.review:
Our must-stop was Fog Harbor. We had oyster and stews and the ocean breeze on our minds. Luckily we arrived before the lunch rush, and got a seat outside to enjoy the wonderful 65 weather (in December!). 

We feasted on fresh oysters, grilled oysters, the clam chowder, and a plate of pickles...We were in heaven. 

My mom kept saying the entire time "I'm taking your father here!"

excerpts: Of course, can't forget the fresh shucked oysters.
Yum!
oysters.author: Candice T.
oysters.review:
Came here for dinner to celebrate NYE. We got a hold of the restaurant to ensure that they were open. Luckily, they were open until midnight. We were told that they weren't accepting any reservations and they were expecting a large amount of diners. We arrived at a perfect time because the wait was only 20 minutes. Yaaaaaaasssssss!!!!!!!!!! 

The fireplace outside the waiting room helped a lot especially for this cold weather. Burrrrrrr!!! Finally, we were directed to our table and oh man we got the indoor patio with a panoramic bay view. A perfect dinner with a great view to end the year was fantastic. Of course, can't forget the fresh shucked oysters. Yum!

excerpts: The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch.
It's very clear they take pride in their food.
oysters.author: Liz W.
oysters.review: Service was great. Food was fantastic. Wine selection is on point. The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch. It's very clear they take pride in their food.

excerpts: Oysters were tasty but pricey.
oysters.author: Paige R.
oysters.review: Food and service were good and the view was nice. Very busy but we didn't wait long for our meal. Oysters were tasty but pricey.

excerpts: Awesome staff, we ordered a few rounds of cocktails, a clam chowder bread bowl with crab, a clam chowder and caesar salad combo, calamari and some oysters.
oysters.author: Jennifer F.
oysters.review:
I used to live in SF and so when we went to visit a few weekends ago I told my boyfriend to look up some seafood spots in the city.  He settled on a location at Pier 39?!?! My past life in SF told me "Seriously?? Pier 39?!" But to my surprise we gave my friend a call and she said that she thought the exact same thing but they have the best clam chowder ever.  She was right. 

We got there put our names in for a table about 30 min wait but they text you when the table is ready which is great since you can then wander around Pier 39.  But we ended up scoring a seat at the bar within about 5 mins so we just ate there.  Awesome staff, we ordered a few rounds of cocktails, a clam chowder bread bowl with crab, a clam chowder and caesar salad combo, calamari and some oysters.  

Tab price wasn't too bad and it was a gorgeous restaurant, good service, great food and gorgeous views! We will be back!!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill.
Everything was soooo tasty.
Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times.
It's hard to get my boyfriend
and I full,
but I left stuffed!
The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.
oysters.author: Jeca D.
oysters.review: Tyler was great. My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill. Everything was soooo tasty. Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times. It's hard to get my boyfriend and I full, but I left stuffed! The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.

excerpts: Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole.
All of it was perfect.
Salads were good, bread delish.
Can't say enough good things about it.
We will definitely be back!!
oysters.author: DARIA O.
oysters.review: We had the best dinner here! Our server Anya was awesome, the view was great, and the food was ah-mazing! Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole. All of it was perfect. Salads were good, bread delish. Can't say enough good things about it. We will definitely be back!!

excerpts: Amazinggggg food, specially the grilled butter chili oysters.
Worth the waif of half n hr.
oysters.author: Divya K.
oysters.review:
Amazinggggg food, specially the grilled butter chili oysters.
Worth the waif of half n hr.

excerpts: We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne.
The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce.
It was so good!
The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat.
The seafood penne was not too greasy
and it was huge.
oysters.author: Allie Y.
oysters.review:
I came here  for a date night. At first, we were scared that this could be a tourist trap since it is in the heart of Pier 39. We wanted to go somewhere with a nice view and good seafood so we chose this place.

We waited about 20 mins for our complimentary bread and butter to come out. The waiter told us that it was still baking in the oven. When it came out, it was freshly baked so i didn't complain.

The food was amazing! We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne. The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce. It was so good! The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat. The seafood penne was not too greasy and it was huge. All of the seafood tasted very fresh!

Something that bothered me was that there were desserts laying out in random places of the restaurants. It seemed unsanitary to me.

The service was not bad. It took a while for our food to come out on a Saturday evening but i'm not complaining since the food tasted good. The prices are decent for seafood, location, and the gorgeous view. There is no outside seating but you can request for a table next to the window with the beautiful ocean view. 

I'd come back!

excerpts: The oysters were pretty good, the fish and chips were cooked perfectly and really tasty, and the whole Dungeness crab was delicious.
Overall, great experience and would totally recommend.
oysters.author: Caitlin K.
oysters.review:
Was able to snag a reservation here when visiting San Francisco in September of last year. It was a really wonderful meal! From the outside, the restaurant may appear a little touristy and cookie cutter, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our party had requested a table by the window and the view was AMAZING. Watched the sunset and all the seals in the water right off the Pier - would highly recommend for anyone celebrating. 

We started with wine, which was delicious and not horribly overpriced. The oysters were pretty good, the fish and chips were cooked perfectly and really tasty, and the whole Dungeness crab was delicious. Overall, great experience and would totally recommend.

excerpts: The lobster tail and the oysters were ok, I suppose.
The foods were super bland compared to other seafood places I've been to.
Would I come back and order the same menu items?
No.
oysters.author: Quynh T.
oysters.review: Enjoyed the Alcatraz Escape cocktail, but the Shellfish Platter with pasta and Crab Ceviche didn't live up to the hype. The shrimp had a weird after taste. The lobster tail and the oysters were ok, I suppose. The foods were super bland compared to other seafood places I've been to. Would I come back and order the same menu items? No.

excerpts: Ordered cocktail oysters.
I was trying it out for the first time, loved it with sauces they provided.
They were a bit smaller than expected but totally worth it!
There clam chowder is really out of the world.
It is Creamy, has the presence of clams and not potatoes.
oysters.author: Jaslin T.
oysters.review:
We came here as my in laws came from out of town. I love love the location of this restaurant. We got seats with the best view :) yaaay!! Ordered cocktail oysters. I was trying it out for the first time, loved it with sauces they provided. They were a bit smaller than expected but totally worth it! There clam chowder is really out of the world. It is Creamy, has the presence of clams and not potatoes. We also ordered a mixed grill. The shrimps on the platter tasted amazing!
Ciopinno ah that was my first time. Fresh clams, mussels, fish and crab legs in it. We were able to crack the crabs ourselves thus we didn't order lazy ciopinno :) yum is the word!

excerpts: Also had the Shell Fish Tower appetizer, dungeons crab, lobster, oysters, jumbo shrimp...tasty!
oysters.author: Stuart Y.
oysters.review: Great fresh seafood!  Little pricy but....did I say great fresh seafood!  The ceviche was excellent!  Only came with 4, yes count them 1,2,3,4, but just ask for more and no problem.  Also had the Shell Fish Tower appetizer, dungeons crab, lobster, oysters, jumbo shrimp...tasty!

excerpts: We also started our meal with oysters, which were fresh.
oysters.author: Lisa H.
oysters.review:
This place is excellent if you are visiting San Francisco and are craving seafood! It is near Fisherman's Wharf with a great view and plenty to do before and after the meal, making it perfect for a meal on your day out! 

We had cocktails during happy hour (bartender's choice), and they were perfectly designed for each of us based on what we like! They bartenders were all very friendly and helpful; they were present, but not pushy. 

I had the swordfish, and it was wonderful! It was light and flavorful! My friend had the sole, which we had never tried before! We also started our meal with oysters, which were fresh. The cocktail sauce was a little spicy, so don't take too much at a time if you don't like a little kick!

To top of the excellent staff and the great food, the view cannot be beat! We didn't have to wait too long at all for seats by the window. If you go, definitely request seating near it because it's so beautiful!

excerpts: We ended up staying for more than just drinks and oysters and Jason N was excellent every step of the way.
I always expect some witty banter and jokes from the bartender
but Jason went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience, which we did.
It was more than just ensuring our drinks were full and cold, he always checked in with us and did it with a smile on his face.
What really put him at 5 stars for me was how well he handled an issue with our meal.
We brought up the issue not thinking much about it, but Jason went above our expectations, brought it up with his manager to help ensure we could really enjoy our meal and dining experience.
As far as the food, I enjoyed the oysters very much!
Really fresh and perfect start to our meal.
oysters.author: Crystal R.
oysters.review:
My 5 star rating really reflects the amazing dining experience and customer service I received here a few weeks ago on a Sunday night at the bar. My sister and I came in when there was a 1.5 hour wait on Sunday night and decided to opt for the bar instead. Luckily, someone left so we grabbed two seats with a view to watch the Olympics, score! We ended up staying for more than just drinks and oysters and Jason N was excellent every step of the way. I always expect some witty banter and jokes from the bartender but Jason went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience, which we did. It was more than just ensuring our drinks were full and cold, he always checked in with us and did it with a smile on his face. What really put him at 5 stars for me was how well he handled an issue with our meal.
