We brought up the issue not thinking much about it, but Jason went above our expectations, brought it up with his manager to help ensure we could really enjoy our meal and dining experience. I rarely get such wonderful service and definitely wanted to mention it because it made all the difference for us! 

As far as the food, I enjoyed the oysters very much! Really fresh and perfect start to our meal. I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables. I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub. My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well. I also tried out their two signature bourbon cocktails which were wonderful, although the old fashioned was a bit too sweet for me.

Overall, my dining experience at Fog Harbor at their bar was wonderful! I would definitely recommend others to try them out.

excerpts: We tried the fresh oysters, steamed clams, clam chowder, calamari, poke, fish and chips, and linguini.
They were all excellent!
We will definitely come back!
oysters.author: Meghan B.
oysters.review: We were hesitant to come here because we thought it would be too touristy, but the experience, the ambiance, the views, and the food are all incredible. Our server Eddy was phenomenal. He was fun-loving and made our dinner one we will never forget! We tried the fresh oysters, steamed clams, clam chowder, calamari, poke, fish and chips, and linguini. They were all excellent! We will definitely come back!

excerpts: I came here strictly for oysters
and they were PHENOMENAL.
I also tried the clam chowder and it was by far the best I have had on the west coast!!!
oysters.author: Annie H.
oysters.review:
Awesome view of the bay and Alcatraz!! I came here strictly for oysters and they were PHENOMENAL. I also tried the clam chowder and it was by far the best I have had on the west coast!!! The ambiance was very calm and family oriented, but still upbeat! 

The only thing I did not like was that for such an affordable prices menu, their cocktails were extremely expensive. Most were between $10-$15. Besides that, everything else was great!!

excerpts: Had their own version of Oysters Rockefeller.
Succulent and luscious.
Codfish special was excellent.
Prepared in a frying pan but not fried.
Does that make sense?
Shrimp over spinach, potatoes and butternut squash was another winner.
And yet another big winner was the waiter who never allowed my Grey Goose on the rocks to go dry.
Windows had a clear view of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz Island....
Well as clear as you can get with the always present fog.
Giving these guys a well earned 4 star review.
Lively spot.
Worth the visit.
oysters.author: Gary M.
oysters.review: Another winner thanks to my Yelp friends for recommending.  Had their own version of Oysters Rockefeller. Succulent and luscious. Codfish special was excellent.  Prepared in a frying pan but not fried. Does that make sense? Shrimp over spinach, potatoes and butternut squash was another winner. And yet another big winner was the waiter who never allowed my Grey Goose on the rocks to go dry. Windows had a clear view of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz Island.... Well as clear as you can get with the always present fog. Giving these guys a well earned 4 star review. Lively spot. Worth the visit.

excerpts: She has really been craving raw oysters on the half shell and I decided to treat her.
Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint!
Between us, we ate at least 48 oysters!
She loved it!
I was impressed with the freshness and the quickness of of oysters delivered to our table.
oysters.author: B H.
oysters.review: My wife and I visited this restaurant during our July 4th get-away. She has really been craving raw oysters on the half shell and I decided to treat her. Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint! Between us, we ate at least 48 oysters! She loved it! I was impressed with the freshness and the quickness of of oysters delivered to our table. We also loved the fried calamari, Ahi Poke & crab cake(s)! The ambiance was great also. As we dined , we had a good view of the harbor & ocean near Pier 39. The service was great! Our waiter brought everything to the table fresh , hot or cold and he was always smiling! Despite a 20min.  wait to be seated, we both had a great experience dining @ Fog Harbor Fish House! Highly recommend!!!

excerpts: The oysters were small af and the steamed clams tasted so bad.
The waitress I got was so rude.
She intentionally made some noises while she was moving my plates and her attitude was terrible.
oysters.author: Mason Y.
oysters.review: This was one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. The oysters were small af and the steamed clams tasted so bad. The waitress I got was so rude. She intentionally made some noises while she was moving my plates and her attitude was terrible.

excerpts: Baked oysters were incredible.
Crab cakes were fresh and had real crab.
It was the best place for oysters I have experienced during my week long trip.
Highly recommended!!
oysters.author: Theresa B.
oysters.review: Baked oysters were incredible. Crab cakes were fresh and had real crab. It was the best place for oysters I have experienced during my week long trip. Highly recommended!!

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, oysters and scallops special with apple pie cobbler dessert.
Definitely recommend and will come back again!
oysters.author: Austin W.
oysters.review: Everything was excellent!! From the views and the delicious food all the selections were magnificent. We ordered the clam chowder, oysters and scallops special with apple pie cobbler dessert. Definitely recommend and will come back again!

excerpts: , the oysters were good and fresh (but if u just want oysters go somewhere else this place is more for a full meal dining experience)
the muscle fries I wasn't a big fan of I think it had a little bit too much truffle
but that's just me personally.
For dessert we got the Blondie brownie which was amazing!
I loved how they had a tray of all their desserts prepared for us to see and choose from.
All and all the experience was a solid 4 stars..... good food, great service, and a great view from our table.
Price is what is expected for a Pier 39 seafood resteraunt, not cheap but not over what we were expecting.
oysters.author: Shannan E.
oysters.review: For starters any place on Pier 39 is going to have a wait but they have a system where you give them your phone number and they text you when your table is ready so you can go explore around the pier while you wait. There is also a cozy fireplace and couches if you want to wait outside the restaurant. Service was great. As for the food we ordered the seafood mix, Cioppino, fresh oyster appetizer, and muscle frys appetizer.... I will tell you the Cioppino was good I have had a few places cook it a little better but that doesn't mean that it was not good, the seafood mix was amazing I loved the fresh butter and kind of garlic herb taste it had, the oysters were good and fresh (but if u just want oysters go somewhere else this place is more for a full meal dining experience) the muscle fries I wasn't a big fan of I think it had a little bit too much truffle but that's just me personally. For dessert we got the Blondie brownie which was amazing! I loved how they had a tray of all their desserts prepared for us to see and choose from. All and all the experience was a solid 4 stars..... good food, great service, and a great view from our table. Price is what is expected for a Pier 39 seafood resteraunt, not cheap but not over what we were expecting.

excerpts: Oysters and food was on deck!
oysters.author: Meishi M.
oysters.review: Great restaurants and great place for family dining. Food was great no complaints at all. Oysters and food was on deck!

excerpts: I had the clam chowder bread bowl with the baked oysters appetizer.
It was amazing the chowder was creamy and delicious.
The oysters were rich in flavor but extremely hot when they bring them to you so dont burn your tongue.
The overall experience was amazing and i will definitely be back
oysters.author: Kassy M.
oysters.review: I had the clam chowder bread bowl with the baked oysters appetizer. It was amazing the chowder was creamy and delicious. The oysters were rich in flavor but extremely hot when they bring them to you so dont burn your tongue. The overall experience was amazing and i will definitely be back

excerpts: I had the mussels and the oysters for lunch and it wasgreat!
The mussels are an appetizers but the portion is gigantic!
Service was friendly and efficient and the wait announced (15 minutes) was shorter than expeced!
oysters.author: Stephanie L.
oysters.review: Great seafood, great view, good vibes! I had the mussels and the oysters for lunch and it wasgreat! The mussels are an appetizers but the portion is gigantic! Service was friendly and efficient and the wait announced (15 minutes) was shorter than expeced!

excerpts: All we ordered were fresh oysters and a appetizer platter.!!!
Really ...not only that we havent gotton our refill on some freaking water....
never offered hot bread!!!
4 different times they have come to our table thinking it FINALLY our food!!
Nope these people getting wrong plates to wrong peoples table!!!
Im so disappointed!!
oysters.author: Monique M.
oysters.review: Zero Stars for this place.....sitting here waiting on our food and everyone who ordered after us have gotten thier food!!! All we ordered were fresh oysters and a appetizer platter.!!!  Really ...not only that we havent gotton our refill on some freaking water.... never offered hot bread!!! 4 different times they have come to our table thinking it FINALLY our food!! Nope these people getting wrong plates to wrong peoples table!!! Im so disappointed!!

excerpts: I ordered the Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab for an entrée and raw oysters for the appetizer.
The crab came with baby potatoes and seasoned vegetables.
oysters.author: Stephanie H.
oysters.review:
I was a little skeptical about eating at an expensive restaurant because I always leave hungry. Lol. 

I ordered the Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab for an entrée and raw oysters for the appetizer. The crab came with baby potatoes and seasoned vegetables. Sooooo good and plentiful. 

On top of that, my waiter was fine. His name is Pierre. Not only was the view from our table beautiful, but so was his smile. 

I'd definitely go back! Lol

excerpts: Wonderful raw oysters, yummy clam chowder, and you have to try the clams linguine.
The best I ever had!
So flavorful.
We had a beautiful and amazing seat next to the window and got to see the sunset.
I would highly recommend this restaurant!
oysters.author: Karen G.
oysters.review: We had a great experience at this restaurant after picking it off of a Yelp review 10 minutes earlier. We were in San Francisco to see the Blue Angels and we decided to try this restaurant. The wait wasn't as long as they had quoted and they have this great texting system when your table is ready . Tyler was a fantastic, attentive and helpful server. He even brought my daughter a birthday dessert and sang happy birthday with us . I didn't think this restaurant did that kind of thing (and we had 3 little kids with us BTW) . The food was great.  Wonderful raw oysters, yummy clam chowder, and you have to try the clams linguine. The best I ever had! So flavorful. We had a beautiful and amazing seat next to the window and got to see the sunset. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

excerpts: We sat at the bar and ordered a full dinner - oysters, clam chowder in a bread bowl with crab, crab/mango/avocado ceviche, and crab cake.
We might have overdone the crab but YOLO, amirite?
These things plus the warm sourdough bread and butter were perfect!
oysters.author: Jayci G.
oysters.review:
A little spendy coming from Dallas, but probably in line for SFO. At any rate, everything was great!

We sat at the bar and ordered a full dinner - oysters, clam chowder in a bread bowl with crab, crab/mango/avocado ceviche, and crab cake. We might have overdone the crab but YOLO, amirite? These things plus the warm sourdough bread and butter were perfect!

excerpts: We had the oysters... so fresh.
Excellent seafood.
We sat at the bar... view was amazing.
Drinks were outstanding.
Mohitos and a lipstick lemon drop.
Awesome!!!!
oysters.author: Jeff F.
oysters.review: Incredibly delicious food. We had the oysters... so fresh. Excellent seafood. We sat at the bar... view was amazing. Drinks were outstanding. Mohitos and a lipstick lemon drop. Awesome!!!!

excerpts: apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters.
Both were delicious!
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
oysters.author: Julia M.
oysters.review:
Very ambivalent about this place. First downside is that they don't take reservations so when we (locals) wanted to go here at 7 PM on a Saturday night, we knew we'd have to wait a while. It ended up taking about 45 minutes.

PROS
-Amazing views! We got seated in the area right on the water. The sun was setting right behind the GGB. It was great. 
-We couldn't decide which bottle of wine we wanted so the waiter let us all taste both! They have a pretty good wine selection.
-For apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters. Both were delicious! The baked oysters were great in an interesting way... Spinach, bacon, and cheese, yum!

CONS
-Once we decided which wine we wanted, it took the waiter a realllllly long time to actually bring out our bottle (at least 20 minutes).
-Our mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic! Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad... It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top. When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon. So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab. While it was very good, there was nothing with it. I was, at least, expecting some butter to dip my crab in.

Again, really ambivalent about this place because the food was pretty good but there were just a few blunders. It's also pretty expensive here.

excerpts: Just came back from fog harbor service, drinks, crabcakes, and oysters were wonderful.
However the fish and chips were terrible!
They were an unappetizing dark color.
I think they refried the fish and chips that was a mistake order.
When I sat down I ordered oysters and crab cake first then
about 10 minutes later I ordered the fish and chip and some how the fish and chips came out to our table only 5 minutes later.
There is no way the fish and chips can be cooked in five minutes.
oysters.author: Chu T.
oysters.review: Just came back from fog harbor service, drinks, crabcakes, and oysters were wonderful. However the fish and chips were terrible! They were an unappetizing dark color. I think they refried the fish and chips that was a mistake order. When I sat down I ordered oysters and crab cake first then about 10 minutes later I ordered the fish and chip and some how the fish and chips came out to our table only 5 minutes later. There is no way the fish and chips can be cooked in five minutes.

excerpts: We shared the clam chowder, wedge salad (a personal fave of mine) and one of the seafood towers (oysters, shrimp, crab legs).
Everything was great.
Its pretty classy looking on the inside
but we were in casual clothes
having just come from Alcatraz and it wasn't a problem.
oysters.author: Debra D.
oysters.review: Came here with my partner in April cause I was in the mood for seafood. We shared the clam chowder, wedge salad (a personal fave of mine) and one of the seafood towers (oysters, shrimp, crab legs). Everything was great. Its pretty classy looking on the inside but we were in casual clothes having just come from Alcatraz and it wasn't a problem.

excerpts: Good oysters, clam chowder, and lobster.
My family got a seafood grill and the surf n turf entree.
The seafood here is above average but to be honest with the price and it being right next to the ocean
it should be a given.
We ordered the steak medium and it was completely well done.
The grilled fish were pretty dry as well.
The best part is the bird shit on the window.
Still, I really enjoyed the oysters and lobster.
oysters.author: Hantine H.
oysters.review:
Good oysters, clam chowder, and lobster. My family got a seafood grill and the surf n turf entree. The seafood here is above average but to be honest with the price and it being right next to the ocean it should be a given. 
We ordered the steak medium and it was completely well done. The grilled fish were pretty dry as well. The best part is the bird shit on the window. 
Still, I really enjoyed the oysters and lobster.

excerpts: The oysters were quite nice, and I liked the mignonette.
The presentation totally sucked-
the receptacle was too big for the portion so it just looked cheaply done.
The clam chowder is nothing special-
it tasted like an average diner's soup.
I have had much better!
I had the fried combo- awful!
The fish batter was claggy and soggy.
The shrimp and calamari tasted like something on Hometown Buffet - out of a box and rubbery.
Terrible!
The swordfish was perfectly cooked, which was impressive, but the flavor and seasoning was off.
Totally bummed as we expected a really WOW meal.
oysters.author: Mo F.
oysters.review: The seafood tower was unimpressive to say the least. The shrimp were totally over cooked and were not fresh tasting, as was the lobster. The oysters were quite nice, and I liked the mignonette. The presentation totally sucked- the receptacle was too big for the portion so it just looked cheaply done.  The clam chowder is nothing special- it tasted like an average diner's soup. I have had much better!  I had the fried combo- awful! The fish batter was claggy and soggy. The shrimp and calamari tasted like something on Hometown Buffet - out of a box and rubbery. Terrible! The swordfish was perfectly cooked, which was impressive, but the flavor and seasoning was off.  Totally bummed as we expected a really WOW meal.

excerpts: Ordered the baked oysters, clam chowder cup and crab cakes.
They were good.
They weren't New Orleans
seafood good.
oysters.author: Matthew D.
oysters.review:
Came in at 1230 on a Saturday. Pretty busy although only waited 15 minutes at the bar before a table with an awesome view of the bay became free. Saying that - sitting at the bar listening to an angry bartender bitch about his "f$cking sh1t" work colleagues for 15 minutes was funny/annoying.

I got carded (I'm 29..!) so they wouldn't serve me alcohol. But it's cool, I should have brought my ID.

Ordered the baked oysters, clam chowder cup and crab cakes. They were good. They weren't New Orleans seafood good. The clam chowder was the best of the bunch.

Overall, food a 4, service a 2, so this gets a 3.

excerpts: We started with oysters Rockefeller.
Amazing!
My wife had a shrimp cocktail and the fried seafood platter.
oysters.author: Petey C.
oysters.review: We started with oysters Rockefeller. Amazing! My wife had a shrimp cocktail and the fried seafood platter. I ordered the blue cheese wedge and the jumbo scallops over risotto. The food was very good and the service was very prompt. The only knock I have is every table but ours had bread, and our entrees showed up early and we didn't have a chance to really enjoy our salads.

excerpts: We start off with the baked oysters and calamari.
oysters.author: Tram T.
oysters.review: Five stars for the service! Our server was super attentive and very nice. He made sure to check on us and refilled our drinks. As for the food it was okay. We start off with the baked oysters and calamari. For entrees we had the linguine with clams and Dungeness cioppino. The food was mediocre. I rather go to swan or hog island next than come back here.

excerpts: Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino.
I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal!
oysters.author: Jodi H.
oysters.review:
Came here for the 2015 SF Restaurant Week with my family on a Sunday night for dinner ($40 dinner menu per person) and EVERYTHING was fabulous and delicious.

I highly recommend coming here. As a born-and-raised NorCal kiddo and lover of all things seafood (shoutout to pescatarians), I gotta hand it to the crew at Fog Harbor. Y'all were ON YOUR GAME that night! I'll be recommending this place to anyone looking for the quintessential San Francisco meal with a romantic, classy, and worthwhile dining experience. 

The service from start to finish was undeniably amazing. We reserved for an early dinner around 4PM, but couldn't make it (coming from South Bay) until 7:30PM for many reasons. But even though we were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes, before we knew it we were seated after only 3 minutes! We were seated at a booth on the lower level a distance from the panoramic windows, but we loved having the grand space for our dining experience. Our server was very understanding, cracked a few jokes here and there, and was just the right amount of "leave us alone/serve us." I gotta give props to the manager of the night who personally went around to all of the tables to offer an amuse-bouche...we thought it was because of SFRW, but he literally went around to all of the tables! 

The food!! MAN!! That deserves its own rating. The four of us ordered all of the starters, entrees, and desserts (since there were only 3 selections, we double'd on the chocolate cake...best decision ever). FOODGASMS to the max, y'all. Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino. I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal! By the time desserts rolled around we were all delightfully satisfied, but loosened our belts for the BEST melt-in-your-mouth-chocolate cake and surprisingly yummy bread pudding! 

Fog Harbor is not a joke. Nor is it a tourist trap. It's got dedicated management, a classy service team, and an unbeatable view at Pier 39. Maybe I'm still reeling from my SFRW high, but it's worth a visit...trust me!

excerpts: We started with the Sour dough bread and oysters.
But the star of the show were the red pepper shrimp and the crab in garlic butter.
oysters.author: Nasir M.
oysters.review:
A straight four for the location and the food. We went there for our anniversary lunch and were promptly seated after a short wait.  The view of the Pier and the Golden Gate was just amazing. We started with the Sour dough bread and oysters. But the star of the show were the red pepper shrimp and the crab in garlic butter. Since we were doing only sea food we took the mixed platter - the salmon was amazing and so were the grilled shrimp. 
Overall had a wonderful time with the sun being a little beneficent on us and granting us the spectacular views of the bay as well.

excerpts: My husband and son ordered grilled oysters which they enjoyed.
My husband also ordered the fried shrimp which came with fries.
The fried shrimp was nothing spectacular.
They were comparable to the fried shrimp at Friday's.
My son ordered a burger and fries.
I tasted his burger and it was bland.
Disappointed to say that the fries and their fresh bread were the tastiest thing that they served us.
The rest was meh.
We were disappointed overall.
oysters.author: Glorimar W.
oysters.review:
We were not impressed with this restaurant. The food was ok. I ordered their shrimp cocktail. It was like $16 with just a few large shrimp, nothing spectacular. My husband and son ordered grilled oysters which they enjoyed. My husband also ordered the fried shrimp which came with fries. The fried shrimp was nothing spectacular. They were comparable to the fried shrimp at Friday's. My son ordered a burger and fries. I tasted his burger and it was bland. Disappointed to say that the fries and their fresh bread were the tastiest thing that they served us. The rest was meh. We were disappointed overall. We won't be back.


Answer to the comment below:  We were there on Thursday, October 19th. Comment asks me to
Contact Bob but no contact info is provided. Do they just expect me to call the restaurant? No email, no special phone number. Generic response. Also read the same exact response to another review. Word for word. Just cut and paste. Wow. I too was led to this place by all the positive reviews. Felt it was important to post our family's experience.

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.
All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.
Presentation of the food was on point!
oysters.author: DeeDee J.
oysters.review: Had an amazing dining experience!  The hostess sat the two of us in a large half-round booth, and our server was wonderful and accommodating.  We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.  All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.  Presentation of the food was on point!

excerpts: oysters and the blue cheese garlic bread.
We really liked the view of Alcatraz and the bay.
The oysters were great and the bread was good.
The place was crowded but it was a Saturday
so I expect the wait would have been pretty long had we been waiting on a table.
oysters.author: Eddie N' Hailee S.
oysters.review: We sat at the bar and just had drinks, oysters and the blue cheese garlic bread. We really liked the view of Alcatraz and the bay. The oysters were great and the bread was good. The place was crowded but it was a Saturday so I expect the wait would have been pretty long had we been waiting on a table.

excerpts: We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder.
Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot.
However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized.
For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving.
So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf.
Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning
and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees.
oysters.author: Whitney C.
oysters.review:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.

excerpts: I got a pair of oysters which were good ($2.50 each) but there was some wasabi or something in the sauce which was a bit too much.
I had a bowl of clam chowder in the rather shallow bowl but this is one of the best chowders I've had.
I think I'm weird and like different chowders than anyone
but I like a tad thick with no potatoes and not so milky.
This was gooood.
I also had the linguini with clams which tasted light and had a few clams.
That was enough to fill two people.
Well on top we had two loads of the free bread haha.
oysters.author: Amy H.
oysters.review: I came here right after the tree lighting so I was luckily able to get seats after 10 minutes of waiting. Unfortunately we didn't get seats near the window for a view but I had a pretty good view anyway :) I got a pair of oysters which were good ($2.50 each) but there was some wasabi or something in the sauce which was a bit too much. I had a bowl of clam chowder in the rather shallow bowl but this is one of the best chowders I've had. I think I'm weird and like different chowders than anyone but I like a tad thick with no potatoes and not so milky. This was gooood. I also had the linguini with clams which tasted light and had a few clams. That was enough to fill two people. Well on top we had two loads of the free bread haha.

excerpts: Get the oysters!
All in all, what a memorable experience
We will certainly come back the next time we make it to San Francisco.
oysters.author: Sam M.
oysters.review: Wonderful evening! The night before the solar eclipse, golden hour casting it's glow on the Golden gate, and a wonderful dinner with wonderful friends...simply excellent :) Our server, Justin, was absolutely professional! I have dietary restrictions, and he took care of me every step of the way. The food was above average, and although I wont be giving out any michelin stars, we truly enjoyed our meal. Get the oysters! All in all, what a memorable experience :) We will certainly come back the next time we make it to San Francisco.

excerpts: We had raw oysters, fried bay scallops that were phenomenal and chowder in a bread bowl.
The food was delicious.
So glad we ate here.
You should eat here too :)
oysters.author: Tina A.
oysters.review: The food, the service and the view! We had raw oysters, fried bay scallops that were phenomenal and chowder in a bread bowl. The food was delicious. So glad we ate here. You should eat here too :)

excerpts: There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome.
Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing.
Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty.
From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant).
oysters.author: Anastasija V.
oysters.review:
We had a really great dinner here. Food is delicious, waiters are nice, atmosphere is lovely! 

Seafood is awesome. From starters we tried Crispy Calamari and they were super tasty. Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.  

Been here on Christmas Day - that day restaurant closed an opportunity to make a table reservation.
Restaurant was busy, we waited some time for table to get free. But waiting wasn't annoying. We had an opportunity to leave the name and phone number, so took a little walk around while waiting.

But anyway, we are super satisfied.
We definitely will come again.

Came back on a Valentines Day with friends. We were all satisfied again. This time we had both foods and deserts. Seafood was great just as the first time! There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome. Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing. Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty. From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant). Delicious! 

This time we hadn't any problems with time at all - had a reservation and service was pretty fast.

excerpts: The baked oysters are super yummy as a starter and the bread they bring you is also very impressive.
This is our "must go to" dinner spot when we visit SanFran.
oysters.author: Chris F.
oysters.review: Everything here was absolutely fantastic!!  We had the whole cooked Dungeness crab in chili sauce and it was so good!!  The baked oysters are super yummy as a starter and the bread they bring you is also very impressive. This is our "must go to" dinner spot when we visit SanFran.

excerpts: My husband and I shared the chowder in a sourdough Bread Bowl with the crab loaded on top for an extra six dollars along with 1/2 dozen of the freshest raw oysters.
oysters.author: Ashley S.
oysters.review:
Look no further! THE place on Pier 39 to have a beautiful lunch with a view! We were seated promptly and had a lovely waiter who had lots of fun stories. My husband and I shared the chowder in a sourdough Bread Bowl with the crab loaded on top for an extra six dollars along with 1/2 dozen of the freshest raw oysters. The hibiscus margarita was refreshing too! 

Just enough to fuel us up for more walking and sightseeing!

excerpts: We ordered oysters, roasted garlic crab and scallops.
The view was nice.
A little bit pricy but worth a try.
oysters.author: Am T.
oysters.review: Food was great. We ordered oysters, roasted garlic crab and scallops. The view was nice. A little bit pricy but worth a try.

excerpts: We ordered oysters and the sea food platter for two....we then realized that some tapatío would be essential for this meal... not because it lacked anything but cause we r Mexican.
Unfortunately they had none.
Marc the bartender and our server busted a Houdini and found us some tapatío to complement our perfect meal.
We are super pleased with our meal and with the great service from Marc.
oysters.author: Mark S.
oysters.review: We ordered oysters and the sea food platter for two....we then realized that some tapatío would be essential for this meal... not because it lacked anything but cause we r Mexican. Unfortunately they had none. Marc the bartender and our server busted a Houdini and found us some tapatío to complement our perfect meal. We are super pleased with our meal and with the great service from Marc.

excerpts:
We ordered the fried calamari, half dozen baked oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and their seasonal short rib dish with mashed potatoes

But the fried calamari came out on a generous size plate, the oysters were topped with a creamy sauce and bacon bits, the clam chowder had lots of clam chunks which is a plus!, and the short rib was super tender and flavorful.
oysters.author: Sheila B.
oysters.review:
Expect to wait up to an hour if you go during dinner time!

Overall setting was very nice. Pretty loud and semi causal restaurant or maybe it was just the table next to me lol. 

Our server was friendly and checked on us during our meal which is always a plus. 

We ordered the fried calamari, half dozen baked oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and their seasonal short rib dish with mashed potatoes

Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture ... But the fried calamari came out on a generous size plate, the oysters were topped with a creamy sauce and bacon bits, the clam chowder had lots of clam chunks which is a plus!, and the short rib was super tender and flavorful. 

Menu pricing varies for dishes, but overall a decent price for good quality compared to maybe the street food on the wharf.

excerpts: It has dungeness crab, mussels, shrimp, oysters, clams, and scallops in a creamy tomato broth.
It also comes with garlic bread.
We sat at the bar and I tried an oyster shot for the first time.
oysters.author: Kristen Nicole F.
oysters.review:
This place was the perfect restaurant to try San Francisco's popular Cioppino dish! If you love fresh seafood then this is the dish you'll want to try. It has dungeness crab, mussels, shrimp, oysters, clams, and scallops in a creamy tomato broth. It also comes with garlic bread. We sat at the bar and I tried an oyster shot for the first time. Pretty delicious too. 

The bartenders were friendly and you can tell it's a tourist place since it's right in Fisherman's Wharf. The view is amazing where you can see the harbor and watch the sunset if you go around dinner time. For the price of my dish, it was well worth it because it had a compilation of different seafood choices.

excerpts: We had the seafood platter and oysters.
The oysters were good, but the mussels in the seafood platter were over cooked and did not taste 100% fresh.
The crabs were pretty nice though.
oysters.author: Anh N.
oysters.review: We had the seafood platter and oysters. The oysters were good, but the mussels in the seafood platter were over cooked and did not taste 100% fresh. The crabs were pretty nice though.

excerpts: The oysters and calamari were excellent.
oysters.author: Mathew N.
oysters.review: Had a great dinner here tonight with the family. Started with a few appetizers to get a feel for the place. The oysters and calamari were excellent. For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon. We all enjoyed our food! We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive. My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh! Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!

excerpts: We ordered the raw oysters, clam chowder with crab, shellfish platter, and mixed seafood grill: oysters tasted fresh, chowder was thick and rich, and the shellfish platter was a huge portion of yumminess.
I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in a touristy spot, but we were surprised by the fresh tasting seafood and amazing service!
oysters.author: Amy C.
oysters.review: Stopped by this restaurant for the convenience, but was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the raw oysters, clam chowder with crab, shellfish platter, and mixed seafood grill: oysters tasted fresh, chowder was thick and rich, and the shellfish platter was a huge portion of yumminess. I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in a touristy spot, but we were surprised by the fresh tasting seafood and amazing service!

excerpts: I hate to bash a spot, but the oysters taste like crap, the steamed clams have corn in them (who does that) how can you screw up a bleu cheese wedge salad.
oysters.author: Frank C.
oysters.review:
Simply just not Good. I hate to bash a spot, but the oysters taste like crap, the steamed clams have corn in them (who does that) how can you screw up a bleu cheese wedge salad. On the bright side The coors light was good if this helps. 

Simply disappointed, dinner time ruined. I didn't complain and still tipped,  it's not the servers fault this places blows donkey nuts. 

I really don't know how all you yelpers gave this place 4 stars and over 2800 reviews, what the hell is wrong with all of you. Unreal. I'm done listening and taking a chance with the hype, this keeps happening more and more.

I'm just visiting SF but if anyone comes out to L.A. Please try the Santa Monica Seafood Market. Trust me!!!!

excerpts: My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ).
oysters.author: Adele F.
oysters.review:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, oysters, and fresh catch of the day: the pacific cod.
5 stars for the oysters -
They were sweet and fresh.
Clam chowder was good, but not the best I've tried in SF - 4 stars.
oysters.author: Kenneth Y.
oysters.review:
Great dining experience!

We were wandering around the pier area and wanted to find a good place for lunch. Luckily, there was no line around 11:30 am on New Years Eve and we were even able to get a seat with a view of the bay and the local sea lions. 

We ordered the clam chowder, oysters, and fresh catch of the day: the pacific cod. 5 stars for the oysters - They were sweet and fresh. Clam chowder was good, but not the best I've tried in SF - 4 stars. Pacific cod was also fresh and the portion was generous - 5 stars.

Our server, Martin, did a great job with delivering just the right level of energy, enthusiasm, and attention throughout our lunch - 5 stars.

Great job!

excerpts: Ordered a dozen raw oysters for $30 expecting some nice oysters for that price, all we got were a dozen of baby raw oysters, they were tiny, yet they served them.
I felt cheated.
To add insult to injury there was a $14 sf surcharge that apparently goes to pay for employee healthcare.
Should I  deduct from the 18% tip they expect?...
oysters.author: David L.
oysters.review: Typical tourist trap restaurant. Overpriced and small portions. Ordered a dozen raw oysters for $30 expecting some nice oysters for that price, all we got were a dozen of baby raw oysters, they were tiny, yet they served them. I felt cheated.  To add insult to injury there was a $14 sf surcharge that apparently goes to pay for employee healthcare. Should I  deduct from the 18% tip they expect?...

excerpts: We ordered the half dozen oysters and clam chowder for appetizers- excellent.
oysters.author: F H.
oysters.review: We ordered the half dozen oysters and clam chowder for appetizers- excellent.  Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.  Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.  The service is friendly and efficient, too!

excerpts: We started with oysters and never received any utensils to dress them with, so we poured the condiments on with reluctance.
Next came salads, which didn't dazzle us, but neither were they intolerable.
oysters.author: Taylor G.
oysters.review:
I really, really wanted to love this place, for a few reasons, but mostly because I'm visiting San Francisco and had a focus on cuisine while visiting.  I wish I could be more polite, but the truth is that I am disappointed that I wasted an evening here.  Across the dock from Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., we instantly noticed the mistake we had made by coming to this tourist trap area.  Face-palm #1.  

Our server was not unfriendly at all, but I felt rushed from the moment we were seated.  We made a semi-late reservation for a Monday night (Halloween!) and we had hoped that would give us a bit more leisurely pace for our meal.  I like those European style meals that take a couple hours, a few drinks, and heavy sighs of satisfaction at the end.  What we received was more like a calculated and rushed meal you'd expect at a mid-grade chain restaurant.  

We started with oysters and never received any utensils to dress them with, so we poured the condiments on with reluctance.  Next came salads, which didn't dazzle us, but neither were they intolerable.  I ordered the "fall special" of Pumpkin Curry Salmon, face-palm #2. My partner requested the "Jumbo" Scallops for his entree. My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.  Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.  My partner's meal?  Delicious.  BUT!  and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".  They were quite small, although tasty.  The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.  I would probably have a different attitude if the scallops were touted as sustainable and local instead of being labeled jumbo.  

I might have a more sunny outlook on this spot if I could have seen the view it's known for, but we had already lost the sunlight for the day and could only see the nighttime lights.  I wish I had tried the chowder they're known for, and maybe I would have been more impressed.

excerpts: Oysters were on point, clam chowder inside of a crispy yet soft bread bowl was delicious, and the  calamari drizzled with a bit of fresh lemon all cooked to perfection.
What more could you possible need?!
I would recommended this location in a heart if you're looking for good food, a better view, and a relaxing environment.
5/5 you darn gone good looking people.
oysters.author: Daniel K.
oysters.review:
My review may be a bit biased since I was sitting with an amazing view of the pier, water, and blue sky's with even more amazing company. The restaurant was clean with fresh sunlight lighting the entire restaurant. The waiters were lovely people doing a fantastic job catering to their patrons. I can't really think of a single thing I did not like about my experience at this spot. 

But more importantly, the food was wonderfully prepared and presented beautifully. Oysters were on point, clam chowder inside of a crispy yet soft bread bowl was delicious, and the  calamari drizzled with a bit of fresh lemon all cooked to perfection. What more could you possible need?! I would recommended this location in a heart if you're looking for good food, a better view, and a relaxing environment. 5/5 you darn gone good looking people.

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, baked oysters, linguini and clams.
Everything was delicious!
I have never had such decadent clam chowder in my life.
It was buttery, smooth, and not at all oily.
The flavors were vibrant without tasting 'fishy'.
The sourdough bread was a fantastic complement to my soup.
You know a restaurant is good when their bread is delicious.
It really was.
It was soft on the inside, and slightly crisp on the outside.
This is how bread should be.
The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious.
The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious.
My mother commented they were the "best oysters" she has ever tasted...and trust me, she's had a lot of them.
We also ordered the creme brûlée -- perfect, just perfect.
The strawberry tres leches cake was also very good.
I've made that type of cake before, and this one was rich in flavor and light in texture.
Not to mention, the service was great; overall, very sophisticated and accommodating.
We will definitely be back!
oysters.author: Camilla L.
oysters.review: I'm not a fish person, but after eating at the Fog Horn, I definitely am! After reading numerous reviews on Yelp, we decided to try this restaurant. Let me tell you -- it did not disappoint. Really beautiful place. The view is to die for! We ordered the clam chowder, baked oysters, linguini and clams. Everything was delicious! I have never had such decadent clam chowder in my life. It was buttery, smooth, and not at all oily. The flavors were vibrant without tasting 'fishy'. The sourdough bread was a fantastic complement to my soup. You know a restaurant is good when their bread is delicious. It really was. It was soft on the inside, and slightly crisp on the outside. This is how bread should be. The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious. My mother commented they were the "best oysters" she has ever tasted...and trust me, she's had a lot of them. We also ordered the creme brûlée -- perfect, just perfect. The strawberry tres leches cake was also very good. I've made that type of cake before, and this one was rich in flavor and light in texture. Not to mention, the service was great; overall, very sophisticated and accommodating. We will definitely be back!

excerpts: oysters were rockin!
oysters.author: Jenny L.
oysters.review:
The scenic view for the window seats
Service
the sourdough bread basket (complimentary)
clam chowder
clams appetizer
oysters were rockin!
Seared tuna main dish
Seabass main dish


main dishes were on point as well. my least fave was the swordfish, only due to texture and dryness than i like a fish to be. I was picking at other peoples dishes in my party since I had too much enjoyment of the appetizers and bread to have my own main dish. 

I'd definitely come back and bring more friends. Exactly what we wanted to have our visitors to experience for their first time being in SF. Thank you Fog Harbour Fish House and the Yelpers.

excerpts: I had the roasted Dungeness crab, hubby had oysters and chowder, kids had grilled salmon and a burger.
Also they did nice job of accommodating the child with food allergies.
oysters.author: Kirsten V.
oysters.review: Lovely seafood place in a super touristy area. Loved the view of the sea lion and bay from our table. Food was excellent and well prepared. I had the roasted Dungeness crab, hubby had oysters and chowder, kids had grilled salmon and a burger. Also they did nice job of accommodating the child with food allergies.

excerpts: We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special).
Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic.
Would recommend others for this place.
oysters.author: Chanyamat W.
oysters.review: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, linguine with clams, crab cocktail, oysters, and crab cakes.
Their food is all fresh and delicious.
On the linguine they weren't cheap about the amount of clams they put in the dish.
Which is awesome because I love clams.
Their oysters were soooo fresh.
I could seriously eat that everyday.
I slurped that baby down.
Everything was amazing.
We got to sit right by the window to see the wonderful view.
It was beautiful.
Definitely highly recommend.
You have to get their clam chowder.
oysters.author: Donna P.
oysters.review: Glad I came here with my mom, brother, and his wife. We ordered the clam chowder, linguine with clams, crab cocktail, oysters, and crab cakes. Their food is all fresh and delicious. On the linguine they weren't cheap about the amount of clams they put in the dish. Which is awesome because I love clams. Their oysters were soooo fresh. I could seriously eat that everyday. I slurped that baby down. Everything was amazing. We got to sit right by the window to see the wonderful view. It was beautiful. Definitely highly recommend. You have to get their clam chowder.

excerpts:
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
oysters.author: China D.
oysters.review:
Decided to grab seafood today and ended up here. The service was pretty good. Only thing was she did take long and forgot about out extra lemon, but hey it happens. 

The food was good. It was kind of pricey but as is seafood and it was good. Nothing to write home to mom about, but maybe cus I'm more of a Cajun creole girl.


 The halibut was fresh and yummy and the shrimp where cooked well. The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh. The rice was however flavorless. Wish they had a happy hour ;(    

Loved my margarita !! 

We ordered 
Moscow mule $12.50
Hibiscus margarita $12.50
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
Mixed grill $26

Total 

$115 with some extra state tax added on on top of the original tax. 


Will we go back ? Maybe not, unless for the view. there are far too many seafood spots to try to us to want to come back. Nothing extra special here. The view was however the best part. Overlooking the water and sunset. 

We got a window seat the a reservation had cancelled so it was a nice romantic dinner.

excerpts: The crispy calamari was good and the crab ravioli was very good (the special of the day), but our linguini and clams tasted fishy along with our oysters from our shellfish tower.
The shrimp off our shellfish tower were  mushy; the crab and lobster was decent, but expected better for a $200+ meal.
oysters.author: Amber W.
oysters.review: We were so excited to eat here after a long Bay cruise. Unfortunately we were very disappointed! We have been on a three week vacation and excited to have finally made it to San Francisco, and eat some good sea food. The atmosphere was excellent and our server was wonderful. However, our food was not so good. The crispy calamari was good and the crab ravioli was very good (the special of the day), but our linguini and clams tasted fishy along with our oysters from our shellfish tower. The shrimp off our shellfish tower were  mushy; the crab and lobster was decent, but expected better for a $200+ meal.

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters to start
and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on.
The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier!
I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve
(it complemented my meal nicely).
We then ordered our meals.
He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters.
It was such a nice surprise and great customer service.
He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters.
It was such a nice surprise and great customer service.
And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters!
oysters.author: Yessenia E.
oysters.review:
My boyfriend and I got the chance to eat here and let me tell you, this place is so good!! 

Scenery - We got a table overlooking Alcatraz, there are also views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the restaurant 

Food - We ordered the baked oysters to start and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on. The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier! I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve (it complemented my meal nicely). We then ordered our meals. I got the Mixed Grill (best swordfish I've ever had) and my boyfriend got the surf and turf (about $50). Everything was delicious. 10/10

Service - Quick and attentive. Our waiter was sent by the gods! He was so nice and always there when I needed him but not overly pushy. Our meal came before the appetizer. When I asked him about it, he said the kitchen must've gotten mixed up and asked if we still wanted it which I kindly refused. He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters. It was such a nice surprise and great customer service. And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters! So good!!

I will definitely be coming back and recommend as a great date restaurant!

excerpts: We also had the oysters, and seafood penne.
Both were good.
The chicken penne was ok.
The view is great too.
They do not take reservations but there can be a wait sometimes.
They only seat you when the entire party is present.
But its well worth the wait.
oysters.author: Shibani K.
oysters.review: Have been here twice now. Had a great experience both times. My family who is not very experimental and fussy about food loved this place. We are all seafood lovers and the seafood here was really fresh( the fish was literally caught that morning and you can feel the difference). If you like spicy food, do try the garlic chilli prawns app, it is really good. We also had the oysters, and seafood penne. Both were good. The chicken penne was ok. The view is great too. They do not take reservations but there can be a wait sometimes. They only seat you when the entire party is present. But its well worth the wait.

excerpts: The oysters on the half shell were fresh.
The steamed crab legs were delicious although a little drier than I'd like.
oysters.author: Suzanne Q.
oysters.review:
Great seafood restaurant in the middle of the touristy Pier 39. 

We started with the bleu cheese garlic bread (free with yelp check in) and as a non-bleu cheese fan, the bread was surprisingly tasty. The bleu cheese was very mild and broiled crisp on top. 

The clam chowder was thick, creamy with large chunks of clam-just the way a good chowder should be. The oysters on the half shell were fresh. The steamed crab legs were delicious although a little drier than I'd like. Drenching them in garlic butter definitely helped:)

I washed down all this garlicky seafood goodness with a Skinny Ginger Lemonade. Advertised as only 14 calories and made with Splenda, it was light and refreshing with fresh ginger shavings throughout.

excerpts: The seafood tower: Crab was sweet and fresh, Lobster was juicy, Oysters was delicious.
Main Dish: I had the mix grill: Swordfish was my fav.
It was buttery and sweet.
oysters.author: Mindy T.
oysters.review:
The food here was excellent. The ambiance was perfect. Our waiter Samir checked on us several times. The pace of the food was perfect. We were able to enjoy the Seafood Tower, our Main entre and even dessert. I made reservation for a window view and it was worth it. 

The seafood tower: Crab was sweet and fresh, Lobster was juicy, Oysters was delicious.
Main Dish: I had the mix grill: Swordfish was my fav. It was buttery and sweet. The Salmon was a bit dry but salmon is salmon. The Grilled Shrimp kabob was a bit tough - may be a little over cooked). 
My fiance had the Ahi-Tuna. The Tuna was huge and seared perfectly. The sauce was your typical mayo Japanese sauce drizzled over it. It was served on top of rice and veggies. The rice was perfect.
Dessert: We had the trio dessert - Creme Brulle, Whip, and warm brownie cake. (Grade A). 

Overall the price was right.

excerpts: They didn't explain which oysters were which.
oysters.author: Heejin L.
oysters.review:
Horrible tourist trap with horrible service and poorly cleaned seafood.
Had steamed clams and i got about 4 sandy ones. 
That I can somewhat overlook but the worst was the seafood tower. It came with 5 shrimp cocktails but like 4 out of the 5 shrimp had been deveined improperly. You can see brownish residue along where they deveined them. This is the first time I've come across that and I have eaten quite a bit of seafood.

The server barely checked up on us. The managers that came by would take forever to give us to-go boxes and no one would bring us the check until we asked, although we were clearly done. 

The food was not that great. The clam chowder wasnt bad and i liked that you can add crab to it.  The seafood tower was just ok. The seafood didn't seem that fresh and they cleaned the inside of the crab (where the tomalley is) really well [unlike the shrimp veins]. I personally love crab tomalley so I felt gipped. They didn't explain which oysters were which. And the tower only comes with half a lobster tail and a claw which I thought was rubbery and overcooked. 

The cioppino was not good. It seemed more like a watery pasta sauce. I actually took it home to add pasta to it and it was better that way.

excerpts: The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious.
oysters.author: Nika W.
oysters.review: I think this place is overrated for the price you pay. The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious. However, I ordered the Cioppino for my main course and was extremely disappointed. The seafood itself was good, but the tomato sauce was flavorless and, in my opinion, ruined the dish. The views from the restaurant were beautiful and the service was top-notch. However, I would not eat here again.

excerpts: The oysters and clams were not very fresh
so I had to eat it with a lot of sauce to get rid of the fishy taste.
The calamari was very salty.
Everything was average, nothing especially great.
oysters.author: Ada Z.
oysters.review: Came to Fisherman's Wharf on vacation to San Francisco. Friends recommended Fog Harbor so we came for lunch. The atmosphere is nice and the view of the harbor is great. The bread bowl clam chowder was not bad but I would say overrated. The oysters and clams were not very fresh so I had to eat it with a lot of sauce to get rid of the fishy taste. The calamari was very salty. Everything was average, nothing especially great.

excerpts: so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder.
oysters.author: Kay D.
oysters.review:
Fog Harbor starts with freshly baked sourdough bread. I ate with family so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder. For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo. Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked. The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino. 

The restaurant has great atmosphere and great service! We enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely come back.

excerpts: 1 or more dozen Oysters (Really fresh) and
oysters.author: Jadya C.
oysters.review:
U live in Bay area...U get visitors...they all want to go to Pier 39...U have been there million times...U hate touristy things...but yet YOU HAVE TO.....Sounds familiar.....then you have come to the right place my friend.....

Tell your friends, family, in-laws (Out-laws)....to stroll on the Pier...buy some things at Lefty's...Go to Ghirardelli Square...blah blah...and meet me at Fog Harbor after 2-3 hours...

1/2, 1 or more dozen Oysters (Really fresh) and Bottle of Jordan or Sonoma Cutrer or if you are that lucky a Kisstler ;) ...and enjoy the afternoon...

When the tourists are back.....njoy SF specials such as Clam Chowder, Cioppino, or Grilled seafood.....and of course more Wine ;)

excerpts: Muscles, Oysters, tuna poke, clam linguine, and much more!!!
All of them were phenomenal.
Drinks were also incredible.
Must try in SF!
oysters.author: Meline N.
oysters.review: BEST clam chowder bread bowl I've had. We came here with a group of 4 and got a bunch of things... Muscles, Oysters, tuna poke, clam linguine, and much more!!! All of them were phenomenal. Drinks were also incredible. Must try in SF!

excerpts: I had the baked oysters, which were pretty good, but very heavy on the butter.
I also had the clam chowder.
Clams were tender, but the chowder seemed overly thick and again, heavy.
For dinner I went with the crab sandwich.
It was very tender and fresh tasking.
The bun was perfectly toasted (New England Style) with lots of butter.
oysters.author: Amie L.
oysters.review:
This place is commercial and touristy. I was pretty disappointed in the ambience and the food was...okay.

I had the baked oysters, which were pretty good, but very heavy on the butter. I also had the clam chowder. Clams were tender, but the chowder seemed overly thick and again, heavy. For dinner I went with the crab sandwich. It was very tender and fresh tasking. The bun was perfectly toasted (New England Style) with lots of butter. I would probably get that again if I found myself "trapped" at the Pier.

The view was obstructed by fog. We couldn't even see a hint of Alcatraz. 

Service was attentive and courteous.

excerpts: We didn't order the oysters here since we had them in 4 different places within a 2-day period, but we'll definitely try them the next time we're back here.
The grilled cheese sandwich was too die for so please get that too.m
oysters.author: Anum H.
oysters.review:
The wait:

We waited for around 45 minutes (even though we got there half an hour after they opened). It was rainy/chilly outside, and the line was outdoors. The great thing about their waiting area is that they have outdoor heaters (overhead) to keep people warm while they wait. Extra star for the extra bit of consideration.

The food:

They serve acme bread here, and it tastes so great with the clam chowder. I don't care if you've already had 15 clam chowder bread bowls in fisherman's wharf yesterday. You're ordering the clam chowder here. Like other reviewers mention, the chowder isn't heavy or creamy. It's more broth-like. I thought I wouldn't like it as much, but I was pleasantly proved wrong. It was really delicious. We didn't order the oysters here since we had them in 4 different places within a 2-day period, but we'll definitely try them the next time we're back here. The grilled cheese sandwich was too die for so please get that too.m

excerpts: For starters we had a dozen of Miyagi oysters...sweet and cucumbery and meaty not seafoody at all.
Also orders calamari which was also yummy.
Yay!!!
oysters.author: Abec H.
oysters.review: Short wait for a Friday night unplanned dinner with the family.  Great service.  Food was good too and portions are huge.  Sourdough bread was hot and steamy and we were never short.  I ordered the lobster dinner, mike had shrimp scampi with tons of clams, Tez had ribeye steak dinner, and Cel had fish and chips.  I had Lombard Lipstick cocktail and Tez the Bloody Mary.   Iced tea was tasty as well.  I was comped a tiramisu dessert in celebration of my bday and we also ordered the trio of lava cake, creme brûlée, and raspberry and cream.  Half of the restaurant sang happy birthday to me.  It was great!  Will definitely return.  For starters we had a dozen of Miyagi oysters...sweet and cucumbery and meaty not seafoody at all.  Also orders calamari which was also yummy.  Yay!!!

excerpts: Me and my boyfriend got a 1/2 dozen oysters.
oysters.author: Lucy K.
oysters.review: It was the most expensive lunch I ever paid for, but it was so worth the money. Me and my boyfriend got a 1/2 dozen oysters. I got a Cioppiano with pasta and my boyfriend got the mixed grill. I would give out 5 out of 5 stars and he said he will give out 4 1/2 stars. It was worth trying and not a long wait. My Cioppiano was sooo good !!!

excerpts: We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate.
Food was good-
oysters.author: Jessy H.
oysters.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is like putting San Francisco in a plate. It was my boyfriend's first time in the city and I decided to take him here based on the whole experience. 

We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate. Food was good- I do wish the salmon was slightly more cooked and the swordfish lacked a bit of seasoning. 

It was crazy packed and we had to sit very close to other customers at the bar. Bartenders were totally awesome and attentive. 

When it came time for dessert, they bring an entire tray of their selection that is like candy to the sweet lover.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers.
The mussel fries was really good.
Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny.
The Cesar salad was also good
but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce.
Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad.
Here's the bad...
I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size..
But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!!
And they only gave us 5.
We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one
but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy!
oysters.author: Fiona T.
oysters.review:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it. 

I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot

excerpts: We also got the calamari and baked oysters.
Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner.
For the finale, surprise surprise...
the chicken was the bomb.com.
Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner.
For the finale, surprise surprise...
the chicken was the bomb.com.
oysters.author: Rose R.
oysters.review:
This is long overdue. We almost passed this place up as we assumed it would be a horrid tourist trap, glad we didn't! It was awesome. 

Clam chowder = OMG. You must try. We also got the calamari and baked oysters. Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner. For the finale, surprise surprise...the chicken was the bomb.com. Drinks were good too. 

I know I'm using alot of tween expressions here but that is only to convey my immense approval of said food. I highly recommend stopping by and giving this place a chance next time you are by Pier 39.

excerpts: My husband and i had the oysters and the "world famous" clam chowder for starters.
The clam chowder was very enjoyable.
My husband said the oysters had a nice color to them and tasted fresh.
oysters.author: Ruby C.
oysters.review: Nice place. Elegant but not stuffy. My husband and i had the oysters and the "world famous" clam chowder for starters. The clam chowder was very enjoyable. My husband said the oysters had a nice color to them and tasted fresh.  For an entree i had a plate with shrimp brochette, salmon and another kind of fish, all grilled. I remember the salmon mostly.  It was flaky and very well seasoned. For desert we had tbe chocolate bread pudding. I am not a fan of bread pudding but this was VERY good! I believe this place is known for fresh made sourdough bread. SOOOO FRESH! beautiful crunchy outside, warm soft, fluffy on the inside! The location is great and we had the perfect view of the bay water, alcatraz and the seals. I would recommend if you're in the area... but may try another place before returning here. There are tons of choices on the wharf.

excerpts: Showing up at 1130, we had already decided on the chowder, baked oysters and garlic dungeness so our order was already locked down but we were very tempted by several other offerings-
I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon.
The garlic dungeness was just heavenly.
I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon.
The garlic dungeness was just heavenly.
oysters.author: Bret S.
oysters.review:
Wife and I decided yesterday to day trip to the city. Looked up menus the night before and loved the wine list at Fog Harbor.... I mean hello- 2012 Sea Smoke Southing Pinot made it case closed. Anyway, we planned on doing a pork bun crawl in Chinatown after so we wanted a nice nomnom gig early so then we could get on our way. Showing up at 1130, we had already decided on the chowder, baked oysters and garlic dungeness so our order was already locked down but we were very tempted by several other offerings- this is a REALLY well thought out menu.

Great food is one thing but it's pretty hard to find and keep good people in the service industry... I know because that was my world too. A great experience starts with prompt, professional (and please....no canned training cheese lines) and just heads up effort. We were lucky enough to get Susan as our server/host. Clearly, a savvy veteran of the craft and exactly what we were hoping for.  I'm not saying anybody else is a letdown because clearly the service level, presentation and attention to detail is evident- but I mention Susan and the quality operation not only as a heads up for yelpers but a  bravo to Fog Harbor.  This isn't some chain trying to flip tables. We had that perfect table too- watching the sea lions, the  craft and Alcatraz... just awesome. 

The food was perfect. I chef a little myself so I'm pretty damn picky. The chowder served with fresh HOT sourdough was epic. My wife and debated on whose was better between them and Pike Place... but it's THAT good. I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon. The garlic dungeness was just heavenly. I'll get the whole one with dinner next time.

We'll be back very soon. If I'm there though- you can't have Susan

excerpts: Oysters were fresh and steaks were fantastic!
Ask for a place near windows which is far away from entrance.
You need to go inside, turn right among the bar and go untill the end.
It's the best place there!
Enjoy!
oysters.author: Dmitriy R.
oysters.review: This is the best place there if you want to have a good food + great view. Oysters were fresh and steaks were fantastic! Ask for a place near windows which is far away from entrance. You need to go inside, turn right among the bar and go untill the end. It's the best place there! Enjoy!

excerpts: Had the calamari clam chowder and oysters all was really nice.
oysters.author: Yishay S.
