oysters.review: Good overall. Great service good food. Had the calamari clam chowder and oysters all was really nice.

excerpts: A special shout out for the broiled oysters appetizer with spinach and bacon.
Yum!
oysters.author: Jeff B.
oysters.review: Very nice place with very friendly staff. The view far outweighs the food. However, the food is respectable especially with it being located in a high traffic tourist area like Pier 39. I would say the quality setting / feel of the restaurant does not match the surrounding businesses.  It is definitely worth a visit. We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl. A special shout out for the broiled oysters appetizer with spinach and bacon. Yum!

excerpts: Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those.
oysters.author: Mimi L.
oysters.review:
For a San Francisco dining landmark at PIER 39, I'd expected better, but the food wasn't great, the restaurant is beautiful, the views were spectacular from our booth, amazing views of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge! We passed by this place, thought the decor was nice enough to eat here... The crab house next door didn't look nice to us...

Had a spicy Bloody Mary ($10) at the bar while waiting for our able, it was sooo spicy, but a good one! Bartenders were very strict at carding me! They insisted to see my ID first before making me a drink! ( Hubby had my ID at the moment & he went to restroom) Responsible! That's a good thing. :) 

Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those. The complimentary bread was delicious. 

I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it. 

Hubby had Linguini & Clams ($18), fresh clams, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes: he didn't like it too much, flavorless

Had one more Bloody Mary and a Stella on draft, didn't like the food. We have had wayyyy much better seafood in LA, disappointed, the service was good, the views made up a little bit, but still not impressed. :( Let's try some other places next time.....

excerpts: My party ordered the raw oysters, surf and turf, crab salad, cioppino and lobster.
It was all amazing, even the steak was great - very tender and juicy.
I never expect much from the steaks going to a seafood restaurant but this was good!
Our waiter was on top of everything, when our drinks were low he came by to fill them up and was very patient, took time to go over the menu even though it was soooo busy.
My only regret is I didn't have room to try the clam chowder which I heard is great.
oysters.author: Danielle W.
oysters.review: Food and service were top notch. If you don't have a reservation expect to wait 45 minutes.  We came in knowing this as we stopped by the night before but we were too hungry to wait and came back the next day and walked around the local shops while we waited. My party ordered the raw oysters, surf and turf, crab salad, cioppino and lobster.  It was all amazing, even the steak was great - very tender and juicy. I never expect much from the steaks going to a seafood restaurant but this was good! Our waiter was on top of everything, when our drinks were low he came by to fill them up and was very patient, took time to go over the menu even though it was soooo busy. My only regret is I didn't have room to try the clam chowder which I heard is great.

excerpts:
for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.
oysters.author: gswfan ..
oysters.review:
My wife and I came here for our anniversary dinner.
I made a reservation and we were promptly seated to a nicely reserved table.  Good thing the reservation was made because it was crowded and a line was forming.  I didn't mention anything specifically about our reserved seat, but they were thoughtful enough to gave us the window seat, where we could see the bridge and the bay.  when I looked at my wife's surprised look and happy smile, I knew this place is going to get 5 stars, and everything else would be gravy

and yes, turned out there was a lot of gravy.  the whole setting was very romantic... not only dimmed light, but there's a candle on each of the table.  place is not noisy despite being full.  our server was very friendly and helpful, and NO change of attitude when we decided not to order any wine or dessert.

for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.  wish they gave us more than one piece of garlic bread because there's a lot of nice sauce to dip from.

Ahi Tuna (RARE) - I asked to have my wasabi on the side since my wife doesn't like wasabi, and it was complied nicely.  can have more flavors, but i liked the unique taste.  outside is nicely cooked with a bit crispy, with a lot of sesame seeds, but the inside it's like sashimi.  

it was a very special night for my wife and I, and when we were leaving, more than one person (not just our server) greeted us with good bye and thank you.

excerpts: I came here for "fresh" oysters and lobster which were highly recommended by lots of people.
It tasted OK
BUT this is what I got after this--viral gastroenteritis (another name for the "stomach flu".
I had to run to bathroom every 5 minutes
The "fresh" oysters here are absolutely poisonous.
I paid more than 2000 bucks in the emergency department (and extra 300 bucks for my health).
I will NEVER go to this place again, and I'm worrying that those poor tourists (maybe without insurance)
CANNOT withstand going to the hospital in the middle of the night.
DONOT go here.
DONOT risk your life.
oysters.author: Sheri K.
oysters.review:
I came here for "fresh" oysters and lobster which were highly recommended by lots of people. It tasted OK BUT this is what I got after this--viral gastroenteritis (another name for the "stomach flu". I had to run to bathroom every 5 minutes and I threw up like crazy. 

I was sent to the emergency department and was told by the doctor this disaster was caused by virus in food. And yes, the food at this place is all what I ate before all the symptoms started. The "fresh" oysters here are absolutely poisonous. I paid more than 2000 bucks in the emergency department (and extra 300 bucks for my health).  I will NEVER go to this place again, and I'm worrying that those poor tourists (maybe without insurance) CANNOT withstand going to the hospital in the middle of the night. DONOT go here. DONOT risk your life.

excerpts: We also shared the baked oysters which were different but really good as well!
Service was also fantastic!!!
Definitely recommend!!
oysters.author: Marsha E.
oysters.review: Yummy and great service!!! My husband and I shared the seafood tower which was super fresh and so good!!! We also shared the baked oysters which were different but really good as well! Service was also fantastic!!! Definitely recommend!!

excerpts: The oysters were tiny and the fried calamari was disappointing and this was all followed by a bowl of clam chowder that rivaled soup plantation quality.
We will definitely skip this place next time we r in town.
oysters.author: M F.
oysters.review: Meh, we read all the reviews and were looking forward to trying what was advertised as the best chowder in San Fran.  We should have known better as it was located next to bubba gumps in a heavily trafficked tourist area where food quality goes down as cost goes up. The oysters were tiny and the fried calamari was disappointing and this was all followed by a bowl of clam chowder that rivaled soup plantation quality. We will definitely skip this place next time we r in town.

excerpts: We also ordered the ahi tuna and their oysters, but the swordfish!
So many things to like about this restaurant 1) obviously the food 2) ambiance and view 3) food came out right away
4) staff was very friendly and accomodating.
I highly recommend it, yes it is pricey but for the quality
oysters.author: Natalia P.
oysters.review: Currently eating here and I gotta say, amazing! So good that I was excited to write the review right away so I wouldnt forget. The swordfish was out of this world, pan seared in a delicious pesto sauce. We also ordered the ahi tuna and their oysters, but the swordfish! So many things to like about this restaurant 1) obviously the food 2) ambiance and view 3) food came out right away 4) staff was very friendly and accomodating. I highly recommend it, yes it is pricey but for the quality

excerpts: We had baked oysters that were amazing...
Shared a shell fish platter for 2 that was very good...
And washed it down with yummy drinks.
I had a cocktail that was so yummy.
I would def go again!
oysters.author: Kady H.
oysters.review: Great food! I loved the view! Perfect lunch on the pier! We had baked oysters that were amazing... Shared a shell fish platter for 2 that was very good... And washed it down with yummy drinks. I had a cocktail that was so yummy. I would def go again!

excerpts: Oysters was good, good sizes too!
oysters.author: S B.
oysters.review: wow this place is awesome. Oysters was good, good sizes too! Cioppino (lazy way) was on point. Nice chunks of everything. Also tried the steak and lobster, whatever sauce they used for the steak maaaaaaaan!! loved every drip of it. Lobster too was also a good nice tail size.

excerpts: very fresh oysters.
$40 avg may be a bit pricy.
oysters.author: Gonart L.
oysters.review: very good view of windowside seats. very tasty calm chowder with extra crab meat($7) on it. very fresh oysters. $40 avg may be a bit pricy.

excerpts:
Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF 
and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.
oysters.author: Mike R.
oysters.review:
Staff was nice, food was...standard fare...which surprised me since it was pricey. Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.

excerpts: Recommend their oysters (very fresh and sweet), Pacific Cod and their roasted sweet potato side.
Their clam chowder with sourdough is not the best I've had but at least comparable to Boudin.
Wanted to rate this place 4 stars but the waiter Martin's service definitely earned the 5th star!
oysters.author: Lisha Y.
oysters.review: Good services, nice view of the harbor, and good food! Recommend their oysters (very fresh and sweet), Pacific Cod and their roasted sweet potato side. Their clam chowder with sourdough is not the best I've had but at least comparable to Boudin. Wanted to rate this place 4 stars but the waiter Martin's service definitely earned the 5th star!

excerpts: The oysters were unbelievable as I did not want to share.
The shell platter for two was more than enough food.
The crabs were extremely juicy and meaty.
The staff was phenomenal and the ambiance was perfect.
I spent a lot
but I got a lot of food
and it was all good.
Definitely come here if you are in town!
oysters.author: Perry T.
oysters.review: This place was everything you think of when they say get seafood in San Francisco. The garlic bread was some of the best I have ever tasted. The oysters were unbelievable as I did not want to share. The shell platter for two was more than enough food. The crabs were extremely juicy and meaty. The staff was phenomenal and the ambiance was perfect. I spent a lot but I got a lot of food and it was all good. Definitely come here if you are in town!

excerpts: Our party of five split several appetizers including the lemon aioli calamari, seasonal heirloom tomato salad, shrimp cocktail, crab cakes and oysters.
Their cup of chowder is amazing and very filling.
It's actually very affordable for the quality, atmosphere and variety.
Although they have a fantastic dessert tray, the parting gift is a biscoff cookie.
Highly recommend!
oysters.author: Kathleen D.
oysters.review: Hands down amazing. The most fantastic view of Alcatraz and the sea lions at pier 39. Fantastic service. Our party of five split several appetizers including the lemon aioli calamari, seasonal heirloom tomato salad, shrimp cocktail, crab cakes and oysters. Their cup of chowder is amazing and very filling. It's actually very affordable for the quality, atmosphere and variety. Although they have a fantastic dessert tray, the parting gift is a biscoff cookie. Highly recommend!

excerpts: We also ordered the baked oysters and crab cakes, oh and the clam chowder.
I would order each item again.
The crab cakes did have some filler, but I guess if not, they would be $20 each, but the flavor was still good.
I would definitely recommend a stop here as you are waiting for a ferry ride to, well, anywhere.
oysters.author: Amy G.
oysters.review: This was our first stop in San Francisco and what a nice start it was. We sat at the bar, our favorite spot and ordered two of their award winning hibiscus margaritas. Don't know what all is in it, but is was delicious! I could have had 2 or 3, and might have, if we weren't getting on a boat to Alcatraz right after lunch. We also ordered the baked oysters and crab cakes, oh and the clam chowder. I would order each item again. The crab cakes did have some filler, but I guess if not, they would be $20 each, but the flavor was still good. I would definitely recommend a stop here as you are waiting for a ferry ride to, well, anywhere.

excerpts: We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders.
Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders.
oysters.author: Wayne Z.
oysters.review:
Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good. 

We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on. 

Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there. 

If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.

excerpts: Others were all good，good servic，nice view，food tasted fresh（swordfish was good） but just wayyyyy tooo expensive compared to the size（yeah im talking about the oysters.
oysters.author: Jifeng Z.
oysters.review:
My girlfriend and i went for dinner last night and ordered a full dozen oysters，they were all fresh but one of them is just as big as my finger nails and the rest were all small ones.And he price is 2.5$ per oyster...gotta post a pic of dat tiny little poor oyster... 

Others were all good，good servic，nice view，food tasted fresh（swordfish was good） but just wayyyyy tooo expensive compared to the size（yeah im talking about the oysters.）

excerpts: The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok.
I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters.
Skip!
-Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon,
Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#3lMGE6tFW3afyze8HNomkA)
: Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy.
This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe.
Skip!
-Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16):
Ok.
The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli.
However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland.
Skip!
-Crab
Louis ($22, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#_pzD387ZKQjuxDPLN0KIFA)
: They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great.
However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland.
I wouldn't order this again.

-Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#FyzyT_3ZvIESH5I0qp6APg): Pretty good
if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely.
The sweet potato fries were also really good.

Recommended!
-Fish & Chips

(Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#EuuXw-pZ356IX--lG1jksA): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok.
I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter-
it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy.
The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland.
However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious.
-Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#s7bQ8LaMVBCTTvrlIYQd4Q)
: This was a pretty good version of clam chowder!
It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder.
Recommended!
-Apple
Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50):
Ok.
I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard.
I wouldn't order this again.
-Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50):
Just ok, nothing special.
oysters.author: Amy D.
oysters.review:
This is your typical touristy restaurant in the Pier 39 area, which decent tasting food and a nice view, but inflated prices. Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer. I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!) since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night. We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away. Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room. However, it worked out fine, and I got to try:

-Blue Cheese Garlic Bread (Fresh Sourdough, Topped w/Garlic, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Herbs, $8): Just ok. The blue cheese overpowered all the other flavors, and you couldn't taste the garlic. The bread was also too crunchy for my liking. Skip!
-Oysters (Served w/Cocktail Sauce, Dozen $26, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw): The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok. I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters. Skip!
-Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon, Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#3lMGE6tFW3afyze8HNomkA): Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy. This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe. Skip!
-Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16): Ok. The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli. However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland. Skip!
-Crab Louis ($22, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#_pzD387ZKQjuxDPLN0KIFA): They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great. However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland. I wouldn't order this again.
-Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#FyzyT_3ZvIESH5I0qp6APg): Pretty good if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely. The sweet potato fries were also really good. Recommended!
-Fish & Chips (Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#EuuXw-pZ356IX--lG1jksA): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok. I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter- it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy. The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland. However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious.
-Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#s7bQ8LaMVBCTTvrlIYQd4Q): This was a pretty good version of clam chowder! It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder. Recommended!
-Apple Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Ok. I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard. I wouldn't order this again.
-Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Just ok, nothing special. I wouldn't order this again.

The best dishes from here were the Crab Roll and Clam Chowder, and the fries from the fish and chips. Although I don't think I'd come back for those dishes again, I would recommend ordering them if you are dining here. The service was good up until the end- it took them a long time to bring the dessert and our check. Make sure you ask them to validate your parking ticket if you parked in the structure across the street.  

Overall, there are so many better restaurants to eat at in SF, and it's not worth coming here unless you can expense your meal, or if you really want a view of the pier area.

excerpts:
oysters - very fresh, tender, delicious with cocktail sauce 10/10

linguine and clams - only 3/9 opened clams,  not very flavorful 5/10

service - very slow
oysters.author: Rose S.
oysters.review:
oysters - very fresh, tender, delicious with cocktail sauce 10/10

linguine and clams - only 3/9 opened clams,  not very flavorful 5/10

service - very slow 4/10

never coming back :))

excerpts: We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
oysters.author: Lisa K.
oysters.review:
This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation. 

We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo. 

As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.

The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.

excerpts: The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw.
The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty!
Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.
oysters.author: Colleen C.
oysters.review: We had the blue cheese garlic bread - yummmmmm. The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw. The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty! Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.

excerpts: The Backed Oysters were amazing!
My friend's clam chowder was alright but not spectacular.
The shrimp I ordered was cooked perfectly and matched the butternut squash and spinach!
oysters.author: Yume C.
oysters.review:
The Backed Oysters were amazing! 
My friend's clam chowder was alright but not spectacular. The shrimp I ordered was cooked perfectly and matched the butternut squash and spinach!

excerpts: I were really in the mood for oysters at around 11am and found fog harbor through yelp.
My gf and I shared a dozen oysters ($25), a clam chowder bread bowl ($10) and a Dungeness crab roll ($19).
The oysters were freshly shucked (they shrunk as I added lemon juice) and very sweet, definitely did not disappoint.
The clam chowder was very creamy and had lots of clams, although a bit lacking in the amount of actual chowder but its a novelty item
so I didn't mind.
oysters.author: Justin L.
oysters.review:
Even though its centered in one of the most touristy areas in sf, Fog Harbor was an awesome standout seafood restaurant. Although the exterior isn't much to look at, once you go upstairs and even to the waiting area, it's a really nice fine dining experience. 

A few friends and I were really in the mood for oysters at around 11am and found fog harbor through yelp. The view from the inside is amazing as you can look out across the pier and see all the boats and tourists wandering about. 

My gf and I shared a dozen oysters ($25), a clam chowder bread bowl ($10) and a Dungeness crab roll ($19). I just had to order a crab dish as they just started their crab season just the day before.  

The oysters were freshly shucked (they shrunk as I added lemon juice) and very sweet, definitely did not disappoint. The clam chowder was very creamy and had lots of clams, although a bit lacking in the amount of actual chowder but its a novelty item so I didn't mind. The crab roll was overflowing with their crab mixture which had good amounts of crab that you could taste in a nicely toasted butter roll. 

At the end of our meal, our server notified us that they were doing a promotion in which you rate your experience on your smartphone on their website and you get a complimentary dessert!! And they aren't the skimpy "one ice cream scoop" desserts. Actual full fledged desserts like a 5" Creme brûlée, huge slices of tiramisu, bread pudding. We got the cranberry and apple crumb cake with vanilla bean ice cream. A great way to finish off the meal. 

Our meal for the two of us came to about $75 because we were also ordering a few beers. I would definitely come back here again. Service and quality of food was spot on.

excerpts: Oysters are good, as are the bay scallop appetizer.
Great view
oysters.author: Garrett A.
oysters.review: Good little seafood joint. Wait was t bad and hey had benches and a nice wait area. Oysters are good, as are the bay scallop appetizer. Great view

excerpts: We also had oysters to start and man were they fresh!
I tasted all that we ordered and they were all very good.
The chowder was especially tasty and my wife's first bread bowl; she loved it!
Our server was an older hispanic gentleman who was excellent!
We had a nice table with a great view of Alcatraz and the bay.
And my younger son, my little 22 month old monster, got to draw on the paper table cloth!
This place is unassuming from the outside but so classy and so welcoming on the inside.
oysters.author: H K.
oysters.review: Food was good and the service was even better!  I had the choppino, my wife had the bread bowl chowder and my older son had the fish and chips.  We also had oysters to start and man were they fresh! I tasted all that we ordered and they were all very good.  The chowder was especially tasty and my wife's first bread bowl; she loved it! Our server was an older hispanic gentleman who was excellent!  We had a nice table with a great view of Alcatraz and the bay.  And my younger son, my little 22 month old monster, got to draw on the paper table cloth!  This place is unassuming from the outside but so classy and so welcoming on the inside.

excerpts: Started with some oysters - very good pacific coast ones.
Also tried the calamari - also very good.
oysters.author: P R.
oysters.review: Ate here a couple times over the last couple months - both times were very good.  One time got straight in and the other had a 30 minute wait.  But they do the text message method and you are able to walk around while waiting. The views are fantastic.  The food and service matched.  Started with some oysters - very good pacific coast ones.  Also tried the calamari - also very good.  Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other. Both were very good. Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.

excerpts: The oysters are so fresh, not overly fishy taste.
The sourdough bread is warm with a great crust and soft inside.
We had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was to die for!
Great views as well!!
oysters.author: Jenny P.
oysters.review: Absolutely amazing! Must try. The oysters are so fresh, not overly fishy taste. The sourdough bread is warm with a great crust and soft inside. We had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was to die for! Great views as well!!

excerpts: Ordered the Caesar salad; a dozen oysters; and white wine to start the meal.
Daniel only poured our wine once and came back at odd times during our meal; almost took away our 95% complete salad
and I wanted my last few bites.
Took a while before we received our appetizers from the start and bread was super late.
I did ask for balsamic vinegar and olive oil and they accommodated me instead of butter so that was delicious.
Oysters were huge and fresh but no different than outside fishermen wharf market minus they had sit down luxurious tables and a delicious salty sauce and cocktail sauce for the oysters.
oysters.author: James L.
oysters.review:
Ordered the Caesar salad; a dozen oysters; and white wine to start the meal. Daniel only poured our wine once and came back at odd times during our meal; almost took away our 95% complete salad and I wanted my last few bites. Took a while before we received our appetizers from the start and bread was super late. I did ask for balsamic vinegar and olive oil and they accommodated me instead of butter so that was delicious. Oysters were huge and fresh but no different than outside fishermen wharf market minus they had sit down luxurious tables and a delicious salty sauce and cocktail sauce for the oysters. Salad was refreshing to wash the grease down. 

Swordfish was cooked deliciously. Seafood was good but 10 % of the muscles were missing it's meat. Clam chowder was good - not as creamy as outside boudin and in lesser quantity and still needed a bit of salt and pepper;  we like to order the chowder in a regular bowl instead of the bread so it's not too filling and not an entire bread bowl gets wasted.

Dessert tray was presented during our meal when we weren't finished yet and this felt lazy. Out of convenience the server asked us for a dessert choice when we were still eating. We didn't like this.

Overall food was good. Wait was long but understandable; and seafood fix was satisfied. If you don't mind standing - you can get the same great food experience standing and eating seafood at the wharf.

excerpts: Our party ordered various items from a seafood variety plate to sliders, curry shrimp, calamari, oysters, crab, and fish.
Everything got rave reviews.
oysters.author: Honest R.
oysters.review:
Wow, really yummy seafood here. The roasted garlic crab was amazing, very flavorful and nice and hot! Our party ordered various items from a seafood variety plate to sliders, curry shrimp, calamari, oysters, crab, and fish. Everything got rave reviews. The pasta dishes were good too, but definitely not at the same level as the rest of the food.

One star off due to the service being extremely slow. The restaurant was very busy but so are a lot of restaurants around the area and they manage to get people in and out in a timely manner. We were there for about 2 hours and didn't even order dessert. Well worth the wait though.

excerpts: We had ahi starter and oysters with sourdough.
oysters.author: Mary S.
oysters.review:
Awesome food and cocktails....beautiful location and decor....friendly prompt service. Will be back!

We had ahi starter and oysters with sourdough.

excerpts: Also, good oysters.
The berry spritzer drink was good too
but more
so taste like
carbonated water just red in color.
oysters.author: Tina D.
oysters.review: Went here for a company outing. The food is good. We couldn't be seated until our whole table was here so that was a little annoying since they place wasn't full. Then when we did have everyone, they needed to set our table. We also had a reservation. I had the clam linguini and it was good. Also, good oysters. The berry spritzer drink was good too but more so taste like carbonated water just red in color.

excerpts: We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!),
oysters.author: Sam R.
oysters.review: Found Fog Harbor on Yelp while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. We desired a great view, delicious food and expert service - in an intimate dining area away from the hustle and bustle... That is what we got! Our server Meron was personable and knowledgeable- it was a special night for us, so she brought flowers and a candle to our table. We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!), the mixed grill - fresh and perfectly cooked fish - and Surf N Turf... Meron even assisted with getting the meat out of the whole lobster! For dessert we had the special - Creme brûlée and chocolate lava cake- absolutely delicious. Thank you Meron and Fog Harbor for a delicious and memorable meal!!!

excerpts: All right, the oysters were delicious and fresh.
I'll give them that!
No horseradish though.
The crab sandwich was okay - the bread that it was served in was very good, but the crab itself was a little bland and just too cold.
oysters.author: Jason D.
oysters.review:
This is my fault. Really, it is. 

We picked a spot right on Pier 39 full of tourists on a Sunday afternoon. Guh. Why did I do that? 

All right, the oysters were delicious and fresh. I'll give them that! No horseradish though. The crab sandwich was okay - the bread that it was served in was very good, but the crab itself was a little bland and just too cold. Needed a little sauce or something to flavor it better. 

Anyway, our server was just flat, lusterless and almost angry at times. The place was overly busy, but she could have at least tried to appear happy. 

I shan't be back.

EDIT:
I'm editing this to a 3 star. The food was 3-4 stars but the service was 2-3 stars. The manager seems extremely conscientious and has contacted me with questions on how they can improve - I appreciate this chance for personal feedback!

excerpts: Good oysters too
Khaiman was our waiter very attentive .
Great place
oysters.author: Shelby S.
oysters.review:
Really good salmon blt. Good oysters too 
Khaiman was our waiter very attentive . Great place

excerpts: Crab cakes are amazing, good oysters and killer clam chowder!
oysters.author: Bryce M.
oysters.review: Cool little spot with a great view. I typically avoid eating at pier 39, but this place is really great. Crab cakes are amazing, good oysters and killer clam chowder!

excerpts: I ordered baked oysters and my daughter ordered the lobster.
I was originally looking for another restaurant
but glad I ate here instead.
Samir was an awesome waiter.
If you at Pier 39 you must eat here.
It's a bit pricey but worth it.
oysters.author: Dawn G.
oysters.review: Walked in and got seated right away. The food was great. I ordered baked oysters and my daughter ordered the lobster. I was originally looking for another restaurant but glad I ate here instead. Samir was an awesome waiter.  If you at Pier 39 you must eat here. It's a bit pricey but worth it.

excerpts: We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters.
Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful.
Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table.
oysters.author: Lea L.
oysters.review:
I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!

We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.

The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese". 

Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.

Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!

excerpts: We were in the mood for oysters
so we got a dozen raw and a dozen cooked.
We also got the shrimp cocktail, some crab appetizer, 2 tuna poke looking things, and there must have been more
but I don't remember now.
I actually was washing my hands when the guys decided to order so I did not participate in the ordering portion of our meal.
We weren't looking to get full, just eat enough to last us till dinner.
This was like around 6ish or so after our ride on Lombard St.
The food was good, can't say it was extremely tasty or that I would be back
but it was a nice meal to share with our friends.
There were 4 of us.
=D
I would recommend coming here for the views and if you're actually looking for a nice sit down place.
I am not sure what the bill looked like
but I think it was around $200 with tip.
It's alright for just appetizers
but I must say that the bread they served us was tasty!!!
Man I ate a lot of bread while up north...
oysters.author: Anna G.
oysters.review:
Awesome location! Our table had a great view of Alcatraz and a dock full of seals just sunbathing. Man I wish I could have joined them!! The food was fresh but I wouldn't expect anything less considering they are right by the water. We were in the mood for oysters so we got a dozen raw and a dozen cooked. We also got the shrimp cocktail, some crab appetizer, 2 tuna poke looking things, and there must have been more but I don't remember now. I actually was washing my hands when the guys decided to order so I did not participate in the ordering portion of our meal. We weren't looking to get full, just eat enough to last us till dinner. This was like around 6ish or so after our ride on Lombard St. The food was good, can't say it was extremely tasty or that I would be back but it was a nice meal to share with our friends. There were 4 of us. =D
I would recommend coming here for the views and if you're actually looking for a nice sit down place. I am not sure what the bill looked like but I think it was around $200 with tip. It's alright for just appetizers but I must say that the bread they served us was tasty!!! Man I ate a lot of bread while up north...

excerpts: I was afraid that it would be tacky or not very good because of its Fisherman's Wharf location, but everything was delicious, the staff was great, and my clients had themselves a blast, ordering oysters, wine, entrees, and "that soup in the bread.
They literally had everything my clients wanted out of a "typical" SF experience, all yummy, and without any of the Fisherman's Wharf touristy tackiness.
oysters.author: Tatiana T.
oysters.review:
I was spending a day translating for two foreign clients when they decided they wanted the San Francisco seafood experience. I panicked, because I don't have a go-to seafood spot that will satisfy the highbrow European tourist, so I Yelped it from the car and fortunately discovered Fog Harbor.

I was so impressed when we walked in to see a beautiful fireplace by the hostess stand and even more so when I saw the lovely views of the bridge from our table (and of course we got a great table with views). I was afraid that it would be tacky or not very good because of its Fisherman's Wharf location, but everything was delicious, the staff was great, and my clients had themselves a blast, ordering oysters, wine, entrees, and "that soup in the bread." They literally had everything my clients wanted out of a "typical" SF experience, all yummy, and without any of the Fisherman's Wharf touristy tackiness.

excerpts: Do the baked oysters ..
To die for, also if your confused seafood or steak get the surf and turf !
Lobster tail great, steak a little too cooked!
Manager came over very professional!
Took care of steak portion!
The drink you MUST have, Moscow Mule"!
My wife drank mine and ordered another !!
oysters.author: Pman B.
oysters.review: Sooooo Gooooood! Service was wonderful .. Do the baked oysters .. To die for, also if your confused seafood or steak get the surf and turf ! Lobster tail great, steak a little too cooked! Manager came over very professional! Took care of steak portion! The drink you MUST have, Moscow Mule"! My wife drank mine and ordered another !!

excerpts: oysters: these were good/fresh but way over priced.
oysters.author: Aric L.
oysters.review:
Being foodies from Chicago, we have higher standards. That is the only reason we can conceive as to why the higher rating. This place is careless about their food and no attention to detail. It's 100% tourist. I think people who have never had good food must be giving these good ratings. 
Service was ok.
I have no idea why they got as many stars as they did.
We spent over 200 dollars because we really wanted to try a variety of seafood. 

We had
- 1/2 doz. oysters: these were good/fresh but way over priced. There is really no skill to serving an oyster.

- bowl of clam chowder: under seasoned and served luke-warm.  

- salad wedge: sent back but still got charged. Literally a non-rinsed, right out of the shrink wrap, warm, wilted, bargain bin, iceberg lettuce. 1/2 of a cherry tomato. And barely enough blue cheese dressing. Maybe a tsp portion. Careless preparation. The dressing was barely that, it was very pasty. 

- garlic dungeoness crab: served luke-warm and over-cooked ! Ton of garlic, under seasoned. not a pinch of salt. The meat was dry inside and crumbled out. We spent 42 dollars for this garbage! We left 1/2 of it.

- chiapino: this was ok, but still served Luke-warm and under seasoned. The broth was bland. It was more of a boring tomato soup with garlic powder, and a pinch of red pepper. The fish inside was ok, but there just wasn't enough. There was some good vegetables inside too. This was nowhere close to a great chiapino. This was just average. I can get way better in chi-town.

- house cab: 14 dollars a glass  for what tastes like and probably is Barefoot brand.

I would have sent most of this back and walked out, but I didn't want to make a scene. 
Hopefully this review is seen by people who know food. 

Update:
The manager reached out to me to get feedback.
He was polite and seemed to care.
I added two additional stars

excerpts: t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!
oysters.author: Paul S.
oysters.review:
fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!

it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.  

this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!

bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.  

after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!  

we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.

and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

excerpts: We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.
I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
oysters.author: David P.
oysters.review:
Last night, decided to head here for dinner with some friends.

Made an online reservation for 5 and the only time available was for 9:30pm.  No worries.

We arrived and were promptly seated in a booth by the windows with a great view.

We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.

I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".  Seems this is for customers who don't want to deal with hassle of cracking your own crab.

Like the Fish & Chips I ate previously, the food was great.  Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.  Linguine was cooked very well and the steaks were perfectly cooked to temperature.

So why only 3 stars?

The service was kinda bad.  It seemed like the server had a bad day and was distracted with a frustrated scowl.  We had to remind him about bringing us our bottle of wine.  Tabasco was requested 2 times from our server and once to another server walking by.  The other server looked frustrated but brought us the Tabasco.  Our waiter brought another bottle after a while.  Water took a few tries.  Kids asked for A1 steak sauce and that took a couple of requests.

By the time he noticed that our wine was depleted and asked if we wanted another, we really didn't want to order any more from him and asked for the check.

I would easily give 4 stars for the food and facilities.  But can't ignore the service this night.

excerpts: We ordered crab cakes, dozen oysters, ciopinni with pasta, seafood platter for 2 with 3 lobster tails.
The hospitality here does not match the price.
We selected this restaurant because it was suppose to have a nice view and ambiance.
We spent about $300 for 3.
I recommend spending your money where they appreciate your business.
oysters.author: Joseph L.
oysters.review: Reserved for dinner about a month in advance for a special occasion for 3. I requested for a less busier window seating upon arrival. Host had a bad attitude and told us to wait until she calls us. We should have walked away then. Host sat us by the bar and very close to entrance of the building. We saw many tables available inside the room so we asked the host for another table further inside with less distractions. When we politely flagged the host as she passed by to request for another table, she spoke to us in a condescending manner and told us to figure it out with the server.  Their solution to our request was to move our table to a booth about 3 feet away. Another chance to just walk out but I didn't want to spoil the occasion. We ordered crab cakes, dozen oysters, ciopinni with pasta, seafood platter for 2 with 3 lobster tails. The hospitality here does not match the price. We selected this restaurant because it was suppose to have a nice view and ambiance. We spent about $300 for 3. I recommend spending your money where they appreciate your business.

excerpts: We ordered oysters, shrimp, clams, mussels, cod, swordfish - and everything was very fresh and delicious!
Also, the best clam chowder soup in all of San Fran!!
They didn't lie when they said it was award-winning soup.
We made reservations on open table, but you could also walk up there and put yourself on a waiting list.
oysters.author: Yuliana A.
oysters.review: If you are looking for a delicious seafood dinner, where you can sit down and enjoy beautiful views at the same time, this is the place to be! We ordered oysters, shrimp, clams, mussels, cod, swordfish - and everything was very fresh and delicious! Also, the best clam chowder soup in all of San Fran!! They didn't lie when they said it was award-winning soup. We made reservations on open table, but you could also walk up there and put yourself on a waiting list.

excerpts: For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious.
Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce.
What's not to love?
oysters.author: Blanca A.
oysters.review: This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver, Rose. As soon as we stepped in we knew it was going to be a spectacular lunch. From the outside it doesn't seem like much. Once you step inside, you realize you're in for a beautiful view of Pier 39, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate. For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious. Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce. What's not to love? For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!). For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp. Neither one disappointed us. All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco. Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.

excerpts: We shared an appetizer (baked oysters with spinach and parmesan OMG!) and a main dish and our bill with tip came to $90.
If you can appreciate upscale dining then the prices shouldn't be to shocking.
I would go back and pay it again simply for the flavor and freshness of what was served!
oysters.author: Teresa H.
oysters.review: I can't help but give this place 5 stars!  We picked this location based on previously Yelp reviews.  We drove into the city from Sonoma before catching a flight home.  Fortunately for us it was a Tuesday afternoon.  We found immediate parking and walked in and were seated immediately.  The service was great.  Our waitress was friendly and checked in on us.  The food was delicious!  It satisfied our craving for fresh seafood and flavor was on point!  My daughter had the clam chowder with crab and I had the swordfish.   We shared an appetizer (baked oysters with spinach and parmesan OMG!) and a main dish and our bill with tip came to $90.   If you can appreciate upscale dining then the prices shouldn't be to shocking.  I would go back and pay it again simply for the flavor and freshness of what was served!

excerpts: He recommended a couple local catches and the oysters.
I got the oysters and calm chowder in bread bowl which was perfect and my wife got the calamari which I usually don't like
oysters.author: Davis W.
oysters.review:
This was really the only seafood place I got too experience while we were on san fran and I'm not dissapointed at all. Service was by far the best I have had in the city. Martin was extremely courteous and knowledgeable of the menu. He recommended a couple local catches and the oysters. 

The view really sets the mood overlooking the water and offers and a good shot of alcatraz. 

The food was absolutely delicious. The sourdough bread was warm and a great compliment to the meal. It only took about 10 minutes to get our food which really surprised me. I got the oysters and calm chowder in bread bowl which was perfect and my wife got the calamari which I usually don't like but this calamari did not have that spongy texture you often get from cheaper restaurants. 

Overall the food, service , and view combine to make a must eat san fran.

excerpts: I'd recommend the clam chowder with crab and baked oysters.
Would be 5 stars but the loud atmosphere made it hard for conversation.
oysters.author: Emily E.
oysters.review: Great service. Great food. Even better view. I'd recommend the clam chowder with crab and baked oysters. Would be 5 stars but the loud atmosphere made it hard for conversation.

excerpts: Combined with the baked oysters appetizer and a nice bottle of wine made for a great meal after another long day.
oysters.author: Panas S.
oysters.review:
What a great view!  Worth the price of entry even before the meal.  

The service is also top notch.  While I normally do not go with any suggestions from the servers, I usually find it is their way to build up the check, somehow this felt different.  The clam chowder is a great starter, it probably would make for a great entree and dessert too.  Always being a fan of crab cakes I had to give them a try, great decision.  Combined with the baked oysters appetizer and a nice bottle of wine made for a great meal after another long day.

excerpts:
The food: 

- Oysters: Fresh.
I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them.
They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted.
oysters.author: Elizabeth N.
oysters.review:
My boyfriend and I visited for our anniversary dinner. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a little under 30 minutes for a table. Service was great; from the hostess to our server. On to the most important part and the reason why you're reading this review... The food: 

- Oysters: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them. They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted. I could've eaten half a dozen by myself.

- Ahi Tuna Poke: Decent size chunks with avocado and I believe it was mango as well? The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for. Down side to this plate was that there was only 3 wonton chips to share! 

- Clam Chowder: You can't come to SF and not have a bowl of clam chowder. You won't regret it! So rich and creamy, you can actually tell that there are clams in there! (Also had clam chowder from Nick's Lighthouse... Fog Harbor blows them out of the water) 

- Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab: YUMMY. So glad we went with this over the steamed dungeness. It had so much more flavor to it and was way more juicy than we expected, which is a definitely plus. (Tip: Dip the corn into the garlic/butter... Also, if you prefer mashed potatoes to the fingerling potatoes, just ask your server to substitute it for you)

Overall, we had a great experience. We also ordered 2 drinks from the bar to go with our meal which brought our grand total to ~$108 (excluding tip). Will definitely be back again!

excerpts: I had two glasses of wine and we also ordered some ahi tuna and one dozen oysters.
The oysters were a bit small but was very tasty which made up for their size.
The view, is breath taking, very beautiful.
Our waiter was very attentive and he was very knowledgeable of the menu.
Very great service.
The bill came out pretty high but we enjoyed this placed and our food plus the view.
Couldn't go wrong.
Would recommend this place to anyone
but I would like to warn you all it is pretty pricey
but we'll worth it.
oysters.author: Emily M.
oysters.review: So me and my fiance decided to have dinner for his birthday here. It was a beautiful day in February And We Just Got Done Hiking In Marin county. We walked in and was greeted. Very welcoming. We ordered to seafood mix plates which were on special and added a lobster tail to each. I had two glasses of wine and we also ordered some ahi tuna and one dozen oysters. The oysters were a bit small but was very tasty which made up for their size. The view, is breath taking, very beautiful.  Our waiter was very attentive and he was very knowledgeable of the menu. Very great service. The bill came out pretty high but we enjoyed this placed and our food plus the view. Couldn't go wrong. Would recommend this place to anyone but I would like to warn you all it is pretty pricey but we'll worth it.

excerpts: The seafood platter and oysters were delicious, very fresh.
Our server, Danny (Daniel) was very attentive.. always keeping our glasses full and making sure we were satisfied which made the experience that much better.
Would come back and recommend, thanks Danny!
oysters.author: Justine M.
oysters.review: Ate a lovely meal here with a view of the water and Golden Gate. The seafood platter and oysters were delicious, very fresh. Our server, Danny (Daniel) was very attentive.. always keeping our glasses full and making sure we were satisfied which made the experience that much better. Would come back and recommend, thanks Danny!

excerpts: 1/2 OYSTERS in a nicely presented plate in center of table.
Fresh!!!
1 WHOLE Garlic CRAB $39.
Great great with butter sauce on side.
Well, it was with lobster
oysters.author: Lauren X.
oysters.review:
Here for some seafood chowdown and wasn't disappointed. Drinks weak so make sure to ask for strong stuff or you'll be disappointed.  

CLAM CHOWDER was too watery and lack filling.  I think a Boudin can would taste better. oh now really did I just say that?!

JUMBO COCKTAIL $13 for 4 shrimps.
1/2 OYSTERS in a nicely presented plate in center of table. Fresh!!! $13.00
1 WHOLE Garlic CRAB $39.  Great great with butter sauce on side. Well, it was with lobster but oh well, let's dip away.

COCKTAILS: Lemon Drop (strong), Long Beach (whole crab strong!), Blackberry Martini (juice was this??! disappointed), and Alcatraz (oh ok..) if you like rum.

Total for 3 adults $180with tax about $190+($60 + a person). Would that be $$$$?

Would be back here if I were not so allergic to seafood and had to just watch as my favorite other two people chow down while I feed the little babes.  Agh, the life.  Friendly upbeat service in a nicely decorated place with great view and really a great place for family (Stroller parking outside is safe). 

It's on 2nd floor so find elevator by NFL store across the way. Check receipt for coupon deals. Don't toss..i know u might be buzzed...but really, check first.

excerpts: Definitely try the calamari and oysters some of the freshest I've had.
And tony the bartender is really great!
oysters.author: Zane D.
oysters.review: Amazing place over in fisherman's wharf. They have great views of the harbor and awesome happy hour specials. Definitely try the calamari and oysters some of the freshest I've had. And tony the bartender is really great!

excerpts: The baked oysters are out of this world.
I highly recommend the restaurant and suggest people check for a spot at the bar.
There was a significant wait when we arrived and we found a spot at the bar right away.
We enjoyed dinner at the bar and the device was great.
When we left there was still people waiting outside to be seated.
I am not sure why they don't tell people that they can have a full dinner at the bar without waiting.
I guess that is what Yelp is for!
oysters.author: Donna G.
oysters.review: The baked oysters are out of this world.  I highly recommend the restaurant and suggest people check for a spot at the bar.  There was a significant wait when we arrived and we found a spot at the bar right away.   We enjoyed dinner at the bar and the device was great.  When we left there was still people waiting outside to be seated. I am not sure why they don't tell people that they can have a full dinner at the bar without waiting.  I guess that is what Yelp is for!

excerpts: When she brought our appetizer out (oysters and shrimp) she didn't prep it like she did the other two tables (and this was right after I had asked about the market price item and the last time she talked to us/came over to our table).
oysters.author: Nial E.
oysters.review:
I was here on Sunday with my Godfather around 3:30PM. We had a waitress who was helpful at first until I asked how much the "Surf Turf" was because it had said market price. She then sarcastically suggested the Lobster Tail which was "only $39". After that, she passed us off to another waiter who told us he was taking over for her because "her shift was over". Yet, we kept seeing her help the table behind us (loaded 60+ yr old guy with a very young wife/gf and small child) and another new table that was seated. 

So we ask our new waiter, "hey, I thought her shift was over". Then he told us without telling us that she passed us off to him because she assumed we didn't have money because I asked how much the surf turf was. It was obvious and plain as day. When she brought our appetizer out (oysters and shrimp) she didn't prep it like she did the other two tables (and this was right after I had asked about the market price item and the last time she talked to us/came over to our table).

For the price, I've had better seafood. This place is slightly overpriced but the food was alright. So if you want average seafood that's a little overpriced then this place is okay. The view from inside the restaurant is nice too. But that waitress should know that just because someone is Black and just because they ask about price does not mean they don't have money for the food or to give you a generous tip afterwards. You missed out.

For a liberal place, San Francisco has a lot of hidden and subtle racism. Was not surprised that the only Blacks in the restaurant was seated right next to the camera (pointing down at our table and next to the waiters/waitresses register) and was passed off because it was assumed we had no money because I asked about a price. Our new waiter enjoyed his 30% tip and I hope he told the chick about that (who would probably do anything if you threw enough money at her tbh...was one of those vibes...especially with the way she was all over the loaded old dude next to us). And it is disappointing that this happened because I overall had a nice trip to San Francisco and we were served great at Everett & Jones in Oakland the night before. But Fog Harbor won't be seeing my business again. I'll check out the numerous other seafood choices around there when I make a roadtrip to SF from LA again rather than come back to this place.

excerpts: Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers.
Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious.
Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned.
oysters.author: Rochelle G.
oysters.review: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.

excerpts: I ordered oysters, fried calamari, clam chowder, and Ani tuna.
The fried calamari was WARM...not crispy at all...
Ani tuna was good, although the soy sauce was not spread evenly which made some of the rice too salty.
There was only one kind of oyster.
But they were really juicy.
oysters.author: Amber X.
oysters.review: Another travelers' must go place but locals will not choose. To be honest, food is really average. I don't think it worth the price neither ($90 for 2 including tips). I ordered oysters, fried calamari, clam chowder, and Ani tuna. The fried calamari was WARM...not crispy at all... Ani tuna was good, although the soy sauce was not spread evenly which made some of the rice too salty. There was only one kind of oyster. But they were really juicy. The award winning clam chowder, I couldn't tell the difference between it and the one sold at street corner.

excerpts: The boiled oysters were INCREDIBLE.
oysters.author: Milan M.
oysters.review:
Oh my gosh.
This restaurant gets five stars from me hands down. My boyfriend and I were looking for a night out and we stumbled across this place on yelp because I wanted dinner next to the water. We came in on a Thursday evening, and went to put our name down. They said it would be a 15 min wait for a seat, but 45 to an hour for waterfront seating. We were hungry so I put us down for regular seating. 10 minutes later they call our name and seat us next to a window for two! The boiled oysters were INCREDIBLE. I had the half crab which was nice and light and he got the fried combo. 
Everything from the appetizer to desert was amazing. The service was great as well. We had a young lady help us out who has a lot of serving experience. I am definitely coming back in the next month or so. It's my new favorite restaurant!

excerpts: Oysters were fresh and tasty.
My main course was just OK
I had the linguine with clam sauce it pales in comparison to many restaurants in NY.
Desert was excellent
maybe the best Tiramisu
i have had.
Service was overall good when the waiter asked how everything was
I said overall  very good
the Pasta was just OK.
He really didn't respond it was just a routine question and really didn't care about my answer.
oysters.author: John Q.
oysters.review:
Fog Harbor was overall very good clam chowder was very good Oysters were fresh and tasty.
My main course was just OK I had the linguine with clam sauce it pales in comparison to many restaurants in NY. Desert was excellent maybe the best Tiramisu i have had.  Service was overall good when the waiter asked how everything was I said overall  very good the Pasta was just OK.    He really didn't respond it was just a routine question and really didn't care about my answer.

excerpts: After a looong look at the menu, I landed on a half dozen baked oysters, and crab roll.
Oysters were good, had some spinach and feta cheese, good flavor.
Then there's the crab roll.
Never had one before (or lobster roll) the crab mixture combined with the bread was awesome!
Nice soft bread with butter on it, had the perfect texture for the moist crab filling with good amount of crab taste, not overpowering with other flavors.
On a previous visit I had the surf and turf, steak with lobster tail.
That was a little on the pricey side, but fur what you get and how much, it's not TOO bad.
There's so many places to eat around here, but I love this place for the quality of food and the variety.
oysters.author: Mike S.
oysters.review: When looking for places to eat around this area this is by far the best rated and there's plenty of reasons why. For being in the middle of tourist central, this place is a nice getaway from the craziness that is fisherman's warf.  I was in the mood for some seafood and wanted a few different things. Only problem was I couldn't decide what to get! Too many good lookin options, too small of a stomach.  After a looong look at the menu, I landed on a half dozen baked oysters, and crab roll.  Oysters were good, had some spinach and feta cheese, good flavor. Then there's the crab roll. Never had one before (or lobster roll) the crab mixture combined with the bread was awesome! Nice soft bread with butter on it, had the perfect texture for the moist crab filling with good amount of crab taste, not overpowering with other flavors. On a previous visit I had the surf and turf, steak with lobster tail. That was a little on the pricey side, but fur what you get and how much, it's not TOO bad.  There's so many places to eat around here, but I love this place for the quality of food and the variety.

excerpts: Oysters were also huge!Resturant environment is excellent.
I will say the price is a little high, but I think it's the same at other restaurants nearby.
We will definitely go here again soon.
oysters.author: Sam N.
oysters.review: Crab had lots of meat and the food overall was excellent. Oysters were also huge!Resturant environment is excellent. I will say the price is a little high, but I think it's the same at other restaurants nearby. We will definitely go here again soon.

excerpts: Great food and superb oysters!
My family and I always come for their oysters when visiting pier 39.
They're location is great for a romantic dinner with a view.
Our waiter, Samir, provided us with great service and has great hair !
oysters.author: Julierose J.
oysters.review: Wow! Great food and superb oysters! My family and I always come for their oysters when visiting pier 39. They're location is great for a romantic dinner with a view. Our waiter, Samir, provided us with great service and has great hair !

excerpts: We started with fresh west coast oysters and found them to be as good as any we ever had from the east coast, which we generally prefer.
oysters.author: Paul L.
oysters.review:
The Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco has earned its reputation for being a wonderful place to visit and to eat, and even the locals come here often. Of the many great restaurants available here, we selected Fog Harbor and were very, very pleased with our choice.
The service was good, the wine list well chosen, and the food was absolutely wonderful. We started with fresh west coast oysters and found them to be as good as any we ever had from the east coast, which we generally prefer. The Seafood Penne I ordered was rich and flavorful and included ample portions of delicious fish and shellfish, all of which were fresh and tasty. The Sole which my wife ordered was plentiful and wonderful and also as fresh as it could be. We matched our meal with a great wine and completed it with a pumpkin bread pudding served warm and wonderful. 
A little off the main tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf, this is worth walking the few extra steps it takes to get to it.

excerpts: Absolutely delicious garlic crab and oysters.
The service was wonderful our drinks were never empty!
The chocolate banana desert is to die for!!
oysters.author: Misty C.
oysters.review: Absolutely delicious garlic crab and oysters.  The service was wonderful our drinks were never empty!  The chocolate banana desert is to die for!!

excerpts: Average, but we only tried a few things since we were not hungry: oysters, french fries, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.
The clam chowder was pretty good and the sour dough bread was really good.
Not sure how you can fuck up oysters, but these were not tasty at all.
They were also very gritty and not cleaned very well.
Fries were just average and nothing special.
Service was ok, but they were super busy so not really that attentive.
oysters.author: David L.
oysters.review: Average, but we only tried a few things since we were not hungry: oysters, french fries, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. The clam chowder was pretty good and the sour dough bread was really good. Not sure how you can fuck up oysters, but these were not tasty at all. They were also very gritty and not cleaned very well. Fries were just average and nothing special. Service was ok, but they were super busy so not really that attentive.

excerpts: We ordered a dozen oysters, crab rolls, lobster mac n cheese, and the alcatraz drink.
oysters.author: Jenifer L.
oysters.review:
I came here with my boyfriend on our first trip to SF. My boyfriend is a big fan of seafood so we decided to try this place. The ambiance here is nice, classy yet casual. Makes it more comfortable without it being too dim. We ordered a dozen oysters, crab rolls, lobster mac n cheese, and the alcatraz drink. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!

Although I did not eat the oyster, my boyfriend said it was really good - very fresh. The crab rolls were good, but nothing super special. However, the lobster mac n cheese was super BOMB! I've never tasted anything like it - it was beyond delicious! The lobster chunks were huge and the pasta was cooked to perfection. I am not a big fan of alcohol and hate the taste of alcohol, but the Alcatraz was delicious! It was fruity and slushy like, but the hint of alcohol was very little. 100% going back to this place again!

excerpts: The bread is fresh and hot, and the oysters are uber fresh and cold!
oysters.author: Red F.
oysters.review: Thank you so much, Madison, for your patience with us and our big order! The cioppino is phenomenal, and the Moscow mules are truly the best I've ever had, and we drink a lot! The bread is fresh and hot, and the oysters are uber fresh and cold!

excerpts:
We had a lovely night here, we really enjoyed the baked oysters and the clam chowder in a cob. 
The staff where friendly and we where seated straight away without a reservation. 
The creme brûlée was so good and the sugar top was perfect and had a nice "crack" when we broke through it. 
The kids really enjoyed drawing on the paper table covers with the supplied crayons. 
My husband had the grilled chicken breast but he said it was a little dry.
oysters.author: Billys M.
oysters.review:
We had a lovely night here, we really enjoyed the baked oysters and the clam chowder in a cob. 
The staff where friendly and we where seated straight away without a reservation. 
The creme brûlée was so good and the sugar top was perfect and had a nice "crack" when we broke through it. The kids really enjoyed drawing on the paper table covers with the supplied crayons. 
My husband had the grilled chicken breast but he said it was a little dry.

excerpts: The half orders of oysters and dungeness crab definitely hit the spot.
oysters.author: Andy G.
oysters.review: If you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area, this is a great place to consider. Great seafood and views. The half orders of oysters and dungeness crab definitely hit the spot. My grilled swordfish and salmon plate was also delicious. Finished it off with a warm chocolate fudge cake.

excerpts: We were told 4 times our oysters and crab cakes were on the way however the actual time to receive was approx.
30 minutes.
If they sent actually on the way, just don't say it.
Again, I wouldn't necessarily knock a place for this however the oysters are raw (easy to plate) and the crab cakes were obviously pre-made and just dropped into a fryer.
Also, it would have been nice to get or even be offered bread, when everyone seem to have it.
oysters.author: Autumn H.
oysters.review:
Normally I do not venture down to Pier 39 since I live here but Codmother was closed (A MUST EAT AT) and I had a visitor in town from AZ so I thought, "what the heck." 

First and foremost: If you are a local - SKIP AT ALL COSTS. 

Pluses: 
1. The wait was minimal on a Thursday night in the summer, which was nice.

2. The restaurant seems clean, upscale and has amazing views if you are willing to wait for them. 

3. The drinks were amazing. Mixed very well, creatively concocted and delicious. 

The minuses:
1.  VERY LOUD AND NOISY. There are way too many tables squeezed in the space available. Normally I wouldn't knock a place for this, but given everything else that was bad, I thought I'd list.

2. The service. It is very apparent that each server has too many tables to handle. Service is extremely slow. We were told 4 times our oysters and crab cakes were on the way however the actual time to receive was approx. 30 minutes. If they sent actually on the way, just don't say it. Again, I wouldn't necessarily knock a place for this however the oysters are raw (easy to plate) and the crab cakes were obviously pre-made and just dropped into a fryer. Also, it would have been nice to get or even be offered bread, when everyone seem to have it. Lastly, when we tried to joke or have any conversation with put waitress at all, she immediately became defensive and didn't get the banter. 

3. The food. Crab stuff lobster ... Should include ... Lobster. Additionally the dish should not be sitting on top of boxed (at least that's what they tasted like) mashed potatoes. Or in my opinion not for $36 bucks. The swordfish had a very odd square shape, tasted at one point frozen and was dry. 

If you're visiting, hungry and need a place to eat on the pier, choose someplace else. Not at all worth the price.

excerpts: We had 2 cocktails, 2 sodas, order of oysters, filet, lobster tail and swordfish.
The bill was $200.00 (not including tip).
The oysters were the only decent item on the list.
The lobster was chewy and lacked flavor, the steak was bland and the swordfish was drowned in sauce.
All of the veggies/potatoes that came with the meals were overcooked.
The service was good but not great.
I wouldn't go back again.
oysters.author: Fresia M.
oysters.review:
The location is nice but the food is way overpriced and not very good.
We had 2 cocktails, 2 sodas, order of oysters, filet, lobster tail and swordfish. The bill was $200.00 (not including tip). The oysters were the only decent item on the list. The lobster was chewy and lacked flavor, the steak was bland and the swordfish was drowned in sauce. All of the veggies/potatoes that came with the meals were overcooked.
The service was good but not great. I wouldn't go back again.

excerpts: Got there early and thought some oysters would be nice.
