Fog Harbor is one of the nicer place on the Pier.
The front open space is spacious, modern and the fireplace is a nice touch.
oysters.author: Gloria H.
oysters.review:
3.5 stars

We went to Pier 39 for the live music - specifically for Tainted Love.  Got there early and thought some oysters would be nice.  Fog Harbor is one of the nicer place on the Pier.  The front open space is spacious, modern and the fireplace is a nice touch.  We had no idea the restaurant is huge - there are a lot of tables in the back.

We grabbed the first booth seat in the front and settled in.  Our waiter, Khaiman? was very friendly and great at selling.  What we had:

Anchor Steam - $6.23
glass of Prosecco - $8.5
1/2 dozen oyster (2x) - $13 - from Prince Edwards Island.  These were very good, plump, sweet, creamy and fresh.  I can probably eat a couple dozens easily.
curry mussels - $12 - pretty good, nice curry flavor with plenty garlic
clam chowder - ordered a bowl mainly because of the Yelp reviews but what a disappointment.  It was chalky and not very flavorful.  Since we didn't eat it, they took it off our bill.

The dessert tray looked very tempting - the bread pudding with Ghiradelli chocolate chips looked quite good.

excerpts: we ordered the fried calamari, garlic cheesy bread, and 1/2 dozen of oysters as appetizers.
i'm not too much of a seafood person
(yes, i know i'm "missing out" and i don't know how to eat good food haha)
so i only ate the calamari and garlic bread and not the oysters.
the calamari and the garlic bread were delicious, especially the bread!
definitely worth ordering
oysters.author: Sylvia H.
oysters.review:
i came here last friday with some friends. they wouldn't seat me because my party wasn't complete yet. but once all my friends arrived, they quickly seated us, so it was nice that we didn't have to wait for a table to be available. we were seated by the window with a stunning view of the sunset! :) we had two servers helping us that night. we ordered the fried calamari, garlic cheesy bread, and 1/2 dozen of oysters as appetizers. i'm not too much of a seafood person (yes, i know i'm "missing out" and i don't know how to eat good food haha) so i only ate the calamari and garlic bread and not the oysters. the calamari and the garlic bread were delicious, especially the bread! definitely worth ordering i ordered the fried combo, which consisted of shrimp, calamari, fish and chips. my friends really like seafood and i'm just okay with it. i was debating on whether or not to eat something non-seafood, but it wouldn't make sense to go to a seafood restaurant and not eat seafood.. haha. i really liked the fried combo! the portion size is huge and very filling. our servers brought out our complimentary bread kind of late and i was at the point where i was getting full. i couldn't finish my fried combo, but i ate the majority of it. when our bill came, our servers gave us each a biscoff cookie. my friend really likes them so she asked our servers if they could give us more and they ended up giving us two handfuls of biscoffs! LOL so we made sure to tip our servers even more. :)

notes: make sure your party is complete or they won't seat you! it's normally really packed around dinner time on the weekends (but surprisingly it wasn't for us on a friday night). your server will give you more biscoff cookies if you ask them to. it's definitely a nice restaurant to bring your date here, especially when the sun is about to set. though the noise level might be a bit too loud for you guys to hear each other talk.

excerpts: Best oysters I have ever had!
Never really thought it meant anything...
That most oysters taste the same...
But holly*!^$...
These are the best oyster of my life!!!
Great service, cocktails, and most of all...
OYSTERS!
Lol
oysters.author: Krys L.
oysters.review: Best oysters I have ever had! Never really thought it meant anything... That most oysters taste the same... But holly*!^$... These are the best oyster of my life!!! Great service, cocktails, and most of all... OYSTERS! Lol

excerpts: A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic.
oysters.author: Wally C.
oysters.review:
We were visiting pier 39 and quickly yelped for a good seafood place. The girlfriend wanted to try the crab shack, but I liked the vibe of this one. I'm glad we went here: the view was incredible, and the food was generally fantastic! 

We went with
 the "famous" clam chowder (in a bowl) - good but I don't see what the fuss is about

The seafood cioppino - this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly. You can't go wrong with this one. 

Lemon fried calamari - Tip, if you have a city pass or one of those flyers at the sf visitor center, be sure to exchange for a welcoming booklet at pier 39, you get the calamari free with two entrees.  This was better than we expected, with the calamari fried to just the right amount of crispness and the lemon sauce providing a bit of zest. 

A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic. 

If you're visiting pier 39, this place is a must.

excerpts: A couple of my favorites were the baked oysters, crab cakes, ciopinno (large portion), and the crab roll.
They also provided us with a free dessert due to my mom's birthday, which was their most popular, the ghirardeli fudge cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
It was very tender, warm, and soft like souffle.
Highly enjoyable meal.
Entrees range from $20-$30.
Appetizers average $10-$15.
Also, the restaurant provided great views of the pier and the bathrooms were clean.
Overall, a solid place to eat if you are looking for a seafood meal.
oysters.author: Patty O.
oysters.review: Extensive menu with delicious options to try. Parking is convenient as there is a Pier 39 garage in which the ticket can be validated. We made reservations online and enjoyed a bunch of delicious entrees. A couple of my favorites were the baked oysters, crab cakes, ciopinno (large portion), and the crab roll. They also provided us with a free dessert due to my mom's birthday, which was their most popular, the ghirardeli fudge cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was very tender, warm, and soft like souffle. Highly enjoyable meal. Entrees range from $20-$30. Appetizers average $10-$15. Also, the restaurant provided great views of the pier and the bathrooms were clean. Overall, a solid place to eat if you are looking for a seafood meal.

excerpts: One friend got a side of oysters and the clam chowder bread bowl, they enjoyed it.
And one got the crab roll, also good.
And another got the crab cakes, and had this mixed cider drink that was really good.
All in all everyone enjoyed their meal!
oysters.author: Ashley G.
oysters.review:
I had some friends visiting and they wanted two things: a restaurant near the water and seafood. I ended up picking this place, I was a little worried it was going to be ultra touristy, since it's at Pier 39. I was pleasantly surprised the restaurant is really nice! And definitely not overly gimmicky or anything.           

The food: I did the classic, clam chowder bread bowl, it was good! And I ordered a side of fries, which wasn't on the menu, but they were accommodating. One friend got a side of oysters and the clam chowder bread bowl, they enjoyed it. And one got the crab roll, also good. And another got the crab cakes, and had this mixed cider drink that was really good. All in all everyone enjoyed their meal!

excerpts: Oysters - both fresh and baked, were great, as well as the blue cheese garlic bread.
oysters.author: Sara D.
oysters.review: Awesome view, awesome service, awesome food, what's not to love?  Oysters - both fresh and baked, were great, as well as the blue cheese garlic bread.

excerpts: We had baked oysters for an appetizer.
I could have made a whole meal out of them because they were so good.
However, I wasn't disappointed with my main meal of a crab roll sandwich.
I'm not sure what kind of bread they used, but it was one of the best crab sandwiches I've had.
We also got great service with Tyler.
He provided good recommendations and was very friendly.
He checked on us to make sure we didn't need anything.
Will definitely go back!
oysters.author: Debbie W.
oysters.review: My husband and I came to here for lunch on a day trip to San Francisco. The food was awesome. We had baked oysters for an appetizer.  I could have made a whole meal out of them because they were so good. However, I wasn't disappointed with my main meal of a crab roll sandwich. I'm not sure what kind of bread they used, but it was one of the best crab sandwiches I've had. We also got great service with Tyler. He provided good recommendations and was very friendly. He checked on us to make sure we didn't need anything. Will definitely go back!

excerpts: We ordered the crab roll with sweet potatoes fries, dozen oysters, and the famous clam chowder.
On the crab roll the bread
was crispy and soft.
The oysters was amazingly delicious.
And the clam chowder is one of the best.
The meat was not chewy in the clam chowder.
It's truly perfect.
Everything was fresh and delicious.
I recommend here if you like seafood!
oysters.author: Jae S.
oysters.review: I was here when I came to san francisco for vacation with my bf. We love seafood. We made reservations the night before but the reservation was not booked when we got here. But since we were here when they opened at 11 there was lots of tables available. No problem. This place has a gorgeous view and the ambience is very nice. The service was okay, our server must have been having a bad day because our order came out late. We ordered the crab roll with sweet potatoes fries, dozen oysters, and the famous clam chowder. On the crab roll the bread was crispy and soft. The oysters was amazingly delicious. And the clam chowder is one of the best. The meat was not chewy in the clam chowder. It's truly perfect. Everything was fresh and delicious. I recommend here if you like seafood!

excerpts: But the oysters and clam chowder were so amazing
, I will always go back there just to have it.
There were other things on the menu that looked amazing too, so...
Gonna keep trying new things.
oysters.author: A S.
oysters.review: The CLAM CHOWDER!!!! Best I've ever had. Still dreaming about it. I ordered the calamari because it was on a lot of people's tables, but it was okay. The Swordfish was okay as well. But the oysters and clam chowder were so amazing, I will always go back there just to have it. There were other things on the menu that looked amazing too, so... Gonna keep trying new things.

excerpts: I am an oyster lover, but the oysters here are too small and shrank, not worth that expensive at all!
Anyway, service was good.
oysters.author: Niko T.
oysters.review: Clean and nice environment, but I was totally disappointed to the food there. Price is not $$ but $$$$. I am an oyster lover, but the oysters here are too small and shrank, not worth that expensive at all! Anyway, service was good.

excerpts: Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried!
Our server went above and beyond to make us happy.
We were very pleased.
The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so
if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking.
Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.
oysters.author: Alina K.
oysters.review: First time trying this place as recommended by our group. They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try! Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl! Everything else was also great. Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried! Our server went above and beyond to make us happy. We were very pleased. The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking. Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.

excerpts: I had their so delicious cioppino and their shackled fresh oysters and white wine.
oysters.author: Amy T.
oysters.review: It was all about seafoods and the view I came in for...I had their so delicious cioppino and their shackled fresh oysters and white wine.

excerpts: And oysters.
oysters.author: Kat M.
oysters.review: The food was good!!! For sure.  But I thought the menu selection was small, device was slow, and I had to ask for water.  The seared tuna was yum!! And oysters.

excerpts: The oysters were a little sad, not plump and delicious.
oysters.author: Jolie D.
oysters.review:
Good but not entirely worth the price. 

Shared a bottle of sparkling wine with two friends and split some seafood appetizers. The oysters were a little sad, not plump and delicious. The tuna poke was kinda standard and the Dungeonous crab cakes were good. 

For this tasting, we paid $118.

Eh. I've had money better spent.

excerpts: I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and oysters.
They also had pumpkin bread pudding as a fall special.
The service was better than most.
I would come back here next trip.
oysters.author: A. K.
oysters.review: The views and the food here are fabulous. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and oysters. They also had pumpkin bread pudding as a fall special. The service was better than most. I would come back here next trip.

excerpts: I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor.
The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters.
oysters.author: James T.
oysters.review:
This place actually surprised me. I'm a city native who doesn't expect much from restaurant around Pier 39, but this place was solid and reasonably priced. I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor. The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters. The pleasant surprise was the generous serving of clam chowder in a bread bowl that surpassed my expectations.

Oh, and our server was AMAZING. I feel awful for forgetting his name, but he was attentive at the right times without being intrusive.

excerpts: The baked oysters were delicious.
I had the surf and turf for market price ($58.00) and I would definitely recommend it.
You will not go hungry
that's for sure!
oysters.author: Brittney P.
oysters.review: Loved our experience tonight!! We sat by the window and it was so pretty! Great service and great food.. The baked oysters were delicious. I had the surf and turf for market price ($58.00) and I would definitely recommend it. You will not go hungry that's for sure!

excerpts: Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters.
Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents.
oysters.author: Arnaud S.
oysters.review:
Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good. 

My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.

excerpts: I loved the crab cakes, ahi tuna, and oysters.
Highly recommend this for a classy seafood meal with a view and a great variety of choices,
oysters.author: Brittany F.
oysters.review: Amazing fresh seafood!!! I loved the crab cakes, ahi tuna, and oysters. Highly recommend this for a classy seafood meal with a view and a great variety of choices,

excerpts: 1/2 Oysters:
Mini oysters was what it was really.
The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures.
Haha!
Foodie!
It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't...
oysters.author: Nhu-Quynh N.
oysters.review:
I came here for my birthday recently, and I must say, not too shabby.  I generally stroll down Pier 39 just because I love the pier/ocean view, and I've always see this restaurant.  Truth be told, I thought it was one of those upscale, dress up like a douche type restaurants.  I was wrong.

I was coming from San Jose, and was planning on having dinner before I go back home.  I was craving for sea food.  You come to San Francisco, you gotta have some sea food if not steak.  Anyways, I was looking for seafood, and found some reviews that shows this place was pretty good.  I didn't know how reservations were, so I had made reservations via Yelp.  When I did it on Yelp, my reservation became at 9:30PM. Meh, lame. 

So we came to Pier 39 walked around a bit, and said screw it.  Let's just ask them how long the wait is.  If it's longer than expected, we've already made reservations anyways.  So we walk up to the restaurant and their layout is quite cozy and warm for those who have to wait.  They have a nice little fireplace that will keep you warm because everyone knows Frisco can get quite cold.  So anyways, I ask the young woman at the podium about the wait time, and suggested I would like a window view.  I didn't expect it to be available considering it's around 6-7ish.  She took me by surprise and said, we are currently cleaning the table right now, and it's window view.  We sat down for like literally 2-3 minutes boom, here comes our waiter--let's go!  Omg, the view was amazing, I mean of course, I'm a sucker for scenery, but damn.  We sat towards the back, window view of the hills and the bridge, to the left was Alcatraz.  Perfect. 

Our waiter was Shawn, absolutely amazing.  Very fast pace, generous, and helpful on the suggestions.  My brother thought differently, felt although he could have been more helpful.  So.. Maybe I was more excited on eating than service. Who knows!

OK, food:  Quite expensive if you ask me, but was it worth it? Yes and no.  Some of the items, you can go out to the fish market and get it for cheaper.  But how it was cooked, well.. Stay tuned.

1/2 Oysters:  Mini oysters was what it was really.  The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures. Haha! Foodie!  It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't... Ugh...

Crab Cakes:  Oh my, these were so good.  They were going for $16, only two pieces, which I felt kind of ripped off.  I cannot deny it, they were bomb!  Once in a while, yes worth the $16. Lol, I'm all for cheap eats.

Bread Bowl:  Personally, I feel although they were better than Boudins.  I had Boudins down the street where you had to get it via cafeteria style and I am not a fan. This bread bowl was much smaller though, but you could taste the clam chowder better.  Not too much breading either, just enough to distribute.

Fog Harbor Burger:  Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.  Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.  Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.  They got it down as far as burger goes.

Fog Harbor 1/2 Lobster/Crab Meat:  Ok... This was quite disappointing.  This was their current specialty on the menu, and I honestly felt like I should have just gotten a full damn lobster tail.  The crab meat was just baked crab.  Nothing special about it.  They charged me a little more than just the lobster tail.  I prefer the lobster tail so much more than to order this again.

Fish and Chips:  Fried to a golden texture, very delish.  On point  Not much I can really say, I didn't really eat it.  My boyfriend ordered it. :P Sorry guys


Overall my experience was great.  The best part was that I got to see the sunset, and oh yea, even if you're not facing the window, there are mirrors so you can reflect the image.  I sat right in front which had the perfect view.  I loved it.

excerpts: Great views of the dock, fresh oysters, cold beer, creamy yummy clam chowder, crusty sourdough bread, yummy I am in heaven!
They have a great seafood menu of every crustacean
, Dungeness crab, fresh fish, and items for the land lovers too.
Great white tablecloth dining and servers.
oysters.author: Rhondi S.
oysters.review: On Pier 39, yes a touristy place, but we were doing the tourist thing! Great views of the dock, fresh oysters, cold beer, creamy yummy clam chowder, crusty sourdough bread, yummy I am in heaven!  They have a great seafood menu of every crustacean, Dungeness crab, fresh fish, and items for the land lovers too.  Great white tablecloth dining and servers.

excerpts: We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent.
Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot.
The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth.
oysters.author: Mike H.
oysters.review:
We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent. Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot. The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth. The Salmon was also very delicious. The service was also very good & promt. To sum it up it the experience was very good & we will definitely be back. 
                                                                 Mike H.

excerpts: The oysters were great!
The crab cakes were delish!
You can tell that they used fresh crab because of the softness of the cake.
They were good size too!
2 for 16 bucks.
The ciopinno was loaded with seafood.
Not skimpy at all.
And the texture of the crab was soft and snow white!
Our waitress was okay..
she missed a few steps of service.
Our apps and soups all came out at once..
no refills.. reaching way over...
but we will definitely be back!
oysters.author: Stephanie S.
oysters.review: My fiance and I just enjoyed a fantastic dinner here. The food was on point! all of the seafood was obviously fresh. The oysters were great! The crab cakes were delish! You can tell that they used fresh crab because of the softness of the cake. They were good size too! 2 for 16 bucks. The ciopinno was loaded with seafood. Not skimpy at all. And the texture of the crab was soft and snow white! Our waitress was okay.. she missed a few steps of service. Our apps and soups all came out at once.. no refills.. reaching way over... but we will definitely be back!

excerpts: Clam Chowder was deeelicious as well as the oysters!!
Definitely going back when i visit S.F.
oysters.author: Esther C.
oysters.review: Clam Chowder was deeelicious as well as the oysters!! Definitely going back when i visit S.F.

excerpts: Oysters had shells and grit.
No real menu
so I don't think they can call themselves an oyster bar.
Over priced for sure.
The only thing which was expected was the white wine.
I don't ever bash like this
but they seemed totally ignorant that it was a poor experience.
The host did her job just fine.
oysters.author: Bridget M.
oysters.review: Got sat right to the bar Memorial Day weekend. Beer glass was dirty. Service was inattentive. Oysters had shells and grit. No real menu so I don't think they can call themselves an oyster bar. Over priced for sure. The only thing which was expected was the white wine. I don't ever bash like this but they seemed totally ignorant that it was a poor experience. The host did her job just fine.

excerpts: We started with the shell fish tower and it came with crab, lobster, oysters and shrimp.
Everything tasted amazing and fresh.
For the entree I had the classic clam chowder and my parents had the halibut which I think was super tasty and flavorful!
This is a must eat place when you come to the pier!
It's worth every penny!
oysters.author: Devin D.
oysters.review: Some of the best sea food I have ever had! Ate here with my family of five. We got to sit in a booth near the window. There was a really nice breeze which was really nice considering it was a hot day. We started with the shell fish tower and it came with crab, lobster, oysters and shrimp. Everything tasted amazing and fresh. For the entree I had the classic clam chowder and my parents had the halibut which I think was super tasty and flavorful! This is a must eat place when you come to the pier! It's worth every penny!

excerpts: We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish.
oysters.author: Brooke G.
oysters.review: Yummy food and a beautiful view. Started off with a cucumber gimlet that was very refreshing. We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish. For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare, it came out perfectly cooked. Or should I say hardly cooked. It was just the way I like it. It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger. They complimented each other really well. Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11. It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check. My husband and I will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes! :D

excerpts: The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh.
oysters.author: Floyd A.
oysters.review:
The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.

I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.

My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.

excerpts: We had the crab and avocado salad and oysters!
The oysters were some of the best I have ever had and the salad was up there as well!
We also indulged in Margaritas, we had the regular and also the hibiscus and they were both delicious.
oysters.author: Tyler H.
oysters.review: Food was amazing! We had the crab and avocado salad and oysters! The oysters were some of the best I have ever had and the salad was up there as well! We also indulged in Margaritas, we had the regular and also the hibiscus and they were both delicious.

excerpts: Great location, view, oysters, clam chowder and bread - amazingly reasonable price on top of all that!
I highly recommend.
oysters.author: Celina M.
oysters.review: Great location, view, oysters, clam chowder and bread - amazingly reasonable price on top of all that! I highly recommend.

excerpts: Oysters were ok,"am not a oyster lover anyway
oysters.author: Pau S.
oysters.review: Excellent service, great food, Our server suggested the ahi poke and baked oyster for starters,we gave it a try and OMG,best ahi poke ever!!! Oysters were ok,"am not a oyster lover anyway" we also had the chili crab, lobster tail and the cioppino to share and we ended up with the dessert combo, we would definitely come back to this place because the food and the excellent service our waiter Oscar provided us.

excerpts: Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters.
Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend
oysters.author: A D.
oysters.review: Though my 1st visit didn't start well.... it ended well. Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters. Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend

excerpts: Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious.
oysters.author: Marielle S.
oysters.review:
Every time my family and I come up to San Francisco, we always stop by here for a meal. 

Service is excellent!!! Ask for Bong. He's amazing and definitely treats you like family. 

Food. Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious. My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined. I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good. And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to. 

It can get a bit pricey, but you're paying for excellent food and excellent service.

excerpts: Oysters are superb!!!!
Really great view of a the bay and excellent atmosphere.
Would definitely return!
oysters.author: Kristen K.
oysters.review: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl! Definitely opt to add crab! Oysters are superb!!!! Really great view of a the bay and excellent atmosphere. Would definitely return!

excerpts: my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters.
She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary.
she said baked oysters was OK.
she said baked oysters was OK.
oysters.author: P S.
oysters.review:
Yes, 4 star is for Fog Harbor. I went with my Fiance to have dinner a few days ago. We went on a little mini adventure for food. Our frist time at the Fog Harbor. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT!  although the food was not as great, i come for a good experince of customer service and i got that from the bar and NELSON was our server. awesome server! I got a fish and chips with fries and it was not what i expected. Ive had BETTER fish n' chips. my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters. She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary. she said baked oysters was OK. 

Her Clam Chowder on the other hand, she took 2 bites and she was done! she said the clam chowder tasted like its been sitting out to get it to our table. Basically she said the chowder was not what she expected. she was expecting something delish since we are at the Harbor and they are known for their chowder. 

Overall, i will probably give this place another chance for a 2nd come back. MAYBE their other entrees are better.

excerpts: the chowder was filled with clams and the oysters were as fresh as could be....
our table was at,the window and the view was delightful....will return
oysters.author: Elizabeth F.
oysters.review: Returned here from our trip of last year and again  it did not disappoint. ...our waitress, ariana was polite and on point....chatting with us and providing feedback on the food.  The fish and chips were delicate and flavorful...French fries were delish...fried platter also was light and delish....the chowder was filled with clams and the oysters were as fresh as could be....our table was at,the window and the view was delightful....will return

excerpts: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.
oysters.author: John K.
oysters.review: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.

excerpts: We had a the clam chowder in bread bowl, sliders and baked oysters to eat.
To drink; the gimlet and dirty martini.
Everything was on point and we were very pleased with Fog Harbor.
oysters.author: M H.
oysters.review: Amazing food and service (Bernie)! We had a the clam chowder in bread bowl, sliders and baked oysters to eat. To drink; the gimlet and dirty martini. Everything was on point and we were very pleased with Fog Harbor.

excerpts: And the oysters left much to be desired.
Not to mention the crappy service at the bar.
oysters.author: Sara C.
oysters.review: Not sure why this gets four stars. It earned two because of the outstanding views. But clam chowder was mediocre. The "side salad" was four pieces of Romaine. And the oysters left much to be desired. Not to mention the crappy service at the bar.

excerpts: Tried some oysters from here and they were great!
I definitely recommend.
Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!!
oysters.author: Danielle F.
oysters.review:
Came here around 2pm with no reservation. The wait was only about 15mins. 

I'll start by saying I am not a fan of blue cheese AT ALL but figured id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon. It was AMAZING! Exceeded expectations. 

Tried some oysters from here and they were great! I definitely recommend. Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!! Loved it 

I ordered the entree with the crab cakes, big mistake!!! I love crab cakes but I tasted everything EXCEPT the crab so that's obviously not something I would order here again. 

My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips which were exceptional! Wish I had ordered that instead. It's cooked to perfection! 

I ordered a Long Island, which was sub par. It's a pretty strong drink but the purpose of the Long Island is to not taste how strong it is. I'd try something different.

excerpts: I can only review them on their raw oysters and clam chowder,  because that's what I had.
The clam chowder was plain and bland.
Very small pieces of clam and nothing else but cream base.
It was boring.
As for the oysters,  they had one kind.
They were just ok.
Walk down to the ferry terminal and Hog Island has 7 fantastic choices.
Take a pass here if these two items are what you're looking for.
oysters.author: Brian M.
oysters.review: Service was good.  I can only review them on their raw oysters and clam chowder,  because that's what I had. The clam chowder was plain and bland. Very small pieces of clam and nothing else but cream base. It was boring.  As for the oysters,  they had one kind.  They were just ok.   Walk down to the ferry terminal and Hog Island has 7 fantastic choices.  Take a pass here if these two items are what you're looking for.

excerpts: Must try if you like raw oysters, shrimp and crabs.
oysters.author: Ann C.
oysters.review: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner as we watched the sunset on the bay. Very beautiful!! Our waiter Samir was very funny and prompt with all of our requests. The seafood tower was very fresh and delicious. Must try if you like raw oysters, shrimp and crabs. We ordered the black cod, salmon and clam pasta. All very well prepared and extremely fresh!

excerpts: Started off with the oysters and both the taste and quality were very good.
We had the linguine with clams and the lobster.
Both dishes were good and the price was within line for the quality.
Good atmosphere and generally a place for all.
oysters.author: Ryu C.
oysters.review:
Spent the weekend in SF and had dinner here on an early Saturday evening.  Staff and everyone at the restaurant were extremely polite and accommodating.  
Started off with the oysters and both the taste and quality were very good.  We had the linguine with clams and the lobster.  Both dishes were good and the price was within line for the quality.  Good atmosphere and generally a place for all.

excerpts: My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT.
oysters.author: Ford S.
oysters.review:
When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT. 

The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

excerpts: The oysters were also great along with the crab dip.
If you like seafood this is a great place to stop in.
We ate at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table and had great service from the bartender.
oysters.author: Scott M.
oysters.review: Great views of the harbor hence the name fog harbor fish house. I had the Crab sandwich which was loaded with crab meat and served in deliciously toasted bread. The oysters were also great along with the crab dip. If you like seafood this is a great place to stop in. We ate at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table and had great service from the bartender.

excerpts: And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend
and I have ever had.
Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.
oysters.author: Virginia B.
oysters.review: Best clam chowder sourdough bread bowl ever--flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend and I have ever had. Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.

excerpts: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great.
Servers were also attentive and courteous.
oysters.author: Jonathan G.
oysters.review: Agreed tourist trap. Acclaimed clam chowder does not have much flavor and clams are lacking. Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering. Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread). Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through. Plusses: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great. Servers were also attentive and courteous.

excerpts: The seafood tower had half of a small lobster, half a dozen oysters, and half of a small crab.
The best part of the meal were probably the raw oysters.
Clean, sweet, and delicious.
However, we did happen to get $1 oysters at happy hour the night before at Boudin which made the comparison price here expensive.
Beautiful view of the ocean though.
oysters.author: C K.
oysters.review: Came here for a late lunch at 2PM visiting from LA on Valentines day weekend. Took about 40 min for 4. We had the seafood tower ($65), fried shrimp ($20) and muscle fries ($20). The food was good, but probably not worth the price. The seafood tower had half of a small lobster, half a dozen oysters, and half of a small crab. The best part of the meal were probably the raw oysters. Clean, sweet, and delicious. However, we did happen to get $1 oysters at happy hour the night before at Boudin which made the comparison price here expensive. Beautiful view of the ocean though.

excerpts: We had their special which consisted of dungeness crab, lobster, boiled shrimp, and oysters on the half shell.
Everything was very fresh and tasted very good.
oysters.author: Brent S.
oysters.review: The food here was very good and our server Shawna was awesome.  The have a great view of the bay too.  We had their special which consisted of dungeness crab, lobster, boiled shrimp, and oysters on the half shell. Everything was very fresh and tasted very good.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo.
Overall, the food was just okay.
Service wasn't too great either.
oysters.author: Micah Anne M.
oysters.review: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.

excerpts: I ordered a couple oysters, which were amazing and made me wish I ordered more!
oysters.author: Mindy B.
oysters.review:
One of the best restaurant experiences my husband and I have ever had! It's a lovely, elegant place while still having a relaxing, casual feel.

We made reservations, and secured a nice table overlooking the bay. I enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread, which is free with yput Yelp check-in! Too bad my husband couldn't eat any, because of a gluten allergy.

I ordered a couple oysters, which were amazing and made me wish I ordered more! I ordered Garlic Herb Dungeness Crab, which was amazing!

This place is great about handling food allergies. My husband has gluten and mushroom allergies, and ordered the chicken, with which he was thoroughly impressed. 

Definitely go here for a lovely atmosphere, delightful food, and a classy experience!

excerpts: My brother ordered the raw oysters and chili pepper shrimp.
The raw oysters didn't come until after we finished our other appetizers, and only after we asked about them.
oysters.author: Nicholas D.
oysters.review:
Breakdown: High price, good location, very mediocre food. Wouldn't come again.

I expected better food from this place after seeing the reviews. I ordered the Curry Muscles and Calamari. The muscles were some of the tiniest I have ever seen and the curry was bland and heavily watered down, more soup-like than curry. My brother ordered the raw oysters and chili pepper shrimp. The raw oysters didn't come until after we finished our other appetizers, and only after we asked about them.

excerpts: Order anything, but be sure not to skip the baked oysters - 2nd best in the country.
oysters.author: Sean T.
oysters.review: Awesome Ambience, Fandamntastic Food, Stupendous Wait Staff. Be sure to request the sourdough bread. Order anything, but be sure not to skip the baked oysters - 2nd best in the country.

excerpts: I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember.
Only 1 selection.
The condiments given could have been better.
They are a seafood restaurant
so I expected to have a larger oyster selection.
The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there.
It felt a little stale to me.
The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well.
oysters.author: Lisa n.
oysters.review:
This place is not too bad if you're not looking for something mind blowing. Don't get me wrong, I believe the food here is great and the quality is phenomenon. But the food just doesn't make you crave to remember. The place has a nice view, it's located on the pier, and the decor is very lovely. 

I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember. Only 1 selection. The condiments given could have been better. They are a seafood restaurant so I expected to have a larger oyster selection. The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there. It felt a little stale to me. The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well. I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl it was an okay amount. I didn't leave feeling full. The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh. I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before. We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made. It tasted great and it wasn't too weak. Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird. Overall, its's an okay place. Not great but definitely not something you must try. I tried to like the place, but I can't still. 3 stars because it's not a bad place.

My friend had the lobster stuffed crab. He enjoyed it. Still he agreed that it's not a memorable place. 

The server was nice though. He helped us quite a bit.

excerpts: We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters.
The oysters were fresh and delicious.
The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood.
oysters.author: Alice A.
oysters.review:
I was delighted to be seated right away, but the experience was far from 5 stars. Our waitress brought us dirty plates. I requested new ones and they came back less dirty (probably the same ones wiped down). 

We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood. Two shrimps, two scallops...not to mention we ordered the additional pasta ($2) but there was none. 

We decided to order a burger because it wasn't enough food. We waited for a while. Our waitress came back to tell us that the kitchen was busy and if we want to cancel our order. We agreed and she apologized about the pasta and the burger. $46 spent and still hungry, it would have been better if we ate somewhere else in Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the awesome romantic view of the ocean and nice ambience of the restaurant, the food and service were not up to par.

Avoid touristy restaurants I guess, unless they are the only available option.

excerpts: Other than that, if you love oysters, you gotta try the baked one.
IT WAS DELICIOUS!
Star.
If i knew it was that good, i would have ordered three instead of that salad -_-
but nope.
The osyter appetizer came after our dinner.
But yeah i don't think i'll come back :l
oysters.author: Frances S.
oysters.review:
This was kinda late but i had to leave a review. I came here with my boyfriend on forth of july to see the fireworks. We yelped this before we came to the pier and gave this place a try. I know they were busy and i didnt mind the wait for an 1 hour and a half. Luckily there was a lounge so my boyfriend and i were able to rest. When we were seated we thought we got the best seat because it was at the corner near the windows. We can see the fisherman wharf but on my right, people from outside can see us which was awkward. So the waiter was very sweet and was kind to take a picture of my boyfriend and I. Since I LOVE the picture so much, i had to give him a tip. So anyways, 1 star for the service. Food....however....
Was HORRIBLE. My boyfriend order the Surf and Turf, medium rare. Nope. It was well-cooked. Then he ask the waiter for a recommendation for a heavy wine. My boyfriend thought it was all right. Wasn't heavy for him, but everyone is different.
So for my food. I order the Caesar salad (idk the full name but it's close to it). Maybe it was me, but I have never really experience not having my lettuce cut so i had to cut them myself. I asked for chicken too but they only gave me like 8 small pieces and 3 croutons.....I was upset. I had way better salad at other places. Other than that, if you love oysters, you gotta try the baked one. IT WAS DELICIOUS! +1 Star. If i knew it was that good, i would have ordered three instead of that salad -_- but nope. The osyter appetizer came after our dinner. But yeah i don't think i'll come back :l

excerpts: We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable.
They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings.
We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl.
We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for!
Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance!
oysters.author: Lauren Y.
oysters.review:
This place was really awesome. We made reservations even though it was located in the heart of Pier 39. I was looking for a delicious restaurant that didn't have a strict dress code. (I'm 8 months pregnant and don't have the widest variety of formalwear) ;) 

We decided to try several appetizers, and then split a dinner instead. It turned out to be an excellent decision. The meal starts out with a perfectly prepared sourdough bread, it was so delicious. We had the calamari, I really enjoyed the dipping sauce and found it the batter to be delightfully crispy. My fiancee, didn't agree with the breading, as he prefers the light crispy kind. We also split the steamed mussels, they came in a delicious broth that was savory and delicious. We both agreed, these were absolutely amazing! We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable. They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings. We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl. We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for! Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance! For our main course, we split the cioppino. It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth. It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me. For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous... they really know their way around the dessert area! 

The entire meal only set us back about $150 which was pretty awesome for location and the amount of food we ordered. Make a reservation and ask for a window seat, the view is beautiful. If we happen to make our way back to the San Francisco area, we will definitely be back!

excerpts: And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!
oysters.author: Aileen D.
oysters.review: Boudin was a cluster so we headed upstairs to FHFH for a snack.  So glad we did.  We opted to sit at the bar and were promptly taken care of.  The chowder in a bread bowl was amazing with a little added pepper and a little bit of tabasco.  The parmesan risotto crab fritters were a tad over fried but were delicious nonetheless.  And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!

excerpts: You HAVE to get the baked oysters!
oysters.author: Cristina M.
oysters.review:
WOW this place is AMAZING! You HAVE to get the baked oysters! We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.

The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. They didn't seem to be bothered that we showed up with four people more than our reservation! They told us to come by again right at sunset; apparently the view is incredible. 

I got half a garlic crab which was super fresh, delicious, and economical. Also, in order to not single me out, they put bibs on our whole table - we had a blast taking pictures!

Go here, bring friends!

excerpts: Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine.
All were excellent.
Would definitely recommend.
Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.
oysters.author: Melanie T.
oysters.review: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.

excerpts: Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces.
Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before.
Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start.
The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.
oysters.author: Luke R.
oysters.review:
Looking for a restaurant in the Wharf that wasn't a total tourist trap, but would satisfy my lady's desire for seafood, I found Fog Harbor through Yelp. We weren't disappointed.

The food was excellent, and service was stellar throughout. Our waitress was attentive without being a hovering presence, and took care of everything from corkage (it's only $12; you might do well to bring your own bottle) to dessert recommendations (more on this later--holycarp). When we asked for more lemon, she brought a plate of six nicely arranged wedges. 

We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl, which we shared. It was, as others have noted, creamy, full of clams, and not too salty. Of course you must not only dip the small wedge-shaped bread top, but also eat as much of the bread bowl as you can handle without jeopardizing your ability to put away dessert. 

Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces. Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before. Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start. The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.

For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns). Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh. All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky. The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious. If I must pick a gripe, I'd take issue with the mixed vegetables--they were overcooked (to my taste; some of the zucchini strips were completely soggy) and unimaginative, though still a step up from the simply steamed carrot, cauliflower and broccoli you'd find at many common seafood joints. 

The dessert tray offered some interesting selections alongside a couple old standbys. In addition to the expected creme brulee and apple crisp, there was a pumpkin bread pudding, some kind of individually baked chocolate cake, and a pumpkin cheesecake. My girlfriend is currently obsessed with pumpkin to what's likely an unhealthy degree, so we got the cheesecake. Moreover, our waitress said it was to die for. She never lied--eating it was like biting into the spiced flesh of an angel, only sweeter and less sacrilegious.  

Two appetizers, two entrees, corkage fee and dessert came to just over $100. You can easily pay more for less in the heart of San Francisco's #1 tourist trap. If you're not on a budget, and you want to enjoy some well-prepared seafood with minimal frills and gimmicks, you might give Fog Harbor a try. We left thoroughly stuffed, and very happy.

PS: Parking is $7/hr in the nearby Pier 39 garage, but dinner will get you 2 hours free if you remember to validate (NB: I did not remember to validate).

excerpts: Lastly, the oysters were great!
Cold, fresh, and big!
oysters.author: Rita S.
oysters.review: Clams in the chowder (one or two in every spoonful) were meaty and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was nice. Heavy, but great. I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo. Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl. We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item. Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.  Lastly, the oysters were great! Cold, fresh, and big!

excerpts: Excellent service and the freshest seafood you could ask for... a dozen oysters, crab stuffed lobster and a whole roasted garlic crab.
We also shared chowder and a salad...
Outstanding... will definitely back again before crab season is over!
oysters.author: Donna V.
oysters.review: Decided to brave Pier 39 on a Sunday evening since we were craving whole crab... Because it's such a touristy area I really wasn't expecting such an amazing experience. Excellent service and the freshest seafood you could ask for... a dozen oysters, crab stuffed lobster and a whole roasted garlic crab. We also shared chowder and a salad... Outstanding... will definitely back again before crab season is over! :)

excerpts: Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters.
Visited twice in our trip.
My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues.
Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.
Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.
oysters.author: Christi G.
oysters.review: The steamed mussels were one of the best things I have ever had! Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters. Visited twice in our trip. My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues. Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.

excerpts: The clam chowder, oysters, crab, dessert were all very good.
The sour dough bread they serve was really good.
The atmosphere was nice and the bathrooms were really clean.
The wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday night.
Would go again when I am in San Francisco.
oysters.author: Mark H.
oysters.review: The food was very good.  The clam chowder, oysters, crab, dessert were all very good.  The sour dough bread they serve was really good.  The atmosphere was nice and the bathrooms were really clean.  The wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday night.  Would go again when I am in San Francisco.

excerpts: I had some delicious oysters as an appetizer then a chicken dish that was amazing.
The waiter was very knowledgeable about wines which was very helpful.
The best part must have been the service, it almost seemed like we were the waiter's only table.
The wait was a bit long but we put in our name before our whole party arrived and got in just as they were calling our group.
It was a good place.
oysters.author: Lisbeth B.
oysters.review: I had some delicious oysters as an appetizer then a chicken dish that was amazing. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wines which was very helpful.  The best part must have been the service, it almost seemed like we were the waiter's only table.  The wait was a bit long but we put in our name before our whole party arrived and got in just as they were calling our group.  It was a good place.

excerpts: We ordered the oysters and chowder to start with.
Although most places claim to have the best chowder in the area, this was the best I've ever had.
The menu is good as it offers something for everyone even if you don't like fish.
We all really enjoyed meals.
I had the tuna which was cooked to perfection and came on a delicious bed of wild rice.
The only reason it gets 4 stars opposed to 5 is because the service was very average.
Our waitress was slow and forgot something that we ordered.
Overall I highly recommend Fog Harbor if you are in the area and a fan of fish.
oysters.author: Louise F.
oysters.review: We went here for dinner on our final night in San Francisco. We booked a table earlier in the day to reserve a window seat. I highly recommend doing this as the views are amazing. Even at night, you can see the boats sailing on the harbor and the flashing of the lighthouse on Alcatraz. We ordered the oysters and chowder to start with. Although most places claim to have the best chowder in the area, this was the best I've ever had. The menu is good as it offers something for everyone even if you don't like fish. We all really enjoyed meals. I had the tuna which was cooked to perfection and came on a delicious bed of wild rice. The only reason it gets 4 stars opposed to 5 is because the service was very average. Our waitress was slow and forgot something that we ordered. Overall I highly recommend Fog Harbor if you are in the area and a fan of fish.

excerpts: The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh.
oysters.author: Lauren C.
oysters.review: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!

excerpts: We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers!
oysters.author: Jennifer W.
oysters.review:
My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.

We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters! 

For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!

Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!

excerpts: The oysters tasted like the ocean.
My only pet peeve was that my table did not get any bread!!
As we were leaving we realized everyone who hadn't started their meal yet were given complimentary bread!
But not us!
oysters.author: Owl R.
oysters.review:
One of the best seafood restaurants on Pier 39. Very reasonably priced. The oysters tasted like the ocean.
My only pet peeve was that my table did not get any bread!! As we were leaving we realized everyone who hadn't started their meal yet were given complimentary bread! But not us!

excerpts: We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp.
The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever.
Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome!
Sevice was ok.
oysters.author: Leah P.
oysters.review: Went here with a group of 8 friends for our last night in San Fran. Our apps were awesome! We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp. The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever. Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome! Sevice was ok.

excerpts: The oysters were super fresh and their complimentary bread was super good!
oysters.author: Kimm P.
oysters.review: Yumm! Went here during vacation with three of my girlfriends. Our waiter was super nice and on point with service. Food was bomb too! The oysters were super fresh and their complimentary bread was super good!

excerpts: My boyfriend took me here for a sea food platter for two: crab, muscles, oysters, corn, scallops the works.
The bread was fabulous and the clam chowder was perfect.
Although I did enjoy my dinner here, I suspect this is the type of place for upscale tourists to dine at during after hours.
This place comes with a price tag as everything here is pretty pricey.
The only thing that you'd be happy with is validation for parking if you park in the garage across the street.
oysters.author: Lea M.
oysters.review:
Trying to get a table on a Friday night is damn near impossible. 

My boyfriend took me here for a sea food platter for two: crab, muscles, oysters, corn, scallops the works.  The bread was fabulous and the clam chowder was perfect.  Although I did enjoy my dinner here, I suspect this is the type of place for upscale tourists to dine at during after hours.  This place comes with a price tag as everything here is pretty pricey.  The only thing that you'd be happy with is validation for parking if you park in the garage across the street.

excerpts: Oysters on the half shell were fabulous as well.
They were accommodating to our friend with dietary limitations too.
Our server offered suggestions on the menu for her.
oysters.author: Jennifer L.
oysters.review: My husband and I dined here twice in the week we visited San Francisco. The food was incredible! The crab cakes were delicious, the calamari was good, the sourdough bread was wonderful. Oysters on the half shell were fabulous as well. They were accommodating to our friend with dietary limitations too. Our server offered suggestions on the menu for her.

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are.
What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate.
I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank!
I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them
but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...
a little harsh
and I feel bad for ever thinking that
but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad)
oysters.author: Abby W.
oysters.review:
Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service. 

We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...

Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.

excerpts: My sister had the crab last time and oysters tis time both were excellent!
I have also had the molten cake both times and it is sooooooo good!
The Blondie is also great!
I will be back!
oysters.author: Kirsten F.
oysters.review: I have eaten here twice and both times were outstanding! I had the new York steak and to was cooked perfectly and had wonderful flavor!  My sister had the crab last time and oysters tis time both were excellent! I have also had the molten cake both times and it is sooooooo good! The Blondie is also great!  I will be back!

excerpts: Clam chowder and oysters are delicious.
Do not get the calamari.
Worst calamari ever.
Server went on break and no one was really checking up on us.
I ordered a cup of clam chowder and never received it.
oysters.author: Grace H.
oysters.review: Clam chowder and oysters are delicious. Do not get the calamari. Worst calamari ever. Server went on break and no one was really checking up on us. I ordered a cup of clam chowder and never received it.

excerpts: Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!
oysters.author: Victor G.
oysters.review: This place is awesome! Great view, it's worth every minute that you have to wait for a seat near the window. Great service, very friendly. Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!

excerpts: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and
creme brulee was delicious.
Couldn't recommend highly enough!
Also service was no.1.
A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.
oysters.author: Laura P.
oysters.review: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and creme brulee was delicious.  Couldn't recommend highly enough! Also service was no.1. A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.

excerpts: Baked oysters-nothing special.
Glass of Sauv.
Blanc.
maybe thins will get better?
Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something).
Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.
At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly.
Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/
oysters.author: Josefina L.
oysters.review:
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly!
The Good:We were seated right away and the view was great.
The Bad:We didn't even see our server for 10 minutes.What kept us entertained while waiting was dodging chairs being moved above us to add to the table next to us. No waters, no bread. Finally the server shows up.  Got our waters and ordered appetizers. Waters showed up and nope can't order main yet so our server can get a couple of people out of there first...Ok then..alright, he's back so we ordered our main courses just in case we don't see our server for another long while.  Kids get clam chowder bread bowls(they miss these since we did live in Monterey) and burgers & fries.  Hubby gets the linguine with crab added on top as recommended by our server.  I get the shellfish combo also recommended by our server. Appetizers showed up-poke & sliders were really good. Baked oysters-nothing special. Glass of Sauv. Blanc. maybe thins will get better? Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something). Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.  
At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly.
Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/ the crayons they gave...waiting...waiting...

and now The Ugly: family next to us got their food before us?  I watch another server take our food (had to be because that table were already ordering desert) to the table in front of us then walks away..Our server returns and asks,"You guys ordered the bread bowls right?" I say "yes, but she went to the wrong table-the one in front".  The poor girl apologizes to our server.  Not her fault she was given wrong directions.  Hubbies linguine arrives-no crab added so server asks the girl to have the crab added.  My shellfish plate arrives-I try a clam & mussle, oh great-it's cold.  Server takes it back saying well the bottom is warm..ok..girl server comes back with another bread bowl?  uh, not us.  Our server puts the bread bowl in front of me to start with until my plate is fixed.  Taste the chowder--oh my how much I miss my Monterey Old Fisherman's Grotto. The 14 year old eats it instead. BTW, the kids were starving after a long drive and golden gate bridge adventure.  Hubbies linguine comes back with crab on top all right.  They threw a pile of COLD crab on top of hot pasta?  Yuck.  Hubby is starving so he decided to just mix it all together to warm the crab. Shellfish mix shows back up-and now it's hot since according to our server he watched just come off the grill. I look down at what was my original plate just reheated so now the food is over done. Clams, crab and mussles are dried up. The shrimp were overcooked so they were tough-I gave these to the hubby.  The best part of this $35 plate-the corn on the cob.
Considering the price ($196) is about the same as our family usuals-Sardine Factory, the Whaling Station, Old Fisherman's Grotto, Saporo, etc., we were all very disappointed.

excerpts: Good crab rolls, fresh oysters, ok house white & great
SF homemade sour dough.
Clam chowder excellent.
If stuck in area I'd return over all the other spots around it.
oysters.author: Surfdawg M.
oysters.review: Probably as touristy an area on Fisherman's Wharf as you could find.... But food is good---better than all the others(cept for Hog Island). Good crab rolls, fresh oysters, ok house white & great SF homemade sour dough. Clam chowder excellent. If stuck in area I'd return over all the other spots around it.

excerpts: Miyagi oysters, score :)
Portions are quite large, so beware of over-ordering (or just get yummy leftovers to go).
Wine list is reasonable also - the Syrah was a winner!
oysters.author: Claudia J.
oysters.review: Great views, great food, great service! Miyagi oysters, score :) Portions are quite large, so beware of over-ordering (or just get yummy leftovers to go). Wine list is reasonable also - the Syrah was a winner!

excerpts: For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters.
The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams.
The oysters had a strange flavor.
I would not get it again, but it was edible.
oysters.author: Kristine L.
oysters.review: An alright seafood restaurant. Lots of menu choices to pick form..I had a hard time deciding. For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters. The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams. The oysters had a strange flavor. I would not get it again, but it was edible. For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too. I was expecting a bit more flavor. Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.

excerpts: Then i ordered some oysters.
And man they were great.
So clean and a great vinegar sauce along with hot sauce put them in my top 5 fav oysters.
Which i knew what kind they where (waiter did not say).
oysters.author: Kyle T.
oysters.review: What a nice resturant. Started off with a great bloody mary. Def one of my top 5 fav bloody marys. Then i ordered some oysters. And man they were great. So clean and a great vinegar sauce along with hot sauce put them in my top 5 fav oysters. Which i knew what kind they where (waiter did not say). Then i got the smoked salmon with a cup of clam chowder. Salmon was good but not memorable. But clam chowder was really good too. Wish i lived in SF just to be able to go here more often.

excerpts: - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari.
They are all GREAT!
oysters.author: Evette B.
oysters.review: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!

excerpts: I absolutely love their baked oysters and the clam chowder is really delicious!
oysters.author: Rocio A.
oysters.review: This place is touristy but it is pretty good! I've been here a few times, specifically when I have visitors at home that want to see Pier 39, and they all loved it!! I absolutely love their baked oysters and the clam chowder is really delicious!

excerpts: Oysters were so very good and the bartender was very attentive.
oysters.author: Ramin P.
oysters.review: Amazing view of the the bay. Oysters were so very good and the bartender was very attentive.

excerpts: The food was pretty amazing especially the fresh oysters.
They serve sourdough bread that is extremely fluffy but be careful it can fill you up.
We tried the crab roll, clam linguine, sample platter and the clam chowder.
All of it was delicious.
Our server, Bong, was great.
Actually he was excellent!
And the reason I prob would've given this place 5 stars instead of 4 but the kitchen was slow and it took almost 45 mins to get our food.
Other than that I'd recommend giving this place a try.
oysters.author: Elizabeth L.
oysters.review: Can't visit SF without eating some seafood.  Yelped this place for dinner and decided to give it a try. The food was pretty amazing especially the fresh oysters. They serve sourdough bread that is extremely fluffy but be careful it can fill you up. We tried the crab roll, clam linguine, sample platter and the clam chowder. All of it was delicious. Our server, Bong, was great. Actually he was excellent! And the reason I prob would've given this place 5 stars instead of 4 but the kitchen was slow and it took almost 45 mins to get our food. Other than that I'd recommend giving this place a try.

excerpts: We tried the swordfish that was cooked perfectly, sour dough clam chowder that is so creamy and delicious, oysters was fresh, lobster and calamari were great too.
oysters.author: L C.
oysters.review: Food is amazing. We tried the swordfish that was cooked perfectly, sour dough clam chowder that is so creamy and delicious, oysters was fresh, lobster and calamari were great too.

excerpts: There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...
the chocolate soufflé is delicious).
Everyone loved everything!
oysters.author: C D.
oysters.review: We were looking for a place to have a special dinner (Easter); this place was perfect! The restaurant itself is very appealing with the views and decor...of course the food and service is the most important. The service was great! Thank you Mila! We had drinks and appetizers as soon as we ordered them! There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...the chocolate soufflé is delicious). Everyone loved everything!

excerpts: Oysters were amazing but calamari didn't taste fresh.
Service was subpar at best.
Great view.
oysters.author: Jay O.
oysters.review: Food was good. Oysters were amazing but calamari didn't taste fresh. Service was subpar at best. Great view.

excerpts: The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.
All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.
Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.
While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.
oysters.author: Marianna K.
oysters.review: Great view, friendly service, and delicious food.  The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.  All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.  Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.  While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.

excerpts: We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo!
It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it!
Would definitely go back!
oysters.author: Laura C.
