oysters.review: Excellent service! Food was great and very fresh! We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo! It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it! Would definitely go back!

excerpts: Manager came over to ensure care with Celiac order - oysters were delicious as well.
Highly recommend, despite the slightly touristy location you wouldn't know you were inside pier 39.
oysters.author: E R.
oysters.review: Delicious and very knowledgable about Celiac Disease (gluten free). Our waitress Meron kindly taught us how to open our first crab and delivered terrific service even during prime time. Portions were extremely generous, albeit of course rich/heavy. Manager came over to ensure care with Celiac order - oysters were delicious as well. Highly recommend, despite the slightly touristy location you wouldn't know you were inside pier 39.

excerpts: My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.
oysters.author: Mark J.
oysters.review: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!

excerpts: I thought the oysters, shrimp cocktail, ahi tun, crab and avocado with mango salad and calamari were all excellent.
My fellow diners were really impressed with the fresh sourdough.
Is this a towny restaurant, no, but it was a good choice for a large group of business people from out of state.
oysters.author: Maria S.
oysters.review: I'm going to try and be fair with this review.  Sure the place is in the MOST TOURISTY area of town and the prices do reflect that, but that being said the restaurant is comfortable, has professional staff and a great view of the golden gate bridge so you expect to pay more.  I sampled a lot of appetizers while I was there.  I thought the oysters, shrimp cocktail, ahi tun, crab and avocado with mango salad and calamari were all excellent.  My fellow diners were really impressed with the fresh sourdough.  Is this a towny restaurant, no, but it was a good choice for a large group of business people from out of state.

excerpts: We like the oysters, spicy shrimp, and calamari.
The clam chowder is great.
The staff welcoming and friendly.
I know it's a tourist place
but hey, when I come to San Francisco, I'm a tourist!
oysters.author: Jim H.
oysters.review: We love coming here. We come for happy hour and enjoy a wonder meal of appetizers and bowls of clam chowder. Nice warm sour dough bread and butter. We like the oysters, spicy shrimp, and calamari. The clam chowder is great. The staff welcoming and friendly. I know it's a tourist place but hey, when I come to San Francisco, I'm a tourist!

excerpts: Were seated at the bar immediately, able to enjoy not only great views and excellent food (the oysters are to die for)
but also great
bartenders-
they created an impromptu cocktail crafting competition and we did not leave disappointed.
If you're in a group, this is a great choice as the San Francisco know it all were just as impressed as the first timers.
oysters.author: Rachel C.
oysters.review: Visiting San Francisco with family as part of a long birthday/bachelorette week. After taking a BYOB bay cruise, we were starving and looking for a nice sit down place (not so easy to find in Fishermans wharf) but not so nice that our slightly loud, relatively inebriated (for 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon) party wouldn't ruin the experience for anyone else. Enter Fog Harbor. Were seated at the bar immediately, able to enjoy not only great views and excellent food (the oysters are to die for) but also great bartenders- they created an impromptu cocktail crafting competition and we did not leave disappointed. If you're in a group, this is a great choice as the San Francisco know it all were just as impressed as the first timers.

excerpts: We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.
The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.
All in all I am glad we went there
but I don;t feel the need to go there again.
oysters.author: Laura F.
oysters.review: My husband and I went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  The restaurant looks great.  It is in a very crowded area of the wharf.  We were able to watch seals lounge on the docks during our meal.  We were really hoping for fresh local seafood but instead the menu s filled with alaskan fish or maine lobster.  The only local catch is the crab.  I had the halibut and it was dry and sitting on a bed of undressed arugala.  My husband's seafood platter looked great and tasted alright but was swimming in garlic butter.  We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.  The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.  All in all I am glad we went there but I don;t feel the need to go there again.

excerpts: The oysters were small and I've had better quality at the super market.
oysters.author: Kristine T.
oysters.review:
So, let me first say my internet went out just as I was sending my review and erased it, BUT I'm determined to tell everyone else not to waste their time and money so I wrote the whole thing again.

If I could give this place .04 stars I would.  Prior to this my worst dinner was at McCormick and Kuleto's but at least they tried to seem like they cared about their customers.

My bf and I went there last night to celebrate our anniversary.  Granted we weren't looking for anything too fancy or high maintenance.  After we were seated it was close to 15 mins. until anyone came by, so we sat there with no water or anything.  When the waitress came she was abrupt and pretty rude.  We ordered our wine and the oyster appetizers.  The oysters were small and I've had better quality at the super market.

For dinner my bf ordered the rib eye and I had the seared prawns over linguine with the house salad to start.  When the salad came it was WILTED spring mix, two cherry tomatoes, one slice each of red onion and cucumber, and super stale croutons.  The food took a long time after that.  The steak was ok, nothing special and my pasta tasted worst then a noodle roni dinner.  I've had much better frozen food from Trader Joes.

We didn't order dessert bc we didn't want to waste anymore time or money.  So, overall - service was horrible, food was just as bad, and halfway through dinner they started blasting the AC until another customer complained for them to turn it off.

I wouldn't go back here if they paid for my dinner ! Sorry, I'm just pissed about a wasted meal out.

excerpts: Came here for Xmas Day, the Oysters with Mignonette are still incredible, as is all the food - mouth watering good.
oysters.author: Samanta V.
oysters.review:
Came here for Xmas Day, the Oysters with Mignonette are still incredible, as is all the food - mouth watering good.

but WTF?? no Happy Hour on Xmas?  That was the biggest draw last year, and they put the sign out - but the bartenders said it was a no-go this year.  That saddened me for about 2 seconds.  (i still love their food)

Although the bartender was a bit of a bitch all around this time,  If you don't want to work on Xmas, then you should find someone else to cover your shift, and not be grumpy with the people who come it.. I'm just saying..

excerpts: Hubby luved the baked oysters.
oysters.author: LINDA R.
oysters.review:
Sat at the bar on 1 of the nicest days San Fran had this yr.  GR8 views!  Had a perfect Sunday afternoon.  

Raymond, bartender, was extremely attentive & courteous.  We concocted a new martini, which i suggested should be their signature drink!  

The manager, Micheal, was professional and came over to make sure entire experience was to our liking.  Hubby luved the baked oysters.  

FYI: Spoke to friends of ours who live in San Franciso, and although this is suppossidly a 'tourist' place, locals visit here on a regular basis.

excerpts: Known for its oysters, we ordered a dozen, followed by the seafood platter.
The food was quite delicious.
oysters.author: Gary H.
oysters.review: When I arrived, there had still been people waiting for a table. Luckily for us, we made a reservation for lunch day. Our hostess seated us right next to wall-sized windows, which had a beautiful view of the San Francisco harbor. We could see Alcatraz and Fisherman's Wharf. Known for its oysters, we ordered a dozen, followed by the seafood platter. The food was quite delicious.

excerpts: We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers.
oysters.author: Meera V.
oysters.review: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!

excerpts: crabs, oysters , mussels and desserts as well
...... thank you to our server Shawna ,for making it possible, you're the best...
traffic & parking was horrible....also, thank you  to Bernie g.... great place, and excellent foods..
oysters.author: Pamela V.
oysters.review: had lunch at fog harbor and foods were all delicious.... crabs, oysters , mussels and desserts as well...... thank you to our server Shawna ,for making it possible, you're the best...traffic & parking was horrible....also, thank you  to Bernie g.... great place, and excellent foods..

excerpts: It was here that I had my first experience with oysters, and raw ones at that!
The cocktail sauce served with them had just the right amount of sinus clearing heat, the oysters themselves were very fresh and delicious.
oysters.author: Renae H.
oysters.review:
When you have out-of-towners visiting you there are a few touristy things you really must do.  One of those things is a visit to the wharf.  It was on such a Saturday that we discovered Fog Harbor Fish House.

Having grown up around here I have a fairly typical disdainful attitude about 'tourist trap' type places, I have to tell you, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here.  The prices were not nearly as bad as I expected (about $30/person with drinks but without dessert) and the food was actually quite tasty.  It was here that I had my first experience with oysters, and raw ones at that! The cocktail sauce served with them had just the right amount of sinus clearing heat, the oysters themselves were very fresh and delicious. 

Between the three of us we had the seared tuna salad, a pasta dish and a burger, we were well satisfied with our meal.  The wine list had several pleasant options and the view was, of course, spectacular.  It was one of those rare days when the sun was shining, the sky was clear and the water was sparkling, the perfect day to enjoy a table by the window, which we did. There was a bit of a miscue at the beginning of the meal, we hung out in the bar while waiting for our table and despite being there for about 15 minutes never did manage to get one of the bar tenders to take our drink order.

What made our experience though was our server, Jay, apparently it was his first weekend there (though not his first weekend as a waiter), he was quick, attentive without hovering, friendly and funny.

While I don't often spend time in this part of town you can bet that the next time I have visitors we'll make our way back here.

excerpts: We all had different entrees that consisted of shrimp, crab, oysters, etc.
Everything was fresh and tasty.
The prices were in the medium range, but it was good value for money.
The great service from our waiter, Khaiman, made the experience one that we won't forget.
We will return next year!!!
oysters.author: Leo J.
oysters.review: My family and I visited at the beginning of August.  We all tried the clam chowder...man was it great!  We all had different entrees that consisted of shrimp, crab, oysters, etc.  Everything was fresh and tasty. The prices were in the medium range, but it was good value for money.  The great service from our waiter, Khaiman, made the experience one that we won't forget.  We will return next year!!!

excerpts: had 2 orders of raw oysters.
They really enjoyed those.
The entree portions were ample.
I finished my crab cake sandwich and fries.
Others finished their tuna and shrimp scampi.
oysters.author: M C.
oysters.review:
(3.5 stars)
Based on my experience and the comments of my friends.
We were about 20 mins early for our reservation, but were seated right away. Table was set & ready. Got service right away.
Enjoyed the appetizers: shrimp, bleu cheese toast & my friends had 2 orders of raw oysters. They really enjoyed those.
The entree portions were ample. I finished my crab cake sandwich and fries. Others finished their tuna and shrimp scampi. Others took home what was left of the fried combo plate. Although they said they did not like the fish. 
The cocktails looked nice but not special. Supposedly had 2 types of rum in my drink but could hardly taste it. My friend ordered a pomegrante "daquiri" which the menu read $4 because it was a 'virgin'. She was charged $9 for an actual cocktail. It was corrected.
They were nice enough to split the checks three ways for the 8 of us. 
I got a free dessert for my birthday. Warm chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. Which we shared because we were too full for individual desserts.
The decor is clean and the windows are huge & give a nice view of the piers. 
Got parking validated.
Not sure if I would ever go back since I hardly ever go to Pier 39. But overall not a bad experience.

excerpts: Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird.
I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated.
oysters.author: Katherine L.
oysters.review: The service is great, the people were super nice and friendly. I like how they give customers a sample of wine without asking or anything, which I guess is a form of marketing. The clam chowder s really good, creamy and chunky, although there isn't really anything about it that makes it particularly any better than other places. Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird. I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated. For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good. I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me. There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite. The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there. The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices. All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.

excerpts: we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious!
we almost ordered a second round.
then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for!
oysters.author: Angelina A.
oysters.review: My boyfriend and i were on vacation in SF for his bday and i was looking for a place to take him for dinner on his special day. i came across this place and man was i happy i chosen it. first let me say i think this was the best seafood ive ever eaten. we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious! we almost ordered a second round. then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for! then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end. the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy. my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had. the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz. oh and our service was so great! he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf. couldn't of wished a better experience.

excerpts: They had the lobster, which looked divine and oysters looked good too.
We saw someone else with the whole crab and it was HUGE!
But, it was late and we were too hungry to be hassled with tearing apart a crab to eat.
Service was great and the view was really nice.
We will be back if we return to San Fran!
oysters.author: Anne B.
oysters.review: We made reservations here after our Alcatraz night tour and we were starving!! We started off with the Lemon Calamari - YUM!!! Best calamari ever! The other people in our party had the clam chowder and crab cakes.  They absolutely loved the crab cakes, but were not blown away by the chowder.  The sourdough they give you is delish - it was gone in minutes.  The fish and chips looked amazing! HUGE portion of fish and it was thick and really good according to my sister in law.  My husband and I both had the crab roll with sweet potato fries.  The fries were amazing, but I wish the roll had chunks of crab, instead of the flaked kind.  It was just a little mushy, but good flavor.  If I had to do it over, I'd probably get fish and chips.  The table next to us had a little of everything - and we were drooling watching it come out.  They had the lobster, which looked divine and oysters looked good too.  We saw someone else with the whole crab and it was HUGE! But, it was late and we were too hungry to be hassled with tearing apart a crab to eat.  Service was great and the view was really nice.  We will be back if we return to San Fran!

excerpts: We had a dozen oysters which were on the table shortly after our drinks and delicious bread.
I had the Ahi Tuni starter that was very fresh and had spectacular flavor, would be a recommendation for those looking for some good flavor.
My daughter had the seafood pasta which was huge and when she was done he offered a to go box.
Even though we had a coupon for 20% off, he made sure we were taken care of.
When we asked him about movie theaters in the area he was enthusiastic and offered info on three different locations.
While the food here is amazing, make sure you ask for Ryan to make the experience even better!
We will be coming back the next time we visit the West Coast.
oysters.author: Ashley G.
oysters.review:
I was here in San Francisco on vacation with my daughter and we stopped by here because we had heard it was amazing...and my friends didn't do it justice!!! We had a fantastic table with a view of the Golden Gate bridge and a waiter (Ryan) who treated us with a lot of care and attention. 
We had a dozen oysters which were on the table shortly after our drinks and delicious bread. I had the Ahi Tuni starter that was very fresh and had spectacular flavor, would be a recommendation for those looking for some good flavor. My daughter had the seafood pasta which was huge and when she was done he offered a to go box. Even though we had a coupon for 20% off, he made sure we were taken care of. When we asked him about movie theaters in the area he was enthusiastic and offered info on three different locations.
While the food here is amazing, make sure you ask for Ryan to make the experience even better! We will be coming back the next time we visit the West Coast.

excerpts: For appetizer, I tried the Clam Chowder in the bread bowl which was really creamy and tasty, fresh oysters - freakin' delicious, and even the baked oysters were noteworthy, and the crab cakes were to die for!
baked oysters.author: Cynthia D.
baked oysters.review:
Amazing spot for great food with view of Alcatraz and the pier.

My party of four enjoyed our seafood dinner here and the sunset view was gorgeous. For appetizer, I tried the Clam Chowder in the bread bowl which was really creamy and tasty, fresh oysters - freakin' delicious, and even the baked oysters were noteworthy, and the crab cakes were to die for! For entrees, we got the seasonal Jumbo Scallop and Crab Meat Risotto and the Seafood Penne. Both were solid dishes! I loved the crab flavor in the risotto. 

Infamous restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf whereas the wait can be for hours. Luckily for us, Yelp Waitlist was the MVP! I wish more restaurants implement this in NYC. I simply opened my handy Yelp app and tapped to join the waitlist (must be within 40 miles) while I was commuting from my hotel in Lower Haight. It would give me an estimated time to check in with the hostess and approximately how many parties are ahead of us. My friends and I were exploring Fisherman's Wharf the entire time until time got closer. Ta Da!

excerpts:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay.
baked oysters.author: Phi N.
baked oysters.review:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. I was pretty disappointed that they remove the shell from the crab and clean all the yellow poop; that stuff is delicious 

Went with the flan and tiramisu for desserts. Both were delightful and delicious. 

Service was just average. Our server was training and it showed, lol. But even the guy training him wasn't that great.

excerpts:
It was ok

Food:
-1/2 Baked Oysters (5/5): I am such a huge connoisseur for baked oysters and these were so delicious.
baked oysters.author: Trinh V.
baked oysters.review:
We came here on a Friday night and we were lucky that we got a reservation that day! When we walked in there was already a crowd of people waiting to be sat and now I can see why. Most places on the water are tourist traps and the prices are usually high but we were on vacation and also wanted to see the sunset so here goes it. 

We requested a table next to the window where we could see the sunset. Our waitress was kind and we had no issues here with service.

Drinks:
-Hibiscus Marg (4.5/5): Delicious! A sweet but not too sweet drink. 
-Lipstick Lemondrop (3.5/5): Not my fav lemondrop. It was ok

Food:
-1/2 Baked Oysters (5/5): I am such a huge connoisseur for baked oysters and these were so delicious. It's hot so be careful. I requested no bacon. 

-Shellfish Platter (4/5): It comes with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and potatoes. The whole platter is doused in butter and it lays on a puddle of butter and garlic. The minced garlic tasted amazing. The butter was a little overwhelming but it was decent and filling. It's pretty messy so they have a bib for you. 

-Fried Combo: I did not try this so I can't rate this dish.

-Creme Brûlée (4/5): Omg I'm not a huge creme brûlée fan but they have the best creme brûlée I have ever tasted!

-Blondie (4/5): So nutty and delicious!

The sunset was covered by the clouds so we couldn't see much but from what we could see it was beautiful! Delicious food and great service.

excerpts: We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters.
Everything was so good I don't have any complaints.
We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset.
On top of that, service was impeccable.
Would definitely come back in the future.
baked oysters.author: Jessica T.
baked oysters.review: Used yelp to reserve our table and were seated right away so it was already off to a great start.  We tried not to order too much as we wanted to try a different restaurant (we're from Orange County so we wanted to make our way around the city), but ended up ordering too much because there was so much we wanted to try! Nonetheless, the food was great! We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters. Everything was so good I don't have any complaints. We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset. On top of that, service was impeccable. Would definitely come back in the future.

excerpts: The crab cakes and baked oysters were delicious and packed with good flavor.
Being on a special diet, they were able to modify the dish as per my restrictions.
My dish arrived with an allergy tag.
baked oysters.author: Tejashree M.
baked oysters.review:
We were able to put our name down, see the pier and come in time for dinner for our turn. The place was pretty packed on a Saturday night. We got a table in the corner where it felt little crowded/claustrophobic. However, it was much better when neighboring table emptied. I would have loved to have a window-side table, perhaps next time.
The crab cakes and baked oysters were delicious and packed with good flavor. Being on a special diet, they were able to modify the dish as per my restrictions. My dish arrived with an allergy tag. The salmon was great and went well with arugula and the smoky taste of peppers. I wondered if it tasted so good with the exceptions, how well it would taste with all its original ingredients. Their desserts were presented well and I was very tempted but found the courage to pass.. The service was good and we were taken care of/ checked on without anybody being persistent/annoying.

excerpts: We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.
Everything was delicious.
The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.
Will totally come back.
baked oysters.author: Eleonor T.
baked oysters.review: Came here for my mother's 75th Birthday.  The food was absolutely fabulous. We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.  Everything was delicious.  The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.  Will totally come back.

excerpts: But I can tell you this much, get the clam chowder and stick with the baked oysters.
They're so good!
My friend got the seared scallop risotto special and it was so tasty!
Wouldn't mind coming back during the day to see the bridge views this place brags about
baked oysters.author: Noel B.
baked oysters.review: After a long flight into the city this place was very good. Nice and tranquil vibe with excellent service. The atmosphere is nice but not uppity, but I wouldn't come in to dine in my yoga pants here. The seafood menu all sounded ohh so good but my appetite this evening wanted smaller bits. But I can tell you this much, get the clam chowder and stick with the baked oysters. They're so good! My friend got the seared scallop risotto special and it was so tasty! Wouldn't mind coming back during the day to see the bridge views this place brags about

excerpts: We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again.
We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.
It was good also.
baked oysters.author: Asia V.
baked oysters.review: Good food,atmosphere, service and view. This restaurant has it all. We went here for lunch on our Anniversary after reading the reviews.  I can tell you that this is a good place to go for a date or if you just want to have delicious seafood. We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again. We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.  It was good also. We then shared the combo fried seafood plate and the shellfish platter. We had so much food it was for dinner as well. I give them 5 stars and looking forward to our next trip. Yummy!

excerpts: Beautiful restaurant with wonderful baked oysters.
Clam chowder was creamy and yummy.
Beautiful place to go for a special occasion or date.
baked oysters.author: Judi H.
baked oysters.review:
Beautiful restaurant with wonderful baked oysters. Clam chowder was creamy and yummy. Beautiful place to go for a special occasion or date. Sunset views were spectacular. 

Margarita was yummy so was the shrimps Brochette

excerpts: That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too.
When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates.
I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me.
The presentation lost its "WOW" factor
baked oysters.author: Alan L.
baked oysters.review:
Smacked in the middle of Pier 39, I was excited to try this place out because of the amount of reviews it has and the amazing look food. 

The restaurant looks super fantastic. Very high class restaurant except you don't have to be all dressed for it. 

There was only 3 dishes I wanted to try. That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab. 

The baked oysters was such an awesome starter. That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious. I wish I had 3 dozens of those. 

The famous clam chowder in a bread bowl. Probably the best clam chowder I have ever had. The consistency, the flavor, and the chuck of clams were great. The sour dough bread really compliments well with the clam chowder. 

The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too. When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates. I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me. The presentation lost its "WOW" factor and I was super disappointed in that. 

Otherwise the crab was very good. Great garlic flavor. Good chunks of crab meat. 

Should really give this place a shot. Great seafood dishes. Except if you get a whole crab, make sure they serve it whole and not split between two plates.

excerpts: We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.
All dishes were excellent.
Would recommend the baked oysters especially.
The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.
But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.
Would recommend the baked oysters especially.
The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.
But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.
baked oysters.author: Scott S.
baked oysters.review: This was my wife and I's first taste of San Francisco seafood.  There are countless options in and around the San Fran area.  We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.  All dishes were excellent.  Would recommend the baked oysters especially.  The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.  But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.

excerpts: The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.
baked oysters.author: Brady B.
baked oysters.review: Brady Bunte - I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39.  It truly was an amazing place. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.  Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.

excerpts: Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty.
Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams.
Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked.
The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT.
I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent.
We were not checked upon by our waiter.
Not once did he ask if everything was okay.
baked oysters.author: Anjelica N.
baked oysters.review:
The food was pretty good. Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty. Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams. Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked. The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT. I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent. We were not checked upon by our waiter. Not once did he ask if everything was okay. After our dinner was finished, 30 minutes went past and I had to grab the waiter's attention for the check.

Side Note: I made the waiter aware that I was there celebrating my birthday. I guess they don't celebrate birthdays here and give a dessert as other places do, because nothing came after dinner.

excerpts: We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake.
Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.
baked oysters.author: Harshini R.
baked oysters.review: Loved absolutely everything here! The service was great. The food was amazing and the dessert was pretty good too. We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake. Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.

excerpts: To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce.
These oysters were incredible.
It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor.
baked oysters.author: Hai L.
baked oysters.review: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

excerpts: Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!
baked oysters.author: Christine A.
baked oysters.review:
wow!  I love this place.

we managed to get a window-view table; an awesome water/land and Alcatraz picture opportunity before or after your meal.

we had a wonderful server named Kayla.  She is very nice and very helpful with Appetizer and Meal recommendations.
Very, very attentive!   

food and service; ON POINT!

Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!

Will definitely be back here!!!

excerpts: My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder.
baked oysters.author: Cruz C.
baked oysters.review: We came to celebrate my wife's birthday here. My wife had the halibut. My oldest child had the pan seared chicken. My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder. I had the Shellfish platter. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Worth every penny! We will be coming again.

excerpts: My wife and I started w/ their baked oysters (oysters Rockefeller,) which were spectacular.
Was hard to hide my southern roots as I wanted to pick up the shell and shoot i down, but I refrained and used a fork.
For my entree I had the crab roll.
I'm a sucker for a New England Lobster Roll, and this was similar.
Crab was shredded so it was closer to crab salad, than the lump meat of a lobster roll.
It was amazing though.
Sweeter meat than a lobster.
Delicious.
My wife had the fresh local caught halibut fish and chips.
As good as I've had across the pond.
Pay a little extra for the view, but worth it.
You can see the sea lions on Pier 39 from your table.
baked oysters.author: Adam B. J.
baked oysters.review: I'm a sucker for a view.  Fog Harbor has a great one.  This was our first meal and stop in SF, and it didn't disappoint.  Our server was helpful, polite, and attentive.  My wife and I started w/ their baked oysters (oysters Rockefeller,) which were spectacular.   Was hard to hide my southern roots as I wanted to pick up the shell and shoot i down, but I refrained and used a fork.  For my entree I had the crab roll.  I'm a sucker for a New England Lobster Roll, and this was similar.  Crab was shredded so it was closer to crab salad, than the lump meat of a lobster roll.  It was amazing though.  Sweeter meat than a lobster.  Delicious.  My wife had the fresh local caught halibut fish and chips.  As good as I've had across the pond.  Pay a little extra for the view, but worth it.  You can see the sea lions on Pier 39 from your table.

excerpts: We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh).
Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.
baked oysters.author: Kate H.
baked oysters.review: My husband and I dined here tonight and we have no faults! We chose the restaurant because we wanted to try a chowder bread bowl and Fog Harbour's didn't disappoint - it was incredible. Highly recommend paying the $7 extra to get crab pieces included. We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh). Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.

excerpts: The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters
baked oysters.author: Daniele T.
baked oysters.review: Great food, will definitely go back again. The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters

excerpts: The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again.
Clam chowder was solid.
baked oysters.author: Joe O.
baked oysters.review:
We were STARVING  from a drive from Napa and needed a place to eat. Some friends were eating there so we joined. It's full of tourists as expected and the food isn't bad at all. The cioppino was not good, at all. Seafood in it was good but it was a super thick sauce. The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again. Clam chowder was solid. The scallops were really good.

The line was crazy outside and it's really loud.

excerpts: Baked Oysters (5/5)
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time !
That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy.
I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used
but I'm guessing it's ricotta .
I didn't read the menu for it lol.
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time !
That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy.
I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used
but I'm guessing it's ricotta .
I didn't read the menu for it lol.
I just saw baked oysters
and I had to try It.
I just saw baked oysters
and I had to try It.
They're small oysters, so it's super yummy
hehe.
baked oysters.author: Jenny N.
baked oysters.review:
I came here a little before noon and it wasn't too crowded considering it was a Monday after all. 

S E R V I C E 
We were immediately sat down when we walked up to the podium. I can't recall if my server had mentioned her name or not. The service was pretty good I have to say. They were really attentive and patient with me when I couldn't decide what I want to eat yet. 

They validate parking garage tickets for an hour :) that's $9 !! Hehe. 


F O O D ! ! 

Clam chowder (5/5) 
I have read some of the reviews and people say the clam chowder is the best. It was Good but I can't say it's the best I ever had. I honestly haven't tasted THE best yet. So I'm still looking. However, this one IS pretty good. Some places are very stingy with their clams. Not here though. They gave a pretty decent amount of clams in their soup. I'd still give it a 5/5 :) cause it was good. Not too salty , which is great.

Baked Oysters (5/5) 
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time ! That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy. I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used but I'm guessing it's ricotta . I didn't read the menu for it lol. I just saw baked oysters and I had to try It. They're small oysters, so it's super yummy hehe. I recommend trying it. 

Seared Tuna- 2/5 
This entre was too salty. Not the tuna, but the veggies and the sauce it was cooked in was too salty and very overwhelminThe garlic mash potato was pretty average. The fish was okay too. I wasn't a really big fan of this dish, so I was kinda disappointed.

excerpts: Baked oysters
: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked.
Even the cheese on top was cold.
But this is where the service shined.
Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well.
When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.
baked oysters.author: Jack R.
baked oysters.review:
I feel rich. Like lottery winning rich.

I won a $100 gift certificate here, and I went all out when it came to ordering food.

But don't worry, I'm not that selfish. I like to share the wealth, so I invited my friends and paid the difference.

Here's what we had and our thoughts.

Clam chowder: Great, creamy, clam-y. Everyone loved their clam chowder. The ones with the bread bowl loved the bread too.

Caesar salad: Huge portion, good dressing, not overly great, just okay.

Baked oysters: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked. Even the cheese on top was cold. But this is where the service shined. Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well. When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.

Large Shrimp Cocktail: Delicious, and lived up to it's name. They were large. So good we couldn't stop ordering and eating these. 

Crab cakes: Excellent flavor. More crab meat than breading, great texture. We ordered several of them because we liked them so much.

Chippino: Huge,and filled with things you would find under the sea. Clams, crab, salmon, I mean this thing was a cauldron of goodness.

I want to say that our waiter was exceptional and was always there to fill up water, and even bagged up fresh sourdough for one of my friends who wanted to take some bread home.

Being that this is a tourist spot, I highly recommend it for tourists who may be overwhelmed with all the choices on the Pier.

Even as a local, I can say, I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome.
baked oysters.author: Kritpong S.
baked oysters.review:
Great food, awesome view, good waiter, horrible hostess.

Took my wife there for a fancy dinner with a view today for our last dinner in San Francisco. The dinner started off great with prompt seating and we ordered our food. 

The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome. 

So after dinner my wife and I took turn to go to the restroom after we ordered dessert. While my wife walk away the waiter came and took our dishes and drop off 2 dessert spoons. Not a minute after that I over heard 2 hostess talking no more than 5 feet away from our table about how we have been sitting at the table for a long time not ordering anything and why are we not leaving. I was shocked and pissed off at them. 

I looked over at them and they gave me a look like oh you heard that? Then took a couple step back and kept talking about us and other table. WTF? 

Totally ruin the experience for me. I understand that it's a busy friday night but we were not just lounging around not ordering any food. Even if we were to lounge around enjoy the view after our meal we should be able too in peace! We end up spending over $100 for the meal and I was totally disappointed with the experience.

excerpts: Our menu: my wife started out with the fabulous baked oysters, with a cocktail of a Hibiscus Margarita.
The clam chowder cup was perfect but I added a pinch of salt to bring in the true sea flavor.
I had a really good Prosecco which cleansed the pallet for each new flavor.
We split a Cal crab Caesar for $30.00 and this is why this rating is NOT a 5 star.
The lettuce was really "off color", seemed bagged and had a strange if not bland taste.
We separated the lettuce from the wonderful crab, bacon and croutons which made it perfect.
The main course of Scallops was perfect with crab and just a touch of cheese in the Risotto.
The Scallops were "crisp" on the outside, perfectly grilled, the inside was tender, moist and most flavorable.
A really good restaurant, except for the lettuce and
we will tell friends and family of our dining experience.
baked oysters.author: John94521 H.
baked oysters.review: Had a lunch date with my wife because we Love to come to the city and find new restaurants that satisfy our tastes and palates. Pier 39 can be a busy and busselling place during the summer but we decided to take a chance on this restaurant. I made reservations for 11:30 am on a Friday, and it worked out perfectly. The open door policy and greeting at the door was very inviting. The hostess was friendly and showed us to a table for two by the window. My wife faced the bay and I faced the tourists walking the Embarcadero, perfect. The bird droppings on the window didn't detour us from ordering a wonderful lunch. Edgar, our waiter, did a fine job of serving us. The restaurant was almost empty when we entered but became packed by noon. Our menu: my wife started out with the fabulous baked oysters, with a cocktail of a Hibiscus Margarita. The clam chowder cup was perfect but I added a pinch of salt to bring in the true sea flavor. I had a really good Prosecco which cleansed the pallet for each new flavor. We split a Cal crab Caesar for $30.00 and this is why this rating is NOT a 5 star. The lettuce was really "off color", seemed bagged and had a strange if not bland taste. We separated the lettuce from the wonderful crab, bacon and croutons which made it perfect. The main course of Scallops was perfect with crab and just a touch of cheese in the Risotto. The Scallops were "crisp" on the outside, perfectly grilled, the inside was tender, moist and most flavorable. A really good restaurant, except for the lettuce and we will tell friends and family of our dining experience.

excerpts: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer.
baked oysters.author: Victor A.
baked oysters.review: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer. For our main course we had the Filet mignon

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill.
Everything was soooo tasty.
Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times.
It's hard to get my boyfriend
and I full,
but I left stuffed!
The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.
baked oysters.author: Jeca D.
baked oysters.review: Tyler was great. My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill. Everything was soooo tasty. Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times. It's hard to get my boyfriend and I full, but I left stuffed! The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.

excerpts: We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne.
The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce.
It was so good!
The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat.
The seafood penne was not too greasy
and it was huge.
baked oysters.author: Allie Y.
baked oysters.review:
I came here  for a date night. At first, we were scared that this could be a tourist trap since it is in the heart of Pier 39. We wanted to go somewhere with a nice view and good seafood so we chose this place.

We waited about 20 mins for our complimentary bread and butter to come out. The waiter told us that it was still baking in the oven. When it came out, it was freshly baked so i didn't complain.

The food was amazing! We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne. The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce. It was so good! The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat. The seafood penne was not too greasy and it was huge. All of the seafood tasted very fresh!

Something that bothered me was that there were desserts laying out in random places of the restaurants. It seemed unsanitary to me.

The service was not bad. It took a while for our food to come out on a Saturday evening but i'm not complaining since the food tasted good. The prices are decent for seafood, location, and the gorgeous view. There is no outside seating but you can request for a table next to the window with the beautiful ocean view. 

I'd come back!

excerpts: Baked oysters were incredible.
Crab cakes were fresh and had real crab.
It was the best place for oysters I have experienced during my week long trip.
Highly recommended!!
baked oysters.author: Theresa B.
baked oysters.review: Baked oysters were incredible. Crab cakes were fresh and had real crab. It was the best place for oysters I have experienced during my week long trip. Highly recommended!!

excerpts: I had the clam chowder bread bowl with the baked oysters appetizer.
It was amazing the chowder was creamy and delicious.
The oysters were rich in flavor but extremely hot when they bring them to you so dont burn your tongue.
The overall experience was amazing and i will definitely be back
baked oysters.author: Kassy M.
baked oysters.review: I had the clam chowder bread bowl with the baked oysters appetizer. It was amazing the chowder was creamy and delicious. The oysters were rich in flavor but extremely hot when they bring them to you so dont burn your tongue. The overall experience was amazing and i will definitely be back

excerpts: apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters.
Both were delicious!
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
baked oysters.author: Julia M.
baked oysters.review:
Very ambivalent about this place. First downside is that they don't take reservations so when we (locals) wanted to go here at 7 PM on a Saturday night, we knew we'd have to wait a while. It ended up taking about 45 minutes.

PROS
-Amazing views! We got seated in the area right on the water. The sun was setting right behind the GGB. It was great. 
-We couldn't decide which bottle of wine we wanted so the waiter let us all taste both! They have a pretty good wine selection.
-For apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters. Both were delicious! The baked oysters were great in an interesting way... Spinach, bacon, and cheese, yum!

CONS
-Once we decided which wine we wanted, it took the waiter a realllllly long time to actually bring out our bottle (at least 20 minutes).
-Our mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic! Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad... It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top. When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon. So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab. While it was very good, there was nothing with it. I was, at least, expecting some butter to dip my crab in.

Again, really ambivalent about this place because the food was pretty good but there were just a few blunders. It's also pretty expensive here.

excerpts: Ordered the baked oysters, clam chowder cup and crab cakes.
They were good.
They weren't New Orleans
seafood good.
baked oysters.author: Matthew D.
baked oysters.review:
Came in at 1230 on a Saturday. Pretty busy although only waited 15 minutes at the bar before a table with an awesome view of the bay became free. Saying that - sitting at the bar listening to an angry bartender bitch about his "f$cking sh1t" work colleagues for 15 minutes was funny/annoying.

I got carded (I'm 29..!) so they wouldn't serve me alcohol. But it's cool, I should have brought my ID.

Ordered the baked oysters, clam chowder cup and crab cakes. They were good. They weren't New Orleans seafood good. The clam chowder was the best of the bunch.

Overall, food a 4, service a 2, so this gets a 3.

excerpts: We start off with the baked oysters and calamari.
baked oysters.author: Tram T.
baked oysters.review: Five stars for the service! Our server was super attentive and very nice. He made sure to check on us and refilled our drinks. As for the food it was okay. We start off with the baked oysters and calamari. For entrees we had the linguine with clams and Dungeness cioppino. The food was mediocre. I rather go to swan or hog island next than come back here.

excerpts: Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino.
I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal!
baked oysters.author: Jodi H.
baked oysters.review:
Came here for the 2015 SF Restaurant Week with my family on a Sunday night for dinner ($40 dinner menu per person) and EVERYTHING was fabulous and delicious.

I highly recommend coming here. As a born-and-raised NorCal kiddo and lover of all things seafood (shoutout to pescatarians), I gotta hand it to the crew at Fog Harbor. Y'all were ON YOUR GAME that night! I'll be recommending this place to anyone looking for the quintessential San Francisco meal with a romantic, classy, and worthwhile dining experience. 

The service from start to finish was undeniably amazing. We reserved for an early dinner around 4PM, but couldn't make it (coming from South Bay) until 7:30PM for many reasons. But even though we were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes, before we knew it we were seated after only 3 minutes! We were seated at a booth on the lower level a distance from the panoramic windows, but we loved having the grand space for our dining experience. Our server was very understanding, cracked a few jokes here and there, and was just the right amount of "leave us alone/serve us." I gotta give props to the manager of the night who personally went around to all of the tables to offer an amuse-bouche...we thought it was because of SFRW, but he literally went around to all of the tables! 

The food!! MAN!! That deserves its own rating. The four of us ordered all of the starters, entrees, and desserts (since there were only 3 selections, we double'd on the chocolate cake...best decision ever). FOODGASMS to the max, y'all. Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino. I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal! By the time desserts rolled around we were all delightfully satisfied, but loosened our belts for the BEST melt-in-your-mouth-chocolate cake and surprisingly yummy bread pudding! 

Fog Harbor is not a joke. Nor is it a tourist trap. It's got dedicated management, a classy service team, and an unbeatable view at Pier 39. Maybe I'm still reeling from my SFRW high, but it's worth a visit...trust me!

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.
All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.
Presentation of the food was on point!
baked oysters.author: DeeDee J.
baked oysters.review: Had an amazing dining experience!  The hostess sat the two of us in a large half-round booth, and our server was wonderful and accommodating.  We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.  All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.  Presentation of the food was on point!

excerpts: We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder.
Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot.
However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized.
For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving.
So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf.
Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning
and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees.
baked oysters.author: Whitney C.
baked oysters.review:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.

excerpts: Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing.
Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty.
From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant).
baked oysters.author: Anastasija V.
baked oysters.review:
We had a really great dinner here. Food is delicious, waiters are nice, atmosphere is lovely! 

Seafood is awesome. From starters we tried Crispy Calamari and they were super tasty. Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.  

Been here on Christmas Day - that day restaurant closed an opportunity to make a table reservation.
Restaurant was busy, we waited some time for table to get free. But waiting wasn't annoying. We had an opportunity to leave the name and phone number, so took a little walk around while waiting.

But anyway, we are super satisfied.
We definitely will come again.

Came back on a Valentines Day with friends. We were all satisfied again. This time we had both foods and deserts. Seafood was great just as the first time! There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome. Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing. Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty. From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant). Delicious! 

This time we hadn't any problems with time at all - had a reservation and service was pretty fast.

excerpts: The baked oysters are super yummy as a starter and the bread they bring you is also very impressive.
This is our "must go to" dinner spot when we visit SanFran.
baked oysters.author: Chris F.
baked oysters.review: Everything here was absolutely fantastic!!  We had the whole cooked Dungeness crab in chili sauce and it was so good!!  The baked oysters are super yummy as a starter and the bread they bring you is also very impressive. This is our "must go to" dinner spot when we visit SanFran.

excerpts:
We ordered the fried calamari, half dozen baked oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and their seasonal short rib dish with mashed potatoes

But the fried calamari came out on a generous size plate, the oysters were topped with a creamy sauce and bacon bits, the clam chowder had lots of clam chunks which is a plus!, and the short rib was super tender and flavorful.
baked oysters.author: Sheila B.
baked oysters.review:
Expect to wait up to an hour if you go during dinner time!

Overall setting was very nice. Pretty loud and semi causal restaurant or maybe it was just the table next to me lol. 

Our server was friendly and checked on us during our meal which is always a plus. 

We ordered the fried calamari, half dozen baked oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and their seasonal short rib dish with mashed potatoes

Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture ... But the fried calamari came out on a generous size plate, the oysters were topped with a creamy sauce and bacon bits, the clam chowder had lots of clam chunks which is a plus!, and the short rib was super tender and flavorful. 

Menu pricing varies for dishes, but overall a decent price for good quality compared to maybe the street food on the wharf.

excerpts: My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ).
baked oysters.author: Adele F.
baked oysters.review:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, baked oysters, linguini and clams.
Everything was delicious!
I have never had such decadent clam chowder in my life.
It was buttery, smooth, and not at all oily.
The flavors were vibrant without tasting 'fishy'.
The sourdough bread was a fantastic complement to my soup.
You know a restaurant is good when their bread is delicious.
It really was.
It was soft on the inside, and slightly crisp on the outside.
This is how bread should be.
The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious.
The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious.
My mother commented they were the "best oysters" she has ever tasted...and trust me, she's had a lot of them.
We also ordered the creme brûlée -- perfect, just perfect.
The strawberry tres leches cake was also very good.
I've made that type of cake before, and this one was rich in flavor and light in texture.
Not to mention, the service was great; overall, very sophisticated and accommodating.
We will definitely be back!
baked oysters.author: Camilla L.
baked oysters.review: I'm not a fish person, but after eating at the Fog Horn, I definitely am! After reading numerous reviews on Yelp, we decided to try this restaurant. Let me tell you -- it did not disappoint. Really beautiful place. The view is to die for! We ordered the clam chowder, baked oysters, linguini and clams. Everything was delicious! I have never had such decadent clam chowder in my life. It was buttery, smooth, and not at all oily. The flavors were vibrant without tasting 'fishy'. The sourdough bread was a fantastic complement to my soup. You know a restaurant is good when their bread is delicious. It really was. It was soft on the inside, and slightly crisp on the outside. This is how bread should be. The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious. My mother commented they were the "best oysters" she has ever tasted...and trust me, she's had a lot of them. We also ordered the creme brûlée -- perfect, just perfect. The strawberry tres leches cake was also very good. I've made that type of cake before, and this one was rich in flavor and light in texture. Not to mention, the service was great; overall, very sophisticated and accommodating. We will definitely be back!

excerpts: We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special).
Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic.
Would recommend others for this place.
baked oysters.author: Chanyamat W.
baked oysters.review: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters to start
and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on.
The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier!
I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve
(it complemented my meal nicely).
We then ordered our meals.
He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters.
It was such a nice surprise and great customer service.
He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters.
It was such a nice surprise and great customer service.
And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters!
baked oysters.author: Yessenia E.
baked oysters.review:
My boyfriend and I got the chance to eat here and let me tell you, this place is so good!! 

Scenery - We got a table overlooking Alcatraz, there are also views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the restaurant 

Food - We ordered the baked oysters to start and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on. The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier! I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve (it complemented my meal nicely). We then ordered our meals. I got the Mixed Grill (best swordfish I've ever had) and my boyfriend got the surf and turf (about $50). Everything was delicious. 10/10

Service - Quick and attentive. Our waiter was sent by the gods! He was so nice and always there when I needed him but not overly pushy. Our meal came before the appetizer. When I asked him about it, he said the kitchen must've gotten mixed up and asked if we still wanted it which I kindly refused. He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters. It was such a nice surprise and great customer service. And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters! So good!!

I will definitely be coming back and recommend as a great date restaurant!

excerpts: The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious.
baked oysters.author: Nika W.
baked oysters.review: I think this place is overrated for the price you pay. The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious. However, I ordered the Cioppino for my main course and was extremely disappointed. The seafood itself was good, but the tomato sauce was flavorless and, in my opinion, ruined the dish. The views from the restaurant were beautiful and the service was top-notch. However, I would not eat here again.

excerpts: I had the baked oysters, which were pretty good, but very heavy on the butter.
I also had the clam chowder.
Clams were tender, but the chowder seemed overly thick and again, heavy.
For dinner I went with the crab sandwich.
It was very tender and fresh tasking.
The bun was perfectly toasted (New England Style) with lots of butter.
baked oysters.author: Amie L.
baked oysters.review:
This place is commercial and touristy. I was pretty disappointed in the ambience and the food was...okay.

I had the baked oysters, which were pretty good, but very heavy on the butter. I also had the clam chowder. Clams were tender, but the chowder seemed overly thick and again, heavy. For dinner I went with the crab sandwich. It was very tender and fresh tasking. The bun was perfectly toasted (New England Style) with lots of butter. I would probably get that again if I found myself "trapped" at the Pier.

The view was obstructed by fog. We couldn't even see a hint of Alcatraz. 

Service was attentive and courteous.

excerpts: We also got the calamari and baked oysters.
Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner.
For the finale, surprise surprise...
the chicken was the bomb.com.
Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner.
For the finale, surprise surprise...
the chicken was the bomb.com.
baked oysters.author: Rose R.
baked oysters.review:
This is long overdue. We almost passed this place up as we assumed it would be a horrid tourist trap, glad we didn't! It was awesome. 

Clam chowder = OMG. You must try. We also got the calamari and baked oysters. Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner. For the finale, surprise surprise...the chicken was the bomb.com. Drinks were good too. 

I know I'm using alot of tween expressions here but that is only to convey my immense approval of said food. I highly recommend stopping by and giving this place a chance next time you are by Pier 39.

excerpts: Showing up at 1130, we had already decided on the chowder, baked oysters and garlic dungeness so our order was already locked down but we were very tempted by several other offerings-
I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon.
The garlic dungeness was just heavenly.
I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon.
The garlic dungeness was just heavenly.
baked oysters.author: Bret S.
baked oysters.review:
Wife and I decided yesterday to day trip to the city. Looked up menus the night before and loved the wine list at Fog Harbor.... I mean hello- 2012 Sea Smoke Southing Pinot made it case closed. Anyway, we planned on doing a pork bun crawl in Chinatown after so we wanted a nice nomnom gig early so then we could get on our way. Showing up at 1130, we had already decided on the chowder, baked oysters and garlic dungeness so our order was already locked down but we were very tempted by several other offerings- this is a REALLY well thought out menu.

Great food is one thing but it's pretty hard to find and keep good people in the service industry... I know because that was my world too. A great experience starts with prompt, professional (and please....no canned training cheese lines) and just heads up effort. We were lucky enough to get Susan as our server/host. Clearly, a savvy veteran of the craft and exactly what we were hoping for.  I'm not saying anybody else is a letdown because clearly the service level, presentation and attention to detail is evident- but I mention Susan and the quality operation not only as a heads up for yelpers but a  bravo to Fog Harbor.  This isn't some chain trying to flip tables. We had that perfect table too- watching the sea lions, the  craft and Alcatraz... just awesome. 

The food was perfect. I chef a little myself so I'm pretty damn picky. The chowder served with fresh HOT sourdough was epic. My wife and debated on whose was better between them and Pike Place... but it's THAT good. I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon. The garlic dungeness was just heavenly. I'll get the whole one with dinner next time.

We'll be back very soon. If I'm there though- you can't have Susan

excerpts: We also shared the baked oysters which were different but really good as well!
Service was also fantastic!!!
Definitely recommend!!
baked oysters.author: Marsha E.
baked oysters.review: Yummy and great service!!! My husband and I shared the seafood tower which was super fresh and so good!!! We also shared the baked oysters which were different but really good as well! Service was also fantastic!!! Definitely recommend!!
