excerpts: We had baked oysters that were amazing...
Shared a shell fish platter for 2 that was very good...
And washed it down with yummy drinks.
I had a cocktail that was so yummy.
I would def go again!
baked oysters.author: Kady H.
baked oysters.review: Great food! I loved the view! Perfect lunch on the pier! We had baked oysters that were amazing... Shared a shell fish platter for 2 that was very good... And washed it down with yummy drinks. I had a cocktail that was so yummy. I would def go again!

excerpts: We also ordered the baked oysters and crab cakes, oh and the clam chowder.
I would order each item again.
The crab cakes did have some filler, but I guess if not, they would be $20 each, but the flavor was still good.
I would definitely recommend a stop here as you are waiting for a ferry ride to, well, anywhere.
baked oysters.author: Amy G.
baked oysters.review: This was our first stop in San Francisco and what a nice start it was. We sat at the bar, our favorite spot and ordered two of their award winning hibiscus margaritas. Don't know what all is in it, but is was delicious! I could have had 2 or 3, and might have, if we weren't getting on a boat to Alcatraz right after lunch. We also ordered the baked oysters and crab cakes, oh and the clam chowder. I would order each item again. The crab cakes did have some filler, but I guess if not, they would be $20 each, but the flavor was still good. I would definitely recommend a stop here as you are waiting for a ferry ride to, well, anywhere.

excerpts: We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders.
Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders.
baked oysters.author: Wayne Z.
baked oysters.review:
Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good. 

We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on. 

Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there. 

If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.

excerpts: We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
baked oysters.author: Lisa K.
baked oysters.review:
This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation. 

We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo. 

As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.

The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.

excerpts: The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw.
The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty!
Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.
baked oysters.author: Colleen C.
baked oysters.review: We had the blue cheese garlic bread - yummmmmm. The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw. The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty! Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.

excerpts: We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!),
baked oysters.author: Sam R.
baked oysters.review: Found Fog Harbor on Yelp while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. We desired a great view, delicious food and expert service - in an intimate dining area away from the hustle and bustle... That is what we got! Our server Meron was personable and knowledgeable- it was a special night for us, so she brought flowers and a candle to our table. We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!), the mixed grill - fresh and perfectly cooked fish - and Surf N Turf... Meron even assisted with getting the meat out of the whole lobster! For dessert we had the special - Creme brûlée and chocolate lava cake- absolutely delicious. Thank you Meron and Fog Harbor for a delicious and memorable meal!!!

excerpts: I ordered baked oysters and my daughter ordered the lobster.
I was originally looking for another restaurant
but glad I ate here instead.
Samir was an awesome waiter.
If you at Pier 39 you must eat here.
It's a bit pricey but worth it.
baked oysters.author: Dawn G.
baked oysters.review: Walked in and got seated right away. The food was great. I ordered baked oysters and my daughter ordered the lobster. I was originally looking for another restaurant but glad I ate here instead. Samir was an awesome waiter.  If you at Pier 39 you must eat here. It's a bit pricey but worth it.

excerpts: We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters.
Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful.
Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table.
baked oysters.author: Lea L.
baked oysters.review:
I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!

We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.

The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese". 

Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.

Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!

excerpts: Do the baked oysters ..
To die for, also if your confused seafood or steak get the surf and turf !
Lobster tail great, steak a little too cooked!
Manager came over very professional!
Took care of steak portion!
The drink you MUST have, Moscow Mule"!
My wife drank mine and ordered another !!
baked oysters.author: Pman B.
baked oysters.review: Sooooo Gooooood! Service was wonderful .. Do the baked oysters .. To die for, also if your confused seafood or steak get the surf and turf ! Lobster tail great, steak a little too cooked! Manager came over very professional! Took care of steak portion! The drink you MUST have, Moscow Mule"! My wife drank mine and ordered another !!

excerpts: We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.
I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
baked oysters.author: David P.
baked oysters.review:
Last night, decided to head here for dinner with some friends.

Made an online reservation for 5 and the only time available was for 9:30pm.  No worries.

We arrived and were promptly seated in a booth by the windows with a great view.

We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.

I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".  Seems this is for customers who don't want to deal with hassle of cracking your own crab.

Like the Fish & Chips I ate previously, the food was great.  Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.  Linguine was cooked very well and the steaks were perfectly cooked to temperature.

So why only 3 stars?

The service was kinda bad.  It seemed like the server had a bad day and was distracted with a frustrated scowl.  We had to remind him about bringing us our bottle of wine.  Tabasco was requested 2 times from our server and once to another server walking by.  The other server looked frustrated but brought us the Tabasco.  Our waiter brought another bottle after a while.  Water took a few tries.  Kids asked for A1 steak sauce and that took a couple of requests.

By the time he noticed that our wine was depleted and asked if we wanted another, we really didn't want to order any more from him and asked for the check.

I would easily give 4 stars for the food and facilities.  But can't ignore the service this night.

excerpts: For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious.
Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce.
What's not to love?
baked oysters.author: Blanca A.
baked oysters.review: This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver, Rose. As soon as we stepped in we knew it was going to be a spectacular lunch. From the outside it doesn't seem like much. Once you step inside, you realize you're in for a beautiful view of Pier 39, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate. For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious. Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce. What's not to love? For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!). For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp. Neither one disappointed us. All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco. Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.

excerpts: We shared an appetizer (baked oysters with spinach and parmesan OMG!) and a main dish and our bill with tip came to $90.
If you can appreciate upscale dining then the prices shouldn't be to shocking.
I would go back and pay it again simply for the flavor and freshness of what was served!
baked oysters.author: Teresa H.
baked oysters.review: I can't help but give this place 5 stars!  We picked this location based on previously Yelp reviews.  We drove into the city from Sonoma before catching a flight home.  Fortunately for us it was a Tuesday afternoon.  We found immediate parking and walked in and were seated immediately.  The service was great.  Our waitress was friendly and checked in on us.  The food was delicious!  It satisfied our craving for fresh seafood and flavor was on point!  My daughter had the clam chowder with crab and I had the swordfish.   We shared an appetizer (baked oysters with spinach and parmesan OMG!) and a main dish and our bill with tip came to $90.   If you can appreciate upscale dining then the prices shouldn't be to shocking.  I would go back and pay it again simply for the flavor and freshness of what was served!

excerpts: I'd recommend the clam chowder with crab and baked oysters.
Would be 5 stars but the loud atmosphere made it hard for conversation.
baked oysters.author: Emily E.
baked oysters.review: Great service. Great food. Even better view. I'd recommend the clam chowder with crab and baked oysters. Would be 5 stars but the loud atmosphere made it hard for conversation.

excerpts: Combined with the baked oysters appetizer and a nice bottle of wine made for a great meal after another long day.
baked oysters.author: Panas S.
baked oysters.review:
What a great view!  Worth the price of entry even before the meal.  

The service is also top notch.  While I normally do not go with any suggestions from the servers, I usually find it is their way to build up the check, somehow this felt different.  The clam chowder is a great starter, it probably would make for a great entree and dessert too.  Always being a fan of crab cakes I had to give them a try, great decision.  Combined with the baked oysters appetizer and a nice bottle of wine made for a great meal after another long day.

excerpts: The baked oysters are out of this world.
I highly recommend the restaurant and suggest people check for a spot at the bar.
There was a significant wait when we arrived and we found a spot at the bar right away.
We enjoyed dinner at the bar and the device was great.
When we left there was still people waiting outside to be seated.
I am not sure why they don't tell people that they can have a full dinner at the bar without waiting.
I guess that is what Yelp is for!
baked oysters.author: Donna G.
baked oysters.review: The baked oysters are out of this world.  I highly recommend the restaurant and suggest people check for a spot at the bar.  There was a significant wait when we arrived and we found a spot at the bar right away.   We enjoyed dinner at the bar and the device was great.  When we left there was still people waiting outside to be seated. I am not sure why they don't tell people that they can have a full dinner at the bar without waiting.  I guess that is what Yelp is for!

excerpts: After a looong look at the menu, I landed on a half dozen baked oysters, and crab roll.
Oysters were good, had some spinach and feta cheese, good flavor.
Then there's the crab roll.
Never had one before (or lobster roll) the crab mixture combined with the bread was awesome!
Nice soft bread with butter on it, had the perfect texture for the moist crab filling with good amount of crab taste, not overpowering with other flavors.
On a previous visit I had the surf and turf, steak with lobster tail.
That was a little on the pricey side, but fur what you get and how much, it's not TOO bad.
There's so many places to eat around here, but I love this place for the quality of food and the variety.
baked oysters.author: Mike S.
baked oysters.review: When looking for places to eat around this area this is by far the best rated and there's plenty of reasons why. For being in the middle of tourist central, this place is a nice getaway from the craziness that is fisherman's warf.  I was in the mood for some seafood and wanted a few different things. Only problem was I couldn't decide what to get! Too many good lookin options, too small of a stomach.  After a looong look at the menu, I landed on a half dozen baked oysters, and crab roll.  Oysters were good, had some spinach and feta cheese, good flavor. Then there's the crab roll. Never had one before (or lobster roll) the crab mixture combined with the bread was awesome! Nice soft bread with butter on it, had the perfect texture for the moist crab filling with good amount of crab taste, not overpowering with other flavors. On a previous visit I had the surf and turf, steak with lobster tail. That was a little on the pricey side, but fur what you get and how much, it's not TOO bad.  There's so many places to eat around here, but I love this place for the quality of food and the variety.

excerpts:
We had a lovely night here, we really enjoyed the baked oysters and the clam chowder in a cob. 
The staff where friendly and we where seated straight away without a reservation. 
The creme brûlée was so good and the sugar top was perfect and had a nice "crack" when we broke through it. 
The kids really enjoyed drawing on the paper table covers with the supplied crayons. 
My husband had the grilled chicken breast but he said it was a little dry.
baked oysters.author: Billys M.
baked oysters.review:
We had a lovely night here, we really enjoyed the baked oysters and the clam chowder in a cob. 
The staff where friendly and we where seated straight away without a reservation. 
The creme brûlée was so good and the sugar top was perfect and had a nice "crack" when we broke through it. The kids really enjoyed drawing on the paper table covers with the supplied crayons. 
My husband had the grilled chicken breast but he said it was a little dry.

excerpts: A couple of my favorites were the baked oysters, crab cakes, ciopinno (large portion), and the crab roll.
They also provided us with a free dessert due to my mom's birthday, which was their most popular, the ghirardeli fudge cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
It was very tender, warm, and soft like souffle.
Highly enjoyable meal.
Entrees range from $20-$30.
Appetizers average $10-$15.
Also, the restaurant provided great views of the pier and the bathrooms were clean.
Overall, a solid place to eat if you are looking for a seafood meal.
baked oysters.author: Patty O.
baked oysters.review: Extensive menu with delicious options to try. Parking is convenient as there is a Pier 39 garage in which the ticket can be validated. We made reservations online and enjoyed a bunch of delicious entrees. A couple of my favorites were the baked oysters, crab cakes, ciopinno (large portion), and the crab roll. They also provided us with a free dessert due to my mom's birthday, which was their most popular, the ghirardeli fudge cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was very tender, warm, and soft like souffle. Highly enjoyable meal. Entrees range from $20-$30. Appetizers average $10-$15. Also, the restaurant provided great views of the pier and the bathrooms were clean. Overall, a solid place to eat if you are looking for a seafood meal.

excerpts: We had baked oysters for an appetizer.
I could have made a whole meal out of them because they were so good.
However, I wasn't disappointed with my main meal of a crab roll sandwich.
I'm not sure what kind of bread they used, but it was one of the best crab sandwiches I've had.
We also got great service with Tyler.
He provided good recommendations and was very friendly.
He checked on us to make sure we didn't need anything.
Will definitely go back!
baked oysters.author: Debbie W.
baked oysters.review: My husband and I came to here for lunch on a day trip to San Francisco. The food was awesome. We had baked oysters for an appetizer.  I could have made a whole meal out of them because they were so good. However, I wasn't disappointed with my main meal of a crab roll sandwich. I'm not sure what kind of bread they used, but it was one of the best crab sandwiches I've had. We also got great service with Tyler. He provided good recommendations and was very friendly. He checked on us to make sure we didn't need anything. Will definitely go back!

excerpts: The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters.
baked oysters.author: James T.
baked oysters.review:
This place actually surprised me. I'm a city native who doesn't expect much from restaurant around Pier 39, but this place was solid and reasonably priced. I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor. The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters. The pleasant surprise was the generous serving of clam chowder in a bread bowl that surpassed my expectations.

Oh, and our server was AMAZING. I feel awful for forgetting his name, but he was attentive at the right times without being intrusive.

excerpts: The baked oysters were delicious.
I had the surf and turf for market price ($58.00) and I would definitely recommend it.
You will not go hungry
that's for sure!
baked oysters.author: Brittney P.
baked oysters.review: Loved our experience tonight!! We sat by the window and it was so pretty! Great service and great food.. The baked oysters were delicious. I had the surf and turf for market price ($58.00) and I would definitely recommend it. You will not go hungry that's for sure!

excerpts: Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters.
Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents.
baked oysters.author: Arnaud S.
baked oysters.review:
Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good. 

My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.

excerpts: We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent.
Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot.
The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth.
baked oysters.author: Mike H.
baked oysters.review:
We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent. Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot. The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth. The Salmon was also very delicious. The service was also very good & promt. To sum it up it the experience was very good & we will definitely be back. 
                                                                 Mike H.

excerpts: Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters.
Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend
baked oysters.author: A D.
baked oysters.review: Though my 1st visit didn't start well.... it ended well. Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters. Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend

excerpts: my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters.
She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary.
she said baked oysters was OK.
she said baked oysters was OK.
baked oysters.author: P S.
baked oysters.review:
Yes, 4 star is for Fog Harbor. I went with my Fiance to have dinner a few days ago. We went on a little mini adventure for food. Our frist time at the Fog Harbor. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT!  although the food was not as great, i come for a good experince of customer service and i got that from the bar and NELSON was our server. awesome server! I got a fish and chips with fries and it was not what i expected. Ive had BETTER fish n' chips. my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters. She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary. she said baked oysters was OK. 

Her Clam Chowder on the other hand, she took 2 bites and she was done! she said the clam chowder tasted like its been sitting out to get it to our table. Basically she said the chowder was not what she expected. she was expecting something delish since we are at the Harbor and they are known for their chowder. 

Overall, i will probably give this place another chance for a 2nd come back. MAYBE their other entrees are better.

excerpts: We had a the clam chowder in bread bowl, sliders and baked oysters to eat.
To drink; the gimlet and dirty martini.
Everything was on point and we were very pleased with Fog Harbor.
baked oysters.author: M H.
baked oysters.review: Amazing food and service (Bernie)! We had a the clam chowder in bread bowl, sliders and baked oysters to eat. To drink; the gimlet and dirty martini. Everything was on point and we were very pleased with Fog Harbor.

excerpts: And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend
and I have ever had.
Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.
baked oysters.author: Virginia B.
baked oysters.review: Best clam chowder sourdough bread bowl ever--flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend and I have ever had. Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo.
Overall, the food was just okay.
Service wasn't too great either.
baked oysters.author: Micah Anne M.
baked oysters.review: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.

excerpts: Order anything, but be sure not to skip the baked oysters - 2nd best in the country.
baked oysters.author: Sean T.
baked oysters.review: Awesome Ambience, Fandamntastic Food, Stupendous Wait Staff. Be sure to request the sourdough bread. Order anything, but be sure not to skip the baked oysters - 2nd best in the country.

excerpts: And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!
baked oysters.author: Aileen D.
baked oysters.review: Boudin was a cluster so we headed upstairs to FHFH for a snack.  So glad we did.  We opted to sit at the bar and were promptly taken care of.  The chowder in a bread bowl was amazing with a little added pepper and a little bit of tabasco.  The parmesan risotto crab fritters were a tad over fried but were delicious nonetheless.  And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!

excerpts: You HAVE to get the baked oysters!
baked oysters.author: Cristina M.
baked oysters.review:
WOW this place is AMAZING! You HAVE to get the baked oysters! We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.

The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. They didn't seem to be bothered that we showed up with four people more than our reservation! They told us to come by again right at sunset; apparently the view is incredible. 

I got half a garlic crab which was super fresh, delicious, and economical. Also, in order to not single me out, they put bibs on our whole table - we had a blast taking pictures!

Go here, bring friends!

excerpts: Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine.
All were excellent.
Would definitely recommend.
Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.
baked oysters.author: Melanie T.
baked oysters.review: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.

excerpts: Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters.
Visited twice in our trip.
My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues.
Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.
Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.
baked oysters.author: Christi G.
baked oysters.review: The steamed mussels were one of the best things I have ever had! Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters. Visited twice in our trip. My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues. Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.

excerpts: We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers!
baked oysters.author: Jennifer W.
baked oysters.review:
My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.

We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters! 

For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!

Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!

excerpts: We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp.
The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever.
Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome!
Sevice was ok.
baked oysters.author: Leah P.
baked oysters.review: Went here with a group of 8 friends for our last night in San Fran. Our apps were awesome! We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp. The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever. Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome! Sevice was ok.

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are.
What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate.
I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank!
I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them
but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...
a little harsh
and I feel bad for ever thinking that
but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad)
baked oysters.author: Abby W.
baked oysters.review:
Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service. 

We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...

Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.

excerpts: Baked oysters-nothing special.
Glass of Sauv.
Blanc.
maybe thins will get better?
Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something).
Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.
At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly.
Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/
baked oysters.author: Josefina L.
baked oysters.review:
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly!
The Good:We were seated right away and the view was great.
The Bad:We didn't even see our server for 10 minutes.What kept us entertained while waiting was dodging chairs being moved above us to add to the table next to us. No waters, no bread. Finally the server shows up.  Got our waters and ordered appetizers. Waters showed up and nope can't order main yet so our server can get a couple of people out of there first...Ok then..alright, he's back so we ordered our main courses just in case we don't see our server for another long while.  Kids get clam chowder bread bowls(they miss these since we did live in Monterey) and burgers & fries.  Hubby gets the linguine with crab added on top as recommended by our server.  I get the shellfish combo also recommended by our server. Appetizers showed up-poke & sliders were really good. Baked oysters-nothing special. Glass of Sauv. Blanc. maybe thins will get better? Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something). Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.  
At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly.
Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/ the crayons they gave...waiting...waiting...

and now The Ugly: family next to us got their food before us?  I watch another server take our food (had to be because that table were already ordering desert) to the table in front of us then walks away..Our server returns and asks,"You guys ordered the bread bowls right?" I say "yes, but she went to the wrong table-the one in front".  The poor girl apologizes to our server.  Not her fault she was given wrong directions.  Hubbies linguine arrives-no crab added so server asks the girl to have the crab added.  My shellfish plate arrives-I try a clam & mussle, oh great-it's cold.  Server takes it back saying well the bottom is warm..ok..girl server comes back with another bread bowl?  uh, not us.  Our server puts the bread bowl in front of me to start with until my plate is fixed.  Taste the chowder--oh my how much I miss my Monterey Old Fisherman's Grotto. The 14 year old eats it instead. BTW, the kids were starving after a long drive and golden gate bridge adventure.  Hubbies linguine comes back with crab on top all right.  They threw a pile of COLD crab on top of hot pasta?  Yuck.  Hubby is starving so he decided to just mix it all together to warm the crab. Shellfish mix shows back up-and now it's hot since according to our server he watched just come off the grill. I look down at what was my original plate just reheated so now the food is over done. Clams, crab and mussles are dried up. The shrimp were overcooked so they were tough-I gave these to the hubby.  The best part of this $35 plate-the corn on the cob.
Considering the price ($196) is about the same as our family usuals-Sardine Factory, the Whaling Station, Old Fisherman's Grotto, Saporo, etc., we were all very disappointed.

excerpts: For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters.
The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams.
The oysters had a strange flavor.
I would not get it again, but it was edible.
baked oysters.author: Kristine L.
baked oysters.review: An alright seafood restaurant. Lots of menu choices to pick form..I had a hard time deciding. For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters. The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams. The oysters had a strange flavor. I would not get it again, but it was edible. For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too. I was expecting a bit more flavor. Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.

excerpts: - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari.
They are all GREAT!
baked oysters.author: Evette B.
baked oysters.review: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!

excerpts: I absolutely love their baked oysters and the clam chowder is really delicious!
baked oysters.author: Rocio A.
baked oysters.review: This place is touristy but it is pretty good! I've been here a few times, specifically when I have visitors at home that want to see Pier 39, and they all loved it!! I absolutely love their baked oysters and the clam chowder is really delicious!

excerpts: My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.
baked oysters.author: Mark J.
baked oysters.review: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!

excerpts: We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.
The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.
All in all I am glad we went there
but I don;t feel the need to go there again.
baked oysters.author: Laura F.
baked oysters.review: My husband and I went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  The restaurant looks great.  It is in a very crowded area of the wharf.  We were able to watch seals lounge on the docks during our meal.  We were really hoping for fresh local seafood but instead the menu s filled with alaskan fish or maine lobster.  The only local catch is the crab.  I had the halibut and it was dry and sitting on a bed of undressed arugala.  My husband's seafood platter looked great and tasted alright but was swimming in garlic butter.  We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.  The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.  All in all I am glad we went there but I don;t feel the need to go there again.

excerpts: Hubby luved the baked oysters.
baked oysters.author: LINDA R.
baked oysters.review:
Sat at the bar on 1 of the nicest days San Fran had this yr.  GR8 views!  Had a perfect Sunday afternoon.  

Raymond, bartender, was extremely attentive & courteous.  We concocted a new martini, which i suggested should be their signature drink!  

The manager, Micheal, was professional and came over to make sure entire experience was to our liking.  Hubby luved the baked oysters.  

FYI: Spoke to friends of ours who live in San Franciso, and although this is suppossidly a 'tourist' place, locals visit here on a regular basis.

excerpts: We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers.
baked oysters.author: Meera V.
baked oysters.review: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!

excerpts: Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird.
I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated.
baked oysters.author: Katherine L.
baked oysters.review: The service is great, the people were super nice and friendly. I like how they give customers a sample of wine without asking or anything, which I guess is a form of marketing. The clam chowder s really good, creamy and chunky, although there isn't really anything about it that makes it particularly any better than other places. Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird. I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated. For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good. I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me. There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite. The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there. The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices. All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.

excerpts: we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious!
we almost ordered a second round.
then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for!
baked oysters.author: Angelina A.
baked oysters.review: My boyfriend and i were on vacation in SF for his bday and i was looking for a place to take him for dinner on his special day. i came across this place and man was i happy i chosen it. first let me say i think this was the best seafood ive ever eaten. we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious! we almost ordered a second round. then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for! then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end. the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy. my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had. the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz. oh and our service was so great! he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf. couldn't of wished a better experience.

excerpts:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. 
baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay.
garlic roasted crab.author: Phi N.
garlic roasted crab.review:
Ordered the seafood tower, baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab. 

-The garlic roasted crab was easily my favorite item 
-The baked oysters were small and rather uninspiring
-The tower was okay. I was pretty disappointed that they remove the shell from the crab and clean all the yellow poop; that stuff is delicious 

Went with the flan and tiramisu for desserts. Both were delightful and delicious. 

Service was just average. Our server was training and it showed, lol. But even the guy training him wasn't that great.

excerpts: The spicy red chilli shrimp and garlic roasted crab were excellent!
garlic roasted crab.author: Nilay P.
garlic roasted crab.review:
Great seafood with a view. A little on the expensive side, as expected for the prime location. The restaurant itself is done up really well, and they have a swanky looking bar. The space is huge; Even with no reservation on a Friday night we got a table for 3 in 10-15 minutes, so not a crazy long wait. Service was quick too, which is not often the case in a big space.

The spicy red chilli shrimp and garlic roasted crab were excellent!

excerpts: We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake.
Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.
garlic roasted crab.author: Harshini R.
garlic roasted crab.review: Loved absolutely everything here! The service was great. The food was amazing and the dessert was pretty good too. We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake. Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.

excerpts: Garlic roasted crab was fantastic.
It serves for two perfectly.
garlic roasted crab.author: HeeYoung Y.
garlic roasted crab.review: Super kind services and great foods and drink! Award winning Clam chowder was no need to say. I recommend a bread bowl one rather than regular ones. Garlic roasted crab was fantastic. It serves for two perfectly.

excerpts: we had the half garlic roasted crab, and penne seafood pasta.
The roasted garlic crab came out perfect.
Everything just broke apart perfectly, no need for any utensils to open up the crab legs.
It was almost like a soft shell crab in a way.
The tomato cream sauce in the Penne seafood pasta was perfect!
garlic roasted crab.author: Katrina Y.
garlic roasted crab.review:
Out of all the restaurants they offer on pier 39, I am so happy I chose Fog Harbor Fish House on my recent trip to SF! Number one of course was the spectacular view on that perfect sunny Saturday. It was just perfect! Service was also phenomenal!


We ordered the mussel fries as a starter and clam chower bowls with crab meat. I am not a fan of mussels usually because I feel they are more on the dry side as oppose to clams, but THESE mussels were so moist and tender I've never had mussels like these before. The aioli sauce drizzled over the french fries were absolutely delicious! Sounds like a weird combo, but trust me, it is soooo good! The clam chowder I felt was a bit too thick, but it was still nonetheless delicious especially with the crab meat!

Main entrees we had the half garlic roasted crab, and penne seafood pasta. The roasted garlic crab came out perfect. Everything just broke apart perfectly, no need for any utensils to open up the crab legs. It was almost like a soft shell crab in a way. The tomato cream sauce in the Penne seafood pasta was perfect! I am not really a fan of tomato sauce pasta, and cream only sauce is a bit too heavy for me, so this was a perfect combo for it was not too tangy nor heavy. 

Our drinks were filled constantly and our waitress checked on us very often to make sure everything was good.

PLEASE give this place a try! WILL BE BACK!

excerpts: We had clam chowder, garlic roasted crab and seafood pasta.
There's bread in every dish but all delicious.
Price was fair.
Great view if you get to sit by the window.
So don't forget to make a reservation beforehand.
No dress code
but I feel like wearing something cute would match the food^
garlic roasted crab.author: Claire L.
garlic roasted crab.review: Loved the ambience and food. We had clam chowder, garlic roasted crab and seafood pasta. There's bread in every dish but all delicious. Price was fair. Great view if you get to sit by the window. So don't forget to make a reservation beforehand. No dress code but I feel like wearing something cute would match the food^

excerpts: We ordered...a crab roll, garlic roasted crab, mussel fries, clam chowder, seared tuna app, grilled seafood plate with a lobster tail (my entree) and cippino (my friends entree).
Did I mention we were really hungry?
Our waiter probably thought we had lost our minds especially bc
we are very tiny girls lol
The mussel fries are prepared really crispy with this shallot cream sauce that you simply want to drink.
The garlic roasted crab was cooked to perfection and is served with just the right amount of garlic.
I loved my grilled swordfish!
My friend could not stop eating her cippino lol we had to squirt hand sanitizer on it
garlic roasted crab.author: Star J.
garlic roasted crab.review:
Let me start by saying this: we waited an hour and 15 mins and it was worth every second! My friend and I were visiting from Vegas and saw the promo on instagram. I didn't have much faith in this choice seeing as how they were advertising on Instagram but she really wanted to give it a try. So glad she didn't listen to me! We are both originally from the East coast and miss a great deal the fresh seafood. It tasted just like home. 

We ordered...a crab roll, garlic roasted crab, mussel fries, clam chowder, seared tuna app, grilled seafood plate with a lobster tail (my entree) and cippino (my friends entree). Did I mention we were really hungry? Our waiter probably thought we had lost our minds especially bc we are very tiny girls lol but we were commited!

Everything was amazing. The mussel fries are prepared really crispy with this shallot cream sauce that you simply want to drink.  The garlic roasted crab was cooked to perfection and is served with just the right amount of garlic. I loved my grilled swordfish! My friend could not stop eating her cippino lol we had to squirt hand sanitizer on it so she would stop. 

Overall this was a great lunch and our server was really good with recommending wines and menu items.  This will definitely be a regular stop on our visits. Our bill was reasonable for what we ordered. We were very pleased

excerpts: We ordered the House Salad $7 and the Garlic Roasted Crab $20.
The atmosphere was amazing.
Everything tasted delicious and very fresh.
If you are a visitor, you should definitely check this place out.
We can't wait to return.
garlic roasted crab.author: Richard F.
garlic roasted crab.review: We were visiting SF and went to the Wharf for lunch. We wanted to eat some famous crab so we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House and I'm glad we did. It was excellent! We came here for a late lunch on a Wed. and had no problems getting a table. Service was very good. We ordered the House Salad $7 and the Garlic Roasted Crab $20. The atmosphere was amazing. Everything tasted delicious and very fresh. If you are a visitor, you should definitely check this place out. We can't wait to return.

excerpts:
The things we ordered:
Crab cake
Whole Garlic roasted crab
Fried Combo
Linguini Clam

What came out first:
Crab cake.
Garlic crab and fried combo.
The whole crab meat was mushy, kind of like the crab was already dead when they cooked it.
The crab was also cold, so maybe that crab was ready to serve the moment we ordered.
The crab was on a bed of potatoes with broccoli on the side.
The fried combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimps on a bed of calamari with Cole slaw and fries on the side.
It was just alright.
garlic roasted crab.author: Jessica T.
garlic roasted crab.review:
This place is mediocre at best. 

I came in with 3 others at 5pm. We have a dinner reservation somewhere else at 7:30, so we figured we'll just "snack" here

The things we ordered:
Crab cake
Whole Garlic roasted crab
Fried Combo
Linguini Clam

What came out first:
Crab cake. We split the crab cake four ways (because there were four of us). Mines was good. While halfway through, one of the girls found a short, black curly hair mixed in with her crab cake. We caught the attention of a server and told him, he said he will get his manager. 

The manager came:
We told him what happened, showed him the hair. He said nothing to us, did not apologize, then asked "do you want another one" . I told the other girl "not if its going to have hair in it" and the manager rudely replies "you either want another one or you don't". Okay you asshole, first of all. One of your workers fucked up and dropped hair into our food. Why the hell are you acting like you couldn't be bothered with us and give us your shit attitude? We declined another crab cake. The shit manager grabs the plate of the girl with the hair crab cake and the main plate and walks away with nothing else to say. No apologies or anything. 

What came out next:
Garlic crab and fried combo. 
The whole crab meat was mushy, kind of like the crab was already dead when they cooked it. The crab was also cold, so maybe that crab was ready to serve the moment we ordered. The crab was on a bed of potatoes with broccoli on the side. The fried combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimps on a bed of calamari with Cole slaw and fries on the side. It was just alright. The fries tasted better than everything else on that plate.

Our linguini clam never came out. Server must've forgotten about it. 

Towards the end, we felt really dissatisfied with our meal, so another girl and I decided to try their clam chowder. We ordered the clam chowder on the bread bowl.

It came out right away. With the remaining crab meat we had from the whole crab, we put the meat into the clam chowder and ate it that way. Out of everything we had up until that point, the clam chowder tasted better than every thing else

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the New York steak and I had a whole garlic roasted crab, both was delicious!
Only problem was the steak wasn't cooked medium well through out the entire cut.
It was the last few bites that were a bit more bloody than the rest of it...
it turned out just fine because I like my steaks medium
so I finished it
and I let him finish my last crab leg.
garlic roasted crab.author: Jackie Lou B.
garlic roasted crab.review: Came here for an early valentine's day dinner.  The service was fast and on point.  We tried their blackberry margaritas which was on happy hour, it was just right, not too strong or sweet.  My boyfriend ordered the New York steak and I had a whole garlic roasted crab, both was delicious!  Only problem was the steak wasn't cooked medium well through out the entire cut.  It was the last few bites that were a bit more bloody than the rest of it...it turned out just fine because I like my steaks medium so I finished it and I let him finish my last crab leg.

excerpts: We had the clam chowder (which has bacon in it!), the crab cake which tasted fried but came with a great sauce and mango salsa (the best crab cake is still from Water Grill in LA), and an amazing garlic roasted crab.
garlic roasted crab.author: E C.
garlic roasted crab.review: Great service, the food was good.  We had the clam chowder (which has bacon in it!), the crab cake which tasted fried but came with a great sauce and mango salsa (the best crab cake is still from Water Grill in LA), and an amazing garlic roasted crab.

excerpts: Delicious garlic roasted crab, beautiful views of the bay.
Great place to celebrate or to take the one you love.
You will not be disappointed.
garlic roasted crab.author: Veronica J.
garlic roasted crab.review: This place is EXCEPTIONAL! The food is great and the service second to none. Delicious garlic roasted crab, beautiful views of the bay. Great place to celebrate or to take the one you love. You will not be disappointed.

excerpts: We tried garlic roasted crab, it was just OK, it is better at crab house, we tried clam and mussel too
but it was not good
, we tried spicy shrimp
it was good.
Probably never going to visit again, not worth the price.
Will go back to crab house!
garlic roasted crab.author: Lali B.
garlic roasted crab.review: We tried garlic roasted crab, it was just OK, it is better at crab house, we tried clam and mussel too but it was not good, we tried spicy shrimp it was good. Probably never going to visit again, not worth the price. Will go back to crab house!

excerpts: Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese.
Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much.
I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge.
The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes).
The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete.
The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it.
garlic roasted crab.author: Calvin S.
garlic roasted crab.review:
3.5/5, +.5 for service

Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.

We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.

Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.

Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.

excerpts: We ordered the garlic roasted crab, do yourself a favor and order a whole crab not 1/2.
The cod special was delicious and my partner really enjoyed the fish and chips.
I would of reviewed it as a 5 star but the waiter was absent most of the time and i desperately needed a glass of water!
garlic roasted crab.author: Josh V.
garlic roasted crab.review: This place was so good! We sat next to the window with the best of views, which was amazing. The food was great! We ordered the garlic roasted crab, do yourself a favor and order a whole crab not 1/2. The cod special was delicious and my partner really enjoyed the fish and chips. I would of reviewed it as a 5 star but the waiter was absent most of the time and i desperately needed a glass of water!

excerpts: We went for my birthday, place is very noisy, I got the garlic roasted crab.
It was not as good as Cuppinos.
The blonde brownie was good.
Both my wife and I didn't get wowed, especially when the $200 bill for the average food served.
garlic roasted crab.author: Tom T.
garlic roasted crab.review: We went for my birthday, place is very noisy, I got the garlic roasted crab. It was not as good as Cuppinos. The blonde brownie was good. Both my wife and I didn't get wowed, especially when the $200 bill for the average food served.

excerpts: The whole garlic roasted crab with corn on the cob and
garlic potatoes was incredible.
garlic roasted crab.author: Emily A.
garlic roasted crab.review:
This place is pretty good. 

First off, free bleu cheese bread with Yelp check-in. (Win) Why is this not a more popular thing?? Totally delish. 

The whole garlic roasted crab with corn on the cob and garlic potatoes was incredible. The server tied on my bib and there I was, a respectable adult, viciously ripping open the exoskeleton of an enormous crustacean, devouring it with my fingers, making an enormous mess, drinking wine and expecting to still be taken seriously.  

Note: Whatever you do, don't order the shrimp. Unless of course you'd like to pay $22 for eight small, slightly overdone shrimp on two skewers over a bed of raw baby spinach that tastes as if it has been drenched in dirty fish juice, with a few cubes of tasteless butternut squash.

excerpts: We also ordered the soup and salad combo with a Caesar salad and garlic roasted crab.
Everything tasted amazing and we would definitely return.
Don't expect cheap.
Our bill for lunch was $86.00, but that is to be expected especially for eating at the wharf.
garlic roasted crab.author: Shell B.
garlic roasted crab.review: Excellent! We came here for a late lunch on a Tuesday and had no problems getting a table. Service was top notch. We ordered the blue cheese bread and added crab. We also ordered the soup and salad combo with a Caesar salad and garlic roasted crab. Everything tasted amazing and we would definitely return. Don't expect cheap. Our bill for lunch was $86.00, but that is to be expected especially for eating at the wharf.

excerpts: *Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night.
Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness.
If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish.
garlic roasted crab.author: Rebekah T.
garlic roasted crab.review:
If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.

Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.

I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the: 

*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good.
*Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish. 
*Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich. 

When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing. 

I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!

excerpts: My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter.
I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold.
garlic roasted crab.author: Nate R.
garlic roasted crab.review:
Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!

To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.

My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.

Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.

No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.

excerpts: garlic roasted crab.
Once I cracked the shell and trying to take out the meat, from the meat texture, I could tell it's NOT FRESH.
My husband verified that since he only tasted the garlic and butter from the crab NOTHING MORE!
For me, it's even worse,
it's completely tasteless, maybe with a little bit of garlic flavor.
But we shouldn't pay $37 for garlic and butter!!
We had crab several times before from Nick's Lighthouse food stand.
We can tell the difference.
Nick's crabs are so fresh and with minimal processing,
no garlic no butter
, the meat alone is already so tasty.
Our conclusion is NEVER get CRAB at FISH House.
garlic roasted crab.author: Kolen C.
garlic roasted crab.review:
I usually only read review on yelp, this is my first review since I am so disappointed at such a highly rated restaurant.

It's our wedding anniversary last night and my husband want a special dinner for me. After reading so many positive yelp reviews, we decided to give it a try.

Food - we ordered seafood cioppino, fish n chips and Garlic roasted whole crab. 2 out of 3 are disappointing. The only dish which is really GREAT is seafood ciopino. The shrimps, scallops are very fresh. You can feel its original freshness even with the strong flavor soup. Highly recommended.
For Fish n chips, the chips are ok but the fish is obviously overcooked and very very oily. The MOST DISAPPOINTING dish is our MOST PRICEY dish- garlic roasted crab. Once I cracked the shell and trying to take out the meat, from the meat texture, I could tell it's NOT FRESH. My husband verified that since he only tasted the garlic and butter from the crab NOTHING MORE! For me, it's even worse, it's completely tasteless, maybe with a little bit of garlic flavor. But we shouldn't pay $37 for garlic and butter!! We had crab several times before from Nick's Lighthouse food stand. We can tell the difference. Nick's crabs are so fresh and with minimal processing, no garlic no butter, the meat alone is already so tasty. Our conclusion is NEVER get CRAB at FISH House. Even the crab in the seafood cioppino is tasteless. From meat texture to taste, you can definitely tell the crabs are NOT FRESH!

Service- we are surprised to have ALL our dishes coming out AT ONCE. I don't know if that's standard practice for seafood restaurant or not. But to us, this is SO WRONG. After we finish fish n chips(the most time sensitive dish), the rest were already cold as ice. Besides that, the service is ok, not very attentive but will do when you ask. 

Ambiance- the view is unbeatable, 5 stars.

Other- this's the first time I saw "SF Emp Ord 4%" from my bill.we paid anyway. I have no clue what the heck is that. After I google it, I felt like being scammed. Why should I pay for the restaurant employee's health insurance?!That should be the restaurant's responsibility! Does that mean they treat their employees like dirt so customers have to do what they don't to keep their employees live a normal life? They don't pay insurance, customers are obligated to pay for them. They pay waiters poor salary, customers have to pay a large sum to cover it(I DO think tips are necessary for rewarding good service, just don't like it when it become obligation even for poor service) And if that really helps the employees get better health insurance, I feel better with that. But according to Wall Street Journal, mostly are just scammer and go to restaurant. I don't know about this restaurant.

Conclusion-It's very unlikely we will return. If we do, we will NEVER order any crab again

excerpts: Among some appetizers, the three of us shared the shellfish tower.
It was very tasty.
Prices are on the higher side and portions slightly smaller.
Check it out!
shellfish tower.author: Mikey J.
shellfish tower.review: Overall a nice experience. Seafood is fresh and tastes good. Excellent views of Fisherman's Wharf through large windows. Among some appetizers, the three of us shared the shellfish tower. It was very tasty. Prices are on the higher side and portions slightly smaller. Check it out!

excerpts: Although I didn't order this due to the limitation of available space in my stomach (you can only loosen your belt so much) I have ordered their Signature Shellfish Tower which is served cold but includes lobster, dungeness crab, shrimp, and oysters.
shellfish tower.author: Tomas R.
shellfish tower.review:
I'm not a fan dining in tourist heavy sights but damnit I will make an exception for Fog Harbor Fish House. I've had the opportunity to dine formally and at the bar at different locations. FHFH is on the second floor and you'll see it from the central location of The Wharf. When you walk up the stairs you'll see an outdoor waiting area with a fireplace where you can wait for your table. You'll be able to check-in with the main host there as well.

If you're looking to skip the line and simply want to grab a bite to eat, as well as, drinks then walk on in to the bar. The bar area is open seating and it's first come first serve. You can enjoy the full menu of FHFH at the bar so that's always a win! No need to worry about a dedicated bar menu.

When you're deciding what to eat make sure to take a look at their seasonal menu.

I have to tell y'all though...
If you don't grab a bowl of their clam chowder, then you're doing yourself an injustice. Their clam chowder is so good you'll be licking the plate clean. You have to add crab meat to the chowder which takes it to the next level. You get such huge chunks of clam and the crab meat for $7 is A STEAL. Pretty sure you're getting way more for your buck without the messiness of opening crab legs yourself.

Although I didn't order this due to the limitation of available space in my stomach (you can only loosen your belt so much) I have ordered their Signature Shellfish Tower which is served cold but includes lobster, dungeness crab, shrimp, and oysters. A great appetizer to order for a party of 4 alongside some of their other apps.

The few dishes I've had there have all been great, but the service is what keeps me coming back for more. Although you may be situated within a highly trafficked tourist area, they don't take advantage of you. They treat each table with pride and they take the time to make sure you have a great dining experience.

Sadly every time I've gone I've yet to learn my lesson to make room for dessert when they bring around the dessert presentation. ONE DAY, ONE DAY....

excerpts: The salsa dipping sauce that came with the Shellfish Tower was to die for.
It's mixed very well with the touch of crab meat too.
I love crab meat as you can tell lol!
shellfish tower.author: Teda R.
shellfish tower.review:
From the food, to the view, and to the staffs, it's all marvelous! I've been here so many times with my family because we really do enjoy eating here. It's our to go restaurant whenever we are adventuring around the Pier or craving clam chowder. I'm from Stockton and yes, we really do drive to SF sometimes just to eat here lol!

I've tried countless of restaurants in SF that serves clam chowder, and I think Fog Habor have the best ones! + adding crab meat makes it extra delicious! Is definitely worth it to get the shellfish platter or tower if you're into seafood! A great variety and nice portion. The salsa dipping sauce that came with the Shellfish Tower was to die for. It's mixed very well with the touch of crab meat too. I love crab meat as you can tell lol! I love French fries as well, so I decided to try the Mussel Fries starter and I think the most tasty thing of it wasn't the mussels and fries alone, it was the creamy white sauce they used with it. Very different but I like. 

The servers here are sooo sweet and friendly. They're the ones to lit up the atmosphere of the restaurant. I never once experienced bad service here. 

I think the only con here is the waiting. It's usually very busy on weekends and especially during dinner hours, which is when I'm usually here lol. You can either reserve ahead of time or put yourself onto the waitlist on Yelp before arriving. It really does help the waiting time to be lessen.

I definitely recommend this restaurant!

excerpts: Highly recommend sharing the shellfish tower and seafood platter.
Their bloody Mary's pair very well with both dishes.

The only reason I couldn't bring myself to give this spot 5 stars is because the nearly bald host gave me a hard time about my emotional support dog and tried to tell me my dog had to sit under the table, not on the chair.
Everyone else was super friendly & nice though.
shellfish tower.author: Sara J.
shellfish tower.review: The seafood here is very fresh! If you have friends or family coming in from out of town, I would highly recommend taking them to this place. There's always a short 15-30 minute wait but it's worth it. Highly recommend sharing the shellfish tower and seafood platter. Their bloody Mary's pair very well with both dishes. The only reason I couldn't bring myself to give this spot 5 stars is because the nearly bald host gave me a hard time about my emotional support dog and tried to tell me my dog had to sit under the table, not on the chair. Everyone else was super friendly & nice though.

excerpts: I had a shellfish tower and a New York steak.
Everything was amazing.
My bother had a mix grill and he loved it.
Everything was amazing.
I  was so satisfied with the presentation and the flavor.
Unfortunately I wasn't able to get the deserts because I was to full.
But I would definitely go back for it next time.
I wish I remember my waitress name.
She was a great and patient to take my orders.
shellfish tower.author: Elizabeth H.
shellfish tower.review: Setting was great. I had a shellfish tower and a New York steak. Everything was amazing. My bother had a mix grill and he loved it. Everything was amazing. I  was so satisfied with the presentation and the flavor. Unfortunately I wasn't able to get the deserts because I was to full. But I would definitely go back for it next time. I wish I remember my waitress name. She was a great and patient to take my orders.

excerpts: I had the Shellfish Tower ($68) which is pricey but good.
I actually didn't want the lobster but it was the only way to get everything else in this chilled double platter.
The iceberg wedge salad was excellent ($10).
My picky-eater son like the Kids Fish & Chips too.
Our waiter ("Bong") was very attentive and friendly.
He was not pushy and often came to refill our water glasses.
Great atmosphere as well.
shellfish tower.author: Lee C.
shellfish tower.review:
Checked out this place only because of its great Yelp reviews. Let's just say I was not disappointed. 
I had the Shellfish Tower ($68) which is pricey but good. I actually didn't want the lobster but it was the only way to get everything else in this chilled double platter. The iceberg wedge salad was excellent ($10). My picky-eater son like the Kids Fish & Chips too. 
Our waiter ("Bong") was very attentive and friendly. He was not pushy and often came to refill our water glasses. Great atmosphere as well.

excerpts: Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner.
Lots and lots of seafood.
shellfish tower.author: Siosiua T.
shellfish tower.review:
Best Chowder I've had!
