Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner. Lots and lots of seafood. Fresh as well. 

Will be back!

excerpts: Had their shellfish tower, wedge salad, and awesome clam chowder!
I highly recommend it.
shellfish tower.author: Jenn S.
shellfish tower.review: Excellent dinner with an excellent view Of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz. Had their shellfish tower, wedge salad, and awesome clam chowder! I highly recommend it.

excerpts: We had a plan to get the shellfish tower but he recommended seafood platter instead (don't quote me on the name) and it hit the spot right on.
Great food!
Even better customer service!
Definitely recommend.
First time in Frisco didn't disappoint!
Thanks
Fog Harbor!
P.s.
The hibiscus margarita is great!
shellfish tower.author: Warren Y.
shellfish tower.review: We had the best server! Raphael treated us well. We had a plan to get the shellfish tower but he recommended seafood platter instead (don't quote me on the name) and it hit the spot right on. Great food! Even better customer service! Definitely recommend. First time in Frisco didn't disappoint! Thanks Fog Harbor! P.s. The hibiscus margarita is great!

excerpts: The crispy calamari was good and the crab ravioli was very good (the special of the day), but our linguini and clams tasted fishy along with our oysters from our shellfish tower.
The shrimp off our shellfish tower were  mushy; the crab and lobster was decent, but expected better for a $200+ meal.
shellfish tower.author: Amber W.
shellfish tower.review: We were so excited to eat here after a long Bay cruise. Unfortunately we were very disappointed! We have been on a three week vacation and excited to have finally made it to San Francisco, and eat some good sea food. The atmosphere was excellent and our server was wonderful. However, our food was not so good. The crispy calamari was good and the crab ravioli was very good (the special of the day), but our linguini and clams tasted fishy along with our oysters from our shellfish tower. The shrimp off our shellfish tower were  mushy; the crab and lobster was decent, but expected better for a $200+ meal.

excerpts: We started out with the shellfish tower and calamari for our appetizers, along with the complimentary sourdough bread.
shellfish tower.author: Hilda A.
shellfish tower.review:
Great food, great service, great view, and even no wait time (we got lucky)!

Went with a party of 5, and we all had a great time! Everyone's food was brought out in a timely manner and was very delicious. We started out with the shellfish tower and calamari for our appetizers, along with the complimentary sourdough bread.  We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees. Everyone was delighted!

For being a touristic seafood restaurant let me say they completely blew us away.  You would in a way expect to pretty much pay for your view and get bad-ok food, but not here! Genuinely delicious. 
Will definitely be going back, and a must for all seafood lovers!

excerpts: Ordered the Shellfish Tower as a meal for two.
My
oh my
what an awesome meal paired with a cocktail called the Alkatraz Escape.
Anything with coconut has got to be good.
The waiter was humorous and friendly in addition to attentive.
Way to go!
shellfish tower.author: Robert B.
shellfish tower.review: Outstanding spot to done after Alkatraz Tour.  Ordered the Shellfish Tower as a meal for two.  My oh my what an awesome meal paired with a cocktail called the Alkatraz Escape.  Anything with coconut has got to be good.  The waiter was humorous and friendly in addition to attentive.  Way to go!

excerpts:
Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF 
and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.
shellfish tower.author: Mike R.
shellfish tower.review:
Staff was nice, food was...standard fare...which surprised me since it was pricey. Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.

excerpts: The shellfish tower wasn't that fresh and the clams I ordered is too salty.
Atleast their bread is warm.
shellfish tower.author: Cryszilla G.
shellfish tower.review: Great service and beautiful view but I wasn't feeling the food Though. The shellfish tower wasn't that fresh and the clams I ordered is too salty. Atleast their bread is warm.

excerpts: Shellfish tower was more like a shellfish plate.
Good quality food.
Kids had fish and chips, mac n cheese both cooked well and adequately portioned.
Salads are a joke-wedge was ok
, Caesar was a head of romaine tossed.
A/C was blowing in our table-
everyone had to put on a fleece!
shellfish tower.author: Pete M.
shellfish tower.review: Shellfish tower was more like a shellfish plate. Good quality food. Kids had fish and chips, mac n cheese both cooked well and adequately portioned. Salads are a joke-wedge was ok, Caesar was a head of romaine tossed. A/C was blowing in our table- everyone had to put on a fleece!

excerpts: Went with the house salad and split the special of scallops and crab risotto between the two of us.
They brought it out already portioned on two separate plates which is always a nice touch.
I'm not even a huge scallop fan because of the texture, but they were so good
I ate them all.
And that risotto!!
I really just wanted to jump in a vat of it...
house salad.author: Marla L.
house salad.review:
Excellent ambiance, amazing food, and fantastic service. 

Walked in on a Monday afternoon, no reservations available for that evening but told to come back for a walk in. Came in around 6pm and was seated within 5 mins at window table with a beautiful water view. Attended to right away, and perfectly throughout the night. 

Went with the house salad and split the special of scallops and crab risotto between the two of us. They brought it out already portioned on two separate plates which is always a nice touch. I'm not even a huge scallop fan because of the texture, but they were so good I ate them all. And that risotto!! I really just wanted to jump in a vat of it...so buttery, creamy, and downright delicious!!

Great experience and highly recommended!!

excerpts: My husband ordered the halibut on the special daily menu and I the linguini and clams also a house salad to share.
The salad dressing tasted sort of like Russian.
Sour dough bread rolls were served with butter---very delicious.
Two Friends ordered fish and chips and were very pleased.
I would recommend this restaurant to others who are visiting Pier 39.
They also have a large wine and cocktail menu.
Cheers!
house salad.author: Peggy C.
house salad.review: Five of us had an early dinner Saturday and all enjoyed the food, harbor view and atmosphere. My husband ordered the halibut on the special daily menu and I the linguini and clams also a house salad to share. The salad dressing tasted sort of like Russian. Sour dough bread rolls were served with butter---very delicious. Two Friends ordered fish and chips and were very pleased. I would recommend this restaurant to others who are visiting Pier 39. They also have a large wine and cocktail menu. Cheers!

excerpts: I ordered a house salad which was huge so share it if you order and a bucket of clams.
All very good
and we left very satisfied.
house salad.author: June C.
house salad.review: Walked in at 730pm on a Friday night with a party of 8 and they were able to seat us right away at a great round table in a quieter corner in the bar area with spectacular views of the water.     Five stars right there!     Amazingly attentive Waite staff and very quick with bringing out drinks and appetizers and dinner orders.     We ordered the seafood tower which was good but seemed a bit small for all of us.   The Crispi calamari was very crisp and maybe a bit heavy on the batter, but very good.   Several ordered the fish stew and said it was great.  Several others ordered the scallops risotto.   The scallops looked a bit small to me although everyone really enjoyed their food.   I ordered a house salad which was huge so share it if you order and a bucket of clams.    All very good and we left very satisfied.

excerpts: Tonight I got the crab and scallop risotto with a lovely house salad, and the next hot homemade sourdough bread in the world!
Breanna took great care of my colleague and I. Not enough room for dessert, but we will be back!
Bravo, Fog Harbor!
house salad.author: Monda W.
house salad.review: Breathtaking views, mouthwatering food. I've visited twice this week. The first time I got the shrimp brochette, with garlic mashed potatoes, spinach and butternut squash. To die for.  Tonight I got the crab and scallop risotto with a lovely house salad, and the next hot homemade sourdough bread in the world! Breanna took great care of my colleague and I. Not enough room for dessert, but we will be back! Bravo, Fog Harbor!

excerpts: My husband & I split a house salad and the Mixed Grill plate.
We are not big eaters plus the fact we weren't that hungry.
We loved how fresh the fish was and the flavor of our entire meal.
A bread basket was served prior to our meal.
The waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive all the while very busy.
house salad.author: Tammy B.
house salad.review: This extremely busy restaurant is found upstairs on pier 39. It looks like there's always a wait for a table. We asked about the bar; if seats are available grab them. We were lucky and sat at the bar.  Yes, you may order from the whole menu at the bar.  My husband & I split a house salad and the Mixed Grill plate. We are not big eaters plus the fact we weren't that hungry.  We loved how fresh the fish was and the flavor of our entire meal.  A bread basket was served prior to our meal. The waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive all the while very busy.

excerpts: We ordered the House Salad $7 and the Garlic Roasted Crab $20.
The atmosphere was amazing.
Everything tasted delicious and very fresh.
If you are a visitor, you should definitely check this place out.
We can't wait to return.
house salad.author: Richard F.
house salad.review: We were visiting SF and went to the Wharf for lunch. We wanted to eat some famous crab so we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House and I'm glad we did. It was excellent! We came here for a late lunch on a Wed. and had no problems getting a table. Service was very good. We ordered the House Salad $7 and the Garlic Roasted Crab $20. The atmosphere was amazing. Everything tasted delicious and very fresh. If you are a visitor, you should definitely check this place out. We can't wait to return.

excerpts: To freshen our palate, we ordered a house salad with grilled shrimp.
The balsamic vinaigrette dressing cut the creaminess of the other dishes to provide a nice contrast in the meal.
All in all, would definitely recommend going for the great view and food.
house salad.author: Stephen L.
house salad.review:
I ordered the shellfish sample platter for two and it came with tiny russet potatoes, mussels, shrimp, clams, and a crab all doused in a savory garlic butter sauce. The shrimp and potatoes were my favorite part of the platter. The potatoes were cooked to tender perfection and the shrimp had a great texture and taste. 
The bread they give is freshly baked and steaming when it arrived at the table and had a perfect crisp on the outside. We dipped the bread in the leftover garlic butter sauce and my oh my it was good. 
We ordered a clam chowder bowl and it was slightly on the salty side but it was super rich and came with a generous serving of clams and other ingredients to make it an appetizing soup option nonetheless. 
To freshen our palate, we ordered a house salad with grilled shrimp. The balsamic vinaigrette dressing cut the creaminess of the other dishes to provide a nice contrast in the meal. 
All in all, would definitely recommend going for the great view and food.

excerpts: I had a house salad, chowder bread bowl, tuna poke, and a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon...
it was wonderfully delicious and the service was sharp.
Great for a decent night out and for lovely seafood dishes.
Highly recommend
house salad.author: Aaron W.
house salad.review: Great vibe and buzz and the food is on point. I had a house salad, chowder bread bowl, tuna poke, and a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon... it was wonderfully delicious and the service was sharp. Great for a decent night out and for lovely seafood dishes. Highly recommend

excerpts: Our son had a house salad and grilled salmon.
I had the NY steak and a glass of the house pinot noir.
My wife had a bowl of clam chowder and fish and chips.
The food was served in a reasonable amount of time, given how busy it was.
It was warm, presented well and the portions were just the right size, in our opinion.
Overall, we were very pleased with the food and our experience.
Being locals, we hardly ever come to Pier 39 to eat
but we just felt like playing tourists in our town that night.
It made for a wonderful pre-Father's Day celebration!
Would highly recommend this place to our friends and family, both local and from out of town.
house salad.author: Alex A.
house salad.review: My wife and son had dinner here on the eve of Father's Day, after taking in a night tour of Alcatraz. Walking distance (9 mins) from Pier 33. Had no reservations and it was busy that night so we waited about 30 mins by the patio fireplace. Got seated at a great table, which was in a corner overlooking the water. Was very happy with our server, Justin H., who promptly took our order and was attentive to the fact that our son and I are gluten-free and our son is also dairy-free. Our son had a house salad and grilled salmon. I had the NY steak and a glass of the house pinot noir.  My wife had a bowl of clam chowder and fish and chips. The food was served in a reasonable amount of time, given how busy it was. It was warm, presented well and the portions were just the right size, in our opinion. Overall, we were very pleased with the food and our experience. Being locals, we hardly ever come to Pier 39 to eat but we just felt like playing tourists in our town that night. It made for a wonderful pre-Father's Day celebration! Would highly recommend this place to our friends and family, both local and from out of town.

excerpts: Had the (free) bleu cheese garlic bread with the starter Dungeness crab cakes and house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing.
It all tasted fine, but pricy for the portions that you're served.
Unable to stop myself, I also got the apple crisp for dessert and it was very good.
My server was prompt, attentive, and friendly which made for a nice dining experience.
house salad.author: CC C.
house salad.review:
My eyes were bigger than my stomach here. 

Had the (free) bleu cheese garlic bread with the starter Dungeness crab cakes and house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It all tasted fine, but pricy for the portions that you're served. Unable to stop myself, I also got the apple crisp for dessert and it was very good. My server was prompt, attentive, and friendly which made for a nice dining experience. Also had an excellent view of the water. 

A nice place to eat on Pier 39, but pricier. Definitely not some place I'd come to regularly, but a good place to eat if you're already down by the wharf.

excerpts: But if you order a house salad, ask for dressing on the side - it was way too overly dressed.
house salad.author: Rhiannon M.
house salad.review: Good food, nice atmosphere, and a great view. Portions are great size, seafood was extra special.  But if you order a house salad, ask for dressing on the side - it was way too overly dressed.

excerpts: We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders.
Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders.
house salad.author: Wayne Z.
house salad.review:
Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good. 

We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on. 

Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there. 

If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.

excerpts: Amazing sourdough bread, house salad, clam chowder, seafood pasta, Dungeness crab and Tiramisu!!!!
Would definitely recommend a visit.
Too notch food!
house salad.author: Kelli K.
house salad.review: Amazing sourdough bread, house salad, clam chowder, seafood pasta, Dungeness crab and Tiramisu!!!! Would definitely recommend a visit. Too notch food!

excerpts: If you order a regular bowl of soup and a house salad, it'll just be $14 as well.
house salad.author: Connie C.
house salad.review:
When you're hungry and just want to sit down somewhere, you'll end up at a place like this. Very touristy. You're paying for the view, the service, and a decently cleaned bathroom. 

My date and I were seated at a table with the view of Alcatraz with a very friendly (and cute!) waiter. I wasn't extremely hungry, just tired and wanted a clean bathroom (which can be hard to find in the tourist zone), so Fog Harbor Fish House isn't a bad place to be at. 

I ordered the soup and salad combo for $14. Definitely not worth it, considering how I get the same stuff as I would at Boudin. Salad is better than Boudin's though, slightly larger portion and with fresher ingredients. I've experienced wilting lettuce at Boudin before. The clam chowder wasn't spectacular. That's probably because no clam chowder in the Bay Area can top the best chowder I've had at Seattle's Pike Place Market. The one here was very generic. I do love my breadbowl though. Yes, that was the deal with this combo, your breadbowl is at no extra cost. If you order a regular bowl of soup and a house salad, it'll just be $14 as well. 

My date had this burger with fries, nothing too amazing. I didn't like their fries just because it was too bland. My date loved it though, he doesn't like his fries too salted. So that's just personal preference. 

TMI material, skip this paragraph if you need to. I wasn't sure if it's because I had coffee in the morning, or their food wasn't prepared well, I had a major stomach ache shortly after the meal. Another good reason to have a clean bathroom. 

Instead of giving you a dessert menu near the end, your waiter will carry a huge tray of desserts to tease you. They are at portions to share. All looking very rich, but I'm not sure how long they've been sitting out. Nonetheless, good tactic.

excerpts: We enjoyed our house salad and would only go back for that alone.
The restaurant is lovely and was packed.
I suspect you would have to be a local and know exactly what to order when dining there.
house salad.author: Audrey S.
house salad.review: Nice ambience but not the best tasting food in town. My husband ordered the crab cake and did not enjoy it. It seemed like it was made from minced crab meat. I had fish and chips and the fish was over breaded and greasy. The coleslaw had no flavor and was not appealing at all. We enjoyed our house salad and would only go back for that alone. The restaurant is lovely and was packed. I suspect you would have to be a local and know exactly what to order when dining there.

excerpts: I had the salmon house salad..
it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..
i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..
i didn't even know..and
man I haven't had real bacon for so long
house salad.author: Minerva L.
house salad.review:
I had the salmon house salad..it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..i didn't even know..and man I haven't had real bacon for so long..it taste crunchy..

The dressing was a bit greasy..blah..fat..but it went well with the overall dish. I came here for lunch on a Friday and it wasn't crazy packed. The bread was nothing special..the butter wasn't either..

I really want to try the crab soup next time..the décor is nice enough to get me to come back.

excerpts: We had the house salad, clam chowder topped with crab.
The clam chowder was over the top.
I had crab cakes, had a little too much bread in it for my taste but still worth it.
We enjoyed ourselves so much that we made reservations for tomorrow night.
Just a side note we made reservations thru the yelp links to the restaurant.
They walked us right in and had a great view.
A bunch of places down here just fake the food because of location but not here!
Would definitely recommend!
house salad.author: Steve C.
house salad.review: Amazing! Our server was Mel, very nice, prompt and attentive. We had the house salad, clam chowder topped with crab. The clam chowder was over the top. I had crab cakes, had a little too much bread in it for my taste but still worth it. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we made reservations for tomorrow night. Just a side note we made reservations thru the yelp links to the restaurant. They walked us right in and had a great view. A bunch of places down here just fake the food because of location but not here! Would definitely recommend!

excerpts: My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners.
The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce.
Presentation was awful.
The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks.
house salad.author: Anastasios V.
house salad.review: Definitely not a destination place. Very touristy spot. My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners. The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce. Presentation was awful. The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks. We have yet to receive our lobster tails but I am sure that they are definitely less than stellar. I will definitely update you all on the lobster tails. That is if my wife and I make it out of this place without food poisoning.

excerpts: House salad was good.
Co worker got chowder and fish n chips.
He said chowder was ok, good, but not the best.
Fish n chips is HUGE!
Come hungry for those!
Waitress was very nice and helpful.
Kept the waters full at all times.
house salad.author: Scott B.
house salad.review:
Great place, right in the heart of tourist country! Great views, nice bar, great food!
Had the snapper special, very good and light. House salad was good. Co worker got chowder and fish n chips. He said chowder was ok, good, but not the best. Fish n chips is HUGE! Come hungry for those!
Waitress was very nice and helpful. Kept the waters full at all times.

excerpts: For dinner my bf ordered the rib eye and I had the seared prawns over linguine with the house salad to start.
When the salad came it was WILTED spring mix, two cherry tomatoes, one slice each of red onion and cucumber, and super stale croutons.
The food took a long time after that.
The steak was ok, nothing special and my pasta tasted worst then a noodle roni dinner.
house salad.author: Kristine T.
house salad.review:
So, let me first say my internet went out just as I was sending my review and erased it, BUT I'm determined to tell everyone else not to waste their time and money so I wrote the whole thing again.

If I could give this place .04 stars I would.  Prior to this my worst dinner was at McCormick and Kuleto's but at least they tried to seem like they cared about their customers.

My bf and I went there last night to celebrate our anniversary.  Granted we weren't looking for anything too fancy or high maintenance.  After we were seated it was close to 15 mins. until anyone came by, so we sat there with no water or anything.  When the waitress came she was abrupt and pretty rude.  We ordered our wine and the oyster appetizers.  The oysters were small and I've had better quality at the super market.

For dinner my bf ordered the rib eye and I had the seared prawns over linguine with the house salad to start.  When the salad came it was WILTED spring mix, two cherry tomatoes, one slice each of red onion and cucumber, and super stale croutons.  The food took a long time after that.  The steak was ok, nothing special and my pasta tasted worst then a noodle roni dinner.  I've had much better frozen food from Trader Joes.

We didn't order dessert bc we didn't want to waste anymore time or money.  So, overall - service was horrible, food was just as bad, and halfway through dinner they started blasting the AC until another customer complained for them to turn it off.

I wouldn't go back here if they paid for my dinner ! Sorry, I'm just pissed about a wasted meal out.

excerpts: The Blue Cheese Wedge Salad was also delicious- great flavor in the blue cheese.
blue cheese wedge.author: Jessica N.
blue cheese wedge.review: The bread (baked fresh every 56ish minutes) was the best thing we ate! The Blue Cheese Wedge Salad was also delicious- great flavor in the blue cheese. The Salmon dish lacked flavor, but the fish was cooked right. The appetizer special, crab ceviche, lacked flavor.

excerpts: I ordered the blue cheese wedge and the jumbo scallops over risotto.
The food was very good and the service was very prompt.
The only knock I have is every table but ours had bread, and our entrees showed up early and we didn't have a chance to really enjoy our salads.
blue cheese wedge.author: Petey C.
blue cheese wedge.review: We started with oysters Rockefeller. Amazing! My wife had a shrimp cocktail and the fried seafood platter. I ordered the blue cheese wedge and the jumbo scallops over risotto. The food was very good and the service was very prompt. The only knock I have is every table but ours had bread, and our entrees showed up early and we didn't have a chance to really enjoy our salads.

excerpts: We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder.
Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot.
However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized.
For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving.
So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf.
Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning
and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees.
blue cheese wedge.author: Whitney C.
blue cheese wedge.review:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.

excerpts: Blue cheese wedge was delish and so was my crap ciopinno
blue cheese wedge.author: Fernanda H.
blue cheese wedge.review: Had dinner sat night and service and the food was delish!! Blue cheese wedge was delish and so was my crap ciopinno

excerpts: Both my fiancée and I had their blue cheese wedge salad after seeing one delivered to another person at the bar.
The salad looked mouth watering when we saw it, then we proved it was delicious when we ordered our own.
blue cheese wedge.author: Aaron T.
blue cheese wedge.review:
Fog Harbor is a touristy place, but tourists wouldn't come here if the food wasn't good.

We stopped in for a late afternoon lunch and cocktails. The cocktail menu is a bit pricey at over $10 a drink, but consistent with other bars we've visited at Fisherman's Warf. We both had Moscow Mules; they were crisp and refreshing, garnished with lime and ginger.

More importantly, you will be delighted in the freshness and high quality of their foods, especially their seafood. Both my fiancée and I had their blue cheese wedge salad after seeing one delivered to another person at the bar. The salad looked mouth watering when we saw it, then we proved it was delicious when we ordered our own. It is loaded with creamy blue cheese, crumbles of blue cheese and bacon.

I had the Seared Alaskan Halibut and it was perfect: flaky, over a bed of quinoa, leafy greens, dried berries and a delicious sauce to bring all the flavors together. My fiancée did an appetizer combo for dinner including a crab cocktail and clam chowder, she said both items were fresh and delicious.

For those with gluten sensitivity, their menu is clearly marked with all the items that are "prepared without gluten." They have a significant selection of gluten free dishes and one gluten free desert. Our server, albeit quirky, was very conscientious about my needs and took ownership of communicating my needs to the kitchen.

We'd also like to thank them for listing the dungeoness crab cocktail on their receipts as "dung crab cocktail." My fiancée and I can verify that the crab cocktail didn't taste like dung, it tasted like crab. However, we we appreciated the laugh.

Overall, a great meal and a wonderful view of the bay. It may be a touristy due to its location on Pier 39. Nevertheless, you'll get a great meal in a nice atmosphere!

excerpts: Me and my husband split a blue cheese wedge and a whole garlic crab.
I had a fabulous Bloody Mary and we enjoyed the creme brûlée at the end.
The whole staff is awesome, met managers Juan, Bob and Ken.
Edgar, Ashley G. and Ashley L. were great at recommendations and speedy service.
We really enjoyed ourselves.
blue cheese wedge.author: Sandi G.
blue cheese wedge.review: Me and my husband split a blue cheese wedge and a whole garlic crab. I had a fabulous Bloody Mary and we enjoyed the creme brûlée at the end. The whole staff is awesome, met managers Juan, Bob and Ken. Edgar, Ashley G. and Ashley L. were great at recommendations and speedy service. We really enjoyed ourselves.

excerpts: Wife had the California crab and avocado caesar salad, which was HUGE.
Our server Khaiman was amazing.
california crab and avocado caesar salad.author: Bri H.
california crab and avocado caesar salad.review: Great food, great service. Had the mixed grill, fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Wife had the California crab and avocado caesar salad, which was HUGE. Our server Khaiman was amazing.

excerpts: We ordered the following: beet and blue cheese salad, california crab and avocado caesar salad, the soup and salad combo (caesar salad and a clam chowder bread bowl), and the crab roll.
california crab and avocado caesar salad.author: Irene L.
california crab and avocado caesar salad.review:
Great restaurant. We were recently in the Pier 39 area - had just finished a tour of Alcatraz and wanted to check out the seals and grab some food. After a quick glance at all the menus, we finally decided on Fog Harbor Fish House. 

The menu is pretty pricey, but the food is pretty good. Fresh warm sourdough bread was complimentary, which was surprisingly delicious (Note: I am a sourdough snob). 
We ordered the following: beet and blue cheese salad, california crab and avocado caesar salad, the soup and salad combo (caesar salad and a clam chowder bread bowl), and the crab roll. Didn't get a chance to try dessert, but the dessert tray they had looked amazing! 

Great views of the Bay and the seals!

excerpts: I had the salmon club salad.
The salmon was grilled to perfection and the ranch mustard dressing was an excellent companion.
The clam chowder is super tasty and the fish and chips is a comforting favorite.
View is beautiful and we were in and out within the hour.
Lively vibe and great atmosphere.
Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.
salmon club salad.author: Lori F.
salmon club salad.review: Spending time with friends and wanted to grab lunch.  This place did not disappoint.  It's a little pricey but worth it and there is a wait but once we were seated the customer service was excellent.  I had the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled to perfection and the ranch mustard dressing was an excellent companion.  The clam chowder is super tasty and the fish and chips is a comforting favorite.  View is beautiful and we were in and out within the hour.  Lively vibe and great atmosphere.  Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good.
I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare.
salmon club salad.author: Amanda K.
salmon club salad.review:
Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills. 

We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.

Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.

My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent. However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw. 

Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.

excerpts: The Salmon Club Salad - this was an interesting dish and as tasty as it was it
just seemed so...
misplaced.
Smoked Salmon is just so better off served with romaine lettuce and shouldn't be served with the softer greens, but that's just a personal opinion.

I also much admit that while the clams from the clam chowder I had earlier had a perfect smokey end taste, the salmon left a taste that made me feel like it wasn't from the freshest of waters, and lastly my tomatoes were old and browsing which wasn't so great.
All in all the salad was lacking.
It was good...but lacking.
I think they should definitely try a romaine lettuce with it.
salmon club salad.author: Veronica S.
salmon club salad.review:
I would say the service here is above par. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. Which I was. 
The only reason my rating is so low is the food. Of course since I didn't order the entire menu I can only speak for a few things. 
The Clam Chowder - delish, honestly the only thing I had there that I can say I have zero complaints about. It was the perfect consistency, plump and meaty clams with a smokey flavor and potatoes. It was great! 

The Mini Sliders - ordered by my best friend. She asked for veeeery well done. But they came out just over medium well. Which was her only complaint. Also her fries were brought out stale as if they were sitting for a while and reheated BUT the manager who was checking on everyone fixed that in an instant and had hot fresh fries out to our table in no time. Which were delish. 

The Salmon Club Salad - this was an interesting dish and as tasty as it was it just seemed so...misplaced.  Smoked Salmon is just so better off served with romaine lettuce and shouldn't be served with the softer greens, but that's just a personal opinion. I also much admit that while the clams from the clam chowder I had earlier had a perfect smokey end taste, the salmon left a taste that made me feel like it wasn't from the freshest of waters, and lastly my tomatoes were old and browsing which wasn't so great. All in all the salad was lacking. It was good...but lacking. I think they should definitely try a romaine lettuce with it. And use fresh tomatoes. 

For dessert we had the fudge brownie a la mode with whipped cream. The brownie I guess isn't a brownie but more like batter? Because it was super soft and almost like a soft grain pudding. 

Other than that, I'd say the views are beautiful. Like breathtakingly beautiful. And the lighting of amazing as well.

excerpts: We also enjoyed the salmon club salad.
The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh.
Our service was great as well.
Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.
salmon club salad.author: Mara S.
salmon club salad.review: Yes the wait is long if you don't have a reservation, but the wait was worth it! The mussel fries were excellent! We also enjoyed the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh. Our service was great as well. Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.

excerpts: I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it).
salmon club salad.author: Detroit R.
salmon club salad.review:
My experience at Fog Harbor was average. The service was subpar and disappointing. Our server Robert payed no attention to detail, was not attentive and showed no interest in serving the needs of his patrons. Robert had no personality and acted like he'd rather be at home. We had to ask for EVERYTHING :-( refills, bread...etc. 

The food was good. I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it). The taste was pretty good. 

Beautiful establishment. If the service was better, my experience would have been great. It irritates the HELL out of me when servers are terrible. Ugggghhhh!!!!!! I'm so disappointed

excerpts: My wife had the salmon club salad.
The piece of salmon was decent and grilled well, but the rest of the salad was pretty bland with mostly green leafs and little else in the salad.
My son and I had the mixed fish grill, which consisted of a piece of salmon, swordfish and 3 shrimp.
They were grilled well and had decent flavor.
It came with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.
salmon club salad.author: Tim B.
salmon club salad.review:
I took the family here for dinner. If you come here I recommend using your AAA card or downloading the Pier 39 coupon on line to redeem for the free booklet of savings at the welcome center at Pier 39.  This alone saved us over $50 on our dinner and parking.

OK, we started out with appetizers of the Bleu Cheese garlic bread and fried Calamari. The coupon book had the bread for free so we tried it. If you love garlic bread and bleu cheese, this is for you! It was over the top good!!  The calamari was nothing special, but beware as they also add fried onion pieces and jalapeno peppers....  weird,, the calamari was a little soggy  and the sauce was OK.

We all had a cup of their clam chowder.  It was good, had lots of big pieces of clams, thick and good flavor.

My wife had the salmon club salad. The piece of salmon was decent and grilled well, but the rest of the salad was pretty bland with mostly green leafs and little else in the salad.  A club anything should have more of everything,, the dressing was bland.

My daughter had the lobster tail. It was very good, large and meaty. She enjoyed it.

My son and I had the mixed fish grill, which consisted of a piece of salmon, swordfish and 3 shrimp.  They were grilled well and had decent flavor. It came with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Overall, it was OK.

This place does get crowded for dinner, so get there early. The wait for us at 615pm was 30 minutes, not too bad.  Overall, this place is a decent fish house, a little pricey, but the views are worth it.

excerpts: We had salmon club salad and swordfish, both were amazing.
salmon club salad.author: Steve S.
salmon club salad.review: Very well run restaurant with great service and great food. We had salmon club salad and swordfish, both were amazing.

excerpts: Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Courtney L.
salmon.review:
During my family's trip to San Francisco, our mission was to find a restaurant that showcased the Bay's fresh seafood at fairly reasonable prices, and Fog Harbor delivered!

Located on the second floor of Pier 39, this restaurant has a classy ambiance and a scenic view of the water where you can spot the sea lions in the distance. We were greeted by our waiter who took great care of us throughout dinner. He was personable, attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. 

We started off our seafood feast by sharing the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp appetizer ($16). It contained just six large shrimp, tossed with thin slices of onions and bell peppers in an intense chili sauce. Although I enjoyed the spicy flavors and tingling heat, I didn't find that it was the best value.  I also couldn't help but try a cup of their award-winning clam chowder ($7), which was so creamy and had large meaty clam pieces. Yum, this is a must!  

For my entree, I went with a lighter plate, being the Seared Pacific Cod ($28). The fish was seared perfectly with a golden brown, slightly crisp top. It was served with white beans, chorizo butter, tomatoes and spinach, then finished with a dab of garlic shallot aioli. The aioli added an extra layer of flavor to an already savory plate and I loved the white beans as an alternative for a starch. With the Cod placed on top of it all, it was truly the highlight of the dish. Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. They enjoyed their entrees as well.

This was easily one of the best seafood meals my family had in years. 
Thank you to Fog Harbor for such a memorable dinner to start off our visit to San Francisco on the right foot!

4.5 stars.

excerpts: I also had the mixed grill and the salmon and Cod were absolutely delicious.
Next time I'm in SF I will make it my mission to stop by here just for the Chowder
salmon.author: jason k.
salmon.review: The Best CLAM Chowder ever! I went here with my folks and they bragged how good the food was. They were not lying. I don't know what they do but man what I wouldn't do for some of that clam chowder again! I also had the mixed grill and the salmon and Cod were absolutely delicious. Next time I'm in SF I will make it my mission to stop by here just for the Chowder

excerpts: I had salmon, cod and a shrimp skewer which were all delicious,  but the salmon was melt-in-your-mouth good.
The garlic mashed potatoes were awesome and the veggies were delicious.
You know how most restaurants give you crappy frozen vegetables on the side and it seems like an afterthought?
Not here.
They had green beans, asparagus, and red pepper and they were seasoned well, crispy and delicious.
Others tried the lobster, salmon BLTs, veggie burgers, oyster platter and much more.
salmon.author: Mary T.
salmon.review:
Come for the views, stay for the food.

The Food: 5 stars.  I'm stuck on the Mixed Grill because it is cooked to perfection and you get a bit of everything.  I had salmon, cod and a shrimp skewer which were all delicious,  but the salmon was melt-in-your-mouth good.  The garlic mashed potatoes were awesome and the veggies were delicious.  You know how most restaurants give you crappy frozen vegetables on the side and it seems like an afterthought?  Not here.  They had green beans, asparagus, and red pepper and they were seasoned well, crispy and delicious.  Others tried the lobster, salmon BLTs, veggie burgers, oyster platter and much more.  Everyone was more than satisfied with their food.  

Service: 3-4 stars. Service tonight was great, but I have had not so great service here in the past. Although, to be fair, it was a rude manager who ruined my previous experience and not a server. 

Also, this restaurant really packs in the tables.  

*Don't get seated in the room alllllll the way in the back. It is awful.  They squeeze so many tables in there I get claustrophobic just thinking about it.  The first time I ate here with my husband they put us there and I should have asked to wait for a better table.  I was uncomfortable the whole meal - too much traffic and such a tiny space.  Not my jam.

Now, the last 2 times I came I was with 6-8 people and we got good tables facing the water in the main room.  Muchhhhhh better and more comfortable!

Ambiance: 4-5 stars for the main dining room.  Again, I wouldn't recommend sitting in the tiny back room unless you enjoy dining in a small, crowded room with no peace or tranquility.  

Overall: solid 4 stars.  The food is awesome!

excerpts: My friend got the mixed grill which came with salmon, cod and shrimp along with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Meghan P.
salmon.review:
Wow!!! This restaurant is amazing. I was out in the city with a good friend and she recommended we go to this restaurant for lunch. I was not disappointed. 

They served warm fresh sourdough bread while waiting for our entrees. The butter was perfectly salted and room temperature which I love. I ordered the half soup/salad. I got the Cesar salad with clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was more than filling I wasn't able to finish it all. Good thing I had my husband there to help me out. 

My husband ordered the Ahi Tuna entree which he let me have a little of. The Ahi tuna was seared and coated with sesame seeds but rare on the inside. It had great flavor and melted in your mouth. It was served with rice with an amazing soy/lime sauce that had a yummy smoky flavor. It was also served with vegetables. 

My friend got the mixed grill which came with salmon, cod and shrimp along with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes. 

We all left very full and satisfied. 

This restaurant has tons of yummy seafood options. I can't wait to come back to this restaurant and test out the other entrees.

excerpts: Salmon with pumpkin curry
- Salmon is flavorful,
salmon.author: Dolls P.
salmon.review:
I thought this place is a tourist trap and the food may be mediocre...I was wrong about the food. We loved everything that we ate and Mel made my husband's birthday celebration very special. We were glad to have him. He's attentive and the desert was a special touch! 

Breaking the yummy part down:

Clam chowder in sour dough bowl- thick, flavorful and delicious!

Salmon with pumpkin curry - Salmon is flavorful,  pan seared to a perfect light crispy texture over a sweet pumpkin sauce (the curry taste is not very strong).

Luguini clam pasta- I'm not a fan of clams but loved he overall dish. If you're a garlic fan like me then you will appreciate garlic sauce flavor

excerpts: The mixed grill and salmon plates were also impeccable and I'd definitely recommend.
salmon.author: Melissa T.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House was probably the most recommended place (by yelp) and there were some high expectations because of that. In short, I'd say that the food lived up to the expectations in my head.

Here are some helpful tips:
-The waiting area is beautiful. True. 
-Make a reservation a week in advance if it's a Friday or weekend. Waiting is fine, but it gets cold and windy, so be prepared. 
-Ask for a water view. 

The service: 
The hostess people were very friendly, BUT I'd say it's hard to hear when they call your names, so stick close to the stand. Once you're inside, the waiters and waitresses are pretty attentive and make sure you always have fresh bread.

The atmosphere:
The restaurant is deceivingly large and the feel is very classy and very vibrant when you walk in. There are a mixture of people from different places, but they all are smiling and happy. 

The food:
Since this was my first time here, I can't talk about the food fully, BUT I'll say that what we had was great. We started with the calamari, which was fresh and lightly fried (perfection). The mixed grill and salmon plates were also impeccable and I'd definitely recommend. When I come back I'll have to try a dessert or two because they looked amazing when they'd walk by our table with them. 

Conclusion: 
Do I recommend it? Of course! It has the most reviews for a reason. The views of the bridge and the harbor are to die for and the food is the perfect pairing with a stunning landscape.

excerpts: The salmon, with a tomato relish was sooo good, with a healthy hint of spice.
Fresh sourdough bread with butter was fantasic.
Always a pleasure, always leaving happy.
Views from the dining area are killer, to the left you see Golden Gate, to the right Alcatraz.
Definitely recommend.
salmon.author: Heraldo L.
salmon.review: I have been here 2 times already and I can say that they have some of the best food & service I have had up to date. The salmon, with a tomato relish was sooo good, with a healthy hint of spice. Fresh sourdough bread with butter was fantasic. Always a pleasure, always leaving happy. Views from the dining area are killer, to the left you see Golden Gate, to the right Alcatraz. Definitely recommend.

excerpts: The food is fantastic, we got 1/2 dozen oysters to start and then the linguini & clams as well as the salmon which were both delicious.
Finished off with apple crumble dessert!
Best food we have had in USA
and we have been to NY, DC, Orlando and Vegas.
salmon.author: Sam L.
salmon.review:
Just finished a tour on Alcatraz and saw the reviews on here were good. It did not lie, the service was great and got a seat for two straight away. Sitting near the window can see Alcatraz and also sea lions! The food is fantastic, we got 1/2 dozen oysters to start and then the linguini & clams as well as the salmon which were both delicious. Finished off with apple crumble dessert!
Best food we have had in USA and we have been to NY, DC, Orlando and Vegas.

excerpts: The broth is complex and complements the varied seafood (crab, salmon, another type of fish, clams, mussels, and shrimp) so well!
My ONLY note is that the shrimp was overdone by the time I got to it.
Everything else was tender and delicious.
salmon.author: Brittany B.
salmon.review:
Oh how I absolutely LOVE this place.  We walked over on a Wednesday evening without a reservation and had a little wait but were fortunate enough to sit by the windows at sunset.  It set the mood beautifully.  I was on a mission for seafood and went with the Cioppino. Man, am I glad I did. The broth is complex and complements the varied seafood (crab, salmon, another type of fish, clams, mussels, and shrimp) so well! My ONLY note is that the shrimp was overdone by the time I got to it.  Everything else was tender and delicious.   I was disappointed I hadn't saved the intro sourdough rolls to soak up more of the broth.  

My guy got the cod and I only tasted a bite but similar sauce complexity and complements to the fish.  It's a pricey meal but very worth it here.

excerpts: Get the seasonal salmon if it's October.
The pumpkin salmon is literally the beat dish of salmon I've ever had.
Highly recommend.
salmon.author: Jonathan W.
salmon.review: Amazing. Get the seasonal salmon if it's October. The pumpkin salmon is literally the beat dish of salmon I've ever had. Highly recommend.

excerpts: Salmon awesome and great view of the bay.
And when your shop pier 39 for the rest of the day to ah burn calories after your meal
salmon.author: Kevin S.
salmon.review: Again we were seated right away and it was busy with the blue angles air show and Fleet Week. And oh yes the food and service impeccable . Salmon awesome and great view of the bay. And when your shop pier 39 for the rest of the day to ah burn calories after your meal

excerpts: The salmon was great and went well with arugula and the smoky taste of peppers.
I wondered if it tasted so good with the exceptions, how well it would taste with all its original ingredients.
Their desserts were presented well and I was very tempted but found the courage to pass..
The service was good and we were taken care
of/ checked on without anybody being persistent/annoying.
salmon.author: Tejashree M.
salmon.review:
We were able to put our name down, see the pier and come in time for dinner for our turn. The place was pretty packed on a Saturday night. We got a table in the corner where it felt little crowded/claustrophobic. However, it was much better when neighboring table emptied. I would have loved to have a window-side table, perhaps next time.
The crab cakes and baked oysters were delicious and packed with good flavor. Being on a special diet, they were able to modify the dish as per my restrictions. My dish arrived with an allergy tag. The salmon was great and went well with arugula and the smoky taste of peppers. I wondered if it tasted so good with the exceptions, how well it would taste with all its original ingredients. Their desserts were presented well and I was very tempted but found the courage to pass.. The service was good and we were taken care of/ checked on without anybody being persistent/annoying.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon, not expecting a farm raised toxic tasting anemic looking filet I couldn't finish.
The sides were regular Denny's quality, nothing special.
The deserts were uninspired previously frozen items one would find at Costco.
All of this would be fine if this place didn't tout itself as world class seafood.
Our server was only seen once, for the remainder of the meal we seemed to have been taken over by food runners and bus staff.
The bill was of course close to $200.
I deleted a previous review generalizing our experience after received a reply from management requesting details because it "wasn't the sort of review they were accustomed to" so here you are.
I should have checked with my employees or any long term SanFran resident, in advance; it's common knowledge
this is a visitor/ tourist/view restaurant only.
Our food looked nothing like the photos offered by the business owners on this site.
The generic cut/paste review below by Bob was for my previously deleted review which apparently doesn't go away when reviews are revised.
salmon.author: Stanley J.
salmon.review: My spouse liked the chowder on our first visit here so we returned at thanksgiving a few years ago. I started with the scampi cocktail which contained almost still frozen farm raised scampi presented in a way that was quite obviously prepared days in advance. I didn't finish. The spouse had the chowder which wasn't rated as highly as before, whole crab which was rated marginal. I ordered the salmon, not expecting a farm raised toxic tasting anemic looking filet I couldn't finish. The sides were regular Denny's quality, nothing special. The deserts were uninspired previously frozen items one would find at Costco. All of this would be fine if this place didn't tout itself as world class seafood. Our server was only seen once, for the remainder of the meal we seemed to have been taken over by food runners and bus staff.  The bill was of course close to $200. I deleted a previous review generalizing our experience after received a reply from management requesting details because it "wasn't the sort of review they were accustomed to" so here you are. I should have checked with my employees or any long term SanFran resident, in advance; it's common knowledge this is a visitor/ tourist/view restaurant only. Our food looked nothing like the photos offered by the business owners on this site. The generic cut/paste review below by Bob was for my previously deleted review which apparently doesn't go away when reviews are revised.

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp.
Overall we were happy with the food.
The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky.
The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams.
The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf
so I wouldn't expect anything less.
salmon.author: Vicky C.
salmon.review: They were very busy here so service was a little slow but overall the food was great and they serve sourdough bread rolls which are delicious!! We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp. Overall we were happy with the food. The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky. The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams. The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf so I wouldn't expect anything less.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill with grilled shrimp, salmon, and pacific cod that was cooked to perfection.
The garlic mashed potatoes were full of flavor and seasoned well.
The view was great!
I would highly recommend.
It is high end food but at lunch the environment was kid friendly and dress was casual.
salmon.author: Jenny S.
salmon.review: Excellent lunch!  I was skeptical at first because the quality of food and prices in such high tourist areas are usually not as good but we were pleasantly surprised. I had the Mixed Grill with grilled shrimp, salmon, and pacific cod that was cooked to perfection. The garlic mashed potatoes were full of flavor and seasoned well. The view was great!  I would highly recommend. It is high end food but at lunch the environment was kid friendly and dress was casual.

excerpts: The fish they used was SALMON, my favorite!
The tomato soup was DELICIOUS with chunks of tomato in it.
$34 for all that?
salmon.author: Athena C.
salmon.review:
When my supervisor asked me for food suggestions for the team outing, of course I decided to go all out on seafood by the bay. It's right down the street from our entertainment, SF Dungeon.

We made reservations for 5:00pm but our show ended much earlier (3:00pm). Instead of walking around or hitting a bar for 2 hours, we went to the restaurant to see if we could get seated early. When we mentioned our reservations, the lady at the front desk was all "Soooooo you came now...?" Obviously? But there were TONS of open tables. Who eats at 3:00pm??? But I bet if we actually arrived at the time of our reservations, we would've gotten a table by the window. Kinda disappointed about that but not the restaurant's fault.

A coworker and I went directly up to the bar to order drinks because we wanted the drinks on a separate tab. I got the Lipstick Lemondrop and he had the Alcatraz Escape. Both were great. Couldn't taste alcohol at all but definitely felt it. I LOVE that.

I got the Cioppino. At first I thought about getting the Lazy Cioppino (no shells), but part of the fun of seafood is eating with your hands! The scallops were HUGE! Do you see the chunk of white on the right of my picture?? That was one of the scallops!! The crabs were already cracked so it was easy to get the meat out. They provide the cracker and a tiny fork but I didn't need it at all. The fish they used was SALMON, my favorite! The tomato soup was DELICIOUS with chunks of tomato in it. $34 for all that? I'd say it was definitely worth it.

I also tried some of my coworker's Lobster Tail, which I was also contemplating but my Cioppino was DEFINITELY the winner. The Lobster Tail was way smaller than I expected, and kinda dry. The melted butter didn't help very much with flavor.

We wrapped it up with dessert. I thought the way they present dessert was VERY smart. They have all their desserts brought to you on a tray, then they introduce each one. I asked our waiter what he recommends personally and we ended up with two: House-made Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and Strawberry Shortcake. The brulee was good, but the shortcake was better IMO. Super soft shortcake with whipped cream and fruits drowning in syrup. Not SUPER sweet either.

The only thing I regret now is my coworkers knowing how much I eat...

excerpts: The cod and salmon just melted in my mouth.
One thing I can't stand is when fish taste fishy lol if you know what I mean - but
both fishes BLEW me away.
Shrimp and was tasty, but not as fresh as the fish-
so my focus was on those two.
Mashed Potatoes were soft and flavorful!
salmon.author: Kaira D.
salmon.review:
Visiting from Hawaii, we traveled from Sacramento to SF just because of their chowder. We heard that this was the place to get the freshest food. Excited to try we had a party of four that was sat right away without any reservations. Our server Gia, was amazing and very very attentive to us. Being our first time, she gave us a lot of tips to what plates to go for and did not rush us at all. Her patience and kindness really made this dinner a great one! 

Of course, her recommendations are what we had to go with and everything she said tasted delicious! The calamari was to die for. It was perfectly cooked and the lemon aioli was mouth watering! I will be definitely dreaming of that dish. The clam chowder was next, and let me say- I could eat that every day. Hands down the best chowder there. No doubt about it. 

My entree was the mixed plate. I was having a difficult time deciding what to choose so Gia told me to get it all. I'm so happy I listened to her. The cod and salmon just melted in my mouth. One thing I can't stand is when fish taste fishy lol if you know what I mean - but both fishes BLEW me away. Shrimp and was tasty, but not as fresh as the fish- so my focus was on those two. Mashed Potatoes were soft and flavorful! I had no disappointments at all. 

We skipped dessert because we were stuffed! But I would recommend this place to all my friends - a little pricy... BUT WORTH IT! I promise you.

excerpts: The mixed grill with a sampling of cod, salmon, and shrimp.
The salmon was melt in your mouth good as was the cod.
salmon.author: Penny L.
salmon.review:
A must go to on the pier! Beyond friendly staff and a fabulous view! The seafood is so incredibly fresh it can't be described. 

I order the crab cocktail which was good. The star of the show for me was the entree. The mixed grill with a sampling of cod, salmon, and shrimp. The salmon was melt in your mouth good as was the cod. The shrimp was sweet and delicious. 

The sourdough is tasty too. Not sure what the hype is with sourdough on the pier but it was a nice addition to the meal for sure. 

I know there's a ton of other choices when you're here but you should choose Fog Harbour; you won't regret it!

excerpts: the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon.

There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood.
salmon.author: danielle a.
salmon.review:
This is one of our favorite local spots. It's great for a sit down dinner with friends but they also have bar seating that's first come first serve. I will say the service is MUCH better if you sit at a table. Great views & for as touristy as it is the food is killer!

One of my favorite dishes is the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon. There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood. Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards. We basically lick our plates clean. Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.

The fog house lager is really good! Try their beers

excerpts: Salmon - Yes, you've read that right.
The plate is called Salmon.
My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it.
salmon.author: Shannen R.
salmon.review:
Two words: Tourist Trap.

Located in Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House sits on the 2nd Floor amongst many restaurants. It's outdoor waiting area is relaxing, spacious, and modern. It felt like I was sitting on a daybed in Hawaii and my parents can second that. 

Fancy? Yes. Pricey? Sure. Food content? As Yelp suggests, it is A-Ok.

I took my parents and siblings out to eat and only waited for 10 minutes to get seated. For a Monday afternoon, this place was already busy. Our host led us to our booth overlooking the pier and boy was that a treat. 

The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn. It was a little salty for my taste but my parents loved it!

Clam Chowder - Cup vs. Bowl - What should you get? Well, my sister and I ordered the cup size, which really is a size of an espresso cup. It was good enough to fill that clam chowder craving. My mom had the bowl. We all concurred that the chowder tasted pretty bland. Our waiter even forgot to give us crackers - whomp! 

Salmon - Yes, you've read that right. The plate is called Salmon. My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it. He gives it 4 stars.

Cioppino - Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food. So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth. It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out. 3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!: Mom and sister had to share this one out. They barely finished the whole plate. This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino. The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time. 5 stars.

Surf and Turf: Brother wanted some meat so he settled for this. He demolished his steak and lobster but says his veggies and mash potatoes were gross. 4 stars.

Drinks:

The  "Perfect Hibiscus Margarita" was really perfect. It was beautifully decorated and STRONG. My dad even tried it and got tipsy with this look deceiving drink. 5 stars. All that for $13.50? What a steal.

My dad's Lombard Lemonade was a refreshing drink. Again beautifully decorated and well worth the price.

Large portions, beautiful plates, and bomb drinks. And would you take a look at that seafront view?!

So why three stars?

Well, the food was A-Ok. It sure wasn't bad but it definitely didn't blow me away either. Solid 3 stars.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.
I had a window table with a great view.
The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.
salmon.author: Debra M.
salmon.review: I have been to Pier 39 several times over the years but always passed this place.  I stopped this time and I'm glad I did because the food was exceptional I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had a window table with a great view. The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.

excerpts: My kids had shrimp and the other had salmon kid meals.
They finished their meals which means it was good!
Our sea food and 2 lobster was PERFECT!
We would love to dine here again.
On another note, when parking in the parking structure in front, don't forget to ask for validation at the restaurant.
We ended up paying over $50 for parking after spending $250 at the restaurant
Lesson learned.
we won't forget next time.
We wish the servers would ask if we need any parking validation like other restaurants do.
salmon.author: Mel V.
salmon.review: We ate here by the windows and enjoyed our meals! My kids had shrimp and the other had salmon kid meals. They finished their meals which means it was good! Our sea food and 2 lobster was PERFECT! We would love to dine here again. On another note, when parking in the parking structure in front, don't forget to ask for validation at the restaurant. We ended up paying over $50 for parking after spending $250 at the restaurant  Lesson learned. we won't forget next time. We wish the servers would ask if we need any parking validation like other restaurants do.

excerpts: We ordered a combo that had salmon and cod.
I don't normally care for cod (my husband does and we were splitting) so I was planning to eat the salmon.
It was so bad though!
The cod was perfect, with a very nice sauce.
The salmon was super-fishy and drowning in sauce.
salmon.author: Kristie W.
salmon.review:
A lot of waiting for little payoff.   We visited during our layover from Hawaii to Atlanta, looking forward to some of that famous San Francisco seafood.  This restaurant was my choice and I chose poorly. 

One bright spot- the super nice hostess seated us at a terrific table overlooking the water. There are some gorgeous views to be had here so make sure you get a good table. 

Though not very crowded there was a long wait for everything.  A long wait to order drinks, to get drinks, to order food, to get food, to get check and on and on.  We almost had to go wander around and find our server to even pay our bill. Our server had a habit of stopping for long chats are many tables in her section.

The food was disappointing as well. We ordered a combo that had salmon and cod.  I don't normally care for cod (my husband does and we were splitting) so I was planning to eat the salmon.  It was so bad though!  The cod was perfect, with a very nice sauce.  The salmon was super-fishy and drowning in sauce. 

Not a horrible place but not a place we'd return to when there are so very many options in the area.

excerpts: Fiancée ordered the clams with linguini but she substituted the clams with salmon which the kitchen had no issues with.
I ordered a sourdough bread bowl filled with clam chowder and crab.
It was amazing.
Probably the best clam chowder I've ever tasted.
The starter bread (sourdough) was also very good.
Great views, huge drink selection, and awesome atmosphere.
salmon.author: Juan M.
salmon.review: Came here on Christmas Day and it was busy. They usually take reservations but not for major holidays. We waited about 30 minutes since we were only a party of two. Our waiter was very friendly and quick. Fiancée ordered the clams with linguini but she substituted the clams with salmon which the kitchen had no issues with. I ordered a sourdough bread bowl filled with clam chowder and crab. It was amazing. Probably the best clam chowder I've ever tasted. The starter bread (sourdough) was also very good. Great views, huge drink selection, and awesome atmosphere.

excerpts: We wanted the seafood trio with the salmon and all and the steak plate... we will have to try again.
Only reason for three stars is we were never asked anything we pretty much walked him through the service of serving.
salmon.author: Coryann E.
salmon.review: The food, well appetizers were good I love calamari. I didn't care for the sauce but that's my preference. I didn't like the mussels fries not sure if it was the onions but something threw it off for me. Again that's just me. We loved the oysters!!!!!! me and my girlfriend went by after doing hair for a wedding on a Saturday. We ordered some waters and started with 3 appetizers, we're big eaters. The server never came back and asked if we wanted anything else. Maybe he assumed we were not going to eat more and we were just snackers which we are. But we were there for the big plates!!! We wanted the seafood trio with the salmon and all and the steak plate... we will have to try again. Only reason for three stars is we were never asked anything we pretty much walked him through the service of serving.

excerpts: I've tried the salmon and a lobster roll but both were bland.
Definitely opt for the fish and chips here!
The beer batter is delicious.
salmon.author: Darla H.
salmon.review: This restaurant does a good job with fish and chips!  I've tried the salmon and a lobster roll but both were bland.  Definitely opt for the fish and chips here! The beer batter is delicious.

excerpts: We ordered the seafood platter (but there was no corn on the cob) and the grilled salmon platter with mashed potatoes.
My sister and I shared the seafood platter for 1 and it was more than enough.
The wait staff was on point ..

we didn't have to wait very long and we had a great view overlooking Alcatraz
Seafood platter 8 out of 10
(we didn't get half of a crab just the legs or any corn on the cob)

Grilled salmon platter 9 out of 10 (need more  lemons) 
Double ipa beer was bomb.com 

Arif
salmon.author: G K.
salmon.review:
Overall the food was great! We ordered the seafood platter (but there was no corn on the cob) and the grilled salmon platter with mashed potatoes. My sister and I shared the seafood platter for 1 and it was more than enough. The wait staff was on point .. we didn't have to wait very long and we had a great view overlooking Alcatraz
Seafood platter 8 out of 10 (we didn't get half of a crab just the legs or any corn on the cob) 
Grilled salmon platter 9 out of 10 (need more  lemons) 
Double ipa beer was bomb.com 

Arif is an awesome waiter and very patient with complicated orders...

excerpts: For the main course the choice was the trio of the salmon, swordfish & shrimp that came with mashed potatoes & grilled asparagus.
DOUBLE YUM!
It was tough to pick a favorite but I'd give the swordfish a slight lead over the other two; the asparagus was grilled & seasoned perfectly too!
salmon.author: Shawn O.
salmon.review:
The Fog House was a great dinner spot to end a beautiful day out in the Bay Area. With a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz, the setting is beautiful to start. The restaurant's ambiance is very nice even though it is clearly very busy!

The hardest part was trying to figure out what to choose with the tasty menu options available!

I asked for the waitress' opinion for a starter - half a dozen oysters or the 2017 prize winning clam chowder highlighted on the menu. She recommended the oysters and they did not disappoint but......I ended up ordering a cup of the clam chowder TOO (adding crab to it) - YUM! The complimentary sourdough bread combo'd perfectly with the chowder.

For the main course the choice was the trio of the salmon, swordfish & shrimp that came with mashed potatoes & grilled asparagus. DOUBLE YUM! It was tough to pick a favorite but I'd give the swordfish a slight lead over the other two; the asparagus was grilled & seasoned perfectly too! The potatoes were not bad but didn't stand out.

Soooooo.....this was already plenty of food and most people wouldn't bother considering dessert .....until the options were presented! So many choices that looked delicious but my choice was the blondie and it was really good!

In case I wasn't clear enough, I'd highly recommend this Pier 39 restaurant option. Enjoy!

excerpts: My kids ordered their salmon children's meal and they had a great time waiting for their meal because of the crayons and the coloring papers.
The kids really enjoyed their salmon and they said that it was the best they ever had!
salmon.author: Iris R.
salmon.review:
I made the conscious decision to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House with my kids in our first visit to San Francisco. There was no line but the place had lots of diners. Although we weren't given the window table, it was still a very nice experience to be guided to your table by affable attendants. My kids ordered their salmon children's meal and they had a great time waiting for their meal because of the crayons and the coloring papers. For myself, I splurged on lobster tails and crab cakes to share. I had Anchor beer to wash it down. 

The lobster was fresh and just juicy. It was yummy! And the crab cakes! The kids really enjoyed their salmon and they said that it was the best they ever had! 

We didnt wait that long for the food and we also didnt dally long inside the restaurant. It was a splurge worth having!

excerpts: My dinner was the grilled prawns cod & salmon.
Sides were fresh green beans & garlic mashed potatoes.
It was delicious.
My husband ordered the hamburger & it was a big burger, he couldn't finish it.
We wanted to order a dessert( saw others orders they looked very yummy, but we were too full.
We were very pleased with our meal & atmosphere.
salmon.author: Christina B.
