salmon.review: I was wanting seafood or fish and this was place. We were lucky & got seated without any wait time. First came the sour dough bread & it was hard not to say yes to a second basket. My dinner was the grilled prawns cod & salmon. Sides were fresh green beans & garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My husband ordered the hamburger & it was a big burger, he couldn't finish it. We wanted to order a dessert( saw others orders they looked very yummy, but we were too full. We were very pleased with our meal & atmosphere.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle.
Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito.
I wouldn't go back.
Many other places to choose from.
salmon.author: Shannon B.
salmon.review: I was dinning alone so sat at the bar. Service was fine, nothing special. Food was okay until I found a hair in my mash potatoes. I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle. Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito. I wouldn't go back. Many other places to choose from.

excerpts: Fiancée had the mixed seafood which included grilled shrimp, grilled salmon, grilled swordfish.
The crab was actually amazing!
Well seasoned deep into the meat!
And the crab was actually pretty meaty despite the size of it!
The mixed seafood dish was really good especially the swordfish!
salmon.author: Brian J.
salmon.review:
My fiancée and I were looking for a good seafood place to eat lunch after walking around the fishermans wharf all morning. When we came across this place on yelp we were impressed with what they had so we gave it a a go.

First thing is that if you're coming for lunch on a Friday or weekend for that matter, expect to wait a while. I think we waited close to 45 min to be seated. No big deal as we just sat at the bar and killed time there. The only thing I regret is forgetting to request a window table to enjoy the view of the water. However looking back we probably would have waited longer and we were too hungry lol.

I had the garlic dungeoness crab... even though I ordered the half size, the waiter must have misheard me and got me the full order ($45). Fiancée had the mixed seafood which included grilled shrimp, grilled salmon, grilled swordfish. The crab was actually amazing! Well seasoned deep into the meat! And the crab was actually pretty meaty despite the size of it! The mixed seafood dish was really good especially the swordfish! We also shared a sourdough bread bowl with clam chowder, but nothing really too crazy about it IMO. 

Service was great, Despite the miscommunication about the crab. I didn't make a big deal about it because honestly I didn't feel like I had to. The food was great regardless.

Overall this place was really good and we would definitely be back! I would still have had the half crab because it was too much food for the full crab, but if you're going with a few people it probably would be good to share one whole crab.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grilled (salmon, cod, shrimp) with veggies and mashed potatoes.
Loved my shrimp and veggies - they were delicious!
Personally was disappointed in the salmon as my husband makes it better himself.
My husband ordered the surf & turf.
We're food people and he said the lobster was one of the best he's ever had!
Our server wasn't very attentive nor was he friendly.
Our bartender (while waiting on a table) was very nice though.
We requested a table with a view and it was perfect.
Alcatraz in the background.
Must walk out to see the sea lions afterwards!
salmon.author: Sara C.
salmon.review: Excellent view and location, great food, decent service. I ordered the mixed grilled (salmon, cod, shrimp) with veggies and mashed potatoes. Loved my shrimp and veggies - they were delicious! Personally was disappointed in the salmon as my husband makes it better himself. My husband ordered the surf & turf. We're food people and he said the lobster was one of the best he's ever had! Our server wasn't very attentive nor was he friendly. Our bartender (while waiting on a table) was very nice though. We requested a table with a view and it was perfect. Alcatraz in the background. Must walk out to see the sea lions afterwards!

excerpts: I had the Cesar salad with Salmon and chowder soup.
My husband had the crab risotto with scallops.
The food was delicious and the service was attentive.
It has a beautiful view of the water.
I highly recommend this restaurant!
salmon.author: Leslie N.
salmon.review: Great seafood restaurant. I had the Cesar salad with Salmon and chowder soup. My husband had the crab risotto with scallops. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. It has a beautiful view of the water. I highly recommend this restaurant!

excerpts: My fiancé ordered salmon with vegetables, when we ordered this we thought the vegetables would be on the side like usual but we were surprised to see the vegetables under the salmon besides that the salmon was good and has a nice flavorful seasoning.
Our bill came out to be around $150, two sodas, two appetizers and two delicious main entree was worth the price.
To add on, it was my fiancé's birthday in which they gave us a complementary slice of Tiramisu cake which was beyond good!
I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone, delicious food, friendly servers, decent wait time and amazing views!
salmon.author: Leah B.
salmon.review: Made reservations ahead of time for this restaurant for my fiancé's birthday and only had to wait about 10 minutes due to it being busy but we didn't mind the wait because the location of the restaurant is very convenient and filled with entertainment all around. We were seated at a table with a beautiful window view of Alcatraz and the ocean, due to the busyness of the restaurant it was loud but besides that restaurant was clean and everything went good. For starters, our waiter served us warm tasty bread with a nice warm butter on the side as you put it on the bread it melted and was so delicious! For appetizers my fiancé got crab ceviche in which the only problem was they don't give that much chips to eat it with but my fiancé enjoyed it with the chips and also on its own. The second appetizer we got was half of a garlic crab, this restaurant is very classy as my waiter took out a bib like plastic and put it on me before eating the crab. The crab was very good, squeezed lemon all over the crab which added a nice touch to it. Our main entree, I ordered a peppered steak with mashed potatoes and vegetables in which the steak and potatoes were flavor flavorful and they cooked my steak to my likings but the vegetables I was not too much of a fan of due to it having some type of sweet taste which to get paste it I had to put quite a bit of salt and pepper on it. My fiancé ordered salmon with vegetables, when we ordered this we thought the vegetables would be on the side like usual but we were surprised to see the vegetables under the salmon besides that the salmon was good and has a nice flavorful seasoning. Our bill came out to be around $150, two sodas, two appetizers and two delicious main entree was worth the price. To add on, it was my fiancé's birthday in which they gave us a complementary slice of Tiramisu cake which was beyond good! I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone, delicious food, friendly servers, decent wait time and amazing views!

excerpts: For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out.
The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with.
Had to give him a reminder.
No problem.
For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter.
This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste.
I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food.
Price is a bit on the more expensive side
but you get what you pay for.
Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier.
Definitely would go again!
salmon.author: Hai L.
salmon.review: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

excerpts: Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus
, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.
salmon.author: Darlene L.
salmon.review:
Delicious Dinner with a View. 
We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess that escorted us to a table with a wonderful view of the bay and Alcatraz. 
We ordered several items to try. 
Dungeness Crab App - generous portion o   Fish and Chips - standard, nothing to get excited over, but worked for the kid. 
Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.

excerpts: The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon.
The best fish on my plate was the shrimp.
salmon.author: Payal V.
salmon.review:
We tried coming here for Father's Day, but couldn't get a reservation for our large group. My family and I happened to be in town one Friday and decided to dine here since the menu had looked so good during Father's Day. 

It's a really nice restaurant amongst all of the casual tourist spots in the same area. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.  I was underwhelmed by my dish. The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon. The best fish on my plate was the shrimp. The other fish were dry and overcooked. 

My husband's ahi was good. The flavors came together well to make a good dish.

excerpts: Children's menu offered grilled salmon for $8.95.
My son enjoyed his meal.
Clam chowder was 4/5.
Good base but is advertised as containing bacon which was scant in the soup.
I had the scallop crab risotto.
I could not see any crab and asked about it.
I was told that the crab was Dungeness crab and that it "melts into the risotto"  For $35 I would expect to see clumps of crab on the top or more than 4 scallops.
Good, not great considering the price.
salmon.author: Mary S.
salmon.review: Many items on the menu can be made gluten free. Great view of Alcatraz. Children's menu offered grilled salmon for $8.95.  My son enjoyed his meal. Clam chowder was 4/5. Good base but is advertised as containing bacon which was scant in the soup. I had the scallop crab risotto. I could not see any crab and asked about it. I was told that the crab was Dungeness crab and that it "melts into the risotto"  For $35 I would expect to see clumps of crab on the top or more than 4 scallops. Good, not great considering the price.

excerpts: I of course had salmon and my bf had some expensive seafood platter with lots of shellfish and mussels.
He said it tastes very fresh.
My salmon was very moist and had a great flavor.
I would definitely recommend
salmon.author: Chelsey A.
salmon.review: We had the best seat overlooking the harbor. I of course had salmon and my bf had some expensive seafood platter with lots of shellfish and mussels. He said it tastes very fresh. My salmon was very moist and had a great flavor. I would definitely recommend

excerpts: I'm not a seafood eater, however, I decided to try their Crab Linguine but I substituted the crab for blackened Salmon.
It was very good.
My husband had the fried trio and said it was really good.
He loved how fresh the shrimp was and was impressed by the amount of Calamari he got jn addition to his other food.
salmon.author: Ashley W.
salmon.review: Food and view were great! Service... As far as our waiter goes not so much but other servers were more responsive! I'm not a seafood eater, however, I decided to try their Crab Linguine but I substituted the crab for blackened Salmon. It was very good. My husband had the fried trio and said it was really good. He loved how fresh the shrimp was and was impressed by the amount of Calamari he got jn addition to his other food.

excerpts: It also came with a  fabulous piece of salmon.
That too would have made a great meal.
Finally a piece very superb swordfish.
I started going into mental overload thinking which I would have as a dedicated meal if I ever came back.
Too many awesome choices!
salmon.author: Robert M.
salmon.review:
This place is SERIOUS about food. I thought it was in the middle of the touristy part of the Fisherman's Wharf and I would pay for the scenery rather than the food. Boy I was wrong. It had both!

Almost all of the seats had spectacular views of the wharves, piers, boats and bay. Ours was not on the window, but one off the row which was in fact better. The wait service was impeccable. 

We came early which is about the smartest thing you could do if you don't want to wait for a hugely popular place to get a seat. Starters was the best old fashioned I've had. I don't like them "muddled", but the mashed fruit with the maple syrup was quite unique and quite enjoyable.

I started with a cub of clam chowder. It was very, very good. Not the best, but enjoyable. Lots of clams and bacon. Maybe too much bacon, but I will never say such a sacrilege out loud - "too much bacon". Just rip my tongue out before that happens. 

We split an appetizer portion of their scallops. They were fried in almost a Callabash style. No, I can't describe it, so Google it. I worked at a seafood restaurant on the South Carolina coast and this tasted like that. Very well cooked and very tasty. Lots of them almost like lightly battered popcorn shrimp. 

I like sampling things, so I went with the mixed grill. Had a little bit of everything. The asparagus was spot on. I'm not a tomato fan, but they were ok. The mashed potatoes were wonderful. Not mashed enough to be smooth, so it had a great texture and taste. It came with three of the most AWESOME grilled shrimp that I hoped I would come back some day just for the shrimp. It also came with a  fabulous piece of salmon. That too would have made a great meal. Finally a piece very superb swordfish. I started going into mental overload thinking which I would have as a dedicated meal if I ever came back. Too many awesome choices!

excerpts: The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Joanne Y.
salmon.review:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi.
I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well.
I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder.
The salmon was the best item I had here.
It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering.
The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked.
The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.
salmon.author: Ash S.
salmon.review:
Fog Fish Harbor House has a spectacular view of the water and is located in the heart of touristy fisherman's wharf. It is located on the second floor if you are searching for it.

I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi. I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well. I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder. The salmon was the best item I had here. It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering. The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked. The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.

excerpts: I had was fried calamari, clam chowder (awarded best in SF) and a salmon sandwich.
All three dishes had different and unique flavors and recommended that you should try when you are in town.
salmon.author: Jasson C.
salmon.review: Views were great and atmosphere was amazing for a Saturday lunch. Food was reasonable priced for the location and the service was quick and responsive. The food my wife and I had was fried calamari, clam chowder (awarded best in SF) and a salmon sandwich. All three dishes had different and unique flavors and recommended that you should try when you are in town.

excerpts: Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!
The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.
salmon.author: Racheal D.
salmon.review:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!

excerpts: My combo came with salmon, tuna and shrimp.
The salmon was very moist, the tuna was done right and the shrimp was on a skewer well done as well.
The sole was a tad bland but was well made, just needed better seasoning or sauce.
salmon.author: Ed D.
salmon.review: This place was super busy on a Saturday night.  We put our name in the wait list of 4 people and they were able to seat us within 30 mins.  It wasn't a bad wait as they had a nice seating area with a fireplace so the wait time went by fast.  The dining area is very spacious and we didn't feel scrunched.  The view was good overlooking the pier.  Our server Jessica came to greet us right away and got us our ordered drinks promptly.  We ordered the combo fish fry, the chicken sandwich, the grill seafood combo, and fresh sole.  I tasted all of the dishes and all of them were good.  My combo came with salmon, tuna and shrimp.  The salmon was very moist, the tuna was done right and the shrimp was on a skewer well done as well.  The sole was a tad bland but was well made, just needed better seasoning or sauce.  I loved the calamari from the fried combo.  They served the dishes very fast and the waitress was attentive throughout.  I'm a fish with my water and Jessica was constantly refilling my glass even though you can tell she was busy with all her tables.  Finally we ordered dessert and the Apple walnut crisp with vanilla ice cream was awesome!  You gotta try it!  The prices weren't bad and the dishes were worth the money. Definitely will return when I'm back in the San Francisco area

excerpts: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone?
Crab Sandwich
that's shredded crab,
how 'bout that?).
Their chowder bowls are incredible.
World class wine and beer selection to pair up with
, I dunno, anything.
The waiting area is nice.
The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous.
The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day.
Sophisticated eating at Pier 39?
"Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered.
#classiceats
salmon.author: Sean C.
salmon.review: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone? Crab Sandwich that's shredded crab, how 'bout that?). Their chowder bowls are incredible. World class wine and beer selection to pair up with, I dunno, anything. The waiting area is nice. The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous. The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day. Sophisticated eating at Pier 39? "Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered. #classiceats

excerpts: The salmon, swordfish AND the shrimp was dry.
She was not enjoying her meal and that's frustrating because I am trying to make sure she has a fantastic meal!
She gets embarrassed when I complain so I held off this evening.
But I am kicking myself that I didn't say anything.
She ended up putting half of her swordfish and salmon on my plate for me to eat, I couldn't even do it.
salmon.author: Alyssa M.
salmon.review:
Great for views but not a place I'd visit twice. The better half and I visited SF for our anniversary. I wanted to take us out to a nice dinner and I chose Fog Harbor Fish House. 

It was very easy to make a reservation. Visit their website, pick your party size and an available time. Easy and done. I called after doing that to nicely request a great table because of the special occasion. Parking is at the Pier 39 garage. Take your ticket with you to get validated (1st hour is free). Cross the street and go upstairs. Upon arriving, our reservation was ready to go. The table was at a window and that was great. I did see some others I would have rather had but oh well.

I ordered the Lobster Tail and the better half ordered the Mixed Grill. When I got my plate it was barely warm but luckily the food wasn't cold. It looked amazing and the lobster tail was huge. I enjoyed my plate, it came with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. 

The better half though, hers wasn't as appetizing. The salmon, swordfish AND the shrimp was dry. She was not enjoying her meal and that's frustrating because I am trying to make sure she has a fantastic meal! She gets embarrassed when I complain so I held off this evening. But I am kicking myself that I didn't say anything. She ended up putting half of her swordfish and salmon on my plate for me to eat, I couldn't even do it. It was very disappointing. 

The service was not great, I'm not saying he was horrible but it felt rushed. He got our drinks, he took our food order, he delivered our food and he brought our check. I realize it's a busy restaurant but we are spending some money here, I don't want to feel rushed out of my table. He never told us his name or made any attempt to make the experience personable. Same with the host when we checked in, no nice welcome and no smile. 

One last thing. Know I am not holding this against the restaurant. Remember I had called ahead and mentioned it was for a 5 year anniversary. Shawn who answered the phone said he would note it, I was very appreciative of that. I definitely don't expect anything from the restaurant but I was hoping for at least some recognition. An awesome 2 chair table (instead of 4 chairs), one of those corny desert dishes with a message or even a simple "Happy Anniversary". We got nothing.. I work in hospitality and have been a customer service professional for many years. I gave them an opportunity to shine and it wasn't taken.. Had they attempted to take the service up a step, I might have seen the experience differently or been able to look over the mistakes. I'm writing this as a mere suggestion to management, if you get the opportunity to make a personable experience for a guest, you won't regret it for going above and beyond. You just might make someone's day.

excerpts: Our mains were scallops, a ravioli special and the salmon.
We were enjoying them, but noticed that our server was nowhere to be found.
salmon.author: Jisoo K.
salmon.review:
We were having a great time until a sudden turn of events happened in the middle of service. 

We were greeted by a friendly server who offered a couple suggestions on the menu. We then ordered a couple glasses of wine and a calamari to start. Wine was great and the calamari was fresh. 

Our mains were scallops, a ravioli special and the salmon. We were enjoying them, but noticed that our server was nowhere to be found. We thought he was just busy, but when he came midway during our eating we were shocked. 

He reeked of cigarette smoke and the smell overpowered the taste of our food. Even as he left the smell lingered. We completely lost our appetite. When he came back to suggest a dessert menu, we had to decline as the smell came back again with him.

We were disappointed to end in a sour note. Management could really do some work in the server's personal breaks.

excerpts: I also got the salmon
and I feel like salmon
is a hit or miss but this was really tender and easy to break apart ( like how salmon should be ) highly recommend !
salmon.author: Altinay A.
salmon.review: Came here for my birthday and everything was amazing. Got the huge plate of seafood and it literally was the most fresh seafood I have ever tried. Sooooooo good. I also got the salmon and I feel like salmon is a hit or miss but this was really tender and easy to break apart ( like how salmon should be ) highly recommend !

excerpts: I got the salmon which was awesomeee.
salmon.author: Uyen N.
salmon.review: I think what caught my eye about this place was the huge windows that gave you a view of the water. It was gorgeous. Our server was nothing short of amazing. He went through the menu w us and suggested a few dishes. I got the salmon which was awesomeee. And I also got the half dozen oysters. A little pricey. $18. I don't think the oyster were worth it. My boyfriend got the steamers. I loveddd those. The sauce they were cooked in was delicious.

excerpts: My Salmon "Club
" Salad was very good.
The portion of salmon was prepared just right.
It was moist and flaky.
The lemon vinaigrette mixed in the salad was nice and tart and the lemon ranch dressing on top of the salmon enhanced the already freshness of the fish.
I enjoyed the onions, cherry tomatoes and bacon bits throughout the dish.
salmon.author: Diana S.
salmon.review:
Our group got here on a busy Monday evening without a reservation and waited for 15-minutes and that wasn't so bad.  

We ordered our meals and waited extremely long for our orders to come, maybe about a half an hour.  But, I was satisfied when my award winning clam chowder was served.  It was piping hot and the clams tasted so fresh and the chowder was rich, creamy, and very flavorful.  I had it with the sour dough bread that was given at our table.  What helped with the long wait was watching the beautiful sunset turning from orange to pink and the sun finally setting.  My group of 5 all stood up to get some pictures.  

We eventually all got our entrees another half an hour later.  My Salmon "Club" Salad was very good.  The portion of salmon was prepared just right.  It was moist and flaky.  The lemon vinaigrette mixed in the salad was nice and tart and the lemon ranch dressing on top of the salmon enhanced the already freshness of the fish.  I enjoyed the onions, cherry tomatoes and bacon bits throughout the dish.  This dish was pricey for a salad, $20, but well worth it.

Next we were waiting for our check to come.  It was a long wait.  Our waitress apologized for our wait and her Manager decided to give us complimentary desserts for our time.  He also came to apologize for our wait.  We all ordered blondies to go.  I actually wanted to get the creme brûlé but that wouldn't be practical to take out.  

So, I gave our experience a 4 since we had great service recovery, and the meal and scenic view was fine.  If you don't mind waiting, this place is very good.

excerpts: It comes with sword fish, salmon and shrimp.
The salmon is also extraordinarily tender, with a light crunch to the exterior.
Also a light buttery taste, and more pronounced fish flavor.
salmon.author: Brock E.
salmon.review:
So while in San Francisco I thought I would walk the Fishermans Wharf and check out the scene. After walking around for a while I was getting hungry. With so many choices I became flooded with indecision. But upon perusing the local listings this place caught my eye.

I opted for a bar seat and was not disappointed. The bartender on duty was very polite and helpful. As I have never really been a seafood restaurant before. I was steered towards the combos to get a variety of seafood to try, and decided on getting a clam chowder cup, with a strawberry lemonade. And for my main course I got the fresh grilled combo. It comes with sword fish, salmon and shrimp.

Upon receiving the strawberry lemonade, it was lightly sweet with a hint of sourness. A little watery, but ok. But the chowder was a real treat. It comes paired with a loaf of sourdough bread. The bread has got a nice soft, fluffy interior with a crunchy bite. By itself it is flavorful, and aromatic; but when dipped into the chowder itself it becomes a force to be reckoned with. When matted with a plat of butter the strong flavor of the sourness is apparent and the saltiness of the butter evens it out.

The chowder is smooth and creamy. Not salty nor fishy, but got a rich milky taste to it with a strong flavor of clams. Overall it is worth the money, it would be nice to see a lobster bisque offered at a place of this caliber.

Now on to the main entree, the sword fish is a nice white fish. I have never had anything other than cod and halibut before so this is new. But it is very tender and mild in flavor. A slight tuna taste to it with a buttery bite. Overall a mild fish and subdued flavor.

The salmon is also extraordinarily tender, with a light crunch to the exterior. Also a light buttery taste, and more pronounced fish flavor. Which should be expected of a pink fish.

And the shrimp is very good. Coming with a strong shrimp flavor, nice a fresh and hot. It has a light initial crunch, and a medium bite to it afterwards. There is a subtle butter, lemon taste to it, that compliments the shrimp flavor.

The sides that came with it is sauteed veggies and garlic mashed potatoes. And I opted to get some french fries instead. The garlic mashed potatoes seems to be a fresh variant as it has lumps of potato in it. And is fairly moist and creamy. Although In my opinion it is always well paired with a country gravy to further make the texture creamy and rich. The french fries are crunchy with a fluffy interior. A little on the salty side, but again not bad.

So in this honest reviewers opinion, the soup paired with the bread is fantastic, the lemonade is ok, the main entree is also fantastic, but the sides are a bit waning compared to the rest of the meal. So between the service and the attributes listed I would give it a solid 9/10 for the price class it is in. Compared to higher end restaurants could bump it down to a 7.5/10. But for the money it is well worth the time to come here.

excerpts: We had salmon and cod, which were not to our standard.
The presentation of the food was not good, fish was not seasoned well, and vegetables appeared old looking.
salmon.author: Cookie C.
salmon.review:
Nice view...Great service. Food is average. We had salmon and cod, which were not to our standard. The presentation of the food was not good, fish was not seasoned well, and vegetables appeared old looking. Fingerlings were cold and over cooked.

We did have special restrictions, such as no dairy or sugars; which our waitress immediately addressed while taking our order. However, with eliminating items, such as butter, the fish should have been seasoned much better.

excerpts: Order tuna tartar app and salmon blt both delicious!
salmon.author: Hanne A.
salmon.review: Great atmosphere, food and service. Came for lunch and was not disappointed. Order tuna tartar app and salmon blt both delicious!

excerpts: The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters
salmon.author: Daniele T.
salmon.review: Great food, will definitely go back again. The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters

excerpts: I tried the alaskan salmon.
Very Very good fish.
Service and atmosphere was really nice.
I also tried the fish and chips.
Was really crispy but very tasty.
Recommend to come at night because the atmosphere during the day is very crowded and packed.
Sunlight was a problem during my lunch.
salmon.author: Michael C.
salmon.review: I tried the alaskan salmon. Very Very good fish. Service and atmosphere was really nice. I also tried the fish and chips. Was really crispy but very tasty. Recommend to come at night because the atmosphere during the day is very crowded and packed. Sunlight was a problem during my lunch.

excerpts: The swordfish and the salmon are my favorite things I tried.
The crab legs were kind of bland, but they were very fresh and we appreciated the opportunity for the crab to be pre-cracked.
Our server Samir was fantastic and attentive without being obtrusive.
The Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was delicious.
We finished the entire bottle.
I wish we had more time to eat here again while we are visiting San Francisco because I'd come back.
This restaurant is definitely worth a visit and in a great location!
salmon.author: Bianca G.
salmon.review: This restaurant has something on the menu for everyone. We only had to wait 15 minutes for a seat with a view on a Friday night, and it was worth it. The swordfish and the salmon are my favorite things I tried. The crab legs were kind of bland, but they were very fresh and we appreciated the opportunity for the crab to be pre-cracked. Our server Samir was fantastic and attentive without being obtrusive. The Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was delicious. We finished the entire bottle. I wish we had more time to eat here again while we are visiting San Francisco because I'd come back. This restaurant is definitely worth a visit and in a great location!

excerpts: My sister who doesn't even like sea food loves her salmon.
I had the lobster tail and my mom had the crab cake.
We left nothing behind and wanted more.
It is pricey but worth it.
I don't mind paying for something if I enjoyed it.
The location was also great with nice view of the ocean.
salmon.author: Daphnée H.
salmon.review: Were do I start. Food was delicious. My sister who doesn't even like sea food loves her salmon. I had the lobster tail and my mom had the crab cake. We left nothing behind and wanted more. It is pricey but worth it. I don't mind paying for something if I enjoyed it. The location was also great with nice view of the ocean.

excerpts: She suggested the Mix Grill with salmon, shrimp and swordfish with mash potato and broccoli.
My Friend Got the Salmon.
Its was moist and Loved it ...
I had to steal half of his salmon too...
salmon.author: Jonathan C.
salmon.review:
Ive been Traveling to the United States for Couple of years. Yelp in the philippine is not that popular. But when I came to visit my Friend in San Francisco. Told me about yelp? I tried it out for the best Seafood at Pier 39? A popular tourist destination in San Francisco. I stumbled at Fog Harbor Fish House. My Host Friend confirmed about the Sustainability of the Restaurant. Sustainability... A first to my ear Let me realized how environmental friendly this restaurant was.

Its on the second level of Pier 39. They had a Majestic View of Golden Gate. Huge Windows to enjoy the best view while you enjoy your Dinning experience.....

Our Server Shawna was sooo welcoming.. Explained what sustainable Seafood they offer.  She suggested the Mix Grill with salmon, shrimp and swordfish with mash potato and broccoli. Loved her suggestion as this trio compliment with each other....

My Friend Got the Salmon. Its was moist and Loved it ...I had to steal half of his salmon too...

Last but not the least is their Award winning Clam Chowder....True Its must try..

For a first time Yelper..Im glad my friend informed me about this application...


Thanks to Shawna and Fog Harbor for a wonderful experience..

excerpts: My husband got some seafood dish and I got ordered the Blt with Salmon.
Our food was amazing and so filling.
I couldn't finish it, I was so stuffed.
My husband got his seafood fix as well.
The view was beautiful, especially when they raised the blinds as the sun went down, they even asked everyone if they were ok with it, making sure no one was bothered by it.
Extremely polite.
I loved it, I would go again!
If I had to be picky and name something I didn't like, the tables were a little close together
so when the servers went in between they always hit my chair and you were so close to the people next to you..
but like I said that's if I'm being picky.
The pros definitely out weigh the cons
salmon.author: Meagan B.
salmon.review:
There was a wait 15 mins, not too bad .
We were sat and greeted instantly, our server was absolutely wonderful. He explained everything on the menus, wines, specials.. then gave us time to look it over. Even though it was busy he came back within a good time and took our order. My husband got some seafood dish and I got ordered the Blt with Salmon. Our food was amazing and so filling. I couldn't finish it, I was so stuffed.
My husband got his seafood fix as well. The view was beautiful, especially when they raised the blinds as the sun went down, they even asked everyone if they were ok with it, making sure no one was bothered by it. Extremely polite. I loved it, I would go again! If I had to be picky and name something I didn't like, the tables were a little close together so when the servers went in between they always hit my chair and you were so close to the people next to you.. but like I said that's if I'm being picky. The pros definitely out weigh the cons

excerpts: Clams, crab, salmon,
salmon.author: Jack R.
salmon.review:
I feel rich. Like lottery winning rich.

I won a $100 gift certificate here, and I went all out when it came to ordering food.

But don't worry, I'm not that selfish. I like to share the wealth, so I invited my friends and paid the difference.

Here's what we had and our thoughts.

Clam chowder: Great, creamy, clam-y. Everyone loved their clam chowder. The ones with the bread bowl loved the bread too.

Caesar salad: Huge portion, good dressing, not overly great, just okay.

Baked oysters: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked. Even the cheese on top was cold. But this is where the service shined. Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well. When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.

Large Shrimp Cocktail: Delicious, and lived up to it's name. They were large. So good we couldn't stop ordering and eating these. 

Crab cakes: Excellent flavor. More crab meat than breading, great texture. We ordered several of them because we liked them so much.

Chippino: Huge,and filled with things you would find under the sea. Clams, crab, salmon, I mean this thing was a cauldron of goodness.

I want to say that our waiter was exceptional and was always there to fill up water, and even bagged up fresh sourdough for one of my friends who wanted to take some bread home.

Being that this is a tourist spot, I highly recommend it for tourists who may be overwhelmed with all the choices on the Pier.

Even as a local, I can say, I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grilled which was a little of everything such as salmon, swordfish & three pieces of grilled shrimp..
it came with garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus salad!
It was yummy..
yummy
..yummy!!
My love had Lobster tail..
not one but two big tails..

it came w/steamed broccoli &
Garlic mashed potatoes also!!
I can't forget the warm sourdough bread they give you while you wait!!
It was so soft & warm that my butter melted deep inside the bread that I couldn't stop eating it!
To finish it off with a fabulous dessert of Blondie..it was brownie w/chunks of chocolate bits & walnut..which I love!
Topped with it a vanilla ice-cream & drizzled with Carmel sauce & the homemade whip cream on the side made it even more decadent!
Overall..our experience was so wonderful..
Being
it was our celebration & it was 4th of July
..it was a beautiful ending seeing the Fireworks after on Pier 39!
Thank you Fog Harbor for a great day!
To Allison W...it was such a pleasure having you make our evening special!
We shall come there again because of your Awesome..positive attitude..
your customer service was superb..A+++ that I hope your boss knows they are very lucky to have you work for them!
You deserve a fat raise girl!!
Thank you ever so much!
salmon.author: Sharon Z.
salmon.review:
This restaurant made our evening so delightful & beautiful! All a big thanks to the front hostesses who took our name!
A great and wonderful server named Allison W.!!!
As we were heading to our table..I noticed a personalized "Happy Anniversary" with two hearts scribbled on the paper tablecloth! Awhhh! Was my first reaction!
I loved it..even the spectacular view where we were seated was awesome! We had a great sight of Alcatraz & far on the other side was Golden Gate Bridge!
To make things anymore but a perfect evening was our food! We started off with
Fries & Mussles..it was pretty good! I wish there were more fries??!! Lol!!
Then our entree came..I had the Mixed Grilled which was a little of everything such as salmon, swordfish & three pieces of grilled shrimp..it came with garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus salad! It was yummy..yummy..yummy!!
My love had Lobster tail..not one but two big tails..it came w/steamed broccoli &
Garlic mashed potatoes also!!
I can't forget the warm sourdough bread they give you while you wait!! It was so soft & warm that my butter melted deep inside the bread that I couldn't stop eating it!
To finish it off with a fabulous dessert of Blondie..it was brownie w/chunks of chocolate bits & walnut..which I love!
Topped with it a vanilla ice-cream & drizzled with Carmel sauce & the homemade whip cream on the side made it even more decadent!
Overall..our experience was so wonderful..
Being it was our celebration & it was 4th of July..it was a beautiful ending seeing the Fireworks after on Pier 39!
Thank you Fog Harbor for a great day!
To Allison W...it was such a pleasure having you make our evening special! We shall come there again because of your Awesome..positive attitude..your customer service was superb..A+++ that I hope your boss knows they are very lucky to have you work for them! You deserve a fat raise girl!!
Thank you ever so much!

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed.
There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor.
Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some.
My water glass was empty more often than it was full.

I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations.
I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!
salmon.author: Mandy B.
salmon.review:
Underwhelmed. Clam chowder was tasty- but not tasty enough to warrant $7/cup price tag. No crackers even offered? The oysters were great, hard to screw those up if you have a good purveyor.  I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed. There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor. Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some. My water glass was empty more often than it was full. I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations. I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!

excerpts: Loves the Salmon Grill, my favorite so far!
Recommended to dine here when you visit Pier 39.
salmon.author: Amabel S.
salmon.review: Come around 4.45pm and wait around 10 minutes. It has a good view especially for sunset! Do not have to do reservation. Good food and good price! The calamari is so good, not to heavy. Loves the Salmon Grill, my favorite so far! Recommended to dine here when you visit Pier 39.

excerpts: Wifey enjoyed 1/2 her Salmon BLT, and so did
I. Ha!
Sister liked her Clam Chowder Bowl, and I savored the Sautéed Dover Sole.
Heaven forbid I forget our veteran server, Pedro, who cheerfully guided us thru the menu and attended us with near forgotten poise and professionalism.
We shall return!
salmon.author: John S.
salmon.review: Good food, view, and service at Fog Harbor--brought wifey and the Orlando contingent over for Lunch on Tuesday. Got there by Noon and seated at last available window table. Short stuff enjoyed her Burger and declared best ever with bacon. Wifey enjoyed 1/2 her Salmon BLT, and so did  I. Ha! Sister liked her Clam Chowder Bowl, and I savored the Sautéed Dover Sole. Heaven forbid I forget our veteran server, Pedro, who cheerfully guided us thru the menu and attended us with near forgotten poise and professionalism. We shall return!

excerpts: Great crab cakes, salmon, lobster tail and swordfish.
Had it all in one go.
Very fresh and prepared well!!
salmon.author: Matthew K.
salmon.review: Great crab cakes, salmon, lobster tail and swordfish.  Had it all in one go.  Very fresh and prepared well!!

excerpts: I had the crab and my husband had the salmon and both agree that this was one of the best tasting stuff we've ever had!
Michael was our server and he was awesome!
salmon.author: D Joseph P.
salmon.review: Wonderful! Excellent seafood in a great atmosphere. The oysters were terrific! I had the crab and my husband had the salmon and both agree that this was one of the best tasting stuff we've ever had! Michael was our server and he was awesome!

excerpts: We ordered salmon and surf & turf.
The salmon was bomb, flavour was on point!
The steak, on the other hand, was a little too hard for me.
It was hard to chew.
The lobster looked great
but it was a tad bit too salty for me.
The best part of the entire meal was the clam chowder!
It was bomb, definitely need to give it a try!
salmon.author: Sheila C.
salmon.review:
I loved the ambiance of the restaurant! Although there was a really loud group of Asians sitting right beside us, it didn't stop me from enjoying the food and the view of the bay! We ordered salmon and surf & turf. The salmon was bomb, flavour was on point! The steak, on the other hand, was a little too hard for me. It was hard to chew. The lobster looked great but it was a tad bit too salty for me. The best part of the entire meal was the clam chowder! It was bomb, definitely need to give it a try! Worth the money. 


Ps. For those who went to the aquarium first, keep your tickets! You get 15% off your bill if you dine at this restaurant!

excerpts: We dined during lunchtime and my salmon salad was delicious and the salmon was perfectly cooked.
My husband had the clam chowder in the sourdough bread and he devoured every bite.
Service was on point and very friendly.
We will definitely return when we visit San Francisco again.
salmon.author: Kimberly R.
salmon.review: We really enjoyed our experience at this restaurant during my birthday.  We were given a window seat for 2 and it was perfect with a nice view of the tourist boats outside along with a view of the marina.  There were several seals sitting on the marina which provided us with an entertaining view.   We dined during lunchtime and my salmon salad was delicious and the salmon was perfectly cooked.  My husband had the clam chowder in the sourdough bread and he devoured every bite.   Service was on point and very friendly.   We will definitely return when we visit San Francisco again.

excerpts: Dinner plate of grilled salmon, cod, shrimp complimented with mashed potatoes and fresh crisp green beans.
Everything was mouth-watering delicious I would totally eat here again.
salmon.author: Nicole L.
salmon.review: OMG phenomenal. Warm sourdough bread. Jumbo shrimp cocktail. Dinner plate of grilled salmon, cod, shrimp complimented with mashed potatoes and fresh crisp green beans. Everything was mouth-watering delicious I would totally eat here again.

excerpts: I would also recommend the salmon!
On point!
salmon.author: Jenny S.
salmon.review: We walked in as a party of 4 and was seated right away. We got an awesome view of the bay. Food was on point! We order a full order of mussels, fried calamari, ceasars salad to share & a bowl of clam chowder as appetizer. BOMB! I got the jambalaya and let me tell you... ORDER this!!! It had a bunch of chicken, pork and clams!!! The flavor was so flavorful and succulent. I would also recommend the salmon! On point!

excerpts: I had sliders, the salmon, ginger lemonade, strawberry basil drink, and the Apple crumble for dessert.
I am definitely coming back and strongly recommend this place for anyone visiting San Francisco that loves seafood!
salmon.author: H.L. S.
salmon.review: My experience at Fog Harbor was nothing short of spectacular.  My server Jane was very friendly and attentive to my needs on a consistent basis.  This place had three things I love in a dining experience: a great view of the bay and sunset, very good food and excellent service.  I had sliders, the salmon, ginger lemonade, strawberry basil drink, and the Apple crumble for dessert.  I am definitely coming back and strongly recommend this place for anyone visiting San Francisco that loves seafood!

excerpts: and normally I love salmon.
The experience was average but the strawberry lemonade was fabulous.
salmon.author: Kayley A.
salmon.review: Well the atmosphere was very pleasant ,but our waiter was very rude about a question of ratatouille. The food wasn't anything special to me and normally I love salmon. The experience was average but the strawberry lemonade was fabulous.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Liz G.
salmon.review:
All I can say is, Wow!! The food here is mind-blowing! There are many great spots for clam chowder in San Francisco, but I've never had it topped with Dungeness Crab!! What a great way to start our meal! (Check out my pic)

Also mind blowing was the seared Ahi Tuna. It's perfectly seared "rare" and topped with a delicious ginger soy glaze, accompanied perfectly with a garlic jasmine rice. My mouth could barely contain this flavor flurry.

My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes. Had I not eaten so much delicious sourdough bread prior to our food arrival, I would have eaten more of his food too! 

Did I mention there's also a beautiful view of the wharf?? It was the perfect birthday dinner! Definitely coming back next time we're in town!!

excerpts: then had the Grilled salmon for main course.

It was served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula,
red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter.
salmon.author: Afshin A.
salmon.review:
Touristy location, but awesome food!

Fog Harbor Fish House is located in one of the most touristy locations in San Francisco. In most cases that would be a warning sign, but they break the norm. The quality of the food and the service is very good, and their prices are very reasonable! Imagine that!

Although I live only a few blocks away, this was my first time eating here and I was very disappointed ....... in me for not having come here sooner! We tried the Mussel Fries and Crispy Lemon Calamari for appetizers; both done really well, especially the mussels.  then had the Grilled salmon for main course. It was served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula,
red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter. Excellent! 

The desserts looked very inviting, but it was late and we were all full, so that we left for another day!

excerpts: The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch.
It's very clear they take pride in their food.
salmon.author: Liz W.
salmon.review: Service was great. Food was fantastic. Wine selection is on point. The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch. It's very clear they take pride in their food.

excerpts: The Salmon dish lacked flavor, but the fish was cooked right.
The appetizer special, crab ceviche, lacked flavor.
salmon.author: Jessica N.
salmon.review: The bread (baked fresh every 56ish minutes) was the best thing we ate! The Blue Cheese Wedge Salad was also delicious- great flavor in the blue cheese. The Salmon dish lacked flavor, but the fish was cooked right. The appetizer special, crab ceviche, lacked flavor.

excerpts: Everything except the salmon in the seafood trio was extremely well cooked.
Unfortunately Salmon was a bit dry.
salmon.author: Sophia H.
salmon.review:
Probably the best seafood stop in the touristy pier 39 area. We had a friend visiting so we came by around 5 pm on a Sunday night. Luckily it wasn't too packed yet so we walked in pretty easily. 

We ordered the seafood mix with garlic crab, mussels, and shrimp, the seafood trio, and scallops. We also got fried calamari for appetizer. Everything except the salmon in the seafood trio was extremely well cooked. Unfortunately Salmon was a bit dry.

Free bread was great and our waitress was very attentive. We sat at the booth on the left closest to the restaurant entrance. I hope to come back if I venture into the area again!

excerpts: I ordered a glass of Moscato which was delicious and their salmon which was truly a work of art!
Loved this place!
If not for the food, definitely check it out for a glass of wine paired with breathtaking views!
salmon.author: Iulia G.
salmon.review:
Came here on a Saturday evening after a tiring day of walking around and doing some awesome sightseeing. The wait was about 20 min which seemed like forever since I was super hungry, but let me tell you the wait was totally worth it!
Even though I was alone, they sat me at a table for four right by the window! The view was amazing. The ocean, Alcatraz and the sunset with a light breeze? Yes, please! I ordered a glass of Moscato which was delicious and their salmon which was truly a work of art!
Loved this place! If not for the food, definitely check it out for a glass of wine paired with breathtaking views!

excerpts: (I had halibut, friend had salmon)
The service was impeccable - very attentive and professional.
The food was so good!
I had one of the best dirty martinis of my life.
Can't wait to visit SF again so I can eat here!
As a side note - Pier 39 is of course very crowded - we used Lyft and it was easy as pie.
salmon.author: Lisa A.
salmon.review:
Great food with fantastic views.  2 of us were there on a Saturday evening at Prime Time, no reservation... only had to wait about 45 minutes.  We had ceviche as an appetizer and then delicious fish meals.  (I had halibut, friend had salmon)  The service was impeccable - very attentive and professional.  The food was so good!  I had one of the best dirty martinis of my life.  Can't wait to visit SF again so I can eat here!  
As a side note - Pier 39 is of course very crowded - we used Lyft and it was easy as pie.

excerpts: Salmon, swordfish, calamari, shellfish, fried fish... name it and they have it.
salmon.author: Kirstin G.
salmon.review:
When craving Seafood going to Pier 39 just makes sense. I've heard and read good things about the Fog Harbor Fish House and the oh so convenient entrance from the parking garage (located in between The Embarcadero and Powell St) made going to this restaurant so easy. There's a little pathway/bridge from the parking garage that takes you right up to the dock on which the Fog Harbor Fish House is located. No worries about the wait there might be to be seated. They created a super cosy waiting area with seats in front of a fireplace to keep you warm. 

The Fog Harbor Fish House is bigger than it appears to be from the dock. This is where you want to go with family and friends, or even a date (!) for an upper casual dinner. Upper casual because at night they create a nice ambience with the lighting, but wearing jeans and sneakers is definitely not a crime. 

Ambience: 
Great! A perfect 'I'm going out for dinner and I can dress up a little' vibe. You can be seated right next to the water which also adds something special to the overall ambience.

Food: 
Good selection of different types of dishes. Salmon, swordfish, calamari, shellfish, fried fish... name it and they have it.

Drinks: 
We all ordered cocktails but none of us really enjoyed them. The Moscow Mule was good. I'd suggest to stick wine.

The Fog Harbor Fish House is a place where you cannot go wrong. I feel anyone would enjoy to eat here while having a great night out.

excerpts: Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole.
All of it was perfect.
Salads were good, bread delish.
Can't say enough good things about it.
We will definitely be back!!
salmon.author: DARIA O.
salmon.review: We had the best dinner here! Our server Anya was awesome, the view was great, and the food was ah-mazing! Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole. All of it was perfect. Salads were good, bread delish. Can't say enough good things about it. We will definitely be back!!

excerpts:
Crab, shrimp, scallops, salmon, and garlic toast. 
He said it was great.  
We were too full for dessert! 
Service was good. 
Will definitely return!
salmon.author: Kristie L.
salmon.review:
Our food was delicious! Highly recommend this place. Best clam chowder I've ever had. My husband liked the warm sourdough bread they serve with butter. We ordered drinks and they were delicious too. He ordered the cocktail of the day and I ordered the strawberry lemonade. His complaint was that the cocktail was light on the alcohol. 
I got the filet mignon served with blue cheese crumbles, mushroom Demi glaze sauce, garlic mashed potatoes, and sautéed spinach and pearl onions. I thought there was too much garlic in the potatoes and my steak was a touch too rare, but overall delicious. 
He ordered the seafood medley which was served in a tomato broth. Crab, shrimp, scallops, salmon, and garlic toast. He said it was great.  
We were too full for dessert! 
Service was good. 
Will definitely return!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill (Salmon, Swordfish, and Shrimp), the rest of the family had pasta, salad, and a grilled cheese.
The mixed grill tasted fine, but nothing outstanding.
salmon.author: Keith D.
salmon.review:
We saw all the stars on yelp and thought this was going to be a winner all around. I won't say that the food is bad, it really wasn't bad. It was just very plain.  I had the mixed grill (Salmon, Swordfish, and Shrimp), the rest of the family had pasta, salad, and a grilled cheese.  

The pasta was good, hard to go wrong with a kids pasta.

The Caesar salad was okay, the dressing was a little runny and not flavorful. Again, not bad, just not worth $16.00 for a salad with 4 shrimp.  

The grilled cheese was served on tasty sourdough, but the sourdough killed the flavor of the cheese. And there was very little cheese. Needs more cheese to balance the flavor.

The mixed grill tasted fine, but nothing outstanding. I was expecting more flavor for $28 at lunch. 

The service was good, our server was polite and attentive.  

Overall, it was probably one of the nicer places to eat in a tourist location, but could have been better.

excerpts: I had the swordfish and my boyfriend the salmon.
DELISH!!!!!
salmon.author: Melissa H.
salmon.review: Food and service was excellent. Highly recommend.walked by a couple days and decided to give it a try. The clam chowder was so creamy and flavorful. The calamari was perfectly fried. I had the swordfish and my boyfriend the salmon. DELISH!!!!!

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables.
I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub.
My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well.
salmon.author: Crystal R.
salmon.review:
My 5 star rating really reflects the amazing dining experience and customer service I received here a few weeks ago on a Sunday night at the bar. My sister and I came in when there was a 1.5 hour wait on Sunday night and decided to opt for the bar instead. Luckily, someone left so we grabbed two seats with a view to watch the Olympics, score! We ended up staying for more than just drinks and oysters and Jason N was excellent every step of the way. I always expect some witty banter and jokes from the bartender but Jason went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience, which we did. It was more than just ensuring our drinks were full and cold, he always checked in with us and did it with a smile on his face. What really put him at 5 stars for me was how well he handled an issue with our meal. We brought up the issue not thinking much about it, but Jason went above our expectations, brought it up with his manager to help ensure we could really enjoy our meal and dining experience. I rarely get such wonderful service and definitely wanted to mention it because it made all the difference for us! 

As far as the food, I enjoyed the oysters very much! Really fresh and perfect start to our meal. I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables. I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub. My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well. I also tried out their two signature bourbon cocktails which were wonderful, although the old fashioned was a bit too sweet for me.

Overall, my dining experience at Fog Harbor at their bar was wonderful! I would definitely recommend others to try them out.

excerpts: Pumpkin Plum Salmon was salty and ingredient flavors were indiscernible.
salmon.author: Wai Y.
salmon.review:
Food was average,  wait time was 40 minutes,  menu offered some interesting new items but it did not pan out.... I preferred Blue Mermaid when it comes to flavor. 

Got a quick inquiry from management which is appreciated.

 So here's more details... Hostess was not friendly  or helpful. The lines of crowd coming in for dinner is understandable but her generic response of "20 more minutes" was off putting.

 Food was very salty,  blue cheese garlic bread was clumpy,  salty,  hard and soaked in oil. Pumpkin Plum Salmon was salty and ingredient flavors were indiscernible.

excerpts: My wife got pacific salmon salad.
The fish was too dry and cooked a tad too long.
However our waitress (I believe her name was Janette) was extremely nice and attentive.
She offered if my wife wanted a new salmon to be cooked and she said yes.
salmon.author: Kevin C.
salmon.review:
I came here based off the tremendous reviews on Yelp.  I have to say we were quite disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, the food is decent and all but I was expecting more from a 4 star yelp reviewed restaurant.  We got fried calamari and clam chowder to start.  The calamari were flavorful and lightly battered.  When our appety are better than our main entrees, oh boy we are in a world of hurt.

I got the seafood penne pasta...nothing to boast about.  My son got the fish and chips.  Fish were too fried.
My wife got pacific salmon salad.  The fish was too dry and cooked a tad too long.  However our waitress (I believe her name was Janette) was extremely nice and attentive.  She offered if my wife wanted a new salmon to be cooked and she said yes.  The second piece was much better.

Would we come back next time we visit SF, I doubt it.  The views are spectacular though.

excerpts: the plate with salmon, swordfish and shrimp was huge and delicious as well.
We enjoyed it.
salmon.author: Apryl E.
salmon.review: The view can't be beat!  The food was delicious and they bring you a lot of it!  We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and loved it!  The fish and chips was enough for 2 people easily and the plate with salmon, swordfish and shrimp was huge and delicious as well.  We enjoyed it.

excerpts: Everything from the sourdough bread to the caesar salad, tuna app and of course, my salmon entree was high quality, well cooked and really tasty.
The service too, was phenomenal.
Our server was really friendly and particularly quick on refills.
salmon.author: Grace M.
salmon.review:
Yep, thank you again,Yelp-!

I found this gem in the heart of the most touristy spot in SF (Pier 39) with the trusty help of Yelp. My partner and I were SO damn hungry we were eyeing the IHOP we passed on our walk to Pier 39, for goodness sake...

Anyway, I actually used the monacle feature and Fog Harbor Fish House hit the spot as a nice generic seafood option that would be fitting of our Pier 39 afternoon. As soon as I started going through the reviews and saw all the amazing photos, I was really excited to give it a try!

Everything from the sourdough bread to the caesar salad, tuna app and of course, my salmon entree was high quality, well cooked and really tasty. The service too, was phenomenal. Our server was really friendly and particularly quick on refills. The food came out reasonably paced.

I couldn't help but notice all food at the other tables also looked really good. If I lived in San Francisco, despite it being in the heart of Pier 39, I'd actually come here regularly! Honestly, I wouldn't mind returning if I'm ever there again myself. :)

I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House!

excerpts: The salmon was tender also but had a crisp on the outside, which is how I like my salmon.
salmon.author: Eduardo M.
salmon.review:
First night in downtown San Francisco! I arrived with a date about an hour and half before closing. I had no reservation, but that wasn't a problem, we were seated immediately. While being seated I felt very underdressed. I had jeans and a hoody. You have to sit by the windows. The view was amazing! We saw a tiny tug boat!

I ordered the mixed grill. The swordfish was very tender and smooth. The salmon was tender also but had a crisp on the outside, which is how I like my salmon. The shrimp was alright and the mashed was a little cold but smooth.

Overall a great experience.

excerpts: Now for my main entree I had the king salmon special.
What can I say?
Pine nuts, avocado, orzo, locally caught king salmon, fennel, and a nice salad...
Talk about explosion of flavor.
Besides the salad/orzo combination being amazing by itself, the king salmon was cooked to perfection...
With a delicate texture, nice seasoned crust and that bright red color...
salmon.author: Eric P.
salmon.review:
Went here for lunch after reading some of the reviews for this place. It was only moderately busy around noon on a Monday, so I got immediately seated next to a window with a view of the water. 

The server was attentive and suggested I try one of the specials that just started this week... More on that later. 

I had the clam chowder with sourdough on the side to start. I've had a lot of clam chowders in my day, and this by far is one of the best if not best I've ever had. Not too dairy creamy... Tons of clam meat... Not overloaded with potatoes and seasoned just right. The hot sourdough bread was also very tasty... Served piping hot and fresh. 

Now for my main entree I had the king salmon special. What can I say? Pine nuts, avocado, orzo, locally caught king salmon, fennel, and a nice salad... Talk about explosion of flavor. Besides the salad/orzo combination being amazing by itself, the king salmon was cooked to perfection... With a delicate texture, nice seasoned crust and that bright red color... All in all a very good piece of fish. 

The only downside to this place is the cost, but you get what you pay for. I'd highly recommend those of you in the area visiting to give this place a try. I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate.
Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it.
salmon.author: Ranjan P.
salmon.review: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.

excerpts: Love the green tea and the crab stuffed salmon so much!!!
salmon.author: Jane L.
salmon.review:
Very delicious though costs a bit high.
Love the green tea and the crab stuffed salmon so much!!!

excerpts: The scallops, the mussels and the salmon were cooked however there weren't any flavors to it from the curry/sauce.
salmon.author: Sebin K.
salmon.review:
We hit the Fog Harbor Fish house on Pier 39,Fishermans wharf for lunch. All the tables to the far end of the restaurant were full but we were lucky enough to get a table right beside the windows overlooking the sea.They definitely offer the best views of the Golden Gate bridge(as long as the skies are clear with no fog), the alcatraz island and the blue ocean.

Impeccable service, the server helped us decide between items on the menu for starters as well as the main course. For example, my friends and I didn't want the crab with the bones so they got us the Cioppino with just the crab meat.

Starters: 
Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Tangy, sweet and sour, really loved it.
Crab Cake: The meat was perfectly cooked and it was upto the reviews you'd already see on Yelp.

Main Course:
Swordfish: Impressed!
Cioppino: We ordered the usual Cioppino but when the check arrived, it said the 'Lazy Cioppino'. I wasnt so impressed because all i could taste was tomato sauce. The scallops, the mussels and the salmon were cooked however there weren't any flavors to it from the curry/sauce.

excerpts: The salmon I ordered was flaky and cooked evenly pink and tender throughout.
salmon.author: Mary S.
salmon.review:
Lunch for a table of 6.

This restaurant is more of a fine-dining spot on the very casual and family-fun Warf area. It's located up the stairs right as you get to the entrance of Pier 39. 

The entrance was beautiful with an outdoor seating area with a lovely fireplace. They greeted us right away and seated us next to a window. We had a great view of the tour boats and even saw Alcatraz off in the distance. 

Our server was very patient with us. She kept our cups refilled and answered all our questions professionally and with a smile. The dining area was much larger than expected as it wrapped around the kitchen and bar area. 

The food was delicious. The calimari was probably one of the best I've had - it was tender and perfectly seasoned. Some at our table couldn't even tell it was calimari because it was so tender. My dad, usually very picky, enjoyed his meal thoroughly. He ordered the new york strip and mash. Everyone finished their meals and we took nothing home. The salmon I ordered was flaky and cooked evenly pink and tender throughout. 

Although the prices were a little higher than what I would have liked to pay, for the experience and the care they put into plating and cooking, I would eat here once in a while.

excerpts: I had obligatory clam chowder, muscles with fries (delicious) and salmon.
