My co workers sitting across from me had a plate of whole crab in butter sauce.
It looked amazing and perfect!
I highly recommend coming here.
The views I heard are great.
Unfortunately I came on a rainy night but cheers to good service
cause they had umbrellas we can borrow to get to our taxi.
salmon.author: Stephanie J.
salmon.review: Came here a few months back for a company dinner. They take big group reservations (ours was for 10). It's very San Francisco tourist when you think about the location at pier 39 BUT the food here was so delicious. I had obligatory clam chowder, muscles with fries (delicious) and salmon. My co workers sitting across from me had a plate of whole crab in butter sauce. It looked amazing and perfect! I highly recommend coming here. The views I heard are great. Unfortunately I came on a rainy night but cheers to good service cause they had umbrellas we can borrow to get to our taxi.

excerpts: My two girls had salmon and I had the seafood penne.
OMG, SO AMAZING!
Calamari appetizer is a must.
My 4 yo had the kids fish and chips
and we took one bite
and that was it.
Dry and bland
so don't bother with wasting $ on kids meal.
The bread..
oh the bread... dreaming about it still.
salmon.author: Babs L.
salmon.review: Amazing place! My two girls had salmon and I had the seafood penne.  OMG, SO AMAZING! Calamari appetizer is a must. My 4 yo had the kids fish and chips and we took one bite and that was it.  Dry and bland so don't bother with wasting $ on kids meal. The bread.. oh the bread... dreaming about it still.

excerpts: mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner
so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic!
Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad...
It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top.
When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon.
So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab.
While it was very good, there was nothing with it.
salmon.author: Julia M.
salmon.review:
Very ambivalent about this place. First downside is that they don't take reservations so when we (locals) wanted to go here at 7 PM on a Saturday night, we knew we'd have to wait a while. It ended up taking about 45 minutes.

PROS
-Amazing views! We got seated in the area right on the water. The sun was setting right behind the GGB. It was great. 
-We couldn't decide which bottle of wine we wanted so the waiter let us all taste both! They have a pretty good wine selection.
-For apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters. Both were delicious! The baked oysters were great in an interesting way... Spinach, bacon, and cheese, yum!

CONS
-Once we decided which wine we wanted, it took the waiter a realllllly long time to actually bring out our bottle (at least 20 minutes).
-Our mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic! Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad... It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top. When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon. So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab. While it was very good, there was nothing with it. I was, at least, expecting some butter to dip my crab in.

Again, really ambivalent about this place because the food was pretty good but there were just a few blunders. It's also pretty expensive here.

excerpts:
My favorites:

- Ahi Poke
- Dungeness Crab
- New York Steak (medium rare)
- Wild Salmon
salmon.author: Owie N.
salmon.review:
I try to steer away from Pier 39 since my first initial visit back in high school. YES, it was that long ago. 

I must admit, I miss the street performers, sea lions, live music and especially waterfront dining at Fog Harbor Fish House. 

They do offer excellent seafood and shellfish. Strikingly, their steak is quite legit.

My favorites:

- Ahi Poke
- Dungeness Crab
- New York Steak (medium rare)
- Wild Salmon

Too many delicious offerings have me at an instant food coma. Oh, no worry; I always have second stomach for dessert. 

Whether you are playing touristy or not. Pier 39 is a must on your list of things to do in SF. Better yet, Fog Harbor is where you want to be be be...

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!

excerpts: I recommend the salmon!
salmon.author: Shauni H.
salmon.review: Food was ok the steak was chewy not a good quality of meat. However service was good.. I recommend the salmon!

excerpts: Ordered 4/17/2018 the $29.00 salmon, a relatively small fish piece (soaked in fried oil and slightly burned in edges) arrived with a side non eatable salad.
I told the server (on the bar) about the salad (I didn't touch it) and he didn't even suggest to replace it.
So I paid and left after 5 minutes.
salmon.author: Yaniv S.
salmon.review: Ordered 4/17/2018 the $29.00 salmon, a relatively small fish piece (soaked in fried oil and slightly burned in edges) arrived with a side non eatable salad. I told the server (on the bar) about the salad (I didn't touch it) and he didn't even suggest to replace it. So I paid and left after 5 minutes.

excerpts: My husband had the salmon which he also enjoyed though and through.
salmon.author: Melo R.
salmon.review:
I had the Crab Ravioli and all I can say is wow. My husband had the salmon which he also enjoyed though and through. We cleaned our plates with extra sour bread which was also amazing! 

The view of Alcatraz and the golden gate made the food even better

excerpts: I had the Salmon Salad and others had the fish and chips.
All the food was excellent.
I highly recommend this place to those in the area.
salmon.author: Bruce C.
salmon.review: After reading the reviews, we had lunch here and it was excellent.  Great views of the marina and it was very clean inside.  The fresh bread and butter were excellent and the service was also good.  I had the Salmon Salad and others had the fish and chips.  All the food was excellent.  I highly recommend this place to those in the area.

excerpts: I have salmon
and it was very good.
The grill was dish was also very good
and Tim is still in the tank.
Scallops and crab risotto was to die for as was the  linguine and clams.
Best restaurants Fisherman's Wharf area
salmon.author: H H.
salmon.review: I was here with 5 people from different parts of the country for a conference. We all had something different and everyone really enjoyed their meal. Surprisingly, the crab was very good even though it took a really long time for Tim to eat.  I have salmon and it was very good. The grill was dish was also very good and Tim is still in the tank. Scallops and crab risotto was to die for as was the  linguine and clams. Best restaurants Fisherman's Wharf area

excerpts: my salmon salad at all.
The salmon was not cooked well, it was always raw.
Salad had wayyyyy too much sauce!
Drenched in sauce.
My husband had the seafood platter and his fish was delicious.
salmon.author: Samantha M.
salmon.review:
Nice view but I didn't like my salmon salad at all. The salmon was not cooked well, it was always raw. Salad had wayyyyy too much sauce! Drenched in sauce. My husband had the seafood platter and his fish was delicious. I'm not impressed overall. 

Bread was very good.

excerpts: Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino.
I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal!
salmon.author: Jodi H.
salmon.review:
Came here for the 2015 SF Restaurant Week with my family on a Sunday night for dinner ($40 dinner menu per person) and EVERYTHING was fabulous and delicious.

I highly recommend coming here. As a born-and-raised NorCal kiddo and lover of all things seafood (shoutout to pescatarians), I gotta hand it to the crew at Fog Harbor. Y'all were ON YOUR GAME that night! I'll be recommending this place to anyone looking for the quintessential San Francisco meal with a romantic, classy, and worthwhile dining experience. 

The service from start to finish was undeniably amazing. We reserved for an early dinner around 4PM, but couldn't make it (coming from South Bay) until 7:30PM for many reasons. But even though we were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes, before we knew it we were seated after only 3 minutes! We were seated at a booth on the lower level a distance from the panoramic windows, but we loved having the grand space for our dining experience. Our server was very understanding, cracked a few jokes here and there, and was just the right amount of "leave us alone/serve us." I gotta give props to the manager of the night who personally went around to all of the tables to offer an amuse-bouche...we thought it was because of SFRW, but he literally went around to all of the tables! 

The food!! MAN!! That deserves its own rating. The four of us ordered all of the starters, entrees, and desserts (since there were only 3 selections, we double'd on the chocolate cake...best decision ever). FOODGASMS to the max, y'all. Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino. I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal! By the time desserts rolled around we were all delightfully satisfied, but loosened our belts for the BEST melt-in-your-mouth-chocolate cake and surprisingly yummy bread pudding! 

Fog Harbor is not a joke. Nor is it a tourist trap. It's got dedicated management, a classy service team, and an unbeatable view at Pier 39. Maybe I'm still reeling from my SFRW high, but it's worth a visit...trust me!

excerpts: Mixed Grill again Swordfish & Salmon Fish
So Tender & Fresh Amazing
Tasting Food.
Best Best Place
To Eat on The Wharf Pier 39.
You'll Always Have Great Service Great Location & Great Reasonable Prices
Thank You Pierre for The Best Service Ever & Had A Great Birthday Dinner
salmon.author: Barbara L.
salmon.review:
Went to The Fog Harbor Fish House for my Birthday I was greeted with smiles all 4 Hostess up Front outstanding was seated right away with the greatest server ever Pierre so Friendly so Kind & A Great Attitude from the start till finish Absolutely Amazing Gentleman so I had 2 Too Shelf Margaritas Strong & Delicious & had the appetizer Calamari very Good & Fresh & Dinner was Mixed Grill again Swordfish & Salmon Fish So Tender & Fresh Amazing Tasting Food. Best Best Place To Eat on The Wharf Pier 39.
You'll Always Have Great Service Great Location & Great Reasonable Prices Thank You Pierre for The Best Service Ever & Had A Great Birthday Dinner

excerpts: As my entree I got the salmon which was cooked perfectly and delicious.
The veggie mix was perfect too.
salmon.author: Carlos P.
salmon.review:
Wow! That's literally the only word I can use to describe my experience here. I'm in San Francisco for a few days with the family and since we are staying in Fishermans Wharf area we decided we wanted some seafood for dinner. Found this restaurant on here and it looked promising.

All of our food was amazing. Even the bread! Actually the bread was one of the highlights. Our appetizer was the garlic shrimp which was delicious and fresh. As my entree I got the salmon which was cooked perfectly and delicious. The veggie mix was perfect too. I seriously loved all the food here.

Service was okay, but the food and the views you get while you're sitting down made up for that. I will absolutely m comeback next I'm in town.

excerpts: Since we were doing only sea food we took the mixed platter - the salmon was amazing and so were the grilled shrimp.
Overall had a wonderful time with the sun being a little beneficent on us and granting us the spectacular views of the bay as well.
salmon.author: Nasir M.
salmon.review:
A straight four for the location and the food. We went there for our anniversary lunch and were promptly seated after a short wait.  The view of the Pier and the Golden Gate was just amazing. We started with the Sour dough bread and oysters. But the star of the show were the red pepper shrimp and the crab in garlic butter. Since we were doing only sea food we took the mixed platter - the salmon was amazing and so were the grilled shrimp. 
Overall had a wonderful time with the sun being a little beneficent on us and granting us the spectacular views of the bay as well.

excerpts: To sum it up, it was overpriced and the salmon was over cooked and dry.
The chowder was excellent and the sour dough bread was excellent as well.
salmon.author: Brayden S.
salmon.review: To sum it up, it was overpriced and the salmon was over cooked and dry. The chowder was excellent and the sour dough bread was excellent as well.

excerpts:
it was so delightful and completed our meal--salmon, sword fish and scrimp combo.
The bay view from our table was so  so nice..
we could see sailboats cruising by.
All in all a super place.
Ty,
Wilma and fred
Walnut creek

salmon.review:
From the entrance...to the table, to eating exp.
Everything was handled very beautifully.
Our waiter edgar from peru and our other waiter Nev ...were great servers...always checking to see if we were happy diners.
We shared a dish and the food was very tasty and well prepared.
One thing i really enjoyed was the fresh hot sourdough bread that was given, along with butter..it was so delightful and completed our meal--salmon, sword fish and scrimp combo.
The bay view from our table was so  so nice..we could see sailboats cruising by.
All in all a super place.
Ty,

Walnut creek

excerpts: Along with the clam chowder (and free bread) I ordered the Mixed Grill Plate - Grilled salmon, swordfish & shrimp covered in a (buttery) citrus buerre blanc served with sides of sauteed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
The mixed grill plate was phenomenal.
I'm a fan of blackened fish, the taste of the grill and proper seasoning.. and everything on the plate was that exactly.
Moist yet partially charred
swordfish & succulent salmon had my taste buds tingling and the healthy sized shrimp smothered in butter turned my face into a pure gold.
Garlic potatoes were creamy and on poooint.
I was shining vividly, and it was obvious to everyone in our presence that I was thoroughly enjoying this section of my meal.
(My grunts, smiles, giggles, muffled speech, or
salmon.author: Ryan B.
salmon.review:
Chilling winds mixed with brisk temps had us searching for warmth, shelter and clam chowder.. I mean, we're in San Francisco, am I right?!

We ended up at Pier 39 / Fisherman's Wharf not long after our gruelingly mediocre Bartlett Hall experience. We didn't have much in our stomachs by high noon, which meant the immediate need to fill them with grub hit us in full force. 

Fog Harbor Fish House appeared to be THE SPOT.. mainly because we were right below it.. and our desperate attempts to eat were dwindling down to a either: wait patiently for a hearty meal or begrudgingly snack on munchies along the bay. We laughed at the snack idea and proceeded to head upstairs towards Fog Harbor. The hostess upfront / outside took our names, then informed us it'd be around a 25 minute wait. Within seconds after our groups arrival, the line became that of a Black Friday sale at Best Buy. We were lucky enough to snag a spot in the little patio section by the front bar, fireplace by our sides, and amusingly watched fellow tourists shiver in those chilly northern California temperatures. 

Aside from the crowd outside, the folks inside seemed mild mannered and less talkative than I'd imagine a spot like Fog Harbor would be. We were sat at nice corner table with easily one of the best views in the house that was accompanied by a pleasant server. And though I couldn't verify this, because our spot was visually stunning.. it seemed most seats within the restaurant gave a decent glimpse of the surrounding Bay and Pier 39. The decor itself was almost on the classy-scale but in far too touristy of a spot to be labeled this. 

It looked like every single table had at least ONE bowl of clam chowder sitting atop them, and because it was on our minds prior to our arrival, it was a dish we'd all be ordering without even looking at the menu. Strategy in mind, we ordered regular bowls of Clam Chowder WITHOUT bread as the bowl.. because, you know, most restaurants provide COMPLIMENTARY BREAD.. so all that excess yeast is simply unnecessary, folks. Unless.. bread is yo' thing. Then do whatcha wanna do, baby. 

Along with the clam chowder (and free bread) I ordered the Mixed Grill Plate - Grilled salmon, swordfish & shrimp covered in a (buttery) citrus buerre blanc served with sides of sauteed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.

The mixed grill plate was phenomenal. I'm a fan of blackened fish, the taste of the grill and proper seasoning.. and everything on the plate was that exactly. Moist yet partially charred swordfish & succulent salmon had my taste buds tingling and the healthy sized shrimp smothered in butter turned my face into a pure gold. Garlic potatoes were creamy and on poooint. I was shining vividly, and it was obvious to everyone in our presence that I was thoroughly enjoying this section of my meal. (My grunts, smiles, giggles, muffled speech, or if I look drunk without drinking, etc.)

The clam chowder was, for lack of better terms, doo-doo. Just about every bite had sand in it. Strange.. it appeared there wasn't much clam in my bowl.. which made the sand ordeal a somewhat mind-boggling. Because of this, I didn't enjoy nor finish their 'Award Winning' Clam Chowder. I would've dipped my head into the Pacific if I wanted to taste as much sand as that.

A thin line between a 3 and a 4, Fog Harbor Fish House (through my eyes) may not have the best clam chowder as claimed.. but was boosted in a positive direction due to solid / attentive service, views truly pleasing to the eyes and all of our food (aside from chowder) was tasty and fulfilling for our once empty stomachs.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good.
However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house.
salmon.author: Whitney C.
salmon.review:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.

excerpts: The salmon with the Mixed Grill was the least enjoyable.
Didn't have much flavor compared to the other items and was somewhat blah.
Otherwise, a very nice dinner.
salmon.author: Ed M.
salmon.review: Clam Chowder was delicious! We ordered the special, Risotto with Grilled Scallops and the Mixed Grill for or entrees. Took a bit for the main courses to come out, but both were very good. The salmon with the Mixed Grill was the least enjoyable. Didn't have much flavor compared to the other items and was somewhat blah. Otherwise, a very nice dinner.

excerpts: We got a bunch if dishes that included fried calamari (very crunch and tasty), the cioppino (flavorful broth with fresh seafood), lobster tail plate (cooked to perfection!), baked salmon, and fish & chips.
Every dish we ordered everyone seemed to enjoy.
Our waiter was great, always had a smile on his face and was very patient with our requests.
Our family liked it so much that they actually went back the next day for dinner again.
Highly recommended even when it's a bit pricey but the view is definitely worth a million bucks!
salmon.author: Erna M.
salmon.review: Brought family here visiting from Hawaii for dinner on a weekday.  Parked at the Pier 39 garage as you'll be able to get it validated by the restaurant which accounts for an hour of free parking.  It was a weekday so waiting for a table didn't take long at all (maybe 15 mins without reservations) but we did notice that it got busy when we got seated.  The host was kind enough to sit us at the window that overlooks the Bay Bridge and the bay... beautiful view on a clear evening.  We got a bunch if dishes that included fried calamari (very crunch and tasty), the cioppino (flavorful broth with fresh seafood), lobster tail plate (cooked to perfection!), baked salmon, and fish & chips.  Every dish we ordered everyone seemed to enjoy.  Our waiter was great, always had a smile on his face and was very patient with our requests.  Our family liked it so much that they actually went back the next day for dinner again. Highly recommended even when it's a bit pricey but the view is definitely worth a million bucks!

excerpts: Tried my friends salmon and clam chowder.
Clam chowder tastes creamy, despite a heavy flavor of corn starch but i somehow enjoy the corn starch taste, remind me of childhood.
Sourdough is cool as well!
Try the bread before meal, if you like it, then clam chowder in a bread bowl is a safe choice,
if you think it's too sour, then you might need to consider not having the soup in a bread bowl, because it is the same type of bread.
Also tried the salmon, salmon is a little bit too salty for me, but still taste fresh and tender.
Definitely worth going when you are at pier 39.
Love the garlic shrimp as the starter!
Portions are great and would love to have dessert but have no room for it.
salmon.author: Chris W.
salmon.review: Great food reasonable price! Seafood penne is the way to go! Tomato cream sauce is wonderful! I usually won't eat cream sauce, but this one is great, not to creamy but flavorful enough to make the seafood great! Love the fish inside. Clams are so fresh in the seafood penne as well. Penne are well cooked, not too soft or hard. Tried my friends salmon and clam chowder. Clam chowder tastes creamy, despite a heavy flavor of corn starch but i somehow enjoy the corn starch taste, remind me of childhood. Sourdough is cool as well! Try the bread before meal, if you like it, then clam chowder in a bread bowl is a safe choice, if you think it's too sour, then you might need to consider not having the soup in a bread bowl, because it is the same type of bread. Also tried the salmon, salmon is a little bit too salty for me, but still taste fresh and tender. Definitely worth going when you are at pier 39. Love the garlic shrimp as the starter! Portions are great and would love to have dessert but have no room for it.

excerpts: The waiter helped me choose the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp.
It was really well done with some great flavor.
The garlic mashed potatoes were yum!
My husband had the fish and chips, which he enjoyed.
We would absolutely recommend Fog Harbor!
salmon.author: Ruth B.
salmon.review: We were seated promptly. The service was great. The view is awesome. We started with a delicious Caesar salad which was plenty for 2 to share. The waiter helped me choose the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp. It was really well done with some great flavor. The garlic mashed potatoes were yum! My husband had the fish and chips, which he enjoyed. We would absolutely recommend Fog Harbor!

excerpts: We had the clams, ahi tuna, shrimp, salmon and swordfish.
All of which I've had far better tasting versions even in joints like red lobster.
Given the quality of taste, I'm not quite sure it was worth the money we spent.
salmon.author: Aidan H.
salmon.review:
After spending a day in San Francisco, I was really excited to eat some good seafood. My wife and I are both foodies particularly with great seafood. I've had some really good fish in my day, but the day I ate here was not a good day. I was extremely disappointed in the food. It was good quality fish - given the fact that the restaurant is right on the pier. The biggest problem was how it tasted. It was extremely under seasoned. We had the clams, ahi tuna, shrimp, salmon and swordfish. All of which I've had far better tasting versions even in joints like red lobster. Given the quality of taste, I'm not quite sure it was worth the money we spent. I was simply disappointed and left wanting

To the inexperienced, this seafood may be a good intro to seafood as most of the other places you will try will be much better. 


I'm not quite sure what it is with coastal restaurants . The worst lobster I've had was in Maine and now I think similarly of fish in California.

excerpts: I loved their Salmon.
I am from the East coast
but whenever I go to SF, I make it a point to visit this place to dine.
Also, its good to reserve the table well in advance.
Use Open table to reserve, will make your life a lot simple, since this place is mostly packed.
salmon.author: Rajesh S.
salmon.review: Definitely one of the best Seafood restaurant in the US. I loved their Salmon. I am from the East coast but whenever I go to SF, I make it a point to visit this place to dine. Also, its good to reserve the table well in advance. Use Open table to reserve, will make your life a lot simple, since this place is mostly packed.

excerpts: I had the salmon club salad.
The salmon was grilled to perfection and the ranch mustard dressing was an excellent companion.
The clam chowder is super tasty and the fish and chips is a comforting favorite.
View is beautiful and we were in and out within the hour.
Lively vibe and great atmosphere.
Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.
salmon.author: Lori F.
salmon.review: Spending time with friends and wanted to grab lunch.  This place did not disappoint.  It's a little pricey but worth it and there is a wait but once we were seated the customer service was excellent.  I had the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled to perfection and the ranch mustard dressing was an excellent companion.  The clam chowder is super tasty and the fish and chips is a comforting favorite.  View is beautiful and we were in and out within the hour.  Lively vibe and great atmosphere.  Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

excerpts: Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing.
Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty.
From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant).
salmon.author: Anastasija V.
salmon.review:
We had a really great dinner here. Food is delicious, waiters are nice, atmosphere is lovely! 

Seafood is awesome. From starters we tried Crispy Calamari and they were super tasty. Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.  

Been here on Christmas Day - that day restaurant closed an opportunity to make a table reservation.
Restaurant was busy, we waited some time for table to get free. But waiting wasn't annoying. We had an opportunity to leave the name and phone number, so took a little walk around while waiting.

But anyway, we are super satisfied.
We definitely will come again.

Came back on a Valentines Day with friends. We were all satisfied again. This time we had both foods and deserts. Seafood was great just as the first time! There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome. Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing. Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty. From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant). Delicious! 

This time we hadn't any problems with time at all - had a reservation and service was pretty fast.

excerpts: We had the the clam chowder with the add of crab, the salmon BLT which was Devine.
The chicken penne was very flavorful and delicious.
We will definitely be returning and have already told many people to go check it out
salmon.author: Mahaugoni S.
salmon.review: My service was fantastic, always kept water in my cup and was able to answer all of our questions. We had the the clam chowder with the add of crab, the salmon BLT which was Devine. The chicken penne was very flavorful and delicious. We will definitely be returning and have already told many people to go check it out

excerpts: Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.
salmon.author: Greg Y.
salmon.review:
The Fog House is a wonderful example of the amazing food available in San Fransisco.  The location on the pier is stunning and you get views from every seat in the room.  It's a shame I live in NY and won't be able to eat here until 2017 when I plan on traveling back to SF.  

Appetizers:  Calamari; New England Clam Chowder. 
   -Both amazing and the NE clam chowder is a must order if you are a fan.  The best one I've ever had and that's a East Coast man talking.


Dinners:  Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.

  Lobster Tail with Garlic mashed potatoes - My fiancé loves lobster, she said it was perfectly cooked and was delectable as well.

  Ahi Tuna dinner with wild rice - My fiancé's cousin ate the entire dish and was another very satisfied customer.

Restaurant atmosphere was fantastic and our waiter was extremely attentive, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly.

excerpts: There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs.
salmon.author: Ameenah M.
salmon.review:
First time, I really wanted to try this place because it has  4 stars of 1000 reviews. Plus the other place I wanted to try was packed. I mean it is a Saturday and today is the giants vs. LA dodgers game.

This place is upscale, fine dining type of place. I like that they offer places like these in an attraction base environment. Cause sometimes you want to enjoy a nice dinner with a fantastic view. Like this place I'm at right now. 

Our server is nice, but when we asked for water she said it's coming, and made it seem like someone else was bringing it but she brought it to us instead. Sometimes she'd walk by just to walk by and see that my water is almost empty and doesn't fill it up, you're just walking back and forth, what are you doing? 

Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.

What it tasted like: everything looked amazing. The clam chowder was the best thing we ordered, it was hot and very good. The seafood ciopponi was ok, there was some type of flavor I probably won't remember. The noodles were hard. The seafood in the ciopponi were good, I like the variety. There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs. The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth. This chorizo with tomatoes, I didn't really care for.

Would I come back? Maybe I'll try somewhere else first before I give this one another shot.

excerpts: I ordered their Wild King Salmon: grilled on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter.
So fresh and delicious!
salmon.author: Kim K.
salmon.review:
Free views ya'll! If they offer you a window seat: take it; the view of the ocean is stunning. Sunsets are beautiful here! 
The food was wonderful, and I am a sucker for good bread. As you wait for your meal to come out, they provide you with Boudin sourdough bread and butter- talk about melt in your mouth and making you weak in the knees. I can't get enough of it!

I ordered their Wild King Salmon: grilled on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter. So fresh and delicious! Several entrees prices change daily to the market price for the day.

If you are into beer and want to try a local brew, I suggest trying Anchor Steam. They also have a pretty extensive wine and cocktail menu, too!

Great experience - it is a bit pricey, but worth it!

excerpts: I had the specialty salmon with a gorgeous pumpkin curry and wanted to lick the plate clean.
Hubby had the rockfish - broiled/pan-fried to perfection with amazing side dishes.
We loved this place.
It sits right on Pier 39 and you'd think it would be kitschy....
but it's NOT.
Enjoy.
salmon.author: Deb S.
salmon.review: Yum diddly yum yum yum. Such a lovely welcome on a rainy evening. The warm fireplace and friendly hostesses were so hospitable. The menu here is gorgeous - we could not make a decision to save our lives. Drinks were incredibly tasty, good beer, and a nice wine selection too. The bread was damn good. I had the specialty salmon with a gorgeous pumpkin curry and wanted to lick the plate clean. Hubby had the rockfish - broiled/pan-fried to perfection with amazing side dishes. We loved this place. It sits right on Pier 39 and you'd think it would be kitschy.... but it's NOT. Enjoy.

excerpts: The salmon stuffed crab off the seasonal menu melted in mouth fully flavored and ZERO FISHINESS.
The mashed potatoes still had chunks of potatoes that gave it great texture, and slightly flavored with garlic and shallots.
I was worries it wiuld be touristy, but even if it was it still good the brocolli was even nicely seasoned to compliment the salmon.
salmon.author: faisal e.
salmon.review:
Very impressive food. The fish and chips was really good. No fishy taste and perfectly breaded. The salmon stuffed crab off the seasonal menu melted in mouth fully flavored and ZERO FISHINESS. The mashed potatoes still had chunks of potatoes that gave it great texture, and slightly flavored with garlic and shallots. I was worries it wiuld be touristy, but even if it was it still good the brocolli was even nicely seasoned to compliment the salmon. 

Food came out hot and ready to be enjoyed. 

Only downside, and it could be cause we were tired and our 13 month old was ready to go was the service. For me its about getting water filled and that didnt happen as regularly as i would like. Overall, loved it.

excerpts: My husband ordered the salmon, which was a special that night, and he couldn't save it like he claimed.
For dessert we went with creme brulee which for us was a delight in itself.
salmon.author: Amy F.
salmon.review:
When we stopped here we definitely felt under dressed; we had jeans, t shirt, and tennis shoes. The atmosphere felt more business casual. The hostess was friendly and we waited outside to semi people watch, not a lot of people at 7pm. 

We were seated 10 minutes later even without reaervations. And we had a good view of the upper boardwalk near a window. We started with the spicy shrimp which had a good amount of kick. I did try the clam chowder, which I needed to try at least a bowl coming from Pier 39. Very very good. Small enough to still enjoy when the food came. I had the seared ahi tuna on rice, and let me tell you, I could have only eaten that the entire trip and not be sick of it. The ahi was perfect and the rice wasn't soggy. My husband ordered the salmon, which was a special that night, and he couldn't save it like he claimed. For dessert we went with creme brulee which for us was a delight in itself. Perfectly coated on top.

One big con is the dress code that I wish we would have considered going. I definitely felt out of place.

Recommended? Absolutely no doubt. Enjoy the food and the not seemingly crowded restaurant.

excerpts: I had the mixed grilled, (sword fish, salmon, and shrimp) with the asparagus and potatoes.
I also tried the garlic blue cheese bread and calamari.
Delicious!
It was quite busy, but it was all the weekend and during peak tourism season.
Will definitely be visiting again when I am back in SF!
salmon.author: Kristin M.
salmon.review: One of the best seafood restaurants in San Francisco! The seafood is 100% sustainable and it is GOOD. I had the mixed grilled, (sword fish, salmon, and shrimp) with the asparagus and potatoes. I also tried the garlic blue cheese bread and calamari. Delicious! It was quite busy, but it was all the weekend and during peak tourism season. Will definitely be visiting again when I am back in SF!

excerpts: Wee had salmon and some shrimps and of course we tried the famous clam chowder in sour dough bowl.
It was really good.
The restaurant and restrooms were clean.
Awesome view from the restaurant.
Nice staff.
The prices were a little high but wasn't too bad.
I would recommend this place to anyone in the San Francisco city looking for some good seafood.
salmon.author: Sharon J.
salmon.review: This is probably one of the best sit down seafood restaurants on pier 39. I found this place on yelp. Read the reviews so wanted to check it out for ourself. Everything I read about the restaurant is true. It's a really great restaurant with an amazing view of the golden gate bridge and Alcatraz island. We had the best seating as well. We forgot to make a reservation for lunch so we went to the restaurant to check if the wait was too long. To my surprise the wait was only 30 minutes and we didn't even wait for 20 minutes before we were seated. So I loved that. Food was really yummy. They fish tastes so fresh. Wee had salmon and some shrimps and of course we tried the famous clam chowder in sour dough bowl. It was really good. The restaurant and restrooms were clean. Awesome view from the restaurant. Nice staff. The prices were a little high but wasn't too bad. I would recommend this place to anyone in the San Francisco city looking for some good seafood.

excerpts: I also end up getting the king salmon which is always extremely fresh and cooked to perfection.
It comes with fingerling potatoes, crispy onion strings, and sautéed spinach.
It is great and is my go-to every single time.
They also have pretty good dessert here as well.
salmon.author: Becky W.
salmon.review:
This is by far one of my favorite places to go to eat when I'm near Pier 39. They are known for their views but honestly you only get the view if you are sitting at one of the 5 tables near the window. Other than that you are just getting great food and awesome service. 

I always get the crab cakes which are very delicious and fresh. I also end up getting the king salmon which is always extremely fresh and cooked to perfection. It comes with fingerling potatoes, crispy onion strings, and sautéed spinach. It is great and is my go-to every single time. They also have pretty good dessert here as well. It never seems to fail me!

As for the service, it is above average. The waiters here are on top of it andddddd... Wait for it... They provide wireless phone chargers that can be at the table with you. So when you have had a long day walking around and your phone is about to die, they have your back.

excerpts: The shrimp and salmon on my plate were ok... but the swordfish was amazing!
I wish I had ordered the swordfish on
it's own.
My husbands crab cakes were pretty tasty but not the best we've had.
You know what the best thing about dinner was?
The view... we were there when the sun was setting and it was just awesome.
Maybe even a bit romantic?
salmon.author: Sarath P.
salmon.review: I don't know what we were expecting from a restaurant around the touristy area but we really wanted seafood and this was close. I do have to say -- man, their clam chowder is GOOOOOOOOOOOD. You know a clam chowder is good when it's more clam than chowder. And it was big meaty pieces of clams too. I ordered the mixed grill and my husband ordered the crab cakes for our entrees. The shrimp and salmon on my plate were ok... but the swordfish was amazing! I wish I had ordered the swordfish on it's own. My husbands crab cakes were pretty tasty but not the best we've had. You know what the best thing about dinner was? The view... we were there when the sun was setting and it was just awesome. Maybe even a bit romantic?

excerpts: For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon.
We all enjoyed our food!
We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive.
My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh!
Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!
salmon.author: Mathew N.
salmon.review: Had a great dinner here tonight with the family. Started with a few appetizers to get a feel for the place. The oysters and calamari were excellent. For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon. We all enjoyed our food! We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive. My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh! Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!

excerpts: I got the salmon plate which was delicious .
It came with greens and small potatoes.
salmon.author: Michelle V.
salmon.review: The bf brought me here for a birthday lunch we got an appetizer, the calamari which came it a dip it had lots of flavor. the sour dough bread they bring was also fresh and warm,with a little bit of butter spread it was great. I got the salmon plate which was delicious . It came with greens and small potatoes.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli.
The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling.
The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service
and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem!
It was delicious and left me incapable of moving.
They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!
salmon.author: Yeraldine S.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House- you were great. I wanted to celebrate my actual birthday dinner by the water to get a nice view of the sunset but unfortunately mother nature wasn't on board with my plans. Either way the hostess was friendly and sat us by a window. The restaurant does cater to the tourist who are wandering around Pier 39. It has a romantic-feel to it--too bad I was with my best friend! 

Our  waiter was super friendly and attentive throughout the entire night. We checked in and got free garlic bread to start off with. We ordered our glasses of wine and I already knew what i wanted since I Yelped their menu. I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli. The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling. The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem! It was delicious and left me incapable of moving. They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!

excerpts: Our son had a house salad and grilled salmon.
I had the NY steak and a glass of the house pinot noir.
My wife had a bowl of clam chowder and fish and chips.
The food was served in a reasonable amount of time, given how busy it was.
It was warm, presented well and the portions were just the right size, in our opinion.
Overall, we were very pleased with the food and our experience.
Being locals, we hardly ever come to Pier 39 to eat
but we just felt like playing tourists in our town that night.
It made for a wonderful pre-Father's Day celebration!
Would highly recommend this place to our friends and family, both local and from out of town.
salmon.author: Alex A.
salmon.review: My wife and son had dinner here on the eve of Father's Day, after taking in a night tour of Alcatraz. Walking distance (9 mins) from Pier 33. Had no reservations and it was busy that night so we waited about 30 mins by the patio fireplace. Got seated at a great table, which was in a corner overlooking the water. Was very happy with our server, Justin H., who promptly took our order and was attentive to the fact that our son and I are gluten-free and our son is also dairy-free. Our son had a house salad and grilled salmon. I had the NY steak and a glass of the house pinot noir.  My wife had a bowl of clam chowder and fish and chips. The food was served in a reasonable amount of time, given how busy it was. It was warm, presented well and the portions were just the right size, in our opinion. Overall, we were very pleased with the food and our experience. Being locals, we hardly ever come to Pier 39 to eat but we just felt like playing tourists in our town that night. It made for a wonderful pre-Father's Day celebration! Would highly recommend this place to our friends and family, both local and from out of town.

excerpts: I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A).
Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it.
I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes.
But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right.
All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert.
Don't forget the 15% coupon!
salmon.author: Adele F.
salmon.review:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

excerpts: The Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread were way too good and my salmon was so crispy and juicy.
The Poke was great, just enough spice to it!
I definitely recommend this place!
This would be 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time.
Otherwise, this place is great!
salmon.author: Alex M.
salmon.review: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed eating here! We were visiting from SoCal and wanted somewhere we could sit and have some great fish and beers but not too expensive. It was pretty crowded when we first got there and luckily found a spot to eat at the bar. The bartenders were very friendly and made us feel welcome and didn't rush us to eat and leave. I ordered the mixed grill and we also shared the Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread and my girlfriend got the Poke for herself. Thy were all awesome!!! The Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread were way too good and my salmon was so crispy and juicy. The Poke was great, just enough spice to it! I definitely recommend this place! This would be 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Otherwise, this place is great!

excerpts: I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good.
I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare.
salmon.author: Amanda K.
salmon.review:
Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills. 

We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.

Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.

My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent. However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw. 

Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.

excerpts: Their salmon was wonderful and my husband loved his fish & chips!
Great wine too!!
Our waitress was wonderful!
We just wish we could have gone back again.
salmon.author: Tracey S.
salmon.review: Stopped here on our first night in San Francisco on a recommendation from our hotel.  We were seated by the large windows and loved our view.  I love it when I can get a great gluten free meal and not feel sick!  Their salmon was wonderful and my husband loved his fish & chips!  Great wine too!!  Our waitress was wonderful!  We just wish we could have gone back again.

excerpts: I ordered the "fall special" of Pumpkin Curry Salmon, face-palm #2.
My partner requested the "Jumbo" Scallops for his entree.
My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.
Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.
My partner's meal?
Delicious.
BUT!
and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".
They were quite small, although tasty.
The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.
My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.
Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.
My partner's meal?
Delicious.
BUT!
and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".
They were quite small, although tasty.
The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.
salmon.author: Taylor G.
salmon.review:
I really, really wanted to love this place, for a few reasons, but mostly because I'm visiting San Francisco and had a focus on cuisine while visiting.  I wish I could be more polite, but the truth is that I am disappointed that I wasted an evening here.  Across the dock from Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., we instantly noticed the mistake we had made by coming to this tourist trap area.  Face-palm #1.  

Our server was not unfriendly at all, but I felt rushed from the moment we were seated.  We made a semi-late reservation for a Monday night (Halloween!) and we had hoped that would give us a bit more leisurely pace for our meal.  I like those European style meals that take a couple hours, a few drinks, and heavy sighs of satisfaction at the end.  What we received was more like a calculated and rushed meal you'd expect at a mid-grade chain restaurant.  

We started with oysters and never received any utensils to dress them with, so we poured the condiments on with reluctance.  Next came salads, which didn't dazzle us, but neither were they intolerable.  I ordered the "fall special" of Pumpkin Curry Salmon, face-palm #2. My partner requested the "Jumbo" Scallops for his entree. My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.  Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.  My partner's meal?  Delicious.  BUT!  and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".  They were quite small, although tasty.  The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.  I would probably have a different attitude if the scallops were touted as sustainable and local instead of being labeled jumbo.  

I might have a more sunny outlook on this spot if I could have seen the view it's known for, but we had already lost the sunlight for the day and could only see the nighttime lights.  I wish I had tried the chowder they're known for, and maybe I would have been more impressed.

excerpts: The salmon was fresh and nice although there were a few too many onions on top.
It's nice that it was served with arugula and vegetables.
salmon.author: Jenny L.
salmon.review: It's rare for a restaurant with nice views to still have good and reasonably priced food.  I enjoyed the perfect hibiscus margarita (where perfect is part of the name) with a nice mix of bitter and sweet, topped with froth.  The salmon was fresh and nice although there were a few too many onions on top.  It's nice that it was served with arugula and vegetables.

excerpts: I had the roasted Dungeness crab, hubby had oysters and chowder, kids had grilled salmon and a burger.
Also they did nice job of accommodating the child with food allergies.
salmon.author: Kirsten V.
salmon.review: Lovely seafood place in a super touristy area. Loved the view of the sea lion and bay from our table. Food was excellent and well prepared. I had the roasted Dungeness crab, hubby had oysters and chowder, kids had grilled salmon and a burger. Also they did nice job of accommodating the child with food allergies.

excerpts: We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special).
Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic.
Would recommend others for this place.
salmon.author: Chanyamat W.
salmon.review: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.

excerpts: The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh.
The rice was however flavorless.
salmon.author: China D.
salmon.review:
Decided to grab seafood today and ended up here. The service was pretty good. Only thing was she did take long and forgot about out extra lemon, but hey it happens. 

The food was good. It was kind of pricey but as is seafood and it was good. Nothing to write home to mom about, but maybe cus I'm more of a Cajun creole girl.


 The halibut was fresh and yummy and the shrimp where cooked well. The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh. The rice was however flavorless. Wish they had a happy hour ;(    

Loved my margarita !! 

We ordered 
Moscow mule $12.50
Hibiscus margarita $12.50
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
Mixed grill $26

Total 

$115 with some extra state tax added on on top of the original tax. 


Will we go back ? Maybe not, unless for the view. there are far too many seafood spots to try to us to want to come back. Nothing extra special here. The view was however the best part. Overlooking the water and sunset. 

We got a window seat the a reservation had cancelled so it was a nice romantic dinner.

excerpts: Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes.
salmon.author: Esther K.
salmon.review:
$16 mango crab/lobster? (don't remember if it was crab or lobster) ceviche with chips appetizer 

$10 Clam chowder in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl 

$26 Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes. 

$19 Crab Roll- Crab, celery, shallot aioli, substituted with French roll 

Free sourdough bread with butter

Long wait (~1 hour.  ~40 minutes outside to be seated, ~20 minutes to be served) was well worth the food.  

Waitress was nice to let me substitute my foods and also giving options.  First time having swordfish.  It was an interesting taste and texture. It tasted like some kind of cheese but my significant other said it tasted like chicken.   

We got free sweet potato fries because the Crab Roll came with regular fries instead of sweet potato.  So we got a plate of our fries and we got to keep the sweet potato fries for free!

excerpts: The Salmon was a bit dry but salmon is salmon.
The Grilled Shrimp kabob was a bit tough - may be a little over cooked).
My fiance had the Ahi-Tuna.
The Tuna was huge and seared perfectly.
The sauce was your typical mayo Japanese sauce drizzled over it.
It was served on top of rice and veggies.
The rice was perfect.
Dessert: We had the trio dessert - Creme Brulle, Whip, and warm brownie cake.
salmon.author: Mindy T.
salmon.review:
The food here was excellent. The ambiance was perfect. Our waiter Samir checked on us several times. The pace of the food was perfect. We were able to enjoy the Seafood Tower, our Main entre and even dessert. I made reservation for a window view and it was worth it. 

The seafood tower: Crab was sweet and fresh, Lobster was juicy, Oysters was delicious.
Main Dish: I had the mix grill: Swordfish was my fav. It was buttery and sweet. The Salmon was a bit dry but salmon is salmon. The Grilled Shrimp kabob was a bit tough - may be a little over cooked). 
My fiance had the Ahi-Tuna. The Tuna was huge and seared perfectly. The sauce was your typical mayo Japanese sauce drizzled over it. It was served on top of rice and veggies. The rice was perfect.
Dessert: We had the trio dessert - Creme Brulle, Whip, and warm brownie cake. (Grade A). 

Overall the price was right.

excerpts: I'd never eaten delicious broccoli before... and grilled salmon and the other kinds of  fish was amazing...
salmon.author: Stacy C.
salmon.review:
My friend and I traveled San Francisco last winter.
We didn't  know anything about  pier39, so we chose restaurant randomly. 

Waiter was kind and he explained what is good to eat this season. We ordered mixed grill, shrimp dish, garlic crab.

It was amazing test. My dish ( mixed grill) it was fabulous.. I really don't like broccoli, but the broccoli was amazing. I'd never eaten delicious broccoli before... and grilled salmon and the other kinds of  fish was amazing... 

At that time, it was crab season, so we ordered crab.
It taste naturally sweet and the garlic sauce was amazing, not too greasy, crab meat is soooo soft..

Table was clean and modern. Service also amazing~

I will come again this summer vacation

excerpts: The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino.
salmon.author: Kay D.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor starts with freshly baked sourdough bread. I ate with family so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder. For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo. Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked. The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino. 

The restaurant has great atmosphere and great service! We enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely come back.

excerpts: We settled on the Cioppino and Salmon for entrees and made it a fat night by adding the Calamari & a cup of Clam Chowder for appetizers.
Typically fired calamari is almost always the same, but the addition of friend jalapeños & onions and homemade dipping sauce made all the difference!
I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area!
salmon.author: Kathy G.
salmon.review: Super fresh food, awesome staff! My husband and I were looking for seafood near our hotel at the Warf and were a bit worried that the Warf restaurants would be a bit too touristy. Although the area was filled with tourist (him and I being 2 of them) there was some great people watching and excellent food at Fog Harbor to be had! We settled on the Cioppino and Salmon for entrees and made it a fat night by adding the Calamari & a cup of Clam Chowder for appetizers. Typically fired calamari is almost always the same, but the addition of friend jalapeños & onions and homemade dipping sauce made all the difference! I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area!

excerpts: Sword fish, salmon and tuna amazing.
Prices were very reasonable and no matter where you sit in this place
it seems like you'll have an amazing view overlooking the bay since its on the second floor.
Thanks Fog Harbor for an amazing experience.
salmon.author: Rob S.
salmon.review: I live close by but usually avoid the pier and restaurants because they usually aren't great food and over priced. I gave this place a shot because it was recommended and glad he did. Everything from just walking up and asking for a table to cashing out was great. First off if you do have to wait they have a great covered outdoor area with a fireplace and seating that's comfortable. Place was busy which I expected since it's at Pier 39. But it's a big place. I waited at the bar with some drinks. Serve staff was very knowledgeable about whiskey which was what I was looking for. Great drinks, great service there. Thank you. We get seated and our server was Lydia. Wonderful Italian woman that helped us choose what she thought we would like based on what we told her our tastes were. Everything from apps to our dinners were amazing. Didn't get to try dessert because the portions were pretty big and I just wouldn't have enjoyed it as much. I will definitely go back. The Manhattans are solid. Mussels spot on. Sword fish, salmon and tuna amazing. Prices were very reasonable and no matter where you sit in this place it seems like you'll have an amazing view overlooking the bay since its on the second floor. Thanks Fog Harbor for an amazing experience.

excerpts: My family and I enjoyed the crab cocktail, salmon and halibut.
They were worth every penny.
salmon.author: Liz C.
salmon.review: I wish I had remembered to take a picture of the view from our table, the food I had and the great server that took care of us. The restaurant is a class act. If you're ever on Pier 39, than be sure to enjoy the food. My family and I enjoyed the crab cocktail, salmon and halibut. They were worth every penny.

excerpts: I also had the mixed grill which was delicious, salmon, shrimps and swordfish.
I tasted many salmons before in my life and this one was really fresh.
Cooked to perfection.
Vegetables on the side were okay.
My gf had the Penne pasta and it was delicious, not a lot of cheese which was perfect.
Our server was very friendly and very helpful.
The place was crowded but we managed to get a great sitting in a corner overviewing alcatraz and the rest of fishermans wharf.
Eating here has been a great experience to anyone who wants to try seafood and something original from San Francisco.
Prices were okay, not cheap
but if you like eating quality food then price are a bargain for what you get.
salmon.author: Daniel C.
salmon.review: I looked for a great place all over pier 39. I stumbled over this restaurant. I must say that the food here is extremely tasty and good. The clam chowder was on point and it was very filling. I also had the mixed grill which was delicious, salmon, shrimps and swordfish. I tasted many salmons before in my life and this one was really fresh. Cooked to perfection. Vegetables on the side were okay. My gf had the Penne pasta and it was delicious, not a lot of cheese which was perfect. Our server was very friendly and very helpful. The place was crowded but we managed to get a great sitting in a corner overviewing alcatraz and the rest of fishermans wharf. Eating here has been a great experience to anyone who wants to try seafood and something original from San Francisco. Prices were okay, not cheap but if you like eating quality food then price are a bargain for what you get.

excerpts: My wife had the salmon which she said it was fresh too.
I had the chicken penne, which was ok, nothing special
BUT overall, the service, atmosphere and especially the view was really nice.
salmon.author: Alex Y.
salmon.review: What a great place to have lunch and watch the view of the Bay. This location is in Fisherman's Wharf. We were told it would be a 30 min wait but we really waited for 15 min. We had a nice booth overlooking the bay and the boat. For appetizers we had the calamari, it tasted so fresh. My wife had the salmon which she said it was fresh too. I had the chicken penne, which was ok, nothing special BUT overall, the service, atmosphere and especially the view was really nice.

excerpts: she had the Salmon
and I had the baked oyster rockefeller...
we LOVED both dishes...and she had the Hibiscus Margarita and LOVED that as well...this is now one of our favorites...
we will be back
salmon.author: Jason M.
salmon.review: Me and my wife went in for lunch after many times wanting to go but ended up going elsewhere...she had the Salmon and I had the baked oyster rockefeller...we LOVED both dishes...and she had the Hibiscus Margarita and LOVED that as well...this is now one of our favorites...we will be back

excerpts: I honestly loved their salmon entree it was superb and the fish was cooked perfectly!!!
My fiancé got the lobster roll!!!
It was amazing!
Had a ton of lobster meat in a nice huge buttery Texas toast bread!
You had plenty of food and they even add fries on the side of the sandwich!
I honestly love this place and would go back.
After lunch we enjoyed strolling wound the pier watching locals perform and sight seeing!!!
I recommend this to bring tourists or just yourself to enjoy.
The prices aren't bad for what you would usually pay at the pier and the view is superb!
salmon.author: Gloria M.
salmon.review:
We parked at the garage on pier 39. The restaurant validates your parking so it's free for one hour!!! That's a plus! The restaurant has an amazing view of Alcatraz and the pier!!! The restaurant is clean and gorgeous! 
As we walked in for lunch, there was a wait.... The staff is really helpful and kind. We waited for  about 15 minutes and got seated right next to the window so that we could enjoy the view!! I think the restaurant is priced reasonably for the prices around the pier. We paid 10 bucks for calamari appetizers which were really good and tasty! We got free sourdough bread also as we waited! My group and I shared their world famous clam chowder for 8 bucks!! I loved the clam chowder..... 

The waitress was very nice and attentive. She even took pictures of us while she helped serve our food! As our orders came out! I honestly loved their salmon entree it was superb and the fish was cooked perfectly!!! My fiancé got the lobster roll!!! It was amazing! Had a ton of lobster meat in a nice huge buttery Texas toast bread! You had plenty of food and they even add fries on the side of the sandwich! I honestly love this place and would go back. After lunch we enjoyed strolling wound the pier watching locals perform and sight seeing!!! I recommend this to bring tourists or just yourself to enjoy. The prices aren't bad for what you would usually pay at the pier and the view is superb!

excerpts: We got the Bleu Cheese Bread appetizer, and I had the Salmon BLT which was good
but I wish it was more seasoned and that there was more pesto aioli on the sandwich.
Amazing wheat draft beer.
salmon.author: Tiffani B.
salmon.review: Not bad! A little pricey but it's about what you'd expect for a touristy spot. The waitress was really nice. We got the Bleu Cheese Bread appetizer, and I had the Salmon BLT which was good but I wish it was more seasoned and that there was more pesto aioli on the sandwich. Amazing wheat draft beer.

excerpts: and I ordered the grilled salmon
and it the food was hot, flavorful and fresh!
We ordered the creme brûlée for dessert
and it was soooo good!
Thank you for an amazing dinner !!!!
salmon.author: Ammara I.
salmon.review: Took my husband here for his bday dinner and OMG the food was so on point! He ordered the red chili shrimp linguini and I ordered the grilled salmon and it the food was hot, flavorful and fresh! We ordered the creme brûlée for dessert and it was soooo good! Thank you for an amazing dinner !!!!

excerpts: Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.
This was just an okay dish.
I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.
The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal!
salmon.author: Diana T.
salmon.review:
I LOVE seafood!!!  Came here with no reservations around 1:00pm and waited just about 10 mins.  Not bad since the place was really crowded!  Got seated and our waiter brought out some fresh sourdough bread with butter! YUM!  Let's cut to the chase.  They are famous for their clam chowder and that was a must have!  We ordered:

Soup and Salad Combo (($14.00) Caesar salad with chicken & clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had!  There were lots of clams in it and the soup was not watered down.  I love eating soup that you can actually chew!  Very creamy, buttery, and full of goodness!

Fish & Chips ($16.00)- Hand dipped in "Anchor Steam" beer batter with cole slaw.  The best fish and chips I've had as well! Super crunchy and full of flavors!  Definitely fills you up!  If you get this, maybe order another dish so you won't get sick of it!  Sharing is caring ;)


Mixed Grill ($23.00): Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.  This was just an okay dish.  I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.  The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal! Buttery!

This is a very busy restaurant so make sure that when you get your bill, check it!  Our waiter actually gave us the wrong bill so good thing I checked it!  After the bill comes out, you get some kind of gingerbread cookie!  Very delish!

Overall, this place was good!  Great view as well!

NOTE:
-Make reservations
-Free Cookies after your meal
-Complimentary bread and butter

excerpts: Well seasoned and perfectly cooked salmon, swordfish, and shrimp from the mixed grill entree.
Splitting the dish with the addition of a cup of the clam chowder made for a very satisfying dinner.
The view of the sunset over the pier with Golden Gate to the left and Alcatraz on the right was the cherry on top.
Thank you also to our waitress Melissa N. for the tips on what wineries to tour in Napa Valley :)
salmon.author: Jena J.
salmon.review: Well seasoned and perfectly cooked salmon, swordfish, and shrimp from the mixed grill entree. Splitting the dish with the addition of a cup of the clam chowder made for a very satisfying dinner. The view of the sunset over the pier with Golden Gate to the left and Alcatraz on the right was the cherry on top. Thank you also to our waitress Melissa N. for the tips on what wineries to tour in Napa Valley :)

excerpts: I was impressed with the local options (Half Moon Bay salmon!)
and the Alcatraz view.
salmon.author: Maria N.
salmon.review:
I really liked the look and feel of this restaurant: light, airy, and very SF. Granted, it's probably full of tourists as a rule given its location, it does not take away from the service and the food. 
Impressive drink options, fun bartender, attentive wait staff. I was impressed with the local options (Half Moon Bay salmon!) and the Alcatraz view.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes.
Everything was grilled perfectly.
salmon.author: Blue A.
salmon.review:
Sure, it's in a touristy part of town, but do I live in SF? Nope...so that would make me a tourist! No?

So we went over for dinner, after a long day of training. The view is really nice, and I recommend a table by the window so you can see the bay, and in some parts even Alcatraz (maybe not romantic, but still a cool sight). 

We started off sharing a couple of appetizers: Shrimp cocktail and crab cakes.
Both were good!

Entree I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was grilled perfectly. My favorite was the swordfish but the other two (and that mash!) were great too.

For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding. Big enough that three of us shared and it was just the right way to end the meal.

Customer service was great. Our waiter accidentally switched up the wine orders and gave them to the wrong people. He felt so embarrassed he apologized the rest of the night. It really was no biggie, but he wanted to make sure he made it right.

excerpts: The salmon and swordfish were very moist.
Will definitely be coming back here very soon.
salmon.author: Kevin P.
salmon.review: This place is a nice spot to take your gf for a nice dinner with a great view by the bay. The ambiance is very classy yet casual. My gf and I were very surprised as to how cheerful the hosts to our server Shawn was. They were very helpful and gave some great recommendations. The drinks and food was outstanding. I loved their bleu cheese garlic bread and their mixed seafood plate. The salmon and swordfish were very moist. Will definitely be coming back here very soon.

excerpts: I do wish the salmon was slightly more cooked and the swordfish lacked a bit of seasoning.
salmon.author: Jessy H.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is like putting San Francisco in a plate. It was my boyfriend's first time in the city and I decided to take him here based on the whole experience.
