We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate. Food was good- I do wish the salmon was slightly more cooked and the swordfish lacked a bit of seasoning. 

It was crazy packed and we had to sit very close to other customers at the bar. Bartenders were totally awesome and attentive. 

When it came time for dessert, they bring an entire tray of their selection that is like candy to the sweet lover.

excerpts: , it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF
salmon.author: Daniel S.
salmon.review: Very high quality seafood place in Pier 39, it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF

excerpts: I ordered the salmon entree.
The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere.
Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens.
It was too much going on.
salmon.author: Fiona T.
salmon.review:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it. 

I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot

excerpts: And the salmon "club" salad was big enough for an entree and extremely tasty.
The side of warm sourdough bread was wonderful, and we finished the meal with quality cappuccinos.
Service at the reception and table was polite and prompt.
The ambience was very nice with the exception of overly loud jazz music pumped over the speakers.
We would give this restaurant a 5-star rating if the music had been toned down to background level.
We shall return!
salmon.author: Michael B.
salmon.review:
We had lunch at a wonderful window table that we had reserved. Views over the harbor and bay were terrific on a sunny day! The food was top notch as noted by so many other reviews. The cup of clam chowder for an appetizer was rich and creamy and full of clam meat. The Alaskan halibut was a fresh filet grilled and served on a bed of quinoa, toasted
pine nuts, arugula, dried cranberries, cilantro and basil, topped with tomato relish, a citrus beurre blanc and crispy leeks. Very delicious! And the salmon "club" salad was big enough for an entree and extremely tasty. The side of warm sourdough bread was wonderful, and we finished the meal with quality cappuccinos. Service at the reception and table was polite and prompt. The ambience was very nice with the exception of overly loud jazz music pumped over the speakers. We would give this restaurant a 5-star rating if the music had been toned down to background level. We shall return!

excerpts: Our group had a salmon dish, a sea scallop and risotto plate and ceviche.
Not a single regret.
salmon.author: Gary W.
salmon.review: Excellent food. Our group had a salmon dish, a sea scallop and risotto plate and ceviche. Not a single regret.

excerpts: For an entree i had a plate with shrimp brochette, salmon and another kind of fish, all grilled.
I remember the salmon mostly.
It was flaky and very well seasoned.
For desert we had tbe chocolate bread pudding.
I am not a fan of bread pudding but this was VERY good!
I believe this place is known for fresh made sourdough bread.
SOOOO FRESH!
beautiful crunchy outside, warm soft, fluffy on the inside!
The location is great and we had the perfect view of the bay water, alcatraz and the seals.
I would recommend if you're in the area... but may try another place before returning here.
There are tons of choices on the wharf.
salmon.author: Ruby C.
salmon.review: Nice place. Elegant but not stuffy. My husband and i had the oysters and the "world famous" clam chowder for starters. The clam chowder was very enjoyable. My husband said the oysters had a nice color to them and tasted fresh.  For an entree i had a plate with shrimp brochette, salmon and another kind of fish, all grilled. I remember the salmon mostly.  It was flaky and very well seasoned. For desert we had tbe chocolate bread pudding. I am not a fan of bread pudding but this was VERY good! I believe this place is known for fresh made sourdough bread. SOOOO FRESH! beautiful crunchy outside, warm soft, fluffy on the inside! The location is great and we had the perfect view of the bay water, alcatraz and the seals. I would recommend if you're in the area... but may try another place before returning here. There are tons of choices on the wharf.

excerpts: Everything was cooked to perfection, salmon was to die for, we cleaned the whole plate.
Even non-alcoholic drink (think I got blueberry drink) was so good.
Service was awesome.
We did have to wait about 20mins to be seated but it was well worth it.
salmon.author: Kripa H.
salmon.review: My boyfriend and I had the best lunch of our CA trip here. Everything was cooked to perfection, salmon was to die for, we cleaned the whole plate. Even non-alcoholic drink (think I got blueberry drink) was so good. Service was awesome. We did have to wait about 20mins to be seated but it was well worth it.

excerpts: They had a kids salmon on the menus, which is really nice, because it allowed my son to order something nice, but it did not cost $30...it was $10.
This was definitely a splurge for us, but highly satisfying.
salmon.author: Mira s.
salmon.review:
We went here because the reviews were great. 
We sat at the bar because we did not want to wait 35 minutes for a table. My kids could sit at the bar as well, which was great. I am gluten and dairy free, which means I ask a lot of questions. The guys at the bar were awesome. They answered my questions, gave recommendations, and were so gracious. I had the Cioppino. Amazing. I went with the regular, not the lazy, which means they take all the seafood apart for you. I wanted the experience. My husband had the crab sandwich. They had a kids salmon on the menus, which is really nice, because it allowed my son to order something nice, but it did not cost $30...it was $10. This was definitely a splurge for us, but highly satisfying.

excerpts: The Salmon Club Salad - this was an interesting dish and as tasty as it was it
just seemed so...
misplaced.
Smoked Salmon is just so better off served with romaine lettuce and shouldn't be served with the softer greens, but that's just a personal opinion.

I also much admit that while the clams from the clam chowder I had earlier had a perfect smokey end taste, the salmon left a taste that made me feel like it wasn't from the freshest of waters, and lastly my tomatoes were old and browsing which wasn't so great.
All in all the salad was lacking.
It was good...but lacking.
I think they should definitely try a romaine lettuce with it.
salmon.author: Veronica S.
salmon.review:
I would say the service here is above par. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. Which I was. 
The only reason my rating is so low is the food. Of course since I didn't order the entire menu I can only speak for a few things. 
The Clam Chowder - delish, honestly the only thing I had there that I can say I have zero complaints about. It was the perfect consistency, plump and meaty clams with a smokey flavor and potatoes. It was great! 

The Mini Sliders - ordered by my best friend. She asked for veeeery well done. But they came out just over medium well. Which was her only complaint. Also her fries were brought out stale as if they were sitting for a while and reheated BUT the manager who was checking on everyone fixed that in an instant and had hot fresh fries out to our table in no time. Which were delish. 

The Salmon Club Salad - this was an interesting dish and as tasty as it was it just seemed so...misplaced.  Smoked Salmon is just so better off served with romaine lettuce and shouldn't be served with the softer greens, but that's just a personal opinion. I also much admit that while the clams from the clam chowder I had earlier had a perfect smokey end taste, the salmon left a taste that made me feel like it wasn't from the freshest of waters, and lastly my tomatoes were old and browsing which wasn't so great. All in all the salad was lacking. It was good...but lacking. I think they should definitely try a romaine lettuce with it. And use fresh tomatoes. 

For dessert we had the fudge brownie a la mode with whipped cream. The brownie I guess isn't a brownie but more like batter? Because it was super soft and almost like a soft grain pudding. 

Other than that, I'd say the views are beautiful. Like breathtakingly beautiful. And the lighting of amazing as well.

excerpts: For my three courses I had their Ahi Poke, King Salmon & their Vanilla Bean Caramel Brulee with a glass of their Pinot Noir.
My friend had order their Crabs, 10 oz NY Steak, and their Warm Chocolate Cake with a glass of their Zinfindel.
Every single dish was well articulated and presented.
And the service was great, we were constantly checked on by 5 different employees to ensure our needs were well met.
It was a great atmosphere, with a great view of the ocean.
salmon.author: Karen C.
salmon.review:
Definitely worth coming to check out for San Francisco Restaurant Week. Appetizer, Entree and Dessert for $40 with three choices each to choose from.

For my three courses I had their Ahi Poke, King Salmon & their Vanilla Bean Caramel Brulee with a glass of their Pinot Noir. My friend had order their Crabs, 10 oz NY Steak, and their Warm Chocolate Cake with a glass of their Zinfindel. Every single dish was well articulated and presented. And the service was great, we were constantly checked on by 5 different employees to ensure our needs were well met. It was a great atmosphere, with a great view of the ocean.

excerpts: I had the salmon sandwich, and it was definitely more than enough food for dinner.
Prices were a bit on the steep side, but the view was pretty amazing.
Service was very good as well!
salmon.author: Tarrah T.
salmon.review: Fog Harbor was pretty good, especially being in the midst of one of the most touristy areas of San Francisco. I expected there to be a lot of low quality restaurants there, but I really enjoyed Fog Harbor. I had the salmon sandwich, and it was definitely more than enough food for dinner. Prices were a bit on the steep side, but the view was pretty amazing. Service was very good as well!

excerpts: I ate almost all of it, and I was happy to have some shrimp, salmon, and swordfish all in 1 dish.
salmon.author: Hannah W.
salmon.review: I found this place on Yelp, but I had trouble finding the actual restaurant. it's on the second floor of the pier, and I didn't find that out until walking in circles maybe 5 times. once I found it, I was warmly welcomed and seated at a comfy spot in front of the window. the views from the restaurant are very pretty. I ordered calamari. it was bomb af. they also served fresh sourdough bread. I was torn between the shrimp skewers or the mixed grill, but I went with the mixed grill for the variety. so yum wow. they added mixed veggies, so I felt better about eating all the meat and fried squid. I ate almost all of it, and I was happy to have some shrimp, salmon, and swordfish all in 1 dish. :)

excerpts: I really enjoyed the crispy lemon calamari appetizer (crispy, lightly battered, and delicious); a bowl of their clam chowder (tons of clams); and the mixed grill entree, which consisted of salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.
salmon.author: Arasto F.
salmon.review:
Fresh seafood, great service, nice decor, and gorgeous views of the Bay.

As noted in other review, the portion sizes are large -- which is rare in this area.

I really enjoyed the crispy lemon calamari appetizer (crispy, lightly battered, and delicious); a bowl of their clam chowder (tons of clams); and the mixed grill entree, which consisted of salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.  

They deserve five stars. I'll upload pics later....

excerpts: Wonderfully prepared salmon, swordfish, and shrimp in a citrus butter.
Simply prepared and served with the usual host of rice and vegetables.
salmon.author: Meredith A.
salmon.review:
Why wait ages for a table, when you can sit at the bar on a Saturday night with no wait?  Same food, and same view, although you're slightly further from the window.  Who cares!  Close enough!

Apparently this place is very touristy.  I believe you, but I also do not care, because their seafood is delicious.

Mussel fries - sounds funnier in English than in French.  And rather than come with fries alongside, these mussels have fries chucked right on top, ready for dipping in the creamy, shalloty, fennelly sauce.  And there's garlic aioli drizzled on top.  And warm baguette alongside if you need more carbs to dip.  Yaaaaas.  Delicious!  Great for sharing, and expect big fat mussels and lots o' fries.

Mixed Grill - they split this onto two plates for us, which was very nice.  Wonderfully prepared salmon, swordfish, and shrimp in a citrus butter.  Simply prepared and served with the usual host of rice and vegetables.  Absolutely fresh seafood, a little expensive for the portion size, but overall great stuff.

We were in, ate, paid, and out in fairly short time, so we could explore Pier 39 and get back to the baaaaaars, because it was Saturday night and that's what we were about.  Anyway if you don't mind being seen at a touristy spot, you will get good quality food here, great views, and a secret way to eat without a long wait first on a weekend night.  You're welcome!

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Grill which consisted of salmon, shrimp skewer and some other type of fish along with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Ibedatnica I.
salmon.review:
As a First Timer I Must say that my experience was Amazing.  The staff was friendly right on point and the food was delicious. 

Let's Start with Ambiance it was very comforting not pretentious rather relaxing and the best part was we never felt rushed. 

I ordered the Mixed Grill which consisted of salmon, shrimp skewer and some other type of fish along with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.

My husband ordered the surf and turf 
His steak was cooked exactly the way he requested. The lobster was well proportioned so no complaints from him. 

We had a few drinks from the bar which were well made and for dessert I had the Tiramisu which was out of this world. 

I highly recommend this restaurant it was worth every penny. 

Kudos to our amazing waitress didn't catch her name but she made the experience well worth it.

excerpts: Son's salmon BLT was quite good
and I had plate envy.
salmon.author: Amy A.
salmon.review: Super touristy but food not bad and view is pretty cool. My seafood trio was average and garlic mashed potatoes were bland and lumpy. Son's salmon BLT was quite good and I had plate envy. Husband's ahi tuna was not cooked well. His sides were okay. Kids enjoyed hot fudge sundae desserts. Probably decent choice if you need a meal on Pier 39 but San Fran certainly has much better options elsewhere.

excerpts: We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl.
salmon.author: Jeff B.
salmon.review: Very nice place with very friendly staff. The view far outweighs the food. However, the food is respectable especially with it being located in a high traffic tourist area like Pier 39. I would say the quality setting / feel of the restaurant does not match the surrounding businesses.  It is definitely worth a visit. We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl. A special shout out for the broiled oysters appetizer with spinach and bacon. Yum!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill - swordfish, salmon and shrimp with rice and steamed broccoli.
salmon.author: Jimmy M.
salmon.review:
We checked this place out to complete our tourist jaunt to the Embarcadero. We easily got a table with a view at 12:30 on a Wednesday.

The kids menu is good - my youngest had a cheese burger and fries, and the older boy had fish and chips. Portions were good sized and very affordable.

My wife had the chowder bread bowl - always a good option.

I had the mixed grill - swordfish, salmon and shrimp with rice and steamed broccoli. A solid seafood dish.

This place won't win any hipster points or anything for hipness or originality - but it's good for a family.

excerpts: For my entree, I ordered the Salmon.
DELICIOUS.
Would recommend and order again as well.
I really have no complaints and look forward to visiting again in the future!
salmon.author: Aysia F.
salmon.review: Food was extremely delicious and fresh, great service. I will definitely come back when I am in SF again. I ordered the clam chowder which was very very good, I highly recommend. For my entree, I ordered the Salmon. DELICIOUS. Would recommend and order again as well. I really have no complaints and look forward to visiting again in the future!

excerpts: My wife had the mixed grilled seafood consisting of grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables and wild rice.
My daughters went with the crab cakes and pan-seared chicken breast.
salmon.author: Bread S.
salmon.review:
Very nice place to have a daytime lunch or even an evening dinner.  Either way, the food here was great.  I ordered the Cioppino and it was excellent!!  It had an assortment of shrimp, Bay scallops, fish, mussels, clams and topped with (lazy style) crab meat- Lazy style as in they crack the crab shell for you and sprinkle the crab meat on top.  Others prefer to break-open the goodness, but I decided against a messy meal.

My wife had the mixed grilled seafood consisting of grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables and wild rice.  My daughters went with the crab cakes and pan-seared chicken breast.  All plates completely cleaned-out.  

The most notable 2 dishes that stood-out from the rest that you ABSOLUTELY must try have to be the following:

1) Mussel Fries
2) Clam Chowder (Best I've tasted in San Francisco)

Our waiter was Scottie- He was the most knowledgeable, funny and down to earth server.  Very attentive and made great recommendations.  Well-deserved tip for this guy.

       *****Read below when reserving a seat with the hostess outside the entrance:*****

(Knocked-off 1 star for this)

If you happen to go here during lunch on a weekend, the hostess will take your cell phone number down and send you a text if the wait should be horrendously long.  You can tell if many people are lounging around the outdoor seating area.    

Keep an eye out on your phone because the text message is a confirmation whether or not you still want your reserved table.  The text is NOT, I repeat, NOT a message telling you your table is ready.  I learned this the hard way by reading my message 10 min. late and then responding 10 minutes later.  The hostess had thought we no longer needed our seats and gave them up to the next party on the list.  When it told her that I read the text message late, we had to wait an additional 20 min.  Our entire wait ended up being over 40 min.  She apologized and said there were too many people even after I told her that my wife was sitting at the couch next to her the whole time.  I was away at the sports store across the way during that entire time.  Anything you send back to them as a text they can read back as a normal message.  

You've been warned- Now go out there and eat!!

excerpts: Outstanding menu with great wine selection; must try the salmon paired with the Malbec Callia Alta.
Great atmosphere and location perfect for that special occasion.
salmon.author: Wild J.
salmon.review: Top-notch service, beautiful views of the San Francisco bay.  Outstanding menu with great wine selection; must try the salmon paired with the Malbec Callia Alta.  Great atmosphere and location perfect for that special occasion.

excerpts: Unfortunately I also gave the salmon flat bread a try, which was disappointing because of its strong fishy flavor.
salmon.author: Vanessa V.
salmon.review:
Based on experience, a fancy-schmancy restaurant located in a touristy spot with great waterfront views is typically all hype. In my case at Fog Harbor Fish House, it actually wasn't all bad. 

Even on a warm San Francisco day, a sourdough bread bowl of hot clam chowder was one of the tastiest things I ate during my trip. For $10 you can have your fill of a comforting bowl of creamy chowder with real chunks of clams and slices of celery. Unfortunately I also gave the salmon flat bread a try, which was disappointing because of its strong fishy flavor.

Although the place was packed for lunch, the service was decent. 

The clam chowder is certainly Fog Harbor's forte. If I were to return here on another visit, I'd to mix it up by trying either their plate of fish & chips or calamari and chips.

excerpts: I ordered the king salmon dish which was "market price" - apparently market price in October was $32!
That's how much a salmon dish at a popular Disneyland restaurant is!
It was REALLY good, though!
I had a hot date, eating deeeeelicious salmon and looking out at the water, tourists, sea lions, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz
.. how could I go wrong?!
salmon.author: Erika R.
salmon.review:
Check in to "Pier 39" on Yelp to receive a "fun pack" at the California Welcome Center located a few shops behind Fog Harbor Fish House. You will receive a coupon book which contains a coupon for 20% off your meal!

Boyfriend and I came on a Monday in October around 1pm. It appeared busy and there was a 10-15 minute wait to be seated, but the gentleman seating us stated that it was "slow" today! 

Luckily, we were seated in an empty connecting room facing the water! I liked this area better because your body is facing the water, as opposed to having to turn your body to face the water in the main dining 

We were served HOT, fresh sourdough before receiving our main dishes. 

I ordered the king salmon dish which was "market price" - apparently market price in October was $32! That's how much a salmon dish at a popular Disneyland restaurant is! It was REALLY good, though! I substituted the potatoes with wild rice. 

You receive a Biscoff cookie with your check, and at the bottom of the check is a coupon for the Biscoff Coffee Corner located on the first floor on Pier 39. I think it was 30% off?

Not only was the food good, but the ambiance was quiet (while we were there, at least!) and romantic. I had a hot date, eating deeeeelicious salmon and looking out at the water, tourists, sea lions, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz.. how could I go wrong?!

excerpts: I ordered the Salmon "Club" Salad after seeing the diner next to me eat the same dish.
The salmon was moist and not too dry.
I would definitely order it again...
that is, if I decide to go back.
Good service leads to re-visits.
Take note, managers.
salmon.author: Diana P.
salmon.review:
Came here for happy hour at the bar and we were not given the happy hour menu. Nor were we informed there was happy hour going on even though the hostesses claim there was one. It was not until the couple next to us asked for the HH menu did the bartender presented them with one. By that time, we were almost finished with our food.... Oh well. We should've asked ourselves. Additionally, the bartenders, while pleasant and personable, were not very attentive even though it was not very busy. Bustling doing other things than tending to their customers. Or maybe we were not given attention due to our low orders of alcohol. That could be it. 

The food, nevertheless, was very good. I ordered the Salmon "Club" Salad after seeing the diner next to me eat the same dish. The salmon was moist and not too dry. I would definitely order it again... that is, if I decide to go back. Good service leads to re-visits. Take note, managers.

excerpts: We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees.
salmon.author: Hilda A.
salmon.review:
Great food, great service, great view, and even no wait time (we got lucky)!

Went with a party of 5, and we all had a great time! Everyone's food was brought out in a timely manner and was very delicious. We started out with the shellfish tower and calamari for our appetizers, along with the complimentary sourdough bread.  We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees. Everyone was delighted!

For being a touristic seafood restaurant let me say they completely blew us away.  You would in a way expect to pretty much pay for your view and get bad-ok food, but not here! Genuinely delicious. 
Will definitely be going back, and a must for all seafood lovers!

excerpts: Enjoy salmon special which was awesome.
Blue cheese bread app is good
didn't have a salad but everyone else's meals looked yum
salmon.author: Jacquelyn L.
salmon.review: So good ! Enjoy salmon special which was awesome. Blue cheese bread app is good didn't have a salad but everyone else's meals looked yum

excerpts: I ordered the chicken penne, but had them substitute the chicken for salmon.
The dish was amazing!!!
The salmon was perfectly grilled; the vegetables and pasta cooked al dente.
I had the Marathon to run the next morning, this meal was a great balance of fresh and clean protein and carbs.
My husband had the fish and chips which he said was perfectly cooked.
Their chocolate molten cake was delish!
The price points were just right for the amount of food received.
Fog Harbor is repeat visit worthy.
salmon.author: Miya F.
salmon.review: Other than the 45min wait Saturday night, I loved our experience and the food. Service was top notch and the food wonderfully prepared. I'm not a fan of sourdough bread, but I had the best sourdough bread here. I ordered the chicken penne, but had them substitute the chicken for salmon. The dish was amazing!!!  The salmon was perfectly grilled; the vegetables and pasta cooked al dente. I had the Marathon to run the next morning, this meal was a great balance of fresh and clean protein and carbs. My husband had the fish and chips which he said was perfectly cooked. Their chocolate molten cake was delish!  The price points were just right for the amount of food received. Fog Harbor is repeat visit worthy.

excerpts: we finally found salmon on the kids menu!
I had the mixed grill with 3 shrimp, swordfish and salmon...
it was amazing!
My hubby had the chicken breast and it was delicious too!
I wish we had time for dessert, next time for sure!
salmon.author: Diana D.
salmon.review:
Great restaurant with delicious food! We went last night, and my 8 year old daughter was thrilled we finally found salmon on the kids menu! 
I had the mixed grill with 3 shrimp, swordfish and salmon...it was amazing! 
My hubby had the chicken breast and it was delicious too! I wish we had time for dessert, next time for sure!

excerpts: no seasoning at all, we brought ot home to season it ourselves; the other asked for the salmon dish well done, was medium and had bones.
The waiter Curtis was nice.
the only dish that stood out was the new risotto with scallops.
My dish alone plus the advertiser was $60 and only worth about half that.
I eat at high quality restaurants often however this place was not that much better than a Red Lobster and I expected more from San Francisco Seafood
salmon.author: Amiyna F.
salmon.review: Reviews on Yelp was a four-star but the food is just okay. There were 5 of us. one had the crab cake appetizer, not seasoned well, bland; the other had clam linguine, no seasoning at all, we brought ot home to season it ourselves; the other asked for the salmon dish well done, was medium and had bones. The waiter Curtis was nice. the only dish that stood out was the new risotto with scallops. My dish alone plus the advertiser was $60 and only worth about half that. I eat at high quality restaurants often however this place was not that much better than a Red Lobster and I expected more from San Francisco Seafood

excerpts: I had the salmon and to be honest with you have had better.
There were way too many red bell peppers and tomatoes on the dish.
The sauce was oily and I'm glad the arugula soaked most of it up.
It just was a weird combination.
For thirty dollars I expected to be wowed.
My fiancé had the dungeons crab he said it was ok.
We usually have dinner at the Pier 39 market and tried this place out instead.
We will it be retuning.
Only positive the server was awesome and the clam chowder.
salmon.author: Michelle D.
salmon.review: We were a little underwhelmed after trying this place out. The menu looks amazing but after our experience we realized that it was only subpar. I had the salmon and to be honest with you have had better. There were way too many red bell peppers and tomatoes on the dish. The sauce was oily and I'm glad the arugula soaked most of it up. It just was a weird combination. For thirty dollars I expected to be wowed. My fiancé had the dungeons crab he said it was ok. We usually have dinner at the Pier 39 market and tried this place out instead. We will it be retuning. Only positive the server was awesome and the clam chowder.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed girl blackened which comes with salmon,shrimp and swordfish
and it was so good.
You can't beat the freshness of the fish from the bay.
We also got the Clam chowder which is my favorite.
Make sure you get it with additional crab.
You get so much that with the bread we had to get a bag for our leftovers.
We will definitely be back.
salmon.author: Rhonda P.
salmon.review:
This is my favorite place to eat when I visit San Francisco. The location is absolutely perfect. You can't beat having grate food while watching the sun set along the pier. The restaurant is the right balance of romantic with a homey vibe. Our server Angela was wonderful. She provide us with great selections from the menu as well as recommendations for other great restaurants in the area. If you can pick a section she is the best! 

I ordered the mixed girl blackened which comes with salmon,shrimp and swordfish and it was so good. You can't beat the freshness of the fish from the bay.  We also got the Clam chowder which is my favorite. Make sure you get it with additional crab. You get so much that with the bread we had to get a bag for our leftovers. We will definitely be back.

excerpts: I had a special of the day Salmon w/ pumpkin Curry with Butternut Squash , my honey had Cioppino which he really enjoyed .
My sons had seafood combo dishes , great food .
salmon.author: Eva L.
salmon.review:
This was my 2nd time coming here, the first time was in a Wednesday for an early dinner and it was good , we knew we would come back. Today a very busy Saturday, we showed up, gave our name , were told the wait w/b 1 1/2 hours, I signed in since they always say more time than it actually takes. We were called in & seated in 45 minutes :). 
Our server Tyler was great , he brought bread , our drinks, appetizers , took our order and served us in a timely manner , then came with a birthday dessert  & singing Happy Birthday for my son . He was a very friendly great server.
The food was AWESOME ! I had a special of the day Salmon w/ pumpkin Curry with Butternut Squash , my honey had Cioppino which he really enjoyed . My sons had seafood combo dishes , great food .

excerpts: The Salmon and Linguini with clams that I ordered DIDN'T TASTE FRESH at all.
Total DISAPPOINTMENT!
salmon.author: M R.
salmon.review:
Ok I'm giving this  resto Two Star for their food! Had high expectations before dining at this resto but now....  The Salmon and Linguini with clams that I ordered DIDN'T TASTE FRESH at all. Total DISAPPOINTMENT! Definitely needs major improvement on food prep...

Would give Charlie (our server) 5 star for being so attentive!

5 star for the view and location of the restaurant. Its in the heart of Pier 39.

excerpts: We ordered the salmon club and crab roll.
I'm usually disappointed in crab rolls because it's all lettuce, his was the complete opposite.
Full of flavor and fresh!
Salmon blt again large portion but salmon was fresh and delicious.
Highly recommend!
salmon.author: Danielle N.
salmon.review:
We started with the chowder which was good and the sour dough bread was amazing. 
We ordered the salmon club and crab roll. I'm usually disappointed in crab rolls because it's all lettuce, his was the complete opposite. Full of flavor and fresh!
Salmon blt again large portion but salmon was fresh and delicious.  Highly recommend!

excerpts: The salmon salad was fabulous.
Our server Samir was extraordinary!!!
He was always there filling our glasses and keeping our table clear of dirty dishes.
salmon.author: Susan I.
salmon.review:
I took my co-workers out for dinner here while we were in town for a conference.  Got there about 5:30pm on June 16, 2016.   The food was outstanding.  I really loved the linguini and clams.  The salmon salad was fabulous.  Our server Samir was extraordinary!!! He was always there filling our glasses and keeping our table clear of dirty dishes.  He was the best employee on the floor that night!

Only issue was the next table.  Very loud group of men with a couple of women.  The hostess gave us this table and when we asked for another table away from the disturbance, we were told that we would have to wait half hour.  So, we sat.  Talked very loudly to have our own conversation.  Other than the hostess not being accommodating, the manager walked through our section a couple of times and didn't ask the loud table to reduce the noise level.  Those were the only disappointments that we experienced here.

excerpts: I also got the salmon which was just okay, the mussles and fries were pretty good.
salmon.author: Rachel L.
salmon.review:
The service here is horrible. The waitress expected me to hand my plates to her, forgot our bread, my meal, in general rude and extremely slow. I don't mind handing my plate to her, just to make her job easier, but she seemed to expect me to clear the table for her! Maybe there was some other reason for her behavior but the service sucked especially at the price I was paying for. 

Now onto the food. The New York Steak was wonderful. Cooked just right with the perfect amount of tenderness and sauce. My boyfriend fell in love with the crab roll. I also got the salmon which was just okay, the mussles and fries were pretty good.

On the other hand, the clams were small, not fresh, and had a lot of empty shells. The clam chowder was disappointing and lastly, the seafood linguine was dry. I have to say, one experience here is enough.

excerpts: Try the local salmon, it's delicious.
Enjoyed beautiful sunset views and the wait was short even without reservations.
salmon.author: Catherine S.
salmon.review: Tyler our waiter was awesome! The food was fantastic! Try the local salmon, it's delicious. Enjoyed beautiful sunset views and the wait was short even without reservations.

excerpts: They had the pumpkin salmon (seasonal dish) which was absolutely delicious.
salmon.author: Sathya B.
salmon.review:
This place is absolutely amazing. The location is amazing. We got a window table which overlooked the water. We were able to watch the sun set while enjoying the delicious food.

We were there in October so they had an outdoor festival at the pier with live music, so we were entertained while we waited for our table. They had the pumpkin salmon (seasonal dish) which was absolutely delicious.

I'd highly recommend this place to anyone. Great for a first date, dinner with the family or just even a nice meal to yourself.

excerpts:
Crab was delicious, clam
Linguini was great and a solid light meal, and the salmon was without a doubt the best iv ever had!
5 Stars and what a great experience!
salmon.author: Trevor P.
salmon.review:
Anytime you order three different meals and everyone at the table agrees that this is worth 5 stars. Ya it's a winner. Crab was delicious, clam
Linguini was great and a solid light meal, and the salmon was without a doubt the best iv ever had! 5 Stars and what a great experience!

excerpts: I must say that the clam chowder, Salmon and shrimp were delicious.
BUT the service is the reason why I'd give it a 2 star rating.
The server first came up and introduced herself and basically walked away, didn't even bother asking if we needed water(I actually had to ask her to bring me water).
Also, didn't ask us if we wanted anything else to drink besides the water and the complimentary bread was brought out to our table minutes before our actual meal came out.
I've worked in the food industry in the past and
I must say even though it's a busy restaurant that was still horrible service.
salmon.author: Carlos R.
salmon.review: I must say that the clam chowder, Salmon and shrimp were delicious. BUT the service is the reason why I'd give it a 2 star rating. The server first came up and introduced herself and basically walked away, didn't even bother asking if we needed water(I actually had to ask her to bring me water). Also, didn't ask us if we wanted anything else to drink besides the water and the complimentary bread was brought out to our table minutes before our actual meal came out. I've worked in the food industry in the past and I must say even though it's a busy restaurant that was still horrible service.

excerpts: Definitely try the salmon, it was delicious!!!
salmon.author: Jullisa S.
salmon.review: This was my first time in SF and I went to this place and was amazed! The food, drinks and service were fantastic. Justin, our server, was amazing. Definitely try the salmon, it was delicious!!!

excerpts: Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese.
Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much.
I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge.
The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes).
The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete.
The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it.
salmon.author: Calvin S.
salmon.review:
3.5/5, +.5 for service

Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.

We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.

Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.

Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.

excerpts: We also enjoyed the salmon club salad.
The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh.
Our service was great as well.
Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.
salmon.author: Mara S.
salmon.review: Yes the wait is long if you don't have a reservation, but the wait was worth it! The mussel fries were excellent! We also enjoyed the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh. Our service was great as well. Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.

excerpts: We had the grilled salmon, crab stuffed lobster and crab & avocado salad.
ALL of our dishes were completely devoured as they were just scrumptious!
Portions weren't significant, at least not the salmon, but can't complain.
It was all good.
salmon.author: Marella M.
salmon.review:
Gorgeous views, friendly service and delicious food! 

Location - great location! Conveniently located at pier 39 on the 2nd floor

Service - staff from the host to the waiters were very friendly.  We were seated quickly and at a nice window table with gorgeous view.  Our waiter was nice & thoughtful without being overbearing.  

Food - food was fabulous!  We had the grilled salmon, crab stuffed lobster and crab & avocado salad.  ALL of our dishes were completely devoured as they were just scrumptious!  Portions weren't significant, at least not the salmon, but can't complain.  It was all good.

excerpts: Everything we ordered was mouth watering from the shrimp appetizer, my ahi tuna and caesar salad, and she had swordfish, shrimp, and salmon plate with a cup of clam chowder.
I would go back here in a heartbeat.
salmon.author: Matthew D.
salmon.review: I wanted a delicious seafood meal before leaving the bay area at a place that had plenty of gluten free options. My girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try even though it being located in the Pier 39 tourist trap and we weren't disappointed. The menu labeled everything that was gluten free and the service was outstanding. Everything we ordered was mouth watering from the shrimp appetizer, my ahi tuna and caesar salad, and she had swordfish, shrimp, and salmon plate with a cup of clam chowder. I would go back here in a heartbeat.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon she ordered the mixed grill and everything was absolutely amazing.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce was delicious and the drinks were great.
Our server was very kind and helpful, sadly I do not remember his name.
Definitely recommend!
salmon.author: Ana C.
salmon.review: Went in for my mom's birthday. I ordered the salmon she ordered the mixed grill and everything was absolutely amazing. The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce was delicious and the drinks were great. Our server was very kind and helpful, sadly I do not remember his name. Definitely recommend!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish.
It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.
salmon.author: Heidi S.
salmon.review:
My boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip to the wharf and decided to try this restaurant out.

He had a mixed seafood pasta that he said was really good.  I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish. It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.  I thought the seafood was very fresh and delicious.

We both started the meal with a cup of clam chowder and both agreed that we could have eaten a bowl.  It was the best clam chowder that I ever can recall eating.  It was perfectly thick with potatoes and loaded with clams.  

Our server was very nice and prompt.  We never had to ask for a refill.

It was a tad pricey, but what isn't on the wharf of San Francisco.   2 cups of chowder, 2 entrees and 2 cokes ran us right about $85.

excerpts: Our server recommended the special, which was a fresh wild salmon atop an arugula salad with cranberries and couscous.
It was incredible.
The views of the bay were also fantastic, especially watching the sunset.
I highly recommend this place.
salmon.author: Rich P.
salmon.review:
Excellent experience! Our server recommended the special, which was a fresh wild salmon atop an arugula salad with cranberries and couscous. It was incredible. 
The views of the bay were also fantastic, especially watching the sunset. 
I highly recommend this place.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill and my swordfish, shrimp, and salmon were cooked perfectly.
Staff were friendly.
Great place.
salmon.author: Kevin P.
salmon.review: This place was great. I ordered the mixed grill and my swordfish, shrimp, and salmon were cooked perfectly. Staff were friendly. Great place.

excerpts: from the salmon "club" salad to the crab cakes to the clam chowder, everything is fantastic.
even the bread that they bring out is great.
there is a reason why their clam chowder is award winning.
the only downside of this place is that it gets a bit expensive!
salmon.author: Sid V.
salmon.review: first of all... this place has amazing food. everything tastes great. from the salmon "club" salad to the crab cakes to the clam chowder, everything is fantastic. even the bread that they bring out is great. there is a reason why their clam chowder is award winning. the only downside of this place is that it gets a bit expensive!

excerpts: Really good salmon blt.
salmon.author: Shelby S.
salmon.review:
Really good salmon blt. Good oysters too 
Khaiman was our waiter very attentive . Great place

excerpts: The kids menu actually had grilled salmon and broccoli, a nice change from the hamburger and fries, for $7.50!
I ordered the lobster tail, a super splurge for us, but well worth it.
salmon.author: Claire D.
salmon.review: Delicious food, great seafood and wonderful prices, especially for the area. We stayed 5 nights in San Francisco and went here our last night, by far the best and most affordable place for dinner. I recommend this place for everyone. The kids menu actually had grilled salmon and broccoli, a nice change from the hamburger and fries, for $7.50! I ordered the lobster tail, a super splurge for us, but well worth it.

excerpts: My hunny got Mixed Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes.
He said it lacked flavor but our waiter brought 2 sauces over & he really liked it.
salmon.author: Tiffani B.
salmon.review:
Came here on Valentines Day with my hunny. The service was great, our waiter was very helpful & the wine she recommended was pretty good. 

For our appetizer we had crispy lemon calamari which was the best calamari I've had. We also tried the clam chowder and the reviewers were right. The best clam chowder I have ever had.

Entrée: I got the special that was not on the menu. It was a half lobster stuff with crab & shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My hunny got Mixed Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. He said it lacked flavor but our waiter brought 2 sauces over & he really liked it. Overall it was delicious & service was awesome.


Will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.
my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.
youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.
HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!
salmon.author: Paul S.
salmon.review:
fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!

it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.  

this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!

bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.  

after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!  

we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.

and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

excerpts: Boyfriend got the salmon and really enjoyed it.
I got linguini with clams, again, pretty good.
Service was good, and when we asked for desserts, they came out with a tray of desserts (which I've never seen before).
We got the creme brulee, which is never disappointing because creme brulee is so good.
Bill was around $100 plus tip (boys and girls, if your server does a good job, make sure you tip accordingly!).
Probably a little more than what I would have liked to paid since I didn't have a culinary explosion
while here
but the scenery is beautiful
and it's in a very touristy area
so it makes sense.
I'm just happy I paid for slightly over-priced good food versus awful food.
salmon.author: Kristin C.
salmon.review: This place is legitimately good. They boasted to have the best clam chowder. With an advertisement like that, you know you gotta order it 'cause ya know your girl likes her clam chowder. The clam chowder was probably the best I had in SF while I was here. (Albeit,all 4 days). Boyfriend got the salmon and really enjoyed it. I got linguini with clams, again, pretty good. Service was good, and when we asked for desserts, they came out with a tray of desserts (which I've never seen before). We got the creme brulee, which is never disappointing because creme brulee is so good. Bill was around $100 plus tip (boys and girls, if your server does a good job, make sure you tip accordingly!). Probably a little more than what I would have liked to paid since I didn't have a culinary explosion while here but the scenery is beautiful and it's in a very touristy area so it makes sense. I'm just happy I paid for slightly over-priced good food versus awful food.

excerpts: The salmon tasted really fresh and it basically melted in your mouth.
This place is definitely a must for San Francisco.
4 stars because I left something at the restaurant and when I called back to see if anyone found it the girl who "helped" was extremely unfriendly.
She even hung up the phone on me when I was trying to think her for "looking".
Rude.
But the food was awesome!
salmon.author: Hazel M.
salmon.review: The food was great and our waiter was fantastic. The salmon tasted really fresh and it basically melted in your mouth. This place is definitely a must for San Francisco. 4 stars because I left something at the restaurant and when I called back to see if anyone found it the girl who "helped" was extremely unfriendly. She even hung up the phone on me when I was trying to think her for "looking". Rude. But the food was awesome!

excerpts: Food was ok, had the Salmon BLT, which was cooked well.
I was looking forward to desert, but the waitress either got busy or was tired of dealing with a quiet table and just dropped off the check.
All the while, I saw her offer Desert to the other tables in her section.
salmon.author: Clifford C.
salmon.review:
This use to be my absolutely favorite place to go to dinner while visiting the city, but tonight changed all of that. After driving 2 hours to come to dinner here with my son, I was greeted by the worst hostess ever. The first thing I asked for was a table by the window. It was a slow night, lots of available seating near the massive Windows, I thought to myself, SCORE! Dining with a view tonight. What I got was totally opposite of that! Readers discretion, I did have my toddler with me, who by the way was actually a saint tonight, even though, I thought a slow night, not a lot of stuck up kid hating people, shouldn't be too bad. Well... Too bad so Sad. Here's what happened: So we first get sat in a booth facing the window. The hostess must of not had a lot of experience with children because as she walked off, I had to call her back and ask for a high chair, she looked at me with puzzlement and semi annoyance, and says: "well you can sit here with a high chair?!"...DUH!! I could have told her that. So, naturally I think, well they're a couple 2 and 4 tops (tables) in plain site next to the window where we can replace a chair with a high chair, no problem! Think again, she sticks me in the far back of the restaurant, farthest away from the window!! WTF!! By this point, my own enjoyment was out of the question, I have to feed my kid and I'm starving, not worth the fight anymore because this "hostess" was obviously discriminatory towards anyone with a kid , and or was just plain clueless about what she was suppose to do. 
Food was ok, had the Salmon BLT, which was cooked well. I was looking forward to desert, but the waitress either got busy or was tired of dealing with a quiet table and just dropped off the check. All the while, I saw her offer Desert to the other tables in her section. Apparently my money is not good enough for this restaurant.  

If you're looking at this restaurant as a possible place for a great dining experience with excellent service and is family friendly...skip it. Go to the restaurant in the front of the wharf.  Or take a short trip to SCOMA's or Woodhouse fish co. Both are fantastic! Great service and food.

Dear management, please train your hostesses to care and show them how to seat your patrons, I saw another lady actually throw a fit and ask to speak with a manager because of said hostesses tonight.. Seems like I wasn't the only one tonight .  Please don't waste your time or money here.

excerpts: Grilled salmon was tasty with a nice presentation.
Crispy calamari and the chowder were wonderful along with the hot sourdough bread.
salmon.author: T B.
salmon.review: Great views and good food. Grilled salmon was tasty with a nice presentation. Crispy calamari and the chowder were wonderful along with the hot sourdough bread.

excerpts: I had a seafood combo plate, per our servers recommendation, and the Salmon was melt in my mouth status, the sauce was perfect and the fish was cooked perfectly.
Highly satisfied with the food and friendly service, this will be my future stop instead of The Fransiscian resturaunt which we used to frequent in the SF area.
salmon.author: Michael M.
salmon.review: First time here, and wow our server Madison had great recommendations for drinks food and appetizers.  We were checked on regularly throughout our meal.  I had a seafood combo plate, per our servers recommendation, and the Salmon was melt in my mouth status, the sauce was perfect and the fish was cooked perfectly.  Highly satisfied with the food and friendly service, this will be my future stop instead of The Fransiscian resturaunt which we used to frequent in the SF area.

excerpts: For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!).
For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp.
Neither one disappointed us.
All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco.
Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.
salmon.author: Blanca A.
salmon.review: This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver, Rose. As soon as we stepped in we knew it was going to be a spectacular lunch. From the outside it doesn't seem like much. Once you step inside, you realize you're in for a beautiful view of Pier 39, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate. For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious. Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce. What's not to love? For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!). For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp. Neither one disappointed us. All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco. Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.

excerpts: For my entree I ordered the Salmon.
The salmon was moist and fresh with just a bit of crunchiness from the grill.
I've not had salmon sitting over the greens and baby potatoes, before.
salmon.author: Warren S.
salmon.review:
The restaurant is located at the front of Pier 39, is contemporary in style, and although it has been around for a while you can see they upkeep the property in detail. Even the bathroom was very clean...

The sour dough bread they served us was very warm, soft and fresh.

I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. The chowder had a nice mixture of slight thickness with potatoes and fresh clams.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon. The salmon was moist and fresh with just a bit of crunchiness from the grill. I've not had salmon sitting over the greens and baby potatoes, before. That made for a nice presentation and helped encourage an overall sampling from each various flavors and texture in each bite.

Our server Mel was very attentive!

excerpts: Also tried the salmon dish which was delicious.
I'll continue to recommend Fog Harbor to visitors who insist on spending time in this area, sigh ; )
Secretly, I wish it took up residence somewhere other than Pier 39!
salmon.author: Brianna M.
salmon.review: Super impressed. I've been to Fog Harbor twice and have had super tasty, satisfying meals on both occasions. Rarely do I venture to Pier 39. It's always crawling with tourists and impossible to navigate around. And when it comes to eats, there are far, far, better spots outside of this area. But, the hubs surprised me with a day on the bay and after a long afternoon of wine and boating, we were craving a tasty, warm meal in the area. Sat at the bar and were dished up great service and food. Their clam chowder is on point. Of course, I wouldn't expect anything less given Fog's location and the area's claim to fame. Also tried the salmon dish which was delicious. I'll continue to recommend Fog Harbor to visitors who insist on spending time in this area, sigh ; ) Secretly, I wish it took up residence somewhere other than Pier 39!

excerpts: Wild caught Salmon so so good!
salmon.author: Dawn V.
salmon.review: Ok so in a touristy location like the other reviews say but I do agree the food here is really great, clean restaurant and the view is awesome. The Manager came around to see how everyone is doing which is a rare service now a day. Top quality food and service!! Wild caught Salmon so so good!

excerpts: My coworker ordered ordered the salmon which was tender and fresh.
The view was amazing and all the nearby stores on pier 39 make this a must see when visiting san francisco.
salmon.author: Diana L.
salmon.review: I was in silicon valley on a business trip and had to stop in based on yelp reviews. They had a bit of a wait to sit by a window, but it was totally worth it. We started with crab cakes(suggested by my waiter). It was sooo good that when i gave my coworkwr a taste he had to order another.  I then ordered fish and chips combo which brings shrimp and calamari (which i substitued for another poece of fish ). It was sooo good that i didn't even touch the fries. My coworker ordered ordered the salmon which was tender and fresh. The view was amazing and all the nearby stores on pier 39 make this a must see when visiting san francisco.

excerpts: I had the grill which included shrimp, swordfish and salmon.
When reading over reviews, I saw many complain of price.
Personally, I wasn't offended at the prices.
salmon.author: Gloria H.
salmon.review: Lunchtime view was absolutely amazing. Service was excellent and meal was good. I had the grill which included shrimp, swordfish and salmon. When reading over reviews, I saw many complain of price. Personally, I wasn't offended at the prices.

excerpts: The mussels and salmon are highly recommended.
salmon.author: David S.
salmon.review: Very touristy location, but great food and service! Would have given five stars, but a long wait and noisy setting which is understandable given the location. The mussels and salmon are highly recommended.

excerpts:
We also got the salmon, it was equally as delicious. 
Even though it was a busy night, our wait was short. 
It was the PERFECT ambiance. 
Great view, perfect temperature. 
We hadn't planned on going to a nice place, so weren't necessarily dressed for it, and were still treated so great. 
The bathrooms were pristine. 
The dessert tray was a sight to behold (in the best way possible).
The bartender was super friendly and we hadn't even interacted with him all night until we were leaving.
salmon.author: Kaitlin D.
salmon.review:
This was one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. Here's why:

1. Our waitress was personable, and engaging. 
2. The sourdough bread was incredible. 
3. They gave us WARMED BUTTER (mind blown. It's the little things.)
4. Great wine selection. 
5. We were told about the special. We got the special. It was the right decision. So delicious. 
6. We also got the salmon, it was equally as delicious. 
7. Even though it was a busy night, our wait was short. 
8. It was the PERFECT ambiance. Great view, perfect temperature. 
9. We hadn't planned on going to a nice place, so weren't necessarily dressed for it, and were still treated so great. 
10. The bathrooms were pristine. 
11. The dessert tray was a sight to behold (in the best way possible).
12. The bartender was super friendly and we hadn't even interacted with him all night until we were leaving. 
13. They gave us Biscoff cookies with our bill. 

I will remember this place for the rest of my dining life.

excerpts: I got the salmon entree, which was just delicious.
Cooked perfectly, with a med-rare center and beautiful grill marks on the outside, set over a creamy sauce with spinach and potatoes.
A beautiful piece of fish and a huge portion!
-Tuna
-- perfectly cooked again with a nice big rare center.
Served over a great hash-like mix that included these delightful bits of bok choy.
salmon.author: Sue S.
salmon.review:
We wanted to have some lovely seafood while we were in San Francisco, and we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House from the many options on Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, very high marks. First, the view is lovely, and the restaurant itself is very nice and well-appointed. A nice place for a relaxed lunch, date night or a special occasion. Second, the food:
-I ordered the ginger coconut cocktail, which was generally very good and tasty, but I felt had a bit too much coconut. It was kind of offputting in mouthfeel but did have a delightful ginger/lemon/spritzer type of flavor. I was torn between loving it and hating it and in the end only drank about half.
-The chowder. Oh my god, get some.Some of the best chowder you will ever have. Thick, creamy, silky, delicious. Think cup, but go bowl. You're welcome.
-Poke. I do love tuna, so poke is a tough thing to ignore on a menu that isn't in Hawaii. This particular poke is mixed with fresh avocado and mango, with a small amount of seaweed like you'd find in a seaweed salad. Light, gingery, soy-ey (??) and really yum.
-Salmon. I got the salmon entree, which was just delicious. Cooked perfectly, with a med-rare center and beautiful grill marks on the outside, set over a creamy sauce with spinach and potatoes. A beautiful piece of fish and a huge portion!
-Tuna -- perfectly cooked again with a nice big rare center. Served over a great hash-like mix that included these delightful bits of bok choy. SUPER yum.


In all the food was really excellent. We didn't have time for dessert. Our server was good, helpful and composed. Not cheap -- we had two apps, two entrees and two drinks and the tab topped $100 for LUNCH. Still.... We would definitely come back!

excerpts: My mixed grill had salmon, swordfish, and a skewer of 3 shrimp.
Our son had the kids fish and chips, best battered fish we had ever tasted.
All the fish was well prepared, i was concerned about the swordfish
but it was not dry at all.
salmon.author: Lucien C.
salmon.review:
Had a real nice evening.  

We got seated right away with a table of 3 on a Friday night in June.   The waitress came quickly and explained the specials and offered drinks.  I had a beer a local hoppy variety and my wife had one of their signature lemondrop drinks(tart, sweet and strong with a sugared rim).  

We split a Caesar salad which was perfect for 2, the dressing was definitely homemade.  The leaves were split but not chopped.  They brought out very tasty sourdough bread with the salads and dinner.  

I ordered a clam chowder which never came, so i didn't get to try that. 

My wife enjoyed the Cod special and I had the mix grill.  Her special was a fillet of cod with chorizo and semi spicy sauce over white bean ragout , very tasty, we both enjoyed the meal.  My mixed grill had salmon, swordfish, and a skewer of 3 shrimp.  Our son had the kids fish and chips, best battered fish we had ever tasted.  All the fish was well prepared, i was concerned about the swordfish but it was not dry at all.  I also had a glass of house chardonay (they have different sizes and the staff tries to push the bigger more expensive one) which was light and complimented the flavors of the fish nicely.

Our son had the kids Sunday which was just a scoop of vanilla ice cream with magic shell on it but for .95 cents he loved it.  

We split the tiramisu, great size for 2 and tasted great not too sweet like some restaurants, light and creamy with a great taste on the soaked lady fingers.  

Dinner for 3 was about 150$ not bad for 3 with drinks.  Nice night except for the hitch of not getting the clam chowder.

excerpts: Salmon Blt fantastic, soup and salad good, fish and chips good and burger
good.try mussels and fries!!!
salmon.author: Leiby D.
salmon.review: Expertly managed business! The wait was 20 min and it actually WAS 20 min. Drinks were delicious, especially clementine Cosmo. Salmon Blt fantastic, soup and salad good, fish and chips good and burger good.try mussels and fries!!!

excerpts: As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon.
The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside.
Both were good, but will try other places around the area first.
Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39.
They do validations.
salmon.author: Rochelle G.
salmon.review: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.

excerpts: When I asked what was the least fishy-tasting fish, he told me the Salmon was great.
(We got a sampler, and although the salmon was fine, it was certainly not the least fishy - just the most expensive!)
salmon.author: Rachel M.
salmon.review:
Of our 8-day vacation, my husband said our visit here was the low point.  Our waiter did not speak English, and so he did not know how to answer our questions.  For example, when my husband asked "What are your three most popular entrees?"  he responded "All of our seafood is fresh."  When I asked what was the least fishy-tasting fish, he told me the Salmon was great.  (We got a sampler, and although the salmon was fine, it was certainly not the least fishy - just the most expensive!)

I decided to place my drink order at the bar rather than try to communicate it to him.  

The clam chowder was really good, but the rest of the food was not that great.  It was very expensive.  There has got to be better options in San Francisco.

excerpts: Had the mixed grill plate and the swordfish and salmon seem both mediocre at best.
The shrimp had good taste and flavor though.
Mashed potatoes had a good flavor when they were not doused in seashell flavor from the Lobster tail sitting in them.
Would be better off spending your money in other places over this overpriced establishment that serves mediocre seafood at high prices.
salmon.author: Daniel P.
salmon.review: The Lobster tail had a good taste and texture and the bread is amazing. That about ends the good though. Had the mixed grill plate and the swordfish and salmon seem both mediocre at best. The shrimp had good taste and flavor though. Mashed potatoes had a good flavor when they were not doused in seashell flavor from the Lobster tail sitting in them. Would be better off spending your money in other places over this overpriced establishment that serves mediocre seafood at high prices.

excerpts: We had the soup (clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl..obviously) with mixed field greens, the salmon entree, and the pumpkin bread pudding.
salmon.author: Jessie B.
salmon.review:
GOD DAMNED DELICIOUS!!! 

We had the soup (clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl..obviously) with mixed field greens, the salmon entree, and the pumpkin bread pudding. Service was fast but unobtrusive, great tasting food, and an amazing view. 

This will be our new SF tradition!!

excerpts: I ordered the salmon salad and my husband ordered the mixed Grill plate that came with salmon, swordfish, shrimp, creamy potatoes and steamed brocolli...all very tasty.
Our waitress was great and was very attentive.
When we arrived we were told it would be 10 minute wait
and we were asked for our cell phone #.
They let you go shop and text you when your table is ready!
Pretty awesome!
salmon.author: Christy S.
salmon.review: Went here for lunch on a Monday after the Alcatraz tour.  What a wonderful place!  Every table has a view to the large windows looking out to Alcatraz. I ordered the popular Perfect Hibiscus Margarita that comes with a Cointreau lime foam.  Delicious!   I wanted a second but I wasn't sure if it was going to my head or I still had sea legs from the boat ride earlier!   The crispy calamari with fried jalapeños and onion pieces was very tasty.  I ordered the salmon salad and my husband ordered the mixed Grill plate that came with salmon, swordfish, shrimp, creamy potatoes and steamed brocolli...all very tasty.  Our waitress was great and was very attentive.  When we arrived we were told it would be 10 minute wait and we were asked for our cell phone #.  They let you go shop and text you when your table is ready!  Pretty awesome!

excerpts: My son had the salmon, and it was delicious.
He won't eat fish if it's not super fresh.
I had a whole dungeoness crab, and hubby had fish and chips.
Delish!
salmon.author: Deb H.
salmon.review:
We sat at the bar for a quick lunch on a busy day at the pier.  The bartender was awesome!  Super friendly and fast.  My son had the salmon, and it was delicious.  He won't eat fish if it's not super fresh.  I had a whole dungeoness crab, and hubby had fish and chips.  Delish! Hard to stomach the price when you aren't used to SF prices, but worth it when you want good seafood.

Great views too!

excerpts: I ordered the linguini with clams & my boyfriend got the wild salmon.
The food literally melts in your mouth.
The drinks were good as well; the cocktails were just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness.
The wine selection was fabulous as well.
For dessert we got the chocolate cake and since it was our anniversary it was on the house!
The chocolate tasted like heaven.
Our server was very nice and knowledgable.
Overall this was a great experience and we will definitely come again.
And the view from our table was beautiful.
salmon.author: Amanda D.
salmon.review: I came here for my two year anniversary with my boyfriend and it was the best evening ever. The food was flavorful and exquisite, the service was fabulous, and the atmosphere was romantic and elegant. I ordered the linguini with clams & my boyfriend got the wild salmon. The food literally melts in your mouth. The drinks were good as well; the cocktails were just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness. The wine selection was fabulous as well. For dessert we got the chocolate cake and since it was our anniversary it was on the house! The chocolate tasted like heaven. Our server was very nice and knowledgable. Overall this was a great experience and we will definitely come again. And the view from our table was beautiful.

excerpts: I ordered the grilled salmon over mashed potatoes and an arugula salad.
I also started with a cup of clam chowder, which I ordered some to go for later.
Tyler our server did a fine job and was very attentive.
I will definitely be back.
salmon.author: Mandi P.
salmon.review: Great food and great atmosphere.  I ordered the grilled salmon over mashed potatoes and an arugula salad. I also started with a cup of clam chowder, which I ordered some to go for later. Tyler our server did a fine job and was very attentive. I will definitely be back.

excerpts: I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it).
salmon.author: Detroit R.
salmon.review:
My experience at Fog Harbor was average. The service was subpar and disappointing. Our server Robert payed no attention to detail, was not attentive and showed no interest in serving the needs of his patrons. Robert had no personality and acted like he'd rather be at home. We had to ask for EVERYTHING :-( refills, bread...etc. 

The food was good. I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it). The taste was pretty good. 

Beautiful establishment. If the service was better, my experience would have been great. It irritates the HELL out of me when servers are terrible. Ugggghhhh!!!!!! I'm so disappointed

excerpts: The daughter had seared ahi and loved it, I had a combination platter that had salmon, mahi-mahi and shrimp.
It came with mashed potatoes and green beans.
The fish was cooked perfectly, but the cook seasoned everything with cayenne pepper.
Since another in our party had the same dish (hers with garlic fries), and the fish on her plate was without this seasoning
salmon.author: Tam F.
salmon.review:
I had friends in town from Arizona and after a day of playing tour guide and having fun at Pier 39, we ended up having dinner here.

There were 5 of us and we were seated right away at a table by the window. Our waitress was a bit surly and seemed like she would rather be helping any other table but ours (could be due to having 2 teenagers with us). 

I ordered clam chowder to start and after a taste of sand and grit, sent it back. The daughter had seared ahi and loved it, I had a combination platter that had salmon, mahi-mahi and shrimp. It came with mashed potatoes and green beans. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the cook seasoned everything with cayenne pepper. Since another in our party had the same dish (hers with garlic fries), and the fish on her plate was without this seasoning I asked the waitress if mine was a mistake (I am not the too spicy fan), the manager came over right away and claimed my dish was made with the pepper by mistake. 

I really appreciated the kindess of the manager (who also comped our desserts), the really good cosmo I had and the company I was with. I would probably not tell people who live in the area to run to this restaurant for a meal, but I would tell people who are visiting to eat here BEFORE going to any other restaurant at Pier 39.

excerpts: I ordered the Salmon and loved the corn topping they served it with.
The piece they gave me was gigantic.
salmon.author: Katie C.
salmon.review:
Perfect touristy dinner.

Located on Pier 39 which is one of the popular tourist spots on the water.
