Made a reservation on open table, checked in early and still had some time before we were called so we walked down to see the sea lions at the end of the pier.  We requested a table by the window and were really excited when we got one because it was a stunning view of the harbor and the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Our waitress was nice and prompt.  Food is quick. They bring out some really tasty sourdough bread while you look over the menu.  We ordered a bottle of white wine which was served nice and cool. My boyfriend ordered the clam chowder with extra crab on top which he loved, we also split a ceasar salad which was good.  I ordered the Salmon and loved the corn topping they served it with.  The piece they gave me was gigantic.  My boyfriend ordered the cioppino which he loved (tons of crab, perfect mussels and scallops, good fish and tasty shrimp).    

We definitely recommend this place, especially if you're staying near the wharf.

excerpts: I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious.
salmon.author: Lauren M.
salmon.review:
My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced. 

The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome! 

Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!! 

One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon.
Be sure to ask the price...
When I ordered it, it was market price
It was delicious.
Great view of the harbor with Alcatraz in the background.
salmon.author: Keith R.
salmon.review:
Had dinner here.  I ordered the salmon.  Be sure to ask the price... When I ordered it, it was market price
 It was delicious.  Great view of the harbor with Alcatraz in the background.

excerpts: The food fell to a low point with my entree the Salmon special.
It was very dry and served on their mashed potatoes which appeared to be instant or potato pearls.
It was not very tasty
and I mostly just ate the vegetable on my plate.
salmon.author: Wendi G.
salmon.review:
Service is definitely a standout at this tourist location at Fisherman's Wharf. Our server was top notch and paid attention to detail and incredibly helpful and friendly. We made our reservation via Open Table and that made it easy to get a table but they also gave us a nice amuse bouche to start our dinner. The atmosphere is loud - lots of noise and clanging - so don't plan on an intimate dinner here. 

Scott started with the Award Winning Clam Chowder. He rated the soup a three star and he is quite the clam chowder aficionado. We split the Beet & Blue Cheese Salad - red and golden beets, organic mixed greens tossed with blue cheese dressing topped with walnuts - which was utterly delicious.  The server had the kitchen split the salad which is a detail often missed. The hot from the oven sour dough bread was very tasty that came with our appetizers. As a side note, I wanted the grilled artichoke but the server said the item was not available. 

The food fell to a low point with my entree the Salmon special. It was very dry and served on their mashed potatoes which appeared to be instant or potato pearls. It was not very tasty and I mostly just ate the vegetable on my plate. Scott had the Whole Dungeness Crab with a spicy Thai sauce. He loved this meal. The crab was cooked perfectly and the sauce, although messy, was really good. Had my seafood been as good as the crab I would have bumped them to a four star.

A fun place to try if you are in the mood for a Pier 39 restaurant.

excerpts: My grilled swordfish and salmon plate was also delicious.
Finished it off with a warm chocolate fudge cake.
salmon.author: Andy G.
salmon.review: If you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area, this is a great place to consider. Great seafood and views. The half orders of oysters and dungeness crab definitely hit the spot. My grilled swordfish and salmon plate was also delicious. Finished it off with a warm chocolate fudge cake.

excerpts: We got the Surf and Turf and a trio of salmon, white fish and shrimp.
Everything was so flavorful and tasty!
Its making my mouth water just thinking about it.
All in all, the night was beautiful!
salmon.author: Dez R.
salmon.review: The evening was perfect! OUR waiter was amazing! Oscar you made our dinning experience worth the rude rude RUDE hostesses we first encountered. Just saying, if you're going to be in a service business you may want to educate yourselves in BASIC laws. So that way you don't look like an airhead when you try and say a restaurant doesn't allow pets; that's common sense btw. But a SERVICE dog, isn't a pet. Back to the evening! Oscar was exceptionally patient and before he brought out our drinks he brought my GF's service dog water. He was an awesome human being! The food was amazing! We got Calamari to start, amazing. We got the Surf and Turf and a trio of salmon, white fish and shrimp. Everything was so flavorful and tasty! Its making my mouth water just thinking about it. All in all, the night was beautiful!

excerpts: We got kids mac and cheese, salmon, lobster tail, swordfish, shrimp cocktail, dungeness crab, and clam chowder.
Everything was on the salty side, but it was fresh seafood.
Not sure if we will come back when we visit SF again, but if your looking for a nice restaurant with ambience, this is the place to go to.
Our waitress was attentive and we didn't have any problems with service being slow (as some of the other yelpers had), the only slow service we had was our wait to be seated.
We thought it was because they were busy, but the minute we got seated,  we realized there were many tables and seats available.
So not sure of they were short on waiters, or if they were being lazy with seating?
salmon.author: Lynn L.
salmon.review: They don't take reservations, but the waiting area is good if you can get a seat by the fireplace cuz it gets chilly in the evening being it's right by the water. We got kids mac and cheese, salmon, lobster tail, swordfish, shrimp cocktail, dungeness crab, and clam chowder. Everything was on the salty side, but it was fresh seafood. Not sure if we will come back when we visit SF again, but if your looking for a nice restaurant with ambience, this is the place to go to. Our waitress was attentive and we didn't have any problems with service being slow (as some of the other yelpers had), the only slow service we had was our wait to be seated. We thought it was because they were busy, but the minute we got seated,  we realized there were many tables and seats available. So not sure of they were short on waiters, or if they were being lazy with seating?

excerpts: The salmon was cooked perfectly and Samir was great - he steered me to the mix grill which was the right call.
Highly recommend.
salmon.author: Mok M.
salmon.review: We had a fantastic meal here! Hard to find quality food on the later side in SF and while pier 39 can get a little tourist-y this place is not trap. The salmon was cooked perfectly and Samir was great - he steered me to the mix grill which was the right call. Highly recommend.

excerpts: My wife ordered the Salmon and she said it was perfectly cooked and it was moist.
salmon.author: Charles W.
salmon.review: The Seafood aelection was outstanding. My wife ordered the Salmon and she said it was perfectly cooked and it was moist. I ordered the Mixed Grill whuch was very tasty aswell. Our appetizer was Calamari it was slightly overcooked but it was good. Rhe desserts were nicely presented,  if you go here you've got to order the Strawberry short cake. Very moist and the cake was awesome. I give this place two thumbs up.

excerpts: The salmon BLT was awesome.
The whole experience was just a little too pricey... but that's par for the course in SF.
salmon.author: Debbie B.
salmon.review: The food and service was great. The salmon BLT was awesome. The whole experience was just a little too pricey... but that's par for the course in SF.

excerpts: The main entree is either salmon, new york steak, or braised chicken, comes with sauteed zucchini's and pearl onion.
Mashed potato's and a dessert of lava cake or tiramisu.
My friend had the salmon and it looked phat, well over an inch, about 6 inches by 6 inches.
salmon.author: Bert K.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor was the choice for a holiday party with my friends from various Banks.
About twenty people.

Tip: to get to Pier 39 from Caltrain, just walk to the BART track, pay $2.00 and ride it to Embarcadero. Then get off and walk to the F Street car, pay $2.00.
Your other option is to cab there for $12.50 each way.

On to Fog Harbor Fish House: 
Good value for large parties.

We did the prix fixe,  for starters every four people were served a platter of yummy calamari perfectly deep fried, cheese toast with fine blue cheese and a small plate of prawns sauteed in a spicy hot marinara (V. good). Next, you get a salad of a few leaves of high quality romaine lettuce with creamy blue cheese or, you can have a white clam chowder. The main entree is either salmon, new york steak, or braised chicken, comes with sauteed zucchini's and pearl onion. Mashed potato's and a dessert of lava cake or tiramisu. $38.00

I had the NY steak, cooked medium, it was tastey, if a bit skinny at 1/2 inch thick cooked.  The excellent romaine salad comes with four pieces of lettuce with a creamy blue cheese dressing; it was perfection. The mashed potatoes and sauteed zucchini were ok.  

For dessert, I chose their lava cake: it was very chocolately,& moist n' sweet on the inside; it was served with a side of vanilla ice cream drizzled with more chocolate. A sprig of mint leaf added to the sensation.

My friend had the salmon and it looked phat, well over an inch, about 6 inches by 6 inches. She said it was delicious.

Their coffee was very good: black and delicious. 

Decent appetizers, entrees and desserts. I just figure you are paying a very reasonable $33.00 for the food and $5.00 for an excellent water front view, fine linen and silverware. I had to ask for my coffee to get refilled. Ditto for water.

Bathrooms: clean and modern.

Customer service: a bit slow.

Ambience: very nice, trad. American.

Tip: from the BART at Embarcadero, walk upstairs and look for the train tracks and hop on the F Street Car, to Pier 39. Just $2.00

Tip: due to the deluge, we cabbed from Pier 39 to CalTrain at King/4th, it was $12.50 without tip.

excerpts: I got the salmon dish and it exceeded my expectations!
Staff is friendly!
If you are looking for a place to eat at on pier 39 I would recommend this place.
salmon.author: amy s.
salmon.review: Great tourist place to eat. The clam chowder is amazing! I got the salmon dish and it exceeded my expectations! Staff is friendly! If you are looking for a place to eat at on pier 39 I would recommend this place.

excerpts: The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked).
I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either.
salmon.author: Patrick W.
salmon.review:
Hard to believe such a great restaurant in a touristy location. We came on a Monday around Christmas and the wait at lunch was 45 minutes!

The clam chowder was very good - lots of clams, not too many potatoes, nice bacon flavor.

The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked). I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either. The wife ordered the crab salad - also very good: fresh ingredients, lots of crab, not too much dressing.

Service was efficient and friendly. We sat at a table with a fantastic view of Alcatraz.

Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).

excerpts: My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.
salmon.author: R P.
salmon.review:
My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.  

Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.

Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.

I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

excerpts: We had the salmon, chicken, fish and chips and many other items (we were a large party).
We would definitely eat at this restaurant again when we come back to San Francisco.
One more thing the view was amazing!
salmon.author: Angie F.
salmon.review: From the second we walked in our server Meron was extremely professional, she was attentive and engaging with everyone at the table. Meron was knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendation. She was considerate about food allergies at our table. The food was delicious. We had the salmon, chicken, fish and chips and many other items (we were a large party). We would definitely eat at this restaurant again when we come back to San Francisco. One more thing the view was amazing!

excerpts: My fiancee was also able to create his perfect meal there, he got salmon and subbed out his vegetables for rice and mashed potatoes.
We left here very happy, and I have nothing negative to say whatsoever.
salmon.author: Caroleigh N.
salmon.review: When visiting San Francisco, dinner at Fog Harbor is a must. You cannot beat the views of the Bay and the atmosphere. My fiancee and I arrived early (we had a reservation) and were promptly seated. Fresh sourdough bread was brought out with spreadable butter, this is already wonderful in my book considering I was served cold, hard butter the night before at another established. My fiancee ordered a drink, something named "Alcatraz" and I had a sip, it was very good too. The waiter was awesome, he was friendly and accommodating. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl with a caesar salad, you need this combo in your life. At $14, it is a steal. I thought the clam chowder was delicious, mine was heavy on the clam and served piping hot. The caesar salad was super fresh and yummy. My fiancee was also able to create his perfect meal there, he got salmon and subbed out his vegetables for rice and mashed potatoes. We left here very happy, and I have nothing negative to say whatsoever.

excerpts: My wife had the salmon club salad.
The piece of salmon was decent and grilled well, but the rest of the salad was pretty bland with mostly green leafs and little else in the salad.
My son and I had the mixed fish grill, which consisted of a piece of salmon, swordfish and 3 shrimp.
They were grilled well and had decent flavor.
It came with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.
salmon.author: Tim B.
salmon.review:
I took the family here for dinner. If you come here I recommend using your AAA card or downloading the Pier 39 coupon on line to redeem for the free booklet of savings at the welcome center at Pier 39.  This alone saved us over $50 on our dinner and parking.

OK, we started out with appetizers of the Bleu Cheese garlic bread and fried Calamari. The coupon book had the bread for free so we tried it. If you love garlic bread and bleu cheese, this is for you! It was over the top good!!  The calamari was nothing special, but beware as they also add fried onion pieces and jalapeno peppers....  weird,, the calamari was a little soggy  and the sauce was OK.

We all had a cup of their clam chowder.  It was good, had lots of big pieces of clams, thick and good flavor.

My wife had the salmon club salad. The piece of salmon was decent and grilled well, but the rest of the salad was pretty bland with mostly green leafs and little else in the salad.  A club anything should have more of everything,, the dressing was bland.

My daughter had the lobster tail. It was very good, large and meaty. She enjoyed it.

My son and I had the mixed fish grill, which consisted of a piece of salmon, swordfish and 3 shrimp.  They were grilled well and had decent flavor. It came with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Overall, it was OK.

This place does get crowded for dinner, so get there early. The wait for us at 615pm was 30 minutes, not too bad.  Overall, this place is a decent fish house, a little pricey, but the views are worth it.

excerpts: We ordered two Sourdough Chowder Bowls and their Salmon Flatbread.
The former didn't stand out to me, but it's getting increasingly difficult to tell the difference between the dozens [and DOZENS] of chowder-serving locations.
salmon.author: Nicolai D.
salmon.review:
Crowded, with a view.

All along the pier, it's hard to pick out a restaurant that will actually be good for the price you pitch (it's San Francisco, you've got to make every dollar count if you want to make it a few hours). Fog House Fish Harbor was one of our first choices because there wasn't a line in front, and the lobby looked welcoming (albeit overly dressed-up like a hotel, I'm not kidding)

We were seated immediately, but the crowd that occupied the restaurant would be daunting for any staff, and I knew right away that this would take awhile. High over the waterfront on the clear day to see the whole Bay, the view from anywhere in the room was fantastic. But even I got a bit bored waiting for the waiter (I'm hilarious).

We ordered two Sourdough Chowder Bowls and their Salmon Flatbread. The former didn't stand out to me, but it's getting increasingly difficult to tell the difference between the dozens [and DOZENS] of chowder-serving locations. The Flatbread wasn't shabby, but shabby doesn't cut it for $13.00 (it's four triangles...small triangles)

Better places for better prices, but perhaps their crab and lobster put up a better meal's experience. Cheers.

excerpts: The bowl of Clam chowder was good ($10) and the Mixed seafood grill was excellent (salmon, swordfish, shrimp with broccoli and 1/2 rice and 1/2 mashed potatoes - $26)
salmon.author: Angie V.
salmon.review:
This restaurant has the best view of Pier 39 and Alcatraz Island.  They also validate parking for 1 hr (at the parking structure across the street)

The restaurant had an excellent ambiance. The bowl of Clam chowder was good ($10) and the Mixed seafood grill was excellent (salmon, swordfish, shrimp with broccoli and 1/2 rice and 1/2 mashed potatoes - $26)

I'll be back next time :)

excerpts: Got the pumpkin salmon, which was a seasonal dish.
It was pretty good.
salmon.author: Alex M.
salmon.review: Got the pumpkin salmon, which was a seasonal dish. It was pretty good.

excerpts: Food was so delishhhhh esp the a la cart Salmon sliders, I could've ate 6 no lie!!
salmon.author: Meryem E.
salmon.review:
Hubby and I stumbled upon this place. 
We opted for H.H and ended up sitting in the bar area. 

Our bartender/server whipped up a mojito for me despite the fact that they don't offer mojitos during H.H which is understandable- I mean who wants to muddle all of that mint during a busy H.H. 

Service was impeccable- everything was just on point. 

Food was so delishhhhh esp the a la cart Salmon sliders, I could've ate 6 no lie!! 

Crab Louis was ENORMOUS!!  We both shared it and couldn't finish it. 

The view wasn't breathtaking but still nice. 

What I really loved about this place the most was the non-touristy vibe it had and may I mention I spotted Barry Sloan from the ABC Show REVENGE sitting right across from us but I was too much of a chicken to say hi as he was with his family. 


All in all we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!

excerpts: I had the salmon sandwich which was really good!
salmon.author: Camisha C.
salmon.review: Love the sourdough bread!!!!  Khaiman was a great waiter.  Garlic bleu cheese bread is fantastic!   Free if you check-in on Yelp.  My friend had the clam chowder and loved it.  I had the salmon sandwich which was really good!

excerpts: One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.
The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.
Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.
Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.
The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.
salmon.author: Calvin T.
salmon.review:
My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.

We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.

Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.

excerpts: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta.
What I thought was really cute
was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself!
A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood.
The tomato herb broth was really flavorful.
I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth.
So delicious.
My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels.
All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality.
There's no fishy taste to them.
salmon.author: Philana C.
salmon.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is located at Pier 39 on the second level. We came here for Dine About Town 2014 and made reservations about a week in advance to secure a spot for dinner. We had parked in the Pier 39 garage where Fog Harbor would validate 2 hours of parking when after 6pm. We came here on a Saturday night and boy, the whole restaurant was packed! There were even people waiting for seats. When you first enter Fog Harbor, you'll notice that they have a really cozy fireplace area for those who are waiting. We were seated in one of the booths near the window with a nice view of the bay. I wish we came a bit earlier when the sun was setting though.

Food-
Red Curry Steamed Mussels: The PEI mussels were steamed in garlic, onions, peppers, and a coconut curry broth. The coconut curry broth was not too flavorful. I could barely taste the curry flavor. However, these mussels were REALLY fresh. YUM. Definitely, the freshest mussels I have had compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.

Seafood Cioppino: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta. What I thought was really cute was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself! A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood. The tomato herb broth was really flavorful. I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth. So delicious. My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels. All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality. There's no fishy taste to them. My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too. Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta. Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions. They are not skimpy with their seafood. 

Molten Chocolate Cake: The cake was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The cake was REALLY sweet. The ice cream definitely complemented well with the chocolate cake. Unfortunately, the cake didn't have any melted chocolate in it when I cut it open in half. :( 

Our dinner lasted for almost 2 hours! That was pretty surprising but in a good way. :) At the end of the meal, they also provide you Biscoff cookies. Per our waiter, he stated that they are quite delicious when dipped in coffee or milk. The overall service was excellent. The waiter and the manager on duty really made sure that everything was going smoothly and checked up on us. I think this was a successful Dine About Town! :)

excerpts: We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango.
Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake).
They were all delicious.
Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels.
Will definitely come back.
salmon.author: Nacine B.
salmon.review: Just ate here with my friends  for the first time over the weekend. Each  one of us ordered different item so we can try it. We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango. Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake). They were all delicious. Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a combo of excellently seasoned and cooked swordfish and salmon with a side of heavenly steamed broccoli, and rice with some juicy shrimps.
My brother ordered the Surf n Turf which was steak and lobster tail, it was equally as mouth watering as my dish.
For dessert we got the Blondie which was one of most delicious desserts I've had!
With a moist chocolate chip cookie brownie and a scoop of ice cream it was to die for!
Service was wonderful and fast!
They even gave us complimentary clam chowder because of the wait for food.
I would definitely recommend this place!
salmon.author: Joleen T.
salmon.review: This is my favorite seafood joint in town! If you're looking for a nice restaurant to have lunch or dinner at, this is the place! It has a beautiful view of the bay. Food is a little pricy, but not too bad. It's definitely worth the price. I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a combo of excellently seasoned and cooked swordfish and salmon with a side of heavenly steamed broccoli, and rice with some juicy shrimps. My brother ordered the Surf n Turf which was steak and lobster tail, it was equally as mouth watering as my dish. For dessert we got the Blondie which was one of most delicious desserts I've had! With a moist chocolate chip cookie brownie and a scoop of ice cream it was to die for! Service was wonderful and fast! They even gave us complimentary clam chowder because of the wait for food. I would definitely recommend this place!

excerpts: The salmon and swordfish were overcooked, dry, and bland and all of the vegetables that came on the sides were undercooked (seriously, undercooked fingerling potatoes?) except the spinach, which was overcooked.
salmon.author: Jennifer G.
salmon.review:
Yep, "Eek! Methinks not" definitely sums it up...

The in-laws took my husband and me here for his birthday since he wanted seafood at Pier 39 and Fog Harbor had the best Yelp reviews...this is the first time Yelp has steered us oh so very wrong.

As far as the service goes, they started out on the right foot by saying the wait for a table was 45 minutes to an hour and we were seated in 30...it's all downhill from there. For being a busy Saturday night, none of the wait staff had any sense of urgency; the speed with which they walked was like they were window shopping at a mall. The 20 minute wait for water and the 90 minutes we waited for our dinner were testament to that. Also, the waitress was really inefficient and/or did not have a good memory. Any time I eat out I like to ask for anything we need all at once so the waiter/waitress doesn't have to make several trips...our waitress literally brought us one item at a time. Her favorite line was "I'll be right back with that;" yeah, you'll be back in another 10 minutes. Perfect example: the food had finally come out and we asked for drink refills (water, hot water with lemon, and coffee), ketchup, and a crab cracker (which, for some reason, didn't come out with the plate)...3 trips and 20 minutes later, we had everything but the ketchup. It took her so long to bring the cracker for the crab that my mother-in-law ordered that she started breaking into it with her hands, and I never did get ketchup for my fries. Our table did have a nice view, but one of the staff opened the window shade too early and it blinded my father-in-law. He asked if he could lower it again and the guys response was, "It'll just be bright for a couple of minutes" and then walked away. Pretty much all the guests had the same response to the bright light, so a manager lowered them, saying rudely it would just be another 30 seconds and it should have been fine, then proceeded to stand near the table while keeping an eye on his watch. The same guy as the first time came around to open the blinds again and was making rude comments as he worked.

Moving on to the food, I'll start with the good...the clam chowder, shrimp, clams, mussels, and whole crab were actually tasty. Not worth the price-tag they slapped on it, but at least tasty. The calamari was ok, kinda chewy, honestly the lemon aioli it came with was the best part. The salmon and swordfish were overcooked, dry, and bland and all of the vegetables that came on the sides were undercooked (seriously, undercooked fingerling potatoes?) except the spinach, which was overcooked. I ordered the crab roll (sandwich) and the best part about it was the bread, which was a good thing since there was a lot of it.

Just considering the food and service we had while dining here, none of us would rate Fog Harbor very highly...once you throw in the $180 we spent for this lovely experience, we will not only never go back, but would recommend everyone to eat anywhere but here.

excerpts: The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had.
I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like
but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here.
I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back.
To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win!
I was not disappointed.
We had Madison as our server
and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift.
She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable.
It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling.
NOT
Madison
she was great.
salmon.author: Ed K.
salmon.review:
Good eats, not touristy eats... 
Delicious sourdough bread as a starter, ceviche was good, the clam chowder was delicious! The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had. I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here. I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back. To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win! I was not disappointed.  We had Madison as our server and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift. She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable. It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling. NOT Madison she was great.

excerpts: We ordered quite a few entrees that were excellent, the King Salmon which I was told was just wild caught @
salmon.author: Zhang W.
salmon.review:
Came In for lunch on Mothers Day, normally I steer clear from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but had some extended family in town from Beijing and had to show them the sights...and I am so glad I did. At first I was kinda disappointed because we were taken towards the back of the restaurant but the view was still really nice. 

We ordered quite a few entrees that were excellent, the King Salmon which I was told was just wild caught @ Bodega Bay was amazing as was the Shellfish platter for two which the waiter kindly split for us.

The service was outstanding some of the best I've ever experienced I believe his name was Khaiman? He really went above and beyond to make sure we were well taken care of and even spoke a little Mandarin...wow! 

Family in town or not I will be back sooner than later. 

P.S. Locals, this is a family owned business the Simmons family have been bay area from the start.

excerpts: Madison the waitress was awesome and this was the best salmon I've ever had.
With all seriousness
salmon.author: Randall M.
salmon.review: Madison the waitress was awesome and this was the best salmon I've ever had. With all seriousness

excerpts: It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.
Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish.
We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.
When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.
I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.
I'm picky since I make my own mules often
and they did it right.
Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage.
Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be.
We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.
If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.
Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server.
He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.
salmon.author: Chris B.
salmon.review:
My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.  
I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening.
We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.  
When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later. 
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.  
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.  
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish. 
We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.  
When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.  
I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be. 
We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.

excerpts: The king salmon entree was great and their complementary bread was amazing!
My dad had the shrimp salad which he enjoyed but my sister said the crab roll was just okay.
All in all a worthwhile meal!
salmon.author: M C.
salmon.review: Good food! Beautiful views! Service was a little slow but I would go back. I agree with other reviewers that the tuna poke appetizer was just okay. It's good with the sauce that's drizzled around the edge, but all the flavor comes from that sauce. The king salmon entree was great and their complementary bread was amazing! My dad had the shrimp salad which he enjoyed but my sister said the crab roll was just okay. All in all a worthwhile meal!

excerpts: The smoked salmon crostini was very flavorful.
salmon.author: Mandy D.
salmon.review:
Went here for Happy Hour.

Got the Lombard Lemonade. The bartender made it very well. Tasted yummy. I can barely taste the alcohol, but it somewhat creeps up on you (in a good way). 

The calamari was good. Nice, crispy, and filling.
The smoked salmon crostini was very flavorful. 

The view from the window looks out into the water, very beautiful. 
The outside area of the restaurant is very cozy with a fire place.

excerpts: I had the salmon house salad..
it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..
i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..
i didn't even know..and
man I haven't had real bacon for so long
salmon.author: Minerva L.
salmon.review:
I had the salmon house salad..it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..i didn't even know..and man I haven't had real bacon for so long..it taste crunchy..

The dressing was a bit greasy..blah..fat..but it went well with the overall dish. I came here for lunch on a Friday and it wasn't crazy packed. The bread was nothing special..the butter wasn't either..

I really want to try the crab soup next time..the décor is nice enough to get me to come back.

excerpts: The Salmon was also very delicious.
The service was also very good & promt.
To sum it up it the experience was very good & we will definitely be back.
Mike H.
salmon.author: Mike H.
salmon.review:
We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent. Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot. The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth. The Salmon was also very delicious. The service was also very good & promt. To sum it up it the experience was very good & we will definitely be back. 
                                                                 Mike H.

excerpts: We ordered fall special pumpkin curry salmon, and grilled salmon.
Also the shrimp ceviche OMG!
Soooooo good !!!!
salmon.author: Lisa R.
salmon.review: Spectacular food, view and customer service !!! Definitely will be back ! We ordered fall special pumpkin curry salmon, and grilled salmon. Also the shrimp ceviche OMG! Soooooo good !!!!

excerpts: I had the seafood grill with swordfish salmon and shrimp .
Great service and food.
Really a tourist area
and I mean huge tourist area.
Must be a cruise ship close by.
Crazy amount of ppl in the area.
Reservations are recommended .
salmon.author: Rick S.
salmon.review: I really like this place .  I had the seafood grill with swordfish salmon and shrimp .   Great service and food. Really a tourist area and I mean huge tourist area.  Must be a cruise ship close by.   Crazy amount of ppl in the area.   Reservations are recommended .

excerpts: My friends got the lobster mac and cheese, salmon, cippino and fried platter.
Everything was pretty good and the portions are pretty big.
I would definitely come here again.
We parked at 80 francisco parking garage
it's $10 for the full day until 9 pm.
salmon.author: V N.
salmon.review: I usually don't ever come to the Piers because it's super touristy and crowded. The food here is pretty good. I got the Trout and calamari appetizers. My friends got the lobster mac and cheese, salmon, cippino and fried platter. Everything was pretty good and the portions are pretty big. I would definitely come here again. We parked at 80 francisco parking garage it's $10 for the full day until 9 pm.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good.
salmon.author: Floyd A.
salmon.review:
The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.

I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.

My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.

excerpts: Fish was good - salmon.
Very crowded, but service was excellent.
My big problem is the garlic mashed potatoes were instant/fake potatoes.
Also, the Creme brulee was fake!
Creme brulee should be a custard; this dessert was basically vanilla pudding with the crusty glazed top.
salmon.author: Kristi N.
salmon.review:
Fish was good - salmon.Very crowded, but service was excellent.  My big problem is the garlic mashed potatoes were instant/fake potatoes.  Also, the Creme brulee was fake! Creme brulee should be a custard; this dessert was basically vanilla pudding with the crusty glazed top.  When we spend $100 + for 2, I expect real potatoes and dessert.

Having traveled cross country, I was looking forward to a great experience on Pier 39.  This was a disappointing dinner.

excerpts: Excellent drinks and the wild salmon entree is a great recommendation.
Can't wait to come back
salmon.author: Holly M.
salmon.review: Wow... The view here is no joke. Our sever was excellent and the food was fresh and delicately prepared. We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder, both made with their own sourdough. Excellent drinks and the wild salmon entree is a great recommendation. Can't wait to come back

excerpts: Salmon was very good.
Service was prompt.
4 Stars
salmon.author: Dan F.
salmon.review: Chowder excellent!   Crab / Avocado salad delicious.    Salmon was very good.   Service was prompt.    4 Stars

excerpts: The Pumpkin Curry Salmon and Braised Beef Short Rib were spot on delicious.
It's always an enjoyable experience here as not only is the food good, but their entire staff is just so gracious and hospitable.
Thank you!!
salmon.author: Mike H.
salmon.review: Well, we had yet another outstanding meal here at Fog Harbor Fish House. The other night we tried some dishes from their seasonal offerings and they were just outstanding! The Pumpkin Curry Salmon and Braised Beef Short Rib were spot on delicious. It's always an enjoyable experience here as not only is the food good, but their entire staff is just so gracious and hospitable. Thank you!!

excerpts: We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill.
The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye.
The taste was just not over the top.
Absolutely no
wow factor.
I also got the clam chowder.
Again the taste was good but not great.
If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service.
This is your place.
Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.
salmon.author: Gigi H.
salmon.review: Beautiful view of the harbor. The service was  professional and inviting. This trip the food was good but not out of the ordinary. We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill. The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye. The taste was just not over the top. Absolutely no wow factor. I also got the clam chowder. Again the taste was good but not great. If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service. This is your place. Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.

excerpts: The kids had the clam chowder and salmon, yummy.
I had the ahi, it was ok.
Had too much sesame, should have read the description.
I ended it with good sauvignon blanc wine so it was all ok.
salmon.author: Billie B.
salmon.review: Ate here with the family. The appetizers were great - the sliders, calamari and crab legs. Hubby had the ciopino and shrimp, really good. The kids had the clam chowder and salmon, yummy. I had the ahi, it was ok. Had too much sesame, should have read the description. I ended it with good sauvignon blanc wine so it was all ok.

excerpts: My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined.
salmon.author: Marielle S.
salmon.review:
Every time my family and I come up to San Francisco, we always stop by here for a meal. 

Service is excellent!!! Ask for Bong. He's amazing and definitely treats you like family. 

Food. Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious. My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined. I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good. And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to. 

It can get a bit pricey, but you're paying for excellent food and excellent service.

excerpts: My husband had salmon which was equally great.
Everything in SF is really expensive and this restaurant charges the San Francisco mandate tax, like most other SF businesses do.
That adds another 5% tax to their already high sales tax, so be aware of that anywhere in SF that you travel.
I thought the service was very friendly and professional, too.
salmon.author: Nancy C.
salmon.review: There are a lot of restaurant choices on Pier 39. We stayed for 10 days so we had the chance to try quite a few. I thought Fog Harbor was a step up from the other restaurants. It had a more classy feel to it, with more intimate lighting and decor. I ordered the cioppino, which is a fish stew like a bouliabaise - I'm sure my spelling is not correct! - and it was great. My husband had salmon which was equally great. Everything in SF is really expensive and this restaurant charges the San Francisco mandate tax, like most other SF businesses do. That adds another 5% tax to their already high sales tax, so be aware of that anywhere in SF that you travel. I thought the service was very friendly and professional, too.

excerpts: I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.
Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.
The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert.
A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.
salmon.author: Racquel E.
salmon.review: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.

excerpts: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k
with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread
its just that good.
salmon.author: Tommy M.
salmon.review: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k. with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread its just that good.

excerpts: I chose the salmon special (pumpkin coconut curry, spinach, and seared salmon).
More expensive than most of their other dishes, but wonderful.
My husband loved his fish and chips.
Generous portions.
We recommend!
salmon.author: Erin D.
salmon.review: Fantastic food, efficient and gracious service. Clementine was a joy. I chose the salmon special (pumpkin coconut curry, spinach, and seared salmon). More expensive than most of their other dishes, but wonderful. My husband loved his fish and chips. Generous portions. We recommend!

excerpts: I personally had the salmon, swordfish, shrimp, mashed potatoes and veggies.
It was delicious!
After it was all said and done
I think my favorite part was the restaurant tweeted at me.
That was just great.
salmon.author: Will B.
salmon.review:
It's been two years and this place is still amazing. I brought my co-workers here while on a business trip and we had dinner. Considering the place was full and there were 6 of us, they still seated us quickly. We all ordered an assortment of things and the food came quickly. 

The wait staff was wonderful and even when our first server had to leave and we received a second waiter, they never missed a beat! 

I personally had the salmon, swordfish, shrimp, mashed potatoes and veggies. It was delicious! After it was all said and done I think my favorite part was the restaurant tweeted at me. That was just great.

excerpts: We ordered the black cod, salmon and clam pasta.
All very well prepared and extremely fresh!
salmon.author: Ann C.
salmon.review: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner as we watched the sunset on the bay. Very beautiful!! Our waiter Samir was very funny and prompt with all of our requests. The seafood tower was very fresh and delicious. Must try if you like raw oysters, shrimp and crabs. We ordered the black cod, salmon and clam pasta. All very well prepared and extremely fresh!

excerpts: I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious.
The bread bowl clam chowder was good
but I had better at Boston Chowder.
Next time you go to Pier 39 I hope you can try Fog Harbor.
salmon.author: Anthony C.
salmon.review:
A review written by a 9 year-old: At Pier 39, I dined at Fog Harbor.  Sitting by the window, with a view of the ocean, was a great experience. The service was prompt and courteous. The food was tasty and they had an extensive kid's menu. I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious. The bread bowl clam chowder was good but I had better at Boston Chowder. Next time you go to Pier 39 I hope you can try Fog Harbor.  I recommend Fog Harbor for your family. 

Note from Parent: If you get you're your reservations through Open Table then you will get a surprise treat. There is also a 15% to 20% off coupons at California Welcome Center at Pier 39 with/without your AAA card.

excerpts: Sword fish, salmon and shrimp.
Nice combination.
Tasty.
Very nice harbour view.
salmon.author: Mike M.
salmon.review: Mixed Grill. Sword fish, salmon and shrimp. Nice combination. Tasty. Very nice harbour view.

excerpts: Then our entrees arrived,  my grilled salmon was fresh and delicious with roasted vegetables but my husband did not enjoy his fish and chips, he said it had no flavor and he would not order that again.
Food at surrounding tables looked really good and people seemed to enjoy their meals.
The nearby table had a red chili shrimp appetizer that looked delicious although it  would be too hot and spicy for us .
Service was excellent and friendly from all staff.
We were happy we ate here and we will definitely return especially for the chowder.
It was a beautiful  sunny, warm  day on the Bay and this was a great choice for dinner.
salmon.author: Catherine D.
salmon.review:
Perfect view at sunset, perfect timing for the perfect table. We had enjoyed a sunny day on the Bay and decided to stop here for a bowl of clam chowder. This was our first time at this Pier 39 restaurant and we enjoyed the clam chowder which was one of the best with alot of clams that had a nice flavor and it was  perfectly prepared, not tough nor rubbery. Also, we enjoyed the crab cakes as an appetizer. Then our entrees arrived,  my grilled salmon was fresh and delicious with roasted vegetables but my husband did not enjoy his fish and chips, he said it had no flavor and he would not order that again. Food at surrounding tables looked really good and people seemed to enjoy their meals. The nearby table had a red chili shrimp appetizer that looked delicious although it  would be too hot and spicy for us . Service was excellent and friendly from all staff. We were happy we ate here and we will definitely return especially for the chowder.
It was a beautiful  sunny, warm  day on the Bay and this was a great choice for dinner.

excerpts: *Salmon BLT:
Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli.
~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had.
You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more.
salmon.author: Rebekah T.
salmon.review:
If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.

Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.

I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the: 

*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good.
*Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish. 
*Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich. 

When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing. 

I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!

excerpts: My boyfriend had the salmon that was stuffed with crab.
We were given a bowl of bread which was so good
and I almost ate all of it until I remembered that I was also getting bread with my meal.
Of course the bread bowl was delicious, and my boyfriends salmon was amazing!
The salmon wasn't dried out, and the crab was fantastic.
salmon.author: Alicia Q.
salmon.review:
Honestly, when I first looked at the number of stars this restaurant had, and that it had two dollar signs, I was a little hesitant because we already spent some money that day, and we didn't want to splurge for lunch/dinner.  I went to the Welcome Center, showed them my AAA card, and picked up the coupon book which offered 2 hrs of validated parking and 20% off at Fog Harbor Fish House, and a few other restaurants. Since we had the 20% off, we decided to try this place! And I'm SO glad that we did.  

We arrived around 2:30 and were seated right away.  There was a good amount of people in there, but it wasn't busy.  I loved the front entrance because it was very peaceful and elegant.  Once seated, I knew I wanted a Bread Bowl because that is what was highly recommended on Yelp (and it was only $9).  My boyfriend had the salmon that was stuffed with crab.  We were given a bowl of bread which was so good and I almost ate all of it until I remembered that I was also getting bread with my meal.  The view was gorgeous outside our window.    

My boyfriend ordered a chardonnay, and I want to say that it was the floor manager who helped him pick one out.  He was very knowledgable and helpful, and knew exactly what he was talking about.  We ordered the calamari for an appetizer.  This was a FULL plate too, it wasn't just a few pieces.  They really were generous, and it was delicious.  Our food arrived about 10 minutes after we got the appetizers.  Of course the bread bowl was delicious, and my boyfriends salmon was amazing!  The salmon wasn't dried out, and the crab was fantastic.  

The service is also good here.  The waiter checked up on us and had no problem when I gave him the coupon.  He also validated our parking which we didn't need (because you can't combine the 2 hr validation with 1hr of restaurant), but he did anyways!  

Also, one more thing:  my boyfriend and I have also eaten at crab house which is right next door.  And we loved that place as well, but if you want to save some money, you get quality food at a lower price at Fog Harbor!  We will definitely be coming here again soon.

excerpts: My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT.
salmon.author: Ford S.
salmon.review:
When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT. 

The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

excerpts: so I could get fresh salmon and enjoy the quinoa salad base.
The salmon with the quinoa based salad had the right amount if citrus, spice and flavor that I was looking for.
salmon.author: M V.
salmon.review:
Excellent customer service - right from the get go. Came here at 915 pm on a Saturday with kids under 8.

Khaiman was our server. He went the extra mile to make sure we had an excellent experience. 

He had an opinion on the drinks and the entrees an suggested a few changes so I could get fresh salmon and enjoy the quinoa salad base. A little mix and match not listed on the menu.

When I mentioned something about the Moscow mule - he added extra lime to get it right - as I wanted it.

When we wanted some rice instead of the ordered fries - he went ahead and got that.

Finally kept checking to make sure we felt very appreciated

The salmon with the quinoa based salad had the right amount if citrus, spice and flavor that I was looking for. The sole was also very well prepared.

They have grilled seafood for kids instead of only fried options. That is a big plus for us.

All in all a much richer experience compared to some of the other places we visited.

Absolutely worth the 15 min wait and the AAA discount also helps.

Highly recommend the place and would visit it the next time we visit Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes.
salmon.author: Lilie D.
salmon.review:
My boyfriend and I went here (after reading some reviews on Yelp!) for a nice lunch on the waterfront on our recent trip through San Francisco. I was looking for some high quality, fresh seafood and this place prides themselves on their sustainable seafood selection!  First they seated us at a table away from the windows and when asked, quickly and politely got us a nice booth instead with a view of the water and sights. 

Service was nothing short of great: a prompt, courteous waiter who didn't hover but brought us our drinks and complimentary fresh-baked sourdough bread with butter and tended to our needs unobtrusively.

Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces. My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions. I expected some mixed veggies at least! 

All in all a great meal and experience! No wonder they get such great reviews! MUCH better than a generic Joe's Crab Shack experience any day!!!

excerpts: The food we ordered (the Fish & Chips, the Clam Chowder, the Kids grilled salmon) were all fantastic.
The view was nice, the service was good, and the prices were to be as expected.
I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here, but I sure wouldn't turn it down if in the neighborhood.
salmon.author: Reza S.
salmon.review:
Yes, it is a touristy restaurant in an extremely touristy area. However, even tourists like to eat well. 
The food we ordered (the Fish & Chips, the Clam Chowder, the Kids grilled salmon) were all fantastic. The view was nice, the service was good, and the prices were to be as expected. I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here, but I sure wouldn't turn it down if in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Salmon plate
calamari
bread  everything.
The restaurant is clean and the view is gorgeous!!!
Our server (the black guy with the gold earrings) was so awesome, he was attentive and fast and had a great sense of humor but still managed to be perfectly discrete at the same time.
Great place!!
Thank you guys!!!
salmon.author: Rachel D.
salmon.review: I'm from south Orange County and I wish this place was close to me!  The food was great! Salmon plate  calamari  bread  everything.  The restaurant is clean and the view is gorgeous!!! Our server (the black guy with the gold earrings) was so awesome, he was attentive and fast and had a great sense of humor but still managed to be perfectly discrete at the same time.  Great place!! Thank you guys!!!

excerpts: Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread).
Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through.
Plusses:
salmon.author: Jonathan G.
salmon.review: Agreed tourist trap. Acclaimed clam chowder does not have much flavor and clams are lacking. Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering. Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread). Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through. Plusses: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great. Servers were also attentive and courteous.

excerpts: their salmon.....
Ohhhh their salmon, it was delicious!!!!
I loved it!
Side veggies and potatoes were just okay, but they're not the main focus anyway.
salmon.author: Megan E.
salmon.review: Fog harbor was really really good, I'm reluctant to give a full 5 stars usually, especially to a touristy restaurant, but I really enjoyed this. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino. I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and their salmon..... Ohhhh their salmon, it was delicious!!!! I loved it! Side veggies and potatoes were just okay, but they're not the main focus anyway. The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there.... All in all, very delicious. I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch... It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.

excerpts: I had the salmon it was cooked perfect and was very good.
My friend had the Ahi, the sauce that it was served with was amazing.
My friend and I were in our own little world laughing and having a great time the atmosphere seemed to suit us.
We were here on 2/19/15 @8:30pm.
salmon.author: Sarah E.
salmon.review: 1st thing I want to say was our waiter Michael was the best, very engage and helpful with all or food a drink choices as well as just being friendly.  We started with the blue cheese bread (yum) and crab cakes. I had the salmon it was cooked perfect and was very good. My friend had the Ahi, the sauce that it was served with was amazing. My friend and I were in our own little world laughing and having a great time the atmosphere seemed to suit us. We were here on 2/19/15 @8:30pm.

excerpts: The clam chowder was great and the mixed grill had great salmon, swordfish and shrimp.
Our server Tyler took great care of us!!
salmon.author: Dustin J.
salmon.review: The clam chowder was great and the mixed grill had great salmon, swordfish and shrimp. Our server Tyler took great care of us!!

excerpts: The portions were decent, except for the most expensive entree of the night -- Crab-stuffed Salmon -- at $33.
Service was excellent; otherwise, I would have given them three-stars.
Overall, a little spendy for what you got, but it is on Pier 39.
salmon.author: Jason H.
salmon.review: We were seated promptly via our Yelp/Open Table reservation. All dishes were presented well. The lettuce of the Crab Louis looked like it could have been fresher. The portions were decent, except for the most expensive entree of the night -- Crab-stuffed Salmon -- at $33. Service was excellent; otherwise, I would have given them three-stars. Overall, a little spendy for what you got, but it is on Pier 39.

excerpts: /o had the kids salmon and cleaned his plate.
salmon.author: Kenneth C.
salmon.review: Touristy? By association to Pier 39 anywhere near would be. That's not the feel inside; classy and clean. All staff we encountered were friendly and engaging. Pierre, our server, was patient and attentive. Good service was fast and well portioned. Price was reasonable and food was good. wife had California Crab Salad and it was mostly crab and very tasty. 10 y/o had the kids salmon and cleaned his plate.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo.
Overall, the food was just okay.
Service wasn't too great either.
salmon.author: Micah Anne M.
salmon.review: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.

excerpts: We had salmon club salad and swordfish, both were amazing.
salmon.author: Steve S.
salmon.review: Very well run restaurant with great service and great food. We had salmon club salad and swordfish, both were amazing.

excerpts: Food was excellent suggest the salmon blt, crab clam chowder, and crab avocado Caesar
salad thanks
Madison
salmon.author: Michelle L.
salmon.review: Beautiful view. Short wait for our bachelorette group with no reservation. Food was excellent suggest the salmon blt, crab clam chowder, and crab avocado Caesar salad thanks Madison

excerpts: I ordered the King Salmon, I was expecting it to be dry and overcooked - I've had it served to me that way at even fine dining restaurants - but it was perfectly made here... pretty damn good!
We had the clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, and some moscow mule drinks too.
Great experience.
I'm looking forward to coming back!
salmon.author: Mel L.
salmon.review: This spot is good! I took my girlfriend, now Fiance, here on the night I proposed to her... last week! I like how the menu changes seasonally and that they do their part to create sustainable seafood dishes. I ordered the King Salmon, I was expecting it to be dry and overcooked - I've had it served to me that way at even fine dining restaurants - but it was perfectly made here... pretty damn good! We had the clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, and some moscow mule drinks too. Great experience. I'm looking forward to coming back!

excerpts: We had clam chowder w/crab, fresh Alaskan salmon and halibut, and our server brought a complimentary dessert for my husband's birthday.
Ask for Madison -- one of the planet's best and most fun servers.
Nice area with fireplace/sofas to wait for a table.
They'll validate your parking ticket.
salmon.author: Karen M.
salmon.review: Yes, in Pier 39, one of the best seafood restaurants in the city! Gorgeous bay view, comfy big booths, unbelievably friendly staff. We had clam chowder w/crab, fresh Alaskan salmon and halibut, and our server brought a complimentary dessert for my husband's birthday. Ask for Madison -- one of the planet's best and most fun servers. Nice area with fireplace/sofas to wait for a table. They'll validate your parking ticket.

excerpts: If I had realized my salmon sandwich came with fries, I would have upgraded to sweet potato.
Blackened salmon was a nice option.
Half my sandwich was leftover and still good the next day, cold.
Our drinks were just okay.
We didn't stay for dessert.
If you go, insist on a seat with a view.
salmon.author: Karin W.
salmon.review:
This restaurant looks good on the surface. Sustainable fish (hooray! A priority for me), amazing view of Alcatraz, nice decor, and a tasty sounding menu. However, many of the items we ordered were mildly disappointing. 
Our starters, chili lime shrimp salad and (on special) crab ceviche with mango and avocado, were bizarrely similar just with different protein. The ceviche was served on lettuce, drizzled with the same salad dressing which was mildly mustardy and didn't go with the dish. Also, while the amount of crab was decent, it actually seems skimpy on the mango, avocado, and lime. Definitely missing a ceviche sort of flavor, but it was a tasty pile of shredded crab meat. Both starters also had the same house made tortilla chips, just in different shapes. 
My husband liked his crab roll sandwich, and the sweet potato fries that came with it were good. If I had realized my salmon sandwich came with fries, I would have upgraded to sweet potato. Blackened salmon was a nice option. Half my sandwich was leftover and still good the next day, cold. 
Our drinks were just okay. We didn't stay for dessert. If you go, insist on a seat with a view.

excerpts: Son loved his grilled salmon.
I had crab cakes which were pretty good.
They obviously had panko in them but no lumps of crab which was disappointing.
This is why they lost a star.
I should take off two but everything else was good even the service.
salmon.author: Carol C.
salmon.review: Great spot at Pier 39. My kids love seafood and begged to go here for lunch. Didn't see the kids menu so we expected to be ripped off. However, it wasn't bad at all. Kids menu came with the usual crayons and good seafood selection. Son loved his grilled salmon. I had crab cakes which were pretty good. They obviously had panko in them but no lumps of crab which was disappointing. This is why they lost a star.  I should take off two but everything else was good even the service.

excerpts: Here is where it went unfavorable: ordered the clam chowder bowl and the salmon blt.
When a waitress brought the clam chowder it was in a bread bowl.
By the time we realized and said, "Excuse me..." she had just dropped it on the table and left rather abruptly.
They later brought the bowl that we ordered.
When the salmon blt arrived, I looked and noticed...
When the salmon blt arrived, I looked and noticed...
hot dog, no salmon wtf?!
I was borderline insulted by this and asked the waitress, "What is this??
She was nice and was surprised as well and took the order back.
The cook manager (?) eventually brought the salmon blt, but by then I was sort of full eating some of my wife's fish n chips.
The cook manager (?) eventually brought the salmon blt, but by then I was sort of full eating some of my wife's fish n chips.
I still give it three stars as the salmon blt was actually pretty good and they comp'd my order.
Just wish they had their act together back there in the kitchen...
I still give it three stars as the salmon blt was actually pretty good and they comp'd my order.
Just wish they had their act together back there in the kitchen...
salmon.author: ryan o.
salmon.review: Sad to say, I need to write a slightly negative review for the first time. This place is very nice, clean and has a great view. Here is where it went unfavorable: ordered the clam chowder bowl and the salmon blt. When a waitress brought the clam chowder it was in a bread bowl. By the time we realized and said, "Excuse me..." she had just dropped it on the table and left rather abruptly. They later brought the bowl that we ordered. When the salmon blt arrived, I looked and noticed...hot dog, no salmon wtf?! I was borderline insulted by this and asked the waitress, "What is this??" She was nice and was surprised as well and took the order back. The cook manager (?) eventually brought the salmon blt, but by then I was sort of full eating some of my wife's fish n chips. I still give it three stars as the salmon blt was actually pretty good and they comp'd my order. Just wish they had their act together back there in the kitchen...

excerpts: I ordered salmon, which was served on a bed of peppers, leafy greens, and fingerling potatoes.
It was priced at $32 that day, but well worth the cost!
Didn't end up ordering dessert, but everything looked excellent.
Great if you're looking for something a little more special but nothing too fancy!
Definitely would recommend this restaurant.
salmon.author: Emily F.
salmon.review: Came here for the first time after a tour of Alcatraz. Our waitress, Madison, politely informed us that she was new and a little rusty, but did a superb job! She was extremely friendly, but also very professional and efficient. The dining experience was above par. They serve you San Francisco's popular sourdough bread to start, which is a big plus. Additionally, we ordered calamari to start, which was served with a really excellent lemon sauce. Although it was very busy while we were there, we were served our entrees promptly. I ordered salmon, which was served on a bed of peppers, leafy greens, and fingerling potatoes. It was priced at $32 that day, but well worth the cost! Didn't end up ordering dessert, but everything looked excellent. Great if you're looking for something a little more special but nothing too fancy! Definitely would recommend this restaurant.

excerpts: We had dinner here, I got the King Salmon and my husband got the swordfish.
We LOVED IT!!
You must try these dishes, so much flavor and the fish is local so it just looks and tastes so fresh.
I highly suggest you try this place, the staff is so friendly and it's a large restaurant, don't let the entrance fool you it curves around the back of the pier.
Very clean
and we didn't wait long at all for our food (maybe 15 minutes).
ENJOY!
Wish we had something like this back home.
salmon.author: J P.
salmon.review: Okay, so this place is not cheap but you WILL NOT REGRET IT.  We had dinner here, I got the King Salmon and my husband got the swordfish.  We LOVED IT!!  You must try these dishes, so much flavor and the fish is local so it just looks and tastes so fresh.  I highly suggest you try this place, the staff is so friendly and it's a large restaurant, don't let the entrance fool you it curves around the back of the pier.  Very clean and we didn't wait long at all for our food (maybe 15 minutes).  ENJOY!  Wish we had something like this back home.

excerpts: The mixed fish grill was very flavorful, especially the salmon.
I recommend it for everyone, specially people who like light seafood.
salmon.author: Anupam M.
salmon.review: Excellent shrimp, specially the chili shrimp. The bread was fresh and well cooked. The mixed fish grill was very flavorful, especially the salmon. I recommend it for everyone, specially people who like light seafood.

excerpts: a palm sized piece of grilled salmon, and a palm sized piece of sword fish, topped with brocolli and wild rice).
salmon.author: James L.
salmon.review:
Love this place. Visiting SF for the first time and found this on Yelp. 

Food was inexpensive and tasty.
