Starters: $16 place of two pieces of crab cake. Massive serving around 150g each. 

Main: $23 for a huge plate of mixed grill seafood (prawn skewer, a palm sized piece of grilled salmon, and a palm sized piece of sword fish, topped with brocolli and wild rice). 

Value for money! Highly recommended.

excerpts: Kids salmon meal excellent value.
salmon.author: Khalid N.
salmon.review:
A huge expectation beater. Really touristy area, so our expectations were low for good food. Had some great chowder an amazing bread. Also got a blueberry cocktail that was super refreshing. Most impressive was our waiter (Khaiman). He was super warm and friendly and made us feel like we were on home soil.  Loved that all of it was sustainable too. This place just hit all the right notes.

Great second experience. The highlight remains chowder and bread and view...and awesome service. Get there 11:30 or sooner, or you'll hit a wait. Skip the crab. Garlic bread yummy. Kids salmon meal excellent value.

excerpts: We had the kids and they had the salmon which tasted very good and the $0.95 sundae was
salmon.author: Jason N.
salmon.review:
A more solid 3.5 stars but I gave it a bonus 1/2 star.  

Service was excellent 5 stars.  We were very well attended to the entire time.  

We had the 1/2 crab Louis w/sub for blue cheese which was a nice side salad for 2 if you're not too hungry.  The dressing is one of the best I've had.  Cheesy and creamy just like my grandfather used to make!  Forget the Louis dressing and go for the blue cheese!

We also had the sliders which were pretty average and overpriced.  I wouldn't order them again.

The crab sandwich was excellent.  Bread was freshly made and the crab filling was delicious.

We had the kids and they had the salmon which tasted very good and the $0.95 sundae was a can't miss

Overall a really good experience.

excerpts: For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns).
Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh.
All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky.
The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious.
salmon.author: Luke R.
salmon.review:
Looking for a restaurant in the Wharf that wasn't a total tourist trap, but would satisfy my lady's desire for seafood, I found Fog Harbor through Yelp. We weren't disappointed.

The food was excellent, and service was stellar throughout. Our waitress was attentive without being a hovering presence, and took care of everything from corkage (it's only $12; you might do well to bring your own bottle) to dessert recommendations (more on this later--holycarp). When we asked for more lemon, she brought a plate of six nicely arranged wedges. 

We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl, which we shared. It was, as others have noted, creamy, full of clams, and not too salty. Of course you must not only dip the small wedge-shaped bread top, but also eat as much of the bread bowl as you can handle without jeopardizing your ability to put away dessert. 

Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces. Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before. Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start. The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.

For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns). Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh. All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky. The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious. If I must pick a gripe, I'd take issue with the mixed vegetables--they were overcooked (to my taste; some of the zucchini strips were completely soggy) and unimaginative, though still a step up from the simply steamed carrot, cauliflower and broccoli you'd find at many common seafood joints. 

The dessert tray offered some interesting selections alongside a couple old standbys. In addition to the expected creme brulee and apple crisp, there was a pumpkin bread pudding, some kind of individually baked chocolate cake, and a pumpkin cheesecake. My girlfriend is currently obsessed with pumpkin to what's likely an unhealthy degree, so we got the cheesecake. Moreover, our waitress said it was to die for. She never lied--eating it was like biting into the spiced flesh of an angel, only sweeter and less sacrilegious.  

Two appetizers, two entrees, corkage fee and dessert came to just over $100. You can easily pay more for less in the heart of San Francisco's #1 tourist trap. If you're not on a budget, and you want to enjoy some well-prepared seafood with minimal frills and gimmicks, you might give Fog Harbor a try. We left thoroughly stuffed, and very happy.

PS: Parking is $7/hr in the nearby Pier 39 garage, but dinner will get you 2 hours free if you remember to validate (NB: I did not remember to validate).

excerpts: He said that everything on it was excellent but the salmon blew him away.
My mom had the fish and chips and it was a solid, well-done version of fish and chips.
My brother ordered the garlic crab which was outstanding... as was everything else on his plate (like the corn and potatoes).
I ordered one of the specials - a pesto halibut that was phenomenal.
salmon.author: Beth G.
salmon.review:
Dude.  This place is legit.

I have a foodie family and we were on vacation when we tried out Fog Harbor.  Being a foodie family, we tried many excellent restaurants, but Fog Harbor was FAR AND AWAY the best meal of our vacation.  So so good.

We started with the grilled artichoke appetizer with the crab dip and it was... amazing.  Then our meals came out.  My dad ordered the Mixed Grill dish.  He said that everything on it was excellent but the salmon blew him away.  My mom had the fish and chips and it was a solid, well-done version of fish and chips.  My brother ordered the garlic crab which was outstanding... as was everything else on his plate (like the corn and potatoes).  I ordered one of the specials - a pesto halibut that was phenomenal.  Great flavors.

It was such a wonderful meal that we were nervous to get dessert, fearing that we might end on a clunker.  Our waitress assured us, though, that the desserts where worth trying and so we ordered the chocolate banana bread pudding.  The waitress was so right... that dessert was... INCREDIBLE.  It was so good, we were trying to figure out if we could go back there and get another one as an afternoon snack before we leave town.  

Oh, and the atmosphere is lovely, the view is pretty nice depending on where you sit, and the service was fantastic.

Seriously.  If you're on Pier 39... go here.  It is a divine blessing.

excerpts: Seasonal special pumpkin salmon, to die for!
salmon.author: Cheri L.
salmon.review: We came in on a whim while spending a weekend in San Francisco and were amazed at the fabulous food. Seasonal special pumpkin salmon, to die for!

excerpts: I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well.
The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it.
The service was great as well.
We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times.
I will definitely be back again!
salmon.author: Lauren C.
salmon.review: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!

excerpts: We had the king Salmon and a seared Tuna and both were cooked to the correct temperature, in addition to being good quality fish.
I ordered an 8oz glass of wine and was very satisfied: the wine was in very good condition (i.e. opened recently), it was a very good wine, and the amount was generous.
salmon.author: Bacco D.
salmon.review: Excellent dining spot overlooking the Bay Area. Some of the tables have great views. The food is very good. We had the king Salmon and a seared Tuna and both were cooked to the correct temperature, in addition to being good quality fish. I ordered an 8oz glass of wine and was very satisfied: the wine was in very good condition (i.e. opened recently), it was a very good wine, and the amount was generous.

excerpts: The salmon was the freshest I have ever tasted.
Madison was the best waitress ever!
Over the top service!
salmon.author: Peyton M.
salmon.review: Delicious!  The salmon was the freshest I have ever tasted.  Madison was the best waitress ever!  Over the top service!

excerpts: Their seasonal dishes, pumpkin-curry salmon and braised short ribs, were extremely delicious.
It is rare to find such a good restaurant in a touristy area, but this one goes above and beyond.
salmon.author: Brandon H.
salmon.review: Stopped by yesterday night for dinner with the family. Their seasonal dishes, pumpkin-curry salmon and braised short ribs, were extremely delicious. It is rare to find such a good restaurant in a touristy area, but this one goes above and beyond.

excerpts: Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth.
salmon.author: Abby W.
salmon.review:
Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service. 

We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...

Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.

excerpts: Had the Tuna poke, cup of clam chowder and the freshest salmon ever!
Also tried cable car, gimlet and margarita.
Everything was prepared extremely well and served quickly.
The place is crowded and you should expect a wait, but it is worth it.
Waiter was new, but really hustled.
Will certainly be back.
salmon.author: Craig D.
salmon.review: The yelpers are right this place is really good both in food and service.   Had the Tuna poke, cup of clam chowder and the freshest salmon ever!  Also tried cable car, gimlet and margarita.  Everything was prepared extremely well and served quickly.   The place is crowded and you should expect a wait, but it is worth it.  Waiter was new, but really hustled.  Will certainly be back.

excerpts: The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.
They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.
salmon.author: Doug K.
salmon.review: Great food.  The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.  They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.

excerpts: Nice seat overlooking the water (although the windows needed to be cleaned) with some very good to great sea food (halibut, sole, salmon).
salmon.author: Nick F.
salmon.review: Nice seat overlooking the water (although the windows needed to be cleaned) with some very good to great sea food (halibut, sole, salmon).

excerpts:
calamari was delicate but too bland
Salmon over beets and brussel sprouts hearty dish excellent 
Apple crisp very good - esp light caramel sauce over high quality vanilla ice cream

by far was the customer service that was impressive
my salmon was supposed to have sauce on the side- cook made it with sauce on top but Ashlie caught it before it even got to us and made them redo it
salmon.author: Win H.
salmon.review:
kid friendly white table cloth restaurant with incredible views
Amazing customer service from the hostess to our server Ashlie to the manager who came by to check on our meal
felt great eating at a place that values sustainable seafood and right across from the aquarium by the bay!

Fried shrimp and fried fish were ok
calamari was delicate but too bland
Salmon over beets and brussel sprouts hearty dish excellent 
Apple crisp very good - esp light caramel sauce over high quality vanilla ice cream

by far was the customer service that was impressive
my salmon was supposed to have sauce on the side- cook made it with sauce on top but Ashlie caught it before it even got to us and made them redo it
That process made our wait time a lot longer for food. manager came by and offered a discount for us! Ashlie meanwhile made sure we had plenty of warm fresh bread - even before we finished the first loaf.
thank you - what a great place in the midst of a big tourist trap with incredible service

excerpts: I was interested in Salmon but they only serve farm raised.

Prices aren't cheap, and I think for an expensive seafood lunch you're better off at McCormick and Kuleto's in Ghirardelli Square, which I'm no big fan of but their food is a notch above and the view is beautiful there too....
salmon.author: Gwynnie P.
salmon.review:
The 3 stars are kind of for the view. The food is nothing remarkable, but you could do worse around Pier 39. I've had lunch a few times at Fog Harbor...today I had a Caesar Salad which was pretty good, and Fried Calamari which was good enough but arrived cold. 

I was interested in Salmon but they only serve farm raised. Prices aren't cheap, and I think for an expensive seafood lunch you're better off at McCormick and Kuleto's in Ghirardelli Square, which I'm no big fan of but their food is a notch above and the view is beautiful there too....

excerpts: Then i got the smoked salmon with a cup of clam chowder.
Salmon was good but not memorable.
But clam chowder was really good too.
Wish i lived in SF just to be able to go here more often.
salmon.author: Kyle T.
salmon.review: What a nice resturant. Started off with a great bloody mary. Def one of my top 5 fav bloody marys. Then i ordered some oysters. And man they were great. So clean and a great vinegar sauce along with hot sauce put them in my top 5 fav oysters. Which i knew what kind they where (waiter did not say). Then i got the smoked salmon with a cup of clam chowder. Salmon was good but not memorable. But clam chowder was really good too. Wish i lived in SF just to be able to go here more often.

excerpts: It included shrimp, Salmon, and Swordfish.
Tasted great.
My girlfriend got some delicious crab cakes which I happily sampled too.
Where we sat we got a nice view of Alcatraz and the window was slightly open, letting in some cool air.
I did notice most of the people sitting near us as international tourists.
The table next to us was French (know some of the language) and they ordered the Maine lobster.
They were waiting for an hour at least.
We left and they still did not have their food.
salmon.author: Tone A.
salmon.review: Walked in with a California hoodie and SF Giants hat. Knew this was a bit more upscale by looking at the other diners and the table setup. But not worries, as more tourist came in after we did. I ordered the Grilled Everything. It included shrimp, Salmon, and Swordfish. Tasted great. My girlfriend got some delicious crab cakes which I happily sampled too. Where we sat we got a nice view of Alcatraz and the window was slightly open, letting in some cool air. I did notice most of the people sitting near us as international tourists. The table next to us was French (know some of the language) and they ordered the Maine lobster. They were waiting for an hour at least. We left and they still did not have their food.

excerpts: For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli.
I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down!
Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything.
salmon.author: Nate R.
salmon.review:
Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!

To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.

My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.

Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.

No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.

excerpts: I had the wild salmon, and it was incredible.
I am a huge salmon fan, and this was the best I have ever had.
It's served over a bed or arugula, fingerling potatoes and crispy onions.
It's delightful.
The dinner was satisfying but not heavy, so we had room for dessert.
We split the tiramisu.
It was delectable.
The wait staff was highly attentive throughout the dinner and very friendly.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant for your time in SF.
salmon.author: Kristen G.
salmon.review: Some may write this restaurant off as it's located in the heart of tourism town at Pier 39, but don't judge it so quickly. The food here is amazing. Upon arrival we were quickly seated at a nice table with a great view. Shortly after we received a delicious amuse-bouche as a thank you for making a reservation. It was rock shrimp with aioli -- delicious. I had the wild salmon, and it was incredible. I am a huge salmon fan, and this was the best I have ever had. It's served over a bed or arugula, fingerling potatoes and crispy onions. It's delightful. The dinner was satisfying but not heavy, so we had room for dessert. We split the tiramisu. It was delectable. The wait staff was highly attentive throughout the dinner and very friendly. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for your time in SF.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.
It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco.
Waitress was very nice.
Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.
salmon.author: Nick L.
salmon.review: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp. It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco. Waitress was very nice. Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful.
salmon.author: Winnie T.
salmon.review:
I came here per the suggestion of my roommate who works as a hostess there because she always would recap to me all the delicious food she ate that day with eyes wide and everything, so I finally got the chance to  try it.

First off, let me just say the ambiance of the place is very...ritzy. The restaurant itself is beautiful--definitely a place to wine and dine someone special with a beautiful view of the bay (*hint hint* guys!). The servers are friendly and attentive, and they made sure my water glass was never left empty.

I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco. They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab. The ahi tuna was okay--I didn't really care for the seared tuna; it was a little dry but the sesame poke with the wonton chips was delicious to snack on. 

I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful. I didn't care too much for the prawns though.

Finally, I had the lava cake for dessert, and this is where the 5 star acclaim comes from. The chocolate lava cake was the BEST cake I have ever had. Drizzeled with a heap of warm gooey fudge and served with vanilla ice cream, each bite was a taste of what heaven should taste like. They could have served me dirt for the main course and this cake for dessert and I probably would have still been happy. 

All in all, this restaurant was a pleasant dining experience. The prices are a bit steep but a seafood restaurant at the wharf with a view overlooking the bay will cost you a shiny penny.

excerpts: - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari.
They are all GREAT!
salmon.author: Evette B.
salmon.review: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!

excerpts: Great atmosphere and fantastic salmon.
Thumbs up!
salmon.author: Kyle B.
salmon.review: The blonde bartender was helpful and very knowledgable. Great atmosphere and fantastic salmon. Thumbs up!

excerpts: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great!
The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid.
The dessert was delicious.
Prices are a bit high but still affordable.
salmon.author: Diana R.
salmon.review: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great! The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid. The dessert was delicious. Prices are a bit high but still affordable.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp.
All perfectly cooked!
salmon.author: Kari D.
salmon.review:
MMMmmmm! I loved my dinner. I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp. All perfectly cooked! I ate every bit. 

Great view, and good wine. The clam chowder was not good...I got a mouthful of sand. Also, expected to pay more for five people, that was a pleasant surprise!!

excerpts: I had the grilled seafood platter, salmon, halibut,  and shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes.
wonderful!
We had drinks and all of us were very happy with the food and service.
We would highly recommend.
Great views of the bay.
salmon.author: Brenda H.
salmon.review: We arrived at the restaurant for my birthday.  We had made reservations and we seat promptly. the service was great and the food was wonderful.  I had the grilled seafood platter, salmon, halibut,  and shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes.  wonderful!  We had drinks and all of us were very happy with the food and service.  We would highly recommend.  Great views of the bay.

excerpts: I had the salmon and it was seasoned well and delicious.
salmon.author: Lisa S.
salmon.review: Madison was the best! Food was great!  I had the salmon and it was seasoned well and delicious.

excerpts: I ordered the Salmon BLT which I liked, but the bread could have been toasted a bit more.
My family really enjoyed the steak and the seafood pasta as well as the clam chowder.
The clam chowder had large chunks of clams in it.
I would recommend this place if you're looking for a place to eat on the wharf.
salmon.author: L C.
salmon.review: The sourdough bread here is really good you could fill up just on the bread!  I ordered the Salmon BLT which I liked, but the bread could have been toasted a bit more.  My family really enjoyed the steak and the seafood pasta as well as the clam chowder.  The clam chowder had large chunks of clams in it.  I would recommend this place if you're looking for a place to eat on the wharf.

excerpts: All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.
Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.
While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.
salmon.author: Marianna K.
salmon.review: Great view, friendly service, and delicious food.  The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.  All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.  Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.  While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.

excerpts: We ordered cocktails, clam chowder, crab cakes, lobster fettuccine, Salmon, Tuna, and a steak.
My husband ordered the steak, and requested medium and it came barely pink.
That's generally OK because most places will happily prepare another steak, to your preferred doneness.
This is where things got a little odd.
The waiter happily took back the steak, but another employee came over with a photo of my husbands steak on their cell phone, asking if this is how he wants it done.
The photo made the steak look more red than it did in person (lighting? filters?)
and we're like "sure, that looks better."
Then this employee says, "well, that's your steak, and that's how we prepare medium.
"  That was such a ridiculous and bizarrely unprofessional way of telling the customer that they are wrong.
salmon.author: Tara B.
salmon.review:
My husband and I took some friends from out of town here for dinner because they were in the mood for seafood.  The food was very fairly priced and generally did not disappoint.  We ordered cocktails, clam chowder, crab cakes, lobster fettuccine, Salmon, Tuna, and a steak.  My husband ordered the steak, and requested medium and it came barely pink.  That's generally OK because most places will happily prepare another steak, to your preferred doneness.  This is where things got a little odd.  The waiter happily took back the steak, but another employee came over with a photo of my husbands steak on their cell phone, asking if this is how he wants it done.  The photo made the steak look more red than it did in person (lighting? filters?) and we're like "sure, that looks better."  Then this employee says, "well, that's your steak, and that's how we prepare medium."  That was such a ridiculous and bizarrely unprofessional way of telling the customer that they are wrong.  Just make the steak, ok?  

Overall, the service was friendly and fun.  However, another strange moment was when our server brought us our check.  He placed the check on the table, and made sure to point to the bottom where it states gratuity percentages.  Reading out, I kid you not, each percentage, each amount of money, along with a note as to how he might have earned each percentage.  Like, "15% if I..., 18% if I..."  I was almost embarrassed for the waiter who thought that this was a proper thing to say to guests.  The food was enjoyable, but perhaps not enough to experience their gauche missteps again.

excerpts: I had the shrimp skewers and my wife the salmon, both tasty.
Yes, it is a little pricey but this is SF.
You can go cheaper in your own hometown, but just to be in the sunshine on Pier 39 adds to the overall experience.
I would go there again on my own.
salmon.author: Marshall W.
salmon.review: Ratings for this restaurant range all over the place, some 5's all the way down to 1's. Mine is a 4.  I went there with my group of 45 seniors for lunch and that is a tough crowd, believe me.  Despite the size of our group, everyone was served promply with their exact choices, and by an large everyone was most happy with the meal, the ambience, and the service.  I had the shrimp skewers and my wife the salmon, both tasty. Yes, it is a little pricey but this is SF.  You can go cheaper in your own hometown, but just to be in the sunshine on Pier 39 adds to the overall experience.  I would go there again on my own.

excerpts: My wife's salmon was tasteless.
My fish and chips were average at best.
Especially given how good San Francisco food can be, we feel that we made a mistake coming to the Wharf.
salmon.author: Steve J.
salmon.review: We were disappointed. My wife's salmon was tasteless. My fish and chips were average at best. Especially given how good San Francisco food can be, we feel that we made a mistake coming to the Wharf.

excerpts: I had the Salmon BLT  & the red chilly shrimp appetizer super good
I totally recommend!!!
the best part our waiter BERNIE gave us the best service.
salmon.author: Art E.
salmon.review: first time here and the food & service is EXCELLENT!!! I had the Salmon BLT  & the red chilly shrimp appetizer super good I totally recommend!!! the best part our waiter BERNIE gave us the best service.

excerpts: The chef's special was salmon stuffed with shrimp and crab- a novel concept, entirely delicious!
The stuffing was just rich enough to delight, but not too overpowering.
The dessert platter looked fantastic, and picking just one was a challenge.
salmon.author: Polina P.
salmon.review:
An excellent restaurant to relax in on Pier 39. The second-story location of the restaurant opens the view of the entire harbor, and of Alcatraz from every corner of the place.

The greeting staff was very courteous, and the service inside was exceptionally warm and professional. The chef's special was salmon stuffed with shrimp and crab- a novel concept, entirely delicious! The stuffing was just rich enough to delight, but not too overpowering. The dessert platter looked fantastic, and picking just one was a challenge. The lava chocolate cake is pure indulgence!

The servers could be more attentive to the customer's drinks.

In the high-traffic tourist place, this restaurant provides great service and dining at a very reasonable cost.

excerpts: I had the lemon dill salmon and their sunset mimosa....
salmon.author: Keeks M.
salmon.review:
The food was AMAZING. My family and I went on Thanksgiving, the place was packed. But the service was still great. I had the lemon dill salmon and their sunset mimosa.... both perfect. 

It's a bit pricey, so I'd probably only go for special occasions. =)

excerpts: Also for main entree, steak was the best for me- cooked to perfection along with pasta and Salmon.
salmon.author: Kristine P.
salmon.review: Awesome food and bartenders! Came here last Thursday for company party and appetizers were delish!! Tried beef on skewers with orange marmalade, mini lettuce wraps and bruschetta. . Also for main entree, steak was the best for me- cooked to perfection along with pasta and Salmon.

excerpts: but it was solid, and the seafood penne- tomato cream sauce with loads of seafood (mussels, clams, swordfish and salmon).
All three dishes did not disappoint.
salmon.author: Uyen L.
salmon.review: We dined here because the view of the bay caught my eye. Our waiter was incredible. He was cheerful, always had a smile on, and very tentative throughout our meal. We ordered the baked oysters- flavorful and cheesy, clam chowder- not the best but it was solid, and the seafood penne- tomato cream sauce with loads of seafood (mussels, clams, swordfish and salmon). All three dishes did not disappoint.

excerpts: He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.
The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.
Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.
The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.
The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.
By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.
I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.
salmon.author: Kurt H.
salmon.review: We decided to eat here on the recommendation of the boat captain who had taken us out to watch the America's Cup boat race.  We are not a big fan of the crowds and restaurants on Pier 39, but he indicated this was the best of the bunch.  Since our boat had left from Pier 39, we opted for convenience.  We came about 2 pm and were told it would be a 40 minute wait.  It would have been nice to have a device to take on the pier that would have vibrated when our table was ready, but the waiting area was pleasant.  The table had a nice view of the harbor, and we were attended to in a timely manner.  There was a good variety of choices on the menu, but my brother in law was very disappointed with the non existant vegan selections.  He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.  The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.  Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.  The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.  The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.  By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.  I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.

excerpts: I love fresh salmon at Fog Harbor!
Amazing taste and fresh ;)
also they have the best clam chowder in the city.
Love this place!
salmon.author: Aikerim S.
salmon.review: I love fresh salmon at Fog Harbor! Amazing taste and fresh ;) also they have the best clam chowder in the city. Love this place!

excerpts:
Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab,
Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp..
Wife had Salmon.
Salmon was not overdone and dry.
Drinks?
Same.
I liked the place so much
, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees.
salmon.author: Azuresees n.
salmon.review:
Dec 29, 2012 9PM. Wife & I were served by Amelia. Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab,
Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp.. Wife had Salmon.

Place was packed. Service was spot-on. Server Amelia was on us immediately. We ordered the 1/2 crab appetizer. It was on our table in 4 minutes and hot.

Dinner was the same. FAST, complete and hot.  Salmon was not overdone and dry. Drinks? Same. I liked the place so much, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees. Manager Nusan was dressed professionally, and polite to us. 

Wife used to work there when it was Chick's Place back in the day. She loved seeing  the place again. 

To qualify my opinion, I am ususally very picky on my kudos for eateries. This place deserved a 5.

excerpts: Swordfish, salmon and shrimp all cooked to perfection.
Delicious asparagus side and garlic mashed potatoes that were strictly okay.
Fresh, homemade sourdough on your table is warm and soft and crusty and delicious.
I also had their yummy tiramisu, apple crisp, and a skinny coconut ginger cocktail, all delicious!
salmon.author: Leslie K.
salmon.review: Good service, excellent Seafood. Make your reservation here to save time. We got an amuse buche for reserving online. We had scallops on the half shell (probably not worth the money, but still good). My entree was delicious: mixed grill. Swordfish, salmon and shrimp all cooked to perfection. Delicious asparagus side and garlic mashed potatoes that were strictly okay. Fresh, homemade sourdough on your table is warm and soft and crusty and delicious. I also had their yummy tiramisu, apple crisp, and a skinny coconut ginger cocktail, all delicious!

excerpts: I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.
Both were very good.
The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.
All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.
salmon.author: Ileen G.
salmon.review: Went here for dinner after a disappointing trip to the Aquarium.  This place did not disappoint.  Ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  My husband had the crispy bay scallops for an appetizer and they were even better.  Both dishes were very ample servings and in retrospect would have been better to order just one and share.  I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.  Both were very good.  The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.  All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna, friend had the stuffed salmon special and we both had a cup of the clam chowder.
salmon.author: Sara S.
salmon.review:
This place got our business after the peeps at Eagle Cafe ignored us for 20+ mins after being seated (not even water was brought to the table)!

We were starving so everything sounded good.  I had the ahi tuna, friend had the stuffed salmon special and we both had a cup of the clam chowder.  The meal was tasty, the service friendly and prompt.  

Menu was a bit pricey but we were so hungry.  If it weren't for the nightmare of getting to this place we'd go back.

excerpts: On the downside: my salmon was a bit dry, the atmosphere is unimaginative and the place is packed to the rafters.
If you're stuck at Pier 39 for whatever reason, this is the place to go.
salmon.author: JJ M.
salmon.review: The owners could have lazily rested on their location laurels and served boring, expensive tourist fare. Instead, they take the high road serving fresh sea food provided by friendly, professional staff. It's the exceptional restaurant indeed  that is right in the heart of one of the biggest tourist traps on the west coast that provides really good food. Our server "Bong" (not a typo) was courteous and prompt and got our order right. On the downside: my salmon was a bit dry, the atmosphere is unimaginative and the place is packed to the rafters. If you're stuck at Pier 39 for whatever reason, this is the place to go.

excerpts: We ordered 2 entrees - the salmon salad and the fish & chips.
More on the food in a moments, but first the highlights.
One, the view is wonderful.
Two, the service - though quirky- was generally good.
Lastly, the sourdough bread is incredible.
Unfortunately, the good food ended there.
FIrst, the fish & chips.
The fish was greasy, and the breading far too thick.
Also, the fries tasted as though they were cooked in dirty oil leftover from shrimp poppers or something similar.
As for the salmon salad, the salmon was unevenly cooked, and the salad both bland and overdressed.
salmon.author: David C.
salmon.review: My family had lunch at Fog Harbor during a recent vacation.  The meal was a general disappointment.  We ordered 2 entrees - the salmon salad and the fish & chips.  More on the food in a moments, but first the highlights.  One, the view is wonderful.  Two, the service - though quirky- was generally good. Lastly, the sourdough bread is incredible.  Unfortunately, the good food ended there.  FIrst, the fish & chips.  The fish was greasy, and the breading far too thick.  Also, the fries tasted as though they were cooked in dirty oil leftover from shrimp poppers or something similar.  As for the salmon salad, the salmon was unevenly cooked, and the salad both bland and overdressed.

excerpts: grilled salmon was very fresh and prepared just right .
delicious seafood experience ..
salmon.author: Scott L.
salmon.review: grilled salmon was very fresh and prepared just right . delicious seafood experience ..

excerpts: We also got a smoked salmon appetizer which was incredible.
My dad order the fish & chips and really enjoyed them.
My mom got a platter of different fish and shrimp with rice pilaf made w/ wild rice and broccoli.
It was all excellent and the fish was so fresh tasting.
My sister got the special- a very tasty white fish that is from the coast of Vietnam.
It was prepared in a wonderful sauce on top of creamy mashed potatoes and wonderful spinach.
My pan-seered chicken also had a great sauce and mashed potatoes/spinach.
It was wonderful.
The waiter somehow convinced me to get dessert even though I was stuffed.
All the desserts looked to die for.
I got the caramel toffee cake-
it was wonderful.
I would highly recommend going here if you are visiting San Francisco and want a less touristy place.
It is pricy
but I would say it is all worth it.
salmon.author: Allison K.
salmon.review:
My family and I were on peir 39 and were amazed by how touristy it was- all the places seemed to attract tourists with cameras and I heart San Fran sweatshirts. We wanted to find a place with good food- especially fish without feeling like total tourists. Although the seating hostess asked us where we were from (showing they get tons of tourists) she was super nice and got us a great table with stunning view.
The waiter was accommodating and kind as well as professional- he spent a bit too long eying my sisters ID when she ordered wine (she is 23). 
The bread was hot and fresh and a great way to start. We also got a smoked salmon appetizer which was incredible. 
My dad order the fish & chips and really enjoyed them. My mom got a platter of different fish and shrimp with rice pilaf made w/ wild rice and broccoli. It was all excellent and the fish was so fresh tasting. My sister got the special- a very tasty white fish that is from the coast of Vietnam. It was prepared in a wonderful sauce on top of creamy mashed potatoes and wonderful spinach. My pan-seered chicken also had a great sauce and mashed potatoes/spinach. It was wonderful.
The waiter somehow convinced me to get dessert even though I was stuffed. All the desserts looked to die for. I got the caramel toffee cake- it was wonderful.
I would highly recommend going here if you are visiting San Francisco and want a less touristy place. It is pricy but I would say it is all worth it.

excerpts: I had the salmon with the lemon dill sauce.
It was so fresh and tasty.
Plus the service was outstanding.
Overall we had a great time.
salmon.author: C. K.
salmon.review: We decided to go here for my daughter's sweet 16 birthday party.  We had been here before and have always really enjoyed it.  The food was wonderful.  I had the salmon with the lemon dill sauce.  It was so fresh and tasty.  Plus the service was outstanding. Overall we had a great time.

excerpts: I had the Ahi, excellent taste, my boyfriend, the salmon - loved it.
We also had the bread bowl of clam chowder and Cesar salad combo which we shared and truly enjoyed it.
The sourdough bread was terrific.
No room for dessert
but they leave little biscoff cookies (some of my favorites) with the check.
salmon.author: Sharon R.
salmon.review: I can't say I've had food any better. (May have had some just as good, but not better.) I had the Ahi, excellent taste, my boyfriend, the salmon - loved it. We also had the bread bowl of clam chowder and Cesar salad combo which we shared and truly enjoyed it. The sourdough bread was terrific. No room for dessert but they leave little biscoff cookies (some of my favorites) with the check.

excerpts: The crab was delicious and the salmon was out of the world!
Must try!
Best crab I ever had.
salmon.author: S J.
salmon.review: Amazing food!  The crab was delicious and the salmon was out of the world! Must try! Best crab I ever had.

excerpts: I had the salmon
and I wanted to finish it all!
It was delicious!
Even the vegetables were great!
lol.
Our waiter was very friendly and gave us some options for sightseeing around the city.
salmon.author: Erica L.
salmon.review: This place has a great view of the bay! It's directly on Pier 39 so beware of lots of crowds. My boyfriend and I went here for lunch and really enjoyed our meals. I had the salmon and I wanted to finish it all! It was delicious! Even the vegetables were great! lol. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us some options for sightseeing around the city.

excerpts: The fish (salmon and mahi mahi) was dry, the shrimp was flavorless.
The tiramisu was good
but I could have done without the obscene amount of whipped cream on top.
The meal for two was about $100, including tip.
Don't waste your money, go someplace else.
salmon.author: Mary R.
salmon.review:
The food was mediocre. There are so many other places in the City that offer much better food for the same price if not, cheaper!

Okay, it's a tourist place but that is a sorry excuse for bad food. Okay, so the portions are large but that just means I have more crap too get through. Okay, there's a nice view of the water and the restaurant looks reasonably good but that is not what I paid for! I could sit outside and enjoy the same view for free. 

I went one night and I ordered the Ciopino and was soooo looking forward to it. I was soooo disappointed. The sauce was not bad but just not very good. The ahi two ways (poke and seared) was okay. The fish (salmon and mahi mahi) was dry, the shrimp was flavorless. The tiramisu was good but I could have done without the obscene amount of whipped cream on top. The meal for two was about $100, including tip. Don't waste your money, go someplace else.

excerpts: My salmon was overcooked, my mahi-mahi had zero seasoning, and the rice was completely dry.
The food overall was bland and unadventurous.
The service was good however
salmon.author: Christina B.
salmon.review:
The location of this restaurant is killer. 

After spotting it yesterday morning, I took the long trek back down to the pier in search of the beautiful view and a fantastic seafood dinner. 

Beautiful view - check. 

Fantastic seafood dinner - not so much. 

The crab appetizer was tiny. The wines offered boring. My salmon was overcooked, my mahi-mahi had zero seasoning, and the rice was completely dry. The food overall was bland and unadventurous. 
The service was good however so I gave them a star for that. 

Final Verdict: Nothing to write home about!

excerpts: My Salmon was cooked to perfection.
the entire experience from the moment we arrived to leaving was excellent...
salmon.author: Barbara M.
salmon.review: WONDERFUL!  the service was quick and efficient, the food DELICIOUS!  we arrived at 5pm and asked for  window seating and were accomodated immediately. This place is very friendly and welcoming, if you do have to wait theres a nice patio with fireplace to enjoy a drink while you wait for seating.  I Highly reccomend Fog Harbor Fish House at pier 39,  and order the Red Chili Shrimp appetizer, nothing short of spicy and delicious, My Salmon was cooked to perfection. the entire experience from the moment we arrived to leaving was excellent...

excerpts: The salmon and shrimp were both delicious and moist.
We also enjoyed cheesecake for dessert.
Service was good and they constantly were refilling our water glasses.
For a nice dinner with a great view of the sea lions and Alcatraz, I would definitely return.
salmon.author: Chrisy C.
salmon.review: Attended a retirement luncheon here and must say the views are fantastic.  We were in the private dining room and it can be a little tight if you have over 30 people.  We had submitted out menus earlier but it still took awhile to receive our appetizers.  The clam chowder was pretty good and I was glad I didn't select the Caesar Salad- it was two pieces of lettuce and  a crouton.  A co-worker said Caesar must've gone broke! The salmon and shrimp were both delicious and moist.  We also enjoyed cheesecake for dessert.  Service was good and they constantly were refilling our water glasses.  For a nice dinner with a great view of the sea lions and Alcatraz, I would definitely return.

excerpts: I ordered fish both times, and had the sustainably harvested salmon this past weekend
and it was perfect!
I was also in a big enough group that we ordered almost every different kind of dessert
and I enjoyed every single one.
salmon.author: Tracy H.
salmon.review:
I've been to Fog Harbor twice so far (the only two times I made it to Pier 39 in the past year) and felt the service and food was incredible both times. The view is great--I could even see a sea otter swimming in the Bay from my seat! The restaurant is very well-kept and clean (including the restrooms).

I ordered fish both times, and had the sustainably harvested salmon this past weekend and it was perfect! I was also in a big enough group that we ordered almost every different kind of dessert and I enjoyed every single one. :)

Although this would be a great place for a nice date, I'd find a slightly quieter place for an intimate, romantic date. The restaurant was bustling even in the late afternoon.

Definitely recommend it ... and save room for dessert!

excerpts: I also really liked the salmon BLT.
No bacon for me but they kindly subbed fresh tomatoes.
Delish!
salmon.author: Max H.
salmon.review: Wonderful lunch today. The clam chowder is really fantastic with the warm sourdough bread. I also really liked the salmon BLT. No bacon for me but they kindly subbed fresh tomatoes. Delish!

excerpts: I had the salmon with spinach.
Great kids menu, very family friendly.
Would love to go back soon.
salmon.author: Fatma K.
salmon.review: Was there yesterday, had reservations through Open Table, we got a table with a view.  Food was fresh and flavorful.  I had the salmon with spinach.  Great kids menu, very family friendly. Would love to go back soon.

excerpts: Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.
For a "tourist trap
" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.
Check it out!
salmon.author: Chris B.
salmon.review: Overall very pleased with my experience.  Went on a Tuesday at 5:30 PM, no wait with good seats and a nice view of the bay. Staff was very pleasant and accomodating.  Started with clam chowder which was decent but had a little sand in some spoonfuls.  Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.  For a "tourist trap" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.  Check it out!

excerpts: We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.
salmon.author: L D.
salmon.review: I really love taking visitors here and the food and service has always been excellent.  I believe the prices are reasonable for the quality and portions you receive (you are on the wharf!)  Visiting friends enjoy the view of the harbor and bridge and the excellent seafood and sourdough.  I also appreciate that they allow you to linger and enjoy your meal unlike other pier restaurants.  Our recent server, Faycal, treated us like royalty--or so it seemed.  We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.

excerpts:
my boyfriend ordered:
stella beer (they accidentally gave him a large, which he enjoyed)
salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much.
he wants me to write he
he loved loved it.
salmon.author: Ness H.
salmon.review:
my boyfriend and i went here tonight. it was our one year. parking garage was very close by, and the first 2 hours is free. the front of the restaurant is very pretty. the decor inside the restaurant is even nicer. we were seated by the window which had a great view of the harbor. 

my boyfriend ordered:
stella beer (they accidentally gave him a large, which he enjoyed)
salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much. he wants me to write he he loved loved it. he wouldnt stop talking about it on the way home

i ordered:
cup of clam chowder ($5) - delicious. very clammy. it does not have potatoes in it or i didn't find any. im not complaining because there were plenty of clams.
sea bass with garlic mashed ($20) - the sea bass was a little on the dry side. i have had sea bass in different places were it was so much more buttery and flaky. this sea bass had the texture of tilapia. the potatoes were good, wish i had more. it was also served with brocoli and red bell. 

our total bill was only 50 bucks plus tip. not bad at all!!  overall, a delicious place to eat, not as pricey as we thought. plus it had a great view and its in the city

excerpts: I got the special, which was a gumbo with vegetables and rice topped with a filet of salmon and grilled shrimp.
The salmon was like butter on the inside, and had a deliciously seasoned and seared outside.
I also had a fresh squeezed lemonade with ginger.
Not overly sweet like most lemonades, just perfect.
We got the chocolate cake for desert.
It was super moist
and I couldn't stop eating it, even after I was already stuffed from dinner.
Our waiter was friendly and helpful.
My kids kept themselves entertained by drawing on the paper tablecloth with crayons provided to us.
My 5 yr.
old got the burger from the kid's menu and it was HUGE!
enough to easily feed an adult.
And it was arguably one of the best burgers I've ever had, too.
We will probably go back to Fog Harbor, the next time my dad wants to go to Pier 39 ;)
salmon.author: Kathryn C.
salmon.review:
Went there with my husband, 5 yr. old and 2 yr. old, and my father this weekend. My Dad likes to visit Pier 39 when he comes to the bay area to stay with us. (which isn't my favorite place, but we go there just for him.) He really wanted to go to a good seafood place, so I looked up reviews on yelp and found Fog Harbor. I'm always a little leery of restaurants in tourist-y places (especially since a couple other places I've been to at Pier 39 turned out to be really terrible), but Fog Harbor turned out to be a great choice. 

My husband and I have high expectations for our food when we go to nice restaurants in the $20-$40 range, and we were very impressed with this place. My husband and dad both got the swordfish, which they raved about. I got the special, which was a gumbo with vegetables and rice topped with a filet of salmon and grilled shrimp. The salmon was like butter on the inside, and had a deliciously seasoned and seared outside. I also had a fresh squeezed lemonade with ginger. Not overly sweet like most lemonades, just perfect. We got the chocolate cake for desert. It was super moist and I couldn't stop eating it, even after I was already stuffed from dinner. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. My kids kept themselves entertained by drawing on the paper tablecloth with crayons provided to us. My 5 yr. old got the burger from the kid's menu and it was HUGE! enough to easily feed an adult. And it was arguably one of the best burgers I've ever had, too. We will probably go back to Fog Harbor, the next time my dad wants to go to Pier 39 ;)

excerpts: Salmon stuffed with crab meat.
salmon.author: John B.
salmon.review:
I been here a few times.

Service is always great!

Drinks are really good.

I really like their fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, calamari, fries, served with tartar sauce and a red sauce and cole slaw)).

My wife had the special of the day. Salmon stuffed with crab meat. She really likes this place.

It has a great view of Alcatraz since it's on the top floor.

I would go back with no hesitation.

excerpts: then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end.
the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy.
my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had.
the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz.
oh and our service was so great!
he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf.
couldn't of wished a better experience.
salmon.author: Angelina A.
salmon.review: My boyfriend and i were on vacation in SF for his bday and i was looking for a place to take him for dinner on his special day. i came across this place and man was i happy i chosen it. first let me say i think this was the best seafood ive ever eaten. we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious! we almost ordered a second round. then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for! then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end. the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy. my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had. the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz. oh and our service was so great! he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf. couldn't of wished a better experience.

excerpts: Appetizer of blue cheese fresh sourdough bread was wonderful and the main course of crab-stuffed salmon was just as good.
Would definitely tell my friends about this place.
salmon.author: Che B.
salmon.review: Was there during fresh crab week.  Appetizer of blue cheese fresh sourdough bread was wonderful and the main course of crab-stuffed salmon was just as good.  Would definitely tell my friends about this place.

excerpts: For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.
The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.
I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.
Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.
salmon.author: Zainab T.
salmon.review: So we went to this place when we were visiting SFO last week.  My husband was in a mood for a "broiled seafood" type of dish and since they had something similar we decided to go here.  We ordered the calamari for appetizers-not good and I would not recommend it at all.  It was "soaked" in oil and we started feeling sick after the first bite.  We asked the waiter if we could order something else and got the "Red Chilli Prawn" instead.  It was an appetizer with a lot of gravy-it was tasty though.  For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.  The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.  I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.  Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.

excerpts: He told us about the Fresh Market Fish of the Day...sounded great...salmon stuffed with crab, etc, etc.. for $20.
After looking at our menus, two of us decided on the salmon with stuffed crab..
I was craving crab and for the price it seemed decent.
After taking our orders...we waited, waited, waited, and waited...and waited some more.
During the time I saw two businessmen come in, order, eat, and pay their bill.
I saw 3 ladies come in, order, and eat.
And two old ladies come in, order and eat...
all while we were still waiting.
After about 40 minutes our food was brought.
BTW, during this time we were waiting for drink refills..hardly ever checked on, etc.
The food arrived...
all looked great and was very excited to eat!
We start to eat...
hmm...
the "salmon" tastes okay, kind of bland...
I said to my dad..
I don't think this is salmon.
So, we ask the waiter again what he said the special of the day was.
He AGAIN said salmon stuffed with crab...
we then POLITELY and RESPECTFULLY said that we didn't think it was salmon and that it tasted good, but it's not the special.
The waiter then said he would go and double-check.
Come to find out...
he was wrong!!!
That was YESTERDAY'S SPECIAL!!
He said that he could get the salmon for us though...
no apology or anything.
Too bad we weren't checked on until 20 minutes into our meal though.
By that time half the meal was gone, and we didn't want to chance waiting another 40 minutes for our food.
We were very polite about the whole "mistake", which you would have thought the waiter would have been even extra nice.
No such thing.
He never refilled our drinks.
Once it came time to get a box and check...
that tooks another 20 minutes!
When he brought the check, he stepped on my dad's foot and didn't say a thing.
Overall...the food was good, but the ONE waiter needs to be switched out.
The other waiter that had to start picking up his slack was great.
Wish we could have had the OTHER waiter.
Got the bill, thought we would maybe be compensated for at least one of the "salmon" bills since I barely even ate half, but all was full price.
Would I go here again?
NO.
Didn't expect a lunch to take 2 hours!
BTW, the waiter's name was something like Lubo.
salmon.author: Melissa H.
salmon.review: We went here on a Friday for lunch.  After walking around the pier and looking for somewhere to eat...  We happened to stop at Fog Harbor.  Manager came out and spoke with us as we were looking over the menu.  What we were seeing looked okay, but the manager's sense of humor and friendly personality is what sold us.  We were immediately brought to our table.   It was nice to look at all the people on the Pier and to see the different boats pull in.  Our server greeted us, he was hard to understand, but seemed friendly.  Unfortunately as time went on we saw less of him and his friendliness seemed to go away as well. He told us about the Fresh Market Fish of the Day...sounded great...salmon stuffed with crab, etc, etc.. for $20.  After looking at our menus, two of us decided on the salmon with stuffed crab..I was craving crab and for the price it seemed decent.  After taking our orders...we waited, waited, waited, and waited...and waited some more.  During the time I saw two businessmen come in, order, eat, and pay their bill.  I saw 3 ladies come in, order, and eat.  And two old ladies come in, order and eat...all while we were still waiting.  After about 40 minutes our food was brought.  BTW, during this time we were waiting for drink refills..hardly ever checked on, etc.  The food arrived...all looked great and was very excited to eat!  We start to eat... hmm...the "salmon" tastes okay, kind of bland...  I said to my dad..I don't think this is salmon.  So, we ask the waiter again what he said the special of the day was.  He AGAIN said salmon stuffed with crab...we then POLITELY and RESPECTFULLY said that we didn't think it was salmon and that it tasted good, but it's not the special.  The waiter then said he would go and double-check.  Come to find out...he was wrong!!!  That was YESTERDAY'S SPECIAL!!  He said that he could get the salmon for us though...no apology or anything.  Too bad we weren't checked on until 20 minutes into our meal though.  By that time half the meal was gone, and we didn't want to chance waiting another 40 minutes for our food.  We were very polite about the whole "mistake", which you would have thought the waiter would have been even extra nice.  No such thing.  He never refilled our drinks.  Once it came time to get a box and check...that tooks another 20 minutes!  When he brought the check, he stepped on my dad's foot and didn't say a thing.  Overall...the food was good, but the ONE waiter needs to be switched out.  The other waiter that had to start picking up his slack was great.  Wish we could have had the OTHER waiter.  Got the bill, thought we would maybe be compensated for at least one of the "salmon" bills since I barely even ate half, but all was full price.  Would I go here again?  NO.  Didn't expect a lunch to take 2 hours!  BTW, the waiter's name was something like Lubo.

excerpts: I had the mahi mahi and I think my husband had the salmon.
Both dishes were well prepared tender, juicy, and flavorful.
Also the crab cakes were pretty good too not superb but good.
The ambiance of this place is great and has a really nice view.
Our waitress was friendly but not as attentive as I would have liked.
My husband felt that because the place was busy she did her best and left a nice tip.
I would recommend this place great food, great atmosphere, good service and nice view.
salmon.author: Nurah M.
salmon.review: We really enjoyed our meal here. I had the mahi mahi and I think my husband had the salmon. Both dishes were well prepared tender, juicy, and flavorful. Also the crab cakes were pretty good too not superb but good. The ambiance of this place is great and has a really nice view. Our waitress was friendly but not as attentive as I would have liked. My husband felt that because the place was busy she did her best and left a nice tip. I would recommend this place great food, great atmosphere, good service and nice view.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon entree - DELICIOUS, best salmon I have had in a long time, very fresh, prepared perfectly, and the wild rice was nice and flaky with bits of fresh herb also.
My partner ordered the Mixed Seafood entree, and that was great too -
the calamari was delicious, deep fried, but not too greasy.

Their portions are generous - I was almost tempted to order the sourdough blue cheese/garlic bread, which sounds delicious, but I didnt, because I knew I would get stuffed on that before the meal came -
I got stuffed on the entree alone!
The views are great from this restaurant, and I really dont think there is a "bad" table in the entire place.
The bar area looks nice too - we ate lunch at the Bar one time, and I remember the nice Coffee Drinks they have.
So after 3 or 4 visits and no negative issues, I would say safe to take anyone here with no fear of feeling like "gee, we've been here before and it was good" and have regrets about saying this!
salmon.author: Craig H.
salmon.review:
We have been here several times, but it has been a couple years (on previous visits food was great too)  They have re-modelled the entrance a bit since last visit, nice, actually more tables inside as a result.  One thing I first must mention in a positive way, this restaurant is a bit more upscale than alot of the burger/cafe-type places in the area, which is nice.  Perfect setting for that special occasion, or to impress an out-of-town guest.  The staff all seem sincerely helpful, prompt service, friendly, fill empty glasses, confirm your order when it is placed, etc.  The prices are what I would call "competitive", and given the atmosphere, nice view, cleanliness of the restaurant,  I would say the prices are very fair.
I ordered the salmon entree - DELICIOUS, best salmon I have had in a long time, very fresh, prepared perfectly, and the wild rice was nice and flaky with bits of fresh herb also.  My partner ordered the Mixed Seafood entree, and that was great too - the calamari was delicious, deep fried, but not too greasy.  Their portions are generous - I was almost tempted to order the sourdough blue cheese/garlic bread, which sounds delicious, but I didnt, because I knew I would get stuffed on that before the meal came - I got stuffed on the entree alone!
The views are great from this restaurant, and I really dont think there is a "bad" table in the entire place.  The bar area looks nice too - we ate lunch at the Bar one time, and I remember the nice Coffee Drinks they have.  So after 3 or 4 visits and no negative issues, I would say safe to take anyone here with no fear of feeling like "gee, we've been here before and it was good" and have regrets about saying this!

excerpts: We ordered 1/2 lb. crab with linguine, crab cake entree, salmon scruttoni (?) appetizer.
The waiter was fun, fast, friendly, had some jokes up his sleeve.
The view was breathtaking.
I really, really wanted to try their vanilla creme brule but was too stuffed to even attempt.
We had lunch
so I didn't feel like drinking
so I have no idea how that menu looks
but the food was great, simple and just enough.
We will be back.
salmon.author: Mala S.
salmon.review: This place was really great. I'm not sure why other other people are complaining but, it definitely was not a-OK type of place during our visit. We ordered 1/2 lb. crab with linguine, crab cake entree, salmon scruttoni (?) appetizer. The waiter was fun, fast, friendly, had some jokes up his sleeve. The view was breathtaking. I really, really wanted to try their vanilla creme brule but was too stuffed to even attempt. We had lunch so I didn't feel like drinking so I have no idea how that menu looks but the food was great, simple and just enough. We will be back.

excerpts: I usually order the grilled salmon - delicious.
Afterwards, you can walk around the pier (if you're not afraid of spending an evening in tourist land).
salmon.author: David P.
salmon.review: I've been to the Fog Harbor several times, and I've enjoyed it every time. The view's alright, and the service is fine. The decor is pretty nice, but I really enjoy the food. I usually order the grilled salmon - delicious. Afterwards, you can walk around the pier (if you're not afraid of spending an evening in tourist land).

excerpts: For my entree, I went with a lighter plate, being the Seared Pacific Cod ($28).
The fish was seared perfectly with a golden brown, slightly crisp top.
It was served with white beans, chorizo butter, tomatoes and spinach, then finished with a dab of garlic shallot aioli.
The aioli added an extra layer of flavor to an already savory plate and I loved the white beans as an alternative for a starch.
With the Cod placed on top of it all, it was truly the highlight of the dish.
seared pacific cod.author: Courtney L.
seared pacific cod.review:
During my family's trip to San Francisco, our mission was to find a restaurant that showcased the Bay's fresh seafood at fairly reasonable prices, and Fog Harbor delivered!

Located on the second floor of Pier 39, this restaurant has a classy ambiance and a scenic view of the water where you can spot the sea lions in the distance. We were greeted by our waiter who took great care of us throughout dinner. He was personable, attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. 

We started off our seafood feast by sharing the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp appetizer ($16). It contained just six large shrimp, tossed with thin slices of onions and bell peppers in an intense chili sauce. Although I enjoyed the spicy flavors and tingling heat, I didn't find that it was the best value.  I also couldn't help but try a cup of their award-winning clam chowder ($7), which was so creamy and had large meaty clam pieces. Yum, this is a must!  

For my entree, I went with a lighter plate, being the Seared Pacific Cod ($28). The fish was seared perfectly with a golden brown, slightly crisp top. It was served with white beans, chorizo butter, tomatoes and spinach, then finished with a dab of garlic shallot aioli. The aioli added an extra layer of flavor to an already savory plate and I loved the white beans as an alternative for a starch. With the Cod placed on top of it all, it was truly the highlight of the dish. Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. They enjoyed their entrees as well.

This was easily one of the best seafood meals my family had in years. 
Thank you to Fog Harbor for such a memorable dinner to start off our visit to San Francisco on the right foot!

4.5 stars.

excerpts: I had the seared pacific cod with white beans, chorizo butter, roasted tomatoes, spinach, basil, cilantro, topped with a garlic shallot aioli.
The sauce was amazing!
So delicious I could have definitely had more and just sopped it up with some sourdough.
seared pacific cod.author: Victor B.
seared pacific cod.review: On our recent trip to San Francisco we decided to dine at Fog Harbor and boy were we glad!  This place is delicious, even for me that isn't too huge of a seafood fan.  We were seated overlooking the little harbor and pier where the seals usually hang out so that made it even better.  I had the seared pacific cod with white beans, chorizo butter, roasted tomatoes, spinach, basil, cilantro, topped with a garlic shallot aioli.  The sauce was amazing!  So delicious I could have definitely had more and just sopped it up with some sourdough.  My girl had the Cioppino and could not stop commenting on how phenomenal it was.  She said it was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.  That being said....we'll definitely be back on our next San Fran adventure!

excerpts: I ordered the seared pacific cod, which was served in a chorizo butter sauce.
Very delicious, as the fish was very flaky and had a perfect crisp to the crust.
However, the white beans that were served alongside left much to be desired.
seared pacific cod.author: Nile R.
seared pacific cod.review:
This is an above average seafood restaurant, that has a fairly high price point. Very good food, but I do believe there is ample room for other seafood restaurants in the area to surpass it. I ordered the seared pacific cod, which was served in a chorizo butter sauce. Very delicious, as the fish was very flaky and had a perfect crisp to the crust. However, the white beans that were served alongside left much to be desired. Fingerling potatoes would have completed this dish in a much more satisfactory manner.

Our waiter, Jeremy, was great. The service was impeccable, as our waters were always filled, and the bread basket was quickly replaced. He was a very helpful waiter without feeling overbearing. 

I would suggest this place if you have time to stop at many other restaurants, but if you only have time/money for one, try somewhere else.

excerpts: This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries.
The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch
but they are, and
the cream sauce was delicious.
The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here.
I generally prefer for my cod to have

that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table).
Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab.
Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options.
Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth
a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway.
We will be coming back!
seared pacific cod.author: Joanne S.
seared pacific cod.review:
Every time my mom comes to SF I take her to get seafood at Fog Harbor Fish House. Great view of the bay and Alcatraz, located at Pier 39 so lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. Of course, with the tourist location comes tourist prices but it's not that bad. In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5. We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good! This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later. Service is usually quite good and you can get seated usually within an hour even if there is a wait - no problem there's lots to do while you wait!

This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries. The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch but they are, and the cream sauce was delicious. The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here. I generally prefer for my cod to have that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table). However our waiter was fabulous at everything else, including getting our check to us early as we had lost track of time and had an upcoming appointment.

My brother usually comes with us and always gets the burger because he doesn't like seafood. It's alright, but really why come to a seafood house for a burger? It does comes with those delicious fries.

Tl;dr: great views, great service, great area, generally great food. Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab. Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options.
