Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway. We will be coming back!

excerpts: My main course was seared pacific cod which came with white beans, tomatoes and spinach.
Normally when you see the fish atop something it is the less expensive components of the plate.
Here the cod was served atop more cod.
The cod was perfectly cooked and pristine.
seared pacific cod.author: David D.
seared pacific cod.review:
Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39. So, there are lots of tourists around the restaurant and within the restaurant.  There are locals here as well.  For despite its location Fog Harbor is anything but a tourist trap.  Rather it is a goodwill ambassador for San Francisco being as good as it is.  Simply put Fog Harbor has great food, great service, a beautiful location overlooking the water, and the food is priced right.  Let me enumerate.

On arriving at the restaurant forty minutes early for my reservation I asked to hostess if it would be possible to seat me.  With a cheerful "Yes" she got me seated at a great table within five minutes.  A nice welcome is always appreciated.

On being seated my outstanding server Luana cheerfully greeted me and provided water and a loaf of wonderful sourdough bread.  Luana was very helpful in going over the menu with me thereby helping me order an outstanding meal.  For health reasons I have to limit my salt intake.  Luana let me know exactly what plates and components of plates had salt already built in or where salt could be held back.  And just when she had my main course ordered she went to the kitchen to remind the chefs to restrict salt where possible. You could go to any of the best, top-tier restaurants in San Francisco and not find better service than was provided me by Luana.  

My first course was a bowl of clam chowder to which they added crab for a quite reasonable surcharge.  The chowder may have been a bit too thick but it was filled with clams; and my goodness the crab atop the soup was sweet and well portioned.  Fog Harbor provides ample portions of very good food at a very fair price.  

My main course was seared pacific cod which came with white beans, tomatoes and spinach.  Normally when you see the fish atop something it is the less expensive components of the plate.  Here the cod was served atop more cod.  The cod was perfectly cooked and pristine.  The spinach was fresh and properly cooked, not some afterthought; likewise the beans and tomatoes.

As I left, Luana came running after me to give me my hat which I had left behind.  I will certainly be back in the near future to visit again with Luana and the rest of the Fog Harbor team.

excerpts: I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic
aioli.
This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base.
Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert.
seared pacific cod.author: Ranjan P.
seared pacific cod.review: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.

excerpts: I had the Grilled Shrimp Brochette (sauteed spinach, butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, $22).
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Lani S.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
Let's be clear. My husband and I were probably the only two in the restaurant who were not tourists given this is located at Pier 39. We went last Friday and it is Lent, so I don't eat meat. The hub searched for seafood places and came across this place on Yelp with high ratings. It did not disappoint, and as a local, I'm glad. 

The menu said that the clam chowder was award winning, so we had to try it. It was delicious --thick, creamy, flavorful, with big chunks of clam, not like other places that use extra potatoes for filler. $7 for a cup.

My husband had the Shellfish Platter (half crab, mussels, clams, & fingerling potatoes -$39 for one) and added a lobster tail (5-6oz, $24). He enjoyed all of it, but says the one thing he'd dock a star for is that the crab was a little dry. I had the Grilled Shrimp Brochette (sauteed spinach, butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, $22). The shrimp were a good size, it was flavorful, but a tad oilier than I like. 

Yes, we had dessert! For him: Apple Crisp a la mode. For me: as if I'd have anything other than tiramisu. They were both very good. $9 each. The tiramisu was probably one of the best I've had-- creamy and not over-soaked w/ espresso & liqueur like many others. 

I'd give this probably 4 stars, however our server, Brianna (assuming that was her name-- it was on our receipt!), really made the difference. Add another star just for her. She was welcoming from the start, friendly, not pushy, and kept checking on us. What gave us a good chuckle was that as we were leaving, she she wished us a nice "rest of your vacation," assuming we were tourists. We had a nice, quick chat w/ her and made our way out. Thanks, Brianna!

excerpts: We ordered mixed grill and grilled shrimp brochette for us and grilled shrimp from kids menu.
Even the food taste was like their employees attitude!
Only the calamari was good.
We visited almost all the restaurants there.
This one is the worst.
Even my 3 years old Throw his food.
Need to buy for him from other place.
Never ever to this place again.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Nawarid N.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
The employees are very rude. I went there with my husband and son. There was some ocean view table available but they didn't give us any! They served complementary bread and butter to everybody but they didn't give us ! Oh we look poor huh! 
We ordered mixed grill and grilled shrimp brochette for us and grilled shrimp from kids menu. Even the food taste was like their employees attitude! Only the calamari was good. We visited almost all the restaurants there. This one is the worst. Even my 3 years old Throw his food. Need to buy for him from other place. Never ever to this place again.

excerpts: I ordered the Grilled shrimp brochette which came plated beautifully with tasty sautéed spinach, roasted butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, and garlic butter.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Leila V.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
VIEWS! Seriously. Make sure you come here and sit at a window seat to take in the bay views from the pier -- big boats, golden gate bridge in the distance and Alcatraz. Right on Pier 39 this place is not to miss. 

I ordered the Grilled shrimp brochette which came plated beautifully with tasty sautéed spinach, roasted butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, and garlic butter. The dish was flavorful, healthy, delicious and not overly filling!

The service was 5/5. Views are 5/5 and Food was 5/5. The extra San Fran taxes were surprising coming from out of state, but totally worth it!

excerpts: Everyone got something different from the "World Famous Clam Chowder", to the burger and my grilled shrimp brochette.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Carolee M.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
Went up to San Francisco for the day with some family that had never been there before and wanted to find a good all around restaurant to treat them to.
We picked the right place! This place was spot on! Everyone got something different from the "World Famous Clam Chowder", to the burger and my grilled shrimp brochette. My son stuck to the simple grilled cheese and I had to fight him off my shrimp lol!

The view was beautiful, the atmosphere inside was just the right amount of upscale with still being relaxed enough to not feel out of place in our sight seeing attire. The only draw back was that it was a bit pricey. But that just allowed us to make sure we enjoyed every bite and the food was good enough to be worth the price!

excerpts: Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Anastasija V.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
We had a really great dinner here. Food is delicious, waiters are nice, atmosphere is lovely! 

Seafood is awesome. From starters we tried Crispy Calamari and they were super tasty. Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.  

Been here on Christmas Day - that day restaurant closed an opportunity to make a table reservation.
Restaurant was busy, we waited some time for table to get free. But waiting wasn't annoying. We had an opportunity to leave the name and phone number, so took a little walk around while waiting.

But anyway, we are super satisfied.
We definitely will come again.

Came back on a Valentines Day with friends. We were all satisfied again. This time we had both foods and deserts. Seafood was great just as the first time! There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome. Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing. Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty. From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant). Delicious! 

This time we hadn't any problems with time at all - had a reservation and service was pretty fast.

excerpts: I had the crab cakes for my appetizer which was very yummy (I highly recommend) and for my meal I had the grilled shrimp brochette which was scrumptious.
The shrimp were cooked perfectly and had the best flavor.
I definitely recommend this restaurant for the food and ambiance, however, because of the staffs sassy attitudes, it's debatable if I will be eating here again on my next visit to San Fran.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Shelby S.
grilled shrimp brochette.review: The food is definitely worth 5 stars, but the service was not. I didn't catch the name of our waitress, but she was just down right RUDE. I would consider this restaurant to be upscale so for staff to be rude is just unacceptable to me, especially when it's an expensive meal. However, looking past the horrible attitude of the waitress, the food and view was amazing. I had the crab cakes for my appetizer which was very yummy (I highly recommend) and for my meal I had the grilled shrimp brochette which was scrumptious. The shrimp were cooked perfectly and had the best flavor. I definitely recommend this restaurant for the food and ambiance, however, because of the staffs sassy attitudes, it's debatable if I will be eating here again on my next visit to San Fran.

excerpts: We read Yelp's reviews & dined here 2 days ago on the Grilled Shrimp Brochette.
8 jumbo shrimp, spinach, butternut squash & garlic mashed potatoes, cooked to perfection.
Wonderful!
Warm delicious sourdough bread, and an excellent martini!
Shawna was the perfect, efficient server we always hope to have.
And the view?
What more can I say?
Except, that we are not tourists, we live here!
Going back soon for a Holiday lunch with friends.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Flavia M.
grilled shrimp brochette.review: We read Yelp's reviews & dined here 2 days ago on the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. 8 jumbo shrimp, spinach, butternut squash & garlic mashed potatoes, cooked to perfection. Wonderful! Warm delicious sourdough bread, and an excellent martini! Shawna was the perfect, efficient server we always hope to have. And the view? What more can I say? Except, that we are not tourists, we live here! Going back soon for a Holiday lunch with friends.

excerpts: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k
with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread
its just that good.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Tommy M.
grilled shrimp brochette.review: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k. with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread its just that good.

excerpts: I had the grilled shrimp brochette.
They were perfectly cooked and had delicious seasoning with a spicy kick to them  definitely will be coming back here on our next trip to San Francisco.
The had a nice waiting area with a fireplace that made it coZy on a cold day.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Betty C.
grilled shrimp brochette.review:
Loved it! We were a party of 6 plus a baby. They told us it was going to be 40 minutes but ended up being sat within 15 minutes which was nice!   I really liked the ambiance of the restaurant.  Although the tables were a little too close together.   We were sat on a window view of the pier and had view of Alcatraz.  Our waiters were sweet and attentive although they sometimes forgot to bring us stuff and it took a while..... I had the grilled shrimp brochette.  They were perfectly cooked and had delicious seasoning with a spicy kick to them  definitely will be coming back here on our next trip to San Francisco.  
The had a nice waiting area with a fireplace that made it coZy on a cold day.

excerpts: I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette.
Both of them were very good!
The service was okay but not overly impressive.
The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross).
The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.
grilled shrimp brochette.author: Lori C.
grilled shrimp brochette.review: We were at the wharf for the afternoon and decided to grab a late lunch here based on the yelp reviews. I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. Both of them were very good! The service was okay but not overly impressive. The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross). The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.

excerpts: We proceeded to order a variety of dishes Blue Cheese Garlic breads, Crab cakes , ahi tuna poke, Red Chili Garlic Shrimp and the Crab .
The Crab cakes were  so soft and succulent
, I wished they would never end !
Our server recommended the Hibiscus Margarita , which I think wasn't that liked by either of us , it was way too sugary .
ahi tuna.author: Rashi T.
ahi tuna.review: Every time I have been to SFO , this is one place we always visited because someone in our party always ends up picking it based on the great reviews . Honestly it doesn't disappoint either. The seafood is good , the service is fast and the views .. ahh the views , well that's the first thing that catches your fancy. We had a nice spot near the window , especially with the sunlight filtering in . I would highly recommend the Clam Chowder , its pretty darn good . We proceeded to order a variety of dishes Blue Cheese Garlic breads, Crab cakes , ahi tuna poke, Red Chili Garlic Shrimp and the Crab . The Crab cakes were  so soft and succulent , I wished they would never end ! Our server recommended the Hibiscus Margarita , which I think wasn't that liked by either of us , it was way too sugary .

excerpts: We got the calamari, fish and chips as well as the ahi tuna.
All were excellent!
ahi tuna.author: Kasey L.
ahi tuna.review: The food here is very good! However for the price point the service was disappointing. We came at a time that wasn't busy either (around 2pm) so really disappointed in the service. We got the calamari, fish and chips as well as the ahi tuna. All were excellent!

excerpts: The crab cakes, which the server told us was different than other restaurants and some sort of Ahi Tuna dish (pictured)
Both were delicious and not too filling.
The server was really nice even though we didn't order alcohol.
ahi tuna.author: Vanita M.
ahi tuna.review:
My daughter and I were looking for a place for get a snack. SF has so many awesome food choices we didn't want to fill up too much at any one place. It was a Friday at 4 or so and we were seated pretty quickly. We ordered 2 appetizers. The crab cakes, which the server told us was different than other restaurants and some sort of Ahi Tuna dish (pictured) Both were delicious and not too filling. The server was really nice even though we didn't order alcohol. (I've experienced many occasions when the server seems annoyed)

The atmosphere is wonderful as is the view.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Ahi Tuna entree which he let me have a little of.
The Ahi tuna was seared and coated with sesame seeds but rare on the inside.
It had great flavor and melted in your mouth.
It was served with rice with an amazing soy/lime sauce that had a yummy smoky flavor.
ahi tuna.author: Meghan P.
ahi tuna.review:
Wow!!! This restaurant is amazing. I was out in the city with a good friend and she recommended we go to this restaurant for lunch. I was not disappointed. 

They served warm fresh sourdough bread while waiting for our entrees. The butter was perfectly salted and room temperature which I love. I ordered the half soup/salad. I got the Cesar salad with clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was more than filling I wasn't able to finish it all. Good thing I had my husband there to help me out. 

My husband ordered the Ahi Tuna entree which he let me have a little of. The Ahi tuna was seared and coated with sesame seeds but rare on the inside. It had great flavor and melted in your mouth. It was served with rice with an amazing soy/lime sauce that had a yummy smoky flavor. It was also served with vegetables. 

My friend got the mixed grill which came with salmon, cod and shrimp along with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes. 

We all left very full and satisfied. 

This restaurant has tons of yummy seafood options. I can't wait to come back to this restaurant and test out the other entrees.

excerpts: Love the crab and scallop risotto and the Ahi Tuna that we ordered.
The only the I would suggest it's about the AC, could be a bit colder.
Sometimes, when the room got too crowded, it could be really steaming.
But food is good tho.
ahi tuna.author: Johnny L.
ahi tuna.review: Really good food here! Love the crab and scallop risotto and the Ahi Tuna that we ordered. The only the I would suggest it's about the AC, could be a bit colder. Sometimes, when the room got too crowded, it could be really steaming. But food is good tho.

excerpts: Potentially the best calamari I have ever had (pictures included) and the Ahi Tuna with mixed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes was cooked to perfection.
I work without question recommend this to others as well as be a returning customer in my future endeavors in San Francisco!
ahi tuna.author: Warren S.
ahi tuna.review:
This is the first seafood spot I've been to in San Francisco and they set the bar HIGH! Starters, the location is gorgeous. Overlooking the bay, great lighting, and easy to get to. The service was friendly, gave great suggestions, and seemed genuine with their guests. I did not partake in the drinks or desert but from what I saw they looked great as well.

Now, the food.. the food was AMAZING! Potentially the best calamari I have ever had (pictures included) and the Ahi Tuna with mixed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes was cooked to perfection. I work without question recommend this to others as well as be a returning customer in my future endeavors in San Francisco!

excerpts: We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna.
The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff.
The crab cakes were good as well.
I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well.
But the service here, was just terrible.
Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink.
We had to ask for everything, straws, etc .
Our table was never cleared at anytime either.
All of our plates were just sitting on the table.
I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space.
Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything.
The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table.
ahi tuna.author: Mike N.
ahi tuna.review:
The restaurant has great ambience while still in the prime location of Pier 39. However today I was deeply disappointed with their service. We had a few things to try and it was all pretty good. We had the award winning clam chowder, Dungeness crab cakes, raw oysters, jumbo scallop and crab risotto, and the ahi tuna. The clam chowder was definitely great, it was not too heavy but just enough, it had a great portion of bacon and all the good stuff. The crab cakes were good as well. I liked the scallop and crab risotto as well. But the service here, was just terrible. Our drinks were never refilled or asked if we wanted another drink. We had to ask for everything, straws, etc . Our table was never cleared at anytime either. All of our plates were just sitting on the table. I was stacking plates one on top of another to open up space. Even after we moved on from the apps to the dinner items everything was left behind, app plates, the empty app plates, the oysters, everything. The oyster dish was sitting on our table even when we left which we finished fairly quickly after they were dropped off at our table. The ice turned into water and the oyster shells were floating around in the dish. 

After paying $170+ dollars is this what I should expect? By all means I have no issue spending money on food. But it really just hits a nerve when I get crappy service and I'm paying for it.....

I would go else where if your thinking about The Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna, and my wife had the jambalaya, it was so so good!!!
Even my daughter who's a very picky eater ate all her dinner, it was great.
Great portion sizes and the wait was very very quick.
We'll be back every time we head to San Francisco, thanks again for the awesome hospitality
and we look forward to next time.
ahi tuna.author: Timothy Z.
ahi tuna.review: The food was absolutely amazing!! The staff was awesome as well!! Our waiter Curtiss was so knowledgeable about the menu and what they had to offer. We thought we would give this place a try and we were so glad we did. I had the ahi tuna, and my wife had the jambalaya, it was so so good!!! Even my daughter who's a very picky eater ate all her dinner, it was great. Great portion sizes and the wait was very very quick. We'll be back every time we head to San Francisco, thanks again for the awesome hospitality and we look forward to next time.

excerpts: We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.
Everything was delicious.
The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.
Will totally come back.
ahi tuna.author: Eleonor T.
ahi tuna.review: Came here for my mother's 75th Birthday.  The food was absolutely fabulous. We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.  Everything was delicious.  The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.  Will totally come back.

excerpts: I ordered seafood pasta and Ahi tuna rare seared which came out
just ok.
$70 for both exluded drinks.
ahi tuna.author: Mai N.
ahi tuna.review: Long wait but the food was not that great. Average quality yet pricey. I ordered seafood pasta and Ahi tuna rare seared which came out just ok. $70 for both exluded drinks.

excerpts: I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna.
Pretty good.
Our guests were happy with thier selections as well.
I am already looking forward to my next visit here.
Be sure to call ahead for reservations.
ahi tuna.author: James H.
ahi tuna.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House was the final destination for our 9 person appreciaton dinner this evening. The location is awesome on pier 39 at Fishermans Warf on the Embarcadero with a stunning view of the Harbor. The location managed to awaken memories of my 1st trip here as a young teenager. The destination is the best its ever been, at least what I remember it to be. Best clam chowder ever! Dessert was Apple Crisp with a small scoop of ice cream on top. Prices are reasonable.

The service here was great as was the menu selection. I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna. Pretty good. Our guests were happy with thier selections as well. I am already looking forward to my next visit here. Be sure to call ahead for reservations.

excerpts: My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne.
I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite!
The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it.
ahi tuna.author: Sarina J.
ahi tuna.review:
Food is pretty good, but is HEAVY. Like I still feel the clam chowder in my stomach, writing this days later. Had to knock down a star for some service issues.

Due to traffic, we barely made the 10-minute cutoff for being late to our reservation. However, we sat for a good 10-15 minutes ignored by at least 3-4 staff members, including who we would find out to be our actual waitress. Just a little after opening, it was busy but not chaotic, and we got one of the last booths in the middle facing the water. However, no one stopped by to offer water or anything for these 10-15 minutes. When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away. Ooookay? However, her attitude adjusted quickly when she came back, and was extremely accommodating and polite afterwards.

As for the food, like I said, it was heavy. We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty. The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough. I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top. We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first. But everything was cooked well.

For my entree, I got the clam chowder and Caesar salad combo, but could barely finish half of the clam chowder. My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne. I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite! The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it. The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free! The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF. Pretty good! When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.

excerpts: The Ahi Tuna was delicious and grilled  shrimp entree.
The restaurant also serves complimentary warm sourdough bread.
They also serve delicious freshly squeezed orange juice and lemonade.
They also have a great selection of desserts.
The service was also amazing.
The restaurant is clean and romantic.
ahi tuna.author: Michelle H.
ahi tuna.review: I highly recommend coming here at opening. You'll have a higher chance of getting a window seat and getting a great view of the harbor and the pier. The Ahi Tuna was delicious and grilled  shrimp entree. The restaurant also serves complimentary warm sourdough bread. They also serve delicious freshly squeezed orange juice and lemonade. They also have a great selection of desserts. The service was also amazing. The restaurant is clean and romantic.

excerpts:
Got the ahi tuna steak and it made my taste buds jump! 
It truly just melted in my mouth. 
I can not wait to return one day to have this again. 
The mix drinks were fair. 
The atmosphere seemed like it was trying to be a bit classier 
but there was a lot more casual feel to it.
Overall service was decent. 
The view if you get seated well is enjoyable.
ahi tuna.author: Jax W.
ahi tuna.review:
By far the best thing I've had since being in San Fran. Got the ahi tuna steak and it made my taste buds jump! It truly just melted in my mouth. 
I can not wait to return one day to have this again. 
The mix drinks were fair. 
The atmosphere seemed like it was trying to be a bit classier but there was a lot more casual feel to it.
Overall service was decent. 
The view if you get seated well is enjoyable.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Poke $18
- Loved the flavors in this!
It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes.
I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors.
ahi tuna.author: Kathy N.
ahi tuna.review:
Disclaimer: Despite the fact that this restaurant has $$$, high stars and looks nice, you can totally get away with dressing casually!! 

The pricing of the dishes here were definitely a bit steep. 

We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish. It was basically your typical raw oysters - it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were. $34 for 12 oysters. 

Ahi Tuna Poke $18 - Loved the flavors in this! It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes. I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors. Great appetizer to start out our meal with.

Clam Chowder w/ Crab - got the cup size to try ($7), to add crab was an additional $7, but well worth it! Had to really get that seafood experience, right? The chowder was good on its own, but the crab added an extra umph and texture. I enjoyed it. Their chowder was also rewarded best in SF! 

Seafood Penne $23 - The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me. The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish. However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate! For a small girl, i found that this dish was just enough for me. 

Alaskan Halibut $34 - This was part of their seafood menu. A bit of a disappointment. Although the fish was very soft and fresh, it lacked flavor. We are more so people who enjoy more flavor in our dishes. Had to use sauce from the pasta so the fish wouldnt be so bland. 

Apple Crisp $8.50 - We came here for our anniversary, so they gave us a complimentary dessert. So nice of them! At the end of your meal, the server will come out with a tray of desserts to choose from - you select the one you want and they will prepare you a new one from the back. I was silly and was about to grab it right off the tray. The Apple Crisp was delicious. Not too sweet and served with vanilla ice cream. Unfortunately, i was too full from the dinner that i couldnt finish the dessert - which never happens.

For being a high rating restaurant with steep prices, I would have taken this place to be a more upscale restaurant, but its a great spot to come for any occasion at any time of the day.

excerpts: The Ahi Tuna was very flavorful.
Justin was our waiter
and he did a great job taking care of us.
We will definitely ask for him next time.
ahi tuna.author: Frank D.
ahi tuna.review: The seafood was very fresh and well prepared. The Ahi Tuna was very flavorful. Justin was our waiter and he did a great job taking care of us. We will definitely ask for him next time.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.
I was underwhelmed by my dish.
The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon.
The best fish on my plate was the shrimp.
ahi tuna.author: Payal V.
ahi tuna.review:
We tried coming here for Father's Day, but couldn't get a reservation for our large group. My family and I happened to be in town one Friday and decided to dine here since the menu had looked so good during Father's Day. 

It's a really nice restaurant amongst all of the casual tourist spots in the same area. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.  I was underwhelmed by my dish. The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon. The best fish on my plate was the shrimp. The other fish were dry and overcooked. 

My husband's ahi was good. The flavors came together well to make a good dish.

excerpts: Order scallop and crab meat risotto(summer menu, not sure if its available year round), ahi tuna poke, clam chowder sourdough bowl!
Clam chower was super creamy with lots of ingredients, the sourdough bowl was warm unlike other places near fisherman's wharf that serves the bowl cold!
Risotto was delicious, didnt overpower the crab meat at all!
ahi tuna.author: Cath C.
ahi tuna.review: Great service! We waited 20mins for a window seating! Great view of the waterfront! Our waiter had great suggestion off their menu! Order scallop and crab meat risotto(summer menu, not sure if its available year round), ahi tuna poke, clam chowder sourdough bowl! Clam chower was super creamy with lots of ingredients, the sourdough bowl was warm unlike other places near fisherman's wharf that serves the bowl cold! Risotto was delicious, didnt overpower the crab meat at all!

excerpts:
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. 
My little tot had the chicken tenders. 
All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.
ahi tuna.author: Jennie N.
ahi tuna.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: The blue cheese bread appetizer was fantastic, and the ahi tuna was firm yet melted in your mouth, and the halibut was just phenomenal.
Best meal I have probably ever had in my life.
Thank you all so much!
It was a special night for us, and you made it perfect!!
ahi tuna.author: Sarah M.
ahi tuna.review: I am horrified that I forgot our waitress's name, as she was just the sweetest and most patient woman and everything you could ever hope for with your dining experience . I literally told her, "thank you for being so wonderful" at the end of the night. We went around 9:00pm with no reservations on a Tuesday night, and were still given a table overlooking the water. Our waitress was super sweet and answered our 6,000 questions about the menu. We felt welcome, respected, and free to explore the menu. Most importantly, the food was AMAZING!!! Locally sourced and perfect. The blue cheese bread appetizer was fantastic, and the ahi tuna was firm yet melted in your mouth, and the halibut was just phenomenal. Best meal I have probably ever had in my life. Thank you all so much! It was a special night for us, and you made it perfect!!

excerpts: I ordered the ahi tuna, which was supposed to be seared rare, but it was cooked maybe medium/medium-rare... the wasabi aioli was really nice, though, and the rice it came with was super tasty.
I also had the hibiscus margarita, and that was bomb!
apparently it's voted the best margarita in the city by SF Weekly, and it was easy to see why.
ahi tuna.author: Angela H.
ahi tuna.review:
Really nice late lunch, and we got to catch the Fleet Week air show with the Blue Angels from our table. That alone should be worthy of five stars, but I need to deduct a star for my food. I ordered the ahi tuna, which was supposed to be seared rare, but it was cooked maybe medium/medium-rare... the wasabi aioli was really nice, though, and the rice it came with was super tasty. I also had the hibiscus margarita, and that was bomb! apparently it's voted the best margarita in the city by SF Weekly, and it was easy to see why. I also enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread that we got for a starter, especially dipped in a little bit of the lemon aioli that came with the calamari starter.

So. Two starters, two drinks each, and two entrees came out to $135 pre-tax. We spent about two hours there (or just over), and had a good meal and good entertainment with the air show. expensive, but worthwhile. Had the tuna been actually rare, I'd have given this visit five stars.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.
My first time having poke in the west coast
and I was not disappointed.
ahi tuna.author: Racheal D.
ahi tuna.review:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!

excerpts: I also ordered the Ahi entree which was a hefty ahi tuna steak encrusted in black and white sesame seeds and cooked to perfection and rare inside.
ahi tuna.author: Tammie W.
ahi tuna.review:
My husband and I were skeptical coming here, since you're gambling with great views vs. great food but we ended up getting a booth facing the water and had a great meal.  Definitely a win win.  

The waitress brought our drinks and a basket of warm sliced sourdough bread with a tray of butter.  It was the best bread during our stay in SF because it was so warm and soft.  

I then ordered the Caesar salad which was dressed nicely, had a nice salty taste from the anchovies in the dressing and had killer garlic croutons that I could've eaten like popcorn.  The salad was plenty big enough to share with my eye candy.  I also ordered the Ahi entree which was a hefty ahi tuna steak encrusted in black and white sesame seeds and cooked to perfection and rare inside.  The was sitting on top of a bed of toasted and seasoned rice and an array of sautéed vegetables including bok choy which was so tasty.  

My husband ordered the sole which was sautéed and served in a caper sauce and atop of vegetables and fingerling potatoes.  

We were both very satisfied and full at the end of the meal.  The bill came with biscoff cookies which were a nice treat as well.  The hostesses were friendly, the manager checked in on the tables and our server was friendly and attentive.

excerpts: we had the ahi tuna appetizer, and we split the pacific sole, and tiramisu on the house for our anniversary which was so sweet.
We look forward to coming again hopefully in the near future.
Thank you!!
ahi tuna.author: Sandy B.
ahi tuna.review: This is MY favorite Restaurant! I took my husband for our 5th year Anniversary. The service was WAY beyond our expectations. Curtis and Ashley both made it a memorable meal for both my husband and I. The food was superb we had the ahi tuna appetizer, and we split the pacific sole, and tiramisu on the house for our anniversary which was so sweet. We look forward to coming again hopefully in the near future. Thank you!!

excerpts: The food was amazing, both steak and seafood (ahi tuna) cooked to rare-perfection!
Yum!
ahi tuna.author: Briana S.
ahi tuna.review: Dinner with an amazing view! We had to wait a bit longer for a table specifically by the window, but we sat by the fireplace; it was worth it! The drinks were delish (I added vodka to their homemade lemonade) and the wine list did not disappoint. The food was amazing, both steak and seafood (ahi tuna) cooked to rare-perfection! Yum!

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder, spicy garlic shrimp, lobster tail, and ahi tuna.
Justin was very accommodating and gave us great recommendations.
If we lived in San Francisco we would come here all the time!!!
ahi tuna.author: Lisa H.
ahi tuna.review: The food is amazing here! We ordered the clam chowder, spicy garlic shrimp, lobster tail, and ahi tuna. Justin was very accommodating and gave us great recommendations. If we lived in San Francisco we would come here all the time!!!

excerpts: The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome.
ahi tuna.author: Kritpong S.
ahi tuna.review:
Great food, awesome view, good waiter, horrible hostess.

Took my wife there for a fancy dinner with a view today for our last dinner in San Francisco. The dinner started off great with prompt seating and we ordered our food. 

The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome. 

So after dinner my wife and I took turn to go to the restroom after we ordered dessert. While my wife walk away the waiter came and took our dishes and drop off 2 dessert spoons. Not a minute after that I over heard 2 hostess talking no more than 5 feet away from our table about how we have been sitting at the table for a long time not ordering anything and why are we not leaving. I was shocked and pissed off at them. 

I looked over at them and they gave me a look like oh you heard that? Then took a couple step back and kept talking about us and other table. WTF? 

Totally ruin the experience for me. I understand that it's a busy friday night but we were not just lounging around not ordering any food. Even if we were to lounge around enjoy the view after our meal we should be able too in peace! We end up spending over $100 for the meal and I was totally disappointed with the experience.

excerpts: Ordered the ahi tuna poke appetizer, lettuce wedge, and crab cocktail.
The first two were superbly done, very flavorful.
I could've done without the crab - I thought it would be lump meat
but it was sort of in shreds.
Don't miss the complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter!
So good!!
Also had the mojito to drink and it was exquisite.
Of course it all was pricey but that seems to be the way of San Francisco.
Bon appetit!
ahi tuna.author: Michelle S.
ahi tuna.review:
Ordered the ahi tuna poke appetizer, lettuce wedge, and crab cocktail. The first two were superbly done, very flavorful. I could've done without the crab - I thought it would be lump meat but it was sort of in shreds.
Don't miss the complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter! So good!!
Also had the mojito to drink and it was exquisite.
Of course it all was pricey but that seems to be the way of San Francisco.
Bon appetit!

excerpts: The seared ahi tuna melts in your mouth.
Grab a bottle of Kunde Sauvignon Blanc-
it will enhance any meal.
The wait staff is typically very accommodating, timely, and personable which only adds to this great experience.
Hostesses are apparently stressed due to their curt responses.
Would have been 5 stars but for the hostesses & disgusting restroom that smelled like it hadn't been cleaned in 8 hot years (the rr not the hostess)
Don't forget to get the 1-hour validation ticket from your server!
Bon appetit!
ahi tuna.author: Ella H.
ahi tuna.review: We have visited once a year, 3 years running. The chowder is superb, except for the bacon they put in this fish dish. (aka please stop) Get the extra crab on top- you won't regret it. The seared ahi tuna melts in your mouth. Grab a bottle of Kunde Sauvignon Blanc- it will enhance any meal. The wait staff is typically very accommodating, timely, and personable which only adds to this great experience. Hostesses are apparently stressed due to their curt responses. Would have been 5 stars but for the hostesses & disgusting restroom that smelled like it hadn't been cleaned in 8 hot years (the rr not the hostess) Don't forget to get the 1-hour validation ticket from your server! Bon appetit!

excerpts: We had the Ahi Tuna and the scallops risotto.
Excellent tiramisu to top off the meal.
It's pricey but great place for a occasion.
ahi tuna.author: Ameya C.
ahi tuna.review: This is a great place to go for seafood in SFO. If you get the right table, you can have some top notch seafood while overlooking the bay and glimpses of the Golden Gate Bridge. Their service is courteous with a smile. We had the Ahi Tuna and the scallops risotto. Excellent tiramisu to top off the meal. It's pricey but great place for a occasion.

excerpts: For the main course, I ordered the Ahi Tuna, seared with a sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables.
ahi tuna.author: Steve N.
ahi tuna.review:
From the outdoor lounge area, the bar, and the dining area, Fog Harbor Fish House is fancy, and packed with out-of-town Fisherman's Wharf visitors. They have the best view of the bay with its bigger than life bay windows! The staff was very professional in appearance and provided excellent service. I ordered some fried calamari for my appetizer. It was so delicious particularly dipped in the sauce that was provided. For the main course, I ordered the Ahi Tuna, seared with a sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables. I had a side of rice to go along with that. 

This place is a tad pricey, but for the price you pay at almost any San Francisco restaurant, I guess it's considered pretty standard. I definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in the San Francisco area!

excerpts: Also mind blowing was the seared Ahi Tuna.
It's perfectly seared "rare" and topped with a delicious ginger soy glaze, accompanied perfectly with a garlic jasmine rice.
ahi tuna.author: Liz G.
ahi tuna.review:
All I can say is, Wow!! The food here is mind-blowing! There are many great spots for clam chowder in San Francisco, but I've never had it topped with Dungeness Crab!! What a great way to start our meal! (Check out my pic)

Also mind blowing was the seared Ahi Tuna. It's perfectly seared "rare" and topped with a delicious ginger soy glaze, accompanied perfectly with a garlic jasmine rice. My mouth could barely contain this flavor flurry.

My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes. Had I not eaten so much delicious sourdough bread prior to our food arrival, I would have eaten more of his food too! 

Did I mention there's also a beautiful view of the wharf?? It was the perfect birthday dinner! Definitely coming back next time we're in town!!

excerpts: We also got Ahi Tuna and Crab cakes.
ahi tuna.author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.
ahi tuna.review:
I love the dining area. Anywhere you sit you get a view of the water.  

We had their fried combo platter, which came with shrimp, fish, and calamari.  Everything was fried to perfection.  Our kids loved the fried fish.  I had the linguini and clam. It came with a very generous serving of Clams. For $18usd, you get a big serving of pasta and clams. It was seasoned to perfection.  We also got Ahi Tuna and Crab cakes.  I think the crab cakes was too expensive. 

It was good food. But it was also expensive.   I guess it is expected for a tourist area like this.

excerpts: For dinner, I had the Dungeness crab sandwich and she had the Ahi Tuna.
The sandwich was a piece of buttered/toasted Texas toast stuffed with crab!
Oh and no mayo!!
Finally a restaurant lets the star of the dish shine!
The Ahi tuna was unbelievable.
Seared perfectly with a wasabi aoli and super delish rice and veggie mix.
She remarked it was better than the Ahi tuna we just had in Maui!
ahi tuna.author: Robert W.
ahi tuna.review:
Oh my gosh this place is amazing!! Our last night in SF and we were looking for a place that would not let us down. No reservation, got seated right away in a booth with a view of Alcatraz, amazing! My wife and I ordered a salad. Her salad was the beet and goat cheese salad and it was delicious. Big portion, generous with the beets and goat cheese. I had a mix green and it too was generous but lacked the wow of her salad. 

For dinner, I had the Dungeness crab sandwich and she had the Ahi Tuna. The sandwich was a piece of buttered/toasted Texas toast stuffed with crab! Oh and no mayo!! Finally a restaurant lets the star of the dish shine! The Ahi tuna was unbelievable.  Seared perfectly with a wasabi aoli and super delish rice and veggie mix. She remarked it was better than the Ahi tuna we just had in Maui!

The dessert choices are excellent as well. We opted for the bread pudding and cream brûlée. Both were excellent!  Service was was also excellent hence the 5 stars!

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Poke - best thing we got by far.

Absolutely delicious, so fresh and light. 
Fish & Chips - unexceptional.
I like fish & chips, but I found these a little floury.
The service was great - and the ahi tuna poke and clam chowder were both delicious!
ahi tuna.author: Sharon C.
ahi tuna.review:
I had lunch here with a couple friends - the wait wasn't too long, we were seated promptly and our server was amazing. 

We got: 
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - free if you stop at the tourism center first and look through some of the maps for coupons! I wouldn't actually pay for this - but then again, I don't really like cheese. 
Clam Chowder - I was craving clam chowder and that's pretty much the reason we wound up here. This hit the spot - flavorful, creamy and generally delicious with the bread. 
Ahi Tuna Poke - best thing we got by far. Absolutely delicious, so fresh and light. 
Fish & Chips - unexceptional. I like fish & chips, but I found these a little floury. I wouldn't get this again. 

I would go back here despite it being a complete tourist trap. The service was great - and the ahi tuna poke and clam chowder were both delicious!

excerpts: apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters.
Both were delicious!
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
The baked oysters were great in an interesting way...
ahi tuna.author: Julia M.
ahi tuna.review:
Very ambivalent about this place. First downside is that they don't take reservations so when we (locals) wanted to go here at 7 PM on a Saturday night, we knew we'd have to wait a while. It ended up taking about 45 minutes.

PROS
-Amazing views! We got seated in the area right on the water. The sun was setting right behind the GGB. It was great. 
-We couldn't decide which bottle of wine we wanted so the waiter let us all taste both! They have a pretty good wine selection.
-For apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters. Both were delicious! The baked oysters were great in an interesting way... Spinach, bacon, and cheese, yum!

CONS
-Once we decided which wine we wanted, it took the waiter a realllllly long time to actually bring out our bottle (at least 20 minutes).
-Our mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic! Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad... It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top. When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon. So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab. While it was very good, there was nothing with it. I was, at least, expecting some butter to dip my crab in.

Again, really ambivalent about this place because the food was pretty good but there were just a few blunders. It's also pretty expensive here.

excerpts:
The starters were:
Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl, 
Calamari, 
Tuna Thai Salad, 
Ahi Tuna Poke, and
Crab Cakes
The Ahi Tuna Poke was very aesthetically pleasing and flavors were just on point with this one!
Fresh tuna and avocado with a Wasabi aioli all add up to create a party in your mouth!

The main courses I tried are as followed:
Surf and Turf, and
Ahi Tuna
The Ahi Tuna had a light sear on the outside, keeping the inside rare.
The sesame seeds added some needed 'CRUNCH' to the tuna, which was already flavorful!
Sear was excellent, and the Wasabi aioli just complements the dish even further.
Aesthetically, the dish was BEAUTIFULLY presented!
ahi tuna.author: Elbert N.
ahi tuna.review:
This review header is only being updated to conform with the outline for all my Yelp reviews. The ratings below will NOT change.

SERVICE: 95/100

We made a reservation at 8pm. Our server, Mila, got us seated early at a table with a decent view of the Bay and Alcatraz. We were immediately seated, but drinks were not brought out within 10 minutes. Once drinks were served, we were given another 5 minutes or so to look at the menu and order what we want. Mila was super patient with us and just an outstanding server! Thank you!

FOOD: 95/100

We ordered quite a bit, actually, so let me break this down. 

The starters were:
Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl, 
Calamari, 
Tuna Thai Salad, 
Ahi Tuna Poke, and
Crab Cakes

The Clam Chowder was just delicious! A nice, thick soup that didn't water up the bread, but still got absorbed by the (fresh) sourdough bowl and packed nice flavors in a very aesthetically pleasing manner. 

The Calamari, although not as aesthetically pleasing in terms of how they plated it...splendid! Crunchy outside, tender squid on the inside. The lemon and aioli complemented the dish well. 

The Tuna Thai Salad was...above average. Yes, fresh. Yes, flavorful. Yes, presentable. But...it's a salad after all. It's nothing to be excited about. The tuna just added to the dish. 

The Crab Cakes...oh my God! How do you start this? Crispy on the outside, yet soft and flavorful on the inside with LOTS (and I mean LOTS) of REAL crab! This is an appetizer I definitely recommend!

The Ahi Tuna Poke was very aesthetically pleasing and flavors were just on point with this one! Fresh tuna and avocado with a Wasabi aioli all add up to create a party in your mouth! I would ALSO recommend this app!

The main courses I tried are as followed:
Surf and Turf, and
Ahi Tuna

The Surf and Turf was some of the best lobster-and-steak I have ever had! A beautifully cooked medium 10 ounce New York Strip and a lobster tail so large and delicious, you'd think it's more a mermaid fin than a lobster tail!

The Ahi Tuna had a light sear on the outside, keeping the inside rare. The sesame seeds added some needed 'CRUNCH' to the tuna, which was already flavorful! Sear was excellent, and the Wasabi aioli just complements the dish even further. Aesthetically, the dish was BEAUTIFULLY presented! Overall a well-executed dish! 

Dessert gave us a whole lot of options to choose from.

In this instance, my sister decided to choose the
Tiramisu. Wow. Just wow. Words escape me at how perfectly executed the tiramisu was! 

Nice, large, and square; it was large enough to feed our party of 5! The flavors inside were a nice bitterness of, what I assume, is coffee and a sweetness from the whipped cream on the side and the filling inside. Very moist and flavorful, so, overall, it's a great dessert that EVERYONE should try at least once in their lifetime!

VALUE: 90/100

This is not your typical workday lunch break restaurant. Is there a better way to put this into words? Hell, I doubt it.

OVERALL SCORE: 93/100

-----------------------------

TL;DR - A lovely restaurant with excellent food, service, atmosphere, and views on Pier 39! A bit pricey, but you honestly can't beat fresh seafood straight from Fisherman's Wharf!

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Poke was delicious along with their clam chowder.
ahi tuna.author: Carmen O.
ahi tuna.review:
Delicious food with an amazing view! Ahi Tuna Poke was delicious along with their clam chowder. 

Arrived around 6:30p.m. We were told our wait time would be 15-20 minutes. Wait time was less then 15 minutes. 

Friendly staff. Our server, although it got busy was awesome!

excerpts: We had the clams, ahi tuna, shrimp, salmon and swordfish.
All of which I've had far better tasting versions even in joints like red lobster.
Given the quality of taste, I'm not quite sure it was worth the money we spent.
ahi tuna.author: Aidan H.
ahi tuna.review:
After spending a day in San Francisco, I was really excited to eat some good seafood. My wife and I are both foodies particularly with great seafood. I've had some really good fish in my day, but the day I ate here was not a good day. I was extremely disappointed in the food. It was good quality fish - given the fact that the restaurant is right on the pier. The biggest problem was how it tasted. It was extremely under seasoned. We had the clams, ahi tuna, shrimp, salmon and swordfish. All of which I've had far better tasting versions even in joints like red lobster. Given the quality of taste, I'm not quite sure it was worth the money we spent. I was simply disappointed and left wanting

To the inexperienced, this seafood may be a good intro to seafood as most of the other places you will try will be much better. 


I'm not quite sure what it is with coastal restaurants . The worst lobster I've had was in Maine and now I think similarly of fish in California.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna dinner with wild rice -
ahi tuna.author: Greg Y.
ahi tuna.review:
The Fog House is a wonderful example of the amazing food available in San Fransisco.  The location on the pier is stunning and you get views from every seat in the room.  It's a shame I live in NY and won't be able to eat here until 2017 when I plan on traveling back to SF.  

Appetizers:  Calamari; New England Clam Chowder. 
   -Both amazing and the NE clam chowder is a must order if you are a fan.  The best one I've ever had and that's a East Coast man talking.


Dinners:  Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.

  Lobster Tail with Garlic mashed potatoes - My fiancé loves lobster, she said it was perfectly cooked and was delectable as well.

  Ahi Tuna dinner with wild rice - My fiancé's cousin ate the entire dish and was another very satisfied customer.

Restaurant atmosphere was fantastic and our waiter was extremely attentive, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly.

excerpts: I had the Ahi Tuna, seared to perfection, with a wasabi aioli.
Definitely recommend if in the San Fran area.
ahi tuna.author: Michelle H.
ahi tuna.review: Amazing food!!!   The clam chowder was one of the best I have had (and I am from MA).  BF had the filet, it was so tender and had so much flavor with the mushroom sauce topped with crumbled blue cheese.   I had the Ahi Tuna, seared to perfection, with a wasabi aioli.  Definitely recommend if in the San Fran area.

excerpts: I had the seared ahi tuna on rice, and let me tell you, I could have only eaten that the entire trip and not be sick of it.
The ahi was perfect and the rice wasn't soggy.
ahi tuna.author: Amy F.
ahi tuna.review:
When we stopped here we definitely felt under dressed; we had jeans, t shirt, and tennis shoes. The atmosphere felt more business casual. The hostess was friendly and we waited outside to semi people watch, not a lot of people at 7pm. 

We were seated 10 minutes later even without reaervations. And we had a good view of the upper boardwalk near a window. We started with the spicy shrimp which had a good amount of kick. I did try the clam chowder, which I needed to try at least a bowl coming from Pier 39. Very very good. Small enough to still enjoy when the food came. I had the seared ahi tuna on rice, and let me tell you, I could have only eaten that the entire trip and not be sick of it. The ahi was perfect and the rice wasn't soggy. My husband ordered the salmon, which was a special that night, and he couldn't save it like he claimed. For dessert we went with creme brulee which for us was a delight in itself. Perfectly coated on top.

One big con is the dress code that I wish we would have considered going. I definitely felt out of place.

Recommended? Absolutely no doubt. Enjoy the food and the not seemingly crowded restaurant.

excerpts: My wife had the Ahi tuna which was terrific.
I had the selfish plate which was good.
I will definitely eat here again when I visit San Francisco.
ahi tuna.author: Michael C.
ahi tuna.review:
We did not make a reservation on a Saturday night.  We arrived about 6:30. The hostess took our name and your cell phone number.  She said  the wait would be about 30 minutes, but that we would be texted when the table was ready.  So we took off to explore fisherman's wharf. About 25 minutes later we were texted.  We returned to the Fog House and were seated very shortly there after.  I hate the wait, but this was very nice way to do things. The view from the Restaurant is of the bay, very pleasant.
The service was good. The clam chowder and sourdough bread  were amazing.  My wife had the Ahi tuna which was terrific. I had the selfish plate which was good.  I will definitely eat here again when I visit San Francisco.

excerpts: We tried the fried calamari, clam chowder (highly recommend), and ahi tuna.
Everything was delicious and service was very good.
Really recommend this place for dinner if you're in the area!
ahi tuna.author: Aja J.
ahi tuna.review: My sister and I were visiting San Francisco for the first time and scheduled a night tour at Alcataraz. We decided to stay in the neighborhood to get dinner and heard about Fog Harbor Fish House. We made a reservation. We tried the fried calamari, clam chowder (highly recommend), and ahi tuna. Everything was delicious and service was very good. Really recommend this place for dinner if you're in the area!

excerpts: My lady had the Ahi Tuna and it was bomb.com!
We ordered bloody Mary's which delivered on spice and content.
Service was excellent and our waitress checked up on us at just the right times.
Wonderful overall experience I can't say enough!
ahi tuna.author: Mo K.
ahi tuna.review: Brought my GF here yesterday for her birthday and boy was it amazing! The ambiance was great, over looking the water and watching the sea lions perched on the floating docs. Beautiful. The food was something else! The Calamari is just heaven mixed with the fried onions and jalapeños! The clam chowder in a bread bowl was a must try and it delivered beautifully. The Filet Migñon topped with Crab just made my day. My lady had the Ahi Tuna and it was bomb.com! We ordered bloody Mary's which delivered on spice and content. Service was excellent and our waitress checked up on us at just the right times. Wonderful overall experience I can't say enough!

excerpts: For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ).
It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures.
ahi tuna.author: Adele F.
ahi tuna.review:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

excerpts: Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.
Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.
The service is friendly and efficient, too!
ahi tuna.author: F H.
ahi tuna.review: We ordered the half dozen oysters and clam chowder for appetizers- excellent.  Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.  Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.  The service is friendly and efficient, too!

excerpts: I got the Ahi Tuna and it was cooked to perfection.
Also has a great view of the wharf.
ahi tuna.author: James O.
ahi tuna.review: Great food. My wife got the fish and chips. They were awesome. Light and crispy crust with flaky cod. I got the Ahi Tuna and it was cooked to perfection. Also has a great view of the wharf.

excerpts: Visited today and I had the ahi tuna salad and mussels....got food poison
and I have been throwing up since lunch.
I'll never go back.
ahi tuna.author: Patrick B.
ahi tuna.review: Visited today and I had the ahi tuna salad and mussels....got food poison and I have been throwing up since lunch. I'll never go back.

excerpts: I had the Ahi Tuna with wild rice which had some cilantro and peppers which gave it a fresh taste.
ahi tuna.author: Sofia R.
ahi tuna.review:
Went this past Friday 3/4 for my birthday and had an amazing experience. Our server was very attentive and amicable. 

We had the Baked Clams as appetizer; the Clams were great, you could taste the spinach and bacon bits in the crust. 

I had the Ahi Tuna with wild rice which had some cilantro and peppers which gave it a fresh taste. The tuna was perfectly crusted with sesame seeds and it was a good medium sized portion. 

My boyfriend had the Swordfish and he said it was juicy. 

For dessert we had the creme brûlée and it was worth every bite!

excerpts: The Ahi Tuna was perfectly/lightly cooked and a very substantial portion.
Fresh and delicious.
ahi tuna.author: S And J T.
ahi tuna.review: Our first visit here and they actually got us in for dinner on Valentine's Day without a reservation. Amazing! Not the best table, but, with their superb location and all those windows, we still had a beautiful view of the bay at sunset. The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was indeed "jumbo" AND delicious. The chowder was excellent but, be warned, my vegetarian wife couldn't have any because it has bacon in it. The Ahi Tuna was perfectly/lightly cooked and a very substantial portion. Fresh and delicious. Wife got the mixed grill and couldn't stop oozing over the swordfish. It was the best either us of us has ever had. Full disclosure, we live in the desert.

excerpts: My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak..
He said the same thing I said about the tuna.
Too much going on.
ahi tuna.author: Fiona T.
ahi tuna.review:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it.
