I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder in bread bow, choppino, and the Ahi tuna poke.
The food is excellent!
Clam chowder is very creamy and tasty.
Choppino's seafood absorbs all the tomato source combined with seafood taste making them a perfect dish.
Tuna pone is very beautiful with awesome taste!
Service is excellent!
We sat next to the window, so also took advantage of the great view!
ahi tuna.author: Linzi Z.
ahi tuna.review: Awesome place! We ordered the clam chowder in bread bow, choppino, and the Ahi tuna poke. The food is excellent! Clam chowder is very creamy and tasty. Choppino's seafood absorbs all the tomato source combined with seafood taste making them a perfect dish. Tuna pone is very beautiful with awesome taste! Service is excellent! We sat next to the window, so also took advantage of the great view!

excerpts:
Poke was good but  used avocados as filler
Ahi tuna was the star.
Husband loved it
and it was his first time ordering this kind of dish.
Customer service was ok but felt it could've been better by being more attentive and personable.
Oh yea view was awesome!
ahi tuna.author: Claire J.
ahi tuna.review:
3.5 Service was ok
Cioppino was good but broth lacked depth
Poke was good but  used avocados as filler
Ahi tuna was the star.  Husband loved it and it was his first time ordering this kind of dish. 
Customer service was ok but felt it could've been better by being more attentive and personable.  
Oh yea view was awesome!

excerpts: I was stuck between choosing the seafood platter or the seared ahi tuna.
In the end, I went with the seared ahi tuna, and it came with this amazing wild rice and seasonal vegetables!
The tuna was a very decent portion and it came crusted with sesame seeds and a ginger glaze.
ahi tuna.author: Pegah Y.
ahi tuna.review:
I visited San Francisco (for the second time ever) last weekend and we decided to eat at Pier 39, since I remembered that it had great seafood restaurants.  I realized that I'd actually eaten at Fog Harbor Fish House during my first visit to SF exactly 7 years ago!  I was not disappointed at all by my second visit. 

It was a beautiful and clear (not foggy at all!) day in San Francisco and the tourists were all abuzz in the pier area.  Though Fog Harbor Fish House is a huge tourist attraction, it's definitely not a tourist trap.  I really enjoyed the service (very nice!) and also the selection of foods.  I was stuck between choosing the seafood platter or the seared ahi tuna.  In the end, I went with the seared ahi tuna, and it came with this amazing wild rice and seasonal vegetables!  The tuna was a very decent portion and it came crusted with sesame seeds and a ginger glaze.  So delicious!  

To top it off, I got a bowl of clam chowder (their chowder is amazing here!) and a pina colada on the side. 

We had such an excellent view of the bay - the Golden Gate bridge was in view, as was Alcatraz island.  

What a lovely visit to SF!  I will certainly be back again to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House when I'm in SF in the future!

excerpts: Husband's ahi tuna was not cooked well.
His sides were okay.
Kids enjoyed hot fudge sundae desserts.
Probably decent choice if you need a meal on Pier 39 but San Fran certainly has much better options elsewhere.
ahi tuna.author: Amy A.
ahi tuna.review: Super touristy but food not bad and view is pretty cool. My seafood trio was average and garlic mashed potatoes were bland and lumpy. Son's salmon BLT was quite good and I had plate envy. Husband's ahi tuna was not cooked well. His sides were okay. Kids enjoyed hot fudge sundae desserts. Probably decent choice if you need a meal on Pier 39 but San Fran certainly has much better options elsewhere.

excerpts: One other ordered the Ahi Tuna and really enjoyed it.
ahi tuna.author: David A.
ahi tuna.review:
First, this place is expensive so check the menu before you put your name in.   

Second, the food was great!  Two of us shared the Seafood Platter for 2.  It was very good.  

One other ordered the Ahi Tuna and really enjoyed it. 

We are glad we stopped in.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna (RARE)
- I asked to have my wasabi on the side since my wife doesn't like wasabi, and it was complied nicely.
can have more flavors, but i liked the unique taste.
ahi tuna.author: gswfan ..
ahi tuna.review:
My wife and I came here for our anniversary dinner.
I made a reservation and we were promptly seated to a nicely reserved table.  Good thing the reservation was made because it was crowded and a line was forming.  I didn't mention anything specifically about our reserved seat, but they were thoughtful enough to gave us the window seat, where we could see the bridge and the bay.  when I looked at my wife's surprised look and happy smile, I knew this place is going to get 5 stars, and everything else would be gravy

and yes, turned out there was a lot of gravy.  the whole setting was very romantic... not only dimmed light, but there's a candle on each of the table.  place is not noisy despite being full.  our server was very friendly and helpful, and NO change of attitude when we decided not to order any wine or dessert.

for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.  wish they gave us more than one piece of garlic bread because there's a lot of nice sauce to dip from.

Ahi Tuna (RARE) - I asked to have my wasabi on the side since my wife doesn't like wasabi, and it was complied nicely.  can have more flavors, but i liked the unique taste.  outside is nicely cooked with a bit crispy, with a lot of sesame seeds, but the inside it's like sashimi.  

it was a very special night for my wife and I, and when we were leaving, more than one person (not just our server) greeted us with good bye and thank you.

excerpts: Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great.
ahi tuna.author: Benny H.
ahi tuna.review:
I'm really going to have a hard time with this review as I actually really did enjoy the food, but it was easily the worst service I've had in a decent amount of time. 

Not sure if they were having a hard time adjusting for the Labor Day tourists, but when you have to ask for ketchup three times from three different servers, you know things aren't going well. 

I had the crab roll which was great. Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great. Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad. It's a typical seafood place located within the tourist utopia that is Fisherman's Wharf. 

We had a nice gentleman who was taking care of us while our server was on break, and he was fantastic. Once he left things really took a hit. Our server was nice, but we barely saw her. We had oyster shells on our table for nearly 30 minutes. 30 minutes. They normally take those away within minutes. 

It's a nice location, with pretty good food, but they really need to step up the service.

excerpts: My husband had the Ahi Tuna and it was less than stellar also.
We left feeling fleeced.
The carpet was filthy also.
Please don't waste your money - you've been warned!
ahi tuna.author: AP C.
ahi tuna.review: This is a money pit and a tourist trap. PLEASE stay away, if you know what's good for you! The food was worth about 1/10 of the price and the service was just as bad. We had a reservation here for our "nice" family dinner while on vacation in SF. We had high expectations because of the good ratings (which I'm really confused about now) and because we ate at Alioto's as few years back in the same area (and it was fantastic). This place, however, was a sad, mediocre excuse for a seafood restaurant. Our waitress, though polite, was literally looking at other customers and around the restaurant while taking our order. It soured our experience from the start. The menu is limited and there is nothing special on it. I had the fried shrimp because I really didn't want anything else on the menu, and it was as good as fried shrimp at Sizzler. My daughter had the Linguine with clams and I was actually angry when I saw the microscopic size of the clams. The linguine seemed like it was just boiled and put on the plate. White wine sauce? Hahahaha - you must be joking! What a sham! My husband had the Ahi Tuna and it was less than stellar also. We left feeling fleeced. The carpet was filthy also. Please don't waste your money - you've been warned!

excerpts: We also ordered the ahi tuna and their oysters, but the swordfish!
So many things to like about this restaurant 1) obviously the food 2) ambiance and view 3) food came out right away
4) staff was very friendly and accomodating.
I highly recommend it, yes it is pricey but for the quality
ahi tuna.author: Natalia P.
ahi tuna.review: Currently eating here and I gotta say, amazing! So good that I was excited to write the review right away so I wouldnt forget. The swordfish was out of this world, pan seared in a delicious pesto sauce. We also ordered the ahi tuna and their oysters, but the swordfish! So many things to like about this restaurant 1) obviously the food 2) ambiance and view 3) food came out right away 4) staff was very friendly and accomodating. I highly recommend it, yes it is pricey but for the quality

excerpts: Our waitress was perfect, the meals (we both had ahi tuna) were tremendous and fresh, and we got our favorite window seat looking out over to Alcatraz.
Just the perfect evening!!!!!
Love love love this place and please: eat the sourdough bread.
It's to die for!!
Kudos to a fantastic restaurant!
We will be back!!!!!
ahi tuna.author: Sandra P.
ahi tuna.review: This restaurant absolutely NEVER disappoints!!!!! It's in one of the most touristy places in SF, yet it's top shelf!! We went here tonight after a hellious week on public transportation. My boyfriend picked me up from work and we headed to the Fog Harbor. Pier 39 was teeming with tourists but we only had a 10 minute wait. Our waitress was perfect, the meals (we both had ahi tuna) were tremendous and fresh, and we got our favorite window seat looking out over to Alcatraz. Just the perfect evening!!!!! Love love love this place and please: eat the sourdough bread. It's to die for!!  Kudos to a fantastic restaurant! We will be back!!!!!

excerpts: Ordered the mixed grill, fish and chips, and ahi tuna, and a wedge salad.
All dishes were tasty, see photos.
ahi tuna.author: Randi B.
ahi tuna.review: So dang delicious. Bread comes out warm and fresh. Ordered the mixed grill, fish and chips, and ahi tuna, and a wedge salad. All dishes were tasty, see photos.

excerpts: We started with ahi tuna poke.
The tuna was super fresh and was good
but I wish there was more sesame oil on it.
We also had the sourdough bread bowl, which was amazing.
For my veggie friends, though it wasn't on the menu they specially made a pasta with veggies.
And the bread, oh MY the bread.
Delicious.
ahi tuna.author: Namita A.
ahi tuna.review:
Though this place is in one of the most touristy spots in San Francisco, it is absolutely a fab place to eat and drink!  We went for a celebratory dinner for my brothers graduation and birthday and even though we were a group of 8, they were able to seat us in 10 minutes which was great. 

The ambience and view is great with a view of the water and bustling room.  We had a few great glasses of sauv blanc and merlot which were delicious.  We started with ahi tuna poke. The tuna was super fresh and was good but I wish there was more sesame oil on it.  We also had the sourdough bread bowl, which was amazing.  For my veggie friends, though it wasn't on the menu they specially made a pasta with veggies.  And the bread, oh MY the bread. Delicious. My sister and I shared the cioppino, sooo amazing.  

Service was good - so overall great evening but the only negative was the tuna poke which just wasn't flavoured as well as I would have hoped

excerpts: We had Ahi Tuna and crab.
The food was good although the plates were way too busy with extra garnishes that took away from the main entree.
Someone reading this review should not be discouraged.
A bit more attentiveness from the waiter and less busy plates would have led to a higher rating for sure.
ahi tuna.author: David F.
ahi tuna.review: My son and I were here on a Tuesday night.  Our reservation was at 8:30 and they took us right on time.  The restaurant was busy and the noise level was loud.  The service was fair.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive but clearly busy with a lot of tables.  We had Ahi Tuna and crab.  The food was good although the plates were way too busy with extra garnishes that took away from the main entree.  Someone reading this review should not be discouraged.  A bit more attentiveness from the waiter and less busy plates would have led to a higher rating for sure.

excerpts: I ordered the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delicious.
Our server was nice and the view of the pier was beautiful.
However, one of the waiters there was a bit rude when I asked her questions.
For example, we asked her for two straws
and she turned around, didn't say anything, came back with our straws and left without a word...even though I said thank you.
Other than that, the restaurant serves good food, along with beautiful scenery.
ahi tuna.author: Monique L.
ahi tuna.review: I ordered the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delicious. Our server was nice and the view of the pier was beautiful. However, one of the waiters there was a bit rude when I asked her questions. For example, we asked her for two straws and she turned around, didn't say anything, came back with our straws and left without a word...even though I said thank you. Other than that, the restaurant serves good food, along with beautiful scenery.

excerpts:
For my entree Ron suggested  the Ahi Tuna $26
Seared "RARE", sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli, stir fried vegetables and garlic jasmine rice.
I prefer medium rare
so I ordered it that way
and it came out perfectly.
I keep using that word but I am serious when I say
-I am a hard to please diner and this place was just hitting it out of the park.
My husband and daughter couldn't believe it.
ahi tuna.author: Lisa D.
ahi tuna.review:
I made a reservation for this place on open table and the day before I noticed that my reservation had been cancelled on open table. I thought that was odd and made another reservation at approximately the same time. The day of my reservation I got a call from the restaurant asking if I really wanted two reservations or was that a mistake. I said I only needed one but my open table reservation had been cancelled and so I made another. The woman on the phone said the original reservation was on their books even though it wasn't on my open table app. As soon as I hung up the phone-my 2nd reservation was cancelled as well! So I ended up not getting the open table 100 points. I just thought that was strange but the experience at the restaurant made up for losing my 100 points. We were seated at a table in the bar area that I chose because it was pretty warm in the restaurant and this area was the coolest place. (I have hot flashes and a cool spot wins over a view any day) Our server Ron C came over and took our drink and appetizer order. I had the Perfect Hibiscus Margarita $12.5 (Voted SF Weekly's Best Margarita) 
El Charro Reposado, Patron Citronge, hibiscus syrup, fresh lime and agave served up and topped with Patron Citronge foam.
It was literally perfect and I very rarely order drinks in a restaurant because I am sooooo picky. I send more drinks back than I drink. 
We ordered a crab Louis salad as an appetizer and it was HUGE and delicious. We didn't expect it to be as large as it was. House made dressing was the cherry on top of this perfectly made salad. For my entree Ron suggested  the Ahi Tuna $26
Seared "RARE", sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli, stir fried vegetables and garlic jasmine rice. I prefer medium rare so I ordered it that way and it came out perfectly. I keep using that word but I am serious when I say-I am a hard to please diner and this place was just hitting it out of the park. My husband and daughter couldn't believe it. My husband ordered the Cioppino $33
Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth, and he was very happy-he called it the best he's ever had.  It was a huge portion and that always makes him happy as well. 
Our 16 year old daughter did not find anything on the menu that she wanted so I encouraged her to order the clam chowder and caesar salad plate. She loves a caesar salad but she did not like the clam chowder. When Ron noticed that she basically hadn't touched it he commiserated with her about living in San Francisco and not liking clam chowder. He took it off the bill even though we told him not to since she had eaten the salad! In the end she ordered the  Blondie Sundae $8.5:
Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. Dessert is always her favorite. Juan the manager came over and asked us how our meal was and we told him how amazing it was and how accommodating our server was. He then told us that he wanted to comp our daughter's dessert because she didn't like her clam chowder. I was shocked. I mean they had already took it off the bill and then gave her a free dessert??? We didn't ask for any of that. I am truly impressed with their commitment to making their diners happy. I can say that I will recommend this place to anyone going to the San Francisco area!

excerpts: I ordered clam chowder as a starter, and my main plate was the Ahi Tuna (also very delicious).
To drink I chose the Juice Press (berries, lemonade and sparkling water), which was refreshing.
ahi tuna.author: Bruna Z.
ahi tuna.review:
I loved this place so much. I had never tried Clam Chowder before, since it's not very common in my country. I think I couldn't have picked a better place to try it for the first time, 'cause it was amazing! In the end, my lunch was a bit expensive (~ U$ 45 without dessert), but it was worth it because of the entire experience: the food, the place, the view from the window close to me - I got to see the pier, boats, the sea and Alcatraz as I enjoyed my meal.
I ordered clam chowder as a starter, and my main plate was the Ahi Tuna (also very delicious). To drink I chose the Juice Press (berries, lemonade and sparkling water), which was refreshing.

excerpts: Everything we ordered was mouth watering from the shrimp appetizer, my ahi tuna and caesar salad, and she had swordfish, shrimp, and salmon plate with a cup of clam chowder.
I would go back here in a heartbeat.
ahi tuna.author: Matthew D.
ahi tuna.review: I wanted a delicious seafood meal before leaving the bay area at a place that had plenty of gluten free options. My girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try even though it being located in the Pier 39 tourist trap and we weren't disappointed. The menu labeled everything that was gluten free and the service was outstanding. Everything we ordered was mouth watering from the shrimp appetizer, my ahi tuna and caesar salad, and she had swordfish, shrimp, and salmon plate with a cup of clam chowder. I would go back here in a heartbeat.

excerpts: For our main entrees I ordered the seared ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and veggies.
It was excellent!
The soy ginger glaze, in addition to the other sauces I can't recall, worked really well with the dish.
The presentation was sooo pretty I didn't want to eat it.
ahi tuna.author: Christine G.
ahi tuna.review:
This place was delicious!

I bookmarked this restaurant for our upcoming San Francisco visit and am very  happy we were able to stop by. 

We came for a late lunch today after visiting Napa. The place was still quite busy around 3pm. 

We got seated by the window so we had a nice view of the bay.  We started off with cup of clam chowder soup and crab and spinach dip. This was probably one of the best clam chowder soups we've ever had. The dip was alright. 

For our main entrees I ordered the seared ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and veggies. It was excellent! The soy ginger glaze, in addition to the other sauces I can't recall, worked really well with the dish. The presentation was sooo pretty I didn't want to eat it.  I was extremely satisfied with the dish :)

My mom got the mixed seafood plate (swordfish was yummy!) and my sister got the seared halibut with quinoa and arugula (very tasty as well). 

Too bad I'm not a San Fran native otherwise I'd make repeat visits!

excerpts: - Ahi Tuna Poke:
Decent size chunks with avocado
and I believe it was mango as well?
The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for.
ahi tuna.author: Elizabeth N.
ahi tuna.review:
My boyfriend and I visited for our anniversary dinner. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a little under 30 minutes for a table. Service was great; from the hostess to our server. On to the most important part and the reason why you're reading this review... The food: 

- Oysters: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them. They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted. I could've eaten half a dozen by myself.

- Ahi Tuna Poke: Decent size chunks with avocado and I believe it was mango as well? The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for. Down side to this plate was that there was only 3 wonton chips to share! 

- Clam Chowder: You can't come to SF and not have a bowl of clam chowder. You won't regret it! So rich and creamy, you can actually tell that there are clams in there! (Also had clam chowder from Nick's Lighthouse... Fog Harbor blows them out of the water) 

- Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab: YUMMY. So glad we went with this over the steamed dungeness. It had so much more flavor to it and was way more juicy than we expected, which is a definitely plus. (Tip: Dip the corn into the garlic/butter... Also, if you prefer mashed potatoes to the fingerling potatoes, just ask your server to substitute it for you)

Overall, we had a great experience. We also ordered 2 drinks from the bar to go with our meal which brought our grand total to ~$108 (excluding tip). Will definitely be back again!

excerpts: I had two glasses of wine and we also ordered some ahi tuna and one dozen oysters.
The oysters were a bit small but was very tasty which made up for their size.
The view, is breath taking, very beautiful.
Our waiter was very attentive and he was very knowledgeable of the menu.
Very great service.
The bill came out pretty high but we enjoyed this placed and our food plus the view.
Couldn't go wrong.
Would recommend this place to anyone
but I would like to warn you all it is pretty pricey
but we'll worth it.
ahi tuna.author: Emily M.
ahi tuna.review: So me and my fiance decided to have dinner for his birthday here. It was a beautiful day in February And We Just Got Done Hiking In Marin county. We walked in and was greeted. Very welcoming. We ordered to seafood mix plates which were on special and added a lobster tail to each. I had two glasses of wine and we also ordered some ahi tuna and one dozen oysters. The oysters were a bit small but was very tasty which made up for their size. The view, is breath taking, very beautiful.  Our waiter was very attentive and he was very knowledgeable of the menu. Very great service. The bill came out pretty high but we enjoyed this placed and our food plus the view. Couldn't go wrong. Would recommend this place to anyone but I would like to warn you all it is pretty pricey but we'll worth it.

excerpts: For entrees, I ordered swordfish while the rest of my family ordered ahi tuna and the seafood spaghetti.
While the food was a little on the salty side, it was pretty good.
I actually liked the swordfish the least out of all the entrees because it was rather dry.
The tuna was surprisingly generous in portion and I liked this entree the most.
The seafood spaghetti was pretty good too, and that's coming from someone who typically doesn't like seafood.
I tried their rose wine soda, which was non-alcoholic.
It was yummy!
It just tastes like a light fizzy soda, haha.
ahi tuna.author: Michelle N.
ahi tuna.review:
What a lovely restaurant! I really enjoyed the intimate/romantic atmosphere. Get a table further inside if you can; you'll have a nice view next to the water.

My family and I came here for dinner and we had a good time. We started off with complimentary sourdough bread and a calamari appetizer as well as clam chowder. A trip to SF isn't complete without some clam chowder! The bread had a wonderful crunchy texture and the clam chowder was delicious without being too heavy.

For entrees, I ordered swordfish while the rest of my family ordered ahi tuna and the seafood spaghetti. While the food was a little on the salty side, it was pretty good. I actually liked the swordfish the least out of all the entrees because it was rather dry. The tuna was surprisingly generous in portion and I liked this entree the most. The seafood spaghetti was pretty good too, and that's coming from someone who typically doesn't like seafood. I tried their rose wine soda, which was non-alcoholic. It was yummy! It just tastes like a light fizzy soda, haha. They should just call it grape soda, but I guess they just want to make it sound fancy.

All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're in the area and looking for a nice sit-down restaurant.

excerpts: As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon.
The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside.
Both were good, but will try other places around the area first.
Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39.
They do validations.
ahi tuna.author: Rochelle G.
ahi tuna.review: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.

excerpts: My wife and I had the Ahi Tuna Poke appetizer.
It was incredible.
We also had a cup of the clam chowder with crab.
You need to add crab for $6.
Worthy every penny.
Entrees were also incredible.
My wife had soul and I had the grilled shrimp.
Everything was amazing!!!
It was pricey, but worth it for when you are at Pier 39 and want a great meal.
ahi tuna.author: Michael S.
ahi tuna.review: Unbelievable food. My wife and I had the Ahi Tuna Poke appetizer. It was incredible. We also had a cup of the clam chowder with crab. You need to add crab for $6. Worthy every penny. Entrees were also incredible. My wife had soul and I had the grilled shrimp. Everything was amazing!!! It was pricey, but worth it for when you are at Pier 39 and want a great meal.

excerpts: Our other dish: an ahi tuna poke.
After having amazing poke in LA, we've been looking around for a good poke.
A trip to Hawaii next perhaps?

Anyways, the dish was beautifully presented with crispy wonton chips with white and black sesame seeds, a wasabi aioli, an unidentified hot sauce, seaweed, and the ahi tuna marinated in a sesame soy sauce with avocados and mango.
Yum!
The mango made the dish
it's own and added to the refreshing taste.
ahi tuna.author: Cindy N.
ahi tuna.review:
Growing hungry for something a little bit more substantial though, we paid a visit to Fog Harbor Fish House, a family-owned seafood restaurant well known at the Pier for great crab and great views.

Great views, check! Located right at the pier's edge and where a lot of the Blue and Gold Fleet cruises dock.

Crab? Check! A whole menu entirely dedicated to the local Dungeness crab. Fresh and a multitude of preparations, making it very hard for us to choose a single dish.

Joe and I were in the noshing mood, planning to go to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner (post to come!). We shared the 1/2 lb crab, stir fried with onions, peppers, in a spicy red chili garlic sauce. NOM! Turned out a lot better than I thought it would be. The shell was super soft, making it pretty easy to crack even without the crab cracker, and the garlic sauce was nice and spicy! The highlight of the dish: the fresh crab meat waiting inside the shell. Sweet and juicy. Should have ordered a second crab dish in my opinion!

Our other dish: an ahi tuna poke. After having amazing poke in LA, we've been looking around for a good poke. A trip to Hawaii next perhaps? Anyways, the dish was beautifully presented with crispy wonton chips with white and black sesame seeds, a wasabi aioli, an unidentified hot sauce, seaweed, and the ahi tuna marinated in a sesame soy sauce with avocados and mango. Yum! The mango made the dish it's own and added to the refreshing taste. Still not up to our standard from Venice Beach, but satisfying enough.

Great eats, but you definitely pay the price for the location and the view. If you want straight up fresh seafood, served simple, look forward to my Fisherman's Wharf post coming this week!

excerpts: My friend and I had the clam chowder, ahi tuna, and the fried combo.
Service and food was absolutely on point.
Best experience I've ever had.
ahi tuna.author: Linda L.
ahi tuna.review: Been using yelp for a while but have never written a review until today. I had Tyler as my server and he was absolutely amazing. He's the best server I have ever had. He was attentive and had wonderful recommendations. My friend and I had the clam chowder, ahi tuna, and the fried combo.  Service and food was absolutely on point. Best experience I've ever had.

excerpts: I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.
ahi tuna.author: R P.
ahi tuna.review:
My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.  

Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.

Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.

I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

excerpts: Ahi tuna with wild rice was well portioned.
ahi tuna.author: Kevin L.
ahi tuna.review:
Food just okay.  Quite expensive for a small crab.  They also cleaned all the tamale out of most of their crabs.  Not good if you like the tamale like I do.  Same price as PPQ and was only half as good.

Also had a crab melt that had too much mayo and a little too runny.  Popcorn rock shrimp was the best.  Perfect seasoning and had a good kick of spiciness.  Clam chowder too thick.  Jumbo shrimp cocktail, no so jumbo.  Ahi tuna with wild rice was well portioned.  SF sourdough bread awesome.

Server was funny and happy even on a super busy night.  But he didn't check on us often.

Hey its pier 39, tourist central.  What can I expect?

excerpts: Had the Ahi Tuna with grilled vegetables and it just melted in your mouth.
Great views of the bay and our server
Tyler was great.
Very attentive and gave us helpful tips for the area as we just arrived in town.
Will definitely come back.
ahi tuna.author: Sharon S.
ahi tuna.review: Fantastic food. Had the Ahi Tuna with grilled vegetables and it just melted in your mouth.  Great views of the bay and our server Tyler was great. Very attentive and gave us helpful tips for the area as we just arrived in town. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango.
Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake).
They were all delicious.
Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels.
Will definitely come back.
ahi tuna.author: Nacine B.
ahi tuna.review: Just ate here with my friends  for the first time over the weekend. Each  one of us ordered different item so we can try it. We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango. Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake). They were all delicious. Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: Highly recommend the crab chowder, grilled shrimp and ahi tuna.
Oh, and don't forget the blondie dessert.
Thank you Meron!
ahi tuna.author: Jill M.
ahi tuna.review: Loved our lunch today - made all the more enjoyable by our server, Meron. Quick-witted and knowledgeable, Meron guided us through the menu with great suggestions. Highly recommend the crab chowder, grilled shrimp and ahi tuna. Oh, and don't forget the blondie dessert. Thank you Meron!

excerpts: We had the crab cakes which were my 2nd favorite only to San Juan island (in WA) and the ahi tuna (ok) and the garlic crab (ok but maybe too butter rich).
ahi tuna.author: Larissa M.
ahi tuna.review:
The food was pretty good, but the ambiance was almost unbearable if you are trying to avoid packed/touristy places. We had the crab cakes which were my 2nd favorite only to San Juan island (in WA) and the ahi tuna (ok) and the garlic crab (ok but maybe too butter rich). 

So food good, worth price et cetera et cetera.  But ambiance we felt like we were packed like sardines.  I've been to plenty of nicer restaurants which deuce food seafood and don't feel so cheap by putting people together. That said the service was very nice. I just wouldn't go back.

excerpts: I loved the crab cakes, ahi tuna, and oysters.
Highly recommend this for a classy seafood meal with a view and a great variety of choices,
ahi tuna.author: Brittany F.
ahi tuna.review: Amazing fresh seafood!!! I loved the crab cakes, ahi tuna, and oysters. Highly recommend this for a classy seafood meal with a view and a great variety of choices,

excerpts: I recommend the ahi tuna entree.
It was incredibly flavorful and paired well with stir fry veggies.
Prices were reasonable (worth it) and the service was attentive and friendly.
I was worried this would be an overpriced tourist trap
but it exceeded my expectations.
ahi tuna.author: Sarah E.
ahi tuna.review: Delicious fresh seafood with a great view. I recommend the ahi tuna entree. It was incredibly flavorful and paired well with stir fry veggies. Prices were reasonable (worth it) and the service was attentive and friendly. I was worried this would be an overpriced tourist trap but it exceeded my expectations.

excerpts: And my bf didn't think the ahi tuna was that great kinda chewy.
For the price tag i would say try somewhere else
ahi tuna.author: Misha M.
ahi tuna.review: I thought the clam chowder tasted like it had flour or starch or something in it. And my bf didn't think the ahi tuna was that great kinda chewy. For the price tag i would say try somewhere else

excerpts: For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu.
My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu.
The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery.
It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT!
Shrimp cocktail was simply great!
And the Tiramisu is amazing!!!
The Ahi Tuna was good.
I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant.
I was hoping for something different.
The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite.
It was way too garlicky for my taste
and it was overflowing with potatoes.
My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you!
This is a great restaurant!
Highly recommended!!!
ahi tuna.author: Alana L.
ahi tuna.review: There was a 45 min wait so decided to sit at the bar. The service was great! Jason bartender/server was very attentive and quick! We ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic bread, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails and Chowder for appetizers. For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu. My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu. The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery. It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT! Shrimp cocktail was simply great! And the Tiramisu is amazing!!! The Ahi Tuna was good. I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant. I was hoping for something different. The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite. It was way too garlicky for my taste and it was overflowing with potatoes. My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you! This is a great restaurant! Highly recommended!!!

excerpts: We ordered the ahi tuna poke which I really enjoyed and my friend had the crab dip which absolutely loved and devoured.
When the main meals arrived my friend had the chowder and said it wasn't really all that special and was just ok.
I ordered a plate of clams, mussels, shrimp, crab and corn.
The dish was absolutely COVERED in Garlic....there so much garlic everywhere
and I had a hard time scraping it off.
The clams were ok and there wasn't too much to the mussels.
The corn was ridiculous as you couldn't really bite into it
but if you scraped it with your teeth you might actually get a little bit.
The whole dish was hard to eat because of the ridiculous amount of garlic.
It was like someone took about 6-8 whole garlic, minced it and to threw it in.
With what we paid, we were severely disappointed....this restaurant needs someone competent enough to actually make this place worth the price...
ahi tuna.author: Amanda O.
ahi tuna.review:
Well with the wait and the beautiful seating outside I guess I was expecting too much from this place. We were startled to see several waitresses and waiters with white uniform button up shirts but no undershirts beneath!! I could see the women's bras and one mans nipples clear as day!!! For a place like this I would have expected management to have that under control at least! 
We were seated in the far back of the restaraunt where a party of about 15 teenage girls of 15 years old were seated with no adult supervision and were so loud throughout our whole meal that I could barely make out anything my friend was saying to me. And I really feel bad for the people who were sitting next to them as we were half way across the room! When I said something to our waiter he stated "yeah, they are pretty annoying" but never attempted to rectify the situation. 
 It took about 15 minutes for someone to come get our drink orders and I ordered a margarita and was able to hardly drink it because it was about 70% syrup and way too sweet. We ordered the ahi tuna poke which I really enjoyed and my friend had the crab dip which absolutely loved and devoured. When the main meals arrived my friend had the chowder and said it wasn't really all that special and was just ok. I ordered a plate of clams, mussels, shrimp, crab and corn. The dish was absolutely COVERED in Garlic....there so much garlic everywhere and I had a hard time scraping it off. The clams were ok and there wasn't too much to the mussels. The corn was ridiculous as you couldn't really bite into it but if you scraped it with your teeth you might actually get a little bit. The whole dish was hard to eat because of the ridiculous amount of garlic. It was like someone took about 6-8 whole garlic, minced it and to threw it in. With what we paid, we were severely disappointed....this restaurant needs someone competent enough to actually make this place worth the price...

excerpts: For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare
, it came out perfectly cooked.
Or should I say hardly cooked.
It was just the way I like it.
It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger.
They complimented each other really well.
Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11.
It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check.
My husband and I will definitely be back.
Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes!
:D
ahi tuna.author: Brooke G.
ahi tuna.review: Yummy food and a beautiful view. Started off with a cucumber gimlet that was very refreshing. We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish. For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare, it came out perfectly cooked. Or should I say hardly cooked. It was just the way I like it. It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger. They complimented each other really well. Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11. It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check. My husband and I will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes! :D

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good.
ahi tuna.author: Marielle S.
ahi tuna.review:
Every time my family and I come up to San Francisco, we always stop by here for a meal. 

Service is excellent!!! Ask for Bong. He's amazing and definitely treats you like family. 

Food. Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious. My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined. I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good. And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to. 

It can get a bit pricey, but you're paying for excellent food and excellent service.

excerpts: I had a delicious steak, fried calamari, my wife enjoyed an Ahi Tuna and our guests were full from Chinese Dim-Sum - but they did have some lovely shrimp cocktail.
ahi tuna.author: Pierre C.
ahi tuna.review:
After just 3 years in the Bay Area I still feel like a tourist. So any opportunity to act like one is taken with gusto. My cousin came in on a cruise ship en route to Alaska or something and she wanted to see my family while she was at port. 

Now - I have 2 kids, a 2 year old and a 11 month old, so I am always cautious not to go out to restaurants that are not kid friendly. Luckily, most tourist venues fit the bill - even nicer one's like Fog Harbor.  

I made reservations right here with Open Table, noted that I had 2 kids and we were set-up with crayons, a coloring menu and a very attentive, patient staff. 

Now onto the food - it was good, nothing too fancy. I had a delicious steak, fried calamari, my wife enjoyed an Ahi Tuna and our guests were full from Chinese Dim-Sum - but they did have some lovely shrimp cocktail.

I can't complain, the 4 stars were really for the kid-friendly atmosphere and great views from almost anywhere inside. Oh and they validated parking. 

TLDR version: Good for kids, good food, validate parking, enjoy the Pier :)

p.s. there is an awesome merry-go-round at the end of the pier, it was epic. :)

excerpts: I had the Ahi Tuna and it was absolutely incredible.
ahi tuna.author: Manny O.
ahi tuna.review:
AMAZING! My sister flew in today and I wanted to show her a good time.  We decided on Fog Harbor at Pier 39, and we're glad we did.    I had the Ahi Tuna and it was absolutely incredible.  My sister had the crab cake entree, and from the look of orgasm that came across her face as she ate, I would say she loved it.

The restaurant venue was very nice, with views of the GG bridge.  If the food and ambiance were not enough, the service was remarkable.  Oscar was our waiter and was very helpful, and Ryan, the manager, stopped by to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our experience.

I'll definitely be back! Thanks Fog Harbor!

excerpts: We ordered three entrees and they were: ahi tuna, crab roll and the garlic roasted dungeness crab.
The portions were pretty decent and the ahi tuna with mashed potatoes was incredibly fresh and unbelievable.
The crab roll was really good and came with fries and the garlic roasted dungeness crab came with corn on the cob and was good.
It was the first time I tried a roasted dungeness crab.
I definitely prefer steamed but it was worth the try.
Plenty of garlic and was definitely happy with the choices we made.
Will definitely visit again the next time we're in town.
ahi tuna.author: Susan C.
ahi tuna.review: Started with the calamari. Needed some seasoning but definitely not overcooked. We ordered three entrees and they were: ahi tuna, crab roll and the garlic roasted dungeness crab.  The portions were pretty decent and the ahi tuna with mashed potatoes was incredibly fresh and unbelievable.  The crab roll was really good and came with fries and the garlic roasted dungeness crab came with corn on the cob and was good. It was the first time I tried a roasted dungeness crab.  I definitely prefer steamed but it was worth the try. Plenty of garlic and was definitely happy with the choices we made. Will definitely visit again the next time we're in town.

excerpts: One son had the trout and the other had the ahi tuna.
Our son's fiancee had a salad-think it was the chili lime shrimp salad.
Everyone loved their food.
A bit pricy, but we are in a touristy area.
Overall, we enjoyed our meal and the service.
ahi tuna.author: Debbie V.
ahi tuna.review:
We just got to San Francisco and were wandering around looking for a good place to eat dinner. Thought this may be touristy but the reviews seemed pretty good. 
We loved our waitress Nicole. She was very friendly and helpful in helping us decide what to order. She also was very accommodating as we substituted rice for potatoes, etc. 
The drinks were a bit disappointing. My husband said his margarita was ok. I had the Lombard and was disappointed, didn't have much flavor, mostly tasted the club soda. Our son's fiancee had the ginger coconut cooler and it wasn't too flavorful either. 
The sourdough bread was great. My husband had dungeness crab as an appetizer, it was excellent. I had the pacific sole with rice instead of fingerling potatoes. It was so good and more than I could eat. One son had the trout and the other had the ahi tuna. Our son's fiancee had a salad-think it was the chili lime shrimp salad. Everyone loved their food. 
A bit pricy, but we are in a touristy area. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and the service.

excerpts: Our party also ordered the Ahi Tuna entree, and it was one of the best ahi tuna that I have ever tasted with the ginger soy glaze and wasabi aioli sauce
= yum!!!
I'll definitely order the Ahi Tuna for myself next time!
ahi tuna.author: Anna Z.
ahi tuna.review: No stranger to Fog Harbor. I've been here numerous times, and they never disappoint every time. I mainly order the crab cake entree, and it's tasty. Crab cakes were not dry at all, and their fries were grease-free. Our party also ordered the Ahi Tuna entree, and it was one of the best ahi tuna that I have ever tasted with the ginger soy glaze and wasabi aioli sauce = yum!!! I'll definitely order the Ahi Tuna for myself next time!

excerpts: So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back.
I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out.
*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli
~Absolutely delicious.
I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary.
Yeah, it's THAT good.
ahi tuna.author: Rebekah T.
ahi tuna.review:
If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.

Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.

I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the: 

*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good.
*Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish. 
*Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich. 

When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing. 

I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!

excerpts: I really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna, the wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables compliments the Tuna very well.
ahi tuna.author: Richard S.
ahi tuna.review:
The service is great! Even with the high volume of people who come into this seafood house of deliciousness, the staff maintain their can-do attitude! 

I really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna, the wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables compliments the Tuna very well. The view of the Bay was nice especially around 5:30 when the sun starts to set.  

It's obvious that the folks who work there really enjoy what they do and are professionals. I would expect no less from a Mom & Pop restaurant that has been open for over 6 years.

I am glad that I took a visit to the California Welcome Center which is right next to the restaurant. They gave me plenty of information on places to dine and visit around  San Francisco.

excerpts: Tried the ahi tuna poke which was a nice fresh dish with some great spicy sauce artfully drizzled along the plate.
We also had the calamari appetizer which was cooked perfectly and was definitely more fish than batter (the way it should be!).
Also had the shrimp chili lime salad.
This was a good portio and the salad was good, there were only about 5 or 6 shrim around the edges of the plate -
they were nothing special, I even left a few behind.
ahi tuna.author: Janelle C.
ahi tuna.review:
Dropped into the bar for dinner on a Monday evening.  The restaurant wasn't too populated and we were two alone at the bar.  The service was great and friendly and our food came out quickly and was delicious.  

Tried the ahi tuna poke which was a nice fresh dish with some great spicy sauce artfully drizzled along the plate.  We also had the calamari appetizer which was cooked perfectly and was definitely more fish than batter (the way it should be!).  Also had the shrimp chili lime salad.  This was a good portio and the salad was good, there were only about 5 or 6 shrim around the edges of the plate - they were nothing special, I even left a few behind.

excerpts: We had the fish and chips, chicken penne, and the ahi tuna poke.
The service was amazing.
Our waiter, Khaiman was really attentive and made really great suggestions.
Great view while eating, and it's really filling.
ahi tuna.author: Jennilyn Kate R.
ahi tuna.review: The food was fantastic. My brother, cousin, and I had lunch here after the bay cruise. We had the fish and chips, chicken penne, and the ahi tuna poke. The service was amazing. Our waiter, Khaiman was really attentive and made really great suggestions. Great view while eating, and it's really filling.

excerpts: I tried the Ahi Tuna Poke, which was fresh but under seasoned.
I also tried bites of the calamari and several pasta dishes, which were all very good.
It's a good place to go as a tourist.
ahi tuna.author: Lauren O.
ahi tuna.review: Not a bad seafood restaurant - although way overpriced, the view off of Pier 39 makes up for it. The service is attentive, and the food was pretty decent. I tried the Ahi Tuna Poke, which was fresh but under seasoned. I also tried bites of the calamari and several pasta dishes, which were all very good. It's a good place to go as a tourist.

excerpts: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna - rich and light and
oh so tender.
Get the Crab ceviche, not too much citrus and very full of flavor.
Service is friendly and knowledgeable.
Classy atmosphere and a great view of the bay at sunset.
ahi tuna.author: Charlene K.
ahi tuna.review: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna - rich and light and oh so tender. Get the Crab ceviche, not too much citrus and very full of flavor.  Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Classy atmosphere and a great view of the bay at sunset.

excerpts: But then I had the Ahi Tuna
- this was fantastic and cheap.
For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.
Tasted great!
ahi tuna.author: Jordan S.
ahi tuna.review: For Fisherman's Wharf this place is good.  I had the clam chowder, which was good, not great.  But then I had the Ahi Tuna - this was fantastic and cheap.  For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.  Tasted great!  Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)

excerpts: Highly recommend the seafood grilled combination, wedge salad, clam chowder, and seared ahi tuna.
They also have fresh complimentary house-made sour dough bread!
Although, this was not the best clam chowder I've had (best is pikes place clam chowder in Seattle, Washington) it is pretty darn tasty!
I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed already!
Great food, ambiance, and great service, what more can you ask for?
ahi tuna.author: Diana U.
ahi tuna.review: We went here for a girls night put dinner. Amazing food and staff! The view is awesome! Our server was extremely helpful and friendly. She made a lot of recommendations and was very attentive. Highly recommend the seafood grilled combination, wedge salad, clam chowder, and seared ahi tuna. They also have fresh complimentary house-made sour dough bread! Although, this was not the best clam chowder I've had (best is pikes place clam chowder in Seattle, Washington) it is pretty darn tasty! I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed already! Great food, ambiance, and great service, what more can you ask for?

excerpts: I got the seared ahi tuna, it didn't disappoint either!
It turned out to be a very good choice!
ahi tuna.author: Jay H.
ahi tuna.review:
After our Alcatraz tour ended, we went exploring around Fisherman's Wharf for a late dinner spot and we stumbled upon Fog Harbor. 

The atmosphere = Awesome! We got a table for 2 right at the window. The view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance was unforgettable. The whole atmosphere was perfect.

BUT...and this is what really made me love this place....the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread!!! SOOOOO GOOOOOD! I could have eaten this for my meal by itself!
I got the seared ahi tuna, it didn't disappoint either! It turned out to be a very good choice!
  
Great spot for dinner if you are out on Pier 39.

PS: No pressure, but you HAVE to get the Blue cheese garlic bread....just sayin'

excerpts: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money.
ahi tuna.author: Gabriella C.
ahi tuna.review: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money. The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.

excerpts: We have their ahi tuna and halibut special.
Def.
would recommend for some fresh sea food and good wine list
ahi tuna.author: Angelica M.
ahi tuna.review: Great food and service. We have their ahi tuna and halibut special. Def. would recommend for some fresh sea food and good wine list

excerpts: Seared Ahi tuna was spectacular!
The clam chowder was very good.
Great sourdough and an excellent wine recommendation.
Service was perfect.
ahi tuna.author: John B.
ahi tuna.review: Seared Ahi tuna was spectacular! The clam chowder was very good. Great sourdough and an excellent wine recommendation. Service was perfect.

excerpts: Should try the Ahi tuna with avacado and mango for a starter!
Nice in general!
ahi tuna.author: Julian N.
ahi tuna.review: Good view, very thick clam chowder but i liked it. Should try the Ahi tuna with avacado and mango for a starter! Nice in general!

excerpts: I had the seared Ahi Tuna and it was to die for.
My parents each loved their dishes as well.
Come here, stay away from the chain restaurants, and you will not be disappointed!
ahi tuna.author: Kyle W.
ahi tuna.review: We had lunch here via a reservation on Yelp.  They got us in early with a fantastic view of the pier.  The service was solid and atmosphere calming.  The food is what really stood out.  All options on the menu are sustainably chosen and extremely fresh.  I had the seared Ahi Tuna and it was to die for.  My parents each loved their dishes as well.  Come here, stay away from the chain restaurants, and you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too.
I was expecting a bit more flavor.
Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.
ahi tuna.author: Kristine L.
ahi tuna.review: An alright seafood restaurant. Lots of menu choices to pick form..I had a hard time deciding. For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters. The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams. The oysters had a strange flavor. I would not get it again, but it was edible. For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too. I was expecting a bit more flavor. Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.

excerpts: We had the Ahi tuna (very good), and the Fish and Chips
(I'd give them 3.5 stars.)
The service was nice, with good sights of the pier.
ahi tuna.author: Chiqui E.
ahi tuna.review:
Kind of a tourist-trap, but prices and food are more than OK for what it is. 
We had the Ahi tuna (very good), and the Fish and Chips (I'd give them 3.5 stars.)
The service was nice, with good sights of the pier.

excerpts: My husband had ahi tuna for his main app and he couldn't get enough of it.
He said the next time he is working in San Francisco he will order this and have it delivered to his hotel!!
I had the lobster Mac and cheese for the main app and it was pretty dang good.
Surprised at how much lobster was actually in the Mac and cheese.
The server was very attentive even though this place was packed and they were so busy.
I was happy with the food and the service.
ahi tuna.author: Kari M.
ahi tuna.review: This was the best seafood experience we had in San Francisco. The sourdough clam chowder bowl was most delicious and I would recommend that to anyone who loves clam chowder. My husband had ahi tuna for his main app and he couldn't get enough of it. He said the next time he is working in San Francisco he will order this and have it delivered to his hotel!! I had the lobster Mac and cheese for the main app and it was pretty dang good. Surprised at how much lobster was actually in the Mac and cheese. The server was very attentive even though this place was packed and they were so busy. I was happy with the food and the service.

excerpts: To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways.
The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance.
The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli.
ahi tuna.author: Nate R.
ahi tuna.review:
Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!

To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.

My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.

Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.

No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.

excerpts: I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco.
They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab.
The ahi tuna was okay
ahi tuna.author: Winnie T.
ahi tuna.review:
I came here per the suggestion of my roommate who works as a hostess there because she always would recap to me all the delicious food she ate that day with eyes wide and everything, so I finally got the chance to  try it.

First off, let me just say the ambiance of the place is very...ritzy. The restaurant itself is beautiful--definitely a place to wine and dine someone special with a beautiful view of the bay (*hint hint* guys!). The servers are friendly and attentive, and they made sure my water glass was never left empty.

I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco. They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab. The ahi tuna was okay--I didn't really care for the seared tuna; it was a little dry but the sesame poke with the wonton chips was delicious to snack on. 

I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful. I didn't care too much for the prawns though.

Finally, I had the lava cake for dessert, and this is where the 5 star acclaim comes from. The chocolate lava cake was the BEST cake I have ever had. Drizzeled with a heap of warm gooey fudge and served with vanilla ice cream, each bite was a taste of what heaven should taste like. They could have served me dirt for the main course and this cake for dessert and I probably would have still been happy. 

All in all, this restaurant was a pleasant dining experience. The prices are a bit steep but a seafood restaurant at the wharf with a view overlooking the bay will cost you a shiny penny.

excerpts: In particular, the clam chowder was amazing, along with the crab louie and seared ahi tuna dish.
The baked crab spinach was pretty good too, though not as good as the other dishes we had.
I will definitely be back here in the near future!
ahi tuna.author: Jean B.
ahi tuna.review: Fresh-tasting seafood, great service, and a wonderful (and rather romantic) view of the pier at sunset =) In particular, the clam chowder was amazing, along with the crab louie and seared ahi tuna dish. The baked crab spinach was pretty good too, though not as good as the other dishes we had. I will definitely be back here in the near future!

excerpts: Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course).
It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna.
ahi tuna.author: Hanna K.
ahi tuna.review:
One of my favorite places by far!!!

My 5 favorites on the menu:

1. Crab Cakes: crunchy on the outside, so soft and moist on the inside. Its good for the appetizer and for the regular meal as well.

2. Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course). It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna. if you are a tuna fan, you will LOVE IT!!! 

3. Fog harbor burger: My first "sweet" burger ever. This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare). the caramelized onions add such a bursting flavor into my mouth... and the saltiness of the bacon balances the taste.

4. Prawn ravioli: i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top. I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but no matter what the size is... this dish will forever be my favorite pasta dish at Fog Harbor.

5. Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful. I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell. I didnt even bother eating the crab legs because i didnt have tools to crack them with.. but everything else was easy to eat :) 

The service is fantastic and the hosts are super friendly! :) :) 

Oh and before i forget--- 
Dessert recommendations: Lava cake and tiramisu!!!! I love the creme bruele.. but the caramelized topping can be often too chewy for me.

ENJOY! hope this helped!

excerpts: There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...
the chocolate soufflé is delicious).
Everyone loved everything!
ahi tuna.author: C D.
ahi tuna.review: We were looking for a place to have a special dinner (Easter); this place was perfect! The restaurant itself is very appealing with the views and decor...of course the food and service is the most important. The service was great! Thank you Mila! We had drinks and appetizers as soon as we ordered them! There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...the chocolate soufflé is delicious). Everyone loved everything!

excerpts: I've had the seared ahi tuna, and have been in heaven.
The fish is super fresh and the service is great.
ahi tuna.author: Lauren F.
ahi tuna.review:
This is my favorite seafood restaurant on Pier 39. It's a little high scale, but very delicious, fresh fish.

I've had the seared ahi tuna, and have been in heaven. The fish is super fresh and the service is great. It does get a bit crowded (due to being located on Pier 39). 

Also, I love the location -- it's high up right above the pier and the view is beautiful, especially at sunset. Great restaurant!

excerpts: All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.
Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.
While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.
ahi tuna.author: Marianna K.
ahi tuna.review: Great view, friendly service, and delicious food.  The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.  All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.  Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.  While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.

excerpts: Seared Ahi Tuna.
It was the first time I ever had it
and I have fallen in love.
It was just so tasty.
Encrusted with sesame seeds, it was just good.
I can't even describe it.
What is the texture suppose to be?
ahi tuna.author: Nancy L.
ahi tuna.review:
Seared Ahi Tuna. It was the first time I ever had it and I have fallen in love. It was just so tasty. Encrusted with sesame seeds, it was just good. I can't even describe it. What is the texture suppose to be? It's just good!!!

Mint Mojitos. SO much mint, therefore I like. covered up the taste of the alcohol more.

Service was great! Warm bread as well.

Chocolate Bread Pudding was a little too dense/hard for my liking. I like my bread pudding on the softer side. 

Tiramisu was actually really good. I thought it was very coffee-ey which is good cause I usually complain about it being too light, but this was on the stronger side so I really enjoyed it. 

All the desserts were $7 so they weren't too bad for a nice restaurant. The portions were HUGE too.

excerpts: For my entree, I had the Ahi Tuna which said it was served rare as I like it.
When it came out it was more like medium.
The flavor was great but it could have been cooked better.
The restaurant has a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge also which is nice to enjoy.
ahi tuna.author: Dennis B.
ahi tuna.review: Waiter was friendly and very responsive.  I had the their award winning clam chowder to start and it was excellent.  For my entree, I had the Ahi Tuna which said it was served rare as I like it.  When it came out it was more like medium.  The flavor was great but it could have been cooked better.  The restaurant has a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge also which is nice to enjoy.

excerpts: The mixed seafood grill was great, but the ahi tuna was a real disappointment!
The texture was very soft and the flavor was very bland...
I think that it was the worst ahi I have ever had.
ahi tuna.author: William H.
ahi tuna.review: Nice atmosphere and pleasant staff. The mixed seafood grill was great, but the ahi tuna was a real disappointment!  The texture was very soft and the flavor was very bland...I think that it was the worst ahi I have ever had.

excerpts: My husband had the ahi tuna and he was shocked at how perfectly it was done.
We have barbecued ahi tuna at home and there's no way he could reproduce what he had that night.
The service was stellar and the staff were very accommodating as they put us at the bar even though we didn't book ahed of time.
We were able to enjoy a full meal at the bar.
It turned out to be a great way to meet people, too!
We really enjoyed the spectacle of basil martinis being made - basil leaves were crushed with a glass pestle in a thick glass filled with ice cubes.
ahi tuna.author: Paige L.
ahi tuna.review:
This is an outstanding restaurant that offers the very best that San Francisco can  give. It's very pricey but the food is just amazing. I ordered a warm spinach salad and swordfish. The swordfish was moist and delicious on a bed of ratatouille. My husband had the ahi tuna and he was shocked at how perfectly it was done. We have barbecued ahi tuna at home and there's no way he could reproduce what he had that night. The service was stellar and the staff were very accommodating as they put us at the bar even though we didn't book ahed of time. We were able to enjoy a full meal at the bar. It turned out to be a great way to meet people, too! We really enjoyed the spectacle of basil martinis being made - basil leaves were crushed with a glass pestle in a thick glass filled with ice cubes. They seemed to be a popular drink!

Highly recommended to anyone visiting Fisherman's Wharf!

excerpts: Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.
Very good!
Would recommend.
ahi tuna.author: Kristine W.
ahi tuna.review: Great food!  After a long day of tourist attractions we referred to yelp and thought we would give this place a chance based on the reviews.  Great ambiance and waterfront!  Reasonably priced for waterfront restaurant.  We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.  Tasted awesome!  Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.  Very good!  Would recommend.

excerpts: BOMB AHI TUNA STEAK.
ahi tuna.author: Nicole L.
ahi tuna.review:
Aight, I'll keep it short and simple. 

The waiter was nice, check. 

BOMB AHI TUNA STEAK. EAT IT.

That's actually all I can remember. I'll update my review in a weekend or two.

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna, friend had the stuffed salmon special and we both had a cup of the clam chowder.
ahi tuna.author: Sara S.
ahi tuna.review:
This place got our business after the peeps at Eagle Cafe ignored us for 20+ mins after being seated (not even water was brought to the table)!

We were starving so everything sounded good.  I had the ahi tuna, friend had the stuffed salmon special and we both had a cup of the clam chowder.  The meal was tasty, the service friendly and prompt.  

Menu was a bit pricey but we were so hungry.  If it weren't for the nightmare of getting to this place we'd go back.

excerpts: I had the crusted Ahi Tuna and garlic mashed and t was the best i've ever had.
My girl had the Seafood Capinnio and that was also great, the other couple both had the Clam Chowder bread bowl, being from Boston
Im very picky on chowda, but that chowda was some of the best i have had.
Our Dinner was $ 104, but there where a few drinks also added in there....will be back for sure...
ahi tuna.author: Chris H.
ahi tuna.review: Myself and my girl and another couple ate her Saturday night, the place rocks.   I had the crusted Ahi Tuna and garlic mashed and t was the best i've ever had.   My girl had the Seafood Capinnio and that was also great, the other couple both had the Clam Chowder bread bowl, being from Boston Im very picky on chowda, but that chowda was some of the best i have had.   Our Dinner was $ 104, but there where a few drinks also added in there....will be back for sure...

excerpts: The Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly.
Booked marked this for future visits and recommendations.
ahi tuna.author: Rob C.
ahi tuna.review: Clam chowder was the best I ever had. Full of clam. The Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly. Booked marked this for future visits and recommendations.

excerpts: But, due to the Ahi Tuna 2 ways I'd give it the extra stars.
The service was really way below par and slow.
ahi tuna.author: John A.
ahi tuna.review:
I would only give it one star. But, due to the Ahi Tuna 2 ways I'd give it the extra stars. The service was really way below par and slow. The bath room was totally out of paper tower. 

p.s. I don't see how the clam chowder is award winning. I couldn't find one piece of clam in their chowder. The view is GREAT but over all......... over price!

excerpts: I believe it was Ahi Tuna Tartar with a hint of cavier.
ahi tuna.author: Bernadette M.
ahi tuna.review:
I have never been to this location but the samples I've had at a travel convention on Alcatraz was delicious.  I believe it was Ahi Tuna Tartar with a hint of cavier.  Needless to say, I went back for seconds.

At the event, they handed out little pocket size menus - very good idea.  Of course they do chowders, salads, sandwiches, pastas, rib eye etc.  Located at Pier 39.  Has live lobster and crab tank, it says.  Someplace I'll check out eventually.

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna for my entree-
it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. .
The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order.
They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.
I would definitely recommend it!
ahi tuna.author: Meera V.
ahi tuna.review: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!

excerpts: For my entree I got the Ahi Tuna with garlic mashed potatoes, this dish was really on point!
You have to cook Ahi Tuna
just right
or it will by too dry or overdone, not
this tuna, it had a perfect sear on the outside and it was nice and rare on the inside!
They serve it on a bed of sauteed onions green peppers and the mashed potatoes with an Asian inspired soy-teriyaki tasting sauce.
I was very surprised to find a pretty good (and not insanely overpriced) restaurant in Pier 39, would definitely eat here again!
ahi tuna.author: Ray M.
ahi tuna.review: Went here the other day for dinner expecting an overpriced seafood place with a view and marginal food.
