What I got a was a restaurant that had a solid price point and very very good food!  They bring fresh sourdough to the table and the waiter was pretty attentive.  I ordered a bowl of clam chowder and split it with my girlfriend (and needless to say dipped the sourdough in the chowder), it was a huge portion!  For my entree I got the Ahi Tuna with garlic mashed potatoes, this dish was really on point!  You have to cook Ahi Tuna just right or it will by too dry or overdone, not this tuna, it had a perfect sear on the outside and it was nice and rare on the inside!  They serve it on a bed of sauteed onions green peppers and the mashed potatoes with an Asian inspired soy-teriyaki tasting sauce.    I was very surprised to find a pretty good (and not insanely overpriced) restaurant in Pier 39, would definitely eat here again!

excerpts: I had the  pacific sole with fingerling potatoes and capers.
Also tried the clam chowder and it was tasty with a little grit from the clams.
Service was excellent.
Expensive on a national level but reasonable for touristy San Francisco.
pacific sole.author: Brian K.
pacific sole.review:
On pier 39,  long wait but efficient and effective system to let you know when your table is ready.  Comfortable wait area.  Food was very good.  I had the  pacific sole with fingerling potatoes and capers.  Also tried the clam chowder and it was tasty with a little grit from the clams.  Service was excellent.  
Expensive on a national level but reasonable for touristy San Francisco.

excerpts: but I was more intrigued with the Pacific Sole.
It was served on a bed of spinach and fingerling potatoes.
This was one of those cases in which the food tasted as good as it looked.
The sole was delicious and melted in my mouth.
The texture and flavor were ON POINT!!!!
pacific sole.author: Michelle T.
pacific sole.review:
We recently took a road trip up to San Francisco to celebrate my husband's birthday. Since he's the planner in this family, I gave him the task of finding a  restaurant that had strong reviews. We wanted something that was unique to San Francisco with a heavy emphasis on seafood selections. We don't eat mammals and our diet that is pretty much that of a pescatarian/vegetarian. 

What baffled us was that we booked our reservation via OpenTable a couple of months in advance. What we noticed was that their reservations were booked ahead of time and that we needed to secure a spot right away. So we set it up for the two of us a couple of months before we even arrived.

Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39, right off of The Embarcadero. It's on the second level of the shopping district, at the top of the stairs. This is an ideal location because it's right at the entrance to Pier 39 so you can't miss it. There are other restaurant chains there but when you travel, you want something different from what you already have back home.

Anyway, I didn't know that my husband's coworker would be joining us for dinner. So I called Fog Harbor and asked if it would be ok if I added one more person to the reservation. They said that it was alright. However, I wasn't aware that his coworker was also bringing his mother and brother who were visiting from New Jersey. Now we were faced with a situation!!!  The initial reservation went from 2 to 3 people and was now at a total of 5 people. So I explained the situation to the hostess and she gave me that look that a teacher gives their students. It wasn't good BUT she gave us the option of waiting for a table to open up OR be seated at one of the elevated tables away from the window. We were hungry so we went for the second option. As it turned out, we still had a nice view of the water as well as The Golden Gate Bridge.

The menu has a heavy seafood emphasis which was right up our alley. I was tempted to try to swordfish fish but I was more intrigued with the Pacific Sole. It was served on a bed of spinach and fingerling potatoes. This was one of those cases in which the food tasted as good as it looked. The sole was delicious and melted in my mouth. The texture and flavor were ON POINT!!!! Everyone else at the table had high regards for their food as well. 

My husband's coworker stated that he's never had swordfish before. With this being his first serving of swordfish, he said it was amazing. He's now hooked on it and won't pass it up when it appears on any other menus in the future.

I really appreciate how flexible the staff were at Fog Harbor. I was nervous about showing up with 3 extra people, given that we had to make this reservation so far in advance. Our entire experience was pleasant and I can see why this place is popular with locals and tourists. It looks like we've got a new favorite location to visit when we're back in The Bay Area!

excerpts: Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner.
Lots and lots of seafood.
pacific sole.author: Siosiua T.
pacific sole.review:
Best Chowder I've had! 

Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner. Lots and lots of seafood. Fresh as well. 

Will be back!

excerpts: For our lunch/dinner I ordered the Pacific Sole and he ordered the Lobster Tail.
My dinner came with a Spinach and Red Pepper mix with Fingerling Potatoes.
My husband's meal came with Mashed Potatoes and Steamed Broccoli.
My dish was AMAZING!!
The fish was seasoned and cooked perfectly.
The butter sauce was amazing as well and probably one of the better ones I have tasted.
I personally don't liked sautéed spinach so this part wasn't my favorite.
The only cooked spinach I like is creamed spinach.
The red peppers added a nice touch to the fish.
My only complaint about the dish is that the Potatoes could have used more seasoning or could have been crisped or something.
They were just plain and put on the plate.
I'm sure they were roasted
but there was no crispness about them or flavor at all.
My husband liked his Lobster Tail.
I didn't try his lobster as I don't like the texture of lobster, but I did try his Mashed Potatoes.
pacific sole.author: Tiffany D.
pacific sole.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House was the first place my husband and I ate when we arrived in San Fran. It was a late lunch and dinner basically. We decided to tour Pier 39 first and when we got here we were starving. It was the first place we came across that looked descent so we decided to dine here. The menu looked nice as well as the restaurant itself. We liked that you could view the Bay while eating. We were greeted by the hostess and had no wait. Our waiter was nice and asked us if we had any questions about the menu. Overall the staff was very nice and welcoming.

We first started with drinks. I ordered the Strawberry-Basil Nojito and he ordered the Maple Old Fashion. My drink was non-alcoholic. It was very good and fizzy and had the perfect blend of strawberry, mint and basil. Nothing was overpowering. Very good. My husband's drink was strong and he enjoyed it. Old Fashions are way to strong for me. 

Next we started with appetizers, side salads and bread. We decided to split a Calm Chowder Bread Bowl and we both ordered our own side salad. I ordered a Mix Green Salad and he ordered a Caesar Salad. I'm not a big fan of Clam Chowder but I'm willing to try most things. I honestly don't care for soup but Clam Chowder is just to creamy and weird for me. My husband was more so wanting to try this and being a team player I did. Now our salads were amazing. Yes they were simple but very good. My mixed Green Salad had the standard Balsamic Dressing but this dressing was thicker and a dark orange color. Very tasty. I didn't taste my husband's salad but he did mention that his salad was one of the best Caesars he has had in awhile so I take it that it was good. Lol. He's the one to order all the fattening (don't worry he works out and is skinny) stuff when we go out and I'm the one to make sure we get our greens. We ate all of this with their standard Sourdough Bread. It wasn't anything special, basic Sourdough. 

For our lunch/dinner I ordered the Pacific Sole and he ordered the Lobster Tail. My dinner came with a Spinach and Red Pepper mix with Fingerling Potatoes. My husband's meal came with Mashed Potatoes and Steamed Broccoli. My dish was AMAZING!! The fish was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The butter sauce was amazing as well and probably one of the better ones I have tasted. I personally don't liked sautéed spinach so this part wasn't my favorite. The only cooked spinach I like is creamed spinach. The red peppers added a nice touch to the fish. My only complaint about the dish is that the Potatoes could have used more seasoning or could have been crisped or something. They were just plain and put on the plate. I'm sure they were roasted but there was no crispness about them or flavor at all. My husband liked his Lobster Tail. I didn't try his lobster as I don't like the texture of lobster, but I did try his Mashed Potatoes. They were definitely a lot better than my potatoes and good. 

Overall, the Fog Harbor Fish House was a good place to eat. Decently priced food and drinks that are good.

excerpts: we had the ahi tuna appetizer, and we split the pacific sole, and tiramisu on the house for our anniversary which was so sweet.
We look forward to coming again hopefully in the near future.
Thank you!!
pacific sole.author: Sandy B.
pacific sole.review: This is MY favorite Restaurant! I took my husband for our 5th year Anniversary. The service was WAY beyond our expectations. Curtis and Ashley both made it a memorable meal for both my husband and I. The food was superb we had the ahi tuna appetizer, and we split the pacific sole, and tiramisu on the house for our anniversary which was so sweet. We look forward to coming again hopefully in the near future. Thank you!!

excerpts: I had the pacific sole
it was so good and the Lombard lemonade was delicious.
Thank you Daniel
it was so nice to meet you.
pacific sole.author: Karen A.
pacific sole.review: What a great restaurant and Daniel C. The best waiter took really good care of us. I had the pacific sole it was so good and the Lombard lemonade was delicious. Thank you Daniel it was so nice to meet you.

excerpts: Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole.
All of it was perfect.
Salads were good, bread delish.
Can't say enough good things about it.
We will definitely be back!!
pacific sole.author: DARIA O.
pacific sole.review: We had the best dinner here! Our server Anya was awesome, the view was great, and the food was ah-mazing! Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole. All of it was perfect. Salads were good, bread delish. Can't say enough good things about it. We will definitely be back!!

excerpts: My entree was the Pacific Sole.
It was pan seared and served with roasted fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon, and a caper butter buerre blanc.
pacific sole.author: Aleeta P.
pacific sole.review:
Service: Outstanding.  The server returned to our table numerous times to check on us.  A few of those times, I missed her because I was so engrossed in my delectable food.  I ordered the grilled sole 

Food: Was absolutely delicious!  We began our meal with warm bread (which I absolutely love) and the award-winning g clam chouder, served in a bread bowl.  The chouder was filled with clams and very tasty.  I can understand why it won awards.  My entree was the Pacific Sole.  It was pan seared and served with roasted fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon, and a caper butter buerre blanc.  I had to save room for dessert, which was a delicious Blondie with vanilla bean ice cream.  

Atmosphere: While the lighting was soft and romantic, the conversation volume was really loud.  Guess that's what happens when restaurants have good food, service and atmosphere....everyone wants to be there.  I recommend this place heartily.

excerpts: I ordered the pacific sole (their fresh caught fish of the day) and it was delicious as all heck!
It inspired me to eat more fish in the future.
It was well cooked, So the meat had been tender, flavorful, and moist and well seasoned to cut the fishiness.
The choice was suggested by our waiter who had been patient even when I had been a little rude and loud - a typical college kid with too much freedom.
pacific sole.author: Karen L.
pacific sole.review:
I'm going to start out by saying I had been on vacation from the state of Colorado. So you can bet that I'm a food snob with a need for good atmosphere. It should also say a lot that I'm writing this review three days later back in my home state.

I also want to start by saying I have always been turned off by fish. My dad had made fun of me my whole life for disliking fish since it's mostly what my family eats except for me. 

I ordered the pacific sole (their fresh caught fish of the day) and it was delicious as all heck! It inspired me to eat more fish in the future. 
It was well cooked, So the meat had been tender, flavorful, and moist and well seasoned to cut the fishiness. The choice was suggested by our waiter who had been patient even when I had been a little rude and loud - a typical college kid with too much freedom. The greens that came with the fish was well balanced with the fish and steamed well too. 

The sparkling ginger lemonade had been refreshing after a day of touristing the area like a chicken with no head or direction. It had a nice zing of ginger, but well balanced with the sweetness of the lemonade. It also helped soothe my headache. 

The calamari was a bit pricy for the amount you received and didn't seem too special. It was tender and the skin was crispy though. The sourdough bread was fresh baked and helped soothe hungry stomachs waiting for their entree! 

One of my cousins ordered the clam chowder and drown it down quickly. She believed it was the best chowder she has ever tried, and she's from Southern California. 

The waiters and hostesses were professional, polished, and extremely welcoming. They can make you feel fancy while you sport your big hat, Hawaiian print shirt, and fanny pack (my cousin's literal attire when we are here). They never once showed frustration or struggle  navigating through the small aisles of the eating area, and carried themselves very well. They were always on time, and they were extremely courteous. Even when my cousin had to ask her where the bathroom had been three times. 

The view of the ocean was lovely, and also calming. The air wasn't too hot or cold. The decor was tasteful and crisp, and there's not a bad thing to say about this establishment. They are a perfect staff to visit with great dishes to try if you're new to the Bay Area! It was a star attraction on my whole trip to San Francisco.

excerpts: I opted for local pacific sole with a caper berre blanc sauce over a bed is sautéed spinach, red peppers and fingerling potatoes.
Fish was perfectly pan-seared and seasoned well.
Veggies were nicely cooked.
Would definitely order it again!
pacific sole.author: Karen B.
pacific sole.review:
Amazing views of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. Incredibly affordable and delicious seafood considering the location! Tried to book online and then called, nothing available until after 9pm, but they take walk-ins as well. Walked up and was seated within 5 minutes at prime dinner time, just before 7pm. 

Service was friendly and quick. Good selection of wines from Napa and Sonoma. I ordered a crisp and refreshing Napa Sauvingon Blanc. Another diner raved about her non-alcoholic Ginger Lemonade. My dining companions loved the seafood mixed platter and the fried fish and chips with calamari platter. I opted for local pacific sole with a caper berre blanc sauce over a bed is sautéed spinach, red peppers and fingerling potatoes. Fish was perfectly pan-seared and seasoned well. Veggies were nicely cooked. Would definitely order it again!

excerpts: I also tried another dish at my table - pacific sole - and it was super flavorful and flaky.
Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.
pacific sole.author: Michelle W.
pacific sole.review: Fishermans Wharf is super touristy, but I would definitely go out of my way to eat at Fog Harbor. Our server was excellent - she really went out of her way to accommodate. I mentioned that I didn't eat a lot, and since we were going to be out and about didn't want to have to worry about leftovers. So she highlighted that another member of my party was ordering the same thing and offered that we could share. She was right on. I shared the seafood penne which came in a delicious tomato cream sauce. I also tried another dish at my table - pacific sole - and it was super flavorful and flaky. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.

excerpts: For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...
(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).
I still ate some of it.
The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).
The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.
Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!
pacific sole.author: Frances G.
pacific sole.review:
Sure, this is along the touristy Wharf, but when it's 9:00p on a Friday night and you haven't eaten since late morning (plus crackers and sh*t in between to tie you over), you'd be desperate to go anywhere, right?

Well, it's good to know that this place was rated pretty good, and I can't say I went to SF without eating some kind of seafood so here I was with 4 others (note: "cooked" seafood...I don't like anything raw).

My friend actually called them around 8:15ish to see if we can make a reservation, but at that time, they were booked and walk-in would be about a 30-minute wait.  By the time we got there around 9:00, the restaurant was maybe a 1/3 empty so we were able to sit down right away (thank goodness, I would've had to chew my arm off).

Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.  The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.  The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.  But I did.

For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).  I still ate some of it.  The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).  The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.  Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!

excerpts: Loved the Pacific Sole and the best clam chowder ever :) thank you Tyler for the great service!
You are part of the reason we love coming back.
pacific sole.author: S H.
pacific sole.review: Great food and great service! Loved the Pacific Sole and the best clam chowder ever :) thank you Tyler for the great service!  You are part of the reason we love coming back.

excerpts: Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other.
Both were very good.
Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.
pacific sole.author: P R.
pacific sole.review: Ate here a couple times over the last couple months - both times were very good.  One time got straight in and the other had a 30 minute wait.  But they do the text message method and you are able to walk around while waiting. The views are fantastic.  The food and service matched.  Started with some oysters - very good pacific coast ones.  Also tried the calamari - also very good.  Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other. Both were very good. Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.

excerpts: I had the pacific sole.
It was fabulous.
The sour dough bread was hot and crunch.
This is a great place.
pacific sole.author: Katherine B.
pacific sole.review: They say "award winning" clam chowder. Well they are right. Probably the best we ever had. We went back the next day and had it again for lunch. Dinner was great. I had the pacific sole. It was fabulous. The sour dough bread was hot and crunch. This is a great place.

excerpts: Pacific Sole was very good.
pacific sole.author: Ariane S.
pacific sole.review:
Gluten Free options!
Grilled Shrimp had a gentle kick to it.
Pacific Sole was very good.

excerpts: We ordered the Pacific Sole and Grilled Shrimp.
Both were very fresh and delicious, but COVERED in butter.
I would suggest ordering with light butter or none at all.
The service was great and very attentive to our needs.
Would definitely recommend to all!
pacific sole.author: Christine L.
pacific sole.review: We were at Fisherman's Wharf and couldn't decide which place to eat at, so we referred to Yelp! The Fog Harbor seemed to have great reviews and a decent selection of food to accommodate the pickiest of eaters, so we went there. We were there around 3:00 and there was a little big of a wait. We were able to walk around while waiting. They send a text when your table is ready. We ordered the Pacific Sole and Grilled Shrimp. Both were very fresh and delicious, but COVERED in butter. I would suggest ordering with light butter or none at all. The service was great and very attentive to our needs. Would definitely recommend to all!

excerpts: I ordered the Pacific sole with fingerling potatoes.
I didn't like it at all.
It had no taste.
My Pinot Grigio from Lane CA was good.
Wished they had more wine choices by the glass.
Husband had a Coke to drink.
Our parking lot ticket got validated which was nice.
Bill came out to about $85 which I don't think this place is a $$..more like a $$$ & this was lunch time.
pacific sole.author: Sara L.
pacific sole.review: Great view and somewhat good food. I went here with my husband for 1 of our wednesdate. We asked to sit near the window and they were able to place us near the window. Loved the view of the pier/ocean/alcatraz. Restaurant is very nice and looks elegant.The girl that greeted us at the front door was nice. Our server was a sweetheart. She has a very cute accent. We ordered 2 cups of clam chowder. It was okay. It had a lot of big clams, very thick and creamy but tasted bland. The sourdough bread they provide was delish. Our favorite was the baked oyster with parmesan and sprinkled bacon. It was so good and addicting. My husband ordered the fried combo which came with the fried shrimp, calamari and fish and fries and coleslaw. We both liked the calamari a lot. I ordered the Pacific sole with fingerling potatoes. I didn't like it at all. It had no taste. My Pinot Grigio from Lane CA was good. Wished they had more wine choices by the glass. Husband had a Coke to drink. Our parking lot ticket got validated which was nice. Bill came out to about $85 which I don't think this place is a $$..more like a $$$ & this was lunch time.

excerpts: I got the pacific sole and my husband got the mixed grill
and we both thought the food was tasty.
And the view overlooking the water beautiful.
Nice fancy little spot, definitely on the expensive side though.
pacific sole.author: MaryJane C.
pacific sole.review: Just had my cousin's bday dinner at Fog Harbor. We got the calamari for our appetizer and I really enjoyed it! I got the pacific sole and my husband got the mixed grill and we both thought the food was tasty. And the view overlooking the water beautiful. Nice fancy little spot, definitely on the expensive side though.

excerpts: Delicious Pacific Sole!
pacific sole.author: Tanya H.
pacific sole.review: Samir delivered the best service!! We wandered in and it was wonderful. Delicious Pacific Sole!

excerpts: I had the Pacific Sole and crab cakes.
The crab cakes were ok but not the best I've had and same for the Sole.
All in all the view is awesome and I'd order the food again so although it wasn't the best I've had, it was good.
pacific sole.author: Bridgette D.
pacific sole.review: I was visiting the area on business from Atlanta and randomly selected Fog Harbor based in Yelp reviews and location. I had the Pacific Sole and crab cakes. The crab cakes were ok but not the best I've had and same for the Sole. All in all the view is awesome and I'd order the food again so although it wasn't the best I've had, it was good.

excerpts: I like the Pacific Sole or the Swordfish.
pacific sole.author: Evelyn B.
pacific sole.review:
This is a great restaurant, especially for a big group (ask for the Alcatraz room) that needs / wants to unwind after a long day at a tradeshow or work in general.  Waiters are very attentive and also provide some entertainment!  Menu has a lot of San Francisco classics - clam chowder, Shrimp or Crab Louis, and tons of seafood - and they also have steaks.  I like the Pacific Sole or the Swordfish.  Crab cakes are awesome and can also be ordered as an entree.  

If you want a nice view, you can request a table by the window, but this really only works if you have a small party (like 6 or less to get a booth that faces the window of a table right next to it).

excerpts: Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.
pacific sole.author: Racquel E.
pacific sole.review: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.

excerpts: I had the pacific sole with rice instead of fingerling potatoes.
It was so good and more than I could eat.
pacific sole.author: Debbie V.
pacific sole.review:
We just got to San Francisco and were wandering around looking for a good place to eat dinner. Thought this may be touristy but the reviews seemed pretty good. 
We loved our waitress Nicole. She was very friendly and helpful in helping us decide what to order. She also was very accommodating as we substituted rice for potatoes, etc. 
The drinks were a bit disappointing. My husband said his margarita was ok. I had the Lombard and was disappointed, didn't have much flavor, mostly tasted the club soda. Our son's fiancee had the ginger coconut cooler and it wasn't too flavorful either. 
The sourdough bread was great. My husband had dungeness crab as an appetizer, it was excellent. I had the pacific sole with rice instead of fingerling potatoes. It was so good and more than I could eat. One son had the trout and the other had the ahi tuna. Our son's fiancee had a salad-think it was the chili lime shrimp salad. Everyone loved their food. 
A bit pricy, but we are in a touristy area. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and the service.

excerpts: and I had the pacific sole which was pretty good.
After touring all afternoon, we both left satisfied.
We wouldn't mind coming here if we were in SF again.
pacific sole.author: Yaheiry G.
pacific sole.review: First time in the pier so we had to eat there. I am a sucker for great views so we decided on this place.  Based on the reviews my expectations were not really high but I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. My husband had half portion of crab and I had the pacific sole which was pretty good. After touring all afternoon, we both left satisfied. We wouldn't mind coming here if we were in SF again.

excerpts: This restaurant is all about seafood, i ordered Pacific Sole, it's a bit salty
and I don't like the way they cooked it
, it's more like indian flavor.
One of my friends ordered Dungeness Crab and looks good though.
The service is very good, we've been there till 10:30pm and nobody seems impatient with us.
I would say it's a good restaurant for treating friends just visiting SF since the location is great.
pacific sole.author: Vivian Y.
pacific sole.review: I am not a sourdough fan so I am not really impressed by it. This restaurant is all about seafood, i ordered Pacific Sole, it's a bit salty and I don't like the way they cooked it, it's more like indian flavor. One of my friends ordered Dungeness Crab and looks good though. The service is very good, we've been there till 10:30pm and nobody seems impatient with us. I would say it's a good restaurant for treating friends just visiting SF since the location is great.

excerpts: We had lunch today at this marvelous restaurant, my friend had the Pacific Sole and I had the Short Ribs both of our lunches were outstanding and the service was superb, the sun had just come out when we arrived about 11:45 a.m.
we had window seating the view
was spectacular.
I would recommend this restaurant to family and friends.
pacific sole.author: Marlene B.
pacific sole.review: We had lunch today at this marvelous restaurant, my friend had the Pacific Sole and I had the Short Ribs both of our lunches were outstanding and the service was superb, the sun had just come out when we arrived about 11:45 a.m.  we had window seating the view was spectacular. I would recommend this restaurant to family and friends.

excerpts: I had the pacific sole, and it was delicious!
We will definitely be coming back!
Mila was our waitress and she was fantastic.
pacific sole.author: Sandy C.
pacific sole.review: We had a great meal and wonderful service here! I had the pacific sole, and it was delicious! We will definitely be coming back! Mila was our waitress and she was fantastic.

excerpts: I ate the Pacific Sole fish and it was fantastic!
One of the best dishes I've ever had!
pacific sole.author: Gemma K.
pacific sole.review: Excellent seafood and great customer service! I ate the Pacific Sole fish and it was fantastic! One of the best dishes I've ever had!

excerpts: I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole.
The food was all outstanding.
pacific sole.author: Lisa C.
pacific sole.review:
Had dinner here on a Saturday night.  Used Open Table via Yelp to make reservations, which I highly recommend because it was pretty busy. Normally my husband and I wouldn't head over to Pier 39 for dinner because it's so touristy, but we had a friend in town and she wanted seafood.  Thanks to Yelp, I'm very glad we ended up here.

The view was outstanding. We got a nice table by the window looking out at the water. The menu had such a large variety of items to choose from. We had crab cakes and clam chowder as an appetizer. The crab cakes were full of crab meat and not to much filler and the clam chowder was nice and thick, but not to thick.  I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole. The food was all outstanding.  I was definitely having a hard time finishing my meal. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was for the service.  It was pretty good for the most part, but after our food was brought out there wasn't much following up.  My husband wanted a second beer and my girlfriend wanted some more wine which took some time to get.  Again it was really busy, so we were patient.  We'd definitely go back again.

excerpts: Pacific sole is also very very good.
If you're confused which fish restaurant to choose, go here!
pacific sole.author: Ksenia Z.
pacific sole.review: This place is a must try. Amazing food, nice people and the view is gorge. Absolute must try is a swordfish. Im such a not-about-fish person but the one  i tried here was beyond delicious. Pacific sole is also very very good. If you're confused which fish restaurant to choose, go here!

excerpts: Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
mixed grill.author: Courtney L.
mixed grill.review:
During my family's trip to San Francisco, our mission was to find a restaurant that showcased the Bay's fresh seafood at fairly reasonable prices, and Fog Harbor delivered!

Located on the second floor of Pier 39, this restaurant has a classy ambiance and a scenic view of the water where you can spot the sea lions in the distance. We were greeted by our waiter who took great care of us throughout dinner. He was personable, attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. 

We started off our seafood feast by sharing the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp appetizer ($16). It contained just six large shrimp, tossed with thin slices of onions and bell peppers in an intense chili sauce. Although I enjoyed the spicy flavors and tingling heat, I didn't find that it was the best value.  I also couldn't help but try a cup of their award-winning clam chowder ($7), which was so creamy and had large meaty clam pieces. Yum, this is a must!  

For my entree, I went with a lighter plate, being the Seared Pacific Cod ($28). The fish was seared perfectly with a golden brown, slightly crisp top. It was served with white beans, chorizo butter, tomatoes and spinach, then finished with a dab of garlic shallot aioli. The aioli added an extra layer of flavor to an already savory plate and I loved the white beans as an alternative for a starch. With the Cod placed on top of it all, it was truly the highlight of the dish. Two of my family members ordered the Mixed Grill, which was a combo of salmon, cod and shrimp served with vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. They enjoyed their entrees as well.

This was easily one of the best seafood meals my family had in years. 
Thank you to Fog Harbor for such a memorable dinner to start off our visit to San Francisco on the right foot!

4.5 stars.

excerpts: We got the Mixed Grill and Linguini and Clams.
It tasted really good and fresh!
There were so many baby clams at the bottom of my plate.
Honestly the prices here are quite reasonable, and you get what you pay for.
But I do wish the Mixed Grill was a bigger portion.
No other complaints though!
mixed grill.author: Emily G.
mixed grill.review:
Sadly, they don't take reservations for the weekends!!! I came on a Saturday and thankfully we decided to come 15 minutes after they opened. They filled up really fast as they are extra busy during the weekends and during lunch time. To celebrate our anniversary, Fog Harbor gives out complementary anniversary desserts!

We got the Mixed Grill and Linguini and Clams. It tasted really good and fresh! There were so many baby clams at the bottom of my plate. Honestly the prices here are quite reasonable, and you get what you pay for. But I do wish the Mixed Grill was a bigger portion. No other complaints though!

excerpts: I also had the mixed grill and the salmon and Cod were absolutely delicious.
Next time I'm in SF I will make it my mission to stop by here just for the Chowder
mixed grill.author: jason k.
mixed grill.review: The Best CLAM Chowder ever! I went here with my folks and they bragged how good the food was. They were not lying. I don't know what they do but man what I wouldn't do for some of that clam chowder again! I also had the mixed grill and the salmon and Cod were absolutely delicious. Next time I'm in SF I will make it my mission to stop by here just for the Chowder

excerpts: I'm stuck on the Mixed Grill because it is cooked to perfection
and you get a bit of everything.
mixed grill.author: Mary T.
mixed grill.review:
Come for the views, stay for the food.

The Food: 5 stars.  I'm stuck on the Mixed Grill because it is cooked to perfection and you get a bit of everything.  I had salmon, cod and a shrimp skewer which were all delicious,  but the salmon was melt-in-your-mouth good.  The garlic mashed potatoes were awesome and the veggies were delicious.  You know how most restaurants give you crappy frozen vegetables on the side and it seems like an afterthought?  Not here.  They had green beans, asparagus, and red pepper and they were seasoned well, crispy and delicious.  Others tried the lobster, salmon BLTs, veggie burgers, oyster platter and much more.  Everyone was more than satisfied with their food.  

Service: 3-4 stars. Service tonight was great, but I have had not so great service here in the past. Although, to be fair, it was a rude manager who ruined my previous experience and not a server. 

Also, this restaurant really packs in the tables.  

*Don't get seated in the room alllllll the way in the back. It is awful.  They squeeze so many tables in there I get claustrophobic just thinking about it.  The first time I ate here with my husband they put us there and I should have asked to wait for a better table.  I was uncomfortable the whole meal - too much traffic and such a tiny space.  Not my jam.

Now, the last 2 times I came I was with 6-8 people and we got good tables facing the water in the main room.  Muchhhhhh better and more comfortable!

Ambiance: 4-5 stars for the main dining room.  Again, I wouldn't recommend sitting in the tiny back room unless you enjoy dining in a small, crowded room with no peace or tranquility.  

Overall: solid 4 stars.  The food is awesome!

excerpts: My friend got the mixed grill which came with salmon, cod and shrimp along with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes.
mixed grill.author: Meghan P.
mixed grill.review:
Wow!!! This restaurant is amazing. I was out in the city with a good friend and she recommended we go to this restaurant for lunch. I was not disappointed. 

They served warm fresh sourdough bread while waiting for our entrees. The butter was perfectly salted and room temperature which I love. I ordered the half soup/salad. I got the Cesar salad with clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was more than filling I wasn't able to finish it all. Good thing I had my husband there to help me out. 

My husband ordered the Ahi Tuna entree which he let me have a little of. The Ahi tuna was seared and coated with sesame seeds but rare on the inside. It had great flavor and melted in your mouth. It was served with rice with an amazing soy/lime sauce that had a yummy smoky flavor. It was also served with vegetables. 

My friend got the mixed grill which came with salmon, cod and shrimp along with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes. 

We all left very full and satisfied. 

This restaurant has tons of yummy seafood options. I can't wait to come back to this restaurant and test out the other entrees.

excerpts: The mixed grill and salmon plates were also impeccable and I'd definitely recommend.
mixed grill.author: Melissa T.
mixed grill.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House was probably the most recommended place (by yelp) and there were some high expectations because of that. In short, I'd say that the food lived up to the expectations in my head.

Here are some helpful tips:
-The waiting area is beautiful. True. 
-Make a reservation a week in advance if it's a Friday or weekend. Waiting is fine, but it gets cold and windy, so be prepared. 
-Ask for a water view. 

The service: 
The hostess people were very friendly, BUT I'd say it's hard to hear when they call your names, so stick close to the stand. Once you're inside, the waiters and waitresses are pretty attentive and make sure you always have fresh bread.

The atmosphere:
The restaurant is deceivingly large and the feel is very classy and very vibrant when you walk in. There are a mixture of people from different places, but they all are smiling and happy. 

The food:
Since this was my first time here, I can't talk about the food fully, BUT I'll say that what we had was great. We started with the calamari, which was fresh and lightly fried (perfection). The mixed grill and salmon plates were also impeccable and I'd definitely recommend. When I come back I'll have to try a dessert or two because they looked amazing when they'd walk by our table with them. 

Conclusion: 
Do I recommend it? Of course! It has the most reviews for a reason. The views of the bridge and the harbor are to die for and the food is the perfect pairing with a stunning landscape.

excerpts: We shared the crab cakes starter, I had a bowl of chowder, and then the Seafood Mixed Grill.
My buddy had the bread bowl chowder with crab as an entree.
Let me tell you, everything was delicious!
The crab cakes were cooked to perfection and had many levels of flavor.
The chowder was among the best I've had, and the mixed grill was superb!
The least favorite part was the mashed potatoes which were not quite creamy how I like best, but I was more than full by this time
mixed grill.author: Nathan L.
mixed grill.review:
We looked around on the Google to see what restaurants were near Fisherman's Wharf and check out menus. In the past, I haven't done my research and had less than awesome experiences here. Just because they all serve fish doesn't mean they all do it right! 

We liked the menu and the establishment looked upscale so we decided to give Fog Harbor Fish House a try for dinner. We arrived without reservation (Thursday) and we had a 20 min wait. We decided to wait at the bar and my buddy tried a new type of whisky (Balvenie 17) per the bartender recommendation. He was stoked with it!

The table was ready soon after and we decided on the menu items. We shared the crab cakes starter, I had a bowl of chowder, and then the Seafood Mixed Grill. My buddy had the bread bowl chowder with crab as an entree. Let me tell you, everything was delicious! The crab cakes were cooked to perfection and had many levels of flavor. The chowder was among the best I've had, and the mixed grill was superb! The least favorite part was the mashed potatoes which were not quite creamy how I like best, but I was more than full by this time so it didn't matter much. 

The service was excellent from bartender to server to farewell from the staff upon departure. I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House if you want top notch seafood at reasonable prices. Nothing to complain about here. Check it out!

excerpts: Followed it with the mixed grill, all was cooked to perfection.
Would come here again in a heartbeat.
mixed grill.author: Lisa E.
mixed grill.review:
Came here with a friend for the first time. Great service from our server -Beautiful views even though we sat in the back 40 room...
Ordered a delicious Malbec through the urging of our server - yummy.
I ordered the award winning clam chowder and indeed they are correct. Followed it with the mixed grill, all was cooked to perfection. 
Would come here again in a heartbeat.

excerpts: We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp.
Overall we were happy with the food.
The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky.
The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams.
The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf
so I wouldn't expect anything less.
mixed grill.author: Vicky C.
mixed grill.review: They were very busy here so service was a little slow but overall the food was great and they serve sourdough bread rolls which are delicious!! We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp. Overall we were happy with the food. The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky. The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams. The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf so I wouldn't expect anything less.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill with grilled shrimp, salmon, and pacific cod that was cooked to perfection.
The garlic mashed potatoes were full of flavor and seasoned well.
The view was great!
I would highly recommend.
It is high end food but at lunch the environment was kid friendly and dress was casual.
mixed grill.author: Jenny S.
mixed grill.review: Excellent lunch!  I was skeptical at first because the quality of food and prices in such high tourist areas are usually not as good but we were pleasantly surprised. I had the Mixed Grill with grilled shrimp, salmon, and pacific cod that was cooked to perfection. The garlic mashed potatoes were full of flavor and seasoned well. The view was great!  I would highly recommend. It is high end food but at lunch the environment was kid friendly and dress was casual.

excerpts: The mixed grill with a sampling of cod, salmon, and shrimp.
The salmon was melt in your mouth good as was the cod.
mixed grill.author: Penny L.
mixed grill.review:
A must go to on the pier! Beyond friendly staff and a fabulous view! The seafood is so incredibly fresh it can't be described. 

I order the crab cocktail which was good. The star of the show for me was the entree. The mixed grill with a sampling of cod, salmon, and shrimp. The salmon was melt in your mouth good as was the cod. The shrimp was sweet and delicious. 

The sourdough is tasty too. Not sure what the hype is with sourdough on the pier but it was a nice addition to the meal for sure. 

I know there's a ton of other choices when you're here but you should choose Fog Harbour; you won't regret it!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.
I had a window table with a great view.
The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.
mixed grill.author: Debra M.
mixed grill.review: I have been to Pier 39 several times over the years but always passed this place.  I stopped this time and I'm glad I did because the food was exceptional I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had a window table with a great view. The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.

excerpts: We got 4 cups of clam chowder, 1 baked oyster, 1 mixed grill, 1 cioppino and 1 linguin clam.
These were enough to fill us up cuz the portions were pretty generous.
In short, I liked everything we ordered
but I think everything was over-seasoned here.
Most dishes were salty and I had to drink lots of water to finish the meal.
Nevertheless, the seafood was fresh and tasty.
I's give 5 stars to Fog Harbor if its food wasn't too salty.
I hope they would mofiy their recipe to make it less salty.
mixed grill.author: Nhi D.
mixed grill.review:
When my friends said they wanted to have dinner at Pier 39, I immediately had to go on Yelp to find a good restaurant in this tourist trap. Fog Harbor Fish House didn't disappoint me. We came here at 6pm and luckily we were seated right away. 

Well, this place had excellent view overlooking the harbor. We were able to eat and watch the sunset at the same time. It was a memorable experience. The service was also excellent. The waiter was extremely attentive and accomodating to us. We decided to order everything together and share between us. We got 4 cups of clam chowder, 1 baked oyster, 1 mixed grill, 1 cioppino and 1 linguin clam. These were enough to fill us up cuz the portions were pretty generous. In short, I liked everything we ordered but I think everything was over-seasoned here. Most dishes were salty and I had to drink lots of water to finish the meal. Nevertheless, the seafood was fresh and tasty. I's give 5 stars to Fog Harbor if its food wasn't too salty. I hope they would mofiy their recipe to make it less salty.

excerpts: My companions got the cod and the mixed grill while I got the clam linguine.
The pasta was absolutely delicious!
Full of clams, in a very garlicky wine sauce.

PRO TIP: don't fill up on the noodles- instead use the bomb sourdough bread to soak up the sauce.
.
Prices are to be expected on a pier-side seafood restaurant, so $20-30 per plate.
I also wanted to mention the service was excellent as well!
mixed grill.author: Neva S.
mixed grill.review:
Came here with two others on a Saturday evening without a reservation and was seated at a table with a gorgeous view in about 15 minutes. The complimentary sourdough was SO GOOD. Warm, with soft butter, chewy, sour... yum. The calamari was so delicious, as was the super rich clam chowder. My companions got the cod and the mixed grill while I got the clam linguine. The pasta was absolutely delicious! Full of clams, in a very garlicky wine sauce. PRO TIP: don't fill up on the noodles- instead use the bomb sourdough bread to soak up the sauce.
.
Prices are to be expected on a pier-side seafood restaurant, so $20-30 per plate. I also wanted to mention the service was excellent as well!

excerpts: We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl.
That's more than enough food for my mom and me.
The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful.
Great experience!
mixed grill.author: Yang L.
mixed grill.review: Went there on a Thursday lunch time. Didn't have to wait and we even got a window table with fantastic pier view. We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl. That's more than enough food for my mom and me. The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful. Great experience!

excerpts: We had the bread bowl clam chowder , sol fish plate and mixed grill plate and
mixed grill.author: Robin C.
mixed grill.review:
5 stars! And worth every one of them! We stopped by here for dinner on a busy Saturday evening around 6 pm and waited only about 20 minutes before we sat down at our table. STUNNING views, even without a table right next to the window you can see them! The staff was so friendly and fast throughout our visit (shoutout to Tyler our awesome waiter who made our visit  that much better!) Not only was the staff and atmosphere great, the food was absolutely AMAZING! We had the bread bowl clam chowder , sol fish plate and mixed grill plate and everything was SO good and a great portion size. 

Overall - if you're in the area, I highly recommend you stop here and give it a try! (you won't regret it!)

excerpts: We ordered mixed grill and grilled shrimp brochette for us and grilled shrimp from kids menu.
Even the food taste was like their employees attitude!
Only the calamari was good.
We visited almost all the restaurants there.
This one is the worst.
Even my 3 years old Throw his food.
Need to buy for him from other place.
Never ever to this place again.
mixed grill.author: Nawarid N.
mixed grill.review:
The employees are very rude. I went there with my husband and son. There was some ocean view table available but they didn't give us any! They served complementary bread and butter to everybody but they didn't give us ! Oh we look poor huh! 
We ordered mixed grill and grilled shrimp brochette for us and grilled shrimp from kids menu. Even the food taste was like their employees attitude! Only the calamari was good. We visited almost all the restaurants there. This one is the worst. Even my 3 years old Throw his food. Need to buy for him from other place. Never ever to this place again.

excerpts: The mixed grill was exceptional as was the clam chowder and shrimp cocktail.
Reasonably priced for SF
mixed grill.author: Fred G.
mixed grill.review: Delicious food and professional waiters. Although located in Pier 39, a very touristy locale, Fog Harbor exceeded expectations. The mixed grill was exceptional as was the clam chowder and shrimp cocktail. Reasonably priced for SF

excerpts: Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger.
mixed grill.author: Kelsey S.
mixed grill.review:
We were hard-pressed to find a restaurant that met everyone's needs: my mom wanted seafood, my dad is a picky eater and seemingly only eats red meat, and we didn't want to spend a fortune. The only place I could find with two dollar signs that served both seafood and steak was the Fog Harbor Fish House. They were concerned about it being too touristy, and were also put off by the fact that we couldn't get a reservation, but I wanted to give it a chance.

Well. Sure, it's at Pier 39, but it's not "touristy" in the typical sense. It's elegant, and very San Francisco. It has a wonderful view of the bay, and our window faced the lovely sunset over Mt. Tam.

They really do reserve most of their tables for walk-ins; we were nervous about walking up at 6 p.m. without a reservation, but we only had to wait 15 minutes.

The food was exquisite. I had the seafood penne, which was to die for. The mussels are HUGE! Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger. Everyone loved their meals, and our waitress, Ashley, was very kind and attentive.

As for the price, it's a bit more than two dollar signs. But graded on a curve, I'd say that it is less expensive than other places that serve similar fare. Each dish could have easily cost $5-10 more elsewhere.

This would be a lovely place to bring visitors from out of town or a local date just the same.

excerpts: Had the Seafood penne; mixed grill;  fried calamari; red chili garlic
shrimp--- all amazing!
Highly recommend!
mixed grill.author: Sussie C.
mixed grill.review:
Excellent!

Had the Seafood penne; mixed grill;  fried calamari; red chili garlic shrimp--- all amazing! Highly recommend!

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle.
Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito.
I wouldn't go back.
Many other places to choose from.
mixed grill.author: Shannon B.
mixed grill.review: I was dinning alone so sat at the bar. Service was fine, nothing special. Food was okay until I found a hair in my mash potatoes. I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle. Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito. I wouldn't go back. Many other places to choose from.

excerpts: WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill!
Everything was for 10!
Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!
mixed grill.author: Srdjan S.
mixed grill.review: Wow! Just look at this smile! The best hostess ever! Kristina was so nice and has just the best customer service! From the time she took our reservation until we left she was really professional and at the same time personable, even though the restaurant is so busy considering it's in the tourist area. WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill! Everything was for 10! Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!

excerpts: For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out.
The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with.
Had to give him a reminder.
No problem.
For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter.
This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste.
I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food.
Price is a bit on the more expensive side
but you get what you pay for.
Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier.
Definitely would go again!
mixed grill.author: Hai L.
mixed grill.review: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

excerpts: Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus
, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.
mixed grill.author: Darlene L.
mixed grill.review:
Delicious Dinner with a View. 
We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess that escorted us to a table with a wonderful view of the bay and Alcatraz. 
We ordered several items to try. 
Dungeness Crab App - generous portion o   Fish and Chips - standard, nothing to get excited over, but worked for the kid. 
Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.
I was underwhelmed by my dish.
The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon.
The best fish on my plate was the shrimp.
mixed grill.author: Payal V.
mixed grill.review:
We tried coming here for Father's Day, but couldn't get a reservation for our large group. My family and I happened to be in town one Friday and decided to dine here since the menu had looked so good during Father's Day. 

It's a really nice restaurant amongst all of the casual tourist spots in the same area. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.  I was underwhelmed by my dish. The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon. The best fish on my plate was the shrimp. The other fish were dry and overcooked. 

My husband's ahi was good. The flavors came together well to make a good dish.

excerpts: It was the perfect companion to the mixed grill and the shell fish platter with lobster tail add on.
Do also try the appetizer, their perfect Jumbo Shrimp paired with the award winning hibiscus margarita and take your time with them.
This view and these tastes are meant to be savored with warm conversation and your lover.
We closed the delightful evening with the tiramisu  and warm apple crisp.
Pure joy!
Thank you Jane for the recommendations!
Superb food and service!
mixed grill.author: Lavette K.
mixed grill.review:
We are not tourist. We live here and are not easily impressed. This lovely place is even better if you choose to sit in the tables that seat 4 in the back of the restaurant. Your view is perfect position of Alcatraz  with the Golden Gate bridge just behind and the gorgeous skyline on your left and sea lions just below on your right. 
Start the night with server Jane who can recommend  the perfect wine pairing for your meal. At $22.00 per glass the chardonnay should taste live Heaven and it did. It was the perfect companion to the mixed grill and the shell fish platter with lobster tail add on.
Do also try the appetizer, their perfect Jumbo Shrimp paired with the award winning hibiscus margarita and take your time with them. This view and these tastes are meant to be savored with warm conversation and your lover. We closed the delightful evening with the tiramisu  and warm apple crisp. Pure joy! Thank you Jane for the recommendations! Superb food and service!

excerpts: We ordered Lazy Cioppino, Mixed grill, Linguini&clams, California crab&avocado salad.
Everything is so fresh and yummy.
The best is Cream brûlée, creamy body with crispy top, not too sweet , perfect ending!
mixed grill.author: Yen C.
mixed grill.review: This is a very nice restaurant for local people and tourists . The sourdough is amazing here, everyone says so. We ordered Lazy Cioppino, Mixed grill, Linguini&clams, California crab&avocado salad. Everything is so fresh and yummy. The best is Cream brûlée, creamy body with crispy top, not too sweet , perfect ending!

excerpts: I like sampling things, so I went with the mixed grill.
Had a little bit of everything.
The asparagus was spot on.
I'm not a tomato fan, but they were ok.
The mashed potatoes were wonderful.
Not mashed enough to be smooth, so it had a great texture and taste.
It came with three of the most AWESOME grilled shrimp that I hoped I would come back some day just for the shrimp.
mixed grill.author: Robert M.
mixed grill.review:
This place is SERIOUS about food. I thought it was in the middle of the touristy part of the Fisherman's Wharf and I would pay for the scenery rather than the food. Boy I was wrong. It had both!

Almost all of the seats had spectacular views of the wharves, piers, boats and bay. Ours was not on the window, but one off the row which was in fact better. The wait service was impeccable. 

We came early which is about the smartest thing you could do if you don't want to wait for a hugely popular place to get a seat. Starters was the best old fashioned I've had. I don't like them "muddled", but the mashed fruit with the maple syrup was quite unique and quite enjoyable.

I started with a cub of clam chowder. It was very, very good. Not the best, but enjoyable. Lots of clams and bacon. Maybe too much bacon, but I will never say such a sacrilege out loud - "too much bacon". Just rip my tongue out before that happens. 

We split an appetizer portion of their scallops. They were fried in almost a Callabash style. No, I can't describe it, so Google it. I worked at a seafood restaurant on the South Carolina coast and this tasted like that. Very well cooked and very tasty. Lots of them almost like lightly battered popcorn shrimp. 

I like sampling things, so I went with the mixed grill. Had a little bit of everything. The asparagus was spot on. I'm not a tomato fan, but they were ok. The mashed potatoes were wonderful. Not mashed enough to be smooth, so it had a great texture and taste. It came with three of the most AWESOME grilled shrimp that I hoped I would come back some day just for the shrimp. It also came with a  fabulous piece of salmon. That too would have made a great meal. Finally a piece very superb swordfish. I started going into mental overload thinking which I would have as a dedicated meal if I ever came back. Too many awesome choices!

excerpts: We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill.
The clam chowder was delicious!
I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy.
The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy.
The cioppino was sooooo delicious.
For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops.
This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that.
The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes.
I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it!
mixed grill.author: Joanne Y.
mixed grill.review:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi.
I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well.
I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder.
The salmon was the best item I had here.
It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering.
The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked.
The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.
mixed grill.author: Ash S.
mixed grill.review:
Fog Fish Harbor House has a spectacular view of the water and is located in the heart of touristy fisherman's wharf. It is located on the second floor if you are searching for it.

I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi. I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well. I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder. The salmon was the best item I had here. It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering. The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked. The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.

excerpts:
We ordered:
Fried Shrimp
Clam Chowder
Mixed Grill
mixed grill.author: Daniel C.
mixed grill.review:
My family and I just had dinner here for the first time ever and it was absolutely amazing. Our server, Justin H, was incredibly attentive! We can't wait to come back and bring some friends. 

We ordered:
Fried Shrimp
Clam Chowder
Mixed Grill

And the dessert:
Chocolate cake and creme brûlée!

Everything was wonderful!

excerpts: We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh).
Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.
mixed grill.author: Kate H.
mixed grill.review: My husband and I dined here tonight and we have no faults! We chose the restaurant because we wanted to try a chowder bread bowl and Fog Harbour's didn't disappoint - it was incredible. Highly recommend paying the $7 extra to get crab pieces included. We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh). Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.

excerpts: I ordered the Lobster Tail and the better half ordered the Mixed Grill.
When I got my plate it was barely warm but luckily the food wasn't cold.
It looked amazing and the lobster tail was huge.
mixed grill.author: Alyssa M.
mixed grill.review:
Great for views but not a place I'd visit twice. The better half and I visited SF for our anniversary. I wanted to take us out to a nice dinner and I chose Fog Harbor Fish House. 

It was very easy to make a reservation. Visit their website, pick your party size and an available time. Easy and done. I called after doing that to nicely request a great table because of the special occasion. Parking is at the Pier 39 garage. Take your ticket with you to get validated (1st hour is free). Cross the street and go upstairs. Upon arriving, our reservation was ready to go. The table was at a window and that was great. I did see some others I would have rather had but oh well.

I ordered the Lobster Tail and the better half ordered the Mixed Grill. When I got my plate it was barely warm but luckily the food wasn't cold. It looked amazing and the lobster tail was huge. I enjoyed my plate, it came with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. 

The better half though, hers wasn't as appetizing. The salmon, swordfish AND the shrimp was dry. She was not enjoying her meal and that's frustrating because I am trying to make sure she has a fantastic meal! She gets embarrassed when I complain so I held off this evening. But I am kicking myself that I didn't say anything. She ended up putting half of her swordfish and salmon on my plate for me to eat, I couldn't even do it. It was very disappointing. 

The service was not great, I'm not saying he was horrible but it felt rushed. He got our drinks, he took our food order, he delivered our food and he brought our check. I realize it's a busy restaurant but we are spending some money here, I don't want to feel rushed out of my table. He never told us his name or made any attempt to make the experience personable. Same with the host when we checked in, no nice welcome and no smile. 

One last thing. Know I am not holding this against the restaurant. Remember I had called ahead and mentioned it was for a 5 year anniversary. Shawn who answered the phone said he would note it, I was very appreciative of that. I definitely don't expect anything from the restaurant but I was hoping for at least some recognition. An awesome 2 chair table (instead of 4 chairs), one of those corny desert dishes with a message or even a simple "Happy Anniversary". We got nothing.. I work in hospitality and have been a customer service professional for many years. I gave them an opportunity to shine and it wasn't taken.. Had they attempted to take the service up a step, I might have seen the experience differently or been able to look over the mistakes. I'm writing this as a mere suggestion to management, if you get the opportunity to make a personable experience for a guest, you won't regret it for going above and beyond. You just might make someone's day.

excerpts: and we each had different meals: risotto, halibut  and mixed grill seafood.
Everything was amazing.
We will definitely be back here.
mixed grill.author: Christina T.
mixed grill.review: Please go eat here!! We are regulars in the City and hardly ever visit the pier area but we had some guests with us who had never been so of course we took them to see the sights. We ended our day down at Pier 39 and were deciding where to eat. My husband used Yelp and Fog Harbor came up highly rated so we decided to give it a try. It was such a good choice! The food, service, views and everything else were excellent. There were four of us and we each had different meals: risotto, halibut  and mixed grill seafood. Everything was amazing. We will definitely be back here.

excerpts: The mixed grill was also good.
Had to add some salt though.
The Scallops and crab risotto was pretty good as well.
My friend got the Lazy ciopinno which looked good added rice instead of bread.
mixed grill.author: Kat K.
mixed grill.review: We came here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Was seated at a lovely table and ordered my favorite old fashioned. I went for a classic instead of their maple but after seeing pics of the maple I'm thinking I might want to try the maple. I wasn't too fond of the paper straws. Would've liked a reg stirrer. We got the Clam chowder bowls with crab. It was really good with a nice stack of fresh crab on top. The mixed grill was also good. Had to add some salt though. The Scallops and crab risotto was pretty good as well. My friend got the Lazy ciopinno which looked good added rice instead of bread. And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs. Which is why a star was lost. Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal. We were too full for dessert. And had a ton of leftovers. :9 great company always makes things amazing. Good times!

excerpts: Family had Mixed Grill which was just ok for $29 a plate.
mixed grill.author: Jeff M.
mixed grill.review:
Its just ok.  $45 for Dungeness crab, which in my opinion isn't as good as King Crab.

Waitress AJ was a little short, certainly didn't go over the menu like the waiter serving the table behind me.

Clam Chowder was good, probably the best thing we had.  Family had Mixed Grill which was just ok for $29 a plate.

Last but not least, $3.95 for a soda?

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed.
There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor.
Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some.
My water glass was empty more often than it was full.

I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations.
I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!
mixed grill.author: Mandy B.
mixed grill.review:
Underwhelmed. Clam chowder was tasty- but not tasty enough to warrant $7/cup price tag. No crackers even offered? The oysters were great, hard to screw those up if you have a good purveyor.  I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed. There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor. Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some. My water glass was empty more often than it was full. I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations. I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill for dinner and my husband had the scallop and crab risotto (a special that night).
The risotto was creamy, cheesy and full of crab.
The scallops were seared and buttery.
The mixed grill fish and shrimp were grilled perfectly and the mashed potatoes and green beans were flavorful.
We requested a seat by the window when we made our reservation and had a wonderful view of the sunset.
The only disappointment, if you can call it one, was that we left way too full!
mixed grill.author: Ciara D.
mixed grill.review: Everything about our experience at Fog Harbor was a 5/5. Our server, Kayla, was excellent, very attentive and quick. They serve a non-alcoholic wine beverage, which was great news since I'm pregnant. We started with the clam chowder soup and couldn't resist adding the crab. It was so creamy and flavorful and paired perfectly with the sourdough bread. We also shared the fried calamari. It is served with fried onions and jalapeños which was a great combination since I love calamari and my husband doesn't. The dipping sauce for the calamari was the best. I had the mixed grill for dinner and my husband had the scallop and crab risotto (a special that night). The risotto was creamy, cheesy and full of crab. The scallops were seared and buttery. The mixed grill fish and shrimp were grilled perfectly and the mashed potatoes and green beans were flavorful. We requested a seat by the window when we made our reservation and had a wonderful view of the sunset. The only disappointment, if you can call it one, was that we left way too full!

excerpts: We had the calamari, halibut special and mixed grill.
Would recommend highly to anyone who wants great seafood and a view of Alcatraz and the harbor.
mixed grill.author: Sharra S.
mixed grill.review: I didn't find this to be a "tourist trap". It's on point with uptown and everywhere else we have eaten on our vacation price wise. We had the calamari, halibut special and mixed grill. Would recommend highly to anyone who wants great seafood and a view of Alcatraz and the harbor.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill and everything on my plate was dry.
Luckily my boyfriend got the cioppinio
so I could use the juice for my fish.
The other items on my plate, potatoes and asparagus, were not edible.
I would have told the waitress but she was disinterested in us.
Saw her twice during dinner.
Would not recommend this place.
A meal a regret.
mixed grill.author: Michelle L.
mixed grill.review: Extremely disappointing meal. I had the mixed grill and everything on my plate was dry. Luckily my boyfriend got the cioppinio so I could use the juice for my fish. The other items on my plate, potatoes and asparagus, were not edible. I would have told the waitress but she was disinterested in us. Saw her twice during dinner.  Would not recommend this place. A meal a regret.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes.
mixed grill.author: Liz G.
mixed grill.review:
All I can say is, Wow!! The food here is mind-blowing! There are many great spots for clam chowder in San Francisco, but I've never had it topped with Dungeness Crab!! What a great way to start our meal! (Check out my pic)

Also mind blowing was the seared Ahi Tuna. It's perfectly seared "rare" and topped with a delicious ginger soy glaze, accompanied perfectly with a garlic jasmine rice. My mouth could barely contain this flavor flurry.

My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes. Had I not eaten so much delicious sourdough bread prior to our food arrival, I would have eaten more of his food too! 

Did I mention there's also a beautiful view of the wharf?? It was the perfect birthday dinner! Definitely coming back next time we're in town!!

excerpts: My husband & I split a house salad and the Mixed Grill plate.
We are not big eaters plus the fact we weren't that hungry.
We loved how fresh the fish was and the flavor of our entire meal.
A bread basket was served prior to our meal.
The waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive all the while very busy.
mixed grill.author: Tammy B.
mixed grill.review: This extremely busy restaurant is found upstairs on pier 39. It looks like there's always a wait for a table. We asked about the bar; if seats are available grab them. We were lucky and sat at the bar.  Yes, you may order from the whole menu at the bar.  My husband & I split a house salad and the Mixed Grill plate. We are not big eaters plus the fact we weren't that hungry.  We loved how fresh the fish was and the flavor of our entire meal.  A bread basket was served prior to our meal. The waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive all the while very busy.
