excerpts: We tried some clam chower bowls, seasonal lobster ravioli, seafood penne, their mixed grill, and fish and chips.
I thought that everything tasted really delicious and fantastic.
My brother who lives in San Francisco, said he's had better clam chowder
mixed grill.author: Karen C.
mixed grill.review:
While visiting the San Francisco fisherman's warf, I had to get my fill of seafood.  I wanted to have some clam chowder and whatever other seafood was available. I visited this place with my family so we got to order quite a few things and shared everything.  We tried some clam chower bowls, seasonal lobster ravioli, seafood penne, their mixed grill, and fish and chips.  I thought that everything tasted really delicious and fantastic.  My brother who lives in San Francisco, said he's had better clam chowder so I guess it's preference.  

We visited on a friday night, so it was very busy and lively in the restaurant. Service wasn't bad, it would've been nice if the waitress had checked on us a few more time because we ran out of beverages and had to try to flag her down. I realize it was busy but it would've been nice to have her check on us a few more times.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit here. I'd visit again.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill.
Everything was soooo tasty.
Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times.
It's hard to get my boyfriend
and I full,
but I left stuffed!
The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.
mixed grill.author: Jeca D.
mixed grill.review: Tyler was great. My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill. Everything was soooo tasty. Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times. It's hard to get my boyfriend and I full, but I left stuffed! The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill (Salmon, Swordfish, and Shrimp), the rest of the family had pasta, salad, and a grilled cheese.
The mixed grill tasted fine, but nothing outstanding.
mixed grill.author: Keith D.
mixed grill.review:
We saw all the stars on yelp and thought this was going to be a winner all around. I won't say that the food is bad, it really wasn't bad. It was just very plain.  I had the mixed grill (Salmon, Swordfish, and Shrimp), the rest of the family had pasta, salad, and a grilled cheese.  

The pasta was good, hard to go wrong with a kids pasta.

The Caesar salad was okay, the dressing was a little runny and not flavorful. Again, not bad, just not worth $16.00 for a salad with 4 shrimp.  

The grilled cheese was served on tasty sourdough, but the sourdough killed the flavor of the cheese. And there was very little cheese. Needs more cheese to balance the flavor.

The mixed grill tasted fine, but nothing outstanding. I was expecting more flavor for $28 at lunch. 

The service was good, our server was polite and attentive.  

Overall, it was probably one of the nicer places to eat in a tourist location, but could have been better.

excerpts: We also ordered a mixed grill.
The shrimps on the platter tasted amazing!
Ciopinno ah that was my first time.
Fresh clams, mussels, fish and crab legs in it.
We were able to crack the crabs ourselves thus we didn't order lazy ciopinno :)
yum is the word!
mixed grill.author: Jaslin T.
mixed grill.review:
We came here as my in laws came from out of town. I love love the location of this restaurant. We got seats with the best view :) yaaay!! Ordered cocktail oysters. I was trying it out for the first time, loved it with sauces they provided. They were a bit smaller than expected but totally worth it! There clam chowder is really out of the world. It is Creamy, has the presence of clams and not potatoes. We also ordered a mixed grill. The shrimps on the platter tasted amazing!
Ciopinno ah that was my first time. Fresh clams, mussels, fish and crab legs in it. We were able to crack the crabs ourselves thus we didn't order lazy ciopinno :) yum is the word!

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables.
I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub.
My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well.
mixed grill.author: Crystal R.
mixed grill.review:
My 5 star rating really reflects the amazing dining experience and customer service I received here a few weeks ago on a Sunday night at the bar. My sister and I came in when there was a 1.5 hour wait on Sunday night and decided to opt for the bar instead. Luckily, someone left so we grabbed two seats with a view to watch the Olympics, score! We ended up staying for more than just drinks and oysters and Jason N was excellent every step of the way. I always expect some witty banter and jokes from the bartender but Jason went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience, which we did. It was more than just ensuring our drinks were full and cold, he always checked in with us and did it with a smile on his face. What really put him at 5 stars for me was how well he handled an issue with our meal. We brought up the issue not thinking much about it, but Jason went above our expectations, brought it up with his manager to help ensure we could really enjoy our meal and dining experience. I rarely get such wonderful service and definitely wanted to mention it because it made all the difference for us! 

As far as the food, I enjoyed the oysters very much! Really fresh and perfect start to our meal. I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables. I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub. My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well. I also tried out their two signature bourbon cocktails which were wonderful, although the old fashioned was a bit too sweet for me.

Overall, my dining experience at Fog Harbor at their bar was wonderful! I would definitely recommend others to try them out.

excerpts: We shared a mixed grill seafood plate it was plenty for the both of us they even sperated it on 2 plAtes.
Dessert was
delicious choc cake and creme brule'.'we also had calamari it came with a lemon sauce so good.!
We will be back again!
mixed grill.author: Sharai S.
mixed grill.review: Love coming here! Nice waiters great food and very nice views. We shared a mixed grill seafood plate it was plenty for the both of us they even sperated it on 2 plAtes. Dessert was delicious choc cake and creme brule'.'we also had calamari it came with a lemon sauce so good.! We will be back again!

excerpts: Had the mixed grill, fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned.
mixed grill.author: Bri H.
mixed grill.review: Great food, great service. Had the mixed grill, fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Wife had the California crab and avocado caesar salad, which was HUGE. Our server Khaiman was amazing.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill.
The swordfish was very tender and smooth.
mixed grill.author: Eduardo M.
mixed grill.review:
First night in downtown San Francisco! I arrived with a date about an hour and half before closing. I had no reservation, but that wasn't a problem, we were seated immediately. While being seated I felt very underdressed. I had jeans and a hoody. You have to sit by the windows. The view was amazing! We saw a tiny tug boat!

I ordered the mixed grill. The swordfish was very tender and smooth. The salmon was tender also but had a crisp on the outside, which is how I like my salmon. The shrimp was alright and the mashed was a little cold but smooth.

Overall a great experience.

excerpts: The clam linguine and mixed grill was also very delicious.
Would come again!
mixed grill.author: Steven N.
mixed grill.review: One of the best restaurant I ever been to. Our server Luane provided excellent service and made me feel completely satisfied with everything! My favorite was the clam chowder with crab and bread. The clam linguine and mixed grill was also very delicious. Would come again!

excerpts: The Mixed Grill plate of fish was also spectacular.
The fish tasted so fresh!
The complimentary bread and butter was also good.
The ambiance is romantic and has a water front view of the Pier.
Service was great!
Didn't get to try dessert
but it looked good too.
The wait can get a bit long, so I suggest making a reservation ahead of time if you can.
OpenTable has this place on their reservation list.
mixed grill.author: Persila N.
mixed grill.review: Stellar restaurant in San Francisco.  I was looking for a nice spot in the Pier 39 area, and this was just the kind of place I was looking for.  The menu is extensive-there are good options of seafood and non-seafood items alike.  The clam chowder was so amazing!  The Mixed Grill plate of fish was also spectacular.  The fish tasted so fresh!  The complimentary bread and butter was also good.  The ambiance is romantic and has a water front view of the Pier.  Service was great!  Didn't get to try dessert but it looked good too.  The wait can get a bit long, so I suggest making a reservation ahead of time if you can.  OpenTable has this place on their reservation list.

excerpts: Lobster tail was not fresh and small, mixed grill just bland with 3 small thin and dry pieces of fish.

The worst were the 2 fillet mignon steaks that my son and daughter ordered medium and came almost well done with abnoxious Worcestershire souce underneath on plate to hide the fact they were just warmed up.
Absolutely discusted with this restaurant.
Do not go.
mixed grill.author: Nisim H.
mixed grill.review: Terrible fraudulent expensive but quality is just bad. Lobster tail was not fresh and small, mixed grill just bland with 3 small thin and dry pieces of fish. The worst were the 2 fillet mignon steaks that my son and daughter ordered medium and came almost well done with abnoxious Worcestershire souce underneath on plate to hide the fact they were just warmed up. Absolutely discusted with this restaurant. Do not go.

excerpts: Friends got the burger, coconut shrimp and the mixed grill
and they were all satisfied.
One friend got the crab roll
but it was really mayo-y and not good at all.
Definitely my favorite spot in Pier 39.
mixed grill.author: Sunia C.
mixed grill.review:
Really amazing place. Came here with a group of 5 and were seated right away. Gorgeous view of the water. Very nice staff and an attentive waitress. We got calamari to start and they gave us fresh bread. The bread is AMAZING. It's hot and fresh and addicting. Calamari was pretty good. 
 I got the lazy cioppino and it was delicious. It was chock full of delicious seafood in a really good sauce. They give you a bib but you don't need it if you got the lazy one (unless you want your friends to make fun of you...like mine did lol). Friends got the burger, coconut shrimp and the mixed grill and they were all satisfied. One friend got the crab roll but it was really mayo-y and not good at all. 
Definitely my favorite spot in Pier 39.

excerpts: Mixed Grill again Swordfish & Salmon Fish
So Tender & Fresh Amazing
Tasting Food.
Best Best Place
To Eat on The Wharf Pier 39.
You'll Always Have Great Service Great Location & Great Reasonable Prices
Thank You Pierre for The Best Service Ever & Had A Great Birthday Dinner
mixed grill.author: Barbara L.
mixed grill.review:
Went to The Fog Harbor Fish House for my Birthday I was greeted with smiles all 4 Hostess up Front outstanding was seated right away with the greatest server ever Pierre so Friendly so Kind & A Great Attitude from the start till finish Absolutely Amazing Gentleman so I had 2 Too Shelf Margaritas Strong & Delicious & had the appetizer Calamari very Good & Fresh & Dinner was Mixed Grill again Swordfish & Salmon Fish So Tender & Fresh Amazing Tasting Food. Best Best Place To Eat on The Wharf Pier 39.
You'll Always Have Great Service Great Location & Great Reasonable Prices Thank You Pierre for The Best Service Ever & Had A Great Birthday Dinner

excerpts: I had the dungness crab cocktail and the mixed grill fish.
Everything I put in my mouth was outstanding.
Service was great.
The view was wonderful.
Can't go wrong here.
mixed grill.author: Gary L.
mixed grill.review: I don't normally give 5 stars so that says a lot. I had the dungness crab cocktail and the mixed grill fish. Everything I put in my mouth was outstanding. Service was great. The view was wonderful. Can't go wrong here.

excerpts: Along with the clam chowder (and free bread) I ordered the Mixed Grill Plate - Grilled salmon, swordfish & shrimp covered in a (buttery) citrus buerre blanc served with sides of sauteed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.
The mixed grill plate was phenomenal.
I'm a fan of blackened fish, the taste of the grill and proper seasoning.. and everything on the plate was that exactly.
Moist yet partially charred
swordfish & succulent salmon had my taste buds tingling and the healthy sized shrimp smothered in butter turned my face into a pure gold.
Garlic potatoes were creamy and on poooint.
I was shining vividly, and it was obvious to everyone in our presence that I was thoroughly enjoying this section of my meal.
(My grunts, smiles, giggles, muffled speech, or
mixed grill.author: Ryan B.
mixed grill.review:
Chilling winds mixed with brisk temps had us searching for warmth, shelter and clam chowder.. I mean, we're in San Francisco, am I right?!

We ended up at Pier 39 / Fisherman's Wharf not long after our gruelingly mediocre Bartlett Hall experience. We didn't have much in our stomachs by high noon, which meant the immediate need to fill them with grub hit us in full force. 

Fog Harbor Fish House appeared to be THE SPOT.. mainly because we were right below it.. and our desperate attempts to eat were dwindling down to a either: wait patiently for a hearty meal or begrudgingly snack on munchies along the bay. We laughed at the snack idea and proceeded to head upstairs towards Fog Harbor. The hostess upfront / outside took our names, then informed us it'd be around a 25 minute wait. Within seconds after our groups arrival, the line became that of a Black Friday sale at Best Buy. We were lucky enough to snag a spot in the little patio section by the front bar, fireplace by our sides, and amusingly watched fellow tourists shiver in those chilly northern California temperatures. 

Aside from the crowd outside, the folks inside seemed mild mannered and less talkative than I'd imagine a spot like Fog Harbor would be. We were sat at nice corner table with easily one of the best views in the house that was accompanied by a pleasant server. And though I couldn't verify this, because our spot was visually stunning.. it seemed most seats within the restaurant gave a decent glimpse of the surrounding Bay and Pier 39. The decor itself was almost on the classy-scale but in far too touristy of a spot to be labeled this. 

It looked like every single table had at least ONE bowl of clam chowder sitting atop them, and because it was on our minds prior to our arrival, it was a dish we'd all be ordering without even looking at the menu. Strategy in mind, we ordered regular bowls of Clam Chowder WITHOUT bread as the bowl.. because, you know, most restaurants provide COMPLIMENTARY BREAD.. so all that excess yeast is simply unnecessary, folks. Unless.. bread is yo' thing. Then do whatcha wanna do, baby. 

Along with the clam chowder (and free bread) I ordered the Mixed Grill Plate - Grilled salmon, swordfish & shrimp covered in a (buttery) citrus buerre blanc served with sides of sauteed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.

The mixed grill plate was phenomenal. I'm a fan of blackened fish, the taste of the grill and proper seasoning.. and everything on the plate was that exactly. Moist yet partially charred swordfish & succulent salmon had my taste buds tingling and the healthy sized shrimp smothered in butter turned my face into a pure gold. Garlic potatoes were creamy and on poooint. I was shining vividly, and it was obvious to everyone in our presence that I was thoroughly enjoying this section of my meal. (My grunts, smiles, giggles, muffled speech, or if I look drunk without drinking, etc.)

The clam chowder was, for lack of better terms, doo-doo. Just about every bite had sand in it. Strange.. it appeared there wasn't much clam in my bowl.. which made the sand ordeal a somewhat mind-boggling. Because of this, I didn't enjoy nor finish their 'Award Winning' Clam Chowder. I would've dipped my head into the Pacific if I wanted to taste as much sand as that.

A thin line between a 3 and a 4, Fog Harbor Fish House (through my eyes) may not have the best clam chowder as claimed.. but was boosted in a positive direction due to solid / attentive service, views truly pleasing to the eyes and all of our food (aside from chowder) was tasty and fulfilling for our once empty stomachs.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good.
However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house.
mixed grill.author: Whitney C.
mixed grill.review:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.

excerpts: We ordered the special, Risotto with Grilled Scallops and the Mixed Grill for or entrees.
Took a bit for the main courses to come out, but both were very good.
The salmon with the Mixed Grill was the least enjoyable.
Didn't have much flavor compared to the other items and was somewhat blah.
Otherwise, a very nice dinner.
mixed grill.author: Ed M.
mixed grill.review: Clam Chowder was delicious! We ordered the special, Risotto with Grilled Scallops and the Mixed Grill for or entrees. Took a bit for the main courses to come out, but both were very good. The salmon with the Mixed Grill was the least enjoyable. Didn't have much flavor compared to the other items and was somewhat blah. Otherwise, a very nice dinner.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill.
Our waiter Khaiman was very attentive regardless of how busy it was.
He even gave us some great recommendations of spots to check out!
All star service!
mixed grill.author: Jenry L.
mixed grill.review: First time in SF from Miami, Great food! I had the mixed grill. Our waiter Khaiman was very attentive regardless of how busy it was. He even gave us some great recommendations of spots to check out! All star service!

excerpts: The waiter helped me choose the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp.
It was really well done with some great flavor.
The garlic mashed potatoes were yum!
My husband had the fish and chips, which he enjoyed.
We would absolutely recommend Fog Harbor!
mixed grill.author: Ruth B.
mixed grill.review: We were seated promptly. The service was great. The view is awesome. We started with a delicious Caesar salad which was plenty for 2 to share. The waiter helped me choose the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp. It was really well done with some great flavor. The garlic mashed potatoes were yum! My husband had the fish and chips, which he enjoyed. We would absolutely recommend Fog Harbor!

excerpts: Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.
mixed grill.author: Greg Y.
mixed grill.review:
The Fog House is a wonderful example of the amazing food available in San Fransisco.  The location on the pier is stunning and you get views from every seat in the room.  It's a shame I live in NY and won't be able to eat here until 2017 when I plan on traveling back to SF.  

Appetizers:  Calamari; New England Clam Chowder. 
   -Both amazing and the NE clam chowder is a must order if you are a fan.  The best one I've ever had and that's a East Coast man talking.


Dinners:  Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.

  Lobster Tail with Garlic mashed potatoes - My fiancé loves lobster, she said it was perfectly cooked and was delectable as well.

  Ahi Tuna dinner with wild rice - My fiancé's cousin ate the entire dish and was another very satisfied customer.

Restaurant atmosphere was fantastic and our waiter was extremely attentive, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly.

excerpts: Almost 80% of my group ordered the Mixed Grill, while we also added some seafood pasta and lobster tail entrée.
Regardless of the wharf being very touristy, Fog Harbor is not just a touristy place, I feel they care and serve quality food.
mixed grill.author: Jeff T.
mixed grill.review:
Ever since our August 2015 trip, I've returned in Sep. 2015 and this past weekend. The Jan. 2016 visit was more important as it was a joint birthday for my mom and gf's dad. There was 12 of us, and I reserved a table a month prior. We were lucky to get the best seat in the house, and a spectacular view of the wharf. Everyone in my group ordered clam chowder in cups and bowls and the calamari for the appetizers. The whole family enjoyed it, even coining the clam chowder one of the best chowders they've had. Our server Amy and the rest of the Fog Harbor team took great care of us. Almost 80% of my group ordered the Mixed Grill, while we also added some seafood pasta and lobster tail entrée. Regardless of the wharf being very touristy, Fog Harbor is not just a touristy place, I feel they care and serve quality food. I highly highly recommend this place, over and over again!

Peace, love and happiness!

excerpts: I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety.
You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter.
mixed grill.author: Christina L.
mixed grill.review:
I had an amazing time at this restaurant. I couldn't give a 5 star, because our original server didn't have the best customer service. However, for some reason, a new server Morgan took over and our time here became almost perfect. She was very kind and always had a small on, and had great customer service for a high quality restaurant. She checked up on us as much as she can, and really changed our time there. I highly recommend asking for her if you want great customer service.

As for the food, the seafood was high quality and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the crab and avocado salad, clam chowder, and the crab ceviche to start off. All of the flavors were upto par and super fresh. I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety. You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter. All of the seafood was very fresh and seasoned well. 

Overall, I will definitely be returning for their quality seafood and the customer service we received in the end. One tip: make reservations for the view because the view really makes it much more special. Thank you Morgan for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner with my family!

excerpts: We had the Bay Scallops, Mixed Grill, and Lobster tails-
all of it was tender, juicy and seasoned well.
Portions aren't huge, but they are certainly big enough
mixed grill.author: Alex R.
mixed grill.review:
Good: 

-The food is very good. We had the Bay Scallops, Mixed Grill, and Lobster tails- all of it was tender, juicy and seasoned well. Portions aren't huge, but they are certainly big enough you won't leave unsatisfied.

-Service is top notch. The server (Raphael) made several good recommendations and was very sociable. He was attentive without being intrusive.

-Ambiance. Has a nice view of bay and the bridge and the decor is upscale without being gaudy. Definitely had a great vibe to it.


Bad:

Feels roughly 10-20% overpriced. Definitely great for special occasions, but the prices mean this will probably not be a weekly event.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill and my husband ordered the crab cakes for our entrees.
mixed grill.author: Sarath P.
mixed grill.review: I don't know what we were expecting from a restaurant around the touristy area but we really wanted seafood and this was close. I do have to say -- man, their clam chowder is GOOOOOOOOOOOD. You know a clam chowder is good when it's more clam than chowder. And it was big meaty pieces of clams too. I ordered the mixed grill and my husband ordered the crab cakes for our entrees. The shrimp and salmon on my plate were ok... but the swordfish was amazing! I wish I had ordered the swordfish on it's own. My husbands crab cakes were pretty tasty but not the best we've had. You know what the best thing about dinner was? The view... we were there when the sun was setting and it was just awesome. Maybe even a bit romantic?

excerpts: The mixed grill never disappoints.
mixed grill.author: Paula G.
mixed grill.review: Fabulous food. Yes, Pier 39 is loaded with tourists, but the food and the view is worth the trek. The mixed grill never disappoints.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli.
The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling.
The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service
and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem!
It was delicious and left me incapable of moving.
They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!
mixed grill.author: Yeraldine S.
mixed grill.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House- you were great. I wanted to celebrate my actual birthday dinner by the water to get a nice view of the sunset but unfortunately mother nature wasn't on board with my plans. Either way the hostess was friendly and sat us by a window. The restaurant does cater to the tourist who are wandering around Pier 39. It has a romantic-feel to it--too bad I was with my best friend! 

Our  waiter was super friendly and attentive throughout the entire night. We checked in and got free garlic bread to start off with. We ordered our glasses of wine and I already knew what i wanted since I Yelped their menu. I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli. The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling. The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem! It was delicious and left me incapable of moving. They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!

excerpts: Our entrees the Mixed grill for her and the Shrimp Brochette for me also perfect.
The restaurant is very nice and pleasantly quiet.
Our server Shawn recommended that we take a Tiramisu to go which is the main reason for this review.
Service is over the top here.
Shawn took very good care of us while we were there and the Tiramisu was the best I ever had.
No wonder Fog Harbor Fish House has  over 3000 reviews.
Thanks Shawn
we will be back.
mixed grill.author: Roger J.
mixed grill.review: Tonight's dinner started with a big bowl of clam chowder which was perfect. My wife had the mixed greens salad. Our entrees the Mixed grill for her and the Shrimp Brochette for me also perfect. The restaurant is very nice and pleasantly quiet. Our server Shawn recommended that we take a Tiramisu to go which is the main reason for this review. Service is over the top here. Shawn took very good care of us while we were there and the Tiramisu was the best I ever had. No wonder Fog Harbor Fish House has  over 3000 reviews. Thanks Shawn we will be back.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill and we also shared the Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread and my girlfriend got the Poke for herself.
Thy were all awesome!!!
mixed grill.author: Alex M.
mixed grill.review: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed eating here! We were visiting from SoCal and wanted somewhere we could sit and have some great fish and beers but not too expensive. It was pretty crowded when we first got there and luckily found a spot to eat at the bar. The bartenders were very friendly and made us feel welcome and didn't rush us to eat and leave. I ordered the mixed grill and we also shared the Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread and my girlfriend got the Poke for herself. Thy were all awesome!!! The Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread were way too good and my salmon was so crispy and juicy. The Poke was great, just enough spice to it! I definitely recommend this place! This would be 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Otherwise, this place is great!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill as the entree.
I would return soon.
mixed grill.author: Joshua R.
mixed grill.review: Excellent service by Mel. The food was great and the response from the staff.  We were attended well and they kept coming by to check on us. Clam chowder was on point. I had the mixed grill as the entree. I would return soon.

excerpts: Mixed grill $26
mixed grill.author: China D.
mixed grill.review:
Decided to grab seafood today and ended up here. The service was pretty good. Only thing was she did take long and forgot about out extra lemon, but hey it happens. 

The food was good. It was kind of pricey but as is seafood and it was good. Nothing to write home to mom about, but maybe cus I'm more of a Cajun creole girl.


 The halibut was fresh and yummy and the shrimp where cooked well. The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh. The rice was however flavorless. Wish they had a happy hour ;(    

Loved my margarita !! 

We ordered 
Moscow mule $12.50
Hibiscus margarita $12.50
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
Mixed grill $26

Total 

$115 with some extra state tax added on on top of the original tax. 


Will we go back ? Maybe not, unless for the view. there are far too many seafood spots to try to us to want to come back. Nothing extra special here. The view was however the best part. Overlooking the water and sunset. 

We got a window seat the a reservation had cancelled so it was a nice romantic dinner.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and it was phenomenal.
I asked for a side of chimichurri which really added something also.
The clam chowder was amazing.
Service was top notch.
One of the best meals I had in San Francisco.
mixed grill.author: Ally K.
mixed grill.review: I got the mixed grill and it was phenomenal. I asked for a side of chimichurri which really added something also. The clam chowder was amazing. Service was top notch. One of the best meals I had in San Francisco.

excerpts: Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes.
mixed grill.author: Esther K.
mixed grill.review:
$16 mango crab/lobster? (don't remember if it was crab or lobster) ceviche with chips appetizer 

$10 Clam chowder in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl 

$26 Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes. 

$19 Crab Roll- Crab, celery, shallot aioli, substituted with French roll 

Free sourdough bread with butter

Long wait (~1 hour.  ~40 minutes outside to be seated, ~20 minutes to be served) was well worth the food.  

Waitress was nice to let me substitute my foods and also giving options.  First time having swordfish.  It was an interesting taste and texture. It tasted like some kind of cheese but my significant other said it tasted like chicken.   

We got free sweet potato fries because the Crab Roll came with regular fries instead of sweet potato.  So we got a plate of our fries and we got to keep the sweet potato fries for free!

excerpts: I got the Mixed Grill (best swordfish I've ever had)
and my boyfriend got the surf and turf (about $50).
Everything was delicious.
mixed grill.author: Yessenia E.
mixed grill.review:
My boyfriend and I got the chance to eat here and let me tell you, this place is so good!! 

Scenery - We got a table overlooking Alcatraz, there are also views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the restaurant 

Food - We ordered the baked oysters to start and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on. The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier! I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve (it complemented my meal nicely). We then ordered our meals. I got the Mixed Grill (best swordfish I've ever had) and my boyfriend got the surf and turf (about $50). Everything was delicious. 10/10

Service - Quick and attentive. Our waiter was sent by the gods! He was so nice and always there when I needed him but not overly pushy. Our meal came before the appetizer. When I asked him about it, he said the kitchen must've gotten mixed up and asked if we still wanted it which I kindly refused. He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters. It was such a nice surprise and great customer service. And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters! So good!!

I will definitely be coming back and recommend as a great date restaurant!

excerpts: My husband had the mixed grill and the fried calamari.
The calamari was tasty and he loved the added kick of the jalapeños that were fried and mixed in.
The aeoli with the calamari was good also.
I had the crab cake app
- it was fresh and tastey.
I had the shell platter for 1 which was very good.
It was a lot of food
and I wish my husband
and I had split it.
mixed grill.author: Latifia C.
mixed grill.review: My husband and I ate there during a Memorial Day weekend trip to San Francisco.  It was a WONDERFUL experience.  We sat at the bar to avoid a wait however the  service we received at the bar was impeccable.  Our waitress (Morgan M.) was warm and attentive even though she was very busy.  Now for the food - excellent!!! My husband had the mixed grill and the fried calamari.  The calamari was tasty and he loved the added kick of the jalapeños that were fried and mixed in.  The aeoli with the calamari was good also.  I had the crab cake app - it was fresh and tastey.  I had the shell platter for 1 which was very good. It was a lot of food and I wish my husband and I had split it.

excerpts: Food is not that good, mixed grill is small portion and Came cold!
The server is rude, didn't even tell us his name.
He didn't know what he was doing, and our food were brought to wrong table!
We have to ask couple times for an extra basket of bread for 4 ppl.
We were just too nice to even tip him which he is not deserved at all.
mixed grill.author: K L.
mixed grill.review: Food is not that good, mixed grill is small portion and Came cold! The server is rude, didn't even tell us his name. He didn't know what he was doing, and our food were brought to wrong table! We have to ask couple times for an extra basket of bread for 4 ppl. We were just too nice to even tip him which he is not deserved at all.

excerpts: We ordered mixed grill, shrimp dish, garlic crab.
My dish ( mixed grill)
it was fabulous..
I really don't like broccoli, but the broccoli was amazing.
mixed grill.author: Stacy C.
mixed grill.review:
My friend and I traveled San Francisco last winter.
We didn't  know anything about  pier39, so we chose restaurant randomly. 

Waiter was kind and he explained what is good to eat this season. We ordered mixed grill, shrimp dish, garlic crab.

It was amazing test. My dish ( mixed grill) it was fabulous.. I really don't like broccoli, but the broccoli was amazing. I'd never eaten delicious broccoli before... and grilled salmon and the other kinds of  fish was amazing... 

At that time, it was crab season, so we ordered crab.
It taste naturally sweet and the garlic sauce was amazing, not too greasy, crab meat is soooo soft..

Table was clean and modern. Service also amazing~

I will come again this summer vacation

excerpts: I had the mixed grill
and it was good.
mixed grill.author: Karen G.
mixed grill.review: I had a really great meal and service at Fog Harbor. I was impressed by the service. I had the mixed grill and it was good.

excerpts: On the other hand my Mixed Grill dish was small for the price in my opinion..
mixed grill.author: Greg F.
mixed grill.review:
The Sourdough Clam Chowder Bowl was yummy, and the bread was very good. 
The Crab Cakes appetizer was the best crab cakes I have ever eaten!! 
I also ordered a Moscow Mule and that is a real nice drink when you have a hot date like I did 
On the other hand my Mixed Grill dish was small for the price in my opinion.. 
And the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail was Subpar. 
The cocktail sauce just had a weird taste to it, no flavor. 
I actually ended up adding the shrimp from that to my meal. 
I would recommend this to family and friends because they have many other really nice looking dishes

excerpts: Had the mussel fries, mixed grill, clam chowder, and half garlic crab.
Mixed grill was savory and in good portion.
Mussel
fries-
I was very surprised with this one because it blew me out of my mind.
It was so good!!!
I loved the combination of fries and mussel!
Clam chowder- was rich and amazing!
mixed grill.author: Michelle K.
mixed grill.review:
Had the mussel fries, mixed grill, clam chowder, and half garlic crab. 

All I can say is everything was SO GOOD. PERFECT!!! 

Garlic crab was cooked perfectly so that my bf didn't have a hard time going through the crab. 
Mixed grill was savory and in good portion. 
Mussel fries- I was very surprised with this one because it blew me out of my mind. It was so good!!! I loved the combination of fries and mussel! 
Clam chowder- was rich and amazing! Best clam chowder in fisherman's wharf imo. 

Would come back here again! Service was nice and attentive!

excerpts: I also had the mixed grill which was delicious, salmon, shrimps and swordfish.
I tasted many salmons before in my life and this one was really fresh.
Cooked to perfection.
Vegetables on the side were okay.
My gf had the Penne pasta and it was delicious, not a lot of cheese which was perfect.
Our server was very friendly and very helpful.
The place was crowded but we managed to get a great sitting in a corner overviewing alcatraz and the rest of fishermans wharf.
Eating here has been a great experience to anyone who wants to try seafood and something original from San Francisco.
Prices were okay, not cheap
but if you like eating quality food then price are a bargain for what you get.
mixed grill.author: Daniel C.
mixed grill.review: I looked for a great place all over pier 39. I stumbled over this restaurant. I must say that the food here is extremely tasty and good. The clam chowder was on point and it was very filling. I also had the mixed grill which was delicious, salmon, shrimps and swordfish. I tasted many salmons before in my life and this one was really fresh. Cooked to perfection. Vegetables on the side were okay. My gf had the Penne pasta and it was delicious, not a lot of cheese which was perfect. Our server was very friendly and very helpful. The place was crowded but we managed to get a great sitting in a corner overviewing alcatraz and the rest of fishermans wharf. Eating here has been a great experience to anyone who wants to try seafood and something original from San Francisco. Prices were okay, not cheap but if you like eating quality food then price are a bargain for what you get.

excerpts: The clam chowder lives up to the award winning title and the Mixed Grill plate was phresh!
It never hurts to have warm bread and butter to get started.
Drinks were also good, even the non-alcoholic ones.
The special touch was definitely the service, Oscar, went above and beyond.
Efficient, courteous and very attentive.
mixed grill.author: Monse R.
mixed grill.review: This was my first time eating here and it was a good life choice. The clam chowder lives up to the award winning title and the Mixed Grill plate was phresh! It never hurts to have warm bread and butter to get started. Drinks were also good, even the non-alcoholic ones. The special touch was definitely the service, Oscar, went above and beyond. Efficient, courteous and very attentive.

excerpts: Mixed Grill ($23.00):
mixed grill.author: Diana T.
mixed grill.review:
I LOVE seafood!!!  Came here with no reservations around 1:00pm and waited just about 10 mins.  Not bad since the place was really crowded!  Got seated and our waiter brought out some fresh sourdough bread with butter! YUM!  Let's cut to the chase.  They are famous for their clam chowder and that was a must have!  We ordered:

Soup and Salad Combo (($14.00) Caesar salad with chicken & clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had!  There were lots of clams in it and the soup was not watered down.  I love eating soup that you can actually chew!  Very creamy, buttery, and full of goodness!

Fish & Chips ($16.00)- Hand dipped in "Anchor Steam" beer batter with cole slaw.  The best fish and chips I've had as well! Super crunchy and full of flavors!  Definitely fills you up!  If you get this, maybe order another dish so you won't get sick of it!  Sharing is caring ;)


Mixed Grill ($23.00): Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.  This was just an okay dish.  I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.  The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal! Buttery!

This is a very busy restaurant so make sure that when you get your bill, check it!  Our waiter actually gave us the wrong bill so good thing I checked it!  After the bill comes out, you get some kind of gingerbread cookie!  Very delish!

Overall, this place was good!  Great view as well!

NOTE:
-Make reservations
-Free Cookies after your meal
-Complimentary bread and butter

excerpts: Well seasoned and perfectly cooked salmon, swordfish, and shrimp from the mixed grill entree.
Splitting the dish with the addition of a cup of the clam chowder made for a very satisfying dinner.
The view of the sunset over the pier with Golden Gate to the left and Alcatraz on the right was the cherry on top.
Thank you also to our waitress Melissa N. for the tips on what wineries to tour in Napa Valley :)
mixed grill.author: Jena J.
mixed grill.review: Well seasoned and perfectly cooked salmon, swordfish, and shrimp from the mixed grill entree. Splitting the dish with the addition of a cup of the clam chowder made for a very satisfying dinner. The view of the sunset over the pier with Golden Gate to the left and Alcatraz on the right was the cherry on top. Thank you also to our waitress Melissa N. for the tips on what wineries to tour in Napa Valley :)

excerpts: Wife got the mixed grill and couldn't stop oozing over the swordfish.
It was the best either us of us has ever had.
Full disclosure, we live in the desert.
mixed grill.author: S And J T.
mixed grill.review: Our first visit here and they actually got us in for dinner on Valentine's Day without a reservation. Amazing! Not the best table, but, with their superb location and all those windows, we still had a beautiful view of the bay at sunset. The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was indeed "jumbo" AND delicious. The chowder was excellent but, be warned, my vegetarian wife couldn't have any because it has bacon in it. The Ahi Tuna was perfectly/lightly cooked and a very substantial portion. Fresh and delicious. Wife got the mixed grill and couldn't stop oozing over the swordfish. It was the best either us of us has ever had. Full disclosure, we live in the desert.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes.
Everything was grilled perfectly.
mixed grill.author: Blue A.
mixed grill.review:
Sure, it's in a touristy part of town, but do I live in SF? Nope...so that would make me a tourist! No?

So we went over for dinner, after a long day of training. The view is really nice, and I recommend a table by the window so you can see the bay, and in some parts even Alcatraz (maybe not romantic, but still a cool sight). 

We started off sharing a couple of appetizers: Shrimp cocktail and crab cakes.
Both were good!

Entree I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was grilled perfectly. My favorite was the swordfish but the other two (and that mash!) were great too.

For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding. Big enough that three of us shared and it was just the right way to end the meal.

Customer service was great. Our waiter accidentally switched up the wine orders and gave them to the wrong people. He felt so embarrassed he apologized the rest of the night. It really was no biggie, but he wanted to make sure he made it right.

excerpts: I got a Cioppiano with pasta and my boyfriend got the mixed grill.
I would give out 5 out of 5 stars and he said he will give out 4 1/2 stars.
It was worth trying and not a long wait.
My Cioppiano was sooo good !!!
mixed grill.author: Lucy K.
mixed grill.review: It was the most expensive lunch I ever paid for, but it was so worth the money. Me and my boyfriend got a 1/2 dozen oysters. I got a Cioppiano with pasta and my boyfriend got the mixed grill. I would give out 5 out of 5 stars and he said he will give out 4 1/2 stars. It was worth trying and not a long wait. My Cioppiano was sooo good !!!

excerpts: We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate.
Food was good-
mixed grill.author: Jessy H.
mixed grill.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is like putting San Francisco in a plate. It was my boyfriend's first time in the city and I decided to take him here based on the whole experience. 

We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate. Food was good- I do wish the salmon was slightly more cooked and the swordfish lacked a bit of seasoning. 

It was crazy packed and we had to sit very close to other customers at the bar. Bartenders were totally awesome and attentive. 

When it came time for dessert, they bring an entire tray of their selection that is like candy to the sweet lover.

excerpts: I was torn between the shrimp skewers or the mixed grill, but I went with the mixed grill for the variety.
so yum
wow.
they added mixed veggies,
so I felt better about eating all the meat and fried squid.
mixed grill.author: Hannah W.
mixed grill.review: I found this place on Yelp, but I had trouble finding the actual restaurant. it's on the second floor of the pier, and I didn't find that out until walking in circles maybe 5 times. once I found it, I was warmly welcomed and seated at a comfy spot in front of the window. the views from the restaurant are very pretty. I ordered calamari. it was bomb af. they also served fresh sourdough bread. I was torn between the shrimp skewers or the mixed grill, but I went with the mixed grill for the variety. so yum wow. they added mixed veggies, so I felt better about eating all the meat and fried squid. I ate almost all of it, and I was happy to have some shrimp, salmon, and swordfish all in 1 dish. :)

excerpts: I really enjoyed the crispy lemon calamari appetizer (crispy, lightly battered, and delicious); a bowl of their clam chowder (tons of clams); and the mixed grill entree, which consisted of salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.
mixed grill.author: Arasto F.
mixed grill.review:
Fresh seafood, great service, nice decor, and gorgeous views of the Bay.

As noted in other review, the portion sizes are large -- which is rare in this area.

I really enjoyed the crispy lemon calamari appetizer (crispy, lightly battered, and delicious); a bowl of their clam chowder (tons of clams); and the mixed grill entree, which consisted of salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.  

They deserve five stars. I'll upload pics later....

excerpts: I would definitely recommend having the Mixed Grill.
Fair price for what you are getting.
mixed grill.author: Christian K.
mixed grill.review: This is my favorite sea food restaurant to date. The service is amazing and the food is delicious.  I would definitely recommend having the Mixed Grill. Fair price for what you are getting.

excerpts: Mixed Grill - they split this onto two plates for us, which was very nice.
mixed grill.author: Meredith A.
mixed grill.review:
Why wait ages for a table, when you can sit at the bar on a Saturday night with no wait?  Same food, and same view, although you're slightly further from the window.  Who cares!  Close enough!

Apparently this place is very touristy.  I believe you, but I also do not care, because their seafood is delicious.

Mussel fries - sounds funnier in English than in French.  And rather than come with fries alongside, these mussels have fries chucked right on top, ready for dipping in the creamy, shalloty, fennelly sauce.  And there's garlic aioli drizzled on top.  And warm baguette alongside if you need more carbs to dip.  Yaaaaas.  Delicious!  Great for sharing, and expect big fat mussels and lots o' fries.

Mixed Grill - they split this onto two plates for us, which was very nice.  Wonderfully prepared salmon, swordfish, and shrimp in a citrus butter.  Simply prepared and served with the usual host of rice and vegetables.  Absolutely fresh seafood, a little expensive for the portion size, but overall great stuff.

We were in, ate, paid, and out in fairly short time, so we could explore Pier 39 and get back to the baaaaaars, because it was Saturday night and that's what we were about.  Anyway if you don't mind being seen at a touristy spot, you will get good quality food here, great views, and a secret way to eat without a long wait first on a weekend night.  You're welcome!

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Grill which consisted of salmon, shrimp skewer and some other type of fish along with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.
mixed grill.author: Ibedatnica I.
mixed grill.review:
As a First Timer I Must say that my experience was Amazing.  The staff was friendly right on point and the food was delicious. 

Let's Start with Ambiance it was very comforting not pretentious rather relaxing and the best part was we never felt rushed. 

I ordered the Mixed Grill which consisted of salmon, shrimp skewer and some other type of fish along with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.

My husband ordered the surf and turf 
His steak was cooked exactly the way he requested. The lobster was well proportioned so no complaints from him. 

We had a few drinks from the bar which were well made and for dessert I had the Tiramisu which was out of this world. 

I highly recommend this restaurant it was worth every penny. 

Kudos to our amazing waitress didn't catch her name but she made the experience well worth it.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill - swordfish, salmon and shrimp with rice and steamed broccoli.
mixed grill.author: Jimmy M.
mixed grill.review:
We checked this place out to complete our tourist jaunt to the Embarcadero. We easily got a table with a view at 12:30 on a Wednesday.

The kids menu is good - my youngest had a cheese burger and fries, and the older boy had fish and chips. Portions were good sized and very affordable.

My wife had the chowder bread bowl - always a good option.

I had the mixed grill - swordfish, salmon and shrimp with rice and steamed broccoli. A solid seafood dish.

This place won't win any hipster points or anything for hipness or originality - but it's good for a family.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill and remember being thankful my seafood was not overcooked.
Being on the water, I expected well cooked, and hopefully seasoned, seafood and was not disappointed.
mixed grill.author: Kemi A.
mixed grill.review:
While my boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco from Chicago last November, we had dinner at Fog Harbor after our tour on Alcatraz.

I ordered the mixed grill and remember being thankful my seafood was not overcooked.  Being on the water, I expected well cooked, and hopefully seasoned, seafood and was not disappointed.  The restaurant was tasteful establishment with good service, but less modern or mixed than what I would typically frequent.

All in all good food, good service, and conveniently on the pier.

excerpts: We had the clam chowder soup and the mixed grill, both great!
mixed grill.author: Jonathan P.
mixed grill.review:
Good food, good service, good view on the Golden Gate and Alcatraz... What else ?
We had the clam chowder soup and the mixed grill, both great!

excerpts: Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad.
mixed grill.author: Benny H.
mixed grill.review:
I'm really going to have a hard time with this review as I actually really did enjoy the food, but it was easily the worst service I've had in a decent amount of time. 

Not sure if they were having a hard time adjusting for the Labor Day tourists, but when you have to ask for ketchup three times from three different servers, you know things aren't going well. 

I had the crab roll which was great. Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great. Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad. It's a typical seafood place located within the tourist utopia that is Fisherman's Wharf. 

We had a nice gentleman who was taking care of us while our server was on break, and he was fantastic. Once he left things really took a hit. Our server was nice, but we barely saw her. We had oyster shells on our table for nearly 30 minutes. 30 minutes. They normally take those away within minutes. 

It's a nice location, with pretty good food, but they really need to step up the service.

excerpts: Ordered the mixed grill, fish and chips, and ahi tuna, and a wedge salad.
All dishes were tasty, see photos.
mixed grill.author: Randi B.
mixed grill.review: So dang delicious. Bread comes out warm and fresh. Ordered the mixed grill, fish and chips, and ahi tuna, and a wedge salad. All dishes were tasty, see photos.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill with 3 shrimp, swordfish and salmon...
it was amazing!
My hubby had the chicken breast and it was delicious too!
I wish we had time for dessert, next time for sure!
mixed grill.author: Diana D.
mixed grill.review:
Great restaurant with delicious food! We went last night, and my 8 year old daughter was thrilled we finally found salmon on the kids menu! 
I had the mixed grill with 3 shrimp, swordfish and salmon...it was amazing! 
My hubby had the chicken breast and it was delicious too! I wish we had time for dessert, next time for sure!

excerpts: Got the mixed grill, sword fish+salmon+shrimp tastefully grilled with fresh veggies and mashed potatoes.
The view is very nice, and add the great atmosphere.
You should expect the usual tourist rush.
Our server was terrific and family friendly.
Top your food with a Tera Misu cake and you are set.
mixed grill.author: Sheggaw B.
mixed grill.review: Very impressive taste, both the starter and main course. Got the mixed grill, sword fish+salmon+shrimp tastefully grilled with fresh veggies and mashed potatoes. The view is very nice, and add the great atmosphere. You should expect the usual tourist rush. Our server was terrific and family friendly. Top your food with a Tera Misu cake and you are set.

excerpts: We had the mixed grill and the fish was freshly cooked to perfection.
Fish and chips was flakey and cooked great.
Our waiter, Khaiman was on point!
Highly attentive, quick and very friendly.
Highly recommended restaurant and one of the best on the pier!
mixed grill.author: Kolby S.
mixed grill.review: Fantastic service, food, and view! Clam chowder was phenomenal. We had the mixed grill and the fish was freshly cooked to perfection. Fish and chips was flakey and cooked great. Our waiter, Khaiman was on point! Highly attentive, quick and very friendly. Highly recommended restaurant and one of the best on the pier!

excerpts: We had the "mixed grill" and "swordfish" (with pesto sauce and chimichurri) as entrees, and they were both wonderful!
The appetizers didn't disappoint either - we shared a bowl of clam chowder and the calamari and both were awesome.
Our server and the view were fantastic, too.
Zero complaints!
I may even try to get my husband to go back before we leave San Francisco tomorrow ;)
mixed grill.author: Sophie S.
mixed grill.review: This place is great! We had the "mixed grill" and "swordfish" (with pesto sauce and chimichurri) as entrees, and they were both wonderful! The appetizers didn't disappoint either - we shared a bowl of clam chowder and the calamari and both were awesome. Our server and the view were fantastic, too. Zero complaints! I may even try to get my husband to go back before we leave San Francisco tomorrow ;)

excerpts: The food I ordered was a clam chowder sourdough bowl, ate every last bite, my main was the mixed grill, and everything was cooked very nicely.
Throughly enjoyed the food as mentioned before.
Will definitely tell my friends about this place :)
mixed grill.author: Mercedes C.
mixed grill.review: First time coming here, my server khaiman was very friendly, prompt, quick to deliver food and drinks. Always made sure everything tasted good and was great at keeping me topped up with water. Looking forward to coming back! The food I ordered was a clam chowder sourdough bowl, ate every last bite, my main was the mixed grill, and everything was cooked very nicely. Throughly enjoyed the food as mentioned before. Will definitely tell my friends about this place :)

excerpts: Food was mostly very good - crab ravioli and beet salad for daughter, bread bowl chowder & caesar for wife, and mixed grill seafood for self.
So was the food the best we have ever had?
No, but it was all very good.
Portions were modest and prices were somewhat on the high side,
but hey .... what would one expect?
mixed grill.author: Dan O.
mixed grill.review: Sensory overload from all the touristy stuff resulted in just picking some place to eat, Fog Harbor Fish House in our case.  The atmosphere is very nice (duh! - most everything in San Francisco has "atmosphere")  and the wait staff was very professional in this rather large hustle bustle restaurant.  Food was mostly very good - crab ravioli and beet salad for daughter, bread bowl chowder & caesar for wife, and mixed grill seafood for self.  So was the food the best we have ever had?  No, but it was all very good.  Portions were modest and prices were somewhat on the high side, but hey .... what would one expect?

excerpts: Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other.
Both were very good.
Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.
mixed grill.author: P R.
mixed grill.review: Ate here a couple times over the last couple months - both times were very good.  One time got straight in and the other had a 30 minute wait.  But they do the text message method and you are able to walk around while waiting. The views are fantastic.  The food and service matched.  Started with some oysters - very good pacific coast ones.  Also tried the calamari - also very good.  Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other. Both were very good. Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.

excerpts: My family enjoyed the mixed grill.
mixed grill.author: Mona M.
mixed grill.review:
Not impressed, value equation was way off.  Fried combo was decent but the cole slaw was very marginal.  My family enjoyed the mixed grill.  I had the Cioppino, portion was great and was enough for a light meal for two people, I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the seafood, fish and scallops were dry.

The best thing about my meal was the Alcatraz cocktail.  It was delicious!

Wait staff and management staff were very attentive but this was a tourist trap that I won't recommend or repeat.

excerpts: For my entree, I had the mixed grill -  which was perfect because I couldn't make up my mind on what kind of seafood I wanted.
mixed grill.author: Paula S.
mixed grill.review:
During my trip to San Francisco - my friend and I stopped here on a Sunday evening. I'm grateful we did!

We sat at the bar after we put our names on the list to be seated. The drinks I had were excellent! I had the Lombard Lemonade and the Lipstick Lemondrop...mmmm. I also liked that they had "lower calorie drink options" on the menu. (Since I was on vacation - the calories didn't count - but just in case for another time where I'm on perfect diet behavior)...

Once we were seated, our server was very attentive and provided excellent service. The complimentary bread was delicious - or maybe I just love sourdough. For my entree, I had the mixed grill -  which was perfect because I couldn't make up my mind on what kind of seafood I wanted. It was plenty of food, but I didn't finish the meal miserably full. 

The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty nice too; I liked our view of the bay. 

When I come back to San Francisco, I'd love to eat here again!

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill after it was suggested by the manager who stopped by our table.
Excellent choice.
Good food & a wonderful water/marina view.
mixed grill.author: Mama M.
mixed grill.review:
Service was a bit lacking, but the food was delicious. I ordered the mixed grill after it was suggested by the manager who stopped by our table. Excellent choice.
Good food & a wonderful water/marina view.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon she ordered the mixed grill and everything was absolutely amazing.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce was delicious and the drinks were great.
Our server was very kind and helpful, sadly I do not remember his name.
Definitely recommend!
mixed grill.author: Ana C.
mixed grill.review: Went in for my mom's birthday. I ordered the salmon she ordered the mixed grill and everything was absolutely amazing. The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce was delicious and the drinks were great. Our server was very kind and helpful, sadly I do not remember his name. Definitely recommend!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish.
It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.
mixed grill.author: Heidi S.
mixed grill.review:
My boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip to the wharf and decided to try this restaurant out.

He had a mixed seafood pasta that he said was really good.  I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish. It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.  I thought the seafood was very fresh and delicious.

We both started the meal with a cup of clam chowder and both agreed that we could have eaten a bowl.  It was the best clam chowder that I ever can recall eating.  It was perfectly thick with potatoes and loaded with clams.  

Our server was very nice and prompt.  We never had to ask for a refill.

It was a tad pricey, but what isn't on the wharf of San Francisco.   2 cups of chowder, 2 entrees and 2 cokes ran us right about $85.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill and my swordfish, shrimp, and salmon were cooked perfectly.
Staff were friendly.
Great place.
mixed grill.author: Kevin P.
mixed grill.review: This place was great. I ordered the mixed grill and my swordfish, shrimp, and salmon were cooked perfectly. Staff were friendly. Great place.

excerpts: the mixed grill - fresh and perfectly cooked fish - and Surf N Turf...
Meron even assisted with getting the meat out of the whole lobster!
For dessert we had the special - Creme brûlée and chocolate lava cake- absolutely delicious.
Thank you Meron and Fog Harbor for a delicious and memorable meal!!!
mixed grill.author: Sam R.
mixed grill.review: Found Fog Harbor on Yelp while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. We desired a great view, delicious food and expert service - in an intimate dining area away from the hustle and bustle... That is what we got! Our server Meron was personable and knowledgeable- it was a special night for us, so she brought flowers and a candle to our table. We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!), the mixed grill - fresh and perfectly cooked fish - and Surf N Turf... Meron even assisted with getting the meat out of the whole lobster! For dessert we had the special - Creme brûlée and chocolate lava cake- absolutely delicious. Thank you Meron and Fog Harbor for a delicious and memorable meal!!!

excerpts: For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!).
For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp.
Neither one disappointed us.
All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco.
Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.
mixed grill.author: Blanca A.
mixed grill.review: This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver, Rose. As soon as we stepped in we knew it was going to be a spectacular lunch. From the outside it doesn't seem like much. Once you step inside, you realize you're in for a beautiful view of Pier 39, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate. For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious. Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce. What's not to love? For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!). For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp. Neither one disappointed us. All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco. Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.

excerpts:
mixed grill
Best clam chowders-
you gotta try
Creme brûlée was excellent as well-
my son surprised me for my birthday
I recommend this restaurant, we keep coming here
mixed grill.author: Tendü Y.
mixed grill.review:
Delicious food, great view from almost every table
We enjoyed the crispy calamari, crab cake and shared mixed grill
Best clam chowders- you gotta try
Creme brûlée was excellent as well- my son surprised me for my birthday
I recommend this restaurant, we keep coming here

excerpts: I got the pacific sole and my husband got the mixed grill
and we both thought the food was tasty.
And the view overlooking the water beautiful.
Nice fancy little spot, definitely on the expensive side though.
mixed grill.author: MaryJane C.
mixed grill.review: Just had my cousin's bday dinner at Fog Harbor. We got the calamari for our appetizer and I really enjoyed it! I got the pacific sole and my husband got the mixed grill and we both thought the food was tasty. And the view overlooking the water beautiful. Nice fancy little spot, definitely on the expensive side though.

excerpts: one of the best clam chowders I had, great service and nice view,ordered mixed grill for entree and it was delicious , definitely will go back
mixed grill.author: Ali T.
mixed grill.review: one of the best clam chowders I had, great service and nice view,ordered mixed grill for entree and it was delicious , definitely will go back

excerpts: My mixed grill had salmon, swordfish, and a skewer of 3 shrimp.
Our son had the kids fish and chips, best battered fish we had ever tasted.
All the fish was well prepared, i was concerned about the swordfish
but it was not dry at all.
mixed grill.author: Lucien C.
mixed grill.review:
Had a real nice evening.  

We got seated right away with a table of 3 on a Friday night in June.   The waitress came quickly and explained the specials and offered drinks.  I had a beer a local hoppy variety and my wife had one of their signature lemondrop drinks(tart, sweet and strong with a sugared rim).  

We split a Caesar salad which was perfect for 2, the dressing was definitely homemade.  The leaves were split but not chopped.  They brought out very tasty sourdough bread with the salads and dinner.  

I ordered a clam chowder which never came, so i didn't get to try that. 

My wife enjoyed the Cod special and I had the mix grill.  Her special was a fillet of cod with chorizo and semi spicy sauce over white bean ragout , very tasty, we both enjoyed the meal.  My mixed grill had salmon, swordfish, and a skewer of 3 shrimp.  Our son had the kids fish and chips, best battered fish we had ever tasted.  All the fish was well prepared, i was concerned about the swordfish but it was not dry at all.  I also had a glass of house chardonay (they have different sizes and the staff tries to push the bigger more expensive one) which was light and complimented the flavors of the fish nicely.

Our son had the kids Sunday which was just a scoop of vanilla ice cream with magic shell on it but for .95 cents he loved it.  

We split the tiramisu, great size for 2 and tasted great not too sweet like some restaurants, light and creamy with a great taste on the soaked lady fingers.  

Dinner for 3 was about 150$ not bad for 3 with drinks.  Nice night except for the hitch of not getting the clam chowder.

excerpts: The mixed grill recommended by Diana, also working the bar, was off the charts..
We'd go back.
Thank you Marc and Diana for making our experience at your work place very enjoyable
mixed grill.author: Rachel T.
mixed grill.review:
I'm so glad we read the reviews.  For a place in a heavily touristy area,  i was very apprehensive about trying this place but the reviews don't disappoint.. the muscles were of the charts,  the fire shrimp app was overcooked,  but we brought it to the attention of the bartender, Marc, and he made it right,  brought us a whole new dish and it was amazing.  The mixed grill recommended by Diana, also working the bar, was off the charts.. 
We'd go back.  Thank you Marc and Diana for making our experience at your work place very enjoyable

excerpts: Had the mixed grill plate and the swordfish and salmon seem both mediocre at best.
The shrimp had good taste and flavor though.
Mashed potatoes had a good flavor when they were not doused in seashell flavor from the Lobster tail sitting in them.
Would be better off spending your money in other places over this overpriced establishment that serves mediocre seafood at high prices.
mixed grill.author: Daniel P.
mixed grill.review: The Lobster tail had a good taste and texture and the bread is amazing. That about ends the good though. Had the mixed grill plate and the swordfish and salmon seem both mediocre at best. The shrimp had good taste and flavor though. Mashed potatoes had a good flavor when they were not doused in seashell flavor from the Lobster tail sitting in them. Would be better off spending your money in other places over this overpriced establishment that serves mediocre seafood at high prices.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon salad and my husband ordered the mixed Grill plate that came with salmon, swordfish, shrimp, creamy potatoes and steamed brocolli...all very tasty.
Our waitress was great and was very attentive.
When we arrived we were told it would be 10 minute wait
and we were asked for our cell phone #.
They let you go shop and text you when your table is ready!
Pretty awesome!
mixed grill.author: Christy S.
mixed grill.review: Went here for lunch on a Monday after the Alcatraz tour.  What a wonderful place!  Every table has a view to the large windows looking out to Alcatraz. I ordered the popular Perfect Hibiscus Margarita that comes with a Cointreau lime foam.  Delicious!   I wanted a second but I wasn't sure if it was going to my head or I still had sea legs from the boat ride earlier!   The crispy calamari with fried jalapeños and onion pieces was very tasty.  I ordered the salmon salad and my husband ordered the mixed Grill plate that came with salmon, swordfish, shrimp, creamy potatoes and steamed brocolli...all very tasty.  Our waitress was great and was very attentive.  When we arrived we were told it would be 10 minute wait and we were asked for our cell phone #.  They let you go shop and text you when your table is ready!  Pretty awesome!

excerpts: got mixed grill and another plate
I dont remember its name
but it had shrimps, fish and scallops in red sauce soup which wad really gooood
mixed grill.author: Omar M.
mixed grill.review:
Been there yesterday
A great place to dine In. Very nice view and location
Food was amazing too. got mixed grill and another plate I dont remember its name but it had shrimps, fish and scallops in red sauce soup which wad really gooood

excerpts: We followed with main courses of scallops, mixed grill, and fish and chips.
All were superbly prepared and delicious.
Our server, Tyler, was top notch.
He was always available when we had any requests, and served with good humor.
We will definitely return any time we visit SF in the future.
mixed grill.author: Harry L.
mixed grill.review: We had dinner the evening of October 22nd. We started with the mussel fries  and calamari, both of which were superb. We followed with main courses of scallops, mixed grill, and fish and chips. All were superbly prepared and delicious. Our server, Tyler, was top notch. He was always available when we had any requests, and served with good humor. We will definitely return any time we visit SF in the future.

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Grill whuch was very tasty aswell.
Our appetizer was Calamari it was slightly overcooked
but it was good.
Rhe desserts were nicely presented,  if you go here you've got to order the Strawberry short cake.
Very moist and the cake was awesome.
I give this place two thumbs up.
mixed grill.author: Charles W.
mixed grill.review: The Seafood aelection was outstanding. My wife ordered the Salmon and she said it was perfectly cooked and it was moist. I ordered the Mixed Grill whuch was very tasty aswell. Our appetizer was Calamari it was slightly overcooked but it was good. Rhe desserts were nicely presented,  if you go here you've got to order the Strawberry short cake. Very moist and the cake was awesome. I give this place two thumbs up.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.
Both were delicious.
mixed grill.author: Anu S.
mixed grill.review:
Great food, great atmosphere.  I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.  Both were delicious.      We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.  The garlic mashed potatoes were good too.

The service was a little disorganized - food that wasn't ours was brought to our table, I got rice instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered, and we were asked twice if we wanted dessert instead of bringing us the bill which we asked for.

But all in all, a great experience.

excerpts: One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.
The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.
Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.
Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.
The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.
mixed grill.author: Calvin T.
mixed grill.review:
My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.

We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.

Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.

excerpts: Had the mixed grill and it was amazing.
Service from our server wasn't all there
but overall I would recommend this place.
mixed grill.author: Niema E.
mixed grill.review: Great food! Great atmosphere! Had the mixed grill and it was amazing. Service from our server wasn't all there but overall I would recommend this place.

excerpts: We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango.
Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake).
They were all delicious.
Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels.
Will definitely come back.
mixed grill.author: Nacine B.
mixed grill.review: Just ate here with my friends  for the first time over the weekend. Each  one of us ordered different item so we can try it. We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango. Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake). They were all delicious. Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a combo of excellently seasoned and cooked swordfish and salmon with a side of heavenly steamed broccoli, and rice with some juicy shrimps.
My brother ordered the Surf n Turf which was steak and lobster tail, it was equally as mouth watering as my dish.
