For dessert we got the Blondie which was one of most delicious desserts I've had!
With a moist chocolate chip cookie brownie and a scoop of ice cream it was to die for!
Service was wonderful and fast!
They even gave us complimentary clam chowder because of the wait for food.
I would definitely recommend this place!
mixed grill.author: Joleen T.
mixed grill.review: This is my favorite seafood joint in town! If you're looking for a nice restaurant to have lunch or dinner at, this is the place! It has a beautiful view of the bay. Food is a little pricy, but not too bad. It's definitely worth the price. I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a combo of excellently seasoned and cooked swordfish and salmon with a side of heavenly steamed broccoli, and rice with some juicy shrimps. My brother ordered the Surf n Turf which was steak and lobster tail, it was equally as mouth watering as my dish. For dessert we got the Blondie which was one of most delicious desserts I've had! With a moist chocolate chip cookie brownie and a scoop of ice cream it was to die for! Service was wonderful and fast! They even gave us complimentary clam chowder because of the wait for food. I would definitely recommend this place!

excerpts: The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had.
I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like
but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here.
I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back.
To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win!
I was not disappointed.
We had Madison as our server
and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift.
She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable.
It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling.
NOT
Madison
she was great.
mixed grill.author: Ed K.
mixed grill.review:
Good eats, not touristy eats... 
Delicious sourdough bread as a starter, ceviche was good, the clam chowder was delicious! The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had. I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here. I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back. To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win! I was not disappointed.  We had Madison as our server and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift. She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable. It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling. NOT Madison she was great.

excerpts: He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.
I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.
Khaiman recommended she get it
Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later.
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing.
We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.
This is
a definite must have and something I would get again.
Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.
It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.
The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.
All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.
I love garlic
so it was like
this dish was made for me.
Everything was fresh and cooked just right.
Price was fair considering what was included.
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.
The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering.
mixed grill.author: Chris B.
mixed grill.review:
My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.  
I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening.
We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.  
When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later. 
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.  
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.  
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish. 
We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.  
When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.  
I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be. 
We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.

excerpts: I ordered clam chowder, mixed grill, calamari and fish & chips.
mixed grill.author: Taelim K.
mixed grill.review: Awesome lunch. Should go n try clam chowder  Service was great n Khaiman was so nice. I ordered clam chowder, mixed grill, calamari and fish & chips.

excerpts: We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill.
Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate.
Don't waste your time and money going here.
The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it.
If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.
mixed grill.author: Sammie B.
mixed grill.review:
Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews, the menu and the proximity to our hotel. I never would have expected such poor service from a restaurant like this, especially one in a prime tourist location. A little background, we had reservations for Sunday at 4:00 PM. Here's a summary of our experience here after being seated:

-No one acknowledged us, no one as in any other waitstaff
-Another server had to take our order 10 min after being seated. He tells us out waiter didn't know he had the section we were in.
-Our waiter served a table that was seated after us and still don't stop by our table which was four feet directly across from their table
-We didn't get water after 20 minutes and that's after asking multiple times 
-Our waiter didn't acknowledge us for over 15 min, didn't say hello or apologize for the wait
-We had to ask for bread
-It took 50 min to get our food
-We had to flag down our waiter to get boxes and the check
-The general manager didn't even ask how everything was even though it was obvious we weren't happy and were looking all over the place for our waiter throughout our entire time there

I cannot stress how bad this dining experience was. How could a tourist restaurant be so poor in customer service? It should be the exact opposite in my opinion. I will not be returning here and will tell others to not go here. The food was mediocre. We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill. Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate. Don't waste your time and money going here. The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it. If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.

excerpts: Chowder, mixed grill were both great.
mixed grill.author: Jesse M.
mixed grill.review: I wasn't expecting anything great in such a touristy area, but everything was great.  Food, service, view.  Brought kids, and we all had a great dinner.  Chowder, mixed grill were both great.  And the mussel fries were evil.

excerpts: It was honestly amazing and then I had the mixed grill which was also great, along with a wonderful glass of sparking Pinot Noir.
The service was great and I had an overall wonderful experience!
mixed grill.author: Laura F.
mixed grill.review: Came here for dinner after graduation with no reservations so I was pleased that we were able to be seated within 15 minutes. It's true, the views are beautiful and the food is even better. We started off with the mouthwatering clam chowder. It was honestly amazing and then I had the mixed grill which was also great, along with a wonderful glass of sparking Pinot Noir. The service was great and I had an overall wonderful experience!

excerpts: Great food and an awesome view...the mixed grill was wonderful!
The only reason I didn't give a five star review was because our waitress was like a sad emo girl who hated life and her job...
Other than that, it was great!!!
mixed grill.author: David B.
mixed grill.review: Great food and an awesome view...the mixed grill was wonderful! The only reason I didn't give a five star review was because our waitress was like a sad emo girl who hated life and her job... Other than that, it was great!!!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good.
mixed grill.author: Floyd A.
mixed grill.review:
The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.

I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.

My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.

excerpts: We had as well the Mixed Grill which looks to be a little bit small but good!
And last but not least, the Clam Chowder in a Sourdough is priceless.
Service 3/5:
I never had perfect service at this place.
There's always something that goes wrong, misunderstanding or takes time to bring the receipts to cite a couple examples.
Too bad for a restaurant of that quality that the service isn't at that level as well.
mixed grill.author: Shay R.
mixed grill.review:
This is such a good restaurant at Pier 39. Prices are an average of $20 per Entrée but the food is really good.

Atmosphere 5/5: Great ambiance and cozy restaurant with fireplace and good seatings next to the bay area. They don't have any outside seating tho.
Food 5/5: Food is definitely great there. I tried the 1/4 Crab Languini that you can ask to be out of the shelf for an extra $4. We had as well the Mixed Grill which looks to be a little bit small but good! And last but not least, the Clam Chowder in a Sourdough is priceless.
Service 3/5: I never had perfect service at this place. There's always something that goes wrong, misunderstanding or takes time to bring the receipts to cite a couple examples. Too bad for a restaurant of that quality that the service isn't at that level as well.

excerpts: We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill.
The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye.
The taste was just not over the top.
Absolutely no
wow factor.
I also got the clam chowder.
Again the taste was good but not great.
If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service.
This is your place.
Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.
mixed grill.author: Gigi H.
mixed grill.review: Beautiful view of the harbor. The service was  professional and inviting. This trip the food was good but not out of the ordinary. We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill. The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye. The taste was just not over the top. Absolutely no wow factor. I also got the clam chowder. Again the taste was good but not great. If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service. This is your place. Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.

excerpts: Mixed Grill was great as well as the Fish and Chips-not too greasy!
Dessert was wonderful.
They have an interesting Chocolate Martini and a great Apple Crisp.
Though the food was great, the best part was the view of the bay.
Definitely try to get a window table.
Enjoy!
mixed grill.author: Keyaun H.
mixed grill.review: Very impressive! Scallops were good if you like them fried. Mixed Grill was great as well as the Fish and Chips-not too greasy! Dessert was wonderful. They have an interesting Chocolate Martini and a great Apple Crisp. Though the food was great, the best part was the view of the bay. Definitely try to get a window table. Enjoy!

excerpts: Delicious calimari, shrimp brochette and mixed grill
-  all fantastic.
Warning...
calimari is a huuuge portion.
Would have been 5 stars
but we had to keep asking for water refills (but it is California during a drought...)
mixed grill.author: Jill G.
mixed grill.review: Delicious calimari, shrimp brochette and mixed grill -  all fantastic.  Warning... calimari is a huuuge portion. Would have been 5 stars but we had to keep asking for water refills (but it is California during a drought...)

excerpts: The mixed grill and scallop are both the best you can have in the area.
mixed grill.author: Stan L.
mixed grill.review: Great view, amazing food. The mixed grill and scallop are both the best you can have in the area.

excerpts: Mixed Grill.
mixed grill.author: Mike M.
mixed grill.review: Mixed Grill. Sword fish, salmon and shrimp. Nice combination. Tasty. Very nice harbour view.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino.
I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and
The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there....
All in all, very delicious.
I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch...
It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.
mixed grill.author: Megan E.
mixed grill.review: Fog harbor was really really good, I'm reluctant to give a full 5 stars usually, especially to a touristy restaurant, but I really enjoyed this. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino. I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and their salmon..... Ohhhh their salmon, it was delicious!!!! I loved it! Side veggies and potatoes were just okay, but they're not the main focus anyway. The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there.... All in all, very delicious. I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch... It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.

excerpts: I had the mixed grill and it was nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection.
This was my second time coming here and much better than the first.
mixed grill.author: James M.
mixed grill.review: My suggestion is to sit at a table that is being served by Tyler. He addressed us quickly and very honest about the food choices. I had the mixed grill and it was nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection. This was my second time coming here and much better than the first.

excerpts: The clam chowder was great and the mixed grill had great salmon, swordfish and shrimp.
Our server Tyler took great care of us!!
mixed grill.author: Dustin J.
mixed grill.review: The clam chowder was great and the mixed grill had great salmon, swordfish and shrimp. Our server Tyler took great care of us!!

excerpts: My wife got the Alaskan Halibut and I got the mixed grill.
Both were great!
Atmosphere and views were amazing!
Instead of a dessert menu they bring out a desert tray for you to pick from.
Desserts on the menu tray are fake but that's not a big deal.
The only complaint I have was a hidden charge on the bull for $3.50.
Not exactly sure what t was for.
But altogether our experience was wonderful and I will definitely be recommending this place to friends!
mixed grill.author: Dustin C.
mixed grill.review: My wife and I went here for our 5th Anniversary. I made the reservation via Open Table and put in a special request to get a booth by the window. Without me following up they granted our request which was even more impressive since it was a busy night. The service was upbeat and prompt and the speed in which we got our food was even prompter. My wife got the Alaskan Halibut and I got the mixed grill. Both were great! Atmosphere and views were amazing! Instead of a dessert menu they bring out a desert tray for you to pick from. Desserts on the menu tray are fake but that's not a big deal. The only complaint I have was a hidden charge on the bull for $3.50. Not exactly sure what t was for. But altogether our experience was wonderful and I will definitely be recommending this place to friends!

excerpts: My group split the wedge salad, mixed grill, and seafood pasta.
We left stuffed to the rafters.
The table next to us got the bread pudding which looked so good
but I just couldn't fit any more food in my belly.
I recommend this place, for tourists anyway!
mixed grill.author: Brittany W.
mixed grill.review: Good food, great views, and quick service. Suuuuper touristy though and some very loud children. It's like a red lobster but with MUCH better food. My group split the wedge salad, mixed grill, and seafood pasta. We left stuffed to the rafters. The table next to us got the bread pudding which looked so good but I just couldn't fit any more food in my belly. I recommend this place, for tourists anyway!

excerpts: My son said the Mixed Grill was the best meal he's had this year, maybe ever.
The service was great and the food was awesome.
Our wait was less then 20 minutes at 2:00 PM on Saturday.
Totally satisfied.
mixed grill.author: Shawn M.
mixed grill.review: Our server, Madison, went the extra mile in making sure we had everything we wanted (including plenty of warm sourdough bread!). My son said the Mixed Grill was the best meal he's had this year, maybe ever. The service was great and the food was awesome. Our wait was less then 20 minutes at 2:00 PM on Saturday. Totally satisfied.

excerpts: Enjoyed the mixed grill, clam chowder, crab ceviche, and seafood cioppinos.
Don't know what's wrong, but service is getting sloppy.
mixed grill.author: Farrah N.
mixed grill.review:
This used to be my favorite restaurant on Pier 39 because of the view, food, and service. A trifecta!

However, my recent visit this weekend left me slightly disappointed due to the service. First, we were seated at a table too small for our party though we made reservations weeks in advance. The sun was glaring on our table and made us uncomfortable, so we ended up changing tables. However, once we changed tables, we ended up with a waitress that was extremely grumpy. Maybe she picked up an extra couple shifts? She was tired and lifeless and was not keen on interacting more with us than possible. There were plenty of servers and waiters around on a Sunday evening when only 30-40% of the restaurant was filled, yet our service was so slow. Our waters were too often completely empty. It was also a birthday as stated during our reservation, but we had to remind the waitress a couple times to get a candle... When the desserts came out, low and behold, candleless... and then the waitress brought out another dessert with a candle 20 minutes later. She then, charged us for the extra dessert and we had to ask her to take it off. Sloppy... and off... 

The food was quite good and well-priced, as usual and the view was nice, though slightly too sunny during sunset (they didnt lower their shades over the offending windows). Enjoyed the mixed grill, clam chowder, crab ceviche, and seafood cioppinos. Don't know what's wrong, but service is getting sloppy.

excerpts: I didn't think there was anything special about my mom's Mixed Grill she ordered but my Crab Roll Sandwhich
oh man, the bread was light, airy, and slightly crunchy around the edges with plenty of crab filling.
Our waiter was very nice when my mom thought she ordered a dish with mashed potatoes but instead received rice by giving her a side of mashed potatoes no questions asked.
It's wonderful!
Come here if you are ever in the area!
mixed grill.author: Lisa P.
mixed grill.review: This was my best meal in California yet. We were seated very quickly, granted it was 2pm but still, it was appreciated. We got a beautiful view of the water. They claimed to have the best clam chowder in San Francisco and boy, did they not disappoint! It was creamy and savory and oh so good. The fresh bread they gave us was also amazing. I also ordered a virgin pina colada which was just sweet enough to not be tart-- perfection. I didn't think there was anything special about my mom's Mixed Grill she ordered but my Crab Roll Sandwhich.... oh man, the bread was light, airy, and slightly crunchy around the edges with plenty of crab filling. Our waiter was very nice when my mom thought she ordered a dish with mashed potatoes but instead received rice by giving her a side of mashed potatoes no questions asked. It's wonderful! Come here if you are ever in the area!

excerpts: Main: $23 for a huge plate of mixed grill seafood (prawn skewer,
mixed grill.author: James L.
mixed grill.review:
Love this place. Visiting SF for the first time and found this on Yelp. 

Food was inexpensive and tasty. 

Starters: $16 place of two pieces of crab cake. Massive serving around 150g each. 

Main: $23 for a huge plate of mixed grill seafood (prawn skewer, a palm sized piece of grilled salmon, and a palm sized piece of sword fish, topped with brocolli and wild rice). 

Value for money! Highly recommended.

excerpts: For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns).
Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh.
All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky.
The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious.
mixed grill.author: Luke R.
mixed grill.review:
Looking for a restaurant in the Wharf that wasn't a total tourist trap, but would satisfy my lady's desire for seafood, I found Fog Harbor through Yelp. We weren't disappointed.

The food was excellent, and service was stellar throughout. Our waitress was attentive without being a hovering presence, and took care of everything from corkage (it's only $12; you might do well to bring your own bottle) to dessert recommendations (more on this later--holycarp). When we asked for more lemon, she brought a plate of six nicely arranged wedges. 

We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl, which we shared. It was, as others have noted, creamy, full of clams, and not too salty. Of course you must not only dip the small wedge-shaped bread top, but also eat as much of the bread bowl as you can handle without jeopardizing your ability to put away dessert. 

Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces. Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before. Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start. The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.

For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns). Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh. All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky. The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious. If I must pick a gripe, I'd take issue with the mixed vegetables--they were overcooked (to my taste; some of the zucchini strips were completely soggy) and unimaginative, though still a step up from the simply steamed carrot, cauliflower and broccoli you'd find at many common seafood joints. 

The dessert tray offered some interesting selections alongside a couple old standbys. In addition to the expected creme brulee and apple crisp, there was a pumpkin bread pudding, some kind of individually baked chocolate cake, and a pumpkin cheesecake. My girlfriend is currently obsessed with pumpkin to what's likely an unhealthy degree, so we got the cheesecake. Moreover, our waitress said it was to die for. She never lied--eating it was like biting into the spiced flesh of an angel, only sweeter and less sacrilegious.  

Two appetizers, two entrees, corkage fee and dessert came to just over $100. You can easily pay more for less in the heart of San Francisco's #1 tourist trap. If you're not on a budget, and you want to enjoy some well-prepared seafood with minimal frills and gimmicks, you might give Fog Harbor a try. We left thoroughly stuffed, and very happy.

PS: Parking is $7/hr in the nearby Pier 39 garage, but dinner will get you 2 hours free if you remember to validate (NB: I did not remember to validate).

excerpts: My dad ordered the Mixed Grill dish.
mixed grill.author: Beth G.
mixed grill.review:
Dude.  This place is legit.

I have a foodie family and we were on vacation when we tried out Fog Harbor.  Being a foodie family, we tried many excellent restaurants, but Fog Harbor was FAR AND AWAY the best meal of our vacation.  So so good.

We started with the grilled artichoke appetizer with the crab dip and it was... amazing.  Then our meals came out.  My dad ordered the Mixed Grill dish.  He said that everything on it was excellent but the salmon blew him away.  My mom had the fish and chips and it was a solid, well-done version of fish and chips.  My brother ordered the garlic crab which was outstanding... as was everything else on his plate (like the corn and potatoes).  I ordered one of the specials - a pesto halibut that was phenomenal.  Great flavors.

It was such a wonderful meal that we were nervous to get dessert, fearing that we might end on a clunker.  Our waitress assured us, though, that the desserts where worth trying and so we ordered the chocolate banana bread pudding.  The waitress was so right... that dessert was... INCREDIBLE.  It was so good, we were trying to figure out if we could go back there and get another one as an afternoon snack before we leave town.  

Oh, and the atmosphere is lovely, the view is pretty nice depending on where you sit, and the service was fantastic.

Seriously.  If you're on Pier 39... go here.  It is a divine blessing.

excerpts: yes yes hot bowl of clam chowder and friendly Waitress , what else could you ask for , best view , yup that too, prices were good for such a touristy spot and the food was good , mixed grill and halibut was our choice .until next time
mixed grill.author: NAEL K.
mixed grill.review: yes yes hot bowl of clam chowder and friendly Waitress , what else could you ask for , best view , yup that too, prices were good for such a touristy spot and the food was good , mixed grill and halibut was our choice .until next time

excerpts: I missed the clam chowder, but the Mixed Grill was not to be missed.
mixed grill.author: Sara K.
mixed grill.review: Went here with my husband for an early lunch.  The food was very good and the wait staff was friendly.  Nice sized portions for the meals.  Sorry I missed the clam chowder, but the Mixed Grill was not to be missed.

excerpts: I had the baked scallops appetizer and the mixed grill seafood dish, plus I sneaked a taste of my friend's clam chowder.
The food is amazing!
The staff was very pleasant and our waiter was exceptionally friendly and attentive.
I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House in San Francisco!
mixed grill.author: Loni B.
mixed grill.review: I have tried the seafood in several restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco and this is the best so far! I had the baked scallops appetizer and the mixed grill seafood dish, plus I sneaked a taste of my friend's clam chowder. The food is amazing! The staff was very pleasant and our waiter was exceptionally friendly and attentive. I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House in San Francisco!

excerpts: Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!
mixed grill.author: Victor G.
mixed grill.review: This place is awesome! Great view, it's worth every minute that you have to wait for a seat near the window. Great service, very friendly. Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!

excerpts: We loved the clam chowder, I ordered the Mixed Grill plate, and darned if I remember what my date ordered, but I know he cleaned his plate!
Five stars for sure!
mixed grill.author: Celeste S.
mixed grill.review: Lovely server Madison charmed her way into our hearts just about instantly!  Charm, grace, wit, humor and maturity beyond her years created a stellar experience for us last Saturday night at this most dreamy of ocean view restaurants!  The view of the boats and sparkling lights on the water was mesmerizing.  A window seat on the water front, a full moon night, a first date!  What more could a girl ask for?  Granted, I am not let out of my cage that often, but this was a truly magical dining experience.   As my date and I basically took out a rental on the table we occupied for the greater part of the evening, I would say that our server went above & beyond the call of duty in catering to all our whims and needs.  Oh yes, and the food was delicious!  We loved the clam chowder, I ordered the Mixed Grill plate, and darned if I remember what my date ordered, but I know he cleaned his plate!  Five stars for sure!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.
It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco.
Waitress was very nice.
Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.
mixed grill.author: Nick L.
mixed grill.review: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp. It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco. Waitress was very nice. Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.

excerpts: I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful.
mixed grill.author: Winnie T.
mixed grill.review:
I came here per the suggestion of my roommate who works as a hostess there because she always would recap to me all the delicious food she ate that day with eyes wide and everything, so I finally got the chance to  try it.

First off, let me just say the ambiance of the place is very...ritzy. The restaurant itself is beautiful--definitely a place to wine and dine someone special with a beautiful view of the bay (*hint hint* guys!). The servers are friendly and attentive, and they made sure my water glass was never left empty.

I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco. They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab. The ahi tuna was okay--I didn't really care for the seared tuna; it was a little dry but the sesame poke with the wonton chips was delicious to snack on. 

I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful. I didn't care too much for the prawns though.

Finally, I had the lava cake for dessert, and this is where the 5 star acclaim comes from. The chocolate lava cake was the BEST cake I have ever had. Drizzeled with a heap of warm gooey fudge and served with vanilla ice cream, each bite was a taste of what heaven should taste like. They could have served me dirt for the main course and this cake for dessert and I probably would have still been happy. 

All in all, this restaurant was a pleasant dining experience. The prices are a bit steep but a seafood restaurant at the wharf with a view overlooking the bay will cost you a shiny penny.

excerpts: Had the mixed grill for mains and again, it was flawless.
Wish seafood was this price in Australia!
mixed grill.author: Steve M.
mixed grill.review: Being a lover of seafood this place is a must. Fantastic picturesque location with great service and food. I had clam chowder for the first time ever and it was amazing.  Also had the panko crumbed scallops and was amazed by the serving size and quality.  Had the mixed grill for mains and again, it was flawless.  Wish seafood was this price in Australia!

excerpts: I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp.
All perfectly cooked!
mixed grill.author: Kari D.
mixed grill.review:
MMMmmmm! I loved my dinner. I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp. All perfectly cooked! I ate every bit. 

Great view, and good wine. The clam chowder was not good...I got a mouthful of sand. Also, expected to pay more for five people, that was a pleasant surprise!!

excerpts: My boyfriend got the mixed grill, which was incredible, and I got the garlic crab.
Overall, I had a great experience!
mixed grill.author: Morgan D.
mixed grill.review: This was my first time in SF and I wanted to have one dinner by the water and really go for it with the seafood.  This place did not disappoint!  The service was fantastic, and we were seated right by the water.  I was able to look at the seals and get a great view of Alcatraz.  The food was wonderful, and drinks were affordable.  My boyfriend got the mixed grill, which was incredible, and I got the garlic crab.  Overall, I had a great experience!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill & I recommend that if you can't make up your mind what kind of fish to have.
Very friendly & professional staff.
The sourdough bread is fresh and warm.
mixed grill.author: Linda H.
mixed grill.review: The fish and vegetables are cooked perfectly!  I had the mixed grill & I recommend that if you can't make up your mind what kind of fish to have.  Very friendly & professional staff.  The sourdough bread is fresh and warm.

excerpts:
Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab,
Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp..
Wife had Salmon.
Salmon was not overdone and dry.
Drinks?
Same.
I liked the place so much
, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees.
mixed grill.author: Azuresees n.
mixed grill.review:
Dec 29, 2012 9PM. Wife & I were served by Amelia. Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab,
Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp.. Wife had Salmon.

Place was packed. Service was spot-on. Server Amelia was on us immediately. We ordered the 1/2 crab appetizer. It was on our table in 4 minutes and hot.

Dinner was the same. FAST, complete and hot.  Salmon was not overdone and dry. Drinks? Same. I liked the place so much, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees. Manager Nusan was dressed professionally, and polite to us. 

Wife used to work there when it was Chick's Place back in the day. She loved seeing  the place again. 

To qualify my opinion, I am ususally very picky on my kudos for eateries. This place deserved a 5.

excerpts: My mom had the seafood mixed grill and I had the steak
and we both enjoyed the sourdough bread.
The food was seasoned well and the portions were decent but not mega large.
Fortunately, we didn't have to wait for a table and the views of the bay/Pier 39 were enjoyable.
mixed grill.author: Latrice R.
mixed grill.review: The decor was nice, but the quality of the food was very impressive.  My mom had the seafood mixed grill and I had the steak and we both enjoyed the sourdough bread.  The food was seasoned well and the portions were decent but not mega large.  Fortunately, we didn't have to wait for a table and the views of the bay/Pier 39 were enjoyable.

excerpts: My entree was delicious: mixed grill.
mixed grill.author: Leslie K.
mixed grill.review: Good service, excellent Seafood. Make your reservation here to save time. We got an amuse buche for reserving online. We had scallops on the half shell (probably not worth the money, but still good). My entree was delicious: mixed grill. Swordfish, salmon and shrimp all cooked to perfection. Delicious asparagus side and garlic mashed potatoes that were strictly okay. Fresh, homemade sourdough on your table is warm and soft and crusty and delicious. I also had their yummy tiramisu, apple crisp, and a skinny coconut ginger cocktail, all delicious!

excerpts: I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.
Both were very good.
The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.
All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.
mixed grill.author: Ileen G.
mixed grill.review: Went here for dinner after a disappointing trip to the Aquarium.  This place did not disappoint.  Ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  My husband had the crispy bay scallops for an appetizer and they were even better.  Both dishes were very ample servings and in retrospect would have been better to order just one and share.  I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.  Both were very good.  The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.  All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.

excerpts: Can't say I would recommend the mixed grill ($26) either as everything was over-cooked.
We shared the tiramisu ($8.50 and the dessert duo ($14) along with cappucino ($4).
mixed grill.author: Scilla M.
mixed grill.review: Started out with calamari ($12), clam chowder ($6) and the blue cheese bread ($8).  All was great.  Two of my colleagues added crab meat (an EXTRA $6 each!) to their soup.  The guys all chose cioppino ($32 each) with pasta (an extra $2 each).  It was a large portion chuck full of clams, mussels, shrimp, and crab.  There was plenty of yummy sauce to sop up with bread.  I had the whole garlic crab ($41) and I was VERY DISAPPOINTED.  I was expecting a succulent crab dripping in garlicy butter, but instead got a very dry, over-cooked crab with almost no flavor.  Can't say I would recommend the mixed grill ($26) either as everything was over-cooked. We shared the tiramisu ($8.50 and the dessert duo ($14) along with cappucino ($4).  Bottom line - view is great, drinks were great, have the cioppino!  BTW, we sat at the bar and had a drink before dinner and the service AND the drinks were great.  Good bartender!  The service at the table was very good as well - just need someone to pay attention to the reviews on the overcooked crab!

excerpts: My wife got the mixed grill fish.
The sauce was nothing like what the menu described - it was just missing.
The fish was over cooked and dry.
mixed grill.author: Timothy L.
mixed grill.review: Unfortunately Fog Harbor Fish House was a bit of a let down for us. We had a special crab ceviche appetizer which was okay. I think the problem with crab and acidity though is that the crab flavor just gets completely hidden. Entrees were not great. My wife got the mixed grill fish. The sauce was nothing like what the menu described - it was just missing. The fish was over cooked and dry. I had the seafood cioppino. The sauce tasted like canned plum tomatoes boiled briefly with some dried herbs and was over salted. The seafood was end piece leftovers. The only reason for the second star is service. Our waiter was great. I just wished he had asked us not to order!

excerpts: I had the mixed grill and my husband had a red clam based pasta dinner.
Both were delicious.
The place is beautiful and we had a really nice table.
The service was fantastic.
I would definately go back there
and I highly recommend it.
mixed grill.author: Kas B.
mixed grill.review: Had a great dinner here in November.  I had the mixed grill and my husband had a red clam based pasta dinner.  Both were delicious.  The place is beautiful and we had a really nice table.  The service was fantastic.  I would definately go back there and I highly recommend it.

excerpts: Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.
For a "tourist trap
" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.
Check it out!
mixed grill.author: Chris B.
mixed grill.review: Overall very pleased with my experience.  Went on a Tuesday at 5:30 PM, no wait with good seats and a nice view of the bay. Staff was very pleasant and accomodating.  Started with clam chowder which was decent but had a little sand in some spoonfuls.  Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.  For a "tourist trap" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.  Check it out!

excerpts: My 83 year old mom and 91 year old Father-in-Law loved their mixed grill seafood dish.
The only minor improvement is the asparagus needs to be a bit more crunchy (i.e. not too soft).
The desserts are awesome (we had the creame brulee and Tiramisu).
I also think their price is quite reasonable given the quality of their food, service, and location - I hope it stays that way.
This place has a great staff who are really attentive to their customers.
A special shout-out to our wait staff, Veronica, and the front desk hostess team (especially Ashley who helped me with the reservation)!
Any owner or business can only dream to have this excellent team!
Dined on 5/10/2013.
mixed grill.author: Roland L.
mixed grill.review: I made a reservation for a pre-mother's day dinner on a Friday evening.  I am local to SF Bay Area, and I am usually unusure about seafood restaurants located on a touristy spot like Pier 39.  I read the Yelp reviews, and I am glad we went.  This restaurant is excellent - from the courteous/helpful team that answers their phone reservation, the food, their wait staff, and chefs.  The view is fantastic with Alcatraz and the East Bay right across.  They even provide you with a free 2-hr parking on the Pier 39 Garage!   The food - everything is good.  Their fish is cooked properly so that it is still juicy.  My daughter had the Filet Mignon, and she said it was excellent and properly cooked.  My 83 year old mom and 91 year old Father-in-Law loved their mixed grill seafood dish.  The only minor improvement is the asparagus needs to be a bit more crunchy (i.e. not too soft).   The desserts are awesome (we had the creame brulee and Tiramisu).   I also think their price is quite reasonable given the quality of their food, service, and location - I hope it stays that way.  This place has a great staff who are really attentive to their customers.   A special shout-out to our wait staff, Veronica, and the front desk hostess team (especially Ashley who helped me with the reservation)!   Any owner or business can only dream to have this excellent team!  Dined on 5/10/2013.

excerpts: Last trip, I had the mixed grill and again no disappointments in the food.
However, I have to agree there are some service issues with this place.
I've eaten at the bar a couple times and usually pretty good service considering the bartender is doing a lot of other things besides the food.
Took a guest to Fog Harbor last Saturday and we were seated in the restaurant portion.
Probably 10-15 mins.
before anyone came and asked if we had been helped.
Then when our waiter took our order, he failed to ask if we wanted anything to drink besides the water that finally showed up, so he lost a sale on that.
Then after he took our order, we never saw him for another 10-15 minutes.
A long time between the chowder and the main meal.
Never brought us the famous sourdough bread he promised.
The food again - very good - recommend eating at the bar if you go.
mixed grill.author: Steve A.
mixed grill.review: I've been here a few times since moving to the Bay Area.  The food always is very good here.  The Clam Chowder is really tasty.  Last trip, I had the mixed grill and again no disappointments in the food.  However, I have to agree there are some service issues with this place.  I've eaten at the bar a couple times and usually pretty good service considering the bartender is doing a lot of other things besides the food.  Took a guest to Fog Harbor last Saturday and we were seated in the restaurant portion.  Probably 10-15 mins. before anyone came and asked if we had been helped.  Then when our waiter took our order, he failed to ask if we wanted anything to drink besides the water that finally showed up, so he lost a sale on that.  Then after he took our order, we never saw him for another 10-15 minutes.  A long time between the chowder and the main meal.  Never brought us the famous sourdough bread he promised.  The food again - very good - recommend eating at the bar if you go.

excerpts: For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.
The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.
I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.
Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.
mixed grill.author: Zainab T.
mixed grill.review: So we went to this place when we were visiting SFO last week.  My husband was in a mood for a "broiled seafood" type of dish and since they had something similar we decided to go here.  We ordered the calamari for appetizers-not good and I would not recommend it at all.  It was "soaked" in oil and we started feeling sick after the first bite.  We asked the waiter if we could order something else and got the "Red Chilli Prawn" instead.  It was an appetizer with a lot of gravy-it was tasty though.  For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.  The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.  I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.  Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.

excerpts: My dear lobster tails were incredibly sweet and not over cooked.
lobster tails.author: Zizzle f.
lobster tails.review:
Hey, sometimes you just want the classics (For which 4 Star is the highest rating 
 - unless you invented chowder in 1673)...Ahem, For spot on Seafood classics with all the ambiance of a classic San Francisco establishment, Fog Harbor delivers!

Really good crab cakes (balanced by a bright mango roasted red pepper/arugula salad). Cleaned, picked, immaculately chilled U grade prawns. Smackin clam and bacon loaded chowder (celery/parsley notes). Wedge with lots of bacon and veiny blue, nice bright heirlooms.

My dear lobster tails were incredibly sweet and not over cooked. My guest had the cod which was a highlight dish - perfect sear and to-die-for white bean 'cassoulet' (really the best dish of the evening).

Desert was an over the top blondie topped with Carmel sauce and vanilla ice cream (whip, Carmel cookie crumble, walnut, mint leaf). It was good, rich as hell, but not great.

The wine selection expensive but expansive. Service was good (and I know how hard they are working). Dinner was overall amazing; just the classics, respected and not pretentious. Yeah so what I'm local. Born and raised, and we really enjoyed sneaking into a 'touristy' place that doesn't get so many locals. GM was on his toes seating guests, hustling! You'd be hard pressed to find a better fish dish then the cod, anywhere. Fog harbor is my new favorite fish house in the bay!

excerpts: Some of us decided to order the shellfish platter (good for 3 people) + 3 lobster tails.
I thought it wouldn't be enough for me, so I ended up ordering the crab Louie salad as well.
OMG, when the food came out, I was overwhelmed.
The shellfish platter and my salad was huge!
Everything tasted so good though.
Shellfish platter was cooked with butter and tons of garlic.
Seafood was fresh and it was worth the price we paid.
Definitely coming back and ordering maybe just the shellfish platter next time.
lobster tails.author: Kristel V.
lobster tails.review:
If you want fresh seafood, you better come here! Was here for a weekend with friends and since we were in SF, we wanted seafood! We were seated by the window and had a nice view of the bay. Some of us decided to order the shellfish platter (good for 3 people) + 3 lobster tails. I thought it wouldn't be enough for me, so I ended up ordering the crab Louie salad as well. OMG, when the food came out, I was overwhelmed. The shellfish platter and my salad was huge! Everything tasted so good though. Shellfish platter was cooked with butter and tons of garlic. Seafood was fresh and it was worth the price we paid. Definitely coming back and ordering maybe just the shellfish platter next time. 

Our waiter was as very nice as well. Will be back!

excerpts: We ordered the crab chicken cocktail and the lobster tails.
The crab had no flavor and the lobster tasted like it had been microwaved.
I am not sure if I would come back unless it was for a work party or something.
lobster tails.author: Elizabeth G.
lobster tails.review: Disappointing experience. Positives: friendly bartender, friendly waitress, great view, clean and spacious. These things are what earned 2 stars. The other 3 were lost due to the attitude of the hostesses and the poor quality of the food. We ordered the crab chicken cocktail and the lobster tails. The crab had no flavor and the lobster tasted like it had been microwaved. I am not sure if I would come back unless it was for a work party or something.

excerpts: As Suggested we had the Platter for 2 and added 2 Lobster tails.
Guest got Mix Grill and Ahi ...
It;s
a Must for My guest to Try their Famous Chowder...
lobster tails.author: Elain C.
lobster tails.review:
Our Second time to visit this Great Restaurant..It's Located on the Second Level of Pier 39...

Coming Here with Friends from Outside California is a great Treat. After showing them the Famous Fisherman's Wharf, SeaLions and Alcatraz. 

We Make it a point that this would be the Last Stop of our Tour of Pier 39.

 We sat exactly on the Same round table by the Entrance. My Family and 2 guest were delighted to have Bernie (Same Server as my Son Vividly Remembers him)

As Suggested we had the Platter for 2 and added 2 Lobster tails. Guest got Mix Grill and Ahi ...It;s a Must for My guest to Try their Famous Chowder...They Loved it...

Service was impeccable from the Host to Bernie's Constant attendening to what my guest needs...Clean Bathroom..

I'd Surely would come back in this restaurant if I have Guest ...

excerpts: Tried their lobster tails, clams, shrimp ...
lobster tails.author: Kai L.
lobster tails.review: Packed out on Sunday but fortunately had nice water view seats! You can ask server to borrow portable charger if you need to juice up your phone.  Tried their lobster tails, clams, shrimp ...

excerpts: I had the lobster tails and if I ever had the heart to spend $49 on one meal again, I'd definitely reorder.
Had the apple crumble for dessert, it was on point!
Came with my family and we ended up spending a bit more than $300 total, but it was $300 well spent.
lobster tails.author: Jackie Q.
lobster tails.review:
Loved my experience here! Everything was fantastic, the restaurant has an upscale feel, and the wait wasn't too bad (cuz good luck trying to get a same-day reservation). 
Our waiter was sassy, but professional, and honestly the only complaint I have was the fact that the oysters were extremely small and had a rather dull taste. I had the lobster tails and if I ever had the heart to spend $49 on one meal again, I'd definitely reorder. Had the apple crumble for dessert, it was on point! Came with my family and we ended up spending a bit more than $300 total, but it was $300 well spent. I'd definitely recommend for seafood lovers, but just a tip don't get the oysters... they are rather unappealing.

excerpts: We had clam chowder and the shellfish platter for two with lobster tails.
After taxes and tip we spent aout 200$.
It is unfortunate and unacceptable to get sick at a restaurant as expensive and well established as this.
I have reached out to the establishment regarding my experience.
lobster tails.author: Danielle M.
lobster tails.review: Unfortunately this 1 star review is due to the fact that I got violently sick, after eating here last night. We had clam chowder and the shellfish platter for two with lobster tails. After taxes and tip we spent aout 200$. It is unfortunate and unacceptable to get sick at a restaurant as expensive and well established as this. I have reached out to the establishment regarding my experience.

excerpts: The main courses I ordered were the lobster tails on our first visit, and the scallop and crab risotto the second visit.
lobster tails.author: Adrian A.
lobster tails.review:
After a second visit today, Fog Harbor Fish House is now firmly on my list of seafood restaurants to go to when in SF. Its location on Pier 39 might initially be a turn-off if you are really just trying to scratch a seafood itch and don't relish the idea of wading through all the tourists milling around the shops. However, the food is worth it. Luckily enough, the restaurant is located on the second floor of one of the buildings closest to curbside, so not much wading is involved. 

I would describe the interior of the restaurant as "modern". The seating options are a mix of booths and standard tables, as well as space at the bar, which I think was for walk-ins. Large windows facing the moorings for the Blue & Gold tour boats lets lots of light in during the day and makes for a nice view from the window tables.

The menu is definitely geared towards seafood aficionados, though there are some non-seafood choices. As I understand it, Fog Harbor is part of the Simmons Family Restaurants group, which has several types of seafood restaurants in and around Pier 39. One thing to bear in mind is that this is the more "proper" of the group's restaurants, and is pricier as a result. 

You will be hard pressed to find better seafood for the price though. On both of our visits here, we ordered the cioppino (seafood stew), the clam chowder, and the bay scallops. The seafood is all fresh, tasty, and generously portioned. The main courses I ordered were the lobster tails on our first visit, and the scallop and crab risotto the second visit. Both dishes were phenomenal.

One thing worth mentioning is that the servers we got both times were very attentive and friendly. Our second visit was actually for a birthday lunch, which I made a note of on my reservation, and our server (Kayla) gave us a dessert on the house, complete with a candle in it! It was the tiramisu, which is definitely worth saving space for. 

In short, I am already looking forward to my next visit to Fog Harbor!

excerpts: For myself, I splurged on lobster tails and crab cakes to share.
lobster tails.author: Iris R.
lobster tails.review:
I made the conscious decision to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House with my kids in our first visit to San Francisco. There was no line but the place had lots of diners. Although we weren't given the window table, it was still a very nice experience to be guided to your table by affable attendants. My kids ordered their salmon children's meal and they had a great time waiting for their meal because of the crayons and the coloring papers. For myself, I splurged on lobster tails and crab cakes to share. I had Anchor beer to wash it down. 

The lobster was fresh and just juicy. It was yummy! And the crab cakes! The kids really enjoyed their salmon and they said that it was the best they ever had! 

We didnt wait that long for the food and we also didnt dally long inside the restaurant. It was a splurge worth having!

excerpts: The lobster tails were meaty not tiny little tails.
The bread was to die for and the service was impeccable.
I will say the lady in the front shirt with black hair was not all that nice
but i can understand dealing with tourist all day can be tough!
10/10 will come back next year!
Keep up the good work!
lobster tails.author: James M.
lobster tails.review: Best fish restaurant on Pier 39! The Ahi was to die for! The lobster tails were meaty not tiny little tails. The bread was to die for and the service was impeccable. I will say the lady in the front shirt with black hair was not all that nice but i can understand dealing with tourist all day can be tough! 10/10 will come back next year! Keep up the good work!

excerpts: For my entree, I ordered the lobster tails which came with broccoli and mashed potatoes.
Lobster tail was perfect and the mashed potatoes were creamy.
Service was great.
Our waitress was friendly and attentive.
I would recommend this place for a great view of the bay & Alcatraz.
lobster tails.author: Brittany M.
lobster tails.review: This place is yummy! Ordered a bowl of clam chowder and it was prob the best I've ever had. I also had the mussels fries and the fries are crisp! Mussels are fresh, too. For my entree, I ordered the lobster tails which came with broccoli and mashed potatoes. Lobster tail was perfect and the mashed potatoes were creamy.  Service was great.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place for a great view of the bay & Alcatraz.

excerpts: and I each got the 2 lobster tails.
lobster tails.author: Becca S.
lobster tails.review:
Amazing seafood spot! My dad was visiting my my fiancé and I from Hawai'i (he knows seafood). Our server Alex I believe, was awesome and very helpful when it came down to deciding on what the heck we were going to get. He recommend the seafood platter, which has mussels, clams, crab and shrimp. 

My fiancé got the shareable size for him and I. My dad and I each got the 2 lobster tails. My fiancé and I split my dish and the platter and it was sooooo much food! 

The shareable seafood platter is honestly good enough to share between 3 people. If you get some appetizers and with all the bread they give you it's definitely a good way to all get down and chow down. 

The view is amazing and I will definitely be back again!

excerpts:
shrimp
Cocktail, 2/5
Crab cocktail 4/5
Dinner: 2 lobster tails (x2) 1/5.
The lobster was either old and soggy or undercooked.
Absolutely unacceptable.
Mixed
grill- 3/5- this meal was average.
If the mashed potatoes were executed better
I'd have been ok with the meal.
Dungenous crab ravioli
this was the best thing we ordered
Burger-
3/5- execution on special requests weren't met (bacon on side not in burger, mayo requested not served) kind of dry but decent quality meat.
Dessert:   Blondie- highlight of the night, very rich.
lobster tails.author: P M.
lobster tails.review:
One star for ambiance, one star for location.   Service was good but not great.   Food was mediocre.  More than a couple dishes were dirty.
Drinks:  cognac neat, seemed like way less than a shot, more like .75 of an ounce
Starters: shrimp
Cocktail, 2/5
Crab cocktail 4/5
Dinner: 2 lobster tails (x2) 1/5.  The lobster was either old and soggy or undercooked.   Absolutely unacceptable.
Mixed grill- 3/5- this meal was average.  If the mashed potatoes were executed better I'd have been ok with the meal.
Dungenous crab ravioli 4/5- this was the best thing we ordered
Burger- 3/5- execution on special requests weren't met (bacon on side not in burger, mayo requested not served) kind of dry but decent quality meat.
Dessert:   Blondie- highlight of the night, very rich.

excerpts: my kids had lobster tails and garlic roasted whole crab.
My wife had penne chicken
and I had combo grill.
Super tasty and server was very polite and professional.
We will be back for sure.
lobster tails.author: George B.
lobster tails.review:
Excellent service and food. my kids had lobster tails and garlic roasted whole crab. My wife had penne chicken and I had combo grill. Super tasty and server was very polite and professional.
We will be back for sure.

excerpts: Had the 2 5-6oz lobster tails and the wife had the fried combo(calamari, octopi, fish and shrimp) with fries.
The lobster was good but tough on top with garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed squash.
Over all it was a good dish.
Wife's plate was meh.
Fish was gross.
Calamari and octopus was good and shrimp was ok.
The star on that dish was the fench fries sad enough.
Came out to $70.
Meh
lobster tails.author: Aaron E.
lobster tails.review: Had the 2 5-6oz lobster tails and the wife had the fried combo(calamari, octopi, fish and shrimp) with fries. The lobster was good but tough on top with garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed squash. Over all it was a good dish. Wife's plate was meh. Fish was gross. Calamari and octopus was good and shrimp was ok. The star on that dish was the fench fries sad enough. Came out to $70. Meh

excerpts: We started with the fried calamari which was fantastic and got the lobster tails and shellfiah platter.
Food, service, and atmosphere was on point.
Definitely coming here again
lobster tails.author: Tim P.
lobster tails.review: Food here was great and very reasomably priced for how much food we got. Our waiter Justin got us started off quick and we loved the friendly service tonight. We started with the fried calamari which was fantastic and got the lobster tails and shellfiah platter. Food, service, and atmosphere was on point. Definitely coming here again

excerpts: Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.
Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.
The service is friendly and efficient, too!
lobster tails.author: F H.
lobster tails.review: We ordered the half dozen oysters and clam chowder for appetizers- excellent.  Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.  Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.  The service is friendly and efficient, too!

excerpts: I ordered the lobster tails, chowder and a cocktail.
Waited nearly an hour for my entree, which was cold and bland when it arrived.
Had to ask for water twice before he brought it.
Noticed that the girls at the table next to us were served quickly and he spent a good deal.of time chatting with them and encouraging them to rate his service.
Not sure if they did, but I sure am!
Justin, as a former waitress I left you a bad tip, it takes a lot to get a bad tip from me.
Hope you learn quickly before you run off more customers like me, a bit older with money to spend.
When I told you my food was cold
you said sorry, took the plate away and that was it.
When we were waiting nearly an hour for our food, you never once came to try table to reassure us that it was on the way.
I won't be back.
lobster tails.author: Donna G.
lobster tails.review: Disappointed! Ate here last night. Server Justin said he was new to the restaurant so perhaps that explains the slow service and cold food. I ordered the lobster tails, chowder and a cocktail. Waited nearly an hour for my entree, which was cold and bland when it arrived. Had to ask for water twice before he brought it. Noticed that the girls at the table next to us were served quickly and he spent a good deal.of time chatting with them and encouraging them to rate his service. Not sure if they did, but I sure am! Justin, as a former waitress I left you a bad tip, it takes a lot to get a bad tip from me. Hope you learn quickly before you run off more customers like me, a bit older with money to spend. When I told you my food was cold you said sorry, took the plate away and that was it. When we were waiting nearly an hour for our food, you never once came to try table to reassure us that it was on the way. I won't be back.

excerpts: We had the lobster tails and they were fantastic.
Best of all was our server Tyler who left us wanting for nothing.
He was consistently at our table filling drinks and getting us whatever we needed.
I almost felt like we at a fast food place because the order came back so quickly.
Be sure to ask for Tyler if you go!
lobster tails.author: Sean L.
lobster tails.review: Just finished a great Dinner at Fog Harbor.  We had the lobster tails and they were fantastic.  Best of all was our server Tyler who left us wanting for nothing.  He was consistently at our table filling drinks and getting us whatever we needed.  I almost felt like we at a fast food place because the order came back so quickly.  Be sure to ask for Tyler if you go!

excerpts: We had the spicy shrimp appetizer, the grill mix, and the lobster tails.
I have never had such well cooked seafood.
The whole experience was awesome and made one of the top things we did while in CA.
Thanks!
lobster tails.author: Mr B.
lobster tails.review: Amazing food and service. The sour dough bread was fresh, hot, and the best I have ever had. We had the spicy shrimp appetizer, the grill mix, and the lobster tails. I have never had such well cooked seafood. The whole experience was awesome and made one of the top things we did while in CA. Thanks!

excerpts: Others had steam clams, lobster tails, and crab all was well worth the wait.
Was told 30-40 minute wait was only about 20 minutes not bad for Saturday night
lobster tails.author: Donna L.
lobster tails.review: Had the crab ravioli was very good amazing view. Others had steam clams, lobster tails, and crab all was well worth the wait. Was told 30-40 minute wait was only about 20 minutes not bad for Saturday night

excerpts: We ordered crab cakes, dozen oysters, ciopinni with pasta, seafood platter for 2 with 3 lobster tails.
The hospitality here does not match the price.
We selected this restaurant because it was suppose to have a nice view and ambiance.
We spent about $300 for 3.
I recommend spending your money where they appreciate your business.
lobster tails.author: Joseph L.
lobster tails.review: Reserved for dinner about a month in advance for a special occasion for 3. I requested for a less busier window seating upon arrival. Host had a bad attitude and told us to wait until she calls us. We should have walked away then. Host sat us by the bar and very close to entrance of the building. We saw many tables available inside the room so we asked the host for another table further inside with less distractions. When we politely flagged the host as she passed by to request for another table, she spoke to us in a condescending manner and told us to figure it out with the server.  Their solution to our request was to move our table to a booth about 3 feet away. Another chance to just walk out but I didn't want to spoil the occasion. We ordered crab cakes, dozen oysters, ciopinni with pasta, seafood platter for 2 with 3 lobster tails. The hospitality here does not match the price. We selected this restaurant because it was suppose to have a nice view and ambiance. We spent about $300 for 3. I recommend spending your money where they appreciate your business.

excerpts: We ordered 2 lobster tails ($38), a garlic roasted whole dungeon crab, fried combo and clam chowder.
The lobster tails were ok.
The crab was particularly dissapointed.
It was $41 and it was a tiny blue-crab sized crab.
The meat was super dry.
If you must eat crab at Pier 39, go to nearby Crab House for a full sized dungeon crab for less.
The fried combo was great.
We all like it.
The clam chowder is advertised as "award winning" on the menu but honestly nothing special.
For $226, I expect better food.
All in all, I will not come back unless someone pays for it.
lobster tails.author: Au N.
lobster tails.review: It's overpriced and touristy but an essential SF experience. The setting is really nice with great view of the harbor. We came here on Saturday. It was packed but the service was fast.  We ordered 2 lobster tails ($38), a garlic roasted whole dungeon crab, fried combo and clam chowder. The lobster tails were ok. The crab was particularly dissapointed. It was $41 and it was a tiny blue-crab sized crab. The meat was super dry. If you must eat crab at Pier 39, go to nearby Crab House for a full sized dungeon crab for less. The fried combo was great. We all like it. The clam chowder is advertised as "award winning" on the menu but honestly nothing special. For $226, I expect better food. All in all, I will not come back unless someone pays for it.

excerpts: I ordered 2 lobster tails that came with fries.
My boyfriend got the sampler plate with clams, crab, and another seafood
I can't remember.
They were both very satisfying and delicious!
lobster tails.author: Ashley M.
lobster tails.review:
I came here for my six month anniversary with my boyfriend. He told me to choose a nice place for a seafood dinner with a view of the water. I did some research and the best I could find was the Fog Harbor Fish House. 

I loved this place! The staff was very very friendly and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge was amazing! You don't have to dress up super fancy but I recommend a little more than casual dress would be nice in this place. The menu choices are broad and prices aren't going to break the bank. The drinks are great too.

We started out with an order of calamari and they don't skip out on the squid that's for sure! I couldn't stop eating it. I ordered 2 lobster tails that came with fries. My boyfriend got the sampler plate with clams, crab, and another seafood I can't remember. They were both very satisfying and delicious! We were checked on frequently by a very attentive and smiling waiter and had an overall wonderful experience.

We ordered Tiramisu at the end and oh man...I shouldn't have indulged but they bring a tray of desserts over to you so you can choose what you want. Nothing worse than seeing it in front of you! The tiramisu was sooo good. Moist, creamy, and had a perfect espresso flavor to go with our espressos. 

The fact that it's right on Pier 39 is great too so you can walk off your dinner around the pier and watch the magicians and performers right by the water.

excerpts: My mom had the twin lobster tails with wild rice and veggies.
She loved everything except the veggies which were undercooked according to her.
I wanted something different
so I went for the beef and shrimp chow mein.
I'm not sure why they called it
chow mein because it was definitely more of a lo mein.
Still it was delicious
and I'd order it again.
lobster tails.author: Anastasia E.
lobster tails.review:
Great food, pleasant service (although the hostess was a bit snobby).  We had a 15 minute wait but that was no problem.  They had a nice fireplace with comfy couches to sit on.  We started with clam chowder.  I enjoyed it and as a native new englander, couldn't find anything to complain about.  My mom had the twin lobster tails with wild rice and veggies.  She loved everything except the veggies which were undercooked according to her.  I wanted something different so I went for the beef and shrimp chow mein.  I'm not sure why they called it chow mein because it was definitely more of a lo mein.  Still it was delicious and I'd order it again.  I'm not a fan of ginger at all, and did bite into a few tiny pieces, so perhaps I'd ask if it could be prepared without the ginger.  

People with reservations get seated at the window tables first.  We sat in a booth right next to those tables, so we had as nice a view as if we were at a window table.  Some people complained that they couldn't sit at a window table even though they were seated in the booths around us and still had a great view.  

I'd definitely come back again.

excerpts: We've never known lobster tails to be served that salty but were told by the manager that they are flash frozen in salt water during shipping and that perhaps that caused the problem.
lobster tails.author: Marshall K.
lobster tails.review:
My wife and I feel bad that we couldn't have rated it higher. Here's the deal. We both treated us to two lobster tail dinners however, much to our surprise, they were "extremely salty"! We've never known lobster tails to be served that salty but were told by the manager that they are flash frozen in salt water during shipping and that perhaps that caused the problem. The manager did, however, comp our dinners and the only thing we paid for was our clam chowder which was perhaps the BEST, or possibly second-best that we've EVER had! 

We also waited a long time for our meal. And, of course, the typical sourdough bread they served in San Francisco was EXCELLENT!

excerpts: We have yet to receive our lobster tails but I am sure that they are definitely less than stellar.
I will definitely update you all on the lobster tails.
That is if my wife and I make it out of this place without food poisoning.
lobster tails.author: Anastasios V.
lobster tails.review: Definitely not a destination place. Very touristy spot. My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners. The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce. Presentation was awful. The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks. We have yet to receive our lobster tails but I am sure that they are definitely less than stellar. I will definitely update you all on the lobster tails. That is if my wife and I make it out of this place without food poisoning.

excerpts: There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...
the chocolate soufflé is delicious).
Everyone loved everything!
lobster tails.author: C D.
lobster tails.review: We were looking for a place to have a special dinner (Easter); this place was perfect! The restaurant itself is very appealing with the views and decor...of course the food and service is the most important. The service was great! Thank you Mila! We had drinks and appetizers as soon as we ordered them! There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...the chocolate soufflé is delicious). Everyone loved everything!

excerpts: Our lobster tails were not only overcooked and chewy, but also pretty small (not acceptable for $32 each + tax); Our broccoli was spongy and waterlogged.
lobster tails.author: John D.
lobster tails.review:
It is a tourist trap, do not eat there, do not waste your time and money. We tried this restaurant because of the free Pier 39 Parking validation, a bad idea...

Our lobster tails were not only overcooked and chewy, but also pretty small (not acceptable for $32 each + tax); Our broccoli was spongy and waterlogged.

The service was very fast but not really friendly and welcoming. We were ignored and our waiter also forgot to bring our wine. What a poor service there.

He quickly tried to apology while giving us the check to get a decent tip, very awkward.

This restaurant ruined our night and I would not recommend it, even to my worst enemy.

excerpts: He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.
I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good
I wished I had ordered that instead.
The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.
lobster tails.author: DaYeen M.
lobster tails.review:
Ok so the one star is for the time me and my husband came here for lunch one saturday afternoon.  He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.  I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good I wished I had ordered that instead.  The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.  The view was great and we said that we would definitely be back the next time we're at pier39.

So now months later, a friend of mine who moved from NY to CA is traveling from Fresno to SF.  I suggested that we go to pier39 and meet up with a couple of our other friends.  Now here comes the "bad experience" part.  

We ordered Clam chowders, Fish and Lobster.  Well, I did order the Lobster because it was so good the last time we were here.  Wrong choice.  It was the saltiest Lobster ever!  Why not just give me pure rock salt and charge me $32 at that! Im not kidding it is real salty.  To top it off, our waiter didn't even bother refilling our water.  Well, I know some of us didn't order any drinks and just water but can't you even bother ASK if we want our glasses refilled.  After all you're still getting 18%  or $35++ in tips.  3.5% health fee is $6.88.  WTH is that for when you gave me salty lobster and no water refill.  Now, I always ask the waiter to leave the little desert menu wherever I go as I have the tendency to change my mind about getting a desert afterward.  He didn't even bother.  Oh and did I tell you that I was still munching on my french fries when he took the plate right then and there.

So far, this has been my WORST experience in a restaurant ever.  I will NEVER go back and I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone ever!  At the end of the night we ended up paying well under $300 for lousy service and bad food. What's funny is at the receipt there is an option for Additional Tip even after they put in 18%.  Never again.

excerpts: I enjoyed my lobster tails very much
The prices aren't cheap, but for a nice restaurant at Pier 39 with a killer view, what do you expect?
Overall, I'm not dying to go back, but definitely wouldn't mind if I do.
lobster tails.author: Elaine H.
lobster tails.review: I came here for my birthday a couple months back, and as I went around the table, I got both positive and negative feedback. I heard that the pasta was horrible, but they could've been exaggerating. However, everyone else that ordered food besides from the pasta said that it was pretty good. I enjoyed my lobster tails very much =) The prices aren't cheap, but for a nice restaurant at Pier 39 with a killer view, what do you expect? Overall, I'm not dying to go back, but definitely wouldn't mind if I do.
