excerpts: We ordered the Fried combo and the seafood platter for our meals.
The seafood platter was a nice serving of crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams with potatoes all topped with lots of garlic butter.
Talk about an explosion of flavor.
Seasoned really well plenty of garlic in the butter.
The fried combo did not disappoint either.
The calamari was fried nicely as well as the fish and shrimp.
Of course the prices are on the higher end, but it was worth every penny.
fried combo.author: Ty S.
fried combo.review:
I will say this is the best seafood restaurant I've been to in a while. Once you get past the touristy vibe it's easy to take in the view and some good food. We made our reservation online and I specifically requested a seat with a view. Our request was honored and it was a beautiful day so we had a nice few of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. 

We started with a bowl of clam chowder and some bread and butter. The chowder was really tasty. I just recently started eating clam chowder so I don't have many points of reference. But the flavor was nice not too heavy. We also had margaritas they were ok not really  strong tasted mostly like the mixer. 

We ordered the Fried combo and the seafood platter for our meals. The seafood platter was a nice serving of crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams with potatoes all topped with lots of garlic butter. Talk about an explosion of flavor. Seasoned really well plenty of garlic in the butter. The platter was so good I wanted more. 

The fried combo did not disappoint either. The calamari was fried nicely as well as the fish and shrimp. Of course the prices are on the higher end, but it was worth every penny.

excerpts: We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters.
Everything was so good I don't have any complaints.
We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset.
On top of that, service was impeccable.
Would definitely come back in the future.
fried combo.author: Jessica T.
fried combo.review: Used yelp to reserve our table and were seated right away so it was already off to a great start.  We tried not to order too much as we wanted to try a different restaurant (we're from Orange County so we wanted to make our way around the city), but ended up ordering too much because there was so much we wanted to try! Nonetheless, the food was great! We got the fried combo which included fries, fried shrimp & calamari, and slaw, clam chowder, and both raw & baked oysters. Everything was so good I don't have any complaints. We were seated right by the window with a view of the water and sunset. On top of that, service was impeccable. Would definitely come back in the future.

excerpts: We ordered a bread bowl of clam chowder as well as the fried combo which came with fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, and cole slaw.
Between the two of us the food was just the right amount of food to get us full.
Our server was also kind enough to have the kitchen divide the fried combo into 2 plates for us.
fried combo.author: Melissa F.
fried combo.review:
I looked into Yelp to find the "best clam chowder" in Fisherman's Wharf and I felt I scored by heading to Fog Harbor! The BF has had many bowls of clam chowder but I insisted that the best clam chowder I ever had was in San Francisco.

So when I was planning our trip to the bay, I had FHFH on my radar. Once we got to Fisherman's Wharf the BF and I waited for the place to open and were one of the first people there that day. Our server was super sweet and helpful. We ordered a bread bowl of clam chowder as well as the fried combo which came with fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, and cole slaw. Between the two of us the food was just the right amount of food to get us full. Our server was also kind enough to have the kitchen divide the fried combo into 2 plates for us. I paired my food with a glass of pinot grigio while the BF had a beer.

I was so happy that the BF thought the clam chowder was delicious! Now, he will be biased against every bowl of clam chowder we encounter because it will never taste as good as Fog Harbor Fish House's. The fried seafood was also yummy! We want to try the rest of the menu if we get another chance to go. The view from our table was also grand. Getting to eat with a view of the harbor is serene and adds to the experience here. If you are in the market to spend some money, spend it here and get a good seat by the window. It's well worth it.

excerpts: We both ordered clam chowder for openers (I got mine in a bread bowl which was simply delightful), and the fried combo plate.
I wasn't sure how much to expect in terms of quality (after all, fried food can only taste like fried food, right?)
Well as it turns out the batter was perfectly seasoned and very light and flavorful, and there was actually more substance than batter which was a big plus.
I was very impressed.
Our server today was Michael, and he was really nice and took care of us well.
My fried and I agreed,
next time we're in San Francisco
we're toally going back!
fried combo.author: Jesse R.
fried combo.review: I came here today with a friend and it was a very enjoyable experience.  We both ordered clam chowder for openers (I got mine in a bread bowl which was simply delightful), and the fried combo plate.  I wasn't sure how much to expect in terms of quality (after all, fried food can only taste like fried food, right?)  Well as it turns out the batter was perfectly seasoned and very light and flavorful, and there was actually more substance than batter which was a big plus.  I was very impressed.  Our server today was Michael, and he was really nice and took care of us well.  My fried and I agreed, next time we're in San Francisco we're toally going back!

excerpts: The fried combo (shrimp, calamari, fish with cole slaw and fries) was totally over fried.
fried combo.author: Luci B.
fried combo.review:
I tend to not go to restaurants with great views in touristy spots of town, as it always means the food can afford to not be top notch, but we happened to be on the Wharf and the reviews of this place were fantastic. And the setting was beautiful, the waitstaff was beyond sweet and attentive, but I am surprised at all the great reviews. 

The best thing we ordered was the crab cocktail. Like shrimp cocktail, but with extremely fresh lump crab meat. It's straightforward but the seafood is quality, it's worth getting.

The chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was really bland. We seasoning it ourselves at the table but it still didn't hit the mark. I got the Cioppino, crab, fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels in tomato broth.The broth was also under seasoned, for the most part the seafood was good though (especially the crab, seems to be a strong choice here), just not a dish that was worth $34. The fried combo (shrimp, calamari, fish with cole slaw and fries) was totally over fried. 

Overall it's a nice view, overpriced, but the raw seafood is worth getting if you find yourself here.

excerpts: My wife and I shared a clam chowder bread bowl and the fried combo.
The bread bowl was the best we've ever had.
You could tell the bread is fresh baked and we opted to add crab meat to our bowl which made it even more amazing.
The fried fish was also very good.
The calamari and shrimp were also tasty.
It only took about 10 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 4:00pm which was impressive.
Our server Mel was friendly and made sure everything was good with our meal.
He definitely knows great customer service.
The prices are a little higher than other places in the area but the quality and service are top notch.
fried combo.author: Micah C.
fried combo.review: Tried fog harbor for the first time today. My wife and I shared a clam chowder bread bowl and the fried combo. The bread bowl was the best we've ever had. You could tell the bread is fresh baked and we opted to add crab meat to our bowl which made it even more amazing. The fried fish was also very good. The calamari and shrimp were also tasty. It only took about 10 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 4:00pm which was impressive. Our server Mel was friendly and made sure everything was good with our meal. He definitely knows great customer service. The prices are a little higher than other places in the area but the quality and service are top notch.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Fried Combo which is fried fish, calamari, and shrimp and while it was good it was nothing special.
fried combo.author: Juanita I.
fried combo.review:
We ate a late lunch at Fog Harbor after arriving in San Francisco, jet lagged and hungry. It was around 2:30 and we were seated right away at a window overlooking the pier. The place was pleasantly busy. 

Our server was kind and pleasant. 

We started off with the calamari appetizer with lemon aioli and it was perfection. We asked for more aioli and it was brought with a smile. 

I ordered the Seafood Penne and again, it was perfection. Perfect pasta, creamy tomato sauce, shrimp, mussels, and clams. It truly satisfied.

My husband ordered the Fried Combo which is fried fish, calamari, and shrimp and while it was good it was nothing special. It came with fries.

For dessert we had the Blondie Sundae because hubby is a lover of all things Biscoff. Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. It was delicious! 

We also each had a yummy raspberry lemonade cocktail which I can't remember the name of. It was quite good. 

Very impressed with Fog Harbor and would eat here again!

excerpts: My husband ordered the fried combo with fish, shrimp, and calamari.
It all was great, crispy, fresh.
Again nothing "fishy" tasting.
We ended the meal with creme brûlée.
Nothing new here-
it's a popular,common dessert...
but it tasted great.
So many seafood restaurants in this area to choose from but this one was one of the better ones.
fried combo.author: Tara M.
fried combo.review: Was vacationing near Fisherman's Wharf and wanted to have fish and chips for dinner. We selected Fog Harbor after looking at reviews, location, and menu. We were impressed by the view of the Bay from our table, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the service. We started with the crab cakes with buerre blanc sauce and mango salsa. They were perfectly crispy and the mango salsa really complimented the sweet crap. Did not taste "fishy" at all. I ordered the shrimp and chips- came with 8 huge butterflied, panko crusted shrimp, fries, and a coleslaw with a horseradish kick. It was all very tasty and prepared well. My husband ordered the fried combo with fish, shrimp, and calamari. It all was great, crispy, fresh. Again nothing "fishy" tasting. We ended the meal with creme brûlée. Nothing new here- it's a popular,common dessert...but it tasted great. So many seafood restaurants in this area to choose from but this one was one of the better ones.

excerpts: I had the fried combo platter  of fish shrimp and calamari.
Everything  was tasty  with the exception of the battered  fish.
It was a little  bland.
The decor was upscale and my seat overlooked  the bay.
I would  definitely  return.
fried combo.author: Cherise N.
fried combo.review: Visiting from nyc This place appeared  to have good reviews. I had the clam chowder and crab  cakes to start with which was really  good. The staff was great attentive and friendly. They served really  good portions. My husband  had their cod  that was also excellent. I had the fried combo platter  of fish shrimp and calamari. Everything  was tasty  with the exception of the battered  fish. It was a little  bland. The decor was upscale and my seat overlooked  the bay. I would  definitely  return.

excerpts: We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood.
It wasn't.
The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.
For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.
fried combo.author: Mandy T.
fried combo.review:
Tourist trap, as expected. On the 2nd level of Pier 39 complex, hubby was getting hangry and refused to walk anywhere else for food. We settled in here as they had good reviews, has a view over the sea lions beaching at the pier, the interior looked clean and well put together, and they offered crayons and coloring sheets to entertain the little one. 

Started off promising. The waitstaff were all professional. We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack. The appetizer was huge!  It tasted alright.  But our entrees did not fair well. We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood. It wasn't. The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.  For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.  I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow. Taste-wise, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring. A very basic burger for $15. 

So overall, overpriced and unmemorable food serving mostly tourists, but does provide a view, comfortable seating and good service.

excerpts: I loved the calamari from the fried combo.
They served the dishes very fast and the waitress was attentive throughout.
I'm a fish with my water and Jessica was constantly refilling my glass even though you can tell she was busy with all her tables.
Finally we ordered dessert and the Apple walnut crisp with vanilla ice cream was awesome!
You gotta try it!
The prices weren't bad and the dishes were worth the money.
Definitely will return when I'm back in the San Francisco area
fried combo.author: Ed D.
fried combo.review: This place was super busy on a Saturday night.  We put our name in the wait list of 4 people and they were able to seat us within 30 mins.  It wasn't a bad wait as they had a nice seating area with a fireplace so the wait time went by fast.  The dining area is very spacious and we didn't feel scrunched.  The view was good overlooking the pier.  Our server Jessica came to greet us right away and got us our ordered drinks promptly.  We ordered the combo fish fry, the chicken sandwich, the grill seafood combo, and fresh sole.  I tasted all of the dishes and all of them were good.  My combo came with salmon, tuna and shrimp.  The salmon was very moist, the tuna was done right and the shrimp was on a skewer well done as well.  The sole was a tad bland but was well made, just needed better seasoning or sauce.  I loved the calamari from the fried combo.  They served the dishes very fast and the waitress was attentive throughout.  I'm a fish with my water and Jessica was constantly refilling my glass even though you can tell she was busy with all her tables.  Finally we ordered dessert and the Apple walnut crisp with vanilla ice cream was awesome!  You gotta try it!  The prices weren't bad and the dishes were worth the money. Definitely will return when I'm back in the San Francisco area

excerpts: the shell fish platter and bf had the fried combo.
We had a reservation on open table and everything was ready for when we arrived.
It highly recommend you book a table ahead of time as this area gets really crowded.
Was a fantastic experience I wish we lived here
so we could go back.
fried combo.author: Hilary H.
fried combo.review: Touristy, yes. Delicious, yes! This place is located in a tourist trap area but it's good and service is excellent. Prices are reasonable for the area and the views are fantastic. They also accommodate food allergies just let them know. I'm gluten free and had some adjustments made to my meal. We started with the spicy shrimp which bf said was the best thing he's had in a long time. I had the shell fish platter and bf had the fried combo. We had a reservation on open table and everything was ready for when we arrived. It highly recommend you book a table ahead of time as this area gets really crowded. Was a fantastic experience I wish we lived here so we could go back.

excerpts: I got the fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, etc) and my wife got the crab sandwich.
All was delicious, though it was the clam chowder that I keep talking about.
fried combo.author: Tanner M.
fried combo.review: You know it's good seafood when it doesn't taste (or even smell) like fish. I got the fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, etc) and my wife got the crab sandwich. All was delicious, though it was the clam chowder that I keep talking about.

excerpts: I ordered the fish and chips and my boyfriend ordered the fried combo.
The flavor and crunch of the the fried fish was very good but also slightly bland.
My boyfriend enjoyed his meal, however he wished there was an equal amount of each seafood on his plate.
The service was lacking, as we waited for a long time for our waiter to come so we could ask for the check.
fried combo.author: Sarah C.
fried combo.review: On our first day in San Francisco, we came to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner. We came to the Fog Harbor Fish House and were given table without having to wait. We both ordered bowls of clam chowder, which we agreed was possibly the best we've ever had. The sourdough bread and butter were excellent. I ordered the fish and chips and my boyfriend ordered the fried combo. The flavor and crunch of the the fried fish was very good but also slightly bland. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal, however he wished there was an equal amount of each seafood on his plate. The service was lacking, as we waited for a long time for our waiter to come so we could ask for the check.

excerpts: Had fried combo, piece of fish not covered on one side with batter, fries cold and no salt, coleslaw no flavor, calamari was great and red sauce very tasty.
The tarter sauce very disappointing.
Great waiter and food did come fast ... would have waited a bit for quality.
fried combo.author: Jette Erick U.
fried combo.review: Had fried combo, piece of fish not covered on one side with batter, fries cold and no salt, coleslaw no flavor, calamari was great and red sauce very tasty. The tarter sauce very disappointing. Great waiter and food did come fast ... would have waited a bit for quality.

excerpts: We had their fried combo platter, which came with shrimp, fish, and calamari.
Everything was fried to perfection.
Our kids loved the fried fish.
I had the linguini and clam.
It came with a very generous serving of Clams.
For $18usd, you get a big serving of pasta and clams.
It was seasoned to perfection.
fried combo.author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.
fried combo.review:
I love the dining area. Anywhere you sit you get a view of the water.  

We had their fried combo platter, which came with shrimp, fish, and calamari.  Everything was fried to perfection.  Our kids loved the fried fish.  I had the linguini and clam. It came with a very generous serving of Clams. For $18usd, you get a big serving of pasta and clams. It was seasoned to perfection.  We also got Ahi Tuna and Crab cakes.  I think the crab cakes was too expensive. 

It was good food. But it was also expensive.   I guess it is expected for a tourist area like this.

excerpts: I got the fried combo.
The fish was horrible.
It had zero flavor.
The fry batter needs seasoning!!!
The fried shrimp was so-so, nothing special.
The calamari was lightly battered, but didn't have much flavor.
The french fries were just french fries.
My boyfriend's pina colada drink was average.
I could have gotten it from any smoothie place and it would have tasted  the same.
The garlic crab was OK.
fried combo.author: Rolena I.
fried combo.review:
Unfortunately, I could have been happier with McDonald's.  I wish I could have my $130 back.  I regret not returning the food and going elsewhere.

The Good:
I did like the New England clam chowder and the sauteed spinach was quite terrific, which I'm so glad I subbed the cole slaw, otherwise, I wouldn't have even had the spinach.  The crab cakes were mushier than I prefer, but the flavor was good.  My virgin strawberry basil nojito (yes, correct spelling of theirs since this is a virgin) beverage  was nice and refreshing.  The waiter was adequate.  The view was  nice.

The Not Great:
Everything else...I got the fried combo.  The fish was horrible.  It had zero flavor.  The fry batter needs seasoning!!!  The fried shrimp was so-so, nothing special.  The calamari was lightly battered, but didn't have much flavor.  The french fries were just french fries.  My boyfriend's pina colada drink was average.  I could have gotten it from any smoothie place and it would have tasted  the same.  The garlic crab was OK.  I didn't taste any kind of garlic flavor though.

The tables were a bit cramped together.  Overall, yes a few items were good, but for the price paid, I guess you're paying for the location and view.

excerpts: Fried combo came with generous proportion of fries and calamari, 1 fried fish, & 2 fried jumbo shrimp.
Great flavors!
I'm pretty picky about ordering fish and chips from most places, but this fish came out fresh & not soggy like most places I've found.
fried combo.author: Nabrina M.
fried combo.review:
The food was awesome! My date and I ordered the clam chowder (WOW!!) as well as the combo fried plate. This was a good amount of food for us both.

The clam chowder is very creamy, flavorful, and has a great consistency.

Fried combo came with generous proportion of fries and calamari, 1 fried fish, & 2 fried jumbo shrimp. Great flavors! I'm pretty picky about ordering fish and chips from most places, but this fish came out fresh & not soggy like most places I've found. I just wish the fish had been a bit bigger because we were sharing however, if I were eating this alone, it would've been the right amount.

Though I don't like going to the wharf due to tourist population, this spot is worth coming back to!!

excerpts: Had the fried combo plate with fish, shrimp, and calamari and wasn't impressed.
Husband had the garlic crab and he enjoyed it.
Customer service is on point, just super busy.
Great views.
fried combo.author: W K.
fried combo.review: Clam chowder with crab on top & fried scallops is the way to go. Had the fried combo plate with fish, shrimp, and calamari and wasn't impressed. Husband had the garlic crab and he enjoyed it. Customer service is on point, just super busy. Great views.

excerpts: My friend had the fried combo plate the calamari was good and the fish was very hot and crispy.
The clock t sis were really
food try the hibiscus margarita but their glasses are small.
Service was good
probably won't come here again unless I have out of town guest.
The view was great.
fried combo.author: Trina D.
fried combo.review: Right in the middle of the tourist area so you have to be in the mood for a crowd if your not get there early. We ordered s lot started with the seafood tower. The crab in it was small so not much to pick from ibe had better from Safeway. Bye cheese toast was food had that with a small cup of clam chowder which was thick and rich. The sole was good vut I wouldnt order it again. My friend had the fried combo plate the calamari was good and the fish was very hot and crispy. The clock t sis were really food try the hibiscus margarita but their glasses are small. Service was good probably won't come here again unless I have out of town guest. The view was great.

excerpts: Mongo eat Fried Combo.
Yummy!
Mongo drink many, many Jack and Cokes.
fried combo.author: Mongo I.
fried combo.review:
Mongo like this rest-or-rant soooo much. And so close to Mongo's hotel - Mongo eat here five times so far. Mongo eat Sourdough Bread Bowl Clam Chowder. Yummy! Mongo eat Crab Cakes. Yummy! Mongo eat Mussel Fries. Yummy! Mongo eat Shrimp Louis. Yummy! Mongo eat Fried Combo. Yummy! Mongo drink many, many Jack and Cokes. And everybody nice to Mongo. 

Mongo say pretty views from Mongo's table. 
But Mongo no see no fog...

excerpts:
The things we ordered:
Crab cake
Whole Garlic roasted crab
Fried Combo
Linguini Clam

What came out first:
Crab cake.
Garlic crab and fried combo.
The whole crab meat was mushy, kind of like the crab was already dead when they cooked it.
The crab was also cold, so maybe that crab was ready to serve the moment we ordered.
The crab was on a bed of potatoes with broccoli on the side.
The fried combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimps on a bed of calamari with Cole slaw and fries on the side.
It was just alright.
fried combo.author: Jessica T.
fried combo.review:
This place is mediocre at best. 

I came in with 3 others at 5pm. We have a dinner reservation somewhere else at 7:30, so we figured we'll just "snack" here

The things we ordered:
Crab cake
Whole Garlic roasted crab
Fried Combo
Linguini Clam

What came out first:
Crab cake. We split the crab cake four ways (because there were four of us). Mines was good. While halfway through, one of the girls found a short, black curly hair mixed in with her crab cake. We caught the attention of a server and told him, he said he will get his manager. 

The manager came:
We told him what happened, showed him the hair. He said nothing to us, did not apologize, then asked "do you want another one" . I told the other girl "not if its going to have hair in it" and the manager rudely replies "you either want another one or you don't". Okay you asshole, first of all. One of your workers fucked up and dropped hair into our food. Why the hell are you acting like you couldn't be bothered with us and give us your shit attitude? We declined another crab cake. The shit manager grabs the plate of the girl with the hair crab cake and the main plate and walks away with nothing else to say. No apologies or anything. 

What came out next:
Garlic crab and fried combo. 
The whole crab meat was mushy, kind of like the crab was already dead when they cooked it. The crab was also cold, so maybe that crab was ready to serve the moment we ordered. The crab was on a bed of potatoes with broccoli on the side. The fried combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimps on a bed of calamari with Cole slaw and fries on the side. It was just alright. The fries tasted better than everything else on that plate.

Our linguini clam never came out. Server must've forgotten about it. 

Towards the end, we felt really dissatisfied with our meal, so another girl and I decided to try their clam chowder. We ordered the clam chowder on the bread bowl.

It came out right away. With the remaining crab meat we had from the whole crab, we put the meat into the clam chowder and ate it that way. Out of everything we had up until that point, the clam chowder tasted better than every thing else

excerpts: We had the special crab/risotto for appetizer; entree: fried combo (fish/calamari/shrimp), and crab roll.
All the seafood are fresh and delicious!
They also provide you a warm sourdough bread that is so yummy...seated by the window overlooking the boat cruise on the bay...
it's nice for people watch
Our waiter is very professional and friendly.
Will definitely come back to try other food.
fried combo.author: CJ B.
fried combo.review:
It's a touristy kinda day for us today so we went to Fisherman's Wharf...  :)
Great food, ambiance, and view! The food are great. 
We had the special crab/risotto for appetizer; entree: fried combo (fish/calamari/shrimp), and crab roll. All the seafood are fresh and delicious! They also provide you a warm sourdough bread that is so yummy...seated by the window overlooking the boat cruise on the bay...it's nice for people watch   :)
Our waiter is very professional and friendly. Will definitely come back to try other food.

excerpts: Highlights: Clam Chowder, Dungeness Ravioli, Pan-Seared Cod, and of course the Fried Combo.
fried combo.author: Jon C.
fried combo.review: Going to PIER 39 you might expect to get caught up in a tourist trap or two, but this is definitely not that... Fog Harbor Fish House is a wonderfully decorated, ambient treasure sitting on the edge of the Bay. Beyond the welcoming yet chic atmosphere, the food and service by our hostess and then waiter, Justin, were stellar. Our group had many questions about the menu, and were met with wonderful responses and suggestions for pairings from the well-versed Justin. It honestly felt like we had met an old friend out for a nice meal, and we couldn't have had a better experience. We will definitely be requesting his section on our next stop back in at the Harbor. Highlights: Clam Chowder, Dungeness Ravioli, Pan-Seared Cod, and of course the Fried Combo.

excerpts: Fried combo:
The combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimp, about a cup of calamari, fries and coleslaw.
Everything was fried crispy but not everything was seasoned properly.
The calamari was perfect and tasted great.
The fish was crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, and fresh
but it lacked salt.
Once I salted it, it was good.
Unfortunately the shrimp was bland and badly needed the cocktail sauce.
The coleslaw was bland and taste like just cabbage & mayo.
It had no seasoning or vinegar and was very boring.
fried combo.author: Lily L.
fried combo.review:
Dungeness Crab & Mango Ceviche:  There was a good portion (about 1/2 cup) of crab mixed with mango.  It taste fresh and the lemon & mango complemented the crab nicely.

Fried combo:  The combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimp, about a cup of calamari, fries and coleslaw.  Everything was fried crispy but not everything was seasoned properly.  The calamari was perfect and tasted great.  The fish was crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, and fresh but it lacked salt. Once I salted it, it was good.  Unfortunately the shrimp was bland and badly needed the cocktail sauce.  The coleslaw was bland and taste like just cabbage & mayo. It had no seasoning or vinegar and was very boring.  Hind sight, I would have ordered the fish & calamari but skip the shrimp.

My server Ashley G. was very nice and friendly.  She was offering suggestions to tourist visiting the area.

If in the area, I would eat here again.

excerpts: My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp.
I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent.
However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two.
Wtf???
fried combo.author: Amanda K.
fried combo.review:
Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills. 

We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.

Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.

My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent. However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw. 

Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.

excerpts: A friend at the table ordered the fried combo and yet again I was blown away by the freshness in the taste of the fish.
fried combo.author: Rob R.
fried combo.review:
I'd say this place is excellent. Definitely recommend it!!! 

It's very sophisticated, so I'd recommend you dress up a bit. I ordered the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. It was phenomenal.  You could really taste the freshness of the clam in each bite. A friend at the table ordered the fried combo and yet again I was blown away by the freshness in the taste of the fish. To drink I had a virgin strawberry daiquiri, which again was phenomenal. 

The only negative I can really say was we were seated by the kitchen, which negatively effected the overall vibe a bit. Something about hearing dishes clank when the doors open just took a small bit away from the overall experience. Overall though, even as a reflect on my experience months after I went to it, this restaurant is a winner and worth trying.

excerpts: For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo.
Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked.
fried combo.author: Kay D.
fried combo.review:
Fog Harbor starts with freshly baked sourdough bread. I ate with family so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder. For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo. Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked. The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino. 

The restaurant has great atmosphere and great service! We enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely come back.

excerpts: We also ordered  Crispy Bay Scallops, Dungeness Crab Cakes, and Fried Combo (breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw).
Based on the description lots of calories for sure.
fried combo.author: Milton J.
fried combo.review:
After a quick four and half hour bus tour of San Francisco we had a couple of hours left before having to leave port for another destination on a cruise. After doing some research I came across Fog Harbor Fish House at Pier 39 on a travel website which had a lot of positive reviews.

Upon arrival we waited for about fifteen minutes before being seated (for a group of three) at a corner not far from the Crab House. 

We ordered two cups of clam chowder, and one in a sourdough bowl. Apparently the basket of bread was sourdough, so the sourdough bowl wasn't necessary. The chowder was great - as the restaurant claims - "the best in San Francisco. "

We also ordered  Crispy Bay Scallops, Dungeness Crab Cakes, and Fried Combo (breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw). Based on the description lots of calories for sure.  The scallops, calamari and crab cakes were the best of the lot.

It felt like we consumed two meals at once given the portions but it was a great experience. A great way to finish a brief trip to San Francisco.

excerpts: Also ordered the fried combo which was too pricey for the portion but it was delicious!
Came with 2 beer bathered fish, 2 fried jumbo shrimp and fried calamari.
fried combo.author: Radney S.
fried combo.review:
Ate here during a weekend getaway to San Francisco. There are so many restaurants and eateries to choose from so as always we referred to yelp for some guidance and we were not disappointed with our choice! 

Arrived during opening on a Saturday and we were immediately seated along the window facing the bay. You're able to enjoy gorgeous views from their 2nd story location. Soon after the place filled fast! Glad we were hungry so early.

We ordered the claim chowder in a sour dough bowl. It was creamy and delicious wuth generous portions of clams. I'm usually the one to avoid such items for fear of their fishy, sea water flavor but wow was it good! Definitely fresh. Also ordered the fried combo which was too pricey for the portion but it was delicious! Came with 2 beer bathered fish, 2 fried jumbo shrimp and fried calamari. The fish and shrimp was great, the calamari was good but not as impressive.

Overall we'd recommend this place to friends. Bit on the pricey side but the location, views, quality and ambience are worth the price.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the fried combo which came with calamari, prawns and fish with sides of fries and coleslaw.
Everything on his plate was really good, I couldn't help but pick off his plate
I ordered the garlic crab and it was awesome.
Had the perfect amount of meat and was shockingly filling considering it was only a half order.
Service was awesome and the food was just as great.
I will definitely come back again; next time, I'll just be sure to make a reservation so that we can get a table with a view
We had a really nice, romantic time with a candle lit dinner...
perfect night overall.
fried combo.author: Monique L.
fried combo.review:
My boyfriend took me out for date night in the city Saturday night and we decided to try out Fog Harbor; there was a 45 minute wait which wasn't bad at all considering the pier was super packed as usual. The wait time flew by since we were able to walk around and look at all the things the pier has to offer.
We got our table and were given a good amount of time to review the menu. By the time we decided on what we wanted, our waiter took our order. We decided on the red chili shrimp for the appetizer; it was packed full of delicious flavor and had the perfect amount of spiciness to it. We both really enjoyed it, would definitely order again. We were also given a basket of bread and butter; the bread was nice and warm, really good.
My boyfriend ordered the fried combo which came with calamari, prawns and fish with sides of fries and coleslaw. Everything on his plate was really good, I couldn't help but pick off his plate :) I ordered the garlic crab and it was awesome. Had the perfect amount of meat and was shockingly filling considering it was only a half order. 
Service was awesome and the food was just as great. I will definitely come back again; next time, I'll just be sure to make a reservation so that we can get a table with a view :) We had a really nice, romantic time with a candle lit dinner...perfect night overall.

excerpts: The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.
fried combo.author: Darien R.
fried combo.review:
We had a very good experience here.  Every dish and drink that came to the table was enjoyed. We had a table by the window.  This restaurant, to me, is a great place for a special occasion celebration.  Large open space, white table cloths. GOOD FOOD!

If I'm remembering correctly, the CLAM CHOWDER was spot on. The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.

We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.

The Garlic Crab was good, but The Crab House next door has them beat when it comes to this dish.  I love it when Yelpers drop hints like this in their reviews, so here is a good tip for you.  Go to The Crab House literally next door and get the Garlic Crab.  Best I've had.

I like this place a lot.  It's between a 4 and a 5 for me. This is exactly what you would expect from a classy version of a fish house.

excerpts: Boyfriend got the fried combo and I got the pan seared chicken; both were delicious and we had leftovers due to filling up on the free Boutin bread.
My only complaint is that our waiter was a bit creepy; he was friendly but honestly made me uncomfortable.
However that's not the restaurants fault!
We will definitely be back again when we are in the city
fried combo.author: Sarah C.
fried combo.review: Came here on a Saturday at 6:30 with my boyfriend and no reservation but we were seated by 7:30. They take your phone number and text you when your table is ready which is great because you can wander around the pier instead of just sitting around. Boyfriend got the fried combo and I got the pan seared chicken; both were delicious and we had leftovers due to filling up on the free Boutin bread. My only complaint is that our waiter was a bit creepy; he was friendly but honestly made me uncomfortable. However that's not the restaurants fault! We will definitely be back again when we are in the city

excerpts: I like the fried sleeve fish from the fried combo, but chips and fish are just fair.
fried combo.author: Sebastian F.
fried combo.review: Cabs are very good. Shellfish is fine. I like the fried sleeve fish from the fried combo, but chips and fish are just fair.

excerpts: - Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw.
We could not finish this.
It was huge.
fried combo.author: Angela L.
fried combo.review:
We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.

The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too. 

What we ordered:
- Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone. 
- Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge. 
- Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either. 

The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed. 

All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!

excerpts: Fried combo was decent but the cole slaw was very marginal.
fried combo.author: Mona M.
fried combo.review:
Not impressed, value equation was way off.  Fried combo was decent but the cole slaw was very marginal.  My family enjoyed the mixed grill.  I had the Cioppino, portion was great and was enough for a light meal for two people, I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the seafood, fish and scallops were dry.

The best thing about my meal was the Alcatraz cocktail.  It was delicious!

Wait staff and management staff were very attentive but this was a tourist trap that I won't recommend or repeat.

excerpts: We ordered 2 lobster tails ($38), a garlic roasted whole dungeon crab, fried combo and clam chowder.
The lobster tails were ok.
The crab was particularly dissapointed.
It was $41 and it was a tiny blue-crab sized crab.
The meat was super dry.
If you must eat crab at Pier 39, go to nearby Crab House for a full sized dungeon crab for less.
The fried combo was great.
We all like it.
The clam chowder is advertised as "award winning" on the menu but honestly nothing special.
For $226, I expect better food.
All in all, I will not come back unless someone pays for it.
fried combo.author: Au N.
fried combo.review: It's overpriced and touristy but an essential SF experience. The setting is really nice with great view of the harbor. We came here on Saturday. It was packed but the service was fast.  We ordered 2 lobster tails ($38), a garlic roasted whole dungeon crab, fried combo and clam chowder. The lobster tails were ok. The crab was particularly dissapointed. It was $41 and it was a tiny blue-crab sized crab. The meat was super dry. If you must eat crab at Pier 39, go to nearby Crab House for a full sized dungeon crab for less. The fried combo was great. We all like it. The clam chowder is advertised as "award winning" on the menu but honestly nothing special. For $226, I expect better food. All in all, I will not come back unless someone pays for it.

excerpts: My husband ordered the fried combo which came with the fried shrimp, calamari and fish and fries and coleslaw.
We both liked the calamari a lot.
fried combo.author: Sara L.
fried combo.review: Great view and somewhat good food. I went here with my husband for 1 of our wednesdate. We asked to sit near the window and they were able to place us near the window. Loved the view of the pier/ocean/alcatraz. Restaurant is very nice and looks elegant.The girl that greeted us at the front door was nice. Our server was a sweetheart. She has a very cute accent. We ordered 2 cups of clam chowder. It was okay. It had a lot of big clams, very thick and creamy but tasted bland. The sourdough bread they provide was delish. Our favorite was the baked oyster with parmesan and sprinkled bacon. It was so good and addicting. My husband ordered the fried combo which came with the fried shrimp, calamari and fish and fries and coleslaw. We both liked the calamari a lot. I ordered the Pacific sole with fingerling potatoes. I didn't like it at all. It had no taste. My Pinot Grigio from Lane CA was good. Wished they had more wine choices by the glass. Husband had a Coke to drink. Our parking lot ticket got validated which was nice. Bill came out to about $85 which I don't think this place is a $$..more like a $$$ & this was lunch time.

excerpts: I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw).
Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish.
fried combo.author: Vol T.
fried combo.review:
Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner. 

The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas. 

Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead. 

And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!

excerpts: Don't ask for the fried combo or the fish and chips.
fried combo.author: Alfonso A.
fried combo.review: There is best and more affordable food around the bay. Don't ask for the fried combo or the fish and chips.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the fried combo and said it was good.
fried combo.author: Kristi O.
fried combo.review:
Ate a late lunch here on Sunday 2/17/13 after a great tour of Alcatraz.  I loved the hot from the oven sour dough bread.  

The food came out quick- I ordered the beet salad w/ grilled chicken and blue cheese dressing.  Fog Harbor has the best blue cheese I've tasted in a long time- I was bummed to hear that they don't make it but nonetheless, it was good.  The salad itself was light on beets which was a bummer and my only complaint is that it could have been a larger portion esp. when I ordered it as an entree.  My boyfriend ordered the fried combo and said it was good.  His portion was huge!

Our server Martin was attentive and although he was busy, he didn't leave us wondering where he was as he checked in often.  The restaurant is nice- unfortunately, we weren't seated w/ a view of the water but at that point it was fine- all we wanted was food.    

I would recommend Fog Harbor

excerpts: I had the fried combo and apple crisp.
It was cooked really well and the flavors were great.
In addition to the food, we had a great view of the harbor.
If you're in San Francisco I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.
fried combo.author: Shericka B.
fried combo.review: The food was really good. I had the fried combo and apple crisp. It was cooked really well and the flavors were great. In addition to the food, we had a great view of the harbor. If you're in San Francisco I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.

excerpts: We both eyed the Fried Combo (fish, shrimp, calamari with fries and slaw) priced at $22.
We expected the high price due to the touristy nature of the area, but the price felt more deserving once we received our food (which was very quick considering the lunch rush).
The portions were HUGE!
We both ended up taking half back to the hotel due to being stuffed after eating.
We really wanted to try the dessert duo (creme brulee and chocolate cake priced at $14), but we were too full.
fried combo.author: Josh H.
fried combo.review:
Ate lunch at Fog Harbor Fish House on 2/15/16 on the recommendation of our pedicab driver. Male host at the host stand was less-than-inviting in his facial expressions and interactions with our party and other guests, but the food and service we had later more than made up for his lack of hospitality. Our walk to the table showed just how big the restaurant is and how great the view we had of the Pier 39 area.

Due to the wait for the table, we were able to peruse the menu prior to getting our table. We both eyed the Fried Combo (fish, shrimp, calamari with fries and slaw) priced at $22. We expected the high price due to the touristy nature of the area, but the price felt more deserving once we received our food (which was very quick considering the lunch rush). The portions were HUGE! We both ended up taking half back to the hotel due to being stuffed after eating. We really wanted to try the dessert duo (creme brulee and chocolate cake priced at $14), but we were too full. Maybe next time.

The highlight of the meal, though, had to be the phenomenal service we experienced with our server Madison. As I mentioned earlier, we weren't the most hopeful after our interactions with the host, but Madison went above-and-beyond in answering any questions we had and ensuring we had an amazing experience. Her warm and inviting personality made our lunch one to remember. Her service was top-notch, and I will definitely ask to be in her section the next time we eat there. 

This is a great restaurant in an excellent location with awesome service and huge portions. What more can you ask for?!

excerpts: I had the half crab which was nice and light and he got the fried combo.
Everything from the appetizer to desert was amazing.
The service was great as well.
We had a young lady help us out who has a lot of serving experience.
I am definitely coming back in the next month or so.
It's my new favorite restaurant!
fried combo.author: Milan M.
fried combo.review:
Oh my gosh.
This restaurant gets five stars from me hands down. My boyfriend and I were looking for a night out and we stumbled across this place on yelp because I wanted dinner next to the water. We came in on a Thursday evening, and went to put our name down. They said it would be a 15 min wait for a seat, but 45 to an hour for waterfront seating. We were hungry so I put us down for regular seating. 10 minutes later they call our name and seat us next to a window for two! The boiled oysters were INCREDIBLE. I had the half crab which was nice and light and he got the fried combo. 
Everything from the appetizer to desert was amazing. The service was great as well. We had a young lady help us out who has a lot of serving experience. I am definitely coming back in the next month or so. It's my new favorite restaurant!

excerpts: My friend and I had the clam chowder, ahi tuna, and the fried combo.
Service and food was absolutely on point.
Best experience I've ever had.
fried combo.author: Linda L.
fried combo.review: Been using yelp for a while but have never written a review until today. I had Tyler as my server and he was absolutely amazing. He's the best server I have ever had. He was attentive and had wonderful recommendations. My friend and I had the clam chowder, ahi tuna, and the fried combo.  Service and food was absolutely on point. Best experience I've ever had.

excerpts: I ended up getting their Fried Combo, which consisted of hand-breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.
I felt like a fat and happy kid when I left the restaurant.
I had to walk around Pier 39 to burn off some calories.
fried combo.author: Bobby S.
fried combo.review: Came here for lunch. This place is clean and the wait staff is super friendly. We had a large group and they were on top of their game. Friendly, clean, good food, and great service is what I'm all about. For starters, I ordered their clam chowder. I was in San Francisco. Can't pass that up. I ended up getting their Fried Combo, which consisted of hand-breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw. I felt like a fat and happy kid when I left the restaurant. I had to walk around Pier 39 to burn off some calories.

excerpts: i ordered the fried combo, which consisted of shrimp, calamari, fish and chips.
my friends really like seafood
and i'm just okay with it.
i was debating on whether or not to eat something non-seafood, but it wouldn't make sense to go to a seafood restaurant and not eat seafood..
haha.
i really liked the fried combo!
the portion size is huge and very filling.
our servers brought out our complimentary bread kind of late and i was at the point where i was getting full.
i couldn't finish my fried combo, but i ate the majority of it.
when our bill came, our servers gave us each a biscoff cookie.
my friend really likes them
so she asked our servers if they could give us more and they ended up giving us two handfuls of biscoffs!
LOL
so we made sure to tip our servers even more.
fried combo.author: Sylvia H.
fried combo.review:
i came here last friday with some friends. they wouldn't seat me because my party wasn't complete yet. but once all my friends arrived, they quickly seated us, so it was nice that we didn't have to wait for a table to be available. we were seated by the window with a stunning view of the sunset! :) we had two servers helping us that night. we ordered the fried calamari, garlic cheesy bread, and 1/2 dozen of oysters as appetizers. i'm not too much of a seafood person (yes, i know i'm "missing out" and i don't know how to eat good food haha) so i only ate the calamari and garlic bread and not the oysters. the calamari and the garlic bread were delicious, especially the bread! definitely worth ordering i ordered the fried combo, which consisted of shrimp, calamari, fish and chips. my friends really like seafood and i'm just okay with it. i was debating on whether or not to eat something non-seafood, but it wouldn't make sense to go to a seafood restaurant and not eat seafood.. haha. i really liked the fried combo! the portion size is huge and very filling. our servers brought out our complimentary bread kind of late and i was at the point where i was getting full. i couldn't finish my fried combo, but i ate the majority of it. when our bill came, our servers gave us each a biscoff cookie. my friend really likes them so she asked our servers if they could give us more and they ended up giving us two handfuls of biscoffs! LOL so we made sure to tip our servers even more. :)

notes: make sure your party is complete or they won't seat you! it's normally really packed around dinner time on the weekends (but surprisingly it wasn't for us on a friday night). your server will give you more biscoff cookies if you ask them to. it's definitely a nice restaurant to bring your date here, especially when the sun is about to set. though the noise level might be a bit too loud for you guys to hear each other talk.

excerpts: The fried combo is crispy & greasless with a lite badder with fresh shrimp, calamari, & fish with a perfect cocktail sauce & drizzle of lemon.
The fries were crispy & perfect with ketcup.
Even the next day, my cousins' food was just as great.
Round it off with a Firestone 805 Blond & you will not be disappointed.
So, for excellent seafood in a casual atmosphere with friendly service at reasonable prices, Fog Harbor cannot be beat.
Keep up the good work guys.
fried combo.author: Brian S.
fried combo.review: We came here after wwalking around Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf Saturday night after finding out Neptoon's Palace was perminently closed.  We were certainly not let down by this place.  We sat at one of the high tables & enjoyed the lively atmosphere.  Our waitress, Christine, was very bubbly, friendly, & might I add cute.  The sour dough bread is wonderful; perfect with butter.  The fried combo is crispy & greasless with a lite badder with fresh shrimp, calamari, & fish with a perfect cocktail sauce & drizzle of lemon.  The fries were crispy & perfect with ketcup.  Even the next day, my cousins' food was just as great.  Round it off with a Firestone 805 Blond & you will not be disappointed.  So, for excellent seafood in a casual atmosphere with friendly service at reasonable prices, Fog Harbor cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

excerpts: I had their Fried Combo platter.
I love love loved the flakey white fish perfectly battered.
The shrimp however that came in my platter was just "ok" really nothing special about it.
The Calamari rings were also good.
Did enjoy the coleslaw to cut through the richness of my dish.
Wash it all down with their house merlot was a perfect dinner minus the mediocre shrimps.
fried combo.author: Mary A.
fried combo.review: I finally found the Best clam chowder in San Fran for me!! If you don't mind the tourist everywhere then this is your place for good seafood. Service was excellent. I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. Man this was phenomenal. No overpowering thyme taste as I mentioned in my review for Capurro's. Clam chowder done right here. Make sure to have reservation as this place is right on the pier where crowds of people are looking for places to eat so they get packed quickly. I had their Fried Combo platter. I love love loved the flakey white fish perfectly battered. The shrimp however that came in my platter was just "ok" really nothing special about it. The Calamari rings were also good. Did enjoy the coleslaw to cut through the richness of my dish. Wash it all down with their house merlot was a perfect dinner minus the mediocre shrimps.

excerpts: I ordered the fried combo (beer battered fish,shrimp, more calamari!, and fries).
Love the taste of the fries--tastes like BK fries, fish was yummy--batter wasn't thick, but thin enough and crispy.
fried combo.author: Zerrilyn P.
fried combo.review:
I'm so glad I picked this place to have lunch!

Went here with my bf last Wednesday after we walked the GG bridge.

It's located in Pier 39, on the second level adjacent to the Eagle Cafe.

Outdoor lobby of the restaurant is nice as well as the interior--great view of the pier/ocean...

Customer service is great!

Our waiter served us complimentary sourdough bread while waiting for our food--I'm not that much of a fan of sourdough bread, but this bread was an exception, only cuz it came fresh out of the oven...

For appetizers we ordered the calamari (everytime I eat out with my bf, and if the restaurant serves calamari, we'll  order it!)...portion is enough to feed 2 people. Love the seasoning and breading of the calamari--texture of the calamari is perfect! Soft, easy to chew, not too firm...

I ordered the fried combo (beer battered fish,shrimp, more calamari!, and fries). Love the taste of the fries--tastes like BK fries, fish was yummy--batter wasn't thick, but thin enough and crispy. The shrimp seemed a bit overfried but whatever, and of course the calamari was my fave out of all of em.

Bf ordered seafood fetuccine. Says it's one of the best he's ever had.

Overall great experience...I'll be sure to come back here again!

excerpts: My boyfriend had the fried combo, which included fish and chips along with calamari
but he thought that the fish wasn't crispy enogh and could have been better.
Overall, it was a good experience, pretty pricey
but that's expected since it's on the pier.
fried combo.author: Sharon Y.
fried combo.review: Waited almost an hour at the chilly pier on a Sunday.  Great ambiance, perfect for a nice date. I came here with my boyfriend and some of his friends. We were starving and took a while for our waitress to greet us. We weren't even offered bread to begin with until after we ordered. We all shared the fried calamari which was pretty tasty. My boyfriend's friends ordered their famous clam chowder and thought it was really good with the sour dough bread. I ordered the fog harbor burger and it was so delicious. The carmelized onion was perfect and it came with a generous amount of fries. I tried and couldn't even finish the burger. My boyfriend had the fried combo, which included fish and chips along with calamari but he thought that the fish wasn't crispy enogh and could have been better. Overall, it was a good experience, pretty pricey but that's expected since it's on the pier.

excerpts: My husband got the fried combo which cam with calamari, one fried shrimp and one fried fish (had way to much batter).
He really didn't like his dinner.
I got a crab with garlic butter.
It came with fingerling potatoes and steamed broccoli  (which where huge clusters.
I had to cut each one smaller ).
The crab itself was a little disappointed.
I was hoping for more of a garlic taste.
It wasn't bad; I was expecting a more of a garlicky taste since it was called garlic butter crab.
The fingerling potatoes were soooo good.
It was roasted.
I tried it and probably won't come back.
fried combo.author: Teresa D.
fried combo.review: This place did not have a wow factor. Being 4 1/2 stars, I had high expectations. We got the fried calamari which was good. I give it a 3 stars. My husband got the fried combo which cam with calamari, one fried shrimp and one fried fish (had way to much batter). He really didn't like his dinner. I got a crab with garlic butter. It came with fingerling potatoes and steamed broccoli  (which where huge clusters. I had to cut each one smaller ). The crab itself was a little disappointed. I was hoping for more of a garlic taste. It wasn't bad; I was expecting a more of a garlicky taste since it was called garlic butter crab. The fingerling potatoes were soooo good. It was roasted. I tried it and probably won't come back.

excerpts: Also got the fried combo....
calamari, fried shrimp with a medley of bomb aiolis!
Khaiman, our server was awesome.
fried combo.author: Mark M.
fried combo.review: Food was great. Started off with blue cheese baked garlic bread on sourdough and bowl if clam chowder. For the main course, we ordered the porterhouse steak special and subbed it with the whiskey peppercorn sauce....amazing and steak was tender and juicy! Also got the fried combo....calamari, fried shrimp with a medley of bomb aiolis! Khaiman, our server was awesome.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces.
My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions.
fried combo.author: Lilie D.
fried combo.review:
My boyfriend and I went here (after reading some reviews on Yelp!) for a nice lunch on the waterfront on our recent trip through San Francisco. I was looking for some high quality, fresh seafood and this place prides themselves on their sustainable seafood selection!  First they seated us at a table away from the windows and when asked, quickly and politely got us a nice booth instead with a view of the water and sights. 

Service was nothing short of great: a prompt, courteous waiter who didn't hover but brought us our drinks and complimentary fresh-baked sourdough bread with butter and tended to our needs unobtrusively.

Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces. My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions. I expected some mixed veggies at least! 

All in all a great meal and experience! No wonder they get such great reviews! MUCH better than a generic Joe's Crab Shack experience any day!!!

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo.
Overall, the food was just okay.
Service wasn't too great either.
fried combo.author: Micah Anne M.
fried combo.review: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.

excerpts: My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp.
fried combo.author: Jennifer W.
fried combo.review:
My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.

We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters! 

For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!

Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!

excerpts: We ordered Choppino, clam chowder in a bread bowl, and fried combo platter.

The Choppino was good, I found it to be a little salty, and was disappointed in the fact that the waiter didn't mention there was an extra fee of 4 dollars for having the crab without the shell (nor did I see it in the menu).

I also was disappointed that in the Choppino, I only had two shrimps, and it was loaded with fish (probably to cut out on cost), but seriously for $28 you'd had better give more of a variety of the seafood.
My dates fried combo was pretty good, but I didn't find it to be excellent.

The fact that she only received two butterflied shrimp was ridiculous, and just to make the volume of the plate look bigger they load it with calamari, which if that was the case, my date stated "I should've just went with the fried calamari and chips.
The breading on the items on the plate was nice and light, I didn't find it to be overpowering
and you could taste the seafood which was nice.
Now for the best part of this experience....the clam chowder bread bowl.
This was the highlight of the night, the clam chowder wasn't too thick nor was it too liquid
, it was just right.
The soup had the right amount of saltiness, it wasn't overbearing.
I found that there was a lot of clams in it which was a huge plus, so they didn't cheat you off of that.
The bread was delicious, crispy on the outside, nice and soft in the inside.

If I go back it'll probably only be for the clam chowder, but overall experience was just alright, nothing to really go crazy over since the prices were pretty high for the kind of seafood they would serve in their dishes.
fried combo.author: Justin P.
fried combo.review: My date and I came here for Valentine's Day. What I was most impressed about was how fast they were to attend to our reservation despite the fact that it was a full house, they were on schedule for those reservations (clearly I've had bad experiences with reservations in the past). The place was clean and had a nice environment. It was a place that you'd expect to look like since it was right by the sea. Our waiter was very nice, and the service was on point for the most part, however at the end it was kind of lagging. We received our food quickly from when we ordered our food, so that was really nice. I didn't expect it to be so prompt since it was a full house. Now onto their food! We ordered Choppino, clam chowder in a bread bowl, and fried combo platter. The Choppino was good, I found it to be a little salty, and was disappointed in the fact that the waiter didn't mention there was an extra fee of 4 dollars for having the crab without the shell (nor did I see it in the menu). I also was disappointed that in the Choppino, I only had two shrimps, and it was loaded with fish (probably to cut out on cost), but seriously for $28 you'd had better give more of a variety of the seafood. My dates fried combo was pretty good, but I didn't find it to be excellent. The fact that she only received two butterflied shrimp was ridiculous, and just to make the volume of the plate look bigger they load it with calamari, which if that was the case, my date stated "I should've just went with the fried calamari and chips." The breading on the items on the plate was nice and light, I didn't find it to be overpowering and you could taste the seafood which was nice. Now for the best part of this experience....the clam chowder bread bowl. This was the highlight of the night, the clam chowder wasn't too thick nor was it too liquid, it was just right. The soup had the right amount of saltiness, it wasn't overbearing. I found that there was a lot of clams in it which was a huge plus, so they didn't cheat you off of that. The bread was delicious, crispy on the outside, nice and soft in the inside. If I go back it'll probably only be for the clam chowder, but overall experience was just alright, nothing to really go crazy over since the prices were pretty high for the kind of seafood they would serve in their dishes.

excerpts: We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo!
It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it!
Would definitely go back!
fried combo.author: Laura C.
fried combo.review: Excellent service! Food was great and very fresh! We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo! It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it! Would definitely go back!

excerpts: My husband had the Fried Combo, which includes fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.
It was like fried seafood heaven!
I tried some of his calamari and it was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all, and lightly breaded.
Yum.
fried combo.author: Amber K.
fried combo.review: My husband, in-laws, and I visited Fog Harbor Fish House a few weeks ago, after finding it here on Yelp.  It was really great!  I had the Crab Cake Entree and the crab cakes were really flavorful, full of crab and not too much filler.  My husband had the Fried Combo, which includes fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.  It was like fried seafood heaven!  I tried some of his calamari and it was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all, and lightly breaded.  Yum.  My father-in-law had the Seafood Cioppino (crab, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in tomato broth, with or without pasta).  They even offer to crack the crab for you, for a few bucks extra, which gets you more crab meat.  It looked fantastic!  And lastly, my mother-in-law got the Fish & Chips, which had an incredible beer batter.  Also, I must highlight that the coleslaw was fantastic:  crunchy cabbage and not overly creamy.  The views of the bay are also beautiful and we enjoyed snapping shots of Alcatraz from our table. It also has a classy, relaxed atmosphere that was even nicer than I imagined from the reviews and price range designation.  I would have liked options for sides (fries came with everything, but I like variety).  Basically, this is a great place to go if you want delicious seafood and great service, with gorgeous views.

excerpts: My niece ordered the fried combo (shrimp, calamari and deep-fried fish)...another big portion.
fried combo.author: Mary S.
fried combo.review:
So, we went to Alcatraz on Saturday and wanted to have lunch in the city. We decided to walk down to Pier 39 and spotted Fog Harbor (formerly Chic's) The front waiting area had a lovely fireplace with waterfalls on either side. It was very inviting, so we went in.

The place is all white tablecloths and beautiful views. It was semi-crowded and smelled really good.

Our waitress Claudia was extemely friendly and helpful. She brought our drinks right away and sourdough bread just out of the oven. Yum! We all ordered crab dishes. When in San Francisco you have to get the seafood, yes?

I had the Bloody Mary (spicy), it was decent. The bf had the Angel Island Iced-Tea, he said was very refreshing. Some of us ordered the crab melt. The crab was delicious and the fries were hot and crispy. The bf ordered the crab louie...it was huge! He ate the crab and said it was good. My niece ordered the fried combo (shrimp, calamari and deep-fried fish)...another big portion. I didn't try any but everyone else did so it must have been good.

All in all a pleasant dining experience. Great service. Good food. Great view. The best company. A little pricey, but hey, it's the city. It was worth it.

If you are in the area of Pier 39, give Fog Harbor a try.

P.S. Alcatraz was a lot of fun. Should have gone there years ago.

excerpts: I really like their fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, calamari, fries, served with tartar sauce and a red sauce and cole slaw)).
fried combo.author: John B.
fried combo.review:
I been here a few times.

Service is always great!

Drinks are really good.

I really like their fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, calamari, fries, served with tartar sauce and a red sauce and cole slaw)).

My wife had the special of the day. Salmon stuffed with crab meat. She really likes this place.

It has a great view of Alcatraz since it's on the top floor.

I would go back with no hesitation.

excerpts: I ordered the Fried Combo which was $20, and it came with a hefty plate of fried calamari, octopus, shrimp, filet, and chips.
It also came with cole slaw which was too spicy because of the overload of horse radish.
The bread bowl clam chowder was delicious, but the bits of clam meat was not sufficient-it can be more accurately described as potato soup with clam.
The downside to this restaurant is the ridiculous taxes they charge.
The tab was charged a 3.5% heatlh fee on top off of the price of the meal which is then taxed at a sales tax of 10%.
Overall, the food was great and the dining was pleasant.
fried combo.author: Carol S.
fried combo.review: This is an upscale restaurant with a nice view of the bay located at Pier 39. The server was very attentive and gladly took the 20% discount I found from the "California Welcome Center," which is located on the 2nd floor. I ordered the Fried Combo which was $20, and it came with a hefty plate of fried calamari, octopus, shrimp, filet, and chips. It also came with cole slaw which was too spicy because of the overload of horse radish. The bread bowl clam chowder was delicious, but the bits of clam meat was not sufficient-it can be more accurately described as potato soup with clam. The downside to this restaurant is the ridiculous taxes they charge. The tab was charged a 3.5% heatlh fee on top off of the price of the meal which is then taxed at a sales tax of 10%. Overall, the food was great and the dining was pleasant.

excerpts: Others took home what was left of the fried combo plate.
Although they said they did not like the fish.
The cocktails looked nice but not special.
Supposedly had 2 types of rum in my drink but could hardly taste it.
My friend ordered a pomegrante "daquiri" which the menu read $4 because it was a 'virgin'.
She was charged $9 for an actual cocktail.
It was corrected.
They were nice enough to split the checks three ways for the 8 of us.
I got a free dessert for my birthday.
Warm chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.
Which we shared because we were too full for individual desserts.
The decor is clean and the windows are huge & give a nice view of the piers.
Got parking validated.
Not sure if I would ever go back since I hardly ever go to Pier 39.
But overall not a bad experience.
fried combo.author: M C.
fried combo.review:
(3.5 stars)
Based on my experience and the comments of my friends.
We were about 20 mins early for our reservation, but were seated right away. Table was set & ready. Got service right away.
Enjoyed the appetizers: shrimp, bleu cheese toast & my friends had 2 orders of raw oysters. They really enjoyed those.
The entree portions were ample. I finished my crab cake sandwich and fries. Others finished their tuna and shrimp scampi. Others took home what was left of the fried combo plate. Although they said they did not like the fish. 
The cocktails looked nice but not special. Supposedly had 2 types of rum in my drink but could hardly taste it. My friend ordered a pomegrante "daquiri" which the menu read $4 because it was a 'virgin'. She was charged $9 for an actual cocktail. It was corrected.
They were nice enough to split the checks three ways for the 8 of us. 
I got a free dessert for my birthday. Warm chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. Which we shared because we were too full for individual desserts.
The decor is clean and the windows are huge & give a nice view of the piers. 
Got parking validated.
Not sure if I would ever go back since I hardly ever go to Pier 39. But overall not a bad experience.

excerpts: Cioppino: loads of seafood.
A big portion.
The tomato sauce is very flavourful.
A must try.
cioppino.author: David T.
cioppino.review:
Extremely busy restaurant on the second level of Pier 39. Around a 30 minute wait at 7pm on a Tuesday. Despite being busy the service was very good.

Clam chowder bread bowl with dungeness crab: one of the best in San Francisco. Very tasty and big chunks of seafood. The bread bowl itself was nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Cioppino: loads of seafood. A big portion. The tomato sauce is very flavourful. A must try. Best I ever had.

Overall a great meal and service.

excerpts: I felt like I had to do the cioppino since it's an SF classic, and I enjoyed it!
I much prefer olive oil based sauces or a white sauce to red sauces, but the seafood was all so fresh and delicious, I didn't even mind.
cioppino.author: Brianna N.
cioppino.review:
Fog Harbor 100% lived up to the high expectations I had after reading so many great reviews!

This cute spot is on Pier 39, so at first I thought, oh no! It's a tourist trap! But it was a damn good one! The view overlooking the bay is stunning and can be seen from a majority of the tables in the dining room.
