I had to get the hibiscus margarita when I saw it won best margarita in San Francisco; it did not disappoint! Soooo good, if you're feeling a cocktail, go for this one! 

For a little app, my husband and I split a bowl of the clam chowder (which they kindly split into two cups for us) with the dungeness crab. Holy. Smokes. It's honestly the best clam chowder I've ever had. I'd say it's a must-order from this place. For the mains, the hubbs got the sea scallops with crab risotto. He  said it was the best risotto he's ever had and grudgingly gave me a bite- it was amazing! I don't think I would have shared had it been mine (jk, kind of). I felt like I had to do the cioppino since it's an SF classic, and I enjoyed it! I much prefer olive oil based sauces or a white sauce to red sauces, but the seafood was all so fresh and delicious, I didn't even mind. I'm really glad I tried it!

Don't let not getting a reservation keep you from going. We went for a late lunch/early dinner (around 4 o'clock on a Tuesday) and didn't even have to wait. This was my fave meal of our SF trip, highly recommend!

excerpts: Of course we had to have the Cioppino which was fantastic.
cioppino.author: Ralph R.
cioppino.review:
Went for lunch while in San Francisco. It's a large Restaurant on Pier 39 on the upper level. The window seats overlook the harbor and the "Sea Lion Resting Area". 
We started with the award winning clam chowder and I could certainly see why it won the award. It was delicious. So was the Dungeness Crab cocktail. 
Of course we had to have the Cioppino which was fantastic. The steamed whole Dungeness Crab was well received. And the Crab Ceviche was outstanding. 
Not only was the food very good, so was the service.

excerpts: Clam chowder, scallop and crab risotto, calamari, cioppino are to die for.
I truly wished that had a location in Las Vegas
so I can experience the wonders of this restaurant more often.
Whenever I visit SF again this will definitely be on the list!!!
cioppino.author: Victoria K.
cioppino.review: Seriously the best!! Clam chowder, scallop and crab risotto, calamari, cioppino are to die for. I truly wished that had a location in Las Vegas so I can experience the wonders of this restaurant more often. Whenever I visit SF again this will definitely be on the list!!!

excerpts: We ordered the calamari, caesar "salad", cioppino and the filet mignon topped with crab.
Everything was delicious along with the bread and butter they serve you while you wait for your food.
The calamari came out very quickly.
cioppino.author: Cynthia C.
cioppino.review:
My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday dinner. We were seated at a window seat during sunset and it was perfect.
The waiter was extremely sweet and very attentive during the evening as it slowly got busier in the restaurant full or tourists, definitely not a locals spot especially since its on Pier 39.

We ordered the calamari, caesar "salad", cioppino and the filet mignon topped with crab. 
Everything was delicious along with the bread and butter they serve you while you wait for your food. The calamari came out very quickly. The best part was that he asked "if we ready for our entrees" instead of just throwing them onto the table and being stuck with all the food. 

LET ME TALK TO YOU ABOUT THE DESSERT!!! 
So they bring out a plastic version of the desserts they offer so you can see what they have to offer. I immediately said "everything!" it all looks so good! But since we were sharing i went for the Duo dessert which was the creme brulee and chocolate molten cake with ice cream. TO DIE FOR! I did not care how full I was I wanted to finish the dessert. Next time I'm trying the banana pudding.

excerpts:
so

I ordered the steamed clams to start and to me although tasty, it was overly salted and smothered in corn- to me not successful

I also had their famous Cioppino which seemed to lack flavor- disappointed
cioppino.author: Gregg B.
cioppino.review:
I was really looking forward to eat at Fog Harbor

The reviews and photos on yelp made this place seem great

I walked over from my hotel and sat at the bar to watch the NBA playoffs with the SF Bay in the background- not a bad setting

Ordered a beer and a Prisoner wine

So far all was good- but the food to me was so so

I ordered the steamed clams to start and to me although tasty, it was overly salted and smothered in corn- to me not successful

I also had their famous Cioppino which seemed to lack flavor- disappointed

I don't know if I will come back- next time I go to Sotto Mare to try that

excerpts: * Cioppino ($34) - Ok to be fair, by the time this came out, I had stuffed myself silly with sourdough bread and the above two dishes.
This was still amazing though.
Very flavorful and wonderfully decorated with an abundant of seafood.
No tough pieces, everything
F R E S H. Note, they provide you bibs so don't be afraid to get the cioppino the normal way (and opt out of the additional $6 services for the ready-to-eat way).
cioppino.author: Vickie Z.
cioppino.review:
Don't let the location of Pier 39 scare you off as a tourist trap. Having lived in the city for over 3 years, this is one of THE BEST seafood places I've ever had. Recommend making reservations so you can ask for a window seat next to the water... oh, and the seals.

The meal: 
* Clam chowder ($9 for bowl) - This is their award-winning clam chowder. Wowza, I could see why! Forget Boudin, this is the winner right here. They give you so much variety and freshness of seafood in this bowl of goodness right here. Plus, no need for a bread bowl when they serve complimentary sourdough bread for the table. IMO, dipping the bread and soaking up all the chowder flavor is much better than having a bread bowl. Mmm!

* Jumbo Scallop & Crab Risotto ($35) - SEASONAL ITEM. Wow again. These were some of the best scallops I've ever had in my life. They were so buttery and juicy and perfectly seared. The risotto was creamy and the crab made it even more flavorful. The dab of pesto was a nice touch. 

* Cioppino ($34) - Ok to be fair, by the time this came out, I had stuffed myself silly with sourdough bread and the above two dishes. This was still amazing though. Very flavorful and wonderfully decorated with an abundant of seafood. No tough pieces, everything F R E S H. Note, they provide you bibs so don't be afraid to get the cioppino the normal way (and opt out of the additional $6 services for the ready-to-eat way). 

All their menu items come from 100% sustainable seafood. Additionally, service was wonderful. They knew we were sharing all items, and split our entrees into two beautifully plated dishes. Everything was divine.

excerpts: We ordered crab ceviche, cioppino and a blueberry seltzer drink.
cioppino.author: Attosa C.
cioppino.review:
My second time coming here and my second time being very impressed. It was packed both times, but wait was fine because I used OpenTable to reserve. 

Our server was nice and made plenty of suggestions. We ordered crab ceviche, cioppino and a blueberry seltzer drink. 

The food was EXCELLENT. Even came with a basket of freshly baked sourdough rolls and soft butter. We were so full by the end, but the food was so good, we were mopping it up. 

Very nice scenery as there are massive windows overlooking the pier. Everyone's got a great view, but I was happy to be at the window!

excerpts: The Cioppino also taste very good, rich in flavor.
cioppino.author: Irene X.
cioppino.review:
Great seafood restaurant at Pier 39! At first I thought this place is one of the tourists trap but I am glad I gave it a try!
I can say this restaurant is upscale, in terms of service, food quality, atmosphere and of course the price.
The restaurant's lobby is pretty cool with the fireplace and sofa to relax with a glass of cocktail while waiting for your table.
We got one of the best seat overlooking the ocean/pier.
The server is very good explaining what to choose from the menu. 
The Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab taste very good, the crab meat is enough to make me full.
The Cioppino also taste very good, rich in flavor.

If you happen to be at Pier 39 and feeling hungry, I would recommend to stop by at Fog Harbor Fish House Restaurant!

excerpts: I ordered the lazy cioppino (recommended by our waiter vs. the regular cioppino) which was an added $5.
I really wanted seafood
and I figured this is the best way to get a taste of a little bit of everything!
My husband went with our waiter's suggestion as well -- the Alaskan Halibut which came with pearl couscous, angula pesto, and a balsamic glaze.
Getting my cioppino "lazy" was totally worth it.
I didn't have to spend time trying to break the crab legs and digging the meat out which often times is frustrating for me.
I just want to eat!
Lol.
The scallops were cooked perfectly, the crab delicious, and all the flavors married well.
I'm more of a white / cream sauce type of girl, but the tomato broth was really delicious and had a bit of a kick to it as well.
My husband absolutely loved his dish.
He noted that it needed a bit of salt, but concluded that it was the best fish he's probably ever had.
As a cook himself, he can sometimes be critical of restaurants, but not this time.
cioppino.author: Maria P.
cioppino.review:
I didn't have a specific place in mind for dinner while we were in the Fisherman's Wharf area so I pulled up the Yelp app.  Fog Harbor Fish House had the most solid reviews and was in the direction that we were heading in, Pier 39. Sweet!

We got to the Pier and realized it was on the 2nd floor of the little shopping area, but luckily there was an escalator (and we found out later an elevator) to get my kiddo's stroller up there.  Traveling with kids makes things a bit tricky sometimes, but getting to this restaurant is manageable.  They do ask that you park your stroller outside in their pretty little sitting area though and the hostesses will keep an eye on it for you.

We didn't have a reservation, but were seated right away and it seemed like we came in right before the dinner rush.  Perfect timing as always!  The restaurant has big, beautiful windows and our table looked out into Pier 39.  Now THIS is the way to enjoy the pier without having to deal with the wind and cold, folks. It was a cold, cold day and the warm restaurant was a welcomed reprieve.

The menu offers a solid seafood selection with specials featured on a separate menu.  I ordered the lazy cioppino (recommended by our waiter vs. the regular cioppino) which was an added $5.  I really wanted seafood and I figured this is the best way to get a taste of a little bit of everything!  My husband went with our waiter's suggestion as well -- the Alaskan Halibut which came with pearl couscous, angula pesto, and a balsamic glaze.  Apparently it's only available 1 month out of the year.

Our food came out quickly and from the moment we dug into our meal to the very last bite, we were ooooo-ing and aaaahh-ing.  Getting my cioppino "lazy" was totally worth it.  I didn't have to spend time trying to break the crab legs and digging the meat out which often times is frustrating for me.  I just want to eat!  Lol.  The scallops were cooked perfectly, the crab delicious, and all the flavors married well.  I'm more of a white / cream sauce type of girl, but the tomato broth was really delicious and had a bit of a kick to it as well.  My husband absolutely loved his dish.  He noted that it needed a bit of salt, but concluded that it was the best fish he's probably ever had.  As a cook himself, he can sometimes be critical of restaurants, but not this time.  Our bellies were full and praises were sung.

We were pleasantly surprised and impressed with our experience.  Our waiter was so attentive and never left us waiting or wanting.  He came out with the dessert menu, which is actual examples of the desserts arranged on a tray, but I was full and content.

I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try fresh seafood with a great view!  You're in the Bay after all!  Just get there early as the restaurant was PACKED by the time we left.

excerpts: My Wife ordered the Cioppino and added noodles to it.
Not only that dish was yummy, it was freakin' HUGE!
So much seafood!!!
I would highly recommend getting the Cioppino with noodles.
cioppino.author: Maikell B.
cioppino.review:
Great views, great customer service, great food!

Me and my family had an awesome experience at Fog Harbor Fish House. Got lucky no wait. Then luck kicked again with a great view of the ocean and Golden Gate Bridge! Our waitress was on top of everything. Filling our waters, making sure everything was okay and she even through in a little jokes. I wish I remembered her name. 

I ordered the Clam Chowder w/ Lobster...or crab. One of those. The clam chowder was nice and creamy. Not too thick and not too thin. Just perfect. 

My Wife ordered the Cioppino and added noodles to it. Not only that dish was yummy, it was freakin' HUGE! So much seafood!!! I would highly recommend getting the Cioppino with noodles. Perfect combo. 

We both ordered the Calamari. Hands down, the best Calamari I've ever had in my life! The outside was flakey while the inside was a very soft but chewable piece of seafood meat. I would probably come here and just order the calamari to go if that's possible.

I would love to come back and dine here again. This place definitely deserves 5 stars.

excerpts: The chowder and cioppino were solid.
The service was spot on.
As a side note, the Harbor gestapo police are really over the top.
I found this out the hard way a few years ago.
Be aware: the restaurant has its own doors  but you still need to PAY for them.
cioppino.author: Tori B.
cioppino.review:
This is a solid seafood restaurant overlooking the harbor. The chowder and cioppino were solid. The service was spot on.
As a side note, the Harbor gestapo police are really over the top. I found this out the hard way a few years ago. Be aware: the restaurant has its own doors  but you still need to PAY for them.

excerpts: I also tried a little of the cioppino and it was really good.
cioppino.author: Dorothy L.
cioppino.review:
This place is great for a date or a nice dinner! The view is spectacular and the ambience of the restaurant is very nice and dim.

For starters, we got the crab cakes. It was very soft and yummy. I think it had a really good texture and the overall taste was pleasant. 8/10

Next, we got half a dozen of raw oysters and it was not worth the price. It was really really small oysters and I have definitely gotten bigger and better tasting oysters for a cheaper price. 2/10

I had the lobster tail and it was good but not spectacular. I felt that it was over priced because it didn't taste any different than other lobsters I have eaten before. The mash potatoes were really buttery and the beans were also really crunchy and tasty. Overall, it was delicious but not worth the price. 7/10

I also tried a little of the cioppino and it was really good. The tomato sauce was very tasty but they gave very little crab in my opinion. 

In terms of quantity, I think this restaurant is on the pricier side since it is located in a very touristy area. Also, at the beginning of the meal, they only served two small pieces of bread which I thought was strange since most restaurants give a large bread basket. However, I would come back here for a special occasion and try their crab.

excerpts: The Cioppino is a classic and was excellent (and we got it 'lazy', which means for a few dollars more they de-shell the crab for you!)
cioppino.author: Jeffrey S.
cioppino.review:
Great food, lovely view, fun location, a bit pricey (as expected).

Right in the heart of Pier 39, on the second floor, gives a lovely view of the piers and the Bay. It can get crowded (mostly with tourists), but even as an SF resident I think this place has some of the best seafood (at relatively reasonable prices, considering the location, and quality and quantity of food) in town. I've been to many other fancier seafood places all around SF and I usually find their portions small and their prices even higher than here!

The garlic sourdough bread with Pt. Reyes blue cheese appetizer was great and incredibly flavorful. The Cioppino is a classic and was excellent (and we got it 'lazy', which means for a few dollars more they de-shell the crab for you!) and the Shellfish platter was full of mussels, clams, crab legs, and shrimp in a lovely butter sauce.

excerpts: The Cioppino was amazing
I ordered it lazy style, for $6 more, found only one shell
but that didn't bother me.
The hibiscus margarita is to die for and definitely recommend to those who don't want that strong of a taste drink.
cioppino.author: Britt A.
cioppino.review:
The Cioppino was amazing I ordered it lazy style, for $6 more, found only one shell but that didn't bother me. The hibiscus margarita is to die for and definitely recommend to those who don't want that strong of a taste drink. The top "froth" comprises from the egg white was a great addition to your typical margarita. 

The tuna entree (not appetizer) was also delicious. Presentation of it was beautiful as well. Portion size of tuna was great. It is rare so be warned if you're not into it. 

If you are a AAA member go go customer service in the Pier before eating bc they usually have a 20% coupon for you to use to eat there and a parking validation as well. The restaurant also does validation if you need it.

excerpts: The cioppino was really good.
The dish has a strong tomato base and there was a good amount of seafood.
cioppino.author: Helen C.
cioppino.review:
This place is filled with tourists, given that it's located at the Wharf. However, Fog Harbor is a great restaurant for those visiting SF and want a taste of Bay Area seafood. They have local dishes such as Dungeness crabs, clam chowder, and mussels. The interior is a little "formal" looking and there's a cozy outdoor patio area to wait at. There's a lot of windows at the dining room to see the views of the waters. Unfortunately, we went at night, so we couldn't get to see much.

Since they ran out of shrimp cocktail, we opted for the Dungeness crab cocktail. Fresh and great compliment to the other salty dishes we had. We also ordered oysters and crispy calamari. The calamari was crispy and an easy dish to share with the table.

The cioppino was really good. The dish has a strong tomato base and there was a good amount of seafood. Pro tip: dip the sour dough bread with your leftover soup. 

The only downside was that the dishes were very salty. I was pretty thirsty afterwards.

Highly recommend checking out the seals at Pier 39 while you're here!

excerpts: I was on a mission for seafood and went with the Cioppino.
Man, am I glad I did.
cioppino.author: Brittany B.
cioppino.review:
Oh how I absolutely LOVE this place.  We walked over on a Wednesday evening without a reservation and had a little wait but were fortunate enough to sit by the windows at sunset.  It set the mood beautifully.  I was on a mission for seafood and went with the Cioppino. Man, am I glad I did. The broth is complex and complements the varied seafood (crab, salmon, another type of fish, clams, mussels, and shrimp) so well! My ONLY note is that the shrimp was overdone by the time I got to it.  Everything else was tender and delicious.   I was disappointed I hadn't saved the intro sourdough rolls to soak up more of the broth.  

My guy got the cod and I only tasted a bite but similar sauce complexity and complements to the fish.  It's a pricey meal but very worth it here.

excerpts: and I also had the cioppino which had, crab legs, fish, scallops and shrimp, best I ever had.
Great service too and out
parking was validated for an hour.
Was with the drive into the city.
cioppino.author: Liz G.
cioppino.review: Fresh delicious food. I had the steam clams, my husband had the surf and turf and I also had the cioppino which had, crab legs, fish, scallops and shrimp, best I ever had. Great service too and out parking was validated for an hour. Was with the drive into the city.

excerpts: I suggested the cioppino to him but he was skeptic at first because he didn't want to be let down.
Luckily, I checked a yelper's tip first and a yelped suggested a linguini added.
My Hubby loved it!
We had calamari and steamed mussels for appetizer; it was delicious!!!
My chowder was excellent!
Our son, well he finished everything on his plate!
cioppino.author: KK M.
cioppino.review:
Our server's name was Curtis the Courteous! He was a wonderful server right from the beginning. He was pleasant, detailed and spoke with class. He definitely made our trip to Fog Harbor Fish House a five star.

My son has been asking for some steamed clams and I've been craving for some chowder; then hubby just wanted to tag-along. I suggested the cioppino to him but he was skeptic at first because he didn't want to be let down. Luckily, I checked a yelper's tip first and a yelped suggested a linguini added. My Hubby loved it! 
We had calamari and steamed mussels for appetizer; it was delicious!!! My chowder was excellent! Our son, well he finished everything on his plate! He ordered the steamed clams with linguini. Lastly, don't forget their non-alcoholic drinks. I enjoyed the strawberry nojito! They even served fresh squeezed orange juice and lemonade.

We will definitely return.

excerpts: I tried their lazy seafood cioppino and it was hearty, full, and flavorful.
I also enjoyed their skinny mocktails.
I almost went back a second time but therewere just too many places in SF to try instead of frequenting a place twice
that I just had an ok dining experience.
The food was definitely tasty, but the wait and a preoccupied waiter killed my overall dining experience.
cioppino.author: Ramona G.
cioppino.review: If I could give this place a 3.5 stars I would, but 4 is suited in this case opposed to just a 3! They are packed which is a great sign, the food offerings are plentiful, and the staff are definitely on their toes with such a full house. However, i found the food to be good, but the wait time for my waiter to assist me to be longer than I would have preferred. I tried their lazy seafood cioppino and it was hearty, full, and flavorful. I also enjoyed their skinny mocktails. I almost went back a second time but therewere just too many places in SF to try instead of frequenting a place twice that I just had an ok dining experience. The food was definitely tasty, but the wait and a preoccupied waiter killed my overall dining experience.

excerpts: I got the Cioppino.
At first I thought about getting the Lazy Cioppino (no shells), but part of the fun of seafood is eating with your hands!
The scallops were HUGE!
Do you see the chunk of white on the right of my picture??
That was one of the scallops!!
The crabs were already cracked so it was easy to get the meat out.
They provide the cracker and a tiny fork
but I didn't need it at all.
I also tried some of my coworker's Lobster Tail, which I was also contemplating but my Cioppino was DEFINITELY the winner.
The Lobster Tail was way smaller than I expected, and kinda dry.
cioppino.author: Athena C.
cioppino.review:
When my supervisor asked me for food suggestions for the team outing, of course I decided to go all out on seafood by the bay. It's right down the street from our entertainment, SF Dungeon.

We made reservations for 5:00pm but our show ended much earlier (3:00pm). Instead of walking around or hitting a bar for 2 hours, we went to the restaurant to see if we could get seated early. When we mentioned our reservations, the lady at the front desk was all "Soooooo you came now...?" Obviously? But there were TONS of open tables. Who eats at 3:00pm??? But I bet if we actually arrived at the time of our reservations, we would've gotten a table by the window. Kinda disappointed about that but not the restaurant's fault.

A coworker and I went directly up to the bar to order drinks because we wanted the drinks on a separate tab. I got the Lipstick Lemondrop and he had the Alcatraz Escape. Both were great. Couldn't taste alcohol at all but definitely felt it. I LOVE that.

I got the Cioppino. At first I thought about getting the Lazy Cioppino (no shells), but part of the fun of seafood is eating with your hands! The scallops were HUGE! Do you see the chunk of white on the right of my picture?? That was one of the scallops!! The crabs were already cracked so it was easy to get the meat out. They provide the cracker and a tiny fork but I didn't need it at all. The fish they used was SALMON, my favorite! The tomato soup was DELICIOUS with chunks of tomato in it. $34 for all that? I'd say it was definitely worth it.

I also tried some of my coworker's Lobster Tail, which I was also contemplating but my Cioppino was DEFINITELY the winner. The Lobster Tail was way smaller than I expected, and kinda dry. The melted butter didn't help very much with flavor.

We wrapped it up with dessert. I thought the way they present dessert was VERY smart. They have all their desserts brought to you on a tray, then they introduce each one. I asked our waiter what he recommends personally and we ended up with two: House-made Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and Strawberry Shortcake. The brulee was good, but the shortcake was better IMO. Super soft shortcake with whipped cream and fruits drowning in syrup. Not SUPER sweet either.

The only thing I regret now is my coworkers knowing how much I eat...

excerpts: The cioppino is delicious (get the "lazy" version)
, I've had the chowder and crab cakes and a few of the "seasonal" dishes.
cioppino.author: Kate M.
cioppino.review:
Fog Harbor is definitely a good spot for tourists looking for a nice seafood dinner.  I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat here if I were a local though.  

I've been to Fog Harbor a few times over the years, I've never had a bad experience here.  The cioppino is delicious (get the "lazy" version), I've had the chowder and crab cakes and a few of the "seasonal" dishes.  All have been very good.  

The service has been reliably good as well.  They are clearly going for an upscale experience and the times I've visited they've hit the nail on the head.  

Again, it's a touristy place, so Pier 39 is the right place for Fog Harbor.  If that's what you're looking for, you're in the right place.

excerpts: Cioppino -
Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food.
So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth.
It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out.
This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino.
The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time.
cioppino.author: Shannen R.
cioppino.review:
Two words: Tourist Trap.

Located in Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House sits on the 2nd Floor amongst many restaurants. It's outdoor waiting area is relaxing, spacious, and modern. It felt like I was sitting on a daybed in Hawaii and my parents can second that. 

Fancy? Yes. Pricey? Sure. Food content? As Yelp suggests, it is A-Ok.

I took my parents and siblings out to eat and only waited for 10 minutes to get seated. For a Monday afternoon, this place was already busy. Our host led us to our booth overlooking the pier and boy was that a treat. 

The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn. It was a little salty for my taste but my parents loved it!

Clam Chowder - Cup vs. Bowl - What should you get? Well, my sister and I ordered the cup size, which really is a size of an espresso cup. It was good enough to fill that clam chowder craving. My mom had the bowl. We all concurred that the chowder tasted pretty bland. Our waiter even forgot to give us crackers - whomp! 

Salmon - Yes, you've read that right. The plate is called Salmon. My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it. He gives it 4 stars.

Cioppino - Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food. So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth. It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out. 3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!: Mom and sister had to share this one out. They barely finished the whole plate. This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino. The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time. 5 stars.

Surf and Turf: Brother wanted some meat so he settled for this. He demolished his steak and lobster but says his veggies and mash potatoes were gross. 4 stars.

Drinks:

The  "Perfect Hibiscus Margarita" was really perfect. It was beautifully decorated and STRONG. My dad even tried it and got tipsy with this look deceiving drink. 5 stars. All that for $13.50? What a steal.

My dad's Lombard Lemonade was a refreshing drink. Again beautifully decorated and well worth the price.

Large portions, beautiful plates, and bomb drinks. And would you take a look at that seafront view?!

So why three stars?

Well, the food was A-Ok. It sure wasn't bad but it definitely didn't blow me away either. Solid 3 stars.

excerpts: My girl had the Cioppino and could not stop commenting on how phenomenal it was.
She said it was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.
That being said....
we'll definitely be back on our next San Fran adventure!
cioppino.author: Victor B.
cioppino.review: On our recent trip to San Francisco we decided to dine at Fog Harbor and boy were we glad!  This place is delicious, even for me that isn't too huge of a seafood fan.  We were seated overlooking the little harbor and pier where the seals usually hang out so that made it even better.  I had the seared pacific cod with white beans, chorizo butter, roasted tomatoes, spinach, basil, cilantro, topped with a garlic shallot aioli.  The sauce was amazing!  So delicious I could have definitely had more and just sopped it up with some sourdough.  My girl had the Cioppino and could not stop commenting on how phenomenal it was.  She said it was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.  That being said....we'll definitely be back on our next San Fran adventure!

excerpts: This had to be the best cioppino that I have ever had!
It was full of seafood (including lots of crab) and FLAVOR!
I got the lazy version which was well worth it after a long day of riding bikes and touring SF.
I come to SF a lot for work
and I think this place will be on my itinerary regularly.
Delicious!
cioppino.author: Minea M.
cioppino.review: This had to be the best cioppino that I have ever had! It was full of seafood (including lots of crab) and FLAVOR! I got the lazy version which was well worth it after a long day of riding bikes and touring SF. I come to SF a lot for work and I think this place will be on my itinerary regularly. Delicious!

excerpts: We got 4 cups of clam chowder, 1 baked oyster, 1 mixed grill, 1 cioppino and 1 linguin clam.
These were enough to fill us up cuz the portions were pretty generous.
In short, I liked everything we ordered
but I think everything was over-seasoned here.
Most dishes were salty and I had to drink lots of water to finish the meal.
Nevertheless, the seafood was fresh and tasty.
I's give 5 stars to Fog Harbor if its food wasn't too salty.
I hope they would mofiy their recipe to make it less salty.
cioppino.author: Nhi D.
cioppino.review:
When my friends said they wanted to have dinner at Pier 39, I immediately had to go on Yelp to find a good restaurant in this tourist trap. Fog Harbor Fish House didn't disappoint me. We came here at 6pm and luckily we were seated right away. 

Well, this place had excellent view overlooking the harbor. We were able to eat and watch the sunset at the same time. It was a memorable experience. The service was also excellent. The waiter was extremely attentive and accomodating to us. We decided to order everything together and share between us. We got 4 cups of clam chowder, 1 baked oyster, 1 mixed grill, 1 cioppino and 1 linguin clam. These were enough to fill us up cuz the portions were pretty generous. In short, I liked everything we ordered but I think everything was over-seasoned here. Most dishes were salty and I had to drink lots of water to finish the meal. Nevertheless, the seafood was fresh and tasty. I's give 5 stars to Fog Harbor if its food wasn't too salty. I hope they would mofiy their recipe to make it less salty.

excerpts: When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away.
Ooookay?
My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne.
The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free!
The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF.
Pretty good!
When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.
cioppino.author: Sarina J.
cioppino.review:
Food is pretty good, but is HEAVY. Like I still feel the clam chowder in my stomach, writing this days later. Had to knock down a star for some service issues.

Due to traffic, we barely made the 10-minute cutoff for being late to our reservation. However, we sat for a good 10-15 minutes ignored by at least 3-4 staff members, including who we would find out to be our actual waitress. Just a little after opening, it was busy but not chaotic, and we got one of the last booths in the middle facing the water. However, no one stopped by to offer water or anything for these 10-15 minutes. When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away. Ooookay? However, her attitude adjusted quickly when she came back, and was extremely accommodating and polite afterwards.

As for the food, like I said, it was heavy. We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty. The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough. I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top. We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first. But everything was cooked well.

For my entree, I got the clam chowder and Caesar salad combo, but could barely finish half of the clam chowder. My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne. I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite! The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it. The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free! The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF. Pretty good! When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.

excerpts: We got the clam chowder in bread bowl, linguini and clams, cioppino, crab and avocado salad.
They were all really good!
I highly recommend trying all of them if you can!
It's a bit pricey but understand considering the location and service.
cioppino.author: Theresa H.
cioppino.review: We went here for dinner on a weekday. There was no wait and got a table pretty quickly. Great service and food. We got the clam chowder in bread bowl, linguini and clams, cioppino, crab and avocado salad. They were all really good! I highly recommend trying all of them if you can! It's a bit pricey but understand considering the location and service.

excerpts: Get the Cioppino, you'll love it.
cioppino.author: John C.
cioppino.review: One of my favorites in town. Their staff is always professional and the food never disappoints. Get the Cioppino, you'll love it.

excerpts: - cioppino : I didn't get to try this but looked amazing.
My husband said it's good but not amazing.
I recommend you to order "lazy" one though...so that you don't need to deal with crab shells
cioppino.author: Kim P.
cioppino.review:
My family and I were looking for a place to have lunch, and I insisted that we should come here based on yelp reviews and I was right. hip hip! Everything was good except that there was this not so little fly trying to kiss on my cheek!

- strawberry basil nojito(non alcohol) : very sweet and fresh. I forgot to ask for little ice. It was literally full of ice that my drink was gone after two sips....:( 

- res chili garlic shrimp : our server warned us that it is very spicy......are you kidding me!? Not spicy at all! Booo but it was good. The plate itself was small but there were many shrimps and vegetables to share with. This was perfect with blue cheese garlic bread. 

- clam chowder : AWARD WINNING! No wonder! One of the best clam chowder I've ever had. But please order this with a cup or a regular bowl(not the bread bowl) and eat it with blue cheese garlic bread. I mean, unless you want to eat lots of breads...

- blue cheese garlic bread : the BEST dish I had here. I love love cheese and garlic and how can you go wrong when you have them with a bread!? And if you add clam chowder here...? Heavenly! But the bread is really big, big enough to share with 3people.

- lobster tail : chewy and fresh, but mashed potato and broccoli was meh :/ i ended up leaving all of them. It tasted like they didn't add any seasoning. 

- cioppino : I didn't get to try this but looked amazing. My husband said it's good but not amazing. I recommend you to order "lazy" one though...so that you don't need to deal with crab shells haha

Overall, it was great!

excerpts: For ages I've wanted to try a classic SFO Cioppino
so I did at the Fog Harbor Fish House on pier 39.
Was it crowded?
Yes!
Was it touristy?
Yes!
Was it really good?
cioppino.author: George H.
cioppino.review:
For ages I've wanted to try a classic SFO Cioppino so I did at the Fog Harbor Fish House on pier 39.  Was it crowded?  Yes!  Was it touristy?  Yes!  Was it really good?  Yes!

There was a plethora of fish and shellfish swimming in what I would consider more of a sauce than a broth with some nice sourdough on the side.  Was it a good representation of the dish?  I'm not sure but it was damn good.  

Keep it up lads, looking forward to coming back.

excerpts: I got the Cioppino, crab, fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels in tomato broth.
The broth was also under seasoned, for the most part the seafood was good though (especially the crab, seems to be a strong choice here), just not a dish that was worth $34.
cioppino.author: Luci B.
cioppino.review:
I tend to not go to restaurants with great views in touristy spots of town, as it always means the food can afford to not be top notch, but we happened to be on the Wharf and the reviews of this place were fantastic. And the setting was beautiful, the waitstaff was beyond sweet and attentive, but I am surprised at all the great reviews. 

The best thing we ordered was the crab cocktail. Like shrimp cocktail, but with extremely fresh lump crab meat. It's straightforward but the seafood is quality, it's worth getting.

The chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was really bland. We seasoning it ourselves at the table but it still didn't hit the mark. I got the Cioppino, crab, fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels in tomato broth.The broth was also under seasoned, for the most part the seafood was good though (especially the crab, seems to be a strong choice here), just not a dish that was worth $34. The fried combo (shrimp, calamari, fish with cole slaw and fries) was totally over fried. 

Overall it's a nice view, overpriced, but the raw seafood is worth getting if you find yourself here.

excerpts: I sampled the Cioppino and some fried calamari.
The entrees were a bit lackluster.
I'd definitely keep it to the light menu here and take in the view.
That's what these joints are good for.
cioppino.author: Cindy S.
cioppino.review: I usually steer clear of tourist traps but why did I fall for this one?  I guess I was obliging the group.  It was quite a scene.  You walk in and one wall is all glass so you get a fantastic view of the bay.  It was gorgeous.  Then we were started with complimentary bread - which is very good.  We had clam chowder to start which lived up to the award winning title.  The main course for me was slightly disappointing.  I had the grilled mixed seafood plate.  I sampled the Cioppino and some fried calamari.  The entrees were a bit lackluster. I'd definitely keep it to the light menu here and take in the view.  That's what these joints are good for.

excerpts: We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto.
Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice.
All of the dishes were packed with flavor!
We were too full for dessert
so we omitted from ordering
but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée!
We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House.
I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends
and I hope you have Lulu as your server!
cioppino.author: Cheryle L.
cioppino.review: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the long Labor Day weekend from San Diego and decided to make the Fog Harbor Fish House the first spot we ate at. The wait for our table took around 45 minutes which I think is pretty fair considering the restaurant's busy location. There are plenty of benches and chairs to sit and wait at which is awesome for my tired feet. My boyfriend and I were seated on the right side of the restaurant with a nice view of Alcatraz and the water. Lulu was our server who was very helpful in guiding us on what her recommendations were on the menu. We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto. Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice. All of the dishes were packed with flavor! We were too full for dessert so we omitted from ordering but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée! We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House. I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends and I hope you have Lulu as your server!

excerpts: For the main course, we ordered the lazy cioppino ($41), and our server split the dish between my boyfriend and I without us asking.
It's too much if you eat alone.
cioppino.author: Jenny N.
cioppino.review:
Amazing dinner place for date nights - classy yet casual. Located on Pier 39, which has a lot of shops to check out while waiting for your name to be called for dinner. Wait for dinner wasn't long at all - maybe 15 minutes in total without a reservation on a Saturday night at 8pm.

We started off with the Mussel Fries ($16), which I HIGHLY recommend just because I'm a fry person. But also because it's actually delicious with the sauce and mussels. My boyfriend and I also split a clam chowder bread bowl ($11), but I recommend getting a regular bowl and using the complimentary sourdough bread to dip since you don't want to get full off of bread. For the main course, we ordered the lazy cioppino ($41), and our server split the dish between my boyfriend and I without us asking. It's too much if you eat alone. We also ended up sharing a dessert plate with chocolate cake and creme brûlée, very light & delicious even when you're full. 

Parking isn't bad... there's a parking garage that's located right across the street from pier 39 which is super convenient because we didn't want to waste time looking for street parking. Again, it's not a bad price...IF YOU DON'T LOSE YOUR PARKING TICKET. I cannot stress this enough. The parking ticket is your GOLDEN TICKET. Each hour is $10, with a max at 5 hours. You can get your ticket validated and get the first hour free. Our ticket would've have cost $10 since we only stayed for 2 1/2 hours, and we wouldve gotten the ticket validated. HOWEVER, we lost it and had to pay the max fee ($50), WHICH IS OUTRAGEOUS (I was very sad). Other than this, Fog Harbor would have gotten a 5 star review but parking wasn't an amazing experience :(

excerpts: I had the clam chowder and cioppino which were hearty and delicious.
The food fills you up quickly, so be careful not to order too much!
cioppino.author: Janet C.
cioppino.review: Beautiful restaurant located at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. I was lucky enough to get the window table (usually fits 2). Since the restaurant is on the second floor, the view was incredible. I had the clam chowder and cioppino which were hearty and delicious. The food fills you up quickly, so be careful not to order too much!

excerpts: They serve a lot of stereotypical seafood dishes, like crab cakes, lobster, cioppino, shrimp linguini...
cioppino.author: Alice C.
cioppino.review:
3.5 stars.

This is at the infamous Fisherman's Wharf, which is why I haven't been -- I prefer local spots, not tourist spots. This is definitely one of the tourist spots, filled with tourists who are shivering from the cold of the SF bay.

They have a large bar you can hang out at before dinner, since they can be quite busy during peak season. I came here with some family who are in town and wanted to have some "authentic San Francisco seafood", and went along even though I'm not sure what that meant ;)

Turns out, the food is actually pretty decent. They serve a lot of stereotypical seafood dishes, like crab cakes, lobster, cioppino, shrimp linguini... I would say the seafood itself is decent quality but not top notch, but the portions are generous and definitely would please one's Asian family.

Waitstaff was nice, and the food arrived in good time. I'd say, however touristy it may be, if you are entertaining tourists it is a good place to go around here.

excerpts: Cioppino was hearty.
Hubby didn't regret ordering it despite the price tag.
The kid shoveled the chicken tenders in, with no complaints.
cioppino.author: Tisha N.
cioppino.review:
Popped in while exploring Pier 39.  We got there just in time and had no wait, when we left closer to 1pm there was definitely a wait.  

Worth sitting and enjoying the view.  Service was good and our waiter was attentive.  Everything is a bit more than what I would normally want to pay, but given the location, not surprised.  

Cioppino was hearty.  Hubby didn't regret ordering it despite the price tag.  The kid shoveled the chicken tenders in, with no complaints.  Actually, he didn't use ketchup.  

Fish and chips were solid.  They were breaded evenly and the hint of beer in the batter added a nice flavor.

excerpts: On both of our visits here, we ordered the cioppino (seafood stew), the clam chowder, and the bay scallops.
The seafood is all fresh, tasty, and generously portioned.
cioppino.author: Adrian A.
cioppino.review:
After a second visit today, Fog Harbor Fish House is now firmly on my list of seafood restaurants to go to when in SF. Its location on Pier 39 might initially be a turn-off if you are really just trying to scratch a seafood itch and don't relish the idea of wading through all the tourists milling around the shops. However, the food is worth it. Luckily enough, the restaurant is located on the second floor of one of the buildings closest to curbside, so not much wading is involved. 

I would describe the interior of the restaurant as "modern". The seating options are a mix of booths and standard tables, as well as space at the bar, which I think was for walk-ins. Large windows facing the moorings for the Blue & Gold tour boats lets lots of light in during the day and makes for a nice view from the window tables.

The menu is definitely geared towards seafood aficionados, though there are some non-seafood choices. As I understand it, Fog Harbor is part of the Simmons Family Restaurants group, which has several types of seafood restaurants in and around Pier 39. One thing to bear in mind is that this is the more "proper" of the group's restaurants, and is pricier as a result. 

You will be hard pressed to find better seafood for the price though. On both of our visits here, we ordered the cioppino (seafood stew), the clam chowder, and the bay scallops. The seafood is all fresh, tasty, and generously portioned. The main courses I ordered were the lobster tails on our first visit, and the scallop and crab risotto the second visit. Both dishes were phenomenal.

One thing worth mentioning is that the servers we got both times were very attentive and friendly. Our second visit was actually for a birthday lunch, which I made a note of on my reservation, and our server (Kayla) gave us a dessert on the house, complete with a candle in it! It was the tiramisu, which is definitely worth saving space for. 

In short, I am already looking forward to my next visit to Fog Harbor!

excerpts: My boyfriend had the shellfish platter and I got the lazy cioppino with linguine added.
It was worth the wait.
cioppino.author: Sokhom K.
cioppino.review:
My boyfriend and I came here last night after out Alcatraz tour to celebrate our 7 years. I knew i should of made a reservation and didn't :(. we had to wait about 45 mins for a table for 2 no biggie. The place is packed for sure. Don't knock this place because it's at pier 39. Im very picky when it comes to my seafood. 

Our server that night was Jane. She was wonderful!! She was very prompt and very courteous. I had a glass of Moscato that too me back to when I had it in Las Vegas at the Delano and she was awesome enough to get me the name. My boyfriend had the shellfish platter and I got the lazy cioppino with linguine added. It was worth the wait.

excerpts: For our entree we had the cioppino.
Our server kindly had the plate split without us even asking.
I'd been wanting to have cioppino in San Francisco for the longest time, because I found out that is where it's originated from (I found this out while looking for it everywhere in Italy LOL).
They were anything but stingy with the portion of seafood - though I wouldn't have minded a little more crab hehe.
And as this is a fish house on the harbor, the seafood was all super fresh!
But unfortunately, I've had better cioppino elsewhere.
Maybe it was something off about the broth, but I remember not feeling completely satisfied.
But my slightest bit of disappointment with my less than perfect cioppino was ceased when the dessert menu was brought out!
They all looked so good that my friend and I had trouble deciding... but luckily there was a dessert with two mini portions!
This worked out perfectly as my friend wanted the creme brulee and I wanted the dark chocolate mousse.
The creme brulee was delicious!
Sweet and perfectly glazed on top.
The chocolate mousse... sent me to heaven.
Perfect blend of bitter and sweet.
cioppino.author: Marika D.
cioppino.review:
I originally chose this place because of the beautiful view. And that did not disappoint at all. But, if you have the option, come during daytime! The harbor is a bit dark at night.

Our server was very sweet and helpful with suggestions.
My friend and I decided to share a few dishes. We started with the calamari. Tasty and not overly fried, though I can't say I would order it again. 

For our entree we had the cioppino. Our server kindly had the plate split without us even asking.
I'd been wanting to have cioppino in San Francisco for the longest time, because I found out that is where it's originated from (I found this out while looking for it everywhere in Italy LOL). They were anything but stingy with the portion of seafood - though I wouldn't have minded a little more crab hehe. And as this is a fish house on the harbor, the seafood was all super fresh! But unfortunately, I've had better cioppino elsewhere. Maybe it was something off about the broth, but I remember not feeling completely satisfied. Maybe my expectations were just too high.

But my slightest bit of disappointment with my less than perfect cioppino was ceased when the dessert menu was brought out! They all looked so good that my friend and I had trouble deciding... but luckily there was a dessert with two mini portions! This worked out perfectly as my friend wanted the creme brulee and I wanted the dark chocolate mousse.
The creme brulee was delicious! Sweet and perfectly glazed on top.
The chocolate mousse... sent me to heaven. Perfect blend of bitter and sweet. Literally just melted in my mouth.

Perfect way to start our SF trip!

excerpts: WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill!
Everything was for 10!
Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!
cioppino.author: Srdjan S.
cioppino.review: Wow! Just look at this smile! The best hostess ever! Kristina was so nice and has just the best customer service! From the time she took our reservation until we left she was really professional and at the same time personable, even though the restaurant is so busy considering it's in the tourist area. WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill! Everything was for 10! Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!

excerpts: After some delicious clam chowder to warm me up, tried their Cioppino.
Accompanied with some Pinot Gris, my god it was the best meal I've had in a long while.
cioppino.author: Average R.
cioppino.review:
The Good: Food, ambiance, service
The Bad and The Ugly: the long long wait

Cold and starving - not a situation anyone should be in.

Hankering for some seafood, we stumbled into this place, after reading reviews of nearby places. And boy was I glad that we did.

After some delicious clam chowder to warm me up, tried their Cioppino. Accompanied with some Pinot Gris, my god it was the best meal I've had in a long while. For the amount of seafood I got, it was well worth the money.

We were able to avoid the 1+ hour wait (despite being on the wait-list) by looking for some seats at the bar. The very attentive bartender made the whole experience that much better.

In short, based on what I've experienced, a definite go to at the Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: The cioppino was so amazing!
It's the only thing I order when I go there.
The fried calamari is also delicious!
Service is always on point and so is the food.
cioppino.author: Karren L.
cioppino.review: I can't believe I've never written a review for this place. I absolutely love Fog Harbor. The cioppino was so amazing! It's the only thing I order when I go there. The fried calamari is also delicious! Service is always on point and so is the food.

excerpts: You won't have to fish for it in your Cioppino (no pun intended), which by the way is phenomenal.
Beautiful waterfront views of Fisherman's wharf, casual dressy atmosphere, and they will validate your parking for an hour.
Use the parking garage across the street and walk across the catwalk to Pier 39.
cioppino.author: Tatiana V.
cioppino.review: A MUST visit for the seasfood lover! If you are looking for fresh and delicious seafood dishes, then this is your spot! Moderately priced but great quality seafood. The portions are good, the seafood is actually large. You won't have to fish for it in your Cioppino (no pun intended), which by the way is phenomenal. Beautiful waterfront views of Fisherman's wharf, casual dressy atmosphere, and they will validate your parking for an hour. Use the parking garage across the street and walk across the catwalk to Pier 39.

excerpts: I had the clam chowder, lazy Cioppino (lazy means meat is taken out of shellfish), and blackberry press.
The chowder has great consistency and pairs well with their freshly made sourdough bread.
The freshness of the seafood really came through on the Cioppini.
I almost regret mixing in the tomato sauce and taking away from the seafood, but that's just a matter a preference
and I'd still order the dish again.
cioppino.author: Don G.
cioppino.review: This place has a great view of the pier. The atmosphere is very classy and the staff gives excellent service. I had the clam chowder, lazy Cioppino (lazy means meat is taken out of shellfish), and blackberry press. The chowder has great consistency and pairs well with their freshly made sourdough bread. The freshness of the seafood really came through on the Cioppini. I almost regret mixing in the tomato sauce and taking away from the seafood, but that's just a matter a preference and I'd still order the dish again.

excerpts: I had the cioppino, and it was chock full of seafood in a beautifully seasoned broth.
My wife had the Dungeness crab in garlic butter, the flavors bounced off the plate.
We loved it so much we went back next day.
We enjoyed the beautiful view of the Bay and the sunset along with an outstanding meal.
I would highly recommend this for a wonderful waterfront seafood experience while in San Francisco.
cioppino.author: Carl T.
cioppino.review:
A delicious and relaxing place. This was my favorite restaurant while in San Francisco. 
This was our first day in San Francisco, we stumbled onto this while walking around Fisherman's Wharf and I am glad we did. We decided to come here for dinner. We had to wait for a table but that was fine by us. Every table has a view of the water. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful, and we were soon digging into delicious freshly baked sourdough bread, enjoying our drinks, and looking forward to our fish. The meal, which was served quickly, was very good, tasty and plentiful!  I had the cioppino, and it was chock full of seafood in a beautifully seasoned broth. My wife had the Dungeness crab in garlic butter, the flavors bounced off the plate.
We loved it so much we went back next day. We enjoyed the beautiful view of the Bay and the sunset along with an outstanding meal. 
I would highly recommend this for a wonderful waterfront seafood experience while in San Francisco.

excerpts: The cioppino had so much seafood that I was full after eating about half of it.
My party also ordered the risotto and linguini with clams.
Both had gigantic portions of seafood.
If you ever visit fisherman's wharf in SF, don't leave without trying this restaurant.
Make reservations in advance if you can to reduce the wait.
cioppino.author: Davis Y.
cioppino.review: This is probably my new favorite restaurant in my favorite city to visit.  The service was great, the wait was reasonable at 40 minutes on a Saturday evening, and the food was excellent.  The cioppino had so much seafood that I was full after eating about half of it.  My party also ordered the risotto and linguini with clams.  Both had gigantic portions of seafood.  If you ever visit fisherman's wharf in SF, don't leave without trying this restaurant.  Make reservations in advance if you can to reduce the wait.

excerpts: Just want to find a fancy seafood place for dinner, ordered cioppino, scallop and crab risotto, really love that risotto!
Buuuuuut, I won't tell you , my favorite is their sourdough bread...
cioppino.author: 100Foodie W.
cioppino.review: Just want to find a fancy seafood place for dinner, ordered cioppino, scallop and crab risotto, really love that risotto! Buuuuuut, I won't tell you , my favorite is their sourdough bread...

excerpts: Order the last cioppino with pasta, the sauce is phenomenal.
A bit pricy but delicious!
cioppino.author: Tom P.
cioppino.review:
Fantastic seafood dishes!
I truly was not expecting much from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but I was pleasantly surprised. 
Order the last cioppino with pasta, the sauce is phenomenal. A bit pricy but delicious!

excerpts: I chose his recommendation of the Cioppino and it was spot on!
Thanks
Justin and thanks Fog Harbor for an outstanding night.
cioppino.author: Kirk Q.
cioppino.review:
Okay don't come if you are looking for cheap. Our 2 adults and a child ticket was a cool 100. 
That being said YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. %100 FANTASTIC!!! Every single thing we ordered was over the top good. Justin our server was super friendly and helpful getting us around the menu. I chose his recommendation of the Cioppino and it was spot on! Thanks Justin and thanks Fog Harbor for an outstanding night.

excerpts: We ordered the cioppino which was very good.
We added lobster and it was very delicious.
We also ordered the fish and chips which were good but no salt.
The fish definitely needed flavor and salt.
Service was good and the restaurant is nice.
cioppino.author: Tina T.
cioppino.review: We ordered the cioppino which was very good. We added lobster and it was very delicious. We also ordered the fish and chips which were good but no salt. The fish definitely needed flavor and salt. Service was good and the restaurant is nice.

excerpts: I ordered their Cioppino it tasted good
but I wasn't taken away by it
the Crab House still has my heart
it's my favorite pier 39 restaurant
cioppino.author: Brenda C.
cioppino.review: The dim light ambiance was nice It's not a bad restaurant like the Hard Rock but its definitely typical for the pier like the pier market and the Franciscan I ordered their Cioppino it tasted good but I wasn't taken away by it the Crab House still has my heart it's my favorite pier 39 restaurant

excerpts:
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. 
My little tot had the chicken tenders. 
All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.
cioppino.author: Jennie N.
cioppino.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail!
cioppino.author: Nicole M.
cioppino.review:
My Fiancé and I had dinner at the Fog Harbor fish house over fleet week. Let me start off by JESSICA W was our server and she was beyond words AMAZING! Being from new jersey we love great customer service, and she went BEYOND THAT! 


The food was super delicious!! We had the fried scallops for appetizer and clam chowder! For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail! Super delicious 

We can go on and on but we'll leave it at: YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE !!!! 


Thank you JESSICA !!

excerpts: Food was great and I loved Cioppino !!!
I will recommend this place to my friends if they travel to San Francisco .
cioppino.author: Oleksandra A.
cioppino.review: This is the best place to have a seafood!!! I loved it. We came here and hostess was so kind with us. She asked how we are and what kind of table we would love to, her name was Olga. She is wonderful!!! Food was great and I loved Cioppino !!! I will recommend this place to my friends if they travel to San Francisco .

excerpts: The most amazing cioppino...
I have had twice now, it's a rich, warm, tomato favor broth packed with shell fish!
Very filling..
it's served with roasted garlic bread to soak up the rich broth.
Get the lazy man way..the snow crab is cracked and
you won't get Messy try to shell out the delicious crab meat.
The place was busy, but didn't wait longer than 15 minutes, service was excellent!
cioppino.author: Stacy F.
cioppino.review: The most amazing cioppino...I have had twice now, it's a rich, warm, tomato favor broth packed with shell fish! Very filling..it's served with roasted garlic bread to soak up the rich broth. Get the lazy man way..the snow crab is cracked and you won't get Messy try to shell out the delicious crab meat. The place was busy, but didn't wait longer than 15 minutes, service was excellent!

excerpts: So far the best cioppino I've had in San Francisco.
Scallops, shrimps, fish, crab and mussels were super-fresh !!!
cioppino.author: Edward M.
cioppino.review:
So far the best cioppino I've had in San Francisco. Scallops, shrimps, fish, crab and mussels were super-fresh !!!  Nice taste with the herbs and all.   

Service was fast and friendly.

Ordered takeout and it was packed well with extra sourdough bread.

excerpts: My bf had the cioppino (dont know if that's the correct spelling)
and he was not impressed.
I tried it, and it was SO.
FREAKING.
BLAND.
Like seriously, has the chef ever heard of seasoning?
It was literally just really great tasting fish drowning in a sad watery tomato sauce.
The food has so much potential if only the people cooking it knew what to do.
Maybe we came on an off day/time
but I dont think we will be returning.
Our waitress (pretty blonde girl, didnt catch her name) was very very friendly and attentive and the manager checked on us a few times which was nice.
So, the restaurant has great staff,  they just need to learn how to season their food.
I get that the restaurant is right on the water with a nice view but the prices are ridiculous.
$20 for a boring pasta dish is just a joke.
cioppino.author: Juliana F.
cioppino.review: Great service, great views, great potential. However $120+ for 2 people is ridiculous when the food is such poor quality. I got the linguine with clams and it was so bland that I was very disappointed and decided to box it up so I can take it home and just season it and fix it myself. I was looking forward to this meal since my bf and I were stuck in San Francisco dealing with passport stuff and we finally got to the restaurant after walking 3 miles. We were excited because all the photos looked delicious. Well, let me just say that the food LOOKS better than it tastes. My bf had the cioppino (dont know if that's the correct spelling) and he was not impressed. I tried it, and it was SO. FREAKING. BLAND. Like seriously, has the chef ever heard of seasoning? It was literally just really great tasting fish drowning in a sad watery tomato sauce. The food has so much potential if only the people cooking it knew what to do. Maybe we came on an off day/time but I dont think we will be returning. Our waitress (pretty blonde girl, didnt catch her name) was very very friendly and attentive and the manager checked on us a few times which was nice. So, the restaurant has great staff,  they just need to learn how to season their food. I get that the restaurant is right on the water with a nice view but the prices are ridiculous. $20 for a boring pasta dish is just a joke.

excerpts: We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you.
The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes.
The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch.
I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving.
I'm not a big drinker
We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile.
cioppino.author: David R.
cioppino.review:
My wife and I were in SF during Christmas weekend having just finished a late afternoon bay tour and needed something to warm us back up. The crowds were decent and we expected long waits regardless of where we decided to dine so we settled on splurging a little. We put our names on the wait list and after hearing the party before us (party of 4) get a 45 minute wait time we were estatic that our names were called within five minutes of putting our name on the waiting list!

The hostess seated us adjacent to the window overlooking the bay! SCORE!!! It did take about seven minutes for our waiter to come take our orders but we used the opportunity to review the menu and decide our options. We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you. The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes. The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch. I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving. I'm not a big drinker but I ended up having two more...suffice to say I enjoyed them.

Our main course was delicious. There was plenty to fill the bowl, large chunks of fish, mussels, a couple clams, and a set of large crab legs reaching out! My bowl had a large 'knuckle' that was packed with meat. As I deshelled the crab legs I observed I had amassed significantly more meat through my labor than what my wife had been provided in her 'lazy style' bowl...in other words 'don't be lazy'. The broth was equally delicious although I would have preferred a little more broth...regardless I was still able to splash some on my coat.

We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile. Very happy that we were able to enjoy a very nice dinner with an incredible view and hardly any wait.

Until the next meal,

David

excerpts: The cioppino was delicious.
cioppino.author: christopher p.
cioppino.review: Justin was an amazing server who helped me out with a food allergy and a poorly chosen entree. The cioppino was delicious.

excerpts: We ordered Lazy Cioppino, Mixed grill, Linguini&clams, California crab&avocado salad.
Everything is so fresh and yummy.
The best is Cream brûlée, creamy body with crispy top, not too sweet , perfect ending!
cioppino.author: Yen C.
cioppino.review: This is a very nice restaurant for local people and tourists . The sourdough is amazing here, everyone says so. We ordered Lazy Cioppino, Mixed grill, Linguini&clams, California crab&avocado salad. Everything is so fresh and yummy. The best is Cream brûlée, creamy body with crispy top, not too sweet , perfect ending!

excerpts: Second best Cioppino after Anchor Oyster bar.
The steak is also good too.
Love this place.
Will come back.
cioppino.author: Huey T.
cioppino.review: Second best Cioppino after Anchor Oyster bar. The steak is also good too. Love this place. Will come back.

excerpts: We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill.
The clam chowder was delicious!
I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy.
The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy.
The cioppino was sooooo delicious.
For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops.
This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that.
The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes.
I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it!
cioppino.author: Joanne Y.
cioppino.review:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)

excerpts: The cioppino and crab cakes were perfectly satisfying in the way a great meal should be.
The only downside is that the wait was long, but I think any place worth eating at down by Pier 39 will have a wait.
cioppino.author: Kate K.
cioppino.review: Maybe I fee! warm and fuzzy toward them because we had an awful dining experience the night before, but I'm giving them the 5.  The ambiance was so nice, the view was beautiful, and the service was impeccable.  Our server (whose name I unfortunately have forgotten) was very knowledgeable and especially accommodating to our young children.  The cioppino and crab cakes were perfectly satisfying in the way a great meal should be.  The only downside is that the wait was long, but I think any place worth eating at down by Pier 39 will have a wait.

excerpts: The Cioppino is a MUST and we enjoyed it tremendously.
And the butter and garlic crab as well.
While all were good, our two favourites are the Cioppino and the garlic crab.
To top the great food experience, our server, Lidia was just outstanding ...
she attended to our needs always with a smile and her food recommendations were spot-on for us.
Would highly recommend this seafood restaurant to all who visit pier 39.
cioppino.author: Patrick L.
cioppino.review:
We didn't expect to find this gem of a seafood place at Pier 39 and we were pleasantly surprised when we decided to give this place a try. The Cioppino is a MUST and we enjoyed it tremendously. And the butter and garlic crab as well. We also had their famous Clam Chowder soup as well as half a dozen oysters. While all were good, our two favourites are the Cioppino and the garlic crab. 
To top the great food experience, our server, Lidia was just outstanding ... she attended to our needs always with a smile and her food recommendations were spot-on for us. 
Would highly recommend this seafood restaurant to all who visit pier 39.

excerpts: Delicious bread (which is probably from nearby Bourdain) to start, and excellent seafood options from crab to cioppino to lobster to fish n chips to chowder.
cioppino.author: Leeyen R.
cioppino.review:
Beautiful view, and you won't have to wait if you come at lunchtime. It's by pier39 so is in the thick of tourist central, which makes it a great place to take your parents or anyone who is visiting San Francisco. You should call ahead to reserve a table by a window. 

Delicious bread (which is probably from nearby Bourdain) to start, and excellent seafood options from crab to cioppino to lobster to fish n chips to chowder. 

It's not a usual spot for locals to go, but is worth it for the view and the seafood.

excerpts: We got the cioppino.
It was delicious and huge portion with a variety of seafood items.
The service was excellent and super friendly.
cioppino.author: Arlene S.
cioppino.review: The restaurant have an amazing view of the Pier 39 and you can see the sea lions. The clam chowder is 9 dollars per bowl and it's a great portion, even enough to share among 2. We got the cioppino. It was delicious and huge portion with a variety of seafood items. The service was excellent and super friendly.

excerpts: I ordered the cioppino.
The "broth" was just tomato paste.
No seafood flavor at all.
The seafood was bland.
I've had better cioppino in San Francisco.
cioppino.author: Payman F.
cioppino.review:
Complete tourist trap!  It's in a touristy destination for a reason. 

I ordered the cioppino. The "broth" was just tomato paste. No seafood flavor at all. The seafood was bland. I've had better cioppino in San Francisco. 

Skip this place!  I wish I did. There's so many better places to eat.

excerpts: I got the cioppino -lazy style.
Did not disappoint.
Don't skip the sourdough rolls!!
So good!
cioppino.author: Colleen P.
cioppino.review: Great food and an awesome view. I got the cioppino -lazy style. Did not disappoint. Don't skip the sourdough rolls!! So good!

excerpts: Generous seafood portions in the Cioppino.
It was delicious as well as the complementary sourdough bread.
My husband loved his cod dish.
Service was Great!
We will be returning here.
cioppino.author: Linda H.
cioppino.review: Great views and romantic ambiance. Generous seafood portions in the Cioppino. It was delicious as well as the complementary sourdough bread. My husband loved his cod dish. Service was Great! We will be returning here.

excerpts: So when I wanted to try their cioppino, I asked if I can have it with crab and shrimp...
"No problem" is what I was told and I was blown away with the flavor of the sauce, the tenderness of the crab and shrimp!
This dish was large enough for 2 to share.
The warm bread they serve is great for dipping in this sauce as well as their soups (we had the amazing clam chowder).
The drinks, strawberry patron maguerita and a tequila sunrise was on point!
Then for desert we trued the duo of creme brûlée and chocolate mousse cake.
The balance of creamy, sweet, and bitterness made the desert one to remember.
I love this place and will always return.
cioppino.author: Nicole H.
cioppino.review:
This is my favorite place to eat in San Francisco!  Pier 39 is a great location, with lots of things to do.  The food here is off the hook every time I go and last night was no exception.  The service is excellent and the patrons are friendly, often striking conversations about area activities and of course the great food!  

Last night the chef made me sooo happy!! I don't like mussels, scallops or oysters.
