So when I wanted to try their cioppino, I asked if I can have it with crab and shrimp..."No problem" is what I was told and I was blown away with the flavor of the sauce, the tenderness of the crab and shrimp!  This dish was large enough for 2 to share.  The warm bread they serve is great for dipping in this sauce as well as their soups (we had the amazing clam chowder).  The drinks, strawberry patron maguerita and a tequila sunrise was on point!  Then for desert we trued the duo of creme brûlée and chocolate mousse cake.  The balance of creamy, sweet, and bitterness made the desert one to remember.  I love this place and will always return.

excerpts: My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino.
Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it.
Service was good.
Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked.
They were not as spicy as I thought they would be.
Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food.
Both the dishes tasted great.
Next time, I will try other items off menu.
cioppino.author: Ruchi S.
cioppino.review:
Pier 39 is synonymous to San Francisco. It is full of restaurants and shops. I have very fond memories of pier 39. Having clam chowder and enjoying the endless beauty of sea.. Divine. During my last visit, I got a chance to try out this restaurant. All the seats with sea view were taken, so we were escorted to the dining area in between. The menu had loads of seafood options to choose from. My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino. Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it. 
Service was good. Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked. They were not as spicy as I thought they would be. Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food. 
Both the dishes tasted great. Next time, I will try other items off menu.

excerpts: The sauces were exquisite which complemented all of the dishes (the shell platter and the cioppino) but of the two, we found the cioppino the best.
Maybe we should have opted for the lobster tail with the platter, but we were full due to the required eating while walking pier 39.
To top all of this off, we had an excellent cocktail (made of tequila) and a blondie, which is reminiscent of the pazookie, but with a chocolate nut brownie instead of a cookie, Yum!!
The only balance to all this is the damage to your wallet.
Depending on your order, it can be on the pricey side.
Honestly speaking, i was thinking of giving it a 4.5, but
our server Mel was too good that it had to become a 5.
He made dinner feel like a visit to a relative that had a lot of guest.
Accomodating and always mindful, it top the experience like whip cream
finishes a great dessert.
In not so many words... if your in the area, like seafood and good service, stop by and say hello.
You wont regret it.
cioppino.author: Bodai P.
cioppino.review: A visit to fishermans wharf always demands a bite of fresh seafood. That we did, and decided to stop by this establishment due to the menu. We had the shell platter, cioppinno, calamari and the clam chowder. I have to say none of the dishes disappoint. You could tell the freshness of the preparation, due to the texture and taste. The sauces were exquisite which complemented all of the dishes (the shell platter and the cioppino) but of the two, we found the cioppino the best. Maybe we should have opted for the lobster tail with the platter, but we were full due to the required eating while walking pier 39. To top all of this off, we had an excellent cocktail (made of tequila) and a blondie, which is reminiscent of the pazookie, but with a chocolate nut brownie instead of a cookie, Yum!! The only balance to all this is the damage to your wallet. Depending on your order, it can be on the pricey side. Honestly speaking, i was thinking of giving it a 4.5, but our server Mel was too good that it had to become a 5. He made dinner feel like a visit to a relative that had a lot of guest. Accomodating and always mindful, it top the experience like whip cream finishes a great dessert. In not so many words... if your in the area, like seafood and good service, stop by and say hello. You wont regret it.

excerpts: The cioppino was not good, at all.
Seafood in it was good
but it was a super thick sauce.
cioppino.author: Joe O.
cioppino.review:
We were STARVING  from a drive from Napa and needed a place to eat. Some friends were eating there so we joined. It's full of tourists as expected and the food isn't bad at all. The cioppino was not good, at all. Seafood in it was good but it was a super thick sauce. The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again. Clam chowder was solid. The scallops were really good.

The line was crazy outside and it's really loud.

excerpts: Cioppino - go for the lazy one.
Clam chowder, oysters= heavenly!
cioppino.author: Krystal D.
cioppino.review: This was our best meal and service in our visit to San Francisco! It was the best!! Great views and the food was delicious!!!! Unlimited sourdough bread and good prices. Cioppino - go for the lazy one. Clam chowder, oysters= heavenly!

excerpts: We also shared a cioppino which had an amazing amount of seafood from scallop, to fish, to shrimp, to crab!
I didn't particularly love the fish and found it tougher than usual.
The cioppino itself was also a bit on the fishy side and less seasoned than other places I've had it.
But then again, all restaurants do cioppino differently, so that may be their style!
cioppino.author: Sherry W.
cioppino.review: This restaurant has an amazing view and ambiance with a variety of seafood options! For dinner for 2,  we shared a large clam chowder and used it as a dip for our complimentary sourdough bread! We also shared a cioppino which had an amazing amount of seafood from scallop, to fish, to shrimp, to crab! I didn't particularly love the fish and found it tougher than usual. The cioppino itself was also a bit on the fishy side and less seasoned than other places I've had it. But then again, all restaurants do cioppino differently, so that may be their style!

excerpts: The whole crab and cioppino were fabulous.
We had a window seat and nice service.
The cioppino had very good flavor.
Rich with great seafood.
Would definitely go back.
cioppino.author: G W.
cioppino.review: The whole crab and cioppino were fabulous. We had a window seat and nice service. The cioppino had very good flavor. Rich with great seafood. Would definitely go back.

excerpts: If I come back, I'd probably try the cioppino next.
cioppino.author: Joy W.
cioppino.review:
From afar, Fog Harbor Fish House always looked like any other Pier 39 seafood restaurant to me. Upon closer inspection, it's actually very nice. The waiting area outside is a tiled patio with couches, a fireplace, and a painting above the fireplace, so it feels more like a cozy outdoor living room. 
They take reservations on Opentable, which is probably a good idea for a tourist-heavy location.
The menu includes a variety of seafood dishes and quite a few fried items. For a seafood restaurant, there is a good amount of land dishes for those who don't eat seafood. We had a cozy table by the window and enjoyed the waterfront view during dinner.

Crispy Bay Scallops ($13) - panko breaded & fried, w/ roasted jalapeno aioli:
I was hoping the scallops would have a light crunchy panko crust, but the tiny bite-sized bay scallops were completely coated in breading and unrecognizable as scallops. It was my mistake. I should have guessed panko breaded meant covered in panko. It was too much breading and a little too oily for me to enjoy them as scallops. If I knew they would have that much breading, I wouldn't have ordered this dish. It's not bad for a deep-fried snack. The thick, heavy jalapeno aioli added a little bit of a kick.

Shellfish Platter ($38 for 1, $59 for 2) - 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, oven roasted w/ butter, garlic, herbs:
The shellfish massacre presented in front of us was seasoned nicely and tasted quite fresh. The crab legs were sweet and meaty. The mussels and clams were nice and springy. The shrimp at the bottom of the plate soaked up all the buttery juices and herbs. It also came with some corn on the cob and garlic toast. 

Bread Pudding ($8.50) - topped w/ vanilla ice cream, vanilla bean sauce, dusted with cocoa powder:
Dinner was a little salty, so I wanted something sweet. I'm fond of bread pudding, so that was an easy choice. It was served warm and gooey and the edges were a little crispy.

While we ate, we enjoyed watching the sunset over the water. It made for a nice meal. If I come back, I'd probably try the cioppino next.

excerpts: I went with the Cioppino (when in San Fran!)
and it was absolutely incredible!
They also served the local Boudin Bakery sourdough which was excellent as well.
Our server was super friendly and engaging.
My only warning is the cocktails look to be a bit of a rip off.
We were sitting near the bar
and I'm here to say,
at least the night we were there, the drinks were poured with a stingy hand.
cioppino.author: Ashley W.
cioppino.review: I was really nervous as we walked up to the restaurant because you are smack tab in the middle of tourist central.  But once inside, the restaurant was warm and inviting with great views.  I went with the Cioppino (when in San Fran!) and it was absolutely incredible!  They also served the local Boudin Bakery sourdough which was excellent as well.  Our server was super friendly and engaging.  My only warning is the cocktails look to be a bit of a rip off.  We were sitting near the bar and I'm here to say, at least the night we were there, the drinks were poured with a stingy hand.

excerpts: Our dinners of the halibut, cioppino and more were all excellent!
Everyone at Fog Harbor was courteous and welcoming.
You've got lots of choices on the pier but Fog Harbor is a great choice!!
cioppino.author: Linda R.
cioppino.review: Wow! Great food and drinks! Quiana in the bar made the best drinks and Curtis was a server that knew the menu and made excellent suggestions. Our dinners of the halibut, cioppino and more were all excellent! Everyone at Fog Harbor was courteous and welcoming. You've got lots of choices on the pier but Fog Harbor is a great choice!!

excerpts: Definitely recommend the Cioppino.
Lots of shrimp and crab.
The mini sourdough loaves are very good as well.
Great place
; I'll be back.
cioppino.author: Cav R.
cioppino.review: Great location with excellent service. Definitely recommend the Cioppino. Lots of shrimp and crab. The mini sourdough loaves are very good as well. Great place; I'll be back.

excerpts:
**** award winning soup, it's delicious, recommend 
  Cioppino -
cioppino.author: Maruko X.
cioppino.review:
Ambiance 3/5: Classic and trendy decorations, comfortable seats and harbor window views

Service 2/5: very slow and forgetful, had to remind a few times to get water. Took stars off because of service. 

Food 4/5: in general great
  Clam Chowder - **** award winning soup, it's delicious, recommend 
  Cioppino - *** Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth, very bold taste, average taste 
  Shellfish Platter - **** A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs, fresh and flavorful crab, recommend 

Price 3/5: reasonably priced, expect at least $30 each plus drinks

excerpts: We had calamari for an appetizer (superb!), each got a cup of clam chowder (I added crab to mine and it was delicious), and we shared a bowl of Cioppino.
Without our asking, our server was kind enough to split our cioppino into separate bowls for us to each have our own.
The sourdough bread was also delicious.
The food came out quickly, but allowed for enough time for us to enjoy each course.
The view was amazing, and we were definitely happy with our meal.
If I come back to San Francisco for our anniversary, I will absolutely make it a point to return.
cioppino.author: Amanda W.
cioppino.review: This was an unexpectedly wonderful meal. My husband and I came to San Francisco for our honeymoon and, while we tried to avoid the touristy aspect of Pier 39, we had heard great things about Fog Harbor Fish House and opted to eat there before our trip to Alcatraz. We had calamari for an appetizer (superb!), each got a cup of clam chowder (I added crab to mine and it was delicious), and we shared a bowl of Cioppino. Without our asking, our server was kind enough to split our cioppino into separate bowls for us to each have our own. The sourdough bread was also delicious. The food came out quickly, but allowed for enough time for us to enjoy each course. The view was amazing, and we were definitely happy with our meal. If I come back to San Francisco for our anniversary, I will absolutely make it a point to return.

excerpts: I ordered the two most popular items on the menu- crab roll and cioppino.
While I was slightly disappointed by the lukewarm temperature of the soup, the crab roll was quite delectable.
Portion size is huuuuge here, so make sure you come with someone whom you can share the food with.
cioppino.author: I L.
cioppino.review:
I ordered the two most popular items on the menu- crab roll and cioppino. 
While I was slightly disappointed by the lukewarm temperature of the soup, the crab roll was quite delectable. Portion size is huuuuge here, so make sure you come with someone whom you can share the food with.

excerpts: Just popped in for a quick bite and ordered half dozen of oyster, Caesar salad, and the cioppino.
Justin H. Was our server and he was great!!
He listened very well as i said we were going to share our plates but didn't ask to split the foods.
(I know it's usually a hassle) but he did it for us anyway!
It made sharing so much easier to do!
The food is great also.. 4 stars because 5 star is rare to give.
Lol outstanding service from this server and i am thoroughly impressed.
cioppino.author: peter n.
cioppino.review: Just popped in for a quick bite and ordered half dozen of oyster, Caesar salad, and the cioppino. Justin H. Was our server and he was great!! He listened very well as i said we were going to share our plates but didn't ask to split the foods. (I know it's usually a hassle) but he did it for us anyway! It made sharing so much easier to do! The food is great also.. 4 stars because 5 star is rare to give. Lol outstanding service from this server and i am thoroughly impressed.

excerpts: We had cioppino, half shell of oysters, and linguini with clams.
And Yes!
we love seafood..
Everything came out very delicious!
My fav. is cioppino (my server reccommended)
the seafood is very fresh and the flavors are just right!
Overall, I love everything about this place.
Price is resonable for what you get...
Also the service from our server was phenomenonal...his name is Arrif?
(apologize on my spelling) he can read our mind, just provided everything that we needed!
cioppino.author: Ryan Y.
cioppino.review:
Went there with my girlfriend on Friday for dinner...We absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
The food and service are amazing. We had cioppino, half shell of oysters, and linguini with clams. And Yes! we love seafood..Everything came out very delicious! My fav. is cioppino (my server reccommended) the seafood is very fresh and the flavors are just right! Overall, I love everything about this place. Price is resonable for what you get...Also the service from our server was phenomenonal...his name is Arrif? (apologize on my spelling) he can read our mind, just provided everything that we needed!

excerpts:
Cioppino*

Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth
Was just what i needed .enjoyed
cioppino.author: Saia F.
cioppino.review:
Cioppino*

Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth
Was just what i needed .enjoyed the sauce with the fish and crab .great little buzz with the IPA lol and loved the view .ive been to cheaper places with better customer service just saying but the food was great!

excerpts: I ordered a burger which was really bland and my boyfriend got the Cioppino which was just okay.
I would not pay that price for what we got.
Granted I shouldn't have ordered a burger from a seafood restaurant, but I wasn't that hungry so didn't want to spend that much money on a dish I wouldn't finish.
But the burger was below average.
The view is nice, but I'm sure there are much better restaurants around there with better food and prices.
cioppino.author: Joyce H.
cioppino.review: This place is ridiculously overpriced for average (at best) food. I ordered a burger which was really bland and my boyfriend got the Cioppino which was just okay. I would not pay that price for what we got. Granted I shouldn't have ordered a burger from a seafood restaurant, but I wasn't that hungry so didn't want to spend that much money on a dish I wouldn't finish. But the burger was below average. The view is nice, but I'm sure there are much better restaurants around there with better food and prices.

excerpts: Amazing big portion fresh seafood cioppino!!!
The seafood is giant uc and fresh ,not to mention the amazing bridge view .
Best date spot ever , great go families too !!
I can not wait to go back again
cioppino.author: Phoebe W.
cioppino.review: Amazing big portion fresh seafood cioppino!!!  The seafood is giant uc and fresh ,not to mention the amazing bridge view . Best date spot ever , great go families too !! I can not wait to go back again

excerpts: The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch.
It's very clear they take pride in their food.
cioppino.author: Liz W.
cioppino.review: Service was great. Food was fantastic. Wine selection is on point. The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch. It's very clear they take pride in their food.

excerpts: We ordered the crab caesar salad and cioppino.
The salad was very good even though it is $28 dollars
you do get a lot of seafood and what you pay for as it did fill me up.
The cioppino was around $30 dollar as well.
You get a lot of seafood as well.
Prices yes you are going to pay up for a tourist spot, but the food was good and also the $3.45 health insurance fee as well.
The service was good and considering how crowded it was
we got our food in a decent time.
cioppino.author: Keven W.
cioppino.review: We went here during lunch and it does get crowded which was around 12pm I believe and on a weekend.  The wait for 2 people was not too bad as it was around 25 minutes.  There is a pokestop there was well with lots of lures :)  We ordered the crab caesar salad and cioppino.  The salad was very good even though it is $28 dollars you do get a lot of seafood and what you pay for as it did fill me up.  The cioppino was around $30 dollar as well.  You get a lot of seafood as well.  Prices yes you are going to pay up for a tourist spot, but the food was good and also the $3.45 health insurance fee as well.  The service was good and considering how crowded it was we got our food in a decent time.

excerpts: I ordered the clam chowder and the cioppino.
I was asked if I wanted extra crab added and I said yes.
I was surprised when the clam chowder came with a huge serving of crab meat right in the middle.
I was expecting the crab in the cioppino.
The crab was a nice addition to the soup, but it was crab, which distracted from the taste of the CLAM chowder and it was not warm, which made the soup not so hot.
The cioppino was good, but not great.
It was heavy on celery, which is not my favorite.
It was a bit underwhelming.
cioppino.author: Scott N.
cioppino.review:
I was a little disappointed.

The view was great, but since the sun was setting, the sun-blocking shades were pulled. They still let in a lot of light. The windows were open and the breezes were wonderful.

The waiter was very helpful and attentive. I ordered the clam chowder and the cioppino. I was asked if I wanted extra crab added and I said yes. I was surprised when the clam chowder came with a huge serving of crab meat right in the middle. I was expecting the crab in the cioppino. The crab was a nice addition to the soup, but it was crab, which distracted from the taste of the CLAM chowder and it was not warm, which made the soup not so hot. I thought that was odd.

The cioppino was good, but not great. It was heavy on celery, which is not my favorite. It was a bit underwhelming.

excerpts: Cioppino 5/5.
Ambience 5/5.
Service 5/5.
Everything is good here!!
cioppino.author: Stephanie T.
cioppino.review: If you have a City Pass, go claim your fun pack for a 15% discount and a free appetizer here. Clam chowder 5/5. Fried calamari 5/5. Cioppino 5/5. Ambience 5/5. Service 5/5. Everything is good here!!

excerpts: Cioppino (4+): Well-prepared seafood a-plenty.
cioppino.author: Eliot Q.
cioppino.review:
Cioppino (4+): Well-prepared seafood a-plenty. Sauce was a bit thicker than expected, and surprisingly salty (we did not notice this during the meal but ended up quite thirsty after we left)

Rock cod (4): Again, the seafood was prepared expertly (5). Chorizo white bean ragout was a disappointment (3); seemed like they left out the chorizo and the white beans were a bit al dente. 

Service (3): I have never encountered a more apathetic hostess. The way she slowly plodded through the restaurant to take us to our table was painful.

excerpts: I ordered a clam chowder, the cioppino and a clam sandwich to go.
This place is literally heaven, with perfect food, broad view of the bay and cozy atmosphere.
Everyone is chatting and laughing with their loved ones.
I came here early so there is no waiting time and the service is super nice.
cioppino.author: Tong S.
cioppino.review: I ordered a clam chowder, the cioppino and a clam sandwich to go. This place is literally heaven, with perfect food, broad view of the bay and cozy atmosphere. Everyone is chatting and laughing with their loved ones. I came here early so there is no waiting time and the service is super nice.

excerpts: I had the cioppino which was very generous with 2 plump scallops, 2 large shrimp, 3-4 mussels, 3-4 clams and fish.
The salads were tasty and sourdough fresh out of the oven.
For our table of eight they didn't add a service charge, which I thought was nice (of course we tipped generously).
Overall a very nice place to enjoy the Bay and good seafood.
cioppino.author: Ted M.
cioppino.review: The prices are high because of the view, which is unbeatable. The food is good. Service is great. Many tourists but it seems also some locals. I had the cioppino which was very generous with 2 plump scallops, 2 large shrimp, 3-4 mussels, 3-4 clams and fish. The salads were tasty and sourdough fresh out of the oven. For our table of eight they didn't add a service charge, which I thought was nice (of course we tipped generously). Overall a very nice place to enjoy the Bay and good seafood.

excerpts: **) and the cioppino (5 stars).
cioppino.author: Patrick C.
cioppino.review:
Not only was the food amazing the service was even better! We had AJ as a server and let her know that we had a plane to catch in a few hours - she put in the order all at once and we were in and out in less than 45 minutes. We had the clam chowder (5 stars), crab cake (5 stars*), garlic cheese bread (3 stars**) and the cioppino (5 stars). 

*the crab was pretty fishy, but it was neutralized when you ate it with the sauce, tomato and fruit slice. 

**too much blue cheese for my taste. Mix it with the garlic sauce and the taste was too strong (I love garlic btw)

excerpts: A couple of us ordered the Lazy cioppino, and we also had the grilled Halibut, both were amazing!
the serve fresh bread hot!
Makes all the difference in the world, with sliced butter.
The sour dough bread taste amazing and is supplied by Boudin Bakery.
The place is a must go to, and we can't wait to go back.
cioppino.author: Jimmy L.
cioppino.review: This place is one of the best! It scores A+ on all accounts: service-fantastic, location-gorgeous, food-delicious! A couple of us ordered the Lazy cioppino, and we also had the grilled Halibut, both were amazing! the serve fresh bread hot! Makes all the difference in the world, with sliced butter. The sour dough bread taste amazing and is supplied by Boudin Bakery. The place is a must go to, and we can't wait to go back.

excerpts: As for the food we ordered the seafood mix, Cioppino, fresh oyster appetizer, and muscle frys appetizer.... I will tell you the Cioppino was good
I have had a few places cook it a little better
but that doesn't mean that it was not good, the seafood mix was amazing
I loved the fresh butter and kind of garlic herb
taste it had
cioppino.author: Shannan E.
cioppino.review: For starters any place on Pier 39 is going to have a wait but they have a system where you give them your phone number and they text you when your table is ready so you can go explore around the pier while you wait. There is also a cozy fireplace and couches if you want to wait outside the restaurant. Service was great. As for the food we ordered the seafood mix, Cioppino, fresh oyster appetizer, and muscle frys appetizer.... I will tell you the Cioppino was good I have had a few places cook it a little better but that doesn't mean that it was not good, the seafood mix was amazing I loved the fresh butter and kind of garlic herb taste it had, the oysters were good and fresh (but if u just want oysters go somewhere else this place is more for a full meal dining experience) the muscle fries I wasn't a big fan of I think it had a little bit too much truffle but that's just me personally. For dessert we got the Blondie brownie which was amazing! I loved how they had a tray of all their desserts prepared for us to see and choose from. All and all the experience was a solid 4 stars..... good food, great service, and a great view from our table. Price is what is expected for a Pier 39 seafood resteraunt, not cheap but not over what we were expecting.

excerpts: We had the seared Ahi and the Cioppino were both outstanding.
cioppino.author: John G.
cioppino.review:
Great service by Martin.   Great views.   Very good prices considering the outstanding quality of the food.     

Fresh sourdough, wonderful clam chowder.    We had the seared Ahi and the Cioppino were both outstanding.  

Thanks for a great afternoon and great food and service.

Their are a lot of tourist joints at Pier 39, glad to see this is not one of them and rather a truly wonderful restaurant

excerpts:
Delicious food and incredible view 

Cioppino was amazing !
cioppino.author: Amanda T.
cioppino.review:
Delicious food and incredible view 

Cioppino was amazing ! 
Lobster was a little fatty but delicious none the less 
Look for Lidia, she was great and attentive

excerpts: another loved her cioppino.
I thought the fish & chips were just above average but the fries were crispy and tasty, and eating while looking over the bay late at night made for nice atmosphere.
A great way to end a long day that included at least six hours of driving a waiting in line for at least 30 minutes for a cable car.
cioppino.author: Mitch P.
cioppino.review:
Got to Pier 39 late tonight on the way to a weeken wedding and decided to eat here after looking on Yelp for a good place that wasn't expensive.
Sarah, our server, was very personable and attentive and made sure everything was taken care of. When we left the restaurant without getting my credit card back (who knows what I was thinking) she ran outside to give it back as well as give her special way to get a discount on Lyft.
One in our party thought the clam chowder excellent and another loved her cioppino. I thought the fish & chips were just above average but the fries were crispy and tasty, and eating while looking over the bay late at night made for nice atmosphere. 
A great way to end a long day that included at least six hours of driving a waiting in line for at least 30 minutes for a cable car.

excerpts: My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate.
Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it.
cioppino.author: Ranjan P.
cioppino.review: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.

excerpts: Cioppino plus Alcatraz Escape!
Best memories in fisherman's wharf!
Remember to get a reservation at least 2 days before your lovely dinner!
cioppino.author: Falconvic C.
cioppino.review: Cioppino plus Alcatraz Escape! Best memories in fisherman's wharf! Remember to get a reservation at least 2 days before your lovely dinner!

excerpts: I ordered the Cioppino which was loaded with seafood and had a nice slightly spicy tomato stew and it came with a giant wedge of garlic bread.
All of the dishes and cocktails we ordered were great!
Not to mention our server, Mel, was really sweet and surprised me with a birthday song with his fellow servers and a super yummy lava cake and ice cream desert.
This was our second time at this restaurant, and we will be coming back for sure.
The location is great, right on Pier 39, and the food is reasonable for quality, fresh seafood prepared right.
cioppino.author: Lisa D.
cioppino.review: My daughter and her boyfriend took my husband and I to a birthday dinner here, and it was pretty much perfect.  The manager, Sean, made sure we got a table with a water view, and he had  a pretty flower bouquet placed on our table to make it special!  I ordered the Cioppino which was loaded with seafood and had a nice slightly spicy tomato stew and it came with a giant wedge of garlic bread.  All of the dishes and cocktails we ordered were great! Not to mention our server, Mel, was really sweet and surprised me with a birthday song with his fellow servers and a super yummy lava cake and ice cream desert.  This was our second time at this restaurant, and we will be coming back for sure.  The location is great, right on Pier 39, and the food is reasonable for quality, fresh seafood prepared right.

excerpts: For example, my friends and I didn't want the crab with the bones so they got us the Cioppino with just the crab meat.
Cioppino: We ordered the usual Cioppino but when the check arrived, it said the 'Lazy Cioppino'.
I wasnt so impressed because all i could taste was tomato sauce.
cioppino.author: Sebin K.
cioppino.review:
We hit the Fog Harbor Fish house on Pier 39,Fishermans wharf for lunch. All the tables to the far end of the restaurant were full but we were lucky enough to get a table right beside the windows overlooking the sea.They definitely offer the best views of the Golden Gate bridge(as long as the skies are clear with no fog), the alcatraz island and the blue ocean.

Impeccable service, the server helped us decide between items on the menu for starters as well as the main course. For example, my friends and I didn't want the crab with the bones so they got us the Cioppino with just the crab meat.

Starters: 
Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Tangy, sweet and sour, really loved it.
Crab Cake: The meat was perfectly cooked and it was upto the reviews you'd already see on Yelp.

Main Course:
Swordfish: Impressed!
Cioppino: We ordered the usual Cioppino but when the check arrived, it said the 'Lazy Cioppino'. I wasnt so impressed because all i could taste was tomato sauce. The scallops, the mussels and the salmon were cooked however there weren't any flavors to it from the curry/sauce.

excerpts: The cioppino and clam chowder were delicious.
THe service was great!
The manager/owner gave us a table by the window with a great view of the harbor, the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz.
They were very accommodating and friendly even though we had two little ones with us and left quite a mess.
cioppino.author: Loan N.
cioppino.review: The cioppino and clam chowder were delicious. THe service was great! The manager/owner gave us a table by the window with a great view of the harbor, the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. They were very accommodating and friendly even though we had two little ones with us and left quite a mess.

excerpts: I had their seafood Penne and their Cioppino, but the king of their dishes is by far the clam chowder.
It is beautifully prepared and teases your appetite with the most exquisite flavors and tastes.
That clam chowder is remarkable among all the dishes there and I will only be going for that in the future.
The ambiance is just right and adds an extra layer to this great place.
However, if you're coming, definitely get the clam chowder, if I haven't said it enough!
You wouldn't regret it!
cioppino.author: Ronaldinhio T.
cioppino.review: I have been this restaurant only once and they have left a lasting impression on my mind. I had their seafood Penne and their Cioppino, but the king of their dishes is by far the clam chowder. It is beautifully prepared and teases your appetite with the most exquisite flavors and tastes. That clam chowder is remarkable among all the dishes there and I will only be going for that in the future. The ambiance is just right and adds an extra layer to this great place. However, if you're coming, definitely get the clam chowder, if I haven't said it enough! You wouldn't regret it!

excerpts: We had the cioppino and the filet.
Both were just delicious.
The desserts that we ended up getting for free was the chocolate cake and tiramisu, and apple with walnut.
They were also delicious.
cioppino.author: Lee K.
cioppino.review:
Our last night in San Francisco brought us here for dinner. Best meal we had this week. We were originally seated next to a large table with some very loud children, I mean LOUD. We joked about it to the waitress, who proceeded to mention it to the manager. He not only reseated us to a quieter area, but comped our desserts and was extremely apologetic, even though it wasn't his fault. 

Once we were reseated, they switched our server. Mel did an awesome job for us. He was friendly and attentive. Our service here could not have been better. Many of the restaurants have the waiter take the order and then others do all of the work. Not here. 

As far as the food, it was fantastic. We had the cioppino and the filet. Both were just delicious. The desserts that we ended up getting for free was the chocolate cake and tiramisu, and apple with walnut. They were also delicious. The cake melted in your mouth. 

We eat at a lot of excellent restaurants and I would definitely put this one up with the best of them.

excerpts: For dinner, we ordered the cioppino and linguine & clams to share.
Next time we're back
I doubt I'll try anything else off the menu because I can't wait to have both of these dishes again.
cioppino.author: Kara C.
cioppino.review:
Let me start off by saying that I can't wait for the day I come back to San Francisco again so I can come back to this incredible restaurant. The food, service, and atmosphere (especially the view!) were all impeccable. 

My fiancé and I had an early dinner reservation since we were going on a sunset sail afterwards, and got seated by the window overlooking the bay. The staff were friendly and attentive from start to finish knowing we had to leave by a certain time.

Now on to the best part, the FOOD. We ordered the calamari as our appetizer. I'm kind of a calamari fanatic and order it in every restaurant we go that has it on their menu. This was hands down the best calamari that I've ever had. For dinner, we ordered the cioppino and linguine & clams to share. Next time we're back I doubt I'll try anything else off the menu because I can't wait to have both of these dishes again. We were both pretty stuffed at this point but their dessert tray had been tempting us from nearby the entire evening that we just had to order something and that something ended up being delicious tiramisu. 

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is nearby Pier 39!

excerpts: I got the lazy cioppino and it was delicious.
It was chock full of delicious seafood in a really good sauce.
They give you a bib
but you don't need it if you got the lazy one (unless you want your friends to make fun of you...
like mine did lol).
cioppino.author: Sunia C.
cioppino.review:
Really amazing place. Came here with a group of 5 and were seated right away. Gorgeous view of the water. Very nice staff and an attentive waitress. We got calamari to start and they gave us fresh bread. The bread is AMAZING. It's hot and fresh and addicting. Calamari was pretty good. 
 I got the lazy cioppino and it was delicious. It was chock full of delicious seafood in a really good sauce. They give you a bib but you don't need it if you got the lazy one (unless you want your friends to make fun of you...like mine did lol). Friends got the burger, coconut shrimp and the mixed grill and they were all satisfied. One friend got the crab roll but it was really mayo-y and not good at all. 
Definitely my favorite spot in Pier 39.

excerpts: Best on the strip and the best cioppino anywhere!!
My wife and I went I. Just to share a cioppino and clam chowder, the server was not happy that we were not a $200 table like most...
but hey man we were in and out in 30 min.
cioppino.author: Billy F.
cioppino.review:
Great great clam chowder. Best on the strip and the best cioppino anywhere!!  Had them take the crab out of the shell to make eating easier.  

My only complaint was that the service I thought was a little rude. My wife and I went I. Just to share a cioppino and clam chowder, the server was not happy that we were not a $200 table like most...but hey man we were in and out in 30 min. You need to treat everyone the same no matter how much food they are ordering. 

Food was great, service was not...

excerpts: The cioppino was pretty good though
cioppino.author: Pattie K.
cioppino.review: The seafood was fresh and the service was good. But overall I felt I was paying more for the view as opposed to the food. The cioppino was pretty good though

excerpts: -SEAFOOD CIOPPINO (normally $30) - 5/5

[Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta]
HUGE portion!
This could definitely feed two people, but I managed to eat pretty much the whole thing by myself because it was just THAT good.
I really liked the crab and scallops in the dish - great soft texture.
The shrimp was a little chewy and the fish was a little overcooked but still good.
The broth was AMAZING.
I was already incredibly full from the seafood cioppino and wasn't planning on actually eating so much dessert, but ended up having zero self-control with this bread pudding.
Warm, gooey and flavorful.
And probably had an entire tub of butter in it :(
In fact, it looked like it was sitting in a pool of melted butter, which scared me a little.
I kind of wish I asked for it without the creme anglaise though because it just made the bread too soggy.
cioppino.author: Jessie L.
cioppino.review:
My friend and I came for dinner during Restaurant Week, which consisted of an appetizer, entree and dessert for $40. Pretty good deal in my opinion. The food is yummy and portion sizes here are HUGE. Definitely more than a normal person should be eating in a single meal.

The restaurant is on the second level of Fisherman's Wharf and has a decent view of the pier. I was expecting a very touristy atmosphere given the location, but it was surprisingly nice. Casual, nothing fancy.

Our waitress was super friendly and attentive. We were given some complimentary warm bread and butter, and the restaurant manager started off our meal with a small amuse-bouche since we decided to go with the Restaurant Week menu. Food came out quickly and the manager even brought us our check himself, along with a biscoff cookie for each of us to take home. The bill had a coupon for the Biscoff shop at the pier as well.

==============================

*** APPETIZERS ***

-1/2 GARLIC ROASTED DUNGENESS CRAB (normally $19) - 5/5
[Roasted with garlic herb butter, served with corn on the cob and fingerling potatoes]
Pretty sizable portion of crab and could probably make for a small entree. The crab meat was super soft and delicious with the herb butter! The crab itself was pretty easy to break open and eat, but definitely still very messy (they even give you a bib anticipating the mess)

-AHI TUNA POKE (normally $16) - 5/5
[Marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli]
Pretty light and fresh with a nice sweetness from the mango.


*** ENTREES ***

-GRILLED SWORDFISH (normally $26) - 3/5
[Served over ratatouille and roasted fingerling potatoes, with pesto aioli and chimichurri sauce]
Just alright, not particularly memorable. I like really soft, flaky fish and the swordfish was a little overcooked for my taste.

-SEAFOOD CIOPPINO (normally $30) - 5/5
[Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta]
HUGE portion! This could definitely feed two people, but I managed to eat pretty much the whole thing by myself because it was just THAT good. I really liked the crab and scallops in the dish - great soft texture. The shrimp was a little chewy and the fish was a little overcooked but still good. The broth was AMAZING. If you're not afraid of carbs, I'd recommend dipping the complimentary bread in it.


*** DESSERT ***

-VANILLA BEAN CREME BRULEE (normally $8.50) - 4/5
[With caramelized top and Biscoff cookie]
Super smooth and creamy with a thin caramelized top. Not too sweet, but definitely pretty rich. It's made in a larger shallow dish so there's more of that crunchy caramelized sugar, which I personally like more than the actual custard.

-PUMPKIN BREAD PUDDING (normally $8.50) - 4.5/5
[Topped with creme anglaise]
SOOO GOOD!! I was already incredibly full from the seafood cioppino and wasn't planning on actually eating so much dessert, but ended up having zero self-control with this bread pudding. Warm, gooey and flavorful. And probably had an entire tub of butter in it :( In fact, it looked like it was sitting in a pool of melted butter, which scared me a little. I kind of wish I asked for it without the creme anglaise though because it just made the bread too soggy.

excerpts: For entrees we had the linguine with clams and Dungeness cioppino.
The food was mediocre.
I rather go to swan or hog island next than come back here.
cioppino.author: Tram T.
cioppino.review: Five stars for the service! Our server was super attentive and very nice. He made sure to check on us and refilled our drinks. As for the food it was okay. We start off with the baked oysters and calamari. For entrees we had the linguine with clams and Dungeness cioppino. The food was mediocre. I rather go to swan or hog island next than come back here.

excerpts: Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino.
I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal!
cioppino.author: Jodi H.
cioppino.review:
Came here for the 2015 SF Restaurant Week with my family on a Sunday night for dinner ($40 dinner menu per person) and EVERYTHING was fabulous and delicious.

I highly recommend coming here. As a born-and-raised NorCal kiddo and lover of all things seafood (shoutout to pescatarians), I gotta hand it to the crew at Fog Harbor. Y'all were ON YOUR GAME that night! I'll be recommending this place to anyone looking for the quintessential San Francisco meal with a romantic, classy, and worthwhile dining experience. 

The service from start to finish was undeniably amazing. We reserved for an early dinner around 4PM, but couldn't make it (coming from South Bay) until 7:30PM for many reasons. But even though we were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes, before we knew it we were seated after only 3 minutes! We were seated at a booth on the lower level a distance from the panoramic windows, but we loved having the grand space for our dining experience. Our server was very understanding, cracked a few jokes here and there, and was just the right amount of "leave us alone/serve us." I gotta give props to the manager of the night who personally went around to all of the tables to offer an amuse-bouche...we thought it was because of SFRW, but he literally went around to all of the tables! 

The food!! MAN!! That deserves its own rating. The four of us ordered all of the starters, entrees, and desserts (since there were only 3 selections, we double'd on the chocolate cake...best decision ever). FOODGASMS to the max, y'all. Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino. I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal! By the time desserts rolled around we were all delightfully satisfied, but loosened our belts for the BEST melt-in-your-mouth-chocolate cake and surprisingly yummy bread pudding! 

Fog Harbor is not a joke. Nor is it a tourist trap. It's got dedicated management, a classy service team, and an unbeatable view at Pier 39. Maybe I'm still reeling from my SFRW high, but it's worth a visit...trust me!

excerpts: We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.
All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.
Presentation of the food was on point!
cioppino.author: DeeDee J.
cioppino.review: Had an amazing dining experience!  The hostess sat the two of us in a large half-round booth, and our server was wonderful and accommodating.  We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.  All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.  Presentation of the food was on point!

excerpts: We got a bunch if dishes that included fried calamari (very crunch and tasty), the cioppino (flavorful broth with fresh seafood), lobster tail plate (cooked to perfection!), baked salmon, and fish & chips.
Every dish we ordered everyone seemed to enjoy.
Our waiter was great, always had a smile on his face and was very patient with our requests.
Our family liked it so much that they actually went back the next day for dinner again.
Highly recommended even when it's a bit pricey but the view is definitely worth a million bucks!
cioppino.author: Erna M.
cioppino.review: Brought family here visiting from Hawaii for dinner on a weekday.  Parked at the Pier 39 garage as you'll be able to get it validated by the restaurant which accounts for an hour of free parking.  It was a weekday so waiting for a table didn't take long at all (maybe 15 mins without reservations) but we did notice that it got busy when we got seated.  The host was kind enough to sit us at the window that overlooks the Bay Bridge and the bay... beautiful view on a clear evening.  We got a bunch if dishes that included fried calamari (very crunch and tasty), the cioppino (flavorful broth with fresh seafood), lobster tail plate (cooked to perfection!), baked salmon, and fish & chips.  Every dish we ordered everyone seemed to enjoy.  Our waiter was great, always had a smile on his face and was very patient with our requests.  Our family liked it so much that they actually went back the next day for dinner again. Highly recommended even when it's a bit pricey but the view is definitely worth a million bucks!

excerpts: The seafood was fresh and delicious, so was the cioppino and chowder
cioppino.author: Bryan S.
cioppino.review: OMG!  The food!  The bread!  The view!  The booze!  Seriously great lunch and we consumed a whole lot of that wonderful sourdough bread that San Francisco is known for. The seafood was fresh and delicious, so was the cioppino and chowder

excerpts: I ordered fish and chips, clam chowder with crab meat and my son ordered cioppino with pasta.
It was heavenly!
Will go again for sure!
cioppino.author: Sandy D.
cioppino.review: The food was delicious. We did not have a reservation on a Sunday around 2pm, so the wait time was approx. 40 minutes long. The time went by fast though because we perused shops while we waited. I ordered fish and chips, clam chowder with crab meat and my son ordered cioppino with pasta. It was heavenly! Will go again for sure!

excerpts: Cioppino was delicious, as was the crab risotto.
Justin was our server and he was terrific.
He is a great ambassador for the restaurant.
We will definitely be back next trip to the bay.
cioppino.author: Jeff F.
cioppino.review: We had an amazing dinner last night celebrating 2 birthdays.  Cioppino was delicious, as was the crab risotto. Justin was our server and he was terrific.  He is a great ambassador for the restaurant.  We will definitely be back next trip to the bay.

excerpts: For my main dish, I had the Cioppino, a bowl of tomato sauce filled with a variety of seafood from fish to crab to mussels.
One thing I appreciate was the option to order the Cioppino "lazy style" meaning all the shell fish was de-shelled before serving.
cioppino.author: Nadav P.
cioppino.review:
Treat yourself right to amazing seafood with a spectacular view.

Fog Harbor has the longest wait times out of all the establishments in Pier 39 and for good cause.  The food and service are top notch with a large variety of seafood dishes. 

For appetizers, I had the blue cheese garlic bread.  This dish is best shared with at least three or four people as you get a half loaf of garlic bread smothered with melted blue cheese.  Fog Harbor doesn't hold back on the cheese either, as each bite was an explosion of flavor.  For my main dish, I had the Cioppino, a bowl of tomato sauce filled with a variety of seafood from fish to crab to mussels.  One thing I appreciate was the option to order the Cioppino "lazy style" meaning all the shell fish was de-shelled before serving.  The dish itself had bold flavors, a good amount of spice, and was so filling that I had to take half of it home.

Fog Harbor is pricey, so it's more of a place to treat yourself and your date or celebrate a special event, but if you have money to spend and want food from the sea, by the sea, then look no further then the Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino.
This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth.
It was delicious and hit the spot.
cioppino.author: Nicole B.
cioppino.review:
After walking around Pier 39 for a few hours, my husband and I were hungry for lunch. We stopped at Fog Harbor since our Aquarium of the Bay ticket allowed us to get 15% off the bill. Additionally, since it was on the second level, the view of the bay was fantastic. The inside was very nicely decorated and had plenty of seating. 

We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to greet us and answer any of our questions. We had a tough time deciding what we wanted to eat, but our waitress had some good advice and offered her favorite dishes. For drinks, we both ordered the Alcatraz Escape. This drink was super tasty and my husband is still raving about how delicious it was. The drink was very tropical with orange and pineapple juices with grenadine, coconut rum, and a float of dark rum. I would definitely order it again. 

For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic. This thing was huge! It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess. I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time. By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino. This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth. It was delicious and hit the spot. I eyed the dessert tray, which looked delicious, but we were both stuffed from our meal. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for a seafood fix. It was a little on the pricey side, but I felt it was justified with how delicious everything was, the great service, and the great view. Next time we visit Pier 39, I would definitely come back here and try the other items on the menu.

excerpts: This place was the perfect restaurant to try San Francisco's popular Cioppino dish!
If you love fresh seafood then this is the dish you'll want to try.
cioppino.author: Kristen Nicole F.
cioppino.review:
This place was the perfect restaurant to try San Francisco's popular Cioppino dish! If you love fresh seafood then this is the dish you'll want to try. It has dungeness crab, mussels, shrimp, oysters, clams, and scallops in a creamy tomato broth. It also comes with garlic bread. We sat at the bar and I tried an oyster shot for the first time. Pretty delicious too. 

The bartenders were friendly and you can tell it's a tourist place since it's right in Fisherman's Wharf. The view is amazing where you can see the harbor and watch the sunset if you go around dinner time. For the price of my dish, it was well worth it because it had a compilation of different seafood choices.

excerpts: Ordered the Caesar salad, "New England" clam chowder, fried shrimp, and the most amazing Cioppino.
Everything was absolute perfect.
Highly recommended
cioppino.author: Frank M.
cioppino.review: Absolutely great welcome to San Francisco's seafood experience. Ordered the Caesar salad, "New England" clam chowder, fried shrimp, and the most amazing Cioppino. Everything was absolute perfect. Highly recommended

excerpts: The tomato sauce in the cioppino tasted manufactured and from a can.
I would not want to come back anytime soon.
cioppino.author: Elliot F.
cioppino.review: Let me start with how we were seated. When our group arrived, they tried seating the 6 of us in a 4-person booth. Since that clearly went south, they then made us wait half an hour for them to finally find a table for us to eat at. It's meh. Really just a tourist trap. The tomato sauce in the cioppino tasted manufactured and from a can. I would not want to come back anytime soon.

excerpts: The food was good (seafood pasta, cioppino, and burger) and reasonably priced for Fisherman's Wharf.
cioppino.author: Gina J.
cioppino.review: Good service, good food, and good view. We were a party of five with two kids. They have a kid's menu and crayons. The food was good (seafood pasta, cioppino, and burger) and reasonably priced for Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: I came in by myself on one of my long layovers near Fishermans Wharf and was craving Cioppino.
After reading reviews, I came into Fog Harbour.
Pretty busy
Ordered the Cioppino as expected, and it was incredible.
Broth was delicious and you can tell the seafood is about as fresh as it gets with fish, clams, mussels, and crab legs.
Plenty of bread to dip in the broth.
Large servings as well.
cioppino.author: Brenden K.
cioppino.review:
I came in by myself on one of my long layovers near Fishermans Wharf and was craving Cioppino. After reading reviews, I came into Fog Harbour. Pretty busy but I was alone and sat at the bar as it was a full service bar.

Food: Started with an Ketel One martini, extra dirty, dry, with no olives, which was made perfectly. Ordered the Cioppino as expected, and it was incredible. Broth was delicious and you can tell the seafood is about as fresh as it gets with fish, clams, mussels, and crab legs. Plenty of bread to dip in the broth. Large servings as well. Even had to take some to go with me because I couldn't finish it.

Service: Was greeted with a menu and a smile by the bartender shortly after sitting down. I was very impressed by the way the bartender prepared my martini perfectly. I am usually a martini snob, but had no complaints. Bartender was very attentive and kept bringing me bread for the broth.

All in all, the restaurant is expensive. Mostly due to the location and the quality of the food. But I would say it was worth it. Very large restaurant but very lovely ambiance. Would definitely recommend to friends, and will be back next time!

excerpts: For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon.
We all enjoyed our food!
We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive.
My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh!
Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!
cioppino.author: Mathew N.
cioppino.review: Had a great dinner here tonight with the family. Started with a few appetizers to get a feel for the place. The oysters and calamari were excellent. For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon. We all enjoyed our food! We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive. My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh! Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!

excerpts: The food was really good, from the bread to the cioppino, to the seafood platter and the fried seafood, everything was excellent.
What made our evening more special was out waiter Curtis.
He was professional, courteous with a good sense of humor.
He had just the right amount of interactions with us where he was attentive but not intrusive.
cioppino.author: Nevine M.
cioppino.review: After a 4 hour Alcatraz tour, my family and I were tired, cold and hungry. We were too tired to look far and ended up at Pier 39. Frankly, I was worried that all the restaurants were going to be too touristy. Because of yelp reviews, we decided to try Fog Harbor. It ended up being a wonderful experience! We sat at a comfy booth with a good view. The food was really good, from the bread to the cioppino, to the seafood platter and the fried seafood, everything was excellent. What made our evening more special was out waiter Curtis. He was professional, courteous with a good sense of humor. He had just the right amount of interactions with us where he was attentive but not intrusive.

excerpts: For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g).
It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30!
She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab.

Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ).
It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
cioppino.author: Adele F.
cioppino.review:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

excerpts: We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special).
Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic.
Would recommend others for this place.
cioppino.author: Chanyamat W.
cioppino.review: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.

excerpts: Skip all of the fried seafood along the wharf and order the seafood cioppino at Fog Harbor.
The portion is large enough for two and you will avoid the grease bomb.
Ask for an extra side of their house made sourdough and go to town on that baby!
Wear your bib and slop tomato sauce with no shame.
There is no attractive way to crack open a crab leg
so attack it with gusto.
I'll be back!
cioppino.author: Hillary D.
cioppino.review: Great service and even better food! Skip all of the fried seafood along the wharf and order the seafood cioppino at Fog Harbor. The portion is large enough for two and you will avoid the grease bomb. Ask for an extra side of their house made sourdough and go to town on that baby! Wear your bib and slop tomato sauce with no shame. There is no attractive way to crack open a crab leg so attack it with gusto. I'll be back!

excerpts: My husband ordered the Cioppino, it was tasty, but nothing worth gushing over.
I ordered the Sole, and it was mediocre at best; the fingerling potatoes were under-cooked and I even got a rotten one.
YUCK!
cioppino.author: Tania S.
cioppino.review:
Decent seafood. The plates are really pretty but the food lacked in flavor. My husband ordered the Cioppino, it was tasty, but nothing worth gushing over.
I ordered the Sole, and it was mediocre at best; the fingerling potatoes were under-cooked and I even got a rotten one. YUCK! I still have that bad taste in my mouth.

I'd save my money and go to a little stand for good seafood. This was overpriced Red Lobster, at least there you get those awesome cheddar bay biscuits.

excerpts: The calamari appetizer,  cioppino, clam chowder in bread bowl were all wonderful.
Our waiter Tyler took the cake though with his personality and service!!
Thank you for making my experience better by recommending a great wine!
cioppino.author: D H.
cioppino.review: We had great food tonight! The calamari appetizer,  cioppino, clam chowder in bread bowl were all wonderful. Our waiter Tyler took the cake though with his personality and service!! Thank you for making my experience better by recommending a great wine!

excerpts: Seafood cioppino was delicious, my hubby kept saying how good it was.
Dessert was the 2 sampler, smallish chocolate fudge cake and creme brûlée, the cake was super rich, too much, but the creme brûlée was excellent!
Total bill for everything including 2 cocktails, virgin piña colada and 3 iced teas, $160, minus tip.
Typical for touristy, seafood places, but the food and service was great, so we were happy with the experience there.
cioppino.author: Danielle G.
cioppino.review:
Amazing food and views. Located at Pier 39 on the wharf in SF, Fog Harbor Fish House is a delicious choice while vacationing, or with business colleagues. 
We arrived and sat at the bar and had a cocktail until our table by the window we'd requested was ready. When out table was ready we were seated and our waitress quickly came over and introduced herself, very friendly (a blond with glasses, her name slips my memory). Sourdough and vinegar are presented, and orders taken. We ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl (amazing, probably some of the best I've ever had!!) Chicken penne pasta with basil, roasted tomatoes, garlic, ( very good, light and not heavy, but flavorful). Seafood cioppino was delicious, my hubby kept saying how good it was. Dessert was the 2 sampler, smallish chocolate fudge cake and creme brûlée, the cake was super rich, too much, but the creme brûlée was excellent!  Total bill for everything including 2 cocktails, virgin piña colada and 3 iced teas, $160, minus tip. Typical for touristy, seafood places, but the food and service was great, so we were happy with the experience there.

excerpts: We ordered a garlic crab and Cioppino.
Crab - it was awesome, fresh, yummy and the price was reasonable.
Cioppino - mussels, shrimps, fish, clams, scallops and crab inside.
I love the scallop and shrimp
but I was a little bit disappointed with the flake crab meat.
Overall it is good and I would like to try there lobster if come again.
Also, we were enjoy the sun and ocean view in the window seat.
cioppino.author: Katelynn H.
cioppino.review:
Came here for the crab. We ordered a garlic crab and Cioppino. 
Crab - it was awesome, fresh, yummy and the price was reasonable. 
Cioppino - mussels, shrimps, fish, clams, scallops and crab inside. I love the scallop and shrimp but I was a little bit disappointed with the flake crab meat. 
Overall it is good and I would like to try there lobster if come again. Also, we were enjoy the sun and ocean view in the window seat.

excerpts: The cioppino was not good.
It seemed more like a watery pasta sauce.
I actually took it home to add pasta to it and it was better that way.
cioppino.author: Heejin L.
cioppino.review:
Horrible tourist trap with horrible service and poorly cleaned seafood.
Had steamed clams and i got about 4 sandy ones. 
That I can somewhat overlook but the worst was the seafood tower. It came with 5 shrimp cocktails but like 4 out of the 5 shrimp had been deveined improperly. You can see brownish residue along where they deveined them. This is the first time I've come across that and I have eaten quite a bit of seafood.

The server barely checked up on us. The managers that came by would take forever to give us to-go boxes and no one would bring us the check until we asked, although we were clearly done. 

The food was not that great. The clam chowder wasnt bad and i liked that you can add crab to it.  The seafood tower was just ok. The seafood didn't seem that fresh and they cleaned the inside of the crab (where the tomalley is) really well [unlike the shrimp veins]. I personally love crab tomalley so I felt gipped. They didn't explain which oysters were which. And the tower only comes with half a lobster tail and a claw which I thought was rubbery and overcooked. 

The cioppino was not good. It seemed more like a watery pasta sauce. I actually took it home to add pasta to it and it was better that way.

excerpts: However, I ordered the Cioppino for my main course and was extremely disappointed.
The seafood itself was good, but the tomato sauce was flavorless and, in my opinion, ruined the dish.
The views from the restaurant were beautiful and the service was top-notch.
However, I would not eat here again.
cioppino.author: Nika W.
cioppino.review: I think this place is overrated for the price you pay. The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious. However, I ordered the Cioppino for my main course and was extremely disappointed. The seafood itself was good, but the tomato sauce was flavorless and, in my opinion, ruined the dish. The views from the restaurant were beautiful and the service was top-notch. However, I would not eat here again.

excerpts: I had the cioppino, and paid extra to have the crab removed from the shell
(I wish everyone did that).
I'm not sure that crab made it back into the dish, but some of the shell did.
I found one scallop in the whole dish, and I don't know what the fish was.
It wasn't the best cioppino I've ever had, but I'll place it 2 or 3 because I could pay to have the crab removed from the shell even though I couldn't find it.
cioppino.author: David M.
cioppino.review:
They tried really hard, and I very much enjoyed the food.  It was a Wednesday July sunset with lots of tourists (including myself, but I was brought by a local).  Some of the tourists should probably be supervised while out in public, or away from their tiny villages for the first time.

We had the steamed clams for a starter.  Some interesting taste selections for the broth.  I would have liked a small bowl rather than a plate to serve my clams on.  The broth sloshes all over the plate, and then you have the serving bowl left with some really edible broth/brine that is taken away uneaten.

My friend had the blackened Cod.  He raved about it constantly.  He'd probably eat it daily if he lived closer.  It was a weird experience to witness for sure.

I had the cioppino, and paid extra to have the crab removed from the shell (I wish everyone did that).  I'm not sure that crab made it back into the dish, but some of the shell did.  I found one scallop in the whole dish, and I don't know what the fish was.  It wasn't the best cioppino I've ever had, but I'll place it 2 or 3 because I could pay to have the crab removed from the shell even though I couldn't find it.

I'd go back again, insist on better seating, and be pickier about my plate.  I'd go back again.

excerpts: I had the cioppino which came out a little cold we were not offered desserts for a party of 7 probably wouldn't go back
cioppino.author: Alfredo T.
cioppino.review: The food was okay. I had the cioppino which came out a little cold we were not offered desserts for a party of 7 probably wouldn't go back

excerpts: The seafood cioppino was real good as well as the steamers.
cioppino.author: Rajesh G.
cioppino.review:
Outstanding view of the harbor. Went here for lunch. Little pricey but very good seafood. Wife and I split a few dishes. The chowder was good and fresh and not condensed milk like. The poke was fresh and flavorful. The seafood cioppino was real good as well as the steamers. The warm sour dough bread complimented all the dishes perfectly.

Dessert was eh for me but the wife chose the creme Brule and chcolate cake combo. I would've done bread pudding or tiramisu.

Definitely coming back.

excerpts: We settled on the Cioppino and Salmon for entrees and made it a fat night by adding the Calamari & a cup of Clam Chowder for appetizers.
Typically fired calamari is almost always the same, but the addition of friend jalapeños & onions and homemade dipping sauce made all the difference!
I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area!
cioppino.author: Kathy G.
cioppino.review: Super fresh food, awesome staff! My husband and I were looking for seafood near our hotel at the Warf and were a bit worried that the Warf restaurants would be a bit too touristy. Although the area was filled with tourist (him and I being 2 of them) there was some great people watching and excellent food at Fog Harbor to be had! We settled on the Cioppino and Salmon for entrees and made it a fat night by adding the Calamari & a cup of Clam Chowder for appetizers. Typically fired calamari is almost always the same, but the addition of friend jalapeños & onions and homemade dipping sauce made all the difference! I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area!

excerpts: SF specials such as Clam Chowder, Cioppino, or Grilled seafood.....and of course more Wine ;)
cioppino.author: Jadya C.
cioppino.review:
U live in Bay area...U get visitors...they all want to go to Pier 39...U have been there million times...U hate touristy things...but yet YOU HAVE TO.....Sounds familiar.....then you have come to the right place my friend.....

Tell your friends, family, in-laws (Out-laws)....to stroll on the Pier...buy some things at Lefty's...Go to Ghirardelli Square...blah blah...and meet me at Fog Harbor after 2-3 hours...

1/2, 1 or more dozen Oysters (Really fresh) and Bottle of Jordan or Sonoma Cutrer or if you are that lucky a Kisstler ;) ...and enjoy the afternoon...

When the tourists are back.....njoy SF specials such as Clam Chowder, Cioppino, or Grilled seafood.....and of course more Wine ;)
