excerpts: Had the ceviche and cioppino and they were both great!!
Sat at the bar and the service was excellent!
cioppino.author: Jana L.
cioppino.review: Had the ceviche and cioppino and they were both great!! Sat at the bar and the service was excellent!

excerpts: we ordered 2 plates of the lazy Cioppino and for both were 78 and for appetizers we got the Crispy Calamari and that was so delicious..
it was very good and the waiter was very nice and they gave us a table the minute we got there.. totally worth going
cioppino.author: Zoe F.
cioppino.review: The food was amazing.. we ordered 2 plates of the lazy Cioppino and for both were 78 and for appetizers we got the Crispy Calamari and that was so delicious.. it was very good and the waiter was very nice and they gave us a table the minute we got there.. totally worth going

excerpts:
We had the Cioppino, the Clam Chowder and the Lobster Tail. 

The Cioppino was outstanding, a lot of seafood and great tomato broth.
cioppino.author: Rainier M.
cioppino.review:
We had the Cioppino, the Clam Chowder and the Lobster Tail. 

The food was excellent. The plates are huge and very tasty, also the complimentary bread is quite great. The Cioppino was outstanding, a lot of seafood and great tomato broth. 

The price range is quite good too, its not cheap, but is definitely not expensive. 

Would definitely recommend.

excerpts: Also, I would highly recommend the clam chowder with crab on top and cioppino!
cioppino.author: Janet T.
cioppino.review: Our food was absolutely delicious, especially our service!! TYLER was INCREDIBLE...he was super friendly, attentive, and gave the best service ever! Also, I would highly recommend the clam chowder with crab on top and cioppino!

excerpts: I was debating between it and Cioppino, but in my experience the latter is always saltier than I like.
cioppino.author: Ya K.
cioppino.review:
Who would've thought a super touristy place will have decent restaurant with amazing view, delicious food, somewhat-reasonable price and pretty decor!? Well, Fog Harbor just raise the dining points in Fisherman's Wharf.

The restaurant is big and with a lot of seats that has amazing view--AMAZING VIEW as in you can see Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz or the seals/sea lions in different combinations or even all three! It is big enough that on a Saturday we didn't have to arrive early or make reservation to get a perfect view. But the restaurant does get full. 

One thing I especially like is that the restaurant is pretty generous on table space--most tables are for 4, and they let us (a group of 2) seat at a 4 people table so that both of us can face the view. 

Enough about view, we ordered Shellfish platter for one, a cup of chowder and a Fish&Chips. Shellfish platter is delicious! I was debating between it and Cioppino, but in my experience the latter is always saltier than I like. Shellfish platter was very flavorful and yet not overly spiced, so I can still taste the clams were fresh. The crab was also very plump and full. The fish&chip was also good, the cole-slaw was very refreshing and not drench in sauces. 

The price was in deed on a higher end, but consider its location, it's seafood, and the view it has, I would say it is reasonable, especially for a special occasion. It is not a place I would recommend to locals, but good for tourists or friends visiting.

excerpts: We ordered a cioppino, it's quite nice.
We also ordered a crab roll, but it's not as good as what I expect.
cioppino.author: Kuan-Hui L.
cioppino.review: Seafood is very fresh, and amount is enough for many people. We ordered a cioppino, it's quite nice. We also ordered a crab roll, but it's not as good as what I expect.

excerpts: Cioppino was good but broth lacked depth
cioppino.author: Claire J.
cioppino.review:
3.5 Service was ok
Cioppino was good but broth lacked depth
Poke was good but  used avocados as filler
Ahi tuna was the star.  Husband loved it and it was his first time ordering this kind of dish. 
Customer service was ok but felt it could've been better by being more attentive and personable.  
Oh yea view was awesome!

excerpts: Get the cioppino here.
It's a seafood fish stew.
Soooooooooo good.
Professional service too
cioppino.author: Robin L.
cioppino.review: Get the cioppino here. It's a seafood fish stew. Soooooooooo good. Professional service too

excerpts: My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino.
We all took a sample bite of each other's orders.
Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected.
Calamarie tasted mediocre.
I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason.
My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking.
cioppino.author: Abby Q.
cioppino.review:
I think ill pass.  After a girls day out in Napa's winery, my friends and i decided to make a trip to the city for the rest of the day.  Our initial choice for dinner, house of prime rib, had a two hour wait and we were all pretty famished. We decided to just play it safe at pier 39.

We were debating between dining here or crab house, and finally settled for this. I ordered the calamarie and bowl of clam chowder.  My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino. We all took a sample bite of each other's orders. Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected. Calamarie tasted mediocre.  I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason. My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking. 

Overall, i probably wouldnt come back. Prices were fair for being in the heart of a tourist attraction, but i feel like i would be more satisfied elsewhere for the same price. Pass.

excerpts: I had the Cioppino.
Amazing.
I went with the regular, not the lazy, which means they take all the seafood apart for you.
I wanted the experience.
My husband had the crab sandwich.
cioppino.author: Mira s.
cioppino.review:
We went here because the reviews were great. 
We sat at the bar because we did not want to wait 35 minutes for a table. My kids could sit at the bar as well, which was great. I am gluten and dairy free, which means I ask a lot of questions. The guys at the bar were awesome. They answered my questions, gave recommendations, and were so gracious. I had the Cioppino. Amazing. I went with the regular, not the lazy, which means they take all the seafood apart for you. I wanted the experience. My husband had the crab sandwich. They had a kids salmon on the menus, which is really nice, because it allowed my son to order something nice, but it did not cost $30...it was $10. This was definitely a splurge for us, but highly satisfying.

excerpts: My friend had the Seafood Cioppino which she let me taste.
absolutely amazing.
cioppino.author: Erica P.
cioppino.review:
Such a great restaurant! We were referred to check out this place because of the views. We were taking a trip to SF and booked out reservation a week in advance, just in case. We loved it!!

My and I both had the clam chowder in the bread bowl. And for $6.00 more you can add fresh crab inside. DEFINITELY SPEND THE 6 bucks! So worth it! They gave us a huge mound of crab. 

We also ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. I tell you, I don't think I could replicate this at home lol. It was so good! 

My friend had the Seafood Cioppino which she let me taste. absolutely amazing. I had the Seafood Penne. Also amazing. 

For dessert we shared the Vanilla Bean Crème Brulee. I wanted to order a 2nd one, it was that good. 

Overall, very good food! Friendly wait staff, and beautiful views of the pier. I would definitely go back again!

excerpts: Try the Cioppino.
Its really good.
cioppino.author: Ken L.
cioppino.review:
I thought this was going to be a bit of tourist trap to be honest, but it actually turned out to be a really nice place to dine.

Dont get me wrong, its not like a small cozy romantic restaurant. Its more of a main street restaurant. However, what they do, they do very well.

Try the Cioppino. Its really good.

excerpts: Cioppino was tasty and filling.
Window view was lovely.
Looking forward to coming back.
cioppino.author: Joelle C.
cioppino.review: Super fast! Incredible food. Crab Louis salad to die for. So. Much. Crab! Food came out in seconds it seemed. Everyone nice and laid back. Cioppino was tasty and filling. Window view was lovely. Looking forward to coming back.

excerpts: This trip, I had the cioppino, and my friend had one of the specials - halibut with peas, if I remember right.
Both were absolutely delicious.
cioppino.author: Susan K.
cioppino.review:
I've eaten here a few times over the years, and really love it. The food is delicious, and the views are fantastic. 

This trip, I had the cioppino, and my friend had one of the specials - halibut with peas, if I remember right. Both were absolutely delicious.

excerpts: As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.
cioppino.author: Jason F.
cioppino.review:
I stopped by here earlier this year with my wife and her parents for dinner.  To be honest with you I wasn't too happy about heading here as I thought it was going to be a touristy place with a ton of tchatche due to its location on the pier.   However, by the end of the visit they had me and I truly enjoyed eating here.  We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.  I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.  As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.

The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future if I was in the San Francisco area.  I really enjoyed the food, especially the bread.

excerpts: we had lobster, cioppino, fried calamari, ceasar salad.
The lobster was good and chioppino was great.
To be honest, menus are plain and the tastes of food are nothing special.. just in between good and great.. but I love to come here because they are consistently good
and whenever i come here I feel satisfied enough..
cioppino.author: JS P.
cioppino.review:
great atmosphere, attentive service, decent food. 
we had lobster, cioppino, fried calamari, ceasar salad.
The lobster was good and chioppino was great. 
To be honest, menus are plain and the tastes of food are nothing special.. just in between good and great.. but I love to come here because they are consistently good and whenever i come here I feel satisfied enough..

excerpts: I ordered the Cioppino and it was excellent!!
It had an assortment of shrimp, Bay scallops, fish, mussels, clams and topped with (lazy style) crab meat-
Lazy style as in they crack the crab shell for you and sprinkle the crab meat on top.
cioppino.author: Bread S.
cioppino.review:
Very nice place to have a daytime lunch or even an evening dinner.  Either way, the food here was great.  I ordered the Cioppino and it was excellent!!  It had an assortment of shrimp, Bay scallops, fish, mussels, clams and topped with (lazy style) crab meat- Lazy style as in they crack the crab shell for you and sprinkle the crab meat on top.  Others prefer to break-open the goodness, but I decided against a messy meal.

My wife had the mixed grilled seafood consisting of grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables and wild rice.  My daughters went with the crab cakes and pan-seared chicken breast.  All plates completely cleaned-out.  

The most notable 2 dishes that stood-out from the rest that you ABSOLUTELY must try have to be the following:

1) Mussel Fries
2) Clam Chowder (Best I've tasted in San Francisco)

Our waiter was Scottie- He was the most knowledgeable, funny and down to earth server.  Very attentive and made great recommendations.  Well-deserved tip for this guy.

       *****Read below when reserving a seat with the hostess outside the entrance:*****

(Knocked-off 1 star for this)

If you happen to go here during lunch on a weekend, the hostess will take your cell phone number down and send you a text if the wait should be horrendously long.  You can tell if many people are lounging around the outdoor seating area.    

Keep an eye out on your phone because the text message is a confirmation whether or not you still want your reserved table.  The text is NOT, I repeat, NOT a message telling you your table is ready.  I learned this the hard way by reading my message 10 min. late and then responding 10 minutes later.  The hostess had thought we no longer needed our seats and gave them up to the next party on the list.  When it told her that I read the text message late, we had to wait an additional 20 min.  Our entire wait ended up being over 40 min.  She apologized and said there were too many people even after I told her that my wife was sitting at the couch next to her the whole time.  I was away at the sports store across the way during that entire time.  Anything you send back to them as a text they can read back as a normal message.  

You've been warned- Now go out there and eat!!

excerpts: My party ordered the raw oysters, surf and turf, crab salad, cioppino and lobster.
It was all amazing, even the steak was great - very tender and juicy.
I never expect much from the steaks going to a seafood restaurant but this was good!
Our waiter was on top of everything, when our drinks were low he came by to fill them up and was very patient, took time to go over the menu even though it was soooo busy.
My only regret is I didn't have room to try the clam chowder which I heard is great.
cioppino.author: Danielle W.
cioppino.review: Food and service were top notch. If you don't have a reservation expect to wait 45 minutes.  We came in knowing this as we stopped by the night before but we were too hungry to wait and came back the next day and walked around the local shops while we waited. My party ordered the raw oysters, surf and turf, crab salad, cioppino and lobster.  It was all amazing, even the steak was great - very tender and juicy. I never expect much from the steaks going to a seafood restaurant but this was good! Our waiter was on top of everything, when our drinks were low he came by to fill them up and was very patient, took time to go over the menu even though it was soooo busy. My only regret is I didn't have room to try the clam chowder which I heard is great.

excerpts:
for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.
cioppino.author: gswfan ..
cioppino.review:
My wife and I came here for our anniversary dinner.
I made a reservation and we were promptly seated to a nicely reserved table.  Good thing the reservation was made because it was crowded and a line was forming.  I didn't mention anything specifically about our reserved seat, but they were thoughtful enough to gave us the window seat, where we could see the bridge and the bay.  when I looked at my wife's surprised look and happy smile, I knew this place is going to get 5 stars, and everything else would be gravy

and yes, turned out there was a lot of gravy.  the whole setting was very romantic... not only dimmed light, but there's a candle on each of the table.  place is not noisy despite being full.  our server was very friendly and helpful, and NO change of attitude when we decided not to order any wine or dessert.

for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.  wish they gave us more than one piece of garlic bread because there's a lot of nice sauce to dip from.

Ahi Tuna (RARE) - I asked to have my wasabi on the side since my wife doesn't like wasabi, and it was complied nicely.  can have more flavors, but i liked the unique taste.  outside is nicely cooked with a bit crispy, with a lot of sesame seeds, but the inside it's like sashimi.  

it was a very special night for my wife and I, and when we were leaving, more than one person (not just our server) greeted us with good bye and thank you.

excerpts: I got cioppino, and was not disappointed.
cioppino.author: Tyler C.
cioppino.review:
4 of us went there, 3 of us for clam chowder bread bowls. I got cioppino, and was not disappointed. I really enjoy the experience of eating that food since I don't get to have fresh clams and crab very often, but they do have a 'lazy' option.

All together a very pleasant eating experience with a great view of the harbor and exceptional food.

excerpts: I had the cioppino and my boyfriend had the surf and turf.
We both really enjoyed dinner and our apps.
It was all well cooked and very flavorful!
Also for how crowded it was all our food came out in record time!
cioppino.author: Shannon M.
cioppino.review:
My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Fog Harbor. We made reservations in advance and emailed them asking for a table with a view. Something extra special for our anniversary. When we arrived we had a reserved table with an amazing sunset view. 

Our server was really attentive, super funny, and suggested a really delicious appetizer. 
He made the experience that much better! 

Our food was delicious! I had the cioppino and my boyfriend had the surf and turf. We both really enjoyed dinner and our apps. It was all well cooked and very flavorful! 
Also for how crowded it was all our food came out in record time! We never felt that 
"where the hell is my food" feeling, which I sort of expected due to the Saturday night crowd. 

We will definitely be back!

excerpts: We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees.
cioppino.author: Hilda A.
cioppino.review:
Great food, great service, great view, and even no wait time (we got lucky)!

Went with a party of 5, and we all had a great time! Everyone's food was brought out in a timely manner and was very delicious. We started out with the shellfish tower and calamari for our appetizers, along with the complimentary sourdough bread.  We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees. Everyone was delighted!

For being a touristic seafood restaurant let me say they completely blew us away.  You would in a way expect to pretty much pay for your view and get bad-ok food, but not here! Genuinely delicious. 
Will definitely be going back, and a must for all seafood lovers!

excerpts: My sister and I shared the cioppino, sooo amazing.
cioppino.author: Namita A.
cioppino.review:
Though this place is in one of the most touristy spots in San Francisco, it is absolutely a fab place to eat and drink!  We went for a celebratory dinner for my brothers graduation and birthday and even though we were a group of 8, they were able to seat us in 10 minutes which was great. 

The ambience and view is great with a view of the water and bustling room.  We had a few great glasses of sauv blanc and merlot which were delicious.  We started with ahi tuna poke. The tuna was super fresh and was good but I wish there was more sesame oil on it.  We also had the sourdough bread bowl, which was amazing.  For my veggie friends, though it wasn't on the menu they specially made a pasta with veggies.  And the bread, oh MY the bread. Delicious. My sister and I shared the cioppino, sooo amazing.  

Service was good - so overall great evening but the only negative was the tuna poke which just wasn't flavoured as well as I would have hoped

excerpts: Wifey had a clam chowder bread bowl and I had the cioppino.
Plenty of food where we could've shared
but it was so good
I devoured the whole thing!
Can't beat the view here.
cioppino.author: Joey Y.
cioppino.review: While in the city for my wife's bday we decided to have a nice dinner here while out at the pier. Stopped by and had a short 10 min wait to be seated. Once we where sat I noticed how warm it was in the restaurant even with the windows open and the ocean breeze. We had the crab cakes to start. Wifey had a clam chowder bread bowl and I had the cioppino. Plenty of food where we could've shared but it was so good I devoured the whole thing! Can't beat the view here.

excerpts: I ordered the Cioppino and my friend ordered the same, but was able to replace some items on her dish that she did not like for more shrimp, which she did like a lot.
The dish was an overall 3.5 stars.
It was not an awful dish, but nothing spectacular at the same time.
Everything seemed to just be thrown in with the sauce and cooked.
It definitely wasn't an awful dish, but the flavors for everything seemed only to be differentiated by the texture after awhile.
cioppino.author: sandy a.
cioppino.review:
I'd give this 4 stars for the ambiance and view. Without a reservation, we were easily seated on a Tuesday night by the window seat. 

I ordered the Cioppino and my friend ordered the same, but was able to replace some items on her dish that she did not like for more shrimp, which she did like a lot. The dish was an overall 3.5 stars. It was not an awful dish, but nothing spectacular at the same time. Everything seemed to just be thrown in with the sauce and cooked. It definitely wasn't an awful dish, but the flavors for everything seemed only to be differentiated by the texture after awhile. I expected more from a seafood/fish house. 

Overall, I had a lovely time laughing with my girls as our waiter was awesome. 

We topped the night off with their espresso tiramisu, which we all shared and wished we ordered more of. You can taste how rich the espresso was.

excerpts: My cioppino was excellent and did not skimp on ingredients.
Judit chose fried shrimp and fries and it is hard to mess that up.
The service was spot on, the ambiance excellent.
And we did not feel touristy.
Then the tiramisu arrived.
cioppino.author: Niall M.
cioppino.review:
First a hint. A AAA card gets you 20% off the food bill.

I was leaning towards four stars until the tiramisu arrived. It was not terrible just not very good. Too much lady fingers and not enough of what makes tiramisu tiramisu. 

OK, lets start at the beginning. With me, three stars is not bad, it means just what I expected, nothing more, nothing less. In this case expectations had to be pretty high, given the prices. My cioppino was excellent and did not skimp on ingredients. Judit chose fried shrimp and fries and it is hard to mess that up. The service was spot on, the ambiance excellent. And we did not feel touristy. Then the tiramisu arrived.

excerpts: I had a special of the day Salmon w/ pumpkin Curry with Butternut Squash , my honey had Cioppino which he really enjoyed .
My sons had seafood combo dishes , great food .
cioppino.author: Eva L.
cioppino.review:
This was my 2nd time coming here, the first time was in a Wednesday for an early dinner and it was good , we knew we would come back. Today a very busy Saturday, we showed up, gave our name , were told the wait w/b 1 1/2 hours, I signed in since they always say more time than it actually takes. We were called in & seated in 45 minutes :). 
Our server Tyler was great , he brought bread , our drinks, appetizers , took our order and served us in a timely manner , then came with a birthday dessert  & singing Happy Birthday for my son . He was a very friendly great server.
The food was AWESOME ! I had a special of the day Salmon w/ pumpkin Curry with Butternut Squash , my honey had Cioppino which he really enjoyed . My sons had seafood combo dishes , great food .

excerpts: My husband had the best Cioppino!
Justin was great and attentive!
Will be back.
Very good place to eat
cioppino.author: Olga L.
cioppino.review: My husband had the best Cioppino!  Justin was great and attentive!  Will be back.  Very good place to eat

excerpts: Cioppino (lazy way) was on point.
Nice chunks of everything.
Also tried the steak and lobster, whatever sauce they used for the steak maaaaaaaan!!
loved every drip of it.
Lobster too was also a good nice tail size.
cioppino.author: S B.
cioppino.review: wow this place is awesome. Oysters was good, good sizes too! Cioppino (lazy way) was on point. Nice chunks of everything. Also tried the steak and lobster, whatever sauce they used for the steak maaaaaaaan!! loved every drip of it. Lobster too was also a good nice tail size.

excerpts: For our entrees my husband ordered the seafood cioppino which was chock full of large shell fish and a broth that lit up our tastebuds.
He's literally still craving it 2 weeks later.
I on the other hand decided to be difficult and create my own dish that was not on the menu.
Our waiter Richard who was phenomenal and beyond accommodating, brought me exactly what I was craving (lobster and Dungeness crab pasta in a cream sauce)
cioppino.author: Tia G.
cioppino.review:
My husband and I came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary while on vacation. We almost ended up at Scoma's but I'm so glad we didn't! Fog Harbor exceeded our expectations. Starting off with two delicious cocktails (Manhattan and dirty martini) at the bar, we were given great recommendations from the bartender. After being seated at a window table with a wonderful view of the wharf and "Happy Anniversary" adorably scribbled on it, we began to indulge. 

For our entrees my husband ordered the seafood cioppino which was chock full of large shell fish and a broth that lit up our tastebuds. He's literally still craving it 2 weeks later. I on the other hand decided to be difficult and create my own dish that was not on the menu. Our waiter Richard who was phenomenal and beyond accommodating, brought me exactly what I was craving (lobster and Dungeness crab pasta in a cream sauce) A-mazing!!

After dinner we were gifted with a large and decadent dessert (a warm walnut brownie with ice cream) for our special occasion. All in all, Fog Harbor made it a very memorable night for us and we thank Richard and staff for the awesome service.

excerpts: Our other dish was their cioppino.
cioppino.author: Alissa C.
cioppino.review:
The location is convenient if you're around Pier 39 and they validate your parking across the street for an hour.  The restaurant is clean, great views and the service was very attentive.  Everything started out great for us.  We got the clam chowder for appetizer and it came out with some hot sourdough bread.  The clam chowder is probably one of the better ones I've had.  However, the reason for the not giving a better review is because the rest of our lunch was just okay.  As others may have mentioned in other reviews, their fish and chips lack flavor.  I know it sounds weird, but it really had no taste.  I felt like it could have used some salt and pepper before they dipped it into the batter or something.  However, the cole slaw that came with the fish and chips were good.  Our other dish was their cioppino.  The fish was overcooked and their broth was too thick and uneven.  

Would I go back again?  Only to have some of their clam chowder and maybe I can get a small salad with it.

excerpts: As you can see my pictures, we ordered mimosa, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder, fish n chips for my daughter and seafood cioppino for myself.
Our dessert was chocolate soufflé.
My daughter picked it.
Good choice
cioppino.author: Mimi S.
cioppino.review:
Five star baby! No doubt. 

If you know me I'm a big BIG seafood lover! My daughter and I were in search of clam chowder at the pier and we found this place on yelp so we decided to have brunch here :) so glad we came because everything we ordered was SOOOO PERFECT! Even the customer service was great! I'm sorry I do not remember her name :( 

As you can see my pictures, we ordered mimosa, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder, fish n chips for my daughter and seafood cioppino for myself. Our dessert was chocolate soufflé. My daughter picked it. Good choice :) 

Definitely coming back to have more clam chowder in bread bowl! Next time, we're gonna get our own. Yes, that's how yummy it is!

excerpts: Wife and ordered a lazy cioppino which came out next and came in 2 bowls.
I told my wife we only ordered 1 unless this was split.
I ask Pedro just to make sure.
He replies back.
I had them split it to make it easier.
Wow!
Very attentive.
I'm impressed!
Cioppino was excellent!
The sourdough bread starter was excellent.
Pedro was on top of his game throughout our dinner.
I honestly have to say Pedro made this dinner and very enjoyable and memorable experience.
Thank you very much Pedro!
You are the man!
cioppino.author: Giovanni G.
cioppino.review: So we decided to have dinner here last night with the fams. I was told the wait time would be 30-40 minutes. Not too bad so we decided to go for it. What seemed like 30 minutes later in the cold and numerous small and large partiesbbeing called in we decided to see how much longer. We were told 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we ask again and was told a few minutes. 5 minutes later i get a text saying to check in with front desk. I do so and they say table will be ready in a few minutes. Aight cool. 10 minutes pass and still nothing so we ask again and they table will be ready in 10 minutes. The hunger is real and we decide if it ain't ready in 10 minutes we'll just leave. Finally table is ready. Restaurant was super busy and was thinking this better be worth the wait. We get to our table and immediately meet our waiter Pedro. He gives us our menus and gives us a quick rundown of the specials and drinks. This is where our experience takes a turn for the best! We order our drinks and food. Our drinks, kids food and appetizers come out quick. Calamari appetizer with that garlic aioli was dank! Wife and ordered a lazy cioppino which came out next and came in 2 bowls. I told my wife we only ordered 1 unless this was split. I ask Pedro just to make sure. He replies back. I had them split it to make it easier. Wow! Very attentive. I'm impressed! Cioppino was excellent! The sourdough bread starter was excellent. Pedro was on top of his game throughout our dinner. I honestly have to say Pedro made this dinner and very enjoyable and memorable experience. Thank you very much Pedro! You are the man!

excerpts: - Seafood Cioppino:
We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew.
This was amazing and definitely my favorite.
I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh.
cioppino.author: Angela L.
cioppino.review:
We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.

The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too. 

What we ordered:
- Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone. 
- Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge. 
- Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either. 

The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed. 

All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!

excerpts: Was hoping to enjoy some nice cioppino.
Paid $38+ for a bowl of cippiono that only had 2 clams 2 muscles and 2 shrimp.
That's pretty shady if you ask me.
It also came with crab and fish that I have no complaints about.
Overall I've had way better cioppino.
Sauce taste like ravioli sauce.
Also ordered the clam chowder which was decent but again small portion for the pricing.
cioppino.author: Niners V.
cioppino.review: Came here on a wednesday with my wife. Was hoping to enjoy some nice cioppino. Paid $38+ for a bowl of cippiono that only had 2 clams 2 muscles and 2 shrimp. That's pretty shady if you ask me.It also came with crab and fish that I have no complaints about. Overall I've had way better cioppino. Sauce taste like ravioli sauce. Also ordered the clam chowder which was decent but again small portion for the pricing. My wife ordered calamari and filet mignon. Calamari was pretty good except for a few pieces that were a little bit chewy. She asked for medium for her steak but it turned out well done. I really wanted to like this place but I spent $140 here including a glass of wine and a glass of lager. I left this place pretty disappointed.

excerpts: Get cioppino with crab in the shell - clearly canned otherwise to save $$.
cioppino.author: Alex W.
cioppino.review: Tourist place with good views and ambiance. Seafood is b-c grade stuff, decently executed. Get cioppino with crab in the shell - clearly canned otherwise to save $$.

excerpts: We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
The first dish we tried was the baked oysters.
Must admit that it was pretty good!
My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries.
My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab.
I was also looking forward to the pasta part.
I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish.
cioppino.author: Lisa K.
cioppino.review:
This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation. 

We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo. 

As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.

The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.

excerpts:
My husband ordered the Cioppino $33
Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth, and he was very happy-he called it the best he's ever had.
It was a huge portion and that always makes him happy as well.
Our 16 year old daughter did not find anything on the menu that she wanted
so I encouraged her to order the clam chowder and caesar salad plate.
She loves a caesar salad
but she did not like the clam chowder.
When Ron noticed that she basically hadn't touched it he commiserated with her about living in San Francisco and not liking clam chowder.
He took it off the bill even though we told him not to since she had eaten the salad!

In the end she ordered the  Blondie Sundae $8.5:
Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle.
Dessert is always her favorite.
Juan the manager came over and asked us how our meal was and we told him how amazing it was and how accommodating our server was.
He then told us that he wanted to comp our daughter's dessert because she didn't like her clam chowder.
I was shocked.
I mean they had already took it off the bill and then gave her a free dessert???
We didn't ask for any of that.
I am truly impressed with their commitment to making their diners happy.
I can say that I will recommend this place to anyone going to the San Francisco area!
cioppino.author: Lisa D.
cioppino.review:
I made a reservation for this place on open table and the day before I noticed that my reservation had been cancelled on open table. I thought that was odd and made another reservation at approximately the same time. The day of my reservation I got a call from the restaurant asking if I really wanted two reservations or was that a mistake. I said I only needed one but my open table reservation had been cancelled and so I made another. The woman on the phone said the original reservation was on their books even though it wasn't on my open table app. As soon as I hung up the phone-my 2nd reservation was cancelled as well! So I ended up not getting the open table 100 points. I just thought that was strange but the experience at the restaurant made up for losing my 100 points. We were seated at a table in the bar area that I chose because it was pretty warm in the restaurant and this area was the coolest place. (I have hot flashes and a cool spot wins over a view any day) Our server Ron C came over and took our drink and appetizer order. I had the Perfect Hibiscus Margarita $12.5 (Voted SF Weekly's Best Margarita) 
El Charro Reposado, Patron Citronge, hibiscus syrup, fresh lime and agave served up and topped with Patron Citronge foam.
It was literally perfect and I very rarely order drinks in a restaurant because I am sooooo picky. I send more drinks back than I drink. 
We ordered a crab Louis salad as an appetizer and it was HUGE and delicious. We didn't expect it to be as large as it was. House made dressing was the cherry on top of this perfectly made salad. For my entree Ron suggested  the Ahi Tuna $26
Seared "RARE", sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli, stir fried vegetables and garlic jasmine rice. I prefer medium rare so I ordered it that way and it came out perfectly. I keep using that word but I am serious when I say-I am a hard to please diner and this place was just hitting it out of the park. My husband and daughter couldn't believe it. My husband ordered the Cioppino $33
Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth, and he was very happy-he called it the best he's ever had.  It was a huge portion and that always makes him happy as well. 
Our 16 year old daughter did not find anything on the menu that she wanted so I encouraged her to order the clam chowder and caesar salad plate. She loves a caesar salad but she did not like the clam chowder. When Ron noticed that she basically hadn't touched it he commiserated with her about living in San Francisco and not liking clam chowder. He took it off the bill even though we told him not to since she had eaten the salad! In the end she ordered the  Blondie Sundae $8.5:
Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. Dessert is always her favorite. Juan the manager came over and asked us how our meal was and we told him how amazing it was and how accommodating our server was. He then told us that he wanted to comp our daughter's dessert because she didn't like her clam chowder. I was shocked. I mean they had already took it off the bill and then gave her a free dessert??? We didn't ask for any of that. I am truly impressed with their commitment to making their diners happy. I can say that I will recommend this place to anyone going to the San Francisco area!

excerpts: We came for the view but mostly for the cioppino and clam chowder.
We weren't disappointed.
The cioppino was especially impressive with a thick broth, filled with seafood.
cioppino.author: Gogo A.
cioppino.review: We came for the view but mostly for the cioppino and clam chowder. We weren't disappointed. The cioppino was especially impressive with a thick broth, filled with seafood.

excerpts:
Lobster tail - yum
Seafood Cioppino with pasta - yum

I would have ordered dessert if they had cheesecake.
cioppino.author: Teresa J.
cioppino.review:
My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco and we decided to visit this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews, and I really had a taste for seafood. It was a Sunday and based on recommendation of Yelp reviews, we made a reservation on OpenTable. The only one they had available was for 5:30pm. But when we got there, there were plenty of table available so...I don't know.

They sat us at a table with a view of the water and setting sun. Beautiful. Our waiter was...a rock star. I asked for a virgin strawberry daiquiri but they brought it with whip cream which I can't have. My husband took it and our waiter brought another one on the house. We ordered one of their appetizer specials, risotto and crab fritters. We didn't like it but didn't complain. Our waiter asked how we liked it and we were honest. So he said we could order something else on the house. Who does that!? Plus he didn't hover and wasn't distant. We gave him 20% tip.

We ordered the following:

Clam chowder - delicious!
Crab mango ceviche - yum
Crab risotto balls fritters - okay
Lobster tail - yum
Seafood Cioppino with pasta - yum

I would have ordered dessert if they had cheesecake.

I wouldn't mind coming back. Good for groups, dates. There is validated parking in the garage, just remember to give your waiter the ticket. The Pier also has other cool places the check out.

excerpts: I had the Cioppino,
cioppino.author: Mona M.
cioppino.review:
Not impressed, value equation was way off.  Fried combo was decent but the cole slaw was very marginal.  My family enjoyed the mixed grill.  I had the Cioppino, portion was great and was enough for a light meal for two people, I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the seafood, fish and scallops were dry.

The best thing about my meal was the Alcatraz cocktail.  It was delicious!

Wait staff and management staff were very attentive but this was a tourist trap that I won't recommend or repeat.

excerpts: Definitely start with the chowder and recommend the cod special or the cioppino.
cioppino.author: Billy N.
cioppino.review: Food was legit! Best seafood restaurant I've been to in a long time. Definitely start with the chowder and recommend the cod special or the cioppino.

excerpts: Four of us shared the crab ceviche, clam chowder in a bowl, seafood platter for 2, and the cioppino.
Total was something like $130 before tip...
The cioppino was _really_ disappointing, tasted like a can of tomato puree dumped on a bunch of seafood.
cioppino.author: Jenn W.
cioppino.review:
Four of us shared the crab ceviche, clam chowder in a bowl, seafood platter for 2, and the cioppino. Total was something like $130 before tip... (pricy!)

Nothing was particularly remarkable. My favorite dish was the seafood platter - the shrimp, clams, mussels and crab were seasoned simply (garlic salt pepper butter) to really let the platter be about the taste of the seafood. Yum! But nothing I want to pay for at a restaurant. The cioppino was _really_ disappointing, tasted like a can of tomato puree dumped on a bunch of seafood. 

I won't be coming again.

excerpts:
Blue cheese sourdough bread was incredible, especially when dipped in the Cioppino tomato sauce 
3.
Cioppino is a specialty dish consisting of a mix of clams, fish, mussels, scallops, and crab in an exquisitely seasoned tomato sauce.

Ridiculously good
4.
Some sort of apple crisp dish with ice cream for dinner was not bad, but wouldn't get it again
cioppino.author: Samuel E.
cioppino.review:
1. Wonderful ambiance, overlooking the harbor  
2. Blue cheese sourdough bread was incredible, especially when dipped in the Cioppino tomato sauce 
3. Cioppino is a specialty dish consisting of a mix of clams, fish, mussels, scallops, and crab in an exquisitely seasoned tomato sauce. Ridiculously good
4. Some sort of apple crisp dish with ice cream for dinner was not bad, but wouldn't get it again

excerpts: Clam chowder was good, oyster (raw) was fresh, crab linguini and cioppino was good.
The problem were that I got a shrimp shell in my chowder and I got food poison afterward :(
cioppino.author: Anya C.
cioppino.review: View was great. Clam chowder was good, oyster (raw) was fresh, crab linguini and cioppino was good. The problem were that I got a shrimp shell in my chowder and I got food poison afterward :(

excerpts: Incredible cioppino -- the best I've had, and I consider myself an aficionado.
The seafood portions were great, and the broth itself was hearty and full of flavor (instead of being an afterthought).
Gold stars all around to the staff -- they are warm and personable.
I had multiple servers stop by to check in and see how I was enjoying myself (answer: IMMENSELY).
I'm here for a business trip and they were warm and accommodating for my table of one.
I'll definitely be back!
cioppino.author: Maggie M.
cioppino.review: Incredible cioppino -- the best I've had, and I consider myself an aficionado. The seafood portions were great, and the broth itself was hearty and full of flavor (instead of being an afterthought). Gold stars all around to the staff -- they are warm and personable. I had multiple servers stop by to check in and see how I was enjoying myself (answer: IMMENSELY). I'm here for a business trip and they were warm and accommodating for my table of one. I'll definitely be back!

excerpts:
The high stars is for the fact that my husband got the cioppino and nearly peed his pants with excitement. 
I got a crab salad with avocado and something crunchy which was decent. 
The views alone are worth the price of admission.
cioppino.author: Ella A.
cioppino.review:
This was the first restaurant i ever ate at in san francisco and it was okay.
The high stars is for the fact that my husband got the cioppino and nearly peed his pants with excitement. 
I got a crab salad with avocado and something crunchy which was decent. 
The views alone are worth the price of admission.

excerpts: The cioppino  was soooo good.
As well as the tartar, clam chowder in a bread bowl and the fish and chips.
The wait staff we had was wonderful as well.
Fast, efficient and friendly.
cioppino.author: Brett M.
cioppino.review: Delicious! The cioppino  was soooo good. As well as the tartar, clam chowder in a bread bowl and the fish and chips. The wait staff we had was wonderful as well. Fast, efficient and friendly.

excerpts: For my entrée, I had the cioppino, which came piping hot and loaded with goodies.
My dining companion had the fillet of sole, that was equally delicious.
For dessert, we shared a complimentary  chocolate molten cake (for my birthday), that was accompanied by a scoop of vanilla ice cream.....
the cake was so moist, rich and decadent....
cioppino.author: Heather K.
cioppino.review:
Surprisingly delicious!

For a "commercial" restaurant on the wharf, I was pleasantly surprised at how fantastic the food and the service was.  Not only was our server, Seth incredibly friendly, but all of the other staff as well.  Everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there.

For my entrée, I had the cioppino, which came piping hot and loaded with goodies.  My dining companion had the fillet of sole, that was equally delicious.
  
For dessert, we shared a complimentary  chocolate molten cake (for my birthday), that was accompanied by a scoop of vanilla ice cream.....the cake was so moist, rich and decadent....spoon licking good. 

I highly recommend this place....don't let the fact that its in a "touristy" location scare you off!

excerpts: The Cioppino was amazing.
Clam chowder was just ok, I've had better.
Calamari were super crispy and delish!
Too full for dessert.
Service was really, really good.
Attentive despite being extremely busy and very friendly.
Highly recommend.
cioppino.author: F S.
cioppino.review: Great lunch. We were walk-ins. Party of 6. I was concerned it might be overpriced, touristy junk but I was proved wrong. The Cioppino was amazing. Clam chowder was just ok, I've had better. Calamari were super crispy and delish! Too full for dessert. Service was really, really good.  Attentive despite being extremely busy and very friendly. Highly recommend.

excerpts: I had the grilled shrimp and my hubby had the Cioppino.
cioppino.author: Maria L.
cioppino.review: Not as we remembered it. Still has a great kids menu so a great place to bring the kids. The sourdough bread is freshly baked and warm. The kids can write/color on the paper tablecloth. The food was only average this time. I had the grilled shrimp and my hubby had the Cioppino.

excerpts: We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.
I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.
cioppino.author: David P.
cioppino.review:
Last night, decided to head here for dinner with some friends.

Made an online reservation for 5 and the only time available was for 9:30pm.  No worries.

We arrived and were promptly seated in a booth by the windows with a great view.

We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.

I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".  Seems this is for customers who don't want to deal with hassle of cracking your own crab.

Like the Fish & Chips I ate previously, the food was great.  Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.  Linguine was cooked very well and the steaks were perfectly cooked to temperature.

So why only 3 stars?

The service was kinda bad.  It seemed like the server had a bad day and was distracted with a frustrated scowl.  We had to remind him about bringing us our bottle of wine.  Tabasco was requested 2 times from our server and once to another server walking by.  The other server looked frustrated but brought us the Tabasco.  Our waiter brought another bottle after a while.  Water took a few tries.  Kids asked for A1 steak sauce and that took a couple of requests.

By the time he noticed that our wine was depleted and asked if we wanted another, we really didn't want to order any more from him and asked for the check.

I would easily give 4 stars for the food and facilities.  But can't ignore the service this night.

excerpts: The only thing that I have to complain about is the burnt bread I got with my cioppino.
The cioppino itself was delicious however the bread was completely burned not just toasted.
I didn't complain to the server because they had already made the mistake; I really did want to let them know  especially the head chef
that a bread that looks like that should NEVER be placed in anyone's plate especially when you're paying $32 for a plate!!
I was kinda bummed about that...aside from that clam chowder was good, bf's fish platter was really good.
We also got pumpkin bread pudding
they said it was good, rich with raisins.
I didn't try it so can't say anything about it.
cioppino.author: Ludmila A.
cioppino.review: Service was great, our server was awesome and the hostess honored our request to be by the window. The only thing that I have to complain about is the burnt bread I got with my cioppino. The cioppino itself was delicious however the bread was completely burned not just toasted. I didn't complain to the server because they had already made the mistake; I really did want to let them know  especially the head chef  that a bread that looks like that should NEVER be placed in anyone's plate especially when you're paying $32 for a plate!! I was kinda bummed about that...aside from that clam chowder was good, bf's fish platter was really good. We also got pumpkin bread pudding they said it was good, rich with raisins. I didn't try it so can't say anything about it.

excerpts: I ordered the Shell Fish Platter for one with the garlic noodles and my partner had the Crab Cioppino, both very good dishes!
Meron never left us dry by making sure we each had a cold beer in hand and always asked if we needed anything else, and NOT in an annoying way that some servers do.
She also chatted with us, checked up on the kids, and made us feel at home.
We all loved her!
Thank you Meron for making our dining experience a great one!
We will be back!
cioppino.author: La 1.
cioppino.review:
I recently had dinner at Fog Harbor this past weekend with family, unfortunately the wait was long, BUT definitely worth it! The food was very good, fresh and tasty (hats off to the chef!) 

Our waitress made our experience even better!!!! We had two children and things get a little crazy with kids at a nice restaurant. Meron, our waitress, was very friendly and welcoming. She gave the kids stickers as well as their drinks before the adults, which definitely kept them occupied while we figured out what they wanted to drink/eat. Our favorite appetizer was the Red Chili Shrimp, which very tasty and had just enough spice for a little kick. I ordered the Shell Fish Platter for one with the garlic noodles and my partner had the Crab Cioppino, both very good dishes! Meron never left us dry by making sure we each had a cold beer in hand and always asked if we needed anything else, and NOT in an annoying way that some servers do. She also chatted with us, checked up on the kids, and made us feel at home. We all loved her! Thank you Meron for making our dining experience a great one! We will be back!

excerpts: We started with the breaded scallop appetizers and ordered the cioppino, mixed seafood grill, fish and chips, and linguine and clams (best I've ever had btw)!
Hot bread and butter was yummy as well.
Had the dual dessert with mini chocolate cake and creme brûlée.
Bummed that they didn't offer fresh berries for dessert.
All in all, would highly recommend this place.
cioppino.author: Kim P.
cioppino.review: Great choice at Pier 39 for seafood! Aside from the dirty wine glass and peppercorn in one of our iced waters, the food was delicious and the view was perfect! We started with the breaded scallop appetizers and ordered the cioppino, mixed seafood grill, fish and chips, and linguine and clams (best I've ever had btw)! Hot bread and butter was yummy as well. Had the dual dessert with mini chocolate cake and creme brûlée. Bummed that they didn't offer fresh berries for dessert. All in all, would highly recommend this place.

excerpts: They have really good cioppino here.
Other dishes like angel hair/pasta dishes are also pretty juicey.
Their portions are also very large which I like.
cioppino.author: Michelle Y.
cioppino.review:
First off I love the the ambiance and I'm all about the ambiance! Very peaceful, with the windows overlooking the bay. Customer service is quite delightful, too.

They have really good cioppino here. Other dishes like angel hair/pasta dishes are also pretty juicey. Their portions are also very large which I like. Prices are obviously on the steeper side, but surprisingly not too much of a tourist trap considering the quality of the food.

Would recommend!

excerpts: The food was awesome we ordered the jumbo shrimp & crab cake for our starter and the Lazy Cioppino plates for our entree.
cioppino.author: Mark H.
cioppino.review:
Celebrated my wife's birthday here. Our experience was great! The food was awesome we ordered the jumbo shrimp & crab cake for our starter and the Lazy Cioppino plates for our entree.

Tyler was listening when I told my wife she needed to decide what desert to choose. He made it special for her with a great solo of happy birthday!
Awesome place!
Thanks

excerpts: The $33 for Cioppino was not worth the money.
You get tiny bits of overcooked seafood in some chunky tomato soup.
I gave a couple of stars for our server, Samir, though.
He was attentive, friendly, and prompt with his service.
cioppino.author: Amy M.
cioppino.review: Beautiful space, right on the water, great views.  However, VERY touristy and way overpriced for small portions of sub-par food.  The $33 for Cioppino was not worth the money.  You get tiny bits of overcooked seafood in some chunky tomato soup.  I gave a couple of stars for our server, Samir, though.  He was attentive, friendly, and prompt with his service.

excerpts: Their lobster and cioppino was very good and their free bread is pretty yummy too.
The service was fantastic and attentive!
cioppino.author: Timothy Y.
cioppino.review: Amazing view of the ocean! In fact, it probably has the best view of pier 39 anywhere in town! The seafood is definitely on the pricier side but it is worth it. Their lobster and cioppino was very good and their free bread is pretty yummy too. The service was fantastic and attentive!

excerpts: We shared crab cake, clam chowder with crab and cioppino
We were full and my husband can eat a lot:)
cioppino.author: Tobi B.
cioppino.review: Best Seafood I've had!! We shared crab cake, clam chowder with crab and cioppino :) We were full and my husband can eat a lot:)

excerpts: My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing.
So good!
I wish I had ordered it also.
We ordered 2 cocktails each
but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL.
cioppino.author: Vol T.
cioppino.review:
Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner. 

The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas. 

Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead. 

And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!

excerpts: Another great bowl of Cioppino with the family.
Samir, our waitor, was gracious and a great host.
My favorite place at Pier 39.
cioppino.author: Darren G.
cioppino.review: Another great bowl of Cioppino with the family. Samir, our waitor, was gracious and a great host. My favorite place at Pier 39.

excerpts: At our waiter Pierre's suggestion (although I was already eyeballing it), I had the Cioppino: essentially a seafood stew consisting of fish, clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp and crab in a spicy tomato broth.
Possibly the too 2 or 3 best seafood dishes I have ever had.
And I've had a lot.
I would definitely fine there again and recommend it to anyone.
Oh and did I mention the view?
cioppino.author: Kelly R.
cioppino.review: In San Francisco for a few days and this was the one place that jumped out at me that I thought we should try. Let's just say it did not disappoint. Being from New England, seafood in other areas of the country doesn't ever live up to our standards but this was by far two of the best seafood dishes we have ever had. The crab cake appetizer was not the best we've ever had but very good.  Wife had the Alaskan Halibut served over a bed of quinoa and arugala.  The halibut was seasoned and cooked perfectly and the quinoa/arugala salad was outstanding. At our waiter Pierre's suggestion (although I was already eyeballing it), I had the Cioppino: essentially a seafood stew consisting of fish, clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp and crab in a spicy tomato broth. Possibly the too 2 or 3 best seafood dishes I have ever had. And I've had a lot. I would definitely fine there again and recommend it to anyone. Oh and did I mention the view?

excerpts: Great Cioppino and Seafood tower was Full-filling!!!
Great Apple cobbler!!
Service was good even though it was packed!
I'll be back!!
cioppino.author: Carrie K.
cioppino.review: Suuuperrrr good!!! Enough said !!! Great Cioppino and Seafood tower was Full-filling!!! Great Apple cobbler!! Service was good even though it was packed! I'll be back!!

excerpts: For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule.
Seafood cioppino was above average.
More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places.
Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish.
Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine.
I'd say sotto mare was better.
The seafood penne was very well done.
Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had.
Soft center and flaky crust with chew.
The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain.
cioppino.author: Matt P.
cioppino.review:
A bit disappointed with the overall experience dining here for dinner. The overall atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and the view is amazing. For a party of three on a Sunday, the wait was minimal which was a plus. 

For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule. Seafood cioppino was above average. More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places. Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish. Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine. I'd say sotto mare was better. The seafood penne was very well done. Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had. Soft center and flaky crust with chew. The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain. The Moscow mule was watered down like crazy and might as well have been ginger ale mixed with water. 

The service for this restaurant was disappointing considering its a tourist trap. My server failed to give me plate/silverware, bread and water refills requires multiple requests and drink came 15 minutes late. Expected a lot more and there wasn't even an apology for lack of plate and utensils. 

I would probably not return based on the overall dining experience but the food was definitely some of the best of pier 39.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the cioppino which he loved (tons of crab, perfect mussels and scallops, good fish and tasty shrimp).
cioppino.author: Katie C.
cioppino.review:
Perfect touristy dinner.

Located on Pier 39 which is one of the popular tourist spots on the water.  Made a reservation on open table, checked in early and still had some time before we were called so we walked down to see the sea lions at the end of the pier.  We requested a table by the window and were really excited when we got one because it was a stunning view of the harbor and the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Our waitress was nice and prompt.  Food is quick. They bring out some really tasty sourdough bread while you look over the menu.  We ordered a bottle of white wine which was served nice and cool. My boyfriend ordered the clam chowder with extra crab on top which he loved, we also split a ceasar salad which was good.  I ordered the Salmon and loved the corn topping they served it with.  The piece they gave me was gigantic.  My boyfriend ordered the cioppino which he loved (tons of crab, perfect mussels and scallops, good fish and tasty shrimp).    

We definitely recommend this place, especially if you're staying near the wharf.

excerpts: The cioppino is phenomenal, and the Moscow mules are truly the best I've ever had, and we drink a lot!
cioppino.author: Red F.
cioppino.review: Thank you so much, Madison, for your patience with us and our big order! The cioppino is phenomenal, and the Moscow mules are truly the best I've ever had, and we drink a lot! The bread is fresh and hot, and the oysters are uber fresh and cold!

excerpts: I had the cioppino.
My cousin had the fried prawns.
I also ordered the calamari.
Our server was absolutely wonderful.
I wish I remembered her name.
She was very attentive and polite.
Now back to the food.
The calamari was lightly coated.
It was very tasty.
The cioppino on the other hand was a little bland .
It was a large serving with tons of mussels, clams etc.
Just kinda blah.
My cousin enjoyed his prawns .
The very best part of the meal.
I must say was the warm sourdough bread.
Nice atmosphere and of course very touristy.
cioppino.author: Sandy P.
cioppino.review:
My cousin and I had lunch here. Since he was visiting. He wanted to dine on the wharf. It's a very nice restaurant. We were seated by the window. He got to see a great view of the bridge and Alcatraz.  Our server came right away. I had the cioppino. My cousin had the fried prawns. I also ordered the calamari. Our server was absolutely wonderful. I wish I remembered her name. She was very attentive and polite. 
Now back to the food. The calamari was lightly coated. It was very tasty. The cioppino on the other hand was a little bland . It was a large serving with tons of mussels, clams etc. Just kinda blah.  My cousin enjoyed his prawns .  The very best part of the meal. I must say was the warm sourdough bread. Nice atmosphere and of course very touristy.

excerpts: My family ordered the lobster mac n cheese, the cioppino, and the clam linguine.
There was also perfectly fresh and warm sourdough bread.
The lobster mac n' cheese had a fair amount of large chunks of lobster, so I was pretty happy.
My mother was very happy about the cioppino; it had a nice range and variety of clam, mussel, fish, and some crab legs, plus, she reported everything was very fresh.
Plus the soup was delicious.
My dad is a quiet man
so I didn't hear much about the linguine, but it looked great.
Overall, everything was very good.
cioppino.author: Jennifer W.
cioppino.review:
Rating 5: It was a great experience and food was delicious!  I'd go here again for a special occasion. 

I made a reservation for Sunday lunch and made a request for a table with a good view, since it was for a special occasion: my dad's birthday.  Upon being seated, I looked around and realized that they really did save one of the best seats in the house even though the rest of the area was full, plus, they wrote happy birthday on our paper table cloth, and of course they offered me to pick any of the desserts on their menu for my dad!  I was very pleased! 

Food: My family ordered the lobster mac n cheese, the cioppino, and the clam linguine.  There was also perfectly fresh and warm sourdough bread.  The lobster mac n' cheese had a fair amount of large chunks of lobster, so I was pretty happy.  My mother was very happy about the cioppino; it had a nice range and variety of clam, mussel, fish, and some crab legs, plus, she reported everything was very fresh. Plus the soup was delicious. My dad is a quiet man so I didn't hear much about the linguine, but it looked great. Overall, everything was very good. The dessert we got for my dad was the apple crumb pie + ice cream on top, which was great! 

Price: Fair for the freshness of the seafood and the occasion. 

Service / Experience: As written above, everything was perfect.  Our waitress was always nearby, brought everything as requested, and was very pleasant.  The view is of the bay, Marina, and Alcatraz. 

Extra: They will validate your Pier 39 parking for 1 hour for lunch, 2 hours for dinner. 

Thanks Fog Harbor Fish House, I'm very happy I brought my dad here!

excerpts: Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino.
Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams.
Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious.
Service was excellent.
Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola.
And don't forget to get your parking validated.
cioppino.author: Veronica C.
cioppino.review: Bff and I got very greedy coming here. We were one of the few patrons, as it was 11am on a Thursday morning. I started off with a refreshing blueberry press and we shared a daily special ceviche. Not the best ceviche, but it was decent. Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino. Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams. Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious. Service was excellent. Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola. And don't forget to get your parking validated.

excerpts: Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).
cioppino.author: Patrick W.
cioppino.review:
Hard to believe such a great restaurant in a touristy location. We came on a Monday around Christmas and the wait at lunch was 45 minutes!

The clam chowder was very good - lots of clams, not too many potatoes, nice bacon flavor.

The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked). I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either. The wife ordered the crab salad - also very good: fresh ingredients, lots of crab, not too much dressing.

Service was efficient and friendly. We sat at a table with a fantastic view of Alcatraz.

Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).

excerpts: The seafood cioppino -
this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly.
cioppino.author: Wally C.
cioppino.review:
We were visiting pier 39 and quickly yelped for a good seafood place. The girlfriend wanted to try the crab shack, but I liked the vibe of this one. I'm glad we went here: the view was incredible, and the food was generally fantastic! 

We went with
 the "famous" clam chowder (in a bowl) - good but I don't see what the fuss is about

The seafood cioppino - this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly. You can't go wrong with this one. 

Lemon fried calamari - Tip, if you have a city pass or one of those flyers at the sf visitor center, be sure to exchange for a welcoming booklet at pier 39, you get the calamari free with two entrees.  This was better than we expected, with the calamari fried to just the right amount of crispness and the lemon sauce providing a bit of zest. 

A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic. 

If you're visiting pier 39, this place is a must.

excerpts:
Naturally, we ordered a spread of different seafood dishes including crab ceviche, clam chowder, a seafood platter and the cioppino. 

I was most excited for and most disappointed by the cioppino; it was literally boiled array of seafood swimming in tomato sauce and immensely lacked depth of flavor.
cioppino.author: Stacey L.
cioppino.review:
Came here to meet up with a couple friends, because the boyfriend really wanted seafood. Naturally, we ordered a spread of different seafood dishes including crab ceviche, clam chowder, a seafood platter and the cioppino. 

Clam chowder was decent, nothing special and definitely can find better in San Francisco. The seafood platter was also standard, and came with a ton of different shellfish, enough for all of us. I was most excited for and most disappointed by the cioppino; it was literally boiled array of seafood swimming in tomato sauce and immensely lacked depth of flavor. 

On the other hand, the restaurant had a great view and good service, but definitely more of a touristy place. Don't know why I expected anything more from Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: Also got a moscow mule and bowl of cioppino - the moscow mule was standard (a little weak), and this was my first venture into ordering cioppino, after tasting others' at different restaurants and really liking it.
This one was very solid in quantity of seafood, with lots of crab, scallops, shrimp, clams and mussels, which made it a delight to eat.
However, I think the seafood might have been cooking a little too long, because the scallops were near disintegrating and the crab tasted straight up like the broth.
So, the seafood was fresh and plentiful, but the seafood all tasted the same, as if it had been boiling in the broth together for a long time.
Shrimp and mussels were the highlight, they seemed to be have cooked properly and still had some firmness.
The broth was simple and tasted like tomato soup, though some salt and pepper brought out the flavors well.
Also, wanted more than a small sliver of garlic bread!
cioppino.author: Sarah B.
cioppino.review:
Came here last week for dinner while entertaining an out of town visitor. Venue is nice - big and touristy. We started with the crab and risotto fritters. These were slightly disappointing, was hoping for crispy hot fritters and received this lukewarm, kind of soggy conglomeration of crab and risotto. Also got a moscow mule and bowl of cioppino - the moscow mule was standard (a little weak), and this was my first venture into ordering cioppino, after tasting others' at different restaurants and really liking it. This one was very solid in quantity of seafood, with lots of crab, scallops, shrimp, clams and mussels, which made it a delight to eat. However, I think the seafood might have been cooking a little too long, because the scallops were near disintegrating and the crab tasted straight up like the broth. So, the seafood was fresh and plentiful, but the seafood all tasted the same, as if it had been boiling in the broth together for a long time. Shrimp and mussels were the highlight, they seemed to be have cooked properly and still had some firmness. The broth was simple and tasted like tomato soup, though some salt and pepper brought out the flavors well. Also, wanted more than a small sliver of garlic bread! Waitstaff was friendly.

Overall, very much enjoyed the meal, but there were a few things that stood out as pieces that could easily be improved upon.

excerpts: Cioppino is really good too!
The view is fantastic even on a rainy day!
cioppino.author: Cathy L.
cioppino.review: They got the best clam chowder! Cioppino is really good too! The view is fantastic even on a rainy day!

excerpts: One word, CIOPPINO!
I'm a huge fan of this dish and rarely have I experienced it served well.
Ordered the lazy style (Crab with no shell) as I didn't feel like fussing with my meal after a long day of touring.
This seafood stew was a flavor bomb with an incredible tomato flavor, accompanied with a generous portion of seafood, which I may add was cooked perfectly and exceeded my expectations.
My friends ordered the surf and turf and lobster tail - wow!
Presentation on all dishes were beautiful, wish I had taken a picture.
My 4 year old had pasta with a side of shrimp, our server was more than happy to accommodate this request.
Our sever was excellent, as was the wine selection.
Surprised at the bad reviews, as the staff here really is friendly and accommodating.
Will be back next trip to SF!
cioppino.author: Lisa G.
cioppino.review: Was a bit wary due to the location of this restaurant in a major tourist area, so was skeptical of the good reviews.  One word, CIOPPINO!  I'm a huge fan of this dish and rarely have I experienced it served well.  Ordered the lazy style (Crab with no shell) as I didn't feel like fussing with my meal after a long day of touring.  This seafood stew was a flavor bomb with an incredible tomato flavor, accompanied with a generous portion of seafood, which I may add was cooked perfectly and exceeded my expectations.  My friends ordered the surf and turf and lobster tail - wow!  Presentation on all dishes were beautiful, wish I had taken a picture.  My 4 year old had pasta with a side of shrimp, our server was more than happy to accommodate this request.  Our sever was excellent, as was the wine selection.    Surprised at the bad reviews, as the staff here really is friendly and accommodating.  Will be back next trip to SF!

excerpts: The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari.
Everything was delicious
but I think the clam chowder took the cake.
It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency.
I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much.
Bread bowl was amazing.
My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl.
Crispy, just a little tart, and warm.
cioppino.author: Sonia Y.
cioppino.review:
Let's just say that walking all the way from the Powell Bart Station to here... was worth the sore feet.

My friend and I had our mind set on clam chowder in a bread bowl on the pier. When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table. 

The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari. Everything was delicious but I think the clam chowder took the cake. It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency. I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much. Bread bowl was amazing. My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl. Crispy, just a little tart, and warm. Hrmm. 

Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was awesome. Would definitely come here again.

excerpts: Seafood Cioppino:
The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta.
What I thought was really cute
was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself!
A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood.
The tomato herb broth was really flavorful.
I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth.
So delicious.
