My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels.
All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality.
There's no fishy taste to them.
My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too.
Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta.
Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions.
cioppino.author: Philana C.
cioppino.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is located at Pier 39 on the second level. We came here for Dine About Town 2014 and made reservations about a week in advance to secure a spot for dinner. We had parked in the Pier 39 garage where Fog Harbor would validate 2 hours of parking when after 6pm. We came here on a Saturday night and boy, the whole restaurant was packed! There were even people waiting for seats. When you first enter Fog Harbor, you'll notice that they have a really cozy fireplace area for those who are waiting. We were seated in one of the booths near the window with a nice view of the bay. I wish we came a bit earlier when the sun was setting though.

Food-
Red Curry Steamed Mussels: The PEI mussels were steamed in garlic, onions, peppers, and a coconut curry broth. The coconut curry broth was not too flavorful. I could barely taste the curry flavor. However, these mussels were REALLY fresh. YUM. Definitely, the freshest mussels I have had compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.

Seafood Cioppino: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta. What I thought was really cute was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself! A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood. The tomato herb broth was really flavorful. I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth. So delicious. My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels. All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality. There's no fishy taste to them. My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too. Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta. Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions. They are not skimpy with their seafood. 

Molten Chocolate Cake: The cake was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The cake was REALLY sweet. The ice cream definitely complemented well with the chocolate cake. Unfortunately, the cake didn't have any melted chocolate in it when I cut it open in half. :( 

Our dinner lasted for almost 2 hours! That was pretty surprising but in a good way. :) At the end of the meal, they also provide you Biscoff cookies. Per our waiter, he stated that they are quite delicious when dipped in coffee or milk. The overall service was excellent. The waiter and the manager on duty really made sure that everything was going smoothly and checked up on us. I think this was a successful Dine About Town! :)

excerpts: I order the Cioppino (I've had better)... it wasn't to my liking....
WAYYYYY
TOO MUCH CELERY!!!
The celery over kills the taste of the whole dish!
Cmon!...
However, my friend ordered the crab roll, which was delicious
cioppino.author: Nhi C.
cioppino.review:
I order the Cioppino (I've had better)... it wasn't to my liking....WAYYYYY TOO MUCH CELERY!!! The celery over kills the taste of the whole dish! Cmon!...However, my friend ordered the crab roll, which was delicious (one of the better ones I've had)! 

The service was great as well. 

View was very pretty as the sun sets. 

3- star because it wasn't really memorable for me, okay, maybe only the crab roll.

excerpts: Seafood cioppino was amazing.
The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly.
Bread was great.
Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic.

Crab meat
Melted in my mouth, fantastic .
Bloody Mary's we're outstanding.
Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts.
Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world.
Great management and great food.
cioppino.author: Matthew H.
cioppino.review:
Best meal I've had in years. Seafood cioppino was amazing. The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly. Bread was great. Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic. Crab meat
Melted in my mouth, fantastic . Bloody Mary's we're outstanding. Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts. Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world. Great management and great food. Highly recommend this place.  

Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !

excerpts: The cioppino is pretty epic, no unnecessary pasta filler.
The clam chowder is great too, especially with the added crab.
And, I love the fresh sourdough bread.
Good to know there's a decent restaurant in this otherwise tourist trap known as Pier 39.
cioppino.author: Maximillian M.
cioppino.review: The cioppino is pretty epic, no unnecessary pasta filler. The clam chowder is great too, especially with the added crab. And, I love the fresh sourdough bread. Good to know there's a decent restaurant in this otherwise tourist trap known as Pier 39.

excerpts: I had their so delicious cioppino and their shackled fresh oysters and white wine.
cioppino.author: Amy T.
cioppino.review: It was all about seafoods and the view I came in for...I had their so delicious cioppino and their shackled fresh oysters and white wine.

excerpts: My brother ordered the Cioppino.
I got to taste it
and it was very good.
I've had lots of cioppino since moving to the area
Skip the calamari and the fried seafood combo (because of the calamari) but try the fish & chips, shrimp & chips, or the cioppino which were all excellent.
cioppino.author: Donley P.
cioppino.review:
We had a great meal here. We came with a party of 8 at about 5:30pm on a Thursday and were seated promptly. 

The beer selection was nice with plenty of good local favorites.

Fried Calamari: I was disappointed that there were no tentacles. They were cooked properly but the breading was unimaginative. Not bad but not great.

Blue Cheese Bread: very rich and delicious.

Most of us ordered some fried seafood. I had the combo and others had the fish & chips. The fried fish is excellent: beer battered, tender and juicy. I also really enjoyed the fried shrimp. They were butterflied and cooked perfectly with a nice panko coating. The disappointing thing was that I only got one piece of fish and two shrimp and a big pile of calamari. The fries were standard.

My brother ordered the Cioppino. I got to taste it and it was very good. I've had lots of cioppino since moving to the area and I'd say this is one of the best around.

To sum up: I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good meal on Pier 39. Skip the calamari and the fried seafood combo (because of the calamari) but try the fish & chips, shrimp & chips, or the cioppino which were all excellent.

excerpts: I ordered the cioppino because everyone was raving about it.
But again it was nothing special.
I didn't even put a dent in it.
Too much food.
The fish and scallop were a bit over cooked.
I ate the 3 mussels and 2 clams to try and get my money's worth.
The tomato based soup was good but nothing to "wow" over.
I guess this was the best west coast crab cake?
Not impressed.
cioppino.author: Bee H.
cioppino.review: Not sure what the hype is about. Clam chowder was okay. Sourdough bread was the best thing on the menu. My BF got the crab cakes and I thought it was just okay. Definitely not the best. I ordered the cioppino because everyone was raving about it. But again it was nothing special. I didn't even put a dent in it. Too much food. The fish and scallop were a bit over cooked. I ate the 3 mussels and 2 clams to try and get my money's worth. The tomato based soup was good but nothing to "wow" over. I guess this was the best west coast crab cake? Not impressed.

excerpts: We had a Caesar salad and cioppino.
cioppino.author: Ben K.
cioppino.review:
We had a last minute urge for some seafood and considering it was Labor Day Monday, our options were pretty limited. Our usual spots were all closed, I saw the strong rating on Yelp so i figured, what the hell--give the tourist trap a try. Turns out we both really liked the meal. We had a Caesar salad and cioppino. 

Don't come here expecting mission-hipster. It is pretty touristy so the service is actually quite respectable. Forgot to mention, they do have great views!!

excerpts: Either way, my date wanted Cioppino and this was a recommended spot.
The cioppino comes out in a big shallow bowl.
As for the food and drinks, our server recommended a sweet white wine to pair with our cioppino.
I might go for dry next time as I feel it would have been less overpowering.
cioppino.author: Brian L.
cioppino.review:
Considering the restaurant is among the touristy restaurants at Pier 39, I had an idea of what I was getting myself into. Either way, my date wanted Cioppino and this was a recommended spot.

Parking is validated for 2 hours after 6pm, so that helped a lot.  The cioppino comes out in a big shallow bowl.  The maitre d accommodated my request for a window seat (+1 star).  

As for the food and drinks, our server recommended a sweet white wine to pair with our cioppino.  I might go for dry next time as I feel it would have been less overpowering.  Nonetheless, it was still good otherwise.

The restaurant offers you crab de-shelled for easy eating for an extra few bucks, which is the first time I've heard that being done.

All in all, it was a great meal.

excerpts: We also try the cioppino but not good.
cioppino.author: Arnaud S.
cioppino.review:
Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good. 

My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.

excerpts: I had the garlic whole crab and cioppino.
Both were really good.
We also had the soup and salad combo.
It was a lot of food.
Come hungry!
cioppino.author: Wendy L.
cioppino.review: I had the garlic whole crab and cioppino.  Both were really good.  We also had the soup and salad combo.  It was a lot of food.  Come hungry!

excerpts: We also shared cioppino, a delicious seafood entree.
(I would have given 5 stars, but the shrimp in this dish was overcooked and not good.
Since there were only a few pieces and the rest of the seafood was tasty, it wasn't worth mentioning or sending back.)
We had planned to order another entree, but were informed that the portions of these two items were pretty large.
They were!
It was good we didn't order more.
We finished with desert.
10 stars for service, 4 stars for food.
cioppino.author: Pam C.
cioppino.review: Very pleased with my experience here! As this is a touristy location, expectations are always a bit lower. Great view, our Server (Christina?) was super nice, very helpful and attentive. My step-mom has many food restrictions, so we were a bit of a challenge. Not only did Christina go out of her way to make sure everything ordered was safe, but she made suggestions to modify items we were interested in and never made us feel that we were that problem table. Just the opposite, she really cared about making sure we had a good experience. We began with cocktails that were unique and delicious, then shared a large crab salad, one of the daily specials; great flavor, (on romaine, not the most interesting of greens, but did provide a good crunch). We also shared cioppino, a delicious seafood entree. (I would have given 5 stars, but the shrimp in this dish was overcooked and not good. Since there were only a few pieces and the rest of the seafood was tasty, it wasn't worth mentioning or sending back.) We had planned to order another entree, but were informed that the portions of these two items were pretty large. They were! It was good we didn't order more. We finished with desert. 10 stars for service, 4 stars for food.

excerpts: My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.
Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average.
cioppino.author: Christina P.
cioppino.review:
Amazing view, great food, friendly server - what more can I ask for?
I know that this place isn't the cheapest, but Fog Harbor Fish House is in the center of tourist mecca. I know there are lots of similar restaurant options nearby, but they either lack in food or interior or attentive servers. I tried to nitpick and find things I don't like about this place, but honestly I couldn't (again, apart from having to deal with major tourist crowds, which is no fault of the restaurant)
Just be sure to check out tourist brochures and/or yelp check-in for modest discounts or freebies. In fact, most Wharf/Pier39 restaurants have some form of promotion. They also validate parking so make sure to take advantage of that.

My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.  Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average. Seafood was fresh and prepared right.

This probably isn't the best place for family with small children, but for more adult-oriented crowd or date nights, I would highly recommend.

excerpts: When in San Fran, I always get cioppino and this place did not disappoint!
Cioppino was full of awesome mussels, clams, fish and shrimp.
We had the calimari as an appetizer and not only was it amazing, but they brought out way more than we could possible eat- so bring your appetite!
Michael took great care of us...
Will definitely be back.
cioppino.author: Michelle M.
cioppino.review:
When in San Fran, I always get cioppino and this place did not disappoint!  Cioppino was full of awesome mussels, clams, fish and shrimp.  We had the calimari as an appetizer and not only was it amazing, but they brought out way more than we could possible eat- so bring your appetite!  Michael took great care of us...
Will definitely be back.

excerpts:
fresh and tasty 
Cioppino with linguini for extra $2- yummy and large but wished they provided more pasta
Garlic fried crab- overly drenched in butter and lackluster in flavor 
Service-
great
cioppino.author: Sherry P.
cioppino.review:
Overall, a great experience but unnecessary for the hostesses to keep us waiting outside in the cold while they set up our 15 minute table in an empty restaurant. 

Oysters- fresh and tasty 
Cioppino with linguini for extra $2- yummy and large but wished they provided more pasta
Garlic fried crab- overly drenched in butter and lackluster in flavor 
Service- great

excerpts: " we also had the chili crab, lobster tail and the cioppino to share and we ended up with the dessert combo, we would definitely come back to this place because the food and the excellent service our waiter Oscar provided us.
cioppino.author: Pau S.
cioppino.review: Excellent service, great food, Our server suggested the ahi poke and baked oyster for starters,we gave it a try and OMG,best ahi poke ever!!! Oysters were ok,"am not a oyster lover anyway" we also had the chili crab, lobster tail and the cioppino to share and we ended up with the dessert combo, we would definitely come back to this place because the food and the excellent service our waiter Oscar provided us.

excerpts: And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to.
cioppino.author: Marielle S.
cioppino.review:
Every time my family and I come up to San Francisco, we always stop by here for a meal. 

Service is excellent!!! Ask for Bong. He's amazing and definitely treats you like family. 

Food. Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious. My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined. I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good. And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to. 

It can get a bit pricey, but you're paying for excellent food and excellent service.

excerpts: I ordered the cioppino, which is a fish stew like a bouliabaise -
I'm sure my spelling is not correct! - and it was great.
cioppino.author: Nancy C.
cioppino.review: There are a lot of restaurant choices on Pier 39. We stayed for 10 days so we had the chance to try quite a few. I thought Fog Harbor was a step up from the other restaurants. It had a more classy feel to it, with more intimate lighting and decor. I ordered the cioppino, which is a fish stew like a bouliabaise - I'm sure my spelling is not correct! - and it was great. My husband had salmon which was equally great. Everything in SF is really expensive and this restaurant charges the San Francisco mandate tax, like most other SF businesses do. That adds another 5% tax to their already high sales tax, so be aware of that anywhere in SF that you travel. I thought the service was very friendly and professional, too.

excerpts: I was ready to enjoy a fine bowl of cioppino and, instead, all I found was dirty everything.
Dirty cups, dirty plates, dirty silverware.
It was so unappetizing.
We left before we even ordered because of how disgusting it was.
Never again.
cioppino.author: Sienna S.
cioppino.review: Ew. That is really all I have to say about this place. I was so disappointed when I came here. I was ready to enjoy a fine bowl of cioppino and, instead, all I found was dirty everything. Dirty cups, dirty plates, dirty silverware. It was so unappetizing. We left before we even ordered because of how disgusting it was. Never again.

excerpts: Calamari was salty, cioppino was mediocre - too much pepper and not much flavor.
Spring special lobster stuffed with crab was underwhelming - too much celery and no flavor.
The sauteed spinach used low quality oil.
Finally,  house merlot was too acid with little body.
Margarita was too sour.
The good: nice view of the water.
Not returning and will not recommend to a friend.
This is a bad deal for the money.
cioppino.author: Abe N.
cioppino.review: Yelpers, you have let me down once again. Service was unimpressive - waiter forgot to bring us bread. We had to ask for water! Calamari was salty, cioppino was mediocre - too much pepper and not much flavor. Spring special lobster stuffed with crab was underwhelming - too much celery and no flavor. The sauteed spinach used low quality oil. Finally,  house merlot was too acid with little body. Margarita was too sour. The good: nice view of the water. Not returning and will not recommend to a friend. This is a bad deal for the money.

excerpts: We had the mussel fries, clam chowder, fried calamari, linguine and clams and cioppino all of which were to die for.
Wonderful ambiance, table overlooked the bay and docks where the ferry would come in.
Wait wasn't as bad as expected considering it was fleet week.
Will only dine here for all future trips to San Francisco!
cioppino.author: L K.
cioppino.review: Words can't express how delicious and fresh the food is at this restaurant. The waitress we had could improve but the quality and tastiness of the food is why we were here this past weekend! We had the mussel fries, clam chowder, fried calamari, linguine and clams and cioppino all of which were to die for. Wonderful ambiance, table overlooked the bay and docks where the ferry would come in. Wait wasn't as bad as expected considering it was fleet week. Will only dine here for all future trips to San Francisco!

excerpts: Tried the Cioppino with pasta and was very good!
cioppino.author: Yude S.
cioppino.review:
Delicious Blue Cheese bread!

Tried the Cioppino with pasta and was very good!

excerpts: My husband got the cioppino which had crab meat, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels served in a tomato herb broth.
Even though this is tourist hot spot, we will return every time we're by the bay.
cioppino.author: Stephanie M.
cioppino.review: This restaurant is right on Pier 39, so it's hard to miss it. Perfectly crispy calamari served with lemon aioli sauce = perfection! The sourdough bread bowl clam chowder is the best bang for your buck (only $10). My husband got the cioppino which had crab meat, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels served in a tomato herb broth. Even though this is tourist hot spot, we will return every time we're by the bay.

excerpts: My hubby enjoyed the cioppino and my crab sandwich was delicious.
cioppino.author: Angela L.
cioppino.review: Great meal..... Blue cheese garlic bread was a great app. My hubby enjoyed the cioppino and my crab sandwich was delicious.

excerpts: I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino.
I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and
The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there....
All in all, very delicious.
I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch...
It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.
cioppino.author: Megan E.
cioppino.review: Fog harbor was really really good, I'm reluctant to give a full 5 stars usually, especially to a touristy restaurant, but I really enjoyed this. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino. I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and their salmon..... Ohhhh their salmon, it was delicious!!!! I loved it! Side veggies and potatoes were just okay, but they're not the main focus anyway. The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there.... All in all, very delicious. I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch... It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.

excerpts: Had the Cioppino and it's the best I have had in the bay area
(and I have tried many).
Service was great and dinner served in just a few minutes.
The views of Alcatraz, the bay, and Pier 39 provide the atmosphere you are looking for when visiting San Francisco.
A great find.
Looking forward to trying other menu items.
cioppino.author: Patrick P.
cioppino.review: Went to Fog Harbor on a Tuesday night and was able to sit at the bar with no wait. Had the Cioppino and it's the best I have had in the bay area (and I have tried many).  Service was great and dinner served in just a few minutes. The views of Alcatraz, the bay, and Pier 39 provide the atmosphere you are looking for when visiting San Francisco. A great find. Looking forward to trying other menu items.

excerpts: Love the fresh sourdough and the cioppino was great and huge!
cioppino.author: Jenn S.
cioppino.review:
In a touristy spot, but it's a beautiful restaurant with great views.  They validate parking, so you end up saving $8 from the parking garage right across the street.

I've had the chowder and as a New Englander, it stands up!  Love the fresh sourdough and the cioppino was great and huge!

excerpts: You'd expect the fish in the cioppino to have a ton of flavor, but it was the opposite.
For a ridiculously expensive meal I would have hoped to be a little more satisfied at the end of the meal.
People who give this place a high rating aren't used to eating good, fresh seafood
so they're purely confused.
cioppino.author: Sam W.
cioppino.review: It's in fishermans wharf so I expected it to be over priced, but it's a seafood restaurant so I thought it would at least be tasty. I was very disappointed. They claim their clam chowder is the best in the city, but it's just ok, nothing special. It wasn't served with any crackers and it's a tiny cup for $6. The crab in the mixed platter has a decent amount of meat, but none of the other shellfish had any flavor. You'd expect the fish in the cioppino to have a ton of flavor, but it was the opposite. For a ridiculously expensive meal I would have hoped to be a little more satisfied at the end of the meal. People who give this place a high rating aren't used to eating good, fresh seafood so they're purely confused.

excerpts: My favorite dish by far has been the seafood cioppino.
Every bite was outstanding.
I also always have to have clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.
I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Pier 39.
cioppino.author: Morgan M.
cioppino.review: Absolutely beautiful views of the Bay Bridge, Alcatraz, and the bay. The waitresses/waiters we have had are always very attentive and kind. Both times they have shared their stories of moving to the Bay Area with us once finding out we are/were new to the area with great recommendations on places to check out. The seafood is always outstanding and worth the price. We always leave larger than when we arrived. My favorite dish by far has been the seafood cioppino. Every bite was outstanding. I also always have to have clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Pier 39.

excerpts: I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl
it was an okay amount.
I didn't leave feeling full.
The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh.
I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before.
We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made.
It tasted great and it wasn't too weak.
Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird.
Overall, its's an okay place.
Not great but definitely not something you must try.
I tried to like the place, but I can't still.
cioppino.author: Lisa n.
cioppino.review:
This place is not too bad if you're not looking for something mind blowing. Don't get me wrong, I believe the food here is great and the quality is phenomenon. But the food just doesn't make you crave to remember. The place has a nice view, it's located on the pier, and the decor is very lovely. 

I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember. Only 1 selection. The condiments given could have been better. They are a seafood restaurant so I expected to have a larger oyster selection. The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there. It felt a little stale to me. The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well. I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl it was an okay amount. I didn't leave feeling full. The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh. I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before. We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made. It tasted great and it wasn't too weak. Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird. Overall, its's an okay place. Not great but definitely not something you must try. I tried to like the place, but I can't still. 3 stars because it's not a bad place.

My friend had the lobster stuffed crab. He enjoyed it. Still he agreed that it's not a memorable place. 

The server was nice though. He helped us quite a bit.

excerpts: We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters.
The oysters were fresh and delicious.
The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood.
cioppino.author: Alice A.
cioppino.review:
I was delighted to be seated right away, but the experience was far from 5 stars. Our waitress brought us dirty plates. I requested new ones and they came back less dirty (probably the same ones wiped down). 

We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood. Two shrimps, two scallops...not to mention we ordered the additional pasta ($2) but there was none. 

We decided to order a burger because it wasn't enough food. We waited for a while. Our waitress came back to tell us that the kitchen was busy and if we want to cancel our order. We agreed and she apologized about the pasta and the burger. $46 spent and still hungry, it would have been better if we ate somewhere else in Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the awesome romantic view of the ocean and nice ambience of the restaurant, the food and service were not up to par.

Avoid touristy restaurants I guess, unless they are the only available option.

excerpts: Will definitely go back for the cioppino...saw another diner order it
and it looked delicious!
cioppino.author: Jeanie L.
cioppino.review: Great food and experience! How awesome to find a truly great restaurant at Pier 39 that's not just a tourist trap! Excellent clam chowder!! Everything we had was great, including the views. Will definitely go back for the cioppino...saw another diner order it and it looked delicious!"

excerpts: For our main course, we split the cioppino.
It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth.
It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me.
For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous...
cioppino.author: Lauren Y.
cioppino.review:
This place was really awesome. We made reservations even though it was located in the heart of Pier 39. I was looking for a delicious restaurant that didn't have a strict dress code. (I'm 8 months pregnant and don't have the widest variety of formalwear) ;) 

We decided to try several appetizers, and then split a dinner instead. It turned out to be an excellent decision. The meal starts out with a perfectly prepared sourdough bread, it was so delicious. We had the calamari, I really enjoyed the dipping sauce and found it the batter to be delightfully crispy. My fiancee, didn't agree with the breading, as he prefers the light crispy kind. We also split the steamed mussels, they came in a delicious broth that was savory and delicious. We both agreed, these were absolutely amazing! We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable. They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings. We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl. We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for! Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance! For our main course, we split the cioppino. It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth. It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me. For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous... they really know their way around the dessert area! 

The entire meal only set us back about $150 which was pretty awesome for location and the amount of food we ordered. Make a reservation and ask for a window seat, the view is beautiful. If we happen to make our way back to the San Francisco area, we will definitely be back!

excerpts: We shared the cioppino , a couple appetizers (including the NE clam chowder), lobster and sea bass.
The chowder was packed with clams and no potatoes, it was quite good, but perhaps not as flavorful as say Sotto Mare or woodhouse fish
co.
Overall, the food was really good.
I would definitely go back, but I think the fact it wasn't crowded at all made for a really nice meal.
I probably wouldn't go on a weekend night.
cioppino.author: Adam F.
cioppino.review: Visited this place mid week and it wasn't overly crowded with tourists. Got a great spot in the window with views toward the GG bridge. It was really a nice meal and made for a solid date spot. The portions were huge. We shared the cioppino , a couple appetizers (including the NE clam chowder), lobster and sea bass. The chowder was packed with clams and no potatoes, it was quite good, but perhaps not as flavorful as say Sotto Mare or woodhouse fish co. Overall, the food was really good. I would definitely go back, but I think the fact it wasn't crowded at all made for a really nice meal. I probably wouldn't go on a weekend night.

excerpts: Cioppino was very good.
cioppino.author: Brent A.
cioppino.review:
Decided to make a day of it and play the tourist role with the family. Went to Fishermans Wharf  to check out the sea lions and decided on this place for lunch. Mostly because it was the highest rated place at the wharf and the free blue cheese bread with check-in. 

Food was good not great. Blue Cheese bread might have been the best part, it was very good. Cioppino was very good. 

Service was excellent, views are great. Good place overall.

excerpts: We got to share the cioppino and there was more than enough food.
The sourdough bread is perfect with this dish.
Pumpkin bread pudding and excellent coffee made for a wonderful end to this meal.
cioppino.author: Barb P.
cioppino.review: Great experience from the front door in including the service, the view, and the food.  We got to share the cioppino and there was more than enough food. The sourdough bread is perfect with this dish. Pumpkin bread pudding and excellent coffee made for a wonderful end to this meal.

excerpts: They split the cioppino with pasta for us in the kitchen before serving.
Delicious.
Our waiter Tyler was attentive, efficient, not intrusive.
cioppino.author: Lisa C.
cioppino.review: Table by the window over the pier.  Crispy tasty calamari strips. Clam chowder that wasn't too thick nor too runny,  lots of clams, yummy.   They split the cioppino with pasta for us in the kitchen before serving.  Delicious.  Our waiter Tyler was attentive, efficient, not intrusive.

excerpts: Must order the Dungeness crab cioppino, so deliciously flavorful since the seafood is very fresh.
The portion is very generous so there will definitely be left overs, which it taste even better the next day!
It's also nice that they provide the option to de-shell the crab for you.
cioppino.author: Stephanie C.
cioppino.review: Must order the Dungeness crab cioppino, so deliciously flavorful since the seafood is very fresh. The portion is very generous so there will definitely be left overs, which it taste even better the next day! It's also nice that they provide the option to de-shell the crab for you.

excerpts: Wine and cocktails, bread fresh from the oven, at the table right away, my brother is vegetarian and he gave him great off menu options, kids were picky he made them happy, Cioppino was amazing, lobster tail YUM, clam chowder, crab cakes all delicious, birthday dessert with a candle... great view of the bay and sea lions.
Seriously, this was an amazing night.
Thank you Fog Harbor team and especially Jason!
cioppino.author: Steph S.
cioppino.review: Our waiter, Jason, made my mom's birthday a stellar experience!! He is awesome, the food was great. Happy Birthday written on the table when we arrived. Wine and cocktails, bread fresh from the oven, at the table right away, my brother is vegetarian and he gave him great off menu options, kids were picky he made them happy, Cioppino was amazing, lobster tail YUM, clam chowder, crab cakes all delicious, birthday dessert with a candle... great view of the bay and sea lions. Seriously, this was an amazing night. Thank you Fog Harbor team and especially Jason!

excerpts: The wines were yummy, as were the calamari & the cioppino (which was large enough for us to share)...
The icing on the cake was the complimentary dessert - the chocolate cake was still warm & just melted in my mouth.
I will definitely come back to try the other dishes & will recommend this place to everyone!
cioppino.author: Jennifer R.
cioppino.review:
Such a wonderful water view while having a great birthday dinner. Our waiter Osscar was so nice & very helpful. The wines were yummy, as were the calamari & the cioppino (which was large enough for us to share)... The icing on the cake was the complimentary dessert - the chocolate cake was still warm & just melted in my mouth. I will definitely come back to try the other dishes & will recommend this place to everyone! Love this place ;-)

P.S. why is there no hot water in the restroom?

excerpts: Seafood cioppino was delicious, husband had fish and chips and no complaints.
I definitely recommend this place!
Our waiter was very attentive, only complaint was the klan of kids next to us that wouldn't be quiet!
cioppino.author: Conchita L.
cioppino.review: Great place at pier 39. The ambience is great with an excellent view towards the harbor. Seafood cioppino was delicious, husband had fish and chips and no complaints. I definitely recommend this place! Our waiter was very attentive, only complaint was the klan of kids next to us that wouldn't be quiet!

excerpts: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and the cioppino was delicious as well.
I highly recommend either of these dishes.
cioppino.author: Daniel T.
cioppino.review: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and the cioppino was delicious as well. I highly recommend either of these dishes.

excerpts: The best Cioppino ever!
Also, great view of the bay.
cioppino.author: Arthur M.
cioppino.review: The best Cioppino ever! Also, great view of the bay.

excerpts: I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well.
The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it.
The service was great as well.
We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times.
I will definitely be back again!
cioppino.author: Lauren C.
cioppino.review: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!

excerpts: The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.
cioppino.author: Gabriella C.
cioppino.review: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money. The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.

excerpts: Highlights: crab cakes, cioppino, crab Louie salad, good burgers.
We had a party of 12 and had excellent service.
I'd reco in the area.
cioppino.author: Greatest E.
cioppino.review: You can do a lot worse in a touristy area. Very tasty. Great service. Highlights: crab cakes, cioppino, crab Louie salad, good burgers. We had a party of 12 and had excellent service. I'd reco in the area.

excerpts: Well, the seafood cioppino has gone from 5 stars to only 2 stars.
Fog Harbor no longer servers crab legs in the soup
and now they use shredded crab meat (not sure of the source)
that doesn't taste good.
What a shame/sham.
cioppino.author: Scott B.
cioppino.review: Well, the seafood cioppino has gone from 5 stars to only 2 stars. Fog Harbor no longer servers crab legs in the soup and now they use shredded crab meat (not sure of the source) that doesn't taste good. What a shame/sham.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Cioppino and took the server's advice of paying a little extra for additional shelled crab meat.
For just a few extra dollars, the extra crab meat was the way to go ... instead of adding pasta for a couple dollars.
My husband absolutely loved his dish and went on to say that it was probably one of the best Cioppinos
he's ever had.
His main props for the dish was because he felt they used quality seafood and not a lot of "filler, cheaper" seafood like calamari.
cioppino.author: Leslie L.
cioppino.review:
Actually, a little higher than 4 stars ... =)

We had a very friendly & attentive waiter which is always great ... no matter where you dine.

I ordered the scallops and it was de-li-ci-ous!!!  Too bad there were only 3 JUMBO scallops, I would have loved at least 1 more ... but that's just greedy me especially when something tastes so great! I asked for a little extra of their Balsalmic Vinegrette Glaze for the scallop on the side.  Very tasty.

My husband ordered the Cioppino and took the server's advice of paying a little extra for additional shelled crab meat.  For just a few extra dollars, the extra crab meat was the way to go ... instead of adding pasta for a couple dollars.  My husband absolutely loved his dish and went on to say that it was probably one of the best Cioppinos he's ever had.  His main props for the dish was because he felt they used quality seafood and not a lot of "filler, cheaper" seafood like calamari.

excerpts: I had the calamari (very tasty, not the usual rubbery yucky stuff); the cioppino (also very tasty, but I couldn't finish all of it); and the tiramisu (man, that's the stuff right there...).
I've never really had managers come up to my table and ask me how I'm doing, I was really impressed that they did that.
For such a large restaurant, they're on top of it.
Plus, the view of the bay isn't too shabby
Check it
out-
it's NOT a tourist trap, I pinky swear.
cioppino.author: Cindy D.
cioppino.review:
So yummy! I love coming to this place, I've been here a couple of times, but this last time, the food and service were exceptional.
The host was super nice (I forget his name, but he was a young Latino). The waitress (I think her name was Monica) was very friendly and checked up on us frequently, but not too much. 
And let me tell you about the food- I'm getting hungry as I write this....
I had the calamari (very tasty, not the usual rubbery yucky stuff); the cioppino (also very tasty, but I couldn't finish all of it); and the tiramisu (man, that's the stuff right there...). I've never really had managers come up to my table and ask me how I'm doing, I was really impressed that they did that. For such a large restaurant, they're on top of it. 
Plus, the view of the bay isn't too shabby :) Check it out- it's NOT a tourist trap, I pinky swear.

excerpts: That memory is saved for an outstanding cioppino.
A ridiculous amount of seafood simmering in a perfect tomato broth.
Sis
and I got one to split, they were kind enough to bring it on two plates, and each half was easily enough for one person.
Cioppino all over yourself is awkward enough.
cioppino.author: Jason B.
cioppino.review:
This is not a four stars yelp for all of Fog Harbor. I wasn't that impressed with most of the menu (nothing too original, Pier 39 pricesfare), the by the script service (nice, but felt like a standard spiel), or even the complimentary two glasses of wine given to my grandparents for their 60th anniversary. Nice gesture, but bringing just two when there were four of us at the table? Awkward. But drink up gparents!

All said, none of the above is what I remember most about eating here. That memory is saved for an outstanding cioppino. A ridiculous amount of seafood simmering in a perfect tomato broth. Sis and I got one to split, they were kind enough to bring it on two plates, and each half was easily enough for one person. It was simply fantastic, enough so to recommend coming here just for your own, and perhaps getting one all for yourself.

Just make sure to bring some extra champagne if you are celebrating. Cioppino all over yourself is awkward enough.

excerpts: , the noodles were too over cooked and my husbands seafood cioppino didn't have enough seafood in it.
cioppino.author: Danyel W.
cioppino.review: Food was average, not worth what we paid. Our waitress was really good and took care of our needs just wish I could say said the food was great! My lobster Mac and cheese was okay, the noodles were too over cooked and my husbands seafood cioppino didn't have enough seafood in it.

excerpts: Cioppino was excellent, hearty, rich broth and plenty of seafood to satisfy any appetite.
Can't go wrong with this house.
cioppino.author: Kyle S.
cioppino.review: Out of all the restaurants on the pier this one might be the best. Great location overlooking the San Francisco harbor, and the menu makes you hungry after going over each item. The service was good, our waiter suggested a few places to see as well as other restaurants to try while staying in the city. Cioppino was excellent, hearty, rich broth and plenty of seafood to satisfy any appetite. Can't go wrong with this house.

excerpts: We've ordered seafood cioppino and it was a home run.
Fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops,and crab legs perfectly blended together.
The dish was large enough for 2 people to start with but added pasta to our order and it was a perfect compliment to the seafood.
Order a bottle of wine to go along with the food
cioppino.author: Vlad P.
cioppino.review:
If you're visiting pier 39 this is definitely the place to go. I've read all the positive reviews on yelp before deciding to go and was definitely not disappointed. 

We've ordered seafood cioppino and it was a home run.  Fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops,and crab legs perfectly blended together. The dish was large enough for 2 people to start with but added pasta to our order and it was a perfect compliment to the seafood. Order a bottle of wine to go along with the food and you have a complete meal. 

There is a little bit of a wait line when you get to restaurant. Make sure you tell the hostess that you want a table with a view on the bay. There is a different waiting time on these tables but the view makes up for it.

excerpts: All the entrees were prepared perfectly, from steak, to cioppino, crab roll, fresh halibut, chowder (outstanding, better than anything I had in Boston), seafood linguine..
I could rhapsodize more, but just trust me -- the food was outstanding.
Truly outstanding service by Khaiman
-- he made our lunch so enjoyable.
Highly recommend eating here.
cioppino.author: Mimi F.
cioppino.review: Was concerned about low ratings and tourist location, but gave it a go on a friend's recommendation.  Very glad I did.  Party of 6, weekday late lunch.  Got a beautiful view of the harbor and beyond.  Appetizers were bleu cheese garlic bread, fried calamari and mussels with fries.  All were excellent, especially the calamari and mussels (had to get every bit of the mussels' sauce with the warm french bread -- heavenly!!).  All the entrees were prepared perfectly, from steak, to cioppino, crab roll, fresh halibut, chowder (outstanding, better than anything I had in Boston), seafood linguine..  I could rhapsodize more, but just trust me -- the food was outstanding.  Truly outstanding service by Khaiman -- he made our lunch so enjoyable.  Highly recommend eating here.

excerpts: : i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top.
I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but
Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful.
I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell.
cioppino.author: Hanna K.
cioppino.review:
One of my favorite places by far!!!

My 5 favorites on the menu:

1. Crab Cakes: crunchy on the outside, so soft and moist on the inside. Its good for the appetizer and for the regular meal as well.

2. Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course). It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna. if you are a tuna fan, you will LOVE IT!!! 

3. Fog harbor burger: My first "sweet" burger ever. This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare). the caramelized onions add such a bursting flavor into my mouth... and the saltiness of the bacon balances the taste.

4. Prawn ravioli: i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top. I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but no matter what the size is... this dish will forever be my favorite pasta dish at Fog Harbor.

5. Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful. I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell. I didnt even bother eating the crab legs because i didnt have tools to crack them with.. but everything else was easy to eat :) 

The service is fantastic and the hosts are super friendly! :) :) 

Oh and before i forget--- 
Dessert recommendations: Lava cake and tiramisu!!!! I love the creme bruele.. but the caramelized topping can be often too chewy for me.

ENJOY! hope this helped!

excerpts: There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...
the chocolate soufflé is delicious).
Everyone loved everything!
cioppino.author: C D.
cioppino.review: We were looking for a place to have a special dinner (Easter); this place was perfect! The restaurant itself is very appealing with the views and decor...of course the food and service is the most important. The service was great! Thank you Mila! We had drinks and appetizers as soon as we ordered them! There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...the chocolate soufflé is delicious). Everyone loved everything!

excerpts: I had the cioppino for the first time and it was tasty and flavorful.
The portion is big enough for two or a very hungry person.
Great service, very attentive waiters.
Reservations are available but we walked in (two of us) with no wait at around 5pm on a Saturday.
Beautiful view of the wharf if you are seated by the window.
cioppino.author: Lyn T.
cioppino.review: I had the cioppino for the first time and it was tasty and flavorful. The portion is big enough for two or a very hungry person. Great service, very attentive waiters. Reservations are available but we walked in (two of us) with no wait at around 5pm on a Saturday.  Beautiful view of the wharf if you are seated by the window.

excerpts: oh and also get the cioppino!!!
its work..but
it is sooo worth it!
they give you the bib and all.
the sauce was very tomato-ey...tasted so fresh.
It goes great with the sourdough bread to scrape off the bottom of the bowl!
they've got a great combination of crab, mussels, clams, and assorted fish in there!
this is a must try!
cioppino.author: Michelle V.
cioppino.review:
Fog Harbor

Went here for lunch. Get the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl!!! it is delicious enough for a meal by itself! the sourdough is baked fresh and they give you more sourdough bread on the side! their clam chowder is FILLED with clams! yes a rarity since sometimes its just all potatoes and other fillers.

oh and also get the cioppino!!! its work..but it is sooo worth it! they give you the bib and all. the sauce was very tomato-ey...tasted so fresh. It goes great with the sourdough bread to scrape off the bottom of the bowl! they've got a great combination of crab, mussels, clams, and assorted fish in there! this is a must try!

excerpts: - we ordered seafood cioppino, fish n chips and Garlic roasted whole crab.
2 out of 3 are disappointing.
The only dish which is really GREAT is seafood ciopino.
The shrimps, scallops are very fresh.
You can feel its original freshness even with the strong flavor soup.
Highly recommended.
For Fish n chips, the chips are ok but the fish is obviously overcooked and very very oily.
The MOST DISAPPOINTING dish is our MOST PRICEY
dish-
Even the crab in the seafood cioppino is tasteless.
cioppino.author: Kolen C.
cioppino.review:
I usually only read review on yelp, this is my first review since I am so disappointed at such a highly rated restaurant.

It's our wedding anniversary last night and my husband want a special dinner for me. After reading so many positive yelp reviews, we decided to give it a try.

Food - we ordered seafood cioppino, fish n chips and Garlic roasted whole crab. 2 out of 3 are disappointing. The only dish which is really GREAT is seafood ciopino. The shrimps, scallops are very fresh. You can feel its original freshness even with the strong flavor soup. Highly recommended.
For Fish n chips, the chips are ok but the fish is obviously overcooked and very very oily. The MOST DISAPPOINTING dish is our MOST PRICEY dish- garlic roasted crab. Once I cracked the shell and trying to take out the meat, from the meat texture, I could tell it's NOT FRESH. My husband verified that since he only tasted the garlic and butter from the crab NOTHING MORE! For me, it's even worse, it's completely tasteless, maybe with a little bit of garlic flavor. But we shouldn't pay $37 for garlic and butter!! We had crab several times before from Nick's Lighthouse food stand. We can tell the difference. Nick's crabs are so fresh and with minimal processing, no garlic no butter, the meat alone is already so tasty. Our conclusion is NEVER get CRAB at FISH House. Even the crab in the seafood cioppino is tasteless. From meat texture to taste, you can definitely tell the crabs are NOT FRESH!

Service- we are surprised to have ALL our dishes coming out AT ONCE. I don't know if that's standard practice for seafood restaurant or not. But to us, this is SO WRONG. After we finish fish n chips(the most time sensitive dish), the rest were already cold as ice. Besides that, the service is ok, not very attentive but will do when you ask. 

Ambiance- the view is unbeatable, 5 stars.

Other- this's the first time I saw "SF Emp Ord 4%" from my bill.we paid anyway. I have no clue what the heck is that. After I google it, I felt like being scammed. Why should I pay for the restaurant employee's health insurance?!That should be the restaurant's responsibility! Does that mean they treat their employees like dirt so customers have to do what they don't to keep their employees live a normal life? They don't pay insurance, customers are obligated to pay for them. They pay waiters poor salary, customers have to pay a large sum to cover it(I DO think tips are necessary for rewarding good service, just don't like it when it become obligation even for poor service) And if that really helps the employees get better health insurance, I feel better with that. But according to Wall Street Journal, mostly are just scammer and go to restaurant. I don't know about this restaurant.

Conclusion-It's very unlikely we will return. If we do, we will NEVER order any crab again

excerpts: My friend and I had the Cioppino and it was pretty awesome.
I would definitely come here again!
cioppino.author: Janessa F.
cioppino.review: I went here for my birthday dinner and the service and food were great!  My friend and I had the Cioppino and it was pretty awesome.  I would definitely come here again!

excerpts: Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino.
We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.
cioppino.author: Lauren W.
cioppino.review: Great tourist spot for the seafood lover if you're strolling around Pier 39. Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino. We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.

excerpts: one person in our group had the cioppino and really liked it.
cioppino.author: Greg V.
cioppino.review: I was impressed, I had the crab roll it was pretty good i would recommend it. one person in our group had the cioppino and really liked it.

excerpts: For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood.
My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment
"This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"
If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!
cioppino.author: Mark J.
cioppino.review: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!

excerpts: I really enjoyed the cioppino, which had a good variety of fish, crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops.
Others enjoyed the crab cakes and steak too.
The view at sunset topped off the meal.
cioppino.author: Brian G.
cioppino.review: There are so many touristy (and mediocre)  restaurant choices near Fisherman's Wharf, so we were surprised to have enjoyed such a wonderful dinner at Fog Harbor. I really enjoyed the cioppino, which had a good variety of fish, crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops. Others enjoyed the crab cakes and steak too. The view at sunset topped off the meal.

excerpts: My father-in-law had the Seafood Cioppino (crab, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in tomato broth, with or without pasta).
They even offer to crack the crab for you, for a few bucks extra, which gets you more crab meat.
It looked fantastic!
And lastly, my mother-in-law got the Fish & Chips, which had an incredible beer batter.
Also, I must highlight that the coleslaw was fantastic:  crunchy cabbage and not overly creamy.
The views of the bay are also beautiful and we enjoyed snapping shots of Alcatraz from our table.
It also has a classy, relaxed atmosphere that was even nicer than I imagined from the reviews and price range designation.
I would have liked options for sides (fries came with everything, but I like variety).
Basically, this is a great place to go if you want delicious seafood and great service, with gorgeous views.
cioppino.author: Amber K.
cioppino.review: My husband, in-laws, and I visited Fog Harbor Fish House a few weeks ago, after finding it here on Yelp.  It was really great!  I had the Crab Cake Entree and the crab cakes were really flavorful, full of crab and not too much filler.  My husband had the Fried Combo, which includes fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.  It was like fried seafood heaven!  I tried some of his calamari and it was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all, and lightly breaded.  Yum.  My father-in-law had the Seafood Cioppino (crab, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in tomato broth, with or without pasta).  They even offer to crack the crab for you, for a few bucks extra, which gets you more crab meat.  It looked fantastic!  And lastly, my mother-in-law got the Fish & Chips, which had an incredible beer batter.  Also, I must highlight that the coleslaw was fantastic:  crunchy cabbage and not overly creamy.  The views of the bay are also beautiful and we enjoyed snapping shots of Alcatraz from our table. It also has a classy, relaxed atmosphere that was even nicer than I imagined from the reviews and price range designation.  I would have liked options for sides (fries came with everything, but I like variety).  Basically, this is a great place to go if you want delicious seafood and great service, with gorgeous views.

excerpts: Loved the cioppino!
It was absolutely delish!
Large portions and excellent service.
Food came surprisingly fast considering we walked in with 9 people in our party.
The sourdough bread was hot with a crisp crust.
My daughter loved the clam chowder.
Said it was even better than Boudin's!
cioppino.author: Jodi L.
cioppino.review: Loved the cioppino!  It was absolutely delish!  Large portions and excellent service. Food came surprisingly fast considering we walked in with 9 people in our party. The sourdough bread was hot with a crisp crust. My daughter loved the clam chowder. Said it was even better than Boudin's!

excerpts: We then moved on to a special they were offering that day, steel head over cheese ravioli and cream sauce that was truly to die for and the Seafood Cioppino which again with the sourdough was very good.
cioppino.author: Leslie B.
cioppino.review:
My boyfriend and I had lunch here on our first day in San Francisco as tourists and I will have to tell ya if we ever visit again we will be returning here no matter how touristy everyone else seems to think it is!! 

The food was great and our server David is probably the best waiter I have ever had the great pleasure to meet. He obviously loves his job and the interaction he is able to have with his guests ( and I mean guests, we were not just mere customers to him). 

We started off with the Red Curry Steamed Mussels as appetizers with the fresh sourdough bread. My boyf is Sinhalese and knows his curries and he really liked this dish, I loved it!!  The mussels cooked perfect!

We then moved on to a special they were offering that day, steel head over cheese ravioli and cream sauce that was truly to die for and the Seafood Cioppino which again with the sourdough was very good. 

We had a couple of the hot drinks from the bar that were good however when 1 turned out to be too strong for us we ordered something else and fully expected to pay for it and were pleasantly surprise to see it not on our bill. 

Dont know when I will get a chance to visit San Fran again but u can be sure I will be stopping by here!!

excerpts: The Cioppino is superb with loads of fresh seafood in a delectable broth.
cioppino.author: Joel W.
cioppino.review:
Fog Harbor Fish House is a gem with an amazing view of San Francisco Bay and the City. On Pier 39, surrounded by many other restaurants that seem to get more exposure, Fog Harbor has the best food and service on the pier. 

The Cioppino is superb with loads of fresh seafood in a delectable broth. I could not find a pasta and seafood combination I wanted so after 30 seconds of discussion with the waiter, I had a custom designed meal with pasta, spinach, garlic, oil, jumbo shrimps, and pine nuts - absolutely delicious and only $18.00.

Anywhere you go on the wharf you will find good to great seafood but if you miss Fog Harbor, you will have missed some of the best seafood and service anywhere in San Francisco.

excerpts: The guys all chose cioppino ($32 each) with pasta (an extra $2 each).
It was a large portion chuck full of clams, mussels, shrimp, and crab.
There was plenty of yummy sauce to sop up with bread.
I had the whole garlic crab ($41)
and I was VERY DISAPPOINTED.
I was expecting a succulent crab dripping in garlicy butter, but instead got a very dry, over-cooked crab with almost no flavor.
Bottom line - view is great, drinks were great, have the cioppino!
BTW, we sat at the bar and had a drink before dinner and the service
AND the drinks were great.
Good bartender!
The service at the table was very good as well - just need someone to pay attention to the reviews on the overcooked crab!
cioppino.author: Scilla M.
cioppino.review: Started out with calamari ($12), clam chowder ($6) and the blue cheese bread ($8).  All was great.  Two of my colleagues added crab meat (an EXTRA $6 each!) to their soup.  The guys all chose cioppino ($32 each) with pasta (an extra $2 each).  It was a large portion chuck full of clams, mussels, shrimp, and crab.  There was plenty of yummy sauce to sop up with bread.  I had the whole garlic crab ($41) and I was VERY DISAPPOINTED.  I was expecting a succulent crab dripping in garlicy butter, but instead got a very dry, over-cooked crab with almost no flavor.  Can't say I would recommend the mixed grill ($26) either as everything was over-cooked. We shared the tiramisu ($8.50 and the dessert duo ($14) along with cappucino ($4).  Bottom line - view is great, drinks were great, have the cioppino!  BTW, we sat at the bar and had a drink before dinner and the service AND the drinks were great.  Good bartender!  The service at the table was very good as well - just need someone to pay attention to the reviews on the overcooked crab!

excerpts: Had the steamed mussels, their famous clam chowder, crab louis salad (huge dish), crab roll, seafood cioppino...
Everything was delicious.
Sat a huge booth, plenty to share.
Really great experience...
a must try!
cioppino.author: Vanessa L.
cioppino.review: I love the food here!!! Such a great view during the day and the portions are massive. Great drinks. Had the steamed mussels, their famous clam chowder, crab louis salad (huge dish), crab roll, seafood cioppino... Everything was delicious. Sat a huge booth, plenty to share. Really great experience... a must try!

excerpts: I had the Cioppino and it was outstanding.
cioppino.author: Paul K.
cioppino.review: This is one of the pricey seafood places at Fisherman's Wharf, on Pier 39. We treat ourselves to one of these on each visit, and this time we chose Fog Harbor. We asked for and were given a window seat with a very nice view. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the Cioppino and it was outstanding. My kids enjoyed the garlic steamed crab, and my wife loved the seafood penne. There is a clean restroom inside the restaurant - shhh, don't tell anyone! My only complaint with the experience is the utterly bogus 3.5% health care surcharge tacked on to every bill. Being California, there's always some nonsense like this going on that people are forced to deal with. I will leave it to you to investigate the origins of this surcharge, but the bottom line is that restaurants are not, in fact required to apply this charge, and their reason for doing so amounts to a political temper tantrum at customer's expense. When I questioned the waiter about this, he gave the straight-faced party line as expected. Can't blame him, really.

excerpts: I had the seafood cioppino.
The sauce tasted like canned plum tomatoes boiled briefly with some dried herbs and was over salted.
The seafood was end piece leftovers.
The only reason for the second star is service.
Our waiter was great.
I just wished he had asked us not to order!
cioppino.author: Timothy L.
cioppino.review: Unfortunately Fog Harbor Fish House was a bit of a let down for us. We had a special crab ceviche appetizer which was okay. I think the problem with crab and acidity though is that the crab flavor just gets completely hidden. Entrees were not great. My wife got the mixed grill fish. The sauce was nothing like what the menu described - it was just missing. The fish was over cooked and dry. I had the seafood cioppino. The sauce tasted like canned plum tomatoes boiled briefly with some dried herbs and was over salted. The seafood was end piece leftovers. The only reason for the second star is service. Our waiter was great. I just wished he had asked us not to order!

excerpts:
Good service
Fish, crab, sourdough bread, cioppino, etc.
Finished off with birthday apple crumble to die for...
How can it be wrong?
cioppino.author: Juliana T.
cioppino.review:
Good service
Fish, crab, sourdough bread, cioppino, etc.
Finished off with birthday apple crumble to die for... 
How can it be wrong?

excerpts: the cioppino was AMAZING!
i love the tomato sauce that it was it!
makes you want more just thinking about it.
there was crab, clams, shrimp and a few different types of fish in my cioppino...
squeeze some lemon..
cioppino.author: Jeannette V.
cioppino.review:
i came here for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised by this place. not only did this place have a great view of fisherman's wharf, but the food was BOMB too!!

the cioppino was AMAZING! i love the tomato sauce that it was it! makes you want more just thinking about it. there was crab, clams, shrimp and a few different types of fish in my cioppino... squeeze some lemon.. and you have PERFECTION!!

the fish and chips were great too!!! perfect batter! perfect!!!

another must try was the clam chowder in a bread bowl! the sourdough bread was warm and chewy! the bread wasnt hard at all, which is important in bread bowls cuz some places have sucky bread!

great time at fog harbor! will come back when in town!

excerpts: The Clam Chowder and the Seafood Cioppino were our favorites, for an extra charge they will crack the crab so you don't get messy.
Best of all, they have a nice fireplace with comfy seating that you can relax and warm up before adventuring back into the cold.
cioppino.author: Amy M.
cioppino.review: Came here on a rare night with my sisters and we stumbled upon this place. We sat at the bar until our table was ready. Staff was attentive and friendly. Drinks were good and made exactly like we wanted. The prices and portions are average, for a restaurant on the wharf. The Clam Chowder and the Seafood Cioppino were our favorites, for an extra charge they will crack the crab so you don't get messy. Best of all, they have a nice fireplace with comfy seating that you can relax and warm up before adventuring back into the cold.

excerpts: I had the Cioppino and was very happy with the selection.
Couple of snivels; comes served with a piece of sourgough on top that is over-oiled and gets soggy in the sauce right away.
I would discourage this presentation technique.
Better to just serve fresh bread on the side.
Also, the sauce itself was a bit on the plain side; non-remarkable flavors beyond a thin tomato sauce.
Otherwise, a wonderful place and would recommend to friends.
cioppino.author: Kenneth W.
cioppino.review: The service made the meal.  Our server was exceptional and went so far as to bring back 2 clams from the kitchen when she noticed that there were a couple of closed ones in my dish.  View of the harbor was picture perfect and made for a very romantic lunch for two.  Definitely make reservations in advance if you are looking to get a good seat; only too easy to do online.  Food was very good as well.  Seafood was fresh and flavorful as one would expect.  My wife had the Dungeness Crab and was thrilled.  I had the Cioppino and was very happy with the selection.  Couple of snivels; comes served with a piece of sourgough on top that is over-oiled and gets soggy in the sauce right away.  I would discourage this presentation technique.  Better to just serve fresh bread on the side.  Also, the sauce itself was a bit on the plain side; non-remarkable flavors beyond a thin tomato sauce.  Otherwise, a wonderful place and would recommend to friends.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Seafood Cioppino with added pasta and we both got  added deshelled crab to top our dishes off and there is nothing better than crab out of the shell!
YUM!
I tried catching our server for another glass of wine but he seemed really busy and didn't look my way.
I ended up leaning over to catch his attention and noticed that the table across from us was trying to catch him too
but he didn't noticed that they had a question about their check....
we enjoyed each of our meals very much and the warm bread in the basket was delicious!
If the server stayed engaged the whole time we might have given this 5 stars.
cioppino.author: Mowdukes H.
cioppino.review: Came here last night after a day trip to the SF Zoo and it was really nice. We were sat right away in a booth near the great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The server was nice and friendly until the end of our visit. I ordered the Napa Landing Chardonnay which was divine and my husband ordered a glass of Anchor Steam which helped each of us unwind. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail for starts and a clam chowder bread bowl for me. My husband ordered the Seafood Cioppino with added pasta and we both got  added deshelled crab to top our dishes off and there is nothing better than crab out of the shell! YUM! I tried catching our server for another glass of wine but he seemed really busy and didn't look my way. I ended up leaning over to catch his attention and noticed that the table across from us was trying to catch him too but he didn't noticed that they had a question about their check....we enjoyed each of our meals very much and the warm bread in the basket was delicious! If the server stayed engaged the whole time we might have given this 5 stars.

excerpts: For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good.
I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me.
There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite.
The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there.
The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices.
All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.
cioppino.author: Katherine L.
cioppino.review: The service is great, the people were super nice and friendly. I like how they give customers a sample of wine without asking or anything, which I guess is a form of marketing. The clam chowder s really good, creamy and chunky, although there isn't really anything about it that makes it particularly any better than other places. Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird. I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated. For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good. I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me. There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite. The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there. The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices. All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.

excerpts: They have the best Seafood Cioppino that I have ever tasted along with the best waitstaff.
During my trip to the bay area a friend
and I dined there twice and each time was wonderful.
I recommend you give it a try.
cioppino.author: Adriana M.
cioppino.review: This has got to be one of the best restaurants in the Pier 39 area. They have the best Seafood Cioppino that I have ever tasted along with the best waitstaff. During my trip to the bay area a friend and I dined there twice and each time was wonderful.  I recommend you give it a try.

excerpts:
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: 
Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) 
Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
whole dungeness crab.author: Elena N.
whole dungeness crab.review:
So I decided to do a touristy day. Since a friend and I were going to be at Fisherman's Wharf, I suggested doing a seafood dinner at Pier 39. I made a reservation through Yelp for a party of two about a week prior for Thursday, September 27th at 7pm. We showed up a few mins early and had to wait for a little bit. We were seated about 10 mins after our reservation at a table by the window, so we had a nice view.

*Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ($16)
*AWARD WINNING CLAM CHOWDER ($9 Bowl)
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
*Duckhorn: Napa Valley, California '17 ($50)

I wanted the crab and clam chowder. Since my friend and I always over order, we added the shrimp. The clam chowder was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. A little thicker than I prefer, but still a good bowl. The crab was a little disappointing. There wasn't enough garlic flavor. Plus, the best part of the crab, the head, was missing. It was just an empty shell for decoration. If a restaurant states a whole crab, I think that should include the head. The shrimp were okay. Had a nice heat, but I didn't really like the sauce. A little too sweet for me. Dinner came with complimentary Bread & Butter, which was good for soup dipping.

Service here was nice and friendly. They were busy cuz there was a convention in town, so there were times when we had to flag down our server. The wine was good and paired well with our food. Both cocktails were okay. A little light for my tastes, but at least the pricing wasn't too bad.

A nice dinner for a touristy spot, but the food was a little underwhelming. 3 stars.

excerpts: The steamed whole Dungeness Crab was well received.
And the Crab Ceviche was outstanding.
Not only was the food very good, so was the service.
whole dungeness crab.author: Ralph R.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Went for lunch while in San Francisco. It's a large Restaurant on Pier 39 on the upper level. The window seats overlook the harbor and the "Sea Lion Resting Area". 
We started with the award winning clam chowder and I could certainly see why it won the award. It was delicious. So was the Dungeness Crab cocktail. 
Of course we had to have the Cioppino which was fantastic. The steamed whole Dungeness Crab was well received. And the Crab Ceviche was outstanding. 
Not only was the food very good, so was the service.

excerpts: The Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab taste very good, the crab meat is enough to make me full.
whole dungeness crab.author: Irene X.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Great seafood restaurant at Pier 39! At first I thought this place is one of the tourists trap but I am glad I gave it a try!
I can say this restaurant is upscale, in terms of service, food quality, atmosphere and of course the price.
The restaurant's lobby is pretty cool with the fireplace and sofa to relax with a glass of cocktail while waiting for your table.
We got one of the best seat overlooking the ocean/pier.
The server is very good explaining what to choose from the menu. 
The Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab taste very good, the crab meat is enough to make me full.
The Cioppino also taste very good, rich in flavor.

If you happen to be at Pier 39 and feeling hungry, I would recommend to stop by at Fog Harbor Fish House Restaurant!

excerpts: I ordered the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (ask for extra garlic butter, if you like a lot like me), which came with veggies and small roasted potatoes.
That was definitely a plus because at any other restaurant i've been to an ordered a whole crab, it just comes with the crab.. nothing more!
whole dungeness crab.author: Qushandia H.
whole dungeness crab.review:
