They have the best Clam Chowder that i've ever had, hands down. Like, I'd go here just for the clam chowder.
I've been here twice.. First visit, We sat in the main room, lights are pretty dim, low restaurant music playing.. really nice but not too fancy restaurant. Cute date spot for sure! Our server was great, he actually took the time to talk to us, ask what we like and made some suggestions. I ordered the shellfish platter for one. I enjoy it. Could have used a little more flavor but that's probably just me lol.. next time, i'll just ask to add garlic butter over the top.

The second time I sat towards the back of the restaurant, "upstairs". I ordered the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (ask for extra garlic butter, if you like a lot like me), which came with veggies and small roasted potatoes. That was definitely a plus because at any other restaurant i've been to an ordered a whole crab, it just comes with the crab.. nothing more! The price for that was $45.. about the same as most places on the pier but felt more of a win because it came with sides.

Fog Harbor has to be my favorite restaurant on the pier, so far. From the restaurant set up & feel, to the servers, food, & scenery. I highly recommend giving it a try.

excerpts: That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.
That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious.
The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too.
When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates.
I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me.
The presentation lost its "WOW" factor
whole dungeness crab.author: Alan L.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Smacked in the middle of Pier 39, I was excited to try this place out because of the amount of reviews it has and the amazing look food. 

The restaurant looks super fantastic. Very high class restaurant except you don't have to be all dressed for it. 

There was only 3 dishes I wanted to try. That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab. 

The baked oysters was such an awesome starter. That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious. I wish I had 3 dozens of those. 

The famous clam chowder in a bread bowl. Probably the best clam chowder I have ever had. The consistency, the flavor, and the chuck of clams were great. The sour dough bread really compliments well with the clam chowder. 

The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too. When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates. I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me. The presentation lost its "WOW" factor and I was super disappointed in that. 

Otherwise the crab was very good. Great garlic flavor. Good chunks of crab meat. 

Should really give this place a shot. Great seafood dishes. Except if you get a whole crab, make sure they serve it whole and not split between two plates.

excerpts: I went all out and ordered a bunch of dishes including oysters, crab cake, whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder, etc. for a couple of hundred dollars.
Food was very fresh and tasty.
Our waiter was friendly and attentive.
whole dungeness crab.author: Angela F. W.
whole dungeness crab.review:
I don't care it's a touristy spot. It's a decent restaurant with an awesome view. Plus it's my dad approved. 

Came here with my dad when we visited SF a few years ago. I was living in Texas back then and wanted to take my dad for a good seafood meal when we were doing our tourist thing at Pier 39. 

After looking at nearby restaurants, we decided to eat here for lunch. I went all out and ordered a bunch of dishes including oysters, crab cake, whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder, etc. for a couple of hundred dollars. Food was very fresh and tasty. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. And the view was amazing. 

My dad was super happy with the food and whole experience. I was so glad he liked it. This place deff brings back memories. Fast forward a few years, I now live in the Bay Area. I'll take my whole family back here when they visit me in the city!

excerpts: And had to order a whole Dungeness crab because it is crab season!!!
I grew up eating crabs and have had Dungeness crab at other places in SF.
I would say the presentation was good, and crab tastes fresh.
But didn't feel amazed by it.
My favorite thing was probably the warm bread with butter that was served before the dinner.
The sunset view was very nice though.
whole dungeness crab.author: Chen C.
whole dungeness crab.review: Very popular spot at Pier 39. Waited over half an hour on a Sunday evening. Luckily there are enough  shops at the pier to walk around before our table is ready. Ordered clam chowder, which was good. And had to order a whole Dungeness crab because it is crab season!!! I grew up eating crabs and have had Dungeness crab at other places in SF. I would say the presentation was good, and crab tastes fresh. But didn't feel amazed by it. My favorite thing was probably the warm bread with butter that was served before the dinner. The sunset view was very nice though.

excerpts: "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter".
Overall we spent $130 not including tip.

10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB:
10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli.
The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering.
Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert.
SHELLFISH PLATTER:
8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry.
He liked the meaty mussels though.
CREME BRÛLÉE:
10/10 perfect sweetness
whole dungeness crab.author: Christal C.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Wow! Amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.  My boyfriend and I wanted to taste a little bit of everything without spending a lot, so we decided to share. We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail". For myself I ordered the  "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter". Overall we spent $130 not including tip. Quite an expensive meal but definitely worth it. 

CHOWDER: 10/10 cup size was perfect to share. Get a little taste without getting full. 
SHRIMP COCKTAIL: 10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB: 10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli. The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering. Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert. 
SHELLFISH PLATTER: 8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry. He liked the meaty mussels though. 
CREME BRÛLÉE: 10/10 perfect sweetness

excerpts: And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes
only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs.
Which is why a star was lost.
Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal.
We were too full for dessert.
And had a ton of leftovers.
:9 great company always makes things amazing.
Good times!
whole dungeness crab.author: Kat K.
whole dungeness crab.review: We came here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Was seated at a lovely table and ordered my favorite old fashioned. I went for a classic instead of their maple but after seeing pics of the maple I'm thinking I might want to try the maple. I wasn't too fond of the paper straws. Would've liked a reg stirrer. We got the Clam chowder bowls with crab. It was really good with a nice stack of fresh crab on top. The mixed grill was also good. Had to add some salt though. The Scallops and crab risotto was pretty good as well. My friend got the Lazy ciopinno which looked good added rice instead of bread. And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs. Which is why a star was lost. Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal. We were too full for dessert. And had a ton of leftovers. :9 great company always makes things amazing. Good times!

excerpts: The whole Dungeness crab was great.
My boyfriend had the clam chowder, but wished he has an option other than sourdough for the bread bowl.
Otherwise, everything was great.
Would recommend coming here if you ever take a trip to San Francisco.
whole dungeness crab.author: Jessica S.
whole dungeness crab.review: Atmosphere was amazing.  I would recommend making a reservation and attempt to get a window seat.The whole Dungeness crab was great.  My boyfriend had the clam chowder, but wished he has an option other than sourdough for the bread bowl.  Otherwise, everything was great.  Would recommend coming here if you ever take a trip to San Francisco.

excerpts: The oysters were pretty good, the fish and chips were cooked perfectly and really tasty, and the whole Dungeness crab was delicious.
Overall, great experience and would totally recommend.
whole dungeness crab.author: Caitlin K.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Was able to snag a reservation here when visiting San Francisco in September of last year. It was a really wonderful meal! From the outside, the restaurant may appear a little touristy and cookie cutter, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our party had requested a table by the window and the view was AMAZING. Watched the sunset and all the seals in the water right off the Pier - would highly recommend for anyone celebrating. 

We started with wine, which was delicious and not horribly overpriced. The oysters were pretty good, the fish and chips were cooked perfectly and really tasty, and the whole Dungeness crab was delicious. Overall, great experience and would totally recommend.

excerpts: Entree ordered was Garlic whole dungeness crab.
whole dungeness crab.author: Robert M.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Excellent food overlooking the pier and bay.  Entree ordered was Garlic whole dungeness crab. Crab cake and cup of award winning clam chowder. 
Having crab cooked with garlic brought out the flavor of the crab!  Crab cake was perfectly cooked while the clan chowder had biteful pieces with every spoonful.

excerpts: For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic.
This thing was huge!
It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess.
I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time.
whole dungeness crab.author: Nicole B.
whole dungeness crab.review:
After walking around Pier 39 for a few hours, my husband and I were hungry for lunch. We stopped at Fog Harbor since our Aquarium of the Bay ticket allowed us to get 15% off the bill. Additionally, since it was on the second level, the view of the bay was fantastic. The inside was very nicely decorated and had plenty of seating. 

We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to greet us and answer any of our questions. We had a tough time deciding what we wanted to eat, but our waitress had some good advice and offered her favorite dishes. For drinks, we both ordered the Alcatraz Escape. This drink was super tasty and my husband is still raving about how delicious it was. The drink was very tropical with orange and pineapple juices with grenadine, coconut rum, and a float of dark rum. I would definitely order it again. 

For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic. This thing was huge! It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess. I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time. By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino. This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth. It was delicious and hit the spot. I eyed the dessert tray, which looked delicious, but we were both stuffed from our meal. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for a seafood fix. It was a little on the pricey side, but I felt it was justified with how delicious everything was, the great service, and the great view. Next time we visit Pier 39, I would definitely come back here and try the other items on the menu.

excerpts: My friends ordered the chicken penne (it was pretty good) and the sole (really soft and flavorful) and I split the whole dungeness crab.
whole dungeness crab.author: Ann T.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Being in such a touristy place, we had to wait about 45 minutes until they called us, but we went back in about 30 and were seated fairly quickly. 

We went for dinner so it was packed but we had a view of the harbor during sunset and it was ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. We could see Alcatraz Island too and the ambiance of the restaurant was really fancy (at least to my poor ass) for somewhere meant for tourists. 

For our drinks we ordered the non-alcoholic Blackberry Press and Strawberry Basil Nojito and both drinks were super super sour and I will probably stick to just water next time. 

The bread was really fresh, warm and fluffy and tasted great with the butter. We ordered a second helping. 

My friends ordered the chicken penne (it was pretty good) and the sole (really soft and flavorful) and I split the whole dungeness crab. 

I am going to say right now I am not a fan of crab due to my past experiences with suffering cracking it open and how bland and dry the innards usually were, BUT THIS WAS NOT THE CASE. It was super moist and had a strong distinct crabby flavor. There was lots of meat available, thus making the tedious process of cracking it open totally worth it. Easily the best crab I've had in my life. The potatoes that came with the dish were kind of greasy and mediocre at best. 

The meal ended with a free Biscotti cookie which I thought was neat. 

Definitely worth it for the crab and bread, but next time I'll skip out on the drinks and pray for a shorter wait time.

excerpts: The crab cakes were lacking crab and the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab was absolutely tasteless.
We will definitely pick a different place next time.
whole dungeness crab.author: Shawn T.
whole dungeness crab.review: We saved this place for our last meal of this SF visit and were extremely disappointed.  After a 30 minute wait, we were seated at a table which had been vacant the entire time.  We were ready to order right away as we had made our choices while waiting but it took some time for our server to get to us..  The crab cakes were lacking crab and the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab was absolutely tasteless.  We will definitely pick a different place next time.

excerpts: I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it.
whole dungeness crab.author: Mimi L.
whole dungeness crab.review:
For a San Francisco dining landmark at PIER 39, I'd expected better, but the food wasn't great, the restaurant is beautiful, the views were spectacular from our booth, amazing views of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge! We passed by this place, thought the decor was nice enough to eat here... The crab house next door didn't look nice to us...

Had a spicy Bloody Mary ($10) at the bar while waiting for our able, it was sooo spicy, but a good one! Bartenders were very strict at carding me! They insisted to see my ID first before making me a drink! ( Hubby had my ID at the moment & he went to restroom) Responsible! That's a good thing. :) 

Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those. The complimentary bread was delicious. 

I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it. 

Hubby had Linguini & Clams ($18), fresh clams, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes: he didn't like it too much, flavorless

Had one more Bloody Mary and a Stella on draft, didn't like the food. We have had wayyyy much better seafood in LA, disappointed, the service was good, the views made up a little bit, but still not impressed. :( Let's try some other places next time.....

excerpts: And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.
To die for!!!
And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.
whole dungeness crab.author: Gene C.
whole dungeness crab.review:
We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.  

All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

excerpts: Scott had the Whole Dungeness Crab with a spicy Thai sauce.
He loved this meal.
The crab was cooked perfectly and the sauce, although messy, was really good.
whole dungeness crab.author: Wendi G.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Service is definitely a standout at this tourist location at Fisherman's Wharf. Our server was top notch and paid attention to detail and incredibly helpful and friendly. We made our reservation via Open Table and that made it easy to get a table but they also gave us a nice amuse bouche to start our dinner. The atmosphere is loud - lots of noise and clanging - so don't plan on an intimate dinner here. 

Scott started with the Award Winning Clam Chowder. He rated the soup a three star and he is quite the clam chowder aficionado. We split the Beet & Blue Cheese Salad - red and golden beets, organic mixed greens tossed with blue cheese dressing topped with walnuts - which was utterly delicious.  The server had the kitchen split the salad which is a detail often missed. The hot from the oven sour dough bread was very tasty that came with our appetizers. As a side note, I wanted the grilled artichoke but the server said the item was not available. 

The food fell to a low point with my entree the Salmon special. It was very dry and served on their mashed potatoes which appeared to be instant or potato pearls. It was not very tasty and I mostly just ate the vegetable on my plate. Scott had the Whole Dungeness Crab with a spicy Thai sauce. He loved this meal. The crab was cooked perfectly and the sauce, although messy, was really good. Had my seafood been as good as the crab I would have bumped them to a four star.

A fun place to try if you are in the mood for a Pier 39 restaurant.

excerpts: By far the best whole Dungeness crab I have ever had.
I had the garlic preparation and can't wait t have it again.
whole dungeness crab.author: Carrie E.
whole dungeness crab.review: I went here with low expectations given it is right in Pier 39.  But wow, what an awesome meal.  By far the best whole Dungeness crab I have ever had.  I had the garlic preparation and can't wait t have it again.

excerpts: I had the Crab Cake Entree with sautéed spinach & roasted fingerling potatoes; my boyfriend had the Fried Shrimp; my brother had the Swordfish; and my sis-n-law had the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (w/out all the nasty stuff from the shell)
....we all enjoyed our meals.
Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!
whole dungeness crab.author: Faye F.
whole dungeness crab.review: I had the Crab Cake Entree with sautéed spinach & roasted fingerling potatoes; my boyfriend had the Fried Shrimp; my brother had the Swordfish; and my sis-n-law had the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (w/out all the nasty stuff from the shell)....we all enjoyed our meals. Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!

excerpts: For the main dish, I had the Halibut special with quinoa, pine nuts, and arugula, and mom had the garlic whole Dungeness crab.
whole dungeness crab.author: Ramona T.
whole dungeness crab.review:
This is a surprisingly great restaurant right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  My mother and I visited San Francisco over the recent holiday and spent one afternoon strolling from the Ferry Building down to Pier 39.  There were already good reviews of this place, so we made a reservation through Open Table (which was nice and easy on a Sunday afternoon) and did some souvenir shopping while we waited for our late lunch.

The hostess seated us at our reservation time to the minute, and we had a great window seat looking directly out on the pier, the Rock, and the beautiful bridge.  Our server Barry was excellent; he was friendly and attentive without hovering, and he got everything right the first time with no hesitation.  I think I overheard him say that he just moved to San Francisco.  I mention this because it sounded like he was trying to play down a heavy British accent - don't you know us American girls (well, at least me and my mom) love that sort of thing?!

All of our dishes and drinks came out perfectly.  We had an appetizer from the specials list - the Dungeness crab and spinach dip - which was delicious, and mom had the "Escape from Alcatraz" cocktail, which she loved.  I had the Gewurztraminer, which is impossible to get by the glass in Florida, so I was thrilled.  For the main dish, I had the Halibut special with quinoa, pine nuts, and arugula, and mom had the garlic whole Dungeness crab.  Both of our dishes were wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned, and everything was obviously fresh and carefully prepared.

The meal wasn't too expensive, and certainly worth the price both for the quality and the volume of food we received.  It is definitely a worthwhile spot to relax, refresh, and refuel while seeing the sights!

excerpts: In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!
Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.
Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.
whole dungeness crab.author: John K.
whole dungeness crab.review: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.

excerpts: We chose the whole dungeness crab for our entrees.
Ladies, if you're wearing a nice outfit, I'd opt for a different dish instead of this messy treat.
The seafood cioppono looked tasty, as did some of the cuts of meat.
We were bibbed for the big event and spent a good 15 minutes hacking away at the shells prior to digging in (our plan of attack:  shell all the meat before feasting).
whole dungeness crab.author: Sarah K.
whole dungeness crab.review:
Our concierge recommended Fog Harbor when discussing options to visit Alcatraz.  Unfortunately, tickets to the prison were sold out so we made a day of it at Haight-Ashbury instead.  I made a reservation at Fog Harbor earlier that day and requested to have a window seat (after all, I heard the place overlooked Pier 39, so why not take advantage of the view)?  

This restaurant is definitely more of a tourist attraction than an authentic fish house, but we still thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Our waitress was the sweetest older woman you'd ever met, and she went out of her way to make sure everything was spot-on.  The location of our table added to the romantic, special experience. 

To start, we had the crab cake, clam chowder, and a salad.  The cake's consistency was perfect--dense with crab meat, lightly seared, accompanied with a red pepper aioli.  The clam chowder was thick, rich and..well...clammy (in a good way), and my boyfriend said the sourdough bread was divine.  I was bummed to hear that they were out of baby spinach...but the portion of romaine more than compensated for this. 

We chose the whole dungeness crab for our entrees.  Ladies, if you're wearing a nice outfit, I'd opt for a different dish instead of this messy treat.  The seafood cioppono looked tasty, as did some of the cuts of meat.  We were bibbed for the big event and spent a good 15 minutes hacking away at the shells prior to digging in (our plan of attack:  shell all the meat before feasting).  The waitstaff kept our area clean, even as the shards of shell flew around us.  

I wish that there had been more veggies on the plate, and the potatoes were a little runny for my taste.  We spent a good two hours enjoying our meals and each others company, never once feeling rushed to leave.  It was a good, solid meal for to conclude our adventure in San Fran.  My senses are piqued and I'm eager to return to the Wharf for more fruits of the sea.

excerpts: My Mother was craving crab, and for $37, Fog Harbor Fish House serves a whole dungeness crab steamed just the way she likes it.
The caesar salad comes with speared romaine, the way I prefer, and the dressing is delicious.
Bread is complimentary and is difficult to stop eating!
I conservatively ordered linguine with clams.
The linguine could have been more al dente, but the serving was generous.
My husband ordered fish and chips.
The woman who served us was extremely polite and doting.
The restaurant is very clean with a pretty interior and a picturesque view of the waterfront.
This is the second meal that we've enjoyed at Fog Harbor Fish House.
whole dungeness crab.author: KJ N.
whole dungeness crab.review: My Mother was craving crab, and for $37, Fog Harbor Fish House serves a whole dungeness crab steamed just the way she likes it. The caesar salad comes with speared romaine, the way I prefer, and the dressing is delicious. Bread is complimentary and is difficult to stop eating! I conservatively ordered linguine with clams. The linguine could have been more al dente, but the serving was generous. My husband ordered fish and chips. The woman who served us was extremely polite and doting. The restaurant is very clean with a pretty interior and a picturesque view of the waterfront. This is the second meal that we've enjoyed at Fog Harbor Fish House.

excerpts: Whole dungeness crab is ruined by cooking in that way.
whole dungeness crab.author: Patrick J.
whole dungeness crab.review: Clam chowder is awesome. Cocktail shrimp is so-so. Whole dungeness crab is ruined by cooking in that way.

excerpts: Whole Dungeness Crab is either steamed or garlic roasted and served with your choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables.
I chose the steamed method with just sautéed vegetables.
If you enjoy the inside of the crab, let your waiter know that you would like them to steam it whole and not to break it open and clean it out.
The best part of the crab is inside.
It reminds me of crab bisque.
Grab a spoon and dig in!
A tip to the kitchen: if someone orders it like this, serve it with the legs up and do not crack open the body shell so the "soup" doesn't drain out.
You can also dip your crab meat into it for a luxurious flavor.
The drawn butter is good too just like with snow or king crab legs.
The crab was steamed to perfection and the meat is sweet and juicy.
Fog Harbor receives crab deliveries every day, freshly caught off the California coast, transported in ocean water filled tanks, held until you order it up.
You can't get anything fresher than that!
The vegetables were sautéed to perfection -crisp with a wonderful butter flavor.
Add a little salt and pepper and you're good to go.
Thumbs up, way up!
whole dungeness crab.author: Chelsea M.
whole dungeness crab.review: Whole Dungeness Crab is either steamed or garlic roasted and served with your choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables. I chose the steamed method with just sautéed vegetables. If you enjoy the inside of the crab, let your waiter know that you would like them to steam it whole and not to break it open and clean it out. The best part of the crab is inside. It reminds me of crab bisque. Grab a spoon and dig in! A tip to the kitchen: if someone orders it like this, serve it with the legs up and do not crack open the body shell so the "soup" doesn't drain out. You can also dip your crab meat into it for a luxurious flavor. The drawn butter is good too just like with snow or king crab legs. The crab was steamed to perfection and the meat is sweet and juicy. Fog Harbor receives crab deliveries every day, freshly caught off the California coast, transported in ocean water filled tanks, held until you order it up. You can't get anything fresher than that! The vegetables were sautéed to perfection -crisp with a wonderful butter flavor. Add a little salt and pepper and you're good to go. Thumbs up, way up!

excerpts:
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: 
Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) 
Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: Elena N.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review:
So I decided to do a touristy day. Since a friend and I were going to be at Fisherman's Wharf, I suggested doing a seafood dinner at Pier 39. I made a reservation through Yelp for a party of two about a week prior for Thursday, September 27th at 7pm. We showed up a few mins early and had to wait for a little bit. We were seated about 10 mins after our reservation at a table by the window, so we had a nice view.

*Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ($16)
*AWARD WINNING CLAM CHOWDER ($9 Bowl)
*Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab: Served with vegetables and roasted fingerling potatoes and butter ($45)
*Ultimate Dirty Martini: Tito's Vodka, dry vermouth, olive juice and a blue cheese stuffed olive ($14)
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: (Up) Bulliet Bourbon, Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth house aged in 5 liter oak barrels ($14)
*Duckhorn: Napa Valley, California '17 ($50)

I wanted the crab and clam chowder. Since my friend and I always over order, we added the shrimp. The clam chowder was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. A little thicker than I prefer, but still a good bowl. The crab was a little disappointing. There wasn't enough garlic flavor. Plus, the best part of the crab, the head, was missing. It was just an empty shell for decoration. If a restaurant states a whole crab, I think that should include the head. The shrimp were okay. Had a nice heat, but I didn't really like the sauce. A little too sweet for me. Dinner came with complimentary Bread & Butter, which was good for soup dipping.

Service here was nice and friendly. They were busy cuz there was a convention in town, so there were times when we had to flag down our server. The wine was good and paired well with our food. Both cocktails were okay. A little light for my tastes, but at least the pricing wasn't too bad.

A nice dinner for a touristy spot, but the food was a little underwhelming. 3 stars.

excerpts: The Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab taste very good, the crab meat is enough to make me full.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: Irene X.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review:
Great seafood restaurant at Pier 39! At first I thought this place is one of the tourists trap but I am glad I gave it a try!
I can say this restaurant is upscale, in terms of service, food quality, atmosphere and of course the price.
The restaurant's lobby is pretty cool with the fireplace and sofa to relax with a glass of cocktail while waiting for your table.
We got one of the best seat overlooking the ocean/pier.
The server is very good explaining what to choose from the menu. 
The Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab taste very good, the crab meat is enough to make me full.
The Cioppino also taste very good, rich in flavor.

If you happen to be at Pier 39 and feeling hungry, I would recommend to stop by at Fog Harbor Fish House Restaurant!

excerpts: I ordered the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (ask for extra garlic butter, if you like a lot like me), which came with veggies and small roasted potatoes.
That was definitely a plus because at any other restaurant i've been to an ordered a whole crab, it just comes with the crab.. nothing more!
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: Qushandia H.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review:
They have the best Clam Chowder that i've ever had, hands down. Like, I'd go here just for the clam chowder.
I've been here twice.. First visit, We sat in the main room, lights are pretty dim, low restaurant music playing.. really nice but not too fancy restaurant. Cute date spot for sure! Our server was great, he actually took the time to talk to us, ask what we like and made some suggestions. I ordered the shellfish platter for one. I enjoy it. Could have used a little more flavor but that's probably just me lol.. next time, i'll just ask to add garlic butter over the top.

The second time I sat towards the back of the restaurant, "upstairs". I ordered the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (ask for extra garlic butter, if you like a lot like me), which came with veggies and small roasted potatoes. That was definitely a plus because at any other restaurant i've been to an ordered a whole crab, it just comes with the crab.. nothing more! The price for that was $45.. about the same as most places on the pier but felt more of a win because it came with sides.

Fog Harbor has to be my favorite restaurant on the pier, so far. From the restaurant set up & feel, to the servers, food, & scenery. I highly recommend giving it a try.

excerpts: And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes
only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs.
Which is why a star was lost.
Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal.
We were too full for dessert.
And had a ton of leftovers.
:9 great company always makes things amazing.
Good times!
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: Kat K.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review: We came here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Was seated at a lovely table and ordered my favorite old fashioned. I went for a classic instead of their maple but after seeing pics of the maple I'm thinking I might want to try the maple. I wasn't too fond of the paper straws. Would've liked a reg stirrer. We got the Clam chowder bowls with crab. It was really good with a nice stack of fresh crab on top. The mixed grill was also good. Had to add some salt though. The Scallops and crab risotto was pretty good as well. My friend got the Lazy ciopinno which looked good added rice instead of bread. And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs. Which is why a star was lost. Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal. We were too full for dessert. And had a ton of leftovers. :9 great company always makes things amazing. Good times!

excerpts: The crab cakes were lacking crab and the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab was absolutely tasteless.
We will definitely pick a different place next time.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: Shawn T.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review: We saved this place for our last meal of this SF visit and were extremely disappointed.  After a 30 minute wait, we were seated at a table which had been vacant the entire time.  We were ready to order right away as we had made our choices while waiting but it took some time for our server to get to us..  The crab cakes were lacking crab and the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab was absolutely tasteless.  We will definitely pick a different place next time.

To die for!!!
And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!

Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.
Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.author: John K.
garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.review: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.

excerpts: Is definitely worth it to get the shellfish platter or tower if you're into seafood!
A great variety and nice portion.
shellfish platter.author: Teda R.
shellfish platter.review:
From the food, to the view, and to the staffs, it's all marvelous! I've been here so many times with my family because we really do enjoy eating here. It's our to go restaurant whenever we are adventuring around the Pier or craving clam chowder. I'm from Stockton and yes, we really do drive to SF sometimes just to eat here lol!

I've tried countless of restaurants in SF that serves clam chowder, and I think Fog Habor have the best ones! + adding crab meat makes it extra delicious! Is definitely worth it to get the shellfish platter or tower if you're into seafood! A great variety and nice portion. The salsa dipping sauce that came with the Shellfish Tower was to die for. It's mixed very well with the touch of crab meat too. I love crab meat as you can tell lol! I love French fries as well, so I decided to try the Mussel Fries starter and I think the most tasty thing of it wasn't the mussels and fries alone, it was the creamy white sauce they used with it. Very different but I like. 

The servers here are sooo sweet and friendly. They're the ones to lit up the atmosphere of the restaurant. I never once experienced bad service here. 

I think the only con here is the waiting. It's usually very busy on weekends and especially during dinner hours, which is when I'm usually here lol. You can either reserve ahead of time or put yourself onto the waitlist on Yelp before arriving. It really does help the waiting time to be lessen.

I definitely recommend this restaurant!

excerpts: My family is a huge fan of the shellfish platter.
Although it's a bit on the pricier end, it encompasses all the seafood favorites that anyone can ever wish for in a meal!

$20
Shellfish platter: ~$50 for a sizable amount of seafood

Overall opinion:
shellfish platter.author: Yixuan L.
shellfish platter.review:
Food: 
This is a great place to go for special occasions! I've celebrated many birthdays, anniversaries, and valentine's days here. I've always sat near the windows for a beautiful view of the water. My absolute favorites on the menu would have to be the award winning clam chowder.  The calamari is one of the best I've tried, and I'm a huge sea food lover. It's paired with fried onions and jalapeños. The dipping is a creamy aioli sauce that truly brings out the flavor of the calamari. For the entree, I usually order the linguini and clams. The amount of clams that's served is unbelievable! If you aren't in the mood for something super heavy, I would go with this dish to satisfy any seafood cravings. It also comes with a slice of garlic bread that pairs really well with the sauce. My family is a huge fan of the shellfish platter. Although it's a bit on the pricier end, it encompasses all the seafood favorites that anyone can ever wish for in a meal! Mussels, clams, shrimp, and half a Dungeness crab. 

Price & Portions:
Clam chowder: I usually go with a cup, but for an additional $2 you can get a large bowl to share between 2-3 people!
Calamari: I would say for a $15 plate, it can comfortably serve 3-4 people as a starter dish! 
Linguini and clams: Not a lot of pasta, but still quite filling. $20
Shellfish platter: ~$50 for a sizable amount of seafood

Overall opinion: 
If you're ever on Pier 39, this is a must-try, not only is the food delicious  but the ambiance is one of a kind. Service here is wonderful, the waiters really make an effort to ensure your time there is well-taken care of!

excerpts: Tried the clam chowder bread bowl and shellfish platter.
You can find a bread bowl on any corner of the wharf and you're overpaying to eat it here.
The crab in the shellfish platter had little to no meat in it.
Entree was covered in too much garlic.
We also had 2 vegetarians in our party and extremely limited options available-- they tried a couscous with veggie and pasta with veggie dishes.
shellfish platter.author: Monica K.
shellfish platter.review:
Long wait on a Sunday afternoon and no advance reservations allowed. Walked through the restaurant while waiting to use the restroom and saw at least 10 empty tables. Hostesses were also rude when approached to ask wait times. 

Food was okay. Tried the clam chowder bread bowl and shellfish platter. You can find a bread bowl on any corner of the wharf and you're overpaying to eat it here. The crab in the shellfish platter had little to no meat in it. Entree was covered in too much garlic. We also had 2 vegetarians in our party and extremely limited options available-- they tried a couscous with veggie and pasta with veggie dishes. Both bland and lacked salt. 

If you're looking for overpriced food with a good view, this is your spot.

excerpts:
For a party of 4 adults and 1 toddler, we ordered the following items:
- crab cakes
- calimari
- 2 bowls of the clam chowder (+ added the Dungeness crab)
- shellfish platter for 2
- whole garlic roasted Dungeness crab
It tasted even better when dipped in the garlic butter from the shellfish platter or roasted garlic Dungeness crab.
Overall, everything tasted good considering this is a touristy area.
The shellfish platter and Dungeness crab are good picks for said fans.
Like I said earlier, it's the roasted garlic and garlic butter  that makes the difference
and I'm not even a seafood fan.
While the clam chowder was nice and creamy, it was pretty heavy and filling as well.
I wouldn't opt for their bread bowl since you're already given sourdough bread.
The only disappointing item we ordered would probably have to be the crab cakes.
shellfish platter.author: Steph F.
shellfish platter.review:
The family and I planned a day trip to go check out Aquarium of the Bay and decided to have the whole Pier 39 tourist experience. We can't remember the last time we came out here but decided to go enjoy the fresh seafood San Francisco has to offer. Fog Harbor Fish House was the top of all the Pier 39 restaurant lists that I saw and that's where we stopped for lunch after checking out the aquarium. 

The restaurant was located on the second floor, across from the aquarium exit (how convenient). It's also next to the California Welcome Center so stop by there as well to get a one hour free parking validation and coupon book. The coupon book included a free garlic blue cheese appetizer with purchase of any entree that you could use. Fog Harbor also provides one hour of parking validation for the garage across the street.

At a little after 11am on a Sunday (on Pride weekend too), there was no wait. You can make reservations ahead of time online but it's limited. The restaurant actually saves most of their tables for walk in guests. The restaurant did get pretty crowded by the time we left and there were people waiting outside for their table. 

We had a table by the window and had a great view of the pier and Golden Gate Bridge. Their menu is pretty extensive but I had a chance to look on Yelp ahead of time to plan out what I wanted to order.

For a party of 4 adults and 1 toddler, we ordered the following items:
- crab cakes
- calimari
- 2 bowls of the clam chowder (+ added the Dungeness crab)
- shellfish platter for 2
- whole garlic roasted Dungeness crab

The freshly made sourdough bread was warm and delicious. It tasted even better when dipped in the garlic butter from the shellfish platter or roasted garlic Dungeness crab. Overall, everything tasted good considering this is a touristy area. The shellfish platter and Dungeness crab are good picks for said fans. Like I said earlier, it's the roasted garlic and garlic butter  that makes the difference and I'm not even a seafood fan. While the clam chowder was nice and creamy, it was pretty heavy and filling as well. I wouldn't opt for their bread bowl since you're already given sourdough bread. The only disappointing item we ordered would probably have to be the crab cakes. I wasn't a fan of the crab filling.

Our server was friendly but kinda left us alone after our main entrees came out. We had to ask about our appetizers towards the end because he forgot about them. Luckily, it didn't take too long before they came out.

The restaurant is pretty child friendly. You can park your strollers out front, they have highchairs for toddlers, changing area in the restrooms, and crayons and coloring sheets for the little ones. That alone distracted my toddler long enough to enjoy our meal. 

While I'm probably unlikely to come back again unless I'm showing out of town visitors around SF, I would recommend others to come here if they're looking for somewhere decent to eat around Pier 39. For what you pay for at Fog Harbor, you get fresh seafood, great views, and a nice dining environment.

excerpts: and the Shellfish platter was full of mussels, clams, crab legs, and shrimp in a lovely butter sauce.
shellfish platter.author: Jeffrey S.
shellfish platter.review:
Great food, lovely view, fun location, a bit pricey (as expected).

Right in the heart of Pier 39, on the second floor, gives a lovely view of the piers and the Bay. It can get crowded (mostly with tourists), but even as an SF resident I think this place has some of the best seafood (at relatively reasonable prices, considering the location, and quality and quantity of food) in town. I've been to many other fancier seafood places all around SF and I usually find their portions small and their prices even higher than here!

The garlic sourdough bread with Pt. Reyes blue cheese appetizer was great and incredibly flavorful. The Cioppino is a classic and was excellent (and we got it 'lazy', which means for a few dollars more they de-shell the crab for you!) and the Shellfish platter was full of mussels, clams, crab legs, and shrimp in a lovely butter sauce.

excerpts: ordered the shellfish platter with garlic noodle and the fish and chips.
OMG when it came out it was huge.
the plate was the size of me!
and that was just for 1 person.
they have an option for 2 people.
i cant imagine how big that would be.
it came with lots of shrimp, mussels, clams, half crab, potatoes, and the whole bottom was full of garlic noodle.
everything was delicious.
the fish n chips had 3 huge fish very plump with a lot of fries.
we were dying trying to finish it all.
but in the end the quantity was too much for us.
had to throw in the towel.
and dessert?
forget about it.
couldnt move.
the prices are okay
i mean its seafood
so its gonna be a little more on the high side.
overall it surpassed my expectations.
shellfish platter.author: Matthew G.
shellfish platter.review: my first impressions: 4000+ reviews so must be good.  second impression: its in pier 39 so it must be a tourist trap.  decided to go in anyways.  came in around 8pm on a sunday and still had to wait about 5 minutes.  surprisingly it was pretty busy.  got a chance to look at the menu before we sat down.  sat us down and gave us bread and water.  the sourdough was fresh out of the oven.  sooo good with that butter.  even better with a bowl of clam chowder.  it was creamy and lots of clams.  ordered the shellfish platter with garlic noodle and the fish and chips.  OMG when it came out it was huge.  the plate was the size of me! and that was just for 1 person.  they have an option for 2 people.  i cant imagine how big that would be.  it came with lots of shrimp, mussels, clams, half crab, potatoes, and the whole bottom was full of garlic noodle.  everything was delicious.  the fish n chips had 3 huge fish very plump with a lot of fries.  we were dying trying to finish it all.  but in the end the quantity was too much for us.  had to throw in the towel.  and dessert? forget about it.  couldnt move.  the prices are okay i mean its seafood so its gonna be a little more on the high side.  overall it surpassed my expectations.

excerpts: My husband had the Shellfish Platter (half crab, mussels, clams, & fingerling potatoes -$39 for one) and added a lobster tail (5-6oz, $24).
He enjoyed all of it, but says the one thing he'd dock a star for is that the crab was a little dry.
shellfish platter.author: Lani S.
shellfish platter.review:
Let's be clear. My husband and I were probably the only two in the restaurant who were not tourists given this is located at Pier 39. We went last Friday and it is Lent, so I don't eat meat. The hub searched for seafood places and came across this place on Yelp with high ratings. It did not disappoint, and as a local, I'm glad. 

The menu said that the clam chowder was award winning, so we had to try it. It was delicious --thick, creamy, flavorful, with big chunks of clam, not like other places that use extra potatoes for filler. $7 for a cup.

My husband had the Shellfish Platter (half crab, mussels, clams, & fingerling potatoes -$39 for one) and added a lobster tail (5-6oz, $24). He enjoyed all of it, but says the one thing he'd dock a star for is that the crab was a little dry. I had the Grilled Shrimp Brochette (sauteed spinach, butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, $22). The shrimp were a good size, it was flavorful, but a tad oilier than I like. 

Yes, we had dessert! For him: Apple Crisp a la mode. For me: as if I'd have anything other than tiramisu. They were both very good. $9 each. The tiramisu was probably one of the best I've had-- creamy and not over-soaked w/ espresso & liqueur like many others. 

I'd give this probably 4 stars, however our server, Brianna (assuming that was her name-- it was on our receipt!), really made the difference. Add another star just for her. She was welcoming from the start, friendly, not pushy, and kept checking on us. What gave us a good chuckle was that as we were leaving, she she wished us a nice "rest of your vacation," assuming we were tourists. We had a nice, quick chat w/ her and made our way out. Thanks, Brianna!

excerpts: Some of us decided to order the shellfish platter (good for 3 people) + 3 lobster tails.
I thought it wouldn't be enough for me, so I ended up ordering the crab Louie salad as well.
OMG, when the food came out, I was overwhelmed.
The shellfish platter and my salad was huge!
Everything tasted so good though.
Shellfish platter was cooked with butter and tons of garlic.
Seafood was fresh and it was worth the price we paid.
Definitely coming back and ordering maybe just the shellfish platter next time.
shellfish platter.author: Kristel V.
shellfish platter.review:
If you want fresh seafood, you better come here! Was here for a weekend with friends and since we were in SF, we wanted seafood! We were seated by the window and had a nice view of the bay. Some of us decided to order the shellfish platter (good for 3 people) + 3 lobster tails. I thought it wouldn't be enough for me, so I ended up ordering the crab Louie salad as well. OMG, when the food came out, I was overwhelmed. The shellfish platter and my salad was huge! Everything tasted so good though. Shellfish platter was cooked with butter and tons of garlic. Seafood was fresh and it was worth the price we paid. Definitely coming back and ordering maybe just the shellfish platter next time. 

Our waiter was as very nice as well. Will be back!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I got the shellfish platter for 2.
Prior to the arrival of the food, Lidia put our bibs on and even fixed my hair after putting it on.
That bit of care for her customer got her a good tip from my boyfriend and
I.
shellfish platter.author: Marie V.
shellfish platter.review:
Updated review:


My boyfriend and I went here on a nice Saturday. Our first trip to SF for 2018! Wait time was only 15-20 mins which wasn't bad. We got seated and our server Lidia did great. She made sure to ask about food allergies! I'm happy that she asked because I am allergic to shrimp. My boyfriend and I got the shellfish platter for 2. Prior to the arrival of the food, Lidia put our bibs on and even fixed my hair after putting it on. That bit of care for her customer got her a good tip from my boyfriend and I. It meant she actually cared. 

On top of the great customer service, the food is always excellent.

excerpts: I ordered the shellfish platter for one.
I enjoy it.
Could have used a little more flavor
but that's probably
just me lol..
shellfish platter.author: Qushandia H.
shellfish platter.review:
They have the best Clam Chowder that i've ever had, hands down. Like, I'd go here just for the clam chowder.
I've been here twice.. First visit, We sat in the main room, lights are pretty dim, low restaurant music playing.. really nice but not too fancy restaurant. Cute date spot for sure! Our server was great, he actually took the time to talk to us, ask what we like and made some suggestions. I ordered the shellfish platter for one. I enjoy it. Could have used a little more flavor but that's probably just me lol.. next time, i'll just ask to add garlic butter over the top.

The second time I sat towards the back of the restaurant, "upstairs". I ordered the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (ask for extra garlic butter, if you like a lot like me), which came with veggies and small roasted potatoes. That was definitely a plus because at any other restaurant i've been to an ordered a whole crab, it just comes with the crab.. nothing more! The price for that was $45.. about the same as most places on the pier but felt more of a win because it came with sides.

Fog Harbor has to be my favorite restaurant on the pier, so far. From the restaurant set up & feel, to the servers, food, & scenery. I highly recommend giving it a try.

excerpts: Wouldn't mind coming back to try the shellfish platter :)
shellfish platter.author: Anna M.
shellfish platter.review:
For such a tourist area, I was impressed with the food/prices here! Came here for a quick snack around 1:30pm on Sunday and was seated within 10 mins. Crazy busy at all times!

We were seated next to the window which was great, but it was freakin' HOT! If the sun's out and it's warm outside, ask for a seat away from the windows. There's no way to get away from the heat otherwise!

Ordered:
x Clam Chowder in Sourdough - I was craving clam chowder the second I woke up and this one did not disappoint! I LOVEEE sourdough bread so the bread bowl was just EVERYTHING! Tore apart the whole bowl and eat 90% of it. Not sure if it's true, but the clam chowder received an award from "best clam chowder" :P Only $11!
x Mussels & Fries - Flavor were great and the mussels were so fresh/perfectly cooked, but the mussels were SO big it was hard for me to eat. I get easily grossed out by huge shellfish so it just wasn't my cup of tea. If you don't mind that, you'd LOVE this dish. 

Fun area to go to once in awhile. Wouldn't mind coming back to try the shellfish platter :)

A-OKAY in my book!

excerpts: Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.
shellfish platter.author: danielle a.
shellfish platter.review:
This is one of our favorite local spots. It's great for a sit down dinner with friends but they also have bar seating that's first come first serve. I will say the service is MUCH better if you sit at a table. Great views & for as touristy as it is the food is killer!

One of my favorite dishes is the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon. There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood. Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards. We basically lick our plates clean. Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.

The fog house lager is really good! Try their beers

excerpts:
3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!:
shellfish platter.author: Shannen R.
shellfish platter.review:
Two words: Tourist Trap.

Located in Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House sits on the 2nd Floor amongst many restaurants. It's outdoor waiting area is relaxing, spacious, and modern. It felt like I was sitting on a daybed in Hawaii and my parents can second that. 

Fancy? Yes. Pricey? Sure. Food content? As Yelp suggests, it is A-Ok.

I took my parents and siblings out to eat and only waited for 10 minutes to get seated. For a Monday afternoon, this place was already busy. Our host led us to our booth overlooking the pier and boy was that a treat. 

The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn. It was a little salty for my taste but my parents loved it!

Clam Chowder - Cup vs. Bowl - What should you get? Well, my sister and I ordered the cup size, which really is a size of an espresso cup. It was good enough to fill that clam chowder craving. My mom had the bowl. We all concurred that the chowder tasted pretty bland. Our waiter even forgot to give us crackers - whomp! 

Salmon - Yes, you've read that right. The plate is called Salmon. My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it. He gives it 4 stars.

Cioppino - Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food. So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth. It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out. 3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!: Mom and sister had to share this one out. They barely finished the whole plate. This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino. The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time. 5 stars.

Surf and Turf: Brother wanted some meat so he settled for this. He demolished his steak and lobster but says his veggies and mash potatoes were gross. 4 stars.

Drinks:

The  "Perfect Hibiscus Margarita" was really perfect. It was beautifully decorated and STRONG. My dad even tried it and got tipsy with this look deceiving drink. 5 stars. All that for $13.50? What a steal.

My dad's Lombard Lemonade was a refreshing drink. Again beautifully decorated and well worth the price.

Large portions, beautiful plates, and bomb drinks. And would you take a look at that seafront view?!

So why three stars?

Well, the food was A-Ok. It sure wasn't bad but it definitely didn't blow me away either. Solid 3 stars.

excerpts: We had clam chowder and the shellfish platter for two with lobster tails.
After taxes and tip we spent aout 200$.
It is unfortunate and unacceptable to get sick at a restaurant as expensive and well established as this.
I have reached out to the establishment regarding my experience.
shellfish platter.author: Danielle M.
shellfish platter.review: Unfortunately this 1 star review is due to the fact that I got violently sick, after eating here last night. We had clam chowder and the shellfish platter for two with lobster tails. After taxes and tip we spent aout 200$. It is unfortunate and unacceptable to get sick at a restaurant as expensive and well established as this. I have reached out to the establishment regarding my experience.

excerpts:
The food we ordered: 
Crispy Calamari-super light batter and fried to perfection
Shellfish Platter-great variety, they did not skimp out 
Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab-I loved the sauce base and potatoes were just a bonus hehe
shellfish platter.author: Grace H.
shellfish platter.review:
This was my first time visiting, but my friend who has visited many times before always raved about the service. She booked a reservation for my birthday weekend and I was delighted to have my birthday dinner here. 

Justin was the SWEETEST server ever!!! Absolutely loved him and all of his recommendations! He was very thoughtful and always checked up on us. Because it was my birthday, he brought out the dessert tray and let me choose one! He also rallied up his coworkers to sing to me, which I really appreciated as I noticed some other tables didn't get the same service. I'm so happy Fog Harbor hired such a sweet gentleman like Justin. Service was seriously impeccable!!!! I will always request Justin whenever I visit now. 

The food we ordered: 
Crispy Calamari-super light batter and fried to perfection
Shellfish Platter-great variety, they did not skimp out 
Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab-I loved the sauce base and potatoes were just a bonus hehe 

I think this was more than enough food for two small girls, we were definitely struggling to finish everything, BUT SO WORTH IT JUST DO IT DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT.

excerpts: We then shared the combo fried seafood plate and the shellfish platter.
We had so much food it was for dinner as well.
I give them 5 stars and looking forward to our next trip.
Yummy!
shellfish platter.author: Asia V.
shellfish platter.review: Good food,atmosphere, service and view. This restaurant has it all. We went here for lunch on our Anniversary after reading the reviews.  I can tell you that this is a good place to go for a date or if you just want to have delicious seafood. We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again. We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.  It was good also. We then shared the combo fried seafood plate and the shellfish platter. We had so much food it was for dinner as well. I give them 5 stars and looking forward to our next trip. Yummy!

excerpts: The shellfish platter is a must!
The hubs is a big guy, so the platter for two plus the lobster was filling for him.
I feel as though if he were to have bought it for 1, he'd be asking for a snickers bar (drumroll, with a hit of the symbols - bam).
Shellfish platter for two came with 1 whole crab, 12 clams, 12 shrimp and 12 mussels.
shellfish platter.author: Natasha R.
shellfish platter.review:
While the hubs and I are on our way to our go-to spot to get our crab craving fix, on a whim we decided to try some place new, and boy i do not regret that decision one bit!

We agreed on Fog Harbor Fish House based on their Yelp reviews (thank you, fellow Yelpians).

We started with the calamari. Mouth.Watering. it's the jalapenos, i swear! And to top it off with the lemon aioli. I died, inside. Happily.

The shellfish platter is a must! The hubs is a big guy, so the platter for two plus the lobster was filling for him. I feel as though if he were to have bought it for 1, he'd be asking for a snickers bar (drumroll, with a hit of the symbols - bam). Shellfish platter for two came with 1 whole crab, 12 clams, 12 shrimp and 12 mussels. We added a lobster for an additional cost.

 The seafood penne was satisfying. Not as much flavor as I wished for, but I guess it's expected when you have a variety of seafood in a pasta - I'm assuming they were trying to put an emphasis in the seafood, rather than seasoning it up and hiding the seafood's natural flavor. And I am not mad at that.

And to end our beautiful experience (almost cried because desserts are always a reminder that you are almost done) I couldn't help, but salivate over their apple crisp. Lord, help me.

Just screw this review and go and get yourself a seat at this place.

excerpts: We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl.
That's more than enough food for my mom and me.
The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful.
Great experience!
shellfish platter.author: Yang L.
shellfish platter.review: Went there on a Thursday lunch time. Didn't have to wait and we even got a window table with fantastic pier view. We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl. That's more than enough food for my mom and me. The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful. Great experience!

excerpts: Also when my shellfish platter came out, it was pretty hot and he just hands me the plate and doesn't say anything.
shellfish platter.author: Junella T.
shellfish platter.review:
This place is good in only a tourist trap kinda way can be. Don't get me wrong,  I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere, but come'on. For the price of our entrees, we should be getting way better everything.

Our waiter couldn't be bothered to remember our order. We were a party of 4 and whenever drinks or food came out. He would just randomly put stuff down and not remember who ordered what. Also when my shellfish platter came out, it was pretty hot and he just hands me the plate and doesn't say anything.

I ordered a cup of clam chowder and the shell fish platter for one. The platter is 1/2 of a crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and fingerling potatoes.  The seafood was good but very messy. They give you a bib to wear but that only help with the splatter and not your hands. Don't get me wrong I love to eat seafood with my hands but this platter was cooked with a TON of garlic and butter so the entire plate was drowning in it. It overwhelms the taste of the seafood.   

I would consider coming back but with SF being a foodie city. There are many better places out there for seafood.

excerpts: My boyfriend had the shellfish platter and I got the lazy cioppino with linguine added.
It was worth the wait.
shellfish platter.author: Sokhom K.
shellfish platter.review:
My boyfriend and I came here last night after out Alcatraz tour to celebrate our 7 years. I knew i should of made a reservation and didn't :(. we had to wait about 45 mins for a table for 2 no biggie. The place is packed for sure. Don't knock this place because it's at pier 39. Im very picky when it comes to my seafood. 

Our server that night was Jane. She was wonderful!! She was very prompt and very courteous. I had a glass of Moscato that too me back to when I had it in Las Vegas at the Delano and she was awesome enough to get me the name. My boyfriend had the shellfish platter and I got the lazy cioppino with linguine added. It was worth the wait.

excerpts: I got the Shellfish Platter and I have to say its perfect, not smelly, bad, sticky or anything like that.
The prices are worth it because of how good the food is.
shellfish platter.author: Jeffery H.
shellfish platter.review: With a couple of friends and we had a great time with the fresh sea foods on the platter, soup, plates, and combos. I got the Shellfish Platter and I have to say its perfect, not smelly, bad, sticky or anything like that. The prices are worth it because of how good the food is.

excerpts: So my wife and I shared a shellfish platter for 2 and my kids shared the sliders appetizer.

The dinner also came with delicious warm sourdough - which was absolutely delicious - and went along perfectly with the shellfish platter's garlic/butter sauce - like a delicious slice of warm garlic bread MMMMMMMMmmmm...
The shellfish platter portion size was very generous, and the crab meat was tender and sweet.
I am a big fan of shellfish - and I felt the mussels and clams were absolutely wonderful!
shellfish platter.author: Ryan Y.
shellfish platter.review:
I must admit when I first walked up to Fog Harbor I was extremely skeptical.  Like seriously, a seafood restaurant in Pier 39?  Being a native of the Bay Area I always associated Pier 39 with overpriced parking and totally tourist trap restaurants.  Value, flavor, and good service in this area historically was very hard to come by.  

But alas, my wife was craving seafood and we were already on location so I said - why not?!   So my wife and I shared a shellfish platter for 2 and my kids shared the sliders appetizer.  The dinner also came with delicious warm sourdough - which was absolutely delicious - and went along perfectly with the shellfish platter's garlic/butter sauce - like a delicious slice of warm garlic bread MMMMMMMMmmmm...

The shellfish platter portion size was very generous, and the crab meat was tender and sweet.  I am a big fan of shellfish - and I felt the mussels and clams were absolutely wonderful!  Shrimp were on the smaller size - but still nice nonetheless.

The star of the show however was our waiter - Jose.  He was amazing in his attentiveness - he even brought out a live "condemned" lobster to cheer my crying daughter up.  He totally went the extra mile to make our experience incredibly memorable.   Kudos to Jose!

excerpts: I recommend  ordering Shellfish Platter and clam chowder they are delicious.
shellfish platter.author: Jenny S.
shellfish platter.review: The restaurant water view is amazing at Pier 39. I recommend  ordering Shellfish Platter and clam chowder they are delicious.

excerpts: but I had the shellfish platter.
That's was great too.
Service was commendable.
Wife had the chicken pasta penne was okay and average.
I'm giving the place 5 for my dishes.
Bread was okay.
shellfish platter.author: A T.
shellfish platter.review: Stopped by with the wife today.  The crab cakes were the best I've ever had.  I would go back just for that alone.  Wow, out of this world.  Almost ordered another one but I had the shellfish platter.  That's was great too.  Service was commendable.  Wife had the chicken pasta penne was okay and average.  I'm giving the place 5 for my dishes.  Bread was okay.

excerpts: Then I ordered the shellfish platter for one, cooked cajun style because I special requested it that way.
I highly recommend the chili shrimp and shellfish platter!
shellfish platter.author: Teena N.
shellfish platter.review:
Service was great, interior and view was excellent, food was delicious. The only thing I didn't care too much for was the clam chowder bowl.

They have us a bowl of bread which we wish we saved for the appetizer we ordered. 
We got the chilli shrimp, it was so delicious !! They topped it off with two garlic bread, but we devoured that so quickly because the sauce was perfection. We would have used the bread they gave us in the beginning to dip it in the sauce. (I'm sure they would he gave us more if we asked)

Then I ordered the shellfish platter for one, cooked cajun style because I special requested it that way. I wouldn't have it any other way, it was finger licking good.

The clam chowder bowl with crabs was slightly bland for my tasting. I didn't care too much about it. 

I highly recommend the chili shrimp and shellfish platter! 

Enjoy!

excerpts: We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto.
That was so delicious!
There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly.
The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor.
If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto.
You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!
shellfish platter.author: Fanny S.
shellfish platter.review: This was the best thing that I had on my San Francisco trip! The food was delicious, and the service was great! We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto. That was so delicious! There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly. The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor. If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto. You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!

excerpts: I got the shellfish platter and added a lobster tail.
If you don't mind spending $8000 for dinner, this place is awesome!
The sourdough bread was delicious.
The chowder in a bread bowl was OK, but not as good as new England to be honest.
My wife had some beef skewers for an appetizer that were absolutely delicious!
Her risotto for dinner was weird...
I couldn't tell if it was risotto or Rice-A-Roni!
I guess that is the San Francisco treat...
Ha ha.
Anyway, the rice was not like a typical risotto.
It wasn't sticky enough, and it needed I heckuva lot more Parmesan cheese and maybe just a tad more seasoning in general!
It was very tasteless.
Not a big enough let down to not give this place five stars though.
It truly was an amazing place.
Oh, and I know this is stupid, but the lemonade was awesome!
shellfish platter.author: Jim C.
shellfish platter.review: The views are to die for, the service is top notch, and the food was excellent! I got the shellfish platter and added a lobster tail. If you don't mind spending $8000 for dinner, this place is awesome! The sourdough bread was delicious. The chowder in a bread bowl was OK, but not as good as new England to be honest. My wife had some beef skewers for an appetizer that were absolutely delicious! Her risotto for dinner was weird... I couldn't tell if it was risotto or Rice-A-Roni! I guess that is the San Francisco treat... Ha ha. Anyway, the rice was not like a typical risotto. It wasn't sticky enough, and it needed I heckuva lot more Parmesan cheese and maybe just a tad more seasoning in general! It was very tasteless. Not a big enough let down to not give this place five stars though. It truly was an amazing place. Oh, and I know this is stupid, but the lemonade was awesome!

excerpts: Wine, clam chowder, and the Shellfish Platter for 4 makes for a happy family!
No crabby-patties here!
#bombdotcom
shellfish platter.author: Maria C.
shellfish platter.review: Our server, Raphael, turned our family outing into a lovely evening. Wine, clam chowder, and the Shellfish Platter for 4 makes for a happy family! No crabby-patties here!  #bombdotcom

excerpts: The shellfish platter is a must have.
Also the clam chowder with crab meat on top is the bomb.
Customer service was awesome and we end up eating here twice while on a short vacation.
shellfish platter.author: Mariam S.
shellfish platter.review: The shellfish platter is a must have. Also the clam chowder with crab meat on top is the bomb. Customer service was awesome and we end up eating here twice while on a short vacation.

excerpts: The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs.
I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time.
I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing.
shellfish platter.author: Cliff W.
shellfish platter.review:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: I ordered the shellfish platter for one with a lobster tail for my entree, and the boy ordered the surf and turf.
Everything was perfect!
You could tell the seafood was fresh and the boy was also happy with the quality and cooking of the steak.
shellfish platter.author: Lauramay N.
shellfish platter.review:
I was a bit worried since some people said this place was a tourist trap on here, but it turned out to be wonderful! 

The boy and I came here for an anniversary dinner since we were craving seafood. We made a reservation a few days in advance, hoping and requesting a nice seat. We came 20 minutes early, and we were seated just in time! Next to a window with a view of the bay too! Someone had also wrote "Happy Anniversary!" on our table. :) 

For starters, we ordered the clam chowder and fried scallops. I ordered the shellfish platter for one with a lobster tail for my entree, and the boy ordered the surf and turf. Everything was perfect! You could tell the seafood was fresh and the boy was also happy with the quality and cooking of the steak. We loved everything that we ordered, and also enjoyed a yummy creme brûlée. 

We were in awe of the meal we had. Not to mention, the sour dough was the best we ever had! We couldn't stop raving about it. We also have to thank our server Justin H. for being so awesome and kind. We asked to take our leftover bread to go, and he came back with more fresh sour dough to take home!

excerpts: Our server, Raphael, recommended the shellfish platter for 4.
No regrets!
Will be back again.
shellfish platter.author: Jessica C.
shellfish platter.review: Family date day to SF! Enjoyed a nice dinner and view. The service was fantastic. Our server, Raphael, recommended the shellfish platter for 4. No regrets! Will be back again.

excerpts: Main course was shellfish platter with lobster tail, that's extra!
This dish is very buttery, and I love it!!!
Highly recommend this place, the view was gorgeous as the sunset over the bay!
Oh, and the sourdough bread...
you cannot come to SF and not have sourdough bread
, it's complementary, just don't go over board, it's hard to stop eating it once you get a piece in your mouth!
shellfish platter.author: Pablo P.
