shellfish platter.review: Brought my wife for her birthday! The food was amazing, started with tomato salad & scallops with jalapeno aioli. First off, the salad, it comes with green & red tomatoes with a sweet balsamic vinegarette,  and some cheese that's out of this world.  Scallops & jalapeno aioli was also delish!  Cooked to perfection. Main course was shellfish platter with lobster tail, that's extra! This dish is very buttery, and I love it!!! Highly recommend this place, the view was gorgeous as the sunset over the bay! Oh, and the sourdough bread...you cannot come to SF and not have sourdough bread, it's complementary, just don't go over board, it's hard to stop eating it once you get a piece in your mouth!

excerpts: For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail!
shellfish platter.author: Nicole M.
shellfish platter.review:
My Fiancé and I had dinner at the Fog Harbor fish house over fleet week. Let me start off by JESSICA W was our server and she was beyond words AMAZING! Being from new jersey we love great customer service, and she went BEYOND THAT! 


The food was super delicious!! We had the fried scallops for appetizer and clam chowder! For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail! Super delicious 

We can go on and on but we'll leave it at: YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE !!!! 


Thank you JESSICA !!

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the shellfish platter + lobster tail.
He said there were shells everywhere on his food that it was barley edible.
shellfish platter.author: Lena ..
shellfish platter.review:
Came in last Friday made reservations for 2 at 6pm,  as requested prior I asked for seats by the window. Checked in at 5:55pm, we were walked to our tables, not a word from the person who walked us to our table apologizing for not having any seats by the window as requested prior to making the reservation. Okay, that's fine. 

For starters, we both started with a cup of clam chowder (this is what they're famous for!). The chowder was delicious until I came across a piece of hair midway into my soup. DISGUSTING!! How does that even happen?! 

I ordered the surf & turf, I give it a 4/5. The lobster tail was too chewy, like it was over cooked. My boyfriend ordered the shellfish platter + lobster tail. He said there were shells everywhere on his food that it was barley edible. There were tiny shells all over his food from the 1/2 crab. 

Overall, I would probably not come back, this was not a good experience. $200 including tips, I've had better in Monterey!

excerpts: Had calamari for appetizer and the shellfish platter for 2 and both were amazing.
Great view and fantastic service.
shellfish platter.author: Jeff L.
shellfish platter.review:
Was always on my list to try and it was well worth it. Had calamari for appetizer and the shellfish platter for 2 and both were amazing. 
Great view and fantastic service.

excerpts: I had the Shellfish platter.
Everything was absolutely wonderful.
Worth every penny!
We will be coming again.
shellfish platter.author: Cruz C.
shellfish platter.review: We came to celebrate my wife's birthday here. My wife had the halibut. My oldest child had the pan seared chicken. My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder. I had the Shellfish platter. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Worth every penny! We will be coming again.

excerpts: My girlfriend and I went we got the shellfish platter for 2 with a lobster tail, the calamari as a appetizer, and drinks she had a margarita
( Khaiman was nice enough to custom make it for her with gin with and Tequila egg white froth) and I had the House beer which was amazing.
Absolutely worth the trip, go check it out!
shellfish platter.author: Alan G.
shellfish platter.review: This place is amazing, great atmosphere, great service we had the best waiter his name is Khaiman he's the best, and delicious food and drinks. My girlfriend and I went we got the shellfish platter for 2 with a lobster tail, the calamari as a appetizer, and drinks she had a margarita( Khaiman was nice enough to custom make it for her with gin with and Tequila egg white froth) and I had the House beer which was amazing. Absolutely worth the trip, go check it out!

excerpts: "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter".
Overall we spent $130 not including tip.

10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB:
10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli.
The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering.
Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert.
SHELLFISH PLATTER:
8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry.
He liked the meaty mussels though.
CREME BRÛLÉE:
10/10 perfect sweetness
shellfish platter.author: Christal C.
shellfish platter.review:
Wow! Amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.  My boyfriend and I wanted to taste a little bit of everything without spending a lot, so we decided to share. We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail". For myself I ordered the  "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter". Overall we spent $130 not including tip. Quite an expensive meal but definitely worth it. 

CHOWDER: 10/10 cup size was perfect to share. Get a little taste without getting full. 
SHRIMP COCKTAIL: 10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB: 10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli. The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering. Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert. 
SHELLFISH PLATTER: 8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry. He liked the meaty mussels though. 
CREME BRÛLÉE: 10/10 perfect sweetness

excerpts: Two people ate the 2-person shellfish platter, had 2 drinks, and an appetizer for $98.
The shellfish platter was huge--we couldn't eat it all!
shellfish platter.author: Jessica H.
shellfish platter.review:
This is the place to eat seafood at Pier 39! The prices are decent and the portions are plentiful! Two people ate the 2-person shellfish platter, had 2 drinks, and an appetizer for $98. While this is pricy, it is cheaper than any other seafood restaurants on the pier and the food is delicious!!!!

I ordered the Lombard Lemonade (yum) and for $10.95 is was pretty large. The shellfish platter was huge--we couldn't eat it all!

excerpts: Several things were ordered but whats still remaining on my mind is still the shellfish platter.
shellfish platter.author: Matt B.
shellfish platter.review:
Loved this place on Pier 39. We asked the waitress for what the best. Several things were ordered but whats still remaining on my mind is still the shellfish platter. And the garlic bread. 

Have to criticize that they had bacon on their world famous clam chowder soup. 

But the views and good service makes up for it.

excerpts: We ordered the shellfish platter for 2 and it was amazing.
Of course we had to end it with the dessert duo ala mode.
We are leaving so full and satisfied!
We'll definitely be here again and highly recommend that you try this place out!
shellfish platter.author: Jesse A.
shellfish platter.review: This was our first time here and we had an awesome experience. Our server Mel was amazing! He knew exactly when to put out orders in, and brought out each dish at the perfect time. We love seafood, and Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint. The seafood tower was good, along with the yummy clam chowder bread bowl. We ordered the shellfish platter for 2 and it was amazing. Of course we had to end it with the dessert duo ala mode. We are leaving so full and satisfied! We'll definitely be here again and highly recommend that you try this place out!

excerpts: Their shellfish platter is the best!!
Their staff is nice all the time.
They're very busy so you better book in advance or wait 20 to 40 min, which is not bad since there are so many souvenir shops around.
And, not to forget the beautiful sea lions
shellfish platter.author: Irina V.
shellfish platter.review: I've been back here over and over. Their shellfish platter is the best!! Their staff is nice all the time. They're very busy so you better book in advance or wait 20 to 40 min, which is not bad since there are so many souvenir shops around. And, not to forget the beautiful sea lions

excerpts: We shared the shellfish platter, chicken penne, and calamari.
shellfish platter.author: Danae L.
shellfish platter.review:
Bf and I came around 7pm and were seated towards the entrance right away. It was really windy so asked to be seated towards the inside. The host immediately told us there's a wait to sit inside. Well shouldn't you have given us the option of waiting to sit inside? The estimated waiting time for the Inside was 10 minutes, but we were seated in less than 2.

We shared the shellfish platter, chicken penne, and calamari.

I really enjoyed the calamari! It wasn't oily compared to other restaurants and had a nice crunch.

The chicken from the pasta was slightly plain and dry.

The shellfish putter comes with half a dozen of oysters, 0.5lb of crab, half a pound of lobsters, and shrimp. Average quality. My one complaint is they didn't offer sauce that wasn't spicy. Oysters were a bit small.

Overall they exceed my expectations given that I wasn't preparing myself for a five-star treatment. What I come again? Maybe next year.

excerpts: Shellfish Platter ($38 for 1, $59 for 2) - 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, oven roasted w/ butter, garlic, herbs:
The shellfish massacre presented in front of us was seasoned nicely and tasted quite fresh.
The crab legs were sweet and meaty.
The mussels and clams were nice and springy.
The shrimp at the bottom of the plate soaked up all the buttery juices and herbs.
shellfish platter.author: Joy W.
shellfish platter.review:
From afar, Fog Harbor Fish House always looked like any other Pier 39 seafood restaurant to me. Upon closer inspection, it's actually very nice. The waiting area outside is a tiled patio with couches, a fireplace, and a painting above the fireplace, so it feels more like a cozy outdoor living room. 
They take reservations on Opentable, which is probably a good idea for a tourist-heavy location.
The menu includes a variety of seafood dishes and quite a few fried items. For a seafood restaurant, there is a good amount of land dishes for those who don't eat seafood. We had a cozy table by the window and enjoyed the waterfront view during dinner.

Crispy Bay Scallops ($13) - panko breaded & fried, w/ roasted jalapeno aioli:
I was hoping the scallops would have a light crunchy panko crust, but the tiny bite-sized bay scallops were completely coated in breading and unrecognizable as scallops. It was my mistake. I should have guessed panko breaded meant covered in panko. It was too much breading and a little too oily for me to enjoy them as scallops. If I knew they would have that much breading, I wouldn't have ordered this dish. It's not bad for a deep-fried snack. The thick, heavy jalapeno aioli added a little bit of a kick.

Shellfish Platter ($38 for 1, $59 for 2) - 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, oven roasted w/ butter, garlic, herbs:
The shellfish massacre presented in front of us was seasoned nicely and tasted quite fresh. The crab legs were sweet and meaty. The mussels and clams were nice and springy. The shrimp at the bottom of the plate soaked up all the buttery juices and herbs. It also came with some corn on the cob and garlic toast. 

Bread Pudding ($8.50) - topped w/ vanilla ice cream, vanilla bean sauce, dusted with cocoa powder:
Dinner was a little salty, so I wanted something sweet. I'm fond of bread pudding, so that was an easy choice. It was served warm and gooey and the edges were a little crispy.

While we ate, we enjoyed watching the sunset over the water. It made for a nice meal. If I come back, I'd probably try the cioppino next.

excerpts: Highly recommend the shellfish platter if visiting for the first time
shellfish platter.author: Alan Z.
shellfish platter.review: Exquisite service and fresh seafood. Highly recommend the shellfish platter if visiting for the first time

excerpts:
** Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth, very bold taste, average taste 
  Shellfish Platter
shellfish platter.author: Maruko X.
shellfish platter.review:
Ambiance 3/5: Classic and trendy decorations, comfortable seats and harbor window views

Service 2/5: very slow and forgetful, had to remind a few times to get water. Took stars off because of service. 

Food 4/5: in general great
  Clam Chowder - **** award winning soup, it's delicious, recommend 
  Cioppino - *** Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth, very bold taste, average taste 
  Shellfish Platter - **** A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs, fresh and flavorful crab, recommend 

Price 3/5: reasonably priced, expect at least $30 each plus drinks

excerpts: To eat we ordered a bowl of clam chowder, Shellfish platter for 2, and the crab roll.
The calm chowder was probably the best part of the meal.
It didn't have a ton of potatoes, which was good, and overall I liked it.
The crab roll was bland.
It definitely needed flavoring added.
The Shellfish platter for 2 wasn't as much as we had expected for the price.
shellfish platter.author: Ros A.
shellfish platter.review:
Came for dinner while visiting Fishermans Wharf. I wasn't impressed with the service here. Food was ok, but not as great as you would expect. 

We chose this place based on overall rating. When we first arrived, I asked to look at a menu before deciding to be seated. At front, they're friendly and really trying to get you in. As we decided to dine here, I requested a table by the window. They said they'd get as as close as possible. When we came in, they originally were going to seat us in a booth near the back. There were several tables by the window, so I asked again if we could sit there. The hostess from the front had to come and she said most tables were reserved and others were for larger parties. Ok, fair enough, so I ask for a table one row off. 

When we were finally seated, our server came. She spoke in a monotone, very quickly, and seemed very serious. No smile, no welcome, no how are you doing. She asked if we had dined there before and after we said no, there was no follow up. So there was basically no point in asking. She wasn't a bad server, but for a place that is located in a tourist location, I would think servers would be friendly and welcoming. 

The complimentary bread was average. It was nice to have to dip into the clam chowder, but on its own is average. To eat we ordered a bowl of clam chowder, Shellfish platter for 2, and the crab roll. The calm chowder was probably the best part of the meal. It didn't have a ton of potatoes, which was good, and overall I liked it. The crab roll was bland. It definitely needed flavoring added. The Shellfish platter for 2 wasn't as much as we had expected for the price. We decided to get dessert elsewhere. 

If customer service was better I would have rated higher. For food, I would definitely recommend the clam chowder.

excerpts: The shellfish platter was pretty good, but overloaded in Garlic butter.
The soup was OK, but doesn't compare to New England style.
What really made this meal great was the server Jess W.
She was awesome and one of the reason i would come back here.
I tip my hat to her.
Thank you
shellfish platter.author: Ryan O.
shellfish platter.review: I liked this place.  The shellfish platter was pretty good, but overloaded in Garlic butter.  The soup was OK, but doesn't compare to New England style.  What really made this meal great was the server Jess W.  She was awesome and one of the reason i would come back here.  I tip my hat to her.  Thank you

excerpts: he was personable but very professional ,all his recommendations were spot on and felt genuine,we had the shellfish platter and halibut ,very tasty and would highly recommend.
Thanks fog harbor we will definitely be back when we visit the area.
shellfish platter.author: Edward M.
shellfish platter.review:
Flawless service and Delicious Food ,5 stars hands down thanks to our server Rafael .

Upon arrival was greeted by the hostess with a warm smile and welcome,we waited 20 mins by the fireplace,truly romantic.If I could rate more than 5 stars due to our server I would,Rafael made this an great experience as we were celebrating my wife's birthday he was personable but very professional ,all his recommendations were spot on and felt genuine,we had the shellfish platter and halibut ,very tasty and would highly recommend.Thanks fog harbor we will definitely be back when we visit the area.

excerpts: At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter.
Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience.
Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.
shellfish platter.author: Matt K.
shellfish platter.review: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.

excerpts: Enjoyed the Alcatraz Escape cocktail, but the Shellfish Platter with pasta and Crab Ceviche didn't live up to the hype.
The shrimp had a weird after taste.
shellfish platter.author: Quynh T.
shellfish platter.review: Enjoyed the Alcatraz Escape cocktail, but the Shellfish Platter with pasta and Crab Ceviche didn't live up to the hype. The shrimp had a weird after taste. The lobster tail and the oysters were ok, I suppose. The foods were super bland compared to other seafood places I've been to. Would I come back and order the same menu items? No.

excerpts: We had a steamed shellfish platter for 2 and it was tastey.
The cocktails were even better, and recommendations were thoughtful and on point.
I know fisherman's wharf restaurants don't have a great rep
but Fog Harbor is solid.
shellfish platter.author: David H.
shellfish platter.review: The food was very good.  We had a steamed shellfish platter for 2 and it was tastey.  The cocktails were even better, and recommendations were thoughtful and on point.  I know fisherman's wharf restaurants don't have a great rep but Fog Harbor is solid.

excerpts: I ordered the clam chowder as an appetizer and the shellfish platter (A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs) for dinner.
I have to tell you that this was probably one of the best dinners I have ever had in San Francisco.
Everything came out great!
shellfish platter.author: Thomas F.
shellfish platter.review:
First I have to tell you that I usually don't go to the 'touristy' areas of San Francisco for dinner but this time I am glad I did. My wife and I ended up on Pier 39 looking for some dinner after a long day. We saw this place up on the top level and decided to try it.

When you walk in you can tell this is a popular place. It has a lot of seats (all usually full) and some spectacular views of the bay. 

I ordered the clam chowder as an appetizer and the shellfish platter (A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs) for dinner. I have to tell you that this was probably one of the best dinners I have ever had in San Francisco. Everything came out great! It had a lot of flavor, nothing was overwhelming and it was all presented really well. 

I will definitely be visiting this place again, it may even be a reason to go back out to San Francisco. If you have a chance, make sure you check it out, you will not regret it.

excerpts: My girlfriend and I ordered the Shellfish platter for one, crispy scallops, and a cup of their famous clam chowder.
First glance at the shellfish platter as soon as it arrived at our table made my mouth water with excitement!
shellfish platter.author: Andrew L.
shellfish platter.review:
If you love fresh seafood, this is the place for you!

My girlfriend and I ordered the Shellfish platter for one, crispy scallops, and a cup of their famous clam chowder.

First glance at the shellfish platter as soon as it arrived at our table made my mouth water with excitement! The aroma from the fresh herbs and spices enhanced the experience!

The creaminess of the clam chowder made me believe why this cup of goodness was crowned Award Winning Clam Chowder.

The crispy scallops was an "okay" for me since I'm not really fond of scallops but my girlfriend thought otherwise.

Overall this lovely restaurant lived up to its name and the great reviews is what got me here!

excerpts: For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad.
The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.
A basket of these with soft consistency butter.
Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2.
The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond.
The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges.
The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter.
Everything is a symphony.
The fish screams pristine FRESH ...
this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local.
shellfish platter.author: Ranjan P.
shellfish platter.review: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.

excerpts: My friend and I each got a clam chowder before splitting the shellfish platter.
The clam chowder was as good as any I have had anywhere, my only disappointment being deciding against the sourdough bread bowl.
The platter was also delicious, with a full lobster tail surrounded several crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp.
The garlic and herb sauce went great with all of the shellfish and as dipping sauce for bread as well.
shellfish platter.author: Arthur C.
shellfish platter.review:
A classic destination in San Francisco, I had to come to Fog Harbor to experience SF seafood with a view of the bay. And the food did not disappoint. My friend and I each got a clam chowder before splitting the shellfish platter. The clam chowder was as good as any I have had anywhere, my only disappointment being deciding against the sourdough bread bowl. The platter was also delicious, with a full lobster tail surrounded several crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp. The garlic and herb sauce went great with all of the shellfish and as dipping sauce for bread as well. You can rest assured that you will be satisfied and satiated after your meal here.

Fog Harbor has some appetizing but pricey fare, but this is to be expected given its prime location on Pier 39. As a visitor to SF, I successfully found the lunch with a view experience I craved. 

Lastly, the service from our waiter Martin was generous and friendly; ask to sit in his section if you want to ensure attentive service.

excerpts: Had the shellfish platter with a lobster tail and it was perfect for two people.
Great service and awesome views of the harbor!
shellfish platter.author: Alix F.
shellfish platter.review: Excellent restaurant for lunch to celebrate our anniversary. Had the shellfish platter with a lobster tail and it was perfect for two people. Great service and awesome views of the harbor!

excerpts: We started off with two glasses of Chardonnay and continued our meal by having the award-winning clam chowder and finished with the shellfish platter.
Thank you Sarah and fog harbor for the great experience
shellfish platter.author: Celina G.
shellfish platter.review: This was not my first time at fog Harbor but this was the best experience I've ever had! Our server Sarah was the best!! As soon as we sat down Sarah greeted us with a smile and throughout our whole meal she was very attentive. It's hard to find great food and service now and days and fog harbor exceeded our expectations! We started off with two glasses of Chardonnay and continued our meal by having the award-winning clam chowder and finished with the shellfish platter. Thank you Sarah and fog harbor for the great experience

excerpts: and I ordered the Shellfish Platter ($59 for two) as well as a bowl of clam chowder.
It was the perfect amount to fill us up with happiness.
The 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and fingerlicking potatoes tasted SO DARN delicious with some magic buttery garlic+herbs sauce.
shellfish platter.author: Jenny H.
shellfish platter.review:
Such a lovely restaurant with great ambiance. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Shellfish Platter ($59 for two) as well as a bowl of clam chowder. It was the perfect amount to fill us up with happiness. The 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and fingerlicking potatoes tasted SO DARN delicious with some magic buttery garlic+herbs sauce. It was fresh and well-balanced.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. It can be for a casual date or fancy night out. :)

excerpts: For our main dish we had the shellfish platter for two.
It was not good.
Our waiter dissapeared for a long time we wanted to beat the crowd.
He finally showed up and we asked for the check I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie with ice cream to go.
The restaurant was beautiful with a nice view of the fireworks but service and food was not good.
My husband asked how much I wanted to leave him for tip.
I said nothing, I did not like my waiters service.
We had better service and food at the in n out a few blocks down.
Waiter came to leave our dessert
we grabbed our belongings and we walked out the restaurant.
He came out the restaurant chasing us that we did not leave him a tip.
I felt embarrased, people probably thought we had not payed our bill.
My husband felt bad and gave him five dollars.
I was upset.
When you have good food and good service we do not hesitate to tip our waiter or waitress but this was just rediculous.
To top it off
I had a bite of the chocolate chip cookie dessert not knowing it had walnuts on it.
Im allergic to them, but since the menu did not include desserts I did not know the ingredients.
Im just glad my allergies did not go crazy or ended up in the hospital because of this.
shellfish platter.author: Tania C.
shellfish platter.review: Came to this restaurant because someone recommended this place to my husband. We arrived at around 6:30pm to the restaurant and the wait was approximately 2 hours. We were seated at about 8:30 pm last night. Our kids were so pumped up to see the fireworks at the pier so we petition for a table near a window since fireworks were to start at 9:30pm. Our waiter came to get us started with our drinks and then came back to leave them and take our order. We asked a few questions which he was unable to answer. During our dinner he never came by to refill our drinks. Our kids were so excited about the dessert because they saw their Platter with the dessert plates being offerred to other tables. Our waiter never came by with it. Food was okay. My son ordered the chicken tenders with french fries. He is not a fan of french fries but he ate them and only ate one of the chicken tenders. He said they were not good. My daughter had the grilled cheese with french fries and she only took a bite of the grilled cheese and left it there too. We had the cesar salad with the clam chowder soup. It was okay. For our main dish we had the shellfish platter for two. It was not good. Our waiter dissapeared for a long time we wanted to beat the crowd. He finally showed up and we asked for the check I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie with ice cream to go. The restaurant was beautiful with a nice view of the fireworks but service and food was not good. My husband asked how much I wanted to leave him for tip. I said nothing, I did not like my waiters service. We had better service and food at the in n out a few blocks down. Waiter came to leave our dessert we grabbed our belongings and we walked out the restaurant. He came out the restaurant chasing us that we did not leave him a tip. I felt embarrased, people probably thought we had not payed our bill. My husband felt bad and gave him five dollars. I was upset. When you have good food and good service we do not hesitate to tip our waiter or waitress but this was just rediculous. To top it off I had a bite of the chocolate chip cookie dessert not knowing it had walnuts on it. Im allergic to them, but since the menu did not include desserts I did not know the ingredients. Im just glad my allergies did not go crazy or ended up in the hospital because of this.

excerpts: The shellfish platter was amazing with the saffron butter garlic sauce.
If you are a fish lover.
Go for the swordfish
shellfish platter.author: Jason B.
shellfish platter.review: Great seats and presentation of the food. Coming in the late afternoon during winter makes the ambiance incredible. The ahi poke was light and spicy in flavor at just the right temp. The shellfish platter was amazing with the saffron butter garlic sauce. If you are a fish lover. Go for the swordfish

excerpts: and I had the shellfish platter.
Both nights I had their clam chowder which was the best I've ever had.
Everyone has an opinion but Fog Harbor is probably the best seafood you will find on the piers.
We will definitely be back on our next trip.
Thank you Fog Harbor for making our romantic weekend getaway unforgettable
shellfish platter.author: Troy G.
shellfish platter.review: Two words...Absolutely amazing!  For my wife and I, This was our first time at the restaurant and don't let the tourist trap location fool you. The food was so fresh, filling, and to die for. Our waiter Rafael was so attentive and personal. He took time to explain the not only the menu, but the city. First night (yes we went back) we had the daily special Halibut which was HUGE and the crab Cesar salad.  Both were so fresh and more than enough food for one. As we were looking online the next day for a different dinner location, we couldn't keep talking about how amazing our dinner at Fog Harbor was so we made reservations again. Not to be disappointed, the dinner and view were amazing again. My wife had the halibut again because it was so good and I had the shellfish platter. Both nights I had their clam chowder which was the best I've ever had. Everyone has an opinion but Fog Harbor is probably the best seafood you will find on the piers. We will definitely be back on our next trip. Thank you Fog Harbor for making our romantic weekend getaway unforgettable

excerpts: I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety.
You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter.
shellfish platter.author: Christina L.
shellfish platter.review:
I had an amazing time at this restaurant. I couldn't give a 5 star, because our original server didn't have the best customer service. However, for some reason, a new server Morgan took over and our time here became almost perfect. She was very kind and always had a small on, and had great customer service for a high quality restaurant. She checked up on us as much as she can, and really changed our time there. I highly recommend asking for her if you want great customer service.

As for the food, the seafood was high quality and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the crab and avocado salad, clam chowder, and the crab ceviche to start off. All of the flavors were upto par and super fresh. I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety. You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter. All of the seafood was very fresh and seasoned well. 

Overall, I will definitely be returning for their quality seafood and the customer service we received in the end. One tip: make reservations for the view because the view really makes it much more special. Thank you Morgan for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner with my family!

excerpts: We ordered the raw oysters, clam chowder with crab, shellfish platter, and mixed seafood grill: oysters tasted fresh, chowder was thick and rich, and the shellfish platter was a huge portion of yumminess.
I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in a touristy spot, but we were surprised by the fresh tasting seafood and amazing service!
shellfish platter.author: Amy C.
shellfish platter.review: Stopped by this restaurant for the convenience, but was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the raw oysters, clam chowder with crab, shellfish platter, and mixed seafood grill: oysters tasted fresh, chowder was thick and rich, and the shellfish platter was a huge portion of yumminess. I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in a touristy spot, but we were surprised by the fresh tasting seafood and amazing service!

excerpts: I tried the blue cheese rolls (a yelp favorite) and as an entree me and my other half got the shellfish platter for 2 which contained steamed clams, mussels, garlic shrimp, garlic Dungeness crab drenched in buttery olive oil garlic sauce.
Delicious just like going fishing and eating the prey.
shellfish platter.author: Ellaine C.
shellfish platter.review:
The second we walked by this place the hostess greeted us and was really friendly! Out of all the places to eat seafood near the bay we chose this place because of its 4.5 reviews. 

1. Appearance 10/10- the outside looked like a ship or a boat and I liked the different color toned wood floors, the comfortable seating as well as the windows overlooking the harbor and ocean. Everything looked clean as well.

2. Customer Service 10/10- besides the hostess who promptly seated us after 10 min of waiting on a lobby coach (great because my legs hurt from all the walking), the waiter quickly came to greet us and get our drink orders.

3. Food 10/10- the food was incredible. I tried the blue cheese rolls (a yelp favorite) and as an entree me and my other half got the shellfish platter for 2 which contained steamed clams, mussels, garlic shrimp, garlic Dungeness crab drenched in buttery olive oil garlic sauce. Delicious just like going fishing and eating the prey. The only bad thing is we smelt like sea water after lol.

I'm definitely bringing my family back here.

excerpts:
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
shellfish platter.author: China D.
shellfish platter.review:
Decided to grab seafood today and ended up here. The service was pretty good. Only thing was she did take long and forgot about out extra lemon, but hey it happens. 

The food was good. It was kind of pricey but as is seafood and it was good. Nothing to write home to mom about, but maybe cus I'm more of a Cajun creole girl.


 The halibut was fresh and yummy and the shrimp where cooked well. The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh. The rice was however flavorless. Wish they had a happy hour ;(    

Loved my margarita !! 

We ordered 
Moscow mule $12.50
Hibiscus margarita $12.50
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
Mixed grill $26

Total 

$115 with some extra state tax added on on top of the original tax. 


Will we go back ? Maybe not, unless for the view. there are far too many seafood spots to try to us to want to come back. Nothing extra special here. The view was however the best part. Overlooking the water and sunset. 

We got a window seat the a reservation had cancelled so it was a nice romantic dinner.

excerpts: For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo.
Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked.
shellfish platter.author: Kay D.
shellfish platter.review:
Fog Harbor starts with freshly baked sourdough bread. I ate with family so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder. For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo. Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked. The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino. 

The restaurant has great atmosphere and great service! We enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely come back.

excerpts: My mom and I came in last week and shared the shellfish platter.
The food was amazing!
The service was even better.
AJ made us feel right at home and made us laugh the whole meal.
I'll definitely be back!
shellfish platter.author: Nico M.
shellfish platter.review: My mom and I came in last week and shared the shellfish platter. The food was amazing! The service was even better. AJ made us feel right at home and made us laugh the whole meal. I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Enough about view, we ordered Shellfish platter for one, a cup of chowder and a
Fish&Chips.
Shellfish platter is delicious!
Shellfish platter was very flavorful and yet not overly spiced, so I can still taste the clams were fresh.
The crab was also very plump and full.
shellfish platter.author: Ya K.
shellfish platter.review:
Who would've thought a super touristy place will have decent restaurant with amazing view, delicious food, somewhat-reasonable price and pretty decor!? Well, Fog Harbor just raise the dining points in Fisherman's Wharf.

The restaurant is big and with a lot of seats that has amazing view--AMAZING VIEW as in you can see Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz or the seals/sea lions in different combinations or even all three! It is big enough that on a Saturday we didn't have to arrive early or make reservation to get a perfect view. But the restaurant does get full. 

One thing I especially like is that the restaurant is pretty generous on table space--most tables are for 4, and they let us (a group of 2) seat at a 4 people table so that both of us can face the view. 

Enough about view, we ordered Shellfish platter for one, a cup of chowder and a Fish&Chips. Shellfish platter is delicious! I was debating between it and Cioppino, but in my experience the latter is always saltier than I like. Shellfish platter was very flavorful and yet not overly spiced, so I can still taste the clams were fresh. The crab was also very plump and full. The fish&chip was also good, the cole-slaw was very refreshing and not drench in sauces. 

The price was in deed on a higher end, but consider its location, it's seafood, and the view it has, I would say it is reasonable, especially for a special occasion. It is not a place I would recommend to locals, but good for tourists or friends visiting.

excerpts: She ordered the shellfish platter for one.
It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes.
She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind.
There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless.
It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too.
shellfish platter.author: Fiona T.
shellfish platter.review:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it. 

I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot

excerpts: For our main meal we had the shellfish platter for two and everything on it very tasty.
Overall great great experience.
So when visiting SF Pier 39 this place is a must.
shellfish platter.author: Scott B.
shellfish platter.review: Great place to dine in for seafood. I had great experience eating here. The food was spot on, awesome view of the bay and golden gate and and great environment. I went on a Thursday night, around 8 pm and it was very busy. My wife and I started with the crispy calamari, delicious. We also had the clam chowder on a bread bowl, and i gotta say that it was some of the best cc I've ever had. For our main meal we had the shellfish platter for two and everything on it very tasty. Overall great great experience. So when visiting SF Pier 39 this place is a must.

excerpts: The food I will give a solid 4 stars, we had the clam chowder and shellfish platter.
I feel like the sauce in the shellfish platter could be a little less greasy, but it was still good nonetheless.
shellfish platter.author: Cee L.
shellfish platter.review:
Me and my friend are here a few days ago and we were really excited as we had heard a lot about this place. When we arrived there was a wait, but we didn't end up waiting too long. 

Shortly after we were seated, our server Meron (spell check? Sorry!) came by and greeted us. She was so friendly! It felt good to have a server who seemed very genuine and also very knowledgable about the menu. She even suggested a few different wines based on what we ordered.

The food I will give a solid 4 stars, we had the clam chowder and shellfish platter. I feel like the sauce in the shellfish platter could be a little less greasy, but it was still good nonetheless. 

The extra star is for our server! I can't get over how great she was! She definitely made our experience in San Francisco one to remember. Kudos to her!

excerpts: But the food is a solid 5 stars, I got the shellfish platter and even though it was a bit messy (thanks to the crab!)
but it was worth it.
The scenic view's also a plus.
shellfish platter.author: Amanda W.
shellfish platter.review: I'd give it 5 if the waiter were more friendly. But the food is a solid 5 stars, I got the shellfish platter and even though it was a bit messy (thanks to the crab!) but it was worth it. The scenic view's also a plus.

excerpts: And we shared the shellfish platter for two.
It was a lot of food and tasted very fresh!
Nothing bad to say about this place at all!
shellfish platter.author: Mateo B.
shellfish platter.review: Went here with a co worker while on a business trip.  Great food! The clam chowder was excellent! And we shared the shellfish platter for two. It was a lot of food and tasted very fresh! Nothing bad to say about this place at all!

excerpts: As a group of 4, we decided to get the Shellfish Platter, which included 4 half-crab legs, a number of clams, mussels, and shrimp!
(I forgot the number
but it was very specific)
The serving size was definitely more than we expected but it was delicious!
shellfish platter.author: Mallory V.
shellfish platter.review:
It was just about dinner time and we had just arrived in SF a couple hours ago (5 hour drive from Santa Clarita-SoCal) and we just wanted to eat something, anything seafood!! 

Walking around Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, we decided to try this spot on the second floor of this Pier. We waited a little less than 20 minutes to be seated-no reservation needed. And when we were seated, the waiter was very polite and informative on what was on the menu in addition to whatever questions we had. 

As a group of 4, we decided to get the Shellfish Platter, which included 4 half-crab legs, a number of clams, mussels, and shrimp! (I forgot the number but it was very specific) The serving size was definitely more than we expected but it was delicious! Seafood is fresh and you can definitely tell. 

Had a good wine collection. Ordered the Strawberry Mojito (Strawberry Nojito) and Lipstick Lemondrop. I recommend the mojito!

excerpts:
Me: Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread add Crab= delicious happiness

Husband: Shellfish Platter for 1= best Shellfish he's ever tasted 

Appetizer: Crispy Bay Scallops are a must try
shellfish platter.author: Cindy I.
shellfish platter.review:
Look no further the best Clam Chowder in San Francisco is here! 

Me: Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread add Crab= delicious happiness

Husband: Shellfish Platter for 1= best Shellfish he's ever tasted 

Appetizer: Crispy Bay Scallops are a must try

excerpts: My wife got the shellfish platter which she said was delicious as well.
shellfish platter.author: Andrew Z.
shellfish platter.review:
If I could give this place 6 stars I would.  The food was incredible - one of the best meals I've ever had - linguini with clams - you'd think kind of boring, right? It wasn't.  It was so good.  My wife got the shellfish platter which she said was delicious as well.  Great views - sea lions were swimming around and entertaining us as we ate.

Highly recommend a visit!

excerpts: We got the crab cake, shellfish platter for two, and the fog harbor burger.
Everything was delicious and our server Tyler was extremely helpful and attentive.
shellfish platter.author: Ellice L.
shellfish platter.review: My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. Our wait time was 30 minutes which really wasn't bad considering how freaking packed pier 39 was during this day. We got the crab cake, shellfish platter for two, and the fog harbor burger. Everything was delicious and our server Tyler was extremely helpful and attentive.

excerpts: We ordered crispy lemon calamari for starters and a chowder bowl to share and a shellfish platter for two to share.
It was more than enough for two of us and
everything was yummy!!!
Strongly recommend the shellfish platter for two.
Everything was fresh.
I especially liked the mussels.
I usually found restaurant food salty but not this one.
It was seasoned perfectly.
It came out a little bit pricy for a quick lunch.
We didn't order any drink and the bill came out a hundred in total but it was worth it.
I'll definitely come back when I get a chance!
shellfish platter.author: Bixi T.
shellfish platter.review:
My boyfriend and I came in for lunch after walking around fisherman's wharf. It was a beautiful day and the area was crowded with tourists. We waited about 20 min to be seated, which wasn't bad. And the wait was totally worth it! 
First let me just say the view was amazing. You get to see the wharf and water. The waitress was professional, fast at service, and friendly. But what impressed me the most was the food. It was DELICIOUS!!! We ordered crispy lemon calamari for starters and a chowder bowl to share and a shellfish platter for two to share. It was more than enough for two of us and everything was yummy!!! Strongly recommend the shellfish platter for two. Everything was fresh. I especially liked the mussels. I usually found restaurant food salty but not this one. It was seasoned perfectly.
It came out a little bit pricy for a quick lunch. We didn't order any drink and the bill came out a hundred in total but it was worth it. I'll definitely come back when I get a chance!

excerpts: He had the shellfish platter and I had the filet mignon.
Both were delicious!!
The filet was cooked perfectly and the shellfish platter was overflowing with deliciousness.
We finished off a great meal with the vanilla bean creme brûlée.
The service was great!
The one thing that bothered me a little was how crowded the seating area was.
But I would recommend this place to anyone!!
shellfish platter.author: Samantha M.
shellfish platter.review: My husband and I had dinner here last weekend and loved it!! He had the shellfish platter and I had the filet mignon.  Both were delicious!! The filet was cooked perfectly and the shellfish platter was overflowing with deliciousness.  We finished off a great meal with the vanilla bean creme brûlée.  The service was great! The one thing that bothered me a little was how crowded the seating area was.  But I would recommend this place to anyone!!

excerpts: and I love seafood we decided to order the Shellfish Platter for two.
The platter comes with corns, shrimps, clams, mussels, and 1/2 a crab.
When I placed the Shellfish platter order I was excited for my seafood lunch, but when the plate came out I was hugely disappointed.
The amount of seafood that was provided did not seem like it was meant for two people.
The mussels were very tiny, so tiny that when I ate them I couldn't really taste mussels.
My boyfriend and I established that they could've been cove mussels since they were so small.
Some of the clams were missing the actual clams, we were served with just their outer shells.
The crab was very delicious, I wish we had more!
Butter is used as the sauce for the platter, but we opted out of it and the platter tasted fine.
shellfish platter.author: Channy M.
shellfish platter.review:
After doing some exploring in San Francisco for the day my boyfriend and I decided to eat lunch at the Fog Harbor Fish House. We were advised to not eat at Pier 39 since it's a tourist trap, low quality food with a hefty price tag. Even though we were advised not to eat at Pier 39, my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try anyways. We turned to yelp and saw that Fog Harbor had very good ratings based on their 1,000+ reviews.

For lunch on a Saturday, expect to wait. The wait wasn't too long considering how busy they were, we were seated within 20-30 minutes. Since my boyfriend and I love seafood we decided to order the Shellfish Platter for two. The platter comes with corns, shrimps, clams, mussels, and 1/2 a crab. While waiting for our order the waitress brought out fresh sourdough bread for us to enjoy and it was delicious.  

When I placed the Shellfish platter order I was excited for my seafood lunch, but when the plate came out I was hugely disappointed. The amount of seafood that was provided did not seem like it was meant for two people. The mussels were very tiny, so tiny that when I ate them I couldn't really taste mussels. My boyfriend and I established that they could've been cove mussels since they were so small. Some of the clams were missing the actual clams, we were served with just their outer shells. The crab was very delicious, I wish we had more! Butter is used as the sauce for the platter, but we opted out of it and the platter tasted fine. Just drizzle some lemons (which were provided) and you are set, a much healthier and tastier alternative. 

I also ordered a cup of the clam chowder. I am a fan of clam chowder and I had to try their "award winning house clam chowder". The chowder was good, but compared to other clam chowders I had, it was a little bit saltier than I preferred. It was still good since I ended up finishing the cup! 

Overall, for the price you are paying the quality and quantity of food was not worth it.

excerpts: We ended up ordering a shellfish platter for 2, clam chowder and clam linguini.
shellfish platter.author: Christy Z.
shellfish platter.review:
Excellent services and food! The atmosphere is really good especially at night, you can see the sea and sunset.

The staff handed us a menu with pic of food and showed us what's popular in the restaurant . We ended up ordering a shellfish platter for 2, clam chowder and clam linguini. It's nice of them to split a linguini into two separate plates so we can all had some!

Overall it was the best $$ seafood restaurant I ever been in SF. Highly recommend.

excerpts: We shared the shellfish platter for two and we were all surprised when they said it was the full "for-two" version.
Nice experience, nothing special about the meal though.
shellfish platter.author: Holly A.
shellfish platter.review: Great views, reasonable prices for the location, average seafood. We shared the shellfish platter for two and we were all surprised when they said it was the full "for-two" version. Nice experience, nothing special about the meal though.

excerpts: Friend and I shared the Shellfish Platter for 2...divine!
Definitely will return on my next visit to San Francisco.
shellfish platter.author: Jacqueline V.
shellfish platter.review: First dinner in San Francisco and it didn't disappoint. Service was personable, attentive, and prompt. Drinks were more than sufficiently supplied with alcohol. The sourdough bread was fantastic. Their clam chowder is a MUST! Friend and I shared the Shellfish Platter for 2...divine! Definitely will return on my next visit to San Francisco.

excerpts: Great creamy chunky clam chowder, delicious calamari infused with lemon, but the shellfish platter was not very good.
The mussels on the platter smelled strong and the dungeness crab legs were so overcooked they were mushy.
So im disappointed since this place is right off the pier
so their shellfish platter could have been better.
bumping up this review because the service with our waiter was good and he was extra friendly.
shellfish platter.author: Yum N.
shellfish platter.review: 3 1/2 stars.. Great creamy chunky clam chowder, delicious calamari infused with lemon, but the shellfish platter was not very good. The mussels on the platter smelled strong and the dungeness crab legs were so overcooked they were mushy. So im disappointed since this place is right off the pier so their shellfish platter could have been better. bumping up this review because the service with our waiter was good and he was extra friendly.

excerpts: Besides the chowder, my gf and I split the Shellfish Platter for 2 ($58).
It was huge, very tasty, and well pleasing to my camera lens.
Oh.
And not a spec of sand was found.
Service was great too.
We had the taller blond/brunette gal with glasses as our server.
She was extremely attentive, very considerate, and really knowledgeable of the menu.
She was a tad stiff though so maybe the management needs to give her a free spa day.
Cuz trust me, she's an asset as a waitress and you guys probably owe her a raise or a spa day anyways.
shellfish platter.author: Joshua F.
shellfish platter.review:
Coming from a local, for being a top tourist spot, there really aren't that many great restaurants on Pier 39. Some take advantage of you with their high prices and low quality food while others simply suck. Yet, in the midst of all of these posers, Fog Harbor is the gem of Pier 39. 
The decor and the overall ambiance makes for a romantic/cozy environment. Perfect for a date night which was exactly what I was looking for. In fact, it surpassed my expectations. Nothing like those dirty old fish houses that line the pier (cough cough Aliotos and Cioppinos). Props to the interior designer. I see you workin' ;)
The food was amazing. The clam chowder was some of the best that I've ever had although I do wish that they had given us more as it seemed as if there was only half a cup of chowder inside the bread bowl. Besides the chowder, my gf and I split the Shellfish Platter for 2 ($58). It was huge, very tasty, and well pleasing to my camera lens. Oh. And not a spec of sand was found. 
Service was great too. We had the taller blond/brunette gal with glasses as our server. She was extremely attentive, very considerate, and really knowledgeable of the menu. She was a tad stiff though so maybe the management needs to give her a free spa day. Cuz trust me, she's an asset as a waitress and you guys probably owe her a raise or a spa day anyways.

excerpts: My husband had the Shellfish Platter and thought it was good.
I had the sourdough bread bowl clam chowder and thought it was okay.
I personally do not like spices and a lot of herbs in my clam chowder and thought this soup had a little too much of both.
shellfish platter.author: Katie C.
shellfish platter.review: My husband and I went here yesterday, April 23, 2015 for dinner. We were seated near the window which was perfect because I was cold. Having the sun come through the window warmed me up. The bread was very hard to cut through; however and luckily, the manager noticed this after I was done and brought us warm and softer pre-cut bread. My husband had the Shellfish Platter and thought it was good. I had the sourdough bread bowl clam chowder and thought it was okay. I personally do not like spices and a lot of herbs in my clam chowder and thought this soup had a little too much of both. We also ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail, which was yummy. The service was nice and ambiance was pleasant.

excerpts: I ordered the shellfish platter to share and it was pretty big with lots of crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, etc.
The price actually wasn't too bad given that the location has tourists galore.
Would come back some time if the occasion calls for it.
shellfish platter.author: Becky C.
shellfish platter.review: I typically don't eat along Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf as it gets to be too touristy and crowded. The food isn't always the best here, but there are a few exceptions. Fog Harbor is one of them. The view from the window seat is great and romantic in the evening. I ordered the shellfish platter to share and it was pretty big with lots of crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, etc. The price actually wasn't too bad given that the location has tourists galore. Would come back some time if the occasion calls for it.

excerpts: I had ordered the very famous shellfish platter and split it with my family.
The food was excellent, it had a ocean of flavors.
The service was excellent and the wait was kind and took a lot of time out of his job to talk with us, crack a couple of jokes, what everyone wants with a waiter.
The sauces for all the dishes were exploding with flavor.
shellfish platter.author: Derek W.
shellfish platter.review:
Very good service and great quality seafood. I had ordered the very famous shellfish platter and split it with my family. The food was excellent, it had a ocean of flavors. The service was excellent and the wait was kind and took a lot of time out of his job to talk with us, crack a couple of jokes, what everyone wants with a waiter. The sauces for all the dishes were exploding with flavor. My only grip with the restaurant is the kids meals were a lot less flavorful than all the other dishes, but they were still good.

Overall, this is a must go if you ever check out Pier 39. There are so many places you could check out in Pier 39 but this restaurant, when you order the right food, could be one of the best.

excerpts: Bodega Bay was amazing as was the Shellfish platter for two which the waiter kindly split for us.
shellfish platter.author: Zhang W.
shellfish platter.review:
Came In for lunch on Mothers Day, normally I steer clear from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but had some extended family in town from Beijing and had to show them the sights...and I am so glad I did. At first I was kinda disappointed because we were taken towards the back of the restaurant but the view was still really nice. 

We ordered quite a few entrees that were excellent, the King Salmon which I was told was just wild caught @ Bodega Bay was amazing as was the Shellfish platter for two which the waiter kindly split for us.

The service was outstanding some of the best I've ever experienced I believe his name was Khaiman? He really went above and beyond to make sure we were well taken care of and even spoke a little Mandarin...wow! 

Family in town or not I will be back sooner than later. 

P.S. Locals, this is a family owned business the Simmons family have been bay area from the start.

excerpts: He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.
I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.
Khaiman recommended she get it
Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later.
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing.
We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.
This is
a definite must have and something I would get again.
Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.
It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.
The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.
All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.
I love garlic
so it was like
this dish was made for me.
Everything was fresh and cooked just right.
Price was fair considering what was included.
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.
The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering.
shellfish platter.author: Chris B.
shellfish platter.review:
My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.  
I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening.
We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.  
When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later. 
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.  
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.  
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish. 
We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.  
When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.  
I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be. 
We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.

excerpts: The shellfish platter is a must!
shellfish platter.author: Max N.
shellfish platter.review:
So delicious! Everything was perfectly cooked and tender- nothing dry or rubbery. The shellfish platter is a must! We got it with Cajun spice added in, which I highly recommend.

The blond bartender was amazing,  and made sure we were taking care of all night. Any rum drinkers need to try the escape from Alcatraz.

To finish off, we had the apple crisp, which was perfect. Warm and cinnamony :)

At the end of the meal, the manager came by the table to check in on us.  All around it was great service and even better food.

excerpts: My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.
Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average.
shellfish platter.author: Christina P.
shellfish platter.review:
Amazing view, great food, friendly server - what more can I ask for?
I know that this place isn't the cheapest, but Fog Harbor Fish House is in the center of tourist mecca. I know there are lots of similar restaurant options nearby, but they either lack in food or interior or attentive servers. I tried to nitpick and find things I don't like about this place, but honestly I couldn't (again, apart from having to deal with major tourist crowds, which is no fault of the restaurant)
Just be sure to check out tourist brochures and/or yelp check-in for modest discounts or freebies. In fact, most Wharf/Pier39 restaurants have some form of promotion. They also validate parking so make sure to take advantage of that.

My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.  Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average. Seafood was fresh and prepared right.

This probably isn't the best place for family with small children, but for more adult-oriented crowd or date nights, I would highly recommend.

excerpts: For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu.
My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu.
The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery.
It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT!
Shrimp cocktail was simply great!
And the Tiramisu is amazing!!!
The Ahi Tuna was good.
I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant.
I was hoping for something different.
The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite.
It was way too garlicky for my taste
and it was overflowing with potatoes.
My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you!
This is a great restaurant!
Highly recommended!!!
shellfish platter.author: Alana L.
shellfish platter.review: There was a 45 min wait so decided to sit at the bar. The service was great! Jason bartender/server was very attentive and quick! We ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic bread, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails and Chowder for appetizers. For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu. My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu. The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery. It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT! Shrimp cocktail was simply great! And the Tiramisu is amazing!!! The Ahi Tuna was good. I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant. I was hoping for something different. The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite. It was way too garlicky for my taste and it was overflowing with potatoes. My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you! This is a great restaurant! Highly recommended!!!

excerpts: We had Shellfish platter & it was a hit!
I will def come back again.
shellfish platter.author: Glam Sass M.
shellfish platter.review: The food was delicious, our server was great & very polite, I believe his name was Jon (Jonathan). The prices are reasonable. We had Shellfish platter & it was a hit! I will def come back again.

excerpts: The shellfish platter comes piled high with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams, in garlic butter.
I highly recommend the platter and it was fun to eat and very fresh!
The clam chowder was delicious!
shellfish platter.author: Shanna M.
shellfish platter.review: We celebrated my husbands birthday here this weekend. Dinner was very fresh and fun right off the water. We had a beautiful view of Pier 39 and the sea lions. The shellfish platter comes piled high with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams, in garlic butter.  I highly recommend the platter and it was fun to eat and very fresh! The clam chowder was delicious!

excerpts: You've got to try the shellfish platter.
It was so good.
The seafood was pretty fresh and the portion was quite large.
We ordered extra plates in case the platter was small but ended up with lots of leftovers.
The price is quite decent as well.
The line can be long at lunch time but they take your phone number down and text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in line.
Will definitely come back again.
shellfish platter.author: Joy H.
shellfish platter.review: We've tried a few seafood restaurants in this area but kept getting disappointed. This place took us by surprise. You've got to try the shellfish platter. It was so good. The seafood was pretty fresh and the portion was quite large. We ordered extra plates in case the platter was small but ended up with lots of leftovers. The price is quite decent as well. The line can be long at lunch time but they take your phone number down and text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in line. Will definitely come back again.

excerpts: The food was very good, I had the Shellfish Platter with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, and shrimp.
Very good portion, but pretty pricey.
The other portions (not specifically sure what the rest of the fam got) were quite small though.
Not worth the money they said.
The service was...
ok.
I wasn't able to get a refill on my ice tea because my waiter didn't come around to check enough.
Waters stayed empty for most of the night.
shellfish platter.author: Lauren F.
shellfish platter.review:
Came here with my family on Christmas Eve. Got seated pretty quickly, even without a reservation. The food was very good, I had the Shellfish Platter with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, and shrimp. Very good portion, but pretty pricey. The other portions (not specifically sure what the rest of the fam got) were quite small though. Not worth the money they said. The service was...ok. I wasn't able to get a refill on my ice tea because my waiter didn't come around to check enough. Waters stayed empty for most of the night. Waiter seemed very flustered and looking to get our table closed out and on with our nights. 

No matter, Pier 39 is a nice place to search for desserts and coffee too!

excerpts: Shellfish platter was variety and yummy, Alcatraz escape was a bomb and crem brûlée topped off the evening...
shellfish platter.author: Heidi Y.
shellfish platter.review: Soooo good. Thanks Samir for everything. Shellfish platter was variety and yummy, Alcatraz escape was a bomb and crem brûlée topped off the evening...

excerpts: I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.
shellfish platter.author: Laura B.
shellfish platter.review: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!

excerpts: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and
creme brulee was delicious.
Couldn't recommend highly enough!
Also service was no.1.
A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.
shellfish platter.author: Laura P.
shellfish platter.review: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and creme brulee was delicious.  Couldn't recommend highly enough! Also service was no.1. A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.

excerpts: The shellfish platter for 2 at $55 was very good.
Fresh seafood a must while in S.F.
The dessert creme brulee was just ok.
Would come here again for the view and seafood.
shellfish platter.author: Chenille R.
shellfish platter.review: This place has a beautiful view. The food is also very good. Service was excellent. We had the free appetizer with yelp check in and it was ok. The shellfish platter for 2 at $55 was very good. Fresh seafood a must while in S.F. The dessert creme brulee was just ok.  Would come here again for the view and seafood.

excerpts: th e calamari was good but the main event was the shellfish platter for one and the bfs surf n turn.
needless to say it was more than delicious.
my boyfriend absolutely loved his steak and i was in heaven with the fresh shrimp and awesome crab.
the little corn on the cob that came along with it was great also.
i'm by no means a professional when it comes to eating crab.
i get all messy and stain my shirt
