but i don't care!!!
needless to say it took me a while to eat the crab
but it was sooooo good
and i had fun.
our tab came out to 150
but it was sooo worth it!
shellfish platter.author: Cecilia G.
shellfish platter.review:
this place was amazing!! after the chipotle festival we came here for dinner. since we didn't have reservations we had to wait about 20 mins for a table. Luckily, two seats opened up at the bar. our waitress was great, super sweet and took really good care of us. i can't remember her name but she works at the bar and has great make up :). so we ordered drinks, i had chardonnay and the bf had an IPA. we ordered calamri as an appetizer. th e calamari was good but the main event was the shellfish platter for one and the bfs surf n turn. needless to say it was more than delicious. my boyfriend absolutely loved his steak and i was in heaven with the fresh shrimp and awesome crab. the little corn on the cob that came along with it was great also. i'm by no means a professional when it comes to eating crab. i get all messy and stain my shirt but i don't care!!! needless to say it took me a while to eat the crab but it was sooooo good and i had fun. our tab came out to 150 but it was sooo worth it! the service was truly great. 

since this place is super busy on the weekend, i strongly recommend reservations. next time we hope to get  a table by the windows. also the best parking has to be the pier 39 structure since it directly connects the third floor to the restaurant and they validate. 

all in all, it was a great day in the city by the bay!

excerpts: We shared scallops and calamari as appetizers, she had crab cakes for her entree and mine was the Shellfish platter.
The shellfish platter included a half Dungeness crab, 5-6 peeled shrimp and 5-7 clams and mussels.
It's all swimming in an eighth-inch of melted butter, crab juices and garlic.
shellfish platter.author: Travel A.
shellfish platter.review:
My wife and I went for Dinner.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table, not a long wait at all.  We had a nice view from our table and the waiter was attentive and friendly.   We shared scallops and calamari as appetizers, she had crab cakes for her entree and mine was the Shellfish platter.

The calamari were very good, they were fresh, had a good remoulade and pleasantly spicy batter.  The scallops however, were not good, they're obviously frozen with a thick, greasy unseasoned batter.  The crab cakes were good, with a lot of crabmeat.  The shellfish platter included a half Dungeness crab, 5-6 peeled shrimp and 5-7 clams and mussels.  It's all swimming in an eighth-inch of melted butter, crab juices and garlic.  How can it not be good?  

Next time I'm in SF, I'd come back, just wouldn't order the scallops.

excerpts: Shellfish platter and crab cakes are SUPER DELICIOUS ...
The waiter Khaiman provides us with a very good service!!!
It is obvious that he likes his job
and he is professional at this...
I would like to come to this restaurant every time I come to San Francisco!!!
shellfish platter.author: Lamya A.
shellfish platter.review: Shellfish platter and crab cakes are SUPER DELICIOUS ... The waiter Khaiman provides us with a very good service!!! It is obvious that he likes his job and he is professional at this... I would like to come to this restaurant every time I come to San Francisco!!!

excerpts: Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food)
shellfish platter.author: Evette B.
shellfish platter.review: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!

excerpts: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great!
The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid.
The dessert was delicious.
Prices are a bit high but still affordable.
shellfish platter.author: Diana R.
shellfish platter.review: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great! The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid. The dessert was delicious. Prices are a bit high but still affordable.

excerpts: I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole.
The food was all outstanding.
shellfish platter.author: Lisa C.
shellfish platter.review:
Had dinner here on a Saturday night.  Used Open Table via Yelp to make reservations, which I highly recommend because it was pretty busy. Normally my husband and I wouldn't head over to Pier 39 for dinner because it's so touristy, but we had a friend in town and she wanted seafood.  Thanks to Yelp, I'm very glad we ended up here.

The view was outstanding. We got a nice table by the window looking out at the water. The menu had such a large variety of items to choose from. We had crab cakes and clam chowder as an appetizer. The crab cakes were full of crab meat and not to much filler and the clam chowder was nice and thick, but not to thick.  I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole. The food was all outstanding.  I was definitely having a hard time finishing my meal. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was for the service.  It was pretty good for the most part, but after our food was brought out there wasn't much following up.  My husband wanted a second beer and my girlfriend wanted some more wine which took some time to get.  Again it was really busy, so we were patient.  We'd definitely go back again.

excerpts: My coworker had the shellfish platter which he also found to be very good.
We started off the meal with some of the biggest and best crab cakes I've ever had the pleasure of eating, and the service was fantastic as well.
We were in and out of a very busy restaurant inside of an hour.
shellfish platter.author: Dan B.
shellfish platter.review:
Everything about this place during my visit was fantastic! I went with a coworker while we were on a business trip and this was by far our best and most memorable meal of the week. 

Here is the highlight reel: Red Snapper (special) was delicious, quite possibly the best fish dish I've had in recent memory. My coworker had the shellfish platter which he also found to be very good. We started off the meal with some of the biggest and best crab cakes I've ever had the pleasure of eating, and the service was fantastic as well. We were in and out of a very busy restaurant inside of an hour. I should also mention that the view was quite impressive and this looks like it would be a good place for a date. 

The not so great: Not really the restaurant's fault, but the address really confused my GPS... both the sprint nav and google maps put me in an industrial area, which I later found out meant that I drove right by the Mythbuster's warehouse. The price is also a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get, but the quality of the food was spot on.

excerpts: We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.
shellfish platter.author: L D.
shellfish platter.review: I really love taking visitors here and the food and service has always been excellent.  I believe the prices are reasonable for the quality and portions you receive (you are on the wharf!)  Visiting friends enjoy the view of the harbor and bridge and the excellent seafood and sourdough.  I also appreciate that they allow you to linger and enjoy your meal unlike other pier restaurants.  Our recent server, Faycal, treated us like royalty--or so it seemed.  We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.

excerpts: but once I had a bite of the seafood penne pasta it was like move over risotto.
Red sauce  better than white sauce FTW.
The seafood on the penne pasta was cooked to perfection and I found myself dipping into this dish more than my own.
The risotto I thought needed to be  cooked more.
It wasn't as creamy as I prefer risotto to be.
It was still good
seafood penne.author: Lindsay C.
seafood penne.review:
Seafood party! Love that you get on the wait list via Yelp and avoid waiting around uncessarily.

The clam chowder here was so amazing! It was creamy with pieces of clams and potato and I wanted to lick the bowl.

Scallop, crab, and clam risotto was pretty tasty at first bite but once I had a bite of the seafood penne pasta it was like move over risotto. Red sauce  better than white sauce FTW. The seafood on the penne pasta was cooked to perfection and I found myself dipping into this dish more than my own. The risotto I thought needed to be  cooked more. It wasn't as creamy as I prefer risotto to be. It was still good but I'd get the penne pasta next time.

The tiramisu was delish. It was a bit more chocolatey but still light with hints of expresso. Service was great and I could see myself coming back for more clam chowder.

excerpts: For entrees, we got the seasonal Jumbo Scallop and Crab Meat Risotto and the Seafood Penne.
Both were solid dishes!
seafood penne.author: Cynthia D.
seafood penne.review:
Amazing spot for great food with view of Alcatraz and the pier.

My party of four enjoyed our seafood dinner here and the sunset view was gorgeous. For appetizer, I tried the Clam Chowder in the bread bowl which was really creamy and tasty, fresh oysters - freakin' delicious, and even the baked oysters were noteworthy, and the crab cakes were to die for! For entrees, we got the seasonal Jumbo Scallop and Crab Meat Risotto and the Seafood Penne. Both were solid dishes! I loved the crab flavor in the risotto. 

Infamous restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf whereas the wait can be for hours. Luckily for us, Yelp Waitlist was the MVP! I wish more restaurants implement this in NYC. I simply opened my handy Yelp app and tapped to join the waitlist (must be within 40 miles) while I was commuting from my hotel in Lower Haight. It would give me an estimated time to check in with the hostess and approximately how many parties are ahead of us. My friends and I were exploring Fisherman's Wharf the entire time until time got closer. Ta Da!

excerpts: I had the seafood penne - with generous portions of fish, mussels, clams, and shrimp; and also tried the dungenous crab, clam chowder and the calamari - all of which tasted divine!
seafood penne.author: Jes S.
seafood penne.review:
Located in pier 39, this restaurant is definitely worth waiting in line for. Tip - luckily you can join the wait-list (via yelp), to cut your waiting time shorter!

I had the seafood penne - with generous portions of fish, mussels, clams, and shrimp; and also tried the dungenous crab, clam chowder and the calamari - all of which tasted divine! 

Highly recommend the clam chowder!

excerpts: I went with the Seafood Penne, also SO good!
The dish was packed full of clams, mussels, crab, shrimp, scallops...too much for me to eat on my own even though I tried so hard
seafood penne.author: Danielle P.
seafood penne.review:
I spent the weekend in SF with my mom and her one request was that she have scallops for dinner, her fav! After some Yelping around, I chose Fog Harbor and made a reservation online. 

Located on the 2nd floor of the Pier 39 strip, you get a pretty awesome view, day or night. We requested a seat by the window and were accommodated with no problem. the service was good and the food was GREAT.

We started with the shrimp cocktail, I highly recommend.
My Mom had the special - Crab risotto with Scallops, she LOVED this dish. Everything was perfectly cooked. I went with the Seafood Penne, also SO good! The dish was packed full of clams, mussels, crab, shrimp, scallops...too much for me to eat on my own even though I tried so hard :)

Overall the view of the water along with a great meal was a perfect ending to our night.

excerpts: I ordered the Seafood Penne which was bomb and very reasonably priced.
seafood penne.author: Scott L.
seafood penne.review:
When every place on a Monday night is dead in the Harbor area, but Fog Harbor Fish house is bumpin then yeah you know this place is awesome. I would recommend making a reservation no matter the night as this place is right on the water and the food/service is amazing. 

Clam Chowder lives up to the hype and I made the rookie mistake of not getting it in the bread bowl. They have great bread that they give you before the meal. Any place that gives me breads always has a special place in my heart. I ordered the Seafood Penne which was bomb and very reasonably priced. The service is excellent and it feels like seconds after you order, the food is at the table. 

If I come back to San Francisco, I'll make sure to eat here again as it was the best restaurant I went to during my trip.

excerpts: Seafood Penne (4/5) - very good.
I don't order pasta much because I am not a big fan of pasta
so this is a high compliment.
seafood penne.author: Paul L.
seafood penne.review:
Dear Foggy,

I am glad I found you. My good friend yelp let me know I should check you out, so I did.

I was looking for a place to take my in-laws, somewhere nice, somewhere where the food is distinctly San-Francisco-like, and of course the food has got to be good. You hit the mark.

I don't dish out 5-stars lightly, but I'll give it to you. If the prices were like $5 cheaper and the seats a little farther apart you would be perfect, but hey I understand. If I was running a business at such a prime location and brimming in the seams, I would have done exactly the same so I can't hold that against you.

To keep it simple, your service good, your people are nice, and the food is fantastic. The highest compliment is that despite your prices, I've returned yet again, with my own parents some months later. We even got seated right next to the window and when that happens it's like magic. Also the wait was never as long as it seems for a place so busy. I would have expected to wait 45minutes to an hour but somehow it ends up being way short of that each time.

As for the food.

Mussel Fries (5/5) - um yes please. what is in that sauce? yum.

Seafood Penne (4/5) - very good. I don't order pasta much because I am not a big fan of pasta so this is a high compliment. pasta lovers would have a field day.

Clam Chowder (5/5) - yeah people might have different opinions but I am firmly in the camp of ... this is really good clam chowder. flavorful, little chunks of meat. Usually I leave clam chowder places wondering if they just opened a can of campbell soup. This ain't one of those.

Seared Scallop Risotto (5/5) - oh yes. yes. very delicious. expensive but delicious. wish there were more scallops, but those scallops that were there... delicious. 

You have become our go-to place to bring people we want to take out to the city to see pier 39. great job.

until then...

excerpts: I ordered the Seafood Penne and my mother ordered a crab sandwich and both meals were delicious.
The sauce they used in my pasta was outstanding, I couldn't get enough of it and the chicken, mussels, and other seafood
I found inside my pasta was fantastic.
In fact it was my first time ever trying mussels, and this restaurant has me hooked...
seafood penne.author: Tori G.
seafood penne.review:
The food here is so good and the seafood is so fresh!

I ordered the Seafood Penne and my mother ordered a crab sandwich and both meals were delicious.  The sauce they used in my pasta was outstanding, I couldn't get enough of it and the chicken, mussels, and other seafood I found inside my pasta was fantastic.  In fact it was my first time ever trying mussels, and this restaurant has me hooked... Unfortunately I haven't experienced any other restaurant that matches the yumminess of this one though!  

There is plenty of seating and did not have to witness any wait.  The waiter was very nice and quick to serve us.

The view and ambiance was also really quite wonderful.  
Parking could be a problem for some people, yet if you are familiar with San Francisco you should know public transportation or walking is really the most viable way to get around.  

I'm so excited to eat here again

excerpts: My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne.
I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite!
The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it.
seafood penne.author: Sarina J.
seafood penne.review:
Food is pretty good, but is HEAVY. Like I still feel the clam chowder in my stomach, writing this days later. Had to knock down a star for some service issues.

Due to traffic, we barely made the 10-minute cutoff for being late to our reservation. However, we sat for a good 10-15 minutes ignored by at least 3-4 staff members, including who we would find out to be our actual waitress. Just a little after opening, it was busy but not chaotic, and we got one of the last booths in the middle facing the water. However, no one stopped by to offer water or anything for these 10-15 minutes. When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away. Ooookay? However, her attitude adjusted quickly when she came back, and was extremely accommodating and polite afterwards.

As for the food, like I said, it was heavy. We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty. The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough. I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top. We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first. But everything was cooked well.

For my entree, I got the clam chowder and Caesar salad combo, but could barely finish half of the clam chowder. My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne. I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite! The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it. The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free! The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF. Pretty good! When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.

excerpts: The seafood penne was satisfying.
Not as much flavor as I wished for,

but I guess it's expected when you have a variety of seafood in a pasta - I'm assuming they were trying to put an emphasis in the seafood, rather than seasoning it up and hiding the seafood's natural flavor.
seafood penne.author: Natasha R.
seafood penne.review:
While the hubs and I are on our way to our go-to spot to get our crab craving fix, on a whim we decided to try some place new, and boy i do not regret that decision one bit!

We agreed on Fog Harbor Fish House based on their Yelp reviews (thank you, fellow Yelpians).

We started with the calamari. Mouth.Watering. it's the jalapenos, i swear! And to top it off with the lemon aioli. I died, inside. Happily.

The shellfish platter is a must! The hubs is a big guy, so the platter for two plus the lobster was filling for him. I feel as though if he were to have bought it for 1, he'd be asking for a snickers bar (drumroll, with a hit of the symbols - bam). Shellfish platter for two came with 1 whole crab, 12 clams, 12 shrimp and 12 mussels. We added a lobster for an additional cost.

 The seafood penne was satisfying. Not as much flavor as I wished for, but I guess it's expected when you have a variety of seafood in a pasta - I'm assuming they were trying to put an emphasis in the seafood, rather than seasoning it up and hiding the seafood's natural flavor. And I am not mad at that.

And to end our beautiful experience (almost cried because desserts are always a reminder that you are almost done) I couldn't help, but salivate over their apple crisp. Lord, help me.

Just screw this review and go and get yourself a seat at this place.

excerpts: The table ordered the recommended dishes such as the Seafood Penne and the Fish and Chips.
The battered fish was bland and tasteless, and the Seafood Penne Pasta left more to be desired.
The sauce was so thin it slid right off the pasta leaving a plain noodle.
The service was awful, and I'm pretty sure the server was high the entire time.
I expected a lot more from a nicer restaurant and wish we had chosen a different place.
seafood penne.author: Carinna L.
seafood penne.review: We were excited to try out this local joint as Seattle locals visiting from out of town. For the price, location, and food selection we had decent expectations. We started with alcoholic beverages which were decent, but didn't taste like much alcohol was in them. We ordered appetizers of Calamari and Clam Chowder which was quite delicious. No complaints there. However, our entrees came out and that's when our experience took a nosedive. The table ordered the recommended dishes such as the Seafood Penne and the Fish and Chips. The battered fish was bland and tasteless, and the Seafood Penne Pasta left more to be desired. The sauce was so thin it slid right off the pasta leaving a plain noodle. The service was awful, and I'm pretty sure the server was high the entire time. I expected a lot more from a nicer restaurant and wish we had chosen a different place.

excerpts: I ordered Seafood Penne accompanied with a cup of their award winning clam chowder.
I have to repeat myself
seafood penne.author: Wildary C.
seafood penne.review:
Definitely one of the finest and best restaurants I've been to.
Had the pleasure to come here for lunch-early dinner a couple of summers ago and I've been dying to come back to this city and this restaurant since then.

We shared appetizers first, sliders, crab cake and crispy calamari. They all were on point!!

I ordered Seafood Penne accompanied with a cup of their award winning clam chowder. I have to repeat myself, i've been wishing i could come back. 

Everything was perfect, from the food to the service. I said it was one of the finest restaurants i've been to because the way they take care of the customers' need is something else. Waiters and waitresses are on another level. 
At some point my phone died, since I was on vacation I was carrying my charger everywhere, I asked one of the waitresses to take my phone somewhere safe so it could charge a little and she brought me a portable charger so I wouldn't have to worry about it, she made my day. Of course, that's one of the things this restaurant has to offer to the clients but to me it was a kindness act and great way to take care of the clients' needs.

If you happen to be in San Francisco, don't leave without paying a visit to this place. Almost forgot to mention, if you happen to be lucky like we were, you'll be seated near the huge windows that offer a view to the bay, in the evening it's BEAUTIFUL here. Come by and rate

excerpts: Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.
The oysters were very fresh and delicious.
The clam chowder was delicious.
It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect.
The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..
yummy.
The roll just meats in your mouth and they
they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.
The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good.
seafood penne.author: Ashley L.
seafood penne.review:
Came here to have my Bday dinner with the Beau because we were in the area and I was craving seafood.  Didn't know this place is located in Pier 39 until we got there.  **Note** This place only validate parking in the garage for an hour and it will take you more than an hour to eat at this place.

We waited about 15 mins before we got seated.  Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.  The oysters were very fresh and delicious.  The clam chowder was delicious.  It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect. The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..yummy.  The roll just meats in your mouth and they they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.  The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good. 

Recommend this place if you are looking for a seafood place to eat in the area.  The view was also very nice as we were seated by the window looking out over the water.

excerpts: I also had the seafood penne (sub-linguine)
it was AMAZING!
I don't eat cilantro, & they had no problem making me a new dish without cilantro!
Our server Ashley was nothing short of amazing.
Ashley's customer service was the best I've had in a long time!
I am huge on customer service.
My experience overall was dope!
I will be back really soon!
seafood penne.author: Charity M.
seafood penne.review: I am never the one to write reviews, but Fog Harbor left me no choice! I had the clam chowder, & I can see why it's award winning! I also had the seafood penne (sub-linguine) it was AMAZING! I don't eat cilantro, & they had no problem making me a new dish without cilantro! Our server Ashley was nothing short of amazing. Ashley's customer service was the best I've had in a long time! I am huge on customer service. My experience overall was dope! I will be back really soon!

excerpts: I had the seafood penne, which was to die for.
The mussels are HUGE!
seafood penne.author: Kelsey S.
seafood penne.review:
We were hard-pressed to find a restaurant that met everyone's needs: my mom wanted seafood, my dad is a picky eater and seemingly only eats red meat, and we didn't want to spend a fortune. The only place I could find with two dollar signs that served both seafood and steak was the Fog Harbor Fish House. They were concerned about it being too touristy, and were also put off by the fact that we couldn't get a reservation, but I wanted to give it a chance.

Well. Sure, it's at Pier 39, but it's not "touristy" in the typical sense. It's elegant, and very San Francisco. It has a wonderful view of the bay, and our window faced the lovely sunset over Mt. Tam.

They really do reserve most of their tables for walk-ins; we were nervous about walking up at 6 p.m. without a reservation, but we only had to wait 15 minutes.

The food was exquisite. I had the seafood penne, which was to die for. The mussels are HUGE! Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger. Everyone loved their meals, and our waitress, Ashley, was very kind and attentive.

As for the price, it's a bit more than two dollar signs. But graded on a curve, I'd say that it is less expensive than other places that serve similar fare. Each dish could have easily cost $5-10 more elsewhere.

This would be a lovely place to bring visitors from out of town or a local date just the same.

excerpts: Had the Seafood penne; mixed grill;  fried calamari; red chili garlic
shrimp--- all amazing!
Highly recommend!
seafood penne.author: Sussie C.
seafood penne.review:
Excellent!

Had the Seafood penne; mixed grill;  fried calamari; red chili garlic shrimp--- all amazing! Highly recommend!

excerpts: Had the seafood penne and the sole.
Both were very good.
The penne was very flavorful and the sole was refreshing.
I would order either of them again, although I would want to try the ahi next.
I love that you can put yourself on the waitlist via Yelp
so we could wander around.
Our friend had their dog from site seeing all day and was glad that the restaurant could still accommodate us.
seafood penne.author: Sheila E.
seafood penne.review: Had the seafood penne and the sole. Both were very good. The penne was very flavorful and the sole was refreshing. I would order either of them again, although I would want to try the ahi next. I love that you can put yourself on the waitlist via Yelp so we could wander around. Our friend had their dog from site seeing all day and was glad that the restaurant could still accommodate us.

excerpts: Calamari was fried to perfection, flavorful creamy seafood penne and yummy creme brûlée.
seafood penne.author: Eliza I.
seafood penne.review:
Best restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf! 

Delicious food with excellent services. Calamari was fried to perfection, flavorful creamy seafood penne and yummy creme brûlée. 

Truly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely come again in next trip!

excerpts: I ordered the Seafood Penne and again, it was perfection.
Perfect pasta, creamy tomato sauce, shrimp, mussels, and clams.
seafood penne.author: Juanita I.
seafood penne.review:
We ate a late lunch at Fog Harbor after arriving in San Francisco, jet lagged and hungry. It was around 2:30 and we were seated right away at a window overlooking the pier. The place was pleasantly busy. 

Our server was kind and pleasant. 

We started off with the calamari appetizer with lemon aioli and it was perfection. We asked for more aioli and it was brought with a smile. 

I ordered the Seafood Penne and again, it was perfection. Perfect pasta, creamy tomato sauce, shrimp, mussels, and clams. It truly satisfied.

My husband ordered the Fried Combo which is fried fish, calamari, and shrimp and while it was good it was nothing special. It came with fries.

For dessert we had the Blondie Sundae because hubby is a lover of all things Biscoff. Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. It was delicious! 

We also each had a yummy raspberry lemonade cocktail which I can't remember the name of. It was quite good. 

Very impressed with Fog Harbor and would eat here again!

excerpts: I had the seafood penne it was just alright nothing special to be over 20 dollars.
Someone tell me how this place is 4 stars because to me it's overrated.
I don't know if it was 2 star bad
but it wasn't good.
seafood penne.author: Dan S.
seafood penne.review: The best part about this place was the bread before the meal. My girlfriend got the garlic shrimp. I hate when places burn shrimp on the skewer to a crisp. Their mashed potatoes were literally nothing more than mashed. potatoes. no salt or butter just bland the sautéed spinach if they were sautéed at all was only in the pan for a couple seconds. When I told the waiter he said that's the way they sauté it. Im sorry man the way you do it is wrong. I had the seafood penne it was just alright nothing special to be over 20 dollars. Someone tell me how this place is 4 stars because to me it's overrated. I don't know if it was 2 star bad but it wasn't good.

excerpts: Seafood Penne
The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me.
The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish.
However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate!
seafood penne.author: Kathy N.
seafood penne.review:
Disclaimer: Despite the fact that this restaurant has $$$, high stars and looks nice, you can totally get away with dressing casually!! 

The pricing of the dishes here were definitely a bit steep. 

We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish. It was basically your typical raw oysters - it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were. $34 for 12 oysters. 

Ahi Tuna Poke $18 - Loved the flavors in this! It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes. I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors. Great appetizer to start out our meal with.

Clam Chowder w/ Crab - got the cup size to try ($7), to add crab was an additional $7, but well worth it! Had to really get that seafood experience, right? The chowder was good on its own, but the crab added an extra umph and texture. I enjoyed it. Their chowder was also rewarded best in SF! 

Seafood Penne $23 - The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me. The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish. However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate! For a small girl, i found that this dish was just enough for me. 

Alaskan Halibut $34 - This was part of their seafood menu. A bit of a disappointment. Although the fish was very soft and fresh, it lacked flavor. We are more so people who enjoy more flavor in our dishes. Had to use sauce from the pasta so the fish wouldnt be so bland. 

Apple Crisp $8.50 - We came here for our anniversary, so they gave us a complimentary dessert. So nice of them! At the end of your meal, the server will come out with a tray of desserts to choose from - you select the one you want and they will prepare you a new one from the back. I was silly and was about to grab it right off the tray. The Apple Crisp was delicious. Not too sweet and served with vanilla ice cream. Unfortunately, i was too full from the dinner that i couldnt finish the dessert - which never happens.

For being a high rating restaurant with steep prices, I would have taken this place to be a more upscale restaurant, but its a great spot to come for any occasion at any time of the day.

excerpts: We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto.
That was so delicious!
There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly.
The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor.
If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto.
You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!
seafood penne.author: Fanny S.
seafood penne.review: This was the best thing that I had on my San Francisco trip! The food was delicious, and the service was great! We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto. That was so delicious! There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly. The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor. If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto. You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!

excerpts: My choice of the seafood penne was great.
There was a good mixture of various seafood goodies: mussels, clams, and some type of fish.
There was a good ratio of meats to pasta.
seafood penne.author: Andrea M.
seafood penne.review:
Such a pricey spot ($20 avg), but, that's what you get for eating right on the pier. 

The blue cheese garlic bread we shared [bc we're on vacay and don't care about being fatties] was yummy. Without the blue cheese atop the bread, it was like any other garlic bread--smothered in butter. And man was it expensive at $8.

The bf's crab roll, under the sandwich section, was really delicious. The poor roll was packed full of yumminess. It was flavorful and sort of oily. The accompanying fries were slightly crispy and yummy.

My choice of the seafood penne was great. There was a good mixture of various seafood goodies: mussels, clams, and some type of fish. There was a good ratio of meats to pasta.

excerpts: Highly recommend the seafood penne and chioppon dish.
seafood penne.author: Joey J.
seafood penne.review:
Excellent food and service! My waitress was super friendly. My coworkers and i had a really bad day and the waitress definitely cheered us up with her awesome attitude and smile. 
Very pleased with the clam chowder, better than the popular Boudin chowder down the street. 
I love how they serve fresh in house bread. 
Highly recommend the seafood penne and chioppon dish. 

Great location too, right at pier 39 at the Fisherman's Wharf. You can plan a day there and finish off with dinner here. Great view of the water too.

excerpts:
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. 
My little tot had the chicken tenders. 
All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.
seafood penne.author: Jennie N.
seafood penne.review:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

excerpts: SEAFOOD PENNE
Really creamy and lots of seafood.
Portion for this was big and definitely filling.
Pasta was cooked well.
Nothing wrong with this dish.
seafood penne.author: Nikki B.
seafood penne.review:
FISH N CHIPS WITH A VIEW~

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 5/5. AJ was our main server but the manager I believe and other servers were helping us out as well. Drinks were never empty and we always got more bread when we asked. Orders were taken at a timely manner and it only took about 15 minutes for all of our food to come out.

FOOD:
SOUP/SALAD COMBO: 5/5. Got the clam chowder bread bowl and Caesar salad. So good! I loved the salad dressing and the lettuce was very fresh and crispy. They leave the lettuce strips uncut so just a heads up. I honestly didn't think too much of it but it could be a little difficult to eat.

FISH N CHIPS: 5/5. So crispy and big. The fish was delicious and the fries were great as well. Coleslaw could've been a bigger portion but not complaining. Came with about 3 big pieces! Definitely would get again.

SEAFOOD PENNE: 5/5. Really creamy and lots of seafood. Portion for this was big and definitely filling. Pasta was cooked well. Nothing wrong with this dish. Highly recommend.

OVERALL: 5/5. With views of the Pier from pretty much wherever you're sitting, great food and how classy the restaurant was, it could easily be a restaurant for a date night or a casual dinner. Can't wait to come back when in SF~

excerpts: The calamari as well as the seafood penne was delightful.
Finally, Justine our server was extremely attentive and friendly.
I would highly recommend this place!
seafood penne.author: Neda A.
seafood penne.review: This place is great! The clam chowder was so creamy and like none other. The calamari as well as the seafood penne was delightful. Finally, Justine our server was extremely attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend this place!

excerpts: Ordered the seafood penne and the risotto and both were spectacular.
Make reservations two days or more in advanced if possible.
Love this place and will be back!
seafood penne.author: AnnMarie J.
seafood penne.review: Ordered the seafood penne and the risotto and both were spectacular. Make reservations two days or more in advanced if possible. Love this place and will be back!

excerpts: I got the seafood penne, and woooo it was soooo goood!!!
(Maybe it was just starving) but thinking about it now, it was still as good!
seafood penne.author: Katelynn N.
seafood penne.review:
I came here yesterday for lunch with my boyfriend, saw really good reviews so I had high expectations!

Staff was very attentive and accommodating, we had no issues there.

Food was great but really pricey; if you're looking for a budget friendly place, I suggest you sit out on this one. 
My boyfriend got the clam chowder bread bowl with the crab added to it, I didn't think it was anything special but he enjoyed it. However, I don't recommend it in a bread bowl because it soaks up all your soup! We also enjoyed the complimentary bread and also ordered the calamari, that was delicious!!! Just a heads up, it's a little spicy! I got the seafood penne, and woooo it was soooo goood!!! (Maybe it was just starving) but thinking about it now, it was still as good! It has a variety of seafood to satisfy my cravings! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again, but only if I'm really craving it not a weekend basis!

excerpts: We loved the garlic cheese bread,  the Seafood Penne, and Grilled Shrimp Bridgette.
Our server Daniel C. was great.
He was attentive, very friendly, and took very good care of us.
We loved it.
seafood penne.author: Diana D.
seafood penne.review: The food is incredible. We loved the garlic cheese bread,  the Seafood Penne, and Grilled Shrimp Bridgette. Our server Daniel C. was great. He was attentive, very friendly, and took very good care of us. We loved it.

excerpts: I had the Seafood Penne dish, which tasted great as expected.
They had a good wine selection and gorgeous ambiance..
seafood penne.author: Erwin C.
seafood penne.review:
I had a business dinner with a partner. The Fog Harbor was among the top restaurants recommended in Yelp, which we selected. It was good choice.

I had the Seafood Penne dish, which tasted great as expected. They had a good wine selection and gorgeous ambiance..

excerpts: We tried some clam chower bowls, seasonal lobster ravioli, seafood penne, their mixed grill, and fish and chips.
I thought that everything tasted really delicious and fantastic.
My brother who lives in San Francisco, said he's had better clam chowder
seafood penne.author: Karen C.
seafood penne.review:
While visiting the San Francisco fisherman's warf, I had to get my fill of seafood.  I wanted to have some clam chowder and whatever other seafood was available. I visited this place with my family so we got to order quite a few things and shared everything.  We tried some clam chower bowls, seasonal lobster ravioli, seafood penne, their mixed grill, and fish and chips.  I thought that everything tasted really delicious and fantastic.  My brother who lives in San Francisco, said he's had better clam chowder so I guess it's preference.  

We visited on a friday night, so it was very busy and lively in the restaurant. Service wasn't bad, it would've been nice if the waitress had checked on us a few more time because we ran out of beverages and had to try to flag her down. I realize it was busy but it would've been nice to have her check on us a few more times.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit here. I'd visit again.

excerpts: We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne.
The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce.
It was so good!
The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat.
The seafood penne was not too greasy
and it was huge.
seafood penne.author: Allie Y.
seafood penne.review:
I came here  for a date night. At first, we were scared that this could be a tourist trap since it is in the heart of Pier 39. We wanted to go somewhere with a nice view and good seafood so we chose this place.

We waited about 20 mins for our complimentary bread and butter to come out. The waiter told us that it was still baking in the oven. When it came out, it was freshly baked so i didn't complain.

The food was amazing! We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne. The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce. It was so good! The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat. The seafood penne was not too greasy and it was huge. All of the seafood tasted very fresh!

Something that bothered me was that there were desserts laying out in random places of the restaurants. It seemed unsanitary to me.

The service was not bad. It took a while for our food to come out on a Saturday evening but i'm not complaining since the food tasted good. The prices are decent for seafood, location, and the gorgeous view. There is no outside seating but you can request for a table next to the window with the beautiful ocean view. 

I'd come back!

excerpts: Seafood Penne ($20):
The seafood was definitely very fresh and worth the price.
The portion was huge.
seafood penne.author: Irene Z.
seafood penne.review:
This place will definitely live up to your expectations. Trust the yelp reviews! The restaurant is on pier 39, towards the front and up the stairs! It is a very big restaurant with a very nice view, towards the sea lions. I ordered:

Blue Cheese Garlic Bread ($8): I got this dish for free because it wad in my coupon book that I got from the welcome center. If I had to pay for this dish, I would probably not get it again. The bread was a bit too oily and tasted really strange.

Seafood Penne ($20): The seafood was definitely very fresh and worth the price. The portion was huge. Would highly suggest this if you like pastas.

Filet Mignon ($39): This is worth every penny!! I usually am not a big fan of meat, but this steak melted in my mouth!! The flavoring was on point. Mashed potato was flavored and creamy with chunks of potato.

I gave it a four star because of the server. He was really bad. He seem confused half the time and it took forever to get his attention. Other than that everything else was pretty good.

excerpts: I got the seafood penne pasta...nothing to boast about.
My son got the fish and chips.
Fish were too fried.
seafood penne.author: Kevin C.
seafood penne.review:
I came here based off the tremendous reviews on Yelp.  I have to say we were quite disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, the food is decent and all but I was expecting more from a 4 star yelp reviewed restaurant.  We got fried calamari and clam chowder to start.  The calamari were flavorful and lightly battered.  When our appety are better than our main entrees, oh boy we are in a world of hurt.

I got the seafood penne pasta...nothing to boast about.  My son got the fish and chips.  Fish were too fried.
My wife got pacific salmon salad.  The fish was too dry and cooked a tad too long.  However our waitress (I believe her name was Janette) was extremely nice and attentive.  She offered if my wife wanted a new salmon to be cooked and she said yes.  The second piece was much better.

Would we come back next time we visit SF, I doubt it.  The views are spectacular though.

excerpts: We ordered seafood penne and crab sandwich.
Seafood penne had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels and the sauce was very flavorful and delicious.
seafood penne.author: Cynthia T.
seafood penne.review:
Great food. Decent sized portions. Yummy drinks. We ordered the moscow mule and raspberry lemon drop drinks. Delicious and cute. Bread was warm and fresh. We ordered seafood penne and crab sandwich. Seafood penne had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels and the sauce was very flavorful and delicious. you could taste the real crab in the crab sandwich and they gave you a generous portion. 

Pricey but i would come again. Tastes fresh.

excerpts: My friend got the linguine and clams which was lighter than my Seafood penne.
My meal had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels.
They also make really tasty cocktails.
Price point isn't too bad at around $19-26 an entree.
If we ever come back, I'd probably stick to some lighter or less carby options.
We were both pretty satisfied but so full from the bread, soup, appetizer, and a portion of our entree.
I think it was due to everything being higher in sodium, carby, and creamy.
I would definitely come back to try the other menu items.
seafood penne.author: Anh N.
seafood penne.review: Enjoyed a nice dinner here for our last night in SF.  Nice views of the bay except for the bird poo on the windows but if you look past that you can appreciate the scenery. This place was really lively and had pretty quick service. Food was actually pretty heavy. Clam chowder was good but very heavy and dense. Bay scallops were cooked well and we both ordered pasta. My friend got the linguine and clams which was lighter than my Seafood penne. My meal had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels. They also make really tasty cocktails. Price point isn't too bad at around $19-26 an entree. If we ever come back, I'd probably stick to some lighter or less carby options. We were both pretty satisfied but so full from the bread, soup, appetizer, and a portion of our entree. I think it was due to everything being higher in sodium, carby, and creamy.  I would definitely come back to try the other menu items.

excerpts: I ordered the clam chowder and my boyfriend ordered the seafood penne and we were not disappointed!
seafood penne.author: Casey T.
seafood penne.review:
Best clam chowder with the best view!!
This restaurant is a must-go whenever you're in SF! Came here on Labor Day weekend and was quoted 45 mins for a party of 2. That may seem like a long time but it's sooo worth the wait. 

We were lucky enough to be seated next to a window table and the view was unbelievable. If possible, try getting here a little early to watch the sun set. I ordered the clam chowder and my boyfriend ordered the seafood penne and we were not disappointed! Both were reasonably price considering it felt like we were in a high end restaurant. 

For anyone looking for a place to eat on the pier, 
Fog Harbor is THE spot!

excerpts: I had a strawberry daiquiri (yummy) and the seafood penne.
I thought it was very yummy and ate every last bite.
It is pricey and definitely a tourist attraction
but it was delicious nonetheless.
seafood penne.author: Karen L.
seafood penne.review: My family and I recently made a trip to San Francisco and we were walking through the pier after going to the aquarium and decided to stop by for a bite to eat. The scenery was nice and the interior is beautiful. I had a strawberry daiquiri (yummy) and the seafood penne. I thought it was very yummy and ate every last bite. It is pricey and definitely a tourist attraction but it was delicious nonetheless.

excerpts: I got the Seafood Penne and the mixture of pasta, fish, shellfish, and tomatoes was perfect.
You could taste everything and nothing took away flavor from another.
Overall the meal was delicious and although pricey I would say being seafood and the location the price was fair.
The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because our waitress didn't seem to happy to be there while rest of the staff seemed happy.
She did her job to the bare minimum
and I don't think I ever saw her smile once.
It kind of made the experience awkward whenever she came around to take orders or fill our water but aside from that our experience was great.
seafood penne.author: Simon L.
seafood penne.review: My girlfriend and I just got into San Francisco for vacation and we were craving the famous San Francisco seafood. We looked on Yelp and that's how we found Fog Harbor Fish House. The restaurant was busy; very ambient, fun, and family friendly. We got seated immediately though and the view was very nice. We could see the Golden Gate in the distance, the restaurant was right by the sea so on one side you could gaze out into the sea and on the other you could people watch and see the city itself. The food was delicious and is the biggest reason I'm giving four stars. We got the clam chowder in a bread bowl and wow both my girlfriend and I agreed it was the best clam chowder we've ever had. The chowder was thick, creamy, and had just enough seafood and the bread bowl was very complimentary to the chowder. My girlfriend got the Swordfish and she said the fish was cook very well and the sauce enhanced the fish. I got the Seafood Penne and the mixture of pasta, fish, shellfish, and tomatoes was perfect. You could taste everything and nothing took away flavor from another. Overall the meal was delicious and although pricey I would say being seafood and the location the price was fair. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because our waitress didn't seem to happy to be there while rest of the staff seemed happy. She did her job to the bare minimum and I don't think I ever saw her smile once. It kind of made the experience awkward whenever she came around to take orders or fill our water but aside from that our experience was great.

excerpts: I had their seafood Penne and their Cioppino, but the king of their dishes is by far the clam chowder.
It is beautifully prepared and teases your appetite with the most exquisite flavors and tastes.
That clam chowder is remarkable among all the dishes there and I will only be going for that in the future.
The ambiance is just right and adds an extra layer to this great place.
However, if you're coming, definitely get the clam chowder, if I haven't said it enough!
You wouldn't regret it!
seafood penne.author: Ronaldinhio T.
seafood penne.review: I have been this restaurant only once and they have left a lasting impression on my mind. I had their seafood Penne and their Cioppino, but the king of their dishes is by far the clam chowder. It is beautifully prepared and teases your appetite with the most exquisite flavors and tastes. That clam chowder is remarkable among all the dishes there and I will only be going for that in the future. The ambiance is just right and adds an extra layer to this great place. However, if you're coming, definitely get the clam chowder, if I haven't said it enough! You wouldn't regret it!

excerpts: My two girls had salmon and I had the seafood penne.
OMG, SO AMAZING!
Calamari appetizer is a must.
My 4 yo had the kids fish and chips
and we took one bite
and that was it.
Dry and bland
so don't bother with wasting $ on kids meal.
The bread..
oh the bread... dreaming about it still.
seafood penne.author: Babs L.
seafood penne.review: Amazing place! My two girls had salmon and I had the seafood penne.  OMG, SO AMAZING! Calamari appetizer is a must. My 4 yo had the kids fish and chips and we took one bite and that was it.  Dry and bland so don't bother with wasting $ on kids meal. The bread.. oh the bread... dreaming about it still.

excerpts: I was the difficult customer who wanted to customize my plate, I got the seafood penne but with shrimp only
and it was AMAZING!
I never finish my food, so I took home the rest and it was just as good as leftovers!
seafood penne.author: Kelsey C.
seafood penne.review:
Beautiful views and delicious food! 
I was the difficult customer who wanted to customize my plate, I got the seafood penne but with shrimp only and it was AMAZING! 
I never finish my food, so I took home the rest and it was just as good as leftovers!

excerpts: The seafood penne is $19 but didn't fill me up.
Mussels and clams' meat are tiny.
The swordfish is really good!
seafood penne.author: Skye V.
seafood penne.review:
An hour wait for a party of 7.

The food isn't amazing and the wait wasn't worth it. It's pretty pricey. The seafood penne is $19 but didn't fill me up. Mussels and clams' meat are tiny. The swordfish is really good! Super fresh but such small proportion for $26 :((

The portions of the clam chowder and salad is pretty large so that was worth the $14. But everything else I ordered wasn't worth it Unfortunately..

Overall this place is nice. Our waiter, Brett, was lovely! He was tentative and funny as well. Wouldn't come back again since it's just too pricey and the food isn't amazing as I thought it would be. But really great service

--my cousin ordered the New York steak and loved it! He recommends that! :)  

Total: $130.24

excerpts: Seafood penne is the way to go!
Tomato cream sauce is wonderful!
I usually won't eat cream sauce, but this one is great, not to creamy but flavorful enough to make the seafood great!
Love the fish inside.
Clams are so fresh in the seafood penne as well.
Penne are well cooked, not too soft or hard.
seafood penne.author: Chris W.
seafood penne.review: Great food reasonable price! Seafood penne is the way to go! Tomato cream sauce is wonderful! I usually won't eat cream sauce, but this one is great, not to creamy but flavorful enough to make the seafood great! Love the fish inside. Clams are so fresh in the seafood penne as well. Penne are well cooked, not too soft or hard. Tried my friends salmon and clam chowder. Clam chowder tastes creamy, despite a heavy flavor of corn starch but i somehow enjoy the corn starch taste, remind me of childhood. Sourdough is cool as well! Try the bread before meal, if you like it, then clam chowder in a bread bowl is a safe choice, if you think it's too sour, then you might need to consider not having the soup in a bread bowl, because it is the same type of bread. Also tried the salmon, salmon is a little bit too salty for me, but still taste fresh and tender. Definitely worth going when you are at pier 39. Love the garlic shrimp as the starter! Portions are great and would love to have dessert but have no room for it.

excerpts: We liked the seafood penne and the shrimp brochette.
Both excellent.
seafood penne.author: Joseph V.
seafood penne.review: Excellent food, good atmosphere, Justin made it very nice.    We liked the seafood penne and the shrimp brochette.   Both excellent.

excerpts: Some standouts were the crab cakes, bleu cheese garlic bread (not overwhelmingly bleu - definitely try), mixed seafood penne and special entrees.
Take a peek at the old-school dessert tray and you won't be able to resist!
seafood penne.author: R A.
seafood penne.review: The food was fantastic and the view was great. We arrived for an early dinner. I knocked one star off since our first server was passing out water and reached across the table and said to my mother "take the glass, honey." Not only is that condescending but it's a sign of an improperly trained server as you should never hand something to a patron. The shift was changing so luckily that server was replaced with someone more professional. Cocktails, appetizers, entrees and dessert...no complaints! Some standouts were the crab cakes, bleu cheese garlic bread (not overwhelmingly bleu - definitely try), mixed seafood penne and special entrees. Take a peek at the old-school dessert tray and you won't be able to resist!

excerpts: I shared the seafood penne which came in a delicious tomato cream sauce.
seafood penne.author: Michelle W.
seafood penne.review: Fishermans Wharf is super touristy, but I would definitely go out of my way to eat at Fog Harbor. Our server was excellent - she really went out of her way to accommodate. I mentioned that I didn't eat a lot, and since we were going to be out and about didn't want to have to worry about leftovers. So she highlighted that another member of my party was ordering the same thing and offered that we could share. She was right on. I shared the seafood penne which came in a delicious tomato cream sauce. I also tried another dish at my table - pacific sole - and it was super flavorful and flaky. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.

excerpts: I tried the seafood penne
The creamy tomato sauce was great.
I preferred the seafood to be more tender, but the dish was still very delicious.
seafood penne.author: Zhou L.
seafood penne.review:
I tried the seafood penne
The creamy tomato sauce was great. I preferred the seafood to be more tender, but the dish was still very delicious.

excerpts: The seafood penne and bread bowl clam chowder were excellent picks.
They even gave us a complimentary dessert.
seafood penne.author: Sean M.
seafood penne.review: We had a 5  meal for our 1 yr anniversary. The seafood penne and bread bowl clam chowder were excellent picks. They even gave us a complimentary dessert.

excerpts: The good: Seafood Penne & Clam Chowder
Not so good:
Ordered Crispy Calamari and
it was mixed by far too many Jalapenos instead of Calamari's.
Also Disappointed that that they have taken many of the favorite dishes off menu: Lobster Mac & Cheese and few more...
seafood penne.author: Sergio A.
seafood penne.review:
Good Food & Atmosphere. 
The good: Seafood Penne & Clam Chowder
Not so good: Ordered Crispy Calamari and it was mixed by far too many Jalapenos instead of Calamari's.  Also Disappointed that that they have taken many of the favorite dishes off menu: Lobster Mac & Cheese and few more...

excerpts: The seafood penne was also very delicious, with lots of fish, and a good amount of shellfish, with a rich tomato cream sauce.
seafood penne.author: Chris W.
seafood penne.review: The best clam chowder I've had in San Francisco. The seafood penne was also very delicious, with lots of fish, and a good amount of shellfish, with a rich tomato cream sauce.

excerpts: We also had the oysters, and seafood penne.
Both were good.
The chicken penne was ok.
The view is great too.
They do not take reservations but there can be a wait sometimes.
They only seat you when the entire party is present.
But its well worth the wait.
seafood penne.author: Shibani K.
seafood penne.review: Have been here twice now. Had a great experience both times. My family who is not very experimental and fussy about food loved this place. We are all seafood lovers and the seafood here was really fresh( the fish was literally caught that morning and you can feel the difference). If you like spicy food, do try the garlic chilli prawns app, it is really good. We also had the oysters, and seafood penne. Both were good. The chicken penne was ok. The view is great too. They do not take reservations but there can be a wait sometimes. They only seat you when the entire party is present. But its well worth the wait.

excerpts: We were started off with complementary bread then we ordered tuna poke starter, clam chowder bowl, and seafood penne.
The tuna poke was actually my favorite!
It was light and fresh.
The soup was very good too.
And the penne was not too bad.
seafood penne.author: Mel H.
seafood penne.review: Had a reservation and ate here with some friends. Not too bad. We were started off with complementary bread then we ordered tuna poke starter, clam chowder bowl, and seafood penne. The tuna poke was actually my favorite! It was light and fresh. The soup was very good too. And the penne was not too bad.

excerpts: For the main course we decided to try the Mix Grill and Seafood Penne.
Both dishes were decent, nothing too amazing.
seafood penne.author: Charlene F.
seafood penne.review:
After reading reviews and looking at pictures of the dishes they serve, I was immediately hooked and reserved for two people. 

Location/Interior:
Let's begin with the location of the restaurant and how the interior looks. The location of this restaurant is very convenient because it is visible right as you enter Pier 39. As I entered the restaurant I liked how it looked, simple yet elegant at the same time. Looked clean and somewhat spacious. 

Service:
For me, not only is the food important but as well as the service. When I was greeted by the hostess, she did not smile and eye contact was barely given. I just assumed it was a busy day and let it go. Our server was nice although it seemed as if he was always rushing and I constantly had to get his attention whenever I had a question or wanted to order another dish. The only time he came to our table was when he served our food, he did not check up on us on his own unless I waived for his attention. 

Food:
Before any of our food arrived, complimentary sourdough bread was served. It was actually super fresh and delicious and I couldn't stop eating it. For appetizer we ordered the Crispy Lemon Calamari which was pretty good and the lemon aioli sauce it came with was delicious. Also we ordered a cup of their "award-winning" clam chowder which was really good and I can see why it is very popular. For the main course we decided to try the Mix Grill and Seafood Penne. Both dishes were decent, nothing too amazing. All of the dishes we ordered arrived fairly quickly, didn't have to wait too long which is good because I get "HANGRY" easily haha. 


Overall, the restaurant itself was okay. The complimentary bread and appetizers we ordered were more delicious compared to the main dishes.

excerpts: I ordered the Seafood Penne which was very tasty
but they forgot the shrimp.
The portion was huge and enough to share.
My daughter's crab ravioli was delicious.
She works in the area so we may return just to order this dish.
seafood penne.author: Donna P.
seafood penne.review: Ok food,ok service, beautiful view.  A nice restaurant in a hectic tourist destination.  The menu is basic seafood with a few chicken options.  I ordered the Seafood Penne which was very tasty but they forgot the shrimp.  The portion was huge and enough to share.  My daughter's crab ravioli was delicious.  She works in the area so we may return just to order this dish.

excerpts: We came back again today and ordered the half dungeness crab, lobster tail, seafood penne, and more clam chowder!
Everything was delicious and the seafood was super fresh.
Would definitely come back!
seafood penne.author: Anna H.
seafood penne.review: This is the second time that I came here. First time was for lunch and we ordered the clam chowder and the baked clams. Both were excellent. We came back again today and ordered the half dungeness crab, lobster tail, seafood penne, and more clam chowder! Everything was delicious and the seafood was super fresh. Would definitely come back!

excerpts: , it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF
seafood penne.author: Daniel S.
seafood penne.review: Very high quality seafood place in Pier 39, it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF

excerpts: My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino.
We all took a sample bite of each other's orders.
Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected.
Calamarie tasted mediocre.
I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason.
My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking.
seafood penne.author: Abby Q.
seafood penne.review:
I think ill pass.  After a girls day out in Napa's winery, my friends and i decided to make a trip to the city for the rest of the day.  Our initial choice for dinner, house of prime rib, had a two hour wait and we were all pretty famished. We decided to just play it safe at pier 39.

We were debating between dining here or crab house, and finally settled for this. I ordered the calamarie and bowl of clam chowder.  My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino. We all took a sample bite of each other's orders. Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected. Calamarie tasted mediocre.  I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason. My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking. 

Overall, i probably wouldnt come back. Prices were fair for being in the heart of a tourist attraction, but i feel like i would be more satisfied elsewhere for the same price. Pass.

excerpts: I had the Seafood Penne.
seafood penne.author: Erica P.
seafood penne.review:
Such a great restaurant! We were referred to check out this place because of the views. We were taking a trip to SF and booked out reservation a week in advance, just in case. We loved it!!

My and I both had the clam chowder in the bread bowl. And for $6.00 more you can add fresh crab inside. DEFINITELY SPEND THE 6 bucks! So worth it! They gave us a huge mound of crab. 

We also ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. I tell you, I don't think I could replicate this at home lol. It was so good! 

My friend had the Seafood Cioppino which she let me taste. absolutely amazing. I had the Seafood Penne. Also amazing. 

For dessert we shared the Vanilla Bean Crème Brulee. I wanted to order a 2nd one, it was that good. 

Overall, very good food! Friendly wait staff, and beautiful views of the pier. I would definitely go back again!

excerpts: Other dishes we've tried and were flavorful too: calamari, crab cakes, grilled mixed seafood plate, and seafood penne.
Can't go wrong!
Only 4 stars as we were set on trying the crab rolls
but they ran out.
Waiter didn't tell us until after we placed order and even though they were busy would've been nice to know ahead....
Bummer.
Will ask ahead next time!
seafood penne.author: pearl s.
seafood penne.review: Second time here, not from here so I'm not familiar with local spots but this is best quality clam chowder I've had in Fishermans wharf. Clams are plentiful and fresh, broth is not salty or thick. Bread baked fresh regularly too. Other dishes we've tried and were flavorful too: calamari, crab cakes, grilled mixed seafood plate, and seafood penne. Can't go wrong! Only 4 stars as we were set on trying the crab rolls but they ran out. Waiter didn't tell us until after we placed order and even though they were busy would've been nice to know ahead.... Bummer. Will ask ahead next time!

excerpts: I had seafood penne and my wife had Ciopcino.
Food was great.
Received a complimentary Tiramisu.
Was very good.
Rafael did a great job.
seafood penne.author: Joe L.
seafood penne.review: Rafael was our waiter.  Great experience.  Made us feel very welcome. The staff wrote happy birthday on the table. When he saw that he said he would make sure we had a great experience.  His recommendations were great.  I had seafood penne and my wife had Ciopcino.  Food was great. Received a complimentary Tiramisu. Was very good. Rafael did a great job.

excerpts: We shared the crispy scallops with jalapeno aioli sauce, crab cakes, seafood penne pasta and the clam chowder.
They also have really good bread, so I would opt out of the bread bowl if you decide on clam chowder.
seafood penne.author: Laura T.
seafood penne.review:
Fog Harbor is one of the top places for seafood on my list. Everything we had was delicious. We shared the crispy scallops with jalapeno aioli sauce, crab cakes, seafood penne pasta and the clam chowder. They also have really good bread, so I would opt out of the bread bowl if you decide on clam chowder. On top of the amazing food, we were also seated by the window with a gorgeous view. 

I would love to make a trip back soon!

excerpts: Loved the seafood penne and cod special, our waiter Tyler was great!
seafood penne.author: Jenny P.
seafood penne.review: Loved the seafood penne and cod special, our waiter Tyler was great!

excerpts: What I ordered was simple, fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw and hubby had Seafood Penne with fresh fish, clams and mussels in a tomato cream sauce.
The food was fresh and hot, good but nothing special.
The shrimp was medium in size and fried to a nice golden crisp but unremarkable in taste as was the fries and coleslaw.
Per my husband although the seafood was fresh the seafood penne was bland.
The service was average, our waiter was more interested in the 3 girls that was seated at the table next to us and totally abandoned our table.
seafood penne.author: Vikki J.
seafood penne.review:
We like trying different restaurants during our yearly visits to San Francisco and decided to give Fog Harbor Fish House a try. We arrived after the lunch crowd but before the dinner crowd so the restaurant wasn't very busy. We were seated right away at the back with a nice view of Coit Tower to the left and the bay to the right. 

We were given fresh sourdough bread and butter. What I ordered was simple, fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw and hubby had Seafood Penne with fresh fish, clams and mussels in a tomato cream sauce. The food was fresh and hot, good but nothing special. The shrimp was medium in size and fried to a nice golden crisp but unremarkable in taste as was the fries and coleslaw. Per my husband although the seafood was fresh the seafood penne was bland. The service was average, our waiter was more interested in the 3 girls that was seated at the table next to us and totally abandoned our table.  Even when he was at the other table we couldn't get his attention and he pretty much ignored us, we had to flag down another waiter to get our check because our waiter disappeared. 

The food was fresh and the views were really nice, definitely worth a 2nd visit but would order something totally different.

excerpts: Seafood platter for one, Choppino, Crab cakes, Shrimp po' boy and Seafood Penne.
Everything was seasoned to perfection and nicely portioned.
Ok so here's the really good part, we noticed that there is a photo shoot behind us, they were taking pictures of this fabulous seafood tower.
The manager walks up to our table and says, hey they're almost finished, the platter hasn't been touched would you guys like to have it?
Wha???
Of course we would!
From Dungeness Crab, Shrimp to Lobster claws!
It was perfect!
What a wonderful experience!
We loved the food and the hospitality at Fog Harbor.
We would def recommend to all of our friends!
seafood penne.author: Chantell S.
seafood penne.review:
One of thee best experiences EVER! My family and I dined on a weeknight, nice crowd...but we were seated right away.  We chose the famous Clam Chowder w/crab as our starter and oh boy did it live up to the hype! Amazing clams and full of crab! It does not disappoint! 
We ordered our entrees. Seafood platter for one, Choppino, Crab cakes, Shrimp po' boy and Seafood Penne. Everything was seasoned to perfection and nicely portioned.  Ok so here's the really good part, we noticed that there is a photo shoot behind us, they were taking pictures of this fabulous seafood tower. The manager walks up to our table and says, hey they're almost finished, the platter hasn't been touched would you guys like to have it? Wha??? Of course we would! From Dungeness Crab, Shrimp to Lobster claws! It was perfect! What a wonderful experience! We loved the food and the hospitality at Fog Harbor. We would def recommend to all of our friends!

excerpts:
Seafood Penne - 18
a couple drinks for 43 with a 20% coupon from the coupon book from the Welcome Center

No better than ordering from a fast food fish and chip joint
- Seafood penne had a lackluster taste.
Don't recommend.
- Overall, very pleasant meal with a wonderful view of the Pier at a discounted price!
seafood penne.author: Chris C.
seafood penne.review:
We came on a Monday evening and ordered
1. Clam chowder in a bread bowl - 9
2. Fish and chips - 16
3. Seafood Penne - 18
a couple drinks for 43 with a 20% coupon from the coupon book from the Welcome Center

- You're on the 2nd floor so you get to see a wonderful view of the Pier. We came during sunset, so we got to see a gorgeous view of the sun near the horizon. 
- Nice service. Quick with refills and condiments. 
- Clam chowder was rich and creamy. generous portions of clam. My favorite part is eating the bread bowl when the bread absorbed most of the clam chowder soup! Nom! They Claim being the best. I can attest that it's good!  
- Fish and chips pretty average. No better than ordering from a fast food fish and chip joint
- Seafood penne had a lackluster taste. Don't recommend. 
- Overall, very pleasant meal with a wonderful view of the Pier at a discounted price!

excerpts: The seafood penne did not disappoint.
seafood penne.author: Gene C.
seafood penne.review:
We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.  

All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

excerpts: My family and I, three of us, ordered seafood penne.
It was incredibly delicious!
It's perfectly seasoned, and the seafood was fresh!
We also ordered a pacific cod to share.
It was equally amazing.
It has beans in it
and it's a fairly big amount.
We almost had a little bit too much food
but it's worth it!
The waitresses are pretty as well.
seafood penne.author: Heidi L.
seafood penne.review: This place has delicious bread as an appetizer. My family and I, three of us, ordered seafood penne. It was incredibly delicious! It's perfectly seasoned, and the seafood was fresh! We also ordered a pacific cod to share. It was equally amazing. It has beans in it and it's a fairly big amount. We almost had a little bit too much food but it's worth it! The waitresses are pretty as well.

excerpts: For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule.
Seafood cioppino was above average.
More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places.
Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish.
Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine.
