I'd say sotto mare was better.
The seafood penne was very well done.
Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had.
Soft center and flaky crust with chew.
The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain.
seafood penne.author: Matt P.
seafood penne.review:
A bit disappointed with the overall experience dining here for dinner. The overall atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and the view is amazing. For a party of three on a Sunday, the wait was minimal which was a plus. 

For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule. Seafood cioppino was above average. More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places. Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish. Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine. I'd say sotto mare was better. The seafood penne was very well done. Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had. Soft center and flaky crust with chew. The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain. The Moscow mule was watered down like crazy and might as well have been ginger ale mixed with water. 

The service for this restaurant was disappointing considering its a tourist trap. My server failed to give me plate/silverware, bread and water refills requires multiple requests and drink came 15 minutes late. Expected a lot more and there wasn't even an apology for lack of plate and utensils. 

I would probably not return based on the overall dining experience but the food was definitely some of the best of pier 39.

excerpts: The Seafood Penne I ordered was rich and flavorful and included ample portions of delicious fish and shellfish, all of which were fresh and tasty.
The Sole which my wife ordered was plentiful and wonderful and also as fresh as it could be.
We matched our meal with a great wine and completed it with a pumpkin bread pudding served warm and wonderful.
A little off the main tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf, this is worth walking the few extra steps it takes to get to it.
seafood penne.author: Paul L.
seafood penne.review:
The Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco has earned its reputation for being a wonderful place to visit and to eat, and even the locals come here often. Of the many great restaurants available here, we selected Fog Harbor and were very, very pleased with our choice.
The service was good, the wine list well chosen, and the food was absolutely wonderful. We started with fresh west coast oysters and found them to be as good as any we ever had from the east coast, which we generally prefer. The Seafood Penne I ordered was rich and flavorful and included ample portions of delicious fish and shellfish, all of which were fresh and tasty. The Sole which my wife ordered was plentiful and wonderful and also as fresh as it could be. We matched our meal with a great wine and completed it with a pumpkin bread pudding served warm and wonderful. 
A little off the main tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf, this is worth walking the few extra steps it takes to get to it.

excerpts: I got the seafood penne.
It was delicious.
seafood penne.author: Brooks S.
seafood penne.review:
Pier 39 was the most touristy pier along the road and it was pretty easy to find parking. Once we got there we asked what the best thing was, she's pointed at the clam chowder. That was $10. I got the seafood penne. It was delicious. My friends like the bread bowl the chowder came in.

The only complaint is the amount of time it took after the meal--to get our check split, 

We got a cool window seat. There was one tv I saw, there could have been one more but I doubt it. As you walked further inside it's pretty boosie (is that the correct spelling?) so more tvs would make it feel like a buffalo wings or Applebee's.

excerpts: I got the seafood penne and it was delicious!
Everyone loved their food.
The atmosphere was great and our waiter was really nice and friendly.
seafood penne.author: Angelica V.
seafood penne.review: It was amazing! The wait was a little long but it was worth it. I got the seafood penne and it was delicious! Everyone loved their food. The atmosphere was great and our waiter was really nice and friendly.

excerpts: The seafood penne and fish & chips were both delicious selections.
Friendly waiters and an attentive manager were on top of their game.
Try to get a seat near a window, it's worth it!
seafood penne.author: Rachel F.
seafood penne.review: Great restaurant, awesome views! Nice relief from a sunny day at Fisherman's Wharf. The seafood penne and fish & chips were both delicious selections. Friendly waiters and an attentive manager were on top of their game. Try to get a seat near a window, it's worth it!

excerpts: I got seafood penne and my wife got the chicken penne both of our dishes were absolutely amazing and very fresh.

The only reason i gave a 4 star instead of 5 is beacause they charged us four dollars for a soda i understand that this a tourist trap type place but their food is marked above food cost already and suggested a 20 % gratuity.
All in all i would come back.
seafood penne.author: Nick K.
seafood penne.review: Me and my wife were there for new years last night. For new years eve the wait was suprisingly not that long. The waiter was also very nice and helpful and although she didnt seem to overwhelmed. We got the calamari as an appetizer cooked to perfection the only problem, they were a little on the salty side. I got seafood penne and my wife got the chicken penne both of our dishes were absolutely amazing and very fresh. The only reason i gave a 4 star instead of 5 is beacause they charged us four dollars for a soda i understand that this a tourist trap type place but their food is marked above food cost already and suggested a 20 % gratuity. All in all i would come back.

excerpts: My husband had the Seafood Penne, also delicious.
The drinks were strong and the bread was great.
Great  view of Alcatraz and the sunset.
Would definitely go back!
seafood penne.author: Wendy D.
seafood penne.review: Just left from having dinner. I had the 1/2 Dungeness Crab. It was delicious and messy just as it should be. My husband had the Seafood Penne, also delicious. The drinks were strong and the bread was great. Great  view of Alcatraz and the sunset. Would definitely go back!

excerpts: Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine.
All were excellent.
Would definitely recommend.
Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.
seafood penne.author: Melanie T.
seafood penne.review: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.

excerpts: Seafood penne was very good
seafood penne.author: Tariq A.
seafood penne.review: Excellent food and nice atmosphere. Grilled seafood was so good. Seafood penne was very good

excerpts: Seafood penne pasta was underwhelming.
Both came very quickly which put me off a bit as nothing is freshly prepared.
Great views as I was by the window.
I would not come back or recommend, there are so many other restaurants to try.
seafood penne.author: Danielle H.
seafood penne.review: Very average. Was a bit disappointed as was looking forward to their amazing seafood. Clam chowder in a sour dough bowl was nice, average. Seafood penne pasta was underwhelming. Both came very quickly which put me off a bit as nothing is freshly prepared. Great views as I was by the window. I would not come back or recommend, there are so many other restaurants to try.

excerpts: We ordered the seafood penne and the crab cake but both were OK.
The seafood penne didn't have much flavor, though it had a lot of seafood so that was nice.
You couldn't really taste much of the crab in the crab cake because the herbs kinda overpowered it.
seafood penne.author: Diana U.
seafood penne.review:
I have to say, they have a very nice view of the harbor! And yummy clam chowder!! 
But the excitement kinda ended there. We ordered the seafood penne and the crab cake but both were OK. The seafood penne didn't have much flavor, though it had a lot of seafood so that was nice. You couldn't really taste much of the crab in the crab cake because the herbs kinda overpowered it.

excerpts: My seafood penne was OK,  but I could knock up  something as good with my eyes shut (in fact the mirepoix was way too chunky to extract much flavour and of course didn't cook through).
seafood penne.author: Matt M.
seafood penne.review:
I wasn't that impressed.  My wifes Chili LIme Shrimp Salad was greasy,  the shrimps overcooked to hell and just not as light as the name suggests.   My seafood penne was OK,  but I could knock up  something as good with my eyes shut (in fact the mirepoix was way too chunky to extract much flavour and of course didn't cook through).

Daughters fish and chips was good  though as was the Calamari.   Service was good, the view was good and the location of course, but coming from near Marseille in France,  where you can eat great seafood the meal was disappointing.

excerpts: We split the seafood penne pasta and the surf and turf, both of which I would highly recommend.
The view was gorgeous and it didn't seem like there were any bad tables in the place.
We had a wonderful time having a celebratory dinner here and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice evening at a tasty restaurant.
I am definitely going back here!!!
seafood penne.author: Jessica L.
seafood penne.review:
We came here to celebrate our engagement and our friends' wedding and had a wonderful time! We made reservations so out wait was less than 5 minutes, and that gave us a chance to take a few pictures in front of the pier 39 Christmas tree, so it was a welcomed wait. Our server was really sweet and patient. They have a delicious selection of appetizers, featuring many with crab, and the drinks were really good! (I had a pumpkin pie martini which was really good!) 
We split the seafood penne pasta and the surf and turf, both of which I would highly recommend. The view was gorgeous and it didn't seem like there were any bad tables in the place. 
We had a wonderful time having a celebratory dinner here and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice evening at a tasty restaurant. I am definitely going back here!!!

excerpts: I got the seafood penne which was good,  though I think the food isn't worth the $19,granted its fresh seafood.
We probably won't rush back here.
The crab cakes were okay and the popcorn shrimp were good.
seafood penne.author: Suny O.
seafood penne.review: This place has great ambience, but the service is lacking. We had to constantly  get our servers attention along with other wait staff. I got the seafood penne which was good,  though I think the food isn't worth the $19,granted its fresh seafood. We probably won't rush back here. The crab cakes were okay and the popcorn shrimp were good.

excerpts: For the main course, we got the seafood penne pasta and the cioppini with pasta.
Both were very very delicious.
seafood penne.author: Claire J.
seafood penne.review:
We got a window table which had a very nice view.  Our server was very nice and offered good recommendations.

We started with the half garlic-roasted dungeness crab and clam chowder.  The crab was delicious.  The chowder was a little on the thick side, but it was still very tasty with lots of clams and minimal potatoes.

For the main course, we got the seafood penne pasta and the cioppini with pasta.  Both were very very delicious.  This was actually a lot of food, and we couldn't finish it all.

If you save your ticket stub from the nearby Aquarium, you get 15% off.

excerpts: I had the best Seafood Penne pasta with fish, clams and mussels in to die for tomato cream sauce.
Definitely will be back.
seafood penne.author: Yelena Z.
seafood penne.review: Excellent food, great service, beautiful restaurant. I had the best Seafood Penne pasta with fish, clams and mussels in to die for tomato cream sauce. Definitely will be back.

excerpts: Food was great (between the 4 of us we got ciocippino, crab roll, half garlic crab, and seafood penne,
all great).
Service was perfect (especially our waitress Madison).
seafood penne.author: Matt S.
seafood penne.review: Awesome view of the bay. Food was great (between the 4 of us we got ciocippino, crab roll, half garlic crab, and seafood penne, all great). Service was perfect (especially our waitress Madison).

excerpts: Among dishes our party of seven tried were Grilled Shrimp, Lobster Squash Ravioli, Chowder in Sourdough and Seafood Penne.
All judged entrees as solid.
Great respite among the chaos.
seafood penne.author: David R.
seafood penne.review: Shocked to find such a pleasant surprise on Fisherman's Wharf.  Great vibe, great food, warm personable service. . . Shocked.  Among dishes our party of seven tried were Grilled Shrimp, Lobster Squash Ravioli, Chowder in Sourdough and Seafood Penne.   All judged entrees as solid.  Great respite among the chaos.

excerpts: I also shared a seafood penne pasta with my friend, and it was plenty of food for the both of us.
Lunch ended up being $35 per person, which is pretty steep for a soup, cocktail and shared entree.
But whatever, it was still good!
Just be prepared to spend $40+.
seafood penne.author: Jeanne C.
seafood penne.review: Definitely on the pricier end, but they have a lovely view of the pier & Golden Gate Bridge. Aside from the prices, the food is delicious. I loved by Blueberry Smash cocktail, and the clam chowder really is award winning (forget, Boudin. This sh*t is no joke). I also shared a seafood penne pasta with my friend, and it was plenty of food for the both of us. Lunch ended up being $35 per person, which is pretty steep for a soup, cocktail and shared entree. But whatever, it was still good! Just be prepared to spend $40+.

excerpts: My kids enjoyed the garlic steamed crab, and my wife loved the seafood penne.
There is a clean restroom inside the restaurant - shhh, don't tell anyone!
My only complaint with the experience is the utterly bogus 3.5% health care surcharge tacked on to every bill.
Being California, there's always some nonsense like this going on that people are forced to deal with.

I will leave it to you to investigate the origins of this surcharge, but the bottom line is that restaurants are not, in fact required to apply this charge, and their reason for doing so amounts to a political temper tantrum at customer's expense.
When I questioned the waiter about this, he gave the straight-faced party line as expected.
Can't blame him, really.
seafood penne.author: Paul K.
seafood penne.review: This is one of the pricey seafood places at Fisherman's Wharf, on Pier 39. We treat ourselves to one of these on each visit, and this time we chose Fog Harbor. We asked for and were given a window seat with a very nice view. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the Cioppino and it was outstanding. My kids enjoyed the garlic steamed crab, and my wife loved the seafood penne. There is a clean restroom inside the restaurant - shhh, don't tell anyone! My only complaint with the experience is the utterly bogus 3.5% health care surcharge tacked on to every bill. Being California, there's always some nonsense like this going on that people are forced to deal with. I will leave it to you to investigate the origins of this surcharge, but the bottom line is that restaurants are not, in fact required to apply this charge, and their reason for doing so amounts to a political temper tantrum at customer's expense. When I questioned the waiter about this, he gave the straight-faced party line as expected. Can't blame him, really.

excerpts: He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.
I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good
I wished I had ordered that instead.
The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.
seafood penne.author: DaYeen M.
seafood penne.review:
Ok so the one star is for the time me and my husband came here for lunch one saturday afternoon.  He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.  I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good I wished I had ordered that instead.  The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.  The view was great and we said that we would definitely be back the next time we're at pier39.

So now months later, a friend of mine who moved from NY to CA is traveling from Fresno to SF.  I suggested that we go to pier39 and meet up with a couple of our other friends.  Now here comes the "bad experience" part.  

We ordered Clam chowders, Fish and Lobster.  Well, I did order the Lobster because it was so good the last time we were here.  Wrong choice.  It was the saltiest Lobster ever!  Why not just give me pure rock salt and charge me $32 at that! Im not kidding it is real salty.  To top it off, our waiter didn't even bother refilling our water.  Well, I know some of us didn't order any drinks and just water but can't you even bother ASK if we want our glasses refilled.  After all you're still getting 18%  or $35++ in tips.  3.5% health fee is $6.88.  WTH is that for when you gave me salty lobster and no water refill.  Now, I always ask the waiter to leave the little desert menu wherever I go as I have the tendency to change my mind about getting a desert afterward.  He didn't even bother.  Oh and did I tell you that I was still munching on my french fries when he took the plate right then and there.

So far, this has been my WORST experience in a restaurant ever.  I will NEVER go back and I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone ever!  At the end of the night we ended up paying well under $300 for lousy service and bad food. What's funny is at the receipt there is an option for Additional Tip even after they put in 18%.  Never again.

excerpts: I settled on Linguine with Clams and my husband went for the Flat Iron Steak.
The latter of which, I must admit, I was hesitant about given the location and abundance of wonderful seafood options.
However, I was extremely happy to be wrong; the hubs claimed this to be the best steak he's ever tasted and I do believe, my dish may have been as well.
flat iron steak.author: Jen R.
flat iron steak.review:
Our very first night in one of my favorite cities, after the day of traveling (albeit, it was a short flight) and upon hitting the touristy Pier 39, we realized we were famished. We actually went online and the only available reservation was for 
10pm that evening which was so not 
happening so, we took a chance at just walking up and surprisingly only had a 20 minute wait.

Upon sitting down we immediately decided on the Blue Cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and a few beers to start. The bread was perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised to find that they did not skimp on the delicious Point Reyes blue cheese. 

I settled on Linguine with Clams and my husband went for the Flat Iron Steak. The latter of which, I must admit, I was hesitant about given the location and abundance of wonderful seafood options. However, I was extremely happy to be wrong; the hubs claimed this to be the best steak he's ever tasted and I do believe, my dish may have been as well. Not only were the clams obviously fresh, the seasoning was perfect and the sauce, nice and light to showcase the delicious seafood. 

The service was absolutely phenomenal and the views of both Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge from our table absolutely could not be beat. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone either visiting or, living in San Francisco.

excerpts: At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter.
Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience.
Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.
flat iron steak.author: Matt K.
flat iron steak.review: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.

excerpts: I ordered the flat iron steak and my partner had the garlic crab.
These were suggested by our waiter.
Both were excellent, good portions.
Staff were fantastic and very obliging, nothing was too much.
They took care of everything.
This restaurant was like a lovely warm hug on a freezing cold evening.
I highly recommend this restaurant.
flat iron steak.author: Ria P.
flat iron steak.review: Hats off to this restaurant.  Finally a restaurant that is fabulous, in every way.  We arrived on a busy Thursday night, and we're seated within 5 min., we had a wonderful table, with a view of the docks. I ordered the flat iron steak and my partner had the garlic crab.  These were suggested by our waiter.  Both were excellent, good portions.   Staff were fantastic and very obliging, nothing was too much.  They took care of everything. This restaurant was like a lovely warm hug on a freezing cold evening.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

excerpts: I actually went away from seafood (weird, right?) and ordered a flat iron steak, my girlfriend ordered fish n chips and her sister ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl.
The steak was amazing!
For a seafood place, this was so good.
I ordered medium rare and it came out just like that.
Great flavor too with the peppercorn sauce.
flat iron steak.author: Brandon C.
flat iron steak.review:
We capped off our vacation with this beautiful restaurant in the Fisherman's Wharf. 

Be prepared to wait.  On a Saturday night for 3 people, we had to wait ~45 min, not too bad I guess.  Once seated, we were lucky enough to have a nice beautiful view of Alcatraz with the window open about 20 degrees, almost too perfect. Except.. the table behind us was a huge family full of kids that were beyond noisy.  There was even a couple that declined to be seated in the same room because of it.  Annoying yes, but it was beyond our and restaurants control.  

I actually went away from seafood (weird, right?) and ordered a flat iron steak, my girlfriend ordered fish n chips and her sister ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl.  The steak was amazing! For a seafood place, this was so good.  I ordered medium rare and it came out just like that. Great flavor too with the peppercorn sauce.  My girlfriends fish n chips were good, same with her sister's chowder.  

Service was okay.  They seemed really swamped with the amount of people that were in there.  No complaints.  

Overall, this is a great choice to have a nice fancy dinner in Fisherman's Wharf!

excerpts: For dinner, my mom had the Filet Mignon, and I had the Flat Iron Steak, they were perfectly cooked.
She even deemed her dish as "the best thing I've ever eaten" -- that's saying a lot!
Skip Scoma's and walk down the pier to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed.
flat iron steak.author: Lauren A.
flat iron steak.review: First off, where do I even begin? Fog Harbor was recommended to my mom by a friend, and boy were we happy she was! First off, the view is AMAZING. And honestly, the food is just as good. My mom and I shared the complimentary made-in- house sourdough bread, clam chowder, and clams appetizer - all were very good. For dinner, my mom had the Filet Mignon, and I had the Flat Iron Steak, they were perfectly cooked. She even deemed her dish as "the best thing I've ever eaten" -- that's saying a lot! Skip Scoma's and walk down the pier to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Blue cheese garlic bread is an instant favorite and the flat iron steak was cooked perfectly.
Khaiman was awesome, and made an excellent dessert recommendation...
The blondie is killer!
flat iron steak.author: Tracy S.
flat iron steak.review: This place is great, even if you don't like fish like me! Blue cheese garlic bread is an instant favorite and the flat iron steak was cooked perfectly. Khaiman was awesome, and made an excellent dessert recommendation... The blondie is killer!

excerpts: My husband ordered the Pan Seared Chicken Breast.
It was dry - not tender or flavorful at all.
I've had much better meals at Applebee's.
Absolutely not worth the 18 bucks we paid for it.
I got the famous clam chowder and a caesar salad.
Clam chowder tasted like something you'd get in a grocery store.
pan seared chicken breast.author: Kathryn P.
pan seared chicken breast.review:
How does this place possibly have 1000+ reviews and 4 stars?? One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. Hands down the most terrible restaurant we went to while visiting California.

Service: Bad. Sooo bad. And so slow. I had to ask our waitress Jeanette (?) to refill our waters, even after she walked by us with a pitcher. The busser did most of the work.

Food: Ridiculously overpriced, extremely poor quality. My husband ordered the Pan Seared Chicken Breast. It was dry - not tender or flavorful at all. I've had much better meals at Applebee's. Absolutely not worth the 18 bucks we paid for it. I got the famous clam chowder and a caesar salad. Clam chowder tasted like something you'd get in a grocery store. Edible, but extremely mediocre.

Atmosphere: View was great - our table overlooked the water. That's my 1 star.

I seriously don't understand why this place has 4 stars. Overpriced, bad food and bad service. Definitely not a great last meal on our honeymoon.

excerpts: Pan seared chicken breast with mashed potatoes is tasty and delightful.
On top of the tasty food you will enjoy the views of water.
Love it!
You won't be disappointed with food and views!
pan seared chicken breast.author: Love Food And Wine W.
pan seared chicken breast.review: Wow, wow and wow! Top notch! Really like this place. The food and bonus views are excellent! The food quality is really there! The clam chowder is excellent; tasty served perfectly temperatured, the fish and chips delicious with just the right amount of crisp to the batter and French fries. Pan seared chicken breast with mashed potatoes is tasty and delightful. On top of the tasty food you will enjoy the views of water. Love it! You won't be disappointed with food and views!

excerpts: We ordered the calamari, caesar "salad", cioppino and the filet mignon topped with crab.
Everything was delicious along with the bread and butter they serve you while you wait for your food.
The calamari came out very quickly.
filet mignon.author: Cynthia C.
filet mignon.review:
My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday dinner. We were seated at a window seat during sunset and it was perfect.
The waiter was extremely sweet and very attentive during the evening as it slowly got busier in the restaurant full or tourists, definitely not a locals spot especially since its on Pier 39.

We ordered the calamari, caesar "salad", cioppino and the filet mignon topped with crab. 
Everything was delicious along with the bread and butter they serve you while you wait for your food. The calamari came out very quickly. The best part was that he asked "if we ready for our entrees" instead of just throwing them onto the table and being stuck with all the food. 

LET ME TALK TO YOU ABOUT THE DESSERT!!! 
So they bring out a plastic version of the desserts they offer so you can see what they have to offer. I immediately said "everything!" it all looks so good! But since we were sharing i went for the Duo dessert which was the creme brulee and chocolate molten cake with ice cream. TO DIE FOR! I did not care how full I was I wanted to finish the dessert. Next time I'm trying the banana pudding.

excerpts: Main course: filet mignon with topped with dungeness
and it was out of this world.
filet mignon.author: Summer M.
filet mignon.review:
Looking for excellent service with quality food???? 
This is the place!!!! Love their wine selection.  Alison was my server and she is a 10/10!!!!! Ambience is also beautiful. 

Appetizers: fried calamari and Dungeness crab ceviche 

Main course: filet mignon with topped with dungeness and it was out of this world.

excerpts: I was torn between surf and turf and found the perfect balance with filet mignon covered with crab.
It was exactly what I wanted and cooked to perfection.
filet mignon.author: Sabrina B.
filet mignon.review:
I was trying everything I could to avoid eating on Pier 39... but... we were hungry and didn't have time to get the car and head elsewhere in the city.

So... I went through Yelp and stumbled upon this restaurant. Given that the wife and I both wanted seafood, this seemed worth a shot. I reserved a table online incase it was busy. 

We headed over a short time before our reservation and were greeted immediately. They said our table was being prepared right by the window. We stepped away to look down the pier and they called us a second later. They walked us to a 4 top along the window. 

Our sever was by almost immediately after we were seated and was super friendly. She checked on us throughout the meal without being too pushy. 

I was torn between surf and turf and found the perfect balance with filet mignon covered with crab. It was exactly what I wanted and cooked to perfection. The wife had scallops and risotto and loved hers also - but we both agreed mine was the winner of the evening. 

The meal was perfect and so was the service. The only thing that made the evening lack a bit of something was the desert selection - nothing seemed overwhelmingly exciting like the meal choices had interested us. 

There is a strong chance I will need to have a meal here in the future - especially if they have the filet on the menu still!

excerpts: I had the filet mignon topped with crab with sautéed spinach and "mashed potatoes
" the potatoes had more lumps than mash and were not cooked well.
The crab was topped a very thick sauce that tasted like the smokiness you get when you bite into a Burger King burger.
Very strange.
My friend chose the shrimp and steak chow mein.
Her noodles were too rubbery to eat.
All in all try their chowder and appetizers.
filet mignon.author: Frasier J.
filet mignon.review: Delicious clam chowder soup. Great service. Fresh oysters. However, the food left us underwhelmed. I had the filet mignon topped with crab with sautéed spinach and "mashed potatoes" the potatoes had more lumps than mash and were not cooked well. The crab was topped a very thick sauce that tasted like the smokiness you get when you bite into a Burger King burger. Very strange. My friend chose the shrimp and steak chow mein. Her noodles were too rubbery to eat. All in all try their chowder and appetizers.

excerpts: The crab meat filet mignon special was delicious
filet mignon.author: Unique4nailz N.
filet mignon.review: Our lobster came out looking melted and mush! Our waiter made up for it of course by a fresh hot perfect lobster! The staff was very friendly and the rest of our dinner was good! The crab meat filet mignon special was delicious

excerpts: Our server seemed rushed and tired, the blue cheese on the filet mignon was a little overwhelming...
other than that we had a good experiences and would recommended to others.
filet mignon.author: Laura O.
filet mignon.review:
Great food, service could be better, but ambiance and food were fenomenal!
Our server seemed rushed and tired, the blue cheese on the filet mignon was a little overwhelming... other than that we had a good experiences and would recommended to others.

excerpts: I love the spicy shrimp app and the filet mignon for entree.
The service is always great this is my go to restaurant when I go to the city.
The ambiance here is amazing servers always very helpful
filet mignon.author: Maria M.
filet mignon.review: I love the spicy shrimp app and the filet mignon for entree. The service is always great this is my go to restaurant when I go to the city. The ambiance here is amazing servers always very helpful

excerpts: They say when you go to Frisco you have to have the seafood but let me tell you something that filet mignon steak is on fire medium rare
it just melts in your mouth.
I tried it with the lobster tail perfect combination.
Don't take my word for it!
Go try it out for yourself.
You won't regret it.
You pay for what you get.
Top notch grub on
filet mignon.author: Victor B.
filet mignon.review: Whenever I go to Frisco this is my spot to get my grub on. The food is on point and so are the views. They say when you go to Frisco you have to have the seafood but let me tell you something that filet mignon steak is on fire medium rare it just melts in your mouth. I tried it with the lobster tail perfect combination. Don't take my word for it! Go try it out for yourself. You won't regret it. You pay for what you get. Top notch grub on

excerpts: For our main course we had the Filet mignon
filet mignon.author: Victor A.
filet mignon.review: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer. For our main course we had the Filet mignon

excerpts: I got the filet mignon served with blue cheese crumbles, mushroom Demi glaze sauce, garlic mashed potatoes, and sautéed spinach and pearl onions.
I thought there was too much garlic in the potatoes and my steak was a touch too rare, but overall delicious.
He ordered the seafood medley which was served in a tomato broth.
filet mignon.author: Kristie L.
filet mignon.review:
Our food was delicious! Highly recommend this place. Best clam chowder I've ever had. My husband liked the warm sourdough bread they serve with butter. We ordered drinks and they were delicious too. He ordered the cocktail of the day and I ordered the strawberry lemonade. His complaint was that the cocktail was light on the alcohol. 
I got the filet mignon served with blue cheese crumbles, mushroom Demi glaze sauce, garlic mashed potatoes, and sautéed spinach and pearl onions. I thought there was too much garlic in the potatoes and my steak was a touch too rare, but overall delicious. 
He ordered the seafood medley which was served in a tomato broth. Crab, shrimp, scallops, salmon, and garlic toast. He said it was great.  
We were too full for dessert! 
Service was good. 
Will definitely return!

excerpts: Filet Mignon ($39)
: This is worth every penny!!
I usually am not a big fan of meat, but this steak melted in my mouth!!
The flavoring was on point.
filet mignon.author: Irene Z.
filet mignon.review:
This place will definitely live up to your expectations. Trust the yelp reviews! The restaurant is on pier 39, towards the front and up the stairs! It is a very big restaurant with a very nice view, towards the sea lions. I ordered:

Blue Cheese Garlic Bread ($8): I got this dish for free because it wad in my coupon book that I got from the welcome center. If I had to pay for this dish, I would probably not get it again. The bread was a bit too oily and tasted really strange.

Seafood Penne ($20): The seafood was definitely very fresh and worth the price. The portion was huge. Would highly suggest this if you like pastas.

Filet Mignon ($39): This is worth every penny!! I usually am not a big fan of meat, but this steak melted in my mouth!! The flavoring was on point. Mashed potato was flavored and creamy with chunks of potato.

I gave it a four star because of the server. He was really bad. He seem confused half the time and it took forever to get his attention. Other than that everything else was pretty good.

excerpts: I ordered a filet mignon with crab and was explaining to the waitress
how I'd like it: between medium and medium well , i.e. no blood when you cut it, but still pink.
Before I could finish my sentence she cut me off and says, "that's medium well.
I was surprised and she abruptly wrote it down and left.
I thought to myself, ok, maybe they have their own definition of medium well.
Then my filet arrives and it's dry and terrible and costs over $50.
Really, they should learn food before forcing their horrible tourist-trap-crap on people.
Fools.
filet mignon.author: Leila T.
filet mignon.review: I was so annoyed with this place. I ordered a filet mignon with crab and was explaining to the waitress how I'd like it: between medium and medium well , i.e. no blood when you cut it, but still pink. Before I could finish my sentence she cut me off and says, "that's medium well." I was surprised and she abruptly wrote it down and left. I thought to myself, ok, maybe they have their own definition of medium well. Then my filet arrives and it's dry and terrible and costs over $50. Really, they should learn food before forcing their horrible tourist-trap-crap on people. Fools.

excerpts: My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach.

He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff.

My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference.
My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough.
Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice.
After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted.
We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce.
I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out,
right?
NOT!
Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce.
6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)

Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)
Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ...
it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.
filet mignon.author: Ranjan P.
filet mignon.review: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.

excerpts: We tried the lobster tail and filet mignon.
No complains at all, everything was good.
Save some room for dessert and try their creme brulee, it's the best!
filet mignon.author: Jai R.
filet mignon.review: First time here and definitely not the last. Food was really good and service was great. Their clam chowder is a must try! We tried the lobster tail and filet mignon. No complains at all, everything was good.  Save some room for dessert and try their creme brulee, it's the best!

excerpts: I highly recommend the filet mignon topped with fresh dungeonous crab.
I would definitely come back.
filet mignon.author: Brian B.
filet mignon.review:
This place is amazing. Fresh seafood and great service. 

Our server was Tyler and he was extremely helpful. He had great recommendations and came by often to refill our drinks. 

I highly recommend the filet mignon topped with fresh dungeonous crab. I would definitely come back. A+!!!

excerpts: The filet mignon and lobster tail was so flavory.
I suggest mango crab ceviche for your starter.
Our server Curtis was superb and very pleasant.
I give the service 5 star!!!!
filet mignon.author: Lorna R.
filet mignon.review: We will definitely going back to this place.  The food was excellent. The filet mignon and lobster tail was so flavory. I suggest mango crab ceviche for your starter.  Our server Curtis was superb and very pleasant.  I give the service 5 star!!!!

excerpts: The filet mignon with crab topping was also outstanding.
Would definitely recommend.
filet mignon.author: Lauren T.
filet mignon.review: Amazing food and exceptional service. The clam chowder bread bowl with crab was delicious. The filet mignon with crab topping was also outstanding. Would definitely recommend.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the filet mignon because he hates seafood and was extremely satisfied with his meal!
I got the clam chowder as appetizers and the ciopinno with pasta.
It was honestly one of the best meals I've ever had.
It had more seafood than I can remember and a gigantic portion for $40-50.
There is a fee to add pasta and another fee to have the crab meat taken out of the shell for you.
I said yes to both and did not regret it.
Overall, it was not a mistake choosing to celebrate my birthday here.
I would definitely come here again!
filet mignon.author: Christine C.
filet mignon.review: Came here for my 21st birthday dinner with my boyfriend and it was the best! Amazing view of the pier and not too loud even thought the tables were decently close together. My boyfriend got the filet mignon because he hates seafood and was extremely satisfied with his meal! I got the clam chowder as appetizers and the ciopinno with pasta. It was honestly one of the best meals I've ever had. It had more seafood than I can remember and a gigantic portion for $40-50. There is a fee to add pasta and another fee to have the crab meat taken out of the shell for you. I said yes to both and did not regret it. Overall, it was not a mistake choosing to celebrate my birthday here. I would definitely come here again!

excerpts: For dinner, my mom had the Filet Mignon, and I had the Flat Iron Steak, they were perfectly cooked.
She even deemed her dish as "the best thing I've ever eaten" -- that's saying a lot!
Skip Scoma's and walk down the pier to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed.
filet mignon.author: Lauren A.
filet mignon.review: First off, where do I even begin? Fog Harbor was recommended to my mom by a friend, and boy were we happy she was! First off, the view is AMAZING. And honestly, the food is just as good. My mom and I shared the complimentary made-in- house sourdough bread, clam chowder, and clams appetizer - all were very good. For dinner, my mom had the Filet Mignon, and I had the Flat Iron Steak, they were perfectly cooked. She even deemed her dish as "the best thing I've ever eaten" -- that's saying a lot! Skip Scoma's and walk down the pier to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: The filet mignon was purrrrrfect.
With a side of mashed potatoes and greens; I wiped my plate clean!!
The service was superb.
I was in the mood for a sangria but they didn't have it on their menu,
the waiter made sure I got my sangria and that was some good wine!
Thanks Rafael!
Next time I'm in San Fran, definitely coming back to try some of the fish!
filet mignon.author: Melanie S.
filet mignon.review: I know it says fish house but I was in the mood for some bloody steak! The filet mignon was purrrrrfect. With a side of mashed potatoes and greens; I wiped my plate clean!! The service was superb. I was in the mood for a sangria but they didn't have it on their menu, the waiter made sure I got my sangria and that was some good wine! Thanks Rafael! Next time I'm in San Fran, definitely coming back to try some of the fish!

excerpts: We ordered the surf and turf upgraded to filet mignon cooked medium.
Everything on that plate was gone without hesitation.
The whole dungness full crab is another favorite.
Pair with Cabernet.
filet mignon.author: Allan V.
filet mignon.review: The sourdough bread is amazing, goes great with their clam chowder or spicy garlic shrimp appetizer, the sauce left over is great. We ordered the surf and turf upgraded to filet mignon cooked medium. Everything on that plate was gone without hesitation. The whole dungness full crab is another favorite. Pair with Cabernet.

excerpts: My husband had the filet mignon which was amazing and the Demi glacé was tasty.
I had the surf and turf which was equally delicious.
My lobster was cooked perfectly and the NY steak was very good.
Personally, I'm more of a filet mignon gal, but I still enjoyed my steak.
Tried the Moscow Mule cocktail and that was very good.
The restaurant even gave me a dessert of choice which I loved....the creme brûlée was beyond delicious!!
It was our first time and we definitely plan on returning soon.
filet mignon.author: Rosa T.
filet mignon.review: Dined at Fog Harbor today for my bday lunch today. First time here! They were able to accommodate my reservation request for a table with a window view. They even wrote "happy birthday" on the white paper they have on the tables. Our server, Madison was friendly and attentive. She checked on us often and provided great service. Even the managers checked on us. I appreciate that level of service. My husband had the filet mignon which was amazing and the Demi glacé was tasty. I had the surf and turf which was equally delicious. My lobster was cooked perfectly and the NY steak was very good. Personally, I'm more of a filet mignon gal, but I still enjoyed my steak. Tried the Moscow Mule cocktail and that was very good.  The restaurant even gave me a dessert of choice which I loved....the creme brûlée was beyond delicious!! It was our first time and we definitely plan on returning soon.

excerpts: My wife ordered calamari and filet mignon.
Calamari was pretty good except for a few pieces that were a little bit chewy.
She asked for medium for her steak but it turned out well done.
I really wanted to like this place
but I spent $140 here including a glass of wine and a glass of lager.
I left this place pretty disappointed.
filet mignon.author: Niners V.
filet mignon.review: Came here on a wednesday with my wife. Was hoping to enjoy some nice cioppino. Paid $38+ for a bowl of cippiono that only had 2 clams 2 muscles and 2 shrimp. That's pretty shady if you ask me.It also came with crab and fish that I have no complaints about. Overall I've had way better cioppino. Sauce taste like ravioli sauce. Also ordered the clam chowder which was decent but again small portion for the pricing. My wife ordered calamari and filet mignon. Calamari was pretty good except for a few pieces that were a little bit chewy. She asked for medium for her steak but it turned out well done. I really wanted to like this place but I spent $140 here including a glass of wine and a glass of lager. I left this place pretty disappointed.

excerpts: He had the shellfish platter and I had the filet mignon.
Both were delicious!!
The filet was cooked perfectly and the shellfish platter was overflowing with deliciousness.
We finished off a great meal with the vanilla bean creme brûlée.
The service was great!
The one thing that bothered me a little was how crowded the seating area was.
But I would recommend this place to anyone!!
filet mignon.author: Samantha M.
filet mignon.review: My husband and I had dinner here last weekend and loved it!! He had the shellfish platter and I had the filet mignon.  Both were delicious!! The filet was cooked perfectly and the shellfish platter was overflowing with deliciousness.  We finished off a great meal with the vanilla bean creme brûlée.  The service was great! The one thing that bothered me a little was how crowded the seating area was.  But I would recommend this place to anyone!!

excerpts: Definitely recommend the Filet Mignon and the Clam Chowder.
They were both Delicious!!
Will definitely return here, if we visit SAN Francisco again.
filet mignon.author: Sarah S.
filet mignon.review: Excellent!! We celebrated my birthday dinner here. The food was the best we had at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf. Pricey, but worth it. Service was great. Definitely recommend the Filet Mignon and the Clam Chowder. They were both Delicious!! Will definitely return here, if we visit SAN Francisco again.

excerpts: we got the filet mignon
it was juicy and good flavor; I got a lipstick lemon drop that was good.
Everything except the waitress that served us, not very friendly didn't check up on us didn't offer bread but she did to another table.
It wasn't till she went on brake that we got good service from another sever.
We felt this other server deserved the tip.
So we spoke to the Manager.
Overall Food is delicious service can be up or down but for their price
I expect good customer service overall
filet mignon.author: Vanessa S.
filet mignon.review: Went For my bf 30th the food was good we got the filet mignon it was juicy and good flavor; I got a lipstick lemon drop that was good. Everything except the waitress that served us, not very friendly didn't check up on us didn't offer bread but she did to another table. It wasn't till she went on brake that we got good service from another sever. We felt this other server deserved the tip. So we spoke to the Manager. Overall Food is delicious service can be up or down but for their price I expect good customer service overall

excerpts: I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach.
It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes.
filet mignon.author: Lauren M.
filet mignon.review:
My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced. 

The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome! 

Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!! 

One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.

excerpts: I ordered lobster tail and filet mignon.
My filet mignon was a bit overdone for medium, but it was still extremely tasty and the lobster was cooked to perfection.
filet mignon.author: Lisa T.
filet mignon.review:
DELICIOUS! 

This food here was absolutely amazing, and I wish I could eat here everyday. The employees were extremely friendly, and we had awesome waiter. We made a last minute reservation on yelp, showed up, and we were seated right on time and at a table with a view of the water! 

We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli sauce- best calamari I've ever eaten and with a unique sauce. I ordered lobster tail and filet mignon. My filet mignon was a bit overdone for medium, but it was still extremely tasty and the lobster was cooked to perfection. My date ordered the live lobster and he said it was also extremely good. 

I can't wait to go back here again next time I head up to the city!

excerpts: for entree hubs ordered a filet mignon (med well) with mixed veggies while I ordered their seafood plate.
filet mignon was too rare for my husband so although he ate it, he didn't enjoy it.
the squash with his veggie mix weren't that great either.
my seafood plate on the other hand was good... not too much seasoning and the seafood weren't overcooked.
for dessert, we ordered the molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.
it was a bit disappointing.
the cake needed to have melted chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted weird...
more like imitation vanilla with some alcohol.
I also thought the fake dessert sample plate that they show you instead of
filet mignon.author: Learnee L.
filet mignon.review:
hubs and I decided to start a holiday tradition of spending one day before christmas in the wharf area to relax and spend some qt.  when we got hungry, we checked out a few of the restaurants and for some reason decided to go here.
Since it was a late afternoon meal, we were seated right away.
the view from the restaurant was pretty awesome.
the tables weren't cramped up and restrooms were clean.

I ordered a nojito (since I cant drink) while hubs ordered their cucumber gimlet drink.  they were both really good.  for apps we shared crab cake--crab cake was good but the salad that came with it was warm and soggy.
for entree hubs ordered a filet mignon (med well) with mixed veggies while I ordered their seafood plate.  filet mignon was too rare for my husband so although he ate it, he didn't enjoy it.  the squash with his veggie mix weren't that great either.  my seafood plate on the other hand was good... not too much seasoning and the seafood weren't overcooked.
for dessert, we ordered the molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  it was a bit disappointing.  the cake needed to have melted chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted weird...more like imitation vanilla with some alcohol.
I also thought the fake dessert sample plate that they show you instead of the dessert menu was a bit tacky for a pricier restaurant.

the service was good... food was hit or miss.

excerpts: Filet mignon was just ok.
The size of meal you get is pretty small.
Make sure you're not that hungry.
Clam chowder was decent.
But not the best.
filet mignon.author: A.J. C.
filet mignon.review: Overrated.  Overpriced.  Lobster was over cooked. Filet mignon was just ok. The size of meal you get is pretty small. Make sure you're not that hungry. Clam chowder was decent. But not the best.

excerpts: For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster!
How sweet!)
filet mignon.author: Jennifer W.
filet mignon.review:
My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.

We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters! 

For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!

Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!

excerpts: He ordered a Filet Mignon.
Don't know where they buy their Filet, but they are like RUBBER!
You cannot eat that S*#$ at all!!!
I thought my friend was joking until I took the knife and tried to cut it, the knife cannot cut thru the beef.
The waitress saw the plate and asked what's wrong, she can bring him something else.
He told her about the Filet and he preferred nothing else.
filet mignon.author: Mike C.
filet mignon.review:
The food is not that great, OVER-PRICED!!!.
I came here to try their seafood dishes, my friend came with me who is allergic to seafood.  He ordered a Filet Mignon.  Don't know where they buy their Filet, but they are like RUBBER! You cannot eat that S*#$ at all!!!  I thought my friend was joking until I took the knife and tried to cut it, the knife cannot cut thru the beef.  The waitress saw the plate and asked what's wrong, she can bring him something else.  He told her about the Filet and he preferred nothing else.  Waitress spoke to manager and gave us a 20% discount. 

The atmosphere is great and the service was excellent.  
Food is not.

excerpts: The filet mignon was also delicious according to my wife.
All in all, this is a great restaurant.
It's pricey, but we all thought it was well worth it
and everyone was happy, which is a miracle considering we were entertaining the very picky in-laws!
Oh, and the sourdough bread is amazing.
It comes out warm and you smother it in butter.....to die for!
I'll be back next time the relatives come to town.
It's a nice place without feeling too touristy.
filet mignon.author: Lulu B.
filet mignon.review: Being a local, I try and stay away from Pier 39, but with parents and in-laws in town, we decided to stop here for dinner based on a recommendation from a friend. I am glad we did! We were able to get a table for 6 by the window and we had a spectacular view. The service was prompt and friendly. Everyone in my party seemed pleased by the food. My FIL ordered a whole [steamed] lobster and I got to try a bite and it was delicious! I ordered the shrimp skewers which were good, but nothing special. I probably wouldn't order them again, just because I would want to try something else next time. My MIL ordered fish cooked a special way and they were able to accommodate her requests. The filet mignon was also delicious according to my wife. All in all, this is a great restaurant. It's pricey, but we all thought it was well worth it and everyone was happy, which is a miracle considering we were entertaining the very picky in-laws! Oh, and the sourdough bread is amazing. It comes out warm and you smother it in butter.....to die for! I'll be back next time the relatives come to town. It's a nice place without feeling too touristy.

excerpts: My daughter had the Filet Mignon, and she said it was excellent and properly cooked.
filet mignon.author: Roland L.
filet mignon.review: I made a reservation for a pre-mother's day dinner on a Friday evening.  I am local to SF Bay Area, and I am usually unusure about seafood restaurants located on a touristy spot like Pier 39.  I read the Yelp reviews, and I am glad we went.  This restaurant is excellent - from the courteous/helpful team that answers their phone reservation, the food, their wait staff, and chefs.  The view is fantastic with Alcatraz and the East Bay right across.  They even provide you with a free 2-hr parking on the Pier 39 Garage!   The food - everything is good.  Their fish is cooked properly so that it is still juicy.  My daughter had the Filet Mignon, and she said it was excellent and properly cooked.  My 83 year old mom and 91 year old Father-in-Law loved their mixed grill seafood dish.  The only minor improvement is the asparagus needs to be a bit more crunchy (i.e. not too soft).   The desserts are awesome (we had the creame brulee and Tiramisu).   I also think their price is quite reasonable given the quality of their food, service, and location - I hope it stays that way.  This place has a great staff who are really attentive to their customers.   A special shout-out to our wait staff, Veronica, and the front desk hostess team (especially Ashley who helped me with the reservation)!   Any owner or business can only dream to have this excellent team!  Dined on 5/10/2013.

excerpts: I got the clam chowder bread bowl and salad and my husband got the Fog Harbor burger, we shared everything!
The clam chowder as great don't get me wrong, but award winning
I was really surprised
, it didn't wow me
like I thought it would.
But the burger.... boy let me tell you.
If I could only eat one burger for the rest of my life it would be that burger!
It was literally the best I've had in a very long time!
The burger is the only reason for the complete five stars.
PS.
I wish I got a better picture of the burger!
fog harbor burger.author: Breona L.
fog harbor burger.review: The food was amazing! I got the clam chowder bread bowl and salad and my husband got the Fog Harbor burger, we shared everything! The clam chowder as great don't get me wrong, but award winning I was really surprised, it didn't wow me like I thought it would. But the burger.... boy let me tell you. If I could only eat one burger for the rest of my life it would be that burger! It was literally the best I've had in a very long time! The burger is the only reason for the complete five stars. PS. I wish I got a better picture of the burger!

excerpts: Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger.
fog harbor burger.author: Kelsey S.
fog harbor burger.review:
We were hard-pressed to find a restaurant that met everyone's needs: my mom wanted seafood, my dad is a picky eater and seemingly only eats red meat, and we didn't want to spend a fortune. The only place I could find with two dollar signs that served both seafood and steak was the Fog Harbor Fish House. They were concerned about it being too touristy, and were also put off by the fact that we couldn't get a reservation, but I wanted to give it a chance.

Well. Sure, it's at Pier 39, but it's not "touristy" in the typical sense. It's elegant, and very San Francisco. It has a wonderful view of the bay, and our window faced the lovely sunset over Mt. Tam.

They really do reserve most of their tables for walk-ins; we were nervous about walking up at 6 p.m. without a reservation, but we only had to wait 15 minutes.

The food was exquisite. I had the seafood penne, which was to die for. The mussels are HUGE! Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger. Everyone loved their meals, and our waitress, Ashley, was very kind and attentive.

As for the price, it's a bit more than two dollar signs. But graded on a curve, I'd say that it is less expensive than other places that serve similar fare. Each dish could have easily cost $5-10 more elsewhere.

This would be a lovely place to bring visitors from out of town or a local date just the same.

excerpts: I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper
but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow.
Taste-wise
, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring.
fog harbor burger.author: Mandy T.
fog harbor burger.review:
Tourist trap, as expected. On the 2nd level of Pier 39 complex, hubby was getting hangry and refused to walk anywhere else for food. We settled in here as they had good reviews, has a view over the sea lions beaching at the pier, the interior looked clean and well put together, and they offered crayons and coloring sheets to entertain the little one. 

Started off promising. The waitstaff were all professional. We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack. The appetizer was huge!  It tasted alright.  But our entrees did not fair well. We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood. It wasn't. The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.  For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.  I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow. Taste-wise, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring. A very basic burger for $15. 

So overall, overpriced and unmemorable food serving mostly tourists, but does provide a view, comfortable seating and good service.

excerpts: The fog harbor burger, clam chowder in a bread bowl and crab rolls were the favorites.
I am from Cape Cod
so I'm very discerning when it comes to seafood
and it was definitely fresh here.
The service was exceptional too.
Very friendly and attentive staff.
We were on vacation
so I had an envelope with $200 cash in it that I accidentally forgot on the table and one of the wait staff
chased us down to return it.
He could've kept it and I never would've known
so I feel like that's a testament to the quality of people they employ.
I'll always be grateful to him for that and remember the whole experience fondly.
Be sure to get your parking validated if you parked in the garage.
It'll save you an hour off your parking fee.
fog harbor burger.author: Tracy L.
fog harbor burger.review:
Absolutely delicious! Not cheap but worth every penny. I ate with a party of 11 people and we all loved our meals. The fog harbor burger, clam chowder in a bread bowl and crab rolls were the favorites. I am from Cape Cod so I'm very discerning when it comes to seafood and it was definitely fresh here. The service was exceptional too. Very friendly and attentive staff. We were on vacation so I had an envelope with $200 cash in it that I accidentally forgot on the table and one of the wait staff chased us down to return it. He could've kept it and I never would've known so I feel like that's a testament to the quality of people they employ. I'll always be grateful to him for that and remember the whole experience fondly. 
Be sure to get your parking validated if you parked in the garage. It'll save you an hour off your parking fee.

excerpts: We got the crab cake, shellfish platter for two, and the fog harbor burger.
Everything was delicious and our server Tyler was extremely helpful and attentive.
fog harbor burger.author: Ellice L.
fog harbor burger.review: My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. Our wait time was 30 minutes which really wasn't bad considering how freaking packed pier 39 was during this day. We got the crab cake, shellfish platter for two, and the fog harbor burger. Everything was delicious and our server Tyler was extremely helpful and attentive.

excerpts: Ordered the seafood platter for two, crab cakes, and the fog harbor burger.
The seafood platter for two itself was very filling that I didn't even get to eat my burger.
Our server Tyler gave the recommendations and was very attentive to our needs.
Would definitely come back here when I am in town.
fog harbor burger.author: Andrew G.
fog harbor burger.review: Came here last Saturday with my girlfriend for dinner and the experience was great! Ordered the seafood platter for two, crab cakes, and the fog harbor burger. The seafood platter for two itself was very filling that I didn't even get to eat my burger. Our server Tyler gave the recommendations and was very attentive to our needs. Would definitely come back here when I am in town.

excerpts: Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)
fog harbor burger.author: R M.
fog harbor burger.review:
Pretty solid dinner tonight- came with two other couples. Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid. Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)

The prices were reasonable, the food was fresh, and the restaurant was nice, airy, and classy while not feeling ultra touristy. Will be back to visit again for sure!

excerpts: Fog Harbor Burger:
Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.
Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.
Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.
fog harbor burger.author: Nhu-Quynh N.
fog harbor burger.review:
I came here for my birthday recently, and I must say, not too shabby.  I generally stroll down Pier 39 just because I love the pier/ocean view, and I've always see this restaurant.  Truth be told, I thought it was one of those upscale, dress up like a douche type restaurants.  I was wrong.

I was coming from San Jose, and was planning on having dinner before I go back home.  I was craving for sea food.  You come to San Francisco, you gotta have some sea food if not steak.  Anyways, I was looking for seafood, and found some reviews that shows this place was pretty good.  I didn't know how reservations were, so I had made reservations via Yelp.  When I did it on Yelp, my reservation became at 9:30PM. Meh, lame. 

So we came to Pier 39 walked around a bit, and said screw it.  Let's just ask them how long the wait is.  If it's longer than expected, we've already made reservations anyways.  So we walk up to the restaurant and their layout is quite cozy and warm for those who have to wait.  They have a nice little fireplace that will keep you warm because everyone knows Frisco can get quite cold.  So anyways, I ask the young woman at the podium about the wait time, and suggested I would like a window view.  I didn't expect it to be available considering it's around 6-7ish.  She took me by surprise and said, we are currently cleaning the table right now, and it's window view.  We sat down for like literally 2-3 minutes boom, here comes our waiter--let's go!  Omg, the view was amazing, I mean of course, I'm a sucker for scenery, but damn.  We sat towards the back, window view of the hills and the bridge, to the left was Alcatraz.  Perfect. 

Our waiter was Shawn, absolutely amazing.  Very fast pace, generous, and helpful on the suggestions.  My brother thought differently, felt although he could have been more helpful.  So.. Maybe I was more excited on eating than service. Who knows!

OK, food:  Quite expensive if you ask me, but was it worth it? Yes and no.  Some of the items, you can go out to the fish market and get it for cheaper.  But how it was cooked, well.. Stay tuned.

1/2 Oysters:  Mini oysters was what it was really.  The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures. Haha! Foodie!  It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't... Ugh...

Crab Cakes:  Oh my, these were so good.  They were going for $16, only two pieces, which I felt kind of ripped off.  I cannot deny it, they were bomb!  Once in a while, yes worth the $16. Lol, I'm all for cheap eats.

Bread Bowl:  Personally, I feel although they were better than Boudins.  I had Boudins down the street where you had to get it via cafeteria style and I am not a fan. This bread bowl was much smaller though, but you could taste the clam chowder better.  Not too much breading either, just enough to distribute.

Fog Harbor Burger:  Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.  Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.  Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.  They got it down as far as burger goes.

Fog Harbor 1/2 Lobster/Crab Meat:  Ok... This was quite disappointing.  This was their current specialty on the menu, and I honestly felt like I should have just gotten a full damn lobster tail.  The crab meat was just baked crab.  Nothing special about it.  They charged me a little more than just the lobster tail.  I prefer the lobster tail so much more than to order this again.

Fish and Chips:  Fried to a golden texture, very delish.  On point  Not much I can really say, I didn't really eat it.  My boyfriend ordered it. :P Sorry guys


Overall my experience was great.  The best part was that I got to see the sunset, and oh yea, even if you're not facing the window, there are mirrors so you can reflect the image.  I sat right in front which had the perfect view.  I loved it.

excerpts: I ordered the fog harbor burger and it was so delicious.
The carmelized onion was perfect and it came with a generous amount of fries.
I tried and couldn't even finish the burger.
fog harbor burger.author: Sharon Y.
fog harbor burger.review: Waited almost an hour at the chilly pier on a Sunday.  Great ambiance, perfect for a nice date. I came here with my boyfriend and some of his friends. We were starving and took a while for our waitress to greet us. We weren't even offered bread to begin with until after we ordered. We all shared the fried calamari which was pretty tasty. My boyfriend's friends ordered their famous clam chowder and thought it was really good with the sour dough bread. I ordered the fog harbor burger and it was so delicious. The carmelized onion was perfect and it came with a generous amount of fries. I tried and couldn't even finish the burger. My boyfriend had the fried combo, which included fish and chips along with calamari but he thought that the fish wasn't crispy enogh and could have been better. Overall, it was a good experience, pretty pricey but that's expected since it's on the pier.

excerpts: Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters.
Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend
fog harbor burger.author: A D.
fog harbor burger.review: Though my 1st visit didn't start well.... it ended well. Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters. Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend

excerpts: My Aussie friend had the fog harbor burger medium well.
He said that it has been one of the best burgers so far.
fog harbor burger.author: Sergio S.
fog harbor burger.review: I loved this place. Nice view of the pier, delicious food and fresh sourdough bread. I had the linguini with clams and it was delicious.
