The server suggested Kendall-Jackson, "Grand Reserve", Chardonnay. It paired well with the clam linguini. My Aussie friend had the fog harbor burger medium well. He said that it has been one of the best burgers so far.

excerpts: Fog harbor burger:
My first "sweet" burger ever.
This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare).
fog harbor burger.author: Hanna K.
fog harbor burger.review:
One of my favorite places by far!!!

My 5 favorites on the menu:

1. Crab Cakes: crunchy on the outside, so soft and moist on the inside. Its good for the appetizer and for the regular meal as well.

2. Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course). It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna. if you are a tuna fan, you will LOVE IT!!! 

3. Fog harbor burger: My first "sweet" burger ever. This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare). the caramelized onions add such a bursting flavor into my mouth... and the saltiness of the bacon balances the taste.

4. Prawn ravioli: i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top. I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but no matter what the size is... this dish will forever be my favorite pasta dish at Fog Harbor.

5. Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful. I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell. I didnt even bother eating the crab legs because i didnt have tools to crack them with.. but everything else was easy to eat :) 

The service is fantastic and the hosts are super friendly! :) :) 

Oh and before i forget--- 
Dessert recommendations: Lava cake and tiramisu!!!! I love the creme bruele.. but the caramelized topping can be often too chewy for me.

ENJOY! hope this helped!

excerpts: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone?
Crab Sandwich
that's shredded crab,
how 'bout that?).
Their chowder bowls are incredible.
World class wine and beer selection to pair up with
, I dunno, anything.
The waiting area is nice.
The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous.
The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day.
Sophisticated eating at Pier 39?
"Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered.
#classiceats
salmon blt.author: Sean C.
salmon blt.review: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone? Crab Sandwich that's shredded crab, how 'bout that?). Their chowder bowls are incredible. World class wine and beer selection to pair up with, I dunno, anything. The waiting area is nice. The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous. The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day. Sophisticated eating at Pier 39? "Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered. #classiceats

excerpts: Order tuna tartar app and salmon blt both delicious!
salmon blt.author: Hanne A.
salmon blt.review: Great atmosphere, food and service. Came for lunch and was not disappointed. Order tuna tartar app and salmon blt both delicious!

excerpts: Wifey enjoyed 1/2 her Salmon BLT, and so did
I. Ha!
Sister liked her Clam Chowder Bowl, and I savored the Sautéed Dover Sole.
Heaven forbid I forget our veteran server, Pedro, who cheerfully guided us thru the menu and attended us with near forgotten poise and professionalism.
We shall return!
salmon blt.author: John S.
salmon blt.review: Good food, view, and service at Fog Harbor--brought wifey and the Orlando contingent over for Lunch on Tuesday. Got there by Noon and seated at last available window table. Short stuff enjoyed her Burger and declared best ever with bacon. Wifey enjoyed 1/2 her Salmon BLT, and so did  I. Ha! Sister liked her Clam Chowder Bowl, and I savored the Sautéed Dover Sole. Heaven forbid I forget our veteran server, Pedro, who cheerfully guided us thru the menu and attended us with near forgotten poise and professionalism. We shall return!

excerpts: We had the the clam chowder with the add of crab, the salmon BLT which was Devine.
The chicken penne was very flavorful and delicious.
We will definitely be returning and have already told many people to go check it out
salmon blt.author: Mahaugoni S.
salmon blt.review: My service was fantastic, always kept water in my cup and was able to answer all of our questions. We had the the clam chowder with the add of crab, the salmon BLT which was Devine. The chicken penne was very flavorful and delicious. We will definitely be returning and have already told many people to go check it out

excerpts: We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special).
Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic.
Would recommend others for this place.
salmon blt.author: Chanyamat W.
salmon blt.review: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.

excerpts: We got the Bleu Cheese Bread appetizer, and I had the Salmon BLT which was good
but I wish it was more seasoned and that there was more pesto aioli on the sandwich.
Amazing wheat draft beer.
salmon blt.author: Tiffani B.
salmon blt.review: Not bad! A little pricey but it's about what you'd expect for a touristy spot. The waitress was really nice. We got the Bleu Cheese Bread appetizer, and I had the Salmon BLT which was good but I wish it was more seasoned and that there was more pesto aioli on the sandwich. Amazing wheat draft beer.

excerpts: , it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF
salmon blt.author: Daniel S.
salmon blt.review: Very high quality seafood place in Pier 39, it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF

excerpts: Son's salmon BLT was quite good
and I had plate envy.
salmon blt.author: Amy A.
salmon blt.review: Super touristy but food not bad and view is pretty cool. My seafood trio was average and garlic mashed potatoes were bland and lumpy. Son's salmon BLT was quite good and I had plate envy. Husband's ahi tuna was not cooked well. His sides were okay. Kids enjoyed hot fudge sundae desserts. Probably decent choice if you need a meal on Pier 39 but San Fran certainly has much better options elsewhere.

excerpts: We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl.
salmon blt.author: Jeff B.
salmon blt.review: Very nice place with very friendly staff. The view far outweighs the food. However, the food is respectable especially with it being located in a high traffic tourist area like Pier 39. I would say the quality setting / feel of the restaurant does not match the surrounding businesses.  It is definitely worth a visit. We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl. A special shout out for the broiled oysters appetizer with spinach and bacon. Yum!

excerpts: Salmon blt again large portion but salmon was fresh and delicious.
Highly recommend!
salmon blt.author: Danielle N.
salmon blt.review:
We started with the chowder which was good and the sour dough bread was amazing. 
We ordered the salmon club and crab roll. I'm usually disappointed in crab rolls because it's all lettuce, his was the complete opposite. Full of flavor and fresh!
Salmon blt again large portion but salmon was fresh and delicious.  Highly recommend!

excerpts: Really good salmon blt.
salmon blt.author: Shelby S.
salmon blt.review:
Really good salmon blt. Good oysters too

excerpts: my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.
my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.
youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.
HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!
salmon blt.author: Paul S.
salmon blt.review:
fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!

it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.  

this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!

bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.  

after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!  

we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.

and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

excerpts: Food was ok, had the Salmon BLT, which was cooked well.
I was looking forward to desert, but the waitress either got busy or was tired of dealing with a quiet table and just dropped off the check.
All the while, I saw her offer Desert to the other tables in her section.
salmon blt.author: Clifford C.
salmon blt.review:
This use to be my absolutely favorite place to go to dinner while visiting the city, but tonight changed all of that. After driving 2 hours to come to dinner here with my son, I was greeted by the worst hostess ever. The first thing I asked for was a table by the window. It was a slow night, lots of available seating near the massive Windows, I thought to myself, SCORE! Dining with a view tonight. What I got was totally opposite of that! Readers discretion, I did have my toddler with me, who by the way was actually a saint tonight, even though, I thought a slow night, not a lot of stuck up kid hating people, shouldn't be too bad. Well... Too bad so Sad. Here's what happened: So we first get sat in a booth facing the window. The hostess must of not had a lot of experience with children because as she walked off, I had to call her back and ask for a high chair, she looked at me with puzzlement and semi annoyance, and says: "well you can sit here with a high chair?!"...DUH!! I could have told her that. So, naturally I think, well they're a couple 2 and 4 tops (tables) in plain site next to the window where we can replace a chair with a high chair, no problem! Think again, she sticks me in the far back of the restaurant, farthest away from the window!! WTF!! By this point, my own enjoyment was out of the question, I have to feed my kid and I'm starving, not worth the fight anymore because this "hostess" was obviously discriminatory towards anyone with a kid , and or was just plain clueless about what she was suppose to do. 
Food was ok, had the Salmon BLT, which was cooked well. I was looking forward to desert, but the waitress either got busy or was tired of dealing with a quiet table and just dropped off the check. All the while, I saw her offer Desert to the other tables in her section. Apparently my money is not good enough for this restaurant.  

If you're looking at this restaurant as a possible place for a great dining experience with excellent service and is family friendly...skip it. Go to the restaurant in the front of the wharf.  Or take a short trip to SCOMA's or Woodhouse fish co. Both are fantastic! Great service and food.

Dear management, please train your hostesses to care and show them how to seat your patrons, I saw another lady actually throw a fit and ask to speak with a manager because of said hostesses tonight.. Seems like I wasn't the only one tonight .  Please don't waste your time or money here.

excerpts: Salmon Blt fantastic, soup and salad good, fish and chips good and burger
good.try mussels and fries!!!

salmon blt.review: Expertly managed business! The wait was 20 min and it actually WAS 20 min. Drinks were delicious, especially clementine Cosmo. Salmon Blt fantastic, soup and salad good, fish and chips good and burger good.try mussels and fries!!!

excerpts: The salmon BLT was awesome.

salmon blt.author: Debbie B.
salmon blt.review: The food and service was great. The salmon BLT was awesome. The whole experience was just a little too pricey... but that's par for the course in SF.

excerpts: My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

salmon blt.review:
My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.  

Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.

Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.

I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread

excerpts: *Salmon BLT:
Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli.
~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had.
You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more.
salmon blt.author: Rebekah T.
salmon blt.review:
If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.

Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.

I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the: 

*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good.
*Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish. 
*Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich. 

When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing. 

I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!

excerpts: My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT.
salmon blt.author: Ford S.
salmon blt.review:
When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT. 

The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

excerpts: Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread).
Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through.
Plusses:
salmon blt.author: Jonathan G.
salmon blt.review: Agreed tourist trap. Acclaimed clam chowder does not have much flavor and clams are lacking. Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering. Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread). Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through. Plusses: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great. Servers were also attentive and courteous.

excerpts: For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli.
I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down!
Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything.
salmon blt.author: Nate R.
salmon blt.review:
Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!

To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.

My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.

Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.

No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.

excerpts: - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari.
They are all GREAT!
salmon blt.author: Evette B.
salmon blt.review: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!

excerpts: I ordered the Salmon BLT which I liked, but the bread could have been toasted a bit more.

My family really enjoyed the steak and the seafood pasta as well as the clam chowder.  The clam chowder had large chunks of clams in it.  I would recommend this place if you're looking for a place to eat on the wharf.

I totally recommend!!!
the best part our waiter BERNIE gave us the best service.
salmon blt.author: Art E.
salmon blt.review: first time here and the food & service is EXCELLENT!!! I had the Salmon BLT  & the red chilly shrimp appetizer super good I totally recommend!!! the best part our waiter BERNIE gave us the best service.

excerpts: He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.
The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.
Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.
The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.
The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.
By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.
I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.
salmon blt.author: Kurt H.
salmon blt.review: We decided to eat here on the recommendation of the boat captain who had taken us out to watch the America's Cup boat race.  We are not a big fan of the crowds and restaurants on Pier 39, but he indicated this was the best of the bunch.  Since our boat had left from Pier 39, we opted for convenience.  We came about 2 pm and were told it would be a 40 minute wait.  It would have been nice to have a device to take on the pier that would have vibrated when our table was ready, but the waiting area was pleasant.  The table had a nice view of the harbor, and we were attended to in a timely manner.  There was a good variety of choices on the menu, but my brother in law was very disappointed with the non existant vegan selections.  He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.  The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.  Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.  The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.  The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.  By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.  I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.

excerpts: I also really liked the salmon BLT.
No bacon for me but they kindly subbed fresh tomatoes.
Delish!
salmon blt.author: Max H.
salmon blt.review: Wonderful lunch today. The clam chowder is really fantastic with the warm sourdough bread. I also really liked the salmon BLT. No bacon for me but they kindly subbed fresh tomatoes. Delish!

salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much.
he wants me to write he
he loved loved it.
salmon blt.author: Ness H.
salmon blt.review:
my boyfriend and i went here tonight. it was our one year. parking garage was very close by, and the first 2 hours is free. the front of the restaurant is very pretty. the decor inside the restaurant is even nicer. we were seated by the window which had a great view of the harbor. 

my boyfriend ordered:
stella beer (they accidentally gave him a large, which he enjoyed)
salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much. he wants me to write he he loved loved it. he wouldnt stop talking about it on the way home

i ordered:
cup of clam chowder ($5) - delicious. very clammy. it does not have potatoes in it or i didn't find any. im not complaining because there were plenty of clams.
sea bass with garlic mashed ($20) - the sea bass was a little on the dry side. i have had sea bass in different places were it was so much more buttery and flaky. this sea bass had the texture of tilapia. the potatoes were good, wish i had more. it was also served with brocoli and red bell. 

our total bill was only 50 bucks plus tip. not bad at all!!  overall, a delicious place to eat, not as pricey as we thought. plus it had a great view and its in the city

excerpts: Appetizers: fried calamari and Dungeness crab ceviche
dungeness crab ceviche.author: Summer M.
dungeness crab ceviche.review:
Looking for excellent service with quality food???? 
This is the place!!!! Love their wine selection.  Alison was my server and she is a 10/10!!!!! Ambience is also beautiful. 

Appetizers: fried calamari and Dungeness crab ceviche 

Main course: filet mignon with topped with dungeness and it was out of this world.

excerpts: The dungeness crab ceviche was pretty good, but it came with 2-3 chips..
They give you a generous portion of fish and chips which were fried well but not very memorable.
dungeness crab ceviche.author: Yvonne K.
dungeness crab ceviche.review:
3.5 stars 

Had lunch here during Restaurant Week (January 2015).

I think they put most of the restaurant week reservations in the far back room, which has more of the view of the pier than of the bay. So not everyone will have a great view.

Amuse bouche (a mini arancini I believe) was a nice surprise and super tasty as well.
Also loved receiving Biscoff cookies with our check.

Restaurant validates parking but only up to an hour during the lunch time, two hours at night.

For a two course lunch, it took about 2 hours from being seated to paying for the check. Service was a bit slow but food was not terrible.

The dungeness crab ceviche was pretty good, but it came with 2-3 chips.. 
They give you a generous portion of fish and chips which were fried well but not very memorable. Fish tasted a little watery and could use some salt.

Overall, not bad for restaurant week, but it could be better.

pumpkin curry salmon.author: Taylor G.
pumpkin curry salmon.review:
I really, really wanted to love this place, for a few reasons, but mostly because I'm visiting San Francisco and had a focus on cuisine while visiting.  I wish I could be more polite, but the truth is that I am disappointed that I wasted an evening here.  Across the dock from Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., we instantly noticed the mistake we had made by coming to this tourist trap area.  Face-palm #1.  

Our server was not unfriendly at all, but I felt rushed from the moment we were seated.  We made a semi-late reservation for a Monday night (Halloween!) and we had hoped that would give us a bit more leisurely pace for our meal.  I like those European style meals that take a couple hours, a few drinks, and heavy sighs of satisfaction at the end.  What we received was more like a calculated and rushed meal you'd expect at a mid-grade chain restaurant.  

We started with oysters and never received any utensils to dress them with, so we poured the condiments on with reluctance.  Next came salads, which didn't dazzle us, but neither were they intolerable.  I ordered the "fall special" of Pumpkin Curry Salmon, face-palm #2. My partner requested the "Jumbo" Scallops for his entree. My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.  Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.  My partner's meal?  Delicious.  BUT!  and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".  They were quite small, although tasty.  The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.  I would probably have a different attitude if the scallops were touted as sustainable and local instead of being labeled jumbo.  

I might have a more sunny outlook on this spot if I could have seen the view it's known for, but we had already lost the sunlight for the day and could only see the nighttime lights.  I wish I had tried the chowder they're known for, and maybe I would have been more impressed.

excerpts: We ordered fall special pumpkin curry salmon, and grilled salmon.
Also the shrimp ceviche OMG!
Soooooo good !!!!
pumpkin curry salmon.author: Lisa R.
pumpkin curry salmon.review: Spectacular food, view and customer service !!! Definitely will be back ! We ordered fall special pumpkin curry salmon, and grilled salmon. Also the shrimp ceviche OMG! Soooooo good !!!!

excerpts: The Pumpkin Curry Salmon and Braised Beef Short Rib were spot on delicious.
It's always an enjoyable experience here as not only is the food good, but their entire staff is just so gracious and hospitable.
Thank you!!
pumpkin curry salmon.author: Mike H.
pumpkin curry salmon.review: Well, we had yet another outstanding meal here at Fog Harbor Fish House. The other night we tried some dishes from their seasonal offerings and they were just outstanding! The Pumpkin Curry Salmon and Braised Beef Short Rib were spot on delicious. It's always an enjoyable experience here as not only is the food good, but their entire staff is just so gracious and hospitable. Thank you!!
